reviews.review: A wonderful place to sit and watch the artists.. This is a peaceful place to sit and enjoy Roman life whilst sipping wine. The piazza has numerous restaurants serving wine and / or meals. The drinks can be expensive but, if you ask the price of the house red or white before sitting down you will get a bottle from €15. We did! There are artists painting and selling their work by day and street artists by night.
Nice plaza . Very nice typical Italian plaza. With commerce and really nice restaurants around. A very nice fountain in the center.Fully recommended.
Nice Stop in the center. This place is quieter and not always so crowded; here is more a relaxing place where you can take pictures without being pushed away by the crowd

Very pretty and romantic at night!. There is so much to see and do in Rome, we saved some of it for the evenings. Rome is very pretty at night, especially all the fountains. They are lit up so nicely. Very romantic.

Athmosphere and a view in the city centra. A really great place for a walk in the city centre. Lots of cafes and restaurants border the piazza, some of the actually both good and inexpensive. Have someone tell you the story about the four sides of the giant fountain, depicting the four partds of the world as believed around 1500 AD.

Piazza extravanganza. The Piazza Navona is a beautiful area, so picturesque. The whole piazza is beautiful but the fountains are a must see and as it is only a few hundred meters from the Pantheon you can visit two beautiful sites within short walking distance of each other.
Cool Place. so many shops around the area, so many restaurants, and so many things to see around - painting, souvenirs, food, wine, etc.

Wow factor. When I entered the Piazza Navona, my jaw just dropped. So amazingly stunning. The magnificent buildings around the piazza, the beautiful fountains, and charming restaurants. It took my breath away.
Land of art. Once you arrive there, you never want to leave. ..Very relaxing atmosphere. ..you are surrounded with art in every single meterI highly recommend this place

Ancient piazza with Egyptian obelisks, medieval fountains.. One of the largest piazza's in the Centro Historical area with great restaurants surrounding it. An old stadium, it now is a meeting place for people, especially at night. Artists and vendors sell their work and wares. It's a most see, and plan on eating there.

Very pretty.. Beautiful fountains. It was so incredibly hot on the day we were there but the square was split into shadow and sunny side so we just kept to the shade. There is a side street that has really nice ice cream - as most places in Italy ;) recommended!

Crossroads of Roman History. Tucked Away in a Corner of Rome, I booked a Walking Tour of Rome and was very pleased the Piazza Navona was featured. Perfectly maintained fountains of Neptune greet you as you enter surrounded by Churches featuring Martyrs is the perfect way to begin your tour of Rome.In the surrounding streets you will discover terrific local eateries, boutiques, hotels and where locals hang out. Art and culture envelop you as you tour the Piazza.

Fantastic for people-watching. Grab a table at one of the numerous places that line the piazza for an afternoon cocktail and people-watching. Like any other touristy area, don't bother with the food - you're better off winding into a nearby alley for fantastic eats but it's highly entertaining to sit for a bit and take it in.
A must. Great piazza with many restaurants around the area. Two street of shopping. And a market. Love it. Great outdoor living.

beautiful square. we had a few minutes here with an ice cream. Busy, but still found a bench to sit on. Lots of pavement cafes that looked very inviting, but we did not have time to sample them. The fountains are glorious
Anticlimax in October. I was a little disappointed with this location as it was partly empty and closed. Fountains are worth a look

Former Roman horse race track. We sat on a bench in the sun for several hours and saw mankind stream by.Tourists and Romans stroll the piazza. Artists sell their paintings. Good street musicians. Human statue of a cowboy.

Popular Plaza. Fountain of the Four Rivers, and another one at the other end of the plaza. Lots of guys selling selfie-sticks, and other touristy items, but it is still worth a trip to see the plaza, which is built on top of the old "stadium area".

A place to unwind and people watch. Piazza Navona is quite centrally located, so definitely make it one of your stops whilst exploring the nearby pantheon whoch is much more crowded.Becasue this piazza is much larger, you don't feel like you're fighting for space with others. There are many restaurants surrounding the piazza but honeslty didn't try any. My suggestion would be to go to the nearby Pasticceria Cinque Lune, get an assortment of small pastries (sold by weight) and enjoy these overlooking the fountain. Thoroughly enjoyed strolling in the piazza at various times. There isn't much shade or seating space though.
lovely sunday. full of people , local or visitors from all over the world , lot of painting, music , gelaterias, good atmospire,
Dissapointing. Maybe it was just the wrong time of day but nothing to get excited about. No stalls or flowers. The fountain itself is nice to look at though.

Fantastic taste of Rome. We walked down to Piazza Navona to get some lunch (pizza naturally) on our first day in Rome. It was a perfect introduction to the city just as our hotel concierge said it would be. Beautiful fountains, several musicians and lots of outdoor eating. A very nice way to start our vacation and extremely clean despite the large amount of people.

Piazza Navona. Nice rectangular piazza with several sidewalk eateries. There are 3 fountains there although they're nothing like the Trevi fountain. The church at the center is the real star here, although much smaller that St Peter's Basilica is just as stunning and shouldn't be missed.
Full of people, great . Great fountain, full of people. Great neighbourhood to visit. Nice cafes, bars and restaurants. Must see.

Weekend in Rome. Worth a visit....The Piaza it's amazing with a big fountain in the middle and a lot of nice restaurants in the sides. I didn't really tried the restaurants which seem very turistic but also with a very nice ambiance. All the Piaza breathes life with a lot of artists in the middle painting and seling.
More interesting than Most Piazzas. In a city with a multitude of plazas, this is one of the more impressive ones. It's history enhances its attractiveness.

Nice Square and Fountain. Nice to visit and laze around for a little while. The restaurants around the piazza are extortionate, but I suppose you would expect that. Not a lot more to do in the piazza.

Worth visiting just to see the fountain of the four rivers. Piazza Navona is one of the many beautiful squares in Rome, but the main attraction is the fountain of the four rivers. The piazza is surrounded by restaurants in the evening, but the food is aimed at tourists so eating here is for the view rather than the food.
Stunning Square. Beautiful piazza. Two lovely fountains lovely cafes and restaurants and a stunning Church.A great place to sit and watch the world go by.
Great space. A wonderful place for an evening stroll to take in the atmosphere and great choice of restaurants either in the square or the side-streets

Centre of the city buzz. This is the place to come of an evening in Rome to feel that buzz of people gathering to relax and socialising. It has that real centre-of-the-city feel to it. Cool place to sit down with a drink and people watch for a while.
Summer of 1990s. Great place with the fountains. A nice walk.in the evenings. Surrounded by places to eat at. Great for taking in the local culture and cuisine and the night life.
Amazing fountain. This is a lovely place that you can not miss, the fountain is really beautiful and easy to reach as it's located in city centre

Vibrant place to watch people and have lunch on the way to the Pantheon. This large plaza used to be a race track and the areas where the buildings are today held grand stands for the people. The history is displayed in an underground exhibit at one end of the plaza. The statuary is interesting and complex and worth seeing but this should not be your only destination in the area. We had a good lunch here but it was overpriced. Check the menu before sitting down.
Interesting piazza in city of piazzas. Rome is a city of impressive piazzas. This one is not an exception. The sculptures and the fountain are beautiful. Definitely worth checking it out.

history and night life at its best. it is one of the most famous plaza to visit, i visited the place late in the evening for my coffee, it's an elegant square that has three fountains with the biggest in the middle (Bernini Fontana), it's surrounded by coffee shops, restaurants, mansions and some small street vendors and hawkers. It is close to St Agnes church and Brazilian embassy which is the 17th century Palazzo Pamphilj, it's very close on your way to Panheon and Trevi Fountain.

A place to relax. this is a place to relax and soak in the atmosphere. lots of tours start from here. Though we were warned, we did not have any issues with pick pockets here. but becarful it may have been their off day

a nice place but a bit overrated. The circus is really nice but given that is listed as one of the main attractions I was expecting much more. If you don't have time or you are exhausted you can easily skip it in my opinion.

how to avoid all the tourists?. the piazza Navona is still a place to be visited although extremely crowded at a sunny day; however, it may not be the calm place anymore where you could sip your morning espresso and reading the morning papers

LOVE Piazza Navona!. We go here every time we are in Rome. The fountains are incredible, and local artists assemble here in scores to sell their paintings and creations. We have added some great oil on canvas paintings to our collection. Piazza Navona never disappoints. From here, take a short walk over to the Pantheon. It's a great area attraction that ranks second only to the Colosseum.

For both beauty and good eats.. Walk around the piazza and environs. Wonderful spot to appreciate Rome at its best. The fountains are, of course, wonderful. A bit crowded at night, but a breakfast visit is highly recommended.
Stunning . Gorgeous fountain not as breathtaking as the trevi fountain but what could beat that well worth finding though
Wishes. Beautiful is all I can say, but through my coin in and made my wish, right hand over left shoulder with back to the fountain
fascinating fountains. Apart from being damn beautiful, this fountains present us with the most beautiful male nude sculptures. check it out

Lovely. Went to this piazza a few times.. the place is surrounded by cafes and restaurants..the huge fountain in the middle is awesome and place is overcrowded day and night like the rest of the top spots.. musicians and artists give the piazza a lovely vibe
Beautiful. Just one of many piazzas but this one has 3 beautiful fountains and lots of lovely restuarants surrounding it

Beautiful place to spend the evening. Piazza Navona is very close to Pantheon so do combine the two. The piazza is beautiful with many fountains, wonderful architecture and good dining places. Many artists perform music, fire acts, clown acts etc there. We spent an entire evening there.

Lovely fountains, nice square. It was a nice sunny day so we took advantage of the warmth & walked over to the piazza. So did everyone else in Rome. It was very crowded, but well worth it looking at the Bernini fountain and the other two.

Rome Trip. Very nice area for quicky shopping, food, drink and sights to see.
People playing music, street shows and lots of fun

The best piazza in Rome. This is a MUST go in Rome. three amazing Bernini fountains, fabulous gelato selections, sidewalk cafes, street musicians and caricaturists for amusement, happy tourists. Best to see around sunset if possible.

NEARBY AND INTERESTING. Pretty much in the middle of a crowded city is the Piazza Navona! We happened to be staying at the Hotel Imperiale which is right around the corner. This is a wonderful place to stop and take a photo.
My favorite piazza in Rome!. Piazza Navona is a must see place! There are three fountains and its a great place to eat too. Don't miss it!

The best Piazza in Rome. What a place this is, largest square in Rome with no traffic and 3 fantastic fountains along its length. Surrounded by a number of cafés and a fantastic church. The piazza is very busy but is so large that it fid not feel crowded.

Spend the Money- SIT at a Cafe. Tourists often grouse about that 5 euro cup of coffee. But they neglect to tell you that they were sitting in one of the prettiest places in the world just watching the crowd go by. Nobody hurries you. Service is included. If, at this point, you miss Starbucks, you were born without a soul!
Great space. 5 day trip to Rome and came across the piazza a few times. The atmosphere is exciting and loads of places to eat.

Beautiful people place night and day. This large piazza is great for sitting, dining, drinking at one of the wonderful street side cafes and just people watching. Lots going on constantly from mimes, clowns, to vendors, and simple fun human antics and dramas. Great restaurants, shops, architecture, and history.
People watching . Spent several hours in this Piazza just watching people, had an ice cream listened to the church choir checked out all the artists work and watched more people very relaxed.

Bernina Four Rivers Fountain. This piazza is marred by all the tourists. OK, I'm one too. But it would be so much better if one could visit it without the hoards. The four rivers are the Tiber, Nile, Danube, and I believe Yangtse. The one whose eyes is covered I s the Nile, because the origin is unknown at the time of the carving.
Rip off joint. Not only did they charge more for beer, they also added service charge to the bill. The place is best avoided.
iconic Rome. Be part of everyday Rome. The Piazza is a hub of atcivity, especially at night. Enjoy the cafes and the artist and engage in great people watching.

Great place to take a break. A great place to sit and people watch to take a break. S expected it's not cheap to eat or drink there due to its tourist popularity. Worth a visit though to take a load off.

Must see!. Some of Bernini's best work in one Piazza. Impressive fountains back to back...We enjoyed a quick visit here to admire the fountains, locals artwork and to check out the shops. Not a far walk from the pantheon so be sure to visit when you're in the area!
Relaxing place. With all the hustle bussel around rome this is a lovely place to chill with an ice cream and a cocktail. Just what is needed at the end of a long day

Family. A very enjoyable piazza eith three beautiful fontaines and a very interesting church. There are many artisits performing in the piazza and is a very beautiful place to have a capuccino and to enjoy italian life outdoors

Away from the crowds. Gorgeous area and not as busy as the rest of the more famous fountains. Very relaxing. More of a local playful area. Experienced the sight of little local children out for walks with their parents just taking in a sunny day.

AMAZING. We all know its a must to visit when in Rome ,but it is terribly crowded and even hard to walk around in some hours of the day .I suggest to go very early in the morning or after 11 at night :this is Rome ....
Best Piazza in Rome. Amazing Piazza with beautiful sculptures and fountains and many wonderful places to eat. Lots of photo opportunities.
Ok. We were a little disappointed. Local hawkers sure to bother you...a very big area with not much going on.

Travel Well, Travel Often. Everyone who visits Rome should go to Piazza Navona. Throw your coin into the fountain and observe the richness of the area. The fountain has been refurbished and looks almost new.

Nice atmosphere with street musicians and pubs around the pool.. There are lots of pizza restaurants around the pool and you can drink with very nice classical music voice performances. Pantheon is very closed to that area .And Spagna is also 10 minutes walk.you can find good ice cream shops with 150 diff taste
It's crowded...but this is Rome!. The fountains re lovely. The church of St. Agnes has abulous baroque art. Look out for pickpockets, but go visit. Stores are pricey. Go elsewhere to buy stuff.

Lovely piazza, go down a side street to eat . Lovely piazza with great fountaina and views. Very busy with tour groups, street artists and the ever present selfie stick sellers. Head down a side street to find a decent eatery!

My Favourite Piazza in Rome. It's size, grandeur, and tremendous people-watching leads the way in Rome. I recall hours spent here as a young guy wayyyy back in my teens and twenties, when I and my friends were young travellers with low funds. It was wonderful then to while away the hours eating gelato and watching passers-by, and it is now. I spent a few hours there early this month and the magic hasn't died. 35-40 years later, it remains the beautiful, aged, majestic piazza it has been for hundreds of years. So so worth some time.

Large Piazza with a great atmosphere. This is a large square, surrounded by restaurants and bars and street performers, with fountains and statues on either end. It's very touristy but I loved it. It was a lovely day and it was busy but there was plenty of space to chill out. It's built on the spot of an ancient stadium hence its size and shape.There's a big church to visit and in the centre of the square is an Egyptian obelisk. Very nice.

My favourite place. I live in Rome and between all the beautiful places of the city Piazza Navona is that place that makes me feel Roman, I always go there in the evening or by night, the lights give it a magical atmosphere

A must see. How could you miss this important square with monuments, history, entertainers, food, cafe's and more. My wife and I enjoyed going there during the day as well as in the evening, always storming with action. Highly recommended indeed, whenever in Rome, not to be missed.

Beautiful colorful place - Must visit. Beautiful colorful place with excellent statues and buildings surrounding the area and nice cafe shops. During the Christmas period there is a fair with art-crafts and other good to buy. Many children and often so many people that it's difficult to walk through. Keep that in mind.I was there on epiphany and it was really crowded.

Three fountains in this square. This square is among the top 10 things to see when visiting Rome. It has 3 fountains built by different artists from different periods. The square is large and lined with cafes and restaurants. Inside there are artists and vendors and there is always a lot of activity surrounding this piazza.
Beautiful fountains!. We visited Piazza Navona both in the evening to see the fountains lighted, and in the daytime to see the details of the sculptures.

Piazza Navona at Night. I got to Piazza Navona in the early evening. The joint was jumping. Locals and tourists were having the time of their lives. Whether you are looking for a nice meal, fine shopping, or just a good time, Piazza Novana is a good place to be.
Beautiful Plaza. Nice place to stroll, sit at a cafe and take pictures. Close to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps so definitely add this one to your list of to do's.
One of my favorite piazzas in Rome. Visit both during the day and at night. This is one of the more popular piazzas in Rome but for good reason.
A Very nice place. The Piazza Navona is a very nice place to visit when you are in Rome, very calme place and free. you can stay something about 1 hour to enjoy enough.

Enjoyed the visit. I liked the sculptures in the square. I went twice. The first time was in the middle of the day and while plenty of people were there, it was not overwhelming. The second time I went at night and there were far more people. I'm not sure if this is a common experience. I didn't eat near there, as I had read that the food was very expensive. Like the Trevi, I don't think you would see much of the sculptures if sitting in a restaurant at the side, unless you go when there are fewer people (not sure when that would be!),
A Rome must see!. Walk up and down this Piazza and enjoy every aspect of it! Admire the fountains and the sculptures but avoid the restos nearby. Too expensive!

When in Rome, do as the Romans!. A great place to feel like the locals! Lots of street artists, live music and lovely cafes, this place is definitely worth spending a couple of hours. You can get the best Gelato here too.

Worth stopping by as you stroll through Rome. The Piazza Navona is a beautiful square that is great for people watching and with countless restaurants and cafes in and around it. While it's definitely the place to enjoy a gelato, I would recommend leaving the square itself if you're looking for a meal. The restaurants down the side street are much better than those you'll find on the square itself.

this place was flooded back in the day. it used to be used for outdoor spectaculars with horses and carriages. now full of music, tourists and fine shopping (Gucci etc). Ice cream the most expensive we found!

A duplicate of Covent Garden at twice the price. The Piazza Navona is nice with some street entertainers. The prices are the top end. For example a small beer and a coffee for 17euros.We did not have 2 drinks there.

A historical important place. The beautiful Rome gives you a special value in life. Our visit to the different historical places in Rome takes us to piazza Navona. Go there, use time and see the beautiful historical statue from our important history. This old roman racetrack will show you some of the old history from the Roman Empire. Take your time, walk slow and let the history hit you and all your senses.

A historical important place. The beautiful Rome gives you a special value in life. Our visit to the different historical places in Rome takes us to piazza Navona. Go there, use time and see the beautiful historical statue from our important history. This old roman racetrack will show you some of the old history from the Roman Empire. Take your time, walk slow and let the history hit you and all your senses.
Wow!. The piazza is marvelous, the fountains are beautiful. Taking the time to read about the square and its monuments certainly makes the trip that much more special.
go to eat. Great place for dinner or lunch...lots of places to choose from. Walk around and read several menus before deciding as they all are a little different
Awesome super beautiful. A must visit. Could stay there for hours to admire the beauty and watching people. The cathedral is also amazing.
Very nice. A large piazza which was lovely to visit. Famous for its fountain in the middle. Surrounded also by lots of lovely buildings. Very close to lots of other different attractions.

Take time out. After a full day of sight seeing this is a terrific place to just sit chill,have a coffee, grad a gelati & just soak up the atmosphere with the many buskers & street performers that frequent the piazza. Oh & of course the fountain with its flowing water is an another example of period architecture & so relaxing.

Lovely place to spend the Evening. When I visited this place it was bustling with people and the ambience was very vibrant. There are a lot of artists around doing different stuff and I was quite amazed by skills of a painter of Asian origin.It was great place to have fun with a group of friends!
Beautiful. Just another random spot if beauty in Rome. I felt like every time I turned a corner I looked up to some unbelievable site ... Piazza Navona was one of them. Check it out!
Great place to get the vibe for Rome. A must see Piazza, central to anything. Didn't stop to eat here as it appeared to be more expensive than the surrounding streets.
Roman Adventure. A very nice Piazza surrounded by many cafes and restaurants plus may souvenirs stores. You can take many beautiful pictures
Have Lunch. Have a snack or a drink and take in Bernini's wonderful fountains. Visit the church.(Yes another ). There was music and entertainment ti while away the afternoon.
Piazza Navona. This a definite must see when in Rome. The buildings, churches and fountains are breathtaking and well worth a visit.

Rap resents one of the characteristics fountains of the city. the construction of this famous Fountain has been ordered by the Pope Innocenzo X to Bernini, the four statues at the foot of the obelisk, represent four famous continents, the Ganges representing the Asia, the Nile represent the Africa, the Danube represent the Europe, the Plate represent The America.Is a popular an busy square during day and night. There r many painters and artists of all kinds, bars and restaurants r always open from morning until late at night, maybe a bit more expensive than other places in Roma
A large outdoor piazza, with many stalls. Very interesting and culturally captivating, the Piazza Navona was a very interesting place to stop for a meal
very nice for a walk!. beautiful square!! they are many stores with antiques near too. don't forget to visit Chiostro del Bramante near to the square. it offers interesting exhibitions!

This place is better with events/celebrations!. It was the Epiphany when the 1st time I visited here. Lots of stalls and crowds but full of celebrations! The 2nd time I visited was just a normal day so there isn't much to see but still a nice place to pass by and take some photos.
Tourist square in centre of Rome. Fountain in the middle, few stalls, cafes/bars lined along the outskirts (apparently most expensive in Rome). Interesting as it used to be a sports stadium.

Historical and Beautiful!. One of the best, relaxing visual site is Piazza Navona! There are numerous things to see around the piazza. In addition, there are a lot of outdoor, covered restaurants. Regardless of where you are on the piazza, there is a comfortable place to relax and take in the sites. It's also important to read the history of the site to make it more meaningful!

Beautiful Piazza. We made the mistake of visiting it in the late afternoon after visiting the Vatican, the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain the day before. Clearly it can't hold a candle to any of the above. Still, it was a sunny day and a beautiful piazza. We sat at one of the open air cafes that line the piazza and overpaid for marginal beer like angst ridden college abroad students. You know the type. The insufferable friend or family member who corrects your pronunciation and maintains an air of superiority despite being an anti social weirdo. It may have been because the 18 Euro beer but we started counting the kids who will one day be ruined by their trip abroad. Stopped counting somewhere in the 40s. Anyway, it is a beautiful place to sit with friends or spouse and take a break. Just don't get all weird about it. Worth visiting.
Great!!. Love this area--its one of my favorites. Grab a drink, visit nearby church and just drink in the atmosphere. Its also really beautiful at night. Highly recommend.

Lovely piazza. Enjoyed wandering around the piazza and seeing the fountains and sculptures and listening to the beautiful music played by the musicians busking. Great just people watching. Lovely atmosphere.

Simply beautiful . This was so good! Had lunch at a restaurant (yes -a bit pricey but wonderful) with a view to the Piazza and all the artists and musicians. Great atmosphere and excellent food. Just to be there and walk around seeing the fountains is a great experience.

One of the amazing Roma fountains. Rome is full of beautiful fountains. The renaissance ones are not that interesting, but the baroque ones are special. The fountain in Piazza Navona depicting the four continents then known to the Romans is spectacular. The Piazza is a large gathering spot for evenings.
Brilliant Atmosphere. A brilliant place to just sit and have a coffee or eat and just to watch everything going on. Lots of art, people, singers etc.

Beautiful piazza and fountains. The day we visited (Monday) it was calm, not very packed and had an easy relaxed atmosphere.It is flanked by beautiful and colourful buildings and has a beautiful fountain with impressive statues. We didn't try the cafe/ restaurants which were doubtless as highly priced as most are in Rome so just come to Rome expecting to pay 5 Euros for a coffee and you won' t be surprised.A nice place to wander around at no cost.
Pleasant spot to visit. A lot going on. Fountains, statues, restaurants, tourists by the dozens!! Good place to spend some time.

My Favourite after the most famous sites. You can''t beat the magnificence of the Vatican or the awesomeness of the Colosseum but this Piazza took my breath away with it vastness, beauty and special-ness!

A relaxing place. We spent about an hour here, grabbing a drink, I'm just taking in this amazing Piazza. The crowd mingled, it was fun people watching. The fountains were very nice, it was a cool day, making this an extremely pleasant visit.
Amazing. I was on piazza navona quite a few times. Night, day or heavy rain. Amazing at any time and i could go back at any time as it is one of my favorite places in Rome.

First stop. The Piazza was our first wander on our arrival. Our evening stroll found the central fountain being used for filming. It was an added benefit to watch what was going on. The night lighting was dreamy. We returned the following moning for a more thorough look. After that we crossed the Piazza every day of our visit to Rome. We spent our final hours together (7 friends holidaying together) nibbling bits at the restaurant immediately in front of the main fountain. A spot which will be treasured in our memories of a wonderful visit to Roma.

great place - when not being used for filming. sadly when we visited there were barriers up and filming was taking place for one of those Italian OTT TV shows, which meant the crowds were even worse as there were celebs and VIPs a plenty - if you were Italian... Still, easy to see why this is a top three spot to visit on any tour of Rome on foot. Judging by the money in the fountain, people are throwing their Euros away by the bucket full - no wonder Italy is in financial crises

odd atmosphere. it's on my "must do tour" I do everytime I am in Rome. in the evening, especially in summer when it's crowded, there is this special feeling the air, you just get in Rome. don't eat or drink close to this, as most are cheap tourist food places.
Special Place. Please visit, simply walk around or have a coffee and admire the Piazza, theres something special about it, lots of restaurants, all with good food.
Wonderful as ever. A beautiful piazza to visit with lots of art, people, artists, ice creams and surprises. There are lots of nice beautiful places and small streets around Navona...

Busy Piazza, expensive restaurants. Have to visit this Piazza as lots going on with restaurants and street performers, but if you pick a restaurant off one of the many little lanes they are half the price and really good. Most probably best if you have a drink and soak up atmosphere.
Beautiful. Beautiful buildings and amazing fountains, great place to sit and have coffee on a hectic days tour. You might not find unless looking for it but defiantley worth looking for.

Tourist rip off. If you want sub standard food, to be annoyed by peddlers,beggars, lines of tourists following tour guides and pushy waiters then eat here.Or if you would rather eat authentic Italian, listen to gentle music and eat without being annoyed go around the corner.Statues,fountains and the buildings are beautiful but you can't absorb the atmosphere without getting harassed

Great Piazzaa for walking and spectacular Fountains. Very old. Good Feelings... Suburb location in the heart of a quaint walking village. becareful not to get lost of the streets here. A little tricky to find, yet really worth it. The journey on the way creates a nice fitting design for when you finally get there. Very religous area and quaint floral covered balconies and lots of attractions going on here. The fountains are incredible and old...

Great Piazza to visit...Cool fountains...and peop;e watching.. This piazza I stumbled upon and was just in awe t the two fountains and floral covered balconies. Very nice...for people watching and photo ops...A little tricky to find down lots of cobblestone streets with very quaint decor along the way.
Mediocre. Second time we've been and on the way to the Pantheon. Not a must-see, but fine if you have the time.

Easy peasy piazza, with good eats and shopping. Great fountain and surrounding architecture. The off shoot streets have some good stores too. And the restaurant and bar district to the south is worth passing through. But the fountain is the best thing about the piazza. Just walk through and take your picture with it, whether it is raining or sunny, day or night.

Beautiful place!. As all Rome , piazza Navona is magic! Beautiful fountain representing 4 main rivers of the world to mention them: Ganges, Nilo , Danubio and Rio de la Plata ( River Plate) by Bernini!!!
Superb!!!

Beautiful fountains.. Piazza Navona has so much to offer the Rome visitor. Beautiful fountains, nice plaza to walk around, especially when all the artists fill the square with their local paintings and plenty of good restaurants line the outside edge of the plaza.
Great. Great place to visit as couples or single. Beautiful. Great for photos. Some walking to get their depending where you live in Rome.
pizza square with fountain. The middle of square has 4 statues of gods of 4 rivers and surrounded by pizza restaurants. Free attractions, best for night.
Famous piazza. Famous piazza that reminds you where you are, love this piazza and all of them. A must see place in city centre.

Relaxing drink. Well worth a visit if you want to relax, unwind, people watch and just take in the beautiful surroundings and the three fountains. There are bars and restaurants all round the edge of the piazza ice cream shops and coffee shops. We visited this place several times.

Nice. It is a nice square with a big Roman fountain. It isn't a must be seen, only if you are nearby and have time you go and sit there for a while. The fountain is pretty and the square is relatively big. There is a small nice church infront of the fountain that you can visit too.

A blast to the senses. On a busy day the Piazza Navona will have your senses reeling. Singing, pizza cooking, throngs of tourists passing by.
Most importantly the beauty of the square itself. The fountains and architecture. All stunning.
It's well worth a visit. Find a comfy place to sit and let it all sink in.
The center of Rome. This is where they had the Roman chariot races in the days of the Roman empire. Today it is a big attraction with many restaurants and tourists.
fine dining. tried the retaurants on piazza navona and would recommend them for good food and service. we have been to plenty of other restaurants in rome and these were second to none
Piazza Navona . One of the many piazzas in Rome. This one has Neptune fountain and an Egyptian obelisk on a marble base with large statues.
A fountain to be seen. In the middle of the Piazza is the Fountain of Four Rivers which was sculpted by Bernini. A magnificent work of art.
Such beauty!. This is a great place to spend an afternoon. The sculptures and fountains are amazing and there are great little restaurants, performers and gelato vendors all around the piazza!
Great plance. This is a great Piazza. Lots of places to eat. Lots of entertainment. Pretty water fountains. Go beyond the Piazza to discover lots of interesting restaurants.
Pretty. Great place to walk around although is full of tourists, so it may feel like a tourist trap, specially from restaurants and other people trying to sale you selfie sticks

Stunning oblong Piazza. This has 3 fountains and at least 3 Churches in it. Michelangelo's St Agnes is the most spectacular. Artists sell landscape paintings there, and many excellent ice cream shops exist. Films have been made in this square which was the former Chariot racing stadium of Emperor Domitian.

Favourite Piazza in the world !. This piazza is defining our family of 4! We have been last year and now we did again !This place is calling us again and again. We walk from our hotel every morning to 'charge our batteries ' for the day then we visit the city and in the evening we r back again to watch the people, the kids playing, the artists . It's a vibrant place! We always end up with a delicious gelato
nice during the day, beautiful at night!. was here during the day with lots of people, and artists, went back at night had dinner in front of the piazza... great food, wine, and company!

This is what community is all about. I loved stopping at Piazza Navona to watch all of the people meet, greet, and eat!! We actually walked in with a parade during a festival. It is a great place to stop and eat, have a glass of wine, and people watch.
Go at night!. Beautiful Piazza and stunning at night. We were fortunate to be staying in the area so enjoyed the stroll.

The Ultimate Feel of Rome. For me, nothing gives me a better feeling about the Roman dining experience of having dinner al fresco at one of the number of restaurants in the Piazza Navona. Even though most of fellow dinners were English speakers, the food, the service, the fountains and the old city feel of the Piazza still represent the finest and fullest Roman dining experience that shouldn't be missed..
A walk around this ancient track. Located in central Rome, this plaza is large with many fountains, cafes and local music & other activities. The statuary is magnificent to behold.
Fun place day and night. Loved the fountains, the history of the area and the atmosphere, you could have fun here no matter what age or time of day
Bring some change . Make a wish and throw a coin over your left shoulder. Busy place, but worth the view. Even nicer at night. Not a bad walk from the Pantheon.

Nice place to hang out!. You must visit this piazza while in Rome. Probably no more than a 10 minute walk from wherever you are staying. Bernini's fountain in the middle is really cool to see. Lots of good restaurants and bars surrounding the area.
To hot in august. Try to go hear when it's not so hot August it's full of tourist. A great day out with lots to see and some great history around the area.
typical square in the heart of Rome. Piazza Navona is a good example of the charming bustle of Rome with many shops and restaurants to browse.

Excellent Meal in Piazza Navona. We had a beautiful meal in Restaurant 4 Fiumi in Piazza Navona. We returned to the restaurant for a second time as enjoyed the pasta so much. It must be home made on the day as it melted in your mouth. Excellent price too. Recommend a visit.

This is one of my favourite places!!. We came here by chance, when we were looking for a restaurant. We were wonderstruck when we got here. The piazza is sprawling, lined with restaurants and there's a fountain in the middle. There are some really talented sketch artists and there are dancers and singers and musicians who stop by at the restaurants as well. A really nice place to sit and chill and people watch.
Best piazza in the city. My favorite piazza in the city. Big and not crowded as the trvi. Great places to eat at the area. For me it's the coolest place to be
Must See. Simply Beautiful, good for a sunny day, you can seat there for hours just enjoying the view, grate atmosphere.

Disappointing. I had read that Piazza Navona was a wonderful place to visit, but after looking inside the Pantheon, I found the Piazza Navona to be very disappointing. A couple of fountains and a few expensive restaurants around the side and that's your lot
A Roman must-see. A beautiful area on a good day, with lots of interesting features around it. Of course it's popular, but it deserves its popularity.

A Must See When in Rome. Gaze at the beautiful fountains, see art on display, people watch and have a drink or dinner while visiting this "must see" stop while on your Rome vacation. It's a short walk from the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain, and the street signs mark the route well, or just follow the crowds to get here.
Most beautiful piazza in Rome!. My favorite piazza to see what the local artists are doing & to sit with a glass of wine and people watch with the gorgeous Bernini fountains in the background!

Perfect place to hang out. The Piazza Navona is an oblong piazza with Bernini's beautiful Fountain of Four Rivers in the center. It's buzzing with tourists, hawkers, artists and street performers any time of the day. Enjoyed some good time by sitting at one of the cafes with a glass of perfect rosato.
Romantic... Every monunent in Rome was kind of romantic and especially the fountains!I liked it very much and there are many bars nearby..Good choice for honeymooners!
Great Piazza. Great big square. Actually a rectangle with the fabulous Bernini fountain in the middle. Its like it's straight out of a Dan Brown book. In fact it is!
Yes yes yes. Definitely a must - very beautiful piazza. Restaurants and gift shops plus all the local artists somehow selling the same drawings as their own! Bought one anyways!

Watch the world go by. Nice square, amazing architecture. The Four Rivers Fountain is really beautiful and worth a visit.
Close to pantheon so combine with a visit there.
Classic Roman holiday!. We enjoyed the fountain from one of the many piazza-side, outdoor cafes. You may pay a little extra for the view, but it is well worth it!
Cozy crowded square. The title basically says it. It's a cozy crowded square. Nice cafes and pubs in the area. It's really crowded in the Piazza, but it's worth going there to have a look.

Too touristy but, what to you expect?. The place is visited by everyone who goes to Rome, so, of course it's crowded. I liked a nice balcony that has plants and flowers hanging. It gave the place a lived in touch

Picture perfect!. Very photogenic square and very peaceful place just to take a stroll. Don't forget to take a drink at the fountain as you enter the square,to the south. Turn around and smile to the live webcam:)
Gorgeous Piazza!. One of my favorite spots! Huge oval piazza, lots of shops, cafes, young folks hanging out. Plenty of shopping and dining near by!

FOOD HEAVEN!!. Read the title. End of! :)
Cantina & Cucina is a local restaurant we went to twice out of 3 nights! Incredible!!

A beautiful piazza. A lovely place to sit and people watch.The road behind the top of the piazza has a musuem where you can see part of the domation stadium that stood where the piazza is now,very interesting.

Nice distraction for a little while. The three fountains that dominate Piazza Navona are impressive enough, especially the central fountain with the obelisk. But it seems like this square isn't as well taken care of as the other "hot" tourist spots. The water in the fountains was somewhat dirty. The statues themselves seemed a bit weathered (yes I know how old they are). To be sure, I still recommend swinging by the Piazza - especially if you're 3 blocks away at the Pantheon. But it's just a walk-by, take some pictures, and move on type of visit.

Oversold in my book.. If you need something to eat or a drink, great. There is nothing here but some fountains and restaurants. Very nice....if you have time....great.. But, don't make this your focus. Wish they had buskers, entertainment....something lively. Okay...but overrated.

Breathtaking!. We were awed upon walking into this piazza. Architecturally beautiful and the fountains were very interesting. There was a lovely atmosphere with a man playing guitar. Drop into one of the many pavement cafes and soak it all in. I recommend Ristorante Panzirone.
The piazza was also very pretty when we walked through at night.

So charming. Piazza Navona was such a beautiful spot, a standout for me while visiting Rome. The buildings and the scene is gorgeous, with cafes and restaurants surrounding the area. Perfect spot to have an afternoon drink and soak up the view. There were people selling artwork and a few caricature artists so it was fun to walk around and see the progress of their work. Lovely spot, highly recommended.

Absolutely Stunning Central Fountain. So much to see and do, but you`re going to spend a few hours walking around the central fountain to make sure that you don`t miss anything. The detail to each of the figures was incredible. Plan some time to walk this piazza, but eat behind the NW wall. 1/2 the price and twice the food!

Stunning square. Any devotees of sculpture. Should not miss this square. There amazing ornate, sculptured fountains by historically renowned artists. Busy meeting place but the wide areas on the side of the fountains mean this busy piazza is generally comfortable in terms of he number of people. Thebars are pricey and there are much better restaurants away from the square but well worth having a drink or ice cream to watch the world go by.

Great evening venue . Piazza Navona is picturesque and comes alive at night. Beautiful sculptured piazza with several excellent al fresco dining experiences. Some nice offshoots for shopping as well. Definitely recommend!
angle of romance. i have spent more than a month in this area and i have to tell that from my first visit i felt in love with the beauty the people and the atmosphere of the square

Not impressed. Pretty plain with not much to do but spend money at a cafe. We stopped at Bar Tre Scalloni that TA people raved about. We do not. They were nice enough to us give an outside table for just beverages, no food. Of course the bill was €11.50 for a local beer and a small mineral water.

An amazing square.. One of Rome's most attractive squares. It gets busy, but it's huge, with many fountains. The are cafes and restaurants all around, where you can sit and enjoy this fabulous area. There are a lot of cheaper and better eateries in the streets behind the square.

We love this place. This is aways a stop on our visits to Rome. There are amazing street artists selling beautiful works of art and always a fun street performer with crowds watching them. It"s fun right before the sun goes down to enjoy relaxing by a fountain and people watching. Don't missing a stop in this area for an hour or two.

Large interesting square with worthwhile walks around the area. We seemed to be there or near there every night. The better restaurants on the side streets behind the square. It's near many many nice places to visit.
Go early before the crowds if possible.. Beautiful fountain area but always crowded, especially at night. In order to get a good picture, nab a spot before all the tour buses come in.

Boring and pricey. Was told to visit here by a friend who visited last year. Sorry but I found it boring. A large square with a couple of large impressive fountains. Once you've taken a couple of pictures of said fountains there's nothing else to do. It's described in the guide books as having street artists and things happening but all there was were a few artists all selling virtually the same paintings. Surrounded by restaurants all touting for business. Don't get drawn into any of them as we were as they are a rip off. 15 euros for 3 cans of Sprite!! Might be more interesting at night time with a bit more atmosphere

Anniversary treat.. I love this place. Full of restaurants, art stall, odd musician playing. We had dinner twice here at the same restaurant and totally loved the view, service and food. Sit with a coffee or an ice cream and people watch. It's great, everyone is doing it, so you won't feel strange. From here, whichever way you turn, it will take you somewhere interesting. Go explore every corner with excitement.....Enjoy
Great Atmosphere. A great place to spend a couple of hours enjoying drinks, watching the street entertainers and admiring the statues and fountains,

Beautiful, Elliptical pIazza. The Stadium of Domitian, Originally Also Known As The Circus Agonalis But Today Known As Piazza Navona Is One Of Rome's Most Popular & Beautiful Piazza's With Three Fountains That Sit At The Top, Middle & Bottom Of This Long, Ellipse. The Central Fountain, Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers ) Is Massive & The Highlight Of This Place, With It's Four Gargantuan Male Nudes Representing The Rivers Of The Nile, Ganges, Danube & Rio De La Plata With A Centralised Obelisk That Marked The Centre Point Of This Former Sports Track. The Church Sant'Agnese in Agone Sits Mid Way On The Western Flank & Is Well Worth A Look Inside. Overall, Piazza Navona Should Be On A Jaunt With The Pantheon, Trevi Fountain & Spanish Steps ( They Are All Within A Short Walk Of Each Other ) & Is Best Seen After Dark When The Lighting Enhances The Beauty Of This Famous Piazza.
Roman Nights. Be here in the evening, perfect for families, and just so Roman, fortune tellers, food, gelato, very nice stroll after dinner.

Where the action is.. One of Rome's great public spaces...grab a gelato on a warm summer evening and take in the scene. Oh, and you might check out the fountains. There is so much history, so much art, so much of everything in this most amazing city. I try not to give five star reviews, but Rome just takes your breath away. Here is a little tip about Rome. It will overwhelm in the beginning. Take a break. Realize you are not going to even scratch the surface of what there is to see. And now, give yourself over to Roma. Oh, and use the taxis. They are good value. Enjoy. Ciao!

Come during night time. One of the greatest squares in the world. It does get crowded during the day and sadly it follow the rule of the god money with all the silly circus for tourists.During night you can admire it properly, walking around its perimeter and looking at the fountains which are simply worth the ticket to Rome. Much less crowded, it is a must.

Excellent Spot to eat & people watch. This is a lovely square with a church and artists and buskers in the middle. There are many restaurant were you can sit relax have a drink something to eat and watch everything going on. Well worth a visit.

Just as you would imagine. Beautiful architecture stunning square all within walking distance from other main sights some great street artists selling their impressive art souvenirs. On a beautiful day magical

Extremely Popular Piazza. We have heard many stories about the beauty and interesting features of Piazza Navona and on a recent visit to Rome, my wife and I were not disappointed. It is an open and welcoming gathering place that dates back to the 1st century. There are places to eat or to just sit and enjoy life flowing by. The piazza has two beautiful fountains - Fontana del Moro [ Fountain of The Moor ] and Fontana del Nettuno [ Fountain of Neptune] but is actually dominated by the huge and impressive Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi { Fountain of the Four Rivers] It was completed in 1651 and represents the 4 known major rivers on the 4 known continents at that time.It is definitely worth some of your time.
A must!. Beauty in every direction you look: right, left, front, back, up... and even down!Every space holds something nice. Better to visit early in the morning if you want to avoid crowds.
FANTASTIC. One of the best places to have a meal in a very roman atmosphere. Lots of restaurants and ice cream shops for all tastes.

Beautiful Square for dinner. We walked through the square during the day to take photos and have a look round. We then returned in the evening for a three course meal. It's a lovely place and would certainly recommend a visit. It has several restaurants to choose from which overlook the beautiful fountains. It's free to visit and beautiful so do make the effort to go here.Click below if you found this review helpful Thank you
Very interesting insights of the fountains and statues. Intimate plaza with 3 fountains. Interesting tales of the fountains and statues. Good area for food and shopping
Our favorite go to place. This was the best Social place to go every evening. We loved the true authentic Italian restaurants in that area. Lots of activity.

Fine but Tourists Eveyrwhere. Piazza Navona is very large with many shops, cafes and large statutes. It is elongated in comparison to other piazzas in Rome and has the most tourists we have seen. Its proximity to the Pantheon makes it easy to fine, and there is a great deal of upscale retail in the area immediately around it. It is - at least for me - a considerable distance from the nearest metro. Though we walked it, I would recommend everyone consider taking the bus or taxi

Nice lovely atmosphere to stop in while walking around.. We came across this one by chance as at this point we were just wondering around. I really enjoyed it here as it isn't nearly as crowded as Trevi. This is a good spot to stop for some gelato and do some people watching. Certainly worth a swing through if you have a few minutes to spare.
Great. I think it's the most beautiful piazza of rome,from the ones that I saw.You can relax or eat something here.
Lovely. Great place to just sit and watch the world go by. Can be very busy. Best after dark when the fountains are lit. A must see. Located in the central area

Packed with tourists, but nice environment. Enjoy this Piazza Navona, sit near the fountains and smell the Italian atmosphere. For a drink or a diner, go just outside this piazza and check one of the many cozy restaurants in the small alleys and on typical italian corners.
Wonderful Square. When in Rome, you have to visit Piazza Navona. They're resurfaced the main fountains and on a nice day (or evening), this is one of the special places in Roma to visit.
Charming Location. Only spent about ten minutes walking through but very attractive location. Wonderful fountains were the highlights.

Enjoy Borromini's sculpture then see one of his churches. Piazza Navone is a Roman landmark. Go early, walk around and admire the fountain then go in to admire his Sant Agnese church. Beware the mass times on Sunday might not be as listed on the internet - when I visited they were an hour out.

Impressive square. I am amazed that when you walk the streets to each attraction, there are unassuming entrances to each of these magnificent attractions. We used an offline gps app lime Map.me to find each attraction. As you get close to this attraction, you start to see the crowds walking toward the attraction and the streets are lined with vendors. You arrive at the attraction and then see it in all its glory. We took pictures at all 3 way fountains. There is also a church you can visit, near the centre fountain.
Wonderful. This was truly an exceptional experience. We were treated well and the food was very good. Imagine sitting close to Bernini's Fountain as you sit and enjoy your dinner.

A bit touristy but still has a good athmosphere.. You have to pay the usual coperta to sit in but the athmospere and the food makes up for it. The place has very good white wines for a reasonable price. Definitely recommended.
Open 24 hours and with good gelato. A very picturesque setting to relax and people watch. i'd also advise trying the gelato on the far end of the piazza, very good for a decidedly touristy space.

Lovley square. A very nice place in Rome where people come to admire the three fountains but in reality seems to only see the big one and then get hoarded of by their tour guide. The big one is impressive and deserves the attention. As for taking photos, before lunch lights up the main fountain and the church behind but any other angle (except towards north) will be against the sun. Lunch time provides a sort of in the middle opportunity. Forgotten your selfie stick? No problem - there are plenty of hawkers with sticks for sale in this area.
Beautiful Piazza. Prefer this more then Trevi fountain. Interesting history, beautiful setting and fountains and some interesting street performers.
Bernini and sunshine. The stunning sculptures and fountains are but one aspect of this delightful piazza where churches, embassies, cafes and museums embrace Bernini's four rivers.

Just gorgeous. Delightful fountain..with lots of mystery, built into it..get a guided tour to tell you about the statues and how they react to each other..you think they are just random statues up in a fountain...but no..they tell their own story and when it's told to you it all makes sense and offers so much more than water being splashed around..
Navona. Gorgeous setting. Lots of street entertainers and artists and restaurants. A gorgeous place to sit and spend time taking in the ambience. Good food and cocktails.

Stunning, lively, Great place to Eat. A great place to eat, be entertained by the street musicians, can be expensive need to study menu particularity drinks as these can be hidden, the architecture is however stunning would highly recommend visting

The Best Square In Rome!. This ellipse shaped square was built as a stadium in the period of Emperor Domitian (81-96), then it was turned to be a square by Papa X. Innocent (1644-1655). However, It still looks like a stadium with the buildings from XVI and XVII century around it.There are three fountains on the square, the most popular one of which is Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. You can find restaurants and stores on the left side of the square. It is within walking distance from Pantheon
3 Coins. Couldn't believe how many people could get in this square by the fountain, it was packed and a struggle to get to the waters edge to throw your coins in, glad we saw it.
Piazza Navona. Everywhere you walk in the centre of Rome is very interesting. The Fountain here is definitely worth a visit.
One of The Nicest Piazzas !. Loved going here in the nighttime it has so much personality. One of my favorite part is the Bernini fountain. Grab a drink in the square to soak up the atmosphere!

Amazing Fountains and Experience . Navona is a beautiful plaza with amazing fountains and people watching. Lots of restaurants and shops as well. Must top place in Rome - especially because it is free to experience culture. Good Luck!

Great Vibe in the Heart of it All. This is a large piazza in the heart of all the action in Rome. It is large enough to comfortably contain three large fountains, which set the ambience perfectly. There are restaurants, bars, gelato shops, coffee shops, and loads of people-watching. This is a great place to "feel the vibe" of Rome.

Over rated??. Had heard quite a lot about this area.. I personally didn't think there was a whole lot to it.. It's a very large square now there's a nice palace and fountain here.. Other than that there restaurants dotted around the square begging for you to come in.. All these restaurants are quite highly priced.. We ate in tre scalini I think? Once the waited finally got us in, they all pretty much forgot about us.. Wasn't impressed with the food or the service!! The next night we went off a little side street from piazza Navona to a restaurant called saltimbocca, much better and friendly staff here! The square itself is very much tourist oriented!!

Beautiful square. This is a beautiful square and it's fun to people watch here. The fountain was beautiful. Unfortunately the restaurants are outrageously expensive which makes it really hard to sit and relax here.

Great for people watching. My 16 year old son and I enjoyed several evenings on the Piazza Navona, where musicians, painters and performance artists entertain visitors. There are several "touristy" restaurants on the square which we skipped in favor of better places in the neighborhood where locals dine, but we enjoyed our evenings here with gelato and souvenir shopping. Not to be missed when you are in Rome...
breath taking. beautiful, its romantic, quaint, soak in the ombiance its just breath takings, it was a sunny day when we went its a place you have to go and people watch enjoy a coffee and sit back
One more fountain..). One of the most famous places in Rome. Had a nice time walking around in the old town. However the area is very busy, too many people at any part of the year...
Crowded. The Web cams are as good as being there because it is very crowded, even on non-peak days. It is small; so cold, hot or rainy day would be fine.

Beautiful place; Relaxing and oh so breath taking. Visit this place towards the evening. Enjoy the beauty of the three main fountains by Bernini. Get enthralled by the street artists quietly working away on their art. Absorb the beauty of it.
The italian experience. This Piazza is THE best in Rome. The atmosphere is great. A must see in Rome, plus its close to the best Gelato in Rome: Giiolitti

Great culture! Even better in the early AM!. Lots of bustle in the middle of the day and into the evening. My husband and I walked through the Navona in the early AM (around 7:15) and it was absolutely stunning. The piazza is so beautiful without all the crowds and I truly believe the monuments and buildings are under appreciated when so many people crowd into the area.I highly recommend visiting the location but do so in the AM when only a few other people are around - it is so so so worth it.
Truly Italian. An exceptional view into the days gone by in Rome.Wonderful statues and fountains. And real Italian feel to the place.
Very nice by night ... A beautiful square to have dinner in by night, many restaurants, and the atmosphere is lovely. take nice pics around the fountain..
Lovely atmosphere. Lovely area to wander around. Lots of cafes and restaurants to choose from. Great place to people watch. Lovely fountains to sit round

Do not miss Piazza Navona. Walk around the square at Piazza Navona and enjoy all the wonderful sights and sit on a bench and view the whole area and of course the beautiful statue and waterfall. Have a leisurely drink at one of the restaurants on the square.
Nice to relax. Loads of bars and resturants, choices the ones that are written up best on here, the square and fountains are excellent
Piazza Navone do not miss.. Great people watching place and the restaurant choices are many. Allow plenty of time to shop eat and take it all in.

Great way to spend an hour or two. One of the more popular piazzas in Rome. Lovely Baroque-style architecture, 3-main fountains and the Church of Sant'Agnese in Agone, dominate the piazza. Many cafes/restaurants surround the square, and they are great for relaxing will doing some enjoyable people watching. There are a lot worse ways to spend 1 or 2 hours in Rome!!!A visit to Piazza Navona is very enjoyable and relaxing.From Piazza Navona , it is only a 15 minute walk Castle Sant Angelo, and all of a five minute walk to the Pantheon.

Lovely Piazza. Visited as part of a walking tour, beautiful fountains, very nice piazza. Although it was busy in this area, we were able to enjoy a very nice relaxing lunch at Caffe Barocco Ristorante (good food).
Very pretty square. Lots of lovely fountains to look at. Plenty of wonderful ice-cream shops and restaurants. Gorgeous to sit and watch the world go by!

Delightful Open Area - Places to Sit, Public Water Available (Not Fountain), Restaurants. Stumbled upon these two beautiful fountains and the piazza. So stunning and great for photographs. The area is charming with its street performers and people selling art. You can possibly find a bench to sit on or enjoy dining at one of the nearby restaurants.Beautiful instrumental music fills the air. We found a public water fountain at the west end of the piazza. There are little shops surrounding the piazza, and there is a hum of activity but pleasantness. Great place to visit for 15 minutes or so.

A place to linger. Life surrounding the fountain of the four rivers. What a perfect people watching location, sit and sip a coffee, a beer and visitors from around the globe walk by absorbing the lively atmosphere. The restaurants here are very touristy so not the best if you are focused on quality food
Well worth a visit. Try to avoid going here on a Monday. None of the museums around the Piazza are open! However, the fountains are glorious, and it's a great place to people-watch.
Visit to piazza navona. It has 3 baroque fountains and the central one designed by Bernini. It is most lively place . The square better represents the bombastic baroque epoch in Rome
Beautiful. Big open Piazza in the heart of the historic district, gorgeous marble statues in the huge fountain just outside the palace.
Beautiful Piazza. This is a beautiful piazza and one that visitors and Italians visit to sit in and watch the world go by well worth a visit.

Loved this place!. We came back time and time again. We first came to meet with a tour guide but we came back several more times because of the cool vibe of this place. We tried several of the restaurants that circle the piazza and just took it all in. A good place to kick back and watch the world go by.
People Watch. I great place to enjoy a drink in 1 of the side bars and just watch the world go by with stunning surroundings.

Justifiably Famous Piazza. Best to visit this iconic spot off peak. The crowds and tour groups can be overwhelming. But devoid of crowds, the plaza and its fountains and surrounding buildings are beautiful and well worth a visit.

A nice view and stroll through Piazza Navona. We enjoyed a nice drink in a cafe in Piazza Navona. Very touristy. In looking at the menu prices, the costs seemed to be way more than lovely cafes a short walk away from Piazza Navona. Our suggestion is to enjoy a drink or two and take the time to people watch and stroll around Piazza Navona. A lovely fountain and not nearly as busy as around the Trevi Fountain.
Lunch spot. Had lunch here one day. Many restaurants around the Piazza. Good place to people watch. Not much else.

Lovely location. When ever I am in Rome I have to go here it's a fab location to stay if you can get it at the right price.The atmosphere is the best and it's minutes from the Pantheon . It's also a 20 min walk to St. Peter's basilica and 10 to the castle .There are many artist the statues are fantastic.If you want food and drink cheaper just come out of the square .

cool to see. This place is not super exciting to see but it is definitely worth it if you are nearby. It is pretty close to the Pantheon. I came during the day and there were a good amount of people around. Would have liked to have seen it at night.
Lovely in the moonlight.. Always crowded, yet worth a visit to enjoy the romance of the breathtaking fountains. Great window shopping abounds as well!
Very beautiful . A very beautiful fountain in a very beautiful piazza. Maybe it is not as large as Trevi fountain but less crowded. Pass by it and have a coffee around it, the view is beautiful
Beautiful.. This is a very large Piazza. The fountains and statures are well worth the visit. Don't miss the competing churches.

Lovely. This is a lovely piazza to have a stroll through on a nice day. I think it is always busy but not that it really matters as people are just passing through and taking some photographs or eating at one of the restaurants. The fountains are nice.

A site on my walking tour. An easy area to visit as part of a tour or alone. Near the Pantheon & Trevi Fountain so easy to do at the same time. The fountains in Piazza Navona are beautiful with interesting stories.

Great for families!. Went here one night last week for our last night in Rome and what everyone said is true. Great place for kids to run around, shop street art, and eat at great cafe's/restaurants lining the perimeter. (Those restaurants carry tourism prices but the food and service is good)

Huge piazza surrounded by food. This large piazza is another good place to people watch and see ancient buildings and fountains. We visited in the evening, with the dun setting and it was lovely. There are many outdoor cafes surrounding the piazza and we had dinner at a delightful one. We watched the crowds and enjoyed our food and the friendly waiters.

Large plaza with great shops nearby. This is a large plaza featuring a fountain and obelisk. It is not overly crowded so is a great place to meet up with friends. There are many interesting little shops and restaurants nearby.

What the hell? why so many people sitting around this small"water feature"?. WE walked to this Piazza late afternoon. It was shockingly crowded and people just sat around. This so average "water feature" is one of the most famous tourist attractions in Rome, really?. So my advice to you: If it happens that you are close to this "attraction" then go there and take some pictures. Otherwise go somewhere else, Rome has many beautiful places on offer.

Piazza Navona . Wow what an exciting place
Although like most attractions in Rome it was so crowded
Great work would like to learn the history behind it
Beautiful!!. This place is so colorful and beautiful. Lots of tourists everywhere during the day but it's still fascinating place to visit.

Great area to visit for half a day. We were luck enough to sat at the Lifestyle Suites which is actually right in the Piazza Navona. Lots of shopping, restaurants, and of course, the fountain and Cathedral. Try and find the time to come back at night. The lights and crowd make for a great atmosphere.

Gorgeous piazza, filled with energy!. Piazza Navona is beyond grand. As soon as you walk out into the piazza, you find beautiful churches, fountains, and buildings laid out in a perfect panorama. Here, street artists and musicians are found in abundance, as are three amazing fountains (4, if you include the nasoni on the north end!) that you just can't miss! Tip: don't fall for the restaurants laid out around the piazza unless you want to pay too much for mediocre food! Instead, head over to Campo de' Fiori for some good eats. I greatly recommend staying at an AirBnB or hotel in this area, nothing beats chilling out at piazza navona, listening to street musicians, seeing the performers, and watching the people milling about at night after a long day of exploring the city!

Breath Taking. Just to sit at the side and watch the world and his uncle walk past is great. When you have the marvelous sculpture and scenery thrown in its all nearly too much to take in. Have an ice cream in a cafe on the side and just simply gaze with wonder and awe.

Nice scenery, artists and musicians busking. It was stunning. The place used to be a race track.The fountains had many tourists crowding around them but still they were pretty. The scenery felt very Italian and European to me who is an Asian.The ambiance was perfected by artists offering to do portraits and musicians playing the accordion. Felt super Italian/European!

Gorgeous . Our hotel overlooked this square. Very lively, lots of restaurants and street entertainment. Enjoyed it ambience, drinks at one of the many bars, and people watching. Although only ate here once as found that the restaurants just off the square were better quality and a fraction of the price.
Fabulous Rome, Amazing Italy. My favourite country in the world-safe, full of history, culture, architecture, wonderful food and drink.

Best place for gelatto. In June 2016 my wife and I were with my family in the evening ,enjoying the sights and sounds pf Piazza Navona, and on the side street just behind Tra Scalini restaurant,are the two best places for gelato. The bosco (wild berry) is great. Try to find any better in all of Rome

A must see when in Rome!. A trip to Rome is not complete without a visit to Piazza Navona. The beautiful Bernini fountains, the street performers, and the lively atmosphere make this one of Roma's favorite gathering places.

Poorly lit up. There seems to be a problem with the lighting of most monuments in Rome and this one too suffers from lack of attention. The piazza is large with beautiful fountains, especially the Four Rivers, but the beauty is hard to appreciate after dark as the lights were patchy and many were not working. However, a visit in the day time is worth coming back for.There are the usual ring of restaurants around the plaza and the one we ate at was surprisingly good, with well-priced dishes and good wine. Unlike many other public squares in Florence or Venice, there is no cover charge or price-gouging. Though you expect it, these are definitely not tourist traps.

Very pretty square, probably one of the nicest. Worth a visit but don't make the mistake I made. There is a building one side of the square which I assumed (wrongly) was a building marked on the 'oh so not to scale' map I had. Ended up going out of completely the wrong end of the square and walking around in circles for ages. No public loos to be found so it's a case of going for a drink to use the loo - bit counter productive!! Loved the piazza

Beautiful Piazza. Stopped in the Piazza Navona for lunch, to admire the fountain and of course people watch. It was a glorious day and perfect for doing all three. Would definitely return if I was going to be here longer. Maybe next time b

Absolutely beautiful. I just LOVE Rome. So romantic. And this fountain is the best of the best. Such beautiful sculptures. And, and wonderful place to just sit back, enjoy the sun, read a good book or just people watch.

beautiful piazza, worth the visit.. we made it a point to pass through after visiting the spanish steps (which were still closed for the reconstruction). We're glad we made the effort. there's also a beautiful church on the square thats work a visit.
Three Fountains Strong!. Three elaborate fountains highlighted the square, all with amazing detail. A great place to people watch, too. Several vendors sold some wonderful artworks.
Beautiful but too crowded. The fountain was spectacular. However, getting to see it was another story! The crowds--even during a non-peak tourist period- were dreadful. Be prepared!

Room to enjoy the plaza. This plaza is large enough that you don't feel crowded and squeezed in. Plenty of casual dining/ drinking options line the square, people watching is great, and it has three interesting fountains.

The place where people meet - beautiful fountain and shops. Visited the Piazza Navona during the day and the evening to people watch and check out the local shopping. Great restaurants nearby. It is the center of excitement in Rome.

Underrated Spot!. Not as crowded as other squares in Rome, this is a great spot to see street performers and artists. There are plenty of places to sit, and 2 grand fountains to admire. Great to escape the seas of tourists for a while.
Must See!. Don't miss the fountain and ambiance of the square. This location is a great place for lunch and people watching.

Wow. Lots of things to do and see.Live music,shops,people.Lots of restaurants.
I enjoyed the Architecture and people watching.

Visit Twice--At night & during the day . This place is stunning. Surely, anyone who visits Rome will make this a stop. Totally different during the day and at night. Truly beautiful place. Visit during the day and at night!!!!

Great Atmosphere at Piazza Navona. I was impressed that the buildings were built on the original foundations of the stadium allowing it to keep it shape. The Piazza Navona felt relaxed and spacious where you can take time to browse at paintings that artists are selling.

Worth a look at in the evening. This is a lovely place to visit any time of the day. We were there in the mid morning and then again in the evening on another day.It does however (as you will see everywhere else around Rome), have certain illegal hawkers bothering you every few minutes and even hassling children, which is what annoyed me the most. Definitively left me with a sour taste regarding my Rome trip, seems to have gotten worse over the years and it appears the government doesn't care..The evening time however, does bring with it some interesting street performers as well as artist with their paintings, potraits etc. There is also really nice gelato place not far away, which has 150 different varieties of gelato! It's called Della Palma Gelato. WORTH a visit :)One place that I would strongly recommend STAYING away from for a meal, is La Fraschetta, off the main square. Unfortunately this shares the name of a more reputable restaurant in the Travestere area. Every review of this place is terrible and our experience was no different, refer to this tripadvisor link:https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/Restaurant_Review-g187791-d3598432-Reviews-La_Fraschetta-Rome_Lazio.html
Cobblestone square with 3 fountains. Really enjoyed walking around the square and admiring the 3 fountains. Another great place to sit, enjoy the amazing sculptures and people watch.
nice Square. nice square to visit very busy and nice to spend couple hour around. not many local but full tourist .

It's a place to relax, enjoy the individual talents and experience the Italian lifestyle. I visited a lot of squares before, but Piazza Navona certainly tops the list of my favorites. The amazing thing about Piazzas of Italy is that you experience the artistic individuals that create the various forms of art. Whether it's singing, playing different musical instruments, drawing faces with funny looks. The fountain over there is breathtaking where you can just sit, relax and enjoy the atmosphere. Definately a must see spot when you visit Rome

Lovely. We walked here from castel sant angelo so we could find the fountain from the film angels and demons.Coming from that way it seemed to be out of the way, a lot of back streets (we used google maps).Surrounding the 3 beautiful fountains is restaurants all around them. There are some nice little shops in side streets near there as well as more restaurants.Worth a visit
Veey nice square that gives a wauw effect. Very nice old square. Definitely worth visiting in the evening as well!the basilica is very beautiful but only open on certain times
Beautiful piazza. A lovely place to visit. Beautiful fountains. Could sit here and watch the world go by. Lots of artist in the centre. Ice-cream a little pricey here .

Beautiful fountains in historic area. This area is not only beautiful on a sunny day, even on a cloudy day it's inspiring. Stayed nearby at Hotel Navona and walked here every day of our visit. So many restaurants surrounding you can eat at a different one every day. Cobblestone streets make for difficult walking though but it's such an intrinsic part of the Italian experience it won't matter. Many sights are a short walk from here. Only downside is the number of panhandlers, who will walk away if you tell them no. It's just a way of life for them in a heavy tourist area.

Chilled plaza of Rome. A gorgeous plaza lined with street view restaurants and street artists... The fountains are a must see and despite it being fairly busy even at 6.30ish people are winding down. It has a calming feel to it. Not many shops but if you're hungry there's plenty of options. Waiters stand out on the street to assist but we ended up moving on to a different part of the city. After a good 30 min sitting break on the benches. Would go back though.
Impressive Piazza. Piazza Novona is a large plaza with 3 famous fountains, lots of artists but expensive restaurants surrounding the square.
