Favorite. Piazza Navona is our favorite resting place. I love the foutains and can stare at teh carvings for hours. Many reasonably priced cafe's all with decent food and drink. Must visit.
Amazing monument. Must see! And go to a walk in all the allys around. Magical place, even for those who don't want the touristic stuff
Heart of Rome. A delightful spot for a short stroll or a stop for expresso or lunch.Open, friendly, and filled with fountains vendors, and many restaurants.

Beautiful. This has to be one of the most picturesque and romantic spots in the city. Its a large square with fountains surrounded by cafes. Less crowded than some parts of Rome. We stopped and had a coffee or two in a lovely cafe called Tre Scalini. We did not eat here but the food looked amazing.

Better at night. Wandered through this square on one of our evening strolls. Very nicely lit. The fountains look great. Only slight drawback are the seemingly never ending invitations to buy from persistent street hawkers. We did return during the daylight but were not as impressed. Still worth seeing but more romantic at night.

Awesome piazza!. There is a beautiful fountain in a large square. A lot of people and activity! A exquisite church the Sant'Agnese is across the street. So many wonderful restaurants to eat or drink wine. We enjoyed the shops there as well. Can't go to Rome without visiting Piazza Navonna!

Worth a visit. If you are in the area, the piazza is worth seeing. The monuments are impressive and there are lots of stores surrounding the piazza, including a number of gelato establishments, restaurants and a fabulous toy store. The piazza is jumping in the evening with lots of musicians and artists.
My favorite place in Rome. I must come here and spend the evening. I live the Fountain of the Four Winds and the activity generated by all those who come into the area. A true treasure.

A Rome must see. We lived here for a long weekend and loved the central location. It is close to everything except the Spanish Steps (30 min walk) and Colosseum (same) but the Vatican and everything else is on your doorstep. Countless amazing eateries around (the places ON Piazza Navona can be costly) and the usual stunning architecture of Rome on display everywhere. Beware touts - don't take anything they hand you as they won't take it back without an awkward situation.
A beautiful tourist trap. Look at it,feast your eyes in the beauty of this place, but keep your money in your pocket, unless you are just sitting to enjoy the view r an aperitif
Favorite square in Italy. Always a pretty big crowd and some annoying hawkers, but the beautiful fountains and the energy and history surrounding you cannot be surpassed.
Beautiful piazza - a must see. if you are in Rome you cannot miss the Piazza Navona with its beautiful fountain and great palazzos around.
Beautiful place to see an amazing piece of art. It's beautiful.. This is one amazing place. The intricate sculpture and large proportional size of this are truly amazing. MUST SEE.

great food and views. This piazza was once an old chariot racing ring, its now one of the best places to visit and relax with a glass of wine and a plate of fine food from one of the many cafe's dotted around the edge of the piazza whilst in the centre there are amazing fountains.

Worth visiting to see the magnificent fountain. There is not a lot to say about Piazza Navona. It was busy and noisy and full of touts trying to sell you some expensive junk. However, two things make it worth the time to visit. Firstly, Bernini's beautiful Baroque Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi or (fountain of the four rivers) and secondly, the marvellous church Sant'Agnese in Agone is accessed from the Piazzo.

Favourite Piazza. This is a lovely piazza with lots of shops restaurants and beautiful fountains. We also found a gorgeous church hidden inside a grand building too. There are people providing entertainment and it has a great atmosphere.

Favourite Piazza. This is a lovely piazza with lots of shops restaurants and beautiful fountains. We also found a gorgeous church hidden inside a grand building too. There are people providing entertainment and it has a great atmosphere.

Lovely place for people watching. Amazingly beautiful piazza with lots going on in and around........the Indians trying to hawk their plastic tat got a bit tiresome but apart from that,it was a lovely place to visit.
A must visit . If you are an art lover then you have to visit this place. You will find local artists there and just enjoy the feel of the place. It has many restaurants there as well.

Hustle, bustle and busy. This lively Piazza with its street art, churches, magnificent fountain and costly restaurants is a beautiful hub which seemed to be at the crossroads of all our journeys in this "walking city".Since this was our second visit to Rome we did not linger here too long, possibly taking a superior "this is too touristy for us" position however we did take the time to marvel at the astonishing sculpture in the fountain.
Comfortable stay. You can eat Gelato & sit beside the fountain , walking & see right & left , then have a pizza with drink

Roma. Well another attraction you need to visit and i promise you it will not be disappointing. If you stay in Rome for few days, best way is to do "Rome Walks" at one point you will be at Piazza Navona. Enjoy time beautiful beautiful city of Romulus and Remus.
Great spot. . Lovely spot for a nice meal in one of the many over looking restaurants. Night time would be what I would recommend. Get a gellato and a selfie stick and your set.
Holiday. Piazza was stunning, great statues and lots of places to sit and eat round the area. Always very busy
Skip the Trevi fountain and go here. Nice square, beautiful fountains and not too many crowds.I found this area pleasant and worth hanging out in.

Probably the most beautiful one in rome! . The Navona is the greatest. Take the time, relax, sit by the bench, listen to the water running... An amazing experience, just you, a thousand tourists and one great piece of art!
Dinner with friends. Great palazzo to visit, plenty of good restaurants, great view. We came at the perfect time of year.

Beautiful. Very pretty, 4 rivers sculptor by Bernini. Good gelato, Very pretty, 4 rivers sculptor by Bernini. Good gelato, retreatants around are expensive and do not allow access to toilet if not purchasing something on the other hand when they knew my baby had to use it were very helpful

Classical Roma!. The Piazza was built over the site of Domitian's stadium. If you work around the corner of the north side, you can visit the ruins of the stadium (extra charge). Spend a few dollars (remember that you are paying top tourist dollar for this experience!) and got to Tre Scalini on the piazza for an Aperol spritz (refreshing) and a tartufo! Tre Scalini is where you get the original tartufo (not the location to its left as you face the cafe.) the restorations on the piazza were well done.
Beautiful Piazza. Lovely spot to spend some time and take in the atmosphere. Busy but full of character, easy walking distance to Trevi Fountain and Pantheon, loved it!
The place to be!. Another must see attraction for visitors to Rome. Be prepared to pay a premium for sitting at one of the many restaurants & cafes in the Piazza.
A Fun Place. Everyone goes to this plaza at some point. There is a lot of activity there including restaurants and street musicians. It is a good stop.
Wonderful. Really glad I managed to visit this Piazza, wonderful fountains and structures, really relaxing and enjoyable

Lowen . We came across this piazza as we wandered around Rome. It was interesting as we hadn't been aware of this and thought it just another amazing site in Rome. Fascinating! Interesting! Worth the effort to see this before the Trevi fountain.

Great spot day and night!. Visited Piazza Navona during day and nighttime during our trip. Both are great. It gets very full, but was always manageable during late September. The restaurants lining the Piazza are generally more expensive and touristy, but not particularly good, so you are better off strolling away a few blocks for a drink or something to eat.

Amazing Piazza...true Italian style, art and beauty.... A place to visit when in Rome...beautiful fountain with its surroundings, amazing colors of Italy. Piazza with restaurants around and amazing for painting

What wonderful sculptures. Although this Piazza has only mediocre restaurants it is a super place to visit to see the fountains. The artists trying to sell you their creations are an interesting bonus.
Bernini at his best!. One of my favourite squares in Rome. Such masterful art - great for people watching or just to gaze at the architecture!

Best Place to Stay For Awhile. Love sitting at the many restaurants around this wide piazza, great people watching and relaxing way to spend some time if you don't have an itinerary packed to the gills!

Beautiful. One of the most beautiful piazzas in Rome - early in the morning before the crowds is the best time to get there and spend time at the fountain. Recommend not eating at any of the restaurants here though as they're overpriced and there's better (less touristy) food if you walk 15mins or so out.

Worth a visit. Well worth seeing for the fountains and streetlife but quite commercialised and many street sellers with complete rubbish on sale, go off into the backstreets for better priced food and drinks
Bigger than expected. The crowds here are huge but it all goes okay. Don't stand in the wrong place or the Police will blow their whistle at you. A large ice-cream costs 6 euro so be warned.

Open plaza. A pretty open plaza with some very nice fountains and a beautiful church. Nice relaxing place to stop. Dont forget to fill your water bottle at the drinking water fountain on the far right when facing the white building that houses the church.
Always a highlight. My favourite square in the city. Amazing fountains. Lots of activity. Some great restaurants on the adjacent side-streets.

Stunning Fountains. This expansive piazza features exquisite fountains by Borromini and Bernini. Musicians frequently provide entertainment to visitors. The piazza is surrounded by small restaurants with patios where you can enjoy a glass of wine as the sun goes down. The light gives surrounding buildings a warm glow that contrasts beautifully with the fountains... Perfect for avid photographers.

Magical. We've came here in the evening. The whole place is just magical - there were a few street musicians, a few fortune-tellers, a lot of people throwing those rubber toys which sparkle... The fountains and surrounding buildings are outstanding. We've wanted a gelato, so randomly have sat on an outdoor terrace of the place called "Dolce Vita", I believe. We've asked about gelato and the waitress told us they make home-made gelato, so we've ordered two cups each. That was, by far, the best gelato I've had in my entire life. I highly recommend you to try it out. It'll maybe seem a bit pricy, but believe me, it's worth it.

Buzzy area. This is a busy area where an old area once stood. Great statues and fountains with little bistro's scattered around. Average rating as we were ripped off being charged 16 Euro for a small beer and a coke.
pretty. We enjoyed hanging around piazza novano. Its pretty. Near by pantheon. Loved it. Good restaurants near by.
A great place to relax. Piazza Navona is just one of those places that oozes Rome, cafes bars, restaurants, side streets and three beautiful fountains that are accessible, not like the Trevi!

Great Restaurants. We had an early dinner in the Piazza Navona at La Dolce Vita. We ate outside and it was wonderful. You could order off the menu or deviate from the stated menu on any particular dish. The pasta was homemade and was one of the best meals I had during my 2 week vacation. Reasonably priced with good wine.

The Fountains of Rome. This was another must see sight on the Tourist trail around Rome. It has 3 large fountains in the main square with the Central Fountain of the 4 Rivers as the highlight. They are really great to look at & the workmanship is fantastic. Avoid the Tourist Trap restaurants that ring this Piazza unless you are rich.

Wonderful at NIght. We walked through here most evenings to capture the atmosphere. Surrounded by a variety of restaurants and bars with lots of people enjoyinmg the warm evenings. Well worth a visit.

Worth a stroll round for Bernini and buzz!. The atmosphere in the piazza during the day and at night is fantastic, well worth a visit just to experience that. Another great reason to visit are the fountains, two by Giacomo della Porta (one has an addition by Bernini) and of course the magnificent Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi by Bernini. Make sure that you wander round it more than once, it takes a lot of time to appreciate Bernini's skill and there is just so much detail to take in! For this fountain alone it's worth a visit. Be aware of the restaurants though, whilst well situated obviously they are of course massively over-priced and of questionable quality. I had a disappointing pizza in one of the restaurants there, it wasn't anywhere near as good as a pizza I had a day earlier in another restaurant situated just 2 minutes walk away in one of the small streets running off the piazza!

Atmospheric!. Music, artists, acrobatics and many more activities to see depending on the day and the time. Great atmosphere, beautiful fountain. Lots of places to eat and enjoy the atmosphere either day or night.

one of the most beautiful of the many, many Roman piazzas. We stumbled across the Piazza Navona after crossing the bridge from the Vatican. Unusual it's a long, rectangle piazza, where most we saw were roundish - very stylish, lots of upmarket restaurants, possibly on the pricier side. We didn't eat there, just strolled through, taking it all in
Nothing better..... Nothing better than sitting in the Piazza Navonna sipping amaretto and watching the world go by. Church by the main fountain is also worth a look.

Get a vibe of Rome and the culture. Stay a while, and spend several hours in this place. Look around, see the intricate details of the structures, pick a restaurant, and enjoy the food. Drink wine, and enjoy!

stroll through the city. Piazza is lovely and hub for local talent from singers to artists & musicians surrounded by many bars and restaurants - my tip however is to walk off the Piazza onto one of the side streets for more intimate and more economic refreshments.

Best Piazza in Rome. Lovely spacious with a touch of different architecture from top to bottom of the Piazza you will see old models of buildings and mid times.
Restaurants and Caffè are all around overlooking the Piazza and there are painters there if you would like a good souvenir.
Plus the Pantheon is soo close to it.

Don't miss this place.. This one is easy, i simply love The Piazza Novona!! One of the most attractive spots to relax after a busy day of walking Rome. It's location is perfect, sitting between the Vatican City to the west and the Pantheon/Trevi Fountain to the east. Just pick a restaurant and sit outside to watch the world go by. Make sure you take a look at the Fountain of the Four Rivers in the southern part of the square, it's stunning!!
Cool mood. Despite too many people (of course!) and some terrible cleaning services i've loved this ancient place. A cool mood and many chicks hangin' around, also!

Lovely square with decent restaurants. . Piazza Navona is a well known square within Rome that sports a good number of restaurants. However, after looking on trip advisor for recommendations on restaurants within the area me and my girlfriend preferred Navona Notte which was only a couple of streets back from the main square. Prices are typically more expensive from restaurants within the main square as it is genuinely what tourists will look for first and also with the view of the square right in front of you.

This place is a Must. You can't explore Rome without spending some time at the Piazza Navona. Not only is it beautiful and filled with dozens of restaurants and cafes, its atmospheric, bustling and a great place to pass some time or just walk through.

Just the Best Place. Every time we are in Rome one of the first places we go. It is a wonderful place to sit, have a drink and people watch. All the restaurants I have been to have all been friendly and not over-priced like say St Marks square in Venice. And if you close your eyes, one can see the chariot racing that happened here 2000 years ago. Some of the original entrance gates are still visible. A lovely spot in the greatest city.

Pretty. This is one of the many places in Rome that is a must visit.It doesn't look as big in the pictures as it really is in person.It has gielattos, restrooms and even a bar nearby.According to tradition, you have to toss:1 coin backwards to return to Rome.2 coins to find love.3 coins to lose a lover.So I would definitely reccomend goibg here if you're in Rome.
Great piazza.. Lovely piazza with fountains, statues and many great restaurants found among all the side streets. Quite delightful.
this is a must see!!. You cannot visit Italy and not see this... it is free and beautiful! It might be crowded, but go anyway!!

A beautiful place to spend some time. Just site there for a while and you will find a peace of mind. A really great place for a walk around or just to sit there and watch all the beautiful people who pass by.

Fabulous Fountains. Piazza Navona has not one, not two, but three fabulous fountains. Any one of them would be reasons to visit a piazza were it the only fountain there. The largest of them is the central "Fountain of the Four Rivers". At the north end is the "Fountain of Neptune" with almost hypnotic horse eyes. At the south end is "Moor Fountain". Unfortunately we visited the piazza in the early afternoon on a very hot (90+ degree) day. Out in the piazza the heat was unbearable, so we walked down the western side where there was a bit of shade. To avoid this I would recommend visiting it either first thing in the morning, or in the late afternoon/early evening

Better sights to see. As I write this review Piazza Navona is # 7 thing to do in Rome. I have no idea how it got ranked that high. We had lunch here during our visit to Rome. The square is nice, but there are many more historic, and interesting places to see in Rome in my opinion. The fountains are cool, lots of artist's selling there wares. If I'm ever back in Rome I would not return.

Lively Piazza. On a hot September day we ambled around the Piazza Navona. It's surrounded by cafes / restaurants / ice cream shops. Inside there's a fountain and street performers.It's a nice place to soak up the atmosphere.
Tourist Magnet!. Beautiful place, quite crowded. Lots of artsy stuff. One thing i don't like, all restaurants are just expensive!
In Christmas it's just incredible.. Must visit during the Christmas Holidays, it just glows during the night. So beautiful.So traditional, just what you'd expect from Christmas in Rome.
Gorgeous. Romantic , beautiful , well worth taking a walk by . Thousands if not millions have shared stories and experiences here , and a few hugs and kisses .

A beautiful Italian Piazza!. A lovely stroll through this Piazza allows you to not just take in the amazing sculptures, fountains etc but also the hustle & bustle of the restaurants/bars & coffee shops either side. If you have the time take a seat & soak up the atmosphere.

Favorite place to find in Rome!. I absolutely adore eating in the Piazza Navona there are so many wonderful restaurants to choose from and it's just an amazing experience to sit outside looking at the people and the fountains and taking in the joy of Rome! After lunch or dinner it's a very easy walk to the Trevi fountain!
Really nice!. We went several times at night after dinner to Piazza Navona. Is beautiful there, still crowded, but very charming.

Lovely visit. Nice restaurants and lovely view, little rainy in September but was great anyway. Is a nice place to walk and share with friends and family.
The Piazza Navona has lots of history!

Beautiful to see all the statues. Enjoyed walking around the plain and look at all the beautiful statues. Artists were displaying their art and you could purchase beautiful art. All along the plain there are restaurants to visit.
Busking Central. Go there, grab a seat at the side, pay over the odds for an Aperol Spritz and just watch the world go by.
Nice place to hang out for a while. Reminds me of a town square. Pretty sculptures and tons of tourists. A nice place to stop and have a gelato. Lots of local street vendors.

Romantic. After a short walking distance from Via Vittorio Emmanuel and between a narrow streets full of churches, stores and charmed atmosfere you get to the piazza and their fountains. Musicians playing theirs violins and chelos make you feel like you are in a romantic movie.

Take a break. This is a great place to take a break. Not only is this a popular tour spot it's also a wonderful spot to take a break. The fountains are beautiful and relaxing also there are many local restaurants in the area if you want a bite to eat or just sit and people watch. Folks at home won't believe the beauty and detail of these fountains so get plenty of pictures.
Bustling pizza with lots to see. One of my favourite piazzas. Lots of restaurants, 2 beautiful fountains and plenty of quirky little stores. A wonderful place to sit and people watch.

Nothing speciak. If you have spare time in your trip, it could be worth going through the Piazza. Its basically a large open sspaxe full of restaurants and cafes with a statue in the middle, we didnt think it was that exciting, we just walked through.
Love it!. Wow! Great place to just hang out and people watch. Great artists are selling their creations. Dozen cafes and restaurants. Not to miss!
Lovely piazza. This is a lovely more quaint piazza in Rome. It's slightly off track for the crowds so easier to find somewhere to sit relax and enjoy the view

You Could Sepnd Hours here Without Being Bored. This was part of Cosmos tour in Italy. There was so much to see in this beautiful Piazza; from the Fiumi fountain, Neptune Fountain and the church right next to the Piazza. Really worth a trip. You have all kinds of restaurants around the piazza. You could spend hours here without being bored!

Incredible night life among the fountains. Piazza Navona is a unique experience. It was once a race track, Circus Agonalis, that eventually became known as Navona. Today, it is a spot to sit at one of the many cafes and watch the people and various artists. The night we visited there were jugglers and street artists entertaining the watchers. The outside cafe seating was full. The piazza itself is quite beautiful with the three fountains. At one end is the Fountain of the Moor and at the other end is the Fountain of Neptune. In the middle is Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers. Each of the nudes represents the principal rivers of the known continents. Be sure to take your time going around this fountain since each side is so different. Stop at one of the cafes or get a gelato and watch the people for a while

My favorite piazza in Rome. Piazza Navona is my favorite piazza in Rome and is (relatively) uncrowded by the standards of Rome in September.It's a lovely place to sit and have coffee but I would not suggest any of the restaurants as they are pretty overpriced and served mediocre food. However, if you want some pizza and wine, it's worth it just to soak up the atmosphere.
Passing through. Always amazing as you walk through Rome and come onto this piazza with fountain.Crowded during the day, it was a bit more quiet at night.
Great Statues.. Nice place to walk around and have a bite to eat or a lovely coffee. Calm and not so busy as some of the other piazza's.
Families, Friends, Tourists. Al Fresco dining at a number of venues. Gelato vendors, endless amateur travel photographers and majestic perspectives.

Stunning attraction. Easily, you could spend hours walking and being amazing by its beauty! I don't know how to explain but the fountain water enhances the noises of everything happening around you. So, no matter what mood you are in, spending an hour or two there would totally regenerate you!
Great place to visit and great pictures!. This area and fountain is not as well known as Trevi Fountain but is another "not to miss" the statues and church are great and the pictures are great.
Beautiful piazza - full of life. There was so much to see in this beautiful Piazza; from the Fiumi fountain, Neptune Fountain and the church right next to the Piazza. Really worth a trip.
Great people watching area . If you want to people watching then this is as good a place as any, but if you sit outside the many bars then be prepared to pay a premium for your drinks and food.

I love this large piazza. Loverly area, lots of restaurants and lots of tourist as well. You will stumble upon it as you walk towards the trevi fountain. Take in the sight, have a drink, great place to people watch. One thing- because of your belongs, I sense that there are a lot of pickpockets in this area.
Amazing. This fountain is really amazing to see. Try to go earlier in the day, as it gets very crowded. The streets and shops in the area are also woth seeing.

living square. plenty of old pubs, restaurants, shops... nice and warm welcome people, very good filing you have walking around, between street artists, painters. best place to take couple minutes break with espresso
Another Piazza. There are so many piazzas in Rome, they kind of all blend together after awhile. This one has a very large plaza. Some good restaurants nearby.

Love love love. As with all Rome's delights, great food, great atmosphere, cosmopolitan crowd, I thoroughly enjoyed Piazza Navona. There is so much going on here and when the weather is good it's a great place to chill and watch the world go by with a Bellini or beer in hand, which is what we did 😄

Great space. Bernini's fountain is the centerpiece of one of the best piazzas in Rome. Stroll down side streets to find a bite to eat in an osteria, trattoria or gelateria. One of my favorite spots in the city

Piazza Novana is a must while visiting Rome. Piazza Novanna is a beautiful large square in Rome that you should visit. There is a large fountain that depicts the historic 4 rivers. There are merchants, restaurants with outdoor patios, and street musicians. It is a very festive environment.

Beautiful!. Everywhere you turn in this city you find beauty and art. This piazza is another place that you will want to visit, enjoy, and take pictures. I will never tire of gazing at the fantastic statues and fountains.

Simply a Masterpiece. Whether by day or night, this piazza is humming with tourists. Early is always better, especially in the morning. The massive sculpted fountain by Bernini is topped with a tall obelisk. The four figures representing the four major river systems at the time, are amazing to see. There is a lion hidden in the center taking a drink from the fountain flanked by a tall carved palm tree. I took me two visits to notice it. There is a basilica on one side which is well worth your time to see. If you are hungry, one whole side is flanked with restaurants. But go one block off the square and you get very tasty food for a bit less price. If you need a taxi, there is a taxi stand just down the street off the Piazza to the right as you face the church. Note that at night you may wait 20 minutes or more.
Good to walk through. This is a large piazza. With cafe culture a great place to buy a selfie stick - even though there are no discussions about buying one, the stick is just shoved in your face!!!!!
Incredible ..... This is a great place to a coffe, at a resonable price and watch the world go by! The fountains and architecture is beyond belief..
peaceful. The square is so peaceful even with the crowds. The fountains are so beautiful and the intricate detail is magical. sit and eat at one of the cafes and just chill in the atmosphere
Peaceful pedestrian sqaure in the heart of Rome.. A great place to wander and enjoy the beautiful fountains and statues. There are often street performers. Lots of sidewalk cafes and gelato stands.
A Beautiful Piazza. The best sights in Rome are the Piazzas - and this is one of the best. Walk around, do some shopping, have an Aperol Spritz at an outdoor cafe - and take in the best of Rome!
Place to chill. Nice place to sit and see the life in Rome unfold. There are several restaurants around to sit and have a good time.

Stayed in the square. Piazza Navona is definitely the area you should stay (if you have the chance to) when you go to Rome. It is central to absolutely anything, with the Colosseum in one direction and the Vatican City, the same distance in the opposite direction. Both places you can walk to and visit different historical sites along the way. Piazza Navona was special in itself.
Very cool. This was a really neat place to see. We got there at dusk. Made the scenery even neater. A great photo op

A square full of life, energy, and that glorious river gods sculpture by Bernini. Great places to eat, lots of people-watching opportunities, and a fantastic place to admire the artistry and detail contained in the river gods fountain sculpture.By day, it's a relaxing place and by night, street music entertains the crowds, artists of many kinds (including performing) put on shows, busy cafes attract visitors, and loads of people are out and about (including pick pockets).Mainly, it's the fountain that draws tourists into this large, rectangular plaza that has been a "hub" since the first century and Roman rule (it was the site of a "circus" or arena).Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi or Fountain of the Four Rivers is the site of a whole entire review of its own; it only plays a part (although major) in this plaza. Two other fountains are the fountain with the moor (wrestling with a dolphin) and the fountain of Neptune.This location comes highly recommended for a very pleasant place to rest, soak up the local ambiance, refresh and restore the body, and plan the afternoon's events. We recommend Caffe Barocco for drinks and pizza and exceptional service.It's a short walk from this square to the Pantheon, a must-see for all visitors to Rome.

When in Rome.. Visited around lunchtime. Visit to view the fountains. Loads of places around for drinks or food. Different budgets catered for. Allowed table just for drinks; after all they ask you to sit!

The best people-watching in Rome. If you are lucky enough to grab a front-row table at one of the many restaurants in the Piazza Navona, order some wine and watch the spectacle. This was our favorite place to sit back and watch Rome unfold around us. There is faint music playing from every direction, street performers entertaining the masses, and a beautiful fountain that becomes a hub of activity once the sun sets. When I die and go to Heaven, I expect I will wake up in Piazza Navona, sipping wine and contently watching the world go by me.

A Truely Amazing Place. Clearly less well known than some of the other sights of Rome but no less spectacular. The intricate carving of the statues and the magnificent architecture of the square is as good as any we have seen in Rome. A big bonus in not having so many people to contend with.

Nice, relaxing and cheerful place. One of my favourite spots in Rome. Ideal time to visit is around 4-6 in the evening. There will be lot of people, lot of activities and you will most definitely find it cheerful. Unlike other major squares in Rome, this one doesn't get disturbed by the traffic. This one is a bit bigger too than most others. A very nice place to sit and relax, especially if the climate is good enough.

Just sit ...... Beautiful fountains all over Rome and this is no exception Indulge and pay the money to sit in a cafe/bar on the piazza and just people watch It's worth every penny Wonderful ! Just say a polite but firm no to any street vendors and look away .... They'll leave you alone Funny to watch them run when the police enter the square ☺️
Near by Baroque Church. Piazza Navonna and surroundingsBeautiful sculptures, outstanding churchMany restaurants right close to it and the ones on the near by streets are a must

Our Favorite Spot. Piazza Navona is truly our family's favorite spot for meals and relaxation. The fountains are beautiful, there aren't street vendors that attack you, and the service in the restaurants are top-notch. Must go!

Beautiful square. Beautiful Renaissance square . Side streets surrounding opening up to a gem on a hot day . The fountains are fab as is the architecture . The cafes surrounding the square are pricy so wander off a little up the side streets for same calibre of food for better value.
Love it here. It is a great place. Love to sit in the piazza and people watch. The perimeter is lined with restaurants. Good restaurants, gelaterias also just one street over in any direction,
Chilling by the water. Great gathering place. Everybody congregates here.Nice to be able to people watch and take in the ambience.
Birthday weekend treat . Amazing huge piazza where fountain is situated lots of bars and restaurants nearby,street artists musicians lovely atmosphere.

Beautiful and historic . I loved Piazza Navona!
So excited to see it on the first day of my honeymoon.
Berninis Fountain of four rivers is my favourite fountain in Rome. Great restaurants in the square and don't forget to toss a coin in and make a wish!!

Lovely Piazza!. I really enjoyed my visit to the Piazza Navona. Even though there were tourists, it wasn't overflowing.
You could meander through the piazza and have a coffee or a light lunch in a lovely atmosphere. There was a man playing guitar who was quite good and subtle.
After visiting the crowded Trevi Fountains and Spanish Steps, this was very nice.

Fantastic Fountain. Fountains play an important role in Rome and can be found in piazzas throughout the city. The Fountain of the Four Rivers, located in Piazza Navona, was sculpted by Bernini in natural stone and marble. It was commissioned by Pope Innocent X. Besides an Egyptian obelisk, the fountain contains gods representing the four major rivers in 1651. The figure representing Europe’s Danube River faces the obelisk. In the same area you can see the Papal coat of arms. Since the source of the Nile in Africa was unknown, the sculpture has a cloth over its face and a lion is nearby. River Ganges represents Asia has an ore with a snake around it. This was done to show the river was navigable. Finally, the sculptor representing the Americas is a statue sitting on a pile of coins representing the riches of this area of the world. Noteworthy of this sculpture is that it is falling backwards with one arm raised. It is believed the god is shading his eyes from the rays of sunshine. I think it is important to have a tour guide in order to know the meaning of this statue. A definite must see!
Must see. Must see on trip to Rome. Great place to people watch. Avoid the overpriced restaurants and beware of pick pockets.

Love this place. Our private tour of Rome ended here and we then had a delightful dinner sitting outside along the perimeter of the square which is lined by many great casual eating establishments. The central fountain is beautiful as is the surrounding architecture. A terrific place for people watching. We went back there to dine a second evening and just take in the wonderful Roman atmosphere.

Pleasant. We went by in the early evening. It's not as tightly packed as the Trevi Fountain. You can relax and sit on a bench, watch the crowd, view the fountain and water running, read the history and get an appertivo.
Great place for people watching. What a lovely piazza! Enjoy a stroll there any time of the day and sit in one of the cafes enjoying excellent coffee and relax!
Beautifull. So beautifull , just cleaned. Very impressive , only minus was too many people. Easy to find, must visit places

A place to relax and have some food.. It is one of the relaxing place in Rome. Simple sit and admire the Roman Architecture with cold breeze and relaxing mind. Personally i liked this place as it was not much crowded making it a good relaxing place.:)

Wonderful. By far the best Piazza in Rome, beautiful fountains lots of lovely cafes to have a coffee ( yes a little more expensive about 12 euro's for 2 coffee's with a small bit of cake but what a setting ) be there a 12 noon and you hear a lovely ringing of church bells )

Plenty of space to enjoy the atmosphere. This area is surrounded by wonderful Italian buildings and has the feature of a beautiful fountain. The story goes that this area was used to recreate sea battles by flooding with water.
Amazing. You must visit this piazza as it is really beautiful with street artists, cafes, and beautiful architecture

Walk through. Nice stroll through the Piazza last night. Full of people, music and Roman atmosphere. The Bernini sculptures were fabulous. St. Agness church was beautiful and filled with other sculptures. The dome ceiling was wonderful.
Beautiful piazza. Look around enjoy the sites lots going on including musicians playing and some acrobats doing stunts. There are many restaurants but may be overpriced and I would eat elsewhere

Worth an amble through . The piazza usually is populated with several artists selling good, although fractionally pricey artwork. The old chariot racing ring is clear and the central Bernini fountain is stunning and worth close look. Avoid being drawn in to the surrounding bars and restaurants. They are over priced and usually only attended by tourists and rich Americans. A few paces away, in surrounding streets you can find more authentic Italian restaurants and trattorie which will be far more atmospheric, filled with locals and a darn sight cheaper. There is a lot of tourist aimed nonsense such as human statues and people selling whirring and buzzing tat. But overall, it's worth half an hour of your time.

Vacation 2016 in Rome. The piazza was full of people, the sounds of the fountain was calming. Many activities to do around the piazza. We went back in the evening and enjoyed a nice gelato for the evening.

Large open piazza with lots of gelato options close by. Grab a gelato and watch the people meandering around. Not a lot of places to sit however. Plenty of restaurants to grab a drink or meal and sit and people watch. Some carts with people selling souvenirs. Fountains and statues were great.
Perfect at night. This place was gorgeous and lively at night.several food spots all day long .At night different artists come out.it's similar to NYC central park outskirts.

Such a beautiful Piazzo. This is one of my favourite places in Rome and the Piazza with the fountain in the middle is just grand. Best time to see the Piazza is early morning as there is no one there but it gets busy.
Beautiful square. Beautiful square. Always loads going on here and plenty of activity. I would avoid the restaurants in this square though as they are expensive.

Busy but worth a look.. I expect it can vary at different times of the year but we found it very busy, it was also on a Sunday so probably extra busy with local folk too. The fountains are lovely to sit around on a hot day, and there are lots of side streets with places to lunch. If you look for special offers by going out a couple of streets you can find lunch for 10 Euro!
Piazza Navona. Large busy piazza. Lots to see including the fountains. Quite a lot of Artists selling pictures. Alleys leading off also with market type stalls and restaurants.

After many visits, went with someone who knows about it!. I have visited Piazza Navona many times, over the course of more than 25 years. I even had an apartment just off the piazza for a month, some time back.However, I walked through last month, with a friend from Rome who has taken a fascination in the city's antiquities. Effectively, I had a tour guide, which is something I've tended to avoid over the years.I wonder what I've missed!I was familiar with Bernini's statues, (though I didn't know he did all three in the piazza); what I didn't know was that Gustav Eiffel saw the largest, centre statue, and took that as his inspiration for the Eiffel Tower. A glance at the four legs makes that obvious, but (for me, anyway) only after it was pointed out.Similarly, I hadn't been familiar with story behind the building of Bernini's statues and the main church in the piazza. Two architects competed for all of the work, Bernini being awarded the statues, and someone else the church. The two men hated each other, and hence the character on the statue is shielding his face from the church, whilst the Blessed Mary atop the church averts her gaze, looking away from the statues.I do not normally post reviews of sites such as this, but add this to underline that a well-informed guide (person or book) can make a terrific difference....(Only 4 stars though, as I was subject to an attempted rip-off at one of the largest restaurants on the piazza, the waiter "accidentally" short-changing me 50 Euros.)

Beautiful open space in Rome. I came here at dusk / night time when the fountains are lit up beautifully. There are a number of restaurants to chose from though they are aimed at the tourist market and so priced accordingly (i.e expensive) so we decided to eat a little further away. The space itself has three fountains adorned with statues and sculptures. They are beautifully done and wonderfully lit in the evening. Definite photo opportunities to be had and its nice just taking a seat where you can (preferably with a coffee at a cafe) and watch people go by. A genuinely wonderful place.

Four Rivers fountain. Beautiful square with 3 fountains. The centerpiece is the Four Rivers Fountain with an obelisk on top. Faces a great church facade. Don't eat directly on the square because most places are over priced and touristy.

Grand square but too much fuzz.. Piazza Navona may be famous and is indeed large and impressive with it's three fountains. But there are almost as many doubtful guys selling everything from slime to roses that to me it's just too much confusion. But if you want to have your portrait made or want to by paintings of Rome, this is the place to go.
Stunning, but very busy even at midnight. A must see but very busy even at midnight. The best time I guess would be early morning to see it without people so set the alarm early.
Nice place to spend a serene evening. Lots of restaurants around to sit and have a dinner or sip wine. Haven't seen any street performer or activity of any type. Mostly tourists roaming around.

Busy but atmospheric . We were here mid afternoon and it was crowded. Weather very warm during this visit so we did not delay here. There were loads of young people sitting in the shade so no where much to longer. Nice to see!
Favourite . Had lunch here today...lovely atmosphere. ..great fountains. ..excellent for people watching. Visited twice.

Beautiful buzzy piazza. We visited every night, ate dinner there whichis entertaining and allowed our 11 year old to watch the artist using spray cans. He did a very special painting for her in the end which she cherishes. The statues and fountains are really beautiful works of art, fountains lit at night. Very nice.

Piazza Navona . The piazza was a short walk from our apartment and we walked passed it nearly every day. It's always busy with tourists and street performers. Plenty of places to eat around the Piazza although a little expensive I would recommend a street just behind the square where there are plenty of lovely restaurants all reasonably well priced and with a more relaxed atmosphere. Just follow your nose and the locals and you'll find them

Favorite place in Rome. We had only a short time in Rome, but I thought this Piazza was fabulous. There a multiple amazing fountains. It is large and lined with cafe's on one length and beautiful buildings on the other length.

Relax.. This time around we just went for a stroll around. The fountain is obviously the main attaction. Loads of eateries around there. We had an ice-cream , we went a bit mad and had a 4 scoop one which cost 3.50 euro each. You have to have at least one ice-cream while you are in Rome.

Beautiful Square !. Absolutely loved Piazza Navona. It is a beautiful square in the heart of town boasting of several fountains, sculptures, a big church and cobbled stone paths. Great place to relax and grab a quick snack, coffee while people watching.

Touristy and beautiful. You will most likely get asked to buy some sort of selfie stick or squishy, flying toy by a street vendor, but seeing these fountains is worth at least walking through the piazza.
Stunning. Fun to walk around and people watch. The view is stunning and lots of little shops and cafes near by
Pretty . Pretty but area very busy. If you make it to Italy, just being among the people and actually seeing the historic site is wonderful.

Huge piazza with a great fountain . Piazza Novana sits on the site of an ancient Roman circus (race track). Today it's focus is the astounding 4 rivers fountain. The Piazza is surrounded with restaurants, gelato shops and pizza places. Do visit Sant Agnes while you're in the Piazza.
Nice place to people watch. . Great place to have a glass of vino and people watch. Nice fountains and nice atmosphere here well worth a visit.
Love this place!. Piazza Navona is worth visiting, it's lively and colourful, nice for walking around. The church of Santa Agnese in Agone in Piazza Navona is beautiful and worth visiting.

Nice city landmark. Pretty fountains and church. Many local artists.. We were on a wonderful walking tour that started at Piazza di Spagna, visited several sites including Trevi Fountain and Pantheon, and ended up at Piazza Navona in the early evening. It was a fun place to hang out. Reminded me a little of Jackson Square, with the many artists selling their paintings or doing portraits. A number of street vendors were around but they were not intrusive.The piazza is where you can view three fountains: the central one is the more famous Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini; and the two complementary fountains at each end of the piazza, the Fountain of Neptune and the Fountain of the Moor. There is also the attractive church of Sant'Agnese in Agone, next to the 4 Rivers fountain.There are several restaurants and cafes along the piazza. We ate dinner there. The food was good but expensive, as you pay a premium for the location and ambience.
Must see when in Rome. It's fun to watch the painters and even more to get a painting or caricature of youself. The Bellini fountain in the middle of the oval is impressive.
Piazza navona. Nice Roman square look around it is beautiful but the better restaurants are in the streets around the square

Very beautiful. Piazza navona is very artistic Best time to visit - Evening when the lights are on around the fountain.Has the line of restaurants around along with the portrait/caricature artists. Ideal time to spend - 2 hours to soke in the city watching beautiful place.

Cool at Night. This place has a very cool vibe at night. Lots of people watching, dining and gelato to go around. I stumbled onto this area on the way to another famous fountain and decided to stay and absorb the cool night. This is very touristy but not as crowded as the Trevi Fountain.
A top piazza for dinner. This piazza has lots of options for dinning and was a welcome find. there are also street performers to keep you entertained while you dine
Fantastic. This is a just do I. Rome although be aware that restaurants here are very overpriced. But is very historical and great place to people watch .

Nice & Lively. Rome is all about walk walk walk, so this place is in the middle of all the action. Nice place for a meal or just a coffee. Very close to all the major attractions and shopping in Rome.
Piazza Navona. Kind of stumbled on this beautiful spot. Really, really beautiful. Not as crowded as some of the other Piazzas which was really nice.
breath taking to see. Worth all the crowds.. Another fantastic part of history that is very interesting to Rome. I must have taken 10 pictures of this alone. Don't miss this.
Favourite Piazza in all of Rome. The title says it all. Had a really nice time here. It's beautiful and especially clean (which you can't say for the vast majority of Rome!)

The last spot of a visit to Rome. After a great day visiting the marvellous monuments in Rome, my favourite place in the evening is the PiazzaNavona, where you can walk around the impressive fountains enjoying the night atmosphere with people from all places, tourist an Romans, while you taste a Tartufo gelatti from any of the icecream shops in the square, the best end for a daily visit.

Lovely place. Worth to go/pass there on different hours of the day. Don't sit on one of the coffee/restaurants most of them are tourists traps. Go to the little street on the surroundings lots of cool places.

Sympathetic square . Very nice and attractive place , fountain made by Bennini , church made by his rival . Fountain made to Show humanization of the rivers ... Evening time has live bands on small streets and some shows

Tourist hotspot. Don't eat at any of the restaurants on the piazza as its not authentic and you will get overcharged. Walk through the piazza to the top end where there are lots of little winding cobble streets abundant with cafes and little shops.
Great day. We visited the square, beautiful statues, many restaurants with misters to sit at and people watch. Great photo opportunites
Superb place. Superb place for hanging around . Very relaxing atmosphere.Lots of decent restaurants around .Would think best place for night out in Rome
A beautiful place!. We spent a lot of time being awe-struck by this place. It was stunning. Although the temperature was very high we appreciated what was there very much. A must-see when in Rome.

It's not just another Roman piazza.. This long open piazza is completely enclosed and has three fountains. We had Rick Steeves guidebook which had a charming explanation of the large fountain, which I would recommend.

Good place to relax and have lunch. My friend and I went to one of the restaurants in this piazza for lunch on a beautiful sunny afternoon! This is a great place to chill, relax and do some peoplewatching after walking around Rome.

Great People watching. Friday evening the musicians start to play to entertain the crowds huddled around the fountains...Saturday afternoon the piazza fills with tables for the market...great place to people watch (don't eat at the restaurants, pricey and not that good compared to even a block away...grab a beverage and watch the people)
Large Piazza. While there was a crowd the piazza was extremely large with two fountains. At lunch at one of the restaurants and enjoyed the beautiful September weather.
Piazza Navona. Absolutely lovely square, quite near the pantheon, so we did the pantheon, then the piazza, where we had lunch and a drink. Worth a visit
Stunning. Great place to watch the world go by and absolutely stunning! Bars are expensive and just out side the square are other bars that are reasonably priced.
Piazza Navona. great to sit and have a gelato in the hot sun and watch the people go by. Did not eat in the main piazza but there are some incredible restaurants in the side streets.

Happening place. This place is a stretch having few old roman monuments which were crafted beautifully, You hv some good eateries here and can spend good time here. When we went a group of people created an awesome experience for us with combination of dance and music in centre of the area..I believe this place experiences regular activities from various artists and is a must visit..

Buzzing with life. Here you will find many places to eat, drink and rest. The Piazza is full of tourists and merchants selling souvenirs.The fountain is beautiful. Every time you look you will find another figure that you didnt see before!If you are looking for rest on a lazy afternoon, this is the best place to go and people watch!
Good trip. This is a must go place to visit, very nice, full of history, full of good restaurants around this area and good food as well. Also very safe.
Very beautiful ! . This one of the places that you should go, walk and enjoy!Take an ice-cream and enjoy!This piazza was also an stadium.

Lovely to see - potential tourist trap. Great piazza with impressive architecture and history. However some of the surrounding cafes/restaurants can be too expensive - we had to go into one due to a thunderstorm and ended up paying 5€ for an espresso...

Wonderful gathering place. This is a beautiful piazza in Rome. Lots of street life, restaurants. Also has street performers that are entertaining; and an unexpected light show on the facade of a building!

Restaurants and Fountains!. The most beautiful 3 fountains, very lively at night with many restaurants; however, if you walk on a side street you might found even better restaurants that are less crowded.
Lovely! Great both day and night. This is a great spot to sit down and take a break. Pick up a snack and beverage and watch people go by.
A place to sit and people watch. Watch out for restaurants in the plaza so much better to eat in the little alleys it would be cheaper
Nice Stroll. Less crowd to visit in the afternoon, walking distance from our hotel, about 30 minutes. Restaurants close by.
amazing. really beautiful square to sit and admire the view,the cafes in the square are expensive just for coffee,14 euros!worth going to see
Beautiful piazza. Lovely to walk around day and night. The sculptured fountains are amazing. There are numerous bars and cafes to enjoy a leisurely drink or meal.
Loved it . So lively with restaurants and shops surrounding it. The water fountains and statues are breathtaking. Lots of local artists selling their works. Must see and to enjoy a drink.

Lovely place. We ended up having a night here after a long hot day of visiting museums, its a beautful little street full with local eateries, cafes, nice restaurants. You won't be disappointed for food here! Theres a few street artists, etc and a beautiful fountain in the middle of the street, Berninis Fountain of Four Rivers, which is striking, and the Triton fountain at the other end. Perfect place to end a busy day, in beautiful surroundings.

Busy. This is hidden down the side streets of Rome and incredibly busy with tourists all day long. It is worth seeing to tick it off of your bucket list but pales in comparison to other attractions such as the Vatican and Colesseum.
Spectacular art and history. Submerge yourself - it's a must see. Wonderful photo ops and history combined. Avoid restaurants and shops on square as they are all touristy.

Beautiful landmark, not overcrowded. I love Piazza Navona! I've been here three times and would absolutely return again. It's a historically interesting and romantic location. Also, excellent selection of quality gelato shops inside the piazza. Avoid the overpriced restaurants, though. Unlike locations such as the Trevi Fountain and Colosseum, which are both very impressive, Piazza Navona has never been overcrowded in my experience. It's a relaxing location perfect for families, couples, or solo trips.

Great for people watching. This area is great for taking a break & enjoying the lively atmosphere in an evening or even after a lot of walking we got sheet from the shop & say & had a drink & watched the world go by. Lots of nice restaurants & some great offers if u get down the side streets, i.e. €10 for a starter main & glass of wine/ beer. Time it right in the church (Sant Agnese in agone) & you can go in & hear the orchestra practicing & view the amazing architecture & marble floors. You will need a scarf for your shoulders (like most places in Rome).
Overcrowded.. Good for a quick visit but not one of the important sites to visit. Just too many people around the day we were there.

Bernini's jewel. Beautiful open piazza. We visited during day and at night, but I prefer its look in the day time. Always busy with tourists; lined up with restaurants. Stop by the beautiful baroque church, St Agnes-In-Agony
BEautiful Piazza. Lovely piazza in Rome to visit, though be warned - no shade! Three lovely fountains to see, plenty of eateries around - including some offering delicious Ice Creams
Interesting Fountain. I think that the biggest attraction for these fountains is that everyone else is there. We enjoyed a lunch on the fountain's plaza. This was nice for people watching.
Beautiful Fountains. Loved seeing the fountains in this beautiful and large square. It was pretty to see during the day and at night. Go in the church if you have time and enjoy the artwork as well.
Nice hangout. All of Rome's public square's are fun to hang around at. Especially so when there are great art work to be admired :)
Loved this beautiful piazza & fountain!. Don't miss this beautiful fountain. We sat & enjoyed an ice cream & glass of wine while soaking it all in.

Enjoy beautiful baroque roman art to your heart's content. Built on a historically significant site, Piazza Navona is an open public place and home to important sculptural and architectural creations, with the Bernini's Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers) being one of the star attractions. All in all, Piazza Navona displays Baroque Roman architecture and art at its best.Most likely the square will not be so peaceful, with many many tourists everywhere, but look up above the heads of all your fellow tourists and you will see the beauty of the Piazza is absolutely there despite everything.

Awesome square. Piazza Navona is a fantastic square in Rome town centre close to Tevere river.Do not miss the Bernini fountain, but if you look around you can only be amazed by the beauty of the place.
Very nice. The square that surrounds this fountain is what sets this place apart. Well worth a look and take a camera!

Beautifully hidden, large Piazza surrounded by nice restaurants.. Well worth a visit although we decided to avoid the restaurants, opting for smaller venues in the smaller back streets. Whilst on the Piazza there was a film being shot. Not suprising in such a lovely location.
Lovely square - beautiful fountains - lit up at night.. Beautiful piazza, and looked great lit up at night. Lots of picture sellers - buy a painting here - I didn't it and I regret it enormously!
Stunning. Stunning and freeAmazing absolute must see. Free easy to walk to and access be weary of pick pockets tho . Loads of con artists in rome

Beautiful but Crowded. One of the larger and more beautiful squares in Rome. Full of tourists, many with selfie sticks and tour groups. Historical, like all of central Rome -- built over an even older stadium. Surrounded by buildings stuccoed in earth tones and a baroque religious building. Fountains are by Bernini and are magnificent. Many generic restaurants line the perimeter. Don't eat there but stop for a drink and enjoy people watching. Best in the early morning with fewer people and lower light angles.

Something Special. This is my second visit to Piazza Navona and I thoroughly recommend it to others. I always feel safe and at ease here, night or day. The fountains are gorgeous, magnificent works of art and I don't get tired of looking at them. The surrounding cafes and restaurants are welcoming and the food is delicious. Or just sit with a coffee and people watch. It's my favourite place.
Bellissima. One of my favorite fountains in all the world. It is a Bernini masterpiece. It is towering and imposing. A must see in Rome
Excellent place. A lovely relaxed area with lots of cafes and the opportunity to do some people watching. We spent Sunday morning with a cup of coffee watching the world go by

Gorgeous. Another tourist favorite, but for good reason. A great place to people watch, but beware of the slightly higher prices at the cafes. I prefer to order some wine or just a caffe and sit and enjoy the view.
“Beautiful but big crowd. Very nice to see it, just sitting , listening to the water and enjoying a gelato. If you go early in the morning , than you will miss big crowd. Afternoon is full of people.

Olden time horse racing arena.. We visited this piazza on our way back from the Vatican tour. Plenty of restaurants, fountains and statues. There was also an Egyptian obelish obviously treasure brought back as treasure trove / loot.

Good for food and drink. Very nice setting with a good selection of bars, restaurants and shops. Stunning fountain in the middle too as well as nice architecture all round. Only annoying thing is the guys trying to sell those cheap toys like they do in St. Marks in Venice!

One of my favourite places in the world!. The Piazza that has everything! The running track of the Stadium of Domitian gives it the unique shape that makes it both spacious and intimate. The Bernini fountain of the four rivers is a masterpiece, although completed in a rush to pacify impatient Innocent X; Bernini closed the curtains in his coach when he passed because he was so ashamed of it, but I can gaze quite happily; he won the competition by letting the viewer see space below the massive obelisk of Domitian. The Triton statue at the north end is another Bernini and balances the centre well, although the third statue is not as good. The piazza is loved by Romans and tourists, and people sit, eat, chat and promenade. A wonderful place to feel yourself in Rome.
Beautiful Piazza. An expensive place to eat and drink, but such an incredible piazza, what fountains. This is certainly one to visit, and have one of their fantastic cappuccinos.
Amazing. A true work of art! Everything in Rome is so beautiful! The architecture, the food , the people... I wish we could stay longer!

Fabulous. So wonder by day & a wonderful place to do at night , so many restaurants to choose from, it's an adventure turning each corner to find wonderful buildings & shops. Beware of street sellers everywhere trying to sell you selfie sticks , umbrellas, scarfs , water etc , they won't take no thank you for an answer !!

Fun Hangout!. A great place to stroll and people watch, this plaza is large with a lot going on. Many sidewalk cafes and shops and also vendors selling their art. The sound of water from the fountains is refreshing!
Nothing special. I have to say nothing special..just ordinary square with fountain..I was a little bit disappointed. But a lot of gelaterias with delicious (and also expensive) ice cream..
Place for early morning stroll. Great location to live by and to go in the mornings. Has a pretty sweet market once a week and there are a couple of really good cafes right around the corner.

Beautiful place. It was lovely just sitting here at the piazza, listening to the water and enjoying a gelato. Lovely art work sold at the piazza by local artists. You'll capture some excellent photos too
Lovely!. I loved this area! It can get really busy, so if you go earlier on in the day, you'll probably have a better time if you're not a big crowd person, but its just lovely!

perfect spot for a packed lunch. This is a must do on your visit. Go buy some cheese, bread and tomatoes and find a seat on the edge of the sculpture high up and hear the sound of the water and ocerlook the crowds.
Trevi Fountain. Fantastic spectacle. Been cleaned up since we were last there but all this has done is improve the whole thing. When you see it you feel like diving in. So beautiful.

Always stunning. Once you walk into the Piazza the fountains and the architecture take your breath away. The amount of detail is amazing on such huge structures. How were they ever constructed back in time without today's heavy lifting machinery? Answer - brute force and some help from horses.
Night time. Best seen at night time just a bit crowded and you need a bit of patience to get a good picture there is a lot of people

Great place to spend the evening. The piazza is a delightful place to spend the evening with a cappuccino or desert. The restaurants are also surprisingly good considering there are so my tourists. there. The fountains include beautiful sculptures by Bernini and are magnificent.
Very Nice Place. My 2nd favourite fountain after Fontana di Trevi. Very interesting history behind it and the creation of the fountain/church. Has a great atmosphere!

Beautiful piazza and fountains!. Beautiful sights, I would recommend going in the late afternoon/evening as it was very hot in September when we went. Lots of places to dine on the square, would be a nice evening visit.

Always Good but beautiful by night. For a week, almost, I kept trying to get my wife and grandchildren to walk to and around the Piazza Navona during the day when it is usually alive with all kinds of sellers of kitsch to good stuff, but we never made it.Then one night after dinner, I managed to navigate them thee and they were all entranced by th intrinsic beauty of the setting.At night it was much less crowded, with only a few of the junk hucksters about. No where near the crowds of the Trevi Fountain or the Spanish Steps.We were able to walk about in peace and enjoy the sheer spectacle of the square and its fountain and its setting.Not something to miss on a trip to Rome.
3 wonderful fountains. A number of good eating places in and around the Piazza. The church - the agony of St Agnes was most interesting. You need to ensure you have good sun screening.
Regal piazza in Rome. I visitied in the summer but was told that there is a stunning christmas market here in the winter. Stay at a caffé and enjoy the views over the piazza!

Famous Roman square, worth a peak. Not as exciting as some of the other wonders of Rome. We went there, because we remembered visiting the place on honeymoon! Lovely fountain, and we had a nice drink off one of the side roads, and worth going as it's famous

A beautiful Piazza, fabulous at night. A very buzzy place to visit at night with street artists. Places to eat around the piazza but worth going along some of the side streets nearby for more eating options.
Very nice atmosphere. the surrounding buildings are very nice and fountains are pieces of art. Good to sit in one of the cafe's around and enjoy a relaxing afternoon or evening.
Beautiful square. Beautiful square, great for taking pictures, checking out the high end shops and people watching. This is what you picture Rome to be.

One of our two favorite buildings in Rome. We wandering into this square as we were looking for a place to eat (they are all delicious). The building, the fountains, and the restaurants are all gorgeous. A very happy vibe in this square with vendors, street performers, music, and sightseers. A great place to unwind.
Fountains - At night it's wonderful. During the day it's great, but at night it's even better. Less people at night and the lights on the fountains are incredible.

Lovely. Built on the ancient stadium of Domitian, piazza Navona is a short walk from Trevi fountain and boasts a colorful, lively scene. Bernini's triumphant Fountain Of Four Rivers sits centrally as a reminder of Rome's love affair with fountains and is a sight not to be missed- the entire piazza is a masterpiece where history meets one of Rome's liveliest squares. There are several cafes, restaurants and shops all around and the Church of Sant'Agnese in Agone is one not to be missed!

The Three Fountain's Piazza. The Piazza Navona is a spacious open Piazza located in the Ponte section east of the Tiber River of Rome. This Piazza is a pedestrian's paradise because no cars are allowed into the center of the open Plaza. This allows visitors to freely walk about and explore the numerous vendors selling art pieces, souvenirs and human entertainment attractions. Both the left and right side of the Piazza Navona are sprinkled with various restaurants offering the some of the best Italian dishes in Rome. The most obvious attraction is the very tall Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi water fountain and obelisk built in the 17th century. The water fountain was designed to represent water gods and the four major rivers of the four major continents at that time period. There is even the Sant’ Agnese in Agone Basilica located right across the street on the west side of the Piazza free for visitors to explore and worship.
Breath Taking. Beautiful Piazza, amazing fountain and beautiful buildings. Lovely restaurants to sit and people watch and to take in the sights.

Spirit of Rome. This square us particlluary interesting because of its jokers, clowns and performers who have their little egzibicions in front of public who form circles around them. This was very funny for yohng kids like mine who had a great time watching this amazing people.Also there are a lot of very good classic roman style restaurants and pastieris where you can seat, dine and enjoy your stay in Rome.

Photo opportunity wherever you look. Just walk around and experience the atmosphere, beautiful little fountains and loads of art tradesmen happily painting away, they are actually very good. If you participate be prepared to be stared at whilst your having yours done. At the end of the square there is a little shop with dolls and toys in , have a look its very good.

A beautiful piazza fulled with artwork by the masters of the Renaissance and bordered by restaurants.. Our private tour of Rome included this famous piazza and we learned of the discord between the architect of the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone, Boromini, and Bernini, the sculptor of the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi in which NONE of the figures is looking at the church although it is directly in front of it! There are othe lovely fountains in the piazza as well as one of the ubiquitous water fountains found throughout Rome with for drinking water.

Love this piazza . This is my favorite piazza in Italy. It is so vibrant at nighttime filled with people and restaurant seekers. Our favorite fountain of the 4 rivers is also here. Tre scalani has the absolute best Tartufo which is a must try. Buy it and take away and sit in the piazza and enjoy the atmosphere. I miss it already
One of the best Piazzas in Rome. There is a nice buzz around the Piazza especially at night but you can also visit during daytime. Nice restaurants to sit outside and enjoy the vibe.

A must see attraction. after a long walk through Rome’s alleys we arrived Piazza Navona , the fascinating site made me forget all the pain in my legs after the long walk ,what can I say about the place ,it’s an elegant square that captures both history and modernity ,the beautifully sculptured fountains ,the statues, the museum takes you to past ages, the bars around the place ,the musicians and the painters ……. All that mixes together and provides you with a delighted , unforgettable experience.
Beautiful to appreciate. Beautiful square to appreciate not far from Fontana di Trevi, just don't stop for a cappuccino in one of the nearby coffee shops or prepare to be overcharged.
So beautiful. this was beautiful but so crowded and very hot. Still worth seeing and to get a picture with your frineds
Piazza navona. This is my favorite place to visit. We arrived early enough to enjoy the beauty of the place. You can walk around at least when we were there.

Amazing. We stayed in a hotel close to the Piazza Navona and went there very often, a very lively square especially at night with amazing restaurants all around. Just be careful of all of the sellers trying to sell you dying roses that they have just dunked in the fountain to try and keep 'fresh'.

Nice Place to visit.. Lovely place to relax as it is such a beautiful place with Cafes ,Fountains, Shops etc.Well worth a visit.
Can be very crowded at times.
Be aware of "PICKPOCKETS & "CON ARTISTS"

Lovely hangout!. The Piazza Navona is built on an old Roman racetrack, and this is evident in the modern shape of the Piazza (there is a museum covering this to the north of the Piazza). It is a lively and colourful place, with a great atmosphere and architecture - and is worth coming for that alone.There are loads of friendly wait staff trying to entice you into their restaurants, but beware of the prices! To keep the meals appearing cheap, they have bumped the prices for drinks, and also charge extra for bread and place a per-person cover charge on the bill! This seems to be fairly common in Italian cities, though.
A place to see. Beautiful area although busy. Definitely a place to see while in Rome. Follow the Rick Steve's tour suggestion.
nice place. Beautiful place with nice fountain and church. Church is very nice inside, no money for entry. It is good place for have a rest
Wonderful square to visit. Not much to say is wonderful square full of tourist and so energetic place to be. Wonderful architecture surrounding the place . Impressive place to visit.

Typical Rome. Rome has it right. These piazzas are nice gathering spots. A place to linger, maybe grab a coffee, enjoy the feel of being with other people. It is not an "attraction" per se. The folks who did not like it seemed to be expecting some form of entertainment. Maybe like the Bellagio fountains in Las Vegas? Nope, not here.

Rich in history and worth a visit.... The fountains (2) are magnificent and the former ancient circus/chariot racetrack is a worthy stop on any walking tour. The church adjacent to the fountain is small but rich in artistic detail.

Another must visit. Tucked away in Rome's narrow streets is the magnificent Piazza Navona. It's a great place to unwind and be refreshed by the fountains and Baroque sculptures. There's loads of space and often some street entertainers. We saw an African acrobatic team. The Church in the centre is worth visiting as is, of course, the Pantheon, just a few streets walk away. Don 't miss it.

Just a square. It is nice, but nothing special, comparing to other parts of Rome.Probably it is worth to come, when market is open. Otherwise, there is nothing to see there, if you do not have much time.

Unbelievable . Rich in history and awe inspiring to enjoy this huge piazza and the four Bernini fountain. We love the Four Fivers, probably his most famous. If you are an Angels and Demons fan, this is a must do. Only sad thing in the evening is the constant pestering of the vendors.
A romantic place. by this piazza there is a long set of stairs and a palace all in white making the view amazing, you can also do some shopping

Very relaxing . I loved this place the most. It's mostly crowded during the day and early evening. Lots of activities taking place around, tap dancing, karaoke etc, making it a very lovely place. The fountains are amazing.

Fabulous !. This is Italy at it's finest. I love to just sit and watch people it is like nowhere else. Also in the top end of the square (it has a slight downhill feel) in the left hand corner, looking downhill, there is just the best ice cream (sorry, gelato) shop you can imagine. The variety of flavours is astonishing.
Good place . Wide and elegant ! a fountain in the center to keep the roman style ... some restaurants around and stately mansions on the sides.
Bernini galore. By day or night this piazza fascinated me to a point that I used to visit there everyday. One can never get enough detail in of Bernini 's work. The most beautiful piazza in Rome .

Restaurant Dolce Vita. This is the second time we have dined at Dolce Vita in the Piazza Navona. The service is personal and excellent and the menu affordable. We were in Rome in July 2016 and the alfresco dining helps you take in all the sights and sounds.
Best Piazza in Rome. Don't leave Rome without having lunch or a beer at the restaurants in Piazza Navona. Every time I come to Rome I spend and afternoon here.
Must visit. I absolutely love this central square. It's pretty, has great fountains to see, has many many little bars and restaurants in the side streets, and is close to the pantheon. Visit!

Beautiful setting. The fountains within this piazza are stunning. Always full of people. Artists working on paintings drawings etc. A very pleasant site to visit. Very near the pantheon. You can then go to the trevi fountain. A short walk. JB

Beautiful fountains. We arrived at the Piazza after having lunch at a nearby restaurant so, we were well refreshed. This is not the first time we have visited Navona but, this time it was much quieter possibly due to the Roman annual holidays. This made it much easier to take photos. An impressive, large Piazza with three magnificent fountains in the middle all worth close scrutiny for their fine detail. The outside of the Piazza is lined with cafes and restaurants. Having had lunch we had no need to frequent any of the establishments. I would imagine that the prices would be enough to make a Saint curse! As is with all establishments bordering famous landmarks.Just enjoy the architecture and absorb one of the most majestic Piazzas in Rome

Another example of prefect Rome. Almost everytime I was in this piazza along the years, it was in summer, on very hot days, around midday. But it didn't matter either the high temperature or the fact that there is no shadow when the sun is high up in the sky. I just sat down on the rail around the lovely main fountain and watch the people and feel the place. You can also visit the cathedral from the piazza, eat something on one of the many terraces here or simply eat an Italian gellato . And don't forget to admire the fountains in the piazza with their splendid sculptures. As far as I am concerned, this square diserves its place as being one of the most beautiful in Rome.

The most beautiful piazza. You could people watch here for hours there is always some kind of entertainment. I would not eat at any of the restaurants I'm sure they will be nice but I prefer the less tourisy trattoria minutia away in the streets around navona .

A great place to stay and to people watch..... My husband and I stayed at a cute little B & B right around the corner from Piazza Navona. We loved this location. It's close to many of the important sites and it's so much fun to hang out there in the evening and people watch. There's always music playing and plenty of places to eat dinner or have a drink. We loved this location!

Fun atmosphere. We walked through here after having had dinner near by. The square is busy and covered in vendors hawking junky stuff but also with many artists who will paint you or do caricatures. There are many outdoor cafes, ice cream shops, and trinkets to buy. The fountain from the DaVinci Code books is here. There were lots of policemen patrolling so we felt safe being in such a crowded place at night. We were able to also grab a 5 minute cab ride to St Peter's square which was lovely all lit up at night.
Awesome!. You really get a feeling for what this city ones represented. In its time it must have been a fantastic place.
A must see. Visit this in the early evening to be there when the sun goes down. The atmosphere is specifically electric around this time

seeing rome by foot. came across this jewel when I was just walking around the area by hotel, and shopping. awesome, all of rome, you can just go on and on, I love art, statues, history fountains, waterfalls, there is just so much to see and do... enjoy!
