Beautiful. Definitely in top 10 places to visit in Rome. Famous fountain and many great eateries surrounding the piazza. Also the Museum of Roma is adjacent and worth visiting
EXPENSIVE RESTAURANTS. Nice place , lot of artists in the square, very interestiq fountain and buidings, bur expensive food .

Beautiful and busy.... It is a must see; a very impressive piece of art and history. It was jam packed with tourists...even though it is a mad house of people, it really didn't matter we just waited for an opportunity and jumped in and took our pics...

Big Piazza with lots of restaurants. We happened upon the Piazza Navona after our morning tour of The Vatican, while on our way to the Trevi Fountain in the afternoon. Lots of historic picturesque buildings with a really nice fountain and statue in the middle. It was a good place to stop for lunch, it was just a matter of deciding on which place to eat. We ended up eating at La Piccola Cuccagna which was on a laneway just outside the Piazza (it had shade and fan misters which were enticing). Had a great meal there, one of the better meals we had in Rome. Following lunch The Pantheon and Trevi Fountain were only a short 10-15 min. walk away.
Beautiful place. The most outstanding square of the Baroque period in Rome features Bernini's Fountain of Rivers at its center as it faces Borromini's church, Sant' Agnese in Agone.
Charming. Mostly restaurants but surrounded by the charm of Rome. Fountains and beautiful buildings. Lovely to see on a wander through the city or to sit and admire during a meal.
must be visit and spend a time. very lively and crowded! place.You can find many restaurant ,bar and cafe..Only worst thing so much aggresive street sellers..
Very pretty. We found this to be our favourite Piazza in Rome. Very peaceful with beautiful fountains and some interesting shops.

Gorgeous!. A must see if you love great architecture, beautiful sculptures, good food and stunning paintings and prints created by local artists. I happened upon this Piazza by accident, just by walking in search of the Pantheon and was so glad I did. I came back the next day with my niece because I thought it was so beautiful. A must see if you appreciate art.
Great evening atmosphere! . Visit in the evening for a relaxed festive atmosphere. Head out of the piazza in the opposite direction to the Pantheon for non- touristic bars and restaurants
Nice place!. There is many restaurants and cafés. 3 fountains. Artists to draw realism portrait, and caricature portrait ........

Enjoying our time at Piazza Navona. Very good and nice place to enjoy lunch or dinner or just relax at one of the coffee shops there. Interesting to sit and watch people just passing by, different nationalities, different ages and different interests. I went there two times: for lunch and one time for dinner and I enjoyed both meals in a nice weather. Sure I recommend you to go there and enjoy the place.
Beautiful place. Beautiful Baroque fountains, former site of the Roman Arena. Impressive! Do not hesitate to visit this square.

More vibrant at night. Bustling with street entertainment and artists. Lots of lovely restaurants. Beautiful fountains with statues. Feels safe with a police presence patrolling including at night. Great atmosphere.

Great place to visit in the evening!. We stumbled across this place by accident while looking for another place. It is a beautiful square, very busy and lots of food and drink places. A great place to visit in the evenings with family, friends or as a couple.
Beautiful. Beautiful, you find all these beautiful charms around every corner in Rome..... Just walking around all day
Great food and people watching. Very large Plaza with lots of great people watching and resturant choices, and a little quieter than the others in town.
Fountain that you throw money into. Hugely busy in August , can bearly get close enough to see it .Don't cycle here it's hard to find a where to safely lock up your bikes

Relaxing and beautiful . We only went here once but it was wonderful, No need to rush or worry while here - We just sat down with an icecream and admired the view! Lovely square to visit and enjoy, Beautiful buildings to enter and fountains.
Great piazza . A must visit, amazing Plaza to enjoy Gelati with s great owner who will intriduce his 3 best of desserts together with his delicious homemade gelati

The place for food. This is the place to go to have food and drinks, lovely atmosphere, nice people and plenty pf variety. No metro stations near this area so either have to get a taxi or walk from another metro station.

Piazza Navona. Piazza Navona is one of the most famous and arguably the most beautiful of Rome's many squares. The large and lively square features no less than three magnificent fountains. Another eyecatcher is the Baroque church of Sant'Agnese in Agone.

drink stop off. Great square to stop and have a glass of wine or coffee. A really lively place to meet, eat and drink. The fountain is the one on Angels and demons Dan Browns book and has a great story behind its making. Def. a place to visit.

Delightful. Wonderful piazza to allow children to run free after the impossible, choked throng at the Trevi Fountain. I loved Piazza Navona, not for the pricey bars and touristy trappings but for the grace of the buildings, the architecture and atmosphere - and of course the fountains. An absolute delight. Bring your own snacks and drinks and just imbue the surroundings.
Worth a look. Lots of guys doing portraits and caricatures. had one done for a laugh and was quite pleased with it!! Different things going on to look at and watch doing the day and at night.

Beautiful place for dinner. Came here twice for dinner because of the atmosphere. Can't say the food we had at either restaurant was great but the atmosphere was perfect in summer. The kids could play on the piazza while waiting for food and after. Great place to stroll around while eating gelato.

Great atmosphere and places to eat. A great place to go - especially if you are a Dan Brown book / film fan as this the fountain where the priest is found in " Angels and Demons"
The fountains are magnificent and there are lots of reasonably priced places to eat around the square and just off of it too.
We went there most nights
Lovely Piazza to hang out. It's a lovely Piazza to hang out, have a coffee or ice cream and breath before heading on into the bustle of the city again.
Great place to eat and absorb the atmosphere. Lively atmosphere with lots going on, lovely little restaurants and bars around. Great for night or daytime visits.

My favorite spot in Rome. I was attracted to this site when watching Eat Pray Love and when I got there, people are everywhere, tourists and artists and performers, also pigeons and fountains. It is a crowded place but somehow you can find a place to sit and stare at the fountains and be clam. Is it the magic of Rome?

Sit in a cafe and people watch for a while. Lots going on in Piazza Navona, it's a really nice spot to sit and watch people whilst taking in the stunning fountain and church nearby. We called here after visiting the Pantheon which is close by and enjoyed a nice midday drink. Prices are a bit steep at the bars and restaurants that line the piazza, but this is one of the places you must visit.

Big square . Probably the biggest Piazza in central Rome. There are three separate fountain structures in the square but because the square is so big the fountains look small. Artists display their paintings here and the square is surrounded by restaurants and cafes. Do check it out.
Lots of fountains. Every fountain in Roma is so different. This piazza has some terraced fountains and some different water flows. Check the expressions on each face.

obviously a fantastic place back in its day but compared to the rest its a nice walk. a nice walk through from the trevi and pantheon but as a square a bit dark at night and full of men selling either roses or flying flashing gismos
Good place for lunch. Seems almost stereotypically Rome with the artists and cafes. Lunches are expensive, but it's a good place to sit and eat in terms of atmosphere

Good place to expand some energy for kids. The place is hopping. Great people watching. Artists on the square. Some of them selling the same junk you see in any piazza in any major European city and on NYC's canal street. But, there are a few better ones so it's fun to browse. Fountains are lovely. No cars allowed so kids have free reign. Surrounding Buildings great. Lots of choices for food but beware of inflated prices. Hard to get taxi, long lines at cab stand on northern end.

Beautiful square with lovely atmosphere.. This is somewhere you must visit during a visit to Rome. Wonderful square with statues and atmosphere. We stopped to have a drink here (a 'man size' beer was 16 euros!), but didn't eat as the restaurants seemed expensive.

A place full of life. A place full of life with a wonderful fountain in the center of a classical rectangular plaza; where you can take an easy walk among strangers, you can eat or have a drink. A beautiful memory.
Great outdoor eating!. Beautiful Piazza with many restaurants, most have outdoor eating which is absolutley lovely on a summer night.

Most amazing. Without a doubt, the best piazza in Rome. From it's history of having once been the site of chariot races and athletic competition (visit the small museum at the open end) to its incredible fountains,2 of them by Bernini, and the beautiful Palazzo Pamphili (now home to the Brazilian consulate) and the church of St Agnes designed by Borromini. It gets a little crazy and touristy but if you can visit early in the morning when it's empty, it's magical.
Beautiful . This piazza is one of the best ones in Rome. It has three fountains and wonderful restaurants. It's a must!! Beautiful church too!

Absorb the atmosphere. This is a must no matter how short your stay. The place to watch the world and it's people - especially good when the artists are showing their wares...enjoy an expresso or gelato in the best of company. Do read up on the fountain to really understand it's magnitude though

So Much Life. This piazza is always alive day or, night. There are always a mass of vendors around, not to mention dozens of restaurants. Also there are quite a few clubs located within this general area, sometimes they can be hard to find though!

Nice to see. Piazza Navona gets some good write ups in the visitor guides, and has a great fountain, architecture and statues. Its a nice place to eat out in the evening, although its not cheap, but other than the fountains and a church there isn't a lot to see.

Atmospheric and a great fountain, even by Roman standards.. Beautiful, atmospheric square with a magnificent fountain. Download the Rick Steves free audio guide. He brings the place to life. Sit and have an expensive drink.
Must see. Go early to avoid crowds and heat.....visit the churches too. They are not strict about dress code but covered shoulders are more respectful.

Large Piazza Worth Visiting. We came across Piazza Navona while looking for a restaurant called La Carbonara, that had been highly recommended. Unfortunately, it being August in Rome, the restaurant was closed for vacation. The Piazza was very lively with many bars and restaurants. We chose a different restaurant and enjoyed watching the people and entertainers.
Magnificant!. Incredible artpieces that actually are fontaines, thes is a must see when in Rome - it is spectaclar!

Gorgeous square with beautiful fountain and lots of restaurants . Beautiful square with a good selection of restaurants, though some are a bit pricey. Lot of artists doing sketches. Plus don't you get fed up with this stupid character limit.

Beautiful. Nice place in Roma. With restaurant and shops there.
You can stay there a long time to have a rest.
You can take some.photos there. But visit is very short as there is just the place to see

The one place you will not get hassled by street sellers. This was a breathe of fresh air for us out of our whole trip to Rome we were hassled no end by street sellers, at the Piazza Navona there wasnt one seller in sight!!! We were able to take in the spectacular view of this breathtaking architecture, walk around looking at paintings that artists were selling of there own work, and werent hassled either by them!!! it was a pleasant relaxed day, and a must see attraction whilst visiting Rome.

not to be missed. piazza navona is the square for all sorts of activities, coffee drinking a must...but not cheap,people watching a must and free.and for atmosphere it is up there with the fab sights of rome...it is terrific in the early evening and theer was even a very elderly man singing in Italian, of course, to all the old Italian songs.......he was miming I thought, but it was great to see him enjoying hmiself and entertaining the tourists.

Large Space. Piazza Navona is a large square in Rome, and a place to observe people pass their day (tourists mainly, but some locals too). I found it to be a quick stop. Tip: As one can expect, the cafes on the square are tourist traps.

Some serious art, architecture and restaurants, but tourist prices!. Rome was our last European stop before flying home so we bought a seven day bus pass and tried to see as many attractions as could be reached by public transport (which is almost all attractions).Piazza Navona is a long-ish rectangle about 250 m long and 50 m wide. It contains four major art forms; three fountain statues and a magnificent church.At the northern end of the piazza is the Fontana del Nettuno (Neptune's fountain) depicting Neptune fighting off a large squid, surrounded by ladies and children and a horse that looks like it is trying to get away from the squid.In the centre is the Fontana del quattro Fiumi (Four rivers fountain) at the centre of which is a large obelisk around which four men are pictured in what appears to be various states of panic.At the southern end is the Fontana del Moro, depicting in the centre a man fighting a fish and surrounding him are four statues blowing a pair of horns each and of course spouting water and surrounded by aquatic life.The "piece de resistance" is the magnificent church Saint Agnese in Agone, the entrance being near the centre fountain. Please check out the photos!Apart from the attractions, the are a plethora of restaurants all mostly full and it is difficult to find an empty table. between many of the restaurants are doorways which lead to shops behind. I would recommend you check out prices for goods in less-frequented places before buying here!

Historic fountain not far from the Pantheon. A iconic fountain of Rome and unlike the Trevi, you can walk around it. It is set in an historic square, not far from the Pantheon. If you visit the Pantheon, walk the extra yards to see this beautiful Piazza

Busy and Overpriced. The place has character with the spectacular fountain and various street artists but if you want to eat there be prepared for over inflated prices in a crowded environment.The alternative is to explore the surrounding back streets where you can find reasonably prices restaurants with loads of character.
Very lifely place. A nice place to watch people coming and going. In the little streets next to it nicer restaurants can be find - but this is def just my oppinion

Best fountain and piazza in Rome. A true must see. All three fountains in the piazza are great, and especially the middle one. Wonderful gathering spot, people watching, and learning about the fountains! We thought it was the best piazza in Rome with the single best fountain!

See and Be Seen. Very lively square with beautiful fountains. You should not miss this as it is truly a melting pot of tourists and locals. Great for taking a break and drinking out of the fresh spring water fountains and people watching.

Location Location. A lot of people as always with many kind of performers from miming people to artists of all kinds, musicians different kind of painters balancemasters and more people......This place proves location is everything even about eating. I never tried all places there but most I think are decent but prices are a little higher than many other of the same kind in Rome. It is a perfect place to stay for a rest if you like to look at different kind of people just passing or doing some kind of performance :) Our 6 year old daughter was pretty fashinated by some of the performers using audience for their tricks and they were also very good.

Stunning. The Piazza still retains it original shape of when it was Domitian's Circus. At the (curved) end is the best place to get a gelato in a briocche with nutella..... A beautiful place with stunning fountains.

Nice area to stroll and beautiful fountains. Not far from Pantheon if you are walking around that area. Few artists draw portraits or caricatures in the plaza, some selling items to tourists. Interesting to look at the 3 fountains in the plaza and the surrounding buildings.

Good place to wander about. gets surprisingly crowde in the evening, but best photo ops are in the morning when there are minimal tourist crowds. Avoid eating though at the places which line both sides of the piazza, they are certainly tourist traps and over priced (Except Bernini, it is certainly value for money). Venture a bit beyond the piazza and you will find some really good places to eat.

Nice piazza.. We took a bus and walked 5-10 mins to get to the Piazza. There are a lot of restaurant looking into the square. We took pictures and watch a street performance. Looked at the caricature of people, there were items for sale. The less expense restaurants on the off streets, lots of choices.
Sppechless. A wonderful place as far as the fountain is concerned. The sculptures are very impressive. But due it being a famous place it is very crowded.

Decent stop. Definitely a pretty square to visit and relax in for awhile; there were musician's and street performers in the area when we were visiting. Stop to sit on a bench in front of the fountain and admire your surroundings, but try to get there in the later afternoon to avoid the hot sun.
Fantastic atmosphere. Loads of places to eat and drink. Artists sat painting. Two lovely fountains and beautiful church to visit
One of my favorite areas of Rome!. The restaurants are amazing and the scenery is even better. The most beautiful time to be here is sunset!

Watch the restaurants! . We stayed just around the corner so walked or scootered through the Piazza a number of times. It was usually busy with tourists and tour groups and had a nice buzz at night with people milling around enjoying a walk about, lots of restaurants with pavement dining and guys selling those blue light, rocket, helicopter things. The only thing we'd warn about is the cost of the restaurants. We walked through early one morning and stopped for coffee which was an outrageous €13 for two cappuccinos!

My Favourite Piazza. Spent an afternoon here! As in August though I expect it was a lot quieter than it normally was. There was a couple of street artists but I expect in busier times there would be more.Great choice of eateries, but expensive as you can imagine. i would go a street back anyway where you have beautiful trattorias, in stunning Rome streets and less expensive.
A must see in Rome!. Piazza Navona its ornate with fountains, baroque palazzi and colourful cast of street artists, sellers and tourists. It is indeed one of the most beautiful Roman piazza.

Stunning. Piazza Navona is beautiful and a great place to sit and admire the stunning architecture, fountains and also people watch. Always busy it's good to see it during the day but also at night when it becomes a bustling place for locals and tourists alike.

Great place to visit at dusk. After a long day of touring Rome I ended up in Piazza Navona , with a lot of great fountains and the sun setting was a great view as well as a much cooler place to sit and have dinner. Lots of restaurants to choose from and lots to see while eating.
A beautiful Italian piazza. An amazing place to sit and enjoy your coffee. Lively, with fountains, sculptures and cafes to enjoy a classic Italian espresso!
Wonderfull. This location stands out in Rome for beauty history and places to eat not to mention the photo opportunities

A typically beautiful Italian piazza. The colours of the surrounding buildings are so beautiful & the fountain itself is very impressive. Lots of restaurants & bars surrounding the plaza & many little side streets with attractive places to visit.

Romantic. I love this place even if it's crowded! There is something about it that makes it so romantic. It is so perfectly made and very clean, if you want to visit with less crowd around, try to be there before 10am.
Art Museum in fresh air.. One of most beautiful Paizza in Rome with many artists and painters show and sell their work. You will also find many good Restaurants in the area.
Amazing atmosphere . You really must visit at night. Spoilt for choice with the number of restaurants. Street entertainers, artists etc Wonderful experience

Three fountains . Piazza Novona
Lovely setting, and well worth an hour to sit down and take in the beautiful fountains. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from, but probably hard or virtually impossible to find a cheap one, free drinking water at the far end.

Beautiful but touristy. Beautiful piazza with pretty shops and cafes, touristy sellers and street shows. Good for all ages, the kids love the atractions. I recomend a morning visit too, before it gets crowdy

Wonderful. Piazza Navona is one of the most beautiful of Rome's many civic open spaces. It is built upon a stadium built by the Emperor Domition, hence its proportions long and narrow with one end round for turning chariots and the other squared off for start and finish. The Piazza contains two of Bernini's masterpieces; the Fountain of the Four Rivers and his church of St. Agnese in Agone. Another item on a visitot to Rome's MUST SEE list.
Very nice . It's S nice piazza, lots of good pizzerias and ice cream shops. Starting from afternoon u can meet the artists see them dhow the draw and they can draw you, it was fun for my kids and me
Family vacation . This is an awesome place to hang out and people watch. There is always something going on and gelato to eat

Experience the hustle and bustle of Rome. This was a plaza filled with the hustle and bustle of Rome. There were many interesting eating places. It was a plaza typical pf Rome with beautiful fountains. We stayed at Hotel Navona so this plaza was very close to our hotel. It is a great place to sit, have a glass of tine and and appetizer and enjoy people watching.

See one of the most beautiful piazza's of Rome. One of the most beautiful places to visit is Piazza Navona. Take the time to have a coffee or have a lunch/dinner in one of the small restaurants arround Navona and...just enjoy the view.

Breathtaking. Pleasantly surprised by the size and beauty of the piazza as we entered from one of the narrow side streets. One of my favorite places in Rome. May have helped that we arrived in the morning before it got too crowded.
Great square with Fountains. Great Fountains including the main central one. Beware the cafe's are expensive as they are in the square.
Piazza Navona. Big square with restaurants and fountains and lots of tourist. Plan this visit in the night. Very nice experience

Very busy and popular. We were staying at the Pantheon which is a short walk from here. It gets very busy during the day so would advise going early morning. Surrounded by restaurants which are pricey

A must. Just round the corner from where I was staying and full of bustling cafes and restaurants. With the fountain in the middle as a focal point there is always something going on with a crowd of painters and street entertainers. The perfect way to end a busy day sightseeing.
Part of the walking tour given to us by the Lancelot Hotel staff.. Nice Piazza with other sites to see along the way like shopping and dining outside. Not too crowded either.

Picturesque location. About walking distance from the Pantheon, this is a very picturesque location in Rome (like so many others). You can take those perfect family vacation photos in the centre or even perfect selfies! There are a lot of restaurants nearby, though I didn't try any but many options are available. Visit on a good sunny day and the place would look beautiful.
Great place for Lunch. enjoyed lunch in a cafe right in the Piazza. I beleive the name was Restaurante dal. Wonderful atmosphere. Try the deep fried articoke
Eternally beautiful. Magical and full of life; magnificent fountains and buildings all round. Plenty of eating places in the vicinity, lovely atmosphere
Lovely piazza. Had a lovely evening here - restaurants off the square much more reasonable priced but just a minute away

Beautiful. Should see if you can!!. Lovely courtyard plaza with stunning fountain and statuary. Such a lovely presentation of how old Rome must have been and how sweet it still is.Cafés offer good menus, good food. A little higher price than elsewhere, but "location, location, location." Plates of pasta run about 5 Euro more than in off the track places but considering the view,sit down and enjoy. Short walk to other must-do attractions. Don't miss it.

Handy Resting Place. It was a very hot day when we were there, so the gelateria was a must visit. Finding somewhere to sit and eat the ice creams was a bit more problematic, but a good place to rest and people watch.
Beautiful. We watched the sunset at the Piazza and the views were beautiful. A very lively atmosphere. It was worth the walk to find this.
TOSS YOUR COIN. No wonder so many thousands of visitors every day on the summer. The sculptures movement, magnificent size and history are an open book to beauty.

Fantastic ambience. Piazza navona is such a beautiful place to go for a fun afternoon with your family, or a date with that special person. There are three beautiful fountains where you can take photo like mine! After that you could eat dinner or have ice cream at the numerous restaurants and gelaterias around the piazza. It's also a good place to buy souvenirs and have a caricature/painting done of yourself.
Typical Roman charm. The fountains are beautiful! Good place to hangout at night. Lots of restaurants around it but don't eat there. We did and regretted.
Piazza Navona. Beautiful Piazza to stroll around. It was an easy walk from our hotel in the Pantheon area. There are numerous places to drink and eat i the area.

Lovely place. Piazza Navona is indeed a lovely place. Worth visiting if you're walking around the city's center since it has 3 fountains of which the middle one is the biggest.Lots of restaurants around it!

Not just a simple square!. This piazza is more the than just a simple square! The fountain in the middle of has a story and you shouldn't get there just take photos. Try to read about the four gods! Must visit!

Food. The main area with the three fountains is Piazza Navona. This is what you will have seen if you have watched Angels and Demons. The fountains are fantastic. There are restaurants in abundance here, however, they are expensive.If you go into one of the many side streets, you will find much more restaurants offering similar food for a cheaper price.Wherever you go' though, be prepared to be hassled to go into a restaurant! Some will practically drag you in. Be prepared to say no!Also, in Italy it is law that on the menu they must state if a dish is frozen. This will be indicated by * next to the meal. So make sure you look at the menus. Anything other than fish/sea food, shouldn't really be being cooked from frozen.
Ok, not much. Nothing special. Pretty cool fountain with a obelisk on top, but nothing else that stands out. The Pantheon which is nearby is an astonishing sight compared.
Least favourite. This was our least favourite Roman site, would have preferred have more time at any of the other sites.

fantastic. Piazza Navona, born as a place of spectacle and still today a spectacular open air show; an architectural miracle in the heart of the Eternal City, filled with masterpieces in perfect harmony with each other.This piazza, which displays the genius of Bernini and Borromini, is one of the finest Baroque Masterpiece in papal Rome. Its harmony and colors, combined with its elegance, give it a charm that is enhanced by the surprising contrast of architecturally sober houses alternating with a number of monumental Buildings.

A lovely Piazza. Come here in the evenings, great choice for dinner here, overlooking a great piazza. Check out the local artworks to in the evening. We bought a great painting from a local italian. A must in Rome.
Great place to sit around and enjoy the weather!. I went here with a few friends, it is a very nice piece of work to look at but also the bars and restaurants around it are very good.
Nice place but expensive restaurants. Piazza Navona is a very nice place to go for a walk especially at night and enjoy the nice atmosphere but the restaurants around are too expensive.

Crowded and touristy. This was one of my least favorite places in Rome. It is crowded and full of vendors trying to sell you selfie-sticks and other junk. The restaurants surrounding the piazza are expensive and touristy. It's worth a walk through to see the Bernini fountain and imagine what it was like during the Roman times, but at least during the height of tourist season, I'd get away as soon as possible.
Wonderful. Visited every night vacanze romane restaurant for after dinner coffee and wine when quiet very nice to people watch on square patrons very nice too

Great Place for an Evening Walk.. After checking into the Hotel Adriano we took a walk and came upon the Piazza Navona. A great place to stroll around and take pictures. Lots of restaurants and shop in the area.
Photographers dream. Three amazing fountains and colourful buildings, but beware the prices at the restaurants facing them! Go a few streets behind and meals/drinks are cheaper.
beautiful but battered by tourists. this is a piece of art in the open and I wish that everyone who visited it it did with respect. Please love and defend the heritage of humanity.

A place to be enjoyed. Besides its architectural point, the place is excellent for just relax and maybe eat an ice cream sit on the stairs. I went during the summer, so early in the morning, before 10 a.m., and after 8 p.m. are really good periods to take pictures without a crowded site. For me, the best period to go is at night so the lights are turned on.
Elegant Piazza - must see. Piazza Navona is my favourite square in Rome. Beautiful place to spend some time having a coffee or just admiring the fountain.
Beautiful Piazza - Bernini masterpiece. And when you are there - do not miss the amazing icecream shop by GROM, with its hipster approach to icecreams.

Good place. This is a good place to rest after you have been traveling around Rome!
You can also eat a lot of great food and spend some nice time!

Art, culture and pure awesomeness!. A wonderful Piazza full of artists of various kinds. Plenty of Cafes and places to eat. The fountain and buildings a truly magnificent sight to behold. Culture overload ;-) Well worth a visit to walk around and look and watch the artists at work.
touristic. piazza is good but the restaurants around the are very expensive and bad. so i hate there. 1 beer around 8 -10 euros and it is too much touristic
Fountains, statues, action!. Such an adorable place to spend some time people watching. Great for kids to hang out for a little while.

Many people, hyped up restaurants, nice relaxation. We visited Piazza Navona in August. There were to many people and the restaurants were overpriced and not really worth it. The environment itself was very nice and there was a magician doing his tricks. We walked around quite a bit and found some other places to eat. The restaurants around the Piazza were just overpriced and offered just the same food available everywhere.

Crowded, but still a perfect place to experience Rome. A must see in Rome. The place is car free and it is lovely to roam around with a gellato while enjoying the music. You are also able to see street magicians performing some tricks and some street artist.
Interesting fountain. This place was so full of people. It is a beautiful place. I enjoyed the time there even though it was so crowded.

Magnificant statues and fountains. Every where you turn in Rome, you see fountains and statues. This piazza has a large collection of these! In addition to the beautiful fountains, there are a lot of artists here, selling their work. Also, restaurants and bars surround the piazza. The area around the piazza is also full of shops and restaurants. It is a great place to spend a few hours.

A must see square in Rome. After walking for some time in the heat, this square looked amazing! Probably the nicest square in Rome. Full of tourists and avoid to sit in the restaurants there if you don't want to pay double prices..

Beautiful . Beautiful place to eat or even just for a drink. So many restaurants around this area and beautiful fountain in the middle. Its very romantic and would definitely recommend eating around here. It works out a bit dearer than other restaurants but in my eyes 100% worth it. In the middle (restaurants all around the edge of the square) they had artist, palm readers and lots of other things that you can go and have a nosey at. Lovely! Our favourite place to go for food.
Relaxing. A great place to sit and pass an hour or two watching the world go by while enjoying a coffee in the sunshine.
Honeymoon visit . Another exquisite bit of immaculately preserved architecture set in the heart of Rome. Not quite the big showpiece fountain but a treat never the less.

You have to go here if you are in Rome. Last year on our honeymoon, the concierge of our favorite hotel in Rome (Boscolo Experia - already wrote about this) recommended this spot for dinner and a visit. It is a large plaza, with fountains and restaurants/shops framing the center, which is a gathering place for artists and musicians. We had our caricatures drawn by a nice young artist (still hangs on our memory wall at home) and enjoyed a wonderfully authentic Italian meal at one of the eight or nine restaurants surrounding the plaza. Of course, this year on our return to Rome for our anniversary, we had to come back to the Piazza and enjoy another memorable experience of sights, sounds, people watching and tremendous food. The cab from our hotel was only about 10-15 Euros. I am not sure about public transportation to the Piazza. You must go to this beautiful little plaza and enjoy the warm and friendly people I am sure you will meet.
Attractive place to Chill. Beautiful place and location near the river and next to historical sites with its own history. Beautiful awe inspiring sculptures and fountains.

Lovely. This is lovely especially when it is nice and sunny a visit here is much needed its surrounded by lovely pizzerias and we visited one and i have never had a pizza that amazing before. Lovely place and lovely staff

Always One of My Favorites. My third trip to Rome and Piazza Navona remains one of my favorite stops. Maybe it's the relatively open space to accommodate the tourist crowds (unlike the always-claustrophobic Trevi Fountain), maybe it's the gorgeous fountains, or maybe it's the grand architecture of the surrounding buildings. But it always seems to possess a sense of peace and relative quiet, despite the persistent vendors shilling their toys, laser lights, etc. With a never-ending list of things to see in Rome, Piazza Navona will always remain near the top on my list.

Picturesque Piazza, very crowded. This is the best known Piazza in Rome and well worth a visit. Take a seat at a table around the piazza but expect to pay over the odds for food or drink. The Fountain of the Four Rivers is particularly impressive. Very crowded and many hawkers around so not a place I'd stay too long.
Most beautiful piazza in Rome. Absolutely amazing!The 2 fountains are incredibly beautiful and the painters give a very romantic touch to the place.

A perfect place to enjoy the Italian evening experience. This is a great place to experience the Roman nightlife. The place is car free and you can roam in the evening drinking in the sights of a Roman evening. Good restaurants are available, although a bit on the expensive side. Lots of places for good photographs too.
Nice neighborhood . Everything is walkable. Good shopping and restaurants. Near many sites such as the Pantheon and Spanish Steps. No subway access.

Beautiful :). A must see in Rome. Rome is a place full of magnificent art/sculptures/fountains ect. and this is one of the historical meccas. Its nice at night you can grab a gellato and hang by the fountain.

Beautiful!. Another day - another extraordinary fountain. Rome is if nothing else amazing with all there is to see. We weren't actually looking for this - just came upon it in our travels. Had a wonderful time looking at the people, watching the street magicians and listening to the music.

Great Gathering Point. Prefer this at night versus the day....but it is a wonderful destination. Lots of activity and people. Please note that this was built on an old Roman circus....and you can see that it sure was if you look closely. Cheap eating....although I would recommend to eat in on the streets immediately behind it toward the Tiber. Much hipper atmosphere for a dinner.

Beautiful foundtain. This site is a hidden gem if you are walking down the street. You turn the corner and the beautiful fountain is right in front of you, It is very crowded with lots of activity going on. I am glad we visited, but stayed near the Piazza del Popolo,

Very beautiful, a must-see when in Rome!. With so many piazzas, fountains, chapels and more across Rome, you might think Piazza Navona is skippable. Why go out of your way to see yet another Roman piazza? Not only is this one of the most famous squares in Rome, it is also one of the most beautiful. It has two gorgeous fountains, a church that is beautiful both inside and out, and fantastic people watching. Restaurants wrap all the way around the square, providing plenty of places to rest in the shade, have a drink, and take the world in. When you're ready to leave, explore the surrounding streets, stroll down to the river, or follow the signs to other nearby attractions, like the Pantheon or the Trevi Fountain.
Great square. Great square with many street artists and great statues. Nice and old buildings around. Can easily combined with pantheon. This place smells like original Rome

Navona is beautiful!. Set in the historic centre of Roma, this piazza bordered by Baroque Roman architecture is famous for its three fountains. In the centre is the largest – The fountain of four rivers. The Neptune fountain and the Moor fountain are on the two ends of the rectangular piazza.Take a seat on a bench or at a café or bar on the piazza and soak in the life on the piazza – watching birds, artists, tourists and Roman life.The fountains are works of art.
large Piazza with lots going on. Large oval Piazza buzzing with activity. Many restaurants, cafes, ice cream shops and fountains with sculptures. Great for people watching.

Not worth it. Its just a nice square. Not really something special, full of rip-off cafeterias. Be careful cause many pickpockets prefer piazza navona for their action, though many carabinieri are there and you feel safe.
Good place to spend some time. Very nice place to spend some time with friends, you can see lots of street artists.Also there is lots of restaurants.
Stunning fountain, beautiful piazza.. In my option, one of the best, biggest, piazzas with three fountains. The many, obviously is huge! And beautiful.

Saw it in the movie, now in person. I found out about this from an old Audrey Hepburn movie, "Three Coins in the Fountain". It's really lovely in person with the sculptures pouring and spouting fountains from everywhere. The color of the water is lovely and it is well maintained. Of course, one must throw three coins. I could see the city employees gathering the coins and cleaning the fountain in the morning from my hotel after busy tourist visits the evening before. It is a very frequented spot at night especially and very crowded. Be sure not to step into the fountain!
A classic Piazza when in Rome.. Nice area, lots of restaurant, good ambiance. make sure you stop buy and at least walk buy. It is close to all other attractions, got a detour.

Lovely place to spend the evening. We were here in our last day in Rome and lazied our way into the piazza. had coffee at the square and was just people-watching all day... There were small performances from artists in the evening which made it quite a spectacle... Most importantly, there are several fantastic places to eat around the piazza which is a big plus for a foodie like me... Don't miss the perfume store when u just walk out of the piazza Navona to piazza Venezia. The perfumes are a steal...
Amazing. Just amazing, beautiful and breathtaking! History right before your eyes. Great restaurants and terrific shopping in immediate area. A once in a lifetime opportunity to visit.

Like a montmartre spirit in Roma. Huge place with a lot of fountains,many painters ,difficult to go to eat there all is horribly expennsive and not good ,go far away in the small streets to find a real trattoria ,eat a good ice cream ,many gelateria have gluten free option and look at the beauty of the statue and the obelisque...an amazing time ,you can spend easily one hour. The Church is amazing and huge !
Water Fountain. Another lovely water fountain. There are many around the city, some bigger than others, but most are well made and are a good photo shot
Worth a visit. I highly recommend Piazza Navona - absolute stunning. There is lots of lovely places to seat and eat or just have a drink in the Piazza too so that you can soak it all in.
Wonderful Piazza. The Bernini fountain/statue alone is worth a visit. Lovely large Piazza with a history. Good restaurants and always something going on.
Great Piazza. You can go there to admire a fountain or just to relaxing seeing the people walking. One of the best piazzas in Rome. I recommend!!!
Grand. One of those places which will stay etched in your memory for a life time, with its grandeur, vibrancy and a spirit of pure magic.
Must Visit. All piazzas deserve a visit, this one is a must if you can not visit them all. The fountains are works of art and people watching is interesting.
Another of the great plazas. In a city of great plazas, this is one of the best. Bonus, its strange shape is because it was a roman racetrack and retains the shape of the track to this day.

Perhaps the loveliest piazza in Rome. This is one of the loveliest plazas in all of Europe, I think. Sitting by a fountain here in on a summer evening and simply people-watching and enjoying the wonderful atmosphere is a very memorable experience indeed. The fountains, by the way, are kind of bizarre-- I wish Neptune didn't feel compelled to stab that adorable octopus!

Fantastic people watching. This is a large piazza and an easy starting point for many adventures around Rome. Three fountains, a great church, and great restaurants almost all around.We twice went in the early AM as our first stop while it was peaceful and empty and they were just starting to set up the tables all around -- quiet place for a coffee. Then, head back around lunch for a great example of Rome culture, dress, food, etc.
breathtaking. Bernini in full swing without the huge froids. Don't skip eating ice-cream. Dining is wonderful around piazza navona.

Wonderful. History all around you, breath takingly beautiful. We were due to meet here for a city tour, we sat and enjoyed the ambience prior to our walking tour. Sitting and soaking up the atmosphere, doing a bit of people watching, certainly allow 1hour or more of your time to enjoy this Piazza.

Well worth a visit. The piazza is the site of the old stadium of Domitian and still keeps the shape.I love it very early in the morning when few people are around,but if you like a festive feel with lots of people then the evening is for you.Fascinating architecture (read up before as there is plenty of history).Restaurants over priced and there are better in the streets around the piazza but the Tartuffo (chocolate gelato ) at Tre Scalini is famous (from 1946 they trumpet) and really is one of those tourist must-haves although there are better gelatos at a number of places in Rome.The Fountain of the Four Rivers dominates the piazza and (with the Trevi Fountain) is a must-see in Rome.
Great place to sit and watch. A Beautiful Square , with lovely restaurants and the Fountain of the four rivers, being held back. Every view beautiful.
A lovely place to watch the world go by. Surrounded by good restaurants with art sellers and good musicians this piazza has a lovely atmosphere day and evening.

Another lovely fountain. Italy is dotted with fountains here and there. And this is one lovely fountain, set in a lively square. You can see a nice statue formation.
Surrounding it are restaurants and different artisans selling their trade.
One of my favourite piazzas in Rome. The fountains and sculptures are so beautiful especially at night . Closeby there are many nice restaurants and bars as well

Piazza da vedere!. Great to visit in the evening with lights illuminating the fountains and the buildings surrounding the piazza. There are many other attractions there but I like best are the music artists playing their instruments for all to hear.
Nice. Open are square, nice to look at and you can sit around the edge of the fountain for pictures and so on.
Cool place!. There are so many Piazzas and they all seem pretty wonderful. We didn't go below. Wished we would have. Didn't know about that part.

Picturesque. A really beautiful place with three wells, the left and right line of small cafes and bistros of this picturesque place. The prices in the cafes are as expected relatively high but when you walk in the little side streets you can drink a delicious cappuccino there for not quite as much money.

One of the best in Rome .. The first piazza I saw in Rome and one of the most beautiful!
Day or night this place has life with painters and musicians all over !
This is the art piazza .
Beautiful fountain. A very nice big piazza with a beautiful fountain. We have visited during the morning and at night and it was a nice place. A must see place in Rome.

A SUNDAY AFTERNOON AT PIAZZA NAVONA. We stay there to have a drink and dinner. First we walking in Piazza to apreciate the fountains, churches and monuments, the families and people who stay there to celebrate the life. It was a grat day. Very beautiful. The sky was clear. We choose a restaurant and seat to have a good wine and wait the night fell down and lights iluminate the Piazza. After thi we have a good dinner. It was a good time before to fly next morning. I recommend.
Fantastic. Beautiful square full of restaurants and wine bars & street entertainment. Great atmosphere and reasonable prices. Highly recommend an evening or afternoon here relaxing
Fountains lovely. Nice place to walk around. Fountains beautiful. Not too crowded. We enjoyed it. Restaurants close by.

Beautiful plazza. The Piazza Navona is a beautiful piazza to wander through but not to stay at for long. I would come here to get a gelato or cafe, look around, and then wander somewhere else before someone is trying to ask you to buy something. In other words, this place can be a tourist trap.
Nice walk!. Great place to chill and walk around to banchetti.. you can just grab a gelato and sit there. This is one of the most famous piazzas here in Rome.

Rome, the eternal city. Rome, one of two greatest cities worth to go and to come back as often as possible. Life is short, so Paris and Rome should be visited at least doyen of times in our short lifetimes.... and place Navona is one of places, believe me

Nice morning at the Piazza. We had a great time here around 9 o'clock in the morning, because there were no tourists. There are 3 different fountains each of them with own history. I definitely recommend this place for a morning walk.
favourite place in rome. the piazza navona is one of my favourite pllaces in rome, i like the three fountains and the egyptian obilisk and it's nice in the evening too.

fun area. Our hotel was very close to this piazza. It was a busy area in the evening with street entertainers and it has several restaurants with a variety of food. We ate at two different places in this piazza as well as tried one of the gelato stores. All were delicious. You can relax around a fountain and people watch, eat or stroll through the stores.

Beautiful Piazza! Best Early!. Piazza Navona is beautiful and very crowded in the evening. The best time to get great pictures without crowds is in the morning. Highly recommend going before noon for the best experience. The fountain is really beautiful. Be sure to see some of the historic churches within a few blocks!
La dolce vita is here ..... Piazza Navona , great place, love the history of this town.There is no other place like this , if you planning to travel to Rome, Piazza Navona needs to be on your list

Favourite place in Rome . This is a must do if you have a few days in Rome, we had a few hours one day so we walked here and just say in the sun for ages, it was beautiful! There was also a lot of bars and restaurants near by so we sat and had a cocktail and it was one of the most enjoyable times of the trip! Good for a few chilled hours and not very far fromThe Pantheon!

Great atmosphere . We loved it. Street artists, musicians, beautiful fountains. Great for a wander in the evening, not so impressive during the day. Expensive to eat/drink in the piazza but great restaurants in the side streets between the Piazza and Via Victor Emmanuel
Really nice fountain, less crowded than the other. Beautiful fountain with a very interesting story, be sure to ask a local what to do there if you are a female.

Beautiful Piazza and nice surroundings. If you like to walk around cities and explore this Piazza should be one of the places to see. It is nice just to sit by the fountain and look at the beautiful area around you.
lovely fountain fun experiance. The fountain it beautiful. It is great for picture. There is a famous gelato shop there, a bit pricey but, to me it's about the experiance
Epitome of Rome. Charming piazza near the Pantheon.Many good restaurants here and great for people watching. Does not seem quite as touristy as other areas in Rome.

Great place to have lunch or a quiet dinner.. This place is lovely during the day, even more lovely at night. It is a big square with fountains, and restaurants surrounding the square. Food is delicious everywhere, make sure you read the menus set outside each restaurant first to be certain of where you want to eat.
There are no words!. Please, please don't miss out on a visit to this spectacular Piazza. Not only are the fountains fantastically beautiful but the atmosphere around the Piazza is magical.
Very beautifull!. We stopped at Piazza Navona several times during our visit but the last day we had a coffe at a very beautifull cafe!You should visit!!
St. Mark's in Rome!. Gorgeous piazza, and even more beautiful at night. Less crowded then Trevi Fountain, but the same feel. A must see in Rome!

Always something interesting going on.... I just like watching the shows. The fountains are all fabulous and the layout (following the plan of Diocletian's arena) is fantastic. Don't eat out on the square- it's pricey!
Nice place to sit and watch the world go by!. Lovely place for a bite to eat and watch the world pass by. Lots of places to eat and drink but they are a little pricey.

Weekend break. Nice place to sit and watch the world go by. Go in the evening, artists and music which is very pleasant.
Drinks and food a little pricey but worth it.

Must visit !. Crowded and busy all the year round but if you find the magic moment when the square is empty you'll feel all the magic of this place and the wonder of the art pieces it hosts (the fountain of the rivers, the churches, etc) and you'll have a full view over the square the ancient Romans used to flood to showcase real ship battles.
Must see in Rome!. Amazing piazza to visit in Rome. Beautiful architecture, some street artists to admire, a lot of little cafes to stop by for a cup of coffee or glass of vine! Lovely!

Great dinner. Had a great dinner at Dolca Vita. Food great, staff friendly and helpful...house wine not bad. We shared the pasta aragosta and it came served on two plates with half the aragosta on each plate. We then had the fillet in pink pepper corn sauce and it was cooked to perfection. We also asked for a side of sweet peppers whic was not on the menu and they were happy to accommodate our request. A great dining experience and fabulous Piazza.
Beautiful fountains. Lively atmosphere, nice little cafés, people sitting around playing music and enjoying the sunshine. Pleasing experience.

Serenity in a Square . Arguably the most beautiful Piazza in all of Rome. Bernini's Four Rivers Fountain is a masterpiece which completes the piazza like a cherry on top. The piazza is surrounded my restaurants, a market in the day and artists and music buskers. A great atmosphere and best enjoyed in the early evening when it is buzzing.

Great place to relax and people watch. Absolutely love Piazza Navona and come here every day when in Rome. It's on our route through to Vatican City but it's also a great place to sit and people watch or just to wander round. Lots of restaurants around the perimeter, our favourite being Caffe Nettuno. The the fountains and the church are all really impressive and certainly add that wow factor. As with everywhere in Rome, be sure to visit at night as well as in the day time, as the whole city takes on a different atmosphere at night.

Excellent place!. This place is probably underrated as its an excellent place to hang around at during the evenings, lots of activities happening around, painters doing their stuff, restaurants etc. Very lively square.
beautiful piazza. plenty of restaurants and a beautiful fountain with a statue in the middle. Very nice, kinda pricey.

Shouldn't be missed.. If you miss this square (or any of a few others), I would really wonder why you visited Rome.And if you are yet to visit Rome, really make sure you visit this Piazza.The Piazza is a great place in the evenings and a little after sunset, but it is also a good place to visit any other time during the day.But as the refrain goes "beware of pick pockets in crowded places"
Beautiful!. A must see while in Rome. Not as crowded as the Trevi! Beautiful details, the piazza is often littered with debris from markets or other events.

A nice Plaza. Plaza Navona is a big plaza with several attractions. We went there with a tour but it was a quick visit so we decided to come back later by our own. My daughter had her pencil sketch done in 20 minutes. She paid 70 EUR but it is awesome. I think it is one of the thing that she will keep for ever. The restaurants in the plaza are touristic a kind of expensive but if you go to the streets on the side you can find better restaurants and not expensive. We have dinner in one called Mama's Roma. The tour guide recommended this restaurant and it was good for 70% of the prices in the Plaza. The only con is that there is no metro subway close to it so we had to take the bus and walk 3 or 3 streets. It was not a big deal the walking.
It's OK. Just OK. A square full of restaurants all VERY EXPENSIVE. There are more interesting places to see and cheaper ones too

Sad decline of a Roman tourism staple. Piazza Navona was one of my favorite places during my last visit to Rome about 10 years ago. Unfortunately it has lost a lot of its charm. Simply put, it has been overrun with hawkers. I enjoy the artists selling paintings and don't mind the caricature drawing booths, even if it is kitschy. But there is nothing charming or redeeming about roving bands of guys tossing glowing plastic helicopters in the sky and getting in your face every five minutes. Thanks, but no. I'm afraid I didn't come to Rome to buy glowing toys made in China.It's still a beautiful place and the fountains are worth a stop on your trip to Rome. But it's not what it once was - which is a reflection of Roman authorities' apathy. Hardly a place where you and your sweetheart can stroll and enjoy the fountains... RIP Piazza Navona!Also, although this probably goes without saying, avoid the tourist trap restaurants that line the Piazza at all costs. Despite the aggressive invitations of the waiters and waitresses, the food (and prices) will disappoint.
City break. A beautiful piazza - surrounded by restaurants, expensive to eat here. We ate just outside the piazza and had a huge pizza to share.
Would recommend a visit. Lovely place to sit to have a coffee or lunch at one of the many restaurants, watching the world go by.
Great food. Great food with a beautiful atmosphere.Night time was full of energy - lots of street performers to watch.
You cant not visit the fountain. Always busy and always worth a visit, morning noon or night its always got such a good buzz. and you get great photos

A large square with beautiful fountains. The square is beautiful but surrounded by very expensive restaurants. The side streets contain markets which are worth a look. Nice place to take a break before heading off for further sightseeing
Best street shoes with fountain . One of the best shows I have seen it was really entertaining I saw a clown some break dancers and there are two fountains that you can also enjoy

Running tour with Livitaly. We ended our running tour at this Piazza and came back later that night to see all the nightlife. The running tour was ok glad. We had a guide it is very easy to get lost and completely turn around in this city. At night this Piazza comes alive with people and artist vendors nice place to walk around and get a gelato with the family

Must see the fountain!. The fountain and its story are incredible. Stop by the little cafe on the left hand side and have some tartufo...delicioso! Great people watching here in this beautiful square.

Beautiful Piazza very crowded in Summer. be careful of pick pick pocket thieves here......Trust me.so much to see in this piazza, great walking and can also get Tour at night.Must eat at Tre Scalini while you are here.....
Beautiful, but not overwhelming. We went on a really hot day and were accosted by parasol sellers. The square is beautiful, but it was so hot we didn't stay long.

Touch of Rome. I would say seeing this piazza will give you of touch of Rome. Filled with nice restaurants around. Fun to watch the fountains with kids with ali these beautiful sculptures.Strongly recommend the visit for single travellers, couples, honeymooners and families. Gelato places are nearby and if you wish to use a bus there are couple stations around.

Stunning and vibrant. As one of the central places in Rome, Piazza Navona is a stunning view. It's beautiful and always vibrant and alive. From early morning to late in the earning. It's a must on your Rome-trip.

Great place for peaceful entertaining. In Piazza Navona there are always paintings and artisan works to admire. Nice atmosphere, street performers and if you are with kids I suggest a visit at the toy store that is towards the end of the piazza. They will love the collection of antique dolls, trolls and fairys. You cannot miss it bacause it has a fairytale window with a big dragon in it.

Beautiful Fountain. Rome is famous for its Fountains, and try to visit this one as its location and surroundings are stunning. Cafes and restaurants all around it but try to go to ones in the side roads, cheaper and you get more personalised service.
Eh. It's okay, kind of blends into everything else in Rome. Not that special. A building facade, a Benini statue, a bunch of vendors and tourists.

Stunning!. We returned to Piazza Navona 3 times during our 4 days in Rome. The Bernini fountain of the 4 Rivers is so beautiful and kept me and kids occupied for ages. The highlight was interestingly the Spray Paint Guy who's name I don't know. He paints the most incredible painting using only spray paint and bits of cardboard. For only 10 euros you can take home a great painting that you watched him create before your eyes. He's amazing. The atmosphere in the piazza is always fun as there are always street performers adding colour to your visit. A must see on your itinerary in Rome!

Nice piazza. Beautiful location but touristy. Some of the smaller piazzas are less touristy and just as nice. The restaurants battle over customers, which was nice to feel wanted, but the prices and service are indicative of a tourist selection.
full of life,amazing. All nationalities,no trouble,just Rome at Its best.2 minutes away from Trevi fountain so many small outdoor café,s,the atmosphere was brilliamt.

Great break opportunity. Lovely sit down around in the day and great atmosphere and ambience in the evenings. Although restaurants will charge more in the piazza... And not always the best quality. Would recommend visiting!

My favourite place in Rome!. This is real Rome! Piazza Navona is the most beautiful square in Italy! There are two beautifull fountains and a nice church to visit and many cafès and restaurants. We sat in a restaurant and just drank coffee and joined the view. There were many people and one musician, who gave a nice note to the whole place. Nice yellow houses with colourfull balkons! I really loved it!
Lovely location to eat and relax. Had a lovely lunch in this Piazza, lots of restaurants to sit and relax. Really nice atmosphere, definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful. Beautiful fountain but very busy spot and hard to get through the crowds. Be careful of pick pockets
Great place to sit and gillato here was amazing . Great place to sit and take in the views. Great food and the gillato here was to die for. Also one of my favorite fountains is here

One of my favorite Piazzas. This is a beautiful and must see location in Rome. Beautiful fountains and fun atmosphere. Lots of restaurants and shops, gelato stores and a beautiful church to see as well. We actually stopped by 3 times when we were in Rome

Piazza Navona. When in Rome, we always have a lunch in Piazza Navona. The fountains are beautiful. We have tried several of the sidewalk cafes and have never been disappointed. Piazza Navona is within easy walking distance of many of the attractions.
Peaceful location. Wide open spaced piazza. lots going on with a vibrant buzz. Plenty of places to sit and watch the world go by .. eat .. drink .. whatever.

A nice evening. This place is located in the City Center of Rome and is marked by lovely cafes on one of its sides. Piazza Navona is a great place to sit and relax after a day full of exploits in Rome's tourist area. You can go and enjoy beers, Pizzas if you want or you can sit on benches or pavements and just see and absorb the flavours of modern day Roman life and those of the tourists who regularly flock this place.
Nice square with strong turism commerce . Great architecture in fountains and buildings, but also many sellers of crap and turism art. Many restaurants with offensive business models.

My favorite piazza. Love the artists.. This is my favorite piazza in Rome. The artists there, showing their many paintings, is wonderful. We have visited Rome fourt times and this is a favorite of ours.

Beautifull place, in the middle of all attractions of Rome. This square especially at night, is a nice place to rest because it's position is in the middle of all attractions like Spagna, Fontana di Trevi, Spagna or Pantheon.Keep on mind that it is not needed to have a coffe, drink or dinner in the square because the Restaurants are all over priced.From the square many small streets is full of nice Restaurants or cafe with better prices .
Okay !!!. Beautiful place în Rome , everything looks so great over there and with lot of restaurant around i eat wonderful pizza there !
Fun scene!. This place is so big you don't feel crowded. Nice locale for a gelato, caffe' or even a meal. The fountain is beautiful.

Great plaza. This was our second time to Piazza Navona. The plaza is such a fun place to visit. You could just sit and people watch if you didn't want to do anything else. There are plenty of restaurants around and just off the plaza plus places to shop. Definitely a place to visit when in Rome.

Great for a lazy lunch or dinner. We went there during lunch. There are many restaurants around and we had a lovely lunch with a great view. Under rome's sun in the summer, I will not suggest Piazza Navona for just a stroll. Rather merge it with your lunch/ dinner plan, enjoy the fountain view, take some photographs and have a good time with your companions!
Great place to eat. Lovely restaurants, beautiful fountains, lively atmosphere and some interesting shops - really liked the Murano glass shop. Great place for lunchtime.

Top list of place to visit in Roma. Even it is not famous like fountana di Trevi or vatican but I very strongly recommended to visit here.
Possible day and night time. Dinner or lunch in this place is very good ideal as we did.
romantic. love this place try to visit it when light goes away and lights are on at the square ,,full of life typical italy ,for me better than crowded fontana di trevi here is so so so

Daytime better than night time?. I came here one evening, but I wasn't totally enamored with it. The sculptures and architecture in Rome are amazing and really impressive, so maybe it was the ambience that I didn't like, and that it was really really busy, I'm not sure. I took a few pictures but didn't feel like I wanted to stay much longer. Maybe it would have been better to have come in the day.

A Favorite Place in Rome. If you can do it, get up early and watch the sun rise in this plaza. The rosy morning light bathes the marble fountains in a beautiful glow. This early you will be mostly alone except for the shop keepers beginning their day. Grab a table at an outdoor café and have coffee and pastry while you relax and watch the plaza start to come alive. The extraordinary sculptures are simply unforgettable. And the lovely buildings that encircle you and the Piazza will make you feel like you're in your own perfect world. Eventually the tourists and locals will descend but by then you will have had a special moment to remember.

Great atmosphere. One of the few places in the city with plenty of benches to just sit and soak up the atmosphere. Especially lovely at night with a great gelato shop (next door to Grom).Lovely art and lots of places to eat.

Amazing place . This was just a couple of minute walk to our hotel. Really lovely place to spend the evening. We had a meal outside which was delicious. Artists painting everywhere. The only downside was the people trying to sell us cheap toys on the street and it gets a bit much apart from that it's well worth a visit if you are in town.
Beautiful piazza in the centre of Rome. Lovely open piazza near Trevi fountain and Campo de Fiori. Huge fountain in the center with many restaurants lining the edges. Great place to stroll thru!
Very pretty. Took us a while to find but thought it was very pretty with amazing architecture. Lots of places to get a drink nearby, not much shade!!
Nice. Very nice to see the artwork, fountain and detail but dont spend too much time here as there is so mich more to see.
even better than the Trevi fountain. the details of the fountains are anazing and with the beautiful buildings as a backdrop, this is a perfect place for spending some hours.
Pleasant area. We used Rick Steves walking tour and found that great. It started ist Campo de Fioro and ended at the Spanish steps.
Worth the Walk. This is a beautiful area that's worth the walk to get there. The shops and the fountains make such a beautiful memory while walking the sites of Rome!
My favorite Piazza . Nice place in the evening.......noone here in the morning.....children not to impressed...food expensive but the evenings are delightful .....many tourist and hawkers...

Great for people-watching!. Piazza Navona was a lively and fun square. We inadvertently found ourselves back at this square time and time again. We used it as a guide to get back to our rented flat. It was full of restaurants, people, music, and entertainment. Always a good time!
Classic Rome. If you come to Rome you have to spend an evening here having a meal and people watching. It really is classic Rome.

Just a big Piazza. The four river fountain and the hiatory behind it was interesting.
Otherwise it is like any other piazza in Rome but just a huge one full of tourists enjoying the atmosphere and cafes.

Beautiful plaza with lots of live art going on. Bernini's work is definitely amazing, no doubt of that. Also, I really enjoy the live street band music and the street artist. I love to see those paintings by different artists. And those cafe, what a nice place to spend sometime sitting there and goofing off for a while.

Pose, snap and move on. Piazza Navona is very nice, but don't spend too much time here - there are too many other places, that are must sees in Rome. You should also be aware of pickpockets here! They are very active in Rome :)
Piazza novona. Beautiful piece of history and specially that in every piazza their is a church. So you can go in and learn more about the piazza
Only for tourists. Very beautifull "piazza"with many fountains, big statues and restaurants.Restaurants are a little bit expensive for what they offer.
Love it. I adore Piazza Navona. Great place to people watch and sit with a coffee or limoncello! I would not miss it, the fountains are so beautiful and the italian ambiance cannot be matched!

Sit, drink and relax. This is one beautiful place to buy a Peroni and sit under an Umbrella with the lovely mists and fans.
Be prepared to pay though.
The Beer is standard Rome prices at about 9euros for 400ml but the cans are 7Euros. Expensive for330ml of sugary black water.
Got to be done though.
Very vibrant in the evening. Stunning architecture, beautiful fountains especially the four river fountain. Plenty of places to eat, great food but a little pricey.
A gem hidden in the old-city. One of those gems you discover while strolling around the city. Great architecture and good for relaxing and clicking pictures

Bernini fest. I am a huge fan of Bernini's work so what could be better than his amazing Four Rivers fountain (His Trevi Fountain perhaps?) We visited at dusk, as the air was getting cooler and the crowds diminished. The Piazza is spacious with restaurants and shops ringing the center. Take time to really look at the movement and expression that Bernini captures in stone.

Fountains of The Four Rivers. One of the amazing fountain to be hunt while in Rome. Rome had quite numbers of fountains and hunting them one by one is my challenge when in Rome. This one capture my interest and the piazza is cool. Hang out and having an ice cream while enjoying the view. Well the four river might be from the water that came out from 4 corner of the fountain. This is one of the must see fountain sculpture when in Rome. Built in 1st AD and the piazza is formerly was a Domitian Stadium.

Beautiful Fountain. The fountain at the centre of the plaza is the main attraction here. The restaraunts and little stall shops were quite expensive - best to avoid those. Lovely little gelato shops nearby if the day is hot and you need a pick-me-up while taking in the sights!
nice. You can check this out in about 5 minutes but it's really cool to check out the fountain. Fun to people watch and the shops nearby have some nice stuff.

People Watching and Relaxing. While this is a perfect place to people watch and relax, please remember that the food and restaurants here are slightly more expensive than the rest of Rome. Our group stayed a bit in the shade to take in the sights but after eating at some fantastic places that were well-priced, these restaurants sounded less and less appealing. But the fountain is absolutely gorgeous and well worth the trek.
do you have Coin !!!!. it was very beautiful place everything looks so great over there and with lot of restaurant around i eat wonderful pizza there mmmmm.

Looks nicer at night. This is one of the sites of Angels and Demons (the prequel to the DaVinci Code). We went there by day and night, and thought that the fountain in the middle of the piazza looks better at night when it is illuminated. Also at night, the place is very festive, with several restaurants in the area and lots of street entertainers. Spend some time there after dinner.

A Rome highlight. Spending time in the Piazza is a must everytime we come to Rome. The fountain is beautiful and the church of St. Agnese right across is a hidden treasure worth seeing. The Piazza is always lively with locals and tourists.
Great location. The location is great, views are stunning. History is all around. there are so many restaurants to choose from. Best stores in the world. Great place for shopacholics

Afternoon tour of Rome including Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and Plaza Navonna.. Damiano was our tour guide and made the afternoon trip really worthwhile. A very enthusiastic guide who was extremely knowledgeable about the main sites and other important structures and areas of Rome that are not promoted as the highlight places to visit. We conducted this tour last year and although we enjoyed it we really learned lots more this year and found the guide brought the trip alive for us all.
Fountain. So many many people hard to get around. Went in August. You definitely need to keep a hand on handbag.

Great place to relax and people watch. I've been to Rome several times and always enjoy visiting Piazza Navona. I'm not sure I would eat at any of the restaurants, but they're a great place to sit and enjoy a nice glass of wine and watch the world go by (along with all your worries and cares). The fountains are beautiful to see and there are often artists at work or selling their work. Piazza Navona is a one-of-a-kind place that should be visited, especially during the evening hours.

Beautiful place. Beautiful place. I come here necessarily, every time when I come to Rome. Previously, there was antique emperor Domitian stadium.The main decoration of Piazza Navona - 3 stunning fountains of the great Bernini. In the center - a fountain "Four Rivers" (the Nile, the Ganges, La Plata and Danube). It symbolizes the four continents: Europe, Asia, Africa and America.If the architecture is music in stone, the Piazza Navona for me is the music of Verdi.Around the Piazza there are cafes, restaurants, pizzerias. But remember the main rule: the further attraction- the cheaper and tastier food.

One of the oldest squares of Rome. Piazza Navona is situated on the remains of a Roman stadium. The houses were built on the location where the people would sit. You can still see some remains if you exit the northside of the square and go to your left (Piazza di Tor Saguigna). There you can see the remains of the "Stadium of DomitianPiazza Navona is a great place to sit at night and look at the crowds passing by. Just beware ofthe street sellers which can be quite annoying at times.
Busy nice square. Busy square with nice fountains and tourist stuff like cartoonists. Also a lot of full terraces around the square. Very touristic, of course, but cosy.

A beautiful town square. The place is picturesque with a magnificent fountain in the middle. There are numerous of restaurants for you to have lunch while enjoying the beauty. However, you also need to consider about the price

Amazing Square!!. This was my favourite place to visit while in Rome!!
We had lunch twice in the square and spent one evening here.
It truly is what you imagine whilst in Rome been able to sit and watch the world go by!
A must visit for a break from the walking!
Great Plaza to have dinner.. Piazza Navona is a grat place to have lunch and dinner as well. Very open space with wide variety of restaurants and pubs to choose from.

Three Fountains - Med Sized. Medium sized three fountains with different architectural design.
If you select the proper timing, you can avoid busy times and have sufficient comfortable photos
A 20 minute visit.
Great fountain. It is in the heart of the city and very accessible. The main attraction is the fountain but it is surrounded by some nice restaurants.

The Fountains of Piazza Navona more spectacular than Trevi!. The Piazza, the people, the fountain, the food, he artists...Piazza Navona has it all. It's a "must visit," a "must see," a must love when you visit Rome. Sit on a bench and enjoy the beautiful surroundings of Piazza Navona.
Best piazza in town. There are many piazzas in central Rome but we spent the most time at Piazza Navona. Good restaurants. Best gelato (kiwi). Lovely.

Beautiful fountain. The area is very busy with entertainers and vendors. All very enjoyable to watch. We sat outside at a small cafe and had coffee and ice cream for almost 2 hours enjoying the people watching.
Busy. Piazza was bustling, was nice walking through. But must also say, the only bad meal we had in Italy was here.
Beautiful square. We lived right next to Piazza Navona so marveled at it everytime we walked by it. Beautiful architecture, fountains and surrounded by lovely restaurants and shops.

A must see when in Rome. We were told that we needed to see Piazza Navona when we were in Rome. We were really glad we did. We had a wonderful, reasonably priced, quality dinner at an outdoor venue and found a souvenir store that had some of the best variety of products we encountered in all of Rome and their prices were not outrageous.But the fountains and the Obelisk are the Piazza Navona surrounded by former mansions made the evening in Rome really great. Don't miss it!
Great place to people watch. My husband and I came here often to drink wine, take in the incredible statues around you and people watch. There is always entertainment in the Piazza!

Nice. This is a quite impressive and beautiful piazza. It may not appeal as a top notch tourist attraction but we enjoyed this as much as the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc.
Short sharp, seen it, enjoyed it, photographed it, type of place.
Lovely square . It's large historical square full of restaurants and small shops and on the center of the square you can see a lot of artists drowning the tourists .

Nice big square. This is a nice big square with a fountain and many restaurants around it. The streets around the square is also very nice. The food price were low so eat your lunch here.
There were artist and people selling paintings here. It is a big square so it was not crowded at all. At least not when we were here.

Great! . Lovely in the day but even better at night with lots of lovely places to eat!!!
People do walk around trying to sell you things whilst you eat which is slightly annoying but expect that wherever you go in Rome!
