We Love Piazza Navona. This is our absolute favorite part of the city and this trip we were able to rent an apartment that was within a stone's throw. The energy at night is contagious, whether you go for a meal, or just to wander around watching the street performers. The ambience is lively and fun, and I can't stop smiling just thinking about Piazza Navona.

Fun fun fun at night with great art. Saw this in the day and went back for an evening stroll when it was all lit up and then found dinner on a side street. Worth doing both especially for all the people watching with a glass....
Piazza Navona. recently renovated. full of tourists. really nice and worth visiting. one of the must see placed to visit in Rome

Piazza Navona-Italy. Just sit in the piazza around the fountain on the ledge or the iron bars on the boundary.You will lucky if you find benches during peak season and enjoy the surroundings.Try the famous gelato store nearby.

The most wonderful town square. This is a beautiful square with it magnificent fountain in the middle. There are numerous restaurants around the edge of the square where we did enjoy a lazy lunch, however unfortunately you do pay for the experience of eating in such a picturesque setting as the prices were hiked in this location. This is also surrounded by lots of small side streets that are full of shops and bars that eventually wind their way to the pantheon (direction dependant). The down side was the pushy restaurateurs attempting to seat you at their tables.

probably the most beautifull piazza in the world. Whenever I am in Rome I try to visit this Piazza, It has nice atmospere, You can sit at the fountains and suprisingly it is never crowded. For eating and drinking just around the corner there are good restaurants for half the price, but also half the view.
Beautiful . Very beautiful, with lots of restaurants around especially good for pizza places, music played around you and lots to see
Grand place. Beautiful place to visit, central statues and fountains flanked by further fountains and statues at both ends of the piazza.

Pretty Piazza. We visited the Pia Navona late morning, which we didn't realize was way to early. Later in the afternoon and evenings its happening place. The fountain is quite nice but nothing like Tevi. Bottom line, if you want to go, visit late
SURPRISE. As if you could stumble onto such a place. Around every corner in Rome lies a great surprise... my favorite Piazza.

Lovely Piazza. Really wonderful relaxed piazza in the heart of Rome. Expect the usual inflated prices for drinks and food in the cafes surrounding the square, but well worth s stop for coffee and maybe a big to eat, watch the world go by and plan your next set of sightseeing.The whole area around here is well worth just aimlessly wondering around, to get a feel for the real Rome.
Amazing! . Superb! The fountains and street artists are fabulous...well worth a visit. We went a few times at different times of day to get the atmosphere.
Beautiful piazza. The fountains here are beautiful. We had a guide book and read about the history of the church, and fountains. It's not as crowded at the Trevi fountain.

My favorite piazza in Rome. With the lovely Bernini fountains, restaurants aND cafes, a beautiful.church with charming balconies above..my tour guide friend Laura Garassini told me so much interesting history of it

Good value. This hotel is right off the interstate. The room was clean and breakfast ample. The staff was friendly and helpful. Excellent value. Our room was on the first floor and there was a little noise from the reception area.

Stumbled onto Piazza Navona. We were just walking the streets of Rome and came across Piazza Navona along our journey. It is fairly large with 3 different fountains and lots of vendors/restaurants. We didn't stay long as it was raining when we came across it but it probably would have been busier on a nicer day.

One of the most beautiful piazzas. Piazza Navona is a must see, with its three fountains (of which the fountain of four rivers is the most famous). You have several good gelato places to enjoy while you walk across it.
It's near other sensational landmarks, so make sure you include it on your tour map.

A great place to chill. We entered this by another small street and it's size was awesome. Its 3 fountains and atmosphere was so relaxing. The church in the middle was fantastic inside and a great place to chill.

Great place to stay . The Navona piazza was a wonderful place to stay in, it was bustling with people and great restaurants , coffee shops and gelato shops everywhere ! Centrally located to all your major sightseeing spots and close walk to the shopping on via del corso! I would highly recommend this area !!!

Perfection in design and scale!. A beautiful oval shaped Piazza that was once flooded and used by the Romans to practice naval warfare. Take a stroll relish the sights and view the beautiful fountains.
Great Great Great. You have to go,it is a must for your trip!It is a beautiful and picturesque piazza with a lot of 'activities' taking place there!

not many people . Unlike the Trevi, the fountain here is less well known but no less beautiful. There aren't many people around the Piazza so its a good place to get away from the crowds and just relax.
Beautiful!. The view is wonderful as well as the atmosphere! Great service and very friendly staff! The tiramisu was excellent!

Savor the moment. Visit this Piazza, walk around, take some photos, have a Lemon Granita at one of the restaurants, enjoy some ice cream and walk off into the narrow cobbled streets surrounding this lovely square.

Perfect for the evening stroll . We loved this Square in the evening ( equally beautiful during the day thought too ) but it gives extra buzz when it goes dark and all the lights are switched .It has very unique toy/souvenir shop Al Sogno , definitely worth a visit .Personally I would avoid the restaurants on the square simply for its touristy feel ( quick service and next please ,unless that's what you prefer ) , we opted for the little hidden places behind the square and were not disappointed!

Impressive. Anyone who has watched Angels and Demons will recognize the impressive piazza.Be aware of pickpockets I was approached by two women one claimimg to be pregnant whilst the other tried and failed to take my wallet
beautiful. The fountain was just reopen to the public. Definitely worth seeing but it is very crowded. Try to got there early in the morning.

Refreshing. The buildings have been very well restored and the fountains are refreshing in case of warm weather. Nice place to take some pictures and many restaurant nearby. A place tourist cannot ignore and do not...
italy. great place to eat and ppl watch., we also got a great painting there! beautiful art work. cool place to walk around have a glass of wine

Beautiful....but touristy restaurants. My hair and and I wanted to be able to experience the Piazza Navona but we're very turned off by the touristy restaurants and all the car salesmen trying to pull you into their restaurant. They made it uncomfortable and annoying. We ended up going to a place by the Pantheon that Rick Steves suggested in his book and had an amazing meal, at half the cost!Go for a little time but beware!
Lovely place to spend an evening. Charming!Beautiful cafes and entertainment! Lovely fountains! At sunset the piazza fills up with people enjoying the area.
Perfect. You must visit. It is one of the most popular piazza in Rome. There are many cafes, restaurants. It is always crowded.
Good place to take a rest between St Peter's and Trevi Fountain. Great to have seen where the film Angels and Demons was shot. Nothing spectacular though....you may chance upon street performers

Great spot. Stayed at the Novana suites boutique hotel as part of our visit to Rome and Tuscany later on on. Great central location overlooking the piazza. Not an obvious place to stay given all the other locations in Rome but very pleased we did - I think a real gem. This is a 3 star hotel and has no other facilities than reception and rooms. Not a negative just a point of clarification. We didn't need restaurants as Rome has a mass of them. We never ate on the piazza itself as these tended to be 10-20% higher in cost - instead walk away from the piazza in any direction and there are some fantastic street restaurants and bars all oozing with ambiance and character. The hotel and staff are great, couldn't help enough and gave some good recommendations. To make yourself feel a little special go for room 14 with the only balcony overlooking the square. Great atmosphere at night. Would I use this hotel again - yes without doubt.
A must see in Rome. This is really a place to see. Even there a lot of tourists, take your time and take a careful look at the buildings, fountains and statues.
Beautiful and enjoyable to sit and people watch!. Easy to reach, very picturesque. The crowds not overwhelming, but like many major cities, beware of pickpockets.
Great spot to experience Rome. Good for people watching, enjoying live music! Perfect in the late afternoon when the fountains come alive with light.
beautiful and buzzing. lovely big square to walk around and people watch, we ate on the square and at the back, down a delightful side street, both times the food was good, and not expensive at all.
The biggest Piazza. There really is nothing that special to see at this piazza, but the atmosphere is nice to have a drink at restaurant.

Loved it !. A beautiful place to visit and hang around. There are lots if places to sit and just enjoy the views.
There are also a lot of street vendors with beautiful paintings which you can enjoy.
We loved this place and this is one of the places to visit when in Rome.
Loved it !

Fantastic history!. The Piazza Navona is a wonder which has many facets. From magnificent buildings to three fountains and some of the best eating spots in Rome. It can be very crowded and hot but worth the visit.

Beautiful area. This was one of the last places we visited. The square is beautiful and the fountains it does feel very touristy and the restaurants are more expensive because of this but I will still recommend visiting the area!
Nice fountains, old buildings and many good restaurants.. Very nice piazza. Should really be seen in day and night time. Some very good restaurants surround the fountains and statues.

Best Piazza in Rome. I know it's really touristy but this is a "can't miss spot". We ended up here after a lovely tour seeing some little known churches to see the 4 fevers fountain by Bernini. It's an elliptical piazza (because it used to be a racing course) with three amazing fountains with the center being the famous four rivers fountain. The building by his rival dominates the architecture. Beautiful. Late evening is a great time to come. People watch. Listen to the music of the street performs, have a gelato or dinner at any of a number of street cafes. We ate at Tre Scalino- excellent!!!!! Wander off on the side streets and enter free, but gorgeous, churches. This is a place to understand "Bel far niente". Relax. Enjoy. You are in Rome. Evening is best I think because less hot and more people watching.

Surprise, Surprise!. Who would think that such an important, ancient and iconic place would be such fun to visit! It is said that this square used to be filled with water, and naval battles won by the Romans would be re-enacted - hence, Piazza Navona. Amazing! And what about the dismay, trepidation - and rivalry - expressed in the raised arms of one of the figures in Bernini's fountain, before the newfangled cupola of Borromini's church?There's so much to see and do; but before you leave this beautiful Square, take an (expensive, but well worthwhile) open air seat at the cafe' and enjoy a 'mela stregata'. There is usually no limit to the amount of ice-cream I can consume, but this bewitched little number was so rich and delicious, it nearly had me beaten.

Nice town square with fountains for photo ops.. Seems a tourist hotspot, crowded most of the time however its a nice place to hangout and learn a abit of the histroy about the locaiton, building and the rivalry beteween the architects. Many restaurants are located around here. Short walk from Pantheon.

Bautiful fountains. We walked up from the Pantheon to the Piazza Navona. It's a pleasant walk along the cobbled streets.
I thought the Trevi Fountain was more appealing.
But Piazza Navona is grand too. Do read up Dan Brown's Angels and demons where he has described the fountains so well.

One of the must stops on your tour. This piazza offers a few things others don't. First it has one of the most important fountains in Rome, the 4 rivers. The other is that it's pretty huge with 3 fountains and ample places to just hang out and enjoy the area. The last thing is there's plenty of food options here, so after a long day of sight seeing, you can relax and enjoy a nice wine or something to eat. You are also not far from many other famous locations in Rome so it's an easy place to incorporate into your walking tour.

One of the most beautiful squadre in Rome. In the Heart of Italy's capital city this unique and baroque square is a must for visitors. With its fantastic fountain and monumental buildings this square is certainly Worth a visit. Enjoy the atmosphere from one of the historical cafès.

Beautiful Piazza~recommended!. Piazza Navona is a piazza in Rome, Italy. It is built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian, built in 1st century AD. Life in the piazza revolves around the open-air-cafés and street performers. Recommend!
Beautiful. It's always so nice to walk around and find these beautiful Piazza's they make you want to stop and have a glass of wine and just watch the world go by.
Lovely square with fascinating fountains. The title says it all. In my opinion, one of the most atmospheric places an Rome and a must visit. It will be familiar to "Angels and Demons" readers.
A happening. The piazza is very lively, full of tourists and buskers, and with three fountains that are well-appreciated by fine sculpters.
Gorgeous fountains/Piazza, shops, drink places. This Piazza has beautiful fountains and shops to visit and places to get drinks at also. Was nice and romantic to walk around. Lovely place.

Very touristic. I was a bit underwhelmed by Piazza Navona. Sure the sculptures are fantastic and makes for a nice photo, but the place just feels very touristic and run down with lots of street vendors during evenings. Go during the day and avoid at night!

Always a favourite venue. Piazza Navona has real character and a buzz we never miss in Rome. It can get crowded, but the restaurants and bars are just brilliant, and you also get to see the living statues striking amazing poses while they collect contributions from the visitors. The two fountains are great spectacles too.

Worth a look. . Nice little shops around this area. Lots of little bars and places to grab lite eats. Would pop here to people watch too. Fountain is in the middle and churches nearby. All worth a look.
Stunning piazza.. A must see in Rome. Very impressive and beautiful. So much to see and many lovely cafes to eat/drink in.
Interesting square. There are 3 fountains and several restaurants on the square. Signs leading to/from are available and helpful.

Busy, but in a good way. We passed through the Piazza Navona as part of our walking tour. The Piazza (or square) is a beautiful, cobbled, wide open space with 3 fountains, 1 at each end (fontana de moro and the fountain of neptune) and a larger one in the middle (fontana dei quattro fiumi), which surrounds an Egyptian Obelisk. It was very busy with tourists when we visited in summer time, and there was lots to see and do. There were street performers, artists doing caricatures, people selling jewelry and selfie sticks, food vendors and lots of places around the edge of the Piazza to eat and drink.We only spent a short while here but got some beautiful photos and our tour guide told us a little bit about the history of the area and the fountains.

Wonderful in the evening . . .. Went there with some friends, just to walk around and enjoy the evening. Musicians playing, artists painting, lovers kissing, and people everywhere enjoying the moment. Don't miss this beautiful piazza!

Fun for kids in the evening, but have coins for buskers. If you are looking for an enclosed Piazza (no traffic) with restaurants, art, buskers, and entertainers, Novona is great. We walked in with my 3 boys, ages 12, 10, & 7, and watched 4 African men tumbling in bare feet on the cobbles. After we sat down at Tucci's (the southern most restaurant), an accordion player came by. While we were in btw courses, the kids wandered over to watch a magician. Then as my husband and I were finishing our drinks, they boys watched a fire eater/juggler. After dinner, we got some gelato and weaved through the artist on the north side of the fountain. One of our most enjoyable evenings in Rome!

Must see Piazza - Gorgeous fountains. This place is beautiful day and night. There tends to be some type of free entertainment here at busy times. Musicians, artists and of course the street vendors selling toys and roses.
Beautiful. Typical Rome Square with plenty of restaurants, shops and performers. Good place to hang out- plenty of Bars
former hippodrome. The largest public plaza in rome, a place to see and be seen, cafes restaurants museums and street vendors. And a lively night life.
former hippodrome. The largest public plaza in rome, a place to see and be seen, cafes restaurants museums and street vendors. And a lively night life.
Great Piazza!. 2012 Makes for great pictures. Nice place to eat on a sunny day. One of the prettier fountains, but not a drinking fountain, I think.

"Another Must". This Piazza is wonderful to visit during the day or evening. Amazing sculptures and beautiful fountains surrounded by lots of eateries. Children will enjoy the activity and street entertainers.
Active Piazza with many sights. Wonderful street entertainment in warm weather, as well as many good restaurants and spots to stop for a drink or gelato!

Beautiful Piazza - but way too many salesmen and bad restaurants. Enjoy the Piazza and the architecture and fontanas; but stay away from all the overpriced restaurants and overly aggressive salespeoplenselling 'made in hong kong' junk.

Best piazza in town . Make sure to visit this piazza when in Rome. Beautiful scenery.
Also remember to get a gelato from one of the nearby shops.

In the Heart of Rome -- so much to watch. Piazza Navona is a place to see art, architecture and locals. Of course there are tourists there, but there is a large complement of locals and Italian tourists, so good texture and entertainment. The Piazza church has great spiritual ambiance and excellent art. The local restaurants are distinctive and the one just to the right of the church is a great place for viewing. Highly recommended as a place to visit and linger.
Wonderful Plaza with great ambience. Loved the whole feel of this Plaza. Could of sat for hours people watching at one of the many cafes.
Gorgeous piazza, many tourists and vendors. Very beautiful area, but too many tourists and art vendors (selling non-trivial art) to be worthy of 5 stars
SAJ. One of my favorite places in the planet. Feels like the crossroads of the world. Great people watching, history and beautiful fountains. Must see for all.
Beautiful. Very pretty; typical of Rome. Good place to hang out for a while and watch street performers who put in quite a good show.

Fun exciting place hang out, but expensive. This is a pretty piazza with a lovely fountain. We were there several times over a few days.It was lovely in the mornings as it was quiet, and vibrant at night with tourists / cafes / etc:Just remember that everything around it is a lot more expensive that if you walk a street or two away.I enjoyed just wandering through and watching.
Rome's best and most beautiful Piazza. We were in awe of the vast area covered by the Piazza and three gorgeous fountains. This is a must see place to visit while in Rome.
Don't miss. This is wonderful to see. an be very crowded. We made a stop every time that we were nearby. It's so beautiful--hard to take it in --in just one visit. Recently beautifully re-newed.

Overhyped. I thought this square would be bustling with locals and street performers.Really I just found hoards of tourist crowding areas in the shade. The fountains around here are nice but nothing to get overly excited about. Wouldn't do it again
Great place to have a snack and take it in!. Another lovely piazza with some great gelato. Don't go out of your way but if you are walking nearby and happen upon it go!

NEVER THE SAME. We were there in all the ocasions we were in Rome and is always a pleasure and a gratifying experience to see the buildings a its fountains.We never get tired of walking through or around this Piazza

An Authentic Taste of Italian City Life. How can you not be in love when you stroll through the Piazza Navona. Loaded with artisans, restaurants and full of life! Although very crowded when we visited (an October afternoon) it was such a vibrant and beautiful atmosphere we enjoyed ourselves immensely. Beautiful fountains,food and great people watching.

Beautiful Square. The Piazza Navona is a beautiful plaza highlighted by a gorgeous Berninini fountain. It is not only a popular meeting spot but is central to a number of other popular tourist sites in Rome, including the Pantheon.

Piazza Navona. Very interesting to see the square and fountains. The square was Romes first athletic track! There are some street performers - not many - and mostly there are restaurants. So apart from that - nothing else to do.

MASSIVE AND BEAUTIFUL. Every single place in Rome is amazing.  This one is one of the million munuments in the centre of Rome catching your eyes!During Christmas time is a nice market. In piazza Navona Roman people celebrate the Epifania their Christmas!Is not Santa Claus but an old woman coming in the middle of the 6th of January night giving present to the good childrens !

Incredable!!. Do not miss this amazing fountain. There are some 30 animals in this fountain carved into the rock. If you take kids, have fun finding all 30. The square is filled with tourist restaurants, worth it though to grab a bite and stare at this work of art.
Beautiful. Wow-- like most of the piazzas in Rome. Try to not get overwhelmed by the crowds and the heat-- grab yourself a quiet spot and admire the beauty of this magnificent public square.

I think it's nice, but overrated. I might be the only person in the world who thinks that Piazza Navona is not amazing - I liked it, but I wasn't charmed by it. Then again, we only went during the day and not at night. That might be a different story then! Still nice to see during the day.

Gorgeous fountains. Great photo opportunities and markets, day dependent. Large piazza with buskers and restaurants. Worth a look. Pick your restaurants around touristy areas as some do precook food (or use frozen food) and heat it up in a microwave!! Small restaurants tend to close around 3pm and reopen around 7p for dinner. Some restaurants will advertise they have real food with real chefs

Great for people watching!. Beautiful and romantic at night. Lots of couples walking around. However, be forewarned that not all restaurants are of the same quality. Tre Scalini was awesome, Caffe Domiziano was not.

Great fountain to visit. I visited the fountain in the morning and there was hardly anybody there. Some of the street vendors were just starting to setup. Since it's not a large fountain you are able to get close for some really good photos.

Worth a visit. I read the reviews before going into Piazza Navona and decided to eat before getting there, we went to a little cafe down the road, we are so glad we did because once we got there the prices went sky high!! The actual grounds their self are beautiful there are fountains and beautiful architecture all around you, it's lovely to sit by one of the fountains with an ice cream just watching the world go by. 100% would recommend just eat before or after you go!!
A great way to finish our Roman experience. We had dinner in the Piazza Navona on the last night of our week long visit to Rome recently. Great atmosphere!
Large Piazza, nice at night!. Piazza Navona is an expansive piazza, large fountain and many restaurant choices, best visited early evening.

Easy and close to main attractions. We rented at a Boutique hotel in Piazza Navona and walked to all main attractions. We ate at the Piazza in the restaurants near by. All of them were excellent as well as the service. Just know that the bread baskets servers put on the table are inviting but cost for each peace of bread you eat. This information is never mentioned to clients.

Fun street scene in the evening. My kids enjoyed the evening street scene including musicians, artists and performers. The primary fountain, 4 Rivers, is dramatically large and the two supporting fountains are cute.I'd pass on recommending the restaurants around the square. We ate there and found it way overpriced and a poor value.My recommendation is skip eating a meal, just grab a gelato and enjoy walking a beautiful evening's entertainment.

Some special for me. I visited Rome in Novembar 2014. with my girlfriend. Since Fontana di Trevi was been renoveted, we walk to Piazza Navona and I proposed to my girlfriend!! She said Yes and I was the happiest man on the planet!!! That was November 23 2014. :)
Great place to eat. As you come into the Piazza with the main church in front of youGo to your right and use the Resturant on the very end as you look at the church Great food Great service

A Good Rest Stop. If you are wandering around the streets of Rome soaking up the atmosphere the Piazza Navona is a great place to take a pitstop, relax, have lunch / dinner. We arrived quite early so there weren't too many people, but I can imagine the Piazza being very busy once all the restaurants are open in the evening.

Tourist Trap. Its a piazza but I guess it is famous due to all the tourist that visit. I would try not to eat here as the restaurants are overpriced and the portions are very small. Its cool that they have artist selling their work there, but whats with all those self-propelled lighted flight toys everyone seems to sell on the Piazza??
Piazza Navona. Piazza Navona has some beautiful fountains! It also is located in an area that has several food and gelato options, as well as some beautiful street art that's available for purchase.

A place for local artist and good food.. This is a great place to hang out. You can look at the locals painting or grab a bite to eat. Sometimes local musicians come out and play. All of this at an old ancient stadium.
WOW!. This piazza was shown to us by our travel guide. It was the site of ancient water battles by ship for the amusement of the crowd!

Iconic piazza. An iconic piazza. Can be quite lively in the evening. A nice place to enjoy a drink and watch the world go by. Just make sure you know the prices first. This could be the world's most expensive place for espresso....

Has it all!. This piazza is one of my favorite places in Rome. It is a big area with a lot of open space. You will see magnificent architecture and sculpture and in the center is, of course, the renowned work of Bernini, the Fountain of the 4 Rivers topped by the Egyptian Obelisk. The square is flanked by 2 other fountains. Just to walk around and enjoy all of the people and the street entertainers is amazing. You also have many restaurants and cafes but it is probably better to avoid them since the prices could be higher than the side streets. I would make a visit during the day and at night if you have the time.

Nice square. We passed this square almost by accident as we wondered around the centre, it has some beautiful water fountains, there was music and artists around the square, and restaurants nearby - a nice area.
Fantastic Historical Visit. Mikaila provided tons of information and clearly expressed her passion for the art and history of Rome. We had a great time!

Made the visit as long as you want. We visited twice once at day and once at night. I enjoyed it more at night seeing the area lit up and not having the intense heat on you so much. Either way it's beautiful. There are three main statues / fountains to see but you can spend time watching the world go buy - bliss

Beautiful piazza, great people-watching, not so great prices. The first time I visited Piazza Navona (2014), I had the best time. On a beautiful, sunny day it is a great spot to walk around a look at the vendors (lots of art). Restaurants circle the piazza. I enjoyed a margarita pizza looking out into the piazza. I would recommend visiting at night too. The second time I visited (this past May) I noticed how expensive everything was. Beware tourist eating traps here. I paid 4€ for a bottle of water where we ate. Do not make my mistake. Maybe enjoy gelato here, but if you want to keep it relatively inexpensive, get away from the piazza to eat a meal. Sit at a fountain and soak in the fact that you are in Rome!

Rome trip. Plenty of stunning buildings and great restaurants to ease your feet after all the shopping. Main fountain is stunning and represents the 4 continents as Australia was not found when it was built
Lovely piazza.. Lovely big piazza. Full,of street vendors in the evening, but the police seem to keep them in check.Great restaurants, particularly Tucci. Great food and our waiter was terrific.

Great to Visit at Night. We hit the Piazza Navona on a beautiful, warm evening (8pm) and the place was teaming with artists, musicians, buskers, and tourists. We stopped for a drink in one of the many restaurants & bars surrounding the piazza. Beware - drinks and food are way overpriced since it is a main tourist attraction but it is fun to stop and enjoy the sights and sounds. When in Rome.....

Piazza Navona is a "hot spot". We loved this plaza! It has 3 different fountains in it and they are all equally beautiful! There are many restaurants surrounding the square with outdoor cafes...just lovely. Enjoyed musicians playing festive songs and great people watching opportunity. And there's the Opera House too!
Perfect. Perfect place to chill. There is a lot of restaurant and pub. Good place to rest some. PIAZZA NOVANOOO

Rome's best square. This elongated square is one of Rome's loveliest and is pedestrianised. You will see street entertainers and also many street sellers as well in the square. Not all is bad as there are two excellent fountains here, one designed by Bernini in the 16th century and with excellent figures spurting water. Many restaurants here and can be overpriced.

Beautiful piazza with magical fountain.. Such a beautiful place located in a heart of ancient Rome. The fountain is really breathtaking, probably one of the most beautuful fountains in the world. One thing that is missing are trees.
Lovely atmosphere. This piazza is very busy in the evenings but all the restaurants are so expensive. We walked a little further and ate right outside the Pantheon for around half the price.
A good place to eat. You can find a few restaurant along the piazza. Choose a restaurant and I am sure they are all great tasting Italian food.
Just sit and enjoy. This is a busy place yet it seems to hold alot of people without making it too busy. Worth seeing and just sit around and relax.
Over hyped. It's a point to see as per attractions but it's overhyped nothing too great honestly. U can easily skip this point

This is Superb !. So much life here . A brilliant brilliant Piazza .
In the evening and at night it just brims over with activity and the whole place is a beautiful gem .
When it's open go into the Church Sant Agnese in Agone but above all read up all you can about Piazza Navona before you go there .
It's superb.

Absolutely Love the Piazza Navona. Romans' favorite piazza! They love to sit in the cafes and people watch. So do we! There are artists selling decent art. Lots of tourists. I particularly love Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers. It is a fun place to go any time of the day!!

Unbucket List moment--one of my favorite spots in Rome. I don't really have a bucket list, so much as I just find myself doing things that I realize in the moment are bucket list worthy type experiences. Sitting at a table on the piazza, sipping wine and nibbling cheese while listening to the bells of Sant'Agnese in Agone strike high noon was one of those moments. Piazza Navona is well-known, but not nearly as crowded as some areas. There are three really cool fountains there, and in some ways this is a better fountain option than Trevi because it's not as crowded. The fountain sculptures are fantastic, and the surrounding architecture is really impressive. Plan to enjoy a meal at one ot the restaurants here and take it all in.

Bit disappointed eating there. We visited Piazza Navona, and the Piazza is beautiful. We made the mistake of eating at a restaurant there. We guessed that it would be a bit over-priced, and that would have been okay if the food had been good. But it wasn't. I really would take the guide book's advice and eat away from the "touristy" areas. Much better value because they have to try harder for your custom. The restaurants at Piazza Navona seemed to know that they had guaranteed trade and weren't really bothered about service, value of quality. Or maybe we were just unlucky.

Absolutely goregous but didn't spend much time there due to being during the heat of the day.. Would like to return to this beautiful piazza...it's a photo op for sure with several restaurants and hotels nearby as well as churches and close to everything in central historic Rome.

heart of historic Rome. This is a huge piazza with the Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini as its centerpiece. It is lined with cafes and restaurants where you can sit and watch everyone stroll around and view historic buildings like Saint Agnese by Borromini. It has lovely proportions.
Art. . The Piazza Navona was very artistic and beautiful! Several local artisans were available to purchase from. The surrounding neighborhood is full of great bars, shops and restaurants!

Busy... A lot of restaurants and places to have something to eat or drink. Beautiful fountains and relaxing atmosphere.
Selfie stick sellers everywhere and pretty hot since it is out there in the open with no roof over you. Gladly, you can sit at the restaurants under sunscreens if you get tired of the sun.

3 lovely fountains, and plenty of eateries to choose from. 3 lovely fountains, complete with a beautiful Egyptian obelisk.
Plenty of eateries to choose from for a snack, lunch or dinner. Good photos for a beautiful Rome scene.

Go back at night time . A very nice piazza to view. It's a big square with 3 fontains and the one in the middle is the most impressive one. The creator is Bernini and if you know his work you can definitely recognise it. When we visited the square it was very busy and many tourists trying to make pictures...but the best time to visit this piazza is at night. When the tourists are gone and the people of Rome go out the atmosphere is so much more authentic.

Heart of it All. Grand Elliptical Piazza surrounded by museums, churches, restaurants, gelatarias and cool shopping neighborhoods. We bought wonderful painting from Antonio Molinari. Check out the original artists and avoid the vendors that sell "art" that is duplicated and sold all over the city. Also, liked artist whose last name was Marni I believe.

Try the "Tartufo"!. Lovely piazza near the Pantheon. I love to go here in the evening after dinner. Be sure to stop at Tre Scalini and order a Tartufo". It's their signature, decadent chocolate ice cream dessert, and it's incredible! There are artists selling paintings, and of course people selling junky souvenirs. It's a fun place to wind down after a busy sightseeing day.

Nice find. We are not first time in Rome. Unfortunately, before we did not found this beautiful Piazza. It is very peaceful and picturesque place. I recommend to spend time here relaxing after day tour in Rome. Just sit and calm, watch people, fountains ...
Very good. Go early in the day before the crowds get there or late at night when they have gone and it is illuminated. Do both.

Lunch on the piazza. Found a wonderful place to cool off, enjoy some pizza and a cold fruit plate. They staff was most helpful helping us understand the different kids of pizza as the menu was in Italian. We ordered the cheese pizza, since we wanted something lite to tide us over until supper, it filled us up just enough along with a generous helping of fruit.
great fun!. have a relaxed day. enjoy music, art, pantomimers, as always great cafe's. easy walk to the Pantheon.

One of my favorite piazzas!. Piazza Navona has a great selection of outdoor cafes and quaint craft fairs that are fun to browse. It is a nice place to spend the evening eating and drinking and enjoying the atmosphere.

Tourist Central!. This is one of the largest squares in Rome, and it's oval-shaped because it follows the outline of an ancient Roman athletics stadium. It's quite exciting to enter it because almost all the side streets leading into it are narrow---and suddenly there's this big, long, open space! Touristy and overpriced restaurants flank both long sides, and I found that, even though the square is a large space, it was too crowded with tourists, large tour groups with guides, street performers, truck vendors, people coming up to you trying to sell you stuff, etc. Also, I heard you have to be on guard for pickpockets.On one side, there's an imposing Baroque church by Borromini. In the centre of the square is Bernini's popular Fountain of the Four Rivers, with one of Bernini's Rivers looking up in "horror" at Borromini's church! I actually liked the two smaller fountains at either short end because at least you could get away from some of the crowds taking "selfies"!This piazza is probably much nicer to be in in the early morning, and I'll bet it's pretty at night.
Pleasant Piazza. This is a lovely area for a stroll with numerous bars and restaurants as well as street vendors and hawkers. A great place for people watching at any time of day.
Angels and Demons site :). Great place to visit, easy to find and fab for angels and demons fans. I took some brilliant pictures.

Beautiful piazza. We spent hours enjoying the diverse entertainment throughout the evening. We enjoyed the fountains and cafes that surround it. Our hotel was next to this location and we could not have enjoyed ourselves more.

One of the most beautiful piazzas in Rome. If you only have one day in Rome this would definitely be at the top of the list for the places to see in Rome. I love this piazza. It is so beautiful and the fountain is just so lovely. It can get quite crowded here but the piazza is big so its never a problem. There are a lot of cute cafes around and also near by in the back streets so it is a lovely place to hang around. My favorite time is to go here at night. It has such a lovely ambiance.
stunning fountain. What stunning fountain and beautiful piazza. walked around got a gelato , then have appertif was a great day there. the buildings are amazing and the art is intreasting

piazza navona, very attractive place,. Piazza Navona is an area full of life, tens of hundreds visit the piazza around the clock, cafes, bars and restaurants remain open late at night, right time to visit during Spring and Summer. Not to forget to enjoy amazing quick dishes of pastas and pitzza
A place to enjoy. An open Place where you can sit Down and relax. A lot of restaurants there where you can get good Food, good drinks and have a Nice streetview.

Relaxing with a beer people watching . After a morning visiting the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and Pantheon all which can be done in a few hours ended up at the Piazza Navona and enjoyed the atmosphere of the square with all its fountains and street entertainers , beware of man selling dancing cartoon characters as a con.
Iconic place to visit. This is definitely a stop to see while in Rome. Lively and full of tourists (and sometimes locals). It is lined with shops and cafes. Worth seeing for sure.
Lots of street entertainers. Many restaurants and shopping. Lots of benches to sit and people watch. Fabulous GELATI...YUM. Stop #9 on the hop on bus is along way to walk! The map is hard to read.
Tons of energy - shear beauty. Went there in early am ( approx 7:30 am) and the place was near empty and went in the early evening ( tons of people, lots of people and activities)

Watch the world go by.... Lovely piazza - complete with musicians, artists, caricaturists and wonderful cafes...spend some time here for sure. Soak up the atmosphere and maybe get a couple of caricatures done for yourselves too :)

Stunning. This place is simply stunning. The architecture is just amazing. We had to try several panoramic angles to try and capture the entirety of its magnificence. It is just beautiful. Just when you think you've already been blown away wander across to the church across the piazza and marvel at what humans were and are capable of. Not religious myself but even I was wowed by the inspiration to create such a beautiful building, the ceilings, the floors...simply stunning. And then walking out again onto the awesome tapestry that is Navona...I think I'm in love.

Beautiful, but crowded!. Like other reviews have stated, this is one of the most crowded places in Rome. Very touristy and over run with high-priced food. It is so beautiful though, you must see it! This was our final stop on our LivItaly running tour and we learned SO MUCH about the statutes in plaza vs the statues on the adjacent building and the opposing sculptures views (google it, it's a funny story!). Bernini was a character for sure!
This fountain is so beautiful.. We toured this area by walking through the heart of Rome. Greenline tours offered a tour guide who led us by this fountain. It is a beautiful piece of art...
Beautiful. Beautiful architecture, nice atmosphere, after soaking up the history it is perfect for sitting in a cafe and watching the world go by
A Must See and enjoy. One of the most famous places in Rome. Stop there for en drink and enjoy the atmosphere, watch the people wandering around.
Great place to start or end your sightseeing. we always started our sightseeing (walking) here and returned here at the end of the day for an appetizer and cold drink Beautiful fountains by Bernini
Throw in a coin. You'll return to Rome if you'll throw in a coin. Ps. the selfie takers try to hustle you. Be firm, only buy what you asked for.

Nice place to sit and walk. With lots of squares, Rome will make you spend lots of hours just sitting or walking thru them.
Piazza Navona is a must and really good place to have a gelato while doing absolutely nothing, just sitting or walking thru its three fountains along the square. Brazilian's Embassy is located on it and it's an amazing building.

Wide open spaces. We visited during the afternoon. This large open piazza is surrounded by great restaurants, fountains and beautiful buildings. We found it to be a very relaxing, open fun atmosphere and welcome escape from the crowded streets around attractions like the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps.

One of our favorite places in Rome. We love to just sit and people watch at Piazza Navona. Great place to find artists and performers in the evening. Restaurants around the Piazza are expensive so just pick up a gelato and find a place to people watch. Can be very hot during the day as it is open with no shade.
Beauty in the heart of Rome. My favorite of the piazzas, beautiful and active in the evenings. Great artists and patios, reasonable prices. Perfect place to people watch and kick back

Lovely Piazza. We went in early evening which I would recommend. There were street performers adding to the fun. Plenty of restaurants around the Piazza. The centerpiece is Bernini's Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. Sophia Loren supposed to have an apartment overlooking the piazza.
Beautiful. It's beautiful to see all fountains in Rome, this one is one of them. The area around it is pretty too. I recommend a walking tour of the "fontana's"
Beautiful . Big beautiful square. Lots of people, of course, but still can find your spot to admire. The heart of centre storico. To visit in the morning.
Nice place, lots to see. Great place to take a picnic lunch. Eat and drink while checking out the statues on the fountains. Good ice cream shop at one end just up 2 or 3 shops up the road.

Lovely place to while away the time in the evening. Our whole family loved this piazza. It is bustling all day, but in the evening it comes alive with artists hoping to draw your portrait, bustling restaurants and a very nice gelato shop at the northern end!
Restaurants, shops, and Bernini fountains!. The most amazing piazza in all of Rome! Plenty to do for couples, singles and families. The Bernini fountains alone will be worth the trip.

LOVED this place!. Such a lovely place to spend the evening and have dinner. BUT be aware that the best seats in the restaurants (on the edge with the best views) come with a price we were not expecting. Got slapped with a $21 Euro fee for our seats. Good seats - might have paid it anyway - but just know it could be coming ;)The gelato shops in this area are fantastic too!

yep, nice place. very, very impressive piazza with the three amazing fountains. lots of cafes and restaurants, but DONT do it !!! every guide book is advising you to rather stroll the side streets, and find a quaint place there, and save a couple of bucks.

A Perfect Piazza. We stumbled across the Piazza Navona by pure accident. It was on our list of things to see but we hadn’t quite planned to see it so early on into our trip! The piazza is apparently built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian. It was used to host games which were watched by the ancient Romans.In the centre of the piazza there is a very famous fountain known as the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi or Fountain of the Four Rivers. There are two other fountains which are either side of this fountation – there is the Fontana del Moro and the Fountain of Neptune. Both have been added at different times and had sculptures added to them over time by different artists.There is no denying that when you walk into the piazza that it is incredibly grand on a huge scale. The architecture of the buildings really creates a dramatic backdrop. There are bars and restaurants which are around the outside of the piazza so a perfect place to stop and have a bite to eat as the view is amazing. The only thing which was a little annoying although it didn’t ruin the view was the men trying to sell cheap tat but then they are everywhere! It is definitely worth a visit and walk around even if you just stop by and eat your gelato on one of the many benches lining the piazza. It is a worthy place for a pit stop break!
beautiful!. Worth a visit for sure! very beautiful, street artists, lots of places to eat, shopping is great. but lots of crowds too!

Nice square. Nice square with a lot of good places where you can eat. The 3 fountains are really nice but the middle one is purely gorgeous. I won't leak any names, as it's a nice adventure to go there, look at them and do a bit of reading while looking at them in order to understand the significance of each statue.Careful with the restaurants as some are tourist traps. I would highly suggest that you use tripadvisor to see which restaurant will suit you better.
Historical and local. Theis square is so lively: when we visited we could see pantomimes, a buddhist monk, a clown performance, and street artists. Must see to experience the Italian culture.

Piazza based on ancient plan. Really interesting history of the piazza. Large piazza with nice statues and fountains. The usual restaurants / cafes / shops, but not as crowded as some other piazzas - a nice place to watch the world go by....

A must for any visit in Rome. One of the famous Rome piazzas, besides the great views there are nice restaurants and bars around. Explore the area for smaller places in the alleys around Piazza Navona.

Piazza Navona. This is one of the most lively places in Rome. Each evening this wonderful Piazza turns in to an artists Mecca. The street talent, artists shops restaurants, people watching and history is amazing. This is one of the locations of the movie Angel's and Demons. Bar Tre Scaline is a touristy place but has outstanding gelato specifically their Tartufo. The Piazza remains active until apearly morning. Like any late night place anywhere please be aware of what is going on. Safe but very crowded.
Love Rome!!. I love Rome. The Piazza Navona had the market stalls I believe. Lots of artists selling their wares. Amazing architecture and historical statues.
Beautiful plaza. We stumbled upon this pretty plaza while looking for gelato and I just loved that you get to see all of these beautiful places around every corner
The best "Get together" plaza in Rome.. Friendly people, lots of tourists, lot of events, artists, musicians ... The fountains give the square timeless beauty .. Must see place in lifetime

Chariot races!. Built over where the Romans raced chariots, Piazza Navona is a great area to stay and operate out of. Everything you need to see is within a 30 minute walk. My wife is in an ankle brace and handled the walks to the Coliseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps very easily. Tomorrow is Vatican and that's only 29 minutes. Restaurants galore (more than needed) are great. Cheaper on the side streets though. All the food is very good, don't have an anxiety attack over your choice, you can't lose. Chao!

Interesting fun place. Lots going on in this square including buskers, street entertainers, a wedding party having photos taken, lots of restaurants and music. And a magnificent fountain in the centre of it all!

much less touristy . when visiting in the heart of tourist season, we found the piazza navona to be a breath of fresh air. it was calm, beautiful, with great shops & quality restaurants. would definitely recommend to someone who wants the classic Rome experience but needs a break from the hustle bustle. :) go to tre scalini!!

Wonderful area to visit. Three beautiful fountains adorn this fashionable square.On efountain made famous in the Tom hanks movie, Angels and Demons. (where a cardinal was being drowned) Musicians are playing here.from the restaurants and cafes that surround the square, you can enjoy spectacular views of the square , the magnificent church and generally people watch..

A wonderful place to chill out. We went to the Piazza Navona at 11.00 on a Saturday morning. It was a beautiful sunny day, there was a guitarist playing and it was the perfect place to chill out with a glass of Prosecco

Like Every Other Piazza. It is a piazza with a fountain, shops, and vendors. It is very similar to all of the other piazzas in Rome. I was told by family members that I just had to visit this one because it was so beautiful but I did not think it was worthy of the hype. I would say if you happen to wander by it then you should walk through, but would not go out of the way to visit.

The Biggest and The Best. Our hotel was very close to here so we visited or walked through the Piazza at least twice a day, at all times. It was always interesting and always busy.There are 3 fountains in this area which was once a Roman racetrack (hence the oval shape). The fountains are still functioning after millennia and the carvings are immense - still almost completely level.There are lots of restaurants in the afternoon and evening and always lots to see, with street performers, people watching, sales of art and trinkets. A great place to experience Roman life.
Beautiful Plazza to visit. We enjoyed our visit to this plaza and watching all the statues. Good place for a cup of coffee, gelato or some shopping.
great sculptures. great sculptures worth seeing but the atmosphere nor the lighting was as good as the trevi at night.navona was better during the day.
Beautiful place. Passed through Piazza Navona on our way to the Pantheon. This is a wonderful place to sit and take in the streets and people of Rome.
Stunning piazza. This was truly one of the highlights on our private tour of the city. It was exactly as I imagine an Italian piazza would be, with a fountain and charming shops and cafes.

Great historic ancient plaza with loads of food outlets . What more could you ask for... Ancient obelisk, amazing fountain, wonderful historic buildings and a great choice of food outlets. Pick pocket hotspot... Beware! Fatso nearly had to punch someone who tried to steal his wallet!
Classic Roman plaza, don't miss.. Third time we've visited here over the years, can't come to Rome without visiting. Beautiful ambiance and fountains, lots of restaurants and best gelato in the city.
Piazza Navona. Great place to sit back and enjoy the people. Lovely fountain, just what you would expect. To my surprise there was another fountain here as well.

Vibrant and fun. Passed through this Piazza on the way to the Pantheon and then Trevi Fountain. It was drizzling but still busy with music and restaurants and people selling things there. Beautiful and you have the fountain of four rivers there (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi) and other landmarks. Nice place to just sit and relax/stroll around looking at the artwork people are selling etc. very enjoyable place.
Nice Square to visit when in Rome. Large beautiful square with shops and restaurants . It has three fountains and lots of artists painting in the square. Stop for lunch and people watch for a while .
Beautiful piazza1. Nice piazza, where you can just sit and watch the world go by or have dinner in one of the restaurants there, all having nice terraces.

Fab Family Caricature . Lovely place to pass the time & watch people go by. Prices of the restaurants include a premium for the location which is not surprising. Talented artists on a Sunday - got a family caricature today which was a laugh.
Always fun. Love this Piazza, the three fountains are great, the artists that line the piazza are very talented and the yummy gelato makes it a must do when in Rome.

If only. A place with amazing history and wonderful fountains and architecture. But crowded out with people who like loud music from the wrong century and the wrong continents, and Italians who have to provide a service (with a smile) to them.
Please, gentle reader, when in Rome, do as the Romans do.

Clean, nice, good for taking photos!. This baroqur piazza is definitely worth a visit when in Rome. Also, if you walk on Via dei Canestrari which is near, you can find lovely locals, restaurants, shops etc.

I'm in love with this place!. Ahhh, Piazza Navona! I am in love with this place. Beautiful both by day and night. It's a great place to chill and people watch. Lots of people, artists and cafes to keep you entertained. It's an overall beautiful place.
Do as the Romans do. This is a beautiful spot to spend your morning or afternoon. The piazza is lovely and is filled with good cafes and local art.

Nice open space. Nice place to relax and watch people, like tourists taking photos, artists painting, locals eating in the restaurants etc. The alleys to and away from this piazza throw up some wonderful food surprises!

Stumbled on this Gem. Accidentally stumbled on this amazing piazza with restaurants, outdoor artists, street performers, gelaterias and historic buildings. It's a must see in Rome for great people watching and street artists. But one warning. Don't assume the paintings are originals. We did (because they were signed by the seller) but then saw very similar ones signed by others just blocks away. Perhaps this is a warning throughout Rome but we didn't know. The paintings were beautiful and well priced, but likely not originals.

It's Just Like in the Movies! . I was excited to visit Piazza Navona as I've seen it in quite a few movies and visiting filming locations is my thing...It's everything you'd expect it to be; touristy, overpriced, full of street artists, gift shops, fountains and restaurants - and it's great!It's quite shady at certain times of day, which can lead to some dramatic pictures as the sun catches just certain points - just watch out for shadows from the now ubiquitous selfie-sticks!!!We returned a second time on our short trip to Rome; there is a familiarity to Piazza Navona like you'd expect from a visit to Leicester Square, there's plenty more to see in all of Rome, but for the sake of movie buffs, put this on your list!

Order an amaro and linger for a while!. Since my first visit to Rome, this has been my absolute favorite piazza/neighborhood in Rome, and on my recent third visit, it brought back happy memories. Though the crowds are a lot larger, the place a lot more touristy, and the menu prices a lot higher in the restaurants in the area, this is still worth going to, to see the exceptional square and Bernini's sculptures. Order an amaro, linger for a while!

More to see less crowds. This wonderful square with its 3 huge water features is a breath of fresh air after the hustle and bustle of the Trevi. You can sit in one of the many resteraunts or bars around and soak up the exquisite sites and sniff in the Italian atmosphere

Fountains, artists and restaurants. One of the most beautiful piazzas in Rome. Known for its ornate fountains.There are a load of restaurants surrounding the piazza but we didn't enter any of them.This also is the spot where a lot of artists hang out selling their work.We passed through this place while walking to the Vatican.
Bellinin's Marvel.. A fascinating story sculptured by Bellinl. We would not have known had we not had an amazing tour with Nick from Romesultimate tours.

Beautiful sights. Piazza Navona - only had the chance to walk around the fountains and obelisk. There is so much to see in Rome, getting a local guide to walk you around is money well spent. They can provide info guide books would never be able to completely cover.
Nice to stroll through in the afternoon. Buzzy spot with lots of people watching to do. Great to walk through after dinner in this area while eating Gelato
So pretty. Stayed near here in Rome. Plaza is beautiful and full of life at night. Great to eat at one of the restaurants and just enjoy the art and the people.

Beautiful place. . We passed through Piazza Navona on our way to other sites quite a few times, but it is well worth seeing in its own right. The fountains are beautiful & so are the surrounding buildings. Our young children enjoyed having their caricature drawn by one of the many street artists there and they also enjoyed getting a friendship bracelet with their name on made in front of them for a couple of €. A definite must on a trip to Rome.
Worth the visit. Lots of tourists, but it's a beautiful piazza, with nice ice cream in stupidly expensive cafe. Be a tourist, and enjoy.

Beautiful Place but very expensive. The Piazza Navaro is without question beautiful. The whole square is very vibrant throughout the day and both sides have restraunts to get something to eat. The only downside is that it is hugely expensive, 2 main meals 2 drinks a coffee and a dessert was the best part of 100 euros and fir a lunch your looking at 50-60 euros.
Lovely Piazza. Very lovely piazza, with many statues and fountains, did not feel over crowded either like everywhere else in early July in Rome. Great people watching and hanging out.
it's a must when in Rome. the Piazza Navona is a must see and feel the atmosphere. if it's for rest or for selfie, for romance or for the scenery, Piazza Navona has it all.

nice place. but be aware!keep close eye on your pockets and belongings. Otherwise nice plazza with a lot of street artists to watch or listen.i would enjoy this place much more, only if there was less street merchants trying to sell you various stuff. at some point it was really annoying.

Fantastic fountain. Crowded as you'd expect but never felt threatening or overwhelming - visitors took their turn to get to the waters edge and have photo's taken. Definitely worth a visit and very beautiful
Beautiful !. A must see sight while in Rome. Read the history and the meaning of the fountain before your come. Beautiful sight to see.
Great piazza for ppl watch. Great place for an afternoon drink and watch people. Cafes around are overpriced but you pay for the atmosphere. Lively

Disappointed that the fountains were NOT lit up at night. We visited in the evening after dinner, and were disappointed that the fountains were NOT lit up. We had heard how pretty they are lit up, so not sure what was going on. This was in prime tourist season in July, so not sure what was going on with the Italians. Visiting in the evening is still great, as it was cool and very comfortable out.
More beautiful fountains. Lovely place to have lunch. I know that it has been said that it was expensive to eat there but we found the food reasonable.

Great hang out. We loved hanging out in this piazza. So much action and so many people enjoying themselves in Rome. The street performers are fun-fire dancing man, the Kenyan pseudo cirque du solie guys and the Italian street dance crew all had my boys' attention.
Not to many tourist.. It is a big place and it is not to many people like around fountain di Trevi. Easier catch photo and saw all details.
Romantic and vibrant. We went to the square in the evening. The buildings are beautiful and so are the monuments. It is a vibrant environment with many restaurants as well as tourists. Recommend it.

Beautiful Square with an amazing church that you can visit.. Stroll the square, go into the church (amazing). A definite visit when in Rome! Also grab an expresso or gelato and enjoy the beautiful fountain.

Afternoon stroll. Immerse yourself in some history and imagine you are Ben Hur careering around this ancient stadium of Domitian.
Nice way to spend an hour and then relax in one of the (tourist trap) restaurants around its perimeter.

A great place to spend your evenings. There are very beautiful statues and fountains in the centre of the piazza which help to create a really enjoyable ambience. It is always full of market stands, street artists etc and there is a wide range of restaurants and shops surrounding it. The food can be quite expensive so it is worth having a walk around to look at the prices first.

My favourite Piazza in Rome. We went here twice on our trip. It is near the Trevi fountain and the Pantheon. I love it here because there are a lot of people and it's so alive. This is how I picture Italy to be, with people walking around, people sitting at restaurants, it was such a great feel I just loved it. A must see if you are in Rome.

Beautiful. Beautiful Piazza in the middle of no where. We had friends staying close by here and were surprised at how beautiful it actually was. Very close to the Pantheon as well. We ate lunch right in the square and were surprised that if you just walked a few feet around there were much cheaper restaurants right around the corner. I would have saved quite a bit on lunch. As a pizza at one of the restaurants over looking the water fountains were about 7Euros, and around the corner they were about 3-4Euros. We were a group of 9 for lunch. Other than that it was beautiful.
Beautiful & very relaxing. Beautiful square with lots of do and see. Plenty of places to eat and drink around with lots of street vendors to browse around.

A lovely gem. Stumbled on the Piazza Navona during a stroll through Rome. So many lovely restaurants to chose from and so much activity going on around you. Cobbled streets and vibrant shops are a main attraction.

Lively and Arty . Fun tourist and local cafe spot. Always a lit going on with street performers, artists and enthusiastic cafe staff. Fun place to people watch and a lovely classic spot for tourists to take pictures of one of tones most favours areas. While it is flanked by cafes and restaurants expect to pay slightly more for the premium location.

Ok, but beware of the overpriced restaurants.. Nice place to people watch, like every piazza in Rome, there are fountains, nice ones here.
Please beware of unscrupulous restaurants on the side streets. Check your menu and ask for price list before you order.
Pit stop with a view. Nice piazza with a fountain, restaurants and shops/ town square. Lovely pit stop place for lunch as its close to other sites to see and markets.
Not like in the movie. a beautiful fountain and sculptures - just not like the image you had in your head after seeing the "Roman Holiday" movie.
Relaxing. Piazza Navona was something else. There were so many things to see. There was spray painting, acrobatic shows, singing and aerobic shows for all ages. You just won't get bored there.
Love the Vibe. There were people playing music, everyone enjoying the calmness outside and near the fountain. Its an awesome place. And Pantheon is close walk from here.
A must visit square.. You have to visit both by day and night...There is so much going on. The restaurants around are a little pricey, but well worth a visit.

Fun in the Roman Sun!. We walked from pur downtown VRBO apartment through the Plaza multiple times. It was fun people watching, artists painting, kids running and parents relaxing! Toured through some of the shops, didn't buy too much--had to carry it back 'home.' Fountain is pretty and the plaza is always bustling with activity.

Great Place to People Watch!. The Piazza Navona was one of our first tastes of Rome as we met for our first tour here. We arrived early, found our first pizza taglio a few blocks off the square, and strolled around the fountains, listened to musicians and rested. Lots of entertainment! It was formerly a forum and you can tell by its' shape if you know this. Very cool!

Lively, and beautiful square with expensive dining, artists, music and more. When in Rome you must come to the Piazza Navona, if only to people watch. Tourists and locals alike come to see the beautiful fountain, to listen to street musicians, to marvel at the architecture, and to eat tartuffo (an ice cream concoction rolled in cocoa powder to look like a truffle) at Tre Scalini--where it was invented. There are a few benches scattered around, and from there you can spy the beautiful terraced apartments that surround this piazza. There seems to be a constant hustle and bustle, and if you listen closely, you can hear a number of languages being spoken. The musicians take advantage of the romantic setting, and provide a wonderful atmosphere. This is life at its best.
favourite piazza. Fabulous to people watch a soak up the atmosphere. Very relaxing, great ambience and much quieter than other squares.
Great Piazza. Worth going to - just to see the fountains! Quite busy, but nice to sit at a cafe for lunch. All the restaurants near tourist attractions charge service charge and still ask for tips!
Good place to eat !. Next to the piazza is via di Santa Maria dell'Anima where you will find many good restaurants. The prices are lower than on piazza.

Love the Vibe. This is a must-see. Be it night or day, Piazza Navona offers hours of free entertainment. From fire jugglers to acrobats this magnificent square provides an opportunity to simply sit and watch.
The surrounding restaurants, gelato bars and palatial buildings add to the ambience.

One of a Kind. Let's face it, Trevi Fountain is a mainstay when visiting Rome. The beautiful area around it is wonderful to explore as well. Yes, I had to make a wish and toss a coin over my shoulder and into the fountain.
3 fountains, nice square. Good spot for an evening stroll and a gelato. Not quite so busy with tourists, less congested than Trevi Fountain. Nearby restaurants if hungry.

Good people watching. Fun piazza to grab a gelato and do some people watching. The restaurants in the immediate vicinity are touristy and not great - go 1-2 blocks off the beaten path for excellent food!

Great atmosphere with varied stalls at night. We visited in mid July one evening. The fountain is a standout. The piazza is far quieter than the area around the Trevi Fountain and only a 10 minute walk to the Pantheon. There are lots of restaurants to choose from, but we found that you were paying higher prices for the location and diners seemed to be rushed to ensure a high turn around. At night lots of little arty stalls appear and busker style entertainers all add to the attraction. We have also attended Christmas markets in the piazza in December.

Lovely. What can one say about this place that you will not find online? Not much I suspect but here is our take1] Well worth two visits - daytime and when the sun is down. Fairly different places.2] Enormous piazza size-wise. Several statutes along it. Each with its own little story3] Grab a cup of excellent Italian coffee. Maybe ice coffee during your day visit and a great cup of cappuccino at night4] Relax! Listen to all those musicians playing for coins in different locationsEnjoy! We sure did

Nice to walk around. This area is always bustle with people but it is good for people watching and just to take a stroll around the area. My husband and I sat by the fountain and had some drinks and just enjoyed the view!

Possibly the nicest Piazza in the world!. Piazza Navona is simply stunning in the summer as the sun is shining. Its a must visit during any trip no matter the duration. There are fables it was once used my military tacticians and it was filled with water to play naval strategy games, but who knows, anything is possible in the Eternal city. Anyway having three Bernini fountains and a beautiful surrounding is more than enough to tempt you to visit. Especially after the Angels and Demons scene in the middle fountain. Has recently been cleaned.One word of note is that prior to sitting down and ordering anything from a coffee to a meal, think twice, as this is high end pricing. Be aware! However every now and again it is worth it and I have done it knowingly on the basis that I love to sit there and watch the great world of Rome go by. But only being conscience at what I would pay.Artists heaven here. Lots of Artisans and artists sitting out and trying to sell their beautiful paintings. It is like a beautiful open air art gallery. Also if you want some fun and a caricature, then this is the place to be. Just haggle!!And of course it is really near the Trevi fountain and Via della Pace (brilliant bars and some nice places to eat). One of choice is Bar del Fico and Ristorante del Fico. Or go further and visit Da Francesco or for me better again Il Corallo - great people and even better food. Try the Gorgonzola pasta!!! On the street Via del corallo.Also as a last note, the Brazilian Embassy is there! Lucky Brazialians. The main church here is Saint Agnes in Agony (go inside its breathtaking and ask to see her skull, it will make you weep). Worth it!

Nice place to people watch..... Lovely area to sit down and have a drink, plenty of bars and restaurants that surround the square where musicians and artists perform..
You can even try the speciality il tartufo... Which is very nice.....

Fun place to people watch!. This is one of the best places in Rome to sit back, relax, and watch the people! It is popular for a good reason. The only thing is -- the food here is more expensive than you may find elsewhere. But the wait staff never seems to mind if you sit and enjoy another glass of wine (or two)! This is a fun place for lunch and though I have never been for dinner, I understand it is wonderful in the evenings as well.

A really nice piazza. Another must for Angels & Demons fans. The fountain of the four rivers is the central feature of the square and is quite stunning. The piazza itself is home to many an art dealer and you need to haggle at their prices. We spent a good hour perusing and enjoying the atmosphere before finding a gelato bar on the North corner and sitting on beautiful day admiring the surrounding architecture. It is fairly central so you can add this on a walk to or from the river if it is a nice day.

Beautiful. Most mornings of our city break to Rome we would toddle along from our hotel near the Pantheon to Piazza Navona for a coffee or two and to simply sit and marvel at its beauty and to watch the world go bySuch beauty to behold in the magnificence of the architecture, the fountain and the settingLots of nice restaurants to choose fromOne of them does a full English breakfast for those who can't do without!

nice place for people watching. we were staying close to Piazza Navona and would walk across several times during the day and in the evening to just take a walk and people watch. There are painters, artists, musicians and several high priced touristy restaurants and bars on both sides for you to take soak in the atmosphere while enjoying a drink.

Beautiful place, lots going on. I used to work around the corner from here in a small bar called Abbey theatre. Before work I used to sit in Piazza Navona and relax before the hectic night.The piazza is surrounded by great restaurants offering some amazing food. The fountains in the middle and beautiful and there are often musicians or street performers throughout the day and into the night. Great place to go out for lunch/dinner and relax with a glass of wine. Authentic Italian experience.

Spectacular. A wonderful place to wander round during the day and at night. There is a lot going on with restaurants very busy, artists and street sellers. The central fountain is a joy to behold, I could look at it for ages. Also the smaller one at one end. Don't forget to look up at the architecture and sit and take it all in.

Lovely piazza!. We had a nice time there. Lots to see with local artists displaying their paintings in the piazza. We sat and enjoyed lunch there and had gelato too. We mainly came to see the Fountain of the Four Rivers because of seeing the movie 'Angels and Demons'. We were pleasantly surprised to see all the other sites too. The only downer was the incessant "salesmen" pushing cheap selfie sticks who wouldn't go away. Hard to sit and have a romantic moment with them constantly coming around waving merchandise in your face.
Lively and beautiful square. We were briefly here but wished to stay longer. Buskers, magic, music, restaurants and beautiful fountains all to the backdrop of colourful roman architechture.
Popular piazza in heart of Rome. Sprawling piazza with restaurants, historic church, fountain, you name it. A fun and colorful scene at night.
Nice for a stroll. Nice place to go for a stroll, lots of cafes, shops, gelato, and artist. Highly recommended for a relaxing time while visiting Rome

Beautiful Setting. Took pictures and walked around visiting the artists on the square and the wonderful restaurants lining the plaza. Great Gelato at the entrance to the Plaza - Nutella Pistachio mix is awesome.
Lovely square!. This is one of our favourite squares in Rome - don't miss it - it is truly beautiful and worth a visit!

Beautiful Fountains. There are 3 beautiful fountains in the piazza, but the center one is the most beautiful one. The 4 River Fountain of Bernini is a piece of art, with representations of 4 rivers for America, Asia, Europe and Africa... also, it's the water fountain portrait in Angels & Daemons book and movie.
Great place. You need to see it. I love it very much, beautiful place, full with tourists. One of the places you have to see in Italy. :))
Piazza Navona. This is a bustling and large Piazza full of tourists, cafes, bars, restaurants and entertainers, certainly worth a look, but better there are places to visit.

A must see!!!. A beautiful piazza in Rome. The enormous square is lined with charming cafes and restaurants. We could have sat for hours eating pizza or pasta and drinking wine while watching the people stroll by. There are entertainers from time to time -- dancers, singers, fire twirlers. Artists fill the square with their work. Am amazing way to spend a beautiful Italian evening!

Beautiful piazza to sit down and drink something, beware of the high prices. Very touristic area, but great to stroll through and have a look at the massive fountains in the square. At night you can find street artists and smaller streets with great restaurants!

Bella Quattro Fiumi. As stated by so many, the 4 rivers of Piazza Navona is a lesson in history and a beautiful display of Bernni's sculptures at its best. The Plaza is surrounded by many Ristorante's which is a wonderful way to spend your evening

Great place to visit and have dinner. Piazza Navone is one of the most famous and arguably the most beautiful of Rome's many squares. The large and lively square The main attraction of the Piazza Navona are the three fountains. The central and largest fountain is the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (fountain of the four rivers). It was constructed between 1647 and 1651 on request of the Pope Innocent X. The Fontana del Nettuno, also known as the Calderari, was built in 1576 by Giacomo della Porta. Giacomo della Porta also built the Fontana del Moro. The central statue of a Moor holding a dolphin, a design by Bernini, was added in the 17th century. The tritons are 19th century additions.I recommend to visit the site in the late afternoon and stay there for an outdoor diner in one of the many restaurants around.

Excellent place to sit and people watch. We went there in the evening and the place was full street performers, art sellers, and just other tourists wandering by. had coffee to go from one of the shops and sat at one of the benches to enjoy the surroundings, kids enjoyed playing in the area with one of the toys that are sold in the street (don't have a name for it but its that thing with blue light that you throw in the sky and it spins down)

Probably Rome's nicest square. Love this square, with the beautiful fountains, especially the fontana dei quattro fiuri (fountain of the four rivers; more on this in a minute!), the street sellers, cafes, buildings, especially the Chiesa di S. Agnese in Agone just behind the 4 rivers fountain. The Square features in many movies, so was great to finally experience it first hand. The cafes are on the expensive side compared to others in Rome, but then again when in Rome and all that it’s great to just sit there with a coffee or beer and people watch. A couple of things to note. First the true history behind the Square is clearly visible if you visit the underground exhibition and excavations that are at the more rounded end of the Square. The Piazza was built on the site of the Stadium of Dominion, built in 1st century AD and exactly matches the open space of that stadium. Ancient Romans went there to watch the games or “agones”. It is believed that over time the name changed to in avone, to navone to navona. Second, this is a must see for fans of Dan Brown’s Angels & Demons, which is centred around the four primal elements Earth, Air, Fire and Water and the murders of 4 cardinals, the preferred candidates to become the next pope, the ‘preferiti’.
