Here the 4th cardinal (Spoiler alert! ) is dumped into the Fontana dei Quattro Fiuri bound to weights in order to drown him (WATER). The cardinal is saved and goes on to become pope in the story. Of course, other than this being pure fiction the fountain is not as deep as depicted in the movie! The fountain, which was designed by Bernini for Pope Innocent X, is a basin from which travertine rocks rise supporting four river gods, with an Egyptian obelisk rising above them. The four river gods represent the four major rivers of the four continents through which papal authority had spread at that time: the Danube representing Europe, the Nile Africa, the Ganges Asia and the Rio de la Plata the Americas
Beautiful place. Nothing spectacular about it, but its a very nice place to chill at for 30-45 mins. Great stuff around it - shops, attractions...
Very lovely square - lots of gelato!. Really nice area - bustling and lively with some great restaurants especially in the evening. Beautiful buildings around a fountain and some nice small shops.
Beautiful place to spend the evening. It was a great place to have an evening meal with drinks on the piazza and theres lots of things going on such as live music and performers.

Amazing collection of statues and fountains. I love this piazza. In addition to the great vibe of the place, the statues and fountains are just outstanding. You can really take your time admiring Bernini's work. There are several good restaurants and cafes to sit and soak in the ambiance, or just sit on a bench and people watch. A great (free) way to see some fantastic works of Roman art and history.
Pass through. Great place to people watch have a nice cream by the Fountains probably need an hour to do this place justice unless you plan to eat
A beautiful piazza but no more. A nice place to be but the touristic aspect of the piazza ruins the beauty of it. It is a must see but not a must stay
Beautiful Plaza. Great place to relax, take a nice stroll and have some gelatto. Loved the wonderful fountain and the open spaces. There is also a nice church you can visit free of charge.
Lovely area to sit to people watch. This was just around the corner from our hotel and we stopped on many occasion on the way back to the hotel for a geleto.
Nice area. nice place to sit and enjoy the atmosphere, relax and watch the world go by. fountains are beautiful and plenty going on.
Sit and Relax!. One of the many great piazzas in Rome Piazza Navona is a great place to sit and relax, take photos, or have some lunch. The fountain is another Rome em to look at.
A must see. Wow, just wow. Didn't even know about this square and found it by chance and am so glad we did, it is the most beautiful in Rome.
An easy walk. Had a lovely lunch in the piazza watching the people walking by, Just enjoyable being there and soaking up the beauty of the piazza
A must see in Rome. Never tired of visiting this square with its million tourists and photograph-perfect monuments. Make sure you have a gelato as you wonder across the square.

Great to visit day or night. This is a favorite hang out for our group in the evenings. The fountains, eateries, gelato, people watching and occasional performers always make for a pleasant experience.

Romantic and lively!. Great square with lots of cafes and restaurants to sit and take in the beauty of this place! The fountain itself is so much bigger in real life than I had imagined! Simply stunning! Definitely something that should be seen in person when you are in Rome.
Piazza Navona. We were tracing the route from the movie Angels and Demons. IT was a great way to see the sights of Rome. Added a little adventure to the trip.

Must visit and gave. Drink. A wonderful place to people watch in Rome.
You will find on trip advisor that many of the restaurants are rated 3 and below though. Still worth going for views, the artists and a drink. Day or night it's worth it.
Totes in the romance side
Evening walk. Strolled through piazza so much going on here didn't know what to look at first. Street artists, musicians, and comedy artists. We sat with a gelato and watched the world go by
Love the Square.. Like so many squares in Europe, Piazza Navona was beautiful with the fountain, artists, performers and the locals enjoying the day. Beautiful daytime and at night lit up.
trip to Rome. wonderful fountain and place to see.full of tourists.....:) best time to explore it is at night...the fountain is lighted....
Piazza. This is my favorite piazza in Rome. Lots of open space around a fancy fountain in the center. There are many great restaurants off the piazza too.
Excellent Surroundings. Neighborhoods and surroundings are beautiful. Fountains and series of restaurants to eat. Must visit!
One of the oldest intact buildings in Rome.. We weren't sure what to expect however we were pleasantly surprised . One of the only buildings where every thing is intact.
Most Beautiful Fountain ever.. This fountain has history and romance mixed up to give you one of the most beautiful fountains in the world. Toss a coin in over your shoulder and make a wish.
Oh you must!. love it! love, love! it is truly romantic, you have to come and visit, I love this place, and the people the food and the passion.
A nice vibrant square with lots to see and to enjoy. People watching and picture taking in this Piazza is a must... a nice vibe with lots of street entertainers to enjoy while in rome.

Fabulous . The piazza navona is a fantastic tourist attraction. It has a lot of history and is definitely beautiful to behold. I was awestruck. It's beautiful to behold. Ride the lift to the top and see Rome in all its beauty. I loved it, a lot.

A fun place to spend the evening. The Piazza comes alive in the early evening with entertainment. Many restaurants are inside the piazza, we found an excellent one, just off one end, slightly down an alley. The fountain in the middle is interesting too.
Loved it here.. After going to The Vatican in 35 degrees it was great to sit and people watch here. There was always something going on whilst we had beer and pizza.
Work of art. Another breath taking fountain in the amazing city of Roma. Located in a nice square with plenty of artist who sell good art work.

A very charming square in Rome !. We've visited this fascinating Piazza after viewing the Pantheon. It has come as sort of relaxation, seating in one of the numerous cafes in the Square and observing the wondrous fountains lined along the Piazza.The Piazza Navona was built in 1st century AD and was intended in the beginning of its existence to serve as the open stadium or space for different games, that is, the "agones", which had been watched by ancient Romans. Over the times the name of the "agones" changed to in avone and finally in navone.We were in front of the most known fountain, i.e. the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi( Fountain of the Four Rivers). It is consisted of the base basin with the rocks that emerge from the water and support the four river gods and above them all this mighty sculptural creation is surmounted by the Egyptian obelisk. The river gods represent the major world rivers, that are, in Europe the Danube, in Africa the Nile, then in Asia the Ganges and in Americas the Rio de la Plata.Since it was very warm that day as in the rest of our sojourn in Rome as well, we have been rather lucky to have the pulverized water tiny droplets above our heads while we were sitting and drinking our cold beverage. The two other remarkable fountains in the Piazza are the Fontana del Moro again with basin and four Tritons and afterwards added the statue of the Moor or African wrestling with a dolphin and second one is the Fountain of Neptune. Always crowded and with many places to eat, drink and shop, naturally highly artistic sight, that Piazza is absolutely not to be omitted when in Rome.One of my favourite Piazzas in the eternal city.
Beautiful piazza. I always come here on my trips to rome, i love just to sit here watch people , listen to the music and admire the fountain of the four rivers.

Ahh... This is where you will find the Roman life you saw in a thousand pictures.... Dinner in one of the restaurants of the Piazza Navona allows for the type of Italian experience for which these grand plazas are tailor-made. From the fountains to the artists to the horse-carriages to all the activity and the superb flavors you are likely to feel like you have always been a Roman and that this city has always lived somewhere deep in your heart only to be awakened in this very lively piazza. If you were ever disappointed by the lack of food choices or activity in Venice's grand Piazza di San Marco, this is the perfect antidote.

At Night There is Little More Fun. The amazing architecture is what first hits the senses, the sight of the statues and fountains, and the depth of detail in the work. Although the surrounding restaurants can be aggressive toward customers, the street performers are great and the artists selling their goods and sketching charcoal drawings make it feel like a carnival. I grabbed a sandwich and a large beer---yes, you can drink outside here---and had the best time watching the people, the entertainment (acrobats, fire-eaters, musicians) and the artisans plying their trades. Try this place out after the Pantheon but it is best to se when illuminated!!

Easily one of my favorite places in the world. This is among one of the places in the world where I could sit and just look at the fountains, buildings and surroundings as people & just watch the world go by. Brilliant place to take photos in your are a photography enthusiast. Different angles and a long exposure or two will make for some terrific photos!
Lovely Piazza. Last minute decision to find this place but well worth the visit.Lovely Square and fountains. Nice bars and restaurants in the sqaure

The Happening Place in Rome. Piazza Navona is a beautiful plaza and fountain surrounded by outdoor eateries. It is very photogenic. It is popular with locals and tourists. If you like energy and relaxation and beauty and art. This is a must see.

Historical place. The most attracting in this place were the fountains. Here you will find 3 fountains in this square each one is a perfect piece of art by it self : 4 rivers , Del Moro and Del Nettuno Fountains. We spent hours just watching.Great artistic work. You must visit and see.

Romantic Piazza Buzzing with Energy. One of our favorite spots in Rome. Had such great energy and charm. We returned time after time. I recommend getting a beer or gelato and sitting there at night. It is beautiful when the fountain is lit up.

The place to buy local art.. We went to the Piazza Navona specifically to look at the work of the local artists who trade their artwork in the square, and we were not disappointed. I ended up chatting to a chap who had been painting for 40 years & buying a nice monochrome of the Colloseum from him. Food is a little more expensive in the Piazza as you would expect and once you acknowledge it is a tourist trap with prices to match, little gems can still be found if you look hard & negotiate.
Not much to see. For me Piazza Navona is not that special. The lighting at night is average. Not much to see except the small fountain and a statue but surround it you can find many good restaurant.

Not Like The Movies!. If you have ever seen Fontana Trevi in the movies, you will surprised to find that this fountain is in a small corner that only has about 20 feet of space around it in each direction. It was just a bunch of people standing around looking at the fountain—which did have very clear water filled with lots of coins.

Very beautiful! . A lovely Piazza with some beautiful features. The fountain in the centre is stunning. Along with some markets stalls/artists in the evenings selling their works. Definitely worth a walk around!

Shopping, Sightseeing & Food Galore. We stopped here to see the fountain, shop, and eat lunch. Then, we walked to the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain and to shop some more. We visited during February and there was Carnivale Events happening all over the Piazza throughout the day. That was a bonus surprise.

Beautiful but a tourist place. it is one of those things you want to see since it is a beautiful piece of Florence. Yes it is crowded with tourists , but go see it. You traveled all the way to Italy might as well see the sights.
Best piazza in town. Piazza navona is my favourite.. Its picturesque.. The scallini cafe is beautiful waiters are friends and deserts are delicious..

Fountains of Youth. Piazza Navona is an awesome place for a stroll, a cocktail or just people watching. In the evening the Piazza is alive with artists, both painting and selling their art, families enjoying the beauty of the surroundings, locals and tourists alike. It's well worth a visit!

Beautiful Place. This was my favourite place in Rome, it is stunning! Theres a buzz around the place and its great to eat in a restaurant, have a drink and watch the world go by. There are lots of artists out in the evening and ts lovely to walk around and see all the performers.

Peaceful and beautiful piazza. A definite must to visit in Rome. Get a fresh ice cream from one of the many shops close and stroll though the square looking at the 3 wonderful fountains and sculptures.

A thing to do. While I would always say go see Navona for the Bernini fountains and the churchIt is not my favourite place in Rome. It is very pricey and showy and a centre of tourism. When there take time to wander the side streets and just turn corners as your will take you and you will find good place to eat, have a drink and people watch. A must see yes, a use stay, not for me

A great place to eat and watch people. We timed our visit here to sit and have a nice lunch. So pretty. No cars. It's a large open space with 3 fountains and plenty of restaurants. It is very near to many well known attractions such as Pantheon and Trevi fountain so ideal as part of a walking tour.

Angels and Demon fan- you got it !!!. Lots of things to do. A piazza with lots of entertainment, restaurants and shops. The Church of St. Agnes is beautiful and Sunday mass is so solemn with their own choir. Perfect for Sunday afternoon walk, lunch and discover bits and pieces of Rome.
Great place to visit. We spent an evening here, had dinner in one of the many restaurants available, very entertaining, real buzz about the place, lots to see,

Beautiful, despite the hustle and bustle. A great open space to sip coffee and people watch. Of course, the magnificent fountain by Bernini is a feast for the eyes. At one end of the piazza is the Museo di Roma, at the opposite (a block away) is the Museo Altemps, and in the middle is the Church of St. Agnes. Lots to do. Lots to see.

Magical place for a stroll. We walked through the Piazza Navona after finishing a wonderful meal at nearby restaurant (Pierluigi). The ambiance was relaxed and inviting even though there were plenty of tourists around in the evening. The architecture was attractive, but the fountain demarking for great rivers was simply stunning.

Beautiful fountain and shopping area. Wish I had more time.. We were with a tour group, but if I had the time I would have spent more of it in this location. It is gorgeous architecture with lots of shops and dining activity. We basically "walked through" on our way to our next stop (Vatican), but I would have liked to see more.
Really nice. Really nice place to visit if your around the area in Rome. Nice fountains and lots of street painting and music going on.

Beautiful Roman square full of artisans and eateries. We visited this square on the way to the Pantheon and found it a great little stop off. There are artists plying their trade all around and the fountains are spectacular to look at. It was a whistlestop visit for us and I wish we'd had a little more time to fully explore the square. Well worth a visit though.

Nice Piazza with Great Fountains. This is just a Piazza you walk around and see/take pictures of the cool fountains, but is very beautiful. There was lots of people there but it was not overcrowded like the Trevi Fountain. Plan to spend less than an hour.

Tourist trap.... Local businesses are pushy over priced and ride the views and atmosphere are nice to see and interesting but I wouldn't spend and abundance of time there. It's said to be a good night spot but we did not experience this

Piazza Navona. Piazza Navona is a great place to visit the historical features, enjoy a warm evening passegiata or just some people watching. We went there many times during our visit over a week and we got something new out of it every time.
beautiful !!!. worth visit the place it is always available to the public and you can have a romantic walk. it's a must see while you are in Rome

A few Artists, Restaurants around a Square and a Nice Sculpture.. Large Square with a few "tourist " type artists. One Greek artist who We spent time with looking at his Modern protest art. He Made the square a worthwhile stop. Purchased a print. Otherwise you have to get lucky for some "entertainment" to happen. Not as "happening" as Piazza di Campo di Fiori..

A magical place. Dinner with a view of a Bernini fountain, in a Piazza where chariots once raced. Street vendors and performers, a choice of a dozen restaurants.
There is no better place on earth

Really Big Piazza with shops, cafes, street performer.. Really Big Piazza with shops, cafes, street performer. There were musicians playing tango music the day I went. Because it is really big, you don't feel crowded like at other sites. There is a nice church in the piazza with some really amazing sculptures.
Beautiful square. It is a very beautiful location. There is always some action happening there. It is nice to go there at night. The surrounding buildings are just stunning!

A must visit. Whilst there are a whack of commercial shops there are some great ones on perimeter
The restaurant were all abuzz
The statues in the fountains spectacular and the buildings typical classic Roman
A great evening walk

Amazing. A place that exhibit extraordinary architecture, with spaces admired paintings fountains and little artists with diverse activities of people willing to convey emotions tourists. A great place!

The square of fountains. This is a huge oval square where you can find three beautiful fountains and great buildings with real mediterranean Italian style. It is a very cheerful place with the people around you and in the restaurants. It is a must see in Rome.
Neat puszza. Enjoyed strolling around piazza Navona after visiting Vatican. Nice fountains to stop at. There are cafes surrounding the piazza.
beautiful. worth a visit- but no need to spend long here. we passed through on a walk around the city- looked at the amazing fountain, read the guidebook and walked on

Gelato and People. This is a fantastic place to sit at one of the restaurants on the square, have some pasta and wine and watch the people and activity. One one occasion, an older street musician started singing O Sole Mio. I thought his voice was quite good. Then a real opera singer started singing from one of the seats at an adjacent cafe. The street musician, understandably, quietened down. Amazing!

A place with a lot of people and high energy. During day time, this place is packed with people and vendors. Since it was less than 10 min. walk from our hotel we went there early in one morning. We have the entire place to ourselves and a few others. So, try to go there in the early morning before all the other tourists show up.
Must See. Loved this square. We sat for about an hour just enjoying and taking it all in. We had a guide who explained the details of the fountain. We really enjoyed it.
Nice Piazza..... Large Piazza with fountains, street artists and plenty of restaurants to sit and watch the world go by.
Too crowded. It is still a great spot to visit but its just too crowded. Too many tourists (especially from China while comparing with my last visit).
lovely piazza. We stopped at this piazza and had a lovely lunch watching people and happenings in the piazza ... lovely atmosphere

Rome in a nutshell. You truly get the romanticism of Rome when in this square. Whether is is simply enjoying a drink at one of the many cafes while you people watch, snapping a few photos of the fountain and square itself, or watching the street performers this square epitomizes what rome is about. Stop and smell the roses.

Beautiful Piazza.. Passed through on the way to Pantheon. Lovely Piazza with beautiful church on one side. A few buskers and artists around to add to its quirkiness. Lots of people just milling around and enjoying the atmosphere.

Very cool. We go back to this plaza every time we in Rome. Great for p[eople watching. The statues are amazing and the Pantheon is within walking distance. Get some gelatin and enjoy the views and the fountains.
Nice ambience and good for people watching. A nice square where you can people watch, take some great photos, and enjoy the weather. I wouldnt spend a lot of time at this place, but worth a visit.

Treat Yourself. This was by far an experience of a lifetime.... My partner took me on a shopping spree for my birthday.... You must visit... spend some time with yourself, for yourself - leave with a few bags... Lol
Nice place to walk around and look at the fountain. The kids like the piazza with the nice buildings and the water fountain. We had dinner there one night too. Fun place to people watch.

Touristy, but Still Authentic Rome. While I like to see some of the more noteworthy spots in any place I visit, I'd much prefer to suddenly "discover the real heart" of that place. Piazza Navona was like that for me. We found it on the way to the Pantheon, but it had such a great fountain and lovely architecture we decided to wander around for a while. We came across some quaint shops and restaurants, but what was the draw for me were the musicians and artists in the square. I'm a sucker for picking up art as a souvenir, and there were several artists all throughout the piazza. It's like going to a free art museum! We ate at one of the restaurants near the fountain, sat outside and watched one of the artists paint nearby. To me, Piazza Navona was the quintessential Italian experience, and I'd highly recommend taking some time to visit.
Crowded 24/7. Crazy place, full of tourist and vendors. Must see for the first timers but I wouldn't waste a lot of time there
Huge square. Beautiful square thats ginormous. Lots of small restos and places to sit and relax. Great atmosphere

Go and See. We spent an evening at Piazza Navona, eating and drinking at the street tables. We were highly entertained by the numerous street performers. The fountains in the piazza were great and gave the feeling of something special

Nice backdrop for dinner just a shame about the street sellers. Visited the area to have some lunch one day on our trip. The food was lovely and the setting by the fountain was great. My only issue is the amount of street sellers trying to pedal their selfie sticks, crappy hats and naff umbrellas to the point they disturb you while you eat....Rome police get a grip and ban them

Enjoy a night time stroll. Used to be you would wander piazza navona at night and join Romans doing what Italians do - stroll at night with their friends and neighbors discussing the day's events. There is still some of that here, but now it is overwhelmed by trinket hawkers and tourists. Still, the central Bernini fountain is a must see, and the scene is great. Also, get tartufo where it was created (supposedly) at Tre Scalini (amazing).

People watching. A big square in the centre of the city dominated by a huge fountain. Head to the end of the square to number two, a chic little cafe, an oasis in the scorching heat and watch life unfold in Piazza navona.

The Heart of Adventure. I'm a person who likes to pound the pavement of a new city and discover hidden treasures. Articles and guidebooks all said to start a day in Rome in this Piazza, and they didn't steer me wrong. Get here and take in one of the coolest fountains in the city (The Fountain of 4 Rivers), and then pick a direction and start to explore. You'll find all sorts of churches and small basilicas peppered in this neighbourhood that you can walk into and be amazed by. This whole piazza is a lesson in the Baroque, and the architecture alone is worth a visit. Hopefully you'll see some live entertainment here too.

A must visit if you are in Rome. Fantastic atmosphere to have lunch or dinner. Surrounded by street artists and musicians. Definitely a place that you have to visit if you are a fan of The Da Vinci Code books and movies.

Fantastic place to sit and soak up the cultute. We spent an evening at Piazza Navona, eating and drinking at the street tables in various restaurants- one better than the next! We were highly entertained by the numerous street performers who spontaneously sing, dance and paint in front of the captive restaurant audiences. The fountains in the piazza and church is beautiful...

Beautiful piazza.... Piazza Navona is the most beautiful one in Rome,in my opinion.It's always lively,with different kind of artists and a lot of tourists.There are nice buildings around a piazza,restaurants,but for me was enough just to sit by the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi,which is very beautiful,and watch people.It was fun and it's place you shouldn't miss when you are in Rome.

Masterpiece. I have visited twice so far and I still cannot wrap my head around the fact that people carved these magnificent figures by hand. It's almost too much to grasp, the artistry....visit the fountains instead of the museums for a change. There are masterpieces around each corner.

Everybody Comes Here!. We've just arrived home, and sorting through photographs prior to putting together a photobook. And there is the Piazza Navona, and it's probably on everybody's slide show, if they've been to Rome. Don't miss it (you won't!). Every party is taken there. People watch. Stop for a drink. Amble along. That's what you do in Rome.

Food. One of the best little piazzas in Rome, food central but be sure to look for the TripAdvisor logo and be sure to eat at Barnini which is in the piazza,The busy has great atmosphere and plenty of photo opportunities

The kids had fun. Although we've had to chase them and force them to remain visible and nearby. The Piazza is beautiful and interesting for kids. You might want to add some spice by telling the story of the characters there (either the real one, if you know it, or invent something interesting). It was a very nice ending to our day. Mind you that most restaurants around the piazza are overpriced and not very good. Check your TA.
Great to people watch!. Fun place to hang out. Magicians, musicians, restaurants, great fountain and lots of people in the Piazza. Great place to spend the late afternoon and evening.

Too many people. I got up early the next morning and then I saw its beauty without the millions of people... The art and skill of those who created this is outstanding - such a beautiful piece of art.
Amazing!. Very crowded in summer but plan your visit late afternoon and have a dinner in local restaurant. Then you see this in daylight and when lights are on. Throw a coin and make a wish.

What happened to piazza navona?? Che successo?! 😔. I used to visit piazza navona on every trip to Italy. There were beautiful artists - from whom I've purchased - music, a place to sit and have coffee, dessert, dinner, etc.
Not anymore. Now piazza navona is filled with people selling squeaky toys, selfie sticks, caricature artists, horrible internet printed "artwork". Such a disappointment!

Very Enjoyable. Came here our first night in Rome. We walked around, checking out all the restaurants and the fountains. Be careful about the 10% service charges and the additional cover charges that some restaurants enforce. Besides that, there were so many people that it is difficult to actually get a picture.
Unimpressed. It was pretty but not particularly impressive in our opinion. Though, we love all the fountains in Rome.

Spectacular Piazza, very long and a lot of points of interest~. We stopped here on two different days and different times of day as well. If you have the choice of time of day I would go later when the light is softer, it's beautifully lit. But it is still spectacular during the daytime as well. We loved the Fountain of the Four Rivers of course, it is the central point of the Piazza. There are so many points of interest around the piazza (restaurants, churches, embassy) and it is a great place to stop and rest or people watch. We did not eat here at all, just took in the sites~
Beautiful. You need to visit at night as well as during the day. Even though you know you're paying for the view, you should have dinner here. It really is fun and great people watching.

Classic Piazza with beautiful fountains. Great for stopping on your stroll through Rome. Grab a drink or gelato and enjoy the ambiance of the piazza. The fountains are gorgeous. Just beware pick-pockets and scams.
Nice. Very nice to wonder round and see, have a drink, chill and people watch. The fountain is ( as all of them ) very impressive
Beautiful at night. I loved the atmosphere, music, restaurants and the buzz. It was beautiful at night time and there are nice restaurants in the area. Some are traps for tourists so be aware.
Must see. All Rome is a must see city but some places are extra important. Piazza Novana is one of them. Should come in the afternoon habe a drink and enjoy the atmosphere.

Amazing Place but Pricey!. This beautiful Piazza is lined on four sides by buildings and shops and a large selection of restaurants. It's one of those places that has a day face and a night face. During the day, you can wander around the artists selling their wares, look into the fantastic little shops, enjoy a drink at one of the many restaurants and watch the world go by. At night, it becomes a beautiful square, the fountains light up and the restaurants become al fresco eateries. Even out of season they are all well equipped with canvas drops and patio heaters. You must visit both in the day and at night to appreciate everything this place has to offer. It's a popular place among the tourists and the prices locally in the restaurants etc reflect this. You must take time to appreciate the fountains here. They are beautiful in the daytime and nighttime and you may recognise one from the film Angels and Demons, where a priest took a dip and was saved by Tom Hanks.
Lively at night. Enjoyed visiting this at night time. Full of local artists, restaurants, and street life. An absolute delight.
Good vibe. Loved St Agnes basilica, the Gelato, street performers and people watching. Food on the piazza is a bit over priced but part of the experience.
Fab square. Many artists and acts cover this square in the daytime. Lots of restaurants and lovely fountains too, nice to walk around to see what's going on.

Beautiful Piazza Navona. Lovely place to see and admire the Piazza Navona fountains, great to visit at night time with the dim lights. Though don't bother having food around square poor quality and expensive

Evening visit . This Piazza is stunning at night. Either leisurely stroll through or enjoy a beverage at one of the restaurants and watch the people wandering about. The fountains are the star of the area, and a great way to see multiple at once.

Beautiful piazza. The piazza is truly beautiful. Avoid the street performers and the touristy stuff, and just enjoy the fountains and the atmosphere. We were there in the daytime and at night and felt safe - there was good police presence. Off the square was a good pizza place - Buffuta (sp?) - but get there before the line forms! Enjoy!
Very Picturesque. I love this Piazza, especially in the early morning when the light is softer and it is easier to leisurely view all of its beauty.

Was once a race course. Better in the morning or late evening. Dinner is great but better value found at Campo dei Fiori. Don't hesitate to get lost in the little vias around the piazza, it's where you'll find a great place to sit and really appreciate where you are.

Never get old visiting this piazzo. We had been to Rome three times and have always made a trip to go to Piazzo Navona to just breath in the air, walk the piazza and see the crowds. It does not disappoint either for locals or tourist. The fountains are amazing! This last time we were there, there was a film crew doing a shoot with a group of people dressed as kangaroos reading newspapers, really funny!
One of my favorites. Every time I go there is always something happening. There is so much to see, take your time and don't run thru it.Pretty during the day and also at night

Go in the AM or late at night!. This popular, famous site is plagued with crowds during the day. It is a mass of teeming humanity, to be avoided at all costs. Sometimes it's good for people-watching, but if I have to stand back 200 yards from the fountain because of the amount of people, it takes the fun out of it. Go after 2100 or in the AM for a better experience.

A favorite place. The Piazza Navona is a "must see" spot each time we visit in Rome. It has a pleasant ambiance to it any time of day...and the street musician group that is frequently playing there adds to the festive nature of the place...purchasing one of their CD's (very reasonable at 10 Euros) makes for a special memory of Rome.
Nice but VERY expensive. Very nice to walk around. With some life music and street artists it's lovely. Though you pay 6euro's for a glass coke (+half cup of ice).

Great atmosphere . Pricey area to eat and drink (in but the atmosphere is great. Stop just for a drink. Take pictures of the fountain. If you feel like paying the prices get food since it's all delicious! Always someone playing music and there are a bunch of street performers and artists around.
Best of many piazzas. Rome is filled with many Piazzas. So they tend to look similar as the trip wears on. this was one of the better ones, but we did find a cool piazza every six blocks or so.

Great Piazza but also a great area of the city in which to stay. This area of the city is filled with narrow cobbled streets leading to the Piazza Navona. We would highly recommend staying in this area. Enjoy the little shops that lead to the Piazza.

Our favorite piazza--beautiful lively yet relaxing. Maybe you're an art buff and you come to see Bernini's Four Rivers fountain. But it was the bustling energizing lively atmosphere of this square that we loved. It was only 5 minutes from the Pantheon and 5 minutes to Campo de Fiori/Palazzo Farnese so you can visit all in a few hours. Rectangular shaped, this grand piazza is open and surrounded by cafes and beautiful buildings. It is a magnet for people and a natural gathering place. We enjoyed strolling around this square, removed from noise of street traffic. No one seemed to be in a rush. Sitting at a cafe, this was a perfect place to have a coffee and catch our breath after a bit of walking. In some respects this was a pedestrian oasis that was lively while at the same time relaxing.
Great fountains from master architect: and not only!. Come and see the beauty of this place where architects tried to do their best one against other: who won in your opinion?
Atmospheric!. We loved the atmosphere, the performance artists and the people watching. Enjoyed a couple of relaxing hours here.

A night tour. Interesting site/sight but it was the last on our 3-hour walking tour at night and we were exhausted. In addition, the summer crowds were unruly and the noise impossible. No fault of the Piazza, or the tour guide... would like to visit again, to study it a bit more...in the daytime!.
Okay. Nice but not a must see site. Have a coffee in a nearby cafe and enjoy the atmosphere of the busy piazza.

A nice family evening. We walked here after seeing the Pantheon and it had such a nice family atmosphere, that we ate dinner here and enjoyed people watching. A place to see people being statues and art and good food. Felt safe.

Terrific plaza day and night. Piazza Navona is so long that it has not one or two fountains but THREE Baroque-style masterpieces! One of Rome's most famous squares, this piazza is formerly an ancient Roman chariot track, AKA the race track back in the days. Today, it is one of Rome's most iconic and beautiful piazzas especially at night.Pick your favorite Piazza Navona fountains! Is it one of the Giacomo della Porta's two fountains, the Moorish Neptune in the south or the Roman Neptune in the north? To me, my favorite is the grandest of the three: Bernini's Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of Four Rivers), a beautiful masterpiece recently featured as a main plot piece in Dan Brown's "Angels and Demons"! Under the shade of the Egyptian obelisk, Bernini masterfully sculptured a backdrop for four male gods representing the four major rivers of the papal domain, each with vivid emotions and actions depicting their characteristics like the Nile hiding its head as its source was unknown at that time. The piazza is also surrounded by popular gelateria like Grom and restaurants, but you don't need to dine here to enjoy this classic Roman piazza. Simply stroll here day or night and feel the jovial atmosphere! Since it's located essentially in the center of Rome's historic center, it's hard to miss and really, why would you? I definitely recommend swinging by to see the beautiful Piazza Navona and its beautiful fountains.---tl;dr version:1) Formerly an ancient Roman racetrack, now a beautiful piazza with 3 fountains2) Surrounded by popular gelataria and restaurant3) Center of the historic center - Worthy of checking out!

meet the 4 continents' big rivers and st. agnes. the impressive fountain built in mid 17th century on the former place of a Domitianus stadium represents the Danube , the Nile, the Ganges and the Rio del Plata. relax watching the church in the back of the fountain : St. Agnes in Agone, the patron of young girls, chastity, rape victims and gardeners. a Christian in 3rd century AD was punished to march naked to a brothel, but her prayers were answered and her hair grew longer to cover her nudity. when they tried to burn her at the stake the fire didn't catch her so she was stabbed.
Must see. Beautiful place for a stroll and a yummy panini! One of my favorite spots in Rome. Make sure you check the street vendors too. Great souvenirs at great prices!
Our Favorite Square in Rome. We love this square in Rome! Lots of great eateries, beautiful fountains and fun street performers! We can't wait to go back!

A chance to rest, and eat!. After walking from the Colosseum to the Roman Forum and the Pantheon, on reaching the Piazza Navona, we took the opportunity to buy ice cream and rest our weary feet for a moment. I'll be honest with you, Piazza Navona is pretty much like every other Piazza. Beautiful buildings, statues and lots and lots of people. Around the edge of the Piazza there are restaurants in plentiful supply. I thought they were perhaps a little more expensive than the restaurants available on the streets close by. Piazza Navona is one of those things you tick off your 'Rome list' (if you have one!!)
one of the most beautiful piazza in Rome. beautiful vibrant piazza with 3 beautiful fountains (benini's fiumi) surrounded by some cafe-restaurants, ornated buildings and churches.

Beautiful and interesting . Stroll along and enjoy the architecture. Enjoy the various street performers but be aware that the gladiators will expect payment for having a photograph taken with them. Several cafes and restaurants surround the square.
Mother daughter2016. Huge piazza, entertainment lots of restaurants great food good shopping great handmade shop if your looking for gifts all prices
Afternoon Visit. We visited here 10 years ago and was full of artists and various street acts fairly empty this time maybe a sign of the economic times I was a bit disappointed
Favourite place!. Every evening we'd og to Piazza Navona for dinner. A beautiful area, quite touristy but nothing too much. Historical meets foodie. Loved it.

Get here early. This place fills up from about 8am each day. It is well worth the visit if you can get there earlier. The fountains are grand and The Four Rivers Fountain by Bernini is spectacular. If you can make it by 7am you can get some great shots.

My favourite Piazza!. Even though busy I still enjoyed wandering around this Piazza, it's very atmospheric. I loved the middle fountain with the 4 main river and how each statue has a story. The church here is also worth a visit. My only disappointment is that I did not come back to visit this place at dusk.
Piazza Navorna.. Beautiful Rome. You have to see and be seen here. Absolutely beautiful. Early morning and early evening are best when trying to beat the summer heat.

Lovely to sit and have a drink in the evening.. Stayed in an hotel just off the Piazza - lovely first thing in the morning before the crowds arrive and also to sit in and people watch in the evening. Be sure to read up about the buildings around and near the Piazza - lots to see.
One of Rome's most Beautiful Piazza's. Beautiful fountains fill this amazing Piazza. Spend some time strolling around here and have a bite to eat or a nice cappuccino.

A Must See in Rome..... It is always amazing to see the fabulous architecture, statues and structures in Rome and Piazza Navona is no different. We visited on a very rainy day and had to see the piazza from under the umbrellas of a sidewalk cafe...and it was still full of crowds trying to do as we were! It is in a nice central location with lots of patio ages nearby to indulge in some people watching and a good Italian coffee.
Crowds of Tourists like Flies. Rome in late June when it is 39 degrees celsius! Piazza Navona was where all the flies gathered. In May there were no flies or tourists.

High on your priority list.. I enjoy going to the Piazza Navona and looking at Bernini's masterpiece Fiume fountain. We followed Rick Steeves self guided tour and discovered the 4 rivers and river gods represented. As always, filled with people and overpriced vendors and just magnificent.
A must Piazza. A very relaxing piazza where you can find good restaurants or simply a relaxing place to unwind. It is best to come a nightfall.

Great gluten free pizza at Piazza Navone. Happily surprised how many places have gluten-free pizza! Bernardini in Piazza Navone - - highly recommend the food and gluten free pizza. Very good and the owners are super nice and they speak English.
Wonderful day or night. We walked through during the day and then at night. Nighttime they had a great group of street performers. Definitely a must see.

Very touristy. The square has great atmosphere but is honestly a huge tourist trap! It's definitely worth visiting but I wouldn't spend a lot of time here as there are so many other non touristy more authentic areas to visit.
Great in the evening. Famous for its three fountains designed by Bernini. Combine it with a visit to the Pantheon and the famous Giolitti ice cream parlour.

The True Culture of Rome. The Piazza Navona is an incredible place to hang out to feel the culture of Rome. In fact, my husband's cousin who is a pilot for all over the world, this is his absolute favorite place in all of his travels. You get immersed into the culture with the beautiful fountains, artists selling their goods, and all the open air restaurants and cafes. You can relax there during the day or at night, while people watching. We always enjoy this area because of the relaxing mode of the large open air feeling.

Wonderful center city meeting spot. Knew nothing about Piazza Navona before we arrived, but had been told to check it out. What a wonderful spot in the middle of the old city! Musicians, children, fountains, restaurants, action. The main fountain was not very clean - green algae - but it was still lovely. We enjoyed the shade and breeze while having yummy gelato!

Browse all the small streets around Piazza Navona for eat and gelato. It is not far from Campo di Fiori. I came to this spot day and night and i got different feeling ..the fountains sounds serine and look so bright at night.
It is nice to just sit down and relax having my gelato next to the fountain.

Breath Taking. There are no words to truly describe how you will feel when you first see the sights. Sit back enjoy a coffee and just relax, you will think you are on a film set, you cannot imagine you are actually there,enjoy the history and the atmosphere that has been created in this wonderful place.

Sit and relax . Walk around the piazza navona around 7pm, lots of street performance to create the magic of music in the background. Don't dine there, instead take a short walk to campo dei fiori and the surrounding area, you'll be amazed by the cute places to have a quick bite or a nice dinner at.

Lovely Piazza. Piazza Navona is a very vibrant place, you can enjoy sitting in open air enjoying the sound of water running out of beautifully fountains designed by Bernini the genius, also you can enjoy a cup of cappuccino or a nice meal at one of the restaurants spreading around while watching enjoyable street performers.Piazza Navona is crowded during day time, so try to visit around sunset or at night that when you will definitely enjoy your visit :)

A wellknown piazza. If you like bigger piazzas with various artists performing their art this is your place! If you want to avoid touristic places though this would be the number one spot to stay away from..

Lovely. Was not as busy as I was expecting it to be here, visited here many years ago and it was so busy back them. Sat and people watched it was nice and quite and to get your breath back from all the walking about we were doing.
Beautiful spot. Popped by to see the sights. Beautiful open area with a plethora of restaurants. Quite a welcoming open area after the claustrophobic tightness of Trevi.
Stunning. A wonderful place to spend the afternoon . Be sure to visit the Museum of Rome at the end of the Piazza.
Day or Night, Magnificent!. Can't get enough of this place! A short walk from our Hotel Tiziano and a world away from the worries of the day!
Great Piazza. Had no idea what was in Piazza Navona, was just following the signs, but what a beautiful Piazza!!! Gorgeous and big. A must see, very near the Trevie Fountain

Just walk around!!. At Piazza Navona you will find lot of local painters painting around. These paintings are so beautiful and looks so real as an eye stopper. Every artist's painting says different story even if they draw same landscape.
There are lots of eateries or food joints around. Really nice place to walk around and a fabulous fountain in middle.

Beautiful fountain, sculptures, nice place to sit. We took a long walk on our last day in Rome and it included the Piazza Navona. I was using a book with the kids (12 and 15) (Mission Rome: A Scavenger Hunt Adventure) and there were lots of things for them to find in this Piazza. We sat at one of the cafes and had coffee and dessert while watching the crowds flow by. To be sure, it was crowded! It was also packed with cafes and places to shop, on the Piazza and around each corner. It isn't a place I would say you have to see in Rome, but if you have the time, I'd recommend a visit.
Lovely place to lunch. Loved it here, great place to sit have a drink and lunch. Bit more expensive than the side streets but beautiful views

Eh...Not My Cup of Tea. I'm not exactly sure why this is considered by many to be a must see in Rome. It's a nice open area, but it's also filled with sub-par restaurants, lots of tourists, and there isn't much to see. We walked into Piazza Navona and were confused. The fountains are nice, but we had just seen Trevi Fountain, so it really paled in comparison. If you go, you can probably see everything you need in about 20 minutes and move on with your day. With all there is to see in Rome, this is not of great importance.

Wonderful atmosphere at night. We just love this piazza, day or night. We had dinner, and enjoyed the piano entertainment in close proximity on the grass. Watching the waterfalls, children play, and couples just enjoying the relaxed atmosphere. Just a beautiful place to be a part of.
Beautiful square but very busy. Well worth a visit and it can be nice to sit in one of the cafes and have a drink but they are expensive compared to the ones on more local streets.

helpful advice. Lots of stuff around this piazza. Don't go to the restaurants right on the piazza, they're way too expensive. Go down the many streets surrounding the piazza and you'll find many more choices with great food and much cheaper prices. Example, short on time foo pick up, sat down on piazza and ordered 2 beers, bill was 20 euro. next day went a little off piazza, had entire lunch & beer and glass of wine for about same price.
Popular Piazza. Big rectangular Piazza and one of many in Rome.Nice atmosphere with surrounding restaurants and some fountains.Can be very busy,but worth a visit.

Great place to buy a painting.. Want a local painting from a local artist. Visit the Piazza Navona - you can see many local artists and their work, we bought a great painting. They will roll it up for you to put into luggage.

Always a show stopper. So much history and art in such a lovely place. Even if you cannot connect the sculptures of the fountains and the church with the rivalry amongst some of the best architects the world ever saw (find out about it) the movie Angels and Demons should give you goosebumps! A great place to watch time and Rome go by

Fabulous Fountain! Pleasant Piazza!. Maybe it was because I had just finished reading Dan Brown's Angels and Demons, but I found the fountain at the Piazza Navona to be incredibly beautiful. Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers is powerful and moving. The Piazza is also home to two other fountains, as well as a number of street performers-- mostly musicians. It is a pleasant place to sit, listen to the water and the music and people watch.

A lively lovely place. The fountains and the statues are very beautiful and the atmosphere is incredible. Artists, singers and clowns are making a lot of shows. There is also a lot of nice restaurants. Don't miss visiting this place.

Beautiful!. When we came to Rome, we went straight to Piazza Navona. I absolutely love it <3 Fontana dei quattro fiumi is is stunning and the whole piazza is charming: street musicians playing, street artists painting and drawing, tourists taking pictures and enjoying. Just being there and soaking up the atmosphere was a perfect start of our wonderful visit to Rome.
Love love love. Eclectic and wonderful I just love the energy, vibe and feelOf this place. Wonderful wandering a with buskers, bands and restaurants.Don't miss this wonderful, wonderful place.
Fountain of many superbly sculpted sculptures. The fountain lay in a street of fantastic restaurants, it was great to eat whilst studying the structure.

MY KIDS LOVED IT AND WANTED TO SPEND EVERY EVENING THERE!. Best place to visit with any age children in rome. Large plaza with no traffic. Lot of performers and entertainers and restaurants! a beautiful cathedral/basilica right there with live music in the evening sometimes. classical! 3 fountains very pretty and lot of shopping too. my 13 yr and 10 yr old loved it. They watched performers there daily. Free place to visit and relax and eat . benches to sit around too.

Top Square in Europe. This is one of my favorite squares anywhere. The fountain and surrounding buildings are beautiful, but the people watching, mingling, and street performers are second to none. This is a must see on any trip to Rome.

The Place to Be for an Evening Stroll in Rome. What a lovely place. Possibly the nicest of all the piazzas in Rome. Bustling with musicians and artists in the summertime, worth a short trip from other spots in Rome just to people watch.
nice for a stroll through. Wonderful fountains, busy square plenty people watching to be done, but no need to linger. Certainly walk through after visiting the Pantheon etc

perfect evening. My favorite Roman square. We visited it in evening, April is perfect in Rome. Small restaurants all around square. Check menus in front of them, there are often daily offers and everything is pretty much OK. Try something that is not pizza :) enjoy sounds of fountains and music.

My favorite piazza. We love Piazza Navona. There are no cars, and because it us so big, it never feels crowded. We ate a leisurely, 3 course, €180 dinner for 4 at an outdoor restaurant. Splurge night. The 2 parents relaxed at the table, while the 10 and 12 year old ran back and forth between a long stream of street performers and spray paint artists.Gergeous fountains. The main fountain was designed by Bernini in a similar style to the Trevi Fountain, created by Nicolas Salvi.

Pretty, but overpriced. The Piazza itself is incredibly beautiful; the Bernini fountain is truly exceptional, but your best bet is to visit, take some photos and soak up the atmosphere, then move on. Coffee and food here is overpriced and generally average in quality.
lots to do and see. Good people watching piazza as well as the many places to eat and drink. Stop and have a spritz and enjoy.

The most elegant and beautiful piazza in Rome. You only need a half hour or so to fit the Piazza Navona into your Rome visit though a sit down to people watch can occupy much longer... Despite the horrible, tourist tat-selling shops on some of its approach roads, the street vendors selling all sorts of things you don't need and the sometimes huge numbers of people visiting it, Piazza Navona still retains it's elegance and charm. The tall buildings crowding around its periphery emphasise it's elongated shape and remind you of its original purpose as a race track,and the two fountains provide a focus for a wander around it whilst you decide whether you want a meal in one of the many restaurants or just an ice cream - the one only slightly more affordable than the other! It is particularly beautiful in the evening, just as the light is beginning to disappear (as do most of the visitors) when you can feel that sense of belonging that Rome seems to generate. I love it.
plenty of nice resteraunts. there are some decent restaurants, fountains and street performers, worth a visit to break up the day as it helps to escape the busyness of the tiny streets of rome

Beautiful and open Piazza. Beautiful fountains are in this square that is surrounded by restaurants, stores and other buildings. The Four Rivers fountain is impressive and sits in the middle of the square.

Gorgeous day, wonderful people watching. On our first day in Rome, we had to stay awake. After a 9-hour flight, we checked into our hotel and started walking the streets of Rome. After a few hours, we ended up at Piazza Navona, where we stay, drank coffee and watched street vendors, artists and all kinds of people walking, laughing, eating, and just enjoying a magnificent day in a beautiful location. A MUST-SEE and EXPERIENCE for anyone traveling to Rome.

3 fountains in a square!. Piazza Navona is a huge rectangular square surrounded by great Italian style buildings. But then there's the three amazing fountains, not least the grand centrepiece which is Bernini’s Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi , an ornate, showy fountain featuring personifications of the rivers Nile, Ganges, Danube and Plate.

Excellent Place to Hang out albeit a little touristy..... Piazza Navona has everything you want to get a good grasp of what it's like to visit Roma. The morning market can be a bit on the inauthentic side, but is still peppered with real farmers selling cheese and earnest people trying to make a living.

Nice square, but don't go out of your way. We came here in the late afternoon/early evening. There are restaurants around the perimeter of the square, vendors in the center, and a nice fountain. Not much was going on when we came by, but I know some people think this Piazza is amazing. As with many Roman tourist areas, the restaurants in the square are on the pricey side, compared with those just a few blocks away. Good people watching place, but there are many places in Rome for that. No place to sit and watch unless you stop at a restaurant.

Simply beautiful!. This is a gorgeous piazza, lots of restaurants around too. It has the big Fiumi fountain and sculptures in the centre of the piazza in front of the church Sant'Agnese in Agone which is another beautiful architecture

One of the best spots in Rome.. This is one of the locations we had an opportunity to see twice during our visit to Rome. I'm told that this is the largest Piazza found in the city of Rome. You can find everything from Ice Cream gelato stores to very nice restaurants, and even a basilica if you wish to stop and pause for a moment to say a few prayers for those who remember back home.As a large Piazza, especially on the weekends, there is an awful lot of Street activity including vendors, artist, and performers. As we walk the streets of this Piazza, we felt extremely safe with all of the local police officers and the wonderful army officers that kept watch over us as we spent our time in the Square.
Evening walk. Amazing fountains and beautiful space to spend a evening in Rome and admire the architecture very easy to get around by metro and walk down the cobbled streets

Beautiful . Gorgeous Piazza to visit at any time of day. The three fountains inside are stunning works of art. Great place to come and people watch or come very early in the morning for some quiet reflection

Beautiful!!. Love this place. Exploring Rome on foot, and this was one of my top choices to visit. It has beautiful fountains all surrounded by beautiful buildings. In the morning sun it can be quite warm, but in the late afternoon the whole piazza was in shade and it was really buzzing. Plenty of shops and restaurants to choose from.
Wonderful surprise in the city!. A great gathering area with shopping, food and art. Local artists display their art. It is close to many churches with local attractions.

Great space to run around. We went here twice during our short stay I Rome. It's just a great space for kids to run around, fountains, no cars, lots of interesting things going on around and shady side streets to get a cold drink or ice cream off the square.
Piazza with 3 fountains. Very central and easy access. Large piazza always bustling with activity Beautiful fountains. Easy to see even if on a short stay.

Must see!!!. Rome has hundreds of squares but this is one of the most beautiful. Two fountains on the sides and one big on the center, colorful flowers on the balconies and itinerant musicians are fulfill the scenery. Perimetrical, there are a lot of restaurants that you can enjoy your launch while the kinds could running around. Even when it is crowded the place is mysteriously remained peaceful!!! There are many allays starting from this square where you can follow for a nice walk.

Hang out there for wonderful times.. It is great place you will definitely like .. Street shows .. hand crafted medals and cafes a lot of people from all the globe in a very nice place you will love to hang out there

Impressive Piazza. This piazza was located right near an apartment that we rented for a week. There are interesting fountains and lots of restaurants. There are also annoying people trying to sell you things, so look out. Great for photos.
Interesting. Very interesting piece of artwork hidden down a street we almost missed. Definately worth a look if you can.

Fountains Foutains Fountains. We visited it by day and by night, both stunning, used in the film Angels and Demons the fountains are amazing to see. There place is buzzing so watch you bags and there are plenty of touts selling tat so be wary of them.. a great walk around the original area site and there is a little historical display and explanation of the levels of Rome in a nearby street which is very interesting.
Most beautiful piazza ever!. Love piazza Navona. The square is always lively, with artists, tourists and restaurant patrons around. The statues and fountain are beautiful. Perfect place to chill.

People watch. What a fantastic spot to sit back and watch the world go by. Artists to street sellers and performers. Tourists and locals alike. I loved this Piazza and I recommend a vist here on your trip to Rome!
Great Piazza. Lovely place to go and have a drink or a meal and people watch. There are 3 fountains one at either end and one in the middle. It's another must on your schedule.
Enjoyable pitstop. Part of full day tour , enjoyed pitstop had a rest & ate at one of the restaurants, very enjoyable as always statues are very Grand in Rome.

This is Rome. A visit to the square is a must to feel the wonderful atmosphere of Rome. OK it is a tourist location with all the add-ons of the tourist scene but look beyond that and enjoy the atmosphere.
Far bigger than I remember.... We went here during the day & at night and both times it was packed. It is a beautiful sculpture and the lighting on it at night really shows it up well.
Romantic at night. We really like this area at night. It feels romantic and you can walk around and people watch. There are restaurants to sit and eat or just have wine.

PEOPLE WATCHING AT ITS BEST!. Loved walking around the Piazza and checking out the artists, vendors and fountain. Great little shops around as well and a wonderful place to people watch and just take it all in. Well worth spending time there.

Huge Piazza. Went here during the day, then returned at night as it was less than a 5 minute walk from our hotel. This is a huge Piazza with a cpl fountains. Alot of places to eat and ppl watch. There was tourist shopping spots all around as well. When we were there their was a chinese camera crew filming their version of the amazing race. It was neat to see the competitors racing through and competing in their competition. The nightlife was good as well...not as happening as the pantheon square, but plenty to keep entertained.

Nice place to relax in the evening. Our hotel was just down the lane from the Plaza. After dinner it was relaxing to grab a Gellato and go sit in the plaza. Lots of activity, street entertainers, music, art vendors, etc. A beautiful plaza.
Evening Stroll. Early evening stroll with lovely weather after a hot afternoon. Many restaurants choices; many people out enjoying the cool evening.
Great for people watching. With tons of people going through there during the day it's a great place to people watch. Between the tourists and the entertainers rotating through there's plenty to see.

Fabulous Piazza.. Great architecture and lots to watch in the sqaure. Lots of places to eat but they charge twice as much as other restaurants not in the square. There are some great ice cream places which were charging the same as elsewhere. No shade but there some benches.
Beautiful and Romantic.. Visit it at night. It's so romantic and theres so much to see. There are street vendors, places to eat and lots of people buzzing around.
Loved It. Three terrific fountains, a beautiful church, lots of restaurants with a vibrant atmosphere. We were happy it was so close to our relais.
Very Beautiful Fountains. It is very nice place to visit. I really enjoyed the beautiful fountains and the crowd. This one of the iconic of Rome.

Awesome place to relax and take a break!. This is a very large plaza with 3 large fountains surrounded by outdoor cafes.. Good place to stop and watch all the activities going on and people watch... Have a refreshment and cool down...

Great place to enjoy Gelato & people watch. A nice square located not too far from the Pantheon. There's a nice restaurant in the square that sell really good Gelato and Italian dessert. Buy a Gelato or dessert to go, find a bench in the square, enjoy the street performance, people watch and have a good time.

Love this piazza. As with anywhere in Rome during the summer you need to get here early in the morning to get a chance to appreciate the piazza before the crowds arrive and to get your photos, but its still a lovely place to walk through at any time. An overly ostentatious fountain set in a massive square - fabulous!

Nice fountains and a lot of activity. Lots of history here plus a lot of activity. Locals think of restaurants as touristy so we avoided - they looked fine though. Fountains are amazing and with the trip

Real Italian Feel. Just sitting here and just feeling the true Italian vibe was something I will not forget! This is such a nice plaza! I thought all of the mimes were cool too! Happy I sat here with a gelato and a nice espresso

Beautiful Piazza!. One must visit Piazza Navona and see the beautiful fountains and the architecture specially of Fountain of the Four Rivers! Truly magnificent...The other 2 fountains are pretty as well , however, this steals the show!

People watching. Great piazza to people watch. Kind of central to all the tourist attractions. If your up early one morning walk through it empty and enjoy the peace and quiet, along with the dog walkers.
Grand on Every Scale. This is a beautiful Piazza in the heart of Rome that attracts many thousands of visitors not only for the Fountain but also the Church of St. Agnes
Fountains a must see. A great end of the day visit for all - after a long, hot visit in Rome - a place to sit by the fountains and relax.

Magical place to walk and enjoy a gelato. We stayed at a hotel right around the corner from the Piazza Navona so we ended up walking through it and enjoying the fountains at least a few times each day. The piazza changes from day to night so it's wonderful to experience it both ways. It's a great people watching spot and there are a few great gelato places nearby. Avoid Dolce Vita for lunch or dinner, as there are much better, customer focused places just off the Piazza.

Beautiful & busy Piazza.. I loved visiting Piazza Navona. We visited twice during our four day stay. Bit more pricey on the food bill, but well worth the stunning food & lovely views. Lovely place to people watch.

Three beautiful fountains. Nice large square with three huge working fountains. Surrounded by outdoor cafes on both sides of the square. Good location to cool off and relax after a day of touring Rome
Taste of Italy. A beautiful, old Piazza. Lined with restaurants, and trolled by hawkers. Beautiful fountains, and an Egyptian Obelisk.

Beautiful Piazza Navona. Very relaxing placing with lots of bars, pizzerias and music.
Acrobat activities, cobblestone walkways.
Sit on a patio by the sidewalk and enjoy a cold beer.

Rome best stops. This was another of our stops while in Rome. Piazza Navona. Lots of cafes around and souvenir shops as well. Take a hat or an umbrella. Very nice picturesque site durin summer time. This is one of the stops on our way to Fontaine de Trevi; Espana Steps and the Colosseum

An elegant square.. A large and elegant square in the heart of Rome and a place to watch the world go by. The fountain is pretty and you can sit on the side. There are always artists painting and there are lots of shops and restaurants around the side. I am told it is lovely at night but we only went during the day.

Very pretty,ideal for photos.. Very pretty,fountains,people painting.loads of restaurants,good food ,sit and people watch,with a glass of wine,lovely,take plenty of photos,a good place to visit,won't disappoint .
Beautiful. One of the larger and more beautiful Piazzas.....many artists gather there.....beautiful fountain....nice place to stroll

Beautiful in summer. A great place to pause, sit down and have a meal or a drink and people watch. We went in June when it was pretty busy but we found a spot in a restaurant easily enough and had lunch while taking in the atmosphere. It has beautiful fountains and people selling artwork all around. It feels like an authentic Italian experience and I'd recommend it.
Beautiful. A grand piazza. The fountains and surrounding buildings are stunning and, should you want to eat or drink, there is a selection of restaurants
Piazza Navona. Good place for people watching. More photos and details on my blog. Link in profile. The blog is nycbonviveur on wordpress.

Interesting to walk around, with wonderful fountains. This is a really interesting Piazza. There are three beautiful fountains in it.- The Fountain of the Four Rivers which is a base for an Egyptian obelisk. The rivers represented are the Nile Danube Ganges and Rio de la Plata. The other two are the fountain of the Moor and the fountain of the Calderari.

Still a must see. Had the privilege of staying at an inn with a balcony overlooking the piazza and fountain of Neptune. Outstanding place to hang out day or night. Very subdued early in the day, but vibrant late afternoon and early evening.
Hard to imagine visiting Rome without at least a stroll through Navona.

Fountains, restaurants and paintings. Great open area in the middle of the city, nice fountains and lots of areas to buy art work. The restaurants are more expensive in the piazza, the streets surrounding are much better value
a must visit. Strangely surrounded by shops its a beautiful place just to take time out and relax, take in the area and watch people go by,
Beautiful fountains..... If you like cultural history this piazza is for you. I've been back 3 or 4 times. The fountain in the middle is top-notch-

Filled With Beauty. Beautiful fountains, remarkable sculptures in a square that is abutted with wonderful restaurants. The piazza is bustling with activity. People sitting and enjoying the fountains while sipping coffee or eating a delicious gelato. There are vendors set up in the piazza selling artwork. The only downside is the barrage of peddlers pestering you to buy a selfie stick and/or some other gadget which stole away some of the authenticity of the piazza.

Finally. To find this place, one has to navigate endless of alleyways and turns but once you get here you'll forget your aching feet and worries about getting lost or how to get back to where you came from. Lots of entertainers and cafes....our limo chauffeur actually recommended this place to have coffee...as customary, sitting at the table will be an additional charge.
simply amazing. Wonderful gigantic fountain with stunning details. The area gets very crowded and can be difficult to move around.
Beautiful fountains. A really vibrant square with several lovely fountains in it. Lots of restaurants to choose from, watch the birds enjoy the fountains...

stunning fountain. Go at 5am unlesss you want to see tiers of hundreds of people taking selfies; or just relax and enjoy the scrabble of humanity. surrounding neighborhood worth strolling through, stop for tea or drinks somewhere and thanks the gods for your good fortune
One of the most beautiful piazza in Rome. Do not miss this piazza with its three fountains, church and the best place for Tartufo at Tre Scalini.

Lovely piazza. Fantastic Piazza, lots going on and loads of restaurants and cafes, a bit more pricey than usual as you are right on the square about €6 for coke and €8 a beer, go to tre scaline and try the tartufo...

Great People-Watching. Our family enjoyed just a chance to people-watch at the Piazza Navona. It is a beautiful spot in Rome. The church was interesting to see and the fountains were a great great backdrop for pictures. The kids enjoyed the chance to just relax in the piazza for a bit.

Worth looking for. There a few places I remember from previous visit over 40 years. This was one of them. This place does have a real atmosphere and feel. Lovely statues and bars
Well worth a visit

Domitian's racetrack is in fine form today.. The piazza retains the shape it had some 2000 year's ago when it was established as a track for horse racing by the Emperor Domitian. Today it contains spectacular fountains and is lined by elegant buildings. It and its surrounding area are well supplied with restaurants.

good place to eat and people watch. a lovely large square , ringed by restaurants , 3 beautiful marble fountains by Berlini .lots of artists offering to paint anyone who wants themselves on canvas. in fact after noticing that one artist had a queue , we went over to look at their pencil portraits , and the were very good indeed. mush less busy mid week , interesting churches to visit nearby as well
Stop to read the history. Such a beautiful Piazza- best seen early in the day without the crowds. Really interesting history- it is worth taking time to read the historical explanations
Gathering spot. We didn't really spend a lot of time here...it was a beautiful area to walk around and people watch.

What's not to like . Nice trendy part of town with loads of things to do surrounding it. Also, some people have mentioned that the cafes/restaurants around here are expensive. If you have a look around the back streets this is not the case. Me and my wife came across one of the best restaurants we visited in Rome here (Navona Notte) which was extremely reasonable. Worth a look.
Remarkable Piazza Art. The Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini is such a remarkable masterpiece. It's worth sitting and staring at - for at least 1 glass of wine...

A Must See. Very beautiful fountain and great (tourist) place to relax and have a nice lunch or dinner, buy a painting, watch the people-ladies don't buy the purses unless a knockoff is what you want. There is a place to exchange money there also.

Interesting entertainment. It's not a must while in Rome but it's nice to pop by in the evening for the nighttime magic of Rome's fountains. Lots of people hang around and show their arts.
Children find the fountains very fascinating with lots of animal figures.
Awesome place!!!. Make sure to grab a table for lunch here :) It's a great place to people watch and the food is really good.

Fantastic place to visit. A very nice place to sit and have a glass of wine or a coffee and watch the world go by. Music in the piazza and entertainment. We would definitely visit again. Lovely atmosphere.
Lovely place . Huge piazza with beautiful fountains. Great place to come here in the evening, sitting at the benches have a gelato while listening to the street musicians performing.

Fun to see. The fountain is fabulous. Make sure to read something about it because it is pretty interesting. We chickened out eating on the square due to the ripoff factor. Maybe a drink might be ok to watch the throngs of people.

Great place!. Piazza Navona is a must for any visitor to Rome. The oldest fountain, Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi, is from the 17th century, the others from the 19th century. Around the square there is a lot of restaurants & bars where you can enjoy lunch or dinner or perhaps only a drink. Restaurants and bars can be crowdy but usually you will get a table within a few minutes waiting.
Piazza Navona. I loved it here, loved the restaurants, the fountains and just the feel of the place. Visit it many times, it's just round the corner to the Pathenon
Pretty but just a square.... So I've been here a few times but at the end of the day it's just a square with a few fountains....and no shade in the hot summer sun. Maybe more enjoyable in winter?!

Disappointing. Overcrowded and overrun with tour groups and expensive cafes. Spent 10 mins there and left. There are better areas off the tourist map to see and enjoy in Rome. If you can walk there it's ok to see but don't spend taxi money to get there. Just not worth it.
A trendy place to visit at any time of the day and night. One of the great Piazza's of Rome. The square is surrounded by restaurants and wine bars and is a great people watching location.

Visit in the night too. One of the most beautiful Piazzas in Rome. Famous for the fountains like Neptune Fountain and Fountain of the Four Rivers. The place is beautifully illuminated in the night and less crowded.

Full of energy. We tried to be hip and went to Trasatvere for dinner, but it was a hit rough around the edges for our taste, and we went back across the river to Piazza Navona. Definitely touristy, but so full of positive energy...it's a great place to stroll with some gelato and people watch. Our cab driver told us about the tour of part of Ancient Rome beneath the piazza...we didn't have time to do but others may want to check out.

Nice to visit. Another pretty lace to visit in Rome! Very colourful in a piazza (square). There are lots of eateries to choose from. There was music parade when we visited & the church bells chimed. Another nice place to stroll through with artists selling paintings to look at.

Large crowds...almost always...be patient. Yes, there will most likely be more people than you imagined, but it is worth it. The cleaning efforts left the fountain looking AMAZING. Pick a spot for pictures and just be patient, people don't linger more than a few minutes. Do drop a coin and do wish to come back to Rome as your first wish!

Charming, especially at night . Not to be missed, Piazza Navona in the middle of the old town in Rome. Very charming with surrounding houses and restaurants, beautiful fountains. Go at night to experience the romantic atmosphere, it will be much quieter, people do their thing, street artists, eating, drinking and relaxing. Just like Rome is :)
Great place to pass time!. Piazza Navona is a great place to have a coffee or a glass of wine and watch the people. The fountains are a great bonus.

Beautiful Fountains - Too many street vendors. Lots of activity in this piazza. A great place to people watch, but I was a bit overwhelmed with servers from every restaurant hassling patrons to eat at there establishment. There were street performers, painters and people trying to sell selfie sticks everywhere. It is a must see as the fountains are beautiful, but I was tired of everyone hassling me to buy something.

Peaceful and beautiful at 6 am.. Many tourists during the normal hours of the day. If those are the only times you can go, do it, it's worth it. Just wear sunscreen or sunglasses and a hat. Hardly any shade here. But if you can, I suggest doing Trevi fountain and Navona at sunrise. Take a nice run and see that, the Pantheon too if you can fit it in.

Beautiful piazza. This is definitely one of the most beautiful piazzas of Rome(i also prefer Piazza di Spagna and Piazza Republica).It is crowded even in the night so you can visit it at any hour.Neer the piazza you can find nice coffess,restaurant and I recommend you all to try the ice cream in one of the shops at the streets which lead you to this piazza.The architecture is amazing and you can spend quality time looking at the fontanes.During the day,there are a lot of artists which perform or make portraits of people who are interested.

A square by any other name. Piazza Navona is a beautiful rectangular square which used to house a Stadium in 1st century AD. If you like ornate fountains there are three to choose from. Whilst the centrepiece is the largest my favourite is the Fontana del Nettuno which sits at the northern end. There are plenty of cafes to choose from if you want to soak in the atmosphere but they are more expensive than those just off the square. I like the simple beauty of the church facade of Nostra Signora del Sacro Cuore over the oppulence of Sant Agnese in Agone.
