Take this square in if you have the chance and see which if the features you prefer.
Must visit. Wonderful piazza in Rome. Large. Food. Street sellers, Art. Great place to spend time time getting to know Italy.
Lazy Sunday Afternoon. Lovely place to sit, have a drink and watch the world drift by.The fountains are impressive and the bar/restaurant selection is vast.

Lovely piazza novana. Piazza novano is second place to visit in roma. First one is collesium. When you visit novana you will feel that you are in Rome. There are 3 different sculpture with water in the center öf piazza which are surrounded by cafes and öld buildings. There are famous cafe in this square also. Prices are Acceptable. Love this place.
Stunning fountain. Less crowded than the Trevi Fountain. Lots of restaurants and cafes around the piazza. Great for people watching.
Lovely!!!. Big beautiful square!! One of the biggest piazzas in Rome! Lots of restaurants and fountains . If you are looking for gelato I recommend GROM it is all organic and delicious !!!

All day visit. Piazza novo a is a square you can visit any time of the day. Many restaurants nearby. A lot of painters at the square who can make your portrait or like a comic but they can also draw a portrait from a photo on your phone
Nice place to walk arround. in the morning it was a bit crowded but at night it was very peaceful and quit, i liked walking around there.
Overwhelming amount of Roman remains. If you want to avoid the queues either visit first thing or late afternoon. Buy a joint ticket with the Colisseum to save a bit of money

Lovely Piazza. Lovely piazza with lots of cafes. Fountains including the famous Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. Good place to enjoy a cool drink and watch the world go by. Do visit the church on the square - Sant'Agnes in Agone- serene and beautiful.

still being renovated. we went there and it was still being renovated...i guess now it is done...however we enjoyed it a lot.. we could see some of it that was already done and we through a coin too :)

Worth a Stop. A nice place to stop for a drink or some food and see the beautiful fountain. Local artists playing music with the tourist just milling around. Take a minute to walk around the corner to the north side and look down at part of the original piazza with a partial arch. It was interesting to read about the chariot racing in this piazza.

Lovely square. The square is actually elliptical in shape and is lined with churches, palaces and cafes, and three Baroque fountains, Bernini's masterpiece in the center - The Fountain of the Four Rivers.
Great place, beautiful site, but very touristy. Great place, beautiful site, but very touristy. Ice-cream and vendors were many. Benches are available for people who do not sit down at a restaurent.

Nice Fountain and Piazza. The first time we entered the piazza it was absolutely teeming with visitors and viewing the fountains was near on impossible. Luckily we were staying close by and returned quite early in the morning and got some wonderful photos minus the hoards of tourists.

Nice Piazza but tons of tourists. Very pretty piazza with beautiful fountain. Definitely worth a see but once is probably enough. Were there 3rd week in June and loaded and I mean loaded with tourists and people selling stuff. The perimeter is lined with resturants but they are all very touristy and overpriced. Go down the side streets if you want to eat something. We did visit here on our first day and sat outside one of the places and had a couple of drinks. It was nice for people watching.
Mrs. Lovely bright lively place, lots of bars and cafes to sit and watch the world go by. Loved sitting by the fountain listening to the water flowing and the noise of people talking and laughing x
Lovely setting. The piazza was great place to walk around and soak up the atmosphere of Rome---the architecture of the fountains and buildings, the sidewalk ristorantes, and the music of the night.
Our favorite spot. ALWAYS crowded! Watch your wallet. Make sure to throw a coin into the fountain so you will one day return to Rome.

A top spot in Rome. The signature fountains mark a wonderful strolling, eating, and shopping venue. The art is apt to be cookie-cutter, but some hidden gams are always available on or near the Piazza.My trips to Rome are not complete without a stop here, and if you're in doubt about accomodations, go for the one nearer this Piazza

Love the fountains but that's about it. Having read about this Piazza before we left I really wanted to go there. The fountains were lovely but the restaurants were very over priced. We found a great little bar just off the Piazza where the drinks & food were considerably cheaper

Good to see. This was a great stop when looking at old Roman sculptures. It would have been nice to have more information about the sculptures that was available to read, but this may be provided on a guided tour. For us, this was a quick stop on the way back to our hotel.
Special Place. I traveled to several cities in Italy & the Piazza Navona fountain was the prettiest one. Super crowded but worth squeezing in to throw your coin in. A must see if visiting Rome.

Beautiful to visit on a sunny day. The fountains of Piazza Navona were so lovely. Even if this was a VERY Touristic place to visit, it was worth the walk over. Come and experience this place for yourself!
ALWAYS visited...... Everytime I visit Italy I cannot stop myself taking pictures of this gorgeous fountain a very historical Amazig work dont miss this while you are in ROME

Relaxing and picturesque. We got here fairly early in the day before the crowds arrived, and it was very relaxing on a sunny day. The plazza is large and extremely picturesque, with three distinct fountains at either end and the middle and the Palazzo Pamphilj presenting an imposing backdrop. Definitely worth visiting if only for a short time to admire the artwork and snap a few photos!

Piazza Navona was a little crowded because of the pilgrimage!. There were a lot of people in Rome for the pilgrimage, but that made some things about it that much more interesting. Piazza Navona was very crowded, but there was plenty of space, a lot going on, and the fountains were all clean and functioning. Love Tre Scalini!
Lovely statues combined with fountain. I highly recommend this place to visit, enjoy very nice atmosphere of this place along looking fantastic statue fountains across the square.
์Nice place. very nice place to visit this ... big place and clean if can go again I will go there hope to see very soon
Have an icevream there. It's worth it :). Yes it's commercial, yes it's crowded, yes it's worth it.Tips:Go there early in the morning.Have a gelato there.
full of life. love it every minute of the day ,nice cafes bustling pleasantly with people,street artists etc,a must visit

Piazza Navona. Loved the Roman street scene at night: everyone strolling, street performers, restaurants, shopping, this piazza is one of the best! If I get to Rome again, we will probably try to stay in this area.

History En Route!. Another great example of Roman history that was easily seen en route to other attractions within the city. The perfect place to take a bit of a break and take in the beauty of Roman surroundings. Restaurants were close by, so a bit of lunch and wine was never out of the question as well.
crowded and overhyped. if you have been to Paris, London or any other European cities, this will be a bit of a letdown. nice to visit during evening strool however

Beautiful Piazza. One of the most beautiful piazzas we visited in Rome. The fountain is striking along with all of the buildings that surround it. There were quite a few people sketching the fountain, which added to the charm. The piazza has an interesting history -- once used as a stadium and later used for naval games.
The most beautiful piazza in Rome. Not to be missed. Try to visit early in the morning before the crowds get there. And try to approach from the East.

Nice place . The most famous piazza of Rome.
Cold water . Frash and tasty .You Can drink it.
Nice place to see and Mark as checked .
Leisurely lunch. Once again ,gifted by not going to the sunny side. Fabulous service and wonderful food. Wine selection fabulous and the strawberries were minute but what a taste.

Beautiful but a Circus. Piazza Navona is a beutiful square, it's proportions are delightful, the fountains in the middle are glorious, but like all tourist attractions, it is a victim of its own fame.I am not aging that you should not visit. Just go at a time when you won't think it's crowded. When we were there, ther were screaming schoolchildren whooping and chanting, there were clowns, street musicians , bad pavement artists, the whole nightmare scenario.It really spoilt it for me, as I wanted to experience it's beauty.So go, but go before all this tat appears.

Three Beautiful Fountains. Three beautiful fountains. The two on the ends are of Neptune. The one in the center represents the four main rivers and is very intricate. You can imagine this as a meeting place for markets and friendly competitions. Now, there are restaurants all around the perimeter. There are also a lot of street performers that seem to be scheduled. While we were there, there was a Michael Jackson impersonator and a magician. There are artists and musicians. Just beware of the individuals approaching you to give the ladies a "free rose" or to sell something. Just keep walking and they will leave you alone. The Piazza is beautiful and a way to go back in time to appreciate the public meeting spaces of ancient Rome.

Lively Piazza. Lovely little "corner" of the city tucked between buildings. There were performers day and night; music, painting, dance. Very entertaining. While in Rome at least visit once. If nothing else, stop at one of the cafes for a cup of cappuccino or glass of wine and watch the fun.
Must see. Crowds again but go anyway. You are in Rome and will kick yourself when everyone back home asks what you thought. Remember to take a selfie!
Beautiful. This must be one of the most beautiful piazzas in Rome.Had a leisurely stroll around the piazza .Nice cafes and shops beautiful fountains.And dont mlss the church of Saint Agnese in Agone.

our favorite plaza. You must visit at 2 different times of the day - early AM with no crowds and in the evening when it is bustling with vendors and street artists.
Always a great time. Many restaurants right on the plaza but locals often caution us as "tourist traps"

Beautiful Piazza navona. This was a surprise finding very beautiful the fountain . In the same area was a church wonderful and beautiful.. In the square they had music and and places where you can stop and have a bite to eat. This area can be view for a good 10 minutes.

Beautiful. Friends recommended that we visit here and dine at, Tucci restaurant. As we entered the square we were hit by a magical looking fountain, music and street entertainment. It was so pretty and all I had imagined Rome to be! Busy restaurants, friendly atmosphere, amazing architecture and loved the fire eater. Just watched the world go by drinking wine and eating amazing food. One place not to miss

Piazza's Hidden History - 'Stadio di Domiziano'. Although the Piazza Navona is wonderful and lively I much preferred the history of the Piazza. Beneath Piazza Navona lie the remains of the 1st century AD 'Stadio di Domiziano', over which the Piazza was laid in the 15th century. This 30,000-seat stadium, whose subterranean ruins can be seen in a museum outside of the north end of the Piazza (Via di Tor Sanguigna) is well worth visiting to understand how this Piazza evolved from the historic arena. It's easy to overlook but it's not expensive and I thoroughly enjoyed the historical experience.

Great place, but expensive restaurants around. The piazza is very beautiful, but it's fun to sit down at a restaurant for a meal or drink. This is the problem: most places are a bit expensive. For sure you'll find better and cheaper food somewhere else, but you won't be at the piazza...

It's a fountain!. Well, a beautiful fountain.. Unless you simply adorer marble this have at max 10 minutes entertainment value. Should be seen non the less (water is powered by the ancient Roman aquadukts!)

Great place to chill and watch the daily rush. For me, this is one of the best squares in Rome (with Piazza de la Rotonda at Pantheon). Its really cute and romatic, with nice restaurants, artists and fountains. I think this is the only place that I havent met any street sellers.
A perfect Piazza with lots of restaurants.. Loved Piazza Navona with plenty of lovely restaurants. We especially loved the Piazza at night as it was lit up with artists selling arts

Beautiful piazza . When meandering around this part of Rome, there is just so much to feast your eyes upon! This is born out by the popularity, particularly when it is a glorious sunny day. This is one of the most beautiful piazzas in Rome, well maintained with architecture to admire. The fountain is the main focal point in the centre.
Beautiful spot for ice cream /Meal worth seeing. Best to visit early in day to appreciate the beauty of the architecture before the crowds arrive! Plenty of places to eat

Nice stroll. Make sure to stop by when strolling through Rome. If you come in the morning, the sun will shine on the church, so that is a better photo op. The cafes around the square are quite expensive. Good street art in the evenings (both times we went by, maybe not every day though).
When in Rome.... you have to go here. A beautiful piazza with lots of nice views, bars and restaurants. Or even just to sit and watch the world go by. Enjoy.

A pleasant surprise. This was a place we did not have on our list and found by chance, it is a very pretty square, with beautiful fountains. We were there on a Sunday afternoon and it was bustling with activity and many local people just sitting around taking in the atmosphere.

Piazza Navona, Rome. this was kind of a surprise. We saw the signs for it, and just followed them. Did not expect to see such a huge square, very crowded, 3 beautiful fountains. Very close to the Pantheon and the Trevi fountain, which was what we were looking for. Very nice surprise!
great place to sit and watch the world go by. great place to wonder round great restaurants and entertainment day and night walk to anywhere from the piazza

Romantic and relaxed. Piazza Navona is romantic and relaxed - even though we visited in peak season and it was very busy, was nice to walk around and check out all the restaurants and monuments in the piazza.
Favourite piazza . Stunning piazza, lovely fountains, and a nice place to chill in the sun with a gelato or just hang out in generally. Kept going back loved it so much.
fountains very disappointing, church of St. Agnes not remarkable. overall I was sorry I put this on my itinerary. 4 rivers fountains is small, uses little water. Figures not interesting.

Average. This is an ok place to see, fairly average with a few fountains to see.
Surrounded by cafes and restaurants so lots of places for a coffee and lunch.
Does not take long to see so it's just rated OK in my books.

At Night at the Piazza Navona. This is a beautiful space, piazza. Like many piazzas it has statues. However, the Piazza Navona has a symbolic water fountain. You can sit at a cafe or restaurant and people watch while you enjoy your favorite meal or beverage. This piazza had a family oriented feel to it. There were entertainers such as fire flame thrower, spray paint artist and singers. It was fun for the children to see. Crowds surround these performers so just watch out for pick pocket folks.

You cannot not .... This is simply one of those places that you must visit on a trip to Rome. So much going on, lots of places to eat, and great sculptures. Read up on the history and identify the places from 'that movie', and you won't be disappointed. If you're on a budget, don't eat or drink here, just go literally a few streets up and eat there instead !

Wonderful. We stayed a block of plaza, space we stayed was great. The best part is that we were within walking distance of all great sights. One of the best was Plaza Navona, I saw it early in the morning when there were no people, then at night when it was jammed. Do not miss this attraction.
Nice square surrounded by restaurants and shops. Lovely central fountain. street musicians. restaurants. shops. Good for just hanging out and browsing.

A Got-To-Go Place. One of the great attractions of Rome and a great place to experience some beautiful fountains and people watch. Sit on the piazza and watch the people while enjoying a glass of wine and some great food.

The place to be in the evening . This piazza, located close to the pantheon and campo de fiori is teeming with activity almost all hours of the day. Here you can find painters selling their pieces, usually with some type of roman motif like the colloseum or the saint Petersburg basilica. Also artist making satirical portraits or regular opens. Like all the other tourist attractions people will try to sell you laser pointers, selfie sticks and some type of flying lights. Great location fot pictures and for experiencing the evening activities!

I love Piazza Navona- great food ! Many eclectic things going on- mines- artists- just plain fun. Great little shopping. Piazza Navona- one of my favorite places in Italy. It is hip, young and fascinating. Great food, shopping- this is your place to relax and people watch!!!! Love the piazza Navona
don't miss it. just down a side street from the pantheon and not to be missed just follow the trail of people great place day or night
Great place to send an evening. Lost of restaurants serving Italian food. Great atmosphere. Lighting in the evening on the fountains and the area needs improvement
A great beauty. We sort of stumbled upon this piazza while walking from St. Peter's to the Pantheon. It is very large and serene, in spite of the many tourists and locals milling about.
Cute. I loved the whole vibe of this square. Verry pretty, a lot of street artosts which maes the square really cute at evenings

Overpriced Resturauants. I love the plaza and the activity. Music and street performers but quickly learned that food off the Piazza was generally less expensive and more likely prepared from scratch.

Beautiful Piazza. This Piazza is one worth seeking out. Likely, if you go on a tour you will make a stop here. It is gorgeous with beautiful fountains and buildings. There are many artists set up in the Piazza selling their art and working on new creations as you walk by. It is truly a great stop to make. We brought home a few beautiful paintings.
Opera. Beautiful area full of artist and souvenirs shops and we attended one of the front churches were it it had a musical evening operal one which was great experience
Place to rest. We stopped here twice to admire the fountain and people watch. Great place to rest for awhile. In close vicinity are some amazing churches that are free to the public.
Lovely quaint square . Lovely square to visit and plenty of places to eat and drink! Prices are quite expensive but that's what you get in rome! Well worth a visit

Rest a while.... Piazza Navona is all that is good about Italy and Rome. You can admire the fine buildings and fountains, you can enjoy food and drink and my favourite you can simply people watch!We had coffee, afternoon drinks and evening drinks here (not all at the same time) over a 3 day visit to Rome. Dependant on the time of day the sights, sounds and smells change. Yes you pay more at the restaurants in the square but you get to enjoy the surroundings so well worth it.
walking around rome. we weren't trying to find but stumbled upon, it is an interesting site in the middle of the city. lots of people!!
Beautiful Piazza. This is a beautiful large piazza to with many pretty fountains. Wish there were more street performers when we visited it. My kids love the street performers.

Beautiful place to take pictures and spend a great time. Piazza Navona is a touristic public square where you can sit and enjoy the beautiful sculptures, fountains and other tourists alike. This is where you take pictures that show that you were in Rome.

Best area in Rome. If you really want to feel what Rome as to offert go around this place. The piazza looks really nice with the 3 fountains. Don't go in the restaurants or café that are directly on the piazza. Just go in the little. and you will find a lot of small restaurant serving the best that Italy as to offer for a fair price !

Nice place, crowded and expensive. As usual in Rome I have to go to Piazza Navona, the monuments are lovely.To sit in a restaurant watching everything that moves on the piazza is relaxing, but very, very expensive, even for Rome.

Nice to visit, great photo ops. It was a hot day, the typical street vendors were on the side streets, away from the heat of the Plaza. It's worth the extra steps to find a place to eat on the side streets, as those on the Plaza are higher priced. A night visit is mandatory, is cooler, more vendors, lots to see.

Great Piazza. Beautiful fountains, piazza changes throughout the day. Our apartment was just 100m away, we arrived early and our apartment was not ready so we sat in the piazza from 8am to 10am, no hordes of people, enjoyed coffee and gelato obtained outside of the square. We don't usually eat at tourist traps but we were tied after a 25 hour flight. Try Domiziano's enter the entrance not on the piazza, cheaper prices. Pizza and pasta was good.
Artist's Piazza. Large piazza near the Pantheon where area artists display their wares. Numerous restaurants encircle the piazza as well as gift shops.

Beautiful to see, but don't eat here.... ...the Piazza was stunning and worth the visit. Our meal on the other hand was our worst ever and so overpriced. I would recommend a stroll through for ambiance.

Enjoyed the Piazza Navona. This was our second trip to Rome and made a point to find this fun Piazza. It did not disappoint. A great church to visit and fantastic fountains. We stopped by one of the cafes where some of us enjoyed a glass of wine and others a refreshing gelato as we people watched.
Beautiful!. Lovely area to relax with a gelato and simply observe! Evenings at Piazza Navona are the best, as several artists display and sell their creations.

Interesting...Didn't Take Much Time. We toured Piazza Navona one afternoon and saw the Pantheon, Campo de' Fiori, the Trevi Fountain, and the Spanish Steps all together...the piazza was beautiful with fountains and alive with street vendors. There was some excitement with police chasing illegal vendors...

Happy memories... Over the years I have been to Piazza Navona many times...have to say yesterday it wasn't as busy as usual..or the majority of street artists had packed up or hadn't unpacked yet..who knows...however, nice to see the unusual toy shop on the corner was still there..and the three historic and beautiful fountains are always a pleasure to see. My favourite time is when the Christmas Stalls are there.

Piazza Navona. Beautiful setting,visit the churches in the Piazza, maybe sit at one of the restaurants for a meal or just watch peoples of bye.The setting is beautiful and so relaxing, you should spend a minimum of 2 hours here.
Worth finding. We walked quite a lot to find this and it was worth it for a lovely setting and a sit down. Eating gelato, watching people and relaxing as it wasn't too busy.

Beautiful, touristic, and great restaurants. As we visited Rome, our hotel was right near Piazza Navona.It had a gorgeous fountain in the middle representing something really cool, interesting street artists and the restaurants around the square are good.We came there every night to hang, have supper, and enjoy the sky.If ever you visit Rome, I suggest finding a hotel near Piazza Navona.

Great location - overpriced bars and restaurants. Nice fountain and worth a walk through but take our advice and explore some of the side streets just off the Piazza. The bars and restaurants are better and the price drops significantly. The Piazza bars are just waiting for you - the tourist!
Great place to be. It is a great place to be, especially in the evening. People selling souvenirs and pictures, street performers and loads of restaurants.
Great place for lunch or dinner. We stopped here for lunch, so many places to choose but a beautiful setting, and where Dr Langdon rescued the Cardinal from the fountain.

Lovely Square. It's a busy tourist spot now but if you can see past the buskers and crowds, it is a beautiful square. The buildings around it are impressive as are the fountains. I suspect most of the bars and restaurants are probably not the best but it's worth visiting the square and walking through.
Nice . Read rave reviews and lots of friends recommended it however it was ok.... Restaurants aren't cheap, it was a pretty place but I wouldn't rush there.

Most Lively public square in Rome. This place was very cool. They had performers, musicians and artists everywhere, restaurants were close by. It was a very short walk from the Pantheon. We stop by here, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps within 2 hours. Great evening walk.
Not much to see. This is a VERY expensive area with not much to do. The gardens close to are nice but that's a about it. I'd skip this if I came to Rome again.

Bigger than I thought. I have to admit, I wanted to see this Piazza because of "Angels and Demons" book and film. Having seen it I'm glad I did. The piazza is long and all on one level, with a small fountain each end and a larger in the middle. The larger fountain is hollow through the middle feeding the imagination and increasing a sense of wonder. Amazing buildings all around, lovely ice cream shop on the corner.
Great place. This is a quaint little place with 3 fountains. There are a lot of restaurants and all of them offering different Italian food.

Beautiful!. The Piazza Navona was our favorite piazza in Rome. It has several ancient carvings and statues that are just beautiful. There are restaurants all around the piazza. We ate at one particular one for lunch and dinner. It was delicious and the prices weren't bad. It is a few blocks from the Pantheon and a must see on your visit to Rome!!

Lovely and Peaceful (if you miss the crowds)!. Get there early in the morning, or late at night, when the crowds have thinned out. Way too crowded to enjoy when there are 1,000 tourists. Looks even more beautiful after dark, when the lights are on.

Beautiful piazza. The ornate and showy Bernini's Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi with it's personifications of the rivers Nile, Ganges, Danube and Plate, is the cepntrepiece of this square . Font a na del Moro is at southern end of the square was designed b y Giacomo della Porta in 1576. This is a great meeting place for the inhabitants of Rome.Have an expresso or wine, or both, relax & take me in some l people watching.

One of the best places to visit. One of the best places to visit. We visited in the night to get a lights effect. Its a beautiful place and a must visit. I can't describe it. You have to be there yourself to experience it.
A beautiful location. Another must see, an exquisite square with numerous watering holes to sit and soak up the atompshere

A must visit when in Roma. We always visit Piazza Navona when in Roma even though we know it's touristy and always busy. A great place to have a drink and do the people watching thing. Great entertainment which will keep you enthralled for hours.

Great Place to appreciate Rome over lunch. - quite busy but still not as crowded
- offers a lot of dining places and a good place to find artisans works, paintings
Very nice place for a stroll . In ancient times they used to flood the Plaza and fight naval battles there, hence the name 'navona'. Nowadays it is just a big Plaza, nice place nonetheless.

Simply beautiful. I got Trevi mixed up with this one...read that review, it is for this fountain...very crowded but beautiful...I did throw a coin in but had to throw it like a baseball. Couldn't get near it. The horses are beautifully sculpted.
Not very interesting. Very large piazza. Mainly tourist shops and pricy restaurants...ain't worth the time. We didn't find it interesting.

Just sit and watch . People watching central!
A lovely big piazza with plenty around to see in shops, taste in cafes, admire buskers and see the monuments and fountains.
Expect cover charge at all cafes and kits of tourist shops selling momentos selfie sticks and paintings.
Amazing fountains. Yet another piazza to see, street performers there as well as artists showing their abilities. Nice place to just sit and people watch
the best gelato in town and coffee. a beautiful location and perfect to have a coffee and one of the best gelato in town. also great to see where the Romans gather in the afternoon
Wonderful day and night. A must see in Rome. It was beautiful at night and also during the day. We did several walking tours which both offered excellent explanations of the Piazza Navona.

Likely much better on a sunny day. Walked there for lunch after the Colosseum and it was a quiet rainy Monday. The little pedestrian streets bustling with restaurants were still well worth the walk. We ate at Est Atigiani Del Gusto ristorante and wine bar and it was excellent and full of locals. I'm sure it's a lively Piazza on a nice day.

Nice place for a break and a drink. After a very long day walking Romes roads and visiting several attractions we stopped here for a drink and a rest in one of the many cafes around the edge of the Piazza. We stayed listening to the guitarist playing for over an hour whiling away an afternoon in the sunshine. However, be warned prices after 12 midday skyrocket everywhere around the Piazza. eg in the morning a very nice cappucino and croissant was 4 eu each, good value, after 12 o'clock iced coffee is 9 eu each as is the beer. The Piazza is a lovelly oblong surrounded by churches, cafes shops and houses worth a visit just remember the cafes will charge a lot and this is one of the few places around the city where you can sit down on benches rather than having to sit in a cafe.
Don't miss the church facing the fountains.. Sant'Agnese in agone. One of, if not the most, beautiful church in Rome or the world and it is free. No photo allow.
Loved it. My husband and I didn't realise we were at piazza navona. It is absolutely stunning. Didn't know until after that theres part of the city underneath. And you can go down a stairs to see it.
Nice place to walk around. There are a lot of restaurants and bars you can stop in for a drink. Also is a good place to people watch at night.

A must of the city. Beautiful square, I have to say it is stunning in particular during christmas. During the summer I prefer to walk through the square to have a look and then sit to have a drink in campo de fiori which is very close.

A great Piazza to wctch the world go by.. A lovely piazza with a really "Roman" feel about it. The jazz musicians playing in the square were great and there is plenty of choice of really nice cafes. The fountains are particularly nice and although we didn't experience it at night, I would imagine it is a great place to visit in the evening. We had lunch here on our final day before heading home and found it a really relaxing way to chill before the flight back to England.
beautiful piazza. its beautiful and nice to hang out there or rest while taking a walk in rome streets and take photos

One of the nice piazzas in Rome. This is quite a large open space in the crowded city centre. There are lots of nice features at the piazza such as fountains, churches and museums. There was a market with painters selling their work when we were there. It's very easy to find and quite close to the Pantheon if you're planning a day exploring the city. I'd avoid eating or buying anything around this area though as when we looked it was very overpriced.

Magic Piazza. Very romantic square surrounded by beautiful buildings. The fountain in the middle with these four statues is sublime. It is nice for people watching, and if you do not pay attention, you might end up staying longer than expected. This is Rome as you have imagined the place.
A lovely place to rest. Take a rest here from one of the lovely cafes. It is one of the great people watching spots in Rome. Don't miss the church Sant'Agnese in Agone during your visit.

Relaxing Piazza Navona. We visited Piazza Navona a few times during our month in Rome. Found it to be a great place to just sit, relax, and unwind. There is street music, street artists (painters/drawers). This piazza was not as busy as a lot of others in Rome, and therefore quite relaxing. We did call in to one of the bars for a drink. The waiters are very keen to get you in to sit at a table but if you want a second drink you'll have to ask for it, don't expect the wait staff to be very attentive once they've got you in. Overall it seems a very friendly relaxed piazza.

Must visit location. Easy to reach and central, full of crowds, beautiful day and night to visit.
Restaurants nearby are pricey.
Favorite Piazza in Rome. Visited during the day and thought this piazza was nice. Went back at night and loved it! Street performers tons of people watching, streetside cafe tables...Fantastic!
Impressive. Loads of people. Good vibe. Various artists displaying beautiful artwork. Nice souvenirs. Beautiful fountains. A true work of art. Well preserved.
A nice piazza. The piazza is nice to visit but you can avoid eating here since the drinks and food are overpriced. Sometimes there arw shows in the piazza.

one of the world's best public spaces. between the fabulous sculpture of the fountains, the beautiful architecture of the church and nearby palazzos and the constant street art and entertainment there are few places which equal Piazza Navona for public spaces

Great place to hang out. I love this place. It was close to our hotel, so we hung out here every night. The three fountains are lovely, especially the one in the center. Good crowds and good people-watching opportunity.

Beautiful Piazza. This is a beautiful piazza, gorgeous fountains and loads of lively locals, hawkers, tourists, very good for people watching. We didn't eat / drink at the cafes around the piazza, as they are a lot more expensive than a street or two further back, however if money is less of an issue, an hour people watching with a pizza and wine would be extremely agreeable.

I could sit and watch for hours....... By far one of the coolest places in Rome to just hang out and observe life. So many great dining places around. Sit outside under an umbrella and have a drink during the day or a nice dinner at night. They have been better at keeping the the drove of people from selling knock off items all around the Piazza which was distracting.
The Place to be at night.. If you want to go out at night, this the place to bw, street performers, restaurant and bars. Beautiful fountains especially th e fountain of the four rivers.

Beautiful. Piazza Navona is a beautiful place with a lot of streets surrounding the square filled with different kinds of restaurants and shops.Massive amounts of tourists..If you are looking for something to eat, try going away from the square itself and go a bit further into the streets surrounding it to find better restaurants.

Lovely. Piazza navone is a beautiful square with amazing architecture
And restaurants galore which come alive at night with artists and entertainment well worth a visit

Bustling and great fun . This square was amazing. We had been walking around Rome for hours in the sunshine and wanted to sit down for a drink and some snacks and rest our feet. We found a restaurant and sat down ordering wine and some cured meats and olives then just watched the world go by in front of us. There were street performers everywhere from mime artists to acrobats and musicians. We hadn't realised but we sat there for over an hour and a half just drinking, nibbling our food and taking in the atmosphere of the square. Well worth a visit on a busy, sunny day!
Great place to visit but watch eating here. Loved walking around this Piazza but if you eat here there is an extra service charge. Wander here but eat somewhere else.

One of the best nights. Talk about atmosphere! This square was packed full of musicians, magicians and entertainers as well as amazing restaurants and bars. The phrase 'This is Italy' cam to mind because you truly get the feeling that you are in the heart of Italian culture.

Must see when in Rome!. One of my favorite piazzas in Roma. Great place to people watch. Entertainers throughout. Many restaurants. Ordered the "american breakfast" one morning and the eggs were phenomenal, sorry don't recall which restaurant but it was around €10. We always use the ATM on the north end with no issues.
A must see!. We were recently in Italy for only a couple of days and this, together with other major attractions like the Colosseum are must sees! Some great little restaurants around this area too.

Angels and Demons. This huge piazza was built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian (circa 1st century AD). This piazza features three beautiful fountains: at the north end, the Fountain of Neptune; at the south end, the Moor Fountain. In the middle, you can find the largest fountain of the three: The Fountain of Four Rivers. You might recognize this fountain as the one the cardinal was dumped into in Dan Brown's Angels and Demons. The fountains are all stunning. The piazza is surrounded by outdoor cafes and restaurants and at any given time, you can see many street performers, musicians and artists here.
Huge plaza with fountains and street performers. Great center for shopping, eating and seeing interesting street performances. Great gelato. Excellent for an evening.
Lovely square. This square gets rather busy but has a couple of beautiful fountains to look at. There are plenty of restaurants to stop off at however may be pricey for the location.
A lovely Piazza. This piazza is both lovely, scenic, big and offers a variety of shops. It's fun just to sit and watch for awhile, have a coffee or drink and relax.
Well worth a visit but very crowded. The Piazza Navona is absolutely beautiful and is a must see if visiting Rome. However, as it is a small area it does get extremely crowded.
Beautiful anytime of the day. It´s very near to Pantheon and on the way to Vatican, so we don´t waste time going to or looking for this place. Very beautiful at night.
Beautiful, gets crowded. The piazza is gorgeous, but it does get crowded. Try to see it in the morning before everybody gets there, and then see it later to people watch.
Great fountains. Beautiful piazza with lovely fountains. Avoid the resturants as they are all tourist traps, this aside taking in the beauty and people watching is free.
Piazza Navona. Location is in the center of Rome....The Trevi Fountain and many nearby gelaterias and souvenir shops. Loved it.
Fabulous fountains.. Surprised by the feeling of space here despite the volume of tourists. Fountains very grand with wonderful sculptures. A place to go for some downtime.

When History turns the corner. It is one of Rome's liveliest squares, with many outdoor cafes, restaurants and night clubs in the neighborhood.Ideal place to spend time doing nothing..You can see many artists , mostly painters displaying their work of art

Stayed on the Piazza. Stayed in a lovely bed and breakfast right on the Piazza. It was really interesting to watch the changes from early morning to evening. Dogs, runners, locals in the AM, as well as brides and grooms. As the day goes on, tourists, buskers and street performers. A must see...

Sit and relax. No visit to Rome would be complete without coming here.
Sit and relax in one of the many restaurants or cafes around the edge of the square and soak up the atmosphere
Drive around Rome. Our favorite piazza and fountain in Rome! It is fun to have a glass of wine and people watch. It is not as crowded as the Trevi piazza.

Another beautiful sight of Rome. Beautiful fountains and the church of Sta. Agnese...beautiful buildings. Lots of cafes and restaurants. A perfect place to sit and relax and admire the piazza and watch people, bioth locals and tourists.
great location. great place to visit and the cafe are really good a little expensive but that is Rome had a lovely time

Great Piazza for sitting in the sun people watching.. Scalati the best treat in the Piazza Navona a bowl of beautiful delicious ice cream,our second visit to Rome and second bowl even better than we remembered worth the high price! So go for it.
Hands down a great spot to eat and mingle. what a great area to relax, people watch and enjoy the square. lots to see and a bunch of wonderful restaurants with great food on the square....

Mix with the locals. Lovely piazza to sit and have coffee or enjoy a gelato. Lots of street vendors. My husband had his portrait(caricature) sketched here. I probably wouldn't recommend eating in any of the restaurants on the piazza it can be quite expensive. But a delightful place to sit and people watch.

My favorite place in Rome. I visit Rome many times and always come here to look at the statues the fountain and other things around. It must be popular with others as well for the place is very large and surrounded by nice restaurants. There a big white church on one side and stores on the other side. What a magnificent view.
Charming square. This is one of Rome's most charming squares. Between the church, quaint restaurants and the famous 4 Rivers fountain, this Piazza is now a must-see in Rome!!
Great piazza. A square piazza with picturesque buildings, amazing fountains(especially the one with the rivers) and traditional cafes/restaurants. The painters make the scene magical!
Grand. The piazza is a grand place with the fountains scattered about and the huge church in the center. It is just a couple of blocks from the Pantheon and worth the walk.

Large open square. We went very early one morning and found the square almost deserted. It was a bit eerie but you don't have to battle the crowds to get a good look at the fountains and statues. It is very close to the Pantheon and a very interesting walk around nearby the square. We came across a number of govt buildings with all their flags and armed guards prominent nearby.Well worth a look

Weekend break. Piazza navona is an incredible place the surrounding buildings are outstanding and the piazza with it fountains is so vibrant and comes alive at night with street entertainers the restuarants are a bit pricey but as a one off to sit and eat and watch the fun is very pleasant

Site seeing. We visited this Pazza shaped oval with a fountain in middle, some excellent restaurants around the edge. Musical entertainment appears
To be a regular event giving an enjoyable atmosphere
Gathering place at any time of the day. With the beautiful fountain in its middle, this piazza is full of restaurants and bars. Can sit and watch the crowd who is always there!
Stunning. Just recently opened after restoration and looked stunning in the sunlight. Yes its packed full of tourists, but it wont take long to sit by the fountain and throw in your coins.
Lovely but not fantastic!. Some lovely architecture and fountains. I would be highly cautious about the restaurants in this area as well as the merchants there.

3 beautifull fountains together in the midle of rome. Rome is characterized by its sources and this place has 3 of them together in a classic architecture surrounded environment. is an oasis in the midst of the hectic city where you can find hundreds of tourists visiting and enjoying the beauty of the place . there are good places to eat in the surrounding streets and you can enjoy artistic street demonstrations gather in this place.

Great place to hang out. I am rating this a five as this is a great place to hang out. Certainly a big piazza and a lot less people (or maybe we just had good timing). Sit down and admire the Baroque architecture and people qatcj as well. Try and go on and visit the Saint'Agnese in Agone chapel/church. Only a few blocks from the Pantheon.

It is beautiful but go really early or late else you'll share it with thousands.. THERE ARE BEAUTIFUL FOUNTAINS, but you share them with thousands of other people. we went back at 730am on a rainy Sunday. There were less than 25 other people there.

Coffee, relax, enjoy the scenery. Piazza Novono is old world, lots of history architecturally.We stopped to have a cappucino and some gelato!! The music was playing, the charm of the waiters.The salesmen as we watched them attract tourists to their restaurant. Amazing.We had a seat right at the edge of the restaurant and the walkway. No vehicles allowed so you could walk everywhere. Beautiful, enjoy some relaxing time over lunch, cafe, or gelato!! Best Gelato, but its everywhere just my opinion

Major piazza in Rome. Piazza Navona with it's three fountains is the center poin of Rome. This is also the place to have a dinner one of the evenings spent in Rome. There are always ongoing activities for tourist with a lot of street artist. Some restaurants are also quite nice and have good choices . The restaurant prices here are at the end not so high because they don't in most of the restaurants here have starting and additional service charges which are normal in Italy. Wort visiting and spending time.

Very pretty square with great restaurants. Good stop over touring the city. The square is a very pretty place with some good restaurants and views. The fountain "Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi" is obviously the main attraction in this Piaza. It's a very well thought out and designed fountain. I loved reading the history behind the design.
Beautiful Piazza!. This place is full of Romans enjoying peace and companionship with their loved ones. The fountains are fabulous!

Beautiful Plaza. There were many people in the plaza when we went. It is a large area. The fountain was especially beautiful. In Rome don't miss this area.
You can sit and watch the world go by.
Beautiful piazza. Stayed nearby and spent a lot of time here. Not too expensive to eat if you read the menus. Some are a rip off. We had fab pizza. Lots of people watching to do and fab fountains.

Typically tourist. Piazza Navona is a large square in Rome with nothing really to do other than eat and people watch. There are lots of street artists and restaurants and two huge fountains. It is expensive to eat there - much cheaper in the adjacent backstreets. My daughter was disappointed with the fountain which featured in Angels and Demons - it is certainly not deep enough to swim in and save someone from drowning....!!!

Rome Jun16. Navona Square (Piazza Navona) is a must on any visitor to Rome. Hope of two beautiful fountains, it is considered a cultural center of the city. Restaurants and bars line the square and allow the visitor to sit, have a drink, and watch the people walking by. We were there while traveling to the stadio di domiziano for a cultural event. Make sure you visit both fountains and the palazzi along the square
Friday night walking tour. This was one of the attractions I visited on a Friday night walking tour on June 10. Beautiful fountains.

The fountain is the centerpiece. Plaza square filled with Baroque architecture surrounds this amazing Bernini fountain, called, I think, the Fountain of Rivers. You can find a lot of plazas like this in Rome, but the Bernini makes it special. Good place ot sit and people watch and grab some food or a gelato.
Must see. Another touristic attraction in Rome that is a must see. Not much to see just a piazza with a fountain but again a tourist point that everyone should see
Stunning statue. The area was very clean (but very busy) and just incredibly beautiful. It was on my list to see, and was even better in person.

One of the better Piazzas in Rome. This Piazza surrounded by fountains and a church at the center in a nice place to sit during the afternoon during non-tourist hours. Its a good place to relax and enjoy the beautiful baroque architecture of Bernini and Borromini.
Stunning very affluent area of Rome . Lovely hotels and restaurants near here not to mention the designer shops! Stunning area to visit in Rome! True chic and very spacious

Navona Square. Antique square in the heart of Rome . During Roman times , the Romans used it for the naval battle games . How did they do? Simply blocking all of the square holes until the water coming out of the fountain filled the square ... and the game began . And you can visit a museum under the square regarding the history of Navona Square.
Loved Piazza Navona. I think this is one of the largest Piazza's in Rome. great to walk around and sit and people watch. Many restaurants that you can enjoy to the activity in the piazza.

Gorgeous!. This is one of the largest and most beautiful Piazzas in all of Rome. It is very tourist-driven, but it is a nice place to spend a few hours. There are shops, street performers, restaurants and gelato shops among other things. The apartments and churches that surround the square are beautiful.

Nice... We visited Piazza Navona as part of a free walking tour and it was really nice! I would highly recommend it as part of a tour or to visit it at night as there are a lot of restaurants near by.
Take a stroll!. This is a wonderful Piazza to take a stroll and look at local artists work. I've bought a few paintings from some of the artists in this square and it is truly wonderful!

Atmosphere. The Piazza was a great place to visit and sit and people watch. So much goes on here! There are plenty of bars and places to eat in the surrounding businesses. I imagine it would come even more alive at night time! The fountain is peaceful and all of the buskers/street entertainment and artists provided us with something to do.

Super crowded. It is a super crowded place and in my opinion it is just one more piazza in Roma. Ok, it is known as a "landmark", so you should go there just to checked-in, but don't eat or drink in that place, unless you want to spend 10 euros in a coke :)

Incredible Architecture, Plagued by Incessant Souvenir Sales. This huge square has lovely fountains, incredible churches, good restaurants, scores of painters selling wares, and more souvenir salespeople than most places in Rome. Just say "no" and walk on. It's a good place to people watch. If you want to buy art, walk around and observe carefully. Some of what you see are mass-produced copies at very high prices. Make sure you are buying from the artist.

Lovely square. Always something going on, from music the magic to artists to mimes to... well, you name it and they've probably got it. We stayed on Via del Governo Vecchio so this was just by our hotel and there was constantly something happening of interest. We didn't eat on the square - many people had warned that you get charged for the table location and we didn't even look at prices to be honest. This was great for a wander through at any time of the day or night, the fountains and architecture are amazing.Tip, if you fancy an ice cream, Frigidarium on Via del Governo Vecchio just off the bottom corner of the square is amazing and constantly has a queue a mile long but they get through the queue super-fast. If you fancy something a little more substantial, just where the Piazza Pasquino off the bottom of the square meets Via del Governo Vecchio there is Cafeteria Pasquino (not the Pizzeria Pasquino which is in the square, the Cafeteria Pasquino tucked behind it actually in the entrance to Via del Governo Vecchio). Their happy hour lasts about 3hrs, you get all the acts passing through as they come off Piazza Navona so you get the same atmosphere and it's a fraction of the price - and the food is pretty good as well!!

Pleasant public square. This square is worth visiting for the fountains and artists and street entertainers who gather there. The perimeter is lined with cafes and restaurants but frankly unless you really want to don't eat there they are really expensive compared to ones in the sides streets around it.

Beautiful fountains!. The loveliest place to sit at a roadside cafe and watch Rome passing by. Located in a quaint alley, the Piazza itself highlights some of the most beautiful architecture of the period.

Lively and beautiful anytime of the day. This is a beautiful Piazza, much larger than any of the others we visited. We didn't try any of the restaurants so cannot tell you what the prices are like but all of the buildings and statues here are lovely and worth a visit.

Lovely public place - Visit in the evening. This is a beautiful square for people watching and artists and a round or two of gelato hogging. It is much pleasant in evening when there are performers performing and artists giving Picasso and Raphael a run for their money. A few blocks walk you can visit Campi di Fiori and have Italian aperitivo, or Italian aperitif - Cocktail drinks with a snack buffet or a sumptuous dinner. It's a great experience.

Any regular square . Nothing special..usual fountain..a rectangular place with all borders swarming with variety of eateries.Again in list of places to visit but have seen much better piazzas elsewhere
Busy piazza. Very busy piazza with lots to see, street entertainers, bars, beautiful fountains including neptune wrestling a dolphin!
A NightTime Visit. Many beautiful restaurants. Would recommend to come here at night for dinner and a leisurely stroll.

Our trip to Rome. This piazza was high on my list of sites in Rome to visit and it did not disappoint. The fountains were fantastic and the space quite open and spacious. It was less crowded than other tourist sites, but again maybe because of its size. There are quite a few restaurants where one can sit and enjoy the lovely scene! There are also benches where you can rest and do the same without spending a dime. Beautiful place!
lovely chilled area. Lovely area ,street entertainers, fountains, expensive food and drink, nice area to chill especially at night

24/7. Piazza Navona is my favorite piazza in Rome. Day or night there is always lots of activity in the square. The Bernini fountain is magnificient but people watching is the BEST. This is one of the must-see sites in Rome.

Beautiful fountains. It was good experience overall. Beautifully built, but I wasn't that impressed with it. If you are nearby worth checking it out. It is a bit far away from the Colosseum and you need to take public transportation to get there.
Gorgeous. Best in the evening when the street performers were there. It was my favourite place in Rome as there was no traffic there!

Special. A special place by day and night. Worth eating at least once in one of the restaurants overlooking the Piazza although better value is found in the nearby side streets. Although not normally our first port of call, we found really interesting churches nearby (went in four at random) all very different and amazingly quiet compared with the 'big' attractions nearby. Great to wander the narrow sttreets and have a quiet drink after dinner.
Beautiful a must see. It's really beatiful, look for blue ice ice cream in the street going out from the middle of the piazza.

Nice Fountain. There are really a lot of piazza in Rome and most of them have some unique sculptures. Piazza Navona also have one unique and i would say quite pretty fountain. if you have time, you can pay a visit there. There are lot of shops and restaurant but we don't have time to stop by.

Some of the most overpriced cafés and rudest staff you'll ever have the misfortune to meet. The Piazza itself is pleasant enough, a couple of good photographs but that is it. It is surrounded by cafés and restaurants but you'd be crazy to eat or drink at any of them. The staff were incredibly rude to all the customers at the ones we passed, and the prices are extortionate, especially given the wealth of places to eat within a 10 minute walk.Get your pictures and get out, before they charge you for looking at the menu.

Piazza Navona. Love this Piazza but as all tourist areas, restaurants more expensive than little ones on side piazzas close to Navona. Just wander the narrow streets and find a quaint little neighborhood restaurant that will give the ambiance and flavor much cheaper and probably better food!

Great after Dark. This Piazza has one of the very best fountains in Rome- beautiful in the day, stunning and mythical at night. We had drinks around 11 pm at one of the restaurants facing St. Agnes and another night at one next to St. Agnes. Cigar smoking was allowed, there were a few street artists out at that time, and many people to simply just watch as we enjoyed conversation with each other.

No ATMs!. Unlike many of the piazzas in Italy, this one did not particularly have seating available. While there were plenty of eateries lining the piazza, it seemed difficult to simple sit and linger.

Lovely. REALLY enjoyed this Piazza, inspite of the NUMEROUS tourists. The fountain, the restaurants and people watching make it ALL worthwhile.
AND it changes character depending on the time of day you spend time here.
LOVED IT!

Always vibrant. If you want to see beautiful fountains, exquisite architecture and a cross section of international travelers, come here. There are churches, museums, street vendors and performers, artists and restaurants. An elderly man was singing And little children were dancing around him - what a joyous sight. Enjoy.

Great Place to People Watch. Fantastic place to visit and watch all the action. Many restaurants with great seating to view all and people watch. Can only vouch for Bernini's which had very entertaining waiters but very good food and service.

A must visit. Our hotel was a 3 minute walk to the Piazza. Tons of places to eat and drink. Beautiful fountain. If you go to some of the side streets off the Piazza you'll find shops and more places to eat away from the crowds.

Day or Night. The piazza was just around the corner from our VRBO apartment. We were there during the day and at night and ate at a few of the restaurants there. The fountains are beautiful and just a wonderful place to relax and take in the Italian culture.

Night life. Me and my wife went to this Piazza every night for 3 nights....the night life is incredible, fun, artistic and a must!!!
Go there!!!

Nicest Piazza in Rome. We visited this Piazza with our tour guide and were very happy that we did. Large, plenty of restaurants and beautiful. When in Rome, do not miss this location and have lunch in one of the many restaurants.

Bring a camera. Came here and was surprised to hear so little of the plaza. The two fountains are beautiful! I came back at night, and the lighting wasn't the greatest. The plaza is surrounded by restaurants, a great place to take a break from walking. Prices are about $15-$20 a plate. I would definitely come back.
Fountains and people watching. We went by these beautiful Bernini fountains on two days while strolling through Rome. Great people watching little outdoor restaurants nearby.

Piazza Grande. Very large and beautiful Piazza - I might have been tired when we walked around it and sat by the fountains but wasn't as blown away by the setting as I had been by the Trevi Fountains and other smaller and more intimate Piazza's - take a look of course but best viewed as part of just plain wondering around rather than a destination in its own right.

Most Beutiful Piazza!!. I have seen almost all Piazzas in Rome.. Always thought that Piazza Epagna is the most Beutiful Piazza but my favorite is Piazza Navona... Visit the Piazza also at night.. very beautiful sight!! Restaurants and great atmosphere
A beautiful square. This area is really beautiful, and I wish I had spent more time here. You can get some really good photos and views here.

Too much, too noisy, too many people. Piazza Navona is just too touristic - with to many tourist-trap-restaurants. But if you just a short walk in to the charming alleys you will find a lot of the romantic roman atmosphere and good food.
Not the best attraction. Somewhat disappointing. Big piazza with lots of people. Unfortunately one of the fountains was being repaired.

Great photo ops!. Two years ago it seems there was mor going on in this piazza. The fountain is majestic. Several restaurants on the perimeter. It is just steps from the Pantheon piazza which seemed a little more lively, with music and another terrific fountain.
Highlight of our Rome trip. Crowded, colorful and fun. Lots of restaurants and things to see. Worth a visit when in Rome. The fountain itself is only one aspect of Piazza Navona.
My Favorite Piazza. Great place to people watch. Sit and take in the culture. Watch the tourist. Listen to the music and check out one of the fine restaurants. Best in the evening of course.
Bellissimo. Looking around the piazza you will find many restaurants or you can gaze at the lovely statues in the fountains otherwise visit one of the churches. Beware of pick pockets when busy

A beautiful square. Spent a lovely hour one afternoon, sat at a restaurant having a drink and people watching. Went again at night time when all lit up very nice. Had some lovely ice cream and of course pestered by the usual street sellers.

Great Piazza but there are better. This Piazza is (i think) the biggest in Rome. Having 3 fountains and many places to drink, grab a snack or sit for dinner/launch. However, I was very dissapointed from 2 things: 1) It was empty of crowd and didn't had the magic like in other fountains. 2) In the night the fountains in Rome look different and deliver another charm and effect than in the morning but here it was very dissapointing and even dull.But of course a must visit.
Beautiful. We came around 1 or 2. The area was a bit crowded, but was able to get close and see the water statues.
My favourite piazza. Three fountains, a stadium shaped square, a charming atmosphere (at night), painters during the day. ❤️ must visit when in rome

Perfect Lunch Spot!. We truly enjoyed this piazza. It is larger so it isn't overwhelming crowded.The Four Rivers Fountain is located here and a couple of other fountains. Based on a recommendation from a couple we met on a tour, we had lunch on the patio at one of the restaurants and enjoyed people watching (including a wedding) and just the atmosphere. Of course the restaurants prices are a little higher but well worth the scenery.

Beautiful. This is one of my favourite places in Rome. It is very pretty, you must go visit. Coffee and restaurants around the piazza are very expensive. But one or two streets away there are cheaper and great places to eat.

My Favourite Piazza in Rome!. Piazza Navona is a wonderful place to spend the evening. The structures and fountains are interesting. The piazza has lots of artists in the centre and you can buy artwork there. The buildings surrounding the square are colourful, well decorated, and have cafes and restaurants. I really enjoyed my time here!

Beautiful piazza with marvellous fountains and delicious ice cream. Worth a visit, this is a beautiful square, containing three stunning fountains, two by Bernini. It is famous also for its ice cream.
I never get tired of going here!!!. how can you not love Piazza Navona! A memory to be made there for sure! Just walk around and enjoy it!

Beautiful Piazza with fountains and many places to dine while experiencing life.. Just one of the must places to go when in Rome. The fountains and sculptures alone are worth the trip and the dining and people viewing is a big plus.

A place to be. Piazza Navidad is a public space surrounded by fine eateries and shops. The open space is decorated with merchants and entertainers. The piazza is a highly visited attraction as it has hosted theatrical events and other activities. Be it night or day, tourist will find activities to keep them entertained.See pictures below of a local entertainer (Pictures by Naji Images)
A wonderful palce on a beautiful summer's day. Beautiful fountains, and the cafes are a great place to relax and take it all in. Don't miss out on the Cathedral either.

Beautiful square - Tourist trap. Go see it. It is one of the great squares in Rome.
Avoid the tourist trap cafes for anything other than a drink. Prices outside are 3x the normal price, and the food is not good.

Artists and fun neighborhood. We stayed at an Airbnb in this neighborhood and really enjoyed this area. It's very convenient and close to all of the touristy spots so we could walk everywhere. We liked seeing the artist paintings in the square and just really liked the vibe overall. Lots of restaurant options and Carrefour express nearby.

It is a Piazza. It is a piazza; with restaurants; lots of them; all trying to make you eat there. Our restaurant served very average pizza. Yes, you can people watch but it is not really a 'go to' place.

The largest square? . This elongated square was the place to see artists at work. We wandered around looking at their work having bought a print on a previous visit. Certainly worth a look if you are in that part of the city.
A very elegant,beautiful Piazza. We stopped here on Segway and appreciated the three beautiful fountains and the Piazza, an elegant space full of lovely cafes. A great place for people watching.

Great place . Good to visit and relax for a while soaking up the atmosphere, beware of prices of the restaurants around we asked for these before eating as some were very high! Not including service, cover , vat charges etc
amazing. Piazza navona was amazing really. It is very beautifull and very peaceful. Me and my husband was there in April and was very romantic and sunny as well.

What a great place to eat and take in the sights. This gorgeous piazza, we believe was featured in the Angels and demons film was a place we definitely wanted to visit. We enjoyed some beers and had our pictures taken by the three fountains.

Good for people watching. An impressive square with the usual eateries around the edges. The fountain in the middle is a good place to just sit and watch the world go by. One of the places in Rome where the original fountains, buildings etc looked to be relatively untouched by time.

Another must see area in Rome. We visited during the day and it was slow, quiet and very picturesque. We visited at night and it felt more romantic with a lot of places to get something to eat and watch the street performers. Same place seemed like two different places when the sun went down. I would definitely recommend seeing it both ways.
beautiful. what a great adventure and Piazza in a nice place to sit and people watch while enjoying pizza and gelato

I love this Piazza and its atmosphere. I have visited several times in the past and always am a little awe struck when I enter the square. The statues, the restaurants (expensive) and the physical size are amazing. The flowers and creeping plants on the walls along with the throng of tourists is exciting. A must see place in the center of this beautiful city.
Beautiful Piazza with many people. We walked to Piazza Navona from Hotel de Minerva. The Piazza was filled with tourists as well as eateries, statues, and artists.
another center!. it is another center of Rome leads you historical places. At Piazza you can see statues, fountains, museums, cathedrals!
Beautiful square.. As the title says, beautiful and a great place to walk around. Just beware of the restaurants surrounding the square. They'll badger you to come in.

Lovely end to the day. We finished a day tour of Rome by ending here for dinner. This was a lovely spot to find somewhere to unwind and have a wine and a meal while watching the passers-by. When the sun went down out came the pedalers- selling shawls,wraps, scarves and glow in the dark toys but a simple no thank you generally kept them at bay.
Great place. We had a whole day there admiring the three amazing fountains and the church. Very nice cafes and restaurants around the place. It's only a 15 minutes walk from the metro.

Angles and Demons strikes again. If you want to see the sites used for Angles and Demons, you will want to visit this Pizza, but as you will see, you cannot believe everything you see in the films, one it is never quite, two the water is not 6" deep, and three they do not let you get too close the edge you can push trolley into the water. There are bars and restaurants around the edge, but they charge a premium for their location, better to go just outside of the Pizza.
Beautiful fountains!. It's always great fun to visit the Piazza Navona. Beautiful fountains, lots of shopping opportunities, and fantastic people watching. What's not to love?

One of my favorite places in Rome!. Great place to people watch. There are several restaurants in the area to enjoy either lunch/dinner, coffee, wine/appetizers. Sit back and enjoy! You'll find vendors at times, mimes, musicians and lots of "carabinieri" protecting the locals & tourist. (Easy on the eyes).It's a large Piazza so expect lots of people.

Better every time I visit. They are still working on the Palatine and so there is something new to see and appreciate every time I go. It is wonderfully a evocative place. Take a book and spend the day soaking up the atmosphere.

not much to see other than tourists!. Heard about this site, but not much to see. If you're not in that area, don't bother walking over! Clearly a tourist trap. All restaurants there were extremely overpriced. Not much to see, other than more tourists!

Fantastic...... This is an awesome place to soak up the culture..... in the evenings
there is always something going on....music, fun shows, art exhibits.....and late friday saturday nights it can be really packed
lots of restaurants in the area and just a fun vibe...

Piazza navona. A great social bustling lively place that has many restaurants and shops. Very beautiful and a good place to propose (I did). Lots of beggars to be wary off. Some of the best restaurants can be found in the parallel side streets. Lovely place.

Just a large square to take some nice photos. It has 3 fountains in the Piazza (square), with the centre fountain which is the most impressive with its many fine stone cravings. There are many street cafes surrounding the square so as to enjoy your Italian coffee and watching the tour groups go by. The main fountain is good for a few photos but not as impressive as the Trevi fountain
a classic. Amazing fountain, amazing statues...the water flowing is very refreshing in that very hot city... maybe you can meet some people randomly...

Visit Sant Agnes di Anone church in Piazza Navona. The inside of Sant Agnes' is stunning - don't miss it. The Piazza is very pretty. The only blemish are the hawkers - whilst the Nepalese/Asian lads are plentiful, they are mikd mannered. However, the attitude of some of the African hawkers are very aggressive - placing 'free' carvings in our kids hands and then asking for money, in a very intimidating manner (I am a big bloke by the way) by invading your space and staring from about 3 inches away was not nice. We refused and simply put the 'freebies' on the floor, but we saw the same guy doing the same thing to a family the next day and he was getting money. All I'd say is do not engage with the African guys, unless you have a penchant for carved tortoises :-)
Beautiful piazza. This is the place we come back to every time we visit Rome. It's easy to wander the tiny cobblestone streets around the main piazza for art, apparel and ambiance.

Great atmosphere. This has got to be one of the most attractive squares in Rome. I was lucky enough to visit with a knowledgeable friend as a guide who was able to tell me about the Bernini sculpture representing four different rivers on four different continents. Despite being a very popular place with many visitors it didn't seem overly crowded because it is a very big space. There are varied things to see, including some quite bizarre street theatre, and plenty of attractive-looking restaurants but I was advised it's better not to eat here as they are pricey. My friend took me to see many places in Rome, and this was definitely one of my favourites.Just as an aside, I've tried to review one or two lesser-known churches, including Luigi Francesi, which has a wonderful Caravaggio painting in it, and beautiful gilding and marble throughout, but I can't find it as an attraction on TripAdvisor. These places are worth a look with their wonderful artwork and architecture, and they are quiet and cool, which I have very much appreciated after the heat and bustle of Rome.

Love this Piazza in Roma. Its such a lovely Piazza and very famous, so its a must see whilst in Roma. The Navona fountain is lovely and the cafes surrounding the Piazza are very nice. Great spot to stop for a meal or a coffee.
Lively and big square. Big lively square with fountains and lots of bars and restaurants to choose from. The church is worth popping into to see the roof. It is stunning.

Piazza Navona, a must see. This piazza is one the famous places in Rome. It is well preserved and has a festive atmosphere. There are many restaus around; and just to sit around the piazza is already enjoyable.

Great place to stroll around. 3 great fountains to look at and a lovely church near the centre. Worth vising at night also, to see the street performers. Save some money and look for pizzerias etc in the alleyways behind the Piazza.

Beautiful, large piazza with a gorgeous central fountain and smaller side fountains. Rome is filled with piazzas and fountains but Piazza Navonna is special. First, it is a very large open space, ringed with restaurants, shops, and cafes, filled with street performers, street vendors, and tourists. The central fountain is one of Rome's most beautiful, and there are side fountains as well. It is a short walk from the Pantheon, and not far from the Campo di Fiori market, on the 'walking trail' that strings together some of Rome's most important sites. It's not far either from the bridges over the Tiber into the Trastevere. Definitely a 'core sight' and very worth seeing. It's also a great place to sit awhile and watch the show.

While away a couple of hours!!!!. You have to experience the nightlife in this impressive square where anything could happen! Beautiful landmarks, wonderful bars and restaurants and street entertainment!! Great fun!!!!
Quick walk through. Fun bustling area that is not too far off the path when wandering between the Pantheon and the Campo Di fiori. Lots to watch and see. Vendors. Cafes. Tourists.
A fine fountain. Easily missed as quite hidden so worth looking out for it. A vibrant place with plenty of people watching opportunities if you just want to watch the world go by.
Piazza Navona. While the restaurants around Piazza Navona are touristy and slightly overpriced it's worth the atmosphere and you won't be disappointed.
Pictoresque. Here you find many artists and handcrafts, and all the streets with small restaurants. There tou find the 2 fountain and an obelisc with makes this place very distinctive
Gorgeous square. Loved the atmosphere here, lots of people and restaurants - these were however more expensive than others just a couple of minutes away.
Rome has a ton of fountains. There are so many fountains you could visit in Rome but this one is a must see. Fantastic and lots of restaurants in the streets behind Piazza Navona.
My 50th. What can i say ..i could have sat here people watching for hours ,with its street performers and beautiful fountain one of my favourites

Rome in a nutshell. The review title is a bit of an overstatement, but whether it is daylight or after dark Piazza Navona captures the essence of this diverse and wonderful city. It is an active urban environment full of people. A wonderful fountain provides a focal point for the space.There are shops and street vendors, restaurants with piazza seating, informal entertainment and art shows. You can walk and explore or sit and watch the parade go by. It's a relatively large space, yet it can feel very intimate, especially in the evening. And if you feel like you've seen enough of the Piazza, there is so much more to explore on the surrounding side streets. There is obviously so much to be explored and appreciated in Rome. For us Piazza Navona, is the perfect initiation to that exploration.
MUST SEE!. This is a MUST SEE piazza with the fabulous fountain and the gorgeous buildings in this square. This is another must see attraction in Rome.
Beautiful square bursting with life!. Full or shops and restaurants, the church on the square is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen, but not unique for Rome.
Good place to chill . Excellent location to visit, to take pictures and have some beers with the loved ones ;)! The fountain in the middle of the square is really a spectacle!
amazing architecture. what was an old stadium now called piazza navona. easily missed if not attentive. good thing we were with our bicycle guide.

Imagine all the things that happened in this Piazza!. A lovely and vibrant piazza to spend a morning, an afternoon or an evening. There are always people around and even more benches to rest your tired legs while taking into the beauty of the space. Lots of lovely restaurants and gelateria around to satisfy your tummy!

One of the largest Piazzas in Rome!. When in Rome you must visit the various Piazzas and chill there for a while to be able to appreciate them. Piazza Navona is one of the largest Piazzas in Rome. It has a huge sculpted fountain in the middle and all around you have space to walk around, take pictures and visit the various performance artists and painting sellers etc. On all four sides the place is packed with restaurants. Sip on a nice brew and just enjoy this place, you can spend a couple of hours here easily!

Nice piazza!. Happened to walk by it without noticing but it was a nice surprise. The atmosphere was great and it is a lot less crowded than the area near the spanish steps. Didnt have much time to explore but first impression wise its good! Would come here again if there is an opportunity.

Best place to experience Italy and Rome!. We kept returning to the Piazza Navona because we loved the restaurants nearby and the shopping was amazing. I got my son a pair of Italian shoes for a very reasonable price.
WOW. What a fantastic place to stay is Rome with unbelievable sites wherever you go. Love Rome and this Piazza was amazing.
Incredible fountain. So many aspects of this fountain worth finding out more details about each aspect of the fountain as it is very interesting.

Rome Visit. While in Rome we had the extreme pleasure of visiting Piazza Navona. The fountain in the square is one of Rome's nicest and there appears to always be live performances in the Piazza. Overall a must se for all sight seers. Also lots of fine places to eat around the square.

Great Fountains, street fare and people watching!. Make sure you get to Piazza Navona - It's a huge Piazza full of life, great bistros and people watching. Always activity there. We enjoyed the fountains and sculptures. Many street artists gather there - musicians, too! A great place for long lunch!

A tourist trap in the most delightful way. Piazza Navona is beautiful.
