From the apartments and hotels that surround it, to the Sant'Agnese in Agone church, to the fountains, Piazza Navona is a treat to the eye. It is lined with numerous restaurants which all prove to be mediocre and slightly over-priced, but it may just be worth it to sit and watch life go by in the piazza as you enjoy a glass of wine. The piazza is beautiful by day, but cannot be beat at night. The fountains and church are lit, the street performers come out, and everyone just casually strolls around as if they have nowhere to get to...ever. Come out at night to see the Michael Jackson impersonator and fire twirler. Sit on one of many benches and just relax. This is the perfect place to just sit and watch people. Definitely bring gelato. I will say that Piazza Navona has become a tourist trap. As I stated, the restaurants are not the best you'll find in the neighborhood and essentially charge for the view. Venture two blocks in any direction to find superior dining establishments. There are also street vendors everywhere trying to sell art prints, toys, souvenirs, and anything else. If you let them bother you, you won't enjoy Piazza Navona as much. But, in reality, they aren't a bother. They aren't overly persistent and tend to concede with a mere "No, grazie." Some of them even add an additional hint of charm to the already charming piazza. This is without a doubt a can't miss destination while in Rome.

Just sit for a while and watch Rome go by. This can be bustling with people and music at times, but can also be very relaxing when most of the crowds have dispersed in late afternoon and before the evening restaurant crowds arrive. It's a great place to admire the fountains or just people watch.Bear in mind though that you will pay over the odds for sitting at a restaurant on the piazza and cheaper (and better) food can be found by moving a street or two back from the piazza.
nice place. A wide place to perform different acts such as looking at different artists, or even walking in the piazza. A recommended place to visit.

Amazing Views and Culture Galore. We sat at a restaurant with a glass of wine and soaked up the atmosphere at the beautiful Piazza Navono. There are street performers and lots of tourists and its a great atmosphere to soak up

Great Views.. A very impressive Piazza, the largest I think in Rome and very picturesque, although the restaurants are pricy ( You Pay for the location obviously) nice atmosphere, the food in most of the restaurants is quite samey! but its worth a visit.

The WOW feeling!. >Wow gelato ice cream at the entrance
>Wow crowd
>Wow statues and fountains..though too old and some broken or cracked..but they are magnificently designed and detailed.
>Wow street artists
>Wow ambience
...A life time experience....and you will go WOWWW!!
Great location to click....and get clicked!
PS: Beware of pickpockets !

Babyorsetto, Quiet and Cosy, View on Piazza Navona! VRBO Listing #421795. VRBO Listing #421795My wife and I stayed at this apartment from 3 to 6 June 2016. Only 2 and ½ days, this was not long enough. This place is absolutely perfect, very clean and well equipped. On our arrival day our host showed us around and gave us a few pointers to be able to avoid the tourists’ traps. To get in the apartment, you take the elevator to the 4th floor and walk back down 1 flight. The elevator stop on the 3rd floor if you want but wrong apartment. This place is 10 to 25 min away from any of the attractions you may want to visit, depending on how fast you walk. If you read the property description, everything is right… There are restaurant all over the city and of course, the owner is providing a list of the best places, restaurants and what not to mist while you are in town which is a very nice touch. There is a grocery store at one minute away and all kind of stores where you can buy food if you want. The pictures you see on the web site is was you can expect to see when you are there. After a long day walking around the city, you may not feel like sitting at a restaurant table where you pay you beer 6 euro…. You can sit on the sofa of the apartment with your shoes off, drink the beer you paid 1 euro at the corner store and enjoy the view, after all you live right on the Piazza Navona. Once you close the patio door, this place is very quiet so you can have a good night sleep in the comfortable bed. Mickfer
Nice square. It is a nice square with the italian feeling. You can drink a coffee or eat a cake or pasta on the terrace meanwhile you can see the wonderful buildings and churches.
Can't be left alone. Such a beautiful place! Too bad you can't enjoy it without being harassed by someone trying to sell you something... =/

Pure beautiful . So last time we came to piazza navona it was a quick trip and little time to truly appreciate it. This time we stayed in Rome a night before our fight back come. There is so much history in piazza navona people don't even know. Example how it used to me the stadio domani. Basically piazza is built on top of it. The three fountains honestly are flawless. We had dinner there at night. I wish the fountains were lit up more even use solar lights something to showcase the gorgeousness that is the Neptune statue. Also please make all the people selling the flying crap go away. Fine sell something cool like the painting but going around selling pointless thing basically is a bother. I LOVE piazza navona.

A Must See When In Rome. If only to see Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers then you must visit Piazza Navona. A very busy place this year so try to get there early so you can then work your way back to see the Pantheon and then go all the way to Trevi. Piazza Navona has two other fountains with one at the top and the other at the bottom of the Piazza. In ancient times Romans went there to watch the games and is in the shape of a stadium and can accommodate large crowds. Good restaurants are in the Piazza and a taxi stand and tourists info place is at the northern end.

Extraordinary fountains in this beautiful piazza.. Go early in the day and spend time delighting your eyes and feeding your soul with the wonderful creativity of the three fountains. Stroll around the piazza, taking in the ambience!

My favourite Piazza in Rome!. Love the atmosphere here...street entertainers give an added interest, especially at night time. Enjoying a lovely evening meal whilst hearing a string quartet in the background, made our wedding anniversary extra special. The four rivers fountain here is stunning, and although it's not quite as grand as the Trevi, you can walk all the way around it without the mass of other tourists filling Trevi Piazza. The Paizza also has two other fountains, both worth your attention!
MUST VISIT. A giant fountain in a small piazza. Too good. Admission is free to the public. I recommend going in morning since evenings are always very crowded.
Lovely Roma. Plenty of Romans and tourists alike meet here, making it a great place for people watching. A classic, beautiful plaza at the very centre of Roma.

Cool area. Cool area with lots of restaurants and bars.
Be aware of pickpockets tho! (Like everywhere in Rome but more so in the crowded areas)

Sights, Music and People Watching.... Piazza Navona is a perfect place to go and see the sights, hear the music and drink a little wine.... Piazza Navona is surrounded buy cafes and restaurants. Some perfect spots... Come, sit, drink a good wine and enjoy some food and the Piazza Navona.

Love it!. We always seemed to migrate back to the piazza Navona no matter where we went in Rome. It's really beautiful airy and bright. There are a lot of restaurants around the piazza at which you can eat and watch the world go by but you pay extra for the luxury of the view. Although we did this once, we preferred to buy some gelato from a nearby shop and eat it by the fountains taking in the scene. There is always something going on in the square from entertainers to artists and it takes on an impressive quality at night when the fountains are lit up too. There are lots of eateries, in the little streets off the square which are very good. Definitely worth a visit !

Different kind of music, street artists and cultural buildings around the square. A lot of different restaurants around the square and also bustling activities such as street musicians, artists and many tourists. In the alleysnext to the square you also ca find many restaurants with different kind of food. Some tourist trapsand some really great with nice service.
Good place for food and touristic interactions. And, of course, to take pictures! Rome breathes art, and that is incredible, it's an open museum everywhere, and this place isn't an exception!
Really pretty. Very crowded, understandably, what a lovely site! Water is very clean. Lovely atmosphere. Bit like Trafalgar square in London
Beautiful at night. We visited Piazza Navona at night with a guided tour....what a beautiful place and great for photos.

Great place to people watch. Piazza Navona is surrounded by restaurants that basically all the same. You just have to pick the one you like best. Because it is touristy, the prices are a little more expensive. Beware at night, there are hawkers selling fancy (but cheaply made) flashlights and things you shoot up in the air that glow.
I wish I lived here. Piazza Navona is always amazing with its fountains, flowered attics and cafes full of tourists. I could go there every day and never get tired, it's a jewel in every way
Navona. We loved this area! It was like a small community, very nice and enjoyable! Our favorite restaurant was Saltimbocca and favorite bar was La Botticella.
Fun area. Had a really great meal and a beer here just off the piazza. lots of cool little shops restaurants and gelaterias.

Look great after the restoration!. The last time we were in Rome 8 years ago, the 4 rivers fountain was under restoration and covered by scaffolds. We were very impressed with the restoration and the beauty of the sculptures and fountains.
Stay away from the restaurants in the square, there are much better options a few streets away.
Highly recommended!
Beautiful. Lovely place to sit and watch the world go by loved the foundation and the details on the sculptures
Beautiful piazza. Wonderful place to sip a coffee and just look and take it in. Lovely and clean area. Go early morning if you can, and then in the evenings

Such a beautiful place . A large oval piazza with impressive buildings, three awesome fountains and some of the best, if not the cheapest, places to eat in Rome. Especially worth a trip in the evening when it has started to get dark as the fountains are even better when lit up.
Nice Piazza. This is the square to see in Rome (with Piazza Espagna in work). There are a lot of bars and restaurants around and a lot of artists on the piazza itself. It gives you a flavor of Rome.
awesome!. had not been here on earlier trip to Italy...so much to see! Visited as part of a tour group, but had time to take in the gorgeous fountain
A classic. Relaxing, great atmosphere, a nice place to relax , because of relatively large size , dosnt feel over crowded.

Wanted to give it a "2" of 5. On a previous visit, Piazza Navona seemed a marvel: large open space, grand marble water fountains, approachable artists displaying and creating their art, lots of outdoor dining surrounding the piazza.What changed? Being constantly approached by hawkers of all kinds of trinkets whether we were walking on seated on the edge seating of the cafes trying to eat dinner. We actually moved from an edge table to an interior (still out doors) table to get away from them.I know Italy and all of Europe have taken in many foreign refugees. I understand they have to work somewhere and just hope they aren't all being exploited in these activities.
Feedback. It is so nice to take a stroll in this square. Many restaurants with a view on the various fountains

Great family adventure in Italy. When in Rome, one must go to the Piazza Navona and see the magical fountains and the artistry of the place. It is such a good place to walk around/observe the current artists and then stop off for a terrific gelato!
It's a piazza. I am not sure about the hype about this piazza. It used to be a stadium, that's interesting, but now it's just a piazza full of dear ice-cream shops and plastic sellers.

Beautiful place to enjoy the Roman Atmosphere. After my visit in Rome I came across a phrase that said "One does not visit Rome, one discovers it" and Piazza Navona is the perfect example to fit the meaning of this. With its restaurants and public music its a magical place to enjoy even so more at night time.
One of the best squares. One of the best and biggest squares- full of activity and craft stalls etc. Its surrounded with expensive residential buildings...in the high end area of Rome.
Active with Culture. The area has plenty of monuments to check out, lots of food and artists in the area. It was good to walk around and enjoy all the life here!

Another interesting busy piazza. Piazza Navona close to the Pantheon is a bustling area with lots of cafes and restaurants. Like most busy tourist areas in Rome it has a charm of its own. I'd recommend taking one of the narrow streets off the piazza for restaurants as they one we dined in was very good and not as expensive as those on the piazza. The fountain was a must do photo opportunity.

Beautiful fountains, and LOADS of vendors!. I'm so glad we went to the Piazza Navona. They had exquisite fountains there and lots of vendors selling their wares. There's also a toy shop at one end that has a Pinocchio statue outside its doors. You MUST pop in there and check it out.

Visit early to enjoy at it's best. Walked into the Piazza after visiting the Pantheon as it is close by. The square is huge and the fountains and buildings within are stunning. the church of Sant' Agnese in Agone is one church not to be missed either, the interior is breathtaking.Visit early to avoid the crowds.

Cool but overpriced. A pleasant Piazza to walk around which has street entertainers and many restaurants. The price for a typical pizza is €16 whereas anywhere else in the city it can vary from €8-12. However, Piazza Navona has a kind of Venice vibe to it which is worth a visit.
gorgeous!. this is another of those surprising beautiful spots in ancient Rome. Definitely worth visiting if the weather is nice.

It's pulsating with life. What can one write about such a place ! It's so so alive and gorgeous that one has to ensure that you spend some time here. Can't put it down in words, just go there and feel the energy! It's bubbling with life, a memory you will cherish forever.
Beautiful square.. Beautiful square to visit with lots of entertainers. Don't eat there though as very expensive, go down the road!

A Plaza worth the visit.. Piazza Navona is one of those places in Rome, where if you haven't been there, you haven't seen all Rome has to offer. There are three incredible fountains that pretty much command the piazza. The piazza itself is lined with cafe and gelaterias worth trying. there are street performers, painters, and musicians. A great place to sit and relax.
Loved the vibe!. Restaurants, old world, amazing fountains - this was a great spot to sit or stroll, and soak in the atmosphere. Plenty of room for everyone!
So much fun!. Nice piazza with lots of action - shops, outdoor dining, fountains. It's a true Italian experience. Perfectly safe to visit anytime day or night.

Beautiful!. Lovely piazza with amazing architecture/fountains
Worth reading ahead so you know what you are looking at
There are some good guide books and also great videos on YouTube
Lovely area but expensive in the nearby shops
On a beautiful day this is a beautiful place
Beautiful public space. Piazza navona is a beautiful public space surrounded by Buliding and featuring and oblisk an the fountain of 4 rivers in the center This was once an old Ariana.
One of my favorite spots. Great for enjoying an afternoon stroll, watching the artists and other performers, listening to live music, eating gelato or sipping a cup of espresso!

Not sure what the fuss is about. It's a big piazza with a water feature and a long row of bar/restaurants service horrifically overpriced drinks to tourists (we sat down, asked the prices, and left). Do have a walk around, but within a stone's throw from here you have a number of different, far calmer squares with drinks that don't cost a fortune.
Fun!. Lots of activity and places to eat and drink. Watch your wallet, but otherwise a good place to stroll. Easy to get to and a taxi stand at one end. Plenty of security at night.
Swing by to sample the eclectic nature of Pizaa Navona. If you are after a quaint piazza with a selection of small, quaint shops and to enjoy some music and a quiet sit down, this is for you.

Fantastic at night. Only went in the evening after the sun had gone down, and it was absolutely marvelous to see. There were a crazy number of people there, but it was not too hard to get to the front after waiting a bit.

People watching and entertainment. Either during the day or at night there is always some kind of performance or event to observe. My wife and I have sat in the piazza relaxing in the sun and watching the artists. The performances are always fun, we saw both a magic show and a pyromancer. Great fun :)
Stunning Square lots to see. The fountain has lots of sculptures to look at. The square itself is pretty and clean. There are many restaurants and cafe for you to enjoy.

Quick and awesome!. A sight you have to see but the best part is there are no lines and you don't need a tour guide! Bring some coin to toss in just don't do what I did and throw it from a distance. I almost hit someone with my coin.

Bad timing. The first time I visited the Spanish Steps it was filled with people relaxing on the steps and shopping in the piazza. This time the steps were under construction and there weren't many places to relax and hang out.

Good people watching piazza, except.... Many times this place is packed. We went in Mar & May 2015 and both times it was full of touts - be careful. There is a nice toy shop, Berte, on the southeast side of the piazza, plus we really enjoyed a shop just a couple of doors north of the toy shop, L'Artigianato, for some nice souvenirs.

gorgeous. nice to walk the piazza every day living nearby..start with the breakfast at coffe places and having dinner at night is one of the best time of my life .you dont think anything else but only about Rome please

Busy, but expensive square. We had our first drink in the city centre on this square. We were quite surprised to pay 9€ for only 40 cl of beer. We thought we had a very expensive trip ahead of us, but fortunately this was the most expensive drink during our stay. Later, when we did a guided tour of the city we found out that this square is actually the most expensive area in town and the guide also told us that the food is not even that great there.Although I would not advise this place for a drink, you should definitely go there during your stay in Rome. There are several artists on the square, there was a clown performing a few acts and we even heard an opera singer. In conclusion, go there for a walk, but go somewhere else for food or a drink if you don't want to pay too much.

What's not to love about this ... except lots and lots of tourists. This is a great piazza: great history about the fountains, lots of people watching and some restaurants.Though typically packed w/tourists, it's a large square w/room for everyone.

Spectacular piazza. The fountain has a most interesting explanation, so do find it out if you visit this lovely, large piazza.
Lots of artists and music to aid the atmosphere.
We ate just off the piazza where there are many small and cheaper restaurants.
The church of St Agnes is closed on Mondays, so we need a return trip!
nice place to just chill and have a good meal. Big plaza with nice view of the fountain. Although its crowded, its nice to just sit in a restaurant and watch people paint, sing etc.

A favorite. Piazza Navona allows you to be a local. What I mean is, take an hour or two to devote to the location. People watch. Sit on the bench and really soak in the history, architecture and ambiance of a great Italian piazza. Grab a gelato from one of several stores in the immediate area and browse a couple of the shops. It's also a great place for a lunch but you need to beat the crowd by about 30 minutes or you'll never get a table. It's our favorite Piazza in Rome, and that's saying a lot because the selection is so great.

Great square with awesome history. Standing in the Piazza Navona amongst the thronging masses can detract from the amazing beauty of the place. I would recommend going early morning or perhaps later in the evening when it is possible to find a little serenity to contemplate on the fact that this was once a great arena for Roman chariot racing. You can feel the history emanating from every stone and can begin to imagine what it may have been like 2000 years ago.Whilst you are there, have a look in the fountain of the four rivers and try to work out how Dan Brown managed to get a Cardinal tied in a chair fully submersed under the water... Writers artistic license I think it's called!

another wonder. This fountain we came across by chance as we were just taking our time wandering up and down the alleys, and roads, but another great fountain lots of people here, still took a few photo's

A gret gathering place. Piazza Navona can be quite hard to find, even though its a large open space, its a gathering place for torists and sellers alike, from cafes and bars to local artwork, its a place not to be missed.

Love the atmosphere. A great place to sit and watch the world go by - whether over lunch or coffee and ice cream. We went to Tre Scalina (there are now two following some sort of disagreement) and had a very tasty lunch. The Piazza is spacious and the fountains are beautiful. Lots of tourists.

Nice place to pass the time of day. Lovely if busy square with artists and restaurants, allow yourself to chose where you want to sit and eat as some of the restaurants can be a tad pushy, but its a lovely place to watch the world go by, ignore the guys trying to sell "selfie sticks" you will be asked 100 times by as many different sellers at all tourist areas throughout Rome
Beautiful Piazza. Buzzing piazza, is a must to see and beautiful fountains! lots of photo opportunities - also lots of nice eateries around the square.
Beautiful square . One of the more beautiful squares it's worth a sit down for an ice cream or a snack. Can be more expensive here though.

A lovely place for people watching. One of our favourite spots in Rome. Very busy and touristy, but great to sit with an ice cream and watch the world go by, often with street artists in the evening for added entertainment. The restaurants which line the piazza are quite expensive, it may be better value to venture down a few streets to find something cheaper. The fountains are rather fun and worth looking at in detail.

Don't miss this place. Lovely lively square, lots to see. Music and performers are here day and night. They are very entertaining and do not bother you for money. The cafes are good for a drink and to people watch, but the cafes off the square are cheaper and the food is better quality.

Good place to relax a little from all the landmarks. This is a place to relax a little after you have visited a lot of other sites full of architectures and cultures. It is among the liveliest place in Rome with a market place and a lot of shows. You can just linger around and buy some souvenirs here. Or you can just stand by to watch some shows. You can also enjoy the fountains in middle of the square. And, I believe, this is place where one of the most important scene in movie "Angles and Demons" was filmed.

Wonderful, Historic..and yes a few tourists. Piazza Navona is a must see place while visiting Rome. Walking distance from The Vatican, Tiber River, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Campo de' Fiori, etc, etc. Beautiful space filled with history dating back to 1st Century AD. Bernini's Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi is a personal favorite.Much discussion is made about the tourists, crap vendors and expensive restaurants..Pay it no mind and enjoy the wonderful architecture, romantic ambience and the AMAZING people watching! If you meander off a few blocks on the northwest side of the square, you will find a few great areas not totally penetrated by the masses. Have been here many times and will always return.
Crowded. A beautiful place, but can be very crowded and be aware of pick pockets. Popular to toss coins in the fountain.

A pleasant atmospheric square in a lovely area of Rome. An impressive square centred around an obelisk and beautiful fountains, surrounded by cafés and restaurants, and with a variety of buskers entertaining all around. It's busy, but large enough to be able to find some space. We visited during the day, and again at night, and whilst it's not as well lit at night as we might have expected, it's still a charming place to walk through and stop in, day, evening or night.

One of the many Fun Piazzas to Visit. Navona has so many fun things to offer from the street entertainers, the fountains the buildings surrounding the area and of course a lot of restaurants. If you are wanderung in this general area then you should go there.

Not impressive, unless you know the history. We were hopeless lost, wandering the streets of Rome, when we came into this Piazza. Fortunately, had read about it and knew the significance of it. It's a very nice piazza with fountains, street artists, musicians, and tons of cafes (mostly geared toward tourists). We returned on our last night in Rome to have a cocktail at one of those cafes and had a very pleasant time.
Fantastic atmosphere . This piazza had restaurants on both sides with the waiting staff "touting" for your business! Sitting eating here is fantastic, people watching a must

Pretty Piazza. By average, I mean more typical Rome. Wonderful place to spend an afternoon, but better in evening with street performers. Cafes Surrounded the piazza. Typical of what I saw in Rome, however, was lots of street hawkers, garbage etc

Tasty ice cream, nice fountains, a bit touristy. During a 3 day trip, we came here at least 6 times. The plaza seemed to always be in the direction of where we were going. There was some wonderful ice cream on the plaza, which we got twice. We also sat down for drinks in one of the usual tourist trap restaurants, which was actually ok. For sure worth a visit. Watch out for people trying to sell you all sorts of junk!
Crowded but Cool. This place is packed with tourists and guys selling watercolor paintings. It's worth swinging by on your visit to Rome.

Lovely but only tourist food on offer. This location is splendid! It's got 3 fountains / statues and a heap of restaurants around the edge. The one we tried was very average !This is a great location close to a hop in hop off bus stop but is quite walkable too.

Large, airy piazza -heart of ancient city. Piazza Navona is a huge Roman space built over the shape of Domitians' Stadium. Great place to relax during the day. Also recommend getting a capuccino , at Ristorante 4 Fiumi (the 4 Fountains)or other restaurant and people watch. The Fountain of the Four Rivers (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi) is by Bernini. There always seems to be some activity there, particularly people in costume, but be careful they may want tips for photos. In the heart of the Ancient city, the Centro Storico.

Beautiful square in the heart of Rome. Stumbled across this square whilst walking back from the Vatican and we couldn't believe how beautiful it was! Will definitely be dining in one of the many restaurants here when we return to Rome
A beautiful sight. Every corner in Rome has something special to offer. The Piazza is no different. A great place for taking photos or selfies.

Beautiful Set of Fountains. Its very worth your time in going to this site. There are plenty of fountains within Piazza Navona and the square have plenty of restaurants around wherein you can eat and enjoy the whole place.

Great people watching!. Get a seat at one of the tables and watch the tourists stroll, the street performers, the hustlers, the artists. You'll pay a little more for your food/drinks for the prime real estate, but it's worth it, especially in the early evening.

Beautiful. Admire the architecture, pay for expensive drinks to people watch. The fountains are very impressive but some of the more interesting things are the street performers and how they interact with people.
Great for dinner or a drink!. This is the busiest piazza and very beautiful. There are several restaurants here and a great place to relax and eat or have a drink.
Great place to stroll and people watch. Very close to our hotel and a place we found ourselves going to many times to stroll, eat, and enjoy the sites.

Nice place to walk through. Piazza Navona is a very interesting square to visit, it is crowded with tourists and had a lot of artists who can draw a caricature of you within three minutes for 10 euros. The square also has some street performance actors and musicians. Piazza Navona has three fountains, the one in the middle is the Fontana dei Quattro fiumi, or the four rivers fountain, which was built in1651 by Gian Lorenzo Bernini,

Interesting and good for people watching . An interesting place to stroll around the piazza. Plenty of walking tours going around but easy to avoid them. Again there are many places to eat around the periphery. Three interesting fountains to sit by.
A Magnet. The square graced with the Bernini Fountain of the Four Rivers draws all the crowds day and night....Lively spot anytime of the day ..A MUST SEE!

Know the history. My favourite square in Rome. Realise that the piazza was once a stadium and imagine yourself being here about 2000 years ago. Then take a close look at the fountain and the church. The church was built by Borromini, the rival of Bernini who was later asked to build the fountain in front of the church. To express their rivalry, Bernini decided to make two of the figures on the fountain face the church. One of them covers his face, the other one raises his hands to protect himself from the church, like it will fall down on him.
Beautiful. With an elaborate fountain and an obelisk, this is a great place to take stock. We wandered here after exploring the Jewish ghetto and were quite charmed by the first piazza on our trip.

Favorite piazza, Bernini fountains and friendly cafe owners. This beautiful square is central for any walks around Rome and is perfect for sitting, resting, people watching and enjoying a great coffee. Some cafés have cheaper prices before noon.

Cool place to just hang out. Piazza Navona is a great place to hang out, especially in the evenings when the artists come out to sell their art and the performers and musicians entertain the crowds. Several good restaurants line one side of Piazza Navona, so tasty eats are close by. The fountains that reside at Piazza Navona are truly awe inspiring. It's a great place to sit, chill, and people watch. I really enjoyed hanging out here.
Very touristic. The piazza is big and really nice and always crowded. However, its very touristic, the restaurants scattered on the piazza are nice but more expensive than other restaurants in rome.

beautiful plaza, but prices are way too high in the caffe's. Honestly, it was so crowdy that we did not get a good look at the fountains at all. Tried catching place at the caffe near-by, but we saw prices of juices and ice-cream, decided to have a take-away ice-cream cone and take a walk around the square instead of sitting at the table, difference is about 3 times pay less for take-away and since we were a group with child with us, the difference was quite big. What I did not like is a big number of beggars on this plaza that are so persistant, even if you do give them couple of coins, they still insist on more. Loved the plaza and the fountains, but will definitely visit it early in the morning next time when hopefuly less people are around.
Grand setting. Large piazza. Great for lounging at cafe and watching people and soaking up Rome. Near pantheon so can easily do both free of charge. Many cafes to lounge at and relax.
Wonderful place in the evenings. This place is excellent place to just sit and see the great monuments created. The place is buzzing with activities and people so you get a great experience
Nice place for a stroll. It's one of the favorite places in Rome for a walk with many dining options around and it's in the center of action with many historical sites around

People Watching central. Come day or night, and it's always lively full of tourists at cafes, street performers, musicians, and artists! Good spot for a meeting point in case you are lost. Explore away!
Lovely Piazza. This Piazza and fountain are not nearly as crowded as the Trevi fountain. It is a lovely place to take pictures of and then get lost in the street of Rome.

A people watching paradise. I love Rome it is one of my most favourite places in the world and within Rome is he piazza Navona. In the daytime it is packed with tourists, lots of people head here from the cruise ships so if you can avoid the area between 10am and 4pm it is a much more enjoyable place to be. The evening is when the piazza really is the place to be. So much going on and a real buzz about the place. Eating and drinking does carry the price tag of a popular place but it's worth it for the experience
great open large piazza with fountain and long history. Was a race track long long ago and is now a delightful place to visit any time of day. Drop by before your leave Roma.
Disappointed. So busy when we arrived and could not get close enough to see it properly.People everywhere and it seemed smaller than we expected.

Do yourself the favor and stop for a coffee in Piazza Navona. So gorgeous, it is the perfect break to stop and have a coffee or refreshment in Rome. Nothing like sitting in this picturesque square sipping coffee and enjoying gorgeous Rome weather.

The happiest place on Earth?. People smiling and laughingKids running amok Artists doing their thingFake statues amusing usArtists displaying their worksMusician playing softlyAnd it's all for freeFeel depressed?? Come here and all will be forgiven!

Street artists and fountains. Follow the crowds to this large plaza with three fountains (thanks to Bernini). There will be street artists, children playing, and families enjoying the piazza on a sunny day. Some nice shops in the small alleyways leading into the piazza, too (avoid the touristy stalls!).
So crowded!. Felt a little crushed in the crowds but the sun was out. Great bucket list item to see but had preconceived picture of a more spacious and open area. Worth seeing.

Great location to sit for a drink for lunch!. The views are great and lots of entertainment and activities going on in the center of the piazza. Sit at any one of the restaurants there for a drink or lunch and just enjoy the sites.
Big Piazza with Sidewalk Cafes. This piazza is near the Pantheon and has many shops and sidewalk cafes and places to sit by fountains and rest.

Perfect location. Our apartment was just steps off of the piazza and it was a perfect location. The piazza is not only beautiful, but surrounded by lovely restaurants, cafes and bars. And within blocks there are even more. Very safe and beautiful area within walking distance to many attractions.

Absolutely beautiful however, I would recommend eating elsewhere and beware of street sellers. My husband and I stumbled across the Piazza when walking to a nearby deli from our hotel, we didn't know about it beforehand and are pleased we came across it.The Piazza is beautiful with stunning fountains and excellent architecture of the surrounding buildings.There are several persistent street sellers who approach you repeatedly and this can be very frustrating, taking the shine off the experience somewhat. We ate at two different restaurants on the Piazza (see separate reviews) and found them to be extortionately priced, particularly for the quality of the food. Although the experience of eating in the Piazza is quite pleasant it's unfortunately not worth the price and I would therefore recommend eating elsewhere.Still, not to be missed, I would recommend a walk here.

You wanna EAT and REST. This is the place to eat and rest. Wonderful square with three foundatins. I will comment on the restaurentas seperately but Trie Scalini and the mushroom risotto is out of this world
Truly Rome!!. A magical piazza to wander around, admire the sculptured fountains or simply to sit with a beer and a pizza while watching the world, in all its diversity, walk by.

Love it every time!!!. This Piazza is one of the most beautiful in Rome! Having been to Rome many times, it is always as beautiful as the first time I saw it - breathtaking!! The fountains, sculptures, buildings, cafes and the people in the piazza create an energy like no other! Do yourself a favour and stop by the piazza - In fact walk through it often- you will love,it every time!
great people watching. the plaza is great but go around the corner to the south east and see the lovely museum on the excavations underneath, well worth to see where the piazza came from

Stroll, look at the amazing fountains and stay awhile. After you get your fill of walking around the fountains, check out any shop you are interested in, find an outdoor spot and sit to people watch. I enjoyed the Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini. We found a nice lunch place, sat outside with our snack and wine. Afterwards, picked up a gelato and strolled back the other way.
100% Romang awesomeness!. The sheer size and scale 0of this piazza can't fail to disappoint. And go inside the church Saint Agnese in Agone.Wow! Just awesome. Go.
Very crowded. We went on a Saturday night with some find of political rally going on in Piazza. It was very crowded and noisy. It was hard to find something special about this Piazza and fountains.

No Construction or Covered Work!. All the fountains were up an running, first that's happened on a trip to Rome in ages. Great restaurants around the piazza, good food and people watching. Could do with fewer wandering minstrels!

Magifico. As with a lot of public spaces in Rome, the best idea is a pre-9am visit. Tie it in with a post breakfast coffee and you'll get unfettered access to this beautiful piazza without the weight of numbers.
Very nice. Very nice piazza. It's free no need of a tour for this place. Is sometimes pack but you can get very pretty pictures

A Must Visit When in Rome. A large square circled by a number of over-priced, mediocre restaurant. But a great place for an outside table and people watching. Order something basic (Pizza), a Chianti works well, and then just sit back and enjoy.Just so you know, the larger fountain in the middle of the Piazza was where one of the vey important scenes was filmed from the movie "Angels and Demons" based on the book by Dan Brown.

Loved this place -- great people-watching spot. In the weeks before our trip to italy we constantly checked in with live webcams at various places we were going, just to check on weather and what people were wearing. Our favorite was the one looking out at the activity in Piazza Navona. So we liked the place before we even left the U.S., and could hardly wait to visit in person. We just loved it! We weren't able to stay long but long enough to appreciate the atmosphere & why this popular square has been a meeting place for centuries.

Lovely spot to visit. The largest and most impressive of the piazzas in Rome I always stop by for a visit when in town. It's a great spot on a walking tour of the city especially coming back from the Vatican over the river via Sant Angelo bridge. Built on top of the Staduim of Domitian, it is large and in the shape of the stadium's open space. Lined with restaurants on the outside (be careful, the food is hit and miss) and lots of artists in the center between the two fountains. A great place to watch the world go by.

June 2015 & December 2015 we visited!. Words seem inadequate when trying to describe the most beautiful of Italian piazzas. The works of art, which are fountains are breathtaking and the Egyptian obelisk...what can one say??!!? Interesting both times of the year in which we visited. The artwork sold during the evening was remarkable and we sure love that which we purchased. Absolutely "a must" for those visiting Rome! Beautiful, BEAUTIFUL!!!!!
Ita ok.. I must admit i didnt spend much time at this location but however it still is a nice place to visit. Its a bonnie( beautiful) place to visit.

Lots of things to see.. There was a lot going on when I visited with different groups set up displaying their talents. I loved the water area in the middle. We didn't stay very long because it was about to rain.
Must visit...no charge..... This open air space is one of the largest piazzas in Rome, aside from Piazza del Popollo. The fountains and obelisk are impressive.
Very beautiful. A very peaceful place even though its full of tourist, lots of cafes & shops around the area.nice to take photos & toss a coin in the fountain.
The Culture on the piazza. The fountain and monuments between painters on the one side fo the square and the rest culture sphere on the other side make this place unforgetable!
Nice fountains.... A gorgeous place to visit, with it´s beauty and history. In the piazza many good restaurants to have dinner..

A stadium with a difference. This piazza retains the shape of the original stadium which was there in the first century. The piazza is dominated by a church and has three fountains - one in the middle and one at each end. It is filled with cafes, restaurants and ice cream parlours. The full length of the piazza is difficult to describe. The original stadium was said to hold 33,000 people, so that gives some idea of the scale!

Lovely Square with Beautiful Fountains. Piazza Navona is a lovely place with two wonderful fountains and lots of places for lunch/dinner - not to mention several gelato places, including one with tartufo (truffle) gelato.

Worth strolling by during the day. Go back for dinner.. The Piazza Navona is a beautiful Baroque piazza, worth strolling by during the day to see the Bernini sculptures and taking some pictures. We walked through with a tour guide, which was great -- if your budget allows. She was able to point out the interesting features of the fountains. They have a lot going on and it made the experience more meaningful.I highly recommend that area for dinner. Away from the piazza is a maze of narrow cobblestone streets with bars and restaurants. A lively place to go for a drink and then dinner. There were people everywhere, so make sure you have a reservation.

This is one of the most famous piazzas in Rome.. This is a magnificent baroque square that is elliptical in shape. Currently it appears to be very trendy, upscale, expensive and a happening place. The piazza has three fountains, Around the edges of this piazza, one can find cafes with outdoor seating. Tourists and locals seem to flock to the area. I am glad I walked there to see this piazza, but it was not some place I wanted to linger at or return to.

a lovely plaza.. There are 3 beautufil fountains in the square. if you saw Angel & Daemon(da Vinci code), you probably know there already. lots artists on the square, fine restaurest, tourist, take a lots photos from both end, graet view, relax. enjoy the beauty of Rome.

always beautiful to see. we went on a sunny day & the crowds were heavy. The plaza is a large rounded rectangle w/ a very large central fountain by Bernini that represents the four continents that they knew of. There are carvings that are a delight to see in the open. We went again at night & were disappointed because they were not lit up.
stunning. both fountains are stunning. It is a very busy area and you may need several attempts at taking photos. Well worth a visit
Another Beautiful Piazza.. I love wandering around the wonderful Piazza Navona imagining I have a small apartment there overlooking the wonderful fountains and artists gathered there.

II had visited Rome several times .Now the fountain was been cleaned but isn spite of thet was great.. One of the beautiful spots to visit , take pictures, selfies etc.Rome is beautiful and this is one of the wonderful spots.
great plaza. this is a don't miss plaza the history and history of games that were played there. the fountains were striking as well. the food what can I say but great and more please
Amazing fountains. This is such a beautiful plaza!! Gorgeous fountains!! A must on any visit to Rome!! Sit in a restaurant by the fountains and enjoy a glass of wine!!! Awesome!!!
Love the Piazza, Hate the selfie-stick pushers. The fountains in this huge piazza are a must see! It's a lovely place to stroll through with a gelato.

Another beautiful Rome attraction.. Come here during the day to go in the beautiful church of Sant'Agnese and to see the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of Four Rivers), then come back in the evening to experience one of the many restaurants situated around the Piazza. Wonderful atmosphere.

Divine!. I could spend hours sitting in Piazza Navona and soaking it all in. The fountains by Bernini, the crowds & ambiance are awesome. It is my favourite hang-out place in Rome. We had a caricature done of the whole family @10 bucks apiece.

Lovely Square. It's a very live and beautiful square. There are lots of restaurants located around the piazza. They usually are few euros more expensive than the regular ones but hey you'll be having you dinner in an area with constant activities. It's certainly worth a visit.

Pleasant to wander. This is a lovely square to wander around and take in the artwork and architecture. The restaurant waiters will try to pull you in but they are pleasant about it if you say no which you will need to again and again! Be sure to venture into surrounding cobbled alleys where you will find much cheaper tiny cafes for lunch
So typically Roma.. Great place to people watch and maybe get a glass of wine or a coffee. Would probably skip getting a meal here.
Piazza Navona. Lovely place - could stay there for hours. Had a great lunch at Bernini restaurant. We came back again and enjoyed it just as much

A breath of fresh air!. Piazza Navona is literally a breath of fresh air in what can be a cramped and crowded part of the eternal city. The wide open space is welcome relief and the cafes surrounding the square provide a great place for some people watching, if being a bit on the expensive side. The piazza normally has several street performers on the go and is surrounded by interesting shops.

Ancient yet modern. Great place to revisit Angels and Demons, which was shot here near the Fontana dei Quottro Fiumi or the fountain of the four rivers. It's beautiful and the obelisk adds to the mystique. The open space is indicative of its being built on the stadium where earlier games were held. Lots of eateries and tourists just laze around here.lanes off the open space have some good places to eat.
Has a buzz but for me over rated. This is a busy square with a number of cafes and typically increased prices.Suggest you take a short walk away from the square for more cafes, shops and ice cream.

Still nice despite the hordes.... Too many tourists and restaurants and bars very expensive; worth it for the Bernini fountains but go off-season if you can as atmosphere is spoiled these days by hordes of tourists.

Bellisimo!!!. I absolutely adored the Piazza Navona! The fountains are beautiful and people watching from the little cafes was lovely! We found a small outdoor cafe next to the centre fountain which had lovely, friendly staff, amazing Prosecco and a lovely atmosphere. We went back 3 times (even though everything is slightly more expensive on the Piazza).
Wonderful trip. Everyone needs to go to Rome, at least once!! There are many churches to visit around here, plus restaurants and gelato!!

The most beautiful Piazza in Roma!. This is by far my favourite place in Rome. Stunning Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (fountain of the four rivers) by Bernini in the centre of the Piazza with lovely smaller fountains at either end. The whole Piazza is surrounded by lovely restaurants, our favourites includes Tucci and Tre Scalini for Gelato.There is always a wonderful atmosphere and vibe to this Piazza, created by all the musicians and artists and enthusiastic Italian waiters.Do not miss this stunning Piazza!
A Beautiful location for a glass of wine.. I love Piazza Novena for people watching...I am not sure you should eat there very overpriced..but sit and have a cola or wine and enjoy the view.
Good resting place. Specacular fountains, obelisk original from Egypt i suppose, but for us it was resting place between pantheon and st angello castle
Expensive bars, but. Navona is a lovely place to sit and rest a bit, so if you want to do so, either sit on the stones or pay 4 euros for a coffee.
Beautiful. The most beautiful piazza of all tourist attraction piazza-s in Rome. Nice location - close to the Pantheon, beautiful architecture around the piazza and beautiful fountains.
People watching fun. Love to sit at a open air cafe and soak in the atmosphere of the parade of visitors and admire the local artists showing their creations.

Little piece of sanity in the madness. Just when a day on our feet was getting too much we stumbled into Piazza Navona. A great space, busy but calm and relaxed. Plenty of artists displaying their work, some quiet space to sit by the fountain and enjoy a gelato in the sunshine whilst resting our feet. Not as 'historically significant' as many of Romes sights, but well worth a visit to break the often relentless pace of seeing Rome in just a few days.

All this culture is overloading me. Yet another fantastic sight of a square, the classic buildings, the amazing sculptures making up the fountain. Just the spot to rest for a while lest the culture is getting too much or perhaps the place to stroll through in the evening.
Very charming . On of the most beautiful plazas, don't miss a visit of the church. We loved the ambiance with the street musicians and the cafés nearby. Perfect for pictures

Wow. So much detail on each part of the fountain.There are so many vendors around the fountain-so be careful.A must see.Nice to stroll at night enjoying a coffee or gelato. Many restaurants surrounding the piazza.

Nice square, but probably not on must see list. I have been here several times and you can never tell how many people will be here. Sometimes it is so crowded you can barely move. This trip there were very few people there. To me, it is kind of fun to just let yourself get lost and stumble upon the square. We past many shops and churches we would not have seen if we followed the map straight there. I would not recommend eating here, as you will pay a lot and get tourist quality food. Be careful of pick pockets when crowded. The fountain is quite beautiful and you can always take great pictures here.

Beautiful Piazza. Piazza Navona is one of my favourite squares in Rome. It is always extremely lively and great if you enjoy people-watching :-) It is surrounded by many local Italian restaurants where I would definitely advise you to have a drink. In the middle of the square there are a couple of beautiful fountains and there are normally lots of painters selling their art. I never miss going there when I am in Rome and I hope that you will like it as much as I do!

Amazing building and fountains. We were traveling on the local bus and saw this place were there were a lot of people. Decided to check it out and were pleasantly surprised to find this piazza with the fountains and statues - Others obviously like this place to judging by the crouwds
Wonderful Square. This is a wonderful, open-air square with fountains and restaurants and cafes around the outside. Great place to relax and catch a drink or snack.
It's classic Rome. This is classic Rome. Come here, wander about and look at the fountains. Read your guidebook. Sit down and drink at least half a bottle of wine and wish every day was like this.

Visit to see Bernini's fountain of the 4 rivers. Bernini's fountain representing 4 fountains is the centrepiece of this Piazza and the main reason for visiting. Free to do and a great stop on a walking tour of Rome.
Crowded and Touristy. It's fine for a glass of wine and people watching, but you can find restaurants MUCH with better quality and value in the streets outside of the piazza.

Not very interesting in Rome, but nice fountains. I walked a lot to reach this place. It has nice architectural buildings surrounded by commercial hotels etc. what I liked was the 3 beautiful fountains, which attract tourists
Great atmosphere. Great atmosphere! Perfect place to relax rest and watch the world go by, but I would not recommend eating here unless you want overpriced average food.

Intering fountains and art works. Another cultural sight to visit on your walk through this part of Rome. Take the time to relax by the fountain. Also take the opportunity to admire the artists' works on display and maybe get your portrait done.

Piazza Navona is an authentic taste of Italy!. Our hotel was only 3 blocks from the Piazza Navona so we walked over there every day. What an authentic Italian experience! Everything you'd want.One day we sat at the outside cafe, having lunch and enjoying the music, fountains, artists and tourists. There are many places to buy gelato - and just walk around and eat it.Watch the local artists as they paint, and admire their talent and artwork,Enjoy the spontaneous musicians, mimes and magicians.A photographers dream - local color galore.No admission as it's a piazza - by the same token, restrooms are only in restaurants.Lots of people, so photos of fountains without people in the way are next to impossible
Our favorite piazza of all. The elliptical shape, the fountains, especially the four rivers one, the surrounding buildings, everything.

when in Rome... yes! the Piazza Navona and its famous fountain are sites not to be missed. A visit to Rome is incomplete without a short stop at the piazza Navona - enjoy the view splash your friends and grab a gelato from one of the nearby gelaterias! It's a great place for photo opportunities and a cool respite from the summer heat.

Gorgeous fountain!. Central Roma piazza with centerpiece fountains surrounded by small hotels and tourist restaurants! Often very crowded with tourists taking selfies, sometimes an art fair is set up. Should not be missed, at night there are musicians playing guitars, violins, sometimes a flutist. Fun place-but can be too crowded

Make your visit short...... The Piazza Navona is just a place to take a evening stroll thru, sure there are fountains, but there is also lots and lots of people, and of course the tourist trap restaurants/cafes my suggestion would be walk thru.
Beautiful statues everywhere. Certainly a place to people watch along with enjoying all the beautiful statues. Kind of in the middle of everything. Don't miss it.
Very detailed and impressive. As this is so close to the Pantheon, it would be silly not to visit. The wealth of detail in the buildings in this again awe inspiring.
Nice for a stop. Great fountain, lots of space, good location to get to other sights. Worth seeing although no need to stay long.

Beautiful piazza. This is the most famous piazza in the whole if Rome and definitely worth a visit. There are 3 fantastic fountains in this huge piazza with restaurants all around. A great place to sit with a bottle of wine and people watch. Not the cheapest place but the ambience is fabulous.
Worth a trip. A lovely piazza and there's some nice restaurants but typically for a tourist area they can be expensive and there are a lot of street traders. Great place to watch the world go by.

Quintessential Rome. Make sure to hit this place up!!! Beautiful day or night. Restaurants and boutique hotels everywhere.
Neptunes fountain is stunning!!

Beautiful Piazza. This is a must visit with 3 beautiful fountains and a mass of eateries. The Piazza is huge with all sorts of entertainment. go in the day and again in the evening when there's quite a different atmosphere.

nice fountain. This is a nice piazza like most in Rome. It does have the four river fountain and street vendors. There are also benches to sit or simply stroll. Many of the cafes also attract tourists.

Great place to people watch!!. Piazza Navona really has it all, the incredible fountains, great cafes, wonderful gelato stands and is a great place to sit and people watch. It never fails to entertain.

Great walk trough, nice restaurants surrounding the square, nice pictures. Walking round the piazza with ice-cream or having a great pasta plate in one of the restaurants. Great place to take pictures
Wonder of the world!. A most visit when in Rome! Incredible architecture that will blow your mind! Make sure you bring some wine to enjoy while sitting there!
Long weekend in Rome. Interesting Piazza with musicians and artists. Beautifully decorated church(free) and interesting fountain. Worth a walk around but take it in with the Pantheon.

Great Piazza, must go there. For everone who comes to Piazza Navona there is Pizzeria near to the Piazza. Go to buy great pizza and a very tasty one and walk at the Piazza with pizza in your hands u will look how much fun it can be. U can feel the Italian talk each with other and enjoy in one of the best attractions at Rome.

FAVORITE PLACE IN ROME..... We never miss a chance to go the the Piazza Navona when we are in Rome. We just love the vibe of the piazza. It's great just sitting at one of the great cafes for a bite and taking in the beautiful fountains.
Large piazza with amazing architecture. Many people around the piazza, amazing and large architecture and fountains. Worth a visit if you're near the Vatican.
Large piazza with amazing architecture. Many people around the piazza, amazing and large architecture and fountains. Worth a visit if you're near the Vatican.
A very nice Piazza. A very nice and big Piazza. Always an activity going on. the fountains are beautiful. Especially the in the middle. I recommend the lasagna at Dolce Vita.

Beautiful but watch the price list ... I passed through on a bike tour & was determined to return, which I did on a rainy night, with a friend. We were keen to have a glass of wine & take in the atmosphere of the Piazza, so we did. However the bill was pretty exorbitant for 4 glasses of wine we could have had a whole meal & bottle just a block away. Didn't make too much of a hole for us but it's worth noting for budget traveling. The piazza is beautiful.

Best to go early in the morning or later in the evening. The Piazza is packed with tourists during the day but is a very nice place to sit in the morning or evening. There are many inexpensive cafes on the side streets nearby.

Great Park for People Watching and Gelato. Great place with lots of life around (artists, a small market, lots of nice shops around the piazza). Great gelato places surround the area and the side streets are really nice to walk around as well.

Interesting Piazza. The place was crowded but had very interesting restaurants. Also, as it was spring/summer the flowers over doors and windows and on balconies were in full bloom with lovely colours
Wonderful part of Rome . It's a busy square in the heart of Rome. The artistic value of the 2 fountains is great and the attractions gets a placing in the must see places in the city..

Stunning. Rome has such spectacular piazzas, and even if you've seen them before, you'll be thrilled to see them again. They're great for relaxing and people watching. Romans love to grab a drink and sit around a fountain enjoying it while catching up.
Nice place to visit . We walked around Rome taking pictures and as with most things you see the size and beauty of the structure was incredible Did not go in but plan to before we leave

Everybody goes. Really everyone goes to see the three fountains and your are near some many other great areas.. love to shop the great fashion store.. 2 streets away; churches abound and there is great outdoor sitting with coffee or wine while people watching.

One of the longest and nicest piazzas in all of Italy. Although Italy is jam packed full of Piazza's lined with shops and restaurants, Navona is one of the best. It is longer than most and has amazing sculpture fountains on both ends. A must see while in Rome.

Nice to visit and grab a bite and people watch.. Interesting square with beautiful fountains but on a hot day would probably be less pleasant. Viewing the wares by Local artists and market stalls is great way to spend a couple of hours. Worth the visit.
Crazy crowd scene.. Kind of a Times-Square-New-Years-Eve experience. Insanely packed with people but obligatory. Threw coins in the fountain and all that.
Large and less crowded. The palazzo is enormous, there are a couple of fountains, and it's less crowded than some of the other piazzas. Food abounds, more hopping at night.

Just passed through. We just passed through on our way to other sights. Too many Street sellers selling / pushing tacky selfie sticks, hats and roses. It became really tiresome by the time we got to the far end.
They would make the experience alot better if this was monitored.

Ok... just a big square to me. I did not spend much time here. It seemed boring compared to the rest of the city. The sculptures around the fountains are something worth seeing, and also if you have time to eat at Culdesac. Other than that, I would spend my time elsewhere

Much smaller than we thought it would be!. There really wasn't much to see at Piazza Navona and it was smaller than we thought it would be. Probably the biggest downside was that all the restaurants seemed to be serving the exact same thing (pizza and fish). We were looking for a nice steak so we left the area to dine. Probably could have skipped this attraction.

Lovely Piazza Navona. I loved all the piazzas in Rome. They are beautiful and huge. It's quite difficult to take a good picture because there's always people in the way, but that's just apply for every single atraction in Rome.

A great place to wind down your Rome vacation.. My wife, daughter and I went and spent a great afternoon there. Drinking wine in one of the many outside areas. Watching the performers and shopping. My wife bought a painting of the actual area (with fountains) from a local artist. I visited Bertè (one of the oldest toy stores in Rome) where I bought a very nice Bronze Reproduction of Roman Soldier Armor to match the sculptures I picked up in Florence. The weather was great and it was nice to be out just doing some last minute shopping. A great place to put on the list.

Lovely busy square. We stayed right by here and its definitely worth walking through. LOADS of restaurants and bars but they cost so much more for the privilege of eating there so we didn't.....But its worth seeing just for the fountains and statues.

the place to be seen. This piazza is renowned for the place to be seen and have a drink. Any of the restaurants will welcome you for drinks and will give complementary olives and snacks. It is slightly pricier than bars in back streets, but worth it for a lovely view and watching the world go by. The food at these restaurants seemed overpriced and not so good. It always cheaper to eat in restaurants in the back streets(especially where the locals go) and you get better food.
Amazing. Truly wonderful, a must not be missed. From seeing this on the television to seeing it in person. Amazing
Bustling piazza near the Pantheon. Fun place to sit and watch the world! Music is playing and people are milling around enjoying themselves. Very enjoyable.
Lovely Place. I like this place it is very amazing and it has a lot of tasty restaurants. just go there take some pictures and enjoy the lunch or dinner

A Great Late Night Walk. As with the Pantheon, these are great walks at night - especially following a large Roman dinner. The night in Rome is magical, and the fountains and people watching are great. Look out for the selfie sticks!!!

La Dolce Vita. We had spent the morning at the Vatican museum and walked over to Piazza Navona to have a late lunch and rest of bit. Great sidewalk restuarants, great people watching, and a chance to enjoy the Italian lifestyle. Just don't expect to be rushed or to get the bill quickly - definitely have to ask. Which is a nice change from being rushed to turn the table.
Great square. Great square with beautiful art everywhere. But of course there is art everywhere you look in Rome. :-)

Social Hub. This place was BUSY! Lots of people, bars, performers and more people!I would avoid the bars here if cost is a consideration (just go a few streets away instead) and also watch your pockets!
go and enjoy. what a place to eat and relax, The whole place is designed with relaxation and eating in mind. I love it, so will you

Dont expect to have it to yourself!. This was my favourite part of Rome. It is tucked away in a little square. We turned the corner and there it was - we have never seen so many people in such a small space. We managed to getto the front and take a picture. People were really good at getting to the front and then moving away for someone else to get their picture. There was someone there taking photos and selling them for €5 but we didn't buy one.

Love this Piazza!. People watching, great fountains, sculptures and restaurants to enjoy. What more could you ask for? Great open space ( albeit stone/marble). Stroll around and enjoy looking at the art for sale, street merchants selling touristy toys. Always worth a visit.

Favorite piazza in Rome to hangout. I love to walk around and see the artists fountains and linger over wine Tartuffe
Pizza or coffee- great place to relax and enjoy the piazza and beautiful fountains

Lively and vibrant square on the site of an old circus which gives it its shape. Good to visit perhaps for an expensive beer to people watch. The Piazza has some beautiful buildings but the beer will be 30%more than other places. However, lots going on, demonstrations, street artists etc. We passed through twice on purpose and stopped for a drink once.

Lovely space so savour it. This is a lovely square, and while other reviewers have said the pavement cafes here are expensive, they are not outrageous (eg we had a glass of prosecco for 7€ each) and it is really worth it just to savour the architecture and atmosphere, and people-watch for an hour or so. You can also see the spot where Tom Hanks rescued that cardinal in "Angels and Demons".

Lovely Gem of Rome. The two times we have visited Rome we have gone to Piazza Navona. It's such a lovely part of Rome because it's not as crowded as some of the other main areas. There are lovely fountains and lots of nice restaurants dotted around the square. I would definitely recommend going here just to appreciate how nice it is. Plus there is a Gelato shop near the main fountain that is amazing!!

Beautiful place. This is a wonderful piazza. It's worth noting this is an easy to do venue for those of us traveling with mobility issues. The fountains and cafes along the piazza are surely to be appreciated.
Exploring Rome. While beautiful, there as a plethora of wondrous piazzas in Rome which are more stunning, less busy, cheaper for a drink/meal and not crowded with bad buskers

Mrs. Stayed at Navona B+B at the Piazza Navona. Beautiful clean room . King size bed and double sofa bed. Lovely bathroom. Helpful staff. Ideal place for sightseeing Rome. Twenty mins walk to Vatican and ten mins to Hop on Hop off bus tour service. Definately stay there again..

Fantastic spot for a bit of Lunch. stopped off here for a nice bit of traditional Italian lunch. Amazing Piazza, so much going on and great for people watching. Very pretty but can get a little busy when the suns out and the temperature suits. Lots of restaurants at reasonable prices (compared to other Capital cities).

Loved it. This was one of my favourite places in Rome. The atmosphere was great and one of the best places to people watch. It is worth coming during the day and at night as both experiences are very different.

Over rated . This is a beautiful square but beware of the over priced cafes around it. It is a nice artistic spot with a lot of nice fountains and places to eat. But the main attractive spots and quirky places are actually off the square in the side streets and alleys. So keep Your eyes open and take it all in. Avoid eating on the square as its double the price of off the square prices.
Sooner or later, you will see this Piazza. This is not really worth discussing because you WILL see the Piazza Navona if you have a pulse when you come to Rome.
Piazza Navone peaceful. Arrive early, before 8:30, to get the best pictures and ambiance. Or try in the evening, when it's lit up.

Ice Cream central in Rome. Beautiful baroque plaza surrounded by high end ice cream cafes. The fountains are spectacular. People watching gets a 5 of 5. Rest your feet (for the price of an ice cream-10 Euro or so) and enjoy the view.

A big piazza. We went here mid-morning and found it reactively quite which was good as we were able stroll around and get the best of views. There are numerous restaurants around for those who like a view with their meal.
Amazing. One of my favorite place in Rome. I have spent hours walking or just watching the view. It is a symbol of Rome for me.
A nice area. This 3 fountain area is nice to sit and relax from a long walk while enjoying ANOTHER gelato..while watching street performers playing music or doung some tricks.

Great square. The guide books call it the most beautiful in Rome, not sure I agree, but it's still a great place to wander and look at the people, fountain, architecture. Certainly should be on the walk about itinerary and there is enough space to avoid the selfi stick brigade.

A very nice piazza near the Pantheon. an unexpected huge square very near the Pantheon, surrounded by lots of restaurants, and with a very nice fountain at one end. A quiet haven of relative tranquility!

Love the fountains. The unique shape of this Piazza comes from the fact it used to be used for chariot racing in the ancient times. There are plenty of benches and I recommend taking a slow stroll and taking it all in.

Always a hive of activity.. Piazza Navona is always a hive of activity whenever we visit Rome, it is a large public square. There are two fountains, the highlight of the square is the central fountain named the Fountain of the four rivers (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi) designed by Bernini in 1651. Around the perimeter of Piazza Navona are mansions, restaurants and the 17th century Baroque church of Sant'Agnese in Agone which is also worth a visit. Piazza Navona is a great place for people watching, if you are lucky enough you might even be able to find a place to sit, eat some gelati like we have done before and pass some time away.
Nice Fountain in the Square. This fountain is very close to the Pantheon and we were really just passing through as a group. Nice place to relax and maybe have some gelato.
Great place to eat. Excellent place to eat dinner and people watch. The fountains are superb. Dinner is a little pricey but worth it

Gorgeous and intriguing. Well, first of all, guys, do look it up in Wikipedia. See where all the buildings, fountains, and the layout came from. You'll enjoy it a lot more. THEN take in the sights. Walk around, have lunch or dinner, or just a cup of lungo. This is arguably the most beautiful plaza in the world. Believe you me, I've seen lots of different plazas, including the ones in Paris and New York and St. Petersburg and what not.

One of my favorite places in Rome. This is the perfect example of the Baroque Roman architecture ensemble. The square is surrounded by baroque style building and it features a number of the genuine masterpieces of Lorenzo Bernini, Francesco Borromini, Girolamo and Carlo Rainaldi and others, such as fountains, churches etc. The place is always very crowded and attracts a lot of tourists and local people. This is really very beautiful and romantic place with a rich history.
Beautiful spot. We passed through the square today and enjoyed a street show by a silly clown getting the audience involved. The architecture is beautiful to see.

Nice fountains and good street entertainment . The Piazza is a pretty square (it's actually a rectangle). It is lined on both sides with restaurants that are a little pricy but the atmosphere is worth it. The centre area has three impressive fountains (one by Bernini) and has artists and street performers that entertain the people sitting outside at the restaurants.
So crowded always. It's huge and beautiful, true- but the throngs are daunting. Beware of pickpockets! Three fountains and many restaurants and cafes make it a magnet for all!

The Grand Piazza of Rome. Evening visit is the best way to experience the Great Piazza Navona. Its not just the fountain nor the spacious piazza that makes it worth while. The surrounding shops, venders, performers, sights and resturants that make this a Roman experience that you will always have to call on when you remember your holiday. Something is always going on at the Piazza. I have been there on two previous occasions and the Piazza is something to experience. It's been a different each visit. Just go there you will find your nitch. Big enough not to feel confined I'm sure you'll love it.

Impressive fountains in a large Square. Part of our walking tour through the city was a stop at the Piazza Navona. The three fountains were impressive and the Square is large surrounded by Cafés and Restaurants. Definitely an enjoyable place to stop and take photos.

Expensive restaurants lovely square. Lovely square with loads of people selling pictures, jewellery and busking. Lovely atmosphere. Very busy. Restaurants was about €15+ for a meal. €20 meal and drink. All food places round square. Souvenir shops round edges of streets.

The Times Square of Rome. Sure, the huge open space and big fountains are impressive. Be prepared, though, for the crushing crowds. And if for some mysterious reason the fountains aren't turned on, you may find yourself slightly turned off.

A great day s visit. I love this Piazza. The artists are a treat and so friendly. There is always some entertainment going on and you are not plagued with people selling you items although they are there if you choose to do so.The cafes are really popular and not as expensive as you may expect. treat yourself to a cocktail in the sunshine.It is actually reassuring that there is security about in these sad times but it is not in your face.The fountains, statues and buildings are wonderful and worth a few pictures as is the Indian man dressed in orange sitting on the top of a pole.but expect to pay 2 euros for that.

Sculpture and fountains make it worth braving the crowds. The Four Rivers fountain is my favorite in all of Rome. Visit at night (for smaller crowds) but do keep your wallet or purse in a safe place as this and Trevi Fountain are pick-pocket central. Police are very visible late at night (which is reassuring but not exactly romantic). But these fountains. Fantastic. Don't miss them.

Lost and found the Piazza. We were lost, trying to find our way back to our hotel - and happened upon the Piazza Navona...WOW! Lots of people - but, not unmanageable (as is Trevi Fountain). Lingered for a while, ogling the carvings, enjoying the ambiance, having a gelato...or two! Returned next day...just because its so beautiful. A four piece jazz group was playing - with fervor...WOW, again!

Beautiful piazza . The piazza is beautiful! Lots of cafes and shops around it. The fountains are beautiful. Spend your time there at a cafe or have your sandwich and ice cream at the many sitting areas there. Admire the beauty around.
small plaza. small plaza, beautiful monuments, hard to get a picture because of everyone sitting around it. interesting vendors in the plaza. nice quick excursion.

Plaza Navona. As usual, this is truly a nice plaza to visit. There was very crowded. I'mGlad we went this time of the year. A lot of beautiful art. Did not buy anything this time. But anybody loving would love to see then in action. Living in New Orleans we see the artists painting at Jackson Square, so is nothing new for us. My friends loved the atmosphere and the art work they saw.
wonderful experience. We traveled to Rome with a few friends who had not been to italy before. They say that walking the piazza after dinner every night was the highlight of the trip for them.

Lots of activity . A great place to people watch but in a large area so you don't feel as crowded as the trevi fountain. Many good restaurants in the area. Just a short walk from the pantheon. Great background for selfies with the fountain and tall beautiful buildings framing the piazza

Nice little square with small shops and eateries.. This is a large open air square built over a stadium of old. The square is pretty quiet except for a small quartet and a man painted as a cowboy and standing like a statue. Restaurants and small shops line the square. As you walk the square the restuarnteers entreat you to come in. This was annoying to me. You can eat on the side walk. There are shops and I did by some very nice leather hand made books in one of the shops I think it was Cartoleria Pantheon. We ate at a small restaurant which had organic food and it was inside a building at one of the ends of the square, sorry, I cannot remember the name, but the food was fantastic!
Stumbled upon this beauty.... By far the prettiest Piazza in Rome in my opinion, plus there are restaurants there that serve a pretty good American breakfast as well. Don't miss this.
Nice piazza, true Roman athmosphere. Not too crowded (as the Trevi Fontain) and not too pure (as Piazza do Popolo). Nice place, nice buildings, perfect stop on a walk from from/to the Pantheon.
Fun place to people watch. Beautiful square; a nice area of the city to stay near. Look into rental apartments in the area; there are many and they are nicer than the hotels.

Don't go out of your way. There are other smaller piazzas with more character & better places to eat. St Agnes church which has an entry on the Piazza opposite the restaurants has fabulous artwork & is worth a visit. It's free & there are no crowds
Rain or shine, a perfect place. OK, so it was wet and miserable...but we went anyway. The fountain alone is worth the trip . Cant wait to go back on a sunny day!

Lots going on here. The plaza has two impressive fountains and plenty of restaurants available. There were a number of artists and street performers around so it was certainly worth the stop while walking around the city.

Spacy and romantic. I visited the square in early December so it was not really crouded, which is very nice. The architecture is grand. There are some interesting street performances and sometimes markets. Of course there also are annoying merchants.
