The most beautiful fountain in Rome! . Has to be your first stop! Beautiful fountains, great scenario, beautiful square! One of my favorites in Italy. Near also the campo di Fiori and the Pantheon! Buy you a delicioys ice cream and seat there to observe the people!

Atmospheric square in which to people watch. This is a great place to visit, have a coffee, and watch the world go buy. There's lots of little cafes trying to get your business - take your time and stand firm - don't be swayed by the waiters trying to catch your attention and lure you inside their establishment. Well worth a visit and it's close by the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain.

Beautiful Piazza. Great area full of people, shops and restaurants. We did not eat but did find a nice patio to sit and have a few drinks. We found food was a bit overpriced. After a morning of walking around Roma is was nice to relax and enjoy the atmosphere of the Piazza Navona. The piazza is beautiful with fountains and sculptures. Worth a visit to see if you have time. We found it very easy to find and not far form the pantheon.

A busy piazza with three fountains. Piazza Navona is pretty and very popular. The restaurants are overflowing with tourists and there are crowds around the fountains. Restaurants just off the square are more reasonably priced and the service is quicker.
Nice place. You can pass through it, see the fountains but not sit in a cafe or restaurant it is very expensive.
Soak up the atmosphere. Our favourite place in the early morning for a coffee before the tourists arrive on their guided tours. Sit around and just enjoy the atmosphere.

Brilliant. I just walked to the Piazza from my hotel. My hotel had given me a map of Rome with major tourist attractions highlighted. I just followed the map and got to the Piazza. The Piazza is well hidden behind some big buildings. But keep persevering and you will come to a breath taking square (well rectangle). The fountains, 3 in total, are exquisitely carved and the water is very clear. There are a lot of restaurants and cafes along the perimeter. There is a big church, which you can enter (I did not) and there are a lot of benches to sit on. All in all, a must do.
Beautiful. Must visit, but only problem is they will not allow to take photo inside the church. Beautiful view from both outside and inside.
Lovely Piazza. We loved wandering through the Piazza with it's huge central fountain and many restaurants vying for your business.
Open air museum. A must go, and freeanother typical beauty from Roma, easy to walk and absolutely amazingIn summer remember to have sun cream and hat
piazza navona. central square very good restaurants all round plus the fountains,street performers most days also can recommend Vacanze Romane restaurant
Beautiful. This is a wonderful area to sit and relax and take in all the beauty. I was able to learn the history of the area and of the fountains.
Beautiful fountains. A lovely place to wander around on a sunny day. There are two fountains in the square; both worth having a look at. Only a short walk from The Pantheon.
Beautiful exciting piazza. Our hotel was one block from there lovely during the day, exciting at night with lights, jugglers and lots of people, but in a good way
Plaza of fountains. During the day this plaza is a good day to people watch and enjoy the Baroque fountains. In the evening many small restaurants open for a glass of wine and good food,
Hang out -- great people watching. Yeah, ok. If you are in Rome it's a must see. Make it an evening visit. Enjoy the fountains and the people watching while having an over priced meal.
Outstanding !!. An absolutley beautiful place to visit , A great atmosphere especially in the evening when it is all lit up....Spectacular !!!!

Beautiful Piazza. Enjoyed a few lovely hours in this Piazza.
Street life and animation spectacular.
Many cafes and restaurants to enjoy, and do as we did.
Sit for a while and soak up the atmosphere.
A wonderful place.

Okay but a little too touristy.. Everyone told us to go here, so we did. Lots to see here and plenty of options to eat, however, our Segway tour guide gave us recommendations that were better, like food the locals eat.
Piazza Navona. Great place to visit! Lots of restaurants around. And Gelato! Plenty of tourists so it is always so crowded!

Beautiful piazza . Great open piazza. Wonderful fountains and sculptures. We had the benefit of a tour guide telling us about the sights in the square. Very interesting hearing about the four giants representing the four continents in the main fountain.

Lots of food and shopping. You can find just about any kind of Italian dining in this "piazza" Full of atmosphere and life. We chose to eat at one of the cafes in the open air and weren't disappointed.
Great square to people watch. Gathered as group to watch people, admire the architecture, enjoy the fountain, and savor Italian Gelato.

Pretty. Piazza Navona is a nice visit. There are lots of street sellers in this area and the restaurants try to rip you off so beware. however the architecture is interesting and it is a pretty location.

Amazing sculture. The sculpture that was done in piazza navona was amazing. A lot of people are wondering how the architect did it as it was almost perfect. Rome was really a place full of good architectural structures .

Beautiful little Piazza . Won't lie, got here on out self guided (and google mapped) tour of Rome and this pleasant Piazza found us staying for over an hour. Sat by the fountain, ice cream in hand, I'd recommend anyone does it... The backdrop alone makes it worth it

A wonderful location to visit. I have been to Rome several times and always visit the Piazza Navona, love the place but find the men trying to sell you things a little frustrating and very annoying. Kind of spoils it in a way but I guess that's how it is.Would still say if you are visiting Rome visit the Piazza Navona but do remember you will at a premium rice to eat/drink in the Piazza, go a couple of streets back and the prices drop dramatically. That said it still a must do at least once!
just beautiful. A must see just stunning,beautiful carvings,waterfalls & a chance to throw a coin & make a wish.....
Beautiful but busy. An amazing place to visit but mainly for the food places around the edge, a beautiful waterfall and other architectual delights, but not really much to see.

Incredible environment. This (along with most things in Rome) is an excellent example of the artistry and workmanship that have been preserved for centuries for us all to see & feel. This place on a sunny day is a joy to be in .. selfie stick salespeople excepted from that of course..grr! Go take a look - you won't be disappointed.
Great place. The most attractive piazza in Rome, lined with excellent eateries,to sit and just have a glass of vino,or a meal and watch the world go by.
Great Peoplewatching. Had our lunch here and loved just watching the people go by. A very relaxing way to spend time, busy, but not crazy. Great architecture to look at
Must see. Great place to see locals. Great pricy restaurants but fun to sit and watch people enjoying life. Gelato great at end of piazza.
Lots of life . Beautiful lots of bars and restaurants suitable for all ages, also walking distance from the Trevi Fountain

Overhyped. It's a beautiful plaza. It's got beautiful fountains . There are lots of tourists hanging around, and a few artists selling their wares. Is it worth seeing? Absolutely. If it were in Paris, I'd give it five stars. But in Rome, it is just one more beautiful thing to see. The city boasts so many, It's a great place to rest for a bit after a lot of walking.
Great place to hang!. Beside the great fountains there, you will street performers, and you can sit at a table eat gelato and people watch.
Beautiful. Piazza Navona is always one of my favriout place to visit in Rome. You can sit and have a nice meal looking onto one of the beautiful fountains

Cool place to sit. We have been a few times now, and on our recent visit it was nice to see that the authorities have at last stopped the constant harrasment of visitors by the street sellers of tat and junk and also the constant helloing of beggars who think that saying hello qualifies for some euros, now because of the security clamp down you can sit and take in the ambience and beauty of this area, and you can sit and enjoy a fine glass of wine and a bite to eat at one of the many restaraunts and coffe stops, people watching is also of the top draw. So well worth a visit now.

A must. You have got to see it a lot of restaurants .But be careful some really expensive . There were deals but you had to ask we saw one deal but told it was over ,when we ordered the deal was put back outside again so be careful

best place for dinner. i totally fell in love with this piazza, maybe it was crowded in the good way because Spanish steps were under renovation. But even if not, the piazza is long, full of good restaurants and very lovely to sit for a dinner.
Piazza. One of the best piazza's in Rome with 3 fountains. Plenty of restaurants and coffee shops. Lots of artists and entertainers. Lovely atmosphere especially in the evening.

beautiful piazza. it's a beautiful piazza. with my 3-years-old baby , we were happy here. you should go there , if you want to say that I see all the things in Rome. drink home-made wine and get a brushetta with it :)
See it twice--day and night. This is the kind of place that is worth seeing twice. The day time experience is active and full of fun. The evening experience is calm and atmospheric.

Buzzing street atmosphere. We stopped to eat at a restaurant in this area. Whilst sitting outside in the scorching sun there was plenty going in to keep us entertained. Live street music, artist stalls and just a general good vibe. The water features are a must see also.
Pi-Na. this is the place / piazza in Rome which my wife has chosen as the most preferred open space in Roma Eterna by her
Great Food. We stayed nearby at Palazzo Navona Hotel, but ate at the trattorias surrounding Piazza Navona a ton. Great pasta and people watching!!!

Must see. Rom is centar of histori and piazza Navona is realy in the heart of city.You can imagine everuthing about that city on thst place
Beautifful

Amazing plaza!. The Piazza Novana is very close to where we stayed in Rome and the place is spectacular. The size, architecture, fountains and statutes are truly a Roman marvel. It is hard to describe in words what these plazas look like so you have to visit them on your own and enjoy their size and splendor. Like most, the Piazza Novana is free and there are lots of activities in the area. I suggest dropping in on the Plazza Novana for yourself and see it's beauty.

Go behind and look for piazza pasquina.. We love to get lost and in search of tuck always. This piazza pasquina has great bars, pasta spots great wine and sandwiches. A challenge to find we had a police officer help us with directions.
People watching at its best. A stunning piazza with bars and pizzerias around the outside and painters / artists in the centre... A lovely place to sit, eat, drink and watch the world go by.

So much to experience. We rented a flat for 3 days, just off the Piazza. What a great location to experience the Piazza day and night, and so close to many of the famous sights in Rome. We've had 2 meals at 2 restaurants at the Piazza, and have enjoyed several walks around the Piazza - very lively, very safe, and very much a cultural experience.

Always Magical. The Piazza Navona is always magical, but it's a great place for dinner. There's a wonderful (small) restaurant at the 11 o'clock space as you face north in the piazza. Great food and an outdoor table gives lots of people-watching potential. If you visit one piazza in Rome, it would be this one or Campo de' Fiori. Better yet, visit Campo de' Fiori to browse the vendors and have lunch, and then return to the Piazza Navona for dinner.

fun, but not like it used to be. the sculptures and surroundings of Piazza Navona are spectacular. fun to sit in the restaurants surrounding the square & people watch. However, compared to as recently as 5 years ago, in the evening the artists seem have a lot of prints, rather than artwork they have actually produced. and the "vendors" that used to charmingly fill the square have been replaced with aggressive peddlers selling cheap glow in the dark toys & "hand carved" african baskets. still worth a visit to see bernini's masterful fountain.
Nice, very nice. Even on a cloudy weather this "piazza" looks beatiful !Nice restorans to enjoj in fontains with good cappuccino.
Beautiful Fountain. Was on our list of "Must See's " while in Rome, recently. Very crowded, day and night. Walking distance from the Termini.

Home of the weird and wonderful . Great place to hang around, get a bite to eat, or a coffee to drink and just watch the world go by... Lots of odd entertainers, some slightly more normal... Like I said, the weird and wonderful, no wonder I felt at home! Make this one of your planned "break stops" when on your touristic mission in Rome and give yourself some time to soak it up.
Lovely fountain and square. Had a great time visiting this fountain went twice, arrive early if you want to avoid the crowds. Very picturesque. lots of nice shops and cafe's around the square

Crowed, no Italian charm, and expensive restaurants. Hurried through when we saw the number of peopla and the prices at the restaurants. It is tourist trap.Go to the small narrow side streets and fine better and cheaper food, with better service. Or go to Borghese park, where you can escape the city noise for a short while
Stunning fountain in Rome. This is worth a visit, cast in a coin and make a wish. They say your wish comes true if you use Lira, not Euros.
One of the main Piazzas. One of the main piazzas in Rome and a must see while visiting. Plenty of places to eat or just have an ice cream

Beautiful Piazza not to be missed. A trip to Rome would not be complete if you did not visit Piazzo Navona. Take a leisurely stroll and finish off with lunch and a gelato. A great way to spend the day.
Mini second honeymoon. Had a delicious sandwich then some even more delicious gelato with my beautiful wife here. Very nice place. Must see if you are in Rome.
So busy!. Worth a look around but extremely busy to take photos etc. Maybe early morning would be best! Or early evening. Easy to find. Sit awhile and people watch!
Beautiful. Beautiful, Wonderful place to enjoy the plaza and the people, so full of charm every building looks perfect
Best Piazza in Rome!. If you just have time to see 1 Piazza I would choose this one. Its close to Pantheon. Beautiful Piazza and I would say top10-15 attraction in Rome!
Fabulous. One of the many squares and fountains dotted throughout rome. Surrounded by stores and little restaurant

Amazing. We spent ages just looking in awe at the dramatic sculptures and their intricate details. I'm not really one for art but even I can appreciate the level of craftsmanship that went into constructing them.
Gorgeous Piazza. Beautiful statues and buildings surrounding the Piazza. Easy to walk to from Campo di Fiori, Pantheon and other sights.

Frenetic. A wonderful Piazza to stroll in the evening and watch the setting sun illuminate the beautiful buildings that surround the piazza.
The music from buskers is fantastic.
Great to have a bug space without cars

Fun stop for people watching and eating when in Rome. I discovered Piazza Navona on my first trip to Rome in 2008 and have returned with each visit. Enjoy the street artists/vendors and "Washington Square park" atmosphere of the large Piazza. Usu some sort of entertainment at night. Better value off the piazzas though for a good Roman meal.

Interesting . Nice bit of history to go with this area. There are 3 fountains here. The 4 rivers is the most spectacular though. We did this as part of a walking tour that showed us the underground area of what used to be a stadium. Interesting stuff but needs to be combined with the underground bit to get the full benefit of the piazza.

Beautiful . This is a beautiful square worth visiting, we went in the evening before dinner nearby and saw a Michael Jackson impersonator and a fire dancer perform. Seems like a nice place to chill in the day.

Put this one on your list as a must see.. Do yourself a big favor, before you go o Piazza Navona, walk up Corso del Rinascimento to where it turns to the left and you will see an underground ruins you can go into that has an audio tour included in the 6 euro price of entry. This experience will make Piazza Navona so much more interesting than just the fountains and the Piazza its self. You won't be disappointed. The tour of the ruins takes about 30 - 40 minutes.
An ok Piazza. I know the history behind the Piazza, but it is now filled with expensive bars and restaurants. After looking at the beautiful fountains that is it.But at least I can say I've seen it

Great atmosphere . If you can avoid the slow moving tours this place is great. Lovely atmosphere and nice and open which is a welcome relief in Rome. The performers here are very impressive and Tucci is the only restaurant here I'd recommend.
Lovely Square. The Piazza Navona is a huge square in the center of the city centered around three fountains and full of cafes. Lovely for a morning coffee or afternoon snack.

under whelming. we where not impressed with Piazza Navona after all the hype but we did have a very nice pizza in one of the many restaurants although it was expensive and they add 10% to the bill and tell you "the boss gets that",oh well there goes the tip.

Huge square with three fountains.. This square is usually packed with people and is lovely to look at. The best time for photos is in the morning before the crowds arrive. We were walking around and I took a photo of Mary on the side of a building when my husband said, "Let's go inside". It was called Antica Salumerir and it was full of hams and cheeses and we found tables so we sat down and had a platter of hams, sausages and cheeses which were very good. It's a good place to stop should you be there in the Piazza.
Good place to relax . A place to put your feet up and enjoy the view. A wide open space with three great fountains, all enclosed by beautiful buildings.
typical Piazza. Beautiful place to visit. Be aware that the coffee is very expensive in the restaurants here. Easy stroll to this place

Three fabulous fountains. We were told that one of the must see and do places in Rome is the Piazza Navona, so like all good tourists we went there. There are three lovely fountains and a plethora of restaurants around the perimeter. Buskers and souvenir sellers, like many other "Free" tourist attractions, abound within the area. We had a light meal in one of the restaurants whilst prices a little higher than other restaurants away from the piazza we were not overly concerned about being ripped off. We did find that café prices were normally higher the closer one was to a "Tourist Trap" than a few streets away. But in Rome .........

Don't go out of your way. This is a another pretty Roman square. It has 3 fountains which makes it unusual but ultimately I wouldn't go out of my way to see it. Plenty of buskers and is a nice place to relax.
Romantic. This is the most romantic place in Rome in my opinion, a must for every couple in love. And do not be shy, give your best kiss here!

Must visit for any stay in Rome. Not as spectacular as other major attractions in Rome that must be visited, but if time permits it is worth while to visit if for no other reason than to see Bernini's work set in the center of this
very large and attractive piazza.

Beautiful and relaxing.. This was the meeting point for a guided walking tour we took. The Piazza is very pretty. The four rivers fountain is beautiful. Worth a stop if you are walking around the city.
Nice square. Nice piazzqin the center, with some interesting fountains. However maybe not the best in Rome, very touristic and quiet.at night
Must see. The piazza is beautiful, with classic sculpture and fine buildings. Should be visited every time you visit Rome. Have a coffee and people watch.

One of the best. This piazza would offer you a pleasant relaxing atmosphere. Simply just find your self a spot to set and enjoy the sounds of the fountains and look around you to see the artists and vendors.

A beautiful 'piazza' in Rome.. Piazza Navona is a long and lovely 'piazza', surrounded by many interesting restaurants. At the Centre, the obelisk with the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. Definitely worth a visit to snap a couple of pictures and to have a drink.
Cafe prices in the Piazza are extremely high. Piazza is a crowded busy place. The cafes are extremely expensive. Pay a premium to sit there. We decided not to.

People watching at its best. Piazza Navona is an elongated rectangular space that covers several city blocks and is surrounded by several classical Baroque buildings. In its center You find Bernini's Fountain of Four Rivers, one of the great master's masterpieces. The Piazza is thought to have started as a stadium, but later became a marketplace until the mid 19th century. At one end, you find the Fontana del Moro, and at the other, the Fontana di Neptuno. The church of St. Agnes is on one side of the piazza, with masterieces by Rainaldi and Borromini as well as one of the palaces of the Pamphilj family. Today, the Piazza is a place where itinerant artists exhibit their work, street entertainers perform, people of all sorts walk, sit and enjoy the sunshine. There are several restaurants, coffee shops and gelaterias and this is Rome at its best for people watching. Be prepared to pay more for everything, since your fellow tourists compete for everything.
Amazing. It was crowded all the time. However it was worth visiting. It is beautiful and the atmosphere is very italian type.
Great piazza to people watch. We enjoyed sitting in a cafe terrace, eating lunch and looking at the beatiful fountain and buildings. There are many choices of cafe's.

Feel the Europe at this public square!. Piazza Navona is undoubtably the best Piazza (public square) in Rome. Just relax at one of the bars/restaurents and get a good feel of the place. Some nice street artists and flunk of tourists will keep you busy!
beautiful. A great place for something to eat or drink and watch the world go by. Also a very safe area. Lots of artist at work there too

Great architecture, great history. Very picturesque place, you can see great work of a great architect. Also, it helps to understand Rome and Renaissance art. Very clean, but there are a lot of tourists.

So elegant. Last time we saw the Piazza it was full of vendors and the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi was covered in scaffolding. And even though it was a wet day, it was lovely to see the Piazza empty of junky stands and the fountain in all its glory. Both fountain are lovely. Missed the flower market in the morning but wandering around the Piazza is another must do when in Roma
People watching square. Had a good meal as we watched people visit the square. Number of restaurants and some stores are located here. I would not make this a destination stop
Fantastic Site. Although within easy walking distance of our hotel, there is a subway nearby and booking a two day subway pass is quite cheap.

Just go to Trevi Fountain. This place was Ok at most. I would just rather go to Trevi Fountain. Wouldn't feel as if I would miss much here. Pros: Easy to get to and free to see. Less busy compared to other attractions. Cons: Not really worth your time and effort.

Touristic Restaurants . The restaurants in the piazza seem like they serve tourists only - which means the food didn't seem authentic or appealing ! But the piazza itself is beautiful - must visit on a trip to Rome

Crowded but wonderful Piazza. This is probably my favorite piazza of all the touristy places. The history of the Circus, the beautiful sunny nights, piazza trattorias, glas of wine etc. As a couple viditing Rome, I would have to recommend this.
piazza romantica!. one of the most amazing place in rome,for a romantic couple,in a sunny day-the perfect place to the a great lunch!near are reconditioned buildings and cozy terraces!

A Typical Italian piazza!. A classic and lively Italian "piazza" where you can find some surprisingly good vintage stuff with really good price. Especially when it is spring (not really cold or not too hot) it is so nice to chill after the overall amazement you will get from the city. Roma is magnificient (in every possible way) and it may be too much -especially if it is your first time. And these piazza's make you feel relax and digest what you see and experience in a city like Roma. Totally suggest you to experience Navona. Even if it is just for touristic pictures you are going to take with friends and family.

A fun place to eat and people watch. We had an excellent meal with outside dining, and the variety of people passing by provided entertainment. The fountain is pretty, and it is very nice at dusk and early evening.

Very busy Piazza but well worth a visit. This does get very busy without a doubt but well worth a visit anyway and to be honest if you are in Rome you will see lots of Piazzas and will be in the vicinity by default. It was a lovely sunny day when we were there and was a nice place to saunter for a short while and people watch.
Visit with a guide to understand its history. As well as having a history this is a lovely location in its own right. Very lively and a good place to sit and admire the fountains and buildings
Very Nice and Lovely!. A Lovely huge square with a beautiful fountain as the centre piece! We had a lovely wood fired oven pizza by the side of the fountain! heavenly combination of sight & taste!

Amazingly beautiful and artsy. Many artists (painters, musicians) choose piazza Navona to show their work. It has cute balconies with flowers. The big fountain in the middle is where the last scenes from the Da Vinci Code were shot. Restaurants are fairly expensive, but definitely worth it. At least 4 Fiume, where we had the best Tiramisù ever.

The Spectacular (and Busy) Piazza Navona. This is one of the "must-sees" in Rome, a place I always show to friends and enjoy walking through. The piazza itself is gorgeous, one of the great public squares of the world, but it also always has a lot of energy, with artists selling their wares, tourists, and a local here or there, walking their little dogs. The Fountain of the Four Rivers, in the center, is a masterpiece, but also take some time to admire the other two, smaller fountains at the end. Do expect crowds, when I visited yesterday it was already very busy.

Loved loved loved it. My favorite place in Rome! This is a large square with beautiful fountains, street music, sidewalk cafes and tons of charm. We enjoyed it so much we kept finding ourselves drawn back again and again. Go!

Tourists and more tourists. Don't get me wrong, a must site to visit when in Rome and the fountains and statues are magnificent, there seemed to be as many people visiting this square as were at the Trevi fountain. We were a bit spoilt as our hotel accommodation was just a street away and we walked either through or passed this square virtually everyday and were amazed at just how many tourists visited each day. But I guess at a price, the square is surrounded by overpriced and pushy restaurants and if you do happened to eat there you are constantly pestered by Indians or Africans trying to sell you rubbish. In our week in Rome this was the only attraction that seemed to have an excessive amount of rubbish lying around. A pity as the fountains are well worth a visit and the restaurants a few block away are all good value.
Lovely . This is a large piazza. There is a very pretty fountain. Nice place to chill and people watch. We spent about ten minutes or so here. There's so much to see in Rome

Fun place to stroll or get a cappucino at Tucci's.. Fun place to stroll or get a cappucino at Tucci's. The Piazza is beautiful and had two lovely statues, surrounded by several restaurants. Tucci's was our favorite. Ask for Alejandro!

My favoutite piazza. The feeling of air, water, artists, restaurants and people is breathtaking. Navona is another dimention, the fountains tell a story, they talk between each other, the artists make a show or draw, the restaurants are trying to attract you with their menu, you can drown in another world. Amazing
Must see!. Its definitely a must see place! At the square you can find the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi, other fountain and many good restaurants!

Essentially a tourist hotspot with a large fountain. Formally the location of Domitian's circus where the ancient Romans played out naval engagements once the colouseum had stopped being used for them. Today it is a tourist zone with strings off tacky restaurants but it is pretty and dominated by a central fountain by Bernini. Slightly better than the Trevi area it is still very much a see and move on ASAP.

Nice spot. One of the many Piazza to see in Rome, its hard to say one is better than another, some are little gems you find by accident others are very popular like this one. If this was sitauted in another city it would be one of the highlights of the city probably, but compared to the rest of Rome it just gets an average from me. There is a lot of people here during the day and evening which does give it a good atmosphere, there are street performers and artist and plenty of tourist. The square is surrounded by bars and cafes, which we found all offer pretty much the same menu. Some of the PR people can get a bit annoying, but its a great place to people watch. The prices are dearer than some of the side street restaurants eg 1ltr draught beer €14, coffee €6 there was then an additional 14% tax and a note saying service charge not included.

Could just imagine the chariot racing!. This was a brilliant area to wander around. Great to have a beer and just people watch. Eating on the piazza itself was expensive. There were great places to eat just a short distance away from the piazza that were significantly cheaper.
Fabulous. A very nice area to visit with some beautiful fountains and buildings. Some nice bars and restraunts also. Also some benches to sit and soak up the atmosphere.

sellers too annoying. too many people in my face selling things. it gets way too irritating when they're all up in your grill one after the other. the fountains here are beautiful but cafes and gelato shops around are expensive. shame about the sellers annoying you
Cool. This is a nice outdoor sight, one of many in Rome. It is surrounded by tourists but still a good view.

Fountains Galore. Piazza Novona is a great place to see the beautiful Neptune fountain, and have lunch at one of the many trattorias around the square. Only disappointment was the fountain waters were dirty

One of the top piazzas to hang out in Rome. I really love the ambience and history surrounding this gorgeous piazza with its ancient fountains, probably second to the Trevi fountain in terms of 'famousness'.. A particular draw for me here is the absolutely stunning fountains which line the piazza. We came by one evening to soak up the atmosphere and saw people relaxing by the fountains, entering the church along the piazza and enjoying the performances by street buskers. We then had dinner at an Enoteca nearby called Cul De Sac. Absolutely amazing food and the bill for 3 persons (we ate a lot! and had 2 glasses of wine) was 52 euros, What a steal!

Beautiful Surreal Place!. The Piazza Navona is a stunning place full of history, restaurants , tourists and everything Rome! I recommend visiting both during daytime and nighttime for different experiences with each.
Mm mmmm better. .... Not much to see there, just the square. Wouldn't know it's a landmark if u just pass by it. A lot of restaurants in the area. But wouldn't recommend to eat in the area.

Any fountain in Rome is GREAT!!. It should be required that you visit all the zillions of fountains in Rome. They are gathering for locals as well as tourist. Always available is food, drink, cheap sales stuff and people watching. Go at night for an extra special experience with the lights and fun. Sleep is for later, on the plane home.
Nice area. The Piazza Navona was central to the sights that we wanted to visit. There are many restaurants and many sights are close to this piazza.

our favorite piazza in Rome. Beautiful beautiful beautiful! A bit touristy, but not in an off putting way. Go during the day, go at night. Off to the one end is Ristorante Bernini- a wonderful place to eat dinner and people watch.
Always fun. I always enjoy this piazza ..it's always vibrant and fun for people watching. I enjoy getting a drink or a meal here . I always come back to this piazza
Allot of fun.. . Amazzing fountains and great food just of the arena. Must see the old stadium down below. The three fountains hve some interesting history.. the church was closed but next time..

Three coins in a beautiful fountain. Beautiful. A shame there is scaffolding next to it but looking straight on you can see the beauty and calm of the water. Lots of coins being thrown over shoulders. Very crowded. A must see because of the beauty when in Rome. Also just around the corner is a yummy gelato shop

One of Rome's most beautiful plazas. Three coins in the fountain as the song goes. Well there are three beautiful fountains in this piazza. First and most famous is the Fountain of the Four Rivers by Benini. Then there are two others by Giacomo Porta the Fountain of the Moor and the Neptune Fountain. The architecture sounding the piazza is impressive as are the many cafes that line the sides for coffee and people watching. Living area by day and night.

I LOVE this Piazza. Every time I'm in Rome I make sure to come here just for a wander around & go into the Chiesa di Sant'Agnese in Agone. Gorgeous little church with an amazing dome. Main attraction being Bernini's fountain though, FABULOUS! Always lots of people milling around, the whole area just has a lovely feel to it I've always found.
Special oasis in Rome. This big piazza has many restaurants and artists play Dire Straits or Clapton while clowns entertain the passers by. Nice for a walk around and a meal.
Cute. Cute little square with 3 big fountains on it. It is close to the Pantheon, if you are near you should see it.

artists and lots of people of all kind. Very huge piazza. Lots of people present their art works there, like paintings. The fountains are very beautiful and also the church is very nice. Food is not so cheap but ok. It is a good point of start to go to Castel Sant'Angelo or to Campo dei Fiori ( a great market)
Stayed Right off the Piazza. It was beautiful, and if you get a chance, I highly recommend that you walk through. Very beautiful Bernini fountain.
ROME. This piazza is lovely, lots of restaurants, bars, nice shops and ice cream parlours. Lovely to sit and people watch.
worth seeing. beautiful piazza, amazing fountains - impressive central fountain: Fontana dei fiuminice place to relax and eat an icecream
For some reason I just love this place. Get an icecream and just chill near the fountains. In the night time it is nicer. Relaxed and cool place to just hangout for awhile.

Lovely square. A beautiful square but, like most sights in Rome, too crowded and too noisy to let you enjoy its beauty and cultural and artistic value. However, as this is one of the most important squares in the city with three majestic fountains, it should not be missed.

The 3 fountains plaza. Famous for its Bernini fountains, Piazza Navona is now bustling with tourists and social life. As a singular example of urban space proportions, it is a must see for architects and urban planners too.

Beautiful!. The Piazza Navona is a wonderful square filled with many remarkable sights. There are several fountains and a huge Egyptian obelisk. Grab a coffee and spend time walking through the square.

very busy but worth seeing. I think I liked this mainly as its seen on so many films, its also much busier than when on a film. overall worth visiting.
Of course you have to toss a coin over your shoulder and make a wish too
Great place to relax at night!. We went here a couple times at the end of our long days to relax and drink some great wine! Very pretty at night and just a great atmosphere! This is a must stop!

Our favourite square. What better place to people watch and enjoy a drink. Prices at restaurants are expensive but the architecture and atmosphere make a visit worthwhile. Artists sell their wares and street entertainers are prominent. Beautiful fountains.
very nice. 3 fountains with great sculptures, you can have there very good pictures. we had an artist that drew a picture of our 3 kids for 20 Euro.

Historic Square. Worth a visit to walk around and look at the fountains, statues and buildings. Can be a little crowded and tends to be expensive, but it is an experience to sit and have a cappuccino and enjoy the surroundings..

Stunning place, great for people watching. We whiled away a couple of hours on a sunny afternoon here - great place to watch the world go by and we found a front row seat in one of the bars that wasn't that expensive. Plenty to see and do and close to some of the main attractions.
Impressive large square. A large open space with 3 fountains. Many bars and cafes so can chill for a while. Piazza is free to all visitors
Relaxing. A good place to chill, hang around and enjoy the vibe after a long day of sight seeing. Bernini's structure is awe inspiring but pales in front of the Trevi.
pizza navona. Great place to go and have a bite to eat and a little drink in the numerous restaurants around the square and people watch :)
Stroll on down. The collection of people is worth watching. The place buzzes. Various side stalls and attractions. Well worth a visit.
Plenty Going on. Walked up from the Pantheon to get there.Had an ice cream a glass of wine and watched the world go by.

Worth walking through. This is a huge and very busy Piazza surrounded by as expected quite expensive restaurants pleasant enough to walk around but if you want a drink take a short walk up a side street.

Fun and Easy Stop for FOUR Stops. Our apartment was near the Piazza so we walked through this lovely area almost daily. This is a large piazza with many small restaurants, lots of energetic activity at night and a several beautiful sights--Anchored by the Fontana del Nettuno at one end, with Bernine's Four Rivers Fountain in the middle in front of the gorgeous Church of St Agnes, the Fontana del Moro is at the other end. We thought this was a great location, restaurants were good and comparable in tourist pricing. Plus it was on the way to Campo de' Fiori, a great flower and veggie market (many tourists) where the people were fun and the produce was excellent, if you want to pick your own baby zucchini with blossoms, for example.

Beautiful Rome.. Have just returned from my third visit to this magical City. Revisited all the popular sights and others I hadn't visited before. Piazza Navona is one of my favourite places to sit and watch everything going on plus meeting others from different countries especially drinking an Aperols Spritzer my favourite Italian drink. Again will return next year for another visit as it is an experience I love and throwing a coin in the Trevi Fountain means you will return.
Beautiful fountains.. Piazza Navona was amazing with its fountains and sculptures, lots of photo ops here. The detail that was put into these magnificent structures is breathtaking.
Nice to see!. This plaza is quite big and of course has a spectacular fountain! One of the best plazas in Rome we saw
beautiful but too crowded and far too expensive. beautiful square, lovely musicians; however, the restaurants are over the top. Bad food quality and absurd prices.

good. we tried to visit as many iconic squares as possible, for that reason we ended up there, was a bit quieter than some but u still have to contend with hustlers selling toys and tatally unlikely items to buy for a tourist or a local for that matter, good are for more reasonably priced family run bistro type eateries

Lovely . A lovely fountain to enjoy en route to some of the bigger more busy attractions. Lots of nice little places to eat or enjoy a coffee around too. Bit manic with the traffic but Rome is a very busy city. Lovely and clean and a nice place to enjoy a rest after a long walk.
Beautiful piazza. Very pretty and vast area. As expected the bars and restaurants are pricy but a lovely setting, especially in the sunshine.
Lovely. A beautiful piazza with a very pretty fountain in the center and surrounded by little cafes, very bohemian. Probably, you can get the most of it if it is not full of people :)

Teaming with Tourist. A great Piazza. A must see when in Rome. Lots of tourists everywhere. There is a beautiful church right off the centre of the square. The fountain in the centre of the square is amazing.

Great place for a break. This is a great place to take a break from walking around the city. There are coffee shops and gelato shops where you can sit and watch the world go by. There is a nice fountain here also. The square can be very crowded, and overrun with annoying people trying to sell you stuff.

Nice lunch . It s very nice lunch at Piazza Navona before to go colosseum , when you can sit down at the front monument it was splendid day , and the return late afternoon , they have more people and few show going on

Lovely place to be!. Glad to have visited this piazza. The fountains are unique and the sound is serene.
Great and lovely place for beautiful pictures too! Don't miss this place!

Place to see once. Visited Piazza Navona on May 8. Very large, very crowded area which is on the list of places to see. Actually, a very large rectangular area surrounded by cafes which didn't seem to be anything special. Several large fountain sculptures and a church. Go, take your pictures and say you've been.
Beautiful during the day and at night. This gorgeous square because the heart of our time in Rome. Amazing side streets with food to fit anyone's desires.

Beautiful. In short piazza Navona is beautiful. The cafes around it are quite expensive, but enjoying even just a cup of cappuccino in in one of them is definitely an important part of the Navona experience.

beautiful fountains, busyness and stunning architecture. This gem just suddenly appears at the end of a small street - no matter which direction to arrive from. Coffees are expensive here but drinking one in a cafe terrace is surely a good way to soak up the atmosphere - and rest the weary legs!!

Must visit this Square, such a lovely atmosphere. We are staying in Spagna, by the Spanish Steps & from morning till night it is packed. Just walked & spent the afternoon by Piazza Novona, what a lovely place & atmosphere. In my opinion much lovelier than Spanish steps. Went into the Borrominis church Sant'Agnese in Agone. Every corner has things to see beautiful church's, fountains by Bernini, Works by Caravaggio just round the corner, and just outside lovely places to eat , drink & people watch. This is a must visit place!!!

Just visiting. on the evening that we were there it was very busy.A wedding taking place.Entertainment, a bit like Covent Garden in London.A film crew making some sort of programme.We just sat for a while and watched the world go by.One of my favourite places in Rome.

Another must visit in Rome. Amazing fountain. Entertainers galore, so you can spend several hours at this place very easily. Restaurants on side streets are much cheaper and better than the ones surrounding the square.
beautiful square. And very touristical. What we visited was the amazing Sant'Agnese in Agone, right in the middle of the square.
a great piazza. busy piazza, plenty of places to eat, nice place to watch the world go by. in the centre artists sell their wares. Beautiful fountain by Bernini.
Beautiful. Such a lovely fountain to see, and the detail is amazing! A must go!! Lots of lovely coffee shops around to sit in the sin and people watch
If you have the time, why not?. This was not our main sight to see. We kind of stumbled upon it. However we sat down, took a drink and just relaxed there. Nice atmosphere!
Interesing to see the fountains. A big piazza but can get very crowded. It is spoiled by tacky souvenir shops and overpriced cafes. Many tour groups congregate here

Early evening chill. Chill indeed. In more ways than one. We sat and sipped our way through a bottle of fizz watching the world go by. It was a really cool evening so we were wrapped up. So chill chill chilly. Square, Vino and weather !. It apparently gets uber busy but there were just enough people around to allow us to chill out, people watch for an hour and chit chat to strangers at the nearby tables.

A favorite. Strolling and watching strollers in the Piazza Navona is something that every visitor to Rome should do. If possible, sit at one of the sidewalk cafes and order a cup of coffee. It will cost you 7 euro but you could probably sit there for two hours and no one would tell you to leave. If you are fortunate enough to be there in the Christmas season, do not miss the Christmas market.
my lovely spot. I love to go Piazza Navona everyday morning to have my pictures better to go early morning cuz by 12 it is fully of people
Great lunch spot. Vibrant place to stop for lunch, lots of choice and a great atmosphere. Beautiful fountains, close to Trevi and Pantheon

The most beautiful square. Such a lovely place to see in Rome! It is a big square with fantastic fountains! It s better to go there in afternoon for ice cream or for a drink(it's a bit expensive). Also, there are lots of artists that give shows to the people and make it more fun for eneryone there!
Very atmospheric. Lovely, large square, surrounded by cafes and restaurants. Very nice to sit and have a drink in the sun watching the world go by. Worth a visit.

Nice, but not wow. This is considered to be one of the highlights in Rome, but in my opinion it's not that nice. You have go take a look of course, but I wouldn't say it's as nice as the other touristic attractions in Rome. The fountain is nice, and there are always a lot of street artists performing. Hard to find a toilet in the neighbourhood.

Overpriced but nice. Piazza Navonna is considered to be one of the nicest places in Rome, so it is. But it is always crowded by tourist and there is no particular things to see there apart from the fountains. Cafes and restaurants close to the Piazza Navonna decide to hawk tourists by asking 8€/coffee which is a bit excessive.
Another Fun Piazza in Rome. This is a fun plaza (piazza) with a beautiful fountain, entertainment, food, snacks, beautiful buildings.

Wonderful. This was our final stop on our first walking day tour of Rome. The obelisk and the fountains are breathtaking as well as the buildings surrounding them. It is best to visit in the morning as it gets reaaly busy at lunchtimes and afterwards. Lots of restaurants here and nearby. WE always headed back to here after each day tour as we liked the area that much.

Lovely place to sit, relax and watch the beautiful square and not forget the people. Lovely place to sit, relax and watch the beautiful square and not forget the people. Prices of the drinks and food are much to high compared with the quality but you can expect that in such a touristic environment
Peoplewatching. And trying to guess which of the big fellows in the fountain is which river, the nike the donube, the ganges and rio something, that represent the 4 continents.

Stunning Bernini fountains, great people watching. We stayed on Piazza Navona decades ago. We always return to see the great fountains and people watching. We never tire. On a good day, mimes are very, very accomplished. I haven't eaten at any of the cafes on the piazza and I've heard mixed reviews: food, price, etc. We didn't eat there.
A beautiful square . Piazza Navona is a beautiful place to go.....there are many restaurants around that serve good Italian foods. We love the area .....A must see when in Rome !!!

Touristy. This is basically an area for tourists! If you've been to Barcelona, piazza navona is like a smaller version of la rambla. There are a lot of caricature artists, when I went they were filming an advert which was fun to watch. Definitely a great place to chill if it's sunny and eat gelato!

Nice piazza. This Piazza is simple, but is a great starting point for a trek through some of the highlights of Rome walk next to the Palazzo, then into the Pantheon and St. Ignatious of Loyola Church, upto via del Corso, and then walk down to the sites towards the Colosseum. Nice walk! Long, but great if you have the whole day! The other option maybe better if you are intending on entering the Colosseum, as the lines are long. Start at the Colosseum by 7.30am, and make your way back to Piazza Navona.

A picturesque Piazza. Full of photo opportunities of fountains and another obelisk. This place does have restaurants. We spent about 20 minutes here but was worth it just for the photos and seeing it with our own eyes and not through photos

The centre of Rome. We found that where ever we were walking, we always passed this piazza. Don't go to the resturants in the piazza, go to the side streets behind the church. the prices are better and so is the food. In the piazza, at one end. there is an ice cream shop. It sells good icecream, but just above the shop is a small camera. This is a livecam that can be seen on the net. We text family and freinds and they could see us.

Rome comes together on this piazza. You have the fountains, the cafes and the experience on this one piazza. For the first time, we had one waiter who was rude (like most in Rome) and a delightful one. So do not give up you may also have a nice experience.

Piazza Navona - Overrated. The piazza is large and impressive with nice fountains. But after that id is filled with restaurants and hawkers preying on tourists, We tried one restaurant and left because of a rude waiter, At the 2nd the service was good 1st courses good, but our main courses lamb and osso buco were overcooked. Recommendation: Go there, spend 5 minutes looking around and the go elswehere.
Buzzing Piazza Navona. Got tired of usual churches/galleries stuff my friends were doing and decided to chill for a while in this Piazza, good coffee and street entertainment all in all a fun place.
Piazza Navona. Lovely walk from our hotel, spent time wandering around shopping and just relaxing. Sat outside had a bite a enjoyed people watching.

Former Stadium of Domitian. This is one of Rome's oldest sites and the current square was the games area of said stadium. Not only does the square represent a major part of Roman life in antiquity, but it found a new leash on life in the 15th century when consecrated as a public space. The piazza hosts a church designed by Boromini [and several others], sculptures in fountains by Bernini and an obelisk from the ancient Circus of Maxentius on Via Appia. There are some nice, reasonably priced cafes to watch the world go by from, but expect the obligatory street vendors buzzing everyone who enters to purchase a toy, selfie stick or the like.
Lovely evening. A must see for me!! Have been to Rome now 3 times and have made a point to stroll through and eat a meal every time!!! Love it!!
Really pretty. Another of Times beautiful fountains. Surrounded by restaurants, it wasn't as busy as some other attractions in the city.

Must need to pick time of day. We had read that this was a bustling piazza with many laces to eat, performers, market stalls and artists. We visited about 1100 and there was a few artists, but that was it. The piazza itself is quite nice, just would have been nice to have a bit more atmosphere. We may have been there too early?
wonderful fountain. loved this fountain and people watching while eating an ice cream. entertainers galore and families out for a stroll excellent
I love this square. Been here so many times but we love it. Just sit and watch the entertainers and passers by. Avoid the tourist traps though. Most of the restaurants are below average Italian fare

Great place to walk around!!. Great place to walk around, in the mornings there are a lot of artists that you can buy paintings. And at night is very quiet, so you can enjoy just sitting around, and have a nice moment.

Great piazza to chill out. Spent some time enjoying the place, eating ice cream (there are 2 good places there), admiring the fountain of 4 rivers and being entertained by a street artist who was awesome:) Go there to feel the flavor of Rome.

Evoking Feelings within that are Suspended in Time.. The Piazza Navona containing The Fountain of The Four Rivers by Bernini being a Master-piece that is vital to see, when in Rome. One cannot adequately describe, in mere words, the exquisite Skills of the Esteemed Italian Sculptor Gian Lorenzo Bernini (1598-1680), to give them the appropriate Praise they richly deserve. He was the first Sculptor to successfully `Capture a Feeling` in stone, and the Creator of what is known as The Baroque Style. What pleasure one gains from sitting there among such wonders enjoying a meal and a glass of wine. Restaurant Prices are understandably slightly higher considering where you are. The many Artists wares on sale lend a colourful touch to one`s view of this ancient open area, dating from the 1st Century. It is the Sculptures of Bernini that Glorify the Piazzas of Rome, the Bridge to Saint Angelo`s Castle, as well as inside the Basilica of St Peters.

Overpriced and tacky. I have no idea what the hype is all about. There is a fountain and a plaza and a gazillion tourists staring at each other. For the pleasure of being in this space, if you sit at one of the cafes you can expect 10 euro espressos just to gawk at other tourists. I can't see any reason to just walk through here and keep moving. Trastevere and Campo di Fiori are more interesting for people watching and much more affordable.
We kept coming back. Always something going on here, and the streets nearby are filled with great places to shop and eat. Beautiful fountain, great architecture. Ah, Rome, I will miss you!

Nice piazza to relax and refresh yourself. Wonderful fountains of Piazza Navona and shade available at almost all time on either side of the square give a nice oasis to rest on long Roman tours. The piazza is lined with restaurants, but an ice-cream that costs 2 EUR, quickly becomes 10 if you sit down. Cute toy store on the corner, those with boys might want to enter, great Roman sword replicas are available.

My Quest!. This Piazza, eluded me MAP AND ALL, LOL. And Once found it was an 'AAAHHH' moment for me. The weather was perfect and we could take our time walking around and taking photo's. Glad I found it... tee hee

lovely, but always crowded. Visited here a number of times at different times of the day, and it was always very busy. Lots and of touts selling selfie-stick and single stem roses, but that is true of everywhere in Rome. Lots of restaurants and bars, but are pricey and the food quite average, you get much better food and deals on quality food and drink at more reasonable prices at some of the small alleys behind and to the side of the piazza, try Bibamus on Via di S. Maria Dell Anima which runs parallel to the piazza, good standard food and relatively cheap beer but its small. Navona is lovely and definitely worth a visit for the fountains and just 'to be there' lots of people walking about just being happy. One of the 'must see' sights of Rome

peolple watching. fun place to people watch. the restaurants surrounding the piazza are all mid priced to inexpensive and the food and service is ok. the fountain and the sculptures are an added attraction
I like this Piazza and the Basilica here. Great place to people watch from a cafe but do remember that you are paying premium prices and a coffee is double the price! Lovely artistic vibe
Charming with history smell. The Place is Charming and you can feel the history smell with many of restaurants around and coffee shops

Four Winds, Angels and Demons and fab gelato. If you've seen 'Angels and Demons' you will recognise the Piazza Navona as the place where the hero rescues a kidnapped cardinal from the fountain of the four winds, an immense sculptural creation by Bernini in the centre of the piazza.The Piazza was reasonably quiet the first time we visited, and we happily nattered about the film, watched some very stylish dancers making the most of a busking quartet and treated ourselves to ice creams in a variety of enticing flavours.For some reason, although it was nowhere near our hotel, we kept finding ourselves at Piazza Navona, and experienced it at night (lots of hawkers with scarves, wooden chopping boards which transform into fruit bowls and carved animals) and again during the day when artists offer prints (100 x the price you will pay on the river bank near the Castel St Angelo) and caricatures.We had a bit of last-evening fun bartering for a couple of scarves, but otherwise weren't bothered by the hawkers who seemed to aim for the more obvious tourists.Now I’m going to say a few words about being a tourist in Rome, and I will include it with reviews of all the places we visited because I wish I had known prior to my visit and maybe it will help you on yours!Firstly, Rome is an elegant city. Tourists in shorts, crop-tops and mini-skirts stand out like a very sore thumb. This attire will mean you are unwelcome in churches, (especially the Vatican and the Vatican Museums) where it is regarded as disrespectful. Expect to be turned away if you are dressed like this. We witnessed from one lady in microshorts and a strappy top and her partner in vest top, Bermudas and tattoos, being politely asked to cover up or leave St Peter’s which did not go down well after waiting for hours in a queue.If you dress smartly you are less likely to be bothered by hawkers, tables materialise in apparently packed restaurants, and you are treated with respect. It’s worth going for ‘smart casual’ if you want to get the best from Rome.Secondly, footwear. Roman streets are mainly cobbled and very gappy. Stiletto or kitten heels are going to be mighty uncomfortable. Wear block heels, wedges or flat shoes and you won’t go far wrong. Most Roman ladies seem to run around in loafers or boots. Another thing to consider is that there is A LOT of walking involved wherever you go. Walk your shoes in thoroughly before you get there and you will save yourself a lot of pain and blisters. Nevertheless, it might be a good idea to pack some plasters in your handbag so you don’t limp yourself out of action. I don’t suppose I’m the first person to lose a toenail after three days walking around the city.Be polite, smile, say hello, please and thank you in Italian and you will be appreciated as much as you appreciate the Eternal City.
Walking distance from Hotel Virgilo. when we went there it was crowded badly. amazing view. you can spent 45min to hour to enjoy this attraction
Rome in Mid April. This is a beautiful area to visit. There is so much to see and its great to people watch at this location.

Always at Home in the Piazza Navona. I love visiting this site because it's almost the beating heart of the city. I always eat at "Tres Scalini". Yummy. A glass of Roman Red Wine and some pasta, boy oh boy, the best.

Street Fun. Navona turned out to be my favourite among Rome's piazzas, outranking Spagna, Popolo and even Trevi. The fountains, the bistros, the ice cream and the street artists made me not want to leave. Needless to say, all the action happens in the evening.
Amazin Vibe. Definitely a must visit on your trip to Rome. Right in the city center, great vibe, great places to eat, great to just chill and relax, soak in the Rome atmosphere.

Lovely Piazza - but very expensive restaurants.... Lovely to walk around and people watch, but find somewhere else to eat. Very expensive, ok food - which was a shame as everywhere else we went was great.

La più elegante e la più gioiosa piazza romana. Piazza Navona is one of the finest Baroque masterpiece in Rome. Life in the piazza revolves around the open-air-cafés and the seasonal fairs. The cafés are really expencive, but you will enjoy in great espresso, and very good service.You will see painters and street performers that put on their shows for tourists and passersby, and for sure you will be impressed by Borromini's and Bernini's architectual masterpieces.
Place to visit. Bit crowded and hard to find this place as situated within a small square. A very famous monument/tourist place but very congested area during busy periods.
Nice place for lunch in the sunshine. Busy but a very pleasant square to sit and watch the world go by as you eat lunch or have a coffee break.

Nice Piazza to walk around and sit and enjoy the weather on a nice day. There are many (quite pricey) restaurants around the piazza where you can sit and have a drink or eat a meal. However, I find it just as nice to get something to go from one of the smaller restaurants on the side streets and eat it at the piazza while enjoying the nice weather! There is some seating which is nice. Would recommend stopping by for sure!

Lovely, lively square, full of restaurants.. Lovely to see, but really only filled with restaurants. No shops. Quaint little streets around and its bet to eat in those streets, as the square is a little pricey.
Beautiful Plaza. While I love this plaza, go early to avoid the throngs of tourists, the fountains are stunning, there area number of restaurants and gelato places

Perfect at Christmastime...... We ended up visiting this Piazza several times during our 7 day stop in Rome. It seems like our path always crossed or ended here. It's a beautiful Piazza - full of history. Piazza Navona is famous for the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers). It's topped by the Obelisk of Domitian, brought in pieces from the Circus of Maxentius. Piazza Navona has two other fountains. at the southern end is the Fontana del Moro and at the northern end is the Fountain of Neptune. You should take some time, sit and enjoy a gelato, and people watch. There are street artists and street vendors that liven things up. There are countless restaurants with outside tables for people-watching. My ONLY complaint/suggestion is : be wary of some of the street vendors - I watched one practically terrorize a tourist when they had expressed interest in a purse (counterfeit to be sure). When the tourist said "never mind" I watched this vendor dog them for about 15 minutes - pressure selling if I ever saw it. The secret is to be distant and uninterested and you'll be fine. Check out the carousel if you have kids - it was fun to watch.

Great place to have a cup of capoccino and admire the fountain and church.. Our hotel was very near here and we visited this Piazza several times during our stay. We had dinner twice at Tucci's. Great pizza and service, say hello to Allihandro, best waiter in town. We also had capoccino and crossants here in the mornings. Be sure to visit the church, its a real gem. The only bad thing is the annoying Indian peddlars. They are numerous and very aggressive to the point I was about to knock a few out of my way when walking. They ruin this square and the numerous other places we visited in Rome.
Lovely Piazza in Rome!. Amazing place. Lots of good places to eat. Great ice cream (valentino) near by.A place you must visit , when in Rome.

Beautiful square in the heart of Rome. the fountains are very pretty. You can also find a church and some ornate government buildings here. Surrounding the plaza, there is some shopping, and a few restaurants and cafe. Its a nice place to bring a book, have a drink, and spend some time.

A buzzy square with fountains and lined with restaurants.. We have eaten here before but this visit we just stopped for a cool drink in the shade. One side of the square is in sun and the other shady so it will please most people.

Really beautiful. A great spot for a quick coffee break on our walk to the Vatican. Fountains were beautiful, and there were many lovely surrounding cafes, so we were spoilt for choice!A great spot to relax and just take in Rome's beautiful culture.

Animated meeting place. Be sure to go to the museum about the Roman stadium that accounts for the shape of the piazza. The restaurants and cafes were full, but there are--unusually for Rome--benches to sun and want the crowds.And watch your wallet.
Avoid the restaurants. Do not be tempted to dine at any of the restaurants at the piazza and do not try the chocolate tartufo which is overestimated and way overpriced at €12 a piece.

Beautiful. Great place to have a drink and watch the world go by. Entertainers on the square so also good for children. Beautiful fountains. There is also a lovely Church you can have a look in.We visited this piazza a couple of times during our visit and there was always a lovely atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit.

Nice square. Highlight for me was the four rivers fountain as featured in angels and demons. The square is pleasant enough and sports another of Rome's many beautiful churches, with places to eat and drink around it.
Good place to eat. Nice people watching square with lots of bars and restaurants. Was worth finding. Some street acts and busy nice place as the sun goes down

A Lively Piazza. In the daytime and early evening, the piazza is busy with tourists, street entertainers and vendors. Late evening the atmosphere changes as tourists hunt out somewhere good to eat or to sit with a glass of Prosecco and watch fellow holidaymakers.
Fun place,. A lovely large square with beautiful fountains - the one in the middle with a hole thought. Fun restaurants all round the square open all day.
Our favorite dinner spot. We love the small cafes in Piazza Navona and there is lots of artists with gorgeous oil paintings and people doing characatures.

Beautiful piazza - lovely place to sit and catch your breath. A guide we used for the Vatican told us to visit here - and to be honest I hadn't heard of it as one of Rome's major sites before. It is not too far from the Spanish Steps or Trevi Fountain and it certainly has more space, restaurants etc than either of them. The fountains are beautiful but as a few other reviewers have commented I had expected more. I think there is a possibility that we can become a bit blasé once you've spent a lot of time visiting the many other wonderful sites Rome has to offer. Nonetheless a lovely place to sit and catch your breath in the sun in between walking from one site to another!
Outstanding Piazza. Loved visiting this enormous piazza that sits on top of a Roman amphitheatre. You can visit the underground museum at the top end as well as admire the Bernini fountains up above,
Renovated. Totally renovated. All fountains can be seen without obstacle. Lots of restaurants around them but better go away from them.
It's beaufiful but too crowded. It's a beautiful place, but for me it was too crowded. It's not possible to enjoy this place. Too many people with selfie stick. ;)
A moment to appreciate Rome. LOVED the fountains!! So gorgeous and stop at Tre Scalini for a Tartuffe. For just a few minutes, you can relax into the "sweet life". Simply lovely.

Beautiful fountains but I expected more.. The piazza Navona was not as beautiful as I had anticipated. It had been said to be THE most beautiful square at least in Europe if not the world. The fountains are beautiful and the restaurants and music makes it very nice and a must see. I probably had to high hopes. I will surely be back to Rome later and give it another chance.

Navona.... Nice to go through walking nicely and, way not, basking in the sun with a nice coffee in hands...Très sympa la traversée de la place avec un café en main et la caresse du soleil italien sur la joue ;)

Lovely fountain and piazza. Definitely worth visiting on your travels round Rome. This is a lovely fountain situated in a beautiful piazza. There are lots of restaurants around the piazza, but just be warned they aren't the cheapest, so maybe just have a drink.

Lovely place to linger. We thought this was a fantastic public square, actually much nicer than the area by the Spanish Steps. It had a more genuine local feel to it and plenty of chance for people-watching as well as the great fountains, and a quick walk from the Jewish quarter as well. Grab an ice cream from the gelateria and relax there....

Amazing Piazza Navona. Huge Piazza with fountain, and close to metro station. It is often starting point for walking tours in this part of Rome. Plenty of tourists, entertainers, there are often events on this Piazza.

Wonderful . Beautiful place, really amazing in the sunshine and easy to navigate to. For food, to avoid the tourism, walk about 5/10 in any direction, we found the service and food quality to be much better!
An amazing piazza. We in sat in a cafe and we had a glass of wine as we watched the piazza. What a wonderful atmosphere. It has three fountains. You must visit this piazza!
A wonderful piazza. A very nice place to visit with three fountains with the main one being a true beauty. A nice place to sit and relax and enjoy the scene.
Large piazza with great fountain. This is a large piazza with an impressive fountain and lots of places to eat and relax and take in the sun.
Always good. Busy, but always worth it! Great place for people watching, eating, or just strolling the beautiful piazza with its beautiful fountains.

Beautuful square. A great place to wonder, people-watch and eat; the centre-piece of the square is an Egyptian stone pillar and the square has fountains on each-side. Like other squares and tourist areas around Rome, Piazza Navona has street-sellers selling laser pens, selfie-sticks, etc. Alongside the square are restaurants on both sides, we did not look at the menu options; hence, cannot say how the prices are compared to other squares and other areas.

Fresh and shiny. The Fountain has just been cleaned and it's a really nice place to have a chat, eat an ice-cream and make a wish. But you have to go early in the morning if you want to make a picture, because otherwise, you won't appear on your own photo !

Stunning fountains.. The magnificent Fountain of the Four Rivers in the centre and two smaller ones at each end make the Piazza Navona worth a visit alone, but there is much more - the atmosphere of the crowds, the art sellers, another beautiful church to visit. This was a place I visited twice, just to soak up the atmosphere and admire the fountains.
Disappointing during the night. I am sure that I would have given it a 5 star if I had visited it during the day but during the night, with almost negligible lighting it is not worth a visit.

Awesome fountains. Came across this by wandering around lost. It was amazing, put it on your must see list as the fountains are something else with plenty of cafes around to sit and just take in the ambiance xx
Not the nicest of Piazzas in the evening , to many hawkers. Much preferred the campo del fiori , restaurants better food , better choice , cheaper , better cocktails , more relaxed
nice place to see. nice location with lot of food and shops around. can be very crowded as it is a place where most tourist will go to.

Perfect for relaxation especially if you go early in the morning. I highly recommend going to Piazza Navona early in the morning between 8am-10am because it's less crowded. You can sit on one of the benches by the fountains and just enjoy the sound of the fountains and watch people walking around, taking pictures, and watch vendors set up their little spot to sell their products. If you want to buy a painting or an artwork, and if you happen to include Venice as one of your itineraries in Italy, I highly recommend buying your artwork souvenir in Venice because it's more expensive in Rome or in Florence. I happen to wait til my last day in Italy and I happen to be in Rome. I bought an artwork in Piazza Navona, which cost me €25.00, which only costs €10.00 in Venice and the quality is better. Anyways, I highly recommend going to Piazza Navona. It was also close to Pantheon. It was a decent walking distance so you can plan to group those two sites on the same day. If you happen to need a bathroom, go in the restaurant just across the fountain. They don't charge bathroom use, unlike other public bathrooms in Italy.
Beautiful plaza.. Great for people watching. Find a table on the sidewalk and enjoy a wonderful lunch and a glass of wine. Good leather shop in the piazza.

Suprised at how great this Piazza is.. If your in Rome on your owe make this a must see. A couple of Fountains here and real spectacular. Especially the four rivers.Absolutely fascinating the take po n the rivers. Ganges, Danube, Rio De La Plata and the Nile. Very big Piazza. Grande
Bernini's Piazza. Bernini's fountain in the middle of the Piazza is beautiful. Pity there are not more lights at night to brighten up the fountain
Beautiful!!. A few shops and restaurants, Piazza Navona is all about the fountains and sculptures. It's an easy walk from the Pantheon (we walked from Pantheon, to Piazza Navona, to Campo di Fiori)

Beautiful square to sit in and eat ice-cream!. This is a beautiful square with fountains, seating and surrounded by ornate historical buildings. It is a lovely place to wander through, just enjoying the surroundings, but also a great place to sit with an ice-cream for a well-earned rest.

Favourite place.. This is my favourite place to people watch. The fountains are superb. Do not buy food in the eating places around the square. Go down any of the little lanes leading off and food and drink is half the price.

Wonderful Piazza to sit and watch the world go by , day and night. Piazza Navona is just one of my favourite bits of Rome where the world and his wife drift by and the buildings and fountain centre piece is a wonder in its self . If you are at the Pantheon then just drift on up to Piazza Navona enjoy a snack in the many wee and the not so wee cafes down the sides of the square go back at night when the bustle of the day has faded into a tranquil murmur just a great way to wind down the day .

The happening place at night in Rome!. We walked through the Piazza at night at the conclusion of a food tour. It was bustling with people of all ages and we learned from our guide that it is the local hang out for teenagers to come and have drink and socialize. Very beautiful and full of life.
Three fountains. One of the best Piazzas in Rome with three fantastic fountains, the area is surrounded with nice eating places most of which are beyond the pocket of this reviewer

We stayed near here so we could stroll to hearts content!. We enjoyed the nighttime strolling the fountains so much last time we were in Rome that we purposely choose a boutique hotel (spendy!!) in the Navona area just so we could enjoy the evenings at our leisure. Broke the budget, but did not disappoint! Would do it again! Lovely area.
Another amazing spot of Rome. Another great place (among so many) to see in Rome. I was impressed with the sculptures and detail that went into this fountain.

One of my favourite places in Rome. There are many local artists here, selling paintings, playing music, performing art. Restaurants all around and beautiful fountains in the middle, far left and right of the square. Plus, you're close by campo di Fiori, and other great attractions, like the pantheon.

A must !!. Just go!! Sit in any restaurant order something simple ( everything is more expensive here) then sit back and watch the show!
Many artists selling some lovely art.
Street performers, musicians, mimes and tourists!!

Beautiful!. One of the loveliest piazzas in Rome. Beautiful fountains and sculptures. Great cafes and restaurants. Fantastic people watching and street performers. This is a happening place day and night.

Off the beaten track, but worth a visit. This isn't high on most people's lists of things to see in Rome, but it is well worth a visit. There are no close metro or HOHO bus stops close to this location, but the walk takes you through some back streets of Rome, so you actually get to see some of Rome, not just the tourist spots.Entering to square, there are three water features; one at each end and a bigger one in the middle. During the day it is full of artists and characturists. The bigger water feature has a needle monument, but the detail on the sculptures attached to it are amazing. There are some stone benches dotted around so there are places to sit and chill if you've walked around all day like I did.

People Watching. The Piazza Navona is the place to gawk in Rome. It is always filled with people, Romans and tourists, and sitting for a time is well worth the time. Berinini's Fountain is spectacular, better than Trevi, and easy to view from all angles. Go at night!!!a dinner at the piazza Fiore and a strollto Navona for a gelato or espresso is a perfect night in Rome.

Bustling piazza. This is a really bustling piazza with lots of people enjoying the atmosphere. We took a seat in the shade and enjoyed a bottle of wine while watching everyone pass by. No further entertainment needed ;-)

A popular and crowded square. The huge and popular Roman square stands on the site of the ancient Stadium of Domitian and still has the form of the open shape of the stadium. It was designed in the Baroque style during the 17th century in the pontificate of Innocent X, whose family palace stood at the square.

Quintessential Roman fountain. This is the perfect place to stroll, to meet a friend, or to enjoy some wine in one of the cafes. Some places are pricy, so as to take advantage of the ambiance, but put that aside - this is pretty dreamy. The sculpture is quite inspirational.

A must do, of course. Famous Trevi Fountain, so had to see. The carving work is absolutely beautiful! Unfortunately, the plaza was packed and it was difficult to get near the fountain. Save for a low-traffic time - maybe during lunch, early morning, or late.
Beautiful fountain. Every piazza in Rome has a statue or fountain but this is one of the more impressive. It is well worth the trip to see it.
Must see this!. Gorgeous romantic square in an opulent style long gone! Wandered around and just enjoyed the ambience.

Relaxing place!. Piazza Navona is central Rome’s elegant showcase square. It was built over the 1st-century Stadio di Domiziano, it was paved over in the 15th century and for almost 300 years hosted the city's main market. I've seen here beautiful fountains, baroque palazzi and colourful cast of street artists, hawkers and tourists. Its centrepiece is Bernini’s Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi, an ornate, showy fountain featuring personifications of the rivers Nile, Ganges, Danube and Plate. The Fontana del Moro at the southern end of the square was designed by Giacomo della Porta in 1576. At the northern end of the piazza, is Fontana del Nettuno where Neptune is fighting with a sea monster, surrounded by sea nymphs. It's nice to stay near a fountain an simply look at the people, have a coffe os buy souvenirs. And, of course, take many photos! :)
