Not to be missed. Best visited in the morning when there are few people and the light is great for photos. This seems much safer then several years ago with police circulating.
Vacation. This is beautiful in the evening and lots of people, so keep your children close. The fountains Art is unbelievable to gaze at.

Incredible Fountain, Large Square, Worth It. Bernini's fountain of the four rivers is finally refurbished and worth the visit although the restaurants in the square are overpriced, they do provide a great ambiance. The fountain is part of Dan Brown's Angel's & Demons book. Must visit.
Try and see. One of the fountians. I prefer fontana di trevi more but still it's realy beautiful and also close to the centre so sorth going if you've time.

When in Rome. When in Rome a place to visit its alive all day and it takes on a different feeling at night it is the place to be you can just sit there and people watch, and with the fountains with its clear water and statues the buskers and street theatre, the restaurants you can spend hours there and then go and enjoy a meal and a glass of wine don't miss it.

Definitely go for the fountains, but nothing else to see. The fountains are great, even two small ones in the both ends of the square (they are identical).The Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers) is breathtaking, it has so many interesting details. It was built in 1651 by famous Gian Lorenzo Bernini.The fountains completely justify the time spent for the visit, however, in my opinion, there's nothing else to see there.

Beautiful but too many agressive hawkers. The piazza is beautiful but the hawkers selling scarves, selfie sticks and toys are very agressive and annoying. There are so many of them that it's very difficult to really appreciate the beauty of the piazza itself.

A Beautiful Piazza but Very Crowded. One must go here early in the morning to avoid crowds and get a good look at the fountains. Also stop at Bar Tre Scalini for a famed Tartufo and just sit on the piazza.

Stunning. The square is really impressive, plenty of restaurants and beautiful fountains, be aware of the street touts which can become quite annoying, also the main fountain is the one that features in Angel and Demons, we also had a wonderful evening meal in the Square and the fountains were all lit up which was stunning.
artistic square. quaint square dominated by painter and artistic people ,enjoy the vibe and the history of this square.Feel free to walk around and drench of this amazing place.

Rome at it's most romantic, with dining options.. With the beautiful Bernini fountain, cafes and restaurants, it is great people viewing. Imagine the palace that sits on the piazza as your dream residence and while away the hours.
Beautiful!. All of the fountains are amazing. Take your time to enjoy the beauty, study the sculptures. They truly are amazing!

Swing by quick and take pics! (Visited in Summer 2013). This place is a good spot to visit. It's similar to the other piazzas but still worth a visit. It could be crowded at times so be ready for that!

Good to People Watch. A really nice square to sit and people watch, usually there is some street theatr taking place too. Only problem is that there are quite a few of those annoying people selling things and the restaurants are definitely more expensive in that area too.

Great, but go to the restaurants behind the plaza. Lovely piazza, large so not too crowded, interesting street vendors, nice cafes, beautiful buildings and fountains. Very attractive day or night. Good to see and walk through on your way to the streets behind the piazza to the west where there are loads of smaller cafes, bars and restaurants. Don't as the remains of the circus stands at the north end of the piazza, walk behind the shops and you can see from the street.
Gorgeously elegant. Lovely place to sit by the fountains and watch the world go by or have a meal in one of the numerous restaurants.
Where Rome comes to watch the tourists. Beautiful - and full of tourists. If you are staying in Rome a stroll through this breathtaking piazza is more relaxing if taken at twilight. Magical.

Takes your breath away. Beautiful fountains wonderful place to watch the people and go back 2000 years as what it was like. Rome is such a great city to get lost in. Every corner there is something that is fabulous
A delightful piazza. Rome continued to work its magic here. Virtually no tourists when I visited so could take it all in. Like stepping back in time.

"Beautiful but always crowded". The fountain has an unique attraction with crystal clear water and massive statues. The only drawback is the never ending crowd which does not allow you to sit there to enjoy the scenic beauty.
TIP- Visit this place at 6 in the morning as it will not have tourists around.

Be there before 11 AM. A beautiful piazza built over the former station in Rome. Boosting of restaurants around the Piazza is the are adjust to sit and watch. The piazza where the cardinal was thrown into the fountain in the movie Angels & Demons by Dan Brown ( except most was filmed in Canada )

Nice place and very secure. tourist wise- this is must see. My feedback is the sense of security we had while there are 4 police cars in 4 corners of he area, blocking merchants with goods to harass tourists with their things to sell. nice place to visit. we spent about 10 minutes there, while walking around the tomb stones

Wow...Amazing! A must see when you are in Rome.. This was truly a spectacular sight. It's hard to describe so this review will be short but on the list of things to see in Rome, this is definitely one of them. I would highly recommend reading up on it ahead of time so you understand the history. That makes the experience that much more meaningful.

Historic Social Center. A former athletic forum turned into a piazza, a great place to watch people and enjoy the fountain. Many other sights are nearby including museums and even a seminary which is still training students. Also money changers - be sure to ask what the real amount is, because they charge you a service fee that is NOT disclosed.
Gorgeous, but crowded.. Watch your stuff, take some pics. You can breeze through here and snap away, or linger by the fountain, provided you can (or dare) tolerate the masses.
Hustling and Bustling Place. Nice area to have some dinner or a coffee just to do some people watching and enjoy the ambiance of Rome in the evening.
Must see!. Have a glass of wine in a piazza cafe and soak up the atmosphere/people watch. Central location where all other attractions are easy access!

Wonderful sight!. Sat in the sunshine and marvelled at the Piazza Navona. Such wonderful sculptures and such detail. The fountains are really relaxing and one could sit here forever'. Really worth a visit.
Breathtaking.. What a lively,spacious meeting place surrounded by wonderful fountains. It was alive with people having a good time.

If you want to eat, be entertained or look at impressive sights. Piazza Navona is spacious and even if it is a lot of people gathering here it doesn't get too crowded. The square often have artist of different kind entertaining spectators and it is lined with restaurants. Three fountains can be found here, most famous is Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. Close to the fountain you'll find Chiesa di Sant'Agnese in Agone.

GREAT PIAZZA. Great Piazza if in Rome must visit this Piazza.
Lots of Restaurants in the Piazza so therefore service is competitive.
Watch the Service charge one Restaurant charged us 15%.

Overrated for the weather :(. I have seen nothing but greatness on Pinterest for this. It rained, which I know sent the authentic vendors running so their merchandise wouldn't be ruined. Cool fountain of the 4 rivers, but was wayyy too touristy.
Best people watching. Great piazza to stop for a wine or coffee and watch all the people. We stopped by almost daily and always enjoyed the parade of people. Buskers were entertaining too.

Lovely area. Lovely Piazza that used to be one of the "circus" areas in Rome~ the shape of the circus is still obvious in the way the Piazza is built up. The fountains are amazing~ especially the one of the "four rivers". Lots of little restaraunts and some shops.
Nice to See.. Very nice and large square , the buildings around it and the fountain in the middle and the sides are very nice and you can also set in many of the Cafe or restaurants on it.
nice place. Piazza Navona is nice place to visit. It is like a square, there are many people resting, talking. there are several statues and fountain also.
Afternoon relaxing. My Daughter and I spent an afternoon watching the world go by in the Piazza - actors. artists and residents of rome on a sunday afternoon. wonderful insight.

Nice, packed with tourists though.. We arrived here by Tuc tuc which was great fun!..Its a lovely square, very busy. We just grabbed an ice-cream and strolled on to Campo Fiori which is a great little spot nearby.
Nice. We went into Piazza Navona on our way to the Vatican but it is an impressive area. Amazing statues and fountains.

Great place to simply be. Relax and soak up the atmosphere. Lovely views, fun entertainers, great restaurants to choose from. Interesting selection of shops. You can really watch the whole world walk by.
Beautiful. This area is beautiful, lots of really nice building, fountains, shops and really nice for chilling out in,.

Over priced. After a fascinating wander through the back streets of Rome we arrived at the Piazza Nervona,as it was morning and warm we decided to have a coffee in one of the cafes.The coffee was very nice but the price £10was a bit steep!As it was midday there was a lot of people but not crowded,a few artists but no other street art in progress.

Great for architecture, history and people watching. A big draw for the crowds with the amazing fountains. a great place to stroll around, enjoy the atmosphere, fountains and perhaps sit with a glass of something enjoying the spectacle.

My favorite piazza. With all the hustle and bustle and noise around you have that lovely fountain in the middle. And it keeps gushing water and ever flowing in the four directions. But in the silence of the night this fountain seems to be the only noise around and it is wonderful to hear the sound. It is like the sound of silence.

FULL OF LIFE!!!. If you like crowded places this is the right one to visit.full of restaurant,cafes and shops.the square is lively with it's four river fountain place at the middle of it.One of the best spots in Rome you should visit.

Beautiful . If you are in Roma you have to visit piazza Navona. There are always many different things going on there, the fountains and the architecture is beautiful but do not go to eat to any of the restaurants that are around Piazza Navona . The food is terrible and they over charge

One to tick off, and some lovely statues as you go past. Very nice but very expensive. We had a cocktail here one night but otherwise walked through on our way elsewhere. It's worth reading up about the statues here

Friendly and supergood. The staff was very friendly, singing, making jokes... And you can easily ask one little piece of ALL the pizzas... which are super good tasting. A good little restaurant very close to Vatican

wonderful area. as we wondered around Rome on our own "tour" of Rome we stopped at this Piazza- what a wonderful area to visit- the fountains were beautiful and grand- plenty of Cafe's to sit and have some good food and drinks- enjoy the people watching and also buy either a picture made from a local artist or a little souvenir - just one of the wonderful areas in Rome to see
Wonderful olace for people watching. a great place to stop and sit to rest weary feet, lots to see, wonderful fountains and statues and eating places all around the edge.
Beautiful & full of life !. Get a beer & just people watch - perfect ! Restaurants can be expensive & touristy - cheaper elsewhere. It's a must see !

A big square. Piazza Navona is a big square with a (very) nice fountain and tourist-trap restaurants. At least it's easily accessible and big enough not to feel very crowded even with a lot of people. For the romantic café visit, go elsewhere.
Wishing Well. You must visit the fountains whilst in Rome and I would advise you to visit during the day and again at night as both experiences were amazing. Hope your wishes come true.
If not for all the people.... The Piazza is of course very beautiful, now that it has been renovated, but the crowd just takes the fun out of the place...
Piazza Navona. A beautiful piazza, restaurants, entertainment, wonderful fountains and a lovely feel. We spent many happy hours sitting here.

Pretty Piazza. Pretty Piazza not far from the Pantheon. The fountain in the middle of the square is the main draw and it is spectacular. I almost prefer it to the Trevi Fountain in all honesty. Lots of artists based here too so lovely to watch them work and also pick up some paintings for home.

Beautiful fountain that is overlooked. Such a beautiful fountain and lively piazza. But somehow this is usually not a must-see sight for many visitors to Rome. Was recommended by a fellow tourist and we are glad we made the trip there!
Lovely little square. . Lovely little square full of eateries and shops. Great atmosphere. "Dolce Vista" is a fantastic restaurant located with the Piazza Navono.
Scenic. Take enough time into account and some extra Euros in the pocket and enjoy a cup of coffee in the sun. Too good to visit only for a quick look. Enjoy!

All three are Superb. but my favourite is the "Meeting of the Four Rivers". It is possible to loose track of time looking at the Sculptures so keep an eye on your watch. Also, beware of pick-pockets (as with most places in Rome - it is better to wear something which has a pocket that can be sealed by zip!).

Love the fountains!. Especially the amazing one by Bernini in the middle of the square. Check it out! I had heard that there were lots of great street performers but didn't see any during our two visits. Still, a pleasant place to hang out, and did I mention the wonderful fountains?!

Fabulous. My husband and I went around 8am to Piazza Navona, just to take in the place before the people arrived...it was gorgeous and quiet!!! We wanted to have breakfast there, but everything was closed or only just opening up, so we simply soaked in the peace and beauty of the piazza and then headed to our next stop. We returned later that day and the place was heaving. We also checked it out one evening after dinner, sat on a bench and people watched, the piazza was buzzing with life...great place to sit and have a gelato!

Nice place to visit. Definitely a place to visit, but as with anywhere busy it's important to be alert. We saw pickpockets in action so keep an eye on valuables! Lots of places to eat, but to we got irritated by the fact that we couldn't stop and look at the menus without being mithered by the staff. We eventually decided not to eat at the Piazza and we found a place around the corner (Bar Senato) were we had a very nice panini for a very reasonable price.

So beautiful. Although it's very touristic but yet I think it's one of their most beautiful Piazzas in Rome... just to sit around the fountain and listen to the voices and see other people coming across perfect morning
Amazing place. One of my favorite places in Rome. And I was lucky about thieves then, didn't meet any. But you always have to be careful anyway. Especially it is beautiful in the evenings.

A work of art. Piazza Navona is a magnificent piece of art. It was built on the ruins of a stadium (Horse racing I believe) so it is big and impressing!The water fountains are truly magnificent. There is a special atmosphere in the area and the street artists contribute to that. Plenty of coffee shops and restaurants. Be sure to visit the Church as it is very impressing. Be sure to go there at least twice – night and day!
Did this as part of Segway tour ,,. Tour guide explained plenty of the colourful history of the place. Early morning is best to avoid the crowds and selfie stick sellers
Piazza Novona. Great place to include in your schedule walking tours of Rome. Can be crowded so have time and remember it's a vacation anyway.
A dramatic square. Piazza Navona has a beautiful fountain and is lined with cafes and restaurants. It is lively and like many of Rome's piazzas is full of atmosphere and charm.
A nice place to visit. There is not much to it just a nice square with some fountains but it was a nice place to visit if you are walking past it.

Nice place... But thieves and robbers hang out.. We visited Rome for 1 week in April 2016, and one thing I experienced is that it seems like for every 10 tourists there must have been 1 robber or thief lurking around every tourists spot. Whether it is the Trevi fountain, piazza Navona, the Pantheon or the Colosseum you really have to watch out for these people. These thieves and robbers are really good and they place themselves among the crowd and most often looking like tourists themselves. I really prepared myself before I went on this trip and doing all the precautions I can think of, but one moment I let go of my guard and my backpack was gone with my camera and some souvenirs. Don't get me wrong. Rome is a nice place to visit but one thing I hate are people who take advantage of people, especially tourists that gives their economy a boost. Imagine all the income tourism brings to Rome. Rome is a great city with an amazing history what makes it not so great are the thieves and robbers that gives a bad name to this marvelous city.

Nice piazza for tourist . A nice large piazza surrounded by restaurants and small stalls. Would recommend the restaurants just along the roads next to the piazza. Some very nice local restaurants that are reasonably priced. Worth a visit for lunch.

Marvellous piazza. We felt in love with Piazza Navona at first side. Our apartment was nearby and we used every opportunity to visit this beautiful and amazing place, ancient stadium of Domitian. It is recommended to see it on day light, as in the evening the fountains are not lighted, the only light coming from the buildings rounding them. In the middle of Piazza Navona there is a special church from the 17-th century, "Sant'Agnese in Agone", a "must see" baroque architecture.

Its a market square..... Stopped by here for a sit down & a drink, waiters were a bit quick to get you sat down & then away??The place is like loads of Rome worth a visit, we did in day time so might be worth a trip here at night to soak up the atmosphere, couple of fountains that are on the tick list.
nice and crowded. stroll on this famous and busiest piazza. listen to street musicians .. have a cup of coffee or glass of wine and people watch.. like the famous piazza in Venice.. must go. enjoy .
like in the pictures. beautiful famous piazza in central rome reflecting all you see in mags books etc. many bars eateries etc and great vibe but expensive...touristy too

Full of tourists: go early morning if you can. Three stars is for the typical daytime and evening experience: tourist central, liberally dotted with grubby people trying to flog cheaply copied artworks, 'tours' and light toys.If you can go in the early morning as the city awakens then you'll get a very much more memorable visit, with stylish Rome residents heading to work and walking their dogs.Your choice!
Stunning Piazza. Do not miss this stunning Piazza with beautiful fountains, surrounded by tempting cafes and lovely buildings
Our favourite Piazza. We visited early on a sunny morning, before the crowds, and it was a pleasure to wander around this beautiful square with its three captivating fountains and stunning buildings

Beautiful Piazza. Gorgeous fountains surrounded by beautiful buildings. Coffee or a meal will cost a little more here than other places but we shared a pizza (one between two was plenty for lunch) and enjoyed the sunshine and the views.
Good place for lunch & people watching. Lovely historic piazza, amazing church, gorgeous fountain, loads of restaurants. Piazza Navona has it all, really
Masterful fountain.. The fountain is gorgeous with the carvings incredible. A large plaza where people congregate and so relaxing to just observe the stone carvings.
Happening Place in Rome with Beautiful Fountains. This was our favorite piazza, especially earthly morning. Has three beautiful fountains. Midday it gets crowded. Good place for people watching.
Charming square. The restaurants around the square are quite expensive. It cost us about 20 euros for 3 coffees. But it is a nice place to sit and let time pass by.
A crowded square by any other name. One of the most popular piazza in Roma. Expensive pizzeria and gelato places. 3 OK fountains. Plenty of police, army and carabinaire for amusement and security.
A fountain from Angels and demons novel <3. Really lovely place in any time - day or night. Fresh and cold water from this fountain is like survival place or oasis in hot weather.
The best square in Rome. Large area, many restaurants. Attractive buildings, fountains and statues.Just a very pleasant open air space.
Worth the trip!. Careful planning as to walking route saves unnecessary fatigue. Get a detailed map of Rome that marks the highlights of the city. This piazza is huge!

A great piazza - nice place for coffee even if touristy!. We love this piazza - the sun always seems to shine. Quite a few places to get coffee, gelato or lunch etc - probably quite touristy so if that bothers you this isn't for you. However, I'm willing to be caught in the trap to sit somewhere so fab :-)
Brilliant. Great place to just sit and watch the world go by over a cup of coffee or Prosecco (or 2). Bit more expensive than other places but well worth a visit.

Good for people watching. A good place to have a break and people watch. As the evening light faded, it was impressive when the lights came on. The street entertainment was varied and not bad at all. Only down side - the sellers who can't take no for an answer.

return after many years .......... we last visited piazza Navona about 15 years previously and found it much unchanged.
its one of the best piazza for people watching and looking at artists at work in middle of piazza stop for a coffee /ice cream and sit watching the world go by contemplating the next site in town to visit .................

Great start point for a morning of sightseeing . We started a touring day here nice and early when it was empty. This allowed us great photo ops with all the buildings and fountains, and set us up well with short walks to the Santa Maria Della Pace, the Pantheon, and so many more famous points to the east of the piazza. Lots of places to eat if you need as well as local artists selling their works
beautiful. one of my favourite parts of rome, and great shopping nearby. Food and restaurants all are good and great place to just sit and eat lunch and take it all in

Lucky enough to be staying on this square. Wow. Out front window and doors open up right into this square. I get a perfect view of this place and have seen how it changes from the morning to lunch to afternoon and evening. It changes every hour and which eve hour you are here you will enjoy this fabulous location. There is the fountain, the restaurants (go into the back streets for best value), the buskers, museums and all the canvassers trying to sell you stuff. So much to explore from this location. I'll attach some photos not normally seen as these were from our hotel window and front door on the balcony.

Great place - veryvrecomanded to spent a few hours there. The piazza is very beautiful. As we were located in a hotel just on the piazza we could see it early in the morning, when there were no other pople yet.We also too great pictures from our hotel room.It was a wanderfull experience.
lovely stop. had a lovely stop at this piazza... lots of people walking by, families... lots of choice near by. lovely italy
Great place to people watch!. There are many art vendors and people wanting to do your caricature. But also lots of restaurants and amazing gelato.

Our Favourite Piazza. What a relaxing place to sit while the world passes you by. Don't order drinks from one of the restaurants closest to the central fountain unless you don't mind paying well over the top.
Right next to Navona Gallery and Garden Suites. Lots going on here. Was nice to walk there, sit in the sun and watch all the buzz of the people coming in and out of the Piazza.
Lovely fountian. We came upon this fountain during our self guided walking tour, that included the Pantheon, which this fountain is near. One of many lovely fountains we seen during our visit!
Bella Italia!. Do yourself a favour and sit and have pizza and a glass of wine and watch the world go by. Oh and don't forget to try the truffle ice cream in the square too.
Great place. The place is great as the buildings and statues are amazing. Also a lot of restuarants and bars are around with very good quality food and good prices.
Perfect fountains.. You should go there just to take some pictures and get mixed with other tourists. It is a very nice square.

Pretty at night . A beautiful romantic walk is a must there .. Walked around .. Sat by the fountain and ate gelato .. It was a light and beautiful experience.. And there are a lot of restaurant choices around that area

Icecream. Rome is the perfect place to walk and loose yourself on the small streets, Piazza Navona will reveal in front of you with all her art and contemporan artists, lovely place to be!
As I said before Rome offers you surprises at every step!

Lovely place ! Just admiring the sculptures and taking in the energy of one of the prettier piazzas in Rome.. If you go to Rome. Piazza Navona will become one of your favorites spots. Romantic, busy, eternal, beautiful art all around. Just enjoy a stroll around the piazza or sit on a bench or by one of the restaurants that overlook the piazza and you will feel delighted and relax. A mixture of energy, vibrant positive energy that always amazes me.

Seemingly pointless, at least in February. Visited this famous place in late February with family including 4 children, and didn't see the point of it. Despite the time of the year it was quite crowded, so don't know how it would change in summer time, but have to give it the shadow of a doubt. But, what's the fuzz?
Walking tour. Bustling lively very beautiful area the fountains are amazing the atmosphere vibrant. Many places to eat and watch the world go by

War of the Artists. Bernini, who built the fountain of the 4 rivers did not like Borromini who built the church Sant'Agnese. The Nile is covering his eyes to stop the church crumbling in front of him. Borromini promptly added a statue to the facade...a goddess to protect his building.

Passing through the Piazza. A lovely open space with much to see! The fountain in the centre is a wonder. Walk right round and enjoy every detail. Then take in the rest of the piazza....the buildings and the the surroundings are superb. Put this on your list.
Lovely place. From all the pliazzas in Rome, this one I liked the most - very pretty with its fountains and surrounding buildings. A must-see in Rome

Most beautiful Piazza in Rome!. I read in a guide book that this was the most beautiful Piazza in Rome so I wanted to see for myself. I wasn't disappointed and agree it truly is beautiful with fantastic architecture all around it.

Meh. Aside from the Four Rivers Fountain, which is FAB. The rest of the Piazza is pretty average. Bunch of tourist trap restaurants and tacky souvenirs. Unfortunately, we didn't get to see the Church of St. Agnes because it was closed on the day we visited.
Lovely place. The piazza is very beautiful and located in a lovely area. Just beware of the restaurants in the piazza. They will murder you with their prices.
Great... Seems to be random when its busy here. We came out twice, one night you couldn't move... the next it felt deserted!

Mots beautiful piazza in Rome !!. Majestic buildings, marvelous fountains, beautiful statues, impressive surroundings, Piazza Navona is unforgettable. So much beauty and so much excitement make the place a magnet where we like strolling and laughing with the many clowns and artists who are welcoming you. Go and forget your sorrows: get lost in beauty and pleasure.

Beautiful. Piazza Navona is a beautiful square providing you with entertainmens, good food, music, stunning monuments and also surrounded by great ice cream, pasta & liquer shops. Must try Tre Scalini, great staff and great food and must try their famous Tartufo :-)
Beautiful! . Great place for a romantic evening. Lots of restaurants and artists in the piazza in the evening. We did not have enough time there to fully appreciate the place.
One of the great Piazza's. Again the guide or a good tour book is really needed to appreciate the statues in the Piazza. Either one would work

Great Piazza. A large and interesting piazza to visit. The fountains are interesting to see.
Many restaurants and a great ice cream shop there

Beautiful square. You should definitely visit for the atmosphere and sunbathe at one of the benches. If you are okay with overpriced coffee, sit in one of the cafes and enjoy the view from there. There are a bit too many illegal shawl/selfie stick/ whatever vendors heckling you, but a firm "no" will send them on their way.
Celebration weekend. This piazza was very impressive with lots of market stalls and restaurants. A lovely place to end the day with a cocktail or gin and tonic. Also lovely to watch the sun go down.

Fantastic. Waiter who served us was fantastic to the point he asked a lucky lucky man to leave us alone. Valpolicella was amazing and even though we only had a pizza it was superb would recommend to anyone ambiance lovely it helped that the sun shined. Gratzi for a lovely day xxx

Fantastic. It is really hard to write about Rome's attractions because they all are truly amazing. Some look better at night, some during the day and some you have to visit a few times during one stay. Piazza Navona is definitely one of them.

Nice enough. We went to Navona at about 8:00pm, thinking the fountains would be beautifully lit. They were not. The Piazza is nice enough, and the fountains amazing, but the atmosphere is quite cold. There is no street mucus or buskers, just lots of folk trying to seek stuff (selfie sticks!). We ate at one of the restaurants. The food was ok, nice Chianti. But probably +3 euros a Mel for the view.
Wonderful place. You see all historical building around. Also statues are very good. Several food options near the plaza. You can eat your food even by walking in the plaza. Must visit place in Rome!
Rome marathon week. We came for the marathon and to celebrate my Fiancée 50th birthday.The romantic Eternal City of Rome has mesmerised us forever#RomeIsInOurHeartsForever

For locals too. It's a sign of a defining monument that attracts locals as well as tourists. And it is good too see that the piazza is receiving some tlc. However, there are a lot of people in this rectangle and it is noisy and there are lots of vendors in your face trying to sell you "junk". It is such fun the first time you see it but that wears thin after your first beverage in one of the adjoining eateries. The people are lovely however I think I needed to have spent less time in Rome (6 days).
Beautiful. Another must see when in Rome!! There's SO much to see, it's impossible to see it all in just a few days!!
Busy Piazza. Certainly one of the larger Piazza's and one of the busiest. 3 fountains in the square and surrounded by shops and restaurants. Lots of artists and other people around.

Lovely piazza full of statuary and people. Just a short walk from Campo di Fiori, Piazza Navona offers photo opportunities galore with its fountains and statues. I have heard and read that it is full of action at night.

So much history in a square.... This is one of the masterpieces of Rome. A must see in a city where you may spend 1 month just sightseeing and not being able to have enough. The square we see nowadays was built on the top of the stadium of Domitian, now visible underneath by entering the building next to the toy store at the beginning of the square.The fountain of the Four Rivers is a 360° monument and the church of Sant'Agnese is worth a visit inside although so less people go in. Buy yourself a gelato while entering the square and wander for at least 30/45 minutes to have the time to explore, see the paintings of the artists, enjoy the white marble/travertino lime stone and then keep on towards the next beauty of the eternal city!
Large piazza. Great place to sit and watch the world go by. Large fountains + bars etc. Also a church to visit which has a great interior.

Very pretty. My partner and i spent our last day in rome here we sat outside and enjoyed the music and watched the street performers and had a lovely meal at one of the outdoor restaraunts (was a little on the expensive side but very beautiful)

Lovely. Beautiful fountains, spacious, good for walking around breathing some fresh air, nice surrounding restaurants, good for people's watching, some artistic activities take place in the area too. Lovely.

Lovely Touristy Area in Central Rome. Piazza Navona is for tourists. It has a range of street sellers, selling craft items and sketching portraits and caricatures. The are a large number of bars and restaurants around the sides of the Piazza, these are generally more expensive than other parts of Rome.

Pricey but worth it. Although I'd encourage searching elsewhere for a meal (there is better quality for less nearby) nothing quite compares to sipping prosecco in one of the cafes lining the piazza, then browsing the art sellers for something a little more special to take home. Definitely the best place to people watch and relax Italian-style.
Nice. Nice fountain to see but I didnt feel it was special like the other fountains I saw around Rome .. but its nice to pass by there
Busy, busy, busy ... for a reason!. Nestled in one of the main walking areas in Rome, The Piazza Navona is a great photo op spot. Worth the visit.

Beautiful and lively plaza. Deservedly described as one of the most beautiful plazas in the world. Lined with cafes and restaurants Piazza Navona is lively as well as visually pleasing. A definite must when visiting Rome

Recommended coffee stop. The three fountains encased within this, what is essentially, large, elongated courtyard (due to being situated on an ancient stadium site, giving it that shape) make for a beautiful backdrop whilst sat in the surrounding bars watching the world go by. The grandest fountain depicts the 4 rivers and is great to sit and marvel at. Free and outdoors. Due to popularity and beauty, found getting a space at surrounding bars difficult.*as accessible as getting around the streets of Rome, cobbled streets and high kerbs.
A must see. Saw it twice at night and it was by far our favorite fountain. Lots of people all trying to obtain the perfect picture. Much bigger than expected.

Maybe the best square of the world!!!. I loved this place from the first minute I visited it. I have been there for more than 30 times and still have not feel bored. All the culture and the unique atmosphere of Rome are concentrated here. The colours of the buildings, the fountains, the churches, the cafes, everything is beautiful here. It is amazing every season of the year and every time of the day. Visit the elegant toy store ' al sogno' , see the fountain of the four biggest rivers of the world, have a coffee, relax seeing the artists, musicians and painters.
Very nice square. It was a very nice area to wander.There were lots of entertainers such as acts using fire.There were also lots of restaurants and cafes around it.

Euro Honeymoon . This was a wonderful place to rest after much site seeing. We grabbed a bite from a nearby vendor and sat in the plaza just admiring all the beauty. The plaza is surrounded by restaurants and you can easily sit outside and enjoy the atmosphere.
Gorgeous. As with everything in Rome ... VISIT EARLY. It's such a different experience to see it in the early morning with hardly any other people.
sight seeing. this must be the best place ever you feel like your in a james bond movie how ever eat just round the corner its a third of the price and better
nice. a nice place to visit with a few monuments around to look at; you could make you me way up to a look out to have a view of the place and much more

Great place to people watch...plus free water. Ok, lots of see here in this Piazza. Its famous for that. Call me easily impressed, but what I was most intrigued by was the free water spigots that everyone was drinking out of (and not just tourists...I counted a couple police officers and a horse and carriage driver there too). These spigots boast water from Roman-age aqueducts...if drinking from one of those is not a cool thing to say you did in Rome, I don't know what is.

Great for people watch. First day in Rome we went to walk over there. Just like all the pictures I've seen, but this time it was for real. Just the perfect weather for us to walk around and take in Rome.

fountains a great view at night and side streets have lots of fun restaurants. you can walk from here to Pantheon to Trevi, makes a good starting point for an evening walk. If you get Pizza, find a restaurant with an authentic oven

Fun place to people watch. This is a bustling piazza highlighted by Bernini's Four Rivers Fountain (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi). It's surrounded by many overpriced restaurants, touristy shops and dominated by the Sant'Agnese in Agone church. The church itself is worth a visit and the piazza is filled with both tourists and locals enjoying the day. There are often performers and artists to entertain you if the people watching is not enough. Check out Tre Scalini's famed Tartufo... a chocolate truffle ice cream concoction!

Soothing Place. It's less crowded compared to Fountain of Trevi. Lot of open space n entertainment in evening hours. Many restaurant around and have few best places for gelato. If you go west lane there are many sea food restaurants. We enjoyed food in one of them.
Piazza Navona. A really lovely place. So much going on, street performers, artists, buskers, bars, restaurants, fountains....what more could anyone want??

Relaxing afternoon break. This piazza is a place where families gather on Sunday afternoons. There are food vendors, souvenir shops and plenty of people to watch. The fountains and statuary are the center of interest for locals and visitors alike. There is wonderful gelato on a warm afternoon. Numerous cafes abound in the area.

One of the best piazza in Rome. The architectural integrity of this public space makes it one of the best piazza in Rome. Magnificent fountains and impressive vista makes this a must see while in Rome.
Lovely piazza. beautiful piazza with impressive fountains and quite central. Nice place to just have a seat and watch the world go by.
Tourist trap - seen in 5 minutes. Nice fountains/statues but packed with tourist crap and poor restaurants. For decent dining, get out of the piazza into the small winding side streets.

Large square that comes alive at night.. We stayed nearby and came through the area several times. It was always very busy. There are very interesting sites that line the square and are nearby. The many restaurants that line the square are great for tourists but if you want better food, better options, and better prices venture off a block or two. There are also several street vendors here so be aware.

Beautiful Fountains, Street artists, musicians, Pizzerias, Gellatos - Must See Piazza!!. I went with my teenage son and we loved the feel of this place with musicians playing their instruments, artists selling water and oil paintings... the 2 beautiful fountains. Plenty of benches and pizzerias and cafes to sit around in. I think it is a must see Piazza when in ROme. I loved the balconies filled with flowers surrounding the Piazza

Lovely Piazza, lots of good restaurants. The fountain in the middle is lovely with a carved horse emerging from the centre. Street entertainers and artists added to the atmosphere. Lots of restaurants around the edge, had a lovely meal at one, with a saxophonist playing outside, but I can't remember the name.
Great atmosphere. Lovely place to go, Rome marathon was on whilst we were here and the runners ran through the Piazza Navona, it was great. Expensive to get a drink here.
Spectacular large public piazza. This is a truly spectacular public piazza and is well worth a detour to see. We stumbled upon it after visiting the Pantheon and were glad we did.

This truly feels like Italy. Such a beautiful places, with lots of places to sit and eat/drink and watch the world go buy, while soaking up the sun and atmosphere. It is also central to everything, if you can, get a hotel around here.

Very chilled.. We liked it here. There were plenty of restaurants and bars around the outside of the Piazza and a fountain in the middle. There were various forms of entertainment happening a bit like Convent Garden in London. In the streets leading up to this area there were street artists and performers which all went towards creating a very relaxed and cheerful feel about it. There were also various little shops selling local wares such as Lemoncello and Murano glass scattered about the area. Well worth a visit.

VERY COOL!. The history of this beautiful piazza and its fountain sculptures rich with history make it a MUST SEE stop while touring Rome. Busy with restaurants and painters, sketchers and the life, smells, people and beauty that is Italy.

Too many hawkers. Beautiful fountains that are worth seeing. We did so by bike tour which was about the right amount of time. Everyone said nearby restaurants in piazza aren't good or good value so we didn't try any. We came back at night as we'd heard that was a beautiful site. It was beautiful but we were so uncomfortable being approached every 1-2 min. by different person selling stuff that it wasn't relaxing or enjoyable.

Worth lingering. We visited on a relatively quiet (and less crowded) Sunday afternoon a week after Easter. The weather was perfect and the pace slow and leisurely. If you can, relax, sit, have a drink and give yourself time to enjoy the architecture, history, sounds and people. For us, it was a perfect break in a day-long walk to the many churches in the surrounding neighborhoods.

Choose a cafe and just take it all in!. People watching is best here, grab a seat...on a bench...at a cafe, and watch Rome. The fountains sparkle and birds fly no matter day or night....I felt like I could sit here forever...and a glass or two of wine made it even better....thank you Rome!

Popular square. A square with a great atmosphere, lots going on and a number of restaurants and bars around.
However the drinks will not be cheao - we paid 15 Euros for 2 glasses of Prosecco in a sidewalk bar

Beautiful. Impossible not visit. Just brace yourself to walk, but, it worth definitely.
I advice that it is important to brig water with you and say no to photographers.

Pretty.. Piazza Navona was an artists dream, fountains, Architecture, street acts, Restaurants and a Museum. Something for everyone. You walk from side streets to the pretty open Piazza, I am sure you will love it.
Beautiful. A wonderful elliptical square. Full of artistically valuable things, like the fountain, the church ... every single piece is a masterpiece of art here.
Great place to visit & eat.. Well worth a visit, lively and incredible views. The 'square' is lined with very nice (but expensive) restaurants.

Piazza Naviba. What a great Piazza with much to do. We visited on the day of the Rome marathon. There was a fun crowd at the piazza cheering on the athletes. No car traffic. Great cafes for people watching, beautiful fountains, obelisk, and art for sale.
Relaxing. A pretty place to relax and soak in the atmosphere and architecture. Great site to see and take photos in front of.
A great people place. Saw this Piazza at the start of a tour but returned later because of the great looking restaurants and a chance to go people watching.

Quick stop on our tour....would have liked more time here!. Came by here on our way to the Vatican on our rome in a day tour. Loved getting the history of the fountain from our tour guide. The plaza looked like a nice place to spend an afternoon eating and just relaxing. Beautifully constructed fountain.
Beautiful square. a beautiful square. the beautiful fountain, it is worth going through it, I recomend to pass there!!

It grew on me. When I first saw it I actually wasn't that impressed. It felt quite bare and, although very busy, lacking in energy. But I was staying close by and was there so often I ended up really liking it, especially in the evenings. You have to avoid the army of annoying guys selling their rubbish (as in most cities now unfortunately) but that's not too bad. Although they are expensive I had a couple of meals at the restaurants around the edges and enjoyed being there people watching and enjoying the atmosphere. Lots of things to find out about here and I intend to go back next time to see what lies beneath!

A Must to visit. A "must" to see and have a coffee etc but beware the prices are relatively high. You can always eat cheaper nearby but it is a Piazza to visit for the fountains and the various activities always taking place

A delightful place.. The fountains are lovely full of interesting statues. A very pretty piazza surrounded by places to sit and watch the world go by in the shade while enjoying refreshments. On a very hot day which it was when we visited it, so relaxing to do just that!

so much going on. We stayed in Rome for 3 nights, in an apartment just a couple of minutes walk from the Piazza so it was pretty much our main port of call between sight seeing.We went during the day as well as in the evening, at all point it was great for people watching. There are a number of restaurants offering similar refreshment, for us the stand out one was Bernini's which I have reviewed separately.We did not see or hear of any trouble, possibly due to the fact there always seemed to be a heavy police presence.Plenty of touts trying to sell their cheap wares but they accepted a 'no thanks' without any issue and moved along.The fountains are beautiful to see all lit up in the dark.
Stunningly beautiful on a spring day.. Worthwhile to visit this is a truly beautiful space to come across after strolling through the alleyways of Rome.

pretty place to relax. A lovely place to relax, people watch, have a coffee or even a nice lunch, Piazza Navona is everything I expected to see. So typically Roman, with beautiful fountains, restaurants all around the piazza. Close to the Pantheon, and city centre. There were a few artists showing their works of art., A great place to enjoy a lovely September day.

A great spot to watch the world go by. We discovered this early one morning and came with the family later in the day for gelato and coffee. It is a wonderful place to watch the Italians and tourists go about their day. Great choices for eating anytime of the day, good artwork for sale

Nice place to spend some tome. We were lucky to be staying close to the piazza, so we went there twice a day. We had lovely meals at the restaurants there, we had a tour guide explain to us the significance of the different statues of the fountain and we had gelato at the various places dotted around.

LOVE THIS AREA. we took a taxi from the Borghese gardens area, and we found great street food, chestnuts, gelato, so many shops, this time a pen and pencil shop caught my eye, old things, history. we met a artist Marina Novelli, we bought a picture of black cats, lovely. Street performers, hanging in the air, sitting on nothing, illusions, magical. a few bands playing , the fountains, the artists, great restaurants, gelato, shops of every kind, windy small streets, many menus being given out, restaurants everywhere, have eaten ate many and then you stop thinking, your mind gets lost in WHERE YOU ARE. .we will be back BELLA ROMA

Lively square. Go up the side streets and the restaurants are cheaper and better!
Worth a visit, just to sit in the sun with an ice cream and see the street performers.

Beautiful at night. The piazza is so beautiful at night, all of the restaurants offer roughly the same food for the same sort of prices, expect to pay a premium for looking out over the Piazza whilst eating your dinner, though in my opinion it was worth it just for the atmosphere.

lovely piazza. This is a lovely piazza to visit in the evening that is next to the Pantheon. There are many restaurants/cafes to choose from. Also in the alleys that lead to the Piazza there are many more restaurants and bars as well as some great shops for souvenirs.

Forever magic ....even with the crowd. It's a must do, it's crowded but it has a charme and a beauty that enchants you. Just stay there, look around you and enjoy the crowd. Every day you'll see different people, different customers at the restaurants and different artists.
Novana. Great place to spend an hour or two. There were many little resturants and shops. It was really nice to walk around.
the place to be. great place, very entertaining with all the painters and the restaurants around and of course the fountains

Comes alive at night!. This Piazza is beautiful to walk through during the day for the fountains and architecture but it just explodes at night! Coloured lights in the fountains, street performers and bars. We just passed through one night but would definitely return!

A fun, lively piazza. For me, the main attraction was the incredible, over the top Bernini sculpture in the middle of the square, but the place is also full of entertainers of all sorts and busy all the time with lots of places to eat and drink. We chose not to use these establishments as they are more pricey, but if you wanted to settle in there for a while to watch all that's going on, that might well be a good option.
Lovely Place. Piazza Navona is a charming place where you can enjoy a walk all over the center, a drink or a meal and you can simply watch the different activities happening in the area.

Favorite Place to Hangout with the Family!. We enjoyed Piazza Navona very much! This square is very large and was not crowded. My girls danced to the music of musicians playing in the distance while we all sat near one of the fountains and relaxed. What a magical moment!

Five Days in Rome. Beautiful place to hang out, see wonderful architecture and people watch. Located near the Pantheon and Campo di Fiore, Piazza Navona is a must...easy walking distance with many churches and restaurants nearby.

A lot of action at Navona. We walked through several times and also stopped to view the Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini and other sculptures. There are a number of restaurants with outdoor eating, a number of shops, a post box in case you need one and many artists and street entertainers. We were entertained one evening by a choir of school children and they were just splendid.
Fab experience.. Great area - we have been so happy to have stayed in the Navonna area.Central to all attractions and a super selection of restaurants.
Impressive one. Explore this one, don't miss it. Very beautiful and chill area, lots of artists around here. Very chill and beautiful

Great atmosphere. We visited Rome while the Rome Marathon was on, and found the Piazza Navona to have great atmosphere. Quite a few restaurants and cafes, quite pricey as you would expect. Really nice fountain which is a focal point of the area. Lovely just to walk around, especially if its nice weather. The Piazza Navona is very near to other attractions such as the Pantheon, so very convenient is you are short on time.
amazing. roma lovely city , with all this beauty to be difficult not to appreciate the many wonders such as Piazza Navona relaxing and solar

Beautiful and grand!. Awesome place...there is live performers,small restaurants and cafes and is home to some beautiful fountains! At 12 the big bell goes off at which everyone looked up and started recording,great place.
Very busy but cosy piazza.. I liked the piazza. It is a pitty that everything in Rome is so over populated. Taking nice pictures is almost not possible; Pitty.

Perfect. There is no other piazza like Piazza Navona! Everything about it is perfect- the buildings, the statues, the fountains, even the people look prettier there. I love it's shape, the fun people have there during the day and night and I can't wait to go again.
Fantastic. Lots of crowds but can't beat the view. The road leads to all the major landmarks in the area so you cannot get lost.
So lively!!. Great restaurants, artists, live performers, fountains left and right...there is a little for everyone here.

Cheerful.. The Four rivers fountain is very interesting. The church is solemn, I went there the night of Pasqua and there was a beautiful Mass and songs were playing it was a cheerful atmosphere. Outside the people can sit and have nice gelato cones and espresso form the restaurants spread across the piazza.

Lovely piazza. We had a good dinner here and it is a lively piazza at night
Wish I could remember the name of the restaurant

Another beautiful square. I only managed to visit the Piazza Navona during the evening but it was beautifully lit and atmospheric. Beautiful Bernini fountain. Lots of restaurants in the evenings though the better ones are probably just off the piazza.

Fantastic place to eat, drink & people watch . My husband and I love visiting a different bar / restaurant in piazza navona at night time, relaxing, listening to the live music at times, street entertainment and just soaking up the atmosphere.
Nice place to take a break. Lovely square to chill and relax admiring the fountains and beautiful buildings and listen to the street music and entertainers

Nice Fountains, Entertainment, People Watching. Easy to get to due to its proximity to other major attractions. The fountains are beautiful and way less crowded than Trevi. Many surrounding restaurants with outdoor tables for food drink and people watching. Nice stop while touring around Rome. MANY great restaurants in the surrounding area nearby.
Beautiful. Beautiful Piazza with lots of restaurants and beautiful architecture to see. A must see in Rome for sure
Amazing. I recommend visiting at night, less people and the lights just make it that much more beautiful. One of my favorite sites I visited while in Italy.

Lively Piazza. Nice piazza where you can grab some food, drink or ice cream and people watch the afternoon or night away. You will see many artists around the piazza which normally attracts the crowds as people watch their work. Lots of picture opportunities with the various fountains.
Fantastic. You see it on tv or photos but never as good as seeing it yourself. Will go again and again. A must see.
4 days in Rome. Worth a visit many restaurants near by a pleasant place to sit and enjoy the ambiance with of course a glass or two of wine!
Get there late in the day.... ...find a table..order a pizza and sit and watch the world walk by. The world only looks this way from this Piazza at that moment in Rome. Enjoy!
Roman Holiday. Grab yourself a Gelato, find a seat sit down and take in the beauty of the square.the fountains are wonderful to see and great place to people watch.
One of the best places to people watch in Rome!. Love this piazza, not only do you have the fountains but find a place to rest you legs and simply watch life go by.
Piazza Navona is lively. People everywhere, lively, typical piazza... but I loved just being there, people watching; I loved being there.

We love this place!. We like to sit here with a glass of wine and just watch the world go by. Our second visit to Rome and we made certain to come back here.
The fountains are interesting but we just like people watching!
Stumbled Upon this Lovely Piazza!. We came upon this lovely piazza on our way from the Spanish Steps to Campo de' Fiori. Many restaurants and perfect place for photos!

Best neighborhood to stay in!. We LOVED staying in this area. Not only is the Piazza gorgeous, the narrow roads in this neighborhood are incredibly romantic. Such a gorgeous, clean and quintessential area of Rome! Not to mention the gorgeous sculptures!
Nice if you're around. It's a nice square with fountains and sculptures, very touristy and not a particular spot to especially go to.
Beautiful Piazza. The Piazza Navona was a great place for relaxing over dinner or drinks. Very friendly people in the restaurant we visited however there are many restaurants around the Piazza.
Nice square. This is a nice square with lots of people. Some impressive buildings around. nut nothing much else to say really

Dirty, crowded and overrated . I would definitely walk through the piazza navona. The three fountains are worth the visit. I would not make this a destination. It was crowded, dirty, full of hawkers. Rome is a city of a thousand piazza's. I would find others off the beaten path when to you just want to sit and take in the sights.

Definitely in the top. For me Piazza Navona was the second best location in Rome, really nice shape of an old track arena, center with a beautiful Fountain, and full or artists, and the surrounding with really nice and good restaurants/cafes/gelaterias but a bit overpriced, since it is very well located.

Beautiful!. One of the most awesome piazza in Rome,
it is a must see by day but also by night when the statues are lightened
the quatro fiumi fountain is amazing
the restaurants in the area are very good

Nice open space. Lovely area to sit and rest for a bit. The fountains are beautiful and the surrounding buildings are a lovely sight too. Cafes and restaurants all around...but mostly quite pricey due to their location.

Love this place. Amazing square with three gorgeous fountains and beautiful buildings all around. Ignore the restaurant around it and go for a stroll - if you want to eat try some of the side streets.
Stunning Piazza. We stumbled upon this square as we were walking around the tiny streets. It really is beautiful and well worth a visit.
Beautiful and relaxing. Piazza Navona is a lovely place to visit for a meal and to see street performers etc. It is a nice open, relaxing place to visit.

Stunning Water features great family alfresco dining. We visted Piazza Navona on a great sunny day. It has fabulous water features and is traditional old Rome. The architecture is stunning and the Piazza is surronded by great dining options including many child friendly options. A great place to drink in the sense of being in one the most historice cities of the world.

You have go there since your in Rome. Its a fairly decent size plaza with lots of people. There are so many fountains around Rome sometimes it hard to know one from the other, there are also quite a few locals selling paintings and trying to pass them off as theirs or someone in their family that painted it, however I have to say there are some paintings that are very nice . Also there are some really nice shops down the little sides streets from Plaza Navona
Crowds. Fantastic area, very busy though, as people just sat there and did not move, take care with the pick pockets, every where.

Nice place to sit down and recharge . It is a very nice place to take a load of your back and recharge your energy. There is plenty of street artists around which is great to keep everybody entertained whilst sitting outside in one of the cafes.

Busy wonderful for people watching. We selected our restaurant here, may not have been the best but we picked it. Don't get pushed. A very busy piazza with lots of things to watch and see. Not a long walk from the Pantheon.
Gorgeous piazza. Terrific place for people watching in one of the many restaurants and bars along the piazza. Beautiful buildings and another stunning fountain by Bernini.

Great place. This was the first place we went to when we arrived in Rome. It is easy to reach via public transport and its a great place to just wander around. There are lots of shops near by and plenty of restaurants.

Dinner Time. Go some time between 6 and 9 pm and you will be entertained not only from people watching, but the street performers. Well worth a visit...especially when you realize chariot races took place there.
Pretty crowded piazza. Really pretty piazza but unfortunatley like all the other tourist main attractions too crowded. I like this place, it has charm and good vibe.

Rome's Covent Garden. Whenever you visit this square there is always something different going on. There are often street entertainers and artists drawing caricatures which creates a lively atmosphere.

Don't Go Out of Your Way. Yes, I suppose this is a bit of a scene with magicians and performers, people strolling about, but overall I was disappointed. The restaurants surrounding the piazza were expensive compared to restaurants in other "tourist" areas like the Pantheon which is nearby, and the menus were the usual pizza type fare. One restaurant had a particularly surly "greeter" who completely turned us off. If you are just walking around Rome, it's fine to see, but I wouldn't go out of my way, particularly if you hope to grab a bite there.

Nice, crowded, nothing special . Yes, you have to go there when in Rome. And actually not for the square itself but the food region on its right side.
If you can get into some of the churches and other houses there, do it. Much more than on the square itself. And when there, go to Pantheon instead

Lovely square. Lovely open square, resembling a ship with a mast, which was once thought to be an arena for all manner of theatrical and competitive events. It was even said to have been flooded twice a week in the summer for mock naval battles! (apparently the street level was much lower then).
Beautiful. We visited piazza navona twice whilst in Rome. The fountains are stunning & there's lots of lovely restaurants & bars in the area.

Big and Busy. A lovely place to discover on a sunny morning - cafes and fellow travellers everywhere enjoying themselves. A fountain at each end and the obelisk statue in the middle no wonder people come here.
Very nice. It's a nice place to walk by. The fountains are very nice. There is people but not that much. In Rome you have to go
Don't miss this beautiful piazza. This is probably best seen, when you come across it accidently. There are a few fountains and a laid back atmosphere.

Great spot. We stumbled across this Piazza, was impressed by the stunning fountains and enjoyed just sitting on one of the many benches and just watching to world go by, there was lots to watch. Had a guy using spray paints to create art works to sell, had a mini band going, one of those real life statues (which made me laugh when he was posing for photos with groups. How he stayed so still for ages I don't know)Do wish we went to one of the many cafes around and stayed a little longer but we wanted to keep moving as we were only there for a few days.

Wonderful !!!. So romantic and so cosy... Just walk around... Have a coffee and relax.... It so beautiful just sitting there, having your coffee and watch people passing by and the painters drawing...

fabulous. This is more than just one fountain BTW. The piazza is huge. This is the place where there are vendors of watercolors,etc. But the fountain itself is incredible. Nice to get here early in the day though if you are claustrophobic or just want to get nice picture. It is very crowed.
Piazza Navona. Right by the Brazilian Embassy. Nice Piazza. Lots to see or even just to relax around the fountain. Or even to have a bite to eat. Recomend this tour
Nothing interesting . I expect more I guess but it is just another piazza with lots of restaurants and such.. Got few monuments as well with the fountain in the centre..

Vibrant, lovely square. This is a wonderful square to visit during the evening. Painters and vendors occupy the piazza. You can enjoy a glass of wine, a bowl of gelato, or a tartufo and engage in some wonderful people watching.
To see and be seen. This is such a lively and fun location. Prices at restaurants lining the piazza are higher, but you pay for the view and locatiion.
Lovely piazza with lots of bars and restaurants. Very pretty piazza, very popular and expensive but worth it for people watching. More reasonable restaurants in the small roads behind.
Ok. Worth a look but full of sellers and restaurants were quite expensive. Very busy also. Nice to see though.
Good to visit. Just fantastic.. Specially in the evening... Something unique about this square.... You will feel when you go..

People Watch!. I visited this Piazza with my family recently, after walking around for a long time taking in so many wonderful sights it was nice just to sit at one of the many adjacent café bars for a cold drink and people watch. This is a busy area with lots going on. It's worth picking your café carefully as some of them can be rather expensive!

Buzzing sqaure. A large and busy square full of action from portrait painters and caricatures to buskers and street artists. I overhead the price of 40 euros for a portrait painted, but boy he was excellent (man aged 50s, dark curly hair). Very crowded so be careful of pick pockets. Fabulous little shop off one end with kids' swords and historical figures. Funnily enough we found the gift shops off this square to be the most reasonable for little 1 euro Colosseums and fridge magnets!
Very busy Plaza. Lots to see at this location. Quaint restaurants, some shopping and at night had buskers entertaining.
Beautiful fountain. The sculptures are magnificent. Stroll around the Piazza to window shop. Not too terribly crowded. A must
Full of tourists. It's a piazza full of restaurants and cafes. It has 3 fountains and 1 church. Full of people. Must see!
Nice location for passeggiata. This was a nice place to stroll, and avoid the crowds of the Trevi Foundation. There wasn't too much to see, but it was fun to people watch.
People watching. We spent hours in the square people watching including the street entertainers. We enjoyed a spritz aperol in the bars.
Piazza Navona. This is basically the centre of a nice street to walk through. Nice to walk by or stop and have an ice cream/glass of wine and enjoy early evening sun.
Nice place. My Wife favorite place in Rome.For me to crowded,must visit early time.The fountains very nice and there is a Church what everyone must see...

Lovely . We stayed in Campo di Fiori and this place was just across the road from us. It's a lovely square with beautiful buildings and glorious fountains. There is a beautiful church in the middle of the rows of buildings and som nice cafes too. Morning is best as it's quieter and the dawn sun will give your pictures a golden glow

Gorgeous . We didn't know much about piazza navona when we landed in Italy and just randomly walked there on our first day - will suffice to say that we went back every evening . The Bernini fountain itself is gorgeous . Energy of the place makes you feel lively. Plenty of eating places - albeit expensive

Lovely square. Beautiful fountains, lovely square and nice atmosphere. Lots of people selling artwork scarfs etc. Restaurants were reasonably priced but as always with Rome, go and street behind the main attractions and the food is just as great and much cheaper if you are on a budget

A nice place to stop and rest and soak up the atmosphere.. I enjoyed finding this piazza as the streets around it are full of fantastic shops and cafes. This is a great spot to sit and people watch, while resting your feet from the major sightseeing! There is a great band that plays by one of the fountains - worth a listen!

Love love love this place. Such a beautiful square, full of history and interest. The 3 fountains are fabulous, the restaurants and their staff are great, the church is awesome and the museum is great.

Piazza Navona. It is always good to return to Piazza Navona. The square was built around an old roman circus. Bernini was responsible for the fountains. The fountain in the centre includes an obelisk from ancient Egypt. Rome had nine. London and Washington have one each.
Interesting piazza. Totally different if visiting during the day than at night when the fairs are on. Worth checking which days the fairs take place.

Busy and bustling. Beautiful Piazza with a lot going on.
Lots of entertainment, restaurants and people trying to sell you selfie sticks.
Do not eat on the Piazza as it is extremely expensive.
Cheock out some of the side streets to the left of the Piazza, there are some incredible restaurants.

old rome mixed with new italy. This is a very old place which was once a roman circus, you can get a tour of that part. But now of days it is full of more expensive italian restaurants. other preforming artists and art works for sale.
So romantic!. You can spend your entire evening here. Fountains are majstic, buildings beautiful, artists everywhere, it has magical atmosphere.
Deserted but for expensive restaurants. Some artists selling pictures that were all the same. Restaurant line the outer square. Typical dish 20 euros coffee 5 euros. Nothing else to do in piazza.
Nice place surrounded with romantic restrurent. Full of fun, artist, cartoonist and street actors. Surrounded with nice romantic restaurants . Good for family on individuals.
Historical gem. Lovely open space full of history, fountains and imagine chariots racing round in Roman times, great on a sunny day.

Busy, but you should go here to sit. The piazza has 3 nice fountains with seats around them where people gather to eat their packed lunches or a gelato from one of the many gelaterias in the square. It's a nice place to stop in and eat your sandwiches etc and enjoy the sun before moving on to your next itinerary item

BEAUTIFUL. a must in Roma, I went there during the day bur I am sure it is also as amazing at night
the fountain and the church are great as well and the Pantheon is 5 mins walk from there.

Over rated. It's a nice square but the restaurants are very expensive and not great. Beautiful to sit and people watch while have an ice cream. I prefer the restaurants off the side streets heading towards the pantheon.
Popular place. This is one of the more popular areas but not to the point of being crowded. There are a couple of churches in the area to visit.

Beautiful, scenic area. This is a great spot to enjoy coffee or gelato and take in the majestic architecture and art that surrounds you. There are always artists working and selling their creations. A fun spot to hang out and people watch!

4 days in Rome. This Piazza is fantastic! We found a little resturant that went ate at for all 3 days that we were there.The weather was decent so we were able to sit outside and enjoy all the sights of the area. There are artist and performers in the area so it was a neat place to go and enjoy dinner and, of course, wine. The resturant is called Bernini if anyone is interested. Great food and great service!
Piazza navona. This is a lovely square with lots going on with artists , entertainers and obviously ice cream bars . We have been before at Christmas when it was filled with stalls. Very pretty.

Wonderfull piazza, one of the most wonderful in Rome. Really cool piazza with a lot of things to do and see. Street artists, beautiful churches, statues and a lot of restaurants you can drink and eat.

THE place to visit!. We loved this square so much last time that we visited three times on this hoiday. Beautiful fountains surrounded by artists, performers and cafes...but it is cheaper to eat away from the main squares! Not as many 'selfie stick' traders here to bother you too, which is a welcome relief!

Worth a stop.... We went here in, it was in the morning around 9AM and there weren't much people around yet. There were 3 fountains overall one of which is the Fountain Of four Rivers with sculptures by Bernini and Eqyptian obelisk on top of the sculpture. Another fountain was the Fountain Of Neptune which is equally impressive. There were some benches around the piazza so we sat for awhile while admiring one of the fountains and sculptures. There were plenty of restaurant and cafes that have outside seating with a view of the fountains around the piazza if you want to eat breakfast or dinner but we've already eaten our breakfast by then so we just bought a gelato and eat it while sitting in one of the bench.
Intresting. When I was in Rome I visited this area two time every day because in evening I stayed and relaxed in restaurant around this square. very beautiful area

Nice!. Elegant square with a beautiful fountain, built on a former stadium of ancient Rome! Best part was the Fountain of 4 rivers (including Ganges) representing the four continents designed by Bernini.
Just Ok. Was here to buy some paintings , 5 or 6 painters were here, it's a nice Piazza, again the architectural is very nice, just go and relax, not Munch else to do.
Beautiful!. Such a beautiful piazza with a large fountain. A lovely place to have a drink and soak in the atmosphere or eat ice cream and watch the world go by.

Three Magnificent Fountains. Piazza Navona was founded in the 1400s by orders from the pope. The sculptures of the fountains are terrific works of art and the water works were examples of the best hydrolic engineering of the time. It is about 400 meters from the Pantheon, so well worth a visit. But make sure to ask often for the Piazza as the streets are winding and intricate. There are plenty of good restaurants close by too.

The Queen of piazzas. I've been there last summer. This piazza has a long interesting history, make sure you ask or read about it when you go there, you'd love it and feel you are a part of it!The fountains are mesmerizing! They bring mythology to life. A variety of good cafés and restaurants surround the place.Artists and musicians can be seen everywhere, adding a kind of a bohemian atmosphere to the place.Art, sculpture, history, music, food, beautiful faces from all around the globe... That is Piazza Navona!PS Wandering there in the early morning all alone is quite an experience, too.
sightseeing Rome. Good for walking tour, nearby underground museum decent however need to better identify signage with subjects viewed

An enchanting evening at Piazza Navona. Buzzing with people around the square, at the Bernini 4-rivers fountain, at the coffee places and also enjoying amazing live artists at work, Piazza Navona is a happening place in Rome esp. in the evenings. I truly enjoyed an enchanting couple hrs there. Combine this with a visit to the Trevi fountain and the Pantheon, it'll make a worthwhile afternoon in Rome.

A beautiful piazza with excellent fountain and history. It's "just" a public square, but it really is beautiful. The facades of the surrounding building are pretty, the fountain is gorgeous, and it's great for people-watching.

Busy Piazza. A place where you can find locals and tourists. Located in the "Old Town" of Rome, only a 10-15 minute walk from Vatican City and right around the corner from the Pantheon. A great place to stop and get lunch from a day of sight-seeing.
Beautiful sculptures. Just one of the beautiful fountains we saw on the trip -- excellent market nearby for when the weather is nice!
Stumble upon this by mistake. found this by mistake situated in a big square with lots of entertainment on a Saturday night with lots of restaurants close by.

Beautiful. A lovely, relaxing piazza where you can have a coffee and enjoy the fountains, be careful of all the looky looky men who will constantly hound you. If you sit in one the cafe's the waiters usually tell them to go away.

Fun place to people watch. This is a big square, compared to any other I saw in Rome. It's great for people watching and the menus looked reasonable, the ambiance was jovial and great for the children. It's also a great spot to stop and rest if you've been walking like crazy all day. I loved the sculpture of the triton submitting the octopus.

Great place to chill by the fountain of four rivers. We first saw this as part of a walking tour (Ultimate Rome) where Nick the guide was great at giving us the history of the fountain, the building behind it, the architects, and what river each of the 4 statues represented. We went back after to see it again, just chill there and people watch, have a cold drink. Some nice restaurants close by, musicians playing, was a very nice atmosphere, definitely worth seeing.
Nice lively plaza. There are tons of good restaurants around and the plaza at night is full of locals and tourists having a drink.
Amazing for people watching. Amazing for people watching, so much going on. Lovely to have a coffee or glass of vino and watch the world go by.

We went here each night to relax and people watch. With the Trevino fountain being so crowded, we spent our evenings people watching in piazza navona and the pantheon. With the two beautiful fountains, piazza navona was my favorite. The only annoying thing is the aggressive people pushing Burberry knockoffs and those things they shoot into the air. Those guys were in every plaza. Still, get a gelato at frigidarium and come sit here to eat it. Lots of energy and beauty.
Wonderful ...... experience, the buildings were fantastic with so many different architectures and learning about the history of the fountain was amazing :)
One of my favorite places. Love spending time here! Perfect spot to rest, enjoy a coffee and people watch. I bought several pieces of art here and they still some of my most treasured things.

So much going on, it's great! . This place has everything! Stopped off here for a drink on the first night, then came back for dinner the next. There's Musicians, dancers and other entertainers dotted about as well. Something for everyone.. One of my favourite places in Rome.
A great place to explore history. This is a place that dates back to BC. This apparently used to be stadium before. We walked to this place from Vatican.

Wonderful artists . Found 2 beautiful paintings here and was able to meet the painter. It was a fun experience to be in this square looking at fantastic art. I believe the prices were also very fair. Would recommend a stroll through this square to anyone visiting Rome.
Piazza Navona. Very busy, church beautiful, lots of beautiful buildings around the square and fountains at either end ☺

Dreamy Italian Night.. This place is absolutely magical. The atmosphere, the architecture, the art surrounding every person there is absolutely magnificent. The vibe I experienced there, by the music of a talented musician sitting by the fountain, felt like a dream ... Cannot wait to go back.

Beautiful Piazza. This is a long and elegant Piazza, bordered by restaurants and shops as well as the outstanding Palazzo Pamphilj. Within the Piazza is a number of fountains and monuments, market stalls and artists fill the centre.

A lovely resting spot. The centerpiece of the piazza, the huge marble fountain symbolizing the four rivers, serves as a lovely anchor for nice resting spot after walking all across Rome.
