On the former grounds of an ancient racetrack is now a long piazza, lined by small and large restaurants, gelato paces, coffee bars; as well as churches and other lovely sights. Street acrobats and -performers can be seen in pretty much every spot of the piazza.  We walked across Piazza Navona multiple times a day on our excursions across Rome, and never grew tired of admiring the fountain, soaking in the sun, and enjoying watching the ever-changing array of street performers, magicians, 'living' statues and mines.

Vibrant Piazza. Stayed at a hotel across the street so we walked through this Piazza several times. It was always full of visitors, day and night. Seems like a fun place for tourists and locals. Lots or restaurants in the square. We ate at 2 and they were good. Always felt safe, even at night.

The famous Trevi Fountain...BEAUTIFUL. This piazza is one of the oldest in Rome. The famous and absolutely gorgeous Trevi Fountain with its horses and three fountains is a great place for selfies! It's very crowded most of the time because, of course, everyone wants to see this sight. There are lots of restaurants around but very expensive. Have a gelato instead and go somewhere off the beaten path to eat. Be sure to toss a coin correctly if you want to return one day...right hand over left shoulder into the fountain.

One of the most beautiful squares. In this square to still end up falling in love with most of Italy, small and rich in history.It is one of the most important square in Rome and is always very crowded.
Place-to-be. A great place, everything of Renaissance Rome in one place, combined with a nice coffee and some great shops

My favourite Roman Square. It's big ,it's brash ,it's Roman.It has plenty of space eventhough it gets very busy. There's so much going on from street vendors,tour guides with groups ,families milling about ,street artists not to mention the cafes and ice cream parlours.The fountains are grandiose and well suited to the square the churches and architecture just simply "Baroque".With 5 or 6 alleys/roads leading off it never seems to get bottle necked.Rome at its best

Magnificent Fountain; Great Neighborhood. The Fountain and statue by Bernini is quite impressive. I often frequent the area because of its great trattorias in the neighborhood, not to mention churches, quaint shops etc.

Interesting plaza at night. We headed there after dinner. We found there were quite a lot of artists performing / selling different things. There were also a few musicians playing guitar and violin. It's very pleasant to have a walk there after dinner. There're quite a number of restaurants right next to the plaza and we would probably have eaten there if we knew it beforehand.
Wonderful place 😀. We stopped off here for a quick drink..... 3 hours and 6 cocktails each later we were still here. Amazing place to sit and watch the world go by.

Billed as the Largest piazza in Rome. This was a fun place! Packed with street performers, great food, a market (on the day that we were there) and a beautiful piazza with a church, which rang the bells at noon and great fountains. Perfect place to sit and soak it all in while taking a break from all the walking that we did.

3 amazing fountains!!. It is a very relaxing square. You just go there and you will be amazed by the marvelous three fountains and the tranquility you find. You can eat in a restaurant near by or have an ice-cream.

Nice but expensive to eat. A lovely walk around and fountain plus a good place for gelato but don't eat there. Go down the side streets to somewhere lesser known without people trying to encourage tourists into their restaurant for a cheaper meal.

One of the most famous piazzas in Rome. Originally designed to hold water and host gladiator type games, this piazza is now the home of the beautiful three rivers fountain. It is cool to see what this area looks like from a birds eye view (via an image) and then visit on foot. Artists set up easels and sell paintings. Outdoor musicians provide additional entertainment. There are some restaurants nearby.

Pass by, have a seat, enjoy the atmosphere. We passed by here after leaving the Pantheon (they are not far apart). This is a lovely Piazza full of artists, tourist and three ducks swimming around waiting for bread to be tossed to them. If you need to stop for a drink, there are tons of options here.
Beautiful . Very nice suprise on our adventure home one of our days in Rome. Had a magical feeling whilst looking at it definitely a nice place to stumble across
Hanging out.. Nice place to be in, really enjoyed spending time with Pietro kids. And there was a presentation in 3D video, I still 've the 3D glasses.

Large fountain.. We arrived in September in the Piazza Navona was being updated and cleaned. It appeared that all the attractions were on a rotating schedule to be cleaned. Check before you leave... We were there September 2015

My favorite place in Rome!. I love the Piazza Navona. It's an excellent place to people watch, eat gelato, study Bernini's fountains, and browse through the artwork sold in the piazza. It is a must see in Rome.

It's lovely and worth a visit.. This is a lovely piazza surrounded by lots of great architecture, a church, restaurants and it has a couple of beautiful fountains. It can get very busy so is good for people watching. The food is more expensive given the popularity of the area but that's the same for any popular part of Rome. Great place and worth a visit but scored three stars due to expensive restaurants.

The architecture and the sculpture/ fountains are well worth the visit. The architecture and the sculpture/ fountains are well worth the visit, the story of the fact the sculptor did not like the Architect of the main building and thus had one of his figures holding up his hand to protect himself from when / if the building fell down always make me chuckle. There are loads of restaurants around the square and these are pricey, a 100 metres down the road they are the normal prices
Great to People Watch. Sit with a glass of Peroni or a glass of Italian wine and watch the world go by. A popular meeting place full of history. A must to visit.

When in Rome, visit Piazza Navona. I really enjoy my visits to Piazza Navona. During the mornings with lots of people wondering about and painting/selling drawing of Rome and other parts of Italy while in the evening with singing.

Great people watching!. I loved walking around the piazza at dusk, relaxing by the Fountain of Neptune, taking snapshots of the famous Fountain of Four Rivers, browsing artworks on display, viewing performances by street artists, and just general people watching. It made for a lovely evening. I will say the restaurants that line the piazza are probably not worth the prices they ask. Much better to eat elsewhere and then take a stroll on the piazza.

One of my favorite place in Rome. As a Rome lover i have travled to Rome many times. I love this city with beautiful arichiteture buidings, histories etc. everywhere is art. and Piazza Navona i like very much. there are famous foutains and sculptures in this piazza which you should not miss it. ask the local for the story behind and it can make you laugh. i like also that there are always some artiests play or draw the picuture just right in front of you. some funny shows at the piazza. its a place i feel very much Rome. everytime i go there i will have a small walk there.

Nice place to grab a latte and people watch. Our family of four enjoyed walking through the piazza while it rained. We stopped into one of the street cafes to wait out the rain and watched people for about an hour. It was a great place to relax.
Often Crowded. Large plaza with nice restaurants and a church. Has Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi, a fountain designed by Bernini
Lots of nice places to eat!. Nice area - but its somewhere to visit for food!! Expensive in comparison to some places in Rome but your paying for a nice surrounding which we thought was worth it!

Lovely square, but not just popular with tourists.... This is a beautiful square, and definitely one of the more popular with tourists for this reason. My family and I visited on a Thursday morning. We were 3 days into our visit to Rome at that point, and had already visited many stunning piazzas. However, I felt that Piazza Navona was a little overstated - there are many squares in Rome equally as beautiful (and in many cases, more so) but much less crowded. In addition, the square was packed with street sellers, con artists and tour groups - at one point we were being offered selfie sticks multiple times per minute, which is extremely bothersome when you are trying to take in the beauty of the square. Overall, I would consider visiting Piazza Navona again, but would much rather spend time somewhere more beautiful and secluded, and less frequented by tourists and street sellers.

Excellent Happening Place of Rome - Don't miss. I loved this place. Nothing extra ordinary still amazing. Big palace, big statues and big fountains. Good number of people. Happening. Very happening. Something is going on at each corner of this Piazza. Good restaurants and shops around. It is at walking distance from major Rome's central part. Loved this. I was solo traveler and still spent couple of hours here.

Loved the Piazza. Love the Piazza Navona, the fountains are very interesting and if one has the chance to read before hand or visit with a tour guide will see that has a nice story behind the sculptures

What a nice Piazza with space and shops!. A very large Piazza with loads of streets running off selling food and other Rome items, the church in the middle is lovely inside and worth having a nose around.It's a crowded area so watch your valuables but buy gelato or a drink from the local bars (6 euros for a glass of Proseco) and enjoy the view as its breath taking and something not to be missed.Anytime of day but the earlier the better as its not as busy.
Very interesting but touristy.. Many interesting spots on this plaza make it a must see. Kind of touristy but plan to spend a hour or so seeing its highlights.

Relaxing and beautiful. Great fountain of the four rivers by Bernini plus other two fountains. Amazing baroque Church Sant'Agnese in Agone. Great place to relax and take a break before continuing with other tourist attractions.
navona. very large piazza great fun plenty of artists lots of restaurants but very expensive best statue in rome we stayed near it was very central

Wonderful artists in an scenic place. We enjoyed the architecture as well as the many artists exhibiting their work in the piazza. Bought a beautiful oil painting for a very reasonable price and would have bought more if it could fit into our luggage without getting damaged! The cafes surrounding the piazza is quite enjoyable.

Piazza Navona and its three mounements.. Our way to see piazza Navona my wife and I discovered another attractive area of Rome's numerous scattered government offices. The area has many nice shops too.

Amazing square!!!. I love it!! Big square with 3 fountains.
Pure art, i love the atmosphere.
Many restaurants and bars around

Meh... Visiting Piazza Navona didn't really do anything for me. Just a bunch more restaurants, street vendors, and people. There are better places in Rome to visit. I wouldn't go out of your way to visit here.

One of the best piazzas. Large piazza and one of the best. Well known with many great statues. Restaurants are plentiful. Lots of visitors, but Rome feels very secure with police and military presence everywhere.

See it at night if possible. . Visited at night the first day. Looked wonderful as the fountains and the church were lit up. Crowds were much smaller which improved the atmosphere. The following day the same scene was a bit chaotic and crowded. However, the Piazza is well worth a visit at any time.

A must see. This square let history come out of all it's pores. The fountains are very nice and you do have to get a ice cream cone at one of the shops. Prices for meals at this square are high. You might want to wander in the side Streets to find real good value for money.
Nice fountains. It is important to read about the fountains and the statues therein. It will make the visit much nicer. Do it by mid-morning, to avoid large crowds during afternoon and night.

A right proper piazza.. This is a what a proper piazza looks like. It's busy, but big enough to swallow loads of people without feeling crowded. Fountain easily as good as the Trevi, elegant buildings, a feeling of space, light and air. Somewhere to sit and relax for a while.
Stop. Lovely square to stop for a drink and food good price, quite open wide so plenty of space for everyone to enjoy. take time to relax
Good place to lounge. One of the bigger piazzas in Rome. They got artists in the area, shops, restaurants. One of the must-visits in Rome.

So beautiful!. This piazza is huge, and has some beautiful fountains. We also had the best gelato at Tre Scalini. I highly recommend reading up on the fountains in a guide book like Rick Steves. He provided details about the fountains I would have missed.
Pricey Eateries Surrounding. I recommend going to see the piazza but don't plan on staying to eat! VERY EXPENSIVE and was our worst meal of the trip.

Still my favourite Piazza in Rome. Love this Piazza, it's my favourite in Rome. Beautiful statues and fountains and a real sense of history here. Lots of places to eat and drink and just sit and people watch if you like. We had lunch at Dolce Vita right on the square which was actually extremely good. Don't come to Rome with visiting this Piazza.
A nice place to sit and people watch. We have been to Piazza Navona a few times and it is a fine place to sit and have a drink and a bite to eat. It is pretty much all tourists but worth the visit.
have to do it so by thowing a coin you will always return. yes its touristy but its beautiful and romantic! take time to watch all the couples you are bound to see a proposal of marriage

Expensive. The square is lovely adorned with the fantastic fountains. It's a great place to stop and do a spot of people watching. Unfortunately The cafes bars and restaurants have a captive audience and choose to charge the tourists for this. Overpriced and a pity. Just around the corner the same beer and wine is half the price.
Beautiful. like all the other fountains and stops in Rome, this one is also very beautiful to see. Also has very nice restaurants in the area.

I like it so much. It's crowed, but we have already expected it. Love the environment! I especially like the sound of fountain. The view of it is even better at night since the lights were turned on. Remember to make wishes there! Throw the coins from your left shoulder: the first one is to come back to Rome, and the second one is your deep wish.

Romantic but touristy. This piazza is spacious with many fountain sculptures. Great place for couples strolling but also touristy. In the summer might not be as ideal when it is hot and have a huge crowd, but still worth a visit if it is your first time to Rome.
Elegant simplicity. I spent a lovely few hours wandering this delightful square and having a beer in one of the many cafes that line it. It is a delightful way to while away a few lazy hours!
Good Italian restaurants. This is a beautiful little centre with fountains. All restaurants seem to be of good quality. We visited in the evening when the sq is at its best

Nice piazza. Piazza Navona is central Rome’s elegant showcase square, a lively place with plenty of stylish restaurants, gelato bars, and everyday musical or artistic performance. Go around and have great time!
Spring break. Fabulous neighborhood! Great shopping! Handmade clothing! Best restaurant is Bar Del Fico! Look for The Twins! And ask for a tour guide named Simeone from Joy of Rome!
What a piazza. Just loved this piazza. great atmosphere and restaurants. The street musicians were amazing especially if you love tango .
Great Environment!. Great Environment here! Stop by, walk around and take in all the local entertainment that lines the square
Bernini's fountains. Bernini's fountains make a visit here worthwhile by themseves but there's much more. Chiesa Agnese and cafe's recommended as well.

A long, crowded journey to heaven. Let's be honest, many people will come here to see the roof of the Sistine Chapel. What you might not realize is that getting there is an exercise in endurance, patience, and claustrophobic situations. But it is not all bad. You will see some lovely art works, friezes, sculptures, mosaics, you name it along your journey. Expect to spend several hours and then don't get too disappointed if you only get a few minutes with the Sistine Chapel itself as you are herded through like...well, a flock of sheep.

A great place to sightsee and eat. What is there not to like about this square and former Roman circus? Lovely buildings, good restaurants off the square and stunning fountains (reminder of Angels and Demons!) plays good quality tat being sold in the market stalls. Great place to have a coffee and watch the world go by.

In the heart of Rome, beautiful and peaceful.. Beautiful square with a few restaurants, stunning fountains. Walking distance to many places, much quieter than Campo de Fiori and Trestevera but still easy access. We enjoyed a quiet walk and peaceful conversation. Many artists set up and paint and sell their art on the plaza. We rented an apartment nearby from rentalsinrome and had a wonderful experience in the heart of Rome.

Little bit empty! . It felt little bit empty but I think it's because of the season! Still you could imagine how it can be during the summer! There were mostly sellers, no artists or music performance.

Very quaint square and artistic. We accidentally stumbled across this place while traversing across the street and we ended up staying here for half an hour looking around the fountain and the majesti building overlooking the square. There are lots of sweet little cafes and very authentic.The rain did hamper the atmosphere from what I'm seeing from the other reviews of street performers and artists so would return on another day to see it again.

Definitely recommended for a visit. I was on a university field trip and my friends and I used to go to Piazza Navona every single day as you get to see the crowds of international visitors like ourselves and it has a wide variety of restaurants to choose from, as well as souvenir stores and small stalls selling paintings. The fountains are very picturesque and by night time, the street performers put on a great show. Very friendly people at Piazza Navona and the locals are always willing to help if you're lost or if you just need to ask a couple of questions about the city.
Lively piazza. Beautiful piazza with cafes and restaurants plus a Bernini sculpure as centrepiece. Lively with a great atmosphere.
Beautiful for a stroll. The four river's fountain is the main attraction of course....the rest is the people and the Dolce Vita! Have a drink and watch the world go by...worth the up cost to do so!
Dull market. Market a damp squib, but worth a quick look at the fountains on your way somewhere else. I don't have anything else to say.
Worth a visit.. Great atmosphere, lots of eateries around the square. We visited during our last day but is apparently superb in the evening when it is illuminated.

Such a beautiful place on different times of the day. Harmonic architecture. Relaxed people from rome and all over the world. Music. Food. Souveniers. Tourists. I'm also one . Thats why just enjoy the nice atmosphere. You can come several times here and you will see each time something new.
Great. Great place for a romantic walk in the evening and a great gelato. Impressive fountain and art. Can't wait to go there again.

Beautiful and lively square. Piazza Navona has three beautifully sculpted fountains, restaurants and cafes. It is very lively place with plenty of people doing their respective performances such as making bubbles, doing street art, singing etc. I went here several times during my short duration of stay in Rome,

Live place. You will have a lot if fun in this place, specially if you are group, i enjoyed looking for the groups that have dun, good place for taking some pgotos, but the most i liked walinkg in the narrow streets around, u will find a lot of gelato shops i tried two

Vibrant Square. We started a walking tour here and came back at least twice during our visit to Rome. There were some really great street performers and live music here. The fountains are gorgeous and so is the architecture. Even the people watching is great.
Family vacation. Very busy and depending on the time of day can be difficult to maneuver around. Lots of street sales people trying to sale "selfie sticks". Recommend going early I the day
Great Fountain with a great story. Take a tour that includes Piazza Navona to learn the history of the Fountain. Nice little cafes surrounding the square.
Lovely Piazza to visit. Charming Piazza with great fountains and some nice bars for cocktails. Really friendly pace for families.

Loads to see and do . Great place to see the fantastic architecture and sights, please visit St Agnes church- spectacular. Loads of fun street performers and a chance to buy some paintings from local artists. Wonder off the square to eat as restaurants over priced for the standard food.
Indescriptible. not even the best pictures can help you to experience the arrival to Piazza Navona.... we arrived late afternoon, and I still feel it was magical.
It's worth a visit . Romantic for couples street artists plenty of restaurants worth a visit can be overcrowded with lots of pigeons
Touristy..... It has 3 Bernini fountains and it is where all the artists hang out to paint and sell their art. A little bit of shopping and touristy restaurants.

At its best in the evening. Piazza Navona is full of tourists, but that's not necessarily always a problem. During the day, its a great spot to grab a gelato and watch the world go by. Busy, but lively!At night, the glow of the lights and the buzz of the cafes and restaurants make it the perfect spot for a post dinner stroll. Sure there are vendors and people selling you things but every major city does.The fountain itself is worth a look, so don't be put off.
Amazing. Everything I ever imagined the Trevi Fountain to be and more the crowd is insane though but the fountain is beautiful

Fountains and more. We visited twice... Sat right on the square and had lunch, pricier than places along the side streets but worth every penny to be in the middle of the action. Great stores, fun street performers.... Artists selling their paintings.... Beautiful beautiful beautiful!!!

Atmospheric little piazza. This was our favourite piazza and there are many to chose from in Rome. It is oval shaped with 3 different fountains.
There was music playing and other street theatre.
The church to one side is well worth a peep inside.
Oversold. Have been to Rome many times and I can not understand why Navona is so hyped - It is a square but there a many squares much nicer

Center of Rome. Don't fail to visit the Piazza Navona - a former Roman chariot racing track (you can see some of the ruins at one end of the oval plaza). Wonderful restaurants with outdoor seating abound around the perimeter and it has an impressive central fountain -- its a great place to see and be seen. Always something going on.

Good to people watch. The fountains are beautiful here, that is mainly why people come. The drinks in the restaurant are pricey, but that is Rome. This is a place to see, but there are many other places around that I would rather sit and admire the surroundings. I would imagine that the piazza gets really busy in summer. There are several areas of interest in the Piazza, we found several exhibitions that were on well worth a visit.
Delightful Piazza . We visited this Piazza on a walking tour of Rome. Many nice restaurants on Piazza. Beware of restaurant in side street La Faschetta .

Charming nook. Don't skip on this iconic piazza. It is true that it is crowded most of the time, especially around the central fountain. All in all, I felt that piazza Navona is one of the most charming spots in Rome. If you have the time, go inside the gorgeous baroque Sant'Agnese in A-one church.

Not the greatest but okay. Been here twice now, 2 yrs. apart. It's interesting as a people-watching place but we would not return if we come back to Rome. There are interesting fountains, lots of restaurants, and many folks walking through. We sat down (outside) at one restaurant for a cold drink and bite of food. Wa need to people-watch, but when the waiter learned we didn't want a meal, he put us at a background table against the building instead of up front in their seating area. Many restaurants have waiters calling out to attract you and they can be pushy! Also, we are thinking that the "service charge" on our tab might have actually been for the server, who was not very attentive. We did leave a tip but later felt ripped off. The whole place just seemed less charming than we'd expected on either visit. Just walk thru once!

OK, but not my favourite piazza in Rome. A friend said this was her favourite place in Rome, but I must admit I wasn't too fussed. The fountains are beautiful, as are the buildings, but the restaurants around it seem fairly similar & priced for tourists. Something missing in the overall feel of it for me.

A great atmosphere.. So much to see and appreciate in this Piazza. Great monument and fountain, architecturally beautiful buildings, and fantastic cafes, restaurants and shopping. It was interesting to just sit and people watch. Easy walking distance to the Pantheon.

Pleasant enough, with a few decent restaurants. Large piazza with impressive Bernini fountain. Some decent restaurants that aren't too expensive considering their prime location. That said, if you're pushed for time on your visit to Roma I wouldn't make a special trip to the square, but if you're passing through it's a pleasant place to pause.

Wonderful. I'm anxious to get back and roam around the piazza again. In the evenings it comes alive with tourists and locals enjoying the shops, restaurants and entertainers. I was last there in September of 2014, but will go back this year!

Gorgeous but Could not Enjoy | Restoration. Family visit to Rome was awesome. Disappointing the day we came to the famous Piazza Navona, restoration all over , is going to be wonderful but that day wasn't our best luck. Still magic , like every part of the city.

Visit this place . Breath takingly beautiful. Definitely worth a visit. Some of the restaurants nearby are a little pricey, have a little wander around and you will find some down the little side streets that are better costed
Lots to see. We spent part of a Saturday afternoon enjoying the sights and sounds of this lovely piazza in Rome. Great fun - many spots to sit a bit over a cappuchino and people watch.

fountain of four rivers. oh you have to see this it is truly amazing. We were there at dusk and all the night life was emerging the little food cafes under marquises candles everywhere and waiters vying for your business, also the local music bands made you want to dance!
Cream of tomato soup!. We enjoyed the most beautiful soup directly in front of the fountain and listened to gorgeous guitar playing by what seemed like an off duty music teacher.

Ala Italiano with great photo here. Walking tour around this area with or without group tour would be good. Easy excess by local transportation. I was stayed at Cicerone area and easy to get direction to go here by walk either. Surrounded by pretty cafes and artistic paintings selling here daily. Great stop for photo.

Best Piazza. Next time I go to Rome, I will stay around or near the Piazza Navona. By far we liked this the best, spacious, not as crowded, appears to be less noisy then most other places in Rome. Just take in the site is amazing!
Good location. Piazza Navona is my favorite piazza in Rome. Here you have everything : good food, historic building, church and so on

rome tour. Another sight in rome, that is tucked away. Lots of locals wandering around enjoying the sights too. Take the time to explore the back alleys too. I found a fantastic leather shop where I bought myself a monogrammed wallet, and my wife a handmade handbag, very reasonably priced

Crowded and a Must do in Rome. This was my seconded visit to Rome. The coin in the fountain worked as I returned 28 years later. The first visit I experienced at night. This is an easy site to visit on a self guided walking tour. This visit was during the day and it was very crowded.
Nice place to sit and rest weary legs.. Busy, with limited seating options, but a good place to meet up a get a snack. Restaurants looked busy and a bit pricey.

Piazza with three Bernini fountains near Pantheon. A wonderful Piazza with three Bernini fountains just steps away from the Pantheon. Piazza is ringed by many restaurants and bars. This is a very good attraction and its close proximity to Pantheon makes it a good combination stop.

So relaxing. A pretty rather large square that is a great place to sit and have a relaxing lunch whist people watching. We walked through in the sunshine and after a hectic morning of sightseeing, we were grateful for a break.
An Italian Piazza!. What's nt to love about an Italian Piazza. Find yourself a spot to sit and watch the world go by, this is a good one to do it from.
nice piazza to discover. nice place in the heart of rome full of tourists and street artist make sure to pass by and admire the huge fountains with the great statutes enjoy :D
Lovely Piazza!. Just had a quick stroll through listened to some music from the street artists, and enjoyed the beautiful fountains.
Every city should have one.. Must be seen to be really appreciated. Very popular day and night. the fountain in the middle is wonderful.
Beautiful place with a soul. Not too crowdy, not needing too much running around it to contemplate... The best for sitting down and resting a bit

People Watching Paradise. This is one of my favourite places to pass the day in Rome.... So many characters to watch ... Simply grab some food and drink and watch the wonders and character of this piazza
nice square. Many restaurants and cafes around the square to sit in and watch people and life pass by. Close to the Pantheon
Romantic!. we went in the evening hours and it was very good. there was a lot of people young and old. i really enjoyed it.
How can there be so many Wonderful fountains?. Well add this to your list of must sees while in Rome. It is a,asking that so much beauty can be expressed so simply. Enjoy.
Worth a wander. Another magnificent square that will take your breath away. The fountains have been recently cleaned and look wonderfully fresh.
The best spot ti be in Rome. Go early, have a cafe, don't mind the prices, it's your one morning in the Piazza Navona, sit, people watch, enjoy.
Picturesque. Piazza Navona is a picturesque square with lots of bars, restaurants and street entertainers to pass the time. Really worth a visit.

Pretty Square, do a little research beforehand. As everything is here, it was really pretty. However, there were so many great things to see in Rome that this one really wasn't one of my favorites. maybe to make it a little more interesting, do some research about the square so you can really know what you're looking at

Picturesque piazza. Such a vibrant and alive square. Filled with artists, music and families 24/7! Whether it's to play by the fountain, have an iced coffee or an evening glass of wine, this is the place to put your feet up and watch the world go by.

Beautiful both day and night. We walked Piazza Navona by day, then returned for dining and walking at night. Both times were terrific! Be sure to listen and watch the various street performers, as this adds to the area's charm.
A lively piazza with a lot of tourists. A lively piazza with a lot of tourists. Several fairly expensive cafes and restaurants by the piazza, however quite nice to watch the live on the piazza.

History and glory . For the ppl who loves museums Roma is a big museum in the open air where u can enjoy walking and spending time as I did in piazza Navona everybody ll love being there and taking a walk and enjoy the time there
Beautiful square. One of the most picturesque squares we visited. Very buzzy lots of restaurants, cafes and bars all with outside heaters for the bright but chilly March day
Wonderful Place. We went here for both Lunch and dinner one day as the place is full of character and restaurants. Very safe to sit and eat.
Piazza Navona is The Piazza in Rome. A beautiful piazza where you can sit and and enjoy your lunch, or drink, gelato.. after you have been sightseeing for some hours, perhaps.

Beautiful square . Lovely little square tucked away in the heart of Roma. Beautiful fountain, lots of restaurants to sit back and people watch. Not as crowded as many of the other tourist areas in the city. This place has a nice ambience so check it out if you get the chance.
WOW !. So beautiful, so unique, great atmosphere, MUST visit, come there at day and night when the lights make the site even nicer

Beautiful Fountain. This is a busy area but worth to take time to go see. The fountains are beautiful, the piazza is filled with street artists and tourist - we love making this a must stop every evening.

Piazza Navona. We had heard that the Piazza Navona is an amazing place to visit. When we went it was cold and raining so maybe that is why it was totally without excitement. It is basically just a dead square, nothing going on in March. No Street artists or entertainment. Don't know what it would be like Inn the summer but certainly wouldn't recommend it in March.

People watching galore!. Nice large plaza with a fabulous Bernini fountain. It is a must see fountain and the plaza is usually busy with tourists, street performers and vendors. Great people watching.
nice but somewhat overrated. Crowded during the day and especially on the weekends. It's nice but not the best of the piazzas. Don't get lost getting to and from if you're on foot.

Underwhelmed. I guess it depends what you have gone to Rome for, or it may be I am just be getting older but The Piazza Navona was a bit of a dissapointment. Architectural it is beautiful a large open Piazza with a sensational fountain , but the restaurants/bars were overpriced and whilst I accept it is March and it was a Thursday it lacked that special something I expected. It was certainly very quiet .I found some great places to eat and drink in Rome all with an abundance of atmosphere normally full of Romans/ Italians and with a much smaller price tag than the Navona.
Nice to relax after a long walk. Piazza Navona is really close to the Pantheon and it's perfect to sit back, relax and enjoy a sunny day.

Heart of Rome's Old Town Centre. This central square is a superb meeting place - located right in the middle of the old town centre. It's 2 mins from The Pantheon, 5 mins from Campo De Fiori. It's a spacious, rectangular area that has tourists flock here during the day, and is where Romans congregate in the evening. Wonderful atmosphere, and gorgeous Bernini sculptures to remind you of Rome's beauty. Admiring this sculpture, slurping on gelato and watching Roman life go by - would go back in a heartbeat!

Worth a visit............ We visited on 2nd March 2016 which was a gloriously sunny day. Been to Rome before but never knew this was here, so decided to take a look. It's a lovely square with 3 fountains and surrounded by bars, cafes etc. Nothing much else here, but worth a short stroll around on a nice day, so i'm glad we paid a visit.

Always my favourite . Luckily we walked through the Piazza Navona 3 times by day and night. Never tire of it. I do tire though of the pushy selfie stick sellers who all look the same, dress the same and have the same merchandise and the same rather rude sales techniques. However, one just has to ignore them as the lovely Rome sites are the focus here.
Overcrowded and dull. sold to me as one of the most beautiful squares in the world - so disappointing. - looked shabby and overcrowded with poor quality street sellers overpriced drinks and ....

Loved it. The piazza navona is built on top of a previous Roman amphitheatre you can see the shape and size of the previous structure by looking at the shape of the piazza. The original structure,s foundations can be seen in places behind iron railings not for public viewing unfortunately. But the piazza itself is pleasant place. There is a very nice gellato shop there. Artists sell pictures and bits and pieces in the piazza too.

Lovely square with overpriced restaurants. The square and the sureoundings are spectacular. You can enjoy a lovely walk around here and from here easily can walk to other attractions of Rome. If you do not want to spend a lot of money on average food then skip the restaurants on the square.
One of the most beautiful squares in Rome!. It is a very beautiful square, the statues that decorate the fountain make it very imposing and the buildings around make the scenery ideal!
Too busy. We visited in March 2016. The square was too busy and the restaurants lining the square very overpriced. Visit to see the fountains but eat elsewhere.

What can i say.... In my opinion piazza navona was the best piazza in Rome.very crowded, artists all over the place and a magical atmosphere. Once you visit Rome you should definitely visit piazza Navona! You can have your comic portrait done or you can see a funny show from Italian artists while you are tasting a great gelato!

Lunch in the Piazza. This piazza was teeming with activity and energy. We had excellent pizza here and just did some serious people watching. The fountains are gorgeous and the shops are interesting. Many options for eating, although it will most certainly be Italian food.
Great for people watching over a coffee. Interesting place to sit with a coffee and watch people. Some of the street performers were worth watching and their interaction with the tourists!

It's a massive space in the heart of Rome. Actually one place that is not overly crowded due to the sheer size, it's massive! Good fun street performers and the obligatory church or two to visit. We went at the end of a long day so probably didn't appreciate it as much as we could have. More spectacular fountains. Oddly, saw pigeons here which seem pretty rare for a city.

Interesting to Walk Through. The Piazza Navona is famous and is interesting to walk through. The fountains, like the Fountain of the Four Rivers, are good to see.The piazza is surrounded by restaurants, but they are very costly..maybe stopping for a drink is the way to go. The restauranteurs and the street merchants will fairly hound you as you walk through.In short, it is interesting to walk through, but there is little reason to linger.
Gorgeous area to visit. This Piazza was very lively and full of restaurants and cafe's. There are two beautiful fountains. A lovely place to while away a couple of hours.
really beautyfull place. it is really nice, even if we visited it at night in the middle of the rain :) deffinitely beautyfull and close to other things in old town

Go to the Cathedral. If you have time this place is wonderful to sit and view but my suggestion is to go inside the church. Stare at the ceiling and you will be awed at such magnificent beauty. There are no photos allowed by the church so sit and stare.
Sunny square. We visited in March beautiful square complete with fountains. Have a coffee or even better a Bellini and watch the world go by

Delightfully Charming!. You should make it a point to go to Piazza Navona, if you are in Rome.It has a special ambiance, that is delightfully charming.Narrow streets lead you on to this rectangular square, which has the famous Bernini fountain called 'The Fountain of the Four Rivers', which features the rivers Nile,Danube, Ganges and the Rio de la Plata. Each river represents the four continents,Africa,Europe,Asia and Americas.It was designed in 1651.The piazza also contains two other fountains and a church. It is not as small as the piazza in front of the Pantheon, nor as big as Piazza Venezia. One doesn't feel hemmed in nor does one feel disoriented.We have been to Piazza Navona thrice while we have holidayed in Rome.Once we were lucky enough to have visited during the Christmas market, when the piazza was buzzing with commercial activity, with stalls selling Christmas decorations, clowns doing shows and a lovely, vintage carousal,festooned with warm lights, lilting out the sweetest of tunes.Piazza Navona is lovely, whatever the time and should be a compulsory part of your Rome itinerary.
Very Ethnic . Very nice quadrangle with ethnic stuff around. One can sit and spend hours seeing the activities that keep happening through the day. Nice restaurants around with some good food.

Possibly the best place for an evening drink. The street entertainers and wonderful setting with fantastic fountains make this one of the best places to have a meal and drink. The little café in the museum entrance is also a lovely find.

An unexpectedly beautiful fountain in Piazza Navona!. Of course everybody who visits Rome wants to see the Trevi fountain! But please don't miss this one, just in front of Saint Agnes's Church in Piazza Navona! Have a nice espresso and enjoy the Four Rivers' fountain.
another treat in the heart of rome. You cant go round a corner in rome without bumping into an historic attraction, this place is lovely for a sit down and rest, its amazing
One of my fav places in Rome. It's a very nice place to sit and enjoy the view. It has that specific aqustics of echo-like. The fountain in the middle is gorgeous. The surrounding buildings, as well.

Lovely place to stroll and grab a coffee or bite to eat.. A quite stunning Piazza with beautiful fountains and plenty to see while you walk around, with Street artists and cafes and restaurants. They are a little more expensive than those further out but it is a great place to people watch.
Early Morning Viewing Recommended. Get there early before the bus loads that arrive around 1000hrs. Its so much better for photos and the kids will enjoy it more too.
Dont miss this charming place. Beautiful fountains with remarcable sculptures, nice atmosphere. We visited it 2 times in 4 days. Many local young artists performing there.

3 Beautiful Fountains? Fantastic!. Just beginning to explore, this was a fantastic and beautiful stop...ALL of them are SO beautiful! The details are exquisite! I LOVE guys with tridents (Neptune? Triton?) and one wrestling with an Octopus?! Absolutely fantastic!!

Massive and beautiful. We visited in early March when you needed a coat at night but the weather was nice in the day. The Piazza is famous for its artists and there were plenty about for you to look and buy. The square has a particular charm and is lovely at night and certainly quieter, there are plenty of restaurants to visit. We were lucky, our hotel was just around the corner so we saw it every day during our visit. It's great to explore off the side streets to find other places of interest.

Perfect Day. The fountains were beautiful along with the plaza. There is so much history in this place. Very interesting bit of trivia, the main fountain in the square represents the four continents that were known by the 1st Century AD Romans.
Lovely little Piazza. Very cute piazza! Loads of nice restaurants around it and a very pretty place to visit when in Rome.

Impressive square. There are three fountains in this square which already makes it stand out. There is also a lovely church on the square. It is, however, very crowded, like everywhere else. The Fountain of Neptune and the Fountain of the Four Rivers are worth seeing if nothing else. If you're in the area it's worth a look.

Great Atmosphere . In the middle is bernini's fountain of 4 rivers. Its hard to imagine how he created this, it's fantastic. Love how the Egyptian obelisk is incorporated. There are also two other fountains both equally amazing. All around the square is resturants and cafes, really nice atmosphere.

always fun for a stroll through the piazza. The Piazza Navona is always a fun stroll through the city center. The area is filled with painters and artists, as well as hundreds (if not thousands) of tourists. Although in most cases, the restaurants on the square are average, you might be served well to walk a block or two west where the fare is much better... dont miss the famous Gelateria Quinto just a few blocks away for some of the best gelato in town!

Understandably touristy - for good reasons!. Piazza Navona is beautiful and atmospheric by day and by night. It is lined with, in general, touristy restaurants but it is not every day that one can eat in such an evocative place!

it's lovely. There isn't a lot to say about Piazza Navona. It's lovely to visit and to see but it's - or was the day we were there - a place to just take in rather than to 'see' anything per se. Sometimes, in a place like Rome, that's a welcome relief!

Great place. Lovely place to people watch and eat loads of Restaurants, a busy place and we spent several hours just chilling and watch the world go by, just the place to relax after a bust day sightseeing.
Good open space. A good open space in the centre of Rome with impressive fountains and statues. Worth walking through but did not stop for long
Fascinating Piazza. It's a surprise when you come across this beautiful Piazza. The statues are spectacular and it is a lovely place to stop for a drink and to do a bit of people watching.
Fascinating Piazza. It's a surprise when you come across this beautiful Piazza. The statues are spectacular and it is a lovely place to stop for a drink and to do a bit of people watching.

Wonderful at Night. Perfect place to look at the fountains while you have dinner in the many restaurants around the Piazza. It doesn't matter what the weather is like , this is an ideal site to enjoy the essence of Rome

Great Area to Chill Out. Beautiful Fountains either side and I think the Fountain of 4 Rivers in the centre, In the Plaza there are various restaurants and cafes to get a meal or refreshment and great to just relax and watch mime artists and brows the various painters stalls.

Stunning . Piazza navona is beautiful and is everything that is so enchanting about rome.This square is fabulous to sit in and people watch. Great atmosphere and feels very safe day or night.Watch out for the selfie stick brigade. They get everywhere and can be ruthless waving it around.No sign of any pickpockets.Lovely statues etc you can spend time looking at if you're into history.

A Beautiful Piazza. An incredible and significant piazza in the heart of Rome. There are three fountains in the piazza the most famous of which is the Fountain of the Four Rivers. This is an excellent example of Baroque Roman architecture. There is always something going on in the piazza - venders, mimes and lots of interesting people enjoying the sights.
Worth a visit, day or night.. We went to the Piazza Navona several times during our stay. Very beautiful and peaceful, sit down restaurants in the square are picturesque but bland.

It's worth the visit for the Fountain of Four Rivers. While the piazzas use an open area it is worth visiting just to see the magnificent Fountain of Four Rivers which has to be the second best Fountain in Rome!

Probably the best and most emblematic of all Piazzas in Rome.. Probably the best and most emblematic of all Piazzas in Rome. The fountains and the vibe of the place is just a bit different compared to all others in Rome. It's one idea more tranquil. Very artistic. Each one of the fountains are absolutely stunning. Great food in most of the restaurants around it
nice but expensive. They asked EUR 4 for water! We were not served and left that place, which is nice to look at but you better go to Campo de Fiori, just a few steps away.
Beautiful baroque square. There is a webcam on the wall opposite Bernini's Four Rivers - ask your friends to visit Skyline Webcams and call them when you are at the drinking well, it's fun!

This is Rome!. Love this location!! So much going on at every time of the day. Magnificent for people watching, relaxing. Well worth a visit at any time of day:music, art, entertainment, gelato, fountains( Bernini!) and churches! Truly magnificent!
Wasn't so special on a rainy day. I suspect our experience would have been different on a sunny day. Perhaps there would be street musicians or other fun activities had it not been raining.
Beautiful day in Piazza Navona. Amazing square with luxurious cafes, Baroque palaces and three lavish fountains. Beautiful day in Piazza Navona with my friends!!!
Wonderful. One of the most famous and gorgeous places at Rome , very amusing place that you won't forget , it's a must when you visit the eternal city 😍

Great place to hang out and be a tourist. The fountains in the Piazza Navona are beautiful. There are 3 altogether; the biggest and most famous is in the centre. The fountains on either end of the piazza are also worth looking at. The Piazza Navona is surrounded by beautiful buildings. We enjoyed an hour or two sitting in a pavement cafe watching the world go by in these lovely surroundings. Do not come to the piazza for an authentic experience of Italian life. The whole set-up is definitely a tourist trap. So, why the 4 stars? well...we were tourists! For much of our time in Rome, we found little out of the way places to eat and drink and soak up Italian culture, so we enjoyed our moment of blatant tourism!! The "artists" in the piazza were mainly selling prints that were mass produced for the tourist market, the coffee and ice cream we bought in the pavement cafe cost the price of a decent lunch, but we did not feel ripped off because it was exactly what we expected and that was okay! Visit Piazza Navona for an indulgent tourist moment and have a coffee in one of the pavement cafes and enjoy the beautiful surroundings.
Visit it at night. The atmosphere in this place at night is ideal for a couple, surrounded by good music, gigantic fountains and local Romans, this place is perfect and you will indeed enjoy it.

Beautiful to see, restaurants expensice. The square was beautiful to visit. I would recommend that if you want to eat then go down one of the side roads & find a restaurant there.The restaurants in the square were double the price for a pizza & they charge you a table cover just for sitting down on weekends.
Beautiful square. Beautiful looking square, restaurants are a bit expensive but just take a walk a few streets away and find reasonably priced restaurants.
Evening spent well. All kinds of artists and artisans, places to eat and drink each one prettier than the other. One of the places you cannot miss when you visit Rome.

There is Trevi, and then Navonna. We really liked this place, with its 3 fountains. Take the time to sit down, or to take lunch there, either at the restaurants on its side,, or with a sandwich bought in the stores aound, you will not regret it!
Dissapointed. On arrival ,scaffolding everywhere.we moved quicky on, did not take any photos as there was not much to see
Great public space with amazing fountain sculptures. Each of the three fountains in this lovely piazza have beautiful detail. Even on a rainy day this place had a lovely feel
weekend visit. one of Rome's many beautiful squares, totally unspoilt and a good place to relax and take in the atmosphere.
Spectacular Piazza. Don't miss this stop on your tour around Rome. The architecture and people watching were fantastic. Explore the surrounding neighborhood as well!
RM loved the photography adventure. As an amateur photographer the Piazza Navona provided a whirl of visual opportunity to capture architecture, people, and Italian style living.
Impressive square. Great to imagine the chariot racing - lots of people and fantastic atmosphere with the sun shining and people sitting on the terraces.
Sit down, relax and people watch. Take the time to sit down, relax and observe the world go by. Think of where you are, a spectacular experience, one you will never forget.

A long piazza filled with painters and resturants. It took us a while to find this one as its not near to a metro but we did in the end. It has 3 fountains within it and is filled with May restaurants and painters.

A magnificent piazza with the most wonderful fountain. It is always a pleasure to walk through the Piazza Navona as it is such a grand space & has a truly outstanding fountain. The piazza is in a rectangular-come-oval shape as it was formerly the site of the 1st century Domitian Stadium. At the centre is Bernini's wonderful Fountain of the Four Rivers which represents the Nile, the Ganges, the Danube & the Rio de la Plata. It is a busy, lively open place now where people meet, mingle & loiter awhile.
Must visit!. One of the trademark places in Rome, there isn't much to say about Piazza Navona, it's just one of the places you have to visit!

nice to sit around for 1/2 hour. restaurants are slightly more expensive - my advice grab a great sandwich or pizza slice and a coffee from one of the many little deli bars and sit and have lunch on one of the benches

Fantastic. It was wonderful place and must go place ,
Dont buy any hop off on bus ticekts and Rome streets are better to see on feet
And u wont njoy in bus , all good places are 3 kms nearby

Amazing. A really beautiful place to visit. It has a lot of restourants and cafes.
The fountains are beautiful, and there are a lot of street performers.

Beautiful!. This Piazza is just beautiful and boasts the Fontant dei Quattro Fiumu. Come here and relax with a gelato and people watch. Just avoid the restaurants within the Piazza as they expensive - wander down a cobbled street instead and find somewhere off the beaten track.

Lovely . A lovely little square with pretty fountains.
Great at night or day . Plenty of lovely bars and snack places while you relax
Lovely atmosphere . A lovely piazza with a great atmosphere with restaurants along its perimeter and lots of people just milling around. Xxx
Romantic at night. This piazza is very romantic especially at night, the lights from the main fountain and the lovely restaurants around the piazza make it perfect for a romantic dinner

My Favourite Square. Navona is something special, something that cannot be described but must be visited. It has a very special "aroma" and feeling of some older times and a carnival atmosphere.
It is so peaceful, local, domestic, funny and playful that I could sit there for hours.
Absolute delight. just go there early in the morning for sports, breakfast and calm before the swarms of tourists! Night time is good for desert
Where the action is!!. Can be a real circus in the evenings!! Plenty of places to eat or just sit and have a drink and watch the circus!!
Watch the world go by.. Take a seat at the front and watch the world go by. Coffee in the morning, pizza at lunch or a evening drink...beautiful location.

One of the best piazzas in Rome. This piazza is impressive and different to many in that it is a long narrow piazza. It has three fountain statues equally spaced in the centre. All around you have a great selection of cafes and restaurants to choose from whilst you soak in the atmosphere

Lovely Piazza. Pretty Piazza with fountains.
Could do with being more 'back-lit' at night.
Lot's of restaurants to choose from, & if you're lucky there might be someone playing a guitar in the square.
Quite nice place. The good weather we had made this place the best place we could visit on our last day in Rome. We also enjoyed a BIG tasty 6 flavor ice cream having no remorse :)

Disappointing square. So after all the hype, found the area a disappointment. There is a large central fountain and 2 smaller ones at either end. The smaller one at the top end as you go towards 'Trevi' is the best to photograph, this is the one shown here by tripadviser. Apart from that it's a very expensive restaurant tourist trap
Lived upto what we expected of Rome's Piazzas. Great ambience day and night fun but civilised. Long wide open space with central fountains and sculptures bars restaurants surround the Piazza.
Lovely Piazza. Worth visiting for the many restaurants and shops, street sellers and live music. Worth sitting having a drink and watching the world walk by!

Great place to people watch. If the weather is nice have a coffee in one of the many cafes/restaurants in the square. There is always lots going on and you can happily sit there watching. There are lots of artists, musicians and other entertainers.
Night life!. Great place to be at night with so much life! If you can base your stay somewhere near here you are in for a treat for all the major attractions are just steps away!

Buzzing... The architecture is beautiful, find out the history about the fountains if that interests you as there is a story behind them. The piazza itself, has market stalls, and a really nice bright atmosphere with a eclectic mix of people. Great for a gelato and people watching.
a delightful way to spend an afternoon. This plaza is alive with live music, wonderful gelato and great shops. Sit and people watch and you will never be bored.

The three fountains are worth the walk. Second visit tho Navona, took lots of pictures and videos this time. Unfortunately we missed visiting Saint Agnes cathedral as we arrived out was closing. Had ac quick bite to eat in a restaurant by the Piazza. Great relaxing. These couple of vendors selling chestnuts. Really worth it.

Beautiful. Piazza Navona is gorgeous. I recommend going earlier in the day to avoid the crowds, then eat lunch somewhere nearby. This is one of the many free attractions in Rome and also one of the best. It would be easy to spend a few hours wandering around and enjoying the romantic ambiance. Beautiful.

Great for people watching. Typical Italian Piazza with shops lots of eateries and street entertainers. Even though we were there in March it was a great place for an early evening meal and we ate outside watching all the entertainment (most places have heaters so no need to venture inside and miss everything.

Great place. Go there aa lot as we really enjoy watching all of the artists at work.
Its best visited in the warmer months in the early evening when the whole square is buzzing with people

My favourite Piazza in Rome. I love the space and the fountains the small cafe/restaurant at the top of the top of the square left of the Toy shop is fantastic, the guys who run it are excellent, so friendly.
nice. came at the night so i could not give some real review but def. less crowded than during daylight =)
Always beatifical to visit . This square is always a pleasure to visit. The main fountain is a must see in the centre of Rome. Only a few minutes walking from the Pantheon.

Rome's "living room". One of the largest piazzas that I've been to in Rome.
The Fountain of the Four Rivers is something to see; notice all the details.
Great place for people-watching.

Tourist Attraction, but a Great Italian Piazza!. We ate lunch at one of the restaurants lining the piazza, and enjoyed the live music being played by the fountain. It was a very "typical" Italian experience for us, and we enjoyed it immensely! We also had gelatto on the top end of the piazza, and found it a delicious way to enjoy looking at the fountains.
Piazza Navona. Beautiful fountains and nightlife. Bustling with music, painters, flower vendors and people. Very beautiful and easy to walk to.
Night time visit. We visited on a rainy night. The piazza was quite quiet and moody. I went during the day years ago and it was much livelier. Still a beautiful place.

The heart of Rome. Most tourist guides about Rome I have read advise we start the sightseeing in Rome here. It is a beautiful square with its famous fountains enclosed by classic buildings of many colors. It is the best place to sit in a restaurant during lunchtime and taste the classic Pizza Romana. There are also many interesting souvenir stores around the square. Although it is always crowded with many local people and tourists is a very calm place to sit and relax in the middle of a long walk visiting Rome

A Baroque Paradise. If you love Baroque, you need to visit this place. Borromini's Sant'Agnese in Agone church occupies one side of the plaza. And smack down in the middle is Bernini's Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi, complete with his hippo (it's a horse). There are lots of places to shop around the plaza; most of them so touristy, though. We got a beautifully bound handmade leather journal there.
The Fountain of Four Rivers. Well worth the extra steps from the Pantheon, a pretty Piazza lined with restaurants. Not sure how much you would see if i was really crowded.

Beautiful sculptures!. This is a busy location during the day and at a night. Great place to see some beautiful sculptures and fountains. Be sure to read up on the history of this "piazza" so you better understand what you are looking at. You will better appreciate the fountains and the sculptor.

Not at all as expected.... I thought this would be a wonderful place with nice bars and restaurants but no. Lots if restaurants with people trying to get your attention, not always nicely. An empty square with tourist and not the small bars we expected. Beautiful buildings and architecture yes but the rest was a "tourist trap".
I want to live here. The Piazza Navona is huge and charming. A stadium-like neighborhood with grand architecture and plenty to do.

A beautiful Piazza. A stunning piazza containing two fountains and a beautiful church. It is worth while visiting, there is are also street entertainers and plenty of cafes and restaurants albeit they are very expensive.
Always!. Piazza Navona is always worth a visit. Such a beautiful Piazza with major art and all the artists showing their art. Beautiful.

Beautiful Piazza. We walked through Piazza Navona enjoyed the architecture and watched the street entertainers. Eventually we sat and enjoyed a coffee in one of the cafes. There is something for everyone here and you can happily pass an hour enjoying the surroundings

Central and an obligatory stop. This piazza is really nice. You see it in books but there is nothing like be standing there. It is very central to many offers and you should definitely dedicate some time in your tour to see it.
Nice area. Really impressive area too look around lots of artist selling paintings seen some lovely ones but abit over priced. It's area too go and look around and enjoy the surroundings.

A beautiful square with impressive fountains, churches, shops. One of the most beautiful & famous squares of Rome, this one is large & the home of the famous tartufalo restaurant (ice cream/chocolate). Some good shopping and eating can be done here. Paintings are for sale by their artists. Great people-watching.
Wet and expensive. Been in summer and it is vibrants but expensive. In a wet March it is grey dead and very expensive. Go to the restaurants off here to eat.

Attractive location. Great area just to walk around and people watch. Beautiful fountains and statues. Souvenir shops and restaurants around the perimeter but don't particularly detract from the Piazza.

Plenty of cafe restaurants for a welcome pit stop.. Interesting fountains.
Good cafe restaurants around the circus. It was pleasant to sit and appreciate the area, people watch and imagine possible chariot races that would have occurred around the piazza in the Roman times.

Rugby weekend. Love this famous gathering place, especially after matches. Always a lot of hustle and bustle whether day or night.
Good selection of restaurants to choose from to suit all budgets.

A beautiful place - so tranquil. A beautiful place to eat and watch the world got by! Good restaurants and a lot of then - so you are spoilt for choice.
Also a good place to visit during the day, many stalls

Bernini's Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. This is an attractive square bustling with overpriced restaurants, souvenir booths, and aggressive selfie stick vendors. Bernini's Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of Four Rivers) is prominently featured in the piazza as well as the Fountain of Neptune. We walked through the Piazza on our way from Vatican City to the Pantheon, but didn't stay long. It looks like it would make for some good people watching in the evening, but expect to pay a premium if you sit at any of the restaurants or cafes. I wouldn't go out of my way to see it, but Rome is a walkable city so it was easy to work it in to our itinerary.
Perfect Location. We rented an apartment just off the Piazza. From here everything is walking distance. The fountains are spectacular and there are many nice restaurants and shops nearby
Wow wow wow. One of the most important thing in Rome. Nice to see in the day. Nice in the evening. Amazing at night. Good food.

Beautiful place. Beautiful place with a wonderfull fountain. To me, this fountain is more or less like the trevi fountain ( best place of roma)
In addition, they are a lot of Shops pubs and restaurants in the neighborhood.

Pretty. This piazza is nice. The first time we went was on a Tuesday and it wasn't really crowded but when we went back on Friday afternoon it was too crowded. So I would recommend trying to go from Monday to Thursday during the day maybe. Most restaurants on the piazza are pricey. You do get the view but since we were travelling on a budget we decided to go on smaller streets around the piazza were we found menus for 10 euros. So if your on a budget try the small streets.
Very active. Big beautiful open space with lots of restaurants. All much of a muchness. Food great but more expensive than you would pay in one if the side streets. Still a must though!

Lovely, large square. Large square with many restaurants and bars. The large fountain is beautiful and very impressive. Well patrolled by police. Lots of street vendors. Plenty of patio heaters for comfortable sitting outside on cooler evenings

A must see Piazza. This is a Piazza in the old part of Rome not exactly and area you would expect to find four large and all different fountains. Please seek out this Piazza you will not be dissapointed

rest stop. i rested for about 15mins after continuous walk from Vatican city to fontana di trevi. Yu can see a lot of people just sitting on the benches here watching fountain and people walking relaxing having coffee or just chatting.
What you think an Italian piazza is like.. This is exactly what I thought a large piazza would be like --- i guess except i thought there would be some green. Lots of restaurants and gellato.

Extraordinary Piazza. This is where cafe society in Rome comes alive in a way it doesn't by the Trevi Fountain or Spanish Steps. Just sit down in a cafe on a sunny day and have a beer or pizza or just a coffee and feel the atmosphere. Fantastic!
Spectacular! . A huge beautiful piazza with spectacular fountains and loads of cafes,bars and restaurants. It has a fun atmosphere and always crowded with selfietakers! Must see!
A wonderfulo place to visit over and ov er again. With little time between meetings in Rome, I chose to return to this unique spot- food, art, sense of relaxation...all in one spot!

Youth Artist crowd. One of The most famous piazza's around rome. The youth crowd that come here are artist from around the world and draw the statues, you will find also cafes, restaurants, clothes stores and some galleries.
beautiful. Lovely square, lots of things going on. a must see in Rome! Can sit and people watch with a Limoncello in the multiple restaurants there! Can take beautiful photos when the weather is hot!

Quite nice food but very pricey. We had a pizza and gluten free pasta with meatballs - five of them. They were tasty but thin on the ground. The ice cream that we ordered was nothing like the picture on the menu. When we paid the waiter said he had forgotten to put the brandy on the bill and asked us to pay cash, we also told him to take ten euro tip from a twenty note that we gave him but we never saw him again so be careful here.

good places to eat at Piazza Navona. It's a good place and there is no entry fee. There are lot of Bangaladeshi selling selfie sticks they will spoil your mood. There are few good places to click picture you can sit and relax at any restaurant have wine and pizza.This place is reachable by local bus there is no metro station nearby. You will have to walk may be 12 minutes to get metro.

Place is always crowded. The place is always crowded, so be ready for it. Totally worth visiting. But I wouldn't expect something extraordinary from cafes surrounding the square: tried pasta in one of them, it was just usual. I could eat the same one at any place of the world.

Another must-visit. This is another place to visit when in Rome. It is even better to see and take some photos when the sun is out. And get some ice cream in the nearby places. Unforgettable lovely place.

Busy and beautiful. Fabulous fountains and amazing architecture! We started a guided walking tour of Rome here in Piazza Navona right in front of the Brazilian Embassy. Our guide Elena gave us a great historical accounting of the fountains and buildings that make up the Piazza. We were here at Christmas time, and the Piazza was filled with street performers trying to make a Euro, vendors (be sure and try some roasted chestnuts if you happen to be in Rome during the Christmas holidays...delicious!), and tourists but amazingly still a great and relatively peaceful experience. If people watching is your thing, you will be in 7th heaven.There are several places to sit throughout the Piazza and enjoy the scenery. I highly recommend a guided walking tour of Rome so that you get all of the historical information while taking it all in. As always, hang onto your belonging as there are some people who would love nothing better than to separate you from t hem forever.Wonderful experience which I hope to replicate some day!

Beautiful Piazza Navona. Arrived here today around 10.00am, and on entering the square and the sun shining it was beautiful. With the endless cafes to choose from and fountains to sit beside this was a lovely morning. It was also an expensive one after having a cola and a coffee in one of the popular cafes (€11) but we didn't care. After that we sat on a bench and watched the world go by with the back drop of water from the fountains, and the steady arrival of more tourists. Lovely morning.

A beautiful baroque square. If you go to Rome do not miss to see Navona square. The square is renown for Bernini fountain but during the evening is a pleasure place to spend the night. There are many restaurants and cafes where you can seat and enjoy the atmosphere.

Small. This was smaller than we expected and maybe it was because we went in February, but it was dead. There were 3 or 4 "vendors" mostly doing paintings and 1 rude made sitting on air.. Not much else to see but maybe during peak season there is more to see.

Most beautifull piazza in the world. This is for me really the most beautifull square or 'piazza' in the world. Especially on a sunny day. The fountains with its sculptures from Bernini are a feast for your eyes. You csn't stop looking and walking around. So much detail and beauty.

Great place for everyone !!!. A beautiful and active Piazza. The Bernini Fountains and the baroque buildings around the Piazza offer fantastic settings throughout the day. Our family kept finding our way here to enjoy the many various and good restaurants and cafes. A great place to sit and observe, to people watch. Enjoy the street theatre!
Sit and Watch the World go by. Lovely area with fountains and cafes, bars etc around it and the little lanes which lead away from it
Most interesting and entertaining. This is a must visit place as there is always excellent street entertainment and loads of cafes and restaurants to sit and enjoy the atmosphere.
Beautiful place. Beautiful place to sit around and visit restaurants. Place was not too crowded like some other squares I have visited. The fountains were amazing.

So much going on here. I've now visited Rome three times and each time I've found myself in Piazza Navona either on purpose or it seems my walkabout led me there. The restaurants around the piazza are touristic and priced as such, but there is something romantic about dining al fresco here and watching the crowds. Lots of artists and street performers, tourists, and likely pickpockets, so watch your belongings. Great for photography.

Probably the most amazing fountain I have seen.. With a huge Egyptian column supported by magic with views through to the square on four sides it is amazing, both structually and artistically. Every visitor to Rome should visit this square, which has been here since Roman times.
Nice atmosphere!!. This is a beautiful piazza with a lovely fountain which we visited in the evening!We didn't eat here but could imagine in the warmer months it would be lively and fun!

Prices Piazza. There is a lot going on here, it's one of the largest piazzas therefore a lot of people go there to see the fountains and artists, architecture etc. The resteraunts tend to be very expensive, as they are at any main attraction, so go a street or two further and you can eat and drink at a much more affordable price.

A beauty. Piazza Navona is to beautiful to be missed, just walk around and get hypnotized by its beauty. Do not recommend the bars & restaurant, although food can be ok, you can get much better value for money somewhere else.

Lovely for a wander through. A great square in a major capital city is always something to see but rarely something to savour. The amount of waiters clamouring for your business is a hug turn off but the square itself is great. Best wander through, eat an ice cream by the fountain or chill in the centre for a while and enjoy lunch at a fairly priced restaurant a block or two away.

Beautiful Piazza.. I found myself stumbling upon this lovely square whist out randomly walking the city. After briefly reading up on the history, I discovered that it used to be an ancient stadium during ancient times, and was also later used as a venue for public executions!There was also a great little jazz band grooving away in one corner of the Piazza. Grrrreat!

Lovely. Love Piazza Navona! This was just around the corner from our hotel so was our place to head to if we ever got lost around the cobbled streets of Rome! The fountains are gorgeous and lots going on, street artists, entertainers, and some lovely places to stop for a drink and watch the world go by!

Lots to see!. The piazza navona was super fun, both, during the day and at night. There are a wide variety of stores and restaurants to spend time in as well as fountains, open spaces, churches to enter in and see. Popular spot with many people constantly passing through.

Amazing Square. Rome has lot's of squares where both locals and tourists while away the time just sitting and admiring the view. The Piazza Navona (on a bright sunny day) is a sight to behold. Amazing fountains, street artists and cafe's. What's not to love.

Beautiful place. We visited when it was chilly, but still it is a beautiful place and definitely worth visiting. It is built on an ancient stadium, the remains of which you can see if you exit the piazza north and turn left. In fact, you can go into the bank building's porch and look down to see the remains of the great stadium, and around the corner is an entrance to visit the place as a museum. But you should definitely visit Piazza Navona. We went during Carnevale time and got to see a terrific equestrian parade with people in ancient and medieval costumes. Lots of fun.
Under scaffolding. Hard to review as it is currently under renovation. Certainly a central site where you can get hour bearings from.
Beautiful. Fountains, architecture, sculptures and traditional Italian buildings and restaurants. A great place to visit to eat, drink and take in all Rome has to offer. Very nice indeed.

Don't miss the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. One of the best places to just hang out and people watch. Good but somewhat expensive restaurants on the outside but definitely a must see when visiting Rome.
Beautiful Piazza. beautiful and exquisite detail on the fountains. We had tea at one of the lovely cafe on the Piazza and the sun was out which made it even better
Very nice. With alot of statues and nice fountain. Alot of people here but you can get great photos. there are restaurants at the side aswell.

Amazing piazza. Piazza navona takes you back to the gladiators era.. it's surrending with restaurants and coffee shop. you can have a rest and enjoying the music and the international langages. the Piazza is close to pantheon it's a walking distance...

Needs sunshine. I like Piazza Navona but I think it's better in the summer than in the winter. Sunshine is needed. The famous Italian light enables you to really see the shape and style of this unusually shaped piazza. We went on a rainy day and didn't feel like lingering. The church in the centre is a gem however and the fountains never fail to please, even in the rain.

Beautiful. A beautiful little square, filled with artists and musicians. The church and fountain are beautiful and it's nice to know the history behind things, I suggest a tour guide or research before going.
Amazing statues. This Piazza is filled with history! Read up before you go or make sure it's part of your tour itinerary with a knowledgable guide. Don't miss it!

Perfect Italy!. It is a large piazza with vendors, restaurants and cafes. Aside from the stunning architecture the artists playing music make it feel just like you think Italy should feel. Really enjoyed visiting and will probably visit again before we leave Rome.

Saltimbocca fabulousness!. It is a really wet Sunday afternoon, and we're all soaked through and need somewhere cosy, but not ridiculously expensive close to Piazza Navona. We stumbled across Saltimbocca Restaurant which is on Via di Tor Millina, and it is a wonderful place to spend a relaxing hour or two.We started with deep fried green olives stuffed with meat and a plate of Italian cheeses with a little honey. Truly delicicious. We had a litre of house red wine to go with everything and it was just right! We shared two large pizzas - one with ham, artichokes, and egg, and a second entirely vegetarian. And both were excellent. We finished with espresso and one tea. The entire bill for 3 was 52 euros which round here is great value for money. Service amazing. And the stone steps to the toilets pretty time in the time of the Pantheon which isn't far away. We were delighted when a complimentary liqueur arrived. Perfect end to a perfect afternoon with friends.Couldn't recommend a place more highly.
Decadence. Great area for hanging out people watching with a glass if prosecco. Very picturesque and less manic than other piazzas - at least in February it was.
Lunch. This Piazza must be the best in Rome it has so much to offer it is both majestic and awesome it is good to see Rome with a lot cleaner image than before the street are more free of litter now.

Artists Square.
