Besides the beautiful "Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi" and the beautiful facade of the church located in the piazza, the square itself is darling and is home to many artists displaying and creating artwork. It's a good place to take in the art of the locals with various styles and offerings.

loved piazza novona. This bright and open piazza is a good attraction for those who like architecture, restaurants and the ambiance of La Dolce Vita.Wide open spaces with three fountains well away from the traffic is not bad but when you couple it with the knowledge that the Piazza is one of the original Roman exercise areas it just moves it up another level.

Ok. I came here to expect something outstanding, but I was quite under whelmed with it, quite a few shops and restaurants with a fountain in it. Good for people watching and paying more for food and drink. I only spent a few minutes here.

impressive plaza and fountain. in combination with visiting the Trevi Fontana , do not miss the plaza and fountain , it's impressive , beautiful , romantic and one of the best places in Rome , di not miss it

Quick visit. Considering your in the middle of Rome this feels comfortable and welcome like a small town or village piazza there are shops and restaurants to make this a good place to observe the fountains. It's then easy to walk through to the Spanish steps
Gorgeous squate. This place is beautiful, does take a bit of finding but well worth it, fountains, a church, restaurants & a fab desserts & drinks cafe, lots of army & police around do felt very safe

Rest and relax here.. sit down and relax. Enjoy the fountains and just grab a bite somewhere else. You can visit the Pantheon from here or go down to Campo de Fiori. Look at hotels close to this location if you are planning to walk your way to other attractions.

Wonderful gathering piazza. This is a place where people can gather, surrounded by cafes and restaurants all over. On the weekends gets filled with vendors and painters. Really nice to see the mixture of locals and foreigners together.
Very cool:. Iconic to pass through and absorb the sights. Everything about this was nice. not too crowded and easy to get to.

Beautiful!!. A love place to view and no traffic allowed near! Nice to see day and night plus loads of nice restaurants around! Prices are higher due to location so we tended to go away from the main tourist areas for food using trip adviser and was never let down!
Over-rated. Nice for a piece of people spotting but really overpriced in comparison to the rest of the authentic restaurants about. Go look at the fountain but buy drinks or coffee somewhere else!
Cool fountains. The fountains in the piazza are very cool. But so are basically all fountains in Rome. Very neat little piazza with some nice restaurants, but very touristy so very expensive.

A beautiful piazza, day or night.. I think everyone who visits Rome visits the Piazza Navona, at least once!It has the most beautifully sculpted fountains and has a wonderful atmosphere, day or night!Near the centre of the piazza is an area dedicated to painters - of varying degrees of skill! - but it all adds up to the buzzy atmosphere.The piazza is completely surrounded by lovely baroque buildings - making it almost pedestrian only - and there are numerous cafes and ristorantes where one can eat, or simply enjoy a coffee or drink.It's certainly one of the most beautiful piazzas in Rome and well worth seeing, day or night!

visit to Piazza Navona. Beautiful Piazza with three fountains. Places to eat are plentiful and reasonable. We got off the bus nearby and walked about a hundred metres to it. We took our photos and then had a meal as we watched the world go by. From here we walked to the Pantheon and then on to Trevi Fountain. Then a lesiurley stroll back to our hotel
Amazing. The face-lift was done so we were able to see the site in all its glory. Truly a special place to visit. Toss your coin...you will want to come back.
Impressive square with local painters. It's a big square with a fountain in the middle. On a sunny day there are a lot of local painters who show their works and you can buy it.
Very pretty. Beautiful place gorgeous waterfalls we loved walking round here it's stunning the buildings are just beautiful well worth a visit.

Best spot in Rome . I adore this piazza. It's my favourate place in Rome, always amazing any time of the day. It's full or artists willing to paint you, although prices are crazy, musicians and singers always make the visit wonderful. The fountains are also very romantic.
Great Piazza. Great place to sit and have a coffee or a meal and watch the world go by. It was quiet at this time of year but you can imagine how busy it would be in the summer months.Worth a visit.
Rest thoes Weary Limbs. A great place to sit with a glass of wine and watch the locals mixing with the tourists. It is a real center of activity with street artists, buskers adding to the atmosphere

Very large and very popular. After a day out with no plans we chanced on the square to have dinner. I forget the restuarant but it was great for a quick meal. A huge amounts of tourists and lots of choice for food.
The square itself is magnificent with oodles of history and some great fountains.

Lovely piazza and fountains. It is a nice piazza in the city with the main attraction being the Fountain of the Four Rivers. It is situated in the middle of the piazza in front of the church. The plaza is large and has additional fountains at either end. Do go into the church it is amazing. There are numerous restaurants and gelato shops. Relax, take in the atmosphere, people watch, and enjoy your gelato or meal.

My Favourite Square In Rome. I have been to Rome many times and come back to Piazza Navona every time. There is always something going on whatever time of day or night, summer or winter. It is architecturally BEAUTIFUL and permanently full of life - I would hate to live here. Whatever you do, visit Piazza Navona!

Roman holiday. This area has some very fine artists displaying their works in this large square. Great alley ways to explore in all directions. Spanish steps are to the east, Pantheon to the west and loads of gift shops, restaurants, etc. so take a walk, just let yourself explore the area, have some lunch, and enjoy being in one of the worlds great cities.

Wander and watch. This bustling square is full of tourists, and artists selling their works. Beware, many of the pictures are not original, and the same piece can be viewed at numerous stalls! If you find something you like, it is worth doing a lap first! Plenty of people to watch, entertainment going on, local restaurants, and some of the best ice cream, or "gelato", that I have ever eaten :-)
Amazing. Amazing square! Beautiful fountaines, Church, art is everywhere. Restaurants, coffee and very good ice cream. We'll came back for sure.
Lovely street entertainment. 30 euros for 1 ice cream / 1 coffee and 1 beer!!! They might have really old gelato parlours but it is so expensive compared to other areas that were nicer.

navona 10. Piazza navona is beatiful, full of restaurants, statues, everything is great. Do not miss it. It is close to fontana di trevi 15 min and panteon 10 min. It is very interesting and great photos, lots of gifts good price in the square. Easy acess by bus 81 and 87 coming from coliseu.
Amazing services. Valentino and Caesare are very friendly and welcoming. The food was great and came quick. The view is amazing. I strongly recommend visiting this restaurant
Picturesque square. Nice place to view the rip off artists work or relax and enjoy an Italian ice cream. Choose the latter.

Beautiful Piazza . One of the most beautiful Piazzas in Rome, so expect it to get busy as it is very popular. But defiantly worth a visit. The fountains are amazing and beautiful with street artists selling their work plentiful but not in your face. Lovely restaurants on the Piazza that are let down only by the annoying waiters outside acting more like touts at a club on a beach holiday.
My favourite place!. This place is steeped in culture and history. A wonderful Piazza with fabulous restaurants ad beauty all around you. A must do when visiting Rome.
unmissable. We were lucky, such a beautiful sunny winter's day. It looks v difficult to find, but you go down a narrow street & suddenly you're there.

Beautiful Piazza. This is a not to miss piazza visit while in Rome!!! Very beautiful and very clean with a lot of restaurants and shops. I bought a leather wallet from one of the shops on the piazza. The pizza also has local artist that are selling their art work and artist that will do a character drawing of you or your family!! A do not miss while visiting Rome!!!
Beautiful Place. Nice place to visit. Plenty of restaurants in the area and some shopping. A lot going on here to watch with entertainers performing in the piazza. A great people watching point.

Worth it for the central fountain. Amazing Piazza with brilliant fountains. The central one represents four of the world's rivers. Very popular area so cafes and bars are expensive, but worth it for the people watching.
Must See Roman landmark.. Loads of lovely places to have dinner or coffee. Watch the world pass you by. Shop and stroll in one of the most beautiful piazza's in the world. A must see.
Excellent place for people watching. Lovely square surrounded by bars/restaurants. Just the place to sit back, relax and take in the pretty fountain and do some people watching.
Top site. Must see fountains. While eating places around plaza are pricey, this plaza is one of the best people watching areas of Rome.
Nice plaza. When we went it was under construction but still beautiful and it was not too busy. Great location to Via de corso

A Piazza where Chariot Races were held. This is a very large Piazza with some very good restaurants in it. Three huge fountains with wonderful sculptures are evenly placed lengthwise within the Piazza. Make sure you walk here and explore the many side streets that run off the Piazza. Day or night, a wonderful place to spend some time while in Rome.

4 have lunch. well worth a visit to this piazza, very beautiful very busy & lively
cafe's all good if not a little expensive but you are paying for a good view

Unimpressed, dirty, not much going on but tourists aimlessly milling.. I guess I expected a vibrant, shop-filled square. Instead, the most exciting thing was the small alley with a few artists selling their prints. The square itself was unimpressive. The fountains were dirty and average. There just wasn't anything overly exciting about being there, other than to say you've been there. If you appreciate the history, for sure stop by. But if you're looking for exciting architecture, vibrant market stands, impressive fountains, or interactive landmarks, you'll be disappointed.

Loved this Piazza. The piazza is built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian, built in 1st century AD. The ancient Romans went there to watch games. Now it is a long Piazza with lots of restaurants down the sides and three very beautiful fountains in the middle.In all honestly we would advise against eating here as it is "££££££" and a typical tourist trap (Adding service charges and tips to the bill" This in mind if you just want to stop at a restaurant for a coffee or small lunch this is fine.We were happy enough to see the Piazza only in the sun but it was beautiful
Wonderfull. Another one of Rome,s hiden treasures, this is a must see when visiting Rome, i found it hard to find but maybe thatwas just me, stunning

A welcome break. I found this large square a relief from the crowds elsewhere. There is still a lot going on but it's a nice step back. As well as the fountains you'll find painters, musicians, human statues and restaurants.

A beautiful square with plenty of visitors. One would find it impossible to nominate a more internationally known piazza than Piazza Navona.There is always a lot of activities throughout the year. The Christmas market, street artists, plenty of eateries, cafe to make this place memorable.
Beautiful. Huge piazza that originally marked it as a Roman auditorium. Full of restaurants and street acts. Nice to walk around at your own leisure and in a great location

Visit, but don´t eat!. One of the most significative "Piazze" in Rome, with 3 fountains. The one at the center ( 4 rivers fountain, probably that´s its name in English ) is the most beautiful one, but don´t skip the other 2 if you like sculptures. There are several restaurants around the Piazza, but forget them. Tourist traps. Anyway, they give to the Piazza a great buzz at the sunset...
Segway Tour. We came to this Piazza in the sunshine and it was a great find the fountains were fab and the sculptures are fantastic around the fountains. Well worth a look.
What's the gig here. Big square, lots of nothing but very ££££ restaurants around the outside. Buskers who run off when the police arrive and selfy stick sellers who get in your face.

Not as festive as I expected. We passed through here in the winter. I was expecting festive Christmas markets and a big tree. There were a few Christmas stalls and some amusement stalls but it was a little disappointing. On a sunny day I can imagine it to be a great place to stop and people watch though.

A Hidden Gem. We found the Piazza Navona on our walk to the Trevi fountain. The Piazza gets very busy on warm evenings, but visit early in the day to see the beauty of the buildings and the fountains.
Fountains and Fountains. This Plaza is full of fountains, shops, restaurants and silent entertainers. It is architecturally interesting and a fun place to visit.

Sit awhile and enjoy!. Take the time to visit this piazza - when we went there were musicians playing and artists selling their wares - a beautifully picture was bought! Coffe, wine you choose but enjoy this piece of Rime !
Lovely Piazza. One of the most famous Piazza's in Rome and the busiest with lots of street artists and performers. Tip.. if you sit at any cafe you will pay a premium for whatever you order.

Beautiful place. Piazza Navona is a beautiful place, either for enjoying the surroundings or just sitting for resting after a long walk in the streets of Rome. All three fountains are beautiful, Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi being the most impressive one.There is a new museum under, which has the remains of the stadium it used to be. I haven't tried the restaurants around, but the church, the museum and the shops around are worth visiting.

Fountains, expensive restaurants and eager salesmen. This is truly a fantastic piazza. Here is commotion from early morning till late night. Here's students in architecture drawing the fountains, here's almost aggressive street vendors selling almost everything from hand reading to truly beautiful paintings to complete useless toys with blinking light. Here's great cafes with friendly staff and maybe a bit high prices. It is really beautiful and we have had some great days here.

A must-see in the historic center of Rome. Mobbed with tourists, but rightly so, since this piazza is an important landmark in Rome's historic city center. Marvelous sculptures by Bernini make up the central fountains, which are truly one-of-a-kind!
Not alot to see. Statues on either side, water feature in the middle, open area, not much to see. Da Vinci museum is at the upper end

Quaint Tourist Area. Interesting area. We actually stayed in a place overlooking the square. Nice to see and people watch. Go inside the cburch there, a real hidden gem. Recommend you eat elsewhere, restaurants in the square of not real rome, tourist traps with hi priced so so food. Within one or two blocks walk are many great restaurants.

Definitely pass through and stop to soak up atmosphere. A beautiful Italian piazza. You will probably pass through here anyway whilst you're walking around Rome and should set aside time to sit and watch the world go by!

Piazza Navona. This is a pretty place to visit, everything in the Piazza is lovely. There are artists with their talents, cafes, music and of course the Fountain that speaks to you. Always a must when I 'm in Rome.

A big courtyard with restaurants on the outside. There isn't much to see here unless you get a guide to tell you all about it.
The large rectangle area has restaurants located around the perimeter and a large fountain in the middle. The four large male sculptures are the four big rivers in the world....i'll let you find out more about it.
glorious piazza. wonderful fountains and cafes and resturants on our way to chiostro de bramante which trip advisor does not seem to k
Angels and Demons. the highlight of this Piazza has to be the Fountain of the Four Rivers ( made more famous by the book & movie Angels & Demons). A beautiful sight and a must see!
Beautiful fountain. A wonderful fountain, and square. See local artists and a huge variety of restaurants. Close to Pantheon and Trevi Fountain.
Relaxing place. It is so nice, I'd go there to have a beer during my walk in the midday or the afternoon. The view is very nice
Interesting. Nice piazza. Good place to grab lunch as the periphery is ringed with restaurants. Festive atmosphere. The day we visited the weather was gorgeous and that added to the piazza's beauty.

Great fountain and beautiful piece of art. Piazza Navona is the place that can be visited at any hour. The market looks great at the sunset, when the sun is hiding behind the church. The fountain is a real piece of art and deserved to be admired. You can take some beautiful pictures out there.

Great to wander, watch and wonder. Piazza Navona is a must see. It's lovely to wander through and see the artists and performers, sit for a meal or drink and do some serious people watching or just enjoy the sculptures and wonder at the talent of Bernini.
Wonderful fountain.. We took time to wander this Piazza and the art exhibit that was in progress that day. The fountain is wonderful.
Nice square. Nice square with a lot of people and painters and terraces, fountains. Even though a bit crowded with tourists.
Nice place to relax. Nice piazza to relax, fountains, nice buildings and a couple of decent cafe/restaurants serving good fare.

More fountains!. A lovely long Piazza with 3 of Bernini's sculpted fountains.
Well worth a visit for these alone. We were there before all of the cafe's had put out their tables, so it felt a bit empty. Imagine being here over a thousand years ago when it was an athletic stadium!

Impressive Piazza. Visited at night and in the day.
A great public space with a few bars and restaurants. Fountains were well lit - close to other attractions
Charming . Whenever we strolled through the piazza it had a charming appeal. Our kids loved the fountains and the open space to play. Great place to people watch!

Superb, simply magnificent. I think perhaps we were spoiled that visiting in February, the piazza wasn't crammed with hordes of fellow tourists. It's certainly magnificent, and the fountains are amazing, we were using one of the hop-on hop-off buses, and we hopped off at the Trevi Fountains, from where this is a 5 minute easy walk.
Beautiful place to people watch!. Lovely square with 3 beautiful fountains and lots of restaurants to sit and people watch. Some lovely ice cream shops and some street sellers.

Most Beautiful Piazza. An absolute must when in Rome, and a short walking distance between the Panthenon and the Castello Di Angelo.Superb fountains and such elegant buildings. lovely shops and some great cafes although a little more expensive than others.Allow at least an hour to enjoy the sights, longer if stopping for coffee/lunch.As with most attractions the hawkers are out in force, but otherwise, very safe and enjoyable.

My Favourite Location in Rome. Piazza Navona is my personal favourite place in Rome.There is always so much going on.All kinds of crafts for sale. Many restaurants. Many overpriced because of the location.The absolute best place for people watching.There is also a webcam hidden on a building. You can tell your friends to find it and you can wave to them.

Gorgeous, if it weren't for the hawkers.. Piazza Navona is beautiful, and a wonderful place to explore while in Rome. Unfortunately the constant stream of hawkers trying to push roses, bracelets, laser pointers and selfie sticks over and over gets tiresome quickly, and mares the experience of so many of Italy's beautiful attractions. We tried to sit and enjoy lunch there one day, only to be approached 5 times in as many minutes.

Nice.... We went to the Piazza Navona expecting to see many artists drawing and painting there but there was only a few people selling prints. Maybe it was the wrong time of the year, even though it was a pleasant and mild day. Anyway, it is a nice location with three lovely fountains and a few restaurants to have lunch.
pretty Piazza. Definitely worth a wee visit, the churches near here are beautiful. The Piazza is bustling with entertainment even in January. Lovely atmosphere and some very good restaurants nearby.

Lovely sunset in marvellous setting. The piazza with its lovely fountains, buildings and statues provides a haven of quiet in this pedestrianised area. We sat at a cafe with a bottle of prosecco and watch the sunset. Marvellous atmosphere. The drinks were a bit more expensive given the location but still good value for money.
Spectacular. Visited on a cool but sunny day, a meeting place for anyone, just a pity that you are bombarded with 'hawkers' encouraging you to but a selfie stick.

Great place to take a break. This is a large open space with beautiful and ornate fountains. It tends to be less cramped and crowded than most of the top tourist spots in Rome. Thus, it is a good place to take a break while enjoying the beautiful scenery. There are lots of places for coffee or lunch nearby. Lots of touristy stuff for sale.
A must when in Rome. Awesome place, loads of history. perfect place to sit and relax. Good street entertainers/ artists in locality. A must when in Rome

Beautiful place to people watch.. Wandered into the square mid-afternoon. It was packed with people so good photos were hard to take. Recommend going during early morning if you want better photos.The restaurants, in the area, are crowded during peak eating hours. The fountain is beautiful and, given time, would warrant an evening visit.

One of the Prettiest Piazzas in Rome. Our hotel was just blocks from this lovely piazza. You could find anything you wanted here: a beautiful fountain representing different areas of the world (we also understood an obelisk in a piazza designated the importance of the piazza), quaint outdoor/indoor restaurants where you could enjoy a breakfast Americano cafe or an afternoon sandwich, little shops selling typical tourist fare, the passing by of local life, the chestnut man roasting & selling chestnuts and a variety of activities depending on the date/celebration. If you have time, learn about the history of this important piazza.
Nice. Lovely place to wander around, stop in a coffee shop / bar soak in the atmosphere. Watch out for the service charges in some places as it can range from 1 euro to 5 euro per person.
Lovely Place. This is a lovely place to visit. Its a lovely square with a lovely fountain and the churches etc are free to enter. Definitely worth a visit.

Superb sculptures, full of lovely shops. A lovely place to visit - the square itself is gorgeous. We loved walking down all the little side streets and popping in a variety of different shops. Places to eat around the square - all busy and had a good atmosphere.

Beautiful piazza. Lovely piazza - very pretty setting but very commercialised and definite mark up on restaurants. Good to visit but woukd probably suggest earlier in the day for photos when the light is better.

Lovely fountain and church!. If you like fountains, the Bernini is a must! It is the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi, or Fountain of the Four Rivers and is lovely! The Church of St. Agnes is directly in front of the fountain. It is a beautiful church and if you are interested in relics, it houses the skull of Saint Agnes. The piazza has many restaurants, but they are touristy and pricey. However, you are paying for the atmosphere in addition to the food! This piazza is really a must stop when visiting Rome!

One of the nicest squares in Rome. You have not been in Rome if you haven't visited the piazza Navona. It's the centre of activity for tourists and it is a great experience.Visit the great toy store on one of the ends
Beautiful Fountain. Beautiful fountain surrounded by a few restaurants relatively close to campo de' fiori. Nice area to stroll around or just to sit and take a break from site seeing
A special ambience. This has a particular and memorable resonance. the perspective, the colours, a sense of peace in a very busy city

An ancient stadium for Greek-style games. Walking into the boisterous Piazza Navona with its crowds, hawkers, and restaurants is exciting for any tourist, but it likely pales in comparison with walking into exactly the same space in 86 A.D. Then Roman citizens crowded into the seats that are now outlined in the buildings that line the piazza and watched the inaugural games ordered by Emperor Domitian. The emperor spent so much building this stadium as well as other venues that he nearly broke the treasury. If you go to the far north end of the piazza and walk through the archway you will find visible remains of the stadium. The name of the Piazza Navona is a corruption of the word "agone" (Greek for games that were held here). The beautiful church on the east side of the piazza is dedicated to St. Agnes who died here as a martyr after being assaulted in one of the brothel areas that flourished in the stadium arcades. (See Jacobs, "A Walk Through The Field of Mars" (Walk Two) ).This is a piazza rich in Roman history even as its modern entertainment delights.

The nicest square in Rome. This is a good place to wander round and admire the situation. The fountains are superb and the surrounding buildings are elegant. Walk at night if possible when it is all lit up.
Worth a look. Beautiful buildings but very busy and do not eat/drink in the cafe/bar on the edge of the square unless you are prepared to pay excessive charges!
Sit and People watch. Really lovely Piazza also Angels and Demons was filmed here.. Stunning fountains Visit at night if you can looks really nice.
Ok but nothing special. I was expecting much more of this attraction. It is just a "piazza" where you can grab something to eat or drink and pay 50% more then anywhere else.

Stunning. This is my wife's favourite Piazza in Rome and I can fully under and why. It is truly a great place to visit and is typically of Rome with its architecture, fountains and ambience. It is totally surrounded by bars and restaurants where you can sit and watch the world go by, if you can get a table as it is always very busy. Artists display there pictures and you can normally strike a good deal with some negotiation.

Wonderful people watching. Traveling with our kids, we love to find interesting places to sit down for a spell and people-watch. Between the fountains and the crowded restaurants, there was a lot to keep their eyes busy while eating gelato!

A Lovely Tranquil Square with Bernini Masterpieces thrown in.. The Piazza Navona is a lovely place to visit when in Rome. Apart from the lovely sculptures and fountains there is sense of serenity there making it a peaceful oasis in the heart of the city. There are plenty of cafes/bars and interesting shops dotted around too.
Passing through . We passed through, it's a lovely plaza, but it was cold. I expect it to be enjoyable in the warmer months.

Excellent atmosphere. A large place with a lively atmosphere, nice buildings and fountains. A must see in Rome, even if you have short time make sure you get there. If you have more time you can sit in a restaurant, the hosts will invite you even if you don't want to.

My Favorite Spot in Rome!. My family and I always go to Navona Square. It is a beautiful square just to visit. We have Gelato and just stroll as we see the artist at work. If you're lucky, you can catch them shooting a magazine ad. Wewatched a bridal ad being filmed. It's not Rome without a stop here!
Lovely place to people watch. Visited this area twice, amazing place, lovely place to sit in one of the many cafes, have a glass of wine, a little lunch and chill

Gorgeous fountain, and villas surrounding the square.. The large fountain by Bernini is simply gorgeous, and the whole square is beautiful! Plenty of places for a glass of wine, lunch, or coffee, and there are art vendors and sketch artists who usually set up near the fountains.

Wonderful restaurants. A great place to just sit and relax and watch the world go by. Wonderful restaurants where you can just have a drink or indulge in some great Italian cuisine. Fantastic architecture all around the Piazza. Make the time for a visit.
Fun and Free. Lots of artists in the piazza. Get a gelato and/or a coffee. Beautiful fountains and plenty of space to relax. Add it to a day with the Spanish steps and Parthenon.

Great place to visit day or night. Always full of people, mostly tourists though, but still a fun place to see people and the beautiful buildings surrounding the square which was once an ancient racing site.

The best place in Rome. I adore this piazza - just sit in a cafe in the sunshine and watch the world go by. You pay more than in a bar round the corner but you wouldn't have the ambiance then and that's what it's all about. Love it
Piazza Navona. Never been here before. Surrounded by lots of restaurants and cafes. There were numerous artists working here who sell their work.
Lovely Piazza. Many places to eat near here, we ended our day here before going home. The fountains here are very nice - and look lovely when they are all light up at night.

Beautiful Fountain - Many Restaurants. Piazza Navonna is a popular stop when visiting Rome as it's a good place to rest your feet in the beauty of the fountain. Usually artists are selling their wares (or copies of someone else's) in the square and often musicians are playing, too. Many, many restaurant serve meals in the area but wander through the small side street to find affordable food rather than eat in the piazza.
Interesting but overrated?. Some nice statues etc to look at but nothing overly special. Lots of similar places round Rome. Go if you're near but don't go out of the way to see it.

A lovely tourist trap. My husband and I have spent many a happy afternoon whiling away the time people watching in a bar in the Piazza Novona. It is a vast area dominated by Boromini's church and Bernini's sculptures. It is packed with bars, restaurants, street vendors and artists of varying calibre. Yes it is touristy and yes the prices are slightly higer than other places in Rome but it really must be done. It is a great place to just sit in the sun in one of the many bars and contemplate your next food order. We always go to Rocco Bar. The waiters are friendly and the food is good. However, I am sure all the bars are very similar, the tables are all very close together and the premium seats are at the front near the pavement. They always go first so go before noon if you want the best seat. Its just a greeat fun place to spend a few calm hours.

A must see on your Rome visit.. Close to the Pantheon, just a short walk. Lots of activity. Get a caricature drawing from one of the resident artists. have a coffee and soak up the history of this famous square

Savor Gelato in this Piazza. We visited the piazza during the day and night and both times were equally as stunning and different. The daytime, you can take in the views of the churches and have a gelato, and a night, be sure to pop in for coffee or a glass of wine. We didn't eat in the square (there were quite a lot of frozen dinners and not kitchens) but the space is a must-see for all Rome visitors.
Atmospheric. This is a lovely destination for an evening. It is filled with character, bars and activity not to mention the history to be explored in every corner

Didn't understand why it was so important. Wasn't as impressed by Piazza Novana as I hoped. There were some nice fountains and a bit of on street entertainment, but after that there wasn't really anything else. Don't feel as if it is a must see place!

Another pretty space. We didn't 'go' to this piazza as much as we stumbled upon it. We say with an over priced beer and listened to a traditional street band who were performing and admired the fountains. It was lovely
Brilliant place to sit and watch the world go by.. This piazza is full of street artists and is a great place to sit and watch the world go byLots of restaurants

Yes, but go early or late if you can for less people. This place gets crowded. The last time I was there it was COLD and there had to be a million people. Well, maybe not a million, but a sea of people. The food near this area... not the best and really expensive in comparison. It is currently under construction, so if this is a MUST for you, please do check out the current status of the construction to avoid disappointment.

Amazing!!!!. Piazza Navona was transformed into a highly significant example of Baroque Roman architecture .It features important sculptural and architectural creations: in the center stands the famous Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi or Fountain of the Four Rivers .Nice restaurants, trattorias and open air cafes around and always a lot of people walking

Very lively Piazza. We were in Rome in early February and wanted to see the Piazza Navona. There was an event going on with marching bands and flag throwers and people dressed in costume. There was lots of confetti being thrown around. It was amazing to be part of it.

A hidden treasure in Rome. It might just be me but I hadn't heard of the Piazza Navona, unlike all the other famous sights in Rome, such as the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc. I almost didn't walk on that little extra bit from the Pantheon but glad I did as I came across this beautiful Piazza with its magnificent fountain as its' centrepiece. Definitely worth a visit.
Amazing workmanship . The workmanship in the fountains are breathtaking. We couls stand just admiring these for hours..the piazza is big and spacious..a nice place to relax

Busy !!. Piazza Navona is a great place for a lunch stop and people watching. There are 3 ornate fountains and this is the place if you want to buy prints of Rome. Plenty of restaurants along the square that is not square !

Seat with the roman and have a cup of coffee. It's like all other piazza in Rome but little bigger. It has some restaurants to eat in the corner. A resting place after lot of walk. Remember you have to walk a lot in Rome so give some rest to your feet and carry bottle of water.
Lovely place to eat. Lovely fountains and good restaurants around the square albeit a bit expensive but you pay for the view I guess.

A must. We stumbled across this piazza after we had eaten and we were devastated as the restaurants in the piazza looked far nicer than where we had eaten. We got some gelato and sat in the sun taking in all the entertainment that was on in the piazza. A wonderful place to eat, rest or just pass some time.
Beautiful. Lovely place to sit and relax in the sun and eat tartufo. lots of choices to eat and drink. you might get pestered to buy a selfie stick though!

Great Piazza. Our hotel was really close. Hotel Raphael was close-by the Piazza and ended up being a perfect location for us. It was in between the Pantheon and the Vatican so we could walk around to many of the sites we visited. The piazza here was wonderful to walk by every morning.

Beautiful piazza. Must visit piazza - the architecture and fountains are spectacular. Worth reading about in a guidebook / internet before so that you can understand some of the history / nuances of the architecture as there are some interesting stories being told by the architects if you know what you are looking for. Although the piazza is amazing - I'd recommend having a good look around / take some photos and then retire down a side street for coffee / ice cream and look at the photos on your camera! You will save a fortune!!!!

Visited with pietro . This is a must, another amazing site, go with DGS tours ask for pietro not only is he a true gent, but also will tell you fantastic story's that his father told him when he visited piazza navona when he was a boy. The cappuccino is also a definite yes

Don't Miss This Place. Rome has so many wonderful attractions it can be difficult to choose which ones to prioritize. Piazza Navona isn't as notable as the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, or St. Peter's Basilica, but it's worth a quick visit. It's a beautiful plaza to people watch or grab a meal in the area. You can take a seat by one of the three fountains or take a look in the small, beautiful Catholic church in the large headlining building on the square. It's a convenient location nearby other major sights to stop in for a few minutes.
Suitable for free time. Nice square in Rome.You can go there to spend your free time and "take a walk".There are a lot of artist and restaurants and bars.

Really nice . After many days and kms of waking around, we happened apon Piazza Navona while on our way to Grom, our favorite gelateria right on the square. Really nice and pretty, good to kind of get away from the big sights and sit down and look around.
Didn't get the attraction. Boring and full of tourist restaurants. Not my cup of tea at all. Perhaps we went at the wrong time of year but wouldn't go again
Worth the visit . One of the better piazzas, truly spectacular with impressive fountain and surrounding buildings. Looks even more impressive at night.
Lively place. Nice, lively place in the center of the Rome. Would recommend anyone looking for some relaxed time to take a stroll around.

Wonderful atmospheric piazza. We walked through Rome in the early evening, Trevi fountain, the Pantheon Piazza Navona the back again taking in the Spanish steps. A great walk as everything is so nearby. We plan the revisit Puazza Navona and spend more time soaking in the atmosphere
Beautiful and impressive!. Beautiful and impressive! A bit crowdy around the piazza as it's one of the major attractions in Rome. Nice restaurants in a close distance.
Always amazing.. Every time we are visiting Rome its a must to visit Piazza Navona, sit there for an hour and admire the master pieces made by the best artist some hundreds years ago...

Amazing piazza. Near Pantheon you can stay .relax and admire this wonderfull piazza . Here you can find painters, musicians , people who are watching and relax. You can feed your personal batteries for go further and visit Pantheon , Fontana Trevi , Piazza Venezia.
Be there for noon to hear the church bells.. I think this is the most beautiful piazza in Rome. Highly recommend you include it in your visit. Lovely.
Good for tea time. You can go there for tea time or brunch. The piazza is full of local artists. You can buy paintings and souvenirs. Good restaurants but a bit expensive

Family vacation. We stayed in an apartment in piazza navona and it was a great location. Easy to maneuver around and since we did not rent a car we were able to walk easily to all attractions. Highly recommend this area.

Breathtaking sculptures - a great place for watching the world go by. On a sunny February Saturday this was a great place to be. The statuary is wonderful and it's delightful to sit at a cafe and watch the world go by. The prices are generally higher than cafes outside the centre of Rome but that's the way of the city. Choose carefully and enjoy.
Pricey cafe's but enjoy the fountain. The cafe's are a rip off around the piazza, but it's worth going to look at the fab fountain of the 4 rivers. A lovely place for a wander.

An oasis of Roma.. When you see too many obelisks and masterpiece s in a short while, it is difficult to appreciate them all. Please do walk around p. navona for at least 30 minutes. It felt like pilgrimage..

Great architecture. I don't recall this square on our first trip to Rome over a decade ago. On this trip we spent a bit of time here absorbing the architecture and atmosphere. It really is a gem in the city.

Beautiful. One of Rome's most beautiful piazzas including the church and the central fountain. The story of the statue sheltering his eyes from the sight of the church is an interesting incident in the rivalry between 2 artists.

Bellissima . One of the best piazzas I have seen. The main fountain in the centre is beautiful, and the surrounding buildings are impressive too! This is definitely a place to people watch if you don't mind paying €5 for a coffee! Highly recommended.

It's OK, but not, in my view, a must see. Even in February it was very crowded and so one couldn't really properly enjoy the main features.If you are tired and want a comfortable place to sit, try taking a table on the very outside of one of the cafes that line much of the piazza. We fancied a glass of red, but after 20 minutes of not being served, we felt refreshed and had used their bathrooms and so we moved on - bit of a win-win for us. Found some wine elsewhere.We had encountered the piazza by accident, but wouldn't necessarily advise people to seek it out.

Piazza Navona. A wide public space, sat down & tried to relax after so much walking around. If not for the presence of too many soldiers and parked army truck, would feel more at ease, as it is it seems the Paris bombing have left it mark everywhere tourists are gathering even in Rome.
diverse people. this is square is near to city center, is full of different people, artists, shops, restaurants, musicians, also there are a big church in the middle.
Lovely Piazza. Great area for a lunch break in one of the restaurants around the piazza! Very nice to visit on the way from Vatican.
superb. Great place for a coffee winter or summer. The fountains' sculpture is magnificent. During the holidays there is a Christmas festival here.
Lovely Fountains close to the Pantheon. A cute square close to the Pantheon in the centre of Rome. The only down part was being pestered to buy selfie sticks...a little annoying...O_o

If you like sculpture & fountains ............ Must see piazza with 3 ornate fountains, the central one being the most impressive. Go into the church on one of the long sides of piazza, doesn't look much from outside but is spectacular on the inside!
Classic Rome. Big, airy plaza with magnificient fountains and lots of street performers. Never a dull moment and the obelisk at the center of the piazza is magnificient!
very nice piatza for a afternoon walk. very nice place for a walk, great monuments for photos, the restaurant we sit there was expensive and the food was not something

Fun Piazza. Fun place to sit and people watch on the site of a Roman race track. Tourist prices
in the cafes and restaurants.
Lots of buskers which were fun.
You can imagine the chariots thundering round in the good old days!
Pizza Navona. This is a nice place to relax...people selling their art and the buildings are nice to look at as is the fountain wide open area
Yet another great square. Another fantastic space that we visited as we wandered around Rome. You can just set off and walk in a straight line in any direction and there are so many things to see.

Good place to sit outside and have a coffee. This Piazza is very impressive, with the obelisk and fountains. There are a number of Cafes, so it is nice to grab a coffee and relax with views of some lovely architectures.

Over-rated. Perhaps it was because I visited on a grey Sunday, but I couldn't really see what the fuss was about. There were a few artists out, but most of these had not actually painted the pictures they were selling (most of them seemed to be selling a print of a couple walking in the rain, with the woman wearing a red dress!). The fountains are quite spectacular, especially the one in the centre, so certainly worth a visit. The street sellers were really annoying and I did have to get quite stroppy with one of them to actually get him to leave me alone! Worth a visit but perhaps better on a sunny day!

Central location to get started. Visiting in February provides easier walking as Rome is all about walking, just everywhere. Cheaper drinks/food prices and less tourists make it very pleasant. Warm Spring weather. All worthwhile.

Try to avoid the crowds. It is one of the most interesting squares in Rome with beautiful buildings around and spectacular fountains. As it is not vast, it can easily lose its charm by the people making selfies in front of the statues or the street vendors pushing for sales. I was amazed that all restaurants around were looking like a tourist trap- to be honest I would not try the food there
Nice place to take a break. A nice square in the centre of Rome with bars and restaurants to rest your feet after walking around the sights

Beautiful and Historical Piazza. Fun History, Bernini (designer for Fontana del Fiumi) and Borromini (designer for Sant'Agnese in Agone) hate each other, you could find ths history .. Suprising man, face covered man in Bernini and St Agenese' hand on heart. Can enjoy peaceful atmosphere with safe guard. Near this, also have many shops and restaurant.

Beautiful fountain... saw on night tour. Night tour explained the fountain and expalinee the four continents, its a must day and to see it light up at night is amazing. its one of the must do's in Rome both day and night I will add..
So nice to sit and enjoy. Just sit and enjoy the surroundings, such a lovely place. The people here are beautiful and the scenery is amazing
Interesting square. It was disappointing. The restaurants were very needy, trying to pull clients in and lots of vendors pushing tat. The square itself was beautiful.
Lovely. Romantically splendid any time of the day or night. Pause here, have a gelato at one of the nearby ice cream shops, and savor the beauty of the place.
Nice square . Relax , have a cappuccino and enjoy life and being in Rome. Very nice atmosphere. There were some street musicians playing everything really nice and relaxing. La dolce vita.

A WONDERFUL EVENING STROLL. This is a great place for an evening stroll. Yes, there are lots of people there, but it's worth a visit. Artists set up their goods all over the square, and you can meander around and look at all the paintings while enjoying a gelato. The church of St. Agatha is definitely worth a visit too if it's still open.
Great place to people watch and relax at cafe. Have to make it here if you are in Rome for a few days. The fountains are great for pictures and the church is beautiful.
History and lovely sights.. Lovely buildings and lots street artists and a impressive fountain. Peel off down the side streets and see how the local live and eat. Well worth the visit.
Worth seeing. A stoll along this is worth it, with lovely shops, stylish building and beautiful fountains among this beautiful Piazza,located between Castel d,angelo and the Pantheon. Worth a visit

A wonderful square with incredible sculptures and fountain . There are wonderful restaurants in the square .. A wonderful square with incredible sculptures and fountain . There are wonderful restaurants in the square . The buildings surrounding the square equally as exquisite . Don't miss this amazing site but do go to the pantheon just round the corner

A day out in itself!. I love this Piazza! probably one of the best in Rome. Wonderful Fountains, great cafes and a great place for grabbing a coffee or beer, chillin and people watching. This piazza is constantly buzzing visited 3 times during a four day break for a small beer.and comfort break whilst also resting what I can only call very tired Rome feet!

The statue that put the rest of the street to shame!!!. This fountain was beautifully sculpted and i adored it a lot !Most people throw coins into the fountain and make a wish, and so i did it as well.
PLEASE SUPPORT ME WITH A HELPFUL VOTE1!!!!!

An evening trip for a meal. We were a little disappointed when we arrived. Apart from a beautiful fountain in the middle and a few restaurants that were open there wasn't much to do. We ended up walking to the Pantheon and eating in the piazza there.

Mindblowing!. A truly wonderful location steeped in history . The cafés and restaurants surrounding the area all offer something a little different and there is incredible choice for most requirements

Beautiful. If you can find it then visit, a large square with some nice cafes and restaurants dotted about. Fountains are beautiful and worth taking pictures of. The area is very historic so worth reading up in guide books.

One of the bucket list sights in Rome.. Every time we visit Rome we visit Plaza Navona, and take a few pictures to see how we have aged!There are some great, reasonably priced restaurants in the square and many more in the surrounding streets, which are full of locals. The best pizza restaurant in Rome is round the corner, but the queue we were pre warned of was formidable and so we ate at Seraline which was excellent...I have reviewed that restaurant separately.
Wonderful. An incredible Piazza with great food and drink, wonderful architecture and great history. Worth it for the Bernini fountain in the middle of the square
Awesome experience!. Wish and sure it will be granted...As the folks say! Ambiance is totally superb. One of the best place to be at!

Art Appreciation. This is a very nice square with local artists. Makes for good people watching! Near other Rome attractions like Pantheon. Skip the restaurants on the square and enjoy good food off the side streets.
Piazza Navona on a rainy day! Rain? What rain??. An iconic square to visit, see the fountains at both ends, sit, drink, eat and people watch. Just lovely.

Look at the fountain but do not sit down at a restaurant.. Wonderful example of baroque carving. Interesting subjects. The big fish mouth that drains the fountain is cleverly made and not to be missed. However do not sit down at one of the many restaurants. They charge very high prices. 11€ for a suppa al Pommedori. Rip off! Just one street behind the square hey charge halve of that price.
Lovely piazza. Very nice fountains and lots of art work for sale. There are 2 beautiful fountains here and some street vendors. Lots of restaurants around the piazza
Amazing place to spend your evening.. This place is full of street artists, musician and all around the square there a awesome restaurants ready to serve you.absolutely great by evening.
Pretty Piazza. This is a good place to have a bite to eat - tons of cute restaurants and score some nice art - lots of art vendors set up in the square

Powerful imagery. Arrive at sunset and sip Prosecco. I typically use this Piazza as a starting point for a lovely walking tour. There are quite a few significant Basilicas in the neighborhood, plus smaller museums and monuments. Plan to spend a half day walking and then return for aperitivo.

well just normal. my friend highly recommend this place
but... well to be honestly say, just big plaza with some fountain

Visit by Night and Day. The Piazza Navona is one of the most important squares in Rome, the atmosphere is awesome as there is a lot of people all the time there, the fountain of the four rivers is so beautiful and the facade of the church too, if you are going to Rome for the first time it is a must to visit this place.

Very nice piazza, comparable with the main piazza at Verona. We passed this piazza when going to the Pantheon. It is a very vivid and nice place, where you can sit and drink or eat, or both :) on a terrace and see all sorts of people walking by or driving by with a scooter or Segway. Definetly worth a visit.

One of Romes's "Must See" places. When visiting Rome there are a few "must see" places ..... and of course Piazza Navona is one of those that you really shouldn't miss. Beautiful, easy to get to and find and you are off to the next stop -- maybe after a nice coffee first :-)
A lovely square!!!. A truly lovely square to visit. Would be fantastic in hand summer. Plenty of locals milling around enjoying the atmosphere. Great!!
I threw the coin so that i can return back to Rome. I had a nice experience and managed to see couples tying knot at the place and every person who was around enjoying the moment with them.
A key place for Rome' lovers. Interesting and big Piazza, unique in its structure and fountains. One of Bernini's great achievements. Don't forget to learn about the Four Rivers Fountain.

Watch the world go by.. We had a botlle of wine here and on another occasion a coffee. Lovely place to sit and chat, wasn't busy and very quiet. I can imagine in high season it's very busy. Great place to do the continental thing and chat, relax and have a drink. Nothing else to do there other than a quick look at the two small fountains and obelisk. Great setting on a beautiful day. Alot quieter than when the Romans had chariot races in there. Nice to relax and add to the experience but if your tight for time there's more important venues.

Very very pretty. After a long day, spend an afternoon here. The main fountain in the middle is beautiful, there are also smaller fountains on both sides. My advise would be: Buy yourself a Gelato, and walk to the Piazza, wander around and enjoy the scene. If you're into arts; you'd love seeing the painters and musicians here.However, if you're on a budget, it isn't recommended to eat in the restaurants around this area.

Beauty all Around. This huge piazza has everything to offer: shopping, people watching, fountains and photo ops everywhere. It is in the shape of an oval and was once Circus Agonalis but was paved over in the 15th century. It holds the stunning Neptune Fountain.

Great place to start or finish a day of tourism. Piazza Navona used to be a site for races during the Roman empire. Now it's a plaza filled with people selling art (some paintings are quite good), fountains, and restaurants. Of course, the restaurants are seriously overpriced.
A must see in Rome. One of my 'must see' places when I visit Rome. Always have a Tartufo ice cream from Tre Scalini - a bar in the square....It's their speciality...Fantastico! !!!

Be sure to visit during the day. Three spectacular fountains in a long oval space with the beautiful church of S. Agnese in Navona smack in the middle. The central fountain by Bernini shows the four rivers as allegorical river gods, each holding an attribute to identify which river. The church facade is unusual because it curves in and out, giving a sense of a living, breathing structure. Be sure to walk inside: it is one of the prettiest examples of the Baroque style, with coordinated chapels each with relief sculptures and paintings commissioned about the same time.
An Afternoon at Piazza Navona. Wow, what a beautiful place to spend some time. Wonderful little streets on the sides of the piazza with great small shops and restaurants. Bernini art in the piazza.
Picturesque . We came here both afternoons for lunch and people watching! Nice way to pass a couple of hours...lovely food, beer and heaters! Very enjoyable.
Beautiful piazza. "The four rivers" By Bernini is the benchmark of this lively square. Shops, restaurants ad cafeterias add to the nice atmosphere. Beautiful to see both at daytime and night time.
Great place to enjoy a drink on the terrace. Lots of little shops and terraces along the piazza - great place to take a break from standing in line for hours.
Nice. This is a nice place in rome to go but dont eat in the sqaure, They rip you off with added bits for Bread, Tips and the price on the menu was not the same as the bill. We was gutted.

A must when in Rome. Beautiful piazza with 3 fountains. Many artists selling their paintings. Also many restaurants trying to give tourists not so good food... and charging too much for it. I would say do not eat there.

An unforgettable "Dimond" in Rome. A happy and beautiful piazza with one more masterpiece - sculptured fountain "The four rivers" By Bernini. In the 3 times I visited Rome I never sciped the opportunity to visit Piazza Navona . Many people ,young as the elderly come and sit in the daytime since it is a wide piazza with shops around coffee shops and restaurants. But again the fountain is wonderful and has a special story to tell.

Meeting place. Definitely worth a visit as there is always something to see or do.We arrived towards the end of the day, early evening and there was still a buzz.Lots of people, painters, stands etc.We stopped for a little while but we had an reservation for dinner.The architecture alone is must.

Good old Bernini!. Bernini's central "Fountain of the four rivers" is stupendous. For my money shading the Trevi fountain (just a tiny bit!) for its artistry - and it's overtopped by Domitian's Egyptian Obelisk. The other fountains at the two ends of this old stadium (when I say "old", I mean like Emperor DOMITIAN old) are also good. They are both by Giacomo della Porta, but improved by Bernini and others.A number of good restaurants and cafes surround the piazza. There is a certain amount of tourist-hustling in the middle of the piazza, especially by people selling paintings, prints and the like. Many are terrible, but there are some good pieces to be seen, though for what price I cannot say.
Interesting but crowded.. Quite a nice Piazza, fountains are a sight to behold. A bit more subdued than majority of other 'must see' sights, so perhaps better for that.
Best place to be in Rome. Spent everyday of my trip here, it's so lovely to pass the time with a little church and gelato shops and performers.

Very agreable!!. Beautiful place with great food and ambience, a lot of tourists walking arround, gorgeous fontanas, good stores arround to visit and next to anothers turistic points like fontana di Trevi

A must see in Rome. Piazza Navona is a place you don't want to miss while in Rome. Scroll around the square and combine it with Pantheon that is very near!Plenty of restaurants and cafes in the area. Be careful though of the tourist traps.
Lovely place!. Piazza Navona was such a gem! It was the kind of place we felt lucky to visit. Lovely atmosphere, I highly recommend visiting it!

The most important Italian words...va via (go away). The plaza is amazing. Come sit, people watch, see fake artists sell generic water colors...but more importantly, feel the history. The statues are incredible and if you more what to look for, look at the buildings and try to find The Madonna. There are street vendors (almost as many as there are tourists some days.) No, i do not want a selfie stick...no i don't want to buy your carnival toys...get out of my picture and quit following me... Learn the magic words "Go away." Use them often and enjoy your day. Eat there only if you are willing to pay triple what you would pay for the same meal around the corner just for the view.
Fountains. Lovely piazza to visit. Nice fountain in the centre and some good (but slightly pricey) restaurants around the perimeter.

Well worth a visit !. We walked into the square having been to the Vatican then stopped on this lovely piazza for a nice beer and a lovely lunch . The fountains and obilusc were impressive and the lovely sunny afternoon only helped our enjoyment of this lovely area of Rome.
Beautiful. Stunning piazza with restaurants and street vendors and 2 lovely fountains. Took loads of photos here and then headed off on a walk towards the Trevi fountain and the Pantheon.
Interesting visit. Nice site, nice statues and piazza. Well set up restaurants around. It has a charm of it's own. Recommended when the sun is out :)
Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful Piazza (but not my favourite) however the restaurants are very over priced. Should definitely visit though.

A lovely place to go for a nice ristretto. This piazza is lovely with a couple of fountains in the middle. It's very beautiful and a lovely place to go for a walk and stop for a nice espresso and croissant.
pulse of the city. fun place to hang out and get a sense of the everyday life in rome. Good place to stop by for lunch or dinner.

The place to be at night.... Great restaurants, amazing fountains. Much less crowded than Trevi fountain area at night.. We stayed on Via Veneto, so ended up taking a taxi back to the hotel, but it seems like this would be a great area to stay near next time, great location.

Wonderful and ver surprising. This is definitely a spectacle not to be missed. throw in a coin and you will return to Rome so the myth goes. It is a must during the day and again at night when it is all lit up, brilliant and free...
Interesting. Interesting place to hang around for 20 minutes or so with a decent backstory behing it. Worth going!
Interesting. Interesting place to hang around for 20 minutes or so with a decent backstory behing it. Worth going!

Great feel. Me and my girlfriend sat in the square around Piazza Navona and found it a nice place to relax for a while watching the world go by after a long day travelling about the city. Their was so much going on there and loads of great features to look at. I recommend paying it a visit.

Love Navona!. It's just a lovely atmosphere. Not much to do apart from eat and drink in one of the many restaurants surrounding the piazza. There are a lot of stalls around selling paintings and what not which is worth a wander. There was a guy playing an accordion when we went, which just added to the vibe. Lovely couple of hours

Lovely fountains. Nice to sit and watch the world go by. Restaurants and cafes etc definitely alot more expensive here than the little side streets and food not greatly better I would say. Vendors selling pictures etc but a few benches around to just watch the fountains etc

So beautiful you feel you have to become a painter.... An amazing place, A must while visiting Rome. following the visit of the Pantheon. Didn't try this time the Tre scalini ice cream but it's also a must while there, I had my share of their Icecream some 2 years ago....
Great ambience. I love this piazza. Not a marvelous place to be but this piazza has its own charm. The restaurants are around are expensive and not worth it..

Feel the energy. This is one of Rome's busiest piazzas. You can grab a coffee & see the variety of people walk past you. There is a large selection of restaurants with some being better than others. After your meal you can get a gelato & have a pleasant stroll around the piazza. The 3 fountains in the piazza are spectacular & provide great photo opportunities. The piazza really comes alive at night. The on site buskers add to the experience.
Our fave place. This is full of locals, artists, atmosphere and lots of people watching. It was a fave place to find a cafe and watch all the delights of Rome we loved it.

Vibrant. Area is just vibrant with all the people milling about around the fountain, churches and alleyways. I stopped here too nights and plan to visit early morning to experience it when quiet with less or no crowds.

The most amazing square in Rome. Piazza Navona is my favorite place in Rome....so beautiful, so perfect. Finally the fountains are restored to the original beauty and the Four Rivers flow through a shining stone...people strolling, cute houses and balcony, artists and funny guys...You do not need anything else.

Charming square with a gorgeous fountain!. Walked through here while walking around Rome. The fountain is beautiful! We went into the church which was also beautiful. Lots of vendors around selling things and plenty of cafe's around if your hungry. Worth a visit.
Nice. Such a great square in the center of Rome. It has a special atmosphere dont forget to visit at night, it is also the landmark of the city.

Another must see every visit. The Piazza Navona looks good on a sunny day, a rainy day, oh and of course at night. The fountain is something to marvel at, as is the whole layout of the Piazza that clearly shows its origins as a Roman circus.
I've visited every time, and will continue to do so.

Pretty piazza. Lovely piazza nice to stroll around taking in the atmosphere,went early morning so nice and quiet.The fountains are spectacular got some lovely photos.Coffee shops and restaurants are a little prices but you are paying for surroundings.Well worth a visit.
beautiful fountains, worth a visit!. This is a great place to go to people watch. The fountains are impressive and a great photo op. Lunch in the Piazza can be expensive though.
Stunning work of very talented craftsmen. The attention to detail and the masterful techniques used to create such magnificent sculptures, a marvel to see and the scale to which they were created!

Magical at night. Built where Roman chariots were raced, this piazza has magnifiçent fountains by Bernini. They contain lots to study, and are lovely to look at as a whole, especially lit up at night. The surrounding buildings give nice context.

Surprise, surprise. Just walking around the streets of Rome taking in the awesome
buildings then when turning a corner you come across the Piazza Novona. Just sit drinking coffee etc and be entertained.
wow. Trevi Fountain is fantastic and great place. during the night probably it's better because there rent a lot of people! Great place

Lovely. We spent a Saturday afternoon here. We arrived at about 12.30 and it wasn't too busy. We walked around and took photo, then got a great seat at restaurant had an amazing pizza, some wine and people watched.
Berninin and Pizza. Sounds heathen but they go well together, a lively square with plenty of watering holes, impressive fountains and lots of selfie stick salesmen

Beautiful. Centrally located square with three different structures to enjoy. Two fountains, one at each end of the square and an obelisk in the middle. Lots of buskers and street artists around. Surrounded by restaurants, but I would assume they would be more expensive than some others off the main drag.

Beautiful. Piazza Navona is beautiful and charming. Perfect spot to enjoy a slice of pizza or gelato while soaking in the atmosphere. The only down side was the people who were trying to sell selfie sticks and such...

Compared to what the rest of Rome has to offer this is average. A lovely big square with a couple of interesting fountains surrounded by restaurants and of course the obligatory and dominating church. Not really much else to say about it other than it gives a feeling of space in the heart of the city

Romantic Atomoshere. Absolutely amazing atmosphere. We were here on a Saturday in July. It was very hot and you could hardly get a seat. The entertainment was super and there was such a variety of it. If in Rome, go there!

Nice piazza to see but not my top site. Visited this piazza towards the end of a piazza tour, the piazza was very busy as you would expect, there are lots of art stalls and some cafe's. The fountain in the middle of the piazza was fantastic, there is also a church however it was my least favourite out of all that I saw. Most have paintings however this one had sculptures as paintings which I wasn't very keen on however others really liked it.

Great place to pick up some Local artwork. In the square there are many many artists (some actual artists others are selling copies of watercolor-like art) where you can pick up an authentic or copy of many different places of Italy. Some of the art is overpriced, but very beautiful; however you can talk down the prices if you make conversation and find out more about the artists. Stop by here just to even had a peak at the art and Piazza Navona square.
Must see area in Rom. From street performers, artists diplaying their paintings to a grea place for restaurants and people watching, this is a must visit area during your trip to Rome

Lovely Piazza. This is a lovely Piazza, after walking down little alleyways and then when it opened out to this Piazza, there were so many people selling their wares, as well as dressed up artists. Lovely restaurants and shops and fountains, we spent a good time looking around and enjoying all the colourful buildings and soaking up the atmosphere of the place. It will be a place I remember always.

Lovely Piazza!. Really in love with this piazza. Next time husband and I we will stay around this beautiful piazza. In front of a beautiful church San't Agnese de Agone, restaurants, ice cream place, beautiful statue. We were in this beautiful Piazza on January, which is not to many people around and the weather is really nice too. By accident I left my shopping back next to the fountain, and still there after about fifteen minutes.
Christmas Trip. Beautiful! We stumbled across this when lost and it was just breathtaking at Christmas as the sun went down.
Beautiful.... This is one of the more beautiful piazzas. There are 2 or 3 fountains in the middle and a church as well. Lots of activities, lots of food, lots of friendly people.

Vibrant place to visit!. We visited this place at night during the markets - It is usually quite lively and busy. There are artists who are willing to draw caricatures and little market stalls. There are 3 fountains in the area which are quite nice as well. Worth a visit!

Amazing atmosphere and delicious food. We stayed in Rome for a week and came here 2 or 3 nights because it was such a lovely place. Relaxed atmosphere but several painting stalls and artists of all types working. Great to watch, a definite must see piazza at night!
So pretty. A lovely typical Italian Piazza buzzing with life and activities. Beautiful at night too! Why not get a caricature done.. Very fun!
Beautiful Piazza. Beautiful three fountains, great view on the church. The whole square is full of artists. I liked it very much.
Amazing!. A amazingly buzzing, lively and active Piazza! The fountain at the centre is absolutely stunning! There are a lot of street shows that keep you enthralled! A must visit!

Fun, bustling piazza with statues, restaurnats, shops. One of the biggest piazzas in Rome, bustling with locals and tourists, statues and fountains, local shops (meat and cheese - must try) and restaurants, and on Sunday there's a nice little market.

Remains a popular area for visitors. This area gained popularity in the 50s & 60s and remains just as popular with tourists today. Great fountains and street entertainment but beware pricey restaurants around its edges

Built on history. This piazza is built on the Stadium of Domitian, 1 AD. The three fountains are very beautiful. And the church opposite the Bernini Fountain of Four Rivers is small but very beautiful (Sant'Agnese in Agone).

Beautiful piazza!. We stopped by the Piazza Navona on our way back from the Pantheon. Upon entering you are immediately struck by the intricate beauty of the carved fountain. The statues are huge and the carving precise and interesting. The surrounding architecture was beautiful. It's also a great place for a bite to eat with wonderful restaurants surrounding the piazza. A definite must see!

4 river fountain of fun. The most beautiful piazza in the world. In the center of Rome and a pedestrian-people watching favorite. Sit outside on a nice day for a 2 hour lunch or 3 hour dinner and watch humanity in full swing.

Crowded beauty!. Unless you visit this area in the early morning times, early spring, or winter....it will be crowded but this is a beautiful, historic area of Rome. People watching is wonderful from any of the many cafes. My favorite reason to go is to see and study the fountains. There is the Fountain of Neptune, the Moor Fountain, and my favorite Fountain of Four Rivers by Bernini. The Baroque church there is absolutely gorgeous. I suggest spending some quiet "sit down" time there.

Makes sure you get a gelato!. Sat and had a coffee and the nicest ice cream we have ever eaten on a beautiful day in Piazza Navona. Would love to have spent more time here but due to our short trip we couldn't. A brilliant photo opportunity with the fountain.
It's interesting . Look went here like all tourist had main meal here though find it privy and not much happening ,,,, may be time of year ,,, not much people watching about
Awesome. Beautiful Piazza. The ammount of beautiful sculptures and monuments in this Piazza is amazing, and one can stay a long time being delighted at all the details.
Worth A Stop On Your Walk. I wouldn't consider this a must-see or even a destination as Rome is filled with similar Piazzas and Fountains however if you are nearby, definitely take a stroll through.

One has to visit, of course.. It is, of course, a must see but if you are only able to visit once, do so at dusk or in the evening. The work is quite fantastic and now very clean white and bright but its true splendour is best see under floodlight.

Fountains that become rives. This was a lovely visit to the square that the ancient Romans used to flood and have boat battles on the flooded square. Today there are lots of artists painting the scenes and the tourists. A simply lovely place.

People watching. great place to sit have a beer and watch the world go by, worth finding a seat at the front of many a restaurant/bar in the sun and spend 30 minutes soaking it all up - nice stop over
Wonderful Piazza, one of the most knows in Roma. Wonderful Piazza, one of the most knows in Roma. Not only to visit and and see, but for stop, walk and drink or eat something around the place !

Fountain Piazza Navona. Tourist attraction, just a must go and see and take loads of picture.Piazza Navona is an elongated oval-shaped public square in Rome, it was built on the former Stadium of Domitian (the remains of which can still be seen on guided tours from Piazza Tor Sanguigna13). The original name was Circus Agonalis or Circus Agonalis.
Wow. Massive sculptured fountains in this the biggest piazza in Rome, close to Spanish steps with nice cafes around
Trip to Piazza Navona. Fabulous place, wonderful fountains, great restaurants which serve a wide choice of food, good shops

The Piazza worth visiting and revisiting!. Every time we visit Rome, Piazza Navona is a must! We always go and sit down in one of the cafe's for a drink! The feeling there is unexplainable, I feel happiness!!

Splendid architecture. Clean square fantastic foundains and very nice architecture in all area It was cold when we visited but it was worth of it ! Some nice restaurants were around a little expencive

Nice place to relax. This is a nice little place to relax if you can get here at a time without the major tourist crush - which to be honest is difficult. Full of life/restaurants, but later in the evening sitting by the fountains can be pleasant, even in winter. I've been here both in the summer and winter and it's calmer out of season but still busy. You will be approached by a lot of cafe owners and sellers but they will leave you alone if you're polite to them
Obviously a must see. to really appreciate this outstanding fountain you must really try and time yourself to be there when it is not to crowded

Beautiful piazza and very picturesque. The most attractive of all the PIazzas in Rome and a must see on any visit. Lots going on in the centre of the Piazza with artists, street performers and beautiful fountains. Upmarket restaurants and bars surround the edge of the Piazza and a great place to sit and have a drink whilst you watch the world go by - really few places to equal this anywhere I've been - but be careful the drinks are very pricey and the food more so. A couple of leisurely drinks is a must though but would head off to one of the many side streets for a much more reasonably priced meal. could not imagine visiting Rome again without going back here

A Must See While You're There. This is a nice place to go and enjoy a cup of coffee or have some dinner during the evening. Some of the restaurants can be like those tourist trap places you see and want to avoid. Check out the menu and make a call. There are vendors there and a great place to take pictures. The fountain has some history to it, but I would read up on it or make sure your tour goes here

Perfecto. My favorite piazza in Rome. Passed it three or four times a day (hotel was closely) and just a softer at night. Walked the piazza each and every time. The piazza is always wonderfully alive.

Very touristy and that is saying a lot for Rome!. I remember going to Piazza Navona about 22 years ago and loving it, but this time I was really put off by all the street traders and fairground stalls there. Maybe it was worse being just after Christmas and New Year, but the stalls and constant noise and lights ruined it for me. The famous fountains in the square are still beautiful and are worth a look, but I got out of the square as quickly as possible and never went back.
Fun place to hang out. Fun piazza with fountains, restaurants, and street performers. And entertaining place to spend a an hour or so.
Nice architecture. Stopped here for a few pictures. The architecture is magnificent and not many people around so we could get some pictures taken. Well worth a look.
Enjoy the fountains. Very nice place - piazza to take a rest and make break when visiting Rome center. Beautiful buildings around too.

Super!!!. I love piazza Navona!!! It is a place that you feel life all around you!! Painters everywhere, small restaurants, cafe and gelaterias, a lot of people walking ,laughing taking pictures and having fun! Wonderful historical fountains and alot of happenings!
Must see. It's one of my favorite piazzas in Roma. In the summer it is packed, but so full of energy and life. The vendors, food and architecture make it a must see to just sit and take it all in.

Beautiful plaza must see when in rome. Loved the plaza. Very vibrant and beautiful. Lovely atmosphere. Must see when in rome.the fountains are really beautiful and the place has a buzz. Lots of cafés and bars around to sit and enjoy a glass of wine.
Featured in Angels and Demons. This used to be a chariot racing track...of course through the years it was built upon. Any time of the season is a good time to visit.

Piazza Navona. Easy to find as we stayed in near by hotel, very central. Went in the evening and there were few street entertainers, some local artists selling their paintings. There are quite few places to eat in the square and souvenir shops.

One of the must see attractions in Rome. In the summer it can be hot and crowded and around Christmas there is (what I considered to be) a tacky fair taking place for several weeks that cluttered the piazza with booths, carnival games and a merry-go-round (!), but the fountains are unquestionably beautiful. Just ignore the aggressive street vendors and watch out for pickpockets.

Lovely location for eating in. There are so many places to eat here, but don't rush and pick your restaurant. The piazza had a number of artists selling paintings, but my advice is to only buy from an artist that is actually painting. Great atmosphere and we spent a lovely hour or so watching the world go by.

The place to go for dining and entertainment. This is my favourite place to go for dinner. With a Choice of dozens of restaurants, as well as the local buskers and entertainers, artists and musicians.
