Piazza hopping. Tourists can access most of Rome's famous piazzas by the excellent public transportation system. Piazza Navona has an ethereal glow, typical of the squares throughout Rome. On this past trip, I commuted by public bus and took in the sights at my leisure.

Brazilian Palace in front of the Navona!. Excellent place for a walking with friends or dor couple.. for relax and to spend time in the iconic square in Rome where you can make a photos with the famous square. Its also good for food and for pubs in the night in the Piazza del Fico, one minute from here.

gorgeous. Especially the Fountain of Four Rivers. a nice place for people watching or a picnic during the day, a beautiful arts market by night. I personally loved the Fountain of Four Rivers, it is wonderful to photograph in black and white.

Crowded. Recommended by nearly every travel book on Rome we read, the piazza was a bit of a let down, just because of all the hype.Don't get me wrong, there's nice fountains, plenty of places to eat and people watch, but its crowded beyond words.Am I glad I saw it...yes. Did I go back in the 10 days I was in Rome....nope.

My favourite Piazza. I love the Piazza Navona and have visited it many many times. Just to sit down and watch the world go by is wonderful. It has such a different feeling during the day as it does at night but any time is wonderful and worth the visit

really nice piazza relaxing. once you get over the shock of the prices at the designer shops on the way to the pizza novena you get to a tranquil piazza were people watching is an activity a lot of the tourists are involved in. didn't have anything to eat or drink there as was told not to do so in the main piazzas as its exorbitant
All roads go to Piazza Navona. This is a wonderful place where you can spend some hours drinking coffee or just walking around. We enjoyed the beautiful architecture.

Simply stunning!. What a beautiful Piazza to spend an afternoon wondering around in the sunshine while visiting Rome! Gorgeous statues everywhere and several amazing fountains to sit by while listening to local musicians sing and play instruments. You can also see the Stadio Domiziano which displaces the most amazing statues all along the front of this building! A must see Piazza while in Rome...would have loved to stop and eat at one of the dozen restaurants and cafes that are lined along this piazza!!

Incredible Architecture. When my friend and I were exploring Trastevere on our first day in Rome we came across this beautiful piazza and originally thought it was the Trevi Fountain because of how incredible and beautiful the architecture was. We were shocked at how amazing Piazza Navona was, as the fountains are breath-taking, and the Piazza itself was so busy yet serene. We enjoyed the nicest meal of our holiday at a restaurant in Piazza Navona too, as not only was the food gorgeous, but the stunning display of the fountain and the beautiful buildings just made the experience so much better.

High Recommended. And tasty stroll the bustling Piazza Navona ... moved by charming restaurants, in winter, are marked by small tables with candles ... A charm! Our Embassy is there ... and the feeling of seeing our flag fluttering is good, lol ....
Piazza Navona. Could this piazza be anymore stunning than what it already is? Picturesque, iconic. A must see for any visitor to Roma..

No tip senoria. Piazza navona is a really pretty square with a few monuments and a fountain surrounded by overpriced pizzaries and cafes - i paid 5 euro for a small coffee and was informed by the actual waiter that there was no tip Included in the price - needless to say I had another type of tip to give him in irish - pog ma hon - 5 euro exactly, which I stacked like the leaning tower of pizza with as much brass as I could find in my purse

Roman "hot spot"!. When in Rome, you have to spend time in this piazza! where the best pizza, the best pasta, the best chestnuts, the best culinary delights of every kind are to be found.... where movies galore have been filmed, where the locals hang out,.... this is the place!

Good Place to stroll in the evening. We arrive there in the winter evening. The fountain is great and the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone, with its Italian baroque style is definitely worth a visit. Be ready to be impressed.

Beautiful Piazza Navona. Although very touristy, Piazza Navona is a must visit. Beautiful fountains and lots of photo opportunities. I had the best Caprese salad I have ever had at one of the cafes on the square. There are also street musicians and street artists on the square. Definitely make this part of your trip to Rome.
One of those places you just have to visit (en route to?????). A wonderful area with colourful buildings and striking sculpture - typical Renaissance Italy. Vasari would recommend this.

Nice place for people watching. The square is a little over the top and beautifully baroque. It is a pedestrian area, so its great for a wonder around, have a coffee, or some lunch and watch the world go by. On a good day it's filled with artists , street performers and buskers to entertain you.
Beautiful. What a beautiful city square. The fountains are stunning. Plenty of eateries around to sit, relax and enjoy the scene and atmosphere
Beautiful piazza. Beautiful piazza with fabulous fountain and architecture however would have preferred a little less crowded.
Very beautiful place.. We found it on the way back to the hotel, and its very good place. A long the piazza there are a lot of restaurants where you can enjoy the lunch and the view of the piazza.

Pass by. We preferred this to trevi fountain but you will pass by both while walking around don't eat or drink on either of the squares as it's overpriced and not great. Walk around winding side streets to find more authentic food
Great Architecture and Artists. Love the architecture and fountains in Navona, never tire of visiting here when we come to Rome. Also a great place to people watch from the many Cafes.

Worth seeing!. The Piazza Navona is definitely worth seeing while in Rome, especially considering it won't cost you a penny. It's a beautiful space with lovely baroque Roman architecture dating from the 1600's. The square has three famous water fountains, including the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the four rivers), the Fontana del Moro, and the Fountain of Neptune. It's a lovely square to stroll around in for a while, or just to visit when passing through to somewhere else. The square is surrounded by shops and restaurants, and is best on the weekend when bustling with painters selling paintings of Rome. Definitely worth a visit!

Did I miss something. There are some truly wonderful sights in Rome but I just didn't get the feel for this place, it's a very large square with a couple of reasonable looking fountains and a few restaurants nothing picturesque or vibrant going on, worth the short walk but not much more
Beautiful. We went in January so it was easy to get around, beautiful architecture, some lovely cafes & restaurants surround it.

Place was dead. This is probably skewed because we were hoping to see the Christmas markets and as we entered the square nothing. The number of police in the square outnumbered the visitors. Some nice little shops and ornate architecture. Restaurants are a bit pricey and not that good.

Not a must-see but worth visiting. I've gone to Piazza Navona every time I've been to Rome yet I'll admit I don't find it all that amazing. Between being worried about my handbag, the abundance of selfie sticks (men selling them and tourists using them) and the overpriced cafes it's just not what other piazza's offer. The fountain is lovely. As the title: it's worth a visit but I wouldn't consider it something one *must* do when in Rome.
One of the many sights to see. As like many of the buildings, statues, fountains and much more Rome has to offer, its a must see. Lots going on around it, many cafes and restaurants
Worth a Visit. We visited in the evening, the square had really come to life. Lots of street artists and performers and a great spot to people watch.

a must visit surrounded be good descent restaurants . winter... go before dinner - enjoy shopping for touristy items including oil pantings on canvas- you will find large and small oil works. very nice! expect to pay half the price. find one you love and then negotiate. for large expect to pay 50 - 60 Euros always walk away when negotiating be respectful and friendly, and then come back with a lower offer .
Very interesting!!. Beautiful square to spend time for coffee or food. Exist three fountains and it is an excellent spot for photos!

Touristy, but very surreal. Yes, Piazza Navona is touristy. And yes, you should watch for pickpockets, but wow....Piazza Navona is beautiful. Restaurant lined all around, street performers, beautiful architecture and the Fountain! If you're in Rome, you have to walk this Piazza. It's a must do.
Outstanding. You have to admire the quality of the carving. The faces of the subjects and where it is, and what it must have looked like when it was new.

Nice afternoon Break. We were strolling around after our visit to Palazzo della Cancelleria and its exhibit of Leonardo's machines. We stopped for gelato on the piazza and there was a carousel on the piazza for the little ones. Not too crowded. Lovely fountain and good restaurants nearby.
fabulous. Great location for watching the world go by - plenty of choices to eat and drink. Lovely fountains. Go to Frigadarium, best gelato in Rome!!
Favorite piazza in rome. You have to visit this piazza and have lunch or dinner here, is not cheap but is not super expensive either to be eating in front of one of the most famous piazzas in Rome.

Iconic Rome. We stayed just a short stroll away from Piazza Navona. Coming into the piazza we were in awe of the fountains, artists and general atmosphere. We couldn't resist buying gelati and watching all that was going on. Sounds a bit corny, but was a picture postcard moment for us and every time we see Piazza Navona on TV documentaries, travel shows or photos we can't help but hark back to that special experience.

Popular square in Rome - beautiful fountains - well worth a look. Piazza Navona is a popular square in Rome for tourists and locals alike. There are three fountains to admire, including the most famous of the three, the fountain of the four rivers. Because it is popular so will find it busy and there will be the usual vendors trying to get you to buy stuff...don't let that ruin it, simply ignore them and concentrate on the beauty of this pretty piazza. There are plenty of eating options in this area, and reading other reviews it is worth visiting in the evening as well as the daytime, to see the fountains illuminated. Don't plan your day around it, but as it is just 5 minutes walk from the Pantheon it's easy to fit this into a walking route. Well worth a visit.
Another great piazza in Rome:). Just as few others piazzas in Rome. The best thing is to sit there take a break and just watch the people around you.
Great to sit and watch the world go by. Gorgeous photo opportunities. The small bars/cafes are not cheap but to just sit and people watch they cannot be beaten.

A beautiful piazza. Piazza navona has all all the attributes of a wonderful Italian piazza: elegance, street artists, restaurants and beautiful architecture. Another absolute must do when visiting Rome.
You seemingly can't stay away from this place. Interesting history and now a bit of a carnival atmosphere. Lovely settings and fountain, lots of live entertainment.
Lovely piazza. We had an unplanned detour though this beautiful piazza. The fountains and sculptures are more than worth a stop. Plus you can shop , eat and people watch. A must see!

Three Fountains And Basilica in one place.. Not far from Vatican, Piazza Navigation got a hidden beauty. The Basilica on the side got marvellous statues in like 3D format. Although this is not too big in scale, you'd appreciate the workmanship of the sculptures. Outside you can see three Fountains in competition. Also various models in many different styles posing standstill. Pay if you want a photo with any of them.
Nice. Could not imagine it was an athletic stadium once, nice little restaurants (but pricy) and beautiful buildings.
Some romantic time. Street sellers, painters, musicians, art, history...etc everything is gathered in this area. Drinking some sparkling wine and listening musicians is so romantic.

Nice but not essential. This is a nice area, would be better without the agressive touts trying to see everything, but then tourist attractions the world over suffer from this. A pretty spot but not essential to your trip.

a market that must pass. The market is oval
The most remarkable monuments are Fontana del Moro market this Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi and both creations of Bernini .

Bring a picnic!. My wife and I prepared our own picnic lunch by stopping at a few shops nearby to picked up tomatoes, meat, cheese, and grapes. We sat by one of the fountains and just took in the sights and sounds of such a neat place. There are many touristy restaurants around the piazza and I am glad we avoided them! Such beautiful artwork and detail in the statues, that it is totally worth visiting on a free afternoon.
The most beautiful square in Rome. Our favourite place to stop for a coffee or a bite to eat. Just the most beautiful square in Rome with lots going on. Different live music adds to the atmosphere.

Worth the Visit but Not without Flaws. The piazza is bustling and for good reason; the fountain is great, the churches around the area are great and several shops have a bit more than the typical tourist goods. However, much like the rest of Rome, it is in need of a clean up like a fresh coat of paint here and there and a power washing to remove some of the grime. Also, beware of the cafes selling overpriced drinks. I don't eat at places where the staff stand outside trying to hustle you to a table but if you don't mind forking over 7 Euros for a coffee or soda, it's not a bad place to get off your feet and take in some of the city.

If you're a horse lover, check out the center fountain.....it's a trough for horses!. The three fountains at Piazza Navona are the end of the ancient Roman aquaducts. The first and third fountains were for humans, and the center fountain was for the horses. I love how horses were provided with such beautiful fountains in Rome!
People Watching at its Best. The night time is the best time to stroll by this beautiful piazza. Great for people watching. The fountains are beautiful to watch in the evenings' lighting.
Amazing!. Not to be missed. As per the designs of most of the buildings in central Rome, the artwork is out of this world.
Fountains. This has some beautiful fountains !! Also some local artists with some nice original art work. Great place to sit in a cafe and look at the fountains.

must to see. It was a arena during the old periods and it was called as agones but then for corruption ‘Navona‘.There are many nice coffes around and still the place for peorple to meet, with many artists who daily exhibit and sell their works, but also-and above all-with the Christmas market and the feast of the Epiphany, with the historic ‘Befana’ that everyone waits on the night of January 6.

Very commercial. I visited during Christmas week. It had a fair set up with games and a merry-go-round. It cheapened the scene for me. Fountain also appeared smaller in person than depicted in movies. Still worth seeing.
amazing. Def a must see when going to Rome! So beautiful and historic, you don't want to miss out on this place!

Nice, but a bit grotty. I hadn't really intended to visit the Piazza Navona, but stumbled on it after I had eaten in an nearby (excellent) pizzeria. The piazza definitely has something to offer, but I thought it was quite grotty. I think a bit of a clean up and it would be really lovely.

A true taste of Rome. We had the taxi from the hotel let us our at this statue. There is lots to do around the beautiful fountain. There are shops with good prices, and one has a good collection of crosses. Lots of people watching and a short walk to the Vatican. a great photo spot as well.

Probably the most beautiful Piazza in Rome. Obviously over crowded at any time of the day but you should not miss the visit.Most of the cafes around are overpriced but it's the price to pay in such location.

Enjoyed the views.. It was fascinating to see so much history in one place. We did a huge circle around Rome that day to see all of the sites. We spent some time in Piazza Navona, it was worth the walk.
Walk To Navona early in the afternoon.. Get a gelato and walk to Navona to hear the street artists play music and take amazing pictures as the sun sets.

what else ?. This is just an enormous and magnificent Plazza. This is of course in the list of what has to be seen, like many other places in Roma (Plazza navona, Trevi, Plaza de Venezzia, Of Spain, etcetera, all beautiful).

In the middle of rome. Its beside the stadium.....this piazza is an amazing place and space where u can meet singers....nusicians and painters ...its fountains with their statues are incredible....by default you will find your self there if you have a walk in rome...visited in 2010

Feell of Rome. Rome is about beauty, antiquity, food, and the people. Navona gives you all of it. Four Rivers with its fabulous statuary is a must see. There are artists and street performers everywhere. I love the Roasted chestnuts and the pomegranate juice. You'll probably want to make a cafe stop for the experience, but you'll find the prices just a tad higher.

Lovely Square. If you are in Rome you have to visit Piazza Navona, the main square has three fountains, one of Neptune fighting a sea monster that makes a great photo. Be sure to have a bite of lunch in the square and enjoy the atmosphere (it can be expensive but is worth it) also check out one of Rome's museums right one the square.

Best seen after dark. The lighting used in the main fountain adds a huge atmosphere to the sculptures so if you're a photographer you'll get some spectacular results - just make sure you keep your camera on manual or semi-auto. Beware of pickpockets at all times! You'll also be pestered by selfie-stick and flower vendors.

Quaint, pretty area of Rome. The Square is home to there beautiful fountains, and many shops and restaurants. We picked one that was down a small alley way which was delicious and not too badly priced considering the location. i would have loved to have been able to sit in the square for hours just taking in the beauty however time and weather did not permit this. Definitely worth the effort to find.

A fun, beautiful open space. We were there around NYears, so it was super fun. Balloons, all kinds of performers, etc. This long piazza is lined with restaurants and shops, has that great fountain as well, and makes for nice pictures.

A must visit. A beautiful place to visit either during the day or in the evening. There is always something going on that will entertain you. There are 3 lovely fountains to look at, sellers of art and different souvenirs. There are great restaurants around the Piazza and it really is an experience to sit down at one of these and have a meal and just watch the world go by. The history of the place makes it extra special.

Good resting place!. I stopped here a couple of times back on forth while out exploring. It is a bit more spacious and there are plenty of places to stop and eat so you can rest a bit from all the walking. The fountain of the four rivers is nice to sit and watch as well. Beautiful when lit up at night!
excellent. it is an excellent place ,wondeful very nice atmosphere you can spend hours and hours I love it I recomend for everyone

A pretty square but marred by the number of hawkers. We walked to Piazza Navona from our hotel. It's a pretty square with some interesting shops around although most were closed as we visited in the evening. The restaurants here are overpriced - you're much better off exploring some of the smaller streets and alleys where absolutely bargains can be found in terms of great food at low prices. The fountain is pretty stunning and great for a photo opportunity. The one thing that really spoils a visit to Piazza Navona is the number of street hawkers/sellers. You can barely walk 2 steps without someone shoving a bunch of 'selfie-sticks' under your nose - even though they must have seen you decline the offers of half a dozen others selling the same things. Just be firm and don't be pressured into buying stuff you don't want or need.

18 years later. We returned to this Piazza 18 years after our first visit. It still has all the charm it ever had. We had lunch at the same place we had eaten all those years ago and showed them the old picture. They were so delighted that we had returned. The toy store at one end is so unique, it seems magical. The fountains are so enchanting and the people watching is great.

a must see in rome. this is the place where you feel rome, huge square with impressive statues and buildings, but the rythm and pace, will definitely ignite you, and if by any chance it fails (none) the streets surrounding it will fill the gap.go there and get lost !!!

Nice place for a coffe. It is always nice to visit this Square. There is always something going on. Music and entertaining. Obvious for a coffee-break when you have wandered around. The fountain is beautyful.
Wonderful monument. Another of Rome's great fountains and plazas. Walking distance to many other key monuments. Take time to see it.

A Must When in Rome. Piazza Navona is asleep early in the morning so go there before the tourists wake up. It's a great place to walk around the narrow streets, hang around the square, and watch the people and world go by. Restaurants abound if you go hungry although I personally prefer eateries outside the tourist areas that locals go to. From Piazza Navona, it's an easy walk to the Pantheon, Fontana di Trevi, Spanish Steps, and the fashionable Via Condotti. It's definitely a must even if you're in Rome for only a day or two.

Always beautiful. No matter if it rains or it is spring (of course in spring is better), it is always nice to walk through this piazza. Just avoid bars and restaurants around as they are bit of tourist trap.
Beautiful Beautiful Beautiful!. Walk down a cobbled stone street and turn the corner and there you will find the Piazza Navona. Beautiful statue and Fountain- NOT TO BE MISSED

Excellent Piazza. This is one of my favorites. It is the length of a football field with beautiful cathedrals, and 3 fountains. The interior is filled with artists painting and selling their work. Around the outside are lots of restaurants to sit and enjoy the scenery. There are usually musicians who come around and play while you eat. Tip them. From there you are 2 blocks from the Pantheon!

Chilled square. A seriously chilled square in the evening. It wasn't busy when we visited, but there was a guy playing guitar which verberated around the square setting the mood. In the centre is the fountain of the four rivers (which if you've watched Dan Brown's movie Angels and Demons) its the fountain its the fountain where Cardinal Regazzi was thrown in and Tom Hank's trries to save him. It's absolutely stunning and a must see.. Try and visit all the little side streets along it.

Piazza Navona, a place to take in the atmosphere of Rome. The Piazza Novona area is home to a number of trattorias and cafes whose guests are both tourists and locals. I recommend browsing through the Roman antique shops.
Nice fountain, don't stay. Over-priced and touristy, somewhere nice to stroll through and see the fountain, but nothing to hang around for.

Stunning and Fun!. I could spend hours here, with the bustling collection of locals and tourist, it really is a hot spot for all kinds of people. Creativity is rife here, with artists hovering around and showing off their work, and if you are lucky, you can get a great deal on some magnificent pieces! fab restaurants too!
Breathtaking views. A beautiful place we visited on a lovely Sunday morning. We had brunch in a lovely cafe overlooking the fountains. So peaceful. Can't wait to return.
Quick visit. Nice place for quick visit. it will take less than 1 Hr. but it deserve by your way to Pantheon. don't forget to buy hot Chestnut!!
Loved it. Perfect place.Very beautiful. I fully recommend to go there!! I've been there on January and it was full of people.. loved it

Beautiful fountain, lively plaza. Large plaza full of restaurants, tourists, street-entertainers/peddlers. a must-see for first-time travelers to Rome!
Don't forget to stop by Friggaderio around the corner!

Good. Very spacious and nice place. But be careful of your pockets/wallets.
There were many street artists but some of them provide unnecessary services and require money!
Beautiful. It's a beautiful place, but during the night they could work better with the lights so the fountain an the buildings could be better seen... Perfect place for a gelato in the afternoon!
One of the biggest Piazzas in Rome apart from Piazza Del Poppolo. Must visit for anyone ....It is a square with famous fountains and nice market areas ....very close to Pantheon and Trevi Fountain ..

One of Rome's most beautiful piazzas. This piazza should not be missed while in Rome...it is a beautiful place to wander around for part of the day. If there at Christmastime, don't miss it, as this is where all the merchants come to sell holiday goods.

this plaza is stunning! must go!. the fountain was beautiful and chiesa st.agnese was worth a visit. The view during the night was great too as you can sit on the bench to enjoy the christmas atmosohere:)

Fun piazza with a carousel and terrific atmosphere. Hotel Rafael where we stayed was just one Piazza Navona so we visited Piazza Navona often. At night it is so much fun with the colorful carousel (kids love it and so do the adults!!!) Saint Agnes which is a beautiful church at Piazza Navona is wonderful too.There are many restaurants and shops around the area to visit.

amazing architecture. Piazza Navona is one of my favourite features in Rome, the sheer historical architecture of the fountains, the buildings and the location are fantastic. A must see for all visitors. Recommended.
Spent New Year's eve here. It's a great place to visit in Rome, lots of restaurants and bars, great for a afternoon with friends and/or family.
Street vendors and fayre rides. Nice to pass through on way to other destinations. Not much there for Christmas but still a lovely square.

Most famous square in Rome. On any given day it is filled with entertainment and worth the visit. However I do suggest that if you want coffee or meal to go into the alleys around the edge of the square otherwise you will pay a premium for eating in Piazza Navona.

Fabulous Navona Square!. This beautiful long and oval square was paved over the site of the Domitian Stadium (86 AD) in the 15th C. and is located in the historic center of Rome. The famous and lively square with many pricey outdoor cafes and restaurants features three magnificent fountains. The central and largest fountain is the famous Fountain of the Four Rivers (the Nile, Ganges, Danube and Rio de la Plata), topped by the Obelisk of Domitian, was created by Bernini in 1651.The Neptune Fountain on the north end was made by Giacomo della Porta in 1576 as was the Moor Fountain on the south end a year earlier.Other prominent Baroque constructions are the Pamphili Palace of Pope Innocent X and the adjacent Church of Sant'Agnese in Angone commissioned by him in 1652. The beautiful church façade was designed by Borromini in 1653. The ancient "speaking" statue of Pasquino on the southwest end was erected in 1501. There used to be a market on the square but it was moved to neighboring Campo de Fiori in 1869.

A must in Roma. When you sit in a cafe sipping a drink think about the old days of the roman empire ; originally this square was used for horses races and was floated with the Tevere river water in order to have boat battle.....if the stone will be able to talk....how much history they saw??

Great Atmosphere all day. Stayed at a nearby hotel and walked through here everyday.Great atmosphere and selection of bars, restaurants and street entertainment.One massive downside is the amount of black guys who hassle you to buy plastic toys of total rubbish from them continually, they are a total pain and ruin the experience. If I wanted rubbish I would buy it elsewhere, the Italian authorities really need to get a grip on these vagabonds, they are spoiling the experience of Italy.

Died and woke up in Michelangelo s arms. Let me just say you are in another time zone , you feel like a princess walking the streets and all you can hear in your mind is why am I not here in Rome this my city , its where I belong and I'm not even Italian.
Nice Plaza and Excellent restaurants. This plaza is a must. You will find a beautiful environment with the locals and excellent places to eat well. Prices are reasonable.

A favourite spot of ours. We stayed one street away from the Piazza Navona whilst visiting Rome, so we were lucky enough to spend a lot of time there. It's a beautiful plaza full of history. There are restaurants, cafes and gelato stands for all tastes. There are lovely sovieneer shops around the plaza, a favourite of ours being the toy store on the corner near a gelato shop. There are individual artists who sell their work at night, this makes for a great opportunity to have your own piece of Rome to return home with.A fantastic area to visit and also stay in!

Lovely but crowded. When we arrived there appeared to be thousands of people here, we really had to battle to get anywhere near the fountains to take pictures, this was the afternoon so I suggest you go here early morning
Wonderful spot to have a meal. You can't miss eating lunch here in one of the awesome pizzerias while looking at the incredible architecture and sculptures.
Piazza Navona. Walked this area. Would not recommend the restaurants on the piazza. Typically overpriced and targeting tourists.

So much to do and see and take in. We walked through Navona so many times I lost count. It was just a few blocks from our hotel and it became an almost daily barometer for what was going on. We went and rode the merry-go-round, played carnival games, sat at the fountains, watched the street performers and would just stroll through and people-watch. The best thing though was spending New Year's in Navona. We were here at midnight when everything went crazy in the best possible way. The fireworks and firecrackers and people cheering and kissing and dancing... I want to spend every NYE in Piazza Navona!

Always bubbling over with energy. We walked through this plaza multiple times and there was always something going on. There was a carousel, carnival booths, acts. On New Year's there were firecrackers and crowds.

Pleasant but very tourist. We went here as it was one of the attractions listed in Rome. It was very pleasant, but I think somewhat ruined by street acts, living statues, funfair stalls and the pain in the neck selfie stick sellers.Lovely fountains to look at and nice architecture, but you are unable to take in the whole things as the tourist money spinners have taken over. A shame really. We went in December, I think it would be unbearable in the summer.Still some people might like this type of thing. We have the same thing in Covert Garden London, but on a slight smaller scale.Again this is just my view on the day we were there.

Great fun Piazza. we visited on Sunday so it was full of locals with plenty of entertainment such as magicians, tricksters, the levitating guy, carrousel, etc. The restaurants in the piazza are not bad and it is a beautiful setting.

A place to blend in with the locals! . They have lots of paintings and painters there. The lil fountain there is beautiful. They have lots of restaurants around it if you want to try Italian food with good service! Personally, it is my favourite piazza!
A Delight. We walked through this plaza area during our city tour during the holiday season and found it truly delightful, especially since it had only minimal tourists at this time of year.

Packed with Tourists. This place was recommended to us and so we went. While it is nice -coz let's face it, there are a lot of beautiful places in Rome that are worth visiting- it would not have been the first on my list; it's very touristy and packed with restaurants that could offer a better quality food but don't coz people would eat there anyways.
iconic. Formerly the stadium built by Nero for his Hellenic-style games in Rome, this piazza sports a famous fountain by the sculptor Bernini.

Nice to see. Although it was chucking it down with rain at the time of our visit it was still a lovely place to visit. Walking through the streets of Rome you tend to just 'stumble' across these attractions

Best place to enjoy food and people watching. Plan to spend time here, without being in a rush to leave. Quintessential Rome experience. Our best memories from 2 separate trips are from this same place.

One major landmark. Piazza Navona is one of the most famous landmarks in Rome... with merit.
Surrounded by historical buildings and a famous church, and stunning fountains in the middle.
Often you also have buskers performing.

This is one of my favorites. With everything being so popular I was surprised that this plaza was as open and relaxed as it is. It has several gorgeous statues and towards the center there is a multitude of artist, that should probably have some of there work in museums, attempting to sell their works. If you`re going to be even close to the area you should take a walk over to see the statues. Also the are several large benches all around the area made just for the weary walker attempting to see all they possibly can of Rome.

Great People Watching. There is something romantic about sitting in Piazza Navona, even with the overpriced food, the ambiance is well worth it! Our favorite nights were sitting in the piazza people watching and sharing a bottle of wine!
It's a square.. Pretty much sums it up. Sometimes has markets, etc. Christmas market is held there every December, it's disappointing though.
Extreemly busy tourist area. it was packed with tourist and with street seller trying to sell anything - from selfie stick to hats. good place to take pictures and have some coffee.

BEAUTIFUL. If you have seen the film Angels and Demons with Tom Hanks you have to visit here. The little cafes ice cream parlours etc. this area was filmed and named in the film. Beautiful architecture.

Wasn't impressed. We visited in Dec, day after Christmas and were expecting a Christmas market but there wasn't one, only a small fair for young children. Nothing exciting. The cafes in the square are expensive so look at the prices first.
beautiful!. a great piazza, 2 fountains, a carousel and plenty of sunshine! the fountian of the 4 rivers is amazing, so big! some stalls selling souveneirs, and many restaurants a well :)

The busiest Piazza: People watching, Dining & Artists. I selected my hotel based on proximity to this Piazza. We walked the 10 minutes to the Piazza a couple times for lunch and once for dinner. Great for people watching and dining. The large group of artists have some good 'real' paintings but a lot of the art are the mass produced type. There are several fountains in the large Piazza, the center one featuring an Egyptian obelisk from when Rome ruled Egypt in the 1st Century. There are the illegal purse & bag sellers all over and police walk through scattering them about frequently.

Romantic and pretty!. We visited Piazza Navona in July 2015 in the afternoon whilst sightseeing in Rome. The square is very busy and lively and there are street artists and cute stalls located around the square. Whilst we didn't eat at PN, there looked to be a lot of restaurants. The fountains here are very beautiful and worth a visit alone. I would have loved to seen the Piazza in the evening as I assume it is lovely at night. I also recommend Frigidarium gelato shop nearby, it is the best in Rome! I hope to come back some day and visit Piazza Navona.
Great food. My friend and I loved Piazza Navona. Close to our hotel and wonderful places to eat. Always something fun going on in the Plaza.

A lovely spot on a Sunday. Music, souvenir booths, and plenty of sunshine on a lovely Sunday afternoon in December. A merry-go-round for the children, and lovers kissing on the benches near the fountains. The Museum of Rome has an entrance on the Piazza, and there are plenty of eateries, too.

a stunning Piazza. a massive area that was once a sort of amphitheater before the surrounding houses and shops were built on it. A touch of Covent Garden about it and soem good eating places surrounding it
Beautiful piazza. Rome is so compact you can walk around to all places . Make sure you go via piazza Navona . The fountain is magical and the local market is good .olive oil , spices . Cakes .......
Good place but do not waste much time here!. Small and good! Do not waste much time here! Can finish this in just 30mins max, enjoy the street shows and cafes here!!
It was a square with 2 fountains. Pleasant to stroll through, would necessarily spend any major length of time in. We had lunch which was nice overlooking the fountains.

Christmas market central. This vast open plaza hosts many fountains in the square. During the Christmas months it hosts the Christmas markets with street performers and Nativity scenes. Last until Jan 4th but go in the early season to see more as shops start closing up after Christmas.

Beautiful. It was quite a struggle to get through the crowd and reach near the fountain but we made it. It was a bustling Sunday evening and we reached this beautiful place walking from the metro station with the help of google maps. It makes me wonder how creative and passionate Romans were that they built such a lovely city. I loved everything in Rome but this one was special. We clicked some great pictures and I hope everyone's wish come true. Must visit

A fun stop for your evening stroll . The Piazza is a beautiful and often very lively center for people of all kinds. You can usually catch many different kinds of street artist or performs displaying their skills. It's a nice to take a minute and reflect on your day in Rome. Music playing and fountains flowing Piazza Navona it's a must for those seeking some entertainment and a lively evening. However I would not recommend eating around the Piazza as it can be expensive.

Piazza Navona. Maybe one of the most beautiful Baroque piazzas in Italy. Bernini's Fountain of Four Rivers (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi) is the most striking scene. Obelisk, two other fountains and Sant'Agnese in Agone church are impressive as much. So many people are around here every day, very frequent place. It's a must.

Was not disappointed. If you are into Touristy type of places this is the perfect place for you to be. Many Italian street performers are located here. You can find many people walking around selling various things, and stands are also numerous all around the piazza selling different objects. During the time my family visited there were carnival booths as well. This place was great place for all ages. Amazing. I was not disappointed.

Too many people. Too many people, nothing so significant except for the pop culture's attraction. You might try to visit it late in the night or very early if you must. else I doubt you will really like it.
Historical Rome. A square build on remnants of a circus - typical Rome ! Wonderful fountains and also a good place to stop for coffee or lunch

Wedding anniversary. A beautiful square filled with painters and muscians. The atmosphere is intoxicating with resteraunts and bars a plenty. We found a resteraunt on the square where the staff were so friendly that we ate there every night. A must goto place when in Rome

very nice to hang out. Its a nice place to see and relax. I found the restaurants close by overprized, so we had some ice cream close by. Loved the Bernini fountain! I´ve found Rome overall lacks explanations of its momuments... it would be great if they had a plaque or something so people know what they are seeing! Ie Bernini is a great master!

Beautifully clean and quite stunning!. The rating as excellent is because it's such a famous place and a visit to Rome would not be complete without seeing it. I suspect in the peak tourist season it will be very crowded and some may think it's not worth it. In December, it was great!
Lovely place. ..with beautiful buildings and fountains. And close to some important landmarks (Pantheon, St Luigi dei Francesi Church).
Nice place for a stroll. Street performers. Fountains. People watching. Not quite as crazy crowded as some other places in Rome. Worth strolling around for a little while.

Even more romantic at night~!. So you need to have either a really good GPS service on either pad or cell phone because trying to get to Piazza Navona can be tricky at times. I just screen shot Google map this place, kept in on my laptop, pad, and print out a hard copy on hand. Bring extra battery or fully charged your electronic devices. You really wanna take some great pix at day, and come back another night for even for romantic pix at night. Lot's people here day and night just like mini version of Time Square NYC. Watch out for pick pockets as always, after all you're in Roma. But do relax, dine, shop around. If it's hot, or raining, just to into St Agnese. Google the history of the 4 dudes sat on the center Fontana dei Fiumi will make your trip even more meaningful to share your selfies with loves ones at home. So what if you're single, well, "schmingle" with the locals for God sake, you're in Roma~! Plenty local families, love birds chilax around this piazza day and night. Please do NOT drink the water. Not these 3 fountains....Coffee lovers, check out the coffeewares available in the shops, but do keep in mind, can be extra costly. Hey, never hurt to look and check out the cute cappuccino and espresso cups. They're nice looking and small and light weight to take home on the back pack. Photographer wannabeez like me, do prep yourself for lot's folks will get in your way, be patience, and pray you've gotta good angles and great battery life.

Amazing sculptures!!!. Bernini's sculptures are incredible! St Agnes Church holds beautiful masses. Worth experiencing the architecture! The area is very touristy. I wouldn't suggest eating in the area. Walk down a side street for better ambiance and quiet-and delicious food. Do walk through the artists. I had a charcoal portrait done by a woman. Turned out beautiful. But watch them before choosing one.

Nice place to people watch. This is a nice Piazza to visit at night or during the day and really enjoy the surroundings. There are some vendors at night, but it is close in proximity to some other places so it allows you to really visit a few places at a time.
Nice place. This piazza is really beautiful but they should work on the lights because at this moment the light doesn't show the beauty of the Four Rivers Fountain.
expected much more. judging by guidebooks - i expected a view which will be a blow to the mind. well - it is nice, quite impressive, but does not fit the superlatives.
Superb!. A chance discovery on a rainy day. Beautiful fountains and street performers added to the ambience. At the end of the Piazza is the Museum of Rome - worth s visit.
Beautiful square . This is a lovely place to sit and enjoy an ice cream whilst people watching. The church opposite the fountain is beautiful.
Big square with nice monument. Square itself is overcrowded with different commercial things, but monument on the middle is something to see.
Great wine, gelato and people watching!. We spent a few nights after dinner wandering over to the Piazza. It is always bustling with people and had great cafes and gelaterias for a nightcap.

Great people watching and good eats. The square is a great place to watch performers like the floating yogi or artists painting. The wonderful backdrop of the fountain and obelisk is icing on the cake.

Piazza Navona !!. The Piazza Navona is situated in the historic center of Rome, west of the Pantheon. It is one of Rome's liveliest squares, with many outdoor cafes, restaurants and night clubs in the neighborhood. Piazza Navona is one of the Roman's most treasured piazzas; here, in centuries past, acrobats and jugglers performed and even today, it's still lively with painters and street performers that put on their shows for tourists and passersby, new spectators of that life that's always flowed though the piazza with movement and joy.
Taste of Rome. Very large Piazza with plenty of places to eat and/or have gelato/expressos. Shops around the piazza and on certain days crafters fill the area.

Busy place - great for buskers/wandering. Fun square to wander when thinking about which restaurant to eat dinner or find dessert at. Plenty of entertaining buskers in the summer and craftsmen selling wares.

Highly over rated. We visited this on Christmas Day to attend the famous Christmas market - it was 4 stalls for children! Nothing more. Very basic surrounding, dirty and wet, with no real 'market'. Touristy restaurants around it which didn't nice at all. Total waste of time. If you are in that area, walk across to the Pantheon, which isn't too far and that is a much better sight!
Nice outdoor place. Many restaurants and little shops, fun place to walk around and see the sculptures. The little shops have some great local samplings

Beautiful open piazza with classic fountains and wonderful cafes. Walking the side streets and popping out onto the plaza is a quintessential Rome experience.This piazza is a must see - the large open area populated with Fountain of the Four Rivers / Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi in the center and surrounded by classic cafes on the perimeter. Definitely worth a stop, when I think of Rome, this is what comes to mind.
Great time!. This is a fun spot! Open air performers, coffee, and beautiful fountains. We spent several hours here just taking in the scene. Give yourself time to take it in and relax.
Fountain. This is the place to be in the evening for a nice meal with views of the square and its stunning Fountain. Its a little more expensive but makes a special treat.
Disappointing. Too many street vendors getting in your face prevent you from enjoying anything. The piazza was like a circus as I went around Christmas and it was difficult to wander around freely.

Super. Wonderful place for a visit while in Rome. It is a must of Rome. It is a large piazza,with excelent restaurants around ( but very expensive ). If you walk one block away, maybe you can find better prices.
With the family . Disappointing as Christmas markets go! A few tents a beautiful piazza near pantheon, well worth a visit.

A great place to while away an hour or two. This is a wonderful piazza with lots going on including artists and street entertainers. We saw an excellent clown act.
Cafes and restaurants on the Piazza are expensive, so enjoy a sit, but maybe eat elsewhere.
Always lots going on.. This is a great spot to come and people watch and check out some street entertainers. There is a few decent food places around too but you definitely pay for the location.
Nice attraction. The fountain was nice and the egyptian obelisk is fascinating to see. The very small christmas market was there also.

Holidays in Rome. Piazza Navonna is probably the most impressionant square in Rome, I can say that you find there a little world. Near the works of art, you can see people doing different things, artists creating in front of you almost anything.
I can say you see there a continuous performance, it is really nice.
So , go there!

Sit back and relax . It is always nice to go in any city in Christmas and new year time around . The piazza was lit up nicely and plenty activities for children . Lots of small shops and restaurants around to take a glass of vino and relax . Enjoyed every moment . I went around 29th December 2015 and it was not so cold .
The Heart of Rom. Piazza Navona gives you a great flavor of Rome and what it means to be a Roman. The Piazza is one of the larger, more open ones and is a great place to relax.

Angels and Demons highlight. What a lovely space! We were initially drawn by the film connection to see the magnificent fountain but we were impressed by the whole atmosphere. It reminded us of Covent Garden in London, crammed full of artists and entertainers.
Good. Good place to sit and watch the world go by. Too many sellers of selfie sticks though and they did get a bit bothersome
Fun for kids.. I was surprised when i saw many stuff for kids to enjoy. If you go there with a baby, no way what histoery says. Just kids take you to enjoy themslves. Anyway a cool place to see
Nice place to relax. Similar to covent garden in london, theres mime artists, street performers etc. nice fountains and some nice Gelato shops there.Nice to sit and people watch. would recommend
Very good. Another Roman piazza that is worth visiting although most would say it is simply a busy tourist spot.
Beautiful Square. Certainly Piazza Navona is a must while in Rome because it's simply is a lovely & lively square with lots of cafe's and ice cream shops.

A "circus" at Christmas time. Piazza Navona is one of my favorite places in Rome, but at Christms there are Merry-go-rounds, vendors, and masses of people. It is almost impossible to see the beauty of the architecutre. Go after Jan 6th if you can, and then you can truly see the beauty of this place.
The Piazza of Joy. Visit to complete your tour in old town Rome - interesting fountains, shops and entertainment all around - buildings are also unique.

Famous Piazza. I enjoyed visiting this Piazza due to how well known it is. It was pretty busy and really a tourist spot only. That being said, I enjoyed walking around. Full of artists or people selling paintings or other items. Good thing is they are not really invasive. You can look without being bothered. Lots of spots to eat, drink or get coffee. Close to other attractions so easy to pass through it and check it off the list.

Better than Spanish Steps, have a gelato!. Loved this piazza, not nearly as crowded as Spanish Steps. wonderful fountains, buskers, and enjoyed eating takeaway tartufi (gelato) from the Cafe Tre Fontini. Lovely place to sit down and enjoy the true Roman atmosphere.
Busy square. This has all the touristy brands and we were told by locals that the area is expensive. We walked around and looked at the fountain, which is beautiful.

Lots of Romanian circus stalls and other nonsense and bad food. Square full of hawkers selling selfie-sticks; Romanian circus stalks charging ridiculous prices for their rubbish. Restaurants were also poor. Food bad, wine bad, service bad.Save yourself the grief, walk down the alleys that leD off the square and you will find some amazing food and service.
Beautiful Piazza. A beautiful large piazza with three fountains to admire and surrounded by wonderful buildings and plenty of places to sit and eat.

Gorgeous. Our hotel was just round the corner from here so we wandered through here several times a day. Always busy, always something to see, be it the architecture, the fountains or the many entertainers. I recommend you just have stroll round and take in the atmosphere - the bars and restaurants are quite expensive and you'll probably be paying about €4 more per meal here than somewhere else just off the beaten track.

Crowded and touristical but worth visiting. This is a very crowded place in warm seasons. Aggressive souvenir vendors could make it a bit difficult to just have a relaxed moment but that is Rome. Plenty restaurants to eat at and beautiful architecture.

Close to our place and LOTS OF GELATO. This was a fun picture taking and "walking around" square near our apartment. The fountains were beautiful and the picture taking was great. It;s a small square with Gelato on every corner, so it ended up being our favorite place, second only to The Colosseum!
buzzing. Worth a stroll round, certainly. We saw various street performers and artists at work and there are many cafes etc. at which to while away some time/rest weary feet/people watch etc.

Nice. About 7 mins walk from the pantheon, it is was a nice addition to the must list see.If you are in the area, I say by all means visit. If not it can be passed.Beautiful structures and not as crowded as I had expected.a lot of street performers, and they are also fun to watch and it is free
nice square but also a tourist trap.. A very nice square in the center of Rome. In dcember with a caroussel. Also a lot of what I call tourist-trap-fun. The restaurants around are overpriced.

Beautiful, must do--a site to see!. Piazza Navona is a tourist trap, and it is very busy, but its not a "trap" in a bad way. I love visiting here. I like seeing all of the people, and I really like all of the vendors. Also, there are some little restaurants on the piazza that are reasonable, and nice for apertivo.

Quiet but locely. Visited in December when the weather was cold so not much going on. However it is a wonderful space with a fantastic selection of eateries I can imagine that the square is a hive of activity in the summer and would be a marvellous place to do a little " people watching " in the summer. There are a couple of wAter features there and if I ever wanted to spend time in Rome I would love to rent an apartment in that square
Beautiful. Enjoy the street vendors and artists, but understand it is a place to beware of pickpockets. The fountains are magnificent.

Great stop. Wonderful place for people watching. There was a lot of people everywhere so be careful of pick pockets but a really nice place to shop, eat, get gelato and watch street people do shows and artists.

The essence of a great city. Beautiful architecture, a great vibe. We had hoped for a Christmas market as had been in previous years but there were just a handful of fairground style stalls and a sad Santa ! Roasted chestnuts were great!
Beautiful Piazza. Great place for shopping or eating and near other nice activities in Rome! The fountains are enchanting! Lots of people go through here as it is a very popular area.

Its a nice place to visit, but you wouldnt want to eat there!. Piazza Navona is a beautiful square in the middle of the old city and well worth spending time there on a sunny day.But be warned, the food available at the many restaurants ranges from average to terrible at rip-off prices. Also, without exception, we were overcharged every time!I suggest just ordering coffee or a beer but eat elsewhere! If you insist on eating there, make an excuse to keep hold of a copy of the menu so you can check the bill. They will attempt to overcharge you every time! This happened to me at several different restaurants. Very disapointing.
Oh lala. Amazing there are no words to explain the beauty of this place! You can find and very tasty food around di piazza Navona!!!!!
Great place, great history. I was on a walking tour of Classical Rome. Loved. Just the type of tour I liked. There were not to many people. The guides were excellent. The weather was great.

Gorgeous piazza. My favourite in Rome - chill in the morning with a coffee - excellent for pizza at lunch time or a romantic meal in the evening. Also really good for people watching. Lots of local artist and smal stalls in the square to roam around .well worth a visit

One of a kind. This square has its own atmosphere - time seems to stop moving here. With its gorgeous fountains, impressive church, many wonderful outdoor cafes and restaurants, Piazza Navona is a must see in Rome.
Must see for the fountains. Crowded but a must see for the fountains. If you can sneak in a picture without others then you can get some great shots. Better during the day vs. night.

Picturesque. Filmed in so many classic movies, it is surreal to see the Piazza in ordinary Rome! It is lined by many restaurants, but we did not dine in any. There were numerous street vendors, each competing for your attention & Euros!
3 Fountains. A beautiful and entertaining area. The fountains are magnificent.Fun people watching area with lots of activity.

Amazing . We went here at night and it was so nice! We had a tour guide telling us about the fountains statues and the artist who carved them. It was great history. There were also street artists and it was nice to watch them.
Very crowded. A beautiful site to see, and very easy to get to. The christmas market there for little children in the month of december is cute, but its only good for small kids.
Dazzling surprise!. It's just amazing. Like a dream. Beatiful and very romantic. The streets around leading to the Pantheon are very nice as well and full for authentic stores.
Piazza Navona. just one of the many things to pass and look at when roaming around the very beautiful Rome, just loved

A whole lot of fun!. We visited Piazza Navona first time around 9 pm Christmas Eve and unfortunately everything and everyone had gone home. The only thing open was the carousel.Hoping things were better, we tried again on the 26th of December in the middle of the day, and man was there a huge difference! The Piazza was packed with people, all the restaurants were open, live entertainment, artists and carnival.Here you can test your aiming skills with bb-gun, air rifle and darts among things.I'm currently 35 years old and suddenly I was 14 again :-)Be aware, the money is loose in your pocket at this place, but honestly: it was the most fun I've had during our 5-day visit.The most impressive are the artists. You can get portraits, spray paint pictures among things.No one traveling to Rome should miss out this Piazza.
the plaza has two great fountains!. the plaza is oozing with fun, there are two fountains in rome's top 12 fountains, and artists, and even a carousel it is a fun stop.
magnificent. Maybe the most famous square in Rome, long and stretched out with a lot of activity going on. Lovely.

Christmas market and Merry go round. in addition to the normal activity here there are a few Christmas market stalls and a merry go round. Brightens up the piazza at night. Stop in and see the precepi at st Agnes

Wonderful place to mingle with other visitors to Rome. Great photo ops to be p-close and personal with fountains and sculpture. The piazza itself is delightful with just enough vendors and places to sit and chat with other travelers. Really comfortable.

Nice place. It's a place full of art and architecture, it's a chilling place especially I. The morning where it's not so crouded it's a place good for nice photos. You can chill in any of the coffee shops and enjoy the scenery. And it's very close to pantheon. So once visiting the local attractions of Rome, this place is not to be missed

Huge disappointment. Through all my research on Christmas markets in Rome this was suppose to be the best. It was very disappointing. There were a few fair-like games and that was about it. We went strolling through on December 23rd expecting lots of shopping, food and entertainment. There was none. Not worth your time!

Too much hassle. Piazza Navona has beautiful fountains that are well worth a look at and the Gelato place was fantastic however the Christmas Markets were non existant and you get constantly hassled by people trying to sell you stuff that ruin the experience.

The children won't leave. The children enjoy a lot for the show...the games...again and again the carousel...oh my god....spent almost half day and hardtime to get children out of piazza hahaha....(hmmmm i was stuck with the shooting game hahahaha)....
Nice visit in a nice weather . Very nice to visit when it is sunny, so you can just sit and watch all the people and the artists with their costumes and guitars

Disappointed. The fountains were nice and I enjoyed the sculptures on the fountains but that is the only thing to do here. The restaurants are your standard restaurant and a lot of beggars doing their little gimmick to get your money.

So beautiful!. A nice stroll to the Piazza with all sorts of quaint shops and restaurants in between. Don't forget to pick up something from one of the many up and coming fashion designers that have shops strewn about in these areas. Back to the Piazza, so relaxing and beautiful. The artistry behind these works are just breathtaking. Like how?? How in the world did they do this, and do it so so well.
December is a great time to visit. Early morning is quiet and it looks great scine the restoration has been completed. Worth a visit.Great photos from the right hand side.
Just beautiful. Wonderful gem in Rome, beautiful fountains on a historic square, we had a really great experience visiting this place.

Don't miss. Awesome place to go, specially when you check historical backgrounds of the whole place. Very touristic restaurants around, but if you are not in Rome every day, you don't care a lot. Specially on the sunny day.
A little disappointing. We were glad that we walked through this historical plaza that once held races. We were hoping for a better market experience. Not much available in terms of quality.
Beautiful. What a lovely lovely square. I happened upon it, and my immediate reaction was to grin, widely. And there's also a lot to be found on either side of it through the little backstreets :D

heart of the city. 3 fountains with great sculptures symbolising the 4 rivers of the world. This is the heart of the city with manyt restaurants. But they're all touristic and not the best choice in Rome.

Three Great Fountains. Visited Aug 2013: The Piazza Navona has three glorious fountains and 17th-century Baroque church Sant'Agnese in Agone. It's built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian from 1st century AD. The ancient Romans watch the agones ("games"), and hence it was known as the competition arena ("Circus Agonalis"). Following the form of the open space of the stadium, the Piazza Navona was transformed into high Baroque Roman architecture during the reigned of Pope Innocent X (1644-55AD). Sant'Agnese in is a 17th-century Baroque church that faces the Piazza Navona. This is the site where the Early Christian Saint Agnes was martyred in the ancient Stadium of Domitian. Construction of the church began in 1652AD under the father/son architects Girolamo and and Carlo Rainaldi but later finished by Francesco Borromini. Legend states that the name of the piazza changed over throuigh the years from 'in avone' to 'navone' and eventually to 'navona'.

Good spot also with kids p. We went there right before Christmas and I think it became of my 4yo's favorite spots in all of Rome. There are stands for games and a merry go round. We also got to admire the statues with their animal figures. The only down side are the numerous tourists taking selfies, oblivious to others around them, making moving around the piazza a bit difficult

Nice place to hang out on a pleasant day. We visited on a nice day and there were many restaurants around the actual piazza. Perfect for just people watching and getting a coffee. There is also a very nice "small" church in the Piazza that is also very well done so worth a quick drop in.

beautiful square, lovely museum. square is as lovely as they say. do go to the museum of rome housed in papal nephew's palace on the piazza. especially of interest for Americans is an exhibit on the end of ww2 and America's intervention in the war

Cool square, but more touristy than authentic. I was expecting more of Piazza Navona, to be honest. While the buildings, fountains and raceway are historical and beautiful, the carnival games, and street hawkers cheapen it. The restaurants around the outside are good for the view of the square, but not wallet. Walked 30 m afterDinner and found another restaurant serving the same food for 1/2 the price. I would walk through (everything is so close - why skip it!) but don't expect a lot. Note: we were really hoping for a Christmas market, and it seems to have been shut down this year, which is a shame.

My Favorite Piazza in Rome. My husband and I visit this place like 5 time while in Rome. In the afternoon there's a lot of people just hanging out in the plaza and the street performers add the good vibe. There are a lot of great restaurant around the piazza so you can easily spend the whole afternoon in here then go to dinner. This place is awesome!
Wide open space surrounded by restaurants... Beautiful fountains, plenty of benches. Surrounded by restaurants and bars. A few individual shops, a short walk from Pathenon.

My favorite piazza!. My husband and I stayed just a hop, skip, and jump away from this piazza in Rome and out of all the piazzas we visited in Rome, Florence, and Italy (which was every one we could get to), it was one of my favorite. It's large (it used to be an athletic field of some sort) and had the best street performers, while at the same time, I didn't feel I was solicited as much to buy silly things like selfie sticks and whirly-gigs ;) Most beautiful fountains--read about the symbolism or take a tour of the historic center with Walks of Italy (if you can, request Amy, she was great). My husband and I spent out first night in Rome, walking through this area and sitting by the fountains. It was perfect!

Gorgeous in december. With Christmas carols playing a carousel to one end and fountains all lit at night, we walked through this one evening returning for another look since our last trip in Aug 2014. Still as pretty as before. Lovely restaurants surrounding too
Good to rest and relax. This was another stop in Rome. It is good for a short walk through. Understanding the theme of the fountain helps.
Magnificent. Great piazza we were there for the Xmas market, which was not possible as it was cancelled in 2013, but this did not distract from this great site

A beautoful square. This is a great spot to end the tour and relax. Lots of restaurants and cafeterias to eat and drink. See the amazing fountain in the middle of square, watch the street painters working their magic.
Faded elegance. Beautiful buildings. Charm that lacks a bit of character. Nice to see, but not to stop and spend time at
Massive space. The dramatic fountains provide an interesting focus to this massive piazza. Particularly enjoyed visiting it at night with the lighting adding to the drama.
Beautiful place and fountain. We stopped by this place once returning to our hotel. It was beautiful and full of tourists and sellers. It is not to be missed.
Angels and Demons. Beware of Street Sellers. Angels and Demons was filmed here but clarly they also used another fountain too because this one is not that deep.

Interesting Site.. During the day,there is a fresh food market; on weekends, there are street artists; at night they disappear and the restaurants that round the Piazza take-over. There are several fountains where people hang out. It is a good people watching, especially on weekends.

Beautiful!. Our taxi driver recommended here, and I'm glad he did!
This is a beautiful piazza, full of incredible architecture, unusual shops and great places to eat. The perfect place to sit and watch the world go by.
Peaceful in the evening. Piazza Navona is in my opinion one of the best spots in Rome to end your day and to enjoy a delicious Italian ice cream.
Fun to walk around. People watching from the cafes, fountains (including the Four Rivers Fountain), nice place to stroll around.

Lovely atmosphere. We went to Piazza Navona to see the Christmas market we'd heard was there in the weeks leading up to the holiday, but didn't see any sign of any market. Still, the piazza is a lovely place to sit and watch the world go by on a sunny winter's day. The Baroque buildings surrounding the square are just beautiful, and the centerpiece, Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers, is huge and impressive from every angle. You have to feel sorry for the sculptors of the other two, much smaller, fountains in the square -- who even knows their names? Although we saw no market on the day we were there, there were a couple of small and (deliberately?) old-fashioned fairground booths and a carousel, and a few street performers and artists we were quite happy to sit in the sun and watch.
One Of My Favorite Piazzas. Wish we could have spent more time here. Adorable Piazza with outdoor artists, awesome restaurants, etc. Well worth the trip.
go during the evening. Very lively at night and I loved the chestnuts from here. It is around the corner from Trevi fountain
Lovely. This place gives insight of Italian lifestyle. Music, good food, crowd... It's magical and beautiful.

A Gem. Our last day in Rome and by default we walked into the enchanting sun drenched square. A violist playing and of course the Roman fountains and restaurants. A great place to sit and relax and people watch, lots of them.So glad we walked here its a buzzing gem

Nice Piazza. This place is busy... Lots of little stores surrounding the Piazza. Very busy and crowded on the day we went. Did not buy anything here as it was expensive and got cheaper items at other markets and shops in Rome...
Big square, many things to do.. really crowded. I do not really understand the fuss about this piazza. OK. It is nice and big but there are tens of piazzas like that around...

Good People Watching. Piazza Navona is a lovely area to grab a drink, its surrounded by beautiful fountains, beautiful buildings, several restaurants looking into the fountain area, and there was an art show with incredible paintings and artists in the middle of the piazza. We enjoyed lunch in the piazza a couple of times, and went to have drinks here before dinner, and to go to the art show. Great way to end the day, music, art and drinks.
Piazza Navona Visit 20151130. Large public square with fountains, sculpture, etc. Good restaurants all around. Highly recommend an enjoyable walk to this site.

Nice but not mandatory . Surprisingly little happens here. Rome has so many fountains and breathtaking buildings and piazza navona has "only" that. Go there if you are close, but don't plan your walk around it. In any other city this would be a top ten thing, but this is Rome.
Lively square in the middle of Rome. Visit during lunch time. You can check out the square and have some nice Pizza at one of the many restaurants that line the roads.

Nice only. Just nice
Not exciting as supposed to be however there are other attractions at walking distance.
Nice to have some pics

Always a great place. Piazza Navona is always a great place to visit. It is a little touristy, and walking a few hundred meters off the Piazza you can get more authentic Italian food. That said, it is worth it to stop at the Piazza see the sights and partake of the wine and cuisine. This is always a stop when I visit Rome.
Great square. It has 3 big fountains and it is a huge place surrounded by cafes and restaurants. The only drawback is the big number of smallsellers that annoy the tourists.
beautiful. There is so much to see in Rome, it is an amazing beautiful City, fabulous architecture everywhere you look

Amazing place in Roma. Amazing and romantic place, a lot of restaurants in the area.
the place is very close to Panteon, so it is easy to see both places in the same day and have a coffee break , seating near Piazza Navona and ingoing the veiw.
Artsy Piazza. I enjoyed looking at the street performers, cafes and the artists at the Piazza. Worth going to have a look and the best place to buy a piece of art to take home.

Great dining and people watching. It's touristy, but still fantastic. Enjoyed pizza on the piazza, shopping at the art fair on the square and watching the people. Close to the Parthenon. Don't miss the espresso at Sant Eustachio...the best in Rome!

Wonderful fountains and lots of cafes with outdoor seating, but street sellers everywhere.. I really enjoyed the Piazza Navona because of the great people watching from the cafes and the wonderful fountains, but found the street hawkers were a bit obnoxious. It appears to be the norm for all the attractions so it takes some getting used to. It is unfortunate that you end up feeling rude for saying "No" so much, but then even that becomes normal and you can enjoy the sights. It was a wonderful time of year to visit Rome because it was less crowded and the weather was much cooler and really quite comfortable.
Visit in christmas and explore the markets. lovely area for a drink and dine. The architectures lovely and the piazza is a good size to people watch.

famous piazza in rome. went there early evening last autumn.. amazing feeling and view.. surrounding by restaurant but didn't went in any.. but just be careful with your belongings in the crowd area.. saw a man performing tricks and enjoyed it.. husband & i chilled for an hour.. must see in rome, finding this place is so exciting..
Amazing atmosphere. Beautiful is all I can say! A must see in Rome very romantic feel especially in the evening. So good we went back later and so glad we did.

Quick wonder around but thats about it. Mainly an area of restaurants, fountains, and some small shops. Busy area, probably worth spending around 30-Minutes strolling around and taking some photos. Would suggest you venture off into some of the alley ways for some traditional Italian cuisine.

My Favorite Piazza in Rome. This is without my favorite Piazza in Rome. It has everything that you would want it to be and have.You can eat at one of the many restaurants. Visit a most beautiful church that looks so unassuming until you get inside. I think it is the church of St. Agnes..it's worth the small donation to enter. Right outside is the famous Bernini fountain that you must walk around and view from all angles. It is exquisite!!. As you walk around the Piazza, that was once an Amphitheater, there will be people playing instruments, painters selling their paintings, etc. I find the beauty of the Piazza Navona in the fact that it is not that big, but a size that makes it very comfortable and enjoyable. Visit at night also when the fountain is lite. It is also in walking distance to the Pantheon.
Amazing fountains. Piazza Navona was breathtaking on a sunny December morning, as we walked into the square you could see all 3, so much detail

Splendid plaza with magnificent fountains & church. The plaza, on the former site of a racecourse (hence the long, thin layout) is now distinguished for three splendid fountains. The best is the Four Rivers Fountain by the l7th century's greatest sculptor, Gian Lorenzo Bernini. Use a guidebook (such as the Touring Club Italiano, the Baedeker, or Blue Guide, or Companion Guide to Rome) to tell you which figure means what. Knowledge makes the fountain even more delightful and interesting. Then visit the handsome, imposing church of St. Agnes that faces the fountain. The fountains at the ends of the piazza are fine but less thrilling, so concentrate on the central one. At the CHristmas season, there's a charming market held on the piazza.

Class. Beautiful piazza where it is worthwhile paying the extra Euros for coffee to sit and watch the world go by. The buidings are beautiful and there is a lovely atmosphere at whatever time of the day or night you go there. This is a great place for taking all sorts of pictures.

My Favorite Piazza. What a wonderful place to spend a few hours. Went with my daughter and granddaughter in June and the beautiful fountains and statues were sparkling white! When I had been there about 10 years ago it was a bit dinghy, but it has been spruced up! Nice area to have a cup of coffee or a glass of wine!
Anyway will pass!. Of course must see and of course beaytyful. Walk around see the buildings and those amazing apartments / penthouses.

Good but not great. The Piazza Navona has some interesting sculptures and some artists selling very nice reasonably priced art. But overall I didn't think this place was as exciting as some other people seem to think it is. I spent about 15 minutes there and then moved on.

Beautiful day and night!. It is best to visit and enjoy early or late in the day (when the tourists do not overwhelm), combining it with nearby Campo di Fiori and the Pantheon. It is worthwhile to read up on the history of all three sights/sites for an even more memorable experience!

Trendy, Pleasant Roman Plaza. The Piazza Navona is my favorite plaza in all of Rome. Beautiful architecture, excellent restaurants and cafes, hundreds of trendy shops surrounding the plaza. And, there are continuous street shows happening there, very entertaining.

Beautiful!. This must be one of the most beautiful piazzas in Rome, wonderful atmosphere both night and day. Excellent bars and restaurants around the piazza but probably cost less just off the square.
Great spot to snap photos.. We stopped by Piazza Navona after dinner one night. We were able to take some lovely night time photos. I would bet that it's even more gorgeous during the day.

Super piazza to spend your evening on. Prices are not the lowest in rotenone. But the people and the lift is worth it. Nice pizza to spend an evening on. It is safe much people, and never seen any problems. Only problem is the police stopped the opera singers in singing. Which we don't love. As there songs are good and gives us an nice evening at one of the many restaurantsQuality of food is from poor to good not superb.But good. It is a pizza you must stay on one evening

Truely Relaxing.. Lovely, relaxing, bustling centrepiece where you can enjoy the fountains and wonderful bars, cafes and restaurants on offer, beautiful by the day or night with a real Italian feel to it all, loved every minute of it !!
Very Nice Open Air Plaza. At first it would be easy to walk past without realizing what it is. Once you spend a few minutes looking around you become awestruck with the beauty.
Close to Pantheon. A good place to people watch. The highlight is the Bernini sculpture. Families with young children would be entertained by the carousel. Lined by restaurants so spoilt for choice.
Beautiful . Must see. It's a very large and beautiful piazza. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from. There is also a lovely church as well. Worth checking out.

Art, Fountain and Peace. This place is perfect for art lovers. There are many illustrators and art vendors. Fountains at the square are wonderful pieces of sculpture. Take your time in here while walking around Rome streets.

No Market!!. we went to Rome last weekend on a deal to specifically visit the Market in Piazza Navona, however, there was no market there at all and I was very upset and have now got a long dispute with the holiday provider to deal with. according to the locals there is no market and hasn't been for a few years???
visted at night was amazing. yet again another wonderful piece of architecture with clear water all lit up in the evening wonderful photos taken

Absolutely beautiful and amazing restaurants and shops in this area. This is a really cute part of Rome!
