I would recommend for anyone to see the fountains in this area and visit one of the many restaurants and cafes here! The shops are also amazing there is a toy shop which is breathtaking! It's a really nice area and there's always street artists with art work on sale managed to get some beautiful photos!
Nice piazza. Really nice piazza on sunny day. However just a note they no longer have a Xmas market here. Lots of bars and restaurants close by

Truly a city Center!!. I choose to wall to walk from my hotel using a longer route to explore the city. This location came a welcome view. So many activities and just so calm. I sat out at one of the cafe exactly opposite one of the fountains.. Made my visit worth it!

Beautiful Piazza but not as advertised. Piazza Navona is beautiful with a huge selection of restaurants and very pretty scenery. Unfortunately we visited based on having read and heard about it's wonderful Christmas markets and there were none to be found. Other websites had made mention of there being 40-50 markets this year but all we find were a half dozen circus stalls and a merry-go-round. Visit if you are looking for somewhere picturesque to eat lunch or dinner and perhaps see one or two street performers but not much else.
Under rated. Early in the day it is an open air market and later becomes a playground for singing groups, bands and lots of folk just living. ANd it is lined with great restaurants.

Art Haven. In all our visits to Rome we always include Piazza Navona. We love it most when the Rome Marathon is being run as it forms part of the course but always opens up walking opportunities. We have been there when its full and when its not. The whole centre of the square and it is huge is full of working painters like a takeaway art gallery. This does not do it for me and only one quadrant of the square has many eating places so the other 3 quarters is devoid of too much other than architecture.
2nd only to Trevi. I thought this was a beautiful piazza and fountain. Don't know the history on it though so not sure what story it is telling, but its still worth a visit
One more beautiful piazza. After seeing so many piazzas you may not remember how each one looks but when you are there you enjoy being there.

Great in the evening!. We went for an evening meal and he view of the fountains was lovely and the food was great, was also nice to walk around after as a lot of sites to see at night very close by worth seeing them all lit up they look great!

Interesting but not overwhelmingly so. This is a large open space that dates back to Roman times, when it was used for racing. At present its function seems to be to allow artists and other street sellers to display their offerings. In that respect it is just like the other touristy locations in Rome. The fountain was impressive as was the large church. Nevertheless, this was probably the least interesting site I visited in Rome.
Nearly didn't bother but glad we did!. Nearly didn't bother but glad we did, really beautiful piazza! Lively fountains and a few fair ground type stalls x
Piazza Navona dining. we had dinner at the Piazza on two evenings. Considering it is a tourist destination, the food and service was outstanding. I would highly recommend
Lovely lively piazza. We went in December 2015, a really lovely and lively piazza, fountains at either end,great buskers, independent shops and relaxing cafes, throughly recomed.

Don't misss this. We discovered Plazza Navona on our last night in Rome. The two fountain sculptures are amazing. We loved the street entertainment, a group of musicians, a clown. Many wonderful restaurants and beautiful churches are on every side.

Piazza Navona - beautiful location, don't eat there. One of the most spectacular piazzas in Rome - the Bernini sculptures are magnificent. I particularly like them in the evening. The piazza is overrun unfortunately with artists selling mostly knock-off paintings, and those guys shooting things in the air! I really don't recommend eating in piazza Navona - overpriced, touristy restaurants. Find a small restaurant on a quieter street. But take the time to enjoy piazza Navona - a guide book will also help you appreciate the area and sculptures.
Lovely place to have lunch on a weekend!. Busy and bustling with street artists and alfresco dinning, great place on a Saturday for a bit to eat over looking the fountains and houses!

another amazing place. If you are lucky and it's a sunny day, then go here and enjoy the painters who are painting and selling there art, drink a coffe in one of the many places or just enjoy the day and look arround

The artists' piazza. One of the most beautiful sites in Rome is Piazza Navona.Originaly built over the ruins of the Circus Agonalis, the stadium of Domitian.Now, it gathers all the painters of rome, to showcase their work. Landscape painters, caricature painters, all kinds of stuff and for all kinds of budgets.Around the piazza you can eat, have a coffee, buy memorabilia or any kind of things you can find.There are also one of the most beautiful fountains you can see in Rome, the baroque-styled Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi with the Egyptian obelisk, in the middle of the square and on both ends you can see the Fontana del Moro (south) and the Fountain of Neptune (north).If you go to this side of the city, don't miss it!
Stunning. There are so many people here and there are security people that make sure you can not put your feet into the fountain

Great outing. Piazza Navona has to be one of the main city landmarks that you shouldn't miss. With cafe's spread all over and the fountain in the middle of the Piazza, there is always something going on. If you are travelling soon, there is a Christmas fair with a carousel and other fun stuff for kids.

Great place for a romantic dinner. It's big and wide, and has a beautiful church on it, and interesting sculptures and fountains...But it was less than expected and Christmas decorations were paltry....

Lovely Piazza Navona!. Piazza Navona follows the form of an open space of an stadium.In the center is the famous ''Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi'' or so called '' Fountain of the Four Rivers'' (build by Lorenzo Bernini). with the Obelisk of Domitian.You will find there alsi the Sant Agnese in Agone church and the Pamphili palace.In the '' Piazza Navona'' exist also other two fountains, at the southern end is the '' Fontana del Moro'' and at the northern end is the '' fountain of Neptun'' .The best view of '' Piazza Navona'' is if you are looking from the north side.In the Piazza you will see a lot of local artists selling their works!
Beautiful . This was such a wonderful market filled with vendors and artists. We just walked around for hours and took it all in. Cannot wait to return!
Pricey restaurants. Cute Piazza and nice churches around. Restaurants were pricey but pleasant place to spend time and take a breather.

Gorgeous…. The first time we went to Piazza Navona it was at night. It was soooo beautiful… the lights… the fountains. We took some pics and went back the next day. There are many restaurants and happenings around. We did not eat anywhere near. I am sure that the places are pricey so move along. Great place to walk around and enjoy.
Artistic place. Amazing piaza where you can enjoy the classic art and the authentic food.Navona is full of cafes and restaurants that offer the best food /espresso in the area

My Favourite Piazza in all of Rome!. You can't go wrong with strolling through this Piazza for a quick cappuccino or a pizza and glass of vino. It always has something going on and is a great place to people watch.
Large piazza. Our hotel was quite close to the Piazza Navona so we walked around the piazza several times. Many street hawkers and entertainers. Definitely worth visiting.
loved piazza navona. the statues in the center are just incredible, and the people watching is excellent too! A fun, safe place to be at night.

My favourite spot in Rome. I just love this piazza so much. So nice to see people strolling and relaxing at this piazza. There are 2 fountains here. The fountain of the 4 rivers is lovely. Go in the evening to see it lit up. Can be crowded in the evening. Trust me all of you will love this piazza. Somehow magical and has its own aura. I miss piazza navona so much..

A beautiful square. One of the most amazing places in Rome! A beautiful square with a fountain. Its a real pleasure to enjoy a cup of coffee in the square, although food at restaurants is not as good (too touristic, i suppose). Try to enjoy it also in the evening, when the lights go on. And definitely go inside the church, its beautiful inside and the choir is singing breathtaking.

Somewhere to eat after a busy day. wonderful relaxing atmosphere, cracking views and fantastic restaurant's a must visit especially at night, street entertainers and sellers all add to the experience.
Nice place. Lots of people especially in the evening. Nice place to hang around or to enjoy 91st a nearby coffee house.
Stunning. Once you can get near due to sheer amount of people, its amazing.Lots of people trying to sell selfy sticks and cloth, just ignore them they go away after a while!!
Lovely Piazza. This is a lovley piazza with beautiful fountains. It is a little spoiled by all the touts and pushy restaurant staff. If you can ignore that, which we did, it is a lovely place.

Beautiful. The picture-post-card-perfect Borromini's church of Sant' Agnese in Agone and the stunning Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers, the Fontana del Moro (southern end) and the Fountain of Neptune (northern end) were all amazing. I suggest that you watch the movie, Angels and Demons. One of the scenes took place here. :) Be careful with those living statue and people in costumes. Taking a photo with them is not for free. :)There are a lot of artists scattered in this place. I suggest you get your portrait done here. It would be an awesome souvenir. :)

nice atmosphere .... There are nice ambiance to waste time in here…
And you can eat something around …
to rest after walking area, that place is good...
An enchanting place. Piazza Navona is the place to go to have a coffee or a quick bite whilst watching people go by in this enchanting square. Probably my favourite place in the eternal city.

The most beautiful piazza and the biggest one, in Rome. I was impressed with fountains and buildings that surrounded piazza. there is a lot of history there. I recommend that you read about it before you visit. very lively place with lots of bars and restaurants

Art & food. This is a nice square with many artists & restaurants. The middle area has a large beautiful fountain & many different people selling there art. Around the outside of the squire there are many restaurants with outside dining. We were here during the day & didn't eat anything, but it was beautiful.

Enjoyed the ambience and people watching. We found this while walking towards the Pantheon and are so glad - just enjoyed the fountains, performers, restaurants and just a place to relax and take it all in. Had one of the artists do pencil art of my wife and it was very close - took out a few wrinkles of course (see hasn't seen this review). Check it out while in Rome!

crowded but fun place. If you want to have a great cappuccino and people-watch this is the place. Excellent statues by Bernini in three areas of the Piazza, multiple restaurants with outdoor seating and excellent food. Definitely worth the visit.

Really nice atmosphere. We got here at about 5:30 in the afternoon and the sun was going down. Really nice colors in the sky, not too many people around so we got to enjoy more of this piazza as it got lighted up!!
Nicer to visit at night. Lovely spot full of artists and restaurants. Much more lively and better atmosphere at night with a few street performers as well.

Better on a dry day. Visited the square twice - the first time on my own and it was sunny and there were many artists there both working and selling their wares. The following day it was raining and wasn't much of a spectacle as a result. Impressive square with fountains at each end, and a church off to one side
One of the nicest places in Rome. I love this place, particulalry when there is not so many people and you can get the look of all the three fountains.
Disappointed. Planned on going to see the Christmas Market. Disappointed to see it wasn't there. Not much else except the fountains & lots of places to eat & drink.
Must see..... .... even though much of the goods and artefacts on sale are tacky. One drink is enough at these prices!
Wonderful place to watch the world go by.. A must go to place. Sit and eat and enjoy the atmosphere. Day or night a great place to go. True Italy.

OK to see. Its ok but a little overrated. Basically a large piazza with fountains in the centre - oh and flooded with the latest hassling sellers with this year's buy of selfie sticks. Got fed up with saying "no thank you". I guess you get used to it!

Nice atmosphere. We walked here from the Pantheon. Took us around 10 minutes with two children. It was easy to find with the help of some signs. We went during the day in December and the weather was brilliant. It was not too crowded or overrun with tourists. The piazza is vast with many beautiful fountains. It is a great place to bring small children because of the wide open space. We ate at one of the restaurants with tables outside, facing the piazza. Very overpriced but provided a good spot to people watch and it had a great ambience.

Christmas is the right time. this beautiful square, where the art of one of the best Italian sculptors is expressed in the splendid sculptures of the fountain of the rivers, during the holidays become a wonderful place to visit for those who love Christmas shopping. Small gifts preserve buildings and strange objects that can make the joy of those who want to do some special gifts.Also on the square overlooking one of the nicest, most Antici and best toy shops in rome, really beautiful and full of games for all ages.It is equipped for gifts and holidays until Epiphany on 6 December, so I recommend this time for the visit of the place, with full of festive joy.
One of the most beautiful piazza in Rome!. If you are in Rome you have to go to piazza navona. It is a real beautiful place perhaps a little more turistc than the other piazza.

I think it's the best plaza in Rome to hang out in.. The fountains are nice. The cars can only drive around the edges and there are few of them. There's usually some musicians or artists or something going on. It's just a fun place to spend a bit of time at, and much more relaxing than most places in Rome.
Wonderful for people watching. Liively a area. Great for strolling, shopping, eating and people watching. Great place to walk in the evening.

Expected more. Nice buzzing environment but wanted a bit more really. Lacked a certain something, unable to explain. Felt like a human zoo, just full of entertainers looking to make money from tourists including the Hindu sage sitting in mid air with a rude double act who doesn't let you take pictures unless you pay up, very hostile. Make money but from voluntary donations do not demand it is all!

No comparison to anything else. It's close to magic!. I have seen it so many times and this time I was so unlucky to go there and realize they were doing major restoration work. Tourists where crazy throwing coins over bullet proof glass. When this place is open it's not only a zoo but it's spectacular.

Allow Some Time To soak It All In. There are several aspects of this piazza: Architecture, History, Quality artwork sold by the artists and great sidewalk cafe atmospheres from which to see it at leisure. It would be an incomplete visit if one were to walk through non-stop. Read the history of the sculptors and the symbolism of their work so you can really appreciate the positions and expressions of the subjects. Take a closer look at local artists' work and see a cross section of all the paintings. We bought a small one which was appealing and I admire it every day in my kitchen.
Need to see after the restoration. after the restoration, the fountain has gained new and improved look. so it is a must to see in the near future

Beautiful at night, but difficult to find. Having seen the film Angels & Demons, I wanted to see the Piazza Navona. It proved quite difficult to find especially at night as there is minimal signposting or information. We walked through a maze of narrow cobbled streets even though we knew we were so close but it was well worth the trek. The fountains and the piazza are stunning especially when lit up at night. Glad we found it, eventually!

Lovely atmosphere. We went here in the evening hoping to purchase some Xmas gifts at the Xmas market. Unfortunately because of some law they are not holding the market this year which was disappointing. However this Piazza had a very cosmopolitan feel about it and enjoyed a very nice meal sitting outside in December!
Exquisite Fountains. Piazza Navona is a beautiful piazza to visit. Lots of shops and places to eat. The fountains are exquisite. Must see.

No Christmas Market. We headed here to see the Christmas market as advertised on a holiday deal, however the Piazza was empty which was a shock, apparently they haven't held a Christmas market now for the 2nd year running due to politics etc, huge let down really. What saved the evening was the nice restaurant we found on our first night and the beautiful main fountain.

Gorgeous. One of many gorgeous piazza in Rome. The fountain and sculptures are beautiful. So hard to understand how old all this beautiful artwork is. Just a beautiful place to sit and reflect on its beauty.

Place to sit, relax, watch people and enjoy the view!. We went straight here from a 10-hr US flight before heading to our hotel which is close by. I sat in one of the benches for hours admiring the place and the great works of art, watching tourists taking lots of pictures and locals passing by. My husband was also busy taking a lot of pictures of this beautiful piazza. We came back few times and mostly at night which I like even better. lots of good restaurants but on a bit pricey side. A must visit place when in Rome!

Fountain of the 4 rivers. Probably my favorite fountain. You need to have a guide in rome or study very hard on your own to get all of the meaning out of all of the antiquities in rome. I love how the 4 rivers symbolizes the relation of the continents to the church.
A very wide Piazza. Has fountains and statues...street performers and many cafes. A great place to sit and enjoy a coffee. Go!
A must when visiting Rome!. This is one of the most iconic places in Rome, and definitely worth a visit. If you go early morning or late afternoon, it is much quieter!
Lots of charm.. Really nice Piazza and just round the corner from the Pantheon, a nice place for a bite to eat & a drink.
Yes, you are in Rome. You have to walk here too.. I really enjoyed walking in Piazza Navone and the streets around it. The fountain is very nice and there are caffes, bistrots and restaurants close.

So beautiful!. Just take an ice cream, sit on one of the benches and look at the wonderful buildings around the square and the –so many- street artists! I took a hundred of photos there! :-) Again… it doesn’t worth to pay double the price of a coffee on the coffee shops on the square… there are so many beautiful shops and places you can enjoy your coffee/food in the streets around piazza.

Good times, very relaxed. Great scenery, live music, good food. What's not to love about this piazza? It is beautiful during the day and even more so at night. Don't skip this local sight. It's so close to other sites, you'd be crazy to not see it in the evening.
Very nice area but be aware of tourist traps. If you are wanting anything more than an espresso, check the TA reviews before you sit down. We encountered one restaurant by the Piazza that was a scam.

My favourite square in whole of Rome!. Amazing square, so beautiful, great artists all around the place, lots of restaurants and great food and drinks places were quite reasonably priced if you considering the location. Went there most of the nights and days we were in Rome.

Worth a visit if time. Visited the Piazza Novona as we had a bit of spare time and glad we did to. Lovely fountains and some great street entertainers and painters. Lovely quaint coffee shops and restaurants to sit outside and watch the world go by.

Perfect square spoiled by tourists and vendors. Look at perfect form of an old oval Roman circus, three fountains, one church, nice paving with dark cubes and white curbstone. Of course, Fountain of rivers is unique. G. L. Bernini was great architect and sculptor. Tourists, making selfies with all kinds of simpering, vendors of useless things, pushy "painters" and restaurants - tourist traps with high prices are spoiling the atmosphere. Go there before and after lunch, don't look at rubbish they are selling, just admire the rhythm of facades, murmuring of water and you will see that this is one of the best squares in Italy.
Amazing. This is an amazing fountain, but unfortunately it was under construction while we were there. No water was flowing so we weren't able to see the full spectacular view
astounding sculpture around every corner. views such as this were found literally around most street corners...and with the sun out - an ideal location to enjoy a gelato!

Worth a visit. We walked to piazza Navona from castel sant angelo.. It's a beautiful square and even though there are too many tourists, still you would find it just wonderful to sit and relax at this place and watch so many artists performing and the place lit up beautifully. It's definitely worth a visit while in Rome.

essential. one of the most famous squares in the city of beautiful squares
the historic and general legendary status of this square make it a must to visit
conveniently within walking distance of majority of Rome's major sights it is a relaxing area with excellent fountain as a feature
try down the adjoining streets for ice cream and coffee shops

The must-see place in Rome. The beautiful square with three fountains. Always crowded with tourists, but for a reason. Simply like this place.
Also good restaurant is available around the corner (try searching this site for good restraunts in Rome, and you will find it)

Worth the bother. Friends told us it wasnt worth the bother and the coffee was expensive!
Loved the coffee and didn't notice how much it cost - too busy people watching.
Loved the fountains and the atmosphere despite the tourists.

A Fun Square . We walked to the Piazza Novona from our hotel in Via Frattina . The square is nicely light up at night and we could see a lot of artists , painting as well as selling their paintings . There was also a group of musicians playing some good english music and entertaining all who were around , and a street performer who was doing a fire aided act . He was pretty at it . The square is quite large and surrounded by tall buildings around it . The sculptures are beautiful and so is the Obelisk .I did buy my souvenir paintings of Rome from this square . There isnt much to see and marvel but if you are looking to spend a fun evening then this is the place .
One of my best squares. Piazza Navona is famous all over the World: the big fountains are gorgeous and the pizza is always very busy.

Friday and Saturday night this is one of the top places to be. This is a tremendous piazza, one long oblong with a myriad of Restaurants and cafes around, the side streets in all direction are home to a variety of lovely shops and some not so lovely of course. There will be street performers all over the square in the evenings, especially at weekends.It's probably a good place to go with Kids to eat, Mum and Dad can sit back after dinner and watch the kids wear themselves out as they tear around the piazza.As always the fountains and architecture is jaw dropping.Great atmosphere and what you expect from a Rome Piazza.
a lot of resturants.. This piazza has everything to visit and see; Beautiful Square and fountain, you will find a lot of food varieties; and a lot of street shows.
Another favourite . . Got here early after a 23 hr flight. Just the place to relax and take in Rome. Visited the beautiful church in the Piazza also.
Very classic spot in Rome. Great for picture taking around the city of Rome, it's really one of those Instagram moments that you will need to take a snaphot.

Nice piazza in Rome with three fountains. We walked through the Piazza Navona today around the late morning time. It was quite busy as the church service was ongoing. A lot of visitors and locals, but it probably wasn't as crammed as it would be if this were the summer peak tourist season. The three fountains are nice, and there are a lot of people taking pictures with them. My favorite one was the one in the middle with the four statues of the main known rivers of the world at that time (the Nile, the Danube, the Rio de la Plata, and the Ganges).The square is also riddled with people trying to sell your camera holders for selfies and other performers and artists as well as a few homeless people begging for money.

great during rainy days.. this sight is very close to the Pantheon. the fountain is surrounded with restaurants all type and they fight for your business. ask if you could get a glass of wine to dine on them. it worked for us on the rainy day we went there

Great Christmas Market. There's not much really to be said about this place that hasn't already been said by people far more knowledgable than me, but if I were to say anything it would be that over Christmas there is a market here with all local products from food to decorations and there's a really nice buzz about the place. Well worth a look in!

Most Beautiful Piazza In Rome. This is certainly one of the largest if not the largest Piazza in Rome and it was certainly our favorite. Enjoy the statues and fountains, vendors, painters, men playing the accordion and have a meal there over a glass of wine and just sit back and take it all in. Spectacular

Best. Piazza. Ever.. This joint is jumpin' - so go early in the morning if you want to get good photos of the fountains and church without all the crowds, but go back in the evening/night to enjoy the night life. Lots of art vendors and such in the area, but did not seem to suffer from the plague of junk/toy vendors that many other piazza's seem to have. Although there are many restaurants in the area, wander a street or two out of the main square to have a bite with more locals, then come back to have a coffee and watch the night life.

Beautiful Square. Piazza Navona is a moderate size square with several beautiful fountains. Its nearby the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon, making it a great spot to eat lunch after visiting both! There are several street artists, and it's fun to browse their work. There are some nice (although a bit touristy) restaurants with a patio, but its lovely to have a nice coffee or pasta in such beautiful surroundings.
Pretty and worth a look. A pretty part of Rome - worth a look :) add it to your walking stops while you are wandering about this beautiful city.

A piazza where the artists sell their paintings. In this piazza there are two beautifull fountains and there are many artists selling very nice paintings. Unfortunatelly I didn't buy any of them and now I want to go back and buy many!!

beautiful. This beautiful sqaure is best visited in the morning to hear the live street musicians. In the afternoon it is quiet-and perfect for having a cappuccino to people watch at a cafe along the perimeter. Something unknown to many travelers: there is a museum at the north end, that is underground, among the Roman ruins of the old stadium of piazza navona...Yes it was a stadium-go see it!
Nice place. I dont see public transportation running effective in Rome, dont hang on public bus to reach navona.
Breath taking. Beautiful fountain and surrounding buildings. A lovely square to share a coffee and watch the world go by. Great atmosphere.

These Best Plazza in Rome, beyond a doubt. Don't miss it, this Piazza, started in the 1st century AD has three fountains that are centuries old and true works of art, it has a work of art church, shops, restaurants, and you could spend a whole day here just checking everything out & enjoying the activities, the food, & the beauty of it all. Highly recommended

Great place to unwind. We stayed at the navona gallery just steps away from the piazza navona. In the evenings there is so much happening with artist, performers and street vendors. A great place to get a glass of wine or coffee and sit, unwind and enjoy.

Best at night. This was a great night walk. The shops were decorated for the holidays, vendors selling roasted chestnuts (not my favorite -but they smell great), and the fountain was a great center piece.Lots of shops and places to eat. It is more for the tourists than the locals.It was fun to sit by the fountain and watch all of the people using it as a backdrop for pictures. Again watch out for selfie sticks.

Not sure what all the fuss was about !. We had a coffee and water in a restaurant overlooking the square and people watched , we did this piazza because it seems everyone else does. Ok but not sure what all the fuss is about.

Watch the artists and listen to music in Piazza Navona. Piazza Navona seems to emerge from a sea of little side streets and it is a glorious space full of artists, musicians, fountains and restaurants. A wonderful place to sit and relax and watch the world go by. You will be spoilt for choice when it comes to having lunch/dinner as there are numerous restaurants all along the edge of the piazza. Fabulous.
Amazing. We stay in Rome for 3 days but we went to Piazza Navona two times ( day time and evening). I will suggest to everyone to experience that great piazza.

one of the must-visit places in Rome !. beautifull place with fascinating history about her and delicious restaurants and great enviroment in the sorrounding streets around it.highly recommended place for all the family members and singles also

Intresting. The fountain as it exists today was finally completed in 1878 by Antonio della Bitta, who added the imposing sculpture of "Neptune fighting with an octopus", and Gregorio Zappalà, who created the other sculptures, based on the mythological theme of the "Nereids with cupids and walruses".  Both are amazing such detail won't bore you too much but the aquaduct that supplies these fountains is the same that supplies the drinking water , so fill up your bottles.
Pleasant Square in Rome. It was the nicest piazza of all. Beautiful fountains and pleasant atmosphere. It is a place worth of spending some time seating and feeling the breeze.

Cute. I stayed with friends in an airbnb apartment close to Piazza Navona and we loved it. It is close to many attractions including the Pantheon and despite being in a very touristy area is also close to some great restaurants. I wouldn't recommend any of the restaurants right not the Piazza (all of them our tourist traps) but if you venture just a block or two away you'll be able to find some great little places.I will say that this is not a place that is worth going out of your way to see but I would stop by if you're in the area or consider staying close by.

Awesome Roman Experience!. We picked our apartment near to this Piazza on purpose. It is in a great neighborhood and the architecture and street vendors and performers were interesting. We had lunch outside at the Tre Scallini restaurant and "people watched" in this amazing historic area. A must see.

Lovely spot to people watch. Pretty square in central Rome with lots of street performers, stalls selling pictures etc and lots of restaurants. Lovely to sit and have a glass of wine and people watch. Very close to Pantheon

So hard to find!. We walked from coliseum and were completely baffled that there were not more signs directing you to the Piazza. However when we did find it it took yr breath away. The four rivers fountain is stupendous. How on earth did Bernini do it and how the hell was it transported. Well worth the long walk. X

Shame it was partially closed. Shame it was partially closed. Restorations were going on this last visit, so unfortunately I wasn't able to fully appreciate it. Still a piece of art and worth the visit

Beautiful piazza. Beautiful fountains,stopped here for coffee and snack while admiring the beauty,the food and drink here is quite expensive but guess you have to pay for the view.They have a christmas market here but we were told it had been postponed.
Excellent. The building is absolutely magnificent with beautiful fountains at its front. The place is crowded mainly by tourists.

Vibrant square. Spend some time walking through and people watching. Enjoy the street artists and the fountains. We didn't stop to eat or drink at any of the places on the square but plenty available and very interesting toy shop with fabulous window displays at the top!
Love the architecture. A splendid area, the architecture, colour of the buildings and the beautiful fountains, a joy to walk around.

Nice place for lunch/dinner.... Grab your camera and visit this beautiful plaza. Surrounding it are a few restaurants who will serve you delicious lunch or dinner. It's a great place mainly to relax and/or eat with friends, family or that special someone.

Cookie-cutter restaurants and creepy pickpockets. We sat here for about 10 minutes at night, just to people-watch. We mostly just saw pickpockets trying to distract tourists with their cheap trinkets. The piazza is lined with cookie-cutter tourist-price restaurants and aggressive maitre'ds. The church is impressive to look at, but apart from that, I found no real draw.

Beautiful. We almost skip this piazza, am so lucky we didn't. There are 2 beautiful fountain and is surrounded, yes, surrounded by cafe, souvenir shop, pizzaria. You need to walk pass street to find this piazza. But worth the time.

Nice and tourist Piazza. Piazza Navona is a beautiful oval shape piazza with lots of coffee shops and restaurants around it. In the middle of it you can see the beautiful fountains decorated with impressive statues. There are a lot of street performances and vendors that try to sell you everything from paintings to toys. Its a place to feel very tourist in Rome if you like this kind of vibe. You can visit the place during the day and after darkness hours, it's beautiful and busy all day long.

Beautiful place. Charming place ! With all the fountains and arts ! Tens of peoples with different kinds of performances or tricks A Lot of restaurants and coffee shops You can easily spend the whole day there without noticing! - if you like a painting there , bargain with seller for at least half of the price !
My favorite. Love this piazza the night life, the ambiance one of my favorites. would recommend this a must. Many restaurants nearby
Another Baroc summum. I visited the piazza in de evening. The piazza and the 3 fountains were wonderfully lighted. The statues around the fountains are very elegant and astonishing.
Piazza navona. Large inviting piazza with a Bernini fountain and surrounded by cafes and a neat water fountain. Make sure to take your time and check out the original entry gate
Another Beautiful Piazza. Large piazza with lots of space surrounded by restaurants and shops. Another beautiful fountain. I believe it's a Bernini.

one of the best piazza in rome. this piazza and it amazing sculptures and fountains, less crowded than other ones but you can enjoy it so much if you visit and know each roman GODs and their stories.
Bernini has good works there.

big. Huge Piazza! Big and full of art, with the four season fountain in the middle and a huge and really beautiful basilica in the center and with lots of artists showing their art there. It is a beutiful Piazza...very crowded again, but beautiful!
Very touristy but interested. I enjoyed taking a break by sitting in Piazza Navona. There is definitely an ambience about the place despite the touristy nature of the square.

Amazing!. We were in Rome for 3 nights..and kept finding ourselves heading to this square every night! The Fountain is simply stunning! And the Piazza is buzzing with cafes and samll gigs and acts! A must do!

Beautiful and Busy Piazza. Our introduction to Piazzo Navona was on our night tour of Rome with Vincenzo of Roman Guides. He started us at the Piazza Navona carefully explaining the artwork of the fountains and surrounding buildings. The Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi was built in 1651 by Bernini and represents the four important rivers of the Nile, the Danube, the Ganges and the Rio de la Plata. Stopping at each section of the fountain we are able to distinguish each river. Beautiful artwork. The buildings surrounding the Piazzo also have interesting and unique history. We visited on a Monday evening and the Piazzo was crowed with various street venders, families out for the evening and numerous restaurants, all full with evening diners. A scenic and fascinating Piazzo.

Beautiful square both day and night. Lovely by day or night, lots of little shops surround and a markey is held here. By night lovely to see the fountains lit up and we ate here and it was slightly overpriced but well worth it for the experience

Probably the best piazza of rome. impressive at least, piazza di navona is the biggest and most visited in the centre of rome. it's worth visiting it and having a coffee in the cafe-restaurants around it. Be careful though, you will pay for a cappuccino up to 6€ and icecream could cost up to 8-9€ if you sit in the restaurants.
Favorite Piazza in Roma. Loved Piazza Navona...The Bellini Fountain is spectacular as is the Gelato and cappuccino directly across from the fountain at the outdoor cafe.
Top Piazza. My Favorite Piazza, home of the fountain of four rivers. Just a really nice place to visit and enjoy Rome.
Not bad public square. Some scupltures around the whole square, two churches, both closed to visit, but generally not bad. Good for a little brea at the walk through the Rome.

Heart of the City Charm. We stayed nearby in the Hotel Piazza Navona and walked to the Piazza frequently. We enjoyed ever stroll through the square with its lovely fountains. There are charming restaurants surrounding as well as shops and at night street musicians and peddlers come out to sell to the tourists.

Beautiful place . Beautiful place to visit, less crowded compared to other Piazzas but bigger as well.
Lots of restaurants and shops around.
An interesting and serene place. Beautiful monument. IS also part of Angels and demons tour. Do read on Angels and demons for better understanding

To some, a tourist trap, to others Rome at its best. If one wants to avoid the crowds and admire in solitude the fantastic fountains that define this large Roman piazza, go early in the morning on a cold rainy day and sit to sip some espresso at one of the cafes. Crowds or not crowds one cannot leave Rome without being this wonder. I advise to see or listen to Tosca, you will soon know why.

Great place to meet up and hang out. We used this piazza as our central meeting place. It's a great pedestrian area with lots and lots of restaurants and shops. The fountains are so pretty. Many artists display their art work here. This is a great spot to spend a day or evening.

Very pretty and a lively spot. My husband and I stayed in a hotel near Piazza Navona on a recent trip to Rome and were here pretty much every day! The atmosphere here is great - quiet in the mornings and lively at night. The Fountain of the Four Rivers is here, as is the church of Sant'Agnese. There are many restaurants and several gelato places to choose from. Just around the corner is a TI which sells the Roma Pass (good for free admission to two of the included attractions, and discounts for others, plus free use of buses - varying length of time is available). The TI also has a very handy map of Rome.

Magical. One of the most delightful spots is this beautiful piazza in Rome. A great place to sit with a coffee and people watch. The buildings and the fountains are a feast on the eye. And a dining feast awaits in some of the finest of Rome's' ristorantes to be found on the Piazza and the narrow streets leading off. Artists and street entertainers abound and there are numerous shops to be found close by. You cannot go to Rome and not visit the Piazza Navona instantly recognisable from its past as a location in many a major film.

Pretty, and cheap place to eat at Museum. Piazza Navona is pretty, especially at Christmas time when they have lots of people selling decorations and creche-making stuff. It's surrounded by lots of ultra-touristy overpriced restaurants, but inside the Museum of Rome on one end (you can see the sign) there's a very reasonably priced lunch/cafe place.
Perfect!!!!!. My favorite piazza of all at Rome...you must visit it and enjoy your walk with one coffee or one glass of italian wine at one of all this coffe restaurant af the area.

Neighborhood fountain and meeting area.. The Piazza is is completely surrounded by appartment like building, so that you do not see the center or square until you are fully within. The central fountain has the requisite gods, lions et al but it is the entire square that is the draw. There are tourists, local, vendors aplenty in the square and makes for a neighborhood like setting.

Pretty, historic, under renovation. Beautiful historic place to visit on your trip to Rome. It was under renovation when we visited in September but have seen it so many times in movies and shows and stories, it is a must visit either way and the area around there is great for shopping and dining as well

The guide books don't lie. Apart from the buildings all over the 'piazza', you will find the famous fountain of four rivers there and don't miss the Sant'Agnese in Agone church, it is very nice. Plenty of opportunities to eat.

Great place to meet and people watch!. Piazza Navona is full of fountains, restaurants, cafes, and people. We took our teenage children who had a fabulous time. This was certainly one of the best areas in Rome with lots of adorable alleyways nearby.

Style and Elegance. Piazza Navona was probably one of my favourite spots in Rome. Gorgeous fountains of course, the monuments here are exquisition. The atmosphere, the cafes and shops were charming and magical.

Simply Stunning. When in Rome, do as the romans do.
You simply must take the time out to sit at one of the charming restaurants, order an espresso and soak up the atmosphere of Piazza Navona, the street acts will entertain you, with the fountains and architecture as the stunning backdrop..

A beautiful piazza!. This is a large and beautiful piazza to stroll and see all the street vendors, people watch, and have coffee or dine at all the numerous restaurants while viewing all sights in the piazza.

Love this place! . We stumbled across this piazza when walking back from the Vatican and it has to be one of my favourite places in Rome! The atmosphere is amazing. I could sit here for hours! We had thousands of starlings put on a show for us in the sky too which was fab!

Bernini's Fountain a Must See. This piazza has everything to visit and see, three fountains, the central one is the superb Fountain of Four Rivers by Bernini, remarkable in size and beauty. You have lots of restaurant choices, can go inside a church, and enjoy the various mimes that are usually present. It is well worth the visit.

One of the most charming places in Rome. Piazza Navona is just stuffed with places of interest, but not the places of interest is its main attraction. The main thing is that there are three fountains which make it cool even in the summer heat, and, besides, it's one of the most relaxing and charming places with a wonderful atmosphere in the city.
Magic. What a place!!!. Full of different cultures. A rainbow of people coming from different countries. Artisans, musicians you really don't want to leave that place ever.
Visit when its dark. This was a really nice place. At the night you can take beautiful pictures of the fountain and buildings around. Nice atmosphere and lots of places to eat.
An expression of Baroque. The piazza is a very good expression of Baroque. If you look at the fountain "4 winds" you will see an obelisk suspended in the "air"
Great. Been there before Christmas time and i regret that, cos' during Christmas this place is absolutely intense and magical.

Art museum under the sky and lively city life together. The Piazza contains three outstanding baroque fountains, of which the Four Rivers are the most famous; of course, made even more famous by Dan Brown (though one must have some healthy scepticism, following bestsellers and famous movies). I personally like the story of rivalry between Bernini and Borromini more – that gesture of the La Plata River figure and covered head of Nile Express Bernini‘s disgust of his rival‘s church (St. Agnese). Besides the fountains, there are several Palazzos and two churches in the Piazza Navona along with cafe‘s and art and souvenir sellers – truly a piazza for everybody’s tastes. Beware, however – food and drinks are expensive and art is mostly kitsch.

A good spread out piazza. With a church, three fountains, a museum, several restaurants, and dining. The Piazza Navona is a good spot to spend the better part of the day. Depending on the time you arrive, I would recommend viewing the the three fountains first; the Fountain of the Four Rivers, The Fountain of Neptune, and Moor Fountain. If you're into Catholic artwork and design then proceed to the Sant'Agnese in Agone. Take a stroll around the venue to enjoy some people watching and capture some photos. Then if you need a break, stop off an eatery. Afterwards, at the south end there's a Museo Roma and wrap up the venue with some shopping. Cheers.
Beautiful square, amazing fountains, great coffee!. This is a fab square to go to sit and have a coffee. Fountains are amazing and really great to see. Would go back

Feel the hustle and bustle of this beautiful city. This spot was great to just sit on the steps and watch the world by. This was very close to our hotel and we sat and drank a coffee before taking a walk through many luxury shops nearby. There was also horse drawn carriages nearby.
Pizazz Navona. Beautiful Square, well worth spending plenty of time exploring and learning about the history and meaning behind it

One of the best Piazzas . This was one of my favorite stops in Rome. I went by here every time I was near it and was never disappointed. You will find something new each time you visit. Plenty of shops, vendors and statues. Put this on your list of places to visit.

Open Air Market with a lot to offer. Restaurants, peddlers, shops, and cafe'...... everything was absolutely magnificent. Many of the restaurants have outdoor seating and in the square there is a lot of entertainment to take in.
November 2015. My wife and mine favourite place in the whole of Rome. Wonderful place for lunch, and to watch the world go bye, with the added attraction of Bernini's Four Rivers....perfect

Interesting piazza. This piazza is everything in one place. I like that I saw culture, art and history rolled into one. There are restaurants around this area, a church, a magnificent work of art by Bernini and lots of art sellers. Forget all the other piazzas if you need to choose just one, this is the place to be.
Perfect place to chill. We walked around a few times on this square, beautiful. With its artists, fountains one of the most amazing places in Rome.

Excellent fountains. On Piazza Navona you can see part of the ancient Rome on a level -5m under the todays ground level. The three fountains are beautiful - on daytime and at night too. Don't miss to visit this square.

This is the "Times Square" of Rome. For people from the United States, I compare this with "Times Square" in New York. It is a place in the center of the city where artists congregate, and you can just relax and enjoy the mass of humanity. I wish I could have had some more time here, but was limited due to other commitments.

Best Piazza in the city!. We stayed at a B & B just off the Piazza and it was a great experience. The cafes are always full of life and there are artists and vendors throughout the square. Its a great place to just sit and relax after a long day of touring!

Lovely open space in the heart of Rome. Piazza Navona is pone of my favorite places in the center of the city. Surrounded by cafes and restaurants, full of local artists painting and selling their work, and many gorgeous, less touristy streets which approach the square from the west. Built in the foundations of an ancient stadium, the piazza retains the shape of the original stadium, buildings painted the colors of sorbet and of course filled with beautiful fountains, including Bernini's masterpiece, the Fountain of the Four Rivers. This is a cant miss while visiting Rome

My favorite place in Rome. I've visited time three times and this is really my favorite piazza, because no matter where you look there's something interesting - amazing sculpture, buildings and artists plying their trade.

Center of the city !. Whenever I need choose a hotel in Rome, the first thing I look is how close it is to Piazza Navona. It is the center of Rome for me. Eavh time I go, I love it more. You can spend a full day there.

Wonderful by night or day. I visited during day time and wandered around the large oblong piazza, watching the myriad of artists at work and tourists and locals all leisurely enjoying the day. Many nice food choices surround the perimeter. I returned in the evening 2 days later and the Bernini 4 Rivers fountain at night is far more spectacular to see, plus the piazza has much less pedestrian traffic at night making for a whole different vibe

A great spot to pause and enjoy!. This is a lovely spot to visit in Rome, featuring three beautiful fountains. Granted, there were vendors of dubious quality, but we found them to be pleasant and not overly pushy. We did not opted to partake in the café that ring the Piazza but there was sitting available to enjoy the atmosphere and architecture. Great picture taking opportunities exist here!

Piazza Navona - a lively, historic place to stroll and sit. Piazza Navona is a long oblong piazza with fountains and surrounded by restaurants, cafes, gelatos and also historic churches and buildings. Wonderful to wonder the side streets and no cars on the Piazza so stroll, enjoy and take in the ambience.
Circus outline visible. To retain the original circus shape and turn it into a piazza is just brilliant. Visited the Roman foundation before entering, which helped to understand it as a whole.
Great place to spend a day!. I found the food a little pricey, but the atmosphere was wonderful. A great place to just sit around and watch people paint and work on crafts.
Lovely place to wander.. Put this on your walking itinerary when in Rome. A picturesque square with 3 fountains. Lots of artists and surrounding restaurants and cafes.

Popular square, one of the must visit sites in Rome. One of the larger and most popular squares in Rome. It is surrounded by lots of small gift/leather and coffee shops. It has a beautiful fountains and a lots of seating so you can enjoy some time relaxing here. Within walking distance from coliseum.

People watching central. A very busy piazza in the middle of rome, full of artist's, living sculptures and street entertainers. It is also home to 3 wonderful fountains, grab a coffee and sit and people watch, it's a great place to lose a couple of hours.

You must see. When in Rome you must see Piazza Navona , for a taste of Rome,stroll around to take in the atmosphere you will not be disappointed music playing, street artists, art stalls it has the lot.

Not much here. I'm not sure if it's because I didn't have time to look around the whole square but there didn't seem to be that much apart from loads of restaurants and artists. Looks pretty though and is just past the Pantheon so you can visit two attractions in one go. Also enjoyed looking at the different "statue" people around there.

Always a Favorite. I love fountains, so how could I not love Piazza Navona? This is literally the heart of Rome, and so easy to walk to so many attractions, even if it's not yet connected by its own metro stop. Fusing history like this and modern convenience is a time consuming process, but there are still a million buses and a tram. Sure, it's touristy, but anything this beautiful will attract the world, for centuries :)

Is this really the best square in the world?. I really can't choose between Piazza del Campo in Siena, Piazza San Marco in Venice and Piazza Navona in Rome. I am sure each square has its specific charms. Piazza Navona has a elongated shape, due to the fact that a racetrack was on this site during the time of the Roman Empire. Piazza Navona is lined with shops and restaurants. (Beware of the elevated prices.) Furthermore, several impressive structures are situated on Piazza Navone, to name one: The Santa Agnese in Agone church. The central area is the domain of painters and street artists; unforgettable are the three beautiful fountains, whereof Bernini's "Four Rivers" is the most famous. Time passes by enjoyably, sitting on a bench with a delicious ice cream bought at "Tre Scalini" and watching Rome street life. Emphatically to be recommended.

A walk through. A walk through the Piazza with all its artists and street entertainers is well worth it. Stopping for a coffee is easy but sometimes the waiters can be aggressive at trying to get you into their cafe.
OK to walk through one time.. This piazza is nice and the statues are neat, but all the street vendors kind of take away from the experience.

Huge square, rather touristy.. You have to be impressed with the size of this square, it's the biggest I have ever seen. Got some nice fountains and statues, but it also has a lot of people trying to sell you pictures of varying degrees of quality, and an endless supply of selfie stick salesmen - I can't believe these guys can make a living. There much be more selfie stick salesmen in Rome than tourists!Worth a visit on the way to the Pantheon, but don't cry if you can't fit it into your itinerary.

The crossroads.. No matter where we walked (and we walked a lot) during our 3 days in central Rome, we wound up crossing this Plazza. A couple of impressive statues, many cafes, some music, but a surprisingly large, character free central plaza. Bustling at all times of the day.

The main square!. If you want to relax and watch the local artist this place is great. You can just have a coffee and you will see how everything is happening around you.This is the main place of Rome so you don't have to miss it!

For Bernini fans it is a must see. If you are into baroque architecture and admire Bernini's work it is worth a visit to the fontains. Even in November there are some artists on the square, people are gathering, sitting around. Many caffees and restaurants - maybe not the best and the cheapest. It is nice to hang around here.
ITALY 2015. what a pleasant surprise. walked around a corner and there it was layout before us. Fountain & monument are interesting. We had lunch here so that we could people watch. Worth the visit

Bernini's fountain is beautiful and the entire visual experience is stunnning. Very touristy cafes encircle the Piazza, but it is so lovely to sit there on a nice day and enjoy the scene! Order a simple coffee or pizza and you will not be disappointed. Great churches to explore and galleries, as well as close by, unique and antique lined street shops.
A perfect Roman Piazza. Lovely night or day- great shops, cafes (I loved Maranega especially- amazing pasta), artists, and just lively and charming in every way.

Lovely atmosphere Piazza. Very lively and lovely too. Plenty of tourist minding their own businesses, photo and selfie taking all over the place. Many street artists showing their tricks for small change. Lots of restaurants and cafes to sit outside and watch passersby.

Just what you want Roman Piazza to be. It's got fine, but expensive, cafes, excellent street artists, cheap hawkers, fantastic facades, good quality buskers and the most fantastic fountain, topped off with an obelisk. No doubt it also has pick-pockets as well, so be careful. It has a buzz about it during the day and seems to be where the cool kids hang out in the evening.

Worth a visit after the pantheon ,don't eat in the square !!!!!. worth a visit after visiting the pantheon to see the fountains , artists selling paintings and musicians playing ,we made the mistake of eating in the square rip off prices for food and drink the worst food we have eaten on our third visit to Rome !!!!

Heart of Action. Clearly one of the most lively and alive places in central rome. Earlier the playground of romans to come and watch the games , now an artistic treat to watch bernini's 4 rivers fountain and baroque architecture. Lined with retsraunts, street performers, church it is the place to be in the evenings..clearly one of the most happening squares.

Fascinating, very up close experience. This plaza ofers a spectrum of architectural delights, along with street vendors and great eateries. You will see many local families gathering here at night. Don't miss the gelato!
Rome visit. Favorite piazza in rome some lovely lane ways off the piazza with abundance of specialist shops and restaurants.
Beautiful Place. This place is not covered by hop on hop off bus. You get down at Piazza Venezia and walk for it. Its a worth it place to visit.
A beautiful place. It's nice place, you can sit and relax.Lots of eating places there later in the day. There were artists and caricaturists along with square which gave it an awesome atmosphere
Expensive view. Crowded area like many in Rome.You can enjoy the fountains having a coffee at one of the terraces around ,where the tables and chairs are unstable and the coffee costs 7euros.

The most magical piazza. If you were in Rome and Piazza Navona you have never been ... you would not be any need to reach Piazza ... Even in the morning and in the evening ... you will find two different worlds. Do not miss the story behind the envy of the church building and sculpture
cosmopolitan. yes i liked this square, buzzing with people, lots of restaurants, very good live music, artists and entertainers i went a few times there
A must. It is really a pleasant place, full of artist selling paintings, restaurants with terraces, beautiful fountain good food. it is just so romantic.

Quintessential Rome. Imagine yourself in a spot, mid-evening where the air is rich with the scent of 20 pasta kitchens furiously competing for your attention. Ancient cobblestones beneath your feet, guiding you along while fine-arts street vendors paint and charcoal some of the most stunning portraits of passer-by for a modest fee. The great Bernini sculptures, fountains and antiquities surround from the balconies to the street. If you do not spend some time here you have missed both the staging point of old Rome and a piece of your own soul.
lovely by night. Great views at night. Very good place for pictures. Nice atmosphere around this area. At night it is not so crowded

Square as painted. You find there three fountains. In the middle is the biggest fountain Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi and behind fountain rises a magnificent church. On the square is a lot of artists. There is a lot of restaurants but I don´t want to know how expensive it is.

One of the Highlights of Rome. by all means, visit this Piazza. If you are a Da Vince Code fan, this is where a Cardinal was tossed into the fountain to drown. My wife and I retraced all the steps in Rome from that movie. This is touristy as the food goes, but fun to people watch. Must see at night!

Center of Roman Life for Centuries!. The Piazza is on my must see list. It has been the heart of Rome for centuries. It has the beautiful Four Rivers Fountain built by Bernini! The square was a racetrack that was built by the emperor Domitian. The square is a great place to sit and experience the people of Rome.

Fun piazza for an evening stroll. We strolled through Piazza Navona one evening and enjoyed looking at the art venders and all the people gathered around. We couldn't fully enjoy all the fountains, but the piazza was lively but not too crowded. We grabbed some gelato and found a bench to sit and enjoy the people and sites.

One of the best places to sit and watch the world go by. Loved everything about Piazza Navona - what a place to chill, eat , drink, and people watch it's so beautiful and relaxing it feels like a 5 Star resort in itself - hard to believe it's in the centre of a city!!
Beautiful. My favourite place by far in all of Rome. A beautiful place to sit and watch the world go by, many crowds at all times of day, painters and sellers and lovely cafes surrounding to eat at.
Three Beautiful Fountains and a beautiful Piazza. Don't miss the three famous fountains by Giacomo della Porta and Bernini in this beautiful Piazza not far from the Pantheon.
Restored Fountain!. We were fortunate to see the Trivoli Fountain right after it's beautiful restoration and while the water was turned on. Beautiful!
Bobbo Rosso. If you're in the area, there is a Bob Ross lookalike (with white hair), doing sketches of people. He was also incredibly good at it. 5/5
Nice. It's nice cool place, you can sit and relax but a lot of people there. For these kind of attractions i recommend hop on hop off bus.

A must in Rome. This square is wonderful and the Pantheon are here so you can not miss it. On the square is always activity, diet travelers, and hawkers and around the square you will find many nice restaurants and bars.
One of the Most Beautiful Piazza. It's centrally located and best to be visited enroute to dinner. In the evening, the Piazza still have a lot of Street Artists there & has a really good atmosphere.

Fun piazza for people watching and street performance. Big beautiful piazza filled with artists and street performers, especially on Sunday afternoon. Go early in the morning to avoid photo bombs if you want to take picture of the fountains (famous 4-river fountain in the middle plus another fountain at each end of the piazza). Enjoy the entertainment by various performers: magician, guys dressed up as Roman soldiers, mimes, musicians, etc. 10 euro for a caricature drawing or a spray painting.

Beautiful gem in the center of Rome. We came through the Plaza several times and marveled at the beautiful central fountain. Altho we did not try any of the restaurants, there are several options available. It never seemed overly crowded so you could get good pictures

Upmarket Piazza - perfect for people watching. Perfect spot to stop for a glass of vino or a leisurely meal to rest, take in the beautiful surroundings and watch the world go by. Lots of artists here if you fancy having your portrait done.
Good Vibe. Busy place. Excellent atmosphere and amazing fountain. The church is beautiful and do not miss to enter. This is one of the places in Rome you wish to visit couple of times.

Beautiful sites. The sun was shinning on the day I visited Piazza Navona, so much going on all around the piazza, wedding music and lots of beautiful paintings what more could you ask for when visiting Rome.

Keep looking, it is there :). This place is hidden in the middle of street maze. But well worth to look for it. There are many artists all the time - painters, drawers, singers, performers, etc. Fountains are in the middle of all of it. There are some annoying sellers (selfie stick, scarf) around as well.
Nice place to spend afternoon. Very nice place to spend afternoon...full activities, restaurants..very colorful. Walk able to all major attractions from here.

Perfect for people watching. We visited Piazza Navona a few times over out 4 night stay. The day-time view is COMPLETELY different to the night-time view. Many many restaurants to choose from. We would go for drinks at one, then move over to another for lunch/dinner. At night-time, there are lots of "sellers" that come out of the woodwork with rubbish to sell to families with kids that will be attracted to the flashing lights. There are also artist (most of them not so good IMO) but you can find the odd talented one.Definitely worth a visit!

One of Rome's beautiful fountains. This is a wonderful area of Rome just to wander around and enjoy. Of course there is the historic fountain, however there are plenty of other things to see and do around Piazza Navona. Artists bring their paintings for sale, so there's lots of colour and it's always such a vibrant area.
Piazza Navona. Such a lovely place in Rome - beautiful buildings all around the place . beautiful fountains - beautiful life in the place - just such a wonderful place to visit

One of the most amazing locations on the planet. So Much to see, the fountains the restaurants the churches and all the street artists make it one of the most interesting and beautiful Piazzas in the world. I would never get tired of sitting at the cafe watching Rome go by at any time of the year
Artists and fountain. The piazza is beautifully surrounded with colorful buildings. The foundation is gorgeous and the artist in the piazza are very talented.

The Artist's square. We started a walking tour here. Its a cute oval shaped piazza with 2 fountains and a church on one side. Like most piazzas, its surrounded by restaurants which seem to cater to tourists. The piazza itself is split in two in terms of who caters to it. One side has the artists who sell paintings or caricatures. I have to say that I was impressed by some of the paintings as they seemed to provide a different sort of view vs the typical "impressionist" type paintings. I saw a few picasso-type or cubist-type painters. The other side of the square is where all of the street performers (living statues, etc) reside. Supposedly the artist market started due to the sister-in-law of one of the popes who drove away the original market in the square because it was too loud but then changed the rules again when she found that it was too quiet after the market left.
Very nice at nigth. We came to Piazza Navona at night. the Piazza is very amazing and nice to finish a day in Rome.Very nice places to eat around. some shows in the Piazza.Must seen!

wonderful open air artists market. beautiful church of St. Agnes, excellent architectural fountains and a wonderful vibe to the area, many artists displaying and selling their work and reasonable prices as well

Heart of the city . Heart of the city , located piazza navona , is the street where u want to be . Art , musical and people are all in abundance here. The fountain of the four river is located here and great for pictures and just to really capture the Roman
Culture. A must go
In Rome

Arty farty. Despite the title, the art on show is mainly exceptional and beautiful. The place to go if you want a classy characature or a piece of affordable art. Fun, friendly and cheerful with stunning fountains
Full of Life. This was my favourite Piazza in Rome. It was full of life and freindly, with a lot of flair. The Vivi Bistro cafe at the far end was also nice and modern.

Mid week break . A lovely area, the Trivvi fountain was hard to find but worth it. It's a lot larger than I thought it would be. I would advise you go early as it can get very busy, and it can get hard to get a picture of the full fountain
Beautiful Piazza. Try to see this Piazza early in the morning without the crowds. It is very beautiful. Lots of eating places there later in the day and the crowds increase.
Expansive piazza with 3 beautiful fountains. The square is spectacular with 3 beautiful fountains. There were lots of artists and caricaturists along with square which gave it an awesome atmosphere

Absolutely spectaculat. My wife and I were strolling about in Rome on a Sunday evening and decided to have an expensive drink in piazza navona as it was nearly sunset. I can honestly say that I would have paid double for the amazing evening and sunset we had. With the bustle of people going by it made people watching exciting and with the musicians and artists busking it made the whole experience just amazing.I have been many times and will go back every time we are in Rome.
Love Piazza Life. Absolutely loved the Piazza with everything from Bernini's fountains to the street vendors and performers. Surrounded by great restaurants.
Beautiful lively piazza. Amazing architecture and gorgeous fountains. piazza was lively with street artist performances and life statues.

Exceptional place for understanding Rome. Drink a coffee, grab something to eat! Its the place to be to relax after a long walk! Very nice piazza with lots of restaurants and events that happening all day long!

Lovely Piazza. One of the nicest Piazza in Rome with 3 fountains. Many Restaurants around but mainly for tourists and do not serve good Food. If you are there, do not miss the Palazzo Doria Pamphilj, which is not mentioned in most guides.
Piazza Navona. On Christmas time is a Christmarket on this place; it's for children; The three fountains are at this time not the center of attention.

Visit but don't eat and don't drink there!. Piazza Navona is nice, worth to see, it is one of more famous places in Rome. Fontaines are very nice however not so great like di Trevi. The Church is very pretty. Restaurants are very, very expensive. I understand that it is famous place but.... For small beer (0,4 l) and glass of white wine (was horrible) we spent 20 EUR. usually we spent 20-40 EUR for a dinner per two persons (with wine!).

Only if you get time. There are many Piazza's in Rome and some are quite spectacular, this one however is nice but I wouldn't go out of your way to visit it. Worth seeing if you happen to be in the area but plenty of other "must see" attractions in Rome

Beautiful Fountains. I visited this piazza twice. Once at night, which was beautiful and once during the day. Both times it was such a wonderful experience because at night the fountains are lite up and the atmosphere is like a party with all the people around. During the day the fountains look beautiful and the area is bustling with tourists. Loved it.

Beautiful piazza. For me personally it's one of the most, if not the most beautiful piazza in Rome. You can find 3 fountains there and one of those three is famous four river fountain. You should definitelly visit piazza navona when you are in Rome.
Sunday walk. I love piazza Navona and every time I come I. Rome I visit it.This time we bought also a very nice spray painting poster.Never forget!

Busy visitor attraction. This was the busiest Suare or Piazza in Rome apart from the Vatican. Nice selection of alfresco restaurants. Good and varied street entertainment and many artists painting and selling original works.

my favorite, but too crowded. there's nothing to write which you cannot read elsewhere, I used to love the place, but it has become too crowded 24/7. It has a nice variety of shops, but all very expensive naturally...

Irritating hawkers. Not hawkers as in people who have Hawks ( like falconers ) but annoying blokes who pester you all day to buy selfie-sticks and all evening to buy pashminas or little plastic flying things. The square is beautiful with three fountains, nice (expensive) restaurants, and lots of traders selling pictures or doing sketches/caricatures. Lovely atmosphere apart from the hawkers!
Covent Garden of Rome. Loads going on in this beautiful area. Lovely little parade with shops, bars, restaurants and a market - whilst looking beautiful
Amazing. The perfect place to be with your family.Many fountains,statues,restaurants,bars and shops great atmosphere.

Dolce vita.... When I imagine a city in Italy and its square with you thought Piazza Navona. In this square all just smells, looks and sounds like Italy. Come to Rome and not visit this square is a big omission.

Lots of atmosphere, and within stumbling distance of so much sites. Piazza Navona is very central to so many sights. The Piazza itself is ringed by restaurants, and there was live music and art in the centre. Although I found most of the art was generic reproduced tourist prints I saw many places, there were a few gems.

Rome's most memorable Piazza. After a survey of the Pantheon a wander down to this Piazza is a must. The beauty of the fountains is superlative. For me this is a richer experience than the Trevi. Again crowds can be a drawback. Visit off-peak or early in the morning. The combination of the church behind and the fountain in front shows Bernini's studio and Borromini working in a truly complimentary fashion

Would be Swell if Cleared of People. The piazza itself -- the space, the three fountains and the surrounding buildings -- is lovely. The place is filled with vendors of toys, baubles and quasi-art, buskers and, of course tourists.

My Fave Piazza in Italy!. Face it, there are tons of piazzas all over Italy. This one is definitely the coolest! The obelisk and the fountain by Bernini are really cool and give you lots of objects for photography. It's a great place to people watch also. The ambience and the energy are really great there. Also, it's just so picturesque when you cast you eyes from one end to the other end of the piazza. There are restaurants and gelaterias nearby. I had so much fun getting a cone of gelato, planted my bottom by the fountain and ate my ice cream watching all that was going on. There were street performers, artists painting and selling art work, vendors making creative bracelets from wire, etc. It is supposedly like hawker galore in Asia, except this feels more like an art fair. Yeah there are also annoying hawkers selling you selfie sticks. However, they're just everywhere. Anyway, Piazza Navona is a must stop in Rome!

Active and beautiful place to feel Rome with art, food, religion.. 영화 천사와 악마에서 교황 후보를 분수에 빠뜨린 곳이 바로 나보나 광장입니다. 광장 양편에 작은 분수가 있고, 중앙에 베르니니의 유명한 조각이 있는 Fiumi 분수가 있는데, 아마 이 분수가 영화에 나온 분수일 것 같네요. 중앙 분수는... 정말 멋있습니다. 광장에는 많은 길거리 화가들이 그림을 그리고, 팔고, 이런저런 물건들도 있습니다. 주변에 식당도 많고, 도보로 5분 거리에 카라바죠의 성화가 그려져 있는 San Luigi dei Francesi 성당도 있습니다. 거기서 또 5분 정도 걸어가면 그 유명한 Pantheon(판테온)을 만날 수 있구요.정말 예술과 음식과 종교 등 많은 것을 한꺼번에 해결할 수 있는 곳이죠~? 꼭 가보세요~!

Another must see in Rome. An attraction you must see while in Rome. The sculptures around the fountain are interesting. A lot of tourist surrounding the area but tossing a coin in the fountain and taking picture is maneuverable.

Beautiful in evening. This also something to see in the evening all lit up. It was gorgeous. There are a ton of restaurants and sitting having a glass of wine looking at all the people and the fountain was wonderful

Very beautiful but also very crowed. A very lovely site and location, but we went on a sat evning and it was very very crowded. If you could go very late at night or very early in the morning you may get better shots than the ones I included.

Romantic but too touristic . Very nice square . Full of fountains and statues ! You can go any time during the day and feel romantic and fulfilled. Even though we went 4 women we felt very nice walking piazza Navona. The only thing that ruined our walk were passers by who sold selfie sticks. Literally every 5m there were different men selling selfie stick and umbrella.and one of us called us names because he understood we were frustrated by the fact we could not enjoy our walk because of them! Which is a bit annoying don't you think?!

a highlight of our time in Rome. This was probably our favorite space in Rome -- and the competition was stiff! The long, thin square is, if I understood correctly, built on the site of an ancient Roman hippodrome/stadium. The space is unusually beautiful, with three interesting fountains, a lot of picturesque buildings, and all sorts of artistic activity, ranging from the strange to the kitschy to the fascinating. There are a number of cafes around the edges of the square. We walked here from St. Peter's and then continued on to the Pantheon, the Trevi Fountain, and the Spanish Steps. Wish we would have lingered a bit longer here. A highlight of Rome!

Food, Fountains and Shopping. View the famous Fountain of the 4 River and and other fountains at each end of the Piazza. In the middle of the Piazza on the west side is the Tre Scalini Cafe Gelateria and Ristorante. Real cold beer and great ice cream. Bathrooms are located upstairs with an attendant, very clean.

Worth a Stop. You should see this piazza because it's so famous, and because it has an amazing fountain carved by Bernini in the 17th century. The fountain has recently been cleaned, and it fairly glows, especially at night. On the down side is that the piazza itself is filled with trashy stalls selling kitsch, and there are various kinds of street entertainment such as fire dancers. Oh well. I suppose you can have great art and kitsch side by side, although the latter tends to overwhelm the former.

Great place to walk around. But not to eat.... Amazing piazza with impressive building facades. A beautiful place to walk around and have a beer or coffee, but not to eat. Prices are exaggerated, food is regular and bad service. No wonder, as it's in the center if the touristic area of Rome.

Wonderful Place.. Must Visit..!!. Lots of Restaurants.. Many artists, paintings.. you can have a 'instant live painting' of yours at this place if you wish to. Good place to spend some time with your loved one.

Perfect Spot to Wander, Hang Out, Enjoy. Travelling with a young family, this location was so great we when back almost every night. Kids of any age can run free and wander with no worry about cars or too many tourist because the space is so large. Lots of restaurants (you can negotiate no service fee) right in the piazza.
Interesting piazza. This is a nice place to wander through. Number of artists selling their wares and street traders. Also, nice to sit and watch people go by.
Be sure to visit here. This is a beautiful piazza and well worth a visit. We especially enjoyed the fountain. We also learned that this piazza used to be the site of chariot races, ala Ben Hur.
Everyone out to make a buck. Beautiful square and spectacular fountains, but the throng of people out to make a buck are simply oppressive.

The square you have to visit. Like Plaka in Athens, like Covent Garden in London, Piazza Novara is a place you must visit to feel the tone of the city. Lots of cafes and restaurants around to choose what you like. All the major monuments are very close as well

A Very Picturesque Piazza. Navona Square in Rome is one of the most beautiful piazzas in the city. What however stands out is the spectacular Obelisk of Ramses which is so beautifully adorned with hierloglyphics and well preserved over the centuries!
Such a beautiful sight!

A beautiful square with the fountain of four rivers and monuments around. A must see place in Rome which is a large piazza or square with the great fountain in the middle called the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi or Fountain of four rivers (River Danube, Nile, Ganges & Platte).
