On one side is the church of St. Agnese and on the other side is a line of cafe's to sit around and have some food and beverages enjoying the beauty of the square.
Nice atmosphere. Had pizza at Restaurant overlooking the Piazza and it was a great experience! A must see must do place.

Very nice Piazza fore people watching and hustle and bustle. We stayed in a suite over looking the Piazza Navona, in the evenings it was busy and was quite interesting watching eveyone from our balcony. I recommend it for families and couples looking to explore the city centre of Rome.

Piazza Navona, Rome . Full with painters and mongers... It is built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian, built in 1st century AD, and follows the form of the open space of the stadium. The ancient Romans went there to watch the agones ("games"), and hence it was known as "Circus Agonalis" ("competition arena"). It is believed that over time the name changed to in avoneto navone and eventually to navona.  It features important sculptural and architectural creations: in the center stands the famousFontana dei Quattro Fiumi or Fountain of the Four Rivers (1651) by Gian Lorenzo Bernini, topped by the Obelisk of Domitian, brought in pieces from the Circus of Maxentius.

Fine Experience. Piazza Navona is a great public space in Rome, to spend few relaxed hours in a vast courtyard flanked by ornate buildings. In its centre is the famous Fountain of the Four Rivers (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi) by Bernini. There are quite a few restaurants sorrounding the courtyard and you will find artists to skech your portrait in few minutes for a fee. Great place to sit and relax.
Lively Piazza. Piazza Navona is a heady mix of history and modernity. There is enough to see from the past even as people make their create their own memories while visiting itIt is a lively place
Piazza Navona. We went in the evening. The fountains are lit up very well. It was lovely. Don't wear heels for this walk. The cobblestones have large spaces between them.
Very nice night visit. I visited it at night in a rainy day. you can take a very nice photos there. Night spot lights are extremely nice.
Beautiful place. There are lots of things to see and enjoy, estatues, temples. Also you can have a meal or just a drink relaxing next to the fountains. Take lots of pictures!
Beautiful. Lovely square with beautiful architecture. Lots of artists and music and plenty of cafes surrounding .
pretty area. pretty area, tho art a bit samey. the street sellers for selfie sticks and shawls are irritating as so many of them
A great place to people watch and stop for lunch or an afternoon coffee & cake!. This is one of many Piazza's in Rome, but with its artists and choice of restaurants to grab a view.

stunning. A simply stunning place to visit, great piazza, fantastic architecture, fountain is wonderful, lots of bars, restaurants in the area, to sit enjoy a cold drink, and meal, in stunning surroundings.

Hightlight of Rome. Buzzy and lively, pos the most famous Piazza in Rome. It won't disappoint. Have a look at the sites around and then stop for a moment or two and look at the artists sketching or just people watch. It's great.

A great place to relax and enjoy street art!. Really nice place, recommend going later afternoon to soak in the start of the evening. We saw lots of street art, including some fantastic spray painting art - one of which we purchased. Lots of really lovely cafes, but if you stroll up some of the side streets, you can find some lovely places. It is also close to the Pantheon.
A must!!. A beautiful piazza both during the day and at night. Definitely worth a visit. Short walk to Campo dei Fiori or to the Pantheon from here.
Take your time there at sunet to relax. Good place to visit after all day of tourism. You can relax there visiting the fountains, and enjoying a beer or a wine in one of the restaurants.

Restaurants and souvenirs. This is a beautiful square with many restaurants and lots and lots of souvenir sales people. If you live nearby come both day and night ... to enjoy both the beauty of this square in the day time and the romantic scenery at night

Beautiful piazza to just stop, rest and relax.. We have had gloriously sunny days so far during our week's visit during November. This piazza is beautiful with three separate fountains, several stone benches (there never seem to be enough of these in Rome) and a host of artists selling photos and paintings, as well as a few busking musicians and unusual turns, like a couple of Asian men who take turns dressing up as a fakir and creating the illusion of levitating above the ground holding not a staff. There are several Asians hawking selfie-sticks and they run away when they see the police walking around, so best get yours from the Campo de Fiori, not far away. We spent about 45 minutes just sitting here in the sun and watching the world go by with Sant'Agnese in Agone at our back (doesn't mean agony, 'agones' were athletic events held in Domitian's Stadium which once stood on this site). The bells went off at midday and were thrillingly loud and clear. Great place!

Nice architecture, heaps of tourists. On the positive side, lots of nice architecture. On the negative side, very much of a tourist trap. Crowded, heaps of tourists, street artists and salespeople. Lots of restaurants, but your'e much better of (both quality and price) leaving for a random backalley.

Must see. This place is a must see for those who want to see Rome. It is a town square that has lots of activity in the centre and great restaurants on the side walks.An obelisk in the centre with a fountain adds to the beauty. There are two smaller fountains one on each end.Go there and spend a quiet hour.
Romes convert garden. It all happens here street entertainment , Artist , paint spraying art lots & lots of cafés set in the most beautiful setting
Piazza Novona. Very beautiful, lots of artists there selling their paintings and a few church surrounding with a lot of art drawing in the church. Worth a visit.

Central point. A hub of activity and a good place to source meals and watch the world go by. Avoid restaurants on the piazza. They are over priced with mediocre food. On the streets leading off the piazza are cheaper restaurants with better food. Fountain is beautiful
Beautiful and buy Piazza. So many restaurants and lots of artists fill this sun drenched piazza. Some excellent people watching and a few lovely churches to pop inside too!

My favorite Piazza. I love to dine within a block or two from Piazza Navona & the end the evening with a walk followed by an expresso or Gelata. I remember Tre Scalini's 50 years ago. It was less of an attraction then but the Gelata is still the best. And where is another Piazza with three fountains. One of my favorite hang out spots

In the Rome's ancient heart. It's one of most beautiful places in Rome. Dominated by famed Bernini fountain (representing the four most important rivers in the world), the huge, long square is sourrounded by pleasant old houses and two amazing churches. Unfortunately the restaurants are too touristy there (they sell the view more than food) and the countless street artists, musicians, dancers and jugglers may be annoying.
Come here for dinner. Great vibe at night! There are plenty of restaurants to choose from and live music entertainment around every corner. You will definitely have violinists serenading you! :)

Nice but not special. This is a popular area for tourists, and the restaurants surrounding the area know this, but there's not a heck of a lot going on here. To be honest I found just wandering the streets randomly to be more rewarding as far as the views and amazing old structures was concerned.

Beautiful Piazza. Beautiful fountain and surrounding buildings makes this large piazza a joy to wander around or just sit with a cold gelato. The day we went there were artists displaying their amazing work which created a lovely atmosphere.

Classic Piazza to enjoy the fountains statues and cafes.. Another must-see in Rome. Plenty to see with a huge range of cafes to choose from where you can sit and take it all in. Enjoy an Aperol Spritz or a classic Tartufo dessert while you're at it.

Beautiful piazza. This was my favourite piazza in Rome. There is a good choice of restaurants in and around the square, close to the pantheon and on your way to the Vatican. Really beautiful fountains, I especially wants to visit as it was described in Angels and demons and I was disappointed.
Such a wonderful work of art!.. Could have stood and looked at this for hours. Amazing detail. Priceless world treasure. One of many.

Ahhhhh ..... Relax with wine, good food and good service. We enjoy Rome - Trevi, Spanish Steps, Sistine, St. Peter's, the Rose Gardens .... and the Piazza Navona. Piazza Navona offers several good to excellent restaurants, an open air market, excellent "people watching", 3 fountains that are beautifully detailed and it is an excellent "rest stop" while doing a walking tour of the sites. We never miss Piazza Navona on our trips to Rome.
Piazza Navona. Nice place to relax a little, look at fountains, people watch while enjoying a gelato or cappuccino. The fountains are interesting to look at.

Amazing fountain, annoying vendors. This fountain is amazing. There is something to discover from every angle as you walk around the fountain. My one complaint was the constant barrage of vendors trying to sell you knock off scarfs, handbags, and selfie sticks. And they wouldn't take no for an answer, awkwardly reducing the price while you continuously turn them down. Definitely worth the visit, but be prepared.
The fountain was beautiful!. It was amazing looking at the sculptures in the fountain. There were artists in the piazza drawing, painting, etc to provide tourists with a nice souvenir.
Piazza Navona. Near the start of the Segway Fun Rome tour. Amazing statues and quite a story behind the construction plus this is where a Ben Hur wold have competed in Chariot Races.

Life. The Piazza Navona has what you would expect from city life. Acrobats, dancers, musicians, artists, restaurants, bars, etc. And, yes, a fair amount of tourists. But they come here for a reason, so don't let them spoil your experience.
Lovely square. One of the only places not closed for refurb on our visit! Lovely to walk around & see all the artists' work

Discovered by chance but stunning. Discovered this area by mistake, beautiful, outer area full of lovely restuarants varying in cuisine offered and price, inside area packed with artists and paintings.
Stunning fountains and a lively atmosphere.. Piazza Navona is quintessential Rome. There are 3 amazing Bernini fountains, and the sounds of street musicians and people enjoying la dolce vita.

Superb atmosphere and artworks. A brilliant square full of artists and people enjoying the sunshine, with lots to see and photograph including a church with fantastic gilded interior. We'll be visiting again when we next go.
The nicest fountain in Rome. Our guide talked about this architectural miracle for one hour. Indeed at the end you understand the genius of Bernini. Also the piazza Navona looks very nice.

A must see in Rome. Piazza Navona is so lovely and busy. Just walk around and see the pictures and restaurants. We ate in one of them and it was very good. The Rome museum is also right there, worth a trip for I enjoyed the WWII exhibit from the American point of view. It's a popular place and it is so lovely and you can walk from there to other sites.
Beautiful Piazza.. Piazza Navona was one of my favorites. We visited it at night and during the day. At night it is mystical. This is a beautiful piazza to sit and enjoy people watching.

Central location. There is always something happening in Piazza Navona from local artists to Christmas markets. The perimeter has a few good restaurants and the surrounding streets are full of cafes and restaurants and have a very Italian / Roman feel.
Nice walk and nice church. A big piazza with many shops and restaurants.please do not forget to visit the fantastic church in the square and to walk until the campo de fiori!

Beautiful, but crowded. The piazza and its fountains are spectacular, but it's very, very crowded! I recommend going to the site early in the morning to avoid the crowds and get great photos of the fountain!

Lively day or night. Roman human statues are incapable of remaining still. They reach out to you, wave, smile, they just don't get the art of human statues. You will see them all here, along with artists, and the ubiquitous street vendors of junk. The fun is in watching all the people on a beautifully sunny day or warm evening. Music, pomp, people watching, great plaza for all of the above. For food, I recommend going a bit west of the Piazza to less touristy restaurants with much better food. The shops around the outskirts of the plaza are great. Enjoy!
Stunning. Finest example of all the Piazza's in Rome. Definitely worth a look while in Rome and close to other attractions like the Pantheon.
Great people watching area. A great piazza to visit with buskers, singers, restaurants and painters. The square is huge and the fountains are amazing.

Superb square, be aware of the props for the restaurants. The square itself, is defintely one of the most beautifull in Rome. The three fountains are amazing, as is the Church of St Agnes. BUT BE AWARE OF THE AGRESSIVE WAITERS OF THE RESTAURANTS AROUND IT! Cheap wine per glass is sold for 8 euro. They try to Shell you a bottle. My advies is enjoyed the square but don't drink or dat Anthony ther
A must!. Great piazza despite touristy approach. Great small streets around with lots of antique shops. Walk from here out to the Tiber river and Castello de St Angelo

Watch the world go by...... Amazing wandering the back streets of Rome and the you suddenly happen upon this wonderful Piazza, stunning baroque fountains, featuring cupids, Dolphins, all sorts. The more you look the more you sea. Lots of bars and restaurants round the edge of the square but we like to just buy a gelato (ice cream) and sit on the edge of the fountains watching the world go by.

Stunning. Definitely a must see on a Rome trip, whether you're there for a few days or more. Worth a stop on any walking tour of the area. We were there in the early evening, so I'm not sure this happens all day long, but there were plenty of interesting performers and artists selling their various paintings. Plenty of cafes and restaurants around, so sit... eat... drink and people
Must visit!!!. Beautiful square with 3 beautiful fountains full of people at all hours. Lots of happenings, many cafes and restaurants. Definitely worth visiting more than once!!

A must-see when in Rome. Of course it is as touristic as it gets in Rome, but the collection of artists and street vendors mixed with the historical buildings and great architecture just does something to you.
A word of advice - if do not HAVE to eat or drink at the Navona, go elsewhere. It is overly, overly priced due to the location.
Rome must see. Stroll around the Piazza, take pictures, look at the paintings and other items for sale. Wonderful relaxing sight.

Romantic and artistic. Yes, go and admire the beautiful fountains. If you read the Dan Brown books back in the day, refresh your memory before going. Live statues, painters, balloon vendors, and many bars make it a nice stop for all ages. Enjoy
Gorgeous place to spend your time. This square is a fantastic place to visit. Lots of cafés to suit in and escape the sun. Can be a little pricey for drinks.
Buzzing Piazza. The art work on display was wonderful, so many different artist to meander through taking in their wonderful talents. Lovely place to sit, drink and watch the world go by.

Built in 1st century AD... Amazing!!. Piazza Navona (pronounced [ˈpjattsa naˈvoːna]) is a piazza in Rome, Italy. It is built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian, built in 1st century AD, and follows the form of the open space of the stadium. The ancient Romans went there to watch the agones ("games"), and hence it was known as "Circus Agonalis" ("competition arena"). It is believed that over time the name changed to in avone to navone and eventually to navona. [ Wikipedia ]
Overrated. Touristy restaurants, mediocre "artists", waaaay too crowded. The side streets are better bets for food.
Piazza not to be missed when in Rome. Relaxing,captivating and delightful. A must to enjoy when in Rome.Right in the very heart of Rome.Enjoy a meal at the surrounding restaurants

A great place to sit and watch the world pass by. A great place to visit day or night, many street artists and local artists displaying their paintings, or willing to draw your portrait. The piazza is surrounded by eateries and coffee shops, a great atmosphere is to be had. Plenty of photo opportunities besides the fountains, one of the top 10 places to visit whilst in Rome

My favorite Piazza. Piazza Navona is my favorite locations in Rome for evening entertainment. There is so much to choose from..have an artist draw a sketch of you, Sit a spell on the edge of one of the fountains and people watch, or browse the art pieces that are for sale. Most nights there is a variety of entertainment from accordion players to mimes. Whether you have a leisurely dinner at one of the many restaurants or have a cup of gelato, you won't regret your visit.

My favorite place in Rome. This place is my absolute favorite spot in Rome. At night you can people watch. There are artists that are painting right there in front of you, you might see someone twirling fire batons, or musicians playing. The fountains are breathtaking and the atmosphere make it amazing
Nice place to walk. A great place to take a walk.no cars,lots of food options. Romantic and quite.try the ice cream place on the corner.
Great for people watching. Large square with portrait artists and picture sellers. Had a lovely meal at Tre Scalini. Worth a visit, they serve great coffee and the best Tiramisu I eat in Rome.

Nice place to visit.. We visited the piazza during the daytime. There are pretty fountains. But even more, there are multiple street performers to see. There are also many vendors but we did not make any purchases. I would recommend a visit if you have the time during your trip to Rome.

Lovely setting, lots of street sellers. Went to this beautiful Piazza recently. Everywhere you turn is another lovely photograph to be taken.There are lots of people selling various things; painting, jewelry, photographs and those dreadful selfie sticks but they weren't aggressive and left once told no.Lovely cafes and tavernas to have a coffee or a glass of wine and a snack and enjoy the view

Interesting, pretty and fun. What a gem of a piazza. The fountain is beautiful, there always seems to be musicians playing on the piazza, the vibe is fun and interesting. It really is quite beautiful and not to be missed during a trip to Rome.
Amazing sculptures. Good thing about this place is all walkable.There are beautiful places to cover. Worth a visit. As usual it was crowded.
Lovely promenade with restaurants. Lined with places to eat and drink, the Piazza Navona has 3 fountains each with is own piece of history. Lovely walk on a nice day!
A place to relax. Piazza Navona is a place to relax and watch the world go by or buy pictures or just eat and drink the fountain is the centre piece, In old Roman times it was a sporting arena

Great Piaza Navona !!. Very beautiful and busy Piazza day and night! Expensive restaurants and caffes but the view is really worth. The fountains are unique in the world, i beleive...Very romantic atmosphere in the evening!

Fountain of four rivers-Worth seeing. This square is surrounded by tourists and tourist attractions is a pleasant place to stroll. The highlight is fountain of four rivers by Bernini. It is a must see attraction on the itinerary of any body visiting Rome.

Ideal for having a beer and doing some people watching!. We took a break here from our walk between the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. Lots of street artists remind me of Covent Garden. The bars and cafes around the square are all much of a muchness.

City break. The first time we walked throughPiazza Navona we had happened across the Piazza by chance. It is a beautiful Piazza surrounded by lovely architecture. The square is filled with fountains surrounded by restaurants. There are street artists and musicians that all add to the ambience. We returned later in our visit to Rome to have a meal and even in the rain the place still felt special.

Beatiful fountain and nice art market!. You should read up on the history of the plaza before (or during) your visit; the shape of the plaza closely follows an ancient complex. The fountain (like many others) is nice to see; it depicts the four continents that were known at the time of construction (see if you can discover which part relates to which continent).If you're into art, there's a nice art market there (at least when we visited in November 2015).

A beautiful piazza and fountain. . This area gets very busy at weekends therefore try and come on a weekday. The fountain of four rivers is beautiful. The restaurant are ok but you won't find the best here and prices are high . There is lots of street entertainment and artists, also the selfie stick and wrap sellers are in your face . A must visit though , if you walk from the Pantheon to the Vatican it is on the way .

Part of the Angels and Demons trail!. Fountain was smaller than had been anticipated but nevertheless worth a quick visit. Gentle stroll around the piazza and watching some of the artists at work. Plenty of restaurants nearby if you are in the mood for refreshments or a meal.

a must see. one of the most spectacular piazzas in Rome with 3 fountains by Bernini and his rival,an interesting story and spectacular place to sit and relax a bit ,but quite busy as anything else in Rome
Lovely place to eat. Very pretty square. Worth a visit. Nice place to eat although pricier that other places. Had 4 ice creams seated 34 euros.

Fantastic Atmosphere. Went twice once at night with fantastic music and also sorts of activities. Then went again during the day and they had the markets. It was the most "alive" Piazza that we visited whilst in Rome. Lots of artists day and night.

One of the most fantastic squares!. All the sculptures could be in a museum but, they've decided to keep in the original place, just making it the most classic and romantic square. It is impossible no to be amazed.

Really pleasant area to see and eat at. Our Hotel Raphael was close to this site and we spent a lot of time around this Piazza. It is really centrally located to so many sites, the Vatican, restaurants, shops. A great place to be around when staying in Rome.
Love It!. We had dinner there two nights in a row and enjoyed all the musicians and performers. Great people watching!
Nice views. Close to the Pantheon and in a city with many fountains, this one is worth a visit. Not nearly as famous or elaborate as the Trevi fountain but unique on its own.

Piazza Navonna. one of three amazing fountain sculptures on this storied piazza.
A must first stop on any trip to Rome.Captures the ambiance of this stunning city and will motivate you to walk the city ad infinitum
Really good use of a few hours. Numerous restaurants and a charming little street market affair. An interesting story too combined with many other attractions being very close by.

Expensive Coffee served here. Stay close to the Pizza Novona, the maze of small streets close are lively and full of atmosphere. In the Pizza there are many artists and performers, be prepared for the street seller with the toys scarves and other trinkets. We stopped for coffee one evening and we were charged €11 not impressed I checked and they donor display the price of coffee "can't remember the cafe name". Otherwise it's a lovely place to chill out and to people watch
The most betiufull piazza in Rome. We fell in love in this piazza - we came during day time and again in the evening. It's different each time. Don't miss it

Sculptures and Restaurants. Baroque masterpiece in the center of the piazza was one of the highlights of our trip. Take the time to walk around the fountain and admire the elegance of the sculptures. Open air cafes fill the piazza with mouth watering smells, people speaking many different languages, hawkers (scarves were big this month) and music. It's a great spot day or night for free entertainment.

Incredible artists!. I bought art work here in 2007, loved it, and came back 8 years later to Rome just to buy more. Unbelievably low prices, very high quality, and if you want the artist to add or change something on the painting you want to purchase, he'll do it right there!
Our favourite piazza in Rome!. Love walking around this part of Rome and exploring the narrow lane ways filled with shops, cafes and interesting buildings.
Worth the visit. Visited first on wet day and then again on a sunny day. Lots of activity within the square with artists everywhere. Lots of eating places and great "buzz" around the area

Briefly pass by . I didn't spend long at the Piazza Navona. I merely walked through, without even stopping to sit down. Unfortunately there are just too many junk sellers in your face. No, I do not want a selfie stick when I'm carrying an expensive DSLR around my neck. The fountains and monuments are incredible though. If you go in the morning with less people interfering with the perfect camera shot, you'll appreciate it.

Nice big open space with 3 fountain and street entertainers. Big open square/piazza area with street performers and 3 fountains. Beautiful building you can enter near middle which is free- no photos once inside (religious church). Near to pantheon.

Nice air sellers in this square. We came here as was trying to see all the sights on our map. There are a few art sellers here and cafes where you can sit and watch the world go by, we just passed through on our way to see other sites
Beautiful! a must!. Can't say much more but go see this beautiful place!I love it! It is terribly crowded around lunchtime, Mornings are great! not everyone has woken up!

Rome's favorite piazza.. Great place to relax, eat, people watch, or buy some art. Had our 17 year old son's portrait drawn by the gentleman with the white curly hair--great job! 30 euros and 20 minutes later--it made for a great FB post and video. Other people came to watch and it was fun to listen to their chatter. (He is a blue-eyed blonde, typical American boy. They thought he was German-ha!) Wonderful souvenir for my son.
One of the best plazas in Rome. Close to the Pantheon. Always a lot going on here great shops and artwork. Very enjoyable place to,spend the afternoon.
Bustling Location. The fountain is amazing, but this is also a great place to people-watch from one of the little cafes with a coffee or a glass of wine. Lots of street vendors.

A must visit square. Always seems to be crowded but equally always enjoyable. Gazing at the beautiful fountains and buildings more than compensate fore the crowds. Watching the artists and cartoonist ply their trade adds to an enjoyable "people watching" Roman experience.

Must seeing!. Very popular piazza. The central monument of the four rivers, the artists around, the restaurants, the people, everything consist for a very busy and popular piazza that worth to visit and have a nice time.
Fun!. The fountain is beautiful! The square is fun! Lots of vendors are set up and I enjoyed our time walking through the square and looking at the things they are selling while drinking some wine.
Lovely. Jostled and pushed around....lovely place gets very busy late in the evening with mimes and all sorts

Funky spot - you need to find it!. We spent two afternoons here - after finally finding it! Its a happening spot, lots of restaurants and cafes, artists displaying their goods, musicians playing music, and even a guy levitating! It was definitely one of my favourite parts of visiting Rome! Sit on the edge, sip a glass of wine, and take it all in!
Chaotic. Piazza Navona is a beautiful place, but it can be very chaotic at times. Unfortunately, the crowds and tacky booths detract from its atmosphere.

You could even see the fountain properly …. … if there weren’t so many tourists. Where we are turning in circles. This place is a sheer beauty. Which thus attracts many tourists. Which in turn prevents visitors from enjoying it in full (I know, as a tourist I am contributing to this circumstance). So things are as they are, and Piazza Navona is worth a visit anyhow. But try to go there either off season, or in the mornings when this area is less crowded. And enjoy the beauty, the calmness and particularly the Bernini fountain in the very middle which is certainly one of the artist’s most important artefacts. PS: Avoid the bars and restaurants on the Piazza, they are tourist traps.
most famous piazza. After our Vatican visit, we directed to piazza navona.The space is wide, surrounded by lovely ancient blgs.It is a pedestrian piazza.Wonderful!
Piazza Navona. Best and most lovely piazza in Rome. Perfect to end the day and dine watching the fountain.Very lively and entertaining.
No good. They are currently restoring this beautiful fountain so was closed off with boards, could only see through tiny gaps. Bet it will look lovely when finished!

Remarkable place. The fountains on this piazza are some of the best in Rome the piazza was originally used for chariot racing.Now it is home to many artists showing off paintings and sketches these are also for sale most are beautiful and original but watch out for prints

Cool place to hang out. My wife and I were only in Rome for a day and a half but managed to get to Piazza Navona three separate times. If we had a week in Rome I would devote several hours to the square. It is a happening place for people-watching, relaxing with a coffee or gelato, and soaking up the two amazing fountains. The middle of the square is filled with vendors and street artists but they are not pushy. We did a quick breath-taking tour of Sant'Agnese in Agone (St Agnes church). There is a museum at the south end and I think you can take an underground tour starting at the north end. Otherwise, I suggest taking a load off and just enjoy the atmosphere.

Beautiful square. Really beautiful square with the fountains.We went during the day and evening and it was really lively. Much better than some of the other places I have been around the world.Visited a couple of good restaurants and bars. The surrounding streets are worth visiting.In the evening they had 3 d show which was great.

Best Piazza that really shows the Italian atmosphere. It a wonderful square for having a Lunch or just a coffee, while watching people drawing, listening to Italian music and singers, crowd with people from all over the world.Price are little bit high, but deserve.If the weather is sunny, It is enjoyable to have a rest in this Piazza, specially on your right hand side, where the sun shines till around 5:00 p.m.
Amazing. So much history and the way it as stood for many many years is astonishing. Significance of North South East West water flow intriguing

An oasis of silence. It is wonderful by night. Less crowded from tourists and people trying to sell you almost everything. It is an ideal place for photos. When me and my wife are in Rome, we use to go often in this "piazza". We enjoy have a drink, an ice-cream or just relaxing sitting in the border of the fountains. If you want to have lunch or dinner the place is plenty of restaurants, a little expensive and tourists oriented but the food is not bad.

Beautiful sight especially at night. We visited Rome recently and were here on a summer evening. It was such a beautiful place full of tourists and nice restaurants. The overall atmosphere was very appealing and upbeat. My family really enjoyed here. Occasionally you will see some street performers and street vendors which add to the overall experience. Worth a visit if you are in Rome.

Stop and watch the world go by. Great place to enjoy an ice cream, sit and watch the artists and take some time out. The fountains are beautiful, the space is large, there are plenty of places to eat.
A wonderful square. I strolled through here late afternoon on a warm summer evening and it was really perfect, it is a beautiful square with some wonderful fountains and so worth a visit.
Fun place to visit. Lots of street performers and artists, just a fun place to stroll through. Great for people watching. Worth a visit if you are nearby.
Beautiful. Very nice place specially at the evening. Lots of painters were selling their artworks over here and we also found something for ourselves. Nice restaurants and good wine.
Vibrant. A beautiful and vibrant piazza full of street entertainers and artists, with lovely fountains, restaurants and shops. A great place to while away a few hours and watch the world go by.

Always a Treat. Love going here and seeing the interesting characters who hang out in the square. Lots of tourists but locals too. The nearby high end shopping streets are worth walking through. Great place to just hang out and spend part of your day.

A grreat place in the evenings. Lots of atmosphere - a great place to people watch or go for a walk.
Impressive buildings and fountain (if you like baroque art).
Lots of nice restaurants and bars around the square.

3 Incredible Fountains. Take a guidebook and read rhe description of each of the three fountains. Then sit and and drink or just sit and people watch. It has to be one of the great people spots in the world.
Lively Square. A wonderful spot to get lost for a while - central to many tourist attractions. Great for shops & dining.

Bustling square with famous fountains. The large oval square is surrounded by restaurants and cafes. Artist practice their craft by painting scenes from Rome and caricatures of tourists. Most impressive, however, are the fountains, and especially the fountain of the four rivers by Bernini. You can also see the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone at one side of the square. The square is busy, picturesque and quite the spot for observing people. Sit down on one of the benches with a gelato or a cappuccino and enjoy being in Rome!

Go and be amazed. Do look at the original entrance to Piazza Navona and you can see how it used to look. It must have been so impressive then with all the seating and events, and now it is a beautiful Piazza full of artists and cafe's and stunning fountains. Glorious.
nice. Italians will kill me, but for me it's not main attraction, just if you walking around visit it, every attraction in Italy is unique

Lovely!. We visited the place in the late morning. Anyone who loves fountains will benefit greatly !!! I loved the environment, the fountains and the tourists who fill the place. The restaurants full of tourists all around. People say the place is much more impressive int the evening. Promising to visit in the evening next time. We visited in May 2014
Art, people, food...ITALIA! !!. This piazza captures all of the spirit of Rome. I like to sit and watch people, listen to the fountains. ..and enjoy!

A romantic place for a stroll.. its a romantic place to stroll through day or night, there's always life and vibrancy. There's the inevitable hawkers offering their wares, but seeing the impressive middle fountain is worth it. The resturants are resonable for food but VERY expensive for drinks, although you'll get better quality food for the same price on the streets nearby. Don't miss the amazing church San Luigi Dei Franscei with its Carravagio paintings and Santa Maria Minerva which are just minutes walk away, and free. Add those to Piazza Navona and that's a brill 90 mins and all free.

The most beautiful square in Rome. Major tourist attraction, but for a reason. The Bernini fountains are gorgeous and it's just fun to walk all around the square, especially at night. Splurge on over-priced gelato at Tre Scalini and enjoy the charming waiters and watch the people!

Quintessential Roman piazza. This is a pretty fountain and piazza to visit, but you'll be hard pressed to relax and enjoy the scenery. Lots of tourists so we were doubtful about trying any of the cafes lining the piazza. Frustrating that we were constantly bombarded by street vendors asking us/pushing us to buy selfie sticks.
Surprised . Such a nice place Be sure to visit in the morning so you'll get the piazza in full sunshine! The fountain is really impressive

Buzzing atmosphere!. Visited in the evening to enjoy a meal, have a wander around looking at The Four Rivers Fountains and to admire the architecture of the beautiful buildings. The square was absolutely buzzing on the Sunday evening and we had a fabulous meal overlooking the fountains and just absorbing the atmosphere. Delightful music played by the street artists added to the ambience!Tip:-Beware the cobbled streets ladies and don't wear stiletto heels as we did - managed to get one of mine stuck and had to have assistance to get it out - caused much hilarity amongst the crowds!
Pleasant square. Busy bustling square with lots if buskers, artists and street sellers (all selling same). Very expensive, even for Rome, restaurants on pavements.
A visit to Piazza Navonna. This was a nice stop on our tour of Rome and I think I would enjoy saying longer next time. The Fountains were being cleaned and restored, but still quite beautiful.

The Best for people watching!. Besides its beautiful sculpture by Bernini, the Piazza is a delightful gathering place for large numbers of people all day long. It is surrounded by excellent restaurants and filled with all sorts of street art displays.
Great meeting place . Lots of people, performers, artists and a food. Fun place to people watch. Ate dinner on patio of tre scalini.

Unexpected wonders of ancient history. Please visit the three fountains.....I insist....do it it is a must being in Rome!! You will find real art in paintings by local artists that we are sure, you will buy at reasonable prices
Lively with lots to see. The Piazza Navona had an enjoyable atmosphere with street performers, and people producing and selling art. The fountains and surrounding architecture are gorgeous!
fenomenal!. wooooow ! roma is my new favouirte place in the world! Piazza Navona is on top 3 place in Italy! amazing !
Lovely place. We visited here on a very wet day but that did not take anything away from its beauty. Really enjoyed sloshing around in the rain in this beautiful place.

Beautiful Piazza. Always lots of activity here. Music, artists, people wandering around this pedestrian only area. Lots of restaurants surrounding both sides of the piazza. A must see for first time visitors.
Favorite Piazza. Visit it early or visit late, either way it is magic. People watch, fountain watch. Have an espresso or a glass of wine and enjoy.
Fantastic water feature. As you travel around Rome you see some fantastic sights, this is one of them. This and the horses were our favourites.

Great Location for an Area, Not a great Attraction. We stayed within a couple of blocks of Piazza Navona. We were through the Piazza at all times of the day and evening. It's a nice place to catch the sun, look at artists displaying their wares and get a caricature of you and your partner made.The surrounding buildings do not seem particularly spectacular and the fountain is attractive but not awe inspiring. The best thing we saw was a toy store on the north side of the plaza near the street outlet.However, if you are looking for a place to eat, there are plenty. If you like a place to stay that is central to the various attractions in Rome, the Piazza Navona area is a great choice as it is very central and has a cab area where it is easy to catch a cab.Fine for what it is, great for a central location, but not really an attraction in its own right.
historical highlights. did a hop on hop off tour around Rome & you get to see most of the must see places & points of interest & they are quite surreal well worth seeing
Magical and Beauty. We stayed around the corner from this famous piazza, very picturesque, fountains were beautiful. We visited during the day and night, nice place tip meander.
visit. lots of little shops and artists selling items in the piazza, two fountains to look at and some restaurants around the outside

Fab, free, fun and artistic (couldn't keep the alliteration). Street artists, music, mimes and a plethora of tourists makes this a buzzing place to visit en route to the Pantheon.
Beautiful sculptures and street artists combine to overload your senses. It's amazing.
Make it part of your route through Rome.

Great find. We found this Piazza by accident. What a great find. Its spacious and pedestrianised - which is a bonus for pedestrians!!! It has two large fountains one at each end and each side of the piazza has a selection of restuarants offering great italian food. Well worth a visti

A bustling piazza, gorgeous fountains and street art. Rome, the land of plazas and fountains! We visited the Piazza Navona in the mid-morning (9:30am) to avoid massive crowds and to check out the Fountain of the Four Rivers, which is quite gorgeous. This is a free attraction and worth a stroll on a nice day. Morning light made for great photos and the plaza was just starting to bustle. There are several artists displaying their oil paintings and water colors, and street performers trying to tempt you out of a few dollars. We popped into Sant'Agnese in Agone Church just in time to catch some of Sunday mass (which was stunning under the ornate interior of the church). There are plenty of restaurants around this area for you to have a coffee or (my favorite) a spritz after checking out the fountains. As with anything in Italy, wear comfortable shoes and bring layers.
Lovely Piazza. Piazza Navona is a lovely, bustling square - beautiful buildings and restaurants and a great place to people watch while in Rome.

Alluring Piazza. When you're done running around in Rome. This is the place to be to find tranquility. Yes tranquility can be found in Rome despite of the invasion of tourists from around the world. This piazza contains fountains, art, architecture, cafés, and shops. Simply find a spot to stay still and absorb all of it's eye pleasure. Unfortunately there are a few street hagglers. Just ignore them and they eventually go away. Otherwise, a great place to take a break from our busy schedule we had in Rome.

Wonderful piazza. this is a really beautiful square. And from the square there are lots of side streets to explore. Try to get into the square early morning or go to the nearby campo Di Fiori for a daily market

Great for people watching along with the beauty. There are all sorts of vendors and artists set up in the piazza, along with gorgeous fountains and architecture. It was a perfect place for an evening stroll. There are various restaurants lining the piazza, but they did not have very good reviews and they seemed very over-priced, so we did not eat there. But I would imagine that the people-watching might make up for it.

Romantic Artists. In this place you can find all the artists that can paint your portrait with your other half . A big piazza full of restaurants but the secrets are behind the small roads which are full of cozy wine bars or romantic restaurants
Must visit. Fills with artists during the day. Get a caricature done only ten euros. Great shops around the square and plenty of eateries....

Not what was expected. Visited on a Thursday morning, full of 'artists' selling their pictures although a lot of them were actually selling prints that are readily available on the internet. There are some genuine artists but be careful. was expecting lots of shops and stalls but mostly overpriced restaurants.
Lovely Piazza to visit at night. Lots of stalls with artists. Lovely waterfalls and statures. Lots of men selling selfie sticks! Lovely place to wander around at night taking in the atmosphere.

Nice square to chill out. The Piazza was bustling with crowds in the afternoon - guided tours and make-shift stalls selling art pieces etc. The Fountain of Four Rivers was an impressive piece of art. It was an experience to find a spot to chill out and just people watch, especially over coffee (and maybe some food on the go).

Romes most beautiful square. Piazza Navona is walking distance from the Pantheon. It is one of Rome's most liveliest squares, with many outdoor cafes, restaurants and night clubs in the neighborhood. To save time, when inRome plan to cover the Colosseum, Pantheon and Piazza Navona on the same day. Goes without saying watch out for the hawkers. They are overpriced.

Wandering around Rome. Great place to take a break from sightseeing.Cool restaurants and lots and lots of flowers. The whole square gives you the feeling that you are travelling in time to the medieval period, with gravel roads and high balcony buildings and lots of flowers everywhere.
unexpected delight. we got a little lost and ended up at this Piazza. I think we have been before but it is always worth seeing. A pleasure of Rome is finding sites you were not expecting.
Eating, Shopping, You'll Find It All. If you are looking for hotels, restaurants, tourist attractions, shopping or people watching, Piazza Navona is a great locatioan to find all of these.

Cool vibe with lots of great photo ops. Liked the fountains in this piazza, but also the vibe - street artists all hustling for a Euro, merchants selling "paintings," artists doing caricatures - a cool place to be with a coffee or a gelato and to walk around and observe.
The most charming place. Very charming, romantic and fascinating place. You can admire both marvelous architecture and wonderful pictures of sidewalk artists presented right in the square.

Romance place. You must visit piazza navona if you come to rome. Its romantic place with a lot of coffee shops and looks amazing.
The resturants there are very recomended, othentic and tasty.

Delightful piazza filled with local artists.. We love Piazza Navona. It's so fun of activity and artists. The fountains are amazing. There are lots of restaurants on streets all around the piazza. There are also some wonderful church's off the piazza.
People-watching heaven. This square (or oval rather) is a great place for people watching. Artists everywhere. The fountains are beautiful. You need to see this place!

Seems like endless restaurants and shopping.. Large square near Trevi fountain and the Pantheon that is filled with street vendors. It is ringed by restaurants with outdoor dining and specialty stores. Beyond the square are more restaurants and bars. Very lively scene. We enjoyed our time there.

Lovely atmosphere in the evening. This was an excellent place to people watch. It was quite busy all day and was full of people just wandering and admiring the amazing fountains. We enjoyed people watching whilst eating hot chestnuts here. There were people trying to sell all sorts of tourist tat, but this didn't detract from the relaxed ambience of the square.
Magical. Come in the early morning before the masses. The architecture is gorgeous. Spend time looking at the details. There is so much to see. One of the world's most beautiful piazzas

Breathtaking!. Be sure to set aside some time to simply sit and enjoy this beautiful, historic piece of art! We actually visited in the summer (but Trip Advisor wouldn't allow me to note that date) and it was hot and extremely crowded with visitors and tourists. But that did not detract one bit from the magnificence of place! There are places close by to grab an italian ice or cool drink and I would suggest doing so and just finding a place to sit and drink in the surroundings!

pretty but overrun. Beautiful spot IF you get there before 9am. After that, it fills with tour groups and the vendors that take up half the piazza begin setting up and remain until the evening. I arrived at dawn to take some photos and was glad I did so as by 9:30 it was already getting hectic. I had passed through earlier in my trip in the late afternoon and it was a madhouse. Not to my taste, but the fountain is gorgeous so worth a brief detour at least.
Beautiful. Lovely place to visit, building amazing as is the fountains, lots of things to see and buy, nice pictures and artists, touts annoying tho!
My dream vacation. Unfortunatley this fountain was under renovation, but piazza was just as beautiful. Once again, walked there from our apt.

Beautiful but felt touristy. The fountain here is incredible, and the piazza is well proportioned. However, lots of people seeking things to tourists, a more attractive time square - caricature portraits, etc. the restaurants were all catering to tourists as well, hard to tell if one was more worthy than any of the others. In a good area for wandering around, I'd recommending seeing the Piazza, maybe sitting down for an apertivo, but then dining elsewhere.

Atmospheric !!. Amazing square built on a roman race course stadium built by Domitian. Three fountains are amazing and the art stalls at the north end worth a look. Expensive restaurants but cheaper ones just off the square to the top or north across the road. Happening place..
Lovely piazza. Lovely piazza with beautiful status and buildings, loads of bar and restaurants, also street markets and painters in the centre.

Bernini did okay... . I adore the fountain in the centre of the square. The shielded head of the figure representing the Nile is such a clever detail, signifying its unknown source.
Be aware that the restaurants on the square are over priced. Walk down a side street and prices drop noticeably.

Artistic mesmerization. Your tour of Rome would be incomplete without a visit to this Piazza. Though Piazzas abound in Rome , this is one of the musts.
Quoting the Da Vinci code "Adorned in masters' loving art, She lies.
She rests at last beneath the starry skies" - This is where art and music play romance with your senses.
Very nice "piazza". Lovely place to be with three fountains and a lot of coffee bars and restaurants. Better for a visit at night

People Watching Heaven. Any of the cafes will do. Lounge over a bottle of wine. Strolling minstrels, street performers, touts, kitschy art, Roman matrons in their furs, proud trotting dogs, tourists galore, funky punks, arguments, pouts, laughter, cacophony, endlessly changing sky, shadows playing on the muted plaster, fountains, restored church facade. A little high, very content.

Lively Venue. A large and bustling square with impressive monuments. Recommend to research the attraction beforehand to make the most of your visit as there is so much to find out about the stories behind the statues and buildings.

A beautiful piazza of great significance. This is another must see in Rome. The square with its beautiful fountains is a hive of activity with cafes, restaurants and bars. Worth visiting by day or by night
Busy bustling piazza. Worth finding. Lots going on in quite a large area. There were artists doing quick sketches and other pictures for sale.
Meeting place of tourists.. Noisy, crowded and provided an assortment of restaurants, all of which had very similar menus. Worth looking at.

Serene!. Piazza Navona is beautiful. Very serene relaxing place to be. There are many resturants & local craftsman making things before you. when we were there, there were 3 women playing the violins & cello. They were amazing. There is a little stand nearby that sells the very best gellato i've ever had!

Take the Time to Stroll around and Watch the Street Entertainers. This is a place for people watching. It is very touristic and prices at restaurants on the piazza are high. However you can still enjoy this attraction by walking around and appreciating the fountains and building architecture. It is also a fun place in the evening with street entertainers and market stalls.
Lively with all sorts of entertainment.. Massive attractive piazza with street entertainers and three massive fountains. Stay for a while, eat,drink and be happy.

FunFirst Day. With the help of Google maps, we made a walking tour starting at Piazza Navona and ending at the Spanish Steps, about a 2 mile walk all together. Public transportation does not really get close, so you must hoof-it. Take your time, enjoy the views. There are gladiators, mimes, the Fountain of Four Rivers, a churCh, and a lovely couple dancing the tango like we all wish we could.

lovely place to walk and look at paintings, beware the ever present selfie stick sellers!. this is a lovely piazza, large and very un-crowded first thing on a morning, but it soon fills up rapidly, we spent a bit of time wandering through on different days, and there are some nice painters and artists gathered at the north end, we ended up getting a couple of small watercolours to take home, cafes and restaurants line one side and these are always bustling. There are the ever present selfie stick/scarf/laser pen sellers or the rose pushers, but we found these took a polite "No thank you" with good grace and left us alone. a nice place to spend an afternoon or to get some lunch.

Very romantic at night. I visited with my partner at night and it was a very romantic setting. The fountains were amazing. There are lots of artists selling their wares and lots of lovely authentic Italian restaurants just off the side streets. I went back to see the fountains the next day and they were every bit as impressive. Worth a visit on your Rome tour!!

La Dolce Vita in Rome. The Piazza Navona is lined with cafes and filled with street entertainers and 'artists' galore. It's a great place to sit ring-side and have lunch or coffee and watch the world go by.There was an excellent woman accordion player who entertained us while we at pizza at the piazza!

Amazing Architectual History. The Piazza Navona was near our B&B Navona Queen, so we walked there several times over the five days we were in Rome. The Piazza is quite large and features three notable fountains. Artists selling their works and entertainment artists are in the Piazza, as are restaurants and gelato cafes. It can be a restful place also to people watch as there are cement benches or ledges around the fountain to sit. The location is central and is easy to get to by city bus. It really is a must-see because it is so well-known for its statuary. So, for this reason, it is crowded with tourists. But there are many side streets in the Piazza Navona area in which to eat or shop.Arlene S. (West Palm Beach area of South Florida, USA)

New in Novona. Well, nothing is new here but the crowds change everyday and artists hawk their wears all over the square. The Four Rivers Statue is quite unique and worth pondering from many angles.There are multiple place to grab a bite and enjoy the sun filled square while you shame off the selfie-stick sellers.
Most beautiful ' piazza ' in Roma ....... but. too many ( would be ) artists , food cooking , street selling , city visitors offers etc etc Too much is just too much !
Spent a couple of hours. We went to a bar/restaurant. Drinks overpriced but the atmosphere is wonderful! We enjoyed the Italian singers and the overall experience.

Beautiful! Must Visit!. Pretty much the most romantic and European site in Rome that we visited! The culture, atmosphere, and ambience is what one would expect to find in a European touristy city such as Rome. The Piazza is peppered with a myriad of cafes and restaurants, and there are at least 2 beautiful fountains as well. In short, a must visit!

Piazza Navona. A lovely square to watch the world go round. Full of bars and restaurants. Had something to eat here on our first night and was a little disappointed. Food wasn't bad, but it's not as good as others, that we tried afterwards. Saying that we had drinks on our last night, which were good, but a bit on the pricey side. 28€'s for 2 drinks! Full of street entertainers in the evening.

Busy. Early in the morning this site was quiet and great for taking photos of the Bernini sculptures. it gets quite busy later on in the day. There are a lot of restaurants to eat at here. We opted to walk off into one of the smaller streets and eat there.

The beauty of the fountain and the people shine through.. This is one of the non miss piazzas in Rome. The Sculptures and fountains as well as the buildings are breath taking. But you can not miss the scene of the street vendors, and musicians that are working in the piazza as well.

Like heart of city. We went there from narrow streets. After narrow streets, suddenly you see the huge piazza navona. You see the fountains and so many people. You see the artists making their art. You see illusionists, stand-up shows. Worth to see it. Perfect place.

Delightful piazza to sit and relax with an ice cream. Located within easy walking distance of the Trevi fountain, the Pantheon and the Coliseum in central Rome, this delightful piazza is not usually quite so busy as its more famous neighbours. This does not detract from this being a lovely place to visit and sit and relax. There are many restaurants and bars to visit, or you can buy a wonderful Galati from one of the street vendors or nearby shops and enjoy while watching the Fountain of the four Rivers or admiring the Egyptian obelisk.Although just one many places to visit in Rome, this should not be missed.
Beautiful statues if you can see them through the crowds. Beautiful statues but the area is really packed with tourists, admiring the paintings for sale and avoiding the guys selling selfie-sticks.

Delightful piazza with beautiful fountains and many places to shop.. Lots of things to see. Enjoyed eating at one of the outdoor cafe. And just walking among the many artists and other venders. Weather was beautiful in late September ..

Lovely place to sit and soak in the Roman sunshine.... When your feet are killing you and you need a rest, the Piazza Navona, very centrally located, is the place to go. Have a drink, eat lunch, enjoy a gelati, feast your eyes on the incredible Bernini fountains - and watch the people go by!

Great place for people watching and romantic at night. This is a large piazza with a two noteworthy fountains that are on the must see list when in Rome. There are always lots of people around. At night it is romantically lit and there is usually some music or other activity going on. The only thing is be on the lookout for pickpockets. If anyone approaches you, decline and walk away quickly. The plaza is close to a lot of other attractions and pedestrian walkways, so a great place to relax from all of the other sight seeing.
mesmerising. ate at a nearby resturant and was lovely to sit outside and take in the surroundings of art and culture

Nice. A stunning square with two ornate fountains. Clearly has become a centre for local artists as lots of stalls selling paintings and prints of the square and of the wider Rome. A number of street musicians were also about which was great to stop and people watch.So as a closed square there is a real buzz about the place. Many nice restaurants on the square and on the surrounding streets. Get some gelato and watch the world go by for 20 minutesWorth a visit but likely going to or from one of the other main attractions.

A beautiful fountain!. We visited this Piazza on our "Angels & Demons tour" (booked through Viator. It was a fantastic tour where we visited the sites of the clues Dan Brown wrote about in the book (that was later made into a movie with Tom Hanks).

Another beautiful piazza. One of our favorite piazzas in Rome. We especially loved the Fountain of Four Rivers in the center. It was fun to try and guess what it was depicting and then learn the real history the next day in our tour. Like much of Rome, it was especially romantic at night. In fact, I highly recommend just strolling around the city at night. I think we loosely followed Rick Steve's Heart of Rome walking tour our first night there. It was a great way to soak up the energy of Rome, see incredible works of art and start to understand the layout of the city.
Hang Out!. Part of our Segway tour. Such a nice place to hang out @ night. With some restaurants lined out in front of Piazza Navona.

You will pass thru and the way to other sites.. Large square with beautiful fountains. Always crowded with tourist, artist, performers and scammers. Nice place to rest if you can ignore the scam artists. Great restaurants in the surrounding streets, cant go wrong.

So atmospheric. This is THE place to go at dusk in Rome. So much going on and in stunning surroundings. We love wandering around listening to the musicians, or watching street entertainers, artists or delving around the trinket stalls. The square has enticing restaurants, bars and some shops around it but an easy way to while away an hour before dinner is to just stroll around.

Entertaining!. We came across this piazza almost by accident and it was fabulous! Street artists, buskers and plenty of cafes to sit and watch the entertainment from. The only downside was the amount of people trying to sell us selfie sticks!

This Place Rocks. This was a really cool piazza...full of life. There are many restaurants surrounding the main fountain square. We found a little roof top spot just off the piazza that was good, but expensive. The music was fun to listen too. But it can be crowded...so be aware.

Very Crowded. Walked over to the Piazza after our tour of the Vatican around lunchtime. Very crowded around all the fountains so you couldn't really appreciate their beauty. Better to visit this area in the morning before lunch or late afternoon when the crowds should be less.

Very pretty. Lots of space and activity. Very busy day and night. Beautiful fountains esp the main central one. Lots of restaurants all around the piazza. Some are quite expensive but others are not so bad. At night is bustling with street artists and stalls.One of the nicer parts of Rome Day or night

An elegant piazza, even swarmed with tourists. We visited in mid-October when the weather was perfect. Piazza Navona and all of Rome were filled with tourists. Even so, the elegance, and grace of this piazza took our breaths away. We joined the throngs lingering there and then treated ourselves to some gelato from Tre Scalini.

Just enjoy and ignore the scarf/gadget-seller men. I have visited Piazza Navona in the evening first. The fountain in the middle is amazing because of the lights. Many people gather together there, just enjoy the view and ignore those who are trying to pursuade you to buy some gadgets.
Always Time for Gelatto. Lots of activity around the Piazza. Lots of things to see. And nothing better than sitting a one of the numerous cafe's for a cappacino and a gelatto.

a great time to be had. with its very busy piazza stunning churches and amazing fountains along with its cool artists and trendy eateries this is a definite must see for any traveller, its great for taking coffee food or just watching the Italian style pass you by
A beautiful gem just off the main road?. Piazza Novana is a beatifiul little gem just off the main road. It is very busy, even in October but it is well worth the visit.
Beautiful area. This square is beautiful, it looks just like a postcard! Amazing fountain and church as well as beautiful colorful buildings lining the square!

Large Lively Piazza. We visited on a misty morning as we were wandering through Rome. You can just imagine the activities here during the day and night time! Just looking at the buildings and imagining the history of this place was joyful for me!The main fountain was tremendous!We went to the Musee de Roma (I think!) in one corner of the Piazza. The main exhibit was about the end of WWII in Italy. As an American, this was very interesting to me! Mainly photos, many were ones that were censored at the time. Very cool.The regular exhibits were also very interesting - including two "draft" pieces of sculpture and the final piece! Never thought of that!!Plus, since this museum was once a private home, there are still 4 original statues which have been there since the time families lived there! Tremendous.

Beautiful square . Piazza Navona is a beautiful square. Even on a drizzly October day. Wonderful but crowded fountains. Play count the animals with young children. Nearby is the museum of Rome and two highly recommended ice cream parlours. Bus 87 goes to Collosium.

Great area for real art. This square seems to be populated by artists painting, and selling their work. The fountains are worth visiting for on their own, but add the art and you've got something worth looking at indeed. Not too hard to find within the Centro Storico area

most beautiful of all Piazzas in all of Italy.. Cannot say enough about the perfection that is Piazza Navona. Even the guys running around trying to sell you anything seem less annoying because of this beautiful site. even with the food being overpriced it's worth it. Just order a very simple dish and you'll enjoy yourself.

Poseidon, Art, food and people watching in Piazza de Navona. We stayed at a lovely boutique hotel one block away from the square down one of the lovely ancient narrow cobblestone streets Rome is known for. It is such a beautiful square, centrally located and full of shops, restaurants, art and amazing history. Loved the toy store and the kitchen store on the corners full of many unique things to bring home. Best area to stay in!

Nice for a stroll. We stayed near the piazza Navona so ate there most evenings. It is quite expensive but there are lots of opportunities to people watch and listen to street musicians. You can walk around the piazza where people are selling paintings or you can have a portrait or characature of your self.

Go early to avoid crowds. We were very fortunate to find an apartment overlooking the piazza . From cafe's and restaurants , a beatiful church to artists and street entertainers not to mention the stunning fountains this is a place not to be missed .At 8 in the morning there are a handful of people walking around but by 10 it is packed with people so go early if you want to enjoy at its best
Good by day, fantastic by night. Fantastic piazza, something going on all the time day and night.Could spend the whole day and evening here, one of my favourite places. Give yourself time here!
Nice place to visit. The square is filled with tourists. Restaurants are plenty. Good place to stroll around with your family and friends.

A people place. Very spectacular. A huge space surrounded by buildings and restaurant terraces, anchored by two fountains at each extremities and balanced by a large fountain in the middle of the piazza. Always full of people taking photos, sitting at the edge of the fountains. Peddlers trying to sell you things. A lively place to get a good feel that you are finally in Rome.

A wonderful and unique Piazza with its own fountain. A wonderful Piazza with an abundance of restaurants with seating outdoors on the Piazza, a Church to wonder at, Street Artists and Musicians and Street Traders all in the fantastic and unique setting of a very special Piazza.

Nice. Nice square with the famous Bernini fountain. Notice that the statues on the fountain don't look at the church by Borromini and the statue on the church deliberately looks the other way. Nice 17th century rivalry!
Under Rennovation. Unfortunately the piazza was under renovation, still you can feel the charm of the place. Would definitely prefer it without the renovation
My favorite piazza in Rome. Not too big, but big enough. Beautiful place to hang out and just take it in. Eat at one of the restaurants in the piazza for a memorable experience.
Enjoyable. Plaza proved to be an interesting place to just stop and look around at the people and the surrounds. Hard to describe the appeal but enjoyed our time there.

Piazza Navona. Great place to relax, people watch, have a caffe or moscato. All kinds of people here complete with artists, vendors, students, tourists, locals etc. Very eclectic and the fountain is not to be missed. One of the coolest piazzas in Rome!

Famous So I'm told. Like my other reviews of Rome, take it with a grain of salt as Rome was not my favorite place in Italy. This is a classic, popular piazza. It is a nice place to sit and have a drink and watch. It is very crowded and to sit at a table and have a drink, it will cost you a little more. I wonder if the art is good or is a scam. I overheard a person telling a tour group to make sure they know what the price is and make sure they count their change after the transaction. This made me question the area, but we did enjoy a glass of vino and people watching.

A Roman stadium, a walk through Renaissance sculpture, or is it a shopping mall with a circus?. The answer depends on the time of day but it's always an enchanting space with over 2000 years of history hidden in the stones. The beauty shifts in color and charm depending on the sun light, the rain, the hail, or even once every few decades a serious snow fall. Contains marvelous churches, Egyptian obelisks, renaissance statues, Roman ruins and some of the best ice cream in the world. Any time, any day, don't miss it. Transportation is difficult, parking nearly impossible, biking too fast to appreciate the details.

School group visit. Coming around the corner into the Piazza Navona, my breath was taken away. The architecture is absolutely gorgeous, and we were delighted to hear some beautiful musicians (cello, accordion and guitar) which made it feel like the most quintessentially Roman experience of our trip. The statues are beyond impressive, and the whole atmosphere was lovely. I could have sat in the piazza for hours! Be warned: there are lots of people 'performing', for example by pretending to levitate etc., who will ask you for money if you take a photo of them.

Interesting place, great to sit with a drink and watch the world go by. Great buildings, fantastic fountains, lovely shops and restaurants and street artists and performers too. Have a browse then get a cocktail or glass of wine and people watch for a while!
Busy and beautiful.. A busy square full of artists and their vibrant paintings. Beautiful water fountains well worth visiting as is the church in the square, Sant' Agnese in Agone.

Nice open space. Due to former 'circus' function is now lovely open area to gather and people watch. Stand by the fountains. Many cafés and tourist tat. Was overwhelmingly populated with cartoon drawers!
Love this part of Roma. Can't say enough about this site- lots of great art and restaurnats- we've eaten in three different ones- all great food and wine and view of the passers-by.
My favorite fountain. I dreamed of seeing the Fountain of the Four Rivers in Piazza Navona for years, and it lived up to my expectations - so beautiful!!
favorite spot in Rome. We could enjoy this piazza every day! afoavorite for relaxing, people watching, artisan shopping, etc...

Great Area. This is a lovely square to visit, sometimes very busy, but you just walk around and take in the fountains and atmosphere. There are a lot of artists sat about and selling paintings and other little sculptures while you are there.
Enjoy :-). Piazza Navona is my favourite place in Rome. After long walks, always come here and sit by the fountains, enjoy in music, drink espresso. And my favourite ice cream Frigidarium is nearby.

One of our favorite spots inn Rome!. Always love going to the Piazza Navona to "soak in" the ambience of Rome, grab a light lunch or dessert, and watch people. Especially enjoy the art work displayed by local artists selling their beautiful prints...we have purchased some for Christmas gifts to be framed...a big hit with family/friends! You can bring the prints home in tubes (easy to bring on airplane).

The heart of Rome. Is a must see. Walk through many restaurants, feeling the ambience of Rome. A lot of places to choose, to take a cup of coffee or a nice cocktail and have a tipical, and good, meal. Prices are not high.

Square like many others. If you expect to see amazing views you might be disappointed. It is quite average and if you have already visited other European capitals this square is nothing special (e.g. Old Town Square in Prague, Czech Republic; Marienplatz in Münich, Germany; Main Square in Kraków, Poland).

Tourist Hell, but You Must Stroll through It at Least. Almost every time I've been to Rome I've sat down and eaten an overpriced meal on this great former Roman "circus" - a long ellipse packed with restaurants, artists selling their wares, two Bernini fountains and another in his style for good measure. For some reason on my most recent trip, less than a month ago I resisted the urge to eat or even have an espresso, but even though I strolled at the cost of an elbow (or worse, a selfie-stick - really hate those) from a rude or at least unknowing tourist (usually in a group) trying for that perfect photo, I never regret even a brief visit - I suspect that you won't either.
Great atmosphere. Visit by day and night always something going on, street artists great music lovely bars and restaurants to people watch.

Beautiful always- In Daylight & after sunset!. Bernini's Fountain of 4 rivers with the egyptian obelisk in the centre is a sight to be enjoyed in broad daylight & after sunset too!We went there in the evening & sat staring at the beautiful fountain all lit up in golden lights - it was super busy, with artists painting, performing, singing, shopping & ppl dining in restaurants around the piazza. The other 2 fountains are little less crowded, so you can sit near them & view the central one. We returned next day for lunch- it was totally crowded again & more beautiful in day light!! Enjoyed a good meal looking at the fountain & got a crazy caricature done by an artist in the square- a pleasant memory.

Relaxing . Beautiful plaza to visit and relax as you watch he comings and going of the plaza.
Spend some time to take in the Roman experience.

My second favourite place in Rome. It's 15 years since we last came here and we remembered this square well. We planned our day around it in fact. We decided to get here mid afternoon and grab some food and a bottle of wine and just people watch. Brilliant.

Visit at Night. Cool place to visit at night with all the different street performers we got to see Micheal Jackson perform ...he was just amazing and the fire spinning guy...The dinners were awesome we had dinner and lunch at three different places and each and everyone was excellent. If you have the time make sure you come here one evening

Yet another Bernini masterpice!. Piazza Navona is another of Rome's many musts. It is built on the site of one of ancient Rome's smaller circuses, so the north end is rounded and the south end squared off. Piazza Navona contains two of Bernini's masterpieces; the church of Sant Agnese in Agone and La Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. The church is brilliant, but it's the fountain that brings back again and again. The four rivers the sculptor has represented are the Nile (a Nubian whose head is covered with a cloth, because in Bernini's day, its source was unknown); the Ganges with its long oar attesting to its navigability; the Plate (Rio de la Plata) with its silver coins (Plata is Spanish for silver) and the Danube with its Papal coat of arms as its the larest river close to Rome. Fantastic! I've visited this fountain every hour of the day and night and it never fails to fascinate me.
Vacation. When in Rome there are many plaza's to see and this is one of those. Whats fun about this one is many things are going on at the plaza. Vendors, places to eat, Music etc..

Touristy but Enjoyable. We always stop here and have a drink or lunch at one of the tourist trap restaurants right on the Piazza and watch the crowds. Then, we walk around the fountain and admire it once again.

Masterpeace!. Be free to wall around in different parts of day. Try to escape bunch of tourists and isolate your view on the fountains. If you decide to have a coffee there, on the piazza, it will cost you around 6eur (cappuccino). Around Navona, you will find several ice cream shops, some souvenir stores, but be careful. All good there is a bit pricey!

Lively, beautiful piazza. This is such a beautiful space. The fountains, churches and buildings are all so harmonious. However, it is getting a bit tacky with all the street "performers" and amateur artists. It would be much nicer to see the wide open space of the piazza. Come early in the morning or late at night to experience the beauty.
Amazing atmosphere m, A must visit when in Roma. Well! What not to love at Piazza Navona Atmosphere is electric, restaurants, street art, live music, ice cream galore Just loved it

A Rome classic. Walking the old centre of Rome you should pass by this piazza. The shape dating back to the original placement of the Roman stadium. The piazza is usually full of tourists, musicians and selfie-stick salesmen. Despite of this it remains a cosy place.

Buzzing atmosphere day and night. We visited in September and in the morning it was quite quiet and relaxing to watch the fountains, in the evenign we went back and it was full of life and lots of stalls to buy peoples arts and crafts, sadly alot of people pushing you to buy stuff but that is everywhere in Rome.The fountains also looked beautiful in the dark with soft lighting.
To busy to see clearly.. Did not enjoy as to crowded to see,early morning might be better.Fountain looked lovely,the little I was able to see.
The World around you.. Every nationality of the World is walking, talking and enjoying the brilliant atmosphere as you stroll around and imagine who has walked these very steps. Brilliant.

Best Piazza. Only a seven minute walk from our hotel (Temple View, see my review) on Largo Argentina by way of busy streets and quiet old alleys, the Piazza Navona gets my vote for the best in Rome. Despite unrealistic expectations to the contrary, it is also one of the larger ones. Compared to the Piazza Mattei, for example, it's huge. Beyond that there are the three splendid fountains, each worthy of their own review, the large church of Sant' Agone, the splendid Renaissance architecture all around, restaurants and shopping, nightlife and some view into normal Roman life. It also made a great starting point for our walking tour of "Renaissance Rome" that included 16 "must see" stops between here, Trevi fountain and back to our hotel.

Beatiful piazza with fountain. We visited this site as part of a "Path of the Illuminati" tour featuring the sites from Dan Brown's book "Angels and Demons." The fountain is beautiful with a lot of significant symbolism. We would have loved to enjoy a coffee on the piazza but unfortunately, both times we were here it was raining. Many of the restaurants and shops along here are known to be tourist traps so you may want to seek a recommendation before stopping in.
Square of the artist and the tourists. This square is a must see in Rome, but it is really crowded! There are a lot of artists making paintings and caricatures, and also a lot of tourist.
one of the biggest place in roma. Very famous place in Roma. Not my favorite as i prefer smaller places but that is a place you should visit during your stay in roma
