Beautiful and busy piazza.. This is a rectangular piazza with three beautiful fountains at either end and in the middle and lots of cafes and bars all around with outside seating perfect for an aperitivo or coffee while people watching.

Great People watching. A great place to while a way a couple of hours, eating gelato and watching the world go by. Loads of artist doing portraits and caricatures and painting the sights. Only downside is the Lookie Lookie touts selling selfie sticks and scarves - I might get a I don't want a selfie stick t shirt printed for my next visit!

Beautiful piazza. This is a beautiful piazza with gorgeous historic buildings and fountains. It also has many restaurants, but I wouldn't recommend them as there are many more non-touristy, more unique restaurants.

Pleasant accidental find.. Beautiful piazza with a church in the centre which has concerts on certain days starting with a guided tour. Unfortunately we were not there when these were on, but worth checking out at the beginning of a visit to Rome. Restaurants around the Piazza very expensive unsurprisingly but there are plenty of benches so I suggest getting a gelato from one of the side streets and enjoying it on one of the free benches in the piazza!

Piazza Navona. Rather boring tourist hotspot. The fountain is swarming with people so taking a picture can be quite a challenge. There's an ice-cream parlour a block from the fountain. There's a very relaxing area walking away from it.

Beautiful square, all 3 historic fountains working!!!. We visited this piazza / square in late September, because the fountains we had visited earlier (Trevi and Spanish Steps) were under maintenance and therefore not operational. Beautiful square with lovely buildings all around and not one but three fountains. A little less touristy meant fewer crowds vs. Trevi and Spanish Steps. Worth a short visit to enjoy its beauty, history and to take some amazing pictures. Combine with other attractions in the neighborhood to make for a wonderful day.
Delightful Square!. Wonderful! We loved seeing all the artists and street performers. Surrounded by sidewalk cafes it was a favorite spot in Rome.

Beautiful . Beautiful buildings and fountains. Lovely way to spend an hour strolling around. Lots of restaurants in which the food is reasonable but drinks are extortionate so go off the sqaure to have lunch or dinner.

Nice square to watch the world go by. It's was a lovely Saturday at the end of October when we visited with no clouds in the sky and around 22 deg C so perfect to be outside to visit places like this. In the centre are 3 different fountains with elaborate designs which look great in Rome. In between there are many artists selling paintings and people available to draw your picture. All surrounded by a range of bars and pizzerias - good venues to just sit back and relax and watch the world go by in Rome.
Beautiful Square. Lots of restaurants surrounding the Piazza. Beautiful fountains and a bit of shopping make it a worthwhile stop.
Best fountain in Rome. Love it. The Bernini sculptures were so fluid and expressive.. And the plaza has a great atmosphere especially towards dusk. A good place to just chill at.

Beautiful Piazza. A beautiful piazza with detailed architecture in the buildings and the fountains.An array of good but slightly expensive restaurants are available on two sides of the Piazza with a number of street vendors.Look out for the toy store on the corner of one of teh entrances, tremendous selection but most a little too big to fit into your suitcase.

Favourite place in Rome. I just love this place - it's stunningly beautiful which helps, but the atmosphere is always pleasant in my view. A great part of the city to browse the various artists and clever folks entertaining people. Plus, some great places to eat within yards of the main square.

Lovely place to visit while in the neighborehood. While making your way through the city its definitely worth of stopping by, or make a slight detour, to visit this vast sized Piazza. I would argue to visit it in daylight as well as darkness!

Beautiful, yet crowded. I'm unsure of how to rate touristy areas in Rome. Piazza Navona is stunning: the fountains, the buildings, the history of the square, but in the daytime it is so terribly crowded with tourists and people selling things, artists that are selling (what I believe) is not their own work, restaurant staff trying to pull you in.. I give it 5 stars for the beauty but 3 for the ambience, evening out to 4. Go late at night when the people are gone and the restaurants are closed and it's much more beautiful.
Amazing. Something to remember, just like everything else in Italy! I wish i didn't wait so long to visit. I'll be back! can't wait....

Beautiful Piazza and Fountain - close to Pantheon. If you are walking in Rome, don't miss the Piazza Navona. It was a busy place, but not overcrowded at the time of our visit, and it was fun to walk around the various artists and see their works - and we especially enjoyed seeing the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (the Fountain of the Four Rivers.) It was only a couple of blocks from the Pantheon - which should be on your must-see list - and worth the short walk. Enjoy!

Beautiful Fountains!. Worth a visit for certain if you're exploring Rome. The fountains are lovely and the piazza is filled with artists and performers and it's fun to browse and people watch. There are some restaurants right on the square if you're in need of food, but it's also a great place to grab a gelato and relax for a few minutes.

Beautiful Piazza. As one of the main piazzas of Renaissance Rome and formerly a Roman circo it is well worth a visit for its sheer size, it's architecture and of course the fountain of four rivers. However, all this history is augmented by the bustle and atmosphere of cafes, bars and street artists make it a great place to spend time. Even better when you are gliding around on a Segway or sipping a cocktail in the evening.

Plenty to see here ............ This is a real hub of activity, from musicians to painters to performers, there is plenty to see. Be prepared for high prices though if you sit outside and eat or have a drink - a small bottle of Heineken can set you back €9! Even the most average starter is the same price as a main meal a couple of streets away ................

Grab a seat to expereince the true beauty. Walking into Piazza Navona I was blown away by the size of the square. The fountains are very beautiful and Saint Agnes' church makes a great backdrop. To truly get the feel of this square I suggest sitting somewhere to people watch and let the Italian world go by. I saw little kids with their mothers chasing after bubbles, people playing instruments and other tourists taking a break to rest their feet. On Tuesdays there are many artists who sell paintings and pictures. I felt as if there are TOO many artists trying to sell something. Know what you are buying if you do plan to purchase a painting. I cannot wait to hang my piece of art by an Italian artist I met named Varmi. Enjoy!
The oldest Piazza. This is the oldest square in Rome, it has a lot of artists in the centre where you can buy their pictures, it is surrounded by restaurants, a great place to 'people watch'.

Absolute Beauty at Night. We were staying near the Campo di Fiore but would walk to Piazza Navona (5-10 minutes) in the evening to view the beautiful fountains. Yes, you encounter that hawkers here but ignore them and admire the central Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini (1651). So romantic to walk arm-in-arm around the entire piazza and main fountain.
Central shopping feature. If you are in Rome for shopping, the area surrounding this attraction is the best. Beautiful area, best value for money.

Charing square. I'm glad we went - the piazza was vibrant and quaint. Lots of places to eat at and all were very busy. We bought some paintings from the one of the many stalls to remind us of our time in Rome.

Surprising find. We accidentally stumbled upon this piazza while we were walking back to our hotel from the Vatican. We were very pleased. In the evening, the plaza was full of artists and vendors. It is home to 3 beautiful fountains and has a bustling community. If you can squeeze in a visit to this piazza, do it.

What a wonderful place.. Loved the atmosphere, the architecture, the fun, the stalls, the artistes - every thing about the place. Don't leave Rome without seeing this place. Absolutely beautiful at night.
Piazza Navona. Its the place to be at night - the restaurants serve the most amazing food and you can imagine the chariot races
Piazza Navona. In a central position great to see on upper deck of the hop on bus and there is a bus stop near it lots of steps up the side of where you can walk up and look at the views

Beautiful piazza in the centre. One of the favourite and most famous piazzas in Rome. With its 3 fountains, represents a place teeming with tourists at all times. The most grandious one, The 4 rivers, is breath-taking.
Restaurants and cafes are full, a bit expensive, but with a fabulous view :)
Beautiful square.. Big square with cool statues and fountains. Great to stop and take some photos. Restaurants on side - did not try any.
Lovely and quite place. Decorated with 3 marvelous fountains this place offers you nice spot to enjoy your snack or break from long walking hours around the city.
Wow. Masterpiece of Bernini in this square and a beautiful church just in front of the fountain done by Borromini. To be seen

A fun place to spend an evening. Piazza Navona is one of those places that you go to relax in the evening. Full of eateries and street performances, it provides a good feel of Rome. The fountains and church are interesting. Children will have a good time here. Just beware of quacks and pick-pocketing.
i love navona square. nice place, people around sqare came from avery place in the world....better clean more and take care

Impressive and free viewing. Like movie Devils and Demons with tom Hanks. Great Piazza, with many artists, people-watching and bistros/cafes to sit back and rest. Was here two times already as still great view and free access. Very nice and will be back.

A must see!. When we went to Rome both times, I had to go to this piazza. This is my absolute favorite and the restaurants are awesome. You get to sit outside and enjoy the atmosphere. I like it most when the local artists and musicians are out! It is a great place to just relax and people watch.

Very busy. We visited during holy week and the piazza was very busy with artists and what appeared to be illegal sellers who were removed by the police but kept returning. A fascinating place to watch people interact with each other.

The fountains are worth seeing as well as the artists and musicians.. Get there early in the day before it gets too crowded. So lovely to see those three magnificent sculptured fountains with few peoples surrounding them. Wish I had seen it at night as well.

My Favorite Piazza In Rome. We really loved the Piazza Navona and the Four Rivers Fountain. This was several blocks from where we were staying and we enjoyed people watching there as well as dinner. One of our favorite meals was at Ristorante Tucci.

Lovely afternoon. The Piazza is really lovely and well worth finding. The artists were out in force and a tradional Italian musical group entertained as well as a very good pop band.
Feelings of Covant Garden rippled round with street entertainers.
The restaurants offer good service and beautifully prepared dishes. You have to pay this treasure a visit
Bets for night life. Wonderful location ,plenty of restaurants ,try the small streets running off the Piazza. Lots going on .

Nice spot for photos.. We were on a bus travelling through this square. Hop on Hop off is the company. Look for the guys standing at buss stations with red vests or just hop on and pay on the bus. There are other vendor. The is a beautiful fountain here and lots of beautiful buildings for photos.

Christmas fair. We learned last year our favorite place at Christmas had essentially shut down. There was no or very limited Christmas fair last year. A political dispute was stated as the reason. I have been trying with little success to find out if our 2015/16 visit should include the piazza. We were very disappointed about last year and hope Rome will get it together this year.
Gorgeous Fountains and Statues. Come here and wander, check out the various artists. Sit and have a macchiato, but don't forget to visit the Brasilia.

Great fun and lots to see. Piazza Navona is sort of tucked-away so that you come upon it quite suddenly. But then what a surpise! it's great all-round entertainment once you arrive there, from sampling the fresh-roasted chestnuts on sale at the southern approach, to the magnificent Fontana del Quattro Fiumi sculpture surmounted by an Egyptian obelisk that forms its artistic centrepiece, to the cafes and restaurants of varying quality and price dotted around its perimeter. Bear in mind, if you are new to the city, that sitting at a table-with-a-view will always cost you.Everywhere you look there is something to entertain the eyes and ears, from street musicians with kids dancing to their tunes, to an Indian apparently seated suspended in mid-air, to those obligatory living statues of pharaohs, bikers, people with no heads . . . . , to clever artists who will create a splendid caricature of you and yours, and roll it up ready for the flight home, for ten Euros in all of five minutes. Yes it's blatantly, brashly touristy, Roman-style, but who cares if you're having a ball!

Gorgeous Piazza with lots of Baroque-style masterpieces. Piazza Navona is small, and there actually isn't much to explore, but it is a very nice place to hang around, people-watch and take photos. It was a fine day and many artists were out and about, putting their craft on display. Some customers were getting their portraits drawn. Very importantly, it is also home to three famous fountains and the beautiful Church of Sant'Agnese in Agone. It is definitely my favourite piazza of all I've seen in Italy!

Always buzzing. This piazza is definitely worth visiting, and conveniently crosses many of the many routes through to the Vatican, Pantheon etc. It's an ever changing landscape, from lazy coffee drinking in the morning, to afternoon cocktails and then atmospheric outdoor dining and gelato in the evening. All against the backdrop of Bernini's magnificent 'Fontana dei Quattro fiumi' (fountain of the four rivers) and Obelisk of Dimitian - worth the visit alone. This square was a market place for more than 500 years, and today hawkers, artists and more still ply their trade - even if their wares are now selfie sticks, shawls, handbags and glow in the dark toys. But it's all pretty benign. Expect to pay a premium for piazza-side dining, but there are some real restaurant and coffee shop gems literally yards from the main piazza down the many side streets.
best piazza in Rome. Full of artists around. Great location for kids and disabled. One could easily spend an hour wandering around.

Nice but not a must see. If you are limited in time this is not a must see compared to other attractions in Rome. Artist gather to show off their works and you can sit down and eat a meal at any of the many places to eat and people watch.
My favorite Piazza en Rome. Amazing fountain and some excellent restaurants around the piazza. A bit touristy but still Roman at heart.

Large bustling plazza. Three large beautiful fountains and lots of people. This plazza is surrounded by restaurants and has the requisite street performers. Be sure and go into Sant"Agnese in Agone basillica

My favorite Piazza!. Absolutely lovely square! Fountains, artists, beautiful buildings, wonderful restaurants. We had an awesome lunch, some entertainment. I would consider staying somewhere there the next time I am in Rome.

My favorite piazza in all of Italy!. My friend and I went back to Piazza Navona several times throughout our trip as it was my favorite place to be in all of Rome; the reason being that in the evening one could be serenaded by Italians singing songs in Italian. One disappointment that I have had in many of my international travels is that while I love to immerse myself in the culture of whichever country I'm visiting, I rarely get the opportunity to hear their native music. It seems almost any country that you visit, you will hear Elvis Presley--whether you are at a restaurant, a bar, just walking down the street, or even while on a Greek ferry and doing some island hopping! :( While I have always loved Elvis Presley, I don't have to leave the States to hear him--I can get that at home! I travel because I want complete cultural immersion. I want to enjoy their music, their food, eat where the locals eat, and not go to tourist traps except to buy souvenirs. Be sure to go to Piazza Navona in the evening. If you go in the daytime, you will scratch your head and wonder what the place has to offer other than its beautiful fountains. It is absolutely dead in the daytime. Nights are a completely different story as the restaurants put almost all of their tables and chairs outside, and you feast on real Italian food while listening to authentic Italian music, and then can wander around just enjoying the fountains or buy souvenirs from the vendors. I bought a lovely Italian scarf that contained illustrations of some of the more popular Roman sites for under 5 euros! Yes, many may consider it a tourist trap as yes tourists gravitate there, at least you can hear the true music of the country while you dine on real Italian food as opposed to what you get in many places, particularly the hotel restaurants: Americanized versions of Italian food! Yuck! They think they are catering to American taste with their special sauces which always turn out to be some form of ketchup sauce :( :( I would love to know where this idea came from LOL--Could it have come from our preponderance of fast-food restaurants? Buon appetito!

Nice but very crowded. I have been to Rome several time over the past 40 years, and have never seen this many people, even in the so called 'off season'. The Piazza Navona has not changed much and is interesting to see, but the tour groups and crowds take away from what I best remember over the years. There are many artists selling their goods, but also many "junk" sellers and "vendors" trying to take advantage of the tourists. Nice place to see see and visit, but be aware that it is very crowded and people trying to sell you anything that they can.
Nice sculpture. A Bernina sculpture is the center piece of this piazza. Not a large piazza but plenty of food eateries surrounding it.

Have lunch here!. This is a great piazza! It's full of bustle with artists and musicians dotted all around what used to be a chariot racing arena where now three fountains stand. We ate twice at a restaurant there called 'Tucci' and it was wonderful. Around the area there are lovely little antique shops and delis. Definitely our favourite food spot.
Shopping spree . Nice buildings nice restaurants and not as many shops as I expected still worth a visit some market type stalls in centre of plaza

Very Lovely. Could do without the pushy restaruant waiters.. The fountains were gorgeous. I enjoyed the ORIGINAL artists, and street vendors, but some were very touristy and sold the exact same painting. If you walked by a restaruant the waitstaff would hound you to come in and eat. And these are not the restaruants you want to dine in. They are used to tourist.

Rating based on comparing other Piazza's. Large Piazza with impressive fountains, a few cute shops and restaurants. We ate a late lunch at Bernini's and is was very good. Cool toy/figurine store here. There was an art show going on which was nice.

Must see. Walk to this place, spend some time soaking up the architecture and the street vendors. "instant artists" are fun to watch, though their tourist art product is of little value, but nice to see. Cafe side tables, average tourist fare, but fun to sit and people watch.

st. Agnes. this is the place to 'PEOPLE WATCH"--also, the plaza is filled with artists displaying their works , but it,s also filled with very persistent 'Hawkers" trying to sell Scarves etc. don,t miss visiting the church of St. Agnes in Agony".the young martyr,s skull is on display in the church ,which is also very beautiful.

Best piazza in Italy. I was pleased that this was part of a Segway tour. When we arrived, there were many street entertainers, artists, and the like in this plaza. It was a great part of Italy to see.
Nice little spot to see. I enjoyed just relaxing in this little spot, there are gift shops, spots to eat and creative people busy all around where you can buy or just watch the entertainment.

Touristy.... I don't get what the big deal is with Piazza Navona. I mean, yeah, you can get your Character drawn... but, otherwise, it is super touristy. All the restaurants in that area are massively overpriced, and mediocre at best. My suggestion - go, take some pictures, enjoy the views, and then walk about 10 minutes away from there (in any direction) and find a REAL Italian restaurant to eat in.
Beautiful on a sunny day. A large, open piazza that makes you feel like you are really in Rome. Pretty, a little cray with all the artists and buskers, but very worth a visit.

A magical Piazza with stunning history and modern culture blended to perfection. One of Romes most famous Piazzas with a great history, some beautiful landmarks & fountains with a daily art market working alongside the cafes to produce a lovely experience of a Roman hotspot.
Beautiful and entertaining. There are three beautiful fountains surrounded by charming buildings. The square is full of street artists nice restaurants where to have a meal or a coffee.

Paintings for Sale Everywhere.. Lovely large square full of Artists with lots of paintings of various styles for sale. beautiful old buildings all around and a fountain in the middle with an obelisk. Great place for people watching.
Beautiful Piazza. Very good place to take a photo in front of the fountain. There are lots of cafes with outdoor seating.

My Favorite Piazza....Piazza Navona. Everytime I visit Rome, Piazza Navona is always on the top of my list. With a brood of 7, my family walked to Piazza Navona from the Pantheon that late afternoon in August. It was a leisurely 15 minutes to the Piazza and a different scene welcomed us. The whole Piazza was full of people..locals having a leisurely time at the parklike setting...tourists taking pictures against the background of the great fountain of four rivers. There were clowns, anime artists or those dressed up knights and ladies of olden times looking for curious tourists to pay for a photo opportunity. It was a lively sight with street dancers breaking dance in the cool pavement. Colored kites and tiny bubbles filled the air from the toys of the toddlers and kids milling in the square. This is Rome, happy, colorful and very picturesque.

The Most Elegant Piazza in Rome. Never miss the Fountain of The Four Rivers and Church of Saint’Agnese in Agone. Worth spending hours to watch and enjoy. We visited 3 times during our 4-day stay. There's a drinking water tap at the north side of the Piazza. Some very good restaurants and gelaterias in the nearby alleys.

Beautiful fountain. Beautiful fountain surrounded by restaurants, shops and ice cream shops. Taxi stand is also nearby. I encourage you guys to visit at night as the fountain is more beautiful with the lightings. And yes, there are some street artists nearby.

Pretty fountains and lively piazza. Great place for people watching, street performers, and lively atmosphere. We enjoyed a gelato while sitting at one of the many outdoor restaurants lining the piazza.

Too many tourists. Italy is very hot in the summer... piazza navona is known to many tourists and that itself spoils the experience there. Nevertheless it is nice to have some gelato nearby and take a couple of photographs.

One of the Great Spces of the World. Yes, you've seen the photos but nothing prepares you for the size and charm of Piazza Navona. The fountains , create perfect photo opportunities. There are many, many vendors mostly just cheap prints, but some who have interesting wares, shop carefully. Crowds come late morning and late afternoon,try to avoid those times. Stop at any of the gelato shops The best one is past the Tre Scalini on the via sant'Angese in Agone walk to the second gelateria on the right. there's a big stuffed bird hanging inside the door. The piazza is great for people watching, there are benches or even better sit in a cafe and enjoy coffee or vino!
Fun Place. Very busy Piazza, neat fountains, artists, street performers, a lot of nice places to eat near by. Very pretty at night
Picturesque piazza. Great place to stop and watch the world go by, though lots go by as it is very busy. Very picturesque and great architecture - one of my favourites for this.
Must Go. It is an ordinary square/Plaza with nice looking , well care and clean , Góis frequency, historical and a walking distance from many others special sites to go.

LOVED THIS!. When traveling in Rome, we rented elebikes to travel around the city! It was amazing! I knew the Trevi Fountain was closed for consruction so I was very pleased we we were taken here. It is so beautiful. A meeting place for hundreds of people and vendors and the architecture and fountains are more than you would ever imagine! BEAUTIFUL!

Definitely recommended!. This is a great square with 3 fountains! We haven't had the chance to see Trevi as it was under construction so Piazza Navona definitely made up for experiencing great sculptures in fountains! Grab a take away from one of the back streets and head to this square for a quaint lunch!
piazza Navona. Our hotel was very close to Piazza Navona so we went here most nights to eat. You can sit at a terrace and enjoy wine, some food and the scenery.

Great atmosphere, great food, slightly pricey. The Piazza Navona is one of the most famous piazza's in the whole of Rome, thanks to the scale of it's footprint, it's classic Roman restaurants and due to high profile movies being filmed there, such as Angels and Demons. There are also a range of street artists and market traders during the day and musicians and other entertainers during the evening.Due to it's popularity the piazza does get busy during the tourist season but the sheer volume of restaurants means that you can normally find a table to sit and eat delicious Roman cuisine whilst watching Rome life. As with all tourist areas across the world, you pay a premium for the restaurants close by but because of the competition for business most eateries in Piazza Navona do not charge the normal service charge, so it's not too badly priced overall.
A Must visit. Lovely atmosphere, good street entertainers, nice art stands and of course architecture. Well worth a visit.....beats the closed Spanish steps into fits!!!

Entertaining Place. We Found this square by just walking around Rome trying to get lost, every alley way brought you somewhere different. There are restaurants lined on either side and the main square is a mix of street performers, artists and street venders. We thoroughly enjoyed sitting at one of the restaurants and just watch the entertainers & people walking around. We saw some amazing acts.
Breathtaking fountains and Oxygen sucking crowds. Unbelievable beauty of the public sculptures and surrounding buildings. Very lively space, not unnoticed by the crowds that congregate.
Good Place for Coffee !. Beautiful Piazza, plenty of architecture and sculpture to look at plus the art work being sold in the piazza. Loads of cafes, etc. good for people watching.
Piazza. It was fun to walk around and see the piazzas - this fountain is one of the prettier ones around, and there were plenty of place to sit and watch people go by.

Be prepared to pay for the experience!. Although wandering around the piazza is free, stopping for a drink or food is an expensive option. You are also constantly stopped by people trying to sell you scarves, handbags, umbrellas, glow in the dark things to launch into the sky, selfie sticks, roses, wooden dishes, etc etc. It's a nice atmosphere but perhaps over rated.

A nice plaza with bustling artists, fountains, and architecture. This is one of the larger and nicer fountain areas of Rome, with many artists performing or selling paintings, and only most of them are kitschy. The fountains are pretty, as are the buildings, and you can get coffee nearby.

A great Piazza. A great place to spend a few hours watching the performance artists, painters & buskers. Amazingly the Piazza still maintains the outline of the original Roman Stadii. Plan it into your visit as a time to relax & unwind (you will need it).

Another masterpiece. Another great example of why people come to Rome. The Piazza itself is a vibrant place filled with just about everything you may need when visiting, capped off with a fantastic monument.
Worth a walk to see. There are three fountains and some other statues here. On the day we visited there was an artist street market also.

Loved it! October 2015. This was a short 5-10 minute walk from our hotel and we were so happy. Piazza Navona is amazing during the morning, afternoon and nighttime as well. It is perfect for people watching, walking off those extra calories from dinner and looking at the local street art. During our 5 day stay in Rome we went to Piazza Navona for our last 3 days and wish we would've went earlier. Amazing strolling area and fun to get lost in the surrounding little streets with a loved one.

Great place to visit.. Lots going on at the Piazza Navona and helped to make up for the Trevi Fountain still undergoing a refurb. The 3 fountains in the Piazza are quite stunning and there is lots going on the surrounding square to keep you entertained. Not to be missed.

Not easy to find - but so lovely in the evening. We were recommended to see the Piazza by our hotel, so duly headed over to explore.First point - it may seem big on the map, but as it is surrounded by some rather large buildings, it is very easy to walk straight by if you don't think to nip down the ally to get there.However, once you find it, its a great place to while away some time. The large centrepiece fountain representing the worlds major rivers (partly by Bernini) is simply gorgeous, and there is no shortage of artists and musicians to keep the place vibrant.Lots of good restaurants on the Piazza, but head onto one of the little side streets just off the main area for a meal that's just as good at half the price.Also - if you make it across the piazza without being offered a "selfie-stick" for sale at least three times then you have done very well!
Beautiful. There are some hidden treasures here. I would recommend that you have a quick walk round just to see the other fountains. We didn't eat here but I suspect that it would be expensive.

Every popular tourist city needs a place like this!... Street artists, kitsch paintings and a lot of people!.... The piazza is surrounded by really nice buildings, nice fountains and restaurants with perfect views on everything that happens on the piazza. Recommend to stroll around and maybe take something to drink outdoor at one of the many restaurants. For real lunch or dinner I would definitely go somewhere else though!

Always busy even in the rain but a great deal of activity. There is music and mimes and just that feeling of old and ancient.There are restaurants all along but it wise to go up to the next street for more locals eat there and i think the food is a bit better.

People Watching Heaven.. Piazza Navona is a fabulous large traffic free square. Restaurants line either side and the main square is a mix of street performers - artists - hawkers etc. We thoroughly enjoyed sitting here most evenings and just soaking it up. You see some amazing acts!And it's light relief from the crazy way the Italians seem to drive!!! Scary!!!

Great places to eat, entertainment, shops and street artists. Our hotel was very close to Piazza Navona so we went here most nights to eat. We didn't eat in the same restaurant more than once, but each was good, with the option to sit "people watching" as you ate. There were street entertainers, artists selling their pictures (some very good - we bought some in any event), artists creating their pictures for you to watch and or buy and people selling other odds and ends. It had a great atmosphere and prices were reasonable. Loved it here.

Piazza Navona...Don't miss this!. This Piazza is one of the most famous in Rome and I believe that your visit would not be complete without seeing this beautiful area. It is usually full of very talented street performers as well as cafes that surround the piazza. The food prices are higher than normal because of the location, but time to sit and have a beer or glass of vino is well advised if for nothing more than the opportunity to watch the people and performers. A must see!

Favorite Piazzza. With Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps under reconstruction this place was a nice alternative. I liked the artitsts in the center doing their thing and sitting at one of the many cafe's was a nice way to regroup and recoup from a heavy day of sight seeing.

Charming place. The Piazza Navona is located at the heart of Rome, and is very close to the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. You can pass through this piazza when walking through the centre. Additionally, you can sit at a terrace and enjoy wine, some food and the scenery. I would recommend going there to anyone who visits Rome, and would go there in a heartbeat!

great fountain and square. We were there in the night, when there is almost no people and silence. The square full of people during the day looks misterious in the night. The fountain made by Bernini and called "Four rivers" is for sure worth a visit.

Gathering Spot. It seems that everyone stops here! The crowds get bigger as the day goes on. There seems to be wonderful music playing here all the time at different corners of the plaza. There are also lots of people dressed up or performing (wanting you to pay them to get your picture taken with them). The fountain is really neat! We would go to watch the fountain and listen to the music (and people watch of course!)
Nice Sunday morning stroll.. Piazza Navona is very close to the Pantheon and other squares which are well worth a wander.Campo de Fiori is nearby, fruit and herbs on sale
Interesting markets. The Piazza Navona has great architecture and really interesting markets including painters, buskers and coffee shops.
A standard Italian Piazza. To me this square is like most Italian squares. Street artists, fountain and statue, stall sellers. I wouldn't say this square is a stand out though

Happening Place. One of the most significant piazzas in Rome. Very lively with street vendors and performers. Always lots of people. Great place to find a bench and people watch. Surrounded by restaurants, bars and cafes.

Crowded. Very touristy and crowded. If you can filter all the c**p out the fountains are magnificent. Lots of places to eat here but we didn't stop as I suspect they may be overpriced due to the location.
Piazza Navona. Beautiful square in the heart of Rome. Stunning fountain with marble statues. Close to the pantheon - can walk there easily. Plenty of coffee shops surrounding it.

A place to watch the people go by. We walked 18,000 steps around Rome this day and ended up at the Piazza Navona. We we stopped and had lunch in one of the cafes that face into the square. it was a beautiful day and the ambiance was the best. There is artwork, musicians, people watching. Really touristy but that is what we are there for!!
BEST PUBLIC SQUARE IN ALL OF ROME. No other piazza compares to this triple fountain square within walking distance to the Vatican. Numerous shops and restaurants, gelaterias, and artists abound here.

Lots of action square. One more lovely place to hang out in Central Rome. Not far from Trevi and Pantheon. Really worth taking nice walks to discover the city. Romains really welcome the tourists. Drivers stop to let you pass. It is amazing! So much culture, delicious food and of course the Gelato!

Busy hubbub. We visited the Piazza twice, once during the day and once in the evening. Each time it was busy with street entertainers and locals selling their wares, a lot of beautiful paintings. The evenings were the same, it did all stop around 10pm where the street hawkers took over and kept trying to sell all their gimmicky toys. The two restaurants we ate in were superb, lunch time and evening. Plenty of taxis outside for getting back to the hotel

Stunning statues and fountains!!. Like the rest of the travelling world you will want to visit the Piazza Navona. To get fewer crowds go early or later in the day but you still want to be there when all the artists are there. There are lots of crowds but it is a must place to see and would likely go on Day 1 of your vacation in Rome along with the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon and the Spanish Steps. The Trevi fountain is having a major restoration done at this time and you might want to Google to check prior to visiting it as it will a great disappointment the way it is now. There is a fence and the fountain has been drained. I would only see it if I thought I would not be back in Rome. I go there every trip to Rome so I can throw a coin over my left shoulder using my right hand to ensure my return to Rome. Seeing those things and a nice long lunch would complete my day so I can live "la dolce vita"If you are trying to pack everything into one day and include the Coliseum, be sure to do online booking for this prior to leaving the country or have your hotel book it as the line-ups at both coliseum and the Vatican Museum are horrendous!! To have less tourists when you see these attractions plan to go after 1PM while people go for lunch. If you want to see spectacular sculptures by Bernini and others you MUST go to Villa Borghese. You MUST book in advance and you are booked at a specific time as they only allow so many people per hour. The Piazza Navona has a beautiful piazza. Lots of decent artwork if you are wanting to pick up something from your travels.

Beautiful. The many fine sculptures and fountains intermingles with street vendors and performers and is a wonderful backdrop in evenings. Be sure to stop by the Church in the piazza. It is amazing. Absolutely amazing. Enjoy a Stoll with live music and great choices for food there or in the cute neighborhood nearby.

One of the best impressive piazza in Rome. Very close to every touristic place. We rented a flat here during whole Rome visit. Wehad dinner here at nights. Various art shows and activities take place here.Pretty nice places are to have romantic lunch also.Crowded almost every hour. On saturdays an open bazaar is set. Worth visiting

Great people watching spot in Rome. We wanted to find a piazza that captured the feel of Rome and Piazza Navona was perfect. A short walk from the Pantheon, it has many quaint shops, gelato stops and a number of different restaurants to choose from. Plus, two beautiful fountains make for great pictures, including the Four Seasons by Bernini.

Beautiful place to have dinner. My wife and I are big fans of Rome. In particular, the Piazza Navona. There are some fantastic restaurants, beautiful fountains and plenty of entertainment. There are lots of artists and street performers, similar to that in Covent Garden. We like this place so much in Rome, on our last stay we actually book a hotel on the Piazza, the Navona Suites.

A must see in rome. this os one of those Rome landmarks . For sure no one should miss the experience. Rome has these water fountains all over and it is a great experience to see the art craft did in stones. Impressive

Beautiful but disappointed. We went last week and were gutted to find the fountain fenced off and still under renovation,so no water.Still beautiful though and it looks like it should be finished soon,I really do think the authorities should remove all the stalls selling tack from the vicinity,really spoils the atmosphere.

Super lively and fun place!. Great place to hang out and people watch, have a meal, coffee or gelato! Easy to find and access! Artists are on sight to sell their work and do portraits on the spot. Charming place with lovely fountains, but do watch your wallet or purse!

Entertaining. Great place for a visit and plenty of places to eat and drink
Street entertainers are good and the fountains impressive
Be careful of which place you eat and drinks as some have extortionate service charges
Well worth a visit

Beautiful Piazza. This piazza is exactly what I pictured Rome to be before I arrived. The outter buildings are tradional roman style with little restaurants offering the usual italian delights and are a right tourist trap. We ventured slightly away from the main square in the hope of finding some lunch somewhere that offers less expensive and more high quality offerings and we were successful. The main square has a beautiful fountain at each end and one large one in the middle which are great for a photo opportunity. There are lots of stalls selling the same artwork you see around all of the tourist attractions in Rome. The major downside to this piazza is the number of people trying to sell you selfie sticks, scarves and various other items of tat. We were constantly approached and it was very annoying when trying to enjoy the surroundings. Overall a cery enjoyable time and good sun trap to watch the world go by.

Lovely, just lovely. Great just to walk around the Piazza and wonder at some of the fabulous paintings on display and for sale. Annoyingly are the street sellers who wont always take no for an answer when you tell then you don't want to buy their selfie sticks...

Classic Rome. Piazza Navona is a must see! You can stroll past 3 beautiful fountains, peruse artists and their wares, sit and watch the crowds at one of the restaurants. A great place to soak in the flavor a of Rome.
Beautiful. An extremely beautiful Piazza, lovely if pricey restaurants, great street entertainment....best to eat in the restaurants off the square for a cheaper but equally good meal..

Most charming piazza in Rome . At any time, this is one of my favorite places in Rome, but specially at night. It has lots of beautiful sculptures all around (Bernini and Borromini always fighting each other through art). The "Fontana dei quattro fiumi" is unbelievably beautiful and full of charm. I strongly recommend this beautiful piazza!
One of the mandatory points of interest in Rome.. One of the mandatory points of interest in Rome. however it's very crowded. Nice photo shot opportunity.

Lively & entertaining!. This place is great by day or night. There are plenty of things going off - statues, artists doing live portraits, general entertainers (MJ Tribute) Lots of restaurants & ice cream places. People watching paradise!

Saturday evening. Chaeming music, stunning fountain,artists, lovely reataurants with tables facing the square.... this evening was thoroughly enjoyable. A great way to relax after viewing the wonders of Rome.

Beauty !!!. Its one of the most beautiful places in Rome!!! One must be there to experience the fountain,the serenity around ,looking at the people sitting around the cafes, the artists making your paintings...its a must see.!!!
Beautiful. Gorgeous. Worth seeing. The best mortadella sandwich in the small boutique. Live music and restaurants.
More Fabulous Bernini Sculptures. Stroll through the Piazza and enjoy beautiful art. Stop and have a refreshment and people watch. We saw a guy doing some magic and it was most enjoyable.

Very interesting :-) . There are lots of people in this area selling their items or arts. Painting, musician, artists and many others. There are lots of coffee shops and restaurants as well. Really must go and see. Don't miss it :-)

Art for sale and people trying to beg for money.. I was not in Rome to buy art but was tempted after seeing the beautiful pictures on display. Looked like reproductions and didn't check the price. Also many street performers - entertaining.

Beautiful Navona. Love at first sight: beautiful fountains, Bernini, architecture, local artists ... Piazza is so picturesque, with plenty of street artists, cafes and restaurants stunning views in all directions.

Great for people watchinh. Second visit to Rome and gravitated to this Piazza on a number of occasions. It's beautiful, has a good buzz and great if you like people watching. Food over priced. Even a simple gnocchi is €15, plus service added to the bill that reads "tip not included". Unsure that the 15% service was if not a tip. One course pasta dish and diet coke came to €27! Outrageous even by my London standards. Still love the square though.

Crowded but fun. Enjoyed a simple lunch and then the tartufo at Tre Scalini. Famous and justifibly so.The scarf hawkers can be bargained down and the funniest was the man who seemed to be playing an accordion, actually had a recording, karaoke style.Unfortunately the crowds made it difficult to see and enjoy the beauty of this elegant piazza.

Many tourists. Many tourists surrounded the fountains. We wanted to have a glass of wine in the piazza and watch the people go by, so we finally found a table and ordered our wine. No food. They charged a service charge of two euros to sit at their table and drink our 7 euro glass of wine.
Piazza Navina great by night or day. Loved the buzz of this piazza. Lots to see and keep you entertained. Great restaurants too. Visited in the day and went back in the evening to eat.

A must visit attraction. This is one of the places you have to visit when in Rome. It is one of those places to just sit on the benches with a Tartufo (chocolate speciality ice cream) and soak up the atmosphere. The fountains are fabulous!

Artists Area. This is a lovely traffic free Piazza, even although it was busy there was plenty of room for everyone.Well worth a visit to see all the street artists at work.
There is a really good restaurant called Ostera? on the street behind the Piazza.

Beautiful. The best time to go is early in the morning when there are few people around. Tourists begin to come in (huge groups) after 9:30am. Artists (some local & not) start putting up their display. Wonderful, peaceful, & safe to sit around the Piazza at night.

Overpriced restaurants, but worth the experience. Loved sitting in the Piazza and watching people while having dinner. Had a lovely dinner, albeit overpriced, but enjoyed the entire experience. Wanted to visit here since the big scene in Eat, Pray, Love was filmed here!
amazing fountain. Simply fantastic piece of Roman sculpture work a amazing fountain lots of nearby restaurants but beware they can be expensive so choose carefully

Grab a cappuccino !. We enjoyed the piazza with the great views and fountain. The artists that have their wares out and some of the performers had great music! We liked sitting in the outdoor cafe and having a rest from all the walking about!
Lovely. My favorite in Rome, always first place we visit, sit down in many cafes around, enjoy the gorgeous fountains, walk around, look at the artist plying there art, people watching....
Awesome Fountain. The fountain is definitely not to be missed. It is a good place to sit and do some people watching. Very close to museums and on the way to see the Trevi Fountain.

Lively atmosphere in popular piazza.. On arrival in Piazza Navona, you immediately feel the buzzing of the ambience. In between the three fountains are numerous artists and street entertainers to greet you. Watch the skill of a painter as he or she, produce a 'masterpiece' in a few minutes using spray cans. Or an oriental artist making a name picture using graphics with a small felt tipped pad.
Must-place. The most interesting thing in Rome is tp sit in Piazza Navona, drink Champagne and look people, who are there or are walking around. Families, many nationalities, all kind of people.

Lots of Fun to people watch!. This Piazza is one of the more fun ones that we visited when in Rome. We picked up dinner from a local restaurant and took it to one of the benches. From there we were able to watch all of the street vendors as well as people watch. It was a lot of fun, and a really easy way to spend an hour or two!

Great people watching place!. My mum and I stopped at the Piazza Navona for a bit of a break from walking around the city. It was a beautiful day and we decided to sit in a nice shady spot and enjoy a drink and share of a pizza. It's obviously a popular place for tourists, and that is reflected in the prices (almost €10 for a pint of peroni!) but it's kind of worth it just to take in the atmosphere. My mum and I are big fans of people watching and this is a great place to do it - our personal highlight was seeing a Nun on a tour with a selfie stick! Not something you see every day! Highly recommend this area, so long as you're prepared to pay a bit extra.

Beautiful Piazza. This Piazza is stunningly beautiful surrounded by great architecture, central fountains with Bellini sculptures. The Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi is wonderful.Along the sides of the piazza are restaurants, we enjoyed a delicious meal watchiing the bustle of the piazza as the sunset and evening fell. In the centre of the piazza are the fountains and also vendors selling prints & souvenirs.Great for people watching, fantastic atmosphere, tourist prices.
Beautiful Eternal City. Astonishing. One of the main squares in Rome. Nice atmosphere and good restaurants. Interesting, to visit in the morning and also in the evening.

Our favorite piazza. Love this piazza eat at two restaurants here one for lunch and one for dinner both times price was good and food was good .Also bought so lovely paintings from a very nice pleasant artist

Never tire of the atmosphere. The restaurants are touristy and pricey, but worth it for the view and soaking up the atmosphere. I never cease to wonder at the work that must have gone into the Fontana and what it represents.

All roads lead to... Piazza Navona. Just loved this Piazza; it's a 'must see'. Not only is the piazza just beautiful, but the street performers and artists make it an incredible place to just relax for a few minutes. You can enjoy really great food at any of the restaurants, or just stop in for a caffe. I'm always surprised that the prices in such amazing locations are not ridiculuously higher; you can enjoy a caffe for under 3e.
What a work of art. A wonderful fountain with a fantastic nearby museum and many fantastic restaurants in the piazza. Definitely worth seeing x

Wonderful piazza, lots to see!. Have been here quite a few times over the years and I still love it. Especially the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi is wonderful. It's great to see, but also hear someone telling you what you're really looking at. There is always so much to see on this square, very good for people watching.

People watching . This square is stunningly beautiful completely lined with restaurants and bars. The centre hasten large fountains and packed with vendors selling prints, souvenirs and nic nacs. On the down side the food and drink is hugely overpriced, as a operator myself I know, and cover charges are in full force. You are paying for the setting only. Having said that the people watching and atmosphere is fantastic.
Side streets worth a walk through. Navona area still very pleasent to visit but more about passing through in exploration of adjoining streets with lots of bohemian boutiques and cafés to enjoy.
Trendy. a fair distance from our hotel with lots of activity going on. From jugglers to street artist Lots of cafes to people watch and soak up the atmosphere

Visited several times!. Piazza Navona is super touristy, but also really special. The fountains are beautiful -- I recommend seeing them in the day and when they are lit at night. Restaurants line the piazza -- they are definitely touristy, but the people watching can't be beat. It's a fun stroll, with street performers and people from all over the world.

Great for people watching. Very near to the Pantheon so very busy especially on a Sunday when it appears that all of Rome is out on the town. Find a step and sit and people watch. Large crowds gather here so you may get trampled on ! The fountain was not going when we visited but it was one place not covered in screens and or scaffold
great entertainment. Piazza Navona proved to be an outstanding way to spend an evening in Rome. Yes, there were tourists, but also plenty of locals. The atmosphere was relaxed and playful.
This is Rome!. This Piazza is stunning! You can spend the whole day here listening to music, getting something to eat and just soaking up the ambiance
Wonderful Square. There is such an amazing atmosphere in this square. I loved going there are watching the artists paint portraits. Beautiful fountains and great place for people watching.
Wonderful fountains in this Piazza. A nice walk in piazza Navona that takes you to wonderful sculptured statues and monuments. Rome is wonderful!!

WOW!. what an amazing buzz to visit Piazza Navona. There was so much going on and so many people. Had a great time just people watching and checking out the artists, stalls, and performers. Definitely worth a visit.

You should drink but NOT eat in square!. Piazza Navona was a great experience. The square was beautiful and there were street performers doing really cool things. My husband and my only mistake was eating at the overpriced, poor food quality restaurants in the square. Great to sit and have drinks and enjoy the shows but you will be dissatisfied with the FROZEN food and overly expensive bill.

Beautiful square. . A must see. Great to relax and sit at the fountain and enjoy a gelato. The sculptures are beautiful and plenty to see.
Lovely church to visit too.
diversity. this is a nice piazza where you can find almost everything - food, paintings, beautiful fountain, icecream, all in one place, well hidden between flats.
Lovely. Great place for a stroll a cafe Americano and a little shopping. Also a great place to get your pocket picked when crowded. Don't miss the roasted chestnuts.

Just lovely!. The piazza is a lovely place to have lunch and people watch. It's a large piazza and buzzing with life. There's an impressive central fountain and an arty market was in place. Definitely recommended.
Great Plaza. Lots of vendors were in the area of this wonderful plaza. Bought some paintings and enjoyed a coffee. Nice place!

We stumbled upon this by accident. We took a cab to a restaurant nearby that ended up being closed and just by accident stumbled into this Piazza by chance. It was in the evening and there is no central lights, just the lights from the restaurants surrounding the square. To really take in the beauty of the fountains you have to go in the daytime. At night they have street entertainers around the square, singing, juggling and such, so that was kind of nice. We had a really nice meal at one of the restaurants on the square called Tucci Restaurante
was under restoration so drained of water. even though fountain was drained and drained of water it still is breath taking, worth a wander to if you in the center of rome
Beautiful. Great place, lots of interesting things like street artists, historical buildings, restaurants, souvenir shops...
Beautiful but crowded. You could grab a pizza slice from a nearby shops , and enjoy the beautiful sight. But, beware of the hawkers always coming to sell unwanted toys.
Must see especially for children. This is a very interesting and fun spot. They have local artists, food, and interesting people along with the interesting fountain.
Beautiful. A gorgeous place to sit and watch the world go by. All types of entertainment available to help enjoy the sunshine. A fantastic group playing tango music when we were there.

Favourite. Found this by accident. Large piazza with room for three fountains and at least six restaurants. I've forgotten which is market day, but there are always things going on there, particularly local artists. The restaurant menus are all pretty much the same (excellent), so we settled on the one with the most comfortable seats and the nicest waiters!! I actually went there earlier than Nov 14 but that's as far back as the list would go!! But, once visited, never forgotten.
The best square in Rome. There is always so much happening in this square, entertainment, caricatures and some great restaurants that you can watch the world go by
Very romantic . Beautiful to visit at night, the lighting makes the whole place majestic! A must see on a trip to Rome.
Very nice!. A very nice square. Beautiful fountains, lots of artists doing charcoal characteristics for €10 each, they are very good and funny, worth it if you haven't had one before!
Under maintenance. It was a very bad luck when we reached there and all the area was under maintenance.I hope i can visit again someday!
You need to visit several times. Every time you go it is a new experience., always very pleasant.Shoping, foof, ace cream, music, painting, etc

My favorite piazza in Rome!. Street musicians, sidewalk artists, ancient fountains, sidewalk cafes, people watching. . . Piazza Navona has it all. Fun during the day, and even better at night. Make sure to try a chocolate gelato from Tre Scalani. It is amazing!

Full of it.!. This square is full of history, restaurants, artists, tourists, you name it. The locals seem to like this place as well. Because of the number of entertainers in this square we spent about a good amount of time. watching them locals exhibit their talent.

Have a chocolate truffle at the gelato stand!. the only place offering a truffle. Our first pizza was as amazing as promised and a spritz to drink. Fountains were beautiful. One on north side was down for construction. Didn't see a place to make a wish, so I saved it.

Plenty to look at in this beautiful piazza. Wether its architecture, shops or stalls for souvenirs,people watching, food or gelato this beautiful piazza is a great stop on your Rome itinerary.
The food opportunities around the piazza are often more expensive than those in adjacent streets.
Beautiful square.. If i had time enough, i could spend here 2 or 3 hours to enjoy the atmosphere! Beautiful fontain, great buildings and such a beautiful square in the city centre!
Favorite Piazza. Everytime we are in Rome we always visit this Piazza. It has all the beauty and vibe of Rome. Fountains, restaurants, people, makes it such a fun place.
space for everything. If you want to see night life then go there it's big space for excellent restaurants not expensive for shows pictures and lovely fontanna in the middle of this
So beautiful,. This visit was surreal, very crowded. Still a great place to visit. I would go back in a minute. Took some beautiful pictures in front of this statue.
a piazza full of life. Wonderful buildings around the square, wonderful fountains and statues! Lots of cafes and restaurants.
Worth seeing but it's not the best thing. We had to visit this while walking through to other attractions and it takes some good photos in the sunshine

Beautiful Piazza. Piazza Navona is a large square with 3 large fountains in the centre. There are lots of street performers, artists and vendors selling jewelry and crafts. You can enjoy a meal at one of the many restaurants lining the square or buy some gelato and enjoy the atmosphere. A lovely place to relax and watch the world go by.
Stunning. Such a picturesque area of the city with lots of street artists, cafes restaurants and stunning views in every direction. Just around the corner from Pantheon so 2 birds with one stone.

Huge Piazza - always busy!. This is the largest piazza in Rome. The Bernini fountain is the centrepiece attraction for obvious reasons.
The area is certainly a tourist trap, so I would not eat in the square area. It's quite expensive and the food quality is not good. Perhaps have a coffee or glass of wine and people watch for an hour or so.

Lovely place to take a break, surrounded by extraordinary art and architecture. And of course other tourists like yourself. But if you are patient, the view you want to photograph will be freed up in just a few minutes. While you are waiting for that all important shot of the fountain, you can listen to the Piazza Navona Band or some of the other buskers, stop for a drink in one of the cafes, or browse the souvenir stalls - one man's tat in another man's treasure.

Huge plaza, a must see. Such a huge plaza in the middle of the city. Easy to reach from the other sites, and strangely not overcrowded with tour busses. Lots of benches to sit and relax on or to people watch. There are also plenty of restaurants and bars in the plaza if your in need of some refreshment. Nice place to sit a refuel (and use the toilets) before the long hike to the Vatican.

The heart of Roman Rome. When you look at a map, the shape gives away the fact that this is a stadium, in fact the stadium of Domitian. Today, he shape tells you as none of the Roman ruins are available, instead the place is a tribute to the art of Bernini and Borromeo. It is a busy, noisy place, despite being pedestrian. It is full of people selling rubbish, the restaurants are overpriced and tout constantly for custom, and it is an ideal spot to get your pockets picked.However, it is one of the nicest places in Rome. Just wander round and admire and then sit at a terrace to sip a prosseco or have a coffee. Sure you'll pay for the privilege, but prices are still low compared to other capitals and it is well worth enjoying the atmosphere of the place. We always go back,and we always stay for a drink.

Beautiful Fountain but very touristy. Lovely square with an amazing fountain but the whole area is so touristy that we didn't stay very long. Well worth visiting if you are in the area but if you can't fit it into your schedule, don't worry about it.

Nice to see!!. Nice place to look around. Alot of people selling Art and other goodsThere is 3 fountains here. The main fountain is very interesting from the meaning of the 4 figures from the fountain.
romes finest piazza. harder to find than the trevi fountain but a much better experience walk around the piazza to get the ambiance have a drink in one of the bars and visit the basilica.

Must see but very touristy. The square has changed a lot since i was last here - loads of tacky stalls and people pestering you to buy things. Restaurants have also gone a bit downhill - with key selling points advertised for one restaurant 'no frozen food'... say it all! However, i did manage a very nice breakfast, and you can't help but enjoy the beautiful architecture and fountains!

Breathtaking, even when crouded. Sunday was not a good choice for a visit, but still... The photos speak for themselves! Piazza Navona is definitely one of the most beautiful squares in Rome. 100% worth-visiting

Favourite Square. This is my favourite Square in Rome that we visited. Very crowded with artists selling paintings or painting you. some live music around and lots of photo opportunities. We got an ice cream, sat on one the benches and watched the world go by. Not to be missed, even if very crowded.

The most beautiful fountains are in Rome !. Rome is the city of fountains and you can just sit in front of the these incredible masterpieces and enjoy the breathtaking sculpture and details. Definitely not sitting at any of the cafes, restaurants and bars that are around the square!
Fun place in the evening. Lots of activity here. Restaurants and street performers abound. Beautiful fountain and just a nice place to hang out.

Beautiful place. I only spent about 30 minutes here maximum, but it was by far one of my favourite places I visited in Rome. The place is so beautiful, especially the three fountains. A must do I think when visiting the city!

Gorgeous Place with 3 Fountains. Really interesting place in Rome, 3 beautiful fountains and a lot of street comerciants with caricatures, pictures etc. Lots of bars and cafes on the side. Really beautiful streets all around.
Beautiful. This is a cracking place to just sit with a Gelato and watch the world go by .. street artists and wonderful places to grab a coffee
Cool down. A place with awesome history and a place where the local Italian go to cool down in the evening .recommended you visit in the evening
The best Piazza in Rome. You will spend many hours there just watching artists painting,dancing, acting.Both of the fountains are remarkable impressive. Try the local tartufo.It' s delicious!
Breathtaking area of Rome. It's just one of my favorite places to stroll, sip prosecco, or enjoy a gelato while being entertained by artists and performers.
Amazing. Spent our last night at the piazza and had lovely meal and then enjoyed the art and the entertainment
True Italy found here .... This is another one of those places where it's a quick stop, but in this case can be longer if one lingers at the shops, cafes and pizzerias. Enjoy!

Magical!. Piazza Navona was filled with the vibrancy of musicians, tourists, and artists. The architecture is magnificent, and the trio of fountains that adorn the square are striking. Visiting this square is a must!

Piazzariffic.. You're in Rome, surrounded by Bernini fountains, cafes, bad street art and tourists. But you're in Rome. And when you leave there are cool winding side streets everywhere with some pretty nice stuff if you look between all the t-shirts and pizza places.

Visit early in the day before the hordes of other tourists arrive. Visit early in the day before the hordes of other tourists arrive. Very pretty fountain with restaurants close by along with lots of artists displays to look at and buy.
Beautiful but expensive. As expected, food and drink is very expensive here but it's a very pretty square so maybe worth an expensive drink for a half hour or so!

The best for people watching!. While nice to see it in the early morning before the crowds gather, the real delight is to be there in there in the late afternoon to early evening. There are many artists and their works for sale, but also bands, solo musicians, and comedy acts. The piazza is centrally located and well worth the visit. The food and drink in the piazza is overpriced and not very good.

Very busy. A very popular attraction with bustling crowds and full of restaurants trying to con you into paying 8 euros for coffee plus 20% for sitting outside but this is normal all over Rome. Beautiful fountains and architecture.

Beautiful. We visited the plaza on a Rainey and sunny day. When it rains the crowds are sparse but come the sunshine the crowds follow. However it's worth the visit, be aware that you'll pay a premium if you want to eat or drink in the pavement cafes

Piazza Navonne Not To Be Missed. Piazza Navona is a beautiful place to visit especially at night with all the lights. Lots of restaurants of course but quieter on nearby side streets. Lovely selection of art to choose from with a multitude of local artists spread out throughout the square. Be prepared to be annoyed by the hawkers.

Awe inspiring!. My friend and I sat and had an espresso and dessert at a little cafe called Tre Scalini and breathed in the sites and sounds. Fantastic service! My friend forgot her hat at the table and about 20 minutes later the waiter had tracked us down on the other side of the Piazza Navona - so nice!

Don;t miss out on this in Rome!. A big piazza where tourists, artistic locals and dining is put in one place. It amazing to admire the area as it is. There are restaurants where you can eat that has an amazing view of the Piazza.

Lovely square to daydream the hours away. Beautiful square surrounded by lots of restaurants and bars and a church. The restaurants are friendly and welcoming whether it is just for drinks or drinks and food. Such a great atmosphere, you could spend all day and night here.

Great place to visit. There on a sunny day watching the performers and artists. The 2 fountains and beautiful church are worth a visit and a few pictures. Lots of places for a sprtiz. We also walked through one rainy evening and it was still magical
Favourite place in Rome. Great site for people watching and buskers. Lots of restauhere but watch out for the expensive ones, they charge you just to sit on the edge of the street.
Beautiful Photo Op. This fountain is located in a very busy intersection (round about). It is worth the stop and taking a look. The statues are beautiful and intricately carved.
Amazing fountain. This site is a must see when your visiting Rome. you will enjoy the area and taking photos. Amazing fountain
Great place but check out the church. Interesting history and lists of ice cream shops andvrestaurants. The statues are interesting but the best invite church on the long side. It's awesome. .
Anazing. Wonderful place to relax and get a bite to eat. So many artists and musicians. People everywhere! It was so interesting.

Enjoyed the street musicians and good place to people-watch. We ate at Tre Scalini for dinner in the Piazza Navona and it was ok. My wife and I really enjoyed some of the musicians that played in the Piazza, but didn't really like some of the vendors hawking the selfie stick, cheap toys, or the scarves.

Great place to see.. Great way to spend time in Rome. We went there on a friend recommendation. We had a wonderful time. Try to eat on the side streets not the main square lots of good restaurants and shops.

Best Entertaining Piazza in Rome. A very lively place to visit. and ensure your loved ones are on skylinewebcams so they can see you there (We did it, its easy to work out where the cam is)Lots of entertainment and restaurants, from spray painters, singers (The Jamaican singer was awesome) and craft stuff.Sit at table, order wine and pizza and watch the world go by. Wonderfully entertaining place to go.

A must to visit. The architecture is to die for with amazing statues. This is also a focus for arts, with living statues to add to the marble kind. It is a tourist attraction so is busy, but it's worth just sitting and taking in the atmosphere, and watching the people going by.

Beautiful area !!. This is a beautiful area of Rome , the fountains being the main attraction, have been here in the day and also at night, there is always something going on , lots of entertainers , artists displaying their work of which you can buy, and lots of cafes and restaurants in the square itself, nice to just sit here and watch the world go by

Worth a visit at night. I went to this piazza both during the day and at night, it was a lot less crowded at night which made it a much more peaceful experience. It has, what seems like, one of the only few working fountains in Rome at the minute, a lot we walked past are waterless or under refurbishment (became a bit of a running joke). So for that reason alone I'd suggest going, it is a lovely fountain. There are also plenty of lovely eateries near by, not just on the main piazza but in the side streets as well. Great area to come to have dinner, felt very safe walking around at night.
The Grand Plaza of Rome. So cool; artists, shops, fountains, and great people watching. This piazza met its billing as the center of Rome in terms of largest square with all the trimmings.
Perfect Sunday Morning.. Perfect Sunday morning at this beautiful square. Sat with a coffee taking in the fountains, buildings, street artists and paintings. And no cars!!

Nighttime visit. We stopped buy after dark and it was a flurry of activity. Lots of street performers, vendors and tons of visitors. The fountains are lit and look great at night. We didn't have any problems, but it seemed like a great place for pickpockets, so be careful. Tons of restaurants, but I'd recommend getting off the piazza a block or two and finding something a bit more intimate.

Must See Bernini's Work. Crazy, hectic, tourist filled but a must-see in Rome. Keep your handbag secured, shifty people lurking. Do go in the beautiful cathedral in the Piazza. Enjoy Bernini's beautiful fountain.

Italian city scene, shopping, food. Beautiful, true Italian city scene! Easy to access by following the map streets and there was many artisans with items for purchase. It was very crowded on a Wednesday afternoon. I wish there were more benches around the fountain.

Beautiful Piazza. We visited this beautiful piazza in July, and it was not busy or overcrowded at all. The fountains are stunning and the whole square is surrounded by beautiful buildings. The history of this piazza is incredible and the architecture is amazing.

Piazza Navona. Very nice place to visit on a sunny day, plenty of food and drink places for people watching. Wonderful fountains. However, as with most of Rome it is cheapened by the incessant sellers of tacky rubbish and beggars.

Wonderful Experience. Vibrant area, fountains, lights, old buildings & a square of restaurants. We ate at a restaurant at the end of the fountains, ? name, but large enough to distinguish, on left of fountains. Food, wine fantastic, & reasonably priced. Approx 100 euros for 4. Manager gave us ? champaigne for waiting to be seated, 5 mins. Placed us at edge of square so that we could view all activities. plus good for smokers. Street performers A1 in these seats but sellers took advantage. Manager saw them off as he would but everyone has a living to make !! Apparently this is a place to do by the hoi polloi Can only say great cheap night out in a great district.
Don,t miss this!. On a summers day you must sit and eat here. The fountains, artists and their paintings will thrill you. It is not expensive and you get a real feel of Rome.

My favourite piazza. This piazza is worth visiting at any time of the day, due to the art stalls and entertainment within the square throughout the day. Sit at one of the cafes around the square and people watch!

Artistic hub, surrounded by restaurants and museums.. One of my favorite places in Rome! I love the buzz, the artists, the music and the restaurants. The fountains are gorgeous, the atmosphere electric. It's beautiful, especially at night.

Roman History 1.3. Visited here in fall with three young children. The crowds were manageable during this off peak period. Unfortunately the area has been under renovation for some time and it continues. The visit was not worth it. Check the Internet for updates.

Beautiful piazza. A very large imposing piazza with a very impressive fountain in the centre of the four rivers along with two other fountains at either end of the piazza. Lots of touristy restaurants and gift shops, a great atmosphere.

Beautiful piazza, stunning fountain, but touristy. Lovely venue and fabulous Bernini fountain, but try to visit in more the off hours. Weekends are especially crowded and there are lots of distracting tourist oriented things going on - street performers, vendors, etc., that have nothing to do with the piazza or Rome. Don't miss going in lovely S. Agnese in Agone Church!

Gorgeous all around.. I'm a huge fan of architecture, whether it be modern, ancient, or in between. Piazza Navona holds a very special place in my heart. The area has a crowd but is not overly crowded, plenty to see and do. Beautiful restaurants with great taste; also there were paintings and nicnacs being sold during my visit. The fountains are spectacular. The entire area is kept up with and very clean. Totally recommend this area for anybody who's visiting Rome the first time or for the 13th time. Will post pictures soon!

Go for lunch and visit the oiazza. Beautiful piazza. Many restaurants around the fountain. Especially nice at night. remember whenever traveling in Italy to be aware of your surroundings.we were told to be ware of pickpockets throughout Italy. Stay out of crowds. We never saw anyone who had a problem. There are people trying to sell you things in every piazza in Italy. No different than any other risk destination t
Beautiful Plaza. A beautiful plaza with plenty of cafes and shops. A very busy plaza due to the Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini and its close proximity to the Pantheon.
Activity galore. This square contains many cafes and restaurants, three fountains, street entertainers and a large beautiful church.
Where to eat in Rome. This is a great place to eat in Rome the food is very good on top of that you get great street entertainment
Lovely piazza.. A stunning Piazza but crowded with tourists and buskers. Restaurants over priced and too busy. Children liked some of the street performers however and the fountain was nice too

Well worth seeing but inevitably busy. Another must see architectural gem of Rome with gigantic fountain sculptures and wonderful buildings. Despite being a very wet day it was crammed with tourists. Unfortunately that's unavoidable in Rome. Probably best to avoid the high priced tourist cafes and restaurants on the perimeter unless you really want to watch half the world go by.
Great fountain and well used square . Locals come here, but mostly tourists and hawkers. Still, worth seeing. Walk the little streets from here to the Pantheon.

Simply amazing. The fountains and their intricate sculpting, the glorious cathedral, the old buildings, the restaurants, the street artists and the whole atmosphere screams la dolce vita. It is our tradition that at the very least, to have our last diner at one of the piazza's eateries. Other than that, we are regular pilgrims, day and night, just to soak up the charm and history. Wish we could stay forever.
Beautiful Piazza. Lovely Piazza with lots of restaurants and cafes. Lots of artists with reasonably priced painting and drawings of various sites in Rome.
Lively!. This square is full of street performers and nice restaurants. It is a nice day out or just go and have a glimpse around your schedule
Beautiful Bernini fountains. great atmosphere, resembles Place du tertre in Rome, the fountains with statues are amazing, even more beautiful than the Trevi fountain

Beautiful Statues and Fountain Surrounded by Vendors/street performers. Beautiful statues and fountain. Lots of vendors during the day and lots of street performers at night. The perimeter is surrounded by restaurants and cafes. In the middle is a beautiful church of St.Agnes. While we're were there they had an opera concert in the evening in the church sacristy.
The place to watch the world go by. A lovely piazza with great fountains, atmosphere and bars. Take a drink, relax and watch the world go by! The prices in the bars are high but not unreasonable.
Awesome place. What can you say? Giant public statues and a space with a real buzz about it. And another one of the many free historic places to visit in Rome

Marvellous! . Love Piazza Navona. Just walking around, feeling the atmosphere. If you're going to one of the restaurants, you're obviously going right in to a tourist trap. But sometimes it's worth it just to be able to feel, observert and enjoy!

Great place to people watch!. While in Rome we arranged a few excursions and the meeting place was the Piazza Navona. Would have happily sat in the piazza all day watching the world go by.
