There are a number of street artists and performers to entertain as well as amazing architecture and fountains. There are a number of cafe bars to chose from and while they are a bit more expensive than other areas in Rome, it is to be expected. The piazza is bustling with tourists and artists but it is still possible to sit and and imagine chariots racing around the cobbled arena when it was originally built.

A lovely place to people watch... A great place to visit, the food was a little pricey for what it was but that's to be expected. An Italian Covent Garden but worth a visit. Surrounded by beautiful architecture.

Nice evening Piazza. Great historic location, lovely atmosphere with artists in the centre. Historic fountains using interesting sculpture but not very impressive use of water. Plenty of restaurants around the Piazza but no public toilets nearby.

Bernini Fountains Amazing. Always busy - great sculptures I could just stare at all day, there is just so many details to admire and admire.The piazza is always busy with street artists - one man was levitating and people were taking his photograph- it provided real entertainment as if the photographers did not place money in his pot he became quite aggressive, but there wasn't much he could do to stop it. He was way over the top and had he have been pleasant he would surely have incensed his days takings. There were a variety of artists and people selling their wears and plenty of places to get a coffee should you wish.

Multi-media show before the term was invented.. Another great example of Bernini's multi-media dog and pony show. Done to glorify the Catholic church during the time of the Counter Reformation. Bernini's was the Pope's visual propagandist in chief. And, oh the magnificent craftsmanship!

Great place to visit and admire all the stalls. We found this gem of a square nearly by accident but its a lovely spot to visit. There is a large fountain in the middle and the whole piazza is filled with artists selling some incredible paintings. You can get your chariacture done, or an amazing portrait or just browse some of the wonderful paintings of Rome and Italy. Priced vary greatly but aren't overly expensive compared to other places. There are loads of restaurants/cafes around the square but we didn't eat in any of them so can't say price wise how they faired.
Wonderful. The fountain of the 4 rivers (Angels and Demons) a lovely church and good dining. Add to this lots of art stalls and street performers. Greatstalls

Lovely Piazza. This is a huge piazza in navona and must not be missed. Its heavily crowded during the day. Fortunately I was staying close by so I used to visit this place early in the morning and not a soul was around. During the day the cafes open up all around the square and there is a huge exhibition and sale of art all over the place. The fountains in this place are as beautiful as the rest in Rome. A great Piazza to visit and spend an evening.

Ok for a stroll. Cute square. It's not as busy as around the Pantheon or Spanish Steps. It's still quite touristy with crappy tourist restaurants all over. At least you can sit on the benches and walk through the art stands. Given that it's free and you can actually walk in peace, I give it an OK if you want a nice stroll.

Must see. One of the 'must-sees' in Rome. The fountains are beautiful, especially on a hot summer's day. Whilst the restaurants can be expensive, in the morning have a coffee 'al bar' - at the counter and it will only cost about 1.5 euro and you can sip like the Romans do.

Piazza & Fountains, architecture, Incredible!!!. The surroundings are amazing!! The incredible fountains alone you can study all day long. Details are phenomenal! Then looking up at the clock in the center of the great piazza with it's steeple, breathtaking!! I tended to avoid shopping in the piazza itself as I felt disappointed to find it to be the same repetitive paintings & street faire found all over the place, not unique or interesting to me. On the other hand, MUST, MUST, MUST, check out the shops surrounding the piazza!!! I thoroughly enjoyed purchasing locally handmade leather journals & diaries, beautiful reproduction ancient Roman coins, soldiers, statues, artifacts, etc, gorgeous music boxes, jewelry, porcelain statuary, dolls, mythical creatures, swords, costumes & so much more with out the big tourist vibe & repetitive stores & keepsakes.

Piazza Navona. Was crowded but still a good place to stop for a snack or drink at one of the sidewalk cafes and watch the people. The Piazza has had many artists displaying their work as well as a few street musicians or performers to see as well. This area is also a nice area to find a hotel near by because of the central location that allows one to walk to many "must see" sites such as the Roman Forum, Pantheon, and Vatican. Also many nice small restaurants just off Piazza We especially liked the Cul de Sac wine bar and cafe.

value. This is an area of historical relevance and great beauty so well worth the visit. Just be aware that just a block away in any direction, you can find a restaurant or vendor which is less expensive and equally charming. Way overpriced comparatively!
Great plaza. It is nice sit around and rest. Very nice water fountain. There's a nice church but after st Peter others don't look great anymore. There are amateur artist around.
Lovely spot. Again, we really enjoyed this because of our expert guide who have us the neck story. Good food and joyful and romantic after dark.
beautiful. The sun was shining so it was extra special, the place was really buzzing, loads of little shops and antique places.

Experience lively Rome". What a beautiful piazza...lots to do and see.We simply walked thru on our self-guided tour of Rome one evening. There were artists and other talented performers out to entertain the masses. The piazza is surrounded by restaurants and gelato places. A very lively place to enjoy a taste of Rome... Especially if you're only there for a day or two.

more than meets the eye. we stayed at the Relais de Senato, just off the Piazza Navona and the location could not be better! the Piazza is lively, exciting, full of people selling 'art', living statues and even fortune tellers. However, in our apartments was a pillar, a fragment of an old Roman stadium, much of which lies beneath the Piazza still. at the end of the Piazza you can enter a basement to view parts of the old stadium. It certainly gives you an extra shiver to think that, where you eat your ice cream or drink your coffee, people watched boxing, poetry readings, speaking contests, races and javelin events 2000 years ago!
Spend a short time here.. Lots of artists, peddlers, very commercial, expensive area, but a must see. Spend about an hour there and continue foot tour.

Romantic & unforgettable!. First time here was during a nice October evening: musicians, painters, artists,... There was a lovely atmosphere.The 3 fountains made it even better, the centre fountain being breathtaking.It's nice in the movie ' angels and demons' but even better in real life.In fact: if you like movies and are going to visit Rome,watch the movie and you surely will recognize some places when visiting Rome!

A piazza for selling paintings. It is a super busy place. With artists putting up their work for sale. Saw heavy police patrolling, meaning could be a hot spot for crime too (not that i saw any), in my 2 visits of 2 hours each. Interesting to see painters doing extempore painting. I even ended up buying few pieces of art, considering they were irresistable. Haggling is common and acceptable . Beware - your haggling skills may well be tested here;)

One of the most beautiful places in Rome. In the middle real art work of Bernini and next to it both smaller fountains of Giacomo della Porta. So beautiful place to stroll and sit down and enjoy a sunny day.Though must be said, that indian salesmen with their selfie sticks, bubble guns and scarves are annoying. Same salesman can come to you for ten times in a row, not even one minute in between. Hold tight to your belongings, because they might get aggressive. I saw one man spitting passing people because they didn't buy anything.Few moments later the same guy attacked an elderly woman and trying to sell a toy really..) that makes noice when you throw it on a ground. He tried to push the lady to buy it. We were ready to go and defence this lady but luckily her husband stepped in picture here.So careful! Maybe not the best place to go with a full wallet and passports in pocket, but still totally worth visiting.Artwork being sold at the market isn't real. Buy only if you see an artist drawing or painting really. Many of the artworks are prints.. I walked with a real artist there and he told me things I wouldn't have known without his advice.The restaurants are there for tourists. If you're searching a real good place, try to find one where most of clients are Italian. There you are guaranteed that food is good, Italian and ok priced. Works all over in Rome.Take water with you and have a long, nice moment to sit and watch the beautiful art and busy Rome around you.
Angels and Demons. We returned for a 2nd visit and ate close-by. We were not disappointed with the atmosphere, the ocassion of the whole piazza and its fountains, art displays and restaurants

Nice Piazza, great fountain. A really nice Piazza in a city full of them. Have a coffee or an ice cream and just take in the charm of the place. And evening visit is recommended after the heat of the summer day. There's a lovely wee church with magnificent artwork facing the fountain, take a peek inside, you won't regret it.

Wonderful! (But over priced). I visited Rome with a couple of friends and one of the places we went to was the Piazza Navona, this square is beautiful, surrounded by wonderful old buildings with 2 fountains in the center (including the four rivers fountain which is a must see!) The atmosphere is lovely with all the people milling about. Of course as a tourist hot spot all of the restaurants in the square were overpriced but if you walk off the square and go a few roads out the prices drop significantly for exactly the same food!
Enjoy the Fountains. The Piazza is large enough to accomodate three fountains and is a nice place to take a break and enjoy the street performers and selfie takers.

Amazing. Definately worth a visit, and if you value the architecture and craftmanship you'll love this place, not sure what goes on here as everything was closed nearly due to one off day of constant rain but even so it was worth seeing as the fountains in the middle are beautiful, note to all go when sunny might be abit more going on aswell.
Great Plaza. Great Plaza to enjoy. With three different fountains it has it all. Food is good in any of the area Cafe's.

Fun and Interesting. The Piazza Navona was lively and fun especially if you are a people watcher! There are shops, street performers, artists, restaurants and of course the fountains. Go in the evening. It's delightful. Highly recommend.
Energetic place. It's a happening place with performers and the three fountains. It's a long area but it's nice to sit there and soak up the vibe of what's happening

Lovely in the daylight or moonlight. We really loved it however we felt sad that the restaurants that we looked at and the one that we ate at within the Square were a little confusing as the great fixed price offers on the boards outside at the very front, didn't quite match the menu we were given when we sat at a table outside but further away from the main board. We won't name the restaurant as we were not disappointed with the food however it became a bit of an annoying game where I kept on taking the waiter back to the large menu to show him what we expected within the fixed price meal we had ordered. It was all good natured but I think some other less worldly travellers might perhaps receive a larger bill than what they might be expecting.
Cool fountains in area. A nice Sunday walk, the piazza is filled with artist and there are nice restaurants to stop and relax, not terrible crowded, just a real pretty place

Read Below. I've been in rome for more than a year and a half, and there is no square as beautiful and impressive as this one. The fountain of the 4 rivers, the other 2 fountains make it an unique and exceptional piece of art. Having a dinner there or just have a walk is a highly reccomended plan for those coming to Rome. Do not miss it.

Pricey but worth a visit. Piazza Navona is a wonderful place to people watch - beautiful fountains, street artists, performers, locals, tourists - it has them all. Beware! One cup of coffee and one beer cost us over 13 euros - outrageous!! We were sat right at the edge of the cafe with prime viewing but still not worth the money. Also, if you sit on the edge of the cafes you are a prime target for the musicians who come around looking for tips. Worth a visit, but if you plan on having a drink - get the credit card ready!

Great in the evening. It's famous for the three fountains, but the atmosphere here is very especial too. Loots of artists, street musicians and dancers perform here in the evening and theirs charm to the place.

Nice Trevi fountain-like Piazza. Worth a stop the fountains at the Piazza Navona will remind you of Trevi fountain - only there are two fountains and far more space to lounge, and fewer tourist shops, fewer merchants.

Our View from our Apartment above the Piazza. Our apartment was directly above the Piazza - which was a fantastic bonus!! Sitting on the balcony chairs, I think other tourists thought we were locals and were taking photo's of us! At the north-eastern corner of the Piazza is a very good explanation describing the history of the fountains. The Piazza at night comes alive with many people and sounds. In the mornings, when no one is around, it is very peaceful and only the birds are swirling around in the Piazza. Vist was June 18th - 20th 2014, not the one selected below.

Another beautiful Roman Fountain. All the Fountains that I saw in Rome were a joy to behold. The water was cool and fresh, while the Statues were right out of the books of the ancient gods and goddesses the I read about as a student in High School and this one did not disappoint at all. We spend time taking pictures and then wondered around the Plaza that it was in.

LOVED this place. Out walking for an afternoon around Rome relaxing, this place has an amazing vibe and buzz around it. Street performers, fantastic artists and great pavement cafes all make for a brilliant sense of happy and fun. Art is cheap here and there is something for all tastes, definitely a coffee stop for serious people watchers.
Visit at Night!. Another fun place to visit, surrounded by history. Performers and musicians round out the experience.
Beautiful . Beautiful fountain, each side represents the longest river of each continent known at the time. Definitely recommend visiting, beautiful day and night

Lovely area to relax and have a rest. This is an area that truly is stunning I can't believe it's ever quiet though. The fountains are impressive and the fountain of the four rivers is incredible As is the church well worth a stroll round.

A nice busy place. We were here once and also walked by it twice on other days, but this place is very beautifull and there is always something to do. There is a market, people doing street art, people performing. A definite must see if you are in Rome!

Too Crowded. a beautiful piazza however between the crowds, vendors trying to aggressively sell you something and the wait staff of nearby restaurants attempting to lure you into their establishments the surroundings get lost in the shuffle. Try early part of the day when it is quieter; avoid later PM and evenings as it becomes almost a circus atmosphere

A nice place to stroll around!. Piazza Navona has almost everything that you want to experience while in Italy. Surrounded by restaurants, arts, music & people. You can just sit and relax while watching people passing by, street entertainers, artist, or you can just simple enjoy the good food.

A Happening Place. This piazza is abuzz with activity, with throngs of people coming here mostly to view the statues and fountains. There are 3 famous and fabulous fountains: the Fountain of Four Rivers by Bernini, the Fountain of the Moor and the Fountain of Neptune. The square is filled with vendors (mostly painters) selling their wares, musicians and artists. I We were mesmerized by a juggler. The square is surrounded by some very nice restaurants where outside dining is available so you can watch the activities on the square as you dine, as well as the usual array of souvenir shops. There is also a conveniently located ATM machine at one end of the square.

piazza navona. the place itself is beautiful full of tourists and the weather was nice when we visited there we tok pictures near the fountains... but the restaurants around the fountains were too expensive and it is not recommended to sit there and relax if you go out of the area to the other streets around the prices are better.
The Nicest Square in Rome. Stay in this area, visit often admire the fountains, check out the local artists, people watch and become intoxicated by all that is Rome. Don't miss this special place.

The place to be.. This could be the best place to eat, drink and people watch in Rome. Beautiful buildings, statues, fountains with a large area for it all to go in without feeling crowded even when it is. The atmosphere changes with the coming of the evening which is when the restaurants start to fill up. One Piazza - Two styles. A must visit.

People Watching Made Easy. Piazza Navona was a people watchers paradise. I was there in early evening and enjoyed taking in the sights & sounds. Tourists, locals, artists, musicians, selfie stick salesmen, restaurants, shops, fountains & architecture - it's all there.

A beautiful slice of Italian life ! a place to sit and people watch with gorgeous food !. We were lucky enough to be staying five minutes from this glorious Piazza,we were at the Via Die Coranari which in itself is a delight both day and night,and were told by out taxi driver that this was a pride of Rome and rightly so !On turning into it you are met by the most fabulous and elaborate fountains,beautiful white marble of sea gods and monsters ,and one representing four famous rivers of the world,all with tumbling water which cools the area around it,there are ornate benches to sit and watch the world go by and feel the coolness of the water.This area was a chariot racing arena and you can see that clearly from the long shape with rounded ends,it has a very posh Brazilian Embassy on one side,but loads of little shops and superb cafes,with lovely food,we tried a lot ,and the cafes are all red checked tablecloths,candles,flowers,chilled carafes of water,local bread and oil in wicker baskets,which often are free with meal,the water free of course and icy cold. The piazza is full of artists,which use every style and medium you can think of,from caricatures of yourself to high quality oils,and all done on the spot ! the colour and vibrancy is amazing and we went back quite a few times,we watched one old lady do oil painting with her thumb while balancing a canvas on her knees ! and they were lovely ! there are dozens of pretty small cobbled streets leading of from the Piazza and lots of interesting churches,one had the body and relics of a very good man called St.Camillus and they have his skeleton laid out under the actual body,fascinating ! the only thing is getting into churches before they close,they have strange opening hours,we walked to one which was supposed to be open according to the guide book ,but was totally closed,you get the feeling that you are not really wanted in some churches,you walk in,and they follow you with keys and want to lock up ! The one we really wanted to see was by the river and was were all the unknown dead were taken,it is full of high Gothic art and skeletons of the poor ,we would have liked to have seen that ! there was so much to look at around this area,find The Pinochio shop,as the writer was born in this area,the shop is full of working wooden toys and the walls and beams are full of mad working cuckoo clocks all going at once ! there are hundreds and you can order any type and pick it up in a couple of hours !The gelato shops are fantastic,fresh melon,local lemon and orange ices are the speciality,get yourself one,find a bench near the fountains and watch the world go by. This is a really lovely place to visit and eat, cannot recommend highly enough !

Piazza Navona true beauty. Beautiful buildings add to the lovely feeling to this place. Magnificent fountains and cobblestone piazza with artist and misicians and crowds mingeling around. Must visit when in Rome!

Dont miss. I loved this piazza, the hawkers are a real nuisance but the there is so much artwork to see and buy! Great eateries surround the piazza and there is a happy, friendly atmosphere, plenty of seating too for those tired feet
Piazza Navona. Piazza Navona is the heart of Rome for pedestrians with many restaurants and artists,musicians everwhere.I strongly recomment this square to everyone who will visit Rome.

Beautiful Piazza. The fountains and statues in this square are absolutely beautiful, especially at night when they are lit up. The four rivers (Fiumi) fountain in the center is particularly beautiful. The only problem with the piazza is that due to its beauty, it is packed with tourists.The square is surrounded by restaurants, bars, and gelato stores (the latter is never bad) and there is a large church on the west side of the piazza.

A wonderful place to stroll, people watch and eat. Few experiences give more pleasure than having a meal al fresco in Piazza Navona. There must be dozens of welcoming restaurants and gelateria around the square.

Amazing sculpture in water fountain. This was my favourite spot in Roma; this water fountain with its amazing sculpture was mesmerizing. To enjoy it more, you must know the story behind it. The art work, water fountain, piazza surroundings, cafes and art in the afternoon puts you in the Italian set up... a must see!
Just a normal square. This is another of a normal square in Rome which is overcrowded with tourists due to the fountains. Don't suggest to stay long in the square.

Beautiful. Beautiful part of Rome, more restaurant, more street art, music, artist, more tourist nad happy people. And of course beautiful Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (the "Fountain of the Four Rivers", i.e. the Danube, the Ganges, the Nile, and the Rio de la Plata) by Gian Lorenzo Bernini.
A meeting spot for tourists. Mandatory visit during a walk through central Rome, you will see nice buildings, nice square and meeting place plus local painters and various entertainers.
Worth leaning the history. Worth having a guide to explain the fountain and all its meanings. Beautiful sculptures, interesting stories.
WHAT A BAUTIFUL PIAZZA. We hadn't read about Piazza Navona, so it was a delightful surprise when we ventured upon it as part of our segway tour.

Great Piazza . If you visit Rome you really must visit the various piazzas.
You can relax, eat, be entertained.
I preferred these locations to the recognised sites.
Positive energy!. Such a happy place! :) It was a great choice going here after the Pantheon visit! Music, dancing, food, photos, art... ❤

fascinating. you can never get enough of this majestic impressive fascinating monument. No matter how many times, no matter how the weather is and no matter in what condition it is. it so happened when we visited last July it was under renovation, with no water, no lights and no visitors... even this was impressive. How many chances do you get seeing it like this.

Do not miss this piaza when in Rome. This is classic Rome! The people, the statues, the Artists and the cafes! And only a few blocks from the magnificent Pantheon. Do not miss either of these awe striking sites when in Rome.

Great place to eat lunch on a patio. We rented an apartment right around the corner from this Piazza, and so glad we did, as we would probably not have visited it if we hadn't. It was picture perfect in the mornings, hardly any people and peaceful. Lunch time was much busier and a great place to sit in one of the restaurants and people watch. We even had dinner there one night and walked around the square after dinner and saw some amazing artists and the fountains and buildings were beautifully lit. Just a really great spot.
Charming. We loved this piazza. It has beautiful fountains, entertaining street performers, and delicious food. Charming area not to be missed
Nice place. This was not along walk from our hotel and was a nice place to see. It has lots of restaurants in the square.

Excellent. Lovely Piazza where you can stroll and enjoy your surroundings. as well as enjoy the various street artists who "set up shop" here to amaze you with their spray paint art!
On the plus crowds aren't as bad as other places in Rome!

Fond memories of here. I was here many years ago before ever using trip advisor when my sister got married in Rome. Loved Piazza Novona. Told about it during the day and went for dinner in a restaurant recommended that was delicious. Plenty of activity here and lots of entertainers to see. Great nightlife around this are and nearby as apposed to where we were staying. We got the perfect quiet street so sleep was disrupted. Would love to return.

Great People Watching, Good Entertainment!!!. This is really an interesting experience in that we initially thought it was a little bit of a carnival like scene. The musicians were absolutely extraordinarily talented. We stopped by one of the restaurants and had a small bite to eat and a glass of wine, and enjoyed the local music. A beautiful fall day, superb music and exceptional people watching and totally FREE!!!

Beatufull Plc to seat. Went here after the pantheon to eat, the atmosphere was amazing listening to music and watching artist paint and do chararutes. The fountains themselves age just stunning! Def worth a visit
Picturesque pause for Rome. It's pure Rome! Nice courtyard/piazza surrounded by good cafe and restaurants. A nice picturesque pause for experiencing the Rome and its beauty.

Favorite Place In Rome. A friend told us to make sure we visited Piazza Navona on a visit to Rome, and we made sure to take her advice. It turned out to be our favorite place, despite all of the other amazing sites! We went every day to relax with a glass of wine, sometimes had dinner, and just took in all of the sites, sounds, tourists, and locals. Artists, musicians, and restaurants surround what used to be a place for chariot races, and there is always something to draw your attention.
Just another site. Not sure what all the hype was about maybe I didn't get the historical significance behind it but it was just another site to see, for me anyway.
Lots to see and people watch here. The artists selling their work in Piazza Navona are a talented bunch. I bought several pieces from a lovely, friendly artist.

Better by night. we visited piazza navona both by day and night. Very very busy by day, to busyin fact to take it all in. We returned during the night and it was much less busy, fountains all lite up a very few people around, lovely.

lazy days in Rome. we are just back from another wonderful week in Rome.we stayed five minutes away from Piazza Navona,and its a lovely place,so much to see and lots going,we watched couples be painted,listened to the live music a really nice place well worth a visit.

Over run with peddlers. The piazza is nicely laid out and many restaurants to grab a bite or beverage at. However the piazza has way to many peddlers attempting to sell you items and they are very aggressive and don't like being told no.

A must see when in Rome.. The Piazza Navona is a great place to visit. You will find some great restaurants in this area, which caters for all tastes. It's a great place to just sit and watch the world go by. Here you can buy original works of art by local artists. The fountains and sculptures are a joy to see. There are plenty of shops in the little side streets off Piazza Navona where bargains can be found. Well worth a visit!

Classical, Vibrant, Fun. A great Piazza with three beautiful fountains. Cafes and gelato shops ring the outside of the piazza, street performers are there throughout the day and artists sell the perfect image of your Italian holiday. A great place for sitting and being entertained or people watching.

What a special evening..... Visited the Piazza in the evening -marvelled at the fountain of the four rivers, and sat at a little street cafe watching the waters and seeing Rome walk past us. Had dinner at a restaurant off the piazza - cheaper and better food. One of the highlights of our trip and not to be missed. The street venders are a bit of a nuisance - but not enough to spoil the experience.
Lovelly. Lovelly and beautifull this square, with a beautifull fountain in the middle with a lot of history from Roman people.

Better to Sit at a Table and People-Watch. This piazza was okay for walking around, but there are just too many people who all want to be in the same exact spot. It was much more enjoyable to find a table at one of the restaurants, and just people-watch from a quiet distance. Like many piazzas in Rome, Florence and Venice, there were too many pushy peddlers selling useless wares (selfie sticks, glow-in-the-dark toys/balls, scarves, etc.).

Fun and cheerfull. Crowded but cheerfull place, with artists and musicians scattered around. The restaurants around are not the cheapest but also not the most expensive. Its beautiful and crowded both by day and night.

Amazing. One of the most spectacular squares in Rome. Full of life. You can spend hours there. The sculptures are very nice. The fountains there are astonishing. Make sure you have a good camera to shoot.There are a lot of dinning options. Good pizza and pasta

We visited it twice during our stay. Beautiful fountains and very pleasant ambiance. Good restaurants too. This was a dream of my wife since she saw the 1962 movie 'Rome Adventure' (Suzane Pleshette & Troy Donahue)

Just plain fun. This is a crowded and tourist end spit which is none the less the perfect place to hang out and chill after a day of more serious sight seeing. There are lots of dining options. Some very good some not, there's gelato, there are street performers - perfect for people watching and not having to think too hard.

Incredible sculptures. When in Rome, go to Piazza Navona just for the experience. The fountains & sculptures are fantastic! We were there mid-day with thousands of other people so we did not get the full benefit but it is lovely nevertheless. I expect it is even more striking in the evening.
Sept in piazza navona. A lovely large piazza with plenty going on... Lots of street performers/musicians and art for sale...

Pure Classic Art. Crowded and expensive, you may prefer to go after sunset when the weather is still reasonable, but expect top level art to enlighten your eyes.
This is a stunning square (piazza), one of many that make Rome so incredibly beautiful.

Piazza Navona. This was my favourite square in Rome, set in a long square with beautiful fountains and wonderful architecture, the place comes alive with street vendors, musicians and performing artists. There are many streets nearby with craft goods.

Very Interesting Square. We went to Piazza Navona via a tricycle from a very near castle. We gave the man 15€ for the ride. It is a very crowded square with many restaurants all around and lots of painters offering to draw portraits and displaying their work. In the middle there was an interesting dancing show of 5 very energetic young men and other very talented shows. We had Tartufo* in a v famous restaurant there. It is a chocolate ice cream made from 12 different kinds of chocolate.It is a must try desert.look for it.

Nice area but too many people wanted to sell tat. This is a nice area, some people will really love this piazza. However there are too many people trying to sell rubbish. We had a wander around and then moved on to other tourist attractions.
Family tour . Nice place in the evening. We had dinner there. There is also a bar street next to it. Suggest to go there in the evening.Food was tasty but only my pizza navona was burnt...

One of the great squares!. Like everyone we made our way to pizza Navona, beautiful Sun shine lots of people, street artists beautiful fountains. Lots of restaurants not cheap but you can people watch and see the world go by in one of the great squares of Europe.

Chilled Out Culture.....Magical !. Words cannot describe the atmosphere you will walk into in Rome's Piazza Navonna !!!You could literally spend all day wandering around, soaking up the atmosphere, enjoying the artists and other culturists displaying their 'art' & performing...I found it totally mesmerising and ended up dancing with my partner to a superb Saxophonist who randomly appeared in front of the cafe we were eating and drinking outside. Along came a guitarist who joned him and the next thing....we too had joined in with an impromtu dance..Totally fabulous and well worth a visit. Its a great place to just sit and 'people watch' too with a glass of wine or beer in the sunshine and literally just ENJOY LIFE.I loved it and will definitely go there again.
One of the nicer Piazzas of Rome. Beautiful statues/fountain, nice public square, and plenty of food/cafes around if you're in need of some refreshment. Definitely worth a walk through here.
ANOTHER BEAUTIFUL ROMAN PIAZZA. We began a walking tour at this location. It is another amazing insight into the history of Rome. You don't need to spend a lot of time but don't miss it.
Lively area at night. we enjoyed the street performers, the fountain, the buildings. Lots of places to eat and good people watching.

Interesting Piazza, a quick look will do it.. You can reach Piazza Navona from the Pantheon very easy. From the piazza Rotondo in front of the Pantheon, take via Giustiniani, which leads to via Salvatore and right into Piazza Navona. You will go by the President of the Senate residence, so you will see lots of police cars. The square is long rectangular, which is different from others, a large fountain and obelisk in the center, and a more interesting fountain at the far end. Neptune with kneeling men holding water flowing vases. One side of Piazza Navona, has dozens of restaurants, and the other side the church, St. Agnese in Agone. A fun stop on your adventure around Rome.
Incredibly romantic. Awesome venue with many love birds.Amazingly beautiful. There were many artists who produced wonderful art pieces. Incredibly romantic especially at night.

short stop on a self guided walk. This is a beautiful place. Pick your time of day carefully if you would like to sit and enjoy the ambiance, it can be crowded but it is one of a few places where you could easily spend a couple hours alone. If you are walking through the city with little time to spare, walk through on your way to another spot....it won't disappoint.

Awesome Piazza. Beautiful vibes around this place with many restaurants and cafes and street shows with different talents to see on the sides of the streets.If you are with babies the McDonalds around the corner has babies changing rooms
Great at night. We thought this area was much nicer in the night time with all.the lights rather than the day very impressive
More than a tourist trap, a great space in Rome if you can see past hawkers. My favourite piazza in Rome.Great artists and sellers, amazing ambience.Shame about the selfie-stick hawkers everywhere!

Beautiful Square, but experience is tainted by tacky tourist traps. Everything from the famous statues, the palazzi, to the oval footprint of the former Stadium Domitian makes this piazza a fascinating visit. There are many cafes that ad to the bustling feeling of the place but I feel that the tourist traps that are inevitable repercussions of famous tourist attractions tainted my experience of the square. Men would always try to force you to buy roses, you hear people trying to sell you selfie sticks, and the worst are the glowing propellers that are thrown into the air. Maybe I visited at the wrong time. Policemen with motorbikes tried to catch the men selling fake handbags on the street. People were pushing and yelling and it all made my feel a little distressed. I also visited one night when a light show was being projected onto the building facade opposite the church. The atmosphere and energy was upbeat and fervent.I consider this a must-see in Rome - visit at different parts of the day - the early mornings (before 9) to see the statues in their most quiet form, early afternoon for a panini on the square, and perhaps, by favorite, right after dinner, when the statues are illuminated. Just try to ignore the street vendors.
Just a statue. It was nothing special just a statue a church n some street shows i am wondering why does it feature in top recommendations by travellers

One of the best.. The Piazza Novona is an absolute must see when in Rome. Sidewalk cafes, street entertainers, monuments, statues, artists, etc. This is one of the greatest piazzas in Rome. We go there every time we are in Rome. To be in Rome and not visit this piazza is not experiencing the fullness of this eternal city.

A beautiful Piazza and an astonishing church. We went last Saturday to Piazza Navona walking through the small Roman streets and we enjoyed every moment of our trip. The monuments are gorgeous and I realize that in spite of the impact of an overcrowded location, it is positive to see that what was the privilege of an elite in the past, today is accesible to many if not to all. This fact does not allow us to experience the feelings of the beautiness in a relaxed and quiet athmosphere but I do not regret it.

Romantic Square. Piazza Navona is a very romantic square with lovely houses, a beautiful fontain,interesting buildings and a many good restaurants and bars.Really nice food and drinks, good local wines and especially in the evening highlyromantic !

A great free variety show every day. Visiting Piazza Navona, particularly in the evening is like having a free pass to an amazing theater. Everybody in Rome who has some kind of "act." seems to appear here. Clowns. Mimes. Singers. Puppeteers. Painters. Fake tattoo artists. Musical groups. Hucksters. Novelty and gimmick sellers. You name it. Their "stage" is a spectacular ancient plaza arrayed around the centerpiece of Gian Lorenzo Bernini's stunning Four Rivers fountain honoring the Danube, the Nile, the Ganges and the Rio de la Plata. Bordered by restaurants and good quality shops with the backdrop of the beautiful 17th Century Baroque church of Sant'agnes in Agone silently overlooking the proceedings. Here's also where you'll find our favorite restaurant, Ristorante Tucci a family run place we've returned to for year after year and dinner after dinner. We never tire of the fun flavor of either the restaurant or this remarkable piazza.
Crowded but nice. Nice place in the center of Rome. Always crowded with many street artists and several restaurants. You must not miss the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi a great Bernini art!

One of the most beautiful squares in Rome. We stayed in a boutique hotel near the square, so we were able to visit during the day and evening.The highlight of the square is the 3 magnificent fountains surrounded by restaurants, and many artists selling their art.

Good place to spend an evening. Its a pretty square , with a lot of tourists, good view of 2 fountains , and some cool restaurants with some music artists playing some really good music gathering the crowd.. You will find people dressed like Roman Emperors or gladiators here , they are there for tourists to take pictures with them for money .. You may find some local artists painting pictures of Roman monuments, you may also buy those paintings as souvenirs , they sure are pretty.. Its worth spending some time here in the evening to relax after a long day of sight seeing..
Nice piazza with lots going on. Lots of nice restaurants and lots of entertainment around the fountain. Some amazing buildings to see. Lovely spot for dinner.

Favorite Piazza. This plaza was just beautiful. Of all the piazzas we saw, it was my favorite. There were people milling around everywhere, outdoor restaurants, and I don't remember anyone trying to sell you junk!
Lovely Piazza. We were able to walk to many places in Rome since we stayed at an apartment inTrastevere. Piazza Navona had ambiance and beautiful fountains.

Beautiful square with a lot of travelers, churches, artist and performances.. As soon as you enter this place, you will see this is full of life. There are a lot of artist displaying their paintings, performing shows around. This place comes to life in the evening and the best time to visit too. You will find a lot of guided tours, a must do for anyone visiting Rome for the first time.This place is close to the St.Agnes Church and the fountain of four rivers. I booked the guided tour in advance, I think you can book a lot of tours on the spot too. There are a lot of souvenir shops around that sells stuffs at a lesser price, good to get them for friends. Best means to reach here is by public bus.
Beautiful. Views are great & people watching is the tourists relaxation. Surrounded by great restaurants. Visited at night - heard beautiful music & ate an amazing pasta dinner!

Particularly good in the evening. Went here in the evening with my girlfriend. The fountain looks excellent when lit at night. The piazza is also full of musical performers and traders selling Rome artwork, all which make it a delight to walk around. Wonderful scenes and a bustling nightlife. Highly recommended.
Romantic square . Most romantique and impresive square we've seen in Rome so far.Big, though cosyNot a lot of noisePerfect on a sunny day to enjoy Rome at his best!

Really cool. We stopped by the Piazza Navona a couple of times while we were in Rome. The first time was on our golf cart tour. One of the things that made the Piazza more interesting to us was our guide explaining that the Piazza was built on top of an ancient stadium, and so you can see the Piazza is not square, one end is rounded. We also enjoyed the large Fountain of the Four Rivers in the center of the Piazza and the two smaller fountains on each end. We had lunch one day at a restaurant on the square (see my review of the Bernini Ristorante), my husband still talks about the six cheese pizza...

Beautiful day and night. Beautiful Piazza, with the 3 fountains and many cafes around them. A lot of street art and music in the piazza - especialy at night. There are a few shops around the piazza but I found them a little expensive... Piazza Navona is a nice place to sit and rest, watch the fountains and people walking by.

Loved it!. Street performers, artists, patio restaurants, and beautiful fountains.. simply a great place to relax and soak it all in! We found a table at one of the restaurants, ordered an appetizer and some drinks and just watched the people go by and listened to some musicians nearby. The area is beautiful and just lovely to walk around away from the busy streets.

Well worth a visit. Reputedly Rome's most famous square. Lined with cafes and restaurants and street artists. A beautiful fountain (one of 3), the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi, topped with an Egypyian obelisk. Well worth a visit.

Vibrant. Piazza Navona was everything I had expected. Vibrant, noisy and colourful. Artists painting, locals and travellers eating in the restaurants. The fountains are beautiful. There are lots of little side streets off the Piazza, one in particular houses a small church which you could easily miss with the most beautiful frescos inside. Well worth a visit especially at night.
Way too touristy and watch for pickpockets. Okay to walk through, but too loud and touristy, plus so many pickpockets we saw police set up a sting for them one morning.

Too many vendors, way too touristy. There are way too many tourists vendors in this plaza. This would be a much nicer place if there weren't so many people trying to get you to spend your money. Stay away from the vendors, and make your way to the far southern or eastern side where you can enjoy the plaza without as many people. There is some good gelato in the Plaza , but does cost a little bit more then other places.

Best Piazza in Rome. This was one of our favorite places to relax on the piazza. There are many in Rome but this one is quite nice. The food on the piazzas were nothing to speak of. I would suggest not eating on any piazzas if you are looking for great food but to have a glass of wine, coffee or to just soak up the world around you, this is the place. Love it!

Lively characters. If you're in the area, stop for dinner or just a stroll. Lots of street artists in a lively atmosphere. We had a wonderful dinner at Bernini's, sitting on the sidewalk, doing some great people watching

Must see. No trip to Rome is complete without visiting Piazza Navona. Bernini's magnificent fountain is a must see, as is the beautiful palace behind it ( by one of Bernini's students) The area bustles with life and local street artists. However, don't eat here! Very overpriced restaurants taking advantage of the tourists.

Something for everybody. It´s beautiful: great design, incredible fountains, interesting buildings around the plazza, restaurants, coffee places, local artistis, performers.....Interesting to visit at any time. Few minutes to look around or taking time to relax and enjoy ....

Whistlestop tour of Rome.. Spent an hour here on a busy day trip around Rome. Beautiful square with spectacular fountains. Great street cafés and a gorgeous gelato shop. Loads to see,artists painting and sketching. Wish we had been there longer.
The piazza for people watching... and more . It doesn't get much better than Piazza Navona in Rome. Fountains, people watching and more. Fantastic.
A must see. A whole different kind of walk. Street vendors in addition to the wonderful fountains. It is Italy that I love.

Visit to piazza navona. Certainly one of the best piazzas in Rome to visit, stunning buildings with many restaurants and bars, we enjoyed the live music entertainment (buskers) playing light jazz, we sat and had a beer while listening. A lovely setting with a great atmosphere.

Essential Place to Visit in Rome. Beautiful piazza, marvelous sculptures and fountains, and plenty of places to sit and take it all in. The cafes surrounding the piazza are extremely overpriced, but a few of the "souvenir shops" actually have some interesting and reasonable merchandise. Fantastic gelato stand at one end of the square. This is definitely in my top five destinations in Rome.

Beautiful Piazza. Our favorite of all the squares and only about a block from the best gelato in all of Rome! Enjoy your cone near the fountain or watching the street performers. If you choose to go into the nearby church or museum, all the better. This is one of the best places to enjoy people watching.

Worth the visit. As I walked out into the piazza I had the warm feeling 'this is what Italy is about'. A piazza, fountains...more than anywhere else is the the word...people, markets....the buildings! It was simply beautiful. i took serval photos of an apartment window full of flowers. Sadly the food places were average and the service shocking. We left one cafe because of poor service...or rather lack of service. Certainly worth a wander.
Place with street artists. It's worth to pass by. You will be close to the place for sure (Pantheon, Fountain de Trevy, ...). You will find there several fountains, artists, music bands, ...

Lots of Art. Fun again with most of the crappy junk gone. A mix of local artists selling nice art,plus immigrants selling junky prints. And what ever happened to the lights in the fountains? At least the water is running. Still, a great place to hang out and always fun.
Piazza Navona. We just loved it, we loved the environment, we loved the cleanliness, we loved Rome. We took an aperitif close by and relaxed.

Great atmosphere and a must see. We were staying very close to Piazza Navona so visited at various times of the day. There are three beautiful fountains. In the afternoon/evening there are lots of artists, vendors and street entertainers which is lots of fun. There are restaurants along one side of the piazza. A five minute walk to the Pantheon which is also a must to visit.

Art history visited. It was great to get to finally see in its beauty the work of Giovanni Bernini in this really busy Piazza. We sat close to the fountain and listed to the history of the Piazza and sculpture on the Roma Walking Tour app (which I'd thoroughly recommend downloading). Music filled the air and people busied themselves around their normal life around the Piazza. Stunning.

Beautiful, Touristy Square. Very beautiful square that is worth visiting. Ofcourse it is very touristy but nevertheless sit in one of the cafes and people watch or get one of your portraits drawn by the numerous talented portrait artists. Nice place for an afternoon stroll.

Great place for lunch. This was my third visit to Piazza Navona. It is a great place to wonder around & look at local art. It is also a very nice place to relax and have lunch, since there are many sidewalk cafes.
Piazza Navonna and Fountain. this fountain is a true work of art and depicts creativity and Christian beliefs in its structure; the piazza is teaming with people and other sights

Very arty but watch out for the fleecing restaurants. The piazza is quite large with all types of artists performing and selling artworks, some even creating to order their. It is a fun place to spend time but tbd restaurants are all over priced and try to entice you in with all kinds of promises. Some will deliver but many just want to get you in and fleece you. Better off walking back out of the square and trying the many eateries out of the square where they treat you better and the food is much better. Walk around and explore nd take in the atmosphere but eat elsewhere.

Beautiful Setting, good for crowd watching. I really enjoyed the Piazza Navona. Good photo opportunity, nice cafes and restaurants. Nightlife is somewhat limited in that area, but if you're looking for low key or loungy places, it's a good area. I honestly didn't find any big nightclubs in that area
Evening entertainment . Great place to go in the evening for street art and entertainment. Also some lively restaurants too. A place to relax and people watch.

Piazza Overated. Impressive Piazza, but please do not eat round here, a drink to 'people watch' is fine.Lots of touts selling prints of pictures that I'm sure I've seen in London!There are far more prettier Piazzas in Rome ,it's fun stumbling into them when walking around.
Get sights for a fancy lunch. A beautiful piazza that is a must see in Rome. Gorgeous fountains which are perfect for photo opportunities and it is the place to eat a lovely, but simple lunch.
navona. Place to relax and see the world go by get a delicious icecream and a picture drawn by many good artists.

Fabules. Every step you do in Rome displays beautiful and powerful history next to you. Walking into Piazza Navona from every road is expirance we would never forget. Don't you even think to leave Rome without seen this place...

A place to enjoy in good company. the place, the surroundings and architecture gives this place a special charme, owing you to feel in square were you can spent hours, with a small drink and café. Unavoidable on a visit to Rome.
This is Rome. You can spend hours at this piazza, you will be entertained, great restaurants and bars, art, live music and just a perfect place to spend a few hours to chill

Plazza Navona. The Plazza Navona was part of a tour by "Walks of Italy", and everyone should experience the charm of this Plazza with all the artist selling their paintings, prints, and pastels. As is always the case, you will find the quality and prices have a wide range - but there will be something for everyone!
Another example of well preserved Roman history. Well worth a visit as it is really well preserved and offers a lot of interest. Best on a sunny day.
Beautiful Fountains. This one was my favorite. It's artsy. A nice place to grab a salad and hang out. The day I was there it was full of paintings and drawings.
Beautiful square!. Beautiful Piazza, worth visiting. Read about the history before going there. Be careful about the coins because unofficially nobody knows where they go.

Amazing Square. a lovely Square lots of cafes, restaurants, art work, music being played sets the mood of Italy in a nutshell, people wandering around taking in there surroundings happily talking about there experiences and a lovely fountain in the centre perfect place to visit day or night
Lovely Piazza. Well worth a visit day or night, surrounded by a good choice of nice restaurants and cafes the piazza is always full of life. Great selection of artists works too

Take a quick look then move on. Along with the Spanish steps, this is a hugely overrated tourist experience. The cafes are all tourist traps, the square isn't that interesting and the fountain can be appreciated in about five minutes. There is an interesting baroque church that you should view. But this isn't anywhere near my top ten attractions for Rome. So much more to view.

Nice place to ponder. This square is worth a visit at any time of the day,for lunch or dinner,with many openair restaraunts slightly more expensive than other restaraunts in Rome ,I always visit it on my many trips ,there are often ,many street artists,muscians,puppet shows,and lots of original small shows,a bit ,like Covent Garden..I have seen some amazing entertainers and guitar players....At the beginning of the square,are two streets ,that wind round to the left,past the church,with quality second hand shops,selling Italian shoes and bags....and lots of trendy new shops and bars.....

Nice. A nice piazza to go through and see. there was a street performer who was dressed up like an Egyptian and it was great! should recommend you to go there on your way to the pantheon - a must see!I heard that the restaurants there are expensive so I avoided them.
Lovely location. Beautiful piazza and is even more beautiful at night. Lots of cafes and restaurants around along with sketch artists etc.

Piazza navona great atmosphere. We visited piazza Navona on 2 days, when in ROMA, so much atmosphere,it has it all cafes bars, shops, no traffic, beautiful fountains, we enjoyed both a lunch & dinner drinks at four columns ristorante, it's bellisimo @ night
A great space for a coffee. Great place for a slightly overpriced coffee. Street entertainment and lots of market stalls. Would recommend eating just outside the Piazza for better value for money.

Piazza Navona Rome Italy. Navona is one of the loveliest and most popular squares in Rome. Piazza Navona sits in the area once occupied by the Stadium of Domitian (Circus Agonalis) in the year 86. It could hold over 30,000 spectators, and provided a space for Roman citizens to enjoy Greek athletic competitions. There are lots of restaurants and terraces there.The greatest draw of Piazza Navona is undoubtedly the three fountains built during the papacy of Gregory XIII:
Nice place to hang around. Although a lot of artist do exactly the same, this was different a few years ago. Prices of food are ok, but when you get the menu the drinks are too expensive.

In a strange way, this might be the nicest place in rome. The plaza is teaming with life and the fountain is just beautiful. If you can come on a weekday it's a little better since there are less people. Nice place to just hang out. Don't bother with the Cafes lining the piazza since you can get better value by turning a corner...unless you want to just sit and have a coffee right on the plaza.
Must see, vibrant busy plaza. Worth the walk, busy, exciting with cafes/ restaurants on the perimeter and vendors, artists and musicians on the inside.stay for lunch

Beautiful magic place. We spent a great afternoon at the Piazza. It is surrounded by nice architecture, and it has the magnificent fountain. You can either have a drink or a coffe at the street cafes, or dinne in some of the many restaurants nearby.Art is in the air!! Artists painting just in front of you, it's like an outside art gallery.It's a place to return as many times as you can.

The heart of Rome. This square just sums up Rome in a nutshell. The atmosphere is indescribable! We spent hours here having drinks, looking at the art, pondering the shops - everything! So so so beautiful, and a must see area of Rome
exotic place. This is a nice Piazza to see in Rome . Worth visiting and no cars , but it is lots of music , art ,cafees and a very good mood !!!!!!!!

A lively piazza second to none. Piazza Navona has it all. With artists and street musicians abound, it is the ideal location for dining on classic Roman food or just enjoying a glass of wine while people watching. Admire the 15th century Baroque architecture, the famous Bernini Fountain of the Four Rivers or Giacomo della Porta's Fountain of Neptune and you'll become mesmorised. But beware, frolicking street entertainers are on the proll coaxing the awestruck into becoming the brunt next of their skit. Day or night this piazza defies you not to smile.

Come early. Passed by again this morning early before the restaurants opened and the vendors arrived. During the day this place is a circus filled with panhandlers, musicians, artists etc. Packed with people from around the globe. Early morning is relatively quiet, the light is just right and then you get a deep appreciation of the fountains and awesome sculptures that create them. A must on your trip to Rome.

Beautiful. Spent a few hours walking around the Piazza, enjoying the vendors and admiring the beautiful statue by Bernini...Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. There are plenty of restaurants that allow you to sit and take in all the people, and enjoy wonderful Italian food.
Fountains&Sculptures. You should see the piazza atmosphere is faboulus. The monuements are georgious and lots of art pieces. You should drink coffe and enjoy the envoiroment.
Lovely neighborhood . Piazza Navona is a neighborhood with rich surroundings. You can easily spot any of the great fountains there. It's a nice destination to have a walk and enjoy your surroundings.

The Fountain is super, go to here after the non working Trevi !. Have a drink or snack in one of the cafe's , see the world go by and carry on to the River , Bridge of Angels,via beautiful side streets.

Beware of the 5% compulsory charge. Nice meal at the restaurant in that area cos u can see street performance. But i was asked to pay extra 5% compulsory charge for sitting outdoor. Waiter said it s a govt tax. Seems this charge applies to restaurants at navona
SURROUNDED BY BAROQUE ARCHITECTURE. Two of my favorite fountains are the Moor Fountain & Neptune Fountain. Plenty of street cafes to sit and look at the wonder of this magnificent Piazza Navone
Classic Rome. What a treat to amble through this area of Rome at both day and night. The atmosphere on each occasion was entirely different.
Just paintings. Great location. In the middle of everything. Only had painters and paintings for sale. Guess I was expecting more vendors. Great stop if you're passing through.

The Art of Piazza Navona. The Piazza is basically a big art gallery. Many artists have their works hanging in small personal clusters. Some great some not so great . The fountains are beautiful and center all the goings on. Restaurants ring the piazza . Lots of interesting things to do and see. Ciao.
A wonderful place. The most beautiful piazza in my opinion The spirit of Rome. We took espresso in one of the many coffe shops there and had wonderful our looking around.
Nice Piazza. There are many places here to eat and places to just sit and watch people. Listen to the musicians and just take in the atmosphere.

People watching. A lovely place to sit and watch the world go by, watching the street artists at work, whilst sipping on a cocktail and enjoying a wonderful meal at one of the many lovely restaurants - which weren't as expensive as we'd been warned!
Bellissima . Certainly the most beautiful square in Rome. A truly magic place definitely worth the visit. You will not resist its charm.

Fun tourist spot. This is a nice area to sit at the fountains or an outdoor cafe and people watch. It is less crowded with better ambience at night, but visit during the day if you actually want to see the monuments as they are not lighted at night.

Wonderful. This piazza was beautiful, in fact it took my breath away. Tha atmosphere was magical as people sat dining, and enjoying the artists selling their pictures. It is certainly worth a visit, and time to soak up the atmosphere.

Peaceful and impressive at the same time. I really enjoyed this plaza. It is quite large - about three blocks long and one block wide. It has a large fountain in the center and then smaller fountains at each end. Those are all famous and several hundred years old. It is ringed by restaurants on one side, shops on either end, and the large church on the other side. I was there in the early evening, about dusk, and it was filled with artists, musicians, and street performers. Very interesting. I would have enjoyed coming back here just to relax and have dinner, but time didn't permit it.
Must see!. This piazza is huge! And absolutely beautiful.You can spend a few hours here. Much activity outside once you have seen the church.
Worth a passing by. To the standards of Rome, though elegant and nice, it is not a top attraction, so worth being here if your rout is crossing it, but for me not worth a special visit

A MUST SEE WHILE IN ROME. Beauty surrounds you,this piazza is awesome and you just stroll along and look at so much beauty.The fountains are of course the main attraction but if you look around the buildings are fantastic too.Just forget the selfies, the tourists,find a place to sit and look at this really elegant and baroque public space.

"All roads lead to Piazza Navona". This must be the most visited place in Rome. A theatre where musicians, artists, painters , families with children and tourists from many countries are gathered all day and evenings. Lots of restaurants in the area , and in the middle Bernini's beautiful fountaine

Stunning . The piazza is really popular and always full of tourists. The piazza contains the fountain of the four rivers so it is always surrounded by people and it is really a must visit for the stunning architecture that surrounds it. There is a nice vibe to the piazza and stands out from the rest.

Busy piazza. Busy piazza with art based street stalls. Most of the artwork is very similar though - very touristy. Entertaining buskers. Lots of tourists making it difficult to take photos of famous fountains. Recommend going in the morning as the stalls are being set up as there are less people then stop in one of the many restaurants surrounding the piazza and enjoy people watching.
So much to see in Rome. . We drove by this one. There were so many fountains in Rome. It's nice to see but I would not have gone out of the way to see it.

Interesting.. We visited around lunchtime and so there were a lot of people around. The musicians were fabulous to sit and listen to, the fountains were very interesting and the Piazza is just lovely to wander around and look at the people. It certainly looked a good place for lunch and probably in the evening.

Just a fabulous piazza with some gorgeous restaurants and cafes. The sculptures and fountains are beautiful!. We were on a whistle stop tour around Rome and this Piazza was highly recommended. It did not disappoint.

Lovely piazza. Beautiful by day - a great place to stroll and then sit and have a gelato and people-watch. There are three beautiful fountains, including Bernini's Four Rivers Fountain, and lots of street artists. Also beautiful by night with buskers and more street artists and a great atmosphere. Go both in the daytime and the night time if you can. It's not far from a lot of other famous places in Rome, within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Campo de Fiori etc. If you leave the piazza by the northern end (past the Fountain of Neptune) and turn left you can see some of the remains of the Stadium Domitian that the Piazza Navona was built over. (I think you can get proper access to the exhibit around the corner in Via di Tor Sanguigna, but we just had a look from the street)

Beautiful. The piazza is just breathtaking, we visited the piazza at night and it was even more magical with all the lights and buzz from all the cafe's in the Piazza. But heard that the food at some of these cafe's is not that great, try to go in the neighborhood around the Piazza and have some food, this is where the locals would go to eat.

A nice fountain and a lively square. This piazza was filled with activity, from people sitting around the running fountain, to a few grabs a bite and some wine at the small sitout restaurants overlooking the fountain, and not forgetting the budding artists who sell their art work here.

Watch the world go by. Good food, good wine the piazza is a great place to visit have a lazy lunch and watch the world go by. The various nationalities and the different resturants make it a great place along with the three fantastic fountains.

I think the best from all piazzas in Rome. Even during daytime although at night is better, Piazza Navona is a place you can walk around, see the three fountains (the middle one of the four lions is absolutely amazing), watch the various artists and their tricks or talents, you can drink or eat at any of the restaurants around this piazza and generally you can pass lovely and relaxing your time! If you can only go once pick a time after sunset, it's more picturesque and unique the whole concept!

Amazing Piazza . This is simply an amazing Piazza and a must see in Rome. The Piazza has a stunning church an impressive water fountains plenty of eateries and right next to the Italian senate. You could spend half hour here looking around and taking some great photography.

Pretty. There's an awesome fountain in the middle of the piazza that is absolutely incredible. The piazza is filled with vendors, but the old buildings that are around it are incredibly pretty. Worth a walk through.

Great way to experience Roman atmosphere, get a bite to eat, People watch. Very enjoyable & slow paced.. Really good experience - plenty to see and do as you stroll through this area.Lots of opportunity to get something to eat on your way, or perhaps see the Four Rivers fountain also.You will be able to see some of the markets possibly - depending on when you go - there are always some interesting local art works available.Note that some if not all of the artists will not be super open to negotiating prices. But that's ok.Piazza Navona is a must for those that like to take a leisurely stroll, people watch, have a leisurely brunch\lunch, encounter some wonderful, historic buildings and monuments.Its a great way to spend some time when in Rome for sure - it shouldn't be on your top 5 list of things to do - its more a good way to spend free time when you are in Rome.Highly recommended regardless.
Pretty. The piazza is very pretty and nice. There are a lot of painters there and a nice environment and a lot of restaurants

Get a portrait. Such a wonderful place, tons of things to do, especially the portrait artists. You can get a caricature or a portrait, yet be careful to watch more than one drawing before choosing the artist especially the portraits. I recommend the artist in this picture, he's really talented and always there.

Worth a night time visit. This place is well worth a night time visit for the Artist, performers and just the whole atmosphere of the square.Just be careful if you stop for a drink as in different bars a medium beer ranged from €6 to €20 for Morrietee beer depending on what bar you use, some also had service charges on top but at least all of them had a price list out the front so buyer beware.28SAC
Italian Mont Martr - artistic heart of Rome. Navona is my favorite place in Rome. Despite being very busy , the place is picturesque and artistic .
Gorgeous. This plaza is beautiful, it gets crowded during the day, but not so much you can't move around. Beautiful place to stroll, the fountain in the center is gorgeous!
Magical Night Time Area. Beautifully lit architecture and statues at night time. Lots of pretty alley ways offer friendly wine bars and restaurants.

A very lively spot not to be missed when visiting eternal Rome.. Every time we visit Rome my wife and I make sure that we visit this site and spend ample time enjoying its attractive lively activities, the delicious food of its restaurants and the enchanting music played by gifted amateur singers/musicians. Certainly a place NOT to be missed.
amazing atmosphere. one of places i really liked in rome even though sweltering heat.full of artists selling paintings and amazing atmosphere to have lunch dinner or even just a drink
Never too many fountains. Beautiful square, gorgeous fountains. So much history! Wasn't too crowded when i was there which was nice.
Best piazza so far. Lively and full of restaurants, plenty of artists showing ,playing or painting. Very vibrant and so far the best entertainment place:)

Nice square. Lots to see in this square, street artists, restaurants (but they might not be the best, they all looked like tourist traps). The stores around were also more expensive. But it's a nice place to check, for sure! Specially by night.

The place to go. No doubt that Piazza Navona is the Rome equivalent to Montmartre in Paris, but nonetheless is worthwhile a visit to enjoy the fontains, the movement, the "gelato" and even to have the courage to eat at the overpriced "ristorantes". But even so, Piazza Navona is the place to go, if not so just to get the ambience, specially at the end of the afternoon.

One of the best fountains in Rome. This is a lovely square to walk around and has one of the most gorgeous fountains in Rome smack dab in the middle of it, The Fountain of Four Rivers. Very easy to walk around and enjoy the sights, street performers, artists, a museum at one end and of course a church. I could have stayed there for a long time but with only 3 days in Rome it was off to the next attraction.
Great fountain and square. This is something that is definitely worth to visit and hang around. For me personally square I liked the most.
Worth a visit. Lovely Piazza with fantastic carved fountains. Lots of photo opportunities and places to eat and drink. Expect to pay 15-20% more here than in restaurants and bars in nearby areas.
Tourists!. Nice place, beautiful architecture, but absolutely packed with tourists. The restaurants are alright, but nothing more.Take a stroll around, and you wanna get on to the next site.
Loved the vibe. One of my favourite places in Rome. Buskers, restaurants and bustling with people just enjoying the piazza.

Random Gem. beautiful; little square deffo have lunch here, and not to busy street artists all around. we stopped of walkinmg back from the vatican to the pantheon in a circle and stumbled across it :)

Beautiful structure . The piazza Navona has a main beautiful fountain right in the middle. Some call it the "4 corners" fountain and others the "4 rivers" which was built by Bernini. The story behind the fountain is quite remarkable and the structure itself is beautiful. We visited on a weekend when walking to the Vatican and there were markets (all very much the same with people doing drawings and then prints) and all the restaurants were bordering the piazza however the food in that area isn't very good. You can't spend a great deal of time there (unless stopping for a meal) but it's a great spot to walk through and we preferred it at night when the fountain is lit up.
Nice, but crowded. Though the fountains are beautiful and worth enjoying, the crowds and the 'performers' put me off. A little bit of peace here would have been perfect.
Lovely. Great place to walk around, grab a bite nearby or people watch. Like most fountains you can sit and relax with a gelato after a long day and take everything in.
Really nice square with a lovely fountain.. Worth a visit. Lots of street artists and a superb fountain. Lots of places to eat nearby although we had already eaten. Easy access via bus.
Piazza Navona. Don't forget to visit this tourist spot. Lots of hussle bustle of tourist at this place. It's the beauty of Ancient Rome.
Lots to see. Two great fountains! People performing like its Las Vegas. Art everywhere. People can't wait to be watched. Museum at one end. It's quite a show. Worth the walk.

Magical place in the evenings. We spent a couple of evenings just sitting and enjoying the scenery and people watching. It is very tranquil especially after a very busy day of sightseeing. When you come to Rome, you need to take time to just relax for an evening in Piazza Navona.

The most beautiful piaaza in Rome. I felt in love with this piazza. It is very tourist oriented but is not so full as for intance Piazza Spagna which is much more crouded. Eating there is not very cheap but I would advise to take a gelato and just walk around or seat in a bench and enjoy. Do not leave Rome with our going here!

THE Fountain of Rome. What can I say but when in Rome you MUST go to the Piazza Navona and toss a coin for a good wish. The structure itself is amazing to look at. Such beauty in this city. Don't miss this one!

Nice atmosphere. Beautiful place lots of local artists and street performers and bunch of restaurants on both sides ,excellent gelato shop at one end of the piazza
Great place to retreat after a long walk for a meal or a drink ...enjoyed it ...been to it twice on my last visit

Great . It is a great place to chill, there are usually lots of performers, be them comedians, musicians or painters around so you have thing to look at if you are not busy chilling by the fountains, sipping a cold drink or visiting the beautiful church. All in all, a must see in Rome
Beautiful!. What a beautiful fountain! The carvings were spectacular and so detailed! They've keep it restored and worth a trip!

Stunning fountains!. Piazza Navona is a must see if touring Rome. There are a number of classic fountains that have to be experienced. The main one, featuring the four rivers was used in the most recent (1990?) version of the movie Three Coins in a Fountain. The Trevi fountain was featured in the original version. Lots of artists, coffee shops as well as the usual trinket vendors. Just a short walk from the Pantheon.

great piazza of rome. it is the famous piazza of romethe fountains and sculptures of horses there are amazing there are many restaurants and gelaterias around also a great church , from there you can easily access other historic part of rome
Lovely piazza. Really interesting piazza. Lots to see. Lovely fountains, plenty of local artists and their work displayed. A variety of places to eat. Great atmosphere

Beautiful fountains and sculptures. If you're in Rome, this is great to visit. The two fountains are beautiful; Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi or Fountain of the Four Rivers (1651) by Gian Lorenzo Bernini, and at the southern end is the Fontana del Moro with a basin and four Tritons sculpted by Giacomo della Porta (1575) to which, in 1673, Bernini added a statue of a Moor, or African, wrestling with a dolphin. Spectacular! The piazza is huge and there's always something entertaining going on there.

Fountain under renovation, disappointed!. The Trevi fountain is a must see when in Rome. Unfortunately, it has been under renovation (late August 2015)The Piazza Navonna is a very crowded square, be careful with pick pockets.

Amazing place to be . What can I say, we went there every day of our trip and I still could not get enough. Fabulous place, you could really fall in love with the atmosphere! And dont get me started on the food.. It was mouth watering.Small tip, despite every restaurant offering amazing food, just by walking to the next Street we save like half of the price;) Be aware of shop lifters as I almost lost my camera! Make sure you will see it by day and night as it makes a big difference!Definitely a place to be!!!Edyta

LOVED this Piazza in Rome !!!!!. Wonderful place to get dinner while listening to the musicians playing on the piazza !!!
Beautiful architecture abounds in this area. The street performers are fun to watch and the shopping is Fabulous !!!
I LOVED the 3 fountains as this is a large piazza. Something for everyone here.

A great piazza not to miss. I join the previous reviewers in the acclaim for this gem of a piazza in Rome. On a beautiful day it is a very nice place to spend some time, having a bite and/or drink and enjoy the ambience. You have to visit this place at least once in your life.
Always a pleasure to have a drink. Always a pleasure to have a drink in Piazza Navona in one of the caffè a bit overrated but beautifull

The best for fountains and people watching, day or night. We were lucky enough to be in Rome for 3 nights so got to see the Piazza Navona in the day as well as at night. It has 3 fountains each one a masterpiece in its own right and each one including the Piazza different again in the night time lights. This place is so beautiful with or without crowds and that again makes it special, such atmosphere, must see.

Lovely piazza. Spent a couple of hours here watching the artists and a really good magician. Plenty of places to sit and eat and two of the most beautiful fountains in Rome. Watch out for the brides walking about, it's a custom for a bride to be to walk around the piazza in her wedding dress for good luck!

Stunning.. This square was great for everything, entertainment, shopping and food. There are street performers constantly amusing you. Artists will set up their booths and even if you don't want to buy anything its a great place to just stroll around and admire where you are.

Lovely Piazza. Great place to eat lunch and relax while listening to musicians playing on the piazza. There are many artists set up with local paintings of the area. With 3 fountains to enjoy (1 large and 2 small) it's a nice area to walk around and then have some lunch or dinner. We ate at Vacanze Romane and enjoyed the meal. The restaurants are expensive but the views and atmosphere are with it.
My favourite piazza. Exactly what you would hope to find in Rome. Beautiful architecture, great restaurants, wonderful atmosphere.
Family outing. We were on a family vacation with different age groups and we enjoyed the out doorrestaurants and great place for people watching locals entertaining
Lots of restaurants and street vendors. There's lots to see and do. Food is very expensive so be prepared. Fountain in the middle was very cool. Lots of things to buy for souvenirs.

Great Public Space.. Day time or evening time this is a wonderful space to eat, people watch, or have a drink.
