Artists and music performers are everywhere, and many good restaurants to fill your stomach. We hired an artist to draw our caricature as well. It's a souvenir for us (I might even get it framed). The fountain looks lovely at night (just like they show in Angels and Demons). It is also very near other attractions such as Pantheon and Campo di fiori. It's a great place to spend time and enjoy the real Europe.
Beautiful Statues. Great place to buy some local art and take some awesome photos of the Piazza and it's statues. Really amazing

La Piazza per eccelenza. Piazza Navona is right smack in the heart of the city. The fountain in the middle of the piazza, entitled “ Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi” (fountain of the four rivers) by Gian Lorenzo Bernini, is a masterpiece and is worth the while to see. The whole piazza, infact, is another must when you visit Rome. It’s not a long walk away from other important attractions in the Eternal City. It should always be included in anybody’s list of “things to see” in Rome.

Horse Racing Track no more!. Domitian's Stadium. Once you see it you can imagine BenHur racing around this space in his chariot! So sophisticated now! We spent an hour reading wikipedia and looking at the fountains, obelisks, buildings and restaurants. A wonderful place to spend a Sunday afternoon in Rome.

Great spot for people watching and restaurants nearby. We passed through here both day & night. It's a perfect square to enjoy a rest, take some photos of the marvelous fountain, and do as I did...enjoy your gellato from nearby La Gelateria Frigidarium (best we had in Italy!).To those planning to go at night, beware of louring pick pockets!!! There's lots going on, with art sellers, psychics, graffiti artists, souvenir salesmen, and yes the guys slinging glowing flashy lights into the sky! I observed a pick pocket approach my rear in my bubble, and upon eye contact, he bounced to the next large group surrounding a graffiti artist...once there, the man attempted to snatch a woman's purse, only to get shutdown by her self awareness!

What a wonderful Piazza.. One of the most beautiful in Rome. The huge fountain in the centre is obviously the main attraction along with Chiesa di Sant'Agnese but the whole piazza is interesting and worth the time. We sat at a restaurant in front of the fountain on that hot July afternoon and watched the world go by - literally.
Wow. Beautiful is all I can say. This place is exquisite. One of my favorites. Soe of the best pictures we took are form here. Great views as well.

Lovely. Absolutely stunning place which is also steeped in history, once having been a place to spectate a compete in athletic sports. Gorgeous place to sit with a wine and watch the numerous street artists, performers and the world go by. A must see. I loved it.

Very nice. Very to walk around and enjoy the atmosphere.
Bars and restaurants are very expensive so be carefull what you order.
Beautiful Piazza. Very nice fountain and very beautiful. There are lots of places where to eat nearby. Worth to visit the beautiful architecture.

Piazza Navona. The Piazza is well worth a visit during the day and in the evening. There are many restaurants around the Piazza with entertainment including accordion players violinist's and mine artist's. The fountains are very nice as well.

Bucket List Trip. Loved these piazza small vars and café to stop in and drink of wine or coffee a bite to eat and recharge watch the world go by. There many artist and other small stalls selling Rome memorabilia. The fountain sculptures were very impressive and a good place to take some pictures to remember the trip..

Impressive Site. Fountain is great. The shops are neat. It wasn't the highlight of my trip to Rome, but it was certainly worth a look. You won't need a lot of time here, and there are a lot of things to do nearby, so it's not really out of the way. Definitely worth a visit if you have the time.

Lot of Fun !. Lot of Fun ! Very Artistic Fountain ! I just visited this place in Hot summer August 2015. Nice Atmosphere , its a big piazza , lot of people gathering. Water is potable , cold & tasty , quench your thirsty.
Real Italian square. Another evidence of the Roman wonderful atmosphere, amazing and relaxing time spent on this square. If You visit Rome You can't miss this place!

Fabulous for relaxing in the eve. walked here and had an expensive but memorable dinner here. Entertained by the street magicians and singing waiters, it's an ideal place to while away an evening in Rome.

Beautiful. It was beautiful place, finding our way through to the location itself was interesting. With a map in hand and your GPS you cannot miss it. Most of the fountains we saw around in Europe were charming and this was excellent.

Pretty area to wander and while away time in Rome. Very pretty and lots to do here. Good place to buy art amongst the stalls, personalised gifts - nice bracelets with names embroidered on made as you wait - and caricatures. Around the edges are lots of cafes and restaurants to stop and eat or drink and the three fountains in the centre are worth a look - particularly the central one. There's also a church dedicated to St Agnes which is cool and quiet - one of the calmest churches we found in Rome - so a good place to get away from the crowds.

Beautiful fountain. Worth a look, sit and people watch, there were armed guards around the area, which made us feel safe. Sometimes you have to site and wait for people to move before you can pose for a photo in front of the statue.

Better in the sunshine than the rain. My husband and I actually visited Piazza Navona twice on our trip to Rome the first time was in a downpour, and it was not very pleasant at all. The second was with our tour guide on a beautiful sunny day. I learned lots about the piazza, such as the fact that it was a giant horse racing track and stadium in Roman times, hence the big oval shape. The fountain in the middle was also great- and better with someone to explain it to you!

It's great!. Finding our way here was great, little back streets and gelato stores abound. And then place itself, lovely! Two fountains, very impressive, a great atmosphere and so much going on. Yes, it's mostly geared up for the tourists but it was a really nice spot.

Perfect Day. We visited Piazza Navona last week. It is a lovely square with lovely scenery. Perfect for an afternoon of relaxation in one of the many bars or restaurants. A definite must see when visiting Rome. :)

Beautiful statuary!!. Again in Rome beautiful statues! It's hard to find somewhere without stunning architecture! This place is lovely and serene. It makes me wonder why the trevi fountain gets more fuss

A must for any visit to Rome. Any visitor should end up here at some point in a trip to Rome. Stand back and look at the long oval. This was originally the circus of Domitian, emperor at the end of the fist century. You can almost hear the athletes groaning, which gave this space its later name.1500 years later this area was reworked into one of the worlds great public spaces with Bernini's masterpiece of a fountain sharing the center with an Egyptian obelisk.Sit down, and have a drink or a snack at the over priced outdoor restaurants, and admire the view.
Wonderful piazza. A jewel in Rome's crown! Lovely piazza with arguably the loveliest church in Rome. Just sit and watch the world go by.
Such a nice day! . We had a great time here. Great restaurants. Beautiful views. Great artists and other vendors. This was a great place to hang out.
My favourite spot in Roma. Go there and see the world go by...Capoeira dancers, guys selling fake luxury goods, police going after them, true Romans, loads of tourists, musicians, artists,

Beautiful tourist infested square. I took city bus number 64 from the Termini metro station and was dropped off a short walk from the square. The square consists of one large fountain, The Fountain of Four Rivers, and 2 smaller fountains at either side of the square. The square is surrounded by beautiful buildings and picturesque cafes. Within the square are entertainers, performers, and artists. You can choose to sit at a cafe and drink an overpriced coffee and people watch, or stroll through the square. There are plenty of photo opportunities. The large fountain is very interesting to study. Many regions of the world are incorporated in the statues. Interesting.

Stunning. Incredible piazza with lots of artists exhibiting their work, fountain and architecture are incredible, a huge range of overpriced restaurants in the piazza, better going a couple of streets away for better food at a more reasonable price, we would reccommend ' Navona Notte '

Amazing. A race track in Rome built some20 centuries ago and capable of being flooded with water for events and when dry for chariot races. The fountain is spectacular. We went to the Plazza in the late evening and then in the afternoon. Evening in Rome is spectacular-people are out eating and socializing.

Experience the Romance of Rome. Experience this in the evening for dinner. The outdoor eateries allow you to overlook the artists painting and selling their paintings on the piazza, along with hearing the local musicians as you eat or stroll by. It's a romantic experience you don't want to miss.

Truely Italy!. Pizza Navona is a place where you can spend one evening doing multiple things. It gives you an amazing peek into what Italian culture is. Filled with highly talented artists, there will be many painters, dancers and singers. The place is filled with restaurants. These restaurants are expensive and not that great. We spent our evening watching the sunset in the company of amazing music and superb coffee.You can buy many painting here. After a tired day of walking around Rome, it is a nice place to sit and relax.

Underwhelming. The Piazza and its Spanish Steps would be stunning in Dubuque (no harm intended), but in Rome, there are better things to see. The fountain is fun and playful and the Spanish steps are impressive....steps. If you're taking the time to come here, we hope you're in Rome for at least several days.

Great historical spot. went here last june..and from seeing the ruins in Palatino..we decided to go here ..and atlast, seen the good view of this architectural, historical designs..also, love the fountains ..this attraction has good restaurants nearby..side by side..Love Italy..

Wonderful memory. How can imagine visiting Rome but not Piazza Navona?An interesting square with stunning fountainsThat is a place where lots of good restaurant, nice cafeterias and delicious gelaterias can be found.It is recommended to visit Piazza Novona and Pantheon together.
pretty. nothing much to say other than theres 2 great statues and good-looking building next to it. its a piazza so it really shouldnt waste your time strolling though the place

A Lovely Square - Make Sure You Visit. This is a really lovely square and the fountain is very impressive. The square has a lot of restaurants, we found the ones just off the square to be more reasonably priced we really enjoyed the restaurant called Gucciana, it was a great place to 'people watch'. The square has lots of artists displaying there work and lots of street performers and musicians.

To be visited and revisited again. This Piazza has an amazing soul and vibe!! With so much positivity and beauty.. We went there for afternoon coffee's twice during our stay in Rome and it is extremely pleasant!!
Great Piazza. The Piazza was wonderful. We enjoyed it especially in the evening, since they had great entertainment and food.

Fun piazza to visit at the end of the day. We went here around 9:00PM, it was fun. Lots of activity, many restaurants to choose from. Lots of good energy. Some artists selling their goods. The fountain is nice to see.

Lovely, and a great buzz, but the restaurants are ordinary yet expensive.. Nice for a late drink in the evening, but the restaurants are far too expensive and serve just the same food you get in any of the many tributary streets leading to the square. Don't be paying 25 Euros for a Pizza at lunchtime guys !

Great place to sit and relax for an hour or two.. After many hours of sightseeing, we visited the Piazza Navona. It was crowded with tourists, and locals displaying their art and craft for sale, but it was spectacular. The fountain in the middle of the square is just amazing. There are lots of restaurants around the square and some gelato shops. It is a great place to sit and relax for a while. There were also some street musicians who made our visit all the more pleasant .
Great Place. Went here in my trip to Rome back in March of 2014. Loved the atmosphere as there is soo much to do and see around the area including a short walk which is the Pantheon.

Beautiful in the evening!! (and in the day of course). Its amazing to sit down and admire these fountains especially at night as they are so magnificent but there is one problem that really lets this (and everywhere else in Rome) down. I don't mind the art sellers etc. but all of these 'Selfie stick, Selfie stick' sellers and and all of the other cheap tat these street sellers get in your way with really are annoying and I wish the police/goverment would crack down on it!!! I suppose this isn't Piazza Navona's fault haha but it does let down the experience in Rome. (But it might not irritate everyone I suppose) but the fountains alone defiantly are amazing.
Nice Piazza. Easy to see along with the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. Easily worth a stop if you are in the area. As always read up on the history before visiting as it makes it much more enjoyable.

Magic. I don't now the countless number of time that I have been to Piazza Navona, and it still takes my breath away at any time of the day or night! The sheer foresight of the designers is incredible - such beauty and magnificent proportions. Easily one of the top sites to visit in Rome
Beautiful. Really beautiful square in Rome, its nice to sit and watch the world go by, My only bit of advice is its quite expensive to eat in the restaurants surrounding the squares
Our favourite place ever. Can sum this place up in just one word...incredible. I won't bore you with a long review - just make sure you leave a day to spend here because you won't want to leave!
Navona. Loved it here and spent time just enjoying the sights and art. Rome has a lovely surprise of artwork on almost every corner!

Beautiful site. This piazza is a lovely as the movies and pictures make it out to be. The art and architecture of the piazza are impressive and awe inspiring. It seems to always be crowded and the restaurants are priced for tourists, which make it expensive. I do enjoy the sight of the piazza, but it is more of a marker of how much farther I need to go to get to other sites.

My favourite place to watch the world go by. The Piazza Navona is always vibrant & welcoming, anytime of year. There were street performers, artists selling their creations, families & friends enjoying being together, with plenty of places to eat and enjoy being in Rome!

Beautiful square. Piazza Navona was the first place we went to when we arrived in Rome and it put the bar rather high, beautiful scenery wise. Be sure to visit the piazza Navona during the daytime as well as night.At night you have to explore the streets around the square and discover the nice restaurants, bars and nightlife.
Beautiful. It is amazing so much to learn appreciate Great ambiance ..the fountain is amazing the details ...the history involved

This is the real Piazza experience!. One of my favorite places in Rome. Sit down, relax and order a coffee or beer in one of the sidewalk cafe's (there are plenty). The Piazza itself is quite large and the sculpture/fountain is beautiful, quintessential Rome. In the Piazza itself you will find artists, locals and yes - plenty of tourists!

Beautiful piazza with 3 fountains. This beautiful well-known rectangular shaped piazza, features 3 fountains; the impressive central Three Rivers Fountain was designed by Bernini, who also designed the famous Trevi Fountain. The piazza is lined on one side with restaurants, most of which have very average food, but wonderful views. A perfect place for a late afternoon stroll.

The Incomparable Piazza Navona. In the historic center of Rome stands one of the most beautiful and well-preserved piazzas you'll ever see. Today, it still maintains it's spectacular ambiance as an open air air forum by day, replete with art shows and live artists pairing portraits, while at night it bustles with pedestrians visiting its sidewalk restaurants. It also boasts one of the 4 live video cams stationed throughout the city. This piazza displays the magnificent creations of both Bernini and Borromini: respectively, Four Rivers and Neptune's fountains. It also has two other fountains. At the southern end is the Fontana del Moro sculpted by Giacomo della Porta to which, in 1673, Bernini added a statue of a Moor, or African, wrestling with a dolphin. At the northern end is the Fountain of Neptune also created by della Porta. The Church of St. Agnes in Agnone is also located here. Its vibrant history is inextricably attached to the great ancient Roman athletics stadium, Stadium Domitian, which used to occupy the area of the present piazza.

Fountain of the Four Rivers is a must see........ Fan of Dan Brown and the book/movie Angels and Demons then you will recognize the fountain in the center of the piazza, the Fountain of the 4 Rivers. Restored just over two years ago it is an impressive sight to see. Along with two other fountains the piazza is a good place to unwind during your touring of Rome.There is a beautiful church to visit and local artist display their wares for sale. Beware of the street performers who can be a pest to get a tip or two. The restaurants are geared to the visitor and you can do better in food and price elsewhere. The shops in the area are geared as well to the visitor.It is a beautiful place to visit day or night. A must stop on any list.

nice to spend time and just enjoy the scenery. Lots of people, lots of street artists and a lot of restaurants. perfec to spend some time relaxing and being entertais by the many options...we had this lovely clown in front of us...he was great and made is laugh hard....

Beautiful bustling spot. This square is lively and full of interesting street performing acts to enjoy. The fountains and sculptures are beautiful. It is a lovely spot to rest, take in your surroundings and maybe even grab another gelato.
A lovely square. A nice place to grab an ice cream or drink. Prices to be expected. Lovely fountains and if you're a fan of Geocaching a really nice multicache here.

Worth the visit. this is a pretty piazza with a number of fountains. There were a few street performers and arts & craft sellers as well. Alongside the central fountain is a church (St Agnes de Agone from memory) that is a must visit; it is like visiting a number of churches in one go.

THREE FOUNTAINS AND A CHURCH. Piazza Navona is one of my favorite place in Rome. The artists showing their chef d'oeuvre and good food all around the place are always appreciated. But there are more: the three fountains with their own stories (you have to read a little bit about this, you wil be surprised ) and the beautiful chrurch are something you cannot avoid. But the most important thing at Piazza Navona is something pretty difficult to describe: this is the atmnosphere of this place. At the moment you arrive there you can feel it. This is totally different than the feeling you can have visiting Piazza Di Spagna per exemple. I do not know why but this is special.This is easy to reach Piazza Navona. Not so far from the Pantheon and the Vatican. I have heard a roman saying: "If you do have not seen Piazza Navona, it is like do not having seen Rome". This is not really true because Rome has so much to offer to the visitors, but this is true that each visit to Rome I always spend a few hours there... to feel the place and its special atmosphere. I highly recommend that you do the same.

A must see place in Rome. It's a big square with three fountains... The fountain in the middle has an obelisk as well... They are decorated with awesome sculptures, definitely a must see place in Rome...

Great for people watching. Lots of outdoor restaurants to choose from and the people watching is great here. You should also check out the famous fountain, Fountain of the 4 Rivers (quatri fiumi) if you are a fan of the Dan Brown book Angels and Demons you'll recognize this fountain.
More Amazing Sculpture. A wonderful piazza to stroll and enjoy a drink or gelato. We love the founatins and stunning sculptures. Avoid the tourist-trap restaurants though!
Gorgeous piazza. The fountain in surrounded by gorgeous shops. Beware of the performers and gladiators that want to be paid if you take a picture of them.
My favourite spot in Rome. Highly reccomended day time or night time! Typical Italian vibe and authenticity :) nice restaurants , artists, dancing , music , And lovely scenery .
Gorgeous place... Piazza Navona is such a beautiful place...there is a church close to it which is very beautiful... You really have to check it out...

beautiful spot. Piazza Navona is great place to strole through and take on the fountain, see street performers, and get lunch. There are a few restaurants in the area so you have options. The detail in the sculptutes is incredible. I would recommend stopping by.

The best piazza in Rome!. Beautiful, with a unique ambience, this is the place to go in order to relax and really appreciate what you have seen during your visit to Rome.
Also, there is a must see market of artists, seeling their art.

The Fountain is truely beautiful but there is so much more here.. from the levitating Indian as you enter the Piazza to the watercolor art work at the other end of the Piazza this is a nice area to take in the upscale "flee market atmosphere". I was here 30 years ago and it was filled with nothing but artist and art work; in fact I bought a watercolor back then. this trip August 2015, I did not see too many artist actually creating art but a variety of small stands displaying their wares.

Great sculptures. In a city of amazing sculptures, the Piazza Navona holds its own. In addition there are artists with original paintings (some better than others) who work right there and sell their work. Lots of places to eat are located around the piazza, and don't miss the Gladiator Museum which explains what is under the piazza.
Nice piazza but not really Italian. Really touristic, but there is always something to do. Beautiful fountains. Do not eat at the restaurants here, though. You pay way more then you should.
Very Nice. The Piazza is very nice, the fountains are lovely to look at and there are some nice restaurants and cafes around the outside of the square.

The Central Fountain can't be missed. The fountain; Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers) in the center is fabulous. The sculpture was done by Bernini and is so human in effect. (For those that get to Ca' d'Oro in Venice they will be pleased to see two of the original clay studies for this fountain on display.) This has to be my favorite statues (& fountain) in Rome. Always on my walking tour of the city. Love the fontana e piazza..
Unforgettable trip. Everyone has to see Piazza Navona. The experience of beeing on that square is unforgettable. Rome is a dream city.
My favorite place in Rome!. Great place to catch your breath and people watch!, not too far from the Pantheon. We always have a meal at Tre Scalini, fresh pasta, good wine.

A square where pigeons, artist and musician compete for attention. This square is full of life and great place to spend your afternoon. Lots of artists in the square so you could spend your time getting your caricature made or just sit around listening to buskers while pigeons keep picking on left overs on the ground. Good gelato places around so eat a gelato and chill by one of the fountains for a laid back afternoon in Rome.

an optional item on your Rome list. This is a nice place, shaped by the ancient theater. Lots of cafés and restaurants. But there are other nice places as well in Rome. So if you can fit in, go there.
The Fountain of Four Rivers. The Piazza is very attractive, very lively but Bernini's masterpiece fountain depicting the four continents (four rivers) is a must see beauty.

Busy and entertaining . We came back to the Piazza Novona a couple of times during our weekend break in Rome. The Piazza itself is flanked by the imposing architecture you see all around Rome. It sets the scene perfectly for the entertainment of the various street theatre taking place in the square. The middle of the Piazza is festooned with various artists selling their wares and offering to paint/draw you while you sit. The whole place lights up at night into an enchanting arena of cosmopolitan magic and the atmosphere is wonderful. Grab a coffee at one of the many cafe bars around the Piazza and just people watch or spend the evening al fresco dining and soak up the atmosphere. Either way do make this part of any visit you make to Rome
Great Atmosphere!. Great place to wonder around and see artisans and beutiful sculptures! Lots to see and great place to people watch.

Revisit the City.. Lot to see and do at this location, great place to chill over a beer, wine, coffe or ice cream. Also a great place to eat at any time of day and night, various shops and artists to paint you and the family.

A square full of energy!!!. You can't miss this, it's a square with lots of restaurants, street painters, an amazing going in and a nice church which is free to visit. The square is located close to pantheon. There is a Gelateria which boasts of the best ice cream in Rome!! Or the universe!!!

Best place in Rome to absorb its atmosphere. I like this place, with its lively character, the restaurants around are expensive and food is terrible, so I recommend ordering a coffee and just sitting there for some time and enjoying the atmosphere.

Joyful spot and best icecream. I was there in March 2014 and I enjoyed the time !! It is a nice piazza, with fountains, great icecream, noise and many people. I could stay in the shadow and enjoy my icecream while admiring the buildings, the fountains and the sexy guys :)
Lovely to sit and soak up the atmosphere. A beautiful square. Lots of lovely restaurants, bars and street artists. It used to be used to re-enact sea battles that the Colosseum was too small to host.

Wonderful Atmosphere. If you want to sit in an Italian cafe drinking coffee and watching people go by then this is THE place to go, especially in the evening. Meals are a little more expensive than those in the side streets but you're surrounded by artists and street performers that you don't get elsewhere.

Lovely large piazza. It's so nice to just sit here and take in the beauty of the architecture. We sat here for a while just looking around. The whole square is beautiful
Lots of coffee shops and restaurants to sit down and appreciate the scene

A Beautiful "Piazza". This was the place where athletic-type races used to be held in ancient times. (Formerly Stadium of Domitian). It's a really large and beautiful square with the Fountain of Four Rivers in the centre. There is a church in front of the fountain and a couple of other fountains on either ends of the square. It is a quite happening place as well with loads of tourists, street music etc.

One nigth. If one nigth ypu have no idea to where to go well seat in one of the coffe around the place just take it easy and look at this living theatre is so nice to look att the people around is just a realyity show i love it

Lovely atmosphere.. Having planned to just walk through Piazza Navona and admire the fountains on the way to other attractions, we wiled away 3 hours looking at artwork for sale, having a leisurely brunch and listening to a the live music. Go and enjoy. Oh and the fountains are pretty fabulous too!
A must visit. Always fun to visit Piazza Navona to see the fountains, the artists, the people and to either have lunch or gelato. Didn't disappoint.

Enjoyed it even when it was Raining. We reached the place after running from the rain, we reached there found for sure all the people were singing and playing preparing to leave after the rain, but still we enjoyed the place under the rain but I think if there wasn't we will enjoy it more

Incredible square. Une of the most particolar squadra in Rome and in The whole world: it could be a good idea visita it, especially early in the morning or late in the nught, without the crowd of the tourists. Il

Beautiful Fountains. This was the largest piazza we saw in Rome with one very large fountain and two smaller fountains. All were beautiful as were the surrounding buildings. There are several restaurants. In the evening there were performers to watch. This piazza is located a very short walk from the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain. You could see all three locations in the same afternoon. This is a nice spot for photos.

My favourite place in rome. Away form he main sights such as the coliseum and the Vatican lies piazza navona a huge open space in which you can really take in the essence of Rome without having to cross endless busy roads,although bustle there is a sense of peace in this square,filled with fountains stalls and amazing pizzerias! Deafeningly worth a visit as it it also close to the pantheon.

Beautiful piazza Navona. It was the best piazza with a fabulous ornate fountain which was lit up in the evening also had some lovely restaurants we enjoyed Domiziano a Ristorante - Bar - Pizzeria the food was excellent

Nice to relax . Piazza navona is also known as the artists place. Lots of them gather especially in the evenings and have some shows. Sell some paintings and the fountains there are so nice. Have a look it's worth walking to it

Beautiful. This is what a Piazza should be like...beautiful, bustling with people fountains, church and lots of thing a going on with street entertainers/ artists etc and restaurants to eat at to watch the world go by.One of my favourite places to visit in Rome

Beautiful. Perfect for people watching too!. Gorgeous square, lovely architecture ( as usual in Rome!)After you have admired the beautiful fountains, take time to visit the church in the Piazza too.Many bars and restaurants to sit at and have a drink while you enjoy the view. Prices are higher, and they refuse to serve tap water.
Nearly missed this gem. Saw this on a night Segway tour. It's wonderful here at night. Fire twirlers. Artists. The fountain. Wow. Many restaurants. Only 2 ways in. Don't miss it.
amazing place. amazing place . Rome is a "museum" ! I love the city and its historical atmosphere! Piazza Navona is full of energy and activity.Don't forget to try the pistachio icecream. Delicious !

Super Fun Piazza!. Piazza Navona is a must see! Centrally located and bustling, especially in the evenings. The restaurants here are pricey, the street vendors annoying but it does not detract from this grand piazzas beauty. The fountains are gorgeous but take a moment to look at the buildings framing Piazza Navona. We travelled with our children ... They loved running around the Piazza while we sipped wine. We felt at ease allowing them to explore without us by their side here!
Nice for chilling. Cool place to relax in the evening and watch the street artists. However I would not eat here as the restaurants are overpriced.

Sit, Sip and See. Very busy plaza well into the night. Lots of hawkers performance artists and cafes to sit, sip and see it all. Apparently it is an ancient sight of horse races and that's why it is so large and oval shaped. We stayed in an AirBnB on the Piazza and were able to walk just about everywhere we wanted to go. Very central and in the thick of it all.
Comes alive in evenings. Great place to visit especially by weekend evenings, because there is lot of street performances going on. Daily there is lot of street painters doing caricatures.

Piazza Navona. My favourite square in Rome. Get there at 9:00AM to avoid the crowds and appreciate the piazza in all its glory. Get there in the evening for a wonderful experience of culture, art and people watching.

Something for everyone. Whether you love architecture, history, art, food or live performances, there's something here for everyone! Perhaps that could be said for all of Rome, bit Piazza Navona in particular boasts a wealth of stunning fountains, lovely museums, charming restaurants and wonderful street performers from jewellery makers to caricature artists. This is the perfect place to visit with your family, and the perfect place to spend some of your holiday money!
Special for night tour . Amazing place for all the family !!!In the summer there are many events. Many good restaurants, and many artists that make your tour nice and enjoyable!

Beautiful fountains and creative artists. The Piazza is filled with statues and fountains and surrounded by cute restaurants, the Pamphili Palace and other small museums. In the center of the Piazza, artists are creating some art works and selling their wares. Enjoyed my stroll around Piazza, then enjoyed a refreshing drink in the Museo di Roma cafe.

Perfect for all the family.. Brilliant place for all the family, street performers, restaurants, artists.We only planned to visit here once but we ended up going for 3 days in a row and had dinner here twice.Loved it.
beautiful square. Piazza Navona is one of the best squares in Rome, hosting some of the most beautiful fountains, churches and palaces of the eternal city.

Beautiful night sight. Walking through Rome at evening we ate an great italian icecream at this place, and have a great dinner at restaurant near by. Beautuful colours of night light and fountain water perfectly match each other.

Nice in the evening. Had a meal outside with the family, which was very pleasent. The kids to run around the piazza and enjoy the various entertainment that is offered, music, spray can art and others. Worth a visit as it one of the larger piazzas and therefore more room and seating for the restaurants.

Our favourite piazza in Rome. This was so beautiful with sculptures & fountains. We stayed at the Locanda Navona hotel so were able to enjoy this piazza in the evening with all the visitors & also very early in the morning with the sunrise making it a magical place.

Very entertaining piazza at night. This piazza is very entertaining when visited during the evening. Lots of local artists and entertainers performing. During the day it can be extremely full of tourists. Avoid the restaurants because they are extremely expensive. Rather opt for the authentic restaurants in the little streets, where the locals eat.

Enjoyable evening in the square. The square ia a lovely touristic place. Ale artists drawing caricature makes it more attractive. Walking around and watching the oblique which is an Egyptian pride and the fountain is really pleasant

A Great Place. Our very favorite piazza in all of Rome. It contains great sculptures and fountains built over an historic chariot racing track,
There are a myriad of outstanding outside and inside cafes many offering music.
Beautiful Piazza. We went by there in the afternoon and saw many art vendors, from beautiful paintings to photographs. Beautiful church here as well.
Gorgeous Piazza!. I loved Piazza Navona. So many local street vendors and artists. It's just a relaxing place. I could people watch here regularly!
One of the most amazing Piazza's of Rome.... The Fountain of the 4 rivers and other fountains on the side are magical and artistically amazing.....

Always something to see. Lots of artists novelty acts etc. in the piazza. Plenty to eat most especially PIZZA, great atmosphere! It is located within walking distance to many attractions ie: Trevi Fountain other Piazza's, shopping.
I wish I had an apartment overlooking this piazza :). Love just sitting in this Piazza watching people passing by, artists creating and getting the vibe of this breathtakingly beautiful city!!!

Beautiful place both at night and day. Lots of people watching and tourity things around. Dont waste time with the vendors. The fountains are beautiful to watch and they are lit up at night. Watch out for pickpockets.

Lovely Piazza. I looooooved it!! I had the opportunity to go to Rome on my own and loved going to Piazza Navona in the afternoon-night to just sit and drink water from the fountains while watching people and the artists. Once I had a nice coffee dessert and a drink at one of the restaurant and had such a delicious time, I wish I could be there right now.

Nice little piazza. After visiting the Parthenon we were looking for a nice place to relax a bit and have a drink. We saw this piazza on the map and walked the 3 or so blocks over. It is a nice open place in the middle of the city with three beautiful fountains. We were there in the evening and the piazza was full of artists of all kinds and a few street performers. There were several nice looking restaurants around the edges and a place to fill our water bottles.

Alive and kicking!. Come later in the day, during diner time the square starts to fill up with artists of all sorts. Get your portrait taken in a realistic style or cartoony. Or look at the funny and amazing street artists. It's all here and more because it isn't just the people, the square phase 3 lovely fountains. Sadly enough they aren't lit at night, well the 2 "little" once at either side of the square are but just barely! Surrounding the square are lots of restaurants where you can get a bite to eat. But in my opinion you'd be better of in one of the establishments in one of the streets leading away from the square. Restaurants on the square tend to be pushy, come in..eat and leave as quickly as possible.

My favourite square. Rome is packed with beautiful squares, both large and small. While they are all delightful, Piazza Navona remains my favourite. It is lined with cafes,and restaurants and filled with tourists and locals watching street artists and performers. Encircling the square are palaces and churches. One cannot but be affected by the beauty of this large piazza, lovely by day and by night.Of the two magnificent fountains gracing the square,the Fountain of the Four Rivers is the most famous. However, the Fountain of Neptune at the opposite end is also impressive.Breathtaking!

Stayed in this area . We were lucky enough to find an apartment on airbnb that was located in the piazza navona. We loved staying here! The piazza navona is very central to everything. Even in mid July we walked everywhere. We never felt that this area was over crowded. If I were to visit Rome again I would stay here again. We had a beautiful terrace over looking the entire piazza. I couldn't imagine a better place to stay in Rome! We only took cabs when we were going in travestere or testaccio late at night. Other than that we walked everywhere..
Liked it. A historic place u have to visit in Rome surrounded by a lot of restaurants & bars, it's v close to pantheon & the fountain.I liked this historic spirit.
Very beautiful. Great place to hang out a while. Beautiful fountain with nice buildings around it, you can enjoy a time to take a drink or an ice cream in the restaurants nearby.

Beautiful piazza and fountain. Having read other reviews I think we did well to visit this on Sunday morning. There were a few people around but it was not too busy to see the magnificent buildings around it. The fountain was spectacular and we were amazed at the carving of the figures in it. There are lots of cafes and restaurants around the piazza and there range from reasonably priced to expensive. Well worth a walk as there are some lovely streets around here too.

Great people watching. Great spot for a drink and people watching. Can't comment on restaurants directly on the square for anything other than dessert or drinks but my impression is food is average at best.

Iconic!. Always a treat to return to the Piazza Navona – an iconic landmark in Rome steeped in history. It is a very large piazza that attracts tourist and locals alike; especially for the evening stroll. In the center is the famous Fountain of the Four Rivers (1651 by Bernini) which sits in front of the church, Sant’Agnese in Agone. There are 2 other fountains in the piazza – Fontana del Moro (Moor Fountain) and Fontana del Nettuno (Fountain of Neptune) by Giacomo della Porta. All three fountains are large and exquisite.

EU world wind tour . Love the square! The fountains were pretty. Not a large amount of water running through but very pretty in pics. The food was really good at Cibo in Piazza. Alex was great! Not sure if he's the manager but he stands outside the restaurant and ushers people to the restaurant.

EU world wind tour . Love the square! The fountains were pretty. Not a large amount of water running through but very pretty in pics. The food was really good at Cibo in Piazza. Alex was great! Not sure if he's the manager but he stands outside the restaurant and ushers people to the restaurant.
Gorgeous. Great square to dine, watch the world go buy and take in the amazing view. Fabulous atmosphere after a day touring the sights.
Lovely. This area is beautiful, I recommend you to stay close to this place. Around the piazza are narrow streets with lovely restaurants and pubs.
crowded piazza. A large piazza with all the cafes and eateries surrounding. Beautiful spectacular fontanas & buildings around.

If you are in Rome this is an other square that you wont want to miss.. Great famous square in the middle of Rome that is an other of these monuments that I recommed you see when in Rome. Seat at the fountain, Grab an Ice Cream in the Bar / Gelateria close by and Enjoy majestic history of old Roma.

Lovely area. This was well worth the visit. We ate in a restaurant in the plaza right next to the main fountain. The food was great and it was nice to relax and soak up the atmosphere and watch the world go buy.
great place to stay an afternoon. This square is a really nice place to stay and appreciate the surroundings. It is quite lively with several street artists and restaurants around.

Beautiful. These fountains were beautiful. Not an astonishing amount of water running through the fountain but the sculptures were breathtaking. The sound of the water was relaxing. Be careful at night it can get loud and busy. There were a ton of "vendors" and the bars were filled with people. You should put it in your "better see" column.

Amazing.... Hello! Rome is wonderful and so is this place, Piazza Navona is beautiful and a must if you ever go to Rome. There are many tourists and sellers around there. There are also people painting arts. They are very skilled. Go around enjoy, eat lunch or dinner and relax. It's beautiful. We recommend that you visit this place.Lucia och Jim
Great area in Rome. Very touristic piazza probably the most touristic one. The food there was really good. It's a great piazza for relaxing and dining and enjoying ur afternoon or ur evening.

LOVE IT!!. This is realy worth visiting! It is very nice.
And the people at the bars are very friendly.
We liked it here better than in the trevi fountain.

Must see place in every Rome trip. This is a must see place is every Rome tourists' itinerary.... Excellent piazza.... Had a good dinner in one of the many fancy restaurants there.... Totally enjoyed the street shows.... Kids loved the street vendors.... Nice souvenir and toy shops.... Mark this spot on your map always....

Great area to stay!. The area around Piazza Navona is a great place to stay. It's fearly quiet and still close to Trastevere for night life, and tourist views on the other side. The piazza it self is beautiful, best a little early or a little late, when its not that touristpacked.

Hidden Gem!. Piazza Navona, tucked away in the small back-streets of Rome, is spark of life and Roman activity. Meandering through the small cobblestone streets searching for the famed Piazza was fun in itself, then all of a sudden it opens up into this huge square of activity.We arrived later in the day, around 6:00pm and considered finding something to eat. During peak tourist season, it was very busy and crowded with other tourists just as ourselves. Bit of a task to get a few pictures in front of the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers) with its obelisk jutting out of the center. As with all statues found around Rome, the detail in the carvings were astounding and with the sun beginning to set the light was casting wonderful shadows high-lighting some of the exquisite detail. We had done a Vatican tour in the morning and the first thing that my 10-year-old daughter pointed out was the Papal Coat of Arms with the keys and tiara, which was also found on the Sant'Agnese in Agone facing the fountain.It was a very enjoyable evening strolling around the Piazza, looking at the various wares being sold by street vendors and seeing the other sights and sounds around. The other two fountains at each end of the square were much smaller in scale, but not in beauty. The Fontana Moro made me laugh a bit watching the "spitting guys". Again, I caught some beautiful light while gazing at the Fontana del Nettuno, which I loved immensely.We did not choose to eat there this time, but the restaurants looked excellent - and had prices to match. If you are looking for a nice dinner out, I would go there. We weren't really dressed the part that day and opted for something quicker and less formal. I would also like to return later at night to experience the fountains illuminated.In my opinion, your trip to Rome wouldn't be complete without at least visiting Piazza Navona.

Piazza Navonna, Rome - best ice-cream ever!. Very busy place, lots of options for all food lovers. The piazza itself is really beautiful, flowers everywhere. The little ice-cream shop there, Gelateria Tre Fontane, is probably the best in Rome - try the Grape gelato!
Must see in rome!. One of the most popular places in Rome!Artists, painters, sketch artists cozy restaurants and musicians all in one place!

Great place to relax and admire the 4 River Fountain. We've stayed about 5 minutes away from Piazza Navona. Everyday after breakfast we walked over there for ice-cream for our kids and coffee for us. We had there one of the best ice-cream we have ever had. So relaxing. Absolutely beautiful way to enjoy a morning.
Stunning fountains. Three excellent fountains. Lively street entertainment: art, people watching. Get a caricature done of your travelling companion ( in my case two children)!

Enjoyable. We stopped by the Piazza at noon time. There were local artist and lots of resturants . I was impressed by the fountain of the four rivers. If you have read the Dan Brown novel or see the ovie angels and Demons, yes this fountain was in the movie. Do not miss going inside the church that is beside the fountain. It is beatuifu as well.

Wasn't that fascinating. It wasn't a memorable experience, I'd rather spend my time going elsewhere thay just to come here. If you like to sit down and relax then maybe it will be a great place to do so. Other than that nothing is impressive.

Loved this Piazza. I loved this Piazza!!!!
It was huge, had 3 beautiful fountains and was very vibrant with many street vendors and artists set up showing their works of art.
A definite must see while in Rome!!!

Best place worth visiting when in Rome.. Came to this place as part of my private car tour in Rome for 3 days, the fountains are very historical and unique in their design and there are plenty of bustiers doing street performance, art-work or magical tricks. Being in more or less the centre of Rome and with very little traffic, it is a peaceful and pleasant street that is worth visiting when you are in Italy. There are a cafe and a museum near by, charges apply but apart from that everything in Piazza Navona is very easy-going and you can stroll at your own leisure..
Diner . Amazing place to be. Lot of activities and yummy food. Recommend for everyone to go there. A wonderful chapel lays in there!
Great!. Nice place for walking and the location was near to some tourist spots in Rome. The place was so crowded.

outstanding beauty and great location. My wife and I enjoyed an excellent time in Rome. This was her favourite place - we were there as the light was fading - brilliant for photos. There were a lot of people but it is a huge piazza. The architecture is stunning with high buildings all around the piazza and huge fountains. We had a superb time there and would warmly recommend it.

Cool and talented street artists. I saw some pretty talented artists here. One of the highlights were the spray paint artists that would make some really pretty and interesting stuff. It's really cool to watch them at work. Generally the art they sell is sold for 10 euro.

People watching . Nice place to people watch - Other touristsLots of street artist's putting a smile on the kids facesLot's of artists selling paintings There are other better options for people watching, tourist prices in the restaurants.

Night life Rome. We stayed in a B&B 30 meters from this piazza and found the night life entertainment very good with artist and all kinds of performers.The 3 fountains are not to be missed and it is essential to read the history of the fountains.Also visit the ‘church‘on the piazza used doily for service but a must to see. The piazza Navona is pretty central for visiting the main attractions including the Vatican. Plenty of good eating places around but Rome prices
Lovely Piazza,. A Vibrant and interesting Piazza with many restaurants, artists displaying their works and also some are painting whilst there

Fun fun fun!. Along with gorgeous historical fountains this "square" is a great place for entertainment. It's a short distance from some delicious little restaurants and great shops all around. I visited at night and the square was full of street performers and artists. It's something to experience. I wouldn't miss it.

Great place to check out!. Awesome square to check out. Restaurants that overlook the plaza and artists - entertainment and people watching. Nice fountain in the middle and architecture is fabulous. Go sit on a patio or just take in the sights. Close to Pantheon and truly worth a visit.

My favorite night time Piazza!. This was such a cool Piazza! So many artists set up here at night and in the evening and they are so talented and so much fun to watch. Not to mention, the beautiful scenery. Love the Bernini Fountain of the 4 Rivers!

Romantic evening in Rome. Lovely place to visit in Rome day and night. Fontani full of art all over, beautiful buildings around. I did not like the low lighting of the Piazza and the extremely high prices of the restaurants and cafeterias on and around the Piazza.

Great for an evening out. Beautiful, lively, clean, loads to see, artists at work, the fountains are outstanding, and fabulous little restaurants down the side streets were you can watch some street performers while you relax with great food and wine, and the best thing is, there's NO pressure to leave the restaurants, so RELAX

Steel your nerves against the chaos!. Insanity. Illegal buskers and sellers swarm you and everyone else here, tour groups clog up the alleys leading to it, and .... yeah, pretty, but hard to see while you're simultaneously watching your wallet and trying not to trip over the bags sold illegally (watch 'em scatter when the cops come by!). ;)
Beautiful place. Nice fountains and also a scene from Angels n Demons was shot here I think. Close to Pantheon and Campo d fuori. Lots of nice restaurants.

A Must See. Lively piazza. Beautiful original artwork, especially towards evening. Choose a restaurant on a side street. The prices will be better and so will the food. Be very careful, crowds get big and pickpockets are there. A must see.

Lovely place for an evening. Very pleasant piazza with three amazing fountains. Lots of artists selling paintings of Roman landmarks. Performance artists present as well. Piazza is surrounded by restaurants and shops.

World Famous Art and Artisanal Chocolate Ice Cream Creation. The Bernini fountain of the four rivers is sited at one end of the Piazza Navona and an obelisk at the other end. The four rivers were the greatest known to man at the time of Bernini's creation of this work. They were the Nile in Africa, the Ganges in Asia, the Danube in Europe and the Río de la Plata in America. the gods were surrounded by plants and animals found on location of these rivers. The only way to truly enjoy this monument by a phenomenal artist is to sit at the outdoor cafe, Tre Scalini and have a Tartufo which is aits “Tartufo”, a chocolate ice-cream truffle made entirely from natural ingredients, including 13 different types of Swiss chocolate, according to the original 1946 recipe.

The Best Piazza in Rome.... Centrally located & within easy walking distance to. Vatican, Castiello St Angello, Pantheon & others. Special because of its size, fountains, street scene, restaurants & nearby attractions. People meeting & mingling until 4:00 AM, always lively. We stayed near the NW edge, at Hotel Raphael, making multiple visits to Navona easy. Lots of sidewalk restaurants with authentic food. Gelaterias too & snacks & drinks. You'll enjoy & will definitely return several times...

A beautiful place to spend some quality time!. All the best Rome has to offer! Artists sell their work, loads of great cafes and breathtaking fountains! Piazza Navona is steps away from the Pantheon in the heart of old Rome. It is a magical piazza brimming with energy from all the artists. If you are lucky you will get to hear the Piazza Navona band playing live in the square. Just awesome!
Rome at its best. Wonderful plaza, should be on the to-do-list of every Rome visitor. The fountains are unique, and the atmosphere is fantastic.

Great Restaurants!!. Not only does Piazza Navona provide a historic back drop of its magnificent fountain in the middle of this rectangular Piazza, but it also provides a bustling nightlife with the tastes of Italy within reach of its many restaurants.

Rome's very own city Center. This is a city center with 3 fountains and a lot of hustle bustle. If you are visting Rome, this is a must see place where the statues are larger than life and tourist and artist pleanty.The alleys arround this area are connecting different places like the Pantheon and other areas. Dinners here are famous too.
Piazza Navona. No trip to Rome is complete without a visit to the Piazza Navona. Sit and people watch, eat a gelato, enjoy a meal or just walk around and enjoy the entertainment.

BEAUTIFUL FOUNTAIN, THAT'S ALL !. If you are really in to beautiful fountains with incredible sculptures then it's worth visiting, but if you are running out of time, you can skip Piazza Navona. There are some nice restaurants around but in my opinion nothing out of this world. There is so much to see in Rome that I would rather spend more time somewhere else that's more interesting. There are many more Piazzas with more going on, like Piazza del Popolo for example.

Piazza Navona. This is a nice central place which is oblong and with a oblique in the center and nice buildings around it. Lots of art work one can buy though we didn't buy. Restaurants around to eat. No entry fee and not far from pantheon and walking distance.

Three Fountains Here. You must visit this piazza, if not for the fountains that are located there. Three of them in fact. So you can satisfy your need to touch one of the fountains of Rome. It's less famous than Fontana di Trevi but equally grand. Surrounding the Piazza are buskers, mimes, ventriloquists, dancers, people selling souvenirs, artists, muses, etc. So not only do you get to see the fountains, you get to see some bargaining too. Just make sure you hold on to your purses/wallets properly. It's a haven for pickpockets.

Beautiful near the Pantheon. We walked there almost as a side trip from the Pantheon. It is very close and easy to find. Fantasticly large beautiful fountain. Hard to really take it all in unless you walk all around it. Numerous tourist shops and restaurants catering to the visitor. Communication was not an issue in the slightest due to the crowd that tends to show up. If you are in the area, I would higly recommend a stop. As with the Pantheon, the biggest issue is simply getting there. Please see my Pantheon review for suggestions. I would recommend making it a half day trip to look at numerous sites since the walk is mildly long though fantastic.
Exceptional. I am speechless! From every angle looks different. Two fountains, bars, restaurants, artists, vendors... It has it all

Don't waste your time. I really cannot figure out why Piazza Navona is considered an attraction or an activity.My family and I visited Piazza Navona on a Friday night. There were people everywhere; selling various goods, singing along to loud karaoke machines, sitting on the fountains and harassing you to eat at their restaurant. The scene was not at all pleasant nor was the experience. We walked through the Piazza a few other times on our way to other sights and the scene / experience was always the same, except for one early morning visit. BUYER BEWARE....It was just before 7 am and we saw one of the "artists" in the Piazza and his friend unloading their "art" from a shipping package. Apparently his "art: is not paint there at the Piazza.

Great place for food and inexpensive art. Piazza is beautiful, great fountains. Many restaurants, reasonably priced. Many artists are ther with art at different price points, but all semm to have quality pieces, some are even painting where they sell.

Bike Tour to the Piazza Navona. The Bike Tour is definitely a must if you want to hit all the highlights of Rome. Piazza Navona was just one stop and were also treated to gelato!! The plaza is filled with restaurants, art works, fountains and a beautiful church. The bike tour will also take you to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and Spanish Steps.
Beautiful, historic.. Plaza is very nice, surrounded by several very good cafes. At north end of Piazza is a museum showing how the piazza was at one time a horse race arena.

Quaint little place. We stopped here for a while on our tour. We had pizza at a little cafe right there by the fountain. Lots of shops and places to meander around. Fountain is so pretty! Loved Rome! Cant wait to go back!

If you need to do a Piazza, this is the one.. This is "the one" as much as for what's around it as for what's in it. Of course there's the multiple cafes in and around the piazza (though i advise walking a bit farther to either pizzeria da baffetto or baffetto 2 for great pizza).Piazza Navona is also a great start/stop for a walking tour that spans numerous antiquities like the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain (still under wraps for rejuvenation). Best preplanned walking tour can be found in Rick Steves guides. Note too that there are plenty of cabs at the taxi stand next to the Piazza.

Cute plaza but eat somewhere else. Very nice square with fountain and monuments and beautiful artwork. Beware of the restaurants around the piazza navona however as they charge way too much for the food and by just sitting around the corner not in the piazza navona itself you pay half the price! Take a few coins for the street performer of your choice for a bit of fun.
Lovely. Lovely square with beautiful artists in the centre. The fountain is stunning. The restaurants and souvenir shops are very expensive so I'd suggest a short walk to find cheaper.

Heart of The Rome. Before going Rome, I had a travel guide book. In the book, it has been said that, have a lunch at Piazza Navona. I was not hungry, so I did not eat anything, but the square was full of people, clowns and attractions. Especially kids had a good time watching the magicians and other performers

Great place to sit around and see some art. There isn't a main attraction here, just a square to sit around, ether by the fountain or the benches along the perimeter. My friends and I settled by some steps near a building to eat our Tartufo. If you're here for the Tartufo, get it takeaway for a cheaper price. Note that Frigidarium is also nearby, offering possible the best Gelato in Rome.

A beautiful, but very busy square.... over run with selfie sticks!. This is a lovely place to just go and people watch. Its extremely busy, but the piazza is quite large with beautiful buildings on 3 sides, and cafes & restaurants on one side. There is a fantastic fountain in the middle of the piazza which is really the main focal point. We sat and had lunch with a glass of wine watching the world go by. The only thing that completely ruined this area is the amount of people with selfie sticks, either selling them or using them to take photos. It was actually ridiculous as you could not move in any direction without bumping into or being offered a selfie stick. They have been banned at the colosseum, so hopefully the rest of Rome follows!
Very pretty. The prettiest piazza in all of Rome. The fountains were a delight for the eye. Sit in one of the cafés, relax and enjoy watching Rome come to life.

Crowded--but a "must see!". Located right in the center of Rome; we happened across thus important site on an early trip to Rome; there was some sort of "demonstration" (read labor action) so it was crowded, but we enjoyed the fountain at the center. There are restaurants surrounding the Piazza, but I would recommend staying out of them. If you take one of the "side streets" that leave the Piazza, I believe that you would be better served. Guys "inviting" you into their establishments is not the best recommendation! In any event, there is great people watching and I went back there one day in the "golden light" of the last afternoon and got some fabulous shots of the statues.

Unbelievable! . So nice! !!! I am speechless! Last night and today we had the pleasure of being right there and it's beyond explanation. I must have taken over 150 photos only on there and the surrounding area. From every angle looks different. Amazing work! How is it possible for such place to exist, ingenious! We had dinner there close by which made our time there even more beautiful and memorable. I will for sure go back there again and again!Thank you! Galia
Great piazza. Two fountains, bars, restaurants, artists, vendors... It has it all. There are lots of people as its popular. Recommend a visit!

Fountains and Artists. This place is full of life. Artists selling and tourists walking around. Beautiful architecture. Great place for cool pictures. There are a few restaurants around the piazza. If you are buying, remember to ask for a discount.

Piazza Navona. I visited here at night and loved it. The fountain of the four rivers is well worth a visit and there is a small open air market to purchase pictures, paintings and portrait caricatures. there are plenty of restaurants and gelato shops also.

Place to relax. Beautiful place for fountains, architecture and restaurants. Very nice church in between the two fountains, beautiful artwork. Just after the piazza finishes there is paid public toilet - very clean, costs an euro - must admit was very happy to locate it :)

Great people watching. This is a great piazza for watching life. Remember that it is a tourist area so there are pick pockets. Be aware and keep your valuables in check and you'll be fine. There are many restaurants around the Piazza - they are pricey and over-rated. Don't expect a great meal but if you're okay with that, it's fun to sit on a terrace with a prosecco and watch the world go by.

Elegant. Possibly my favourite place in Rome. For Brits, I would say that this is Rome's Covent Garden. Elegant architecture, street entertainers, artists, good - if slightly expensive, compared to the rest of Rome - restaurants and Bernini's beautiful fountain.

Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful space to go for a stroll. There's a lovely fountain in the center of the piazza. In addition, I got to view some great street performers and sift through art being sold in the piazza. I would definitely recommend it :)

Beautiful. This is a fantastic place to grab a coffee or lunch and watch the world go by. It is one of the most beautiful piazzas in Rome and has a beautiful fountain in the centre. It's also on the way between the Trevi Fountain, The Pantheon and St. Peter's square if your walking around Rome.
popular. A popular place for the area of Rome with lots of beautiful architecture, an amazing fountain, an art market and restaurants. About 5 minutes' walk from the Pantheon.

Great Gatherings!. Great place to relax or eat at one of the restaurants or have a drink. Our hotel was in this area which was great because we walked to everything. There were lots of artists selling fake paintings LOL! you would see most of them with a paintbrush but the paintings were always done plus you would see the same painting throughout Rome. LOL!!! We rarely were harassed by peddlers as many on TA complained about. Just ignore them and don't make eye contact with them and if you do give them "the look", don't even try to come near me look!

A beautiful piazza and a special treat for brazilians.. This is one of the nicest places in Roma. But it depends if it is busy or if you have it for yourself and a few others. So pick the hour of the day you visit it. Right in the center is the Fontana dei 4 fiumes, which is already worth the visit. You can throw a coin in it while The Trevis is closed and wish for happiness forever or simply for the crowds disappear for a few minutes. The Piazza has two other fountains, one in each side. Some portraitists will try to hassle you into their jobs - not worth it. The best thing is to seat at the ice cream place os one of the sides (you wont miss it) take some pictures and post in the instagram for your friends go crazy with jealousy. It is not a cheap thrill. For brazilians a special treat. At the end of the piazza is the fantastic Palazzo Pamphilj ( famous papal family), where is located the Brazilian Embassy, the nicest by far in the city. Visits can be arranged at the Embassy site.

lovely restaurants here. in the square there was lots of people selling paintings and craft work here. the atmosphere is very nice here. with lots of restaurants to dine here.We went to dinner around the square and i can say all the restaurants seemed nice but we are so lucky we chose a really nice one!

Nice place to get a drink. This is a nice square with a beautiful fountain and a lot of artists, musicians all around. Nice to walk around and get a drink or a bite to eat. Not really much to see. Just a nice hang out. Beware tourist traps! :)

A really lovely piazza - vibrant and cultured. We absolutely loved spending time in this piazza. A lovely fountain is surrounded by local artists and tradesman (some sell tat to be honest but some stuff is good i.e. handmade jewellery). The artists were fantastic - creating pictures and paintings in front of a crowd. There are street performers (good ones!) that included dancers, magicians etc - not just the usual rubbish. Surrounding the perimeter of the piazza are lots of lovely restaurants - the food is gorgeous! Was so nice to sit and have some food/drinks and look out onto the piazza at all the hustle and bustle - great :)

4 Rivers fountain is amazing but the peddlers are uncomfortable, still Rome's most beautiful piazza. I seem to cram my review into my subject line. Piazza Navona may be Rome's most beautiful square. The buildings around it are elegant and the highlights are the famous Four Rivers fountain by Bernini and the Santa Agnes Church. All of this is great.The down side of the Piazza are throngs of tourists, including my family, and peddlers rudely pushing themselves into one's face. The item of the moment and seen throughout Rome was "selfie" sticks. The harassment really hindered our enjoyment.In addition to buildings and fountains and sculpture the Piazza has many enjoyable restaurants.
Worth a visit. We had a gorgeous lunch here!, it wasn't on our must do list, but it was definitely worth a stop off, even for lunch. The street art and entertainers where very good.
Nice. Beautiful architecture and lovely fountains, just spoilt by another million selfie sticks. Cafe bars here are nice but your paying top prices for a super tourist area
great evening entertainment. It's a beautiful area with lots going on at night. Street performers, artists (lots of spray painters), vendors. and of the course the lovely fountains and sculptures.

amazing!. Such a great Piazza to visit! It was soo impressive!!! I totally recommend spending at least an hour in this place. Maybe you can stop by for a drink! If it helps please give me a helpfull vote! Enjoy!

great place to hang out. Our apartment over looked teh Piazza Navona. We loved just hanging out watching all teh street artists in the evening. Lots of painters as well but beware alot of the oil on canvas are hand done. Alot of the people selling these if you walk around all have the exact same paintings hmmmmm.. So walk around find a local artist that actually paints his or her own stuff. Just fun to hang out relax people watch. If you have kids watch out for all the guys selling laser pointers, selfie sticks and light whirl bird you shoot up into the air. They usually want 15 Euro for teh laser pointer keep telling them NO we got our laser pointers for our boys for 5 euro.
Lovely place to stroll around. This is a lovely piazza. There are three big fountains that are fun to walk around. Gelato on this street is more expensive than other places.

great in the morning, horrible after dark. Piazza Navona is one of the most beautiful squares in Rome. In the early morning, you can actually sit on one of the benches and take in all the many wonderful details in the sculptures around the fountains.After nightfall, the square is inundated by swarms of tourists, street salesmen, weirdos, etc. etc. To each his own

Our Favorite Place in Rome!. The Piazza Navona was hands down our favorite place to relax...we dined and people watched at least twice a day during our 5 days in Rome. The fountains were beautiful and the center square was lively and filled with all sorts of vendors and characters to watch...flame throwers, fake purse vendors that would scamper from side to side of the Piazza when the Policia would come through, excellent restaurants, artists, and stores...this Piazza has it all.

Butling down town Rome. Got back yesterday from the Piazzo Navona area. This review is something like a "Rome's guide for Dummies" as this was the first time my wife and self had been to the city, and we found things somewhat confusing. It is relatively easy to get lost in Rome, as there are so many narrow streets where all the buildings are built up. its like a rabbit warren. The sheer heat in the City Center is so intent, it zaps the life out of you walking around for hours trying to find what you are looking for.We had picked the Piazza Navona area because after spending hours on Google, it was clear that this was right in the center, and walking distance to Trevi Fountain, Vatican, Pantheon and Spanish Steps.Left Ciampino airport on a bus that cost 4 euros each to the main City bus Terminal that is around 3km from Piazza Navona.First Tip.....Take a cab from there to your hotel. We decided to walk and take in the ambiance of the city....big mistake. To start with, the heat was unbearable after walking for an hour. Due to perspiration, my T-shirt couldn't have been more wet if i had stood under a shower. Secondly....crossing a road in Rome requires you to have some sort of death wish. If you cant run, best stay at home....If you can run but are bad with your nerves, take your Diazapam....and if you fancy attempting suicide, Walk when the green man tells you to walk.A red traffic light in Rome means "STOP...But Only If You Want To"Eventually found Piazza Navona. It is definitely the area to be based. The Piazza is a large open square , i would think around the size of a football pitch, with the stunning "Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi on " placed in the center. The square has Eateries/Restaurants around the sides facing the mass array of us tourists, entertainers, artists and musicians. We preferred to eat in a similar square about a 3 minute walk away(campo de fiori), which was a bit smaller and quieter.The majority of the Restaurants around both squares are around the same sort of price for similar menus. The menus cater for tourists, and are not what you would call great restaurants, but it all depends on taste. I like salads, and these cost around the 10 euro mark. My first night was a Tuna salad which was just ok...a mound of iceberg and tinned tuna. the second night was ham....a mound of iceberg and packet ham...kind of like what you would rustle up at home.Starters like Bruchetta and soup are around 6 euros and pasta, spaghetti and lasagna around 10 euros each. Meat and fish dishes around 18 euro mark.However....sat outside and listening to the musicians in Piazza Navona, with a cool mist blowing over you from the air conditioning fans that all the restaurants have, may be idyllic, but beware. Some of the staff at these places are like Scorpions, and if not handled correctly, you are going to get stung. In our 3 nights there, i was charged different prices for the same drink,at the same restaurant and after handing over 60 euros for a 54 euro bill, the change wasn't brought back. Every restaurant bangs a service charge on top of the bill anyway, so if they can fleece another tenner out of you....they will.The drinks prices can get a bit silly. They know that a lot of people who come to Italy will want a glass or two of prosecco. Certain places will charge over 6 euros for the tiniest of glasses, which is a bit rich seeing the stuff in supermarkets for a couple of euros a bottle. I drink Gin ( a bit too much... but Hey-Ho) with a splash of diet coke, (yep...they thought what a weirdo as well), at a cost of around 8-10 euros.On the whole....This is Rome, and the Piazza Navona is very popular, so they basically charge what they want as they know people will pay it.Would i go back and do it all again ?.....ABSOLUTELYP.S.....Dont forget the City Tax @ 12 euros per night that every hotel charges when you check out.

One of Rome's better piazzas. After a punishing day of sightseeing in Rome, this large, lively square is a great place to sit down and have a bite or drink whilst looking at the other tourists, the stret performers and the artists. There are some lovely fountains which give off cooling mists on a hot summer's day. Great gelaterias around as well.

An Entertaining Leftover!. This Piazza is a leftover from the old Roman Circus called Circo Agone (games Circus) and nicknamed after it's originator, the Emperor Domitiam (81-96) - younger son of the first Flavian emperor, Vespasian (builder of the Colisseum). The Piazza is roughly the open area of the old Circus. In medieval times it contained the old City Market - later moved. In the mid 17th century, Pope Innocent X (a member of the Pamphili family) remodelled the Piazza into virtually what we see today. His family Palazzo was and still does face the Piazza. The great central Fountain of the Four Rivers is topped by the obelisk of Domitian. The southern Fountain of the Moor, was damaged recently by a vandal, but has been restored. A security note while on the Piazza: there is physical and video security everywhere, not only because of the art and the vendors, but because there is an Embassy there. - that of Brazil. The fountain at the north end is that of Neptune. Art continues to influence the Piazza, here is where you can purchase some contemporary art or have your image sketched. Stores and restaurants here are overpriced, but it can all be found here (from a toy store to a rug dealer) and where else can you get a meal inside an old Roman Circus? Nighttime on the Piazza is much more lively especially around and in the various Piazza restaurants. If going at night, be cautious with your wallet and handbag at all times. Be aware of those around you at all times. Ensure you have secure transportation into and out of the PiazZa after dusk. Just off of the SW side of the Piazza is the 'Speaking Statue' of Pasqualino, to which Romans have been attaching scandalous and s urrilous notes about others for literally centuries. Finally, a dining note: there is a wine bar / restaurant next to Pasquilino called Cul de Sac. Patronise this iwonderful place if you get the chance. It is a favourite of both locals (there is an elderly gentleman who comes in at the same time every day and has a single piece of Tiramisu), and tourists alike (see my review), one word first, however - try to go in off peak hours, such as right after opening, early afternoon (siesta time) and early evening 6-7:30). Enjoy!

Relax in Piazza Navona. Piazza Navona is a wonderful place to relax, watch street performers, sit by the fountains, or stop in for a drink or quick bite. The piazza is filled with vendors selling art as well, if you are interested in browsing the local artists. It is a beautiful area and I recommend that you read up on the fountains in the piazza before taking a visit.

Nice resting spot in the center of Rome. Very large square in the center of Rome ( actually a large rectangle - the same shape as the chariot arena that once stood there ). Now has three lovely fountains and populated by numerous buskers and artists. Lovely church on the west side and a number of cafes on the east side. Prices at the cafes ( and tourist shops ) are a bit higher than usual, but to sit back with a drink and soak in the atmosphere - it's worth it !
Pleasant. Pleasant area. Nice bars and restaurants. Often a high police presence no idea why. Great if you are a people watcher! Lots of people wandering around can get a bit over crowded.

A relaxing visit. The piazza was bustling with various artists and tourists. The fountains are beautiful and Tower over you. It was a lovely place to sit on a bench and eat ice cream and watch the crowds

Absolutely Beautiful. We stopped in the Piazza Navona as part of a "Dan Brown's Angels And Demons" tour. It was a great tour of all the sites of the murders in that novel. The fountain wasd breathtaking, and the Piazza was amazing. They were setting up a Christmas Market at the time. THAT I could do without. Christmas in Italy and Spain are not at all what Americans celebrate the holidays, so the junk they sell is strange. Witches on brooms for Christmas? Minature Elvis for the creche? But otherwise, emerging from narrow streets into the piazza seems to emphasize the grandeur of the space. STUNNING!

A Must See. This piazza is very different throughout the day.Early morning is best if you want take pictures before all the vendors get set up.The daytime is fairly, busy. The night time is very lively.

Cultural Center of Rome. If you're looking for a touristy place that has it all, stop by Piazza Navona! It is a 5 minute walk from the Pantheon and the culture here is wonderful.
