There are artists displaying and selling art and people with crafts and not to mention a beautiful fountain! There are restaurants all along this plaza to eat at. Check it out, even to relax for a moment, but be weary of pick-pocketers.
piazza navona. italian beauty .italian architecture.italian medality..italian culture..all so simple beautiful.its the number one spot of the rome.

Fun and exciting night atmosphere. My wife and I went here during the day and at night. Both were fun but it was so much more alive at nighttime. There was performers (watch your pockets) and street vendors who would do caricatures and make paintings. There are overpriced restaurants but there is also the beautiful fountain to sit by. It was a fun and romantic atmosphere that my wife and I both enjoyed. During the day, there are two beautiful churches to visit as well.

Fantastic district . This is a fantastic district of course visit the long square, but there is much more to see down the narrow back streets, with one of the best churches nearby a must for all. Santa De Maria Aniam. Today I discovered another's little gem, down the side street Via De Corinari A little deli, where the meat and cheese are mouthwatering, sit dow relax, let the waitress tell you what you can have, then enjoy like a emperor - Fres&Co - great little place

Beautiful Piazza. Absolutely beautiful and atmospheric piazza in Rome - our favourite of the bunch. Wish we could have spent more time there. Many vendors, artists, and performers - a meal along the piazza watching everything would have been lovely - next time for sure! A must visit in Rome.

Large active square. This Piazza is a few minutes walk from Campo de Fiori market area and is quite large. Artists abound even in stifling heat, and restaurants line the perimeter.The sculptures are fantastic. The river gods are spectacular to take in. If the cathedral of St Agnes is open, it is well worth going in for a look. I think it's beautiful inside.Also this square is a close walk to the Pantheon
BEST PIAZZA IN ROME. go there in the evening when is not so hot enjoy the bernini fountains and the atmosfhere of the place

Great for a Piazza!. The history and ambiance Italiano make this a perfect place for kids--tossing coins in the fountain, getting a bracelet made to order, imagining the elliptical shape flooded for ancient battleships, and having dinner outside with a gelato for dessert!
Touristicus Maximus. Full of restaurants with guys beckoning to you as you pass. Walk thru it as you go to Gelateria al Téatro.

Lovely. A magnificent piazza, surrounded by a host of restaurants, and beautiful buildings. The fountain is magnificent in its detail, and draws tourists, and street artists to it like a magnet. A great place to sit and watch the world go by.

Lively piazza. The piazza, with it's fountains at either end, Sant'Agnese church to one side and restaurants on the other, not to mention loads of street artists has a nice mix of experiences on offer. Each attraction on it's own is worth the visit, so having all of them so close together makes for an unmissable stop.

FOUNTAINS ALWAYS FLOWING. Wonderful Piazza in Rome. Just sitting and having a coffee looking at the Fountain of Moor, the Fountain of the four Rivers and the Fountain of Neptune is simple amazing. The Piazza is a story in itself. At times, there are musicians playing and there is lots of people watching. Just sitting down and having a drink or a coffee when it's not so crowded is my favorite. And it free.

Active and Entertaining. We have twice set down and had a meal at one of the restaurants on the piazza. I'm sure we could have dined for less at one of the many places off of the piazza but the entertainment we enjoyed during our wait and meal was worth it.

Imersion. Visit in the evening and stroll with the locals doing laps around the piazza for a culture Imersion. Lost of street performers, a beautiful fountain, nice cafes and outdoor eating and a beautiful little baroque church to peek into.

great people watching!. This was my favorite piazza in Rome! It was fun to walk around and look at the fountains, there were lots of artists, a beautiful church and lots of cafes to people watch! If you need to rest and relax with a glass of wine or bite to eat this is a great place to do it!

Afternoon outing. What a wonderful experience we had. The art is quite afordable and after 17:00 there is a lot of entertainment for the children. A place to take your young children to keep them occupied while you enjoy something a glass of wine or early dinner. I must add the entertainers only arrive after 17:00 and for young children this will only be another open area to chase pigeons if you go before 17:00.

My favourite and most relaxing Piazza in Rome. Before travelling I hadn't heard of this place and ended up stumbling across it by accident and I'm so happy that I did. For me it was the most relaxing Piazza I visited in Rome(and there is a lot of Piazza's in Rome). The atmosphere is constantly buzzing and I enjoyed sitting at one of the bar/restaurants there soaking up the atmosphere whilst enjoying a couple of glasses of vino. If you want a nice relaxing couple of hours after a busy day of sight seeing(the pantheon is just around the corner and another must see of Rome) this is definitely the place to come to unwind and enjoy a little al fresco drink/meal.

Plaza Novona..."Honey, I am on vacation.". This is an amazing place to check out the life in Rome. Centrally located the Plaza Novona is by itself a poem to architecture and life style. Romans and tourists alike get together here on their way to explore what Rome's secluded streets and spots have to offer. It is unquestionably one of the world's favorite meeting points. There is always something going on from musical and comedy acts to wonderful painters and performers. The restaurants and the fountains are just the icing on the cake. A perfect spot to really say..."Honey, I am on vacation."

Smelly. Lots of activity and looked like a great town square to hangout in.But the strong smell of maybe urine,was a major turn off.Also be careful of being constanty harassed by beggars.There is a nice church that you can go into in the Piazza Navona to visit.
Favorite Piazza in Rome. Favorite Piazza in Rome. Lovely, spacious, lots of artists selling their works. Musicians playing for tips, benches to watch all the people.

It was OKAY. One side of the Piazza has Restaurants, but so many of them were closed during my visit, while the other side has some sort of office or state or court building. The fountain in the middle was beautiful. The problem, with this and so many other piazzas all throughout Italy, are the street vendors. They are extremely pushy and annoying.

Expected more. Though the piazza is very nice I was a little disappointed. Lots of cafés and bars as well as artists. Not sure how the paintings and drawings are original as there seems to be a lot of the same everywhereReally had no buzz that you get in the likes of Paris or Masrid

Spend a nice lunchtime here. This is one of the best piazzas in Rome, and one of most famous. Great to watch people walking about, the artists paining and children playing. Have a nice long lunch in one of the many outdoor patio ristorantes there. Pick one, they are all good, I've eaten in many. This is a historical place, and nice little shops abound.. Take your time here, live like an Italian

A lovely piazza to walk through at twighlight. If you are wandering around in Rome as you undoubtedly will find yourself doing, consider including Pizza Navona into your stroll. I wouldn't advise going to any of the restaurants that border this square, but the actual atmosphere is akin to Covent garden with street performers scattered around and a genuine buzz in the air. When the sun sets the square looks lovely and provides some really nice photo opportunities around the fountain. Short of being somewhere to relax or as a stop off point for a drink you won't find much more to do here. That doesn't mean it isn't worth visiting though. As stated please read reviews for restaurants that border such populist locations to avoid disappointment and some of the many scams that operate in such areas.

Great place to hang out.. This Piazza was around the corner from where we stayed so got to view this early morning before the crowds arrived. It is a beautiful square with Baroque sculptures and architecture and views from either end of the square are equally wonderful. There is a trio of lavish fountains, an Eygptian obliesk and church. It is lined with restaurants and bars and is very busy and lively with street artists and entertainers. Much of the art we seen was very similar. It is a great place to hang out. We never ate in the Piazza as chose to eat in restaurants in the many side streets.

Vert artistic place. I loved this piazza since you can find painters, musicians, comedians... It is very romantic and joyfull. You can also see a lot of sculptures. It is a must see in Rome, located in the center.

Our favourite square in Rome. Loved the street performers, the art and the general buzz of this Piazza. A great break from all the history and ancient art for my 14 and 11 year olds. They loved walking around the square stopping and watching a street performer whilst we grabbed a wine at a cafe on the square and watched from there.

beautiful, spacious. We enjoyed having some gelato in this piazza while watching people. It was a huge piazza with plenty of room for everyone. We visited there in the evening and were happy that it (unlike Trevi Fountain) is not being restored at this time.
Great place to wander. Nice place to sit and listen to buskers, view the art, have photos in front of fountains, drink, eat and just enjoy the atmosphere!
People Watch. It is amazing to just sit here and watch people walk around and just enjoy the time. You can take as long as you want and just relax its worth just sitting here for 20 mintues.

Piazza to see! But a lot of tourists!. The one thing to see in Rome. But be aware there are a lot of tourists. Due to that there are also different sales man so you can either buy fake bags, sun glasses, paintings, restaurants are for tourists only. To get better food walk one or two blocks away from the area. But all on all it is worth seeing.

This is Rome. While walking and exploring the narrow streets of Rome and without planning it, my wife and I happened upon this open piazza. We didn't know the name of it at the time, but it was packed full of things to see, hear, smell and eat. There are street performers and artists in the middle, with fountains and flanked from all sides are wonderful shops and restaurants housed in beautiful architecture. We had a wonderful meal there while being serenaded by the music in the atmosphere. It was everything in Rome and I would return in a heartbeat.

Pizzza Navona. What a magnificent sculpture for Bernini, with an interesting story. Please read about the interaction between Bernini's sculpture's design (one of the statues holding his had up, and facing away from the building), as well as the statue on the op of the building looking the other way......

Place where the Fountain of the Four Rivers is located!. Even if it is only to see the Fountain of the Four Rivers, don’t miss to go to Piazza Navona. This is kind of the center of the historic center of Rome. Lots of things to do. Lots of people around. Lots of street performers. You will not get bored at Piazza Navona.

All the world's a stage. And this is THE stage. When you enter the piazza it's like stepping into a amphitheater or something like that. The three fountains are nice enough but it's the piazza itself you want to check out! Street artists, and restaurants all around the piazza. Make sure you sit down and enjoy the atmosphere this place offers.
What Piazza. The fountains, the papal family residence, the flood, the history. This place can be very crowded as the day progresses. Go early but it is a large Piazza.

Great place to sit and people watch. We wondered through the area several times. Lots to see and do. There's lots of touristy restaurants around the sides but head down a side street and there are lots of lovely places to grab a take away bite. Return to the square and set up on a bench and you have a wonderful meal with a view at a fraction of the price.
the spot for colorful family nightlife in rome. the best spot in all rome for streetlife -- merchants, artists, preformers. it's all there around one of the best fountains imaginable.

A very pleasant scene. Strolling east from the Tiber, we found the Piazza Navona to be almost hidden behind a block of buildings. But once you step into the piazza itself, the view is lovely: Fountains, sidewalk cafes, and very old churches, including Santa'Agnese, which, among its other points of interest, displays a skull said to belong to the saint of that name. Back outside, there were musicians playing at both ends of the square. All in all, it was a very pleasant place to be (except maybe for St. Agnes's skull) on an early evening in summer.

New Year's Day. Cool Spot! one of the settings for the "Angels and Demons" film. we got there on New Years Day and like many places in Rome, they were having a party with music. They had a DJ and light show projected onto the sculptures in the fountain. There were also street performers and carnival attractions for the younger kids.Only a couple of blocks from the Pantheon-- worth the walk.

beautiful. Absolutely stunning! Went during the day so did not get to see it all light up at night but was still gorgeous! 3 beautiful fountains. Was a lot of people trying to sell handbags in this location took away the beauty of it. Do not eat in any of the restaurants as they are very dear. Myself and my partner stopped in one of them and all we got was 2 cokes and was 20 euros! Lovely view so sit and look at though!

One of the beautiful piazzas of Rome. Going to Rome and not visiting or eating at the many restaurants of Piazza Navona is like missing Rome. The beautiful Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi made by Bernini is amazing. There are 2 other fountains at Piazza Navona, Fontana di Nettuno and Fontana del Moro.

Piazza with people and more. Boy does this Piazza make you look with it's three seperate Fountains, Painters by the dozen plying their works Restaurants all around the edge. Fine buildings also in evidence with beautiful architecture. Well worth a visit

Great atmosphere . Great place to visit at night when it isn't too hot and all the street vendors are there. Be careful when buying art and make sure it is authentic and not a photocopy. A lot of the art is repetitive so have a good look around before bartering for a price. Just around the corner is the Pantheon and there are lots of in expensive restaurants further away from the piazza. As you walk by the restaurants and the server is selling you the menu, walk away and they will offer you complimentary champagne if you stay and eat there. We were there both at night and during the day and our teens preferred the evening because the street performers were out which provided a cheap party-like atmosphere for them.

Ended up spending a couple of hours there it was very enchanting. Went to see the fountains and the piazza ended up having lunch there reasonable
price Fresh food wonderful atmosphere

Lovely by day or night.. My husband and I came back here after visiting it a couple of years ago whilst on a cruise trip. It is still as beautiful as we remembered. By day or night it is lovely to sit in one of the many cafes, listening to the music, watching the world go by (or a couple spontaneously start doing the tango) or walk around and watch the many artists at work and look at the pictures they have for sale. A visit to Piazza Navona is a must.
Beautiful!. This was a very nice place to see. Especially at night! A lot of vendors and street performers as well. Very nice!

Stunning!. Such a beautiful place and well worth a visit. At a time when the Trevi fountain is undergoing renovation work, this has got to be the best fountain in Rome! Beware high prices in the cafes opposite though! Just outside the Piazza Navona are much cheaper places to eat and drink!
PIAZZA NAVONA. Its nice to be in Piazza Navona, there are lots of restaurants while while people walking around. Great place to relax.

ALWAYS A SCENE.. One wonders what the buildings surrounding Navona are but whatever they are they frame an elegant piazza.Always tourists and crowds but not as many as nearby Capo Di Fiori & surrounding edifices mush more stately.

An unexpected Piazza. When we came down the narrow street and the piazza opened before us it was not full of tourists or stalls. The column in the center dominated and the storm clouds in the background made the view dramatic.

Could be quite a circus but still the most beautiful piazza in Rome. Despite the crowds and circus-like atmosphere, one will be hard-pressed to find a piazza as large and beautiful as Navona with its Four Rivers Fountain centerpiece by Bernini. Others may find it touristy but It's a happy place where people of all ages hang out. We stayed in the area and had many opportunities to see it empty early in the morning with only the birds. Priceless, completely different, really beautiful. We got acquainted with the details of the four river gods and what they thought then as only four continents.

take a leisurely lunch (for a few hours!). What a fantastic piazza...wonderful restaurants (Tre Scalini), small shops, great gelato (Grom), amazing architecture, super people-watching, talented artists displaying their work and beautiful fountains!!!! This is a wonderful place to relax and spend some time when in Rome.
Love this piazza. Great restaurants, street artist doing beautiful work truly beautiful fountains by Bernini really loved this square just wonderful

Good visit. Loved this place and would go back good fountain and sculptures
Best to visit as part of a walking tour with a guide and a small group

Free and worth a quick stop. One of numerous Piazzas in Rome, this is famous for it's three fountains - with the central Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (fountain of the four rivers) taking centre stage. Built around this is a series of somewhat cheap souvenir stores, although none of the sellers are particularly aggressive which is appreciated. Be careful before buying one of the generic art pictures - some of the cheaper ones (usually those left laying on the ground) are high quality zerox colour photocopies of actual paintings!It gets a bit busy here during the day so night time may be a better time to visit. If you come at meal times, don't eat in restaurants around the piazza - they are overpriced. You are better off getting your food a couple of streets away and bringing it here. You can't dip your hands in the fountains (officials enforce this).It's within walking distance of the pantheon and the two should ideally be combined as part of a walking tour to Romes famous sites.
Perfect. You can spend hours here. A dozen or so restaurants all competing for your business. Great artists and entertainers on the square. Grab a table and watch the show....

Beautiful Location. The Piazza Navona provides a great atmosphere both at night and during the day. Its vast range on restaurants and also statues make it one of the most beautiful locations within Rome

True old world charm. This is a wonderful example of what a piazza is and should be! Three fantastic fountains, numerous restaurants with al fresco dining to watch the world go by and architecture that leaves no doubt as where you are. There are some rather aggressive street vendors who are definitely trying to get some of your vacation money, but if you don't give them any attention they are swiftly off to the next passerby. My wife and I felt very safe as we strolled the area and really appreciated the numerous seating areas. After a long day of doing what tourists do, a seat close to a refreshing fountain was a true respite! Enjoy all that Piazza Navona has to offer. Plan on at least sampling a restaurant and taking in all the sights and sounds that make this a truly memorable experience.
GO AT SUNSET!. Go! Buy your local artisan souvenirs HERE! Magical atmosphere at sunset with a cold drink, live music and sparkling fountains! Love it!

Lovely piazza, great for people watching, very touristy. I revisited the Piazza Navona recently and although it's as beautiful as I remembered, it has become overwhelmingly touristy. Lots of buskers and cartoonists. The cafes were expensive; we did enjoy one drink and a bit of people watching, but you could easily do the same sitting by the fountains. Worth a visit for the architecture and fountains alone.

Must see. Of course Piazza Navona is a must see attraction in Rome. Great place to grab a drink and just relax for a few minutes in the heart of the city. Of course the fountains and architecture are pretty amazing as well.
Amazing. Fountains , basilica ... cafe , charming piazza that you should pass by when you visit rome, segway rental point , close to the pantheon

One of the most beautiful places in Rome. The piazza in exquisite, It features important sculptural and architectural creations, most beautiful is the "Fountain of the Four Rivers" (1651) by Gian Lorenzo Bernini- simply breath taking.
The most beautiful square. The best place to sit and enjoy Rome.. Everything you need is there! One of the most beautiful squares in the world! Totally worth its reputation!

Fun and Free. We went to the Piazza in the early evening, which was the perfect time to go. The air had cooled a bit from the heat of the day, the fountains caught the early evening light, and the buskers were out in droves. One could easily while away some time just people watching and enjoying the beauty of the location. Avoid the restaurants right on the plaza; they are pricey. The Tartuffo at Tre Scalini was, however, excellent, and can be purchased at their walk-up window.
Must see.. Very nice in the daytime but even better at night.There is a great atmosphere where you can while away the evening watching various performers.
Beautiful fountains day and night. . St Agnes was a surprising gem. Walking, sitting, photographing and simply enjoying the beautiful spot.

Best place in Rome. I definitely can say that Piazza Navona is the most beautiful place in Rome. The colors of the buildings, the music, the fountains, the paintings, all of them make you feel very bohemian.

A beautiful Piazza, with great shopping and food. After a visit to the Pantheon, take a short walk over to the Piazza Navona. I purchased a very stylish yellow leather purse for my wife there, top quality for a very reasonable price. Don't hesitate negotiation the price down a little, not a lot, even in the best of shops, and do get plenty of Gelato's to cool you off during the humid hot days of Rome in the summer. Always take a water bottle with you, and ask for refills at the restaurants before you leave to save a few bucks.
Beverage stop. Another great stopping place on our walk through rome. Lovely small places to eat and drink.Very reaonsably priced.

Overpriced food, but great location to sit and relax. We met friends who were staying near the piazza, and we had planned to get some cappuccino and gelato, but the restaurants were charging triple here what they charged on side streets (and that's before the cover charge), so we walked around the corner, got our gelato for a couple euros each, and walked back. The piazza is full of street performers and vendors, but they aren't overly aggressive, and the area near the main fountain gets some nice afternoon shade. The fountain itself was cool with creepy sculptures that my kids loved, and the atmosphere of the square is fun and festive.

Beautiful spot in Rome, walk off to the side streets to eat. Like other reviews, this Piazza is beautiful. Dont eat here, the restaurants are expensive and mediocre. Wander off to the side streets to eat.

Beautiful architecture bombarded by tourism. This once great piazza is now purely a tourist trap with street sellers, cartoonists and over priced restaurants. Truly we had our most expensive and worst meal in Rome here. We kicked ourselves that we had not stopped in a small side street to eat. Yes you get the atmosphere if you eat here but you will not get good value for money. Yes, you must see the square as it is so impressive. But sadly I can recall it in the 70's when hardly anyone was there and it really did feel special. But that's modern life for you!

Piazza Navona. A beautiful piazza. We stopped to have coffee and hot cocoa at an outdoor cafe and loved listening to the fountain and watching the people scurry about. It was a peaceful place to rest for a short time before bustling off to another amazing Italian site.

Beautiful place. The Italians know how to make a beautiful focal point for relaxing by. The fountain is lovely as is the whole square and surrounding buildings. Stumbled upon it by accident on our way to the river but sooo glad we did. Could've spent hours here just people watching. Worth a visit
Beautiful Piazza. This Piazza was very pretty. The Fountain of the Four Rivers was really beautiful. If you have time add it to the list of places to stop.
Beatiful piazza. This piazza is really beatiful, with nice fountains and churches, but do not plan to eat here as the restaraunts are extremly busy...
Lovely. The Piazza Navona is well worth a visit to soak up the architecture. It is a lovely experience to eat at one of the restaurants and watch the activity in the Piazza.

Great place to stop. Fantastic little spot to take a break from the heat and enjoy some well deserved gelato! We did however find out a little too late not to dip your hands in the fountain as we along with 25 other tourists got scolded by rather serious looking officials!

Stunning. Only came across this square as we wandered through to the Pantheon, but it took my breath away. Absolutely stunning !!
Ignore the tatty street vendors and find a restaurant to sit and enjoy the beauty of this place

Great Gathering Place in the Evening. After a day touring Rome, we rested at the hotel before heading out again in the cool evening. The Piazza Navona was the first plaza we visited in Rome and loved the open air gathering site. It was filled shops and street performers, artists, and things to buy. But it was not crowded (June 17th 2015) or overwhelming. Busy, but fun. The fountains of the World's Rivers are must-see landmarks and here you can enjoy architecture, the local Roman culture, and the arts and people-watching.

One of the nicest squares. Piazza Navona is a very pretty square, with the three separate fountains. It is big and there are a lot of artists at work and/ or selling their work or making music. You can find original art here, for example paintings with Vespa's on them. We saw one woman making Italian graffiti art (with a picture of the Colloseum) on the spot, selling them for about ten Euro's. She was very impressive. It's nice to have a walk around this square, but it's a bit touristy and many shops in the area sell the typical (rubbish) souvenirs.

THE place to go in Rome at nights!. Piazza Navona is THE place to go during afternoon and nights in Rome! It is lovely mixing ancient with modern art! It is very safe, beautiful, with a variety of restaurants and Gelatto to die for! You can get a live dancing show while eating or waiters might also be greatly entertaining. You can also buy souvenirs or sit by the fountain and have a snack! It is a great experience! Must Go!
Rome 2015. One of the best squares in Rome to visit. In the day is good to walk around as lots of people are there. Pretty good to relax with a bit of alcohol at night.

One of the finest squares. Absolutely the finest squares in Rome. 360 degrees around you is great details, flower beds, fountains, restaurants, buildings, artists and people spending a time. Go there.
Just Beautiful . The perfect place for people watching, but just be careful of bag snatchers whilst taking in he beautiful architecture and fountains.

The place to see and be seen. A very busy piazza lined with shops, stores, street venders, fountains and churches. It is the place to go to see people and enjoy the street atmosphere. We spent a relaxing afternoon there enjoying the atmosphere. Ate at one of the local restaurants the line the piazza. Very unhurried. A great place to take in the local flavors.

Could sit for hours. Always buzzing with activity from artists, musicians and dancers - gives you a real flavour of Italy with views of some beautiful fountains and buildings from the restaurants that line the perimeter of the square
Lovely fountains. Watch the world go by or go to one of the vendors to get a caricature. Beautiful fountains and a lovely square. Nice place to relax and watch the world float past

Wonderful artist market at night. We were in Rome during the heat of summer and found that these sites are just a incredible late in the day, less crowded and that the community comes out so you get a better experience. The Piazza Novona had artists at night and we were able to stroll around and enjoyed the neighborhood.

Day or night great place to people watch. I don't understand all of the negative reviews about this place on this site. Yes there are people trying to sell you stuff you don't want - it's a market for goodness' sake. The hawkers are just trying to make a living - just say no.During the day there's an "art" market, good for a wander around for a while. The main deal is the 5 or so restaurant/bars on the eastern side of the square. Day or night just sit, eat, drink and talk - watch the world go by.

Stunning architecture and makes for a great place to hang out. The church is awesome, the fountain is awesome, the street musicians and the alfresco restaurants are awesome. They all seem to work in perfect harmony to create the right ambiance for you to want to soak it all in for hours on end.

One the must sees in Rome. Always busy here, lots of people, verndors, and interesting stuff going on. The fountains are spectacular. Lots of restaurants and shops surrounding the piazza. The best gelato place is just a couple blocks away. Interesting at night too.

Sit and watch the world go by!!!. My favorite place to sit and eat breakfast, lunch or dinner or even just for drinks. The fountains and statues are amazing, you must visit this piazza whilst in Rome, so beautiful
People watch with lunch!. We spent an afternoon having a very long lunch and people watching the painters, tourists and locals. Great atmosphere in Piazza Navona.

Roman plaza, outdoor cafes. Great open square. Trevi fountain is much more popular, but this plaza is much more open and with much better food and drink options. Not too far from Trevi is you want to go there first for the vacation photo-op.

Worth a visit. Visited this area during our Rome break. It is well worth a visit
It is lovely sitting in a restaurant watching the world go by and watching the artists painting.

Full of life. The square is just amazing and the atmosphere is not behind. Close to nice restaurants and streets full of shops if you fancy shopping. The Bernini sculpture in the middle is outstanding and you'll love it even if art is not between your hobbies.

A lot of history in only one piazza. It's a gorgeous square with elipse shape which has the famous Fontana Dei Quattro Fiumi in the center, with an egyptian obelisk, the Fontana del Moro in the south side, the Fountain of Neptune in the north side, the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone and the Palazzo Pamphili. The piazza is surrounded by restaurants and small shops, artists painting and selling their paints.In the summer morning it's a nice place to hang, just sit on the benches and watch the people come and go.

Fabulous place to chill. This piazza has everything, fantastic statues and fountains, an Egyptian obelisk, artist stalls, street entertainers, open air restaurants and shops. Reminds me of Montmartre in Paris but in a more beautiful setting and with sunshine.

A free place to visit in Rome with an imposing masterpiece!!!. Though visited by most people most of the time, the piazza feels so wide and spacious. Musicians, artists and painters can be found here that further enhanced the somewhat festive atmosphere of the area.The fountain of four rivers baroque marble sculpture surrounding the Egyptian obelisk is an enduring testament of Bernini's genius. You could probable gaze at this work of art endlessly while sipping coffee and people-watch as the area at the sides of the piazza has many coffee shops, pizzeria, cafes. Must-see wile in Rome!

excellent people watching. We returned to this Piazza multiple times during our trip. There is plenty of street entertainment at night, and lots of activity with artists during the day. The fountains themselves are fantastic sculptures. There are cafes all around to sit and enjoy the scene.Return at dusk for glorious light for pictures.

Most favourite place in rome . Its an awesome place to visit in rome. Great square with beautiful fountains.. Many good caricature artists, drawing artist, various artist.. Its full of artistic people.. Very calm but happenning place in the Rome. You can take away and enjoy nice icecreme nearby. Must visit place in rome..
Great place to people watch.. Love the area. Has cute little shops and restaurants located in the area. Great place to people watch.
The best. It is definitely the best piazza in Rome, the architecture, the fountains, sculptures, churches, the crowds...... I visited it three times during my trip to Rome.
One of the best in rome. I think one of the best piazza's in Rome, enjoyed the Christmas Market and the fountains are special

First visit to Rome. My husband and I visited from for first time in July. Although temperature was in 30's we had a wonderful time. We came about Piazza Navona by accident one afternoon and loved it. Great atmosphere with lots of cafe/restaurants along the perimeter and musicians/entertainers in the centre.

Lots of activities, vendors, fountains, and just beautiful. My wife and I had walked by here a few times; it was always a beehive of activity.
Enjoyed the vendors and what they had to sell or show.
As a sideline, St Agnese church is right in here and worth stopping in for at least a few minutes

Family vacation in Rome. piazza navona This is a great place to spend a couple of hours, it's about the size of three football fields in a large oval with all stores facing each other all the way around. There's a center section that's filled with statures and water features, and also has performers of all types to entertain you. There's a tremendous number of very fine Italian restaurants all through this area as well as souvenir shops gelato shops etc. it's a great place to have a casual couple of hours. One of the things that we do like there is that there's no cars or motorcycles allowed so you can walk in the streets and in the center section without worrying about being run down by a motorcycle or getting hit by a car. This is a great place to enjoy part of your day. bob232015

Very pretty at night. This place was buzzing at night, floodlight fountains, artists painting and selling their work, restaurants & a lovely toy shop. Most definitely pefect for ROMA-ntic walk on a balmy evening. Could've spent hrs just soaking up the atmosphere here... even my children picked up on it.

The grand piazza!. This very large piazza or square is a wonderful people place. A place where locals and tourists alike enjoy each other and the many fine restaurants in the piazza. It's a great place to spend a few relaxing hours taking in the energy. I love the small vendors that surround the wonderful fountain, Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi, which is the focal point of the piazza.

A beautiful place to sit and relax. Found the piazza Novona by accident How lucky we were. Three fountains all wonderfully crafted in an area with plenty of places to sit and have a drink or a bite to eat Also lots of local artists displaying their wares made this a facinating spot to spend a while Definitely a must see on a visit to Rome

You want to visit there at least once. It's arguably one of the most popular tourists' attractions in Rome. It is filled with people during daytime and even night time, so we revisited there in the morning to enjoy the beauty of the square. It is located west of the Pantheon, so you can plan a visit together. Just be mindful that many outdoor cafes and restaurants near Piazza Navona sometimes add service charges on the tab.
Who loves a meeting place. Music arts travellers locals. Water food and space to mingle. Need I say more... Love saying piazza navona what a great evening with my sister ... Now where is the scooter?

Great for an evening iut. This place never sleeps. Ideally, go in the evening and have dinner in one of the many restaurants and just people watch. This place always has some form of street performer as well and the fountains in the middle are amazing.

Piazza Navona, fountains, artists, cafes, restaurants. The atmosphere when you enter into the large rectangular piazza is very arty and sophisticated. Historically it was a stadium and of Baroque architecture. There are fountains and gorgeous restaurants, bars, coffee shops line the edge. The middle of the piazza is a wonderful array of tourist gifts and souvenirs, including prints of Rome and Italy which can be framed, mounted as you like. There are street artists willing to paint you on the spot. All sorts of things going on. There have been movies made here and famous visitors. All in all a great spot for lunch. Prints are cheaper to buy in say Trastevere than here. Its a tourist spot so be careful. If you love photography, as my friend does, she enjoyed it!
Beautiful square, but crowded. The square itself is great but the market there ruins a bit of the greatness. Must see anyway. Of course prices are quite upped on the square.

Fun people-watching but very touristy. Our family enjoyed seeing this famous "square," however I would probably skip having a meal here. Expect the usual characters selling laser lights, selfie sticks, etc. Also, there are artists wanting to do your portrait, and performance artists wanting tips. It makes for a lively atmosphere, but we were ready to leave after an hour or two. Check out the interesting statues and fountains, and cool little cobblestone streets nearby that have great shops.

What a wonderful way to spend an evening!. We were told through a Rick Steve's podcast to be certain to stroll to Piazza Novona. The spot did NOT disappoint. The square was filled with artists, musicians, and other performers. There are a few pushy sales people as well, with handbags and scarves, but all and all a wonderfully safe feeling place to wonder for a bit after a long day of sightseeing. We even went back on our last night here and had dinner on the piazza. We will go again!

A beautiful piazza with fabulous street artists and plenty of side streets to stroll around. We stumbled across piazza Navona by accident but what an amazing find, we stopped off for lunch in one of the restaurants and enjoyed a delicious fish grill and glass of wine. We decided to take a stroll along one of the side streets and came across some fabulous steak restaurants and shops and made a decision to return that evening for dinner. All we can say is that Rome didn't disappoint. Will definitely return

The most beautiful piazza in Italy. The most beautiful piazza in Italy, if not the most lively square in the world. Fountainas, sculptures by great Bernini. you can enjoy live music, street artists, restaurants, bars, gelaterie, you name it.

Beautiful piazza with shops and fountains. What a picturesque piazza. Huge piazza with Lots of shops and outdoor patio restaurants. Large fountain that was beautiful to see especially since trevi fountain was closed for renos.Must see this and hang out in the piazza

You must go!. I'll keep it simple: three great fountains in one Piazza, great atmosphere! The one thing I didn't like was that at night time there was no light for the fountains so my pictures didn't reflect their real beauty. A few tips: If it gets too hot during the day, leave your fountains and piazzas for touring during night time. Walking at night through the streets of Rome it's also another experience on its own. Make sure you take a break if you can during the hottest time of day and don't miss Piazza Navona.

Beautiful piazza to enjoy a cup of coffee. This is a large and beautiful piazza in the heart of Rome with many cafes and restaurants. It's a wonderful place to rest, people-watch, and enjoy a cup of coffee during your visit to Rome.

Great place to visit. This was one of our favorite places to visit in Rome. My daughter (16) and I ate at a cafe in the piazza and enjoyed watching the artisits who had set up in the piazza. We had the absolute best ice cream we've ever had at the restaurant. Lots of locals come there for the ice cream too.

Just lovely. While in Rome, why not try a walk here. It will be, at any time, a really pleasant experience. The presence of the enchanting fountains will refresh the hot air of the summer. The bars, surrounding this place, will serve you refreshing drinks and delicious sandwiches. On the winter, the warm atmosphere of this location will warm your heart. Do not miss the Christmas holidays when for the Italian traditional holiday of the Epiphany there is a street market with a lot of candies and toys and of course a big Santa Claus available to all children for photo and wishes.

Hive of Activity. I loved it here and so did my girlfriend. The weather was amazing the day we arrived here and it was busy but not too busy that it was over crowded. Its located down some lovely back streets and there are plenty of places to grab a bite to eat or get a drink. There was plenty going on from painting to dancing to comedy entertainment and its a must do for me.

Fountains, street performers, art and more!. This is a must see square in Rome. beautiful fountains, original art work for sale, street performers and loaded with great restaurants. Go one block in from the square itself for better food pricing.

We were here a few times and it was always a little different each time.. We were fortunate enough to stay near this piazza. We saw musicians, fire dancers and artists. The fountain is beautiful. The area is especially vibrant near sunset in the summertime. It is one of my favorite places in Rome.
a Roman pearl. This is a place of wonder and needs to be near the top of your list when you visit Rome. It is a piece of architectural brilliance that has to be seen to be savoured. One word Go
Every city should have a Piazza Navona. A very cool place to hang out. Obviously very touristy but still a must see location. If you like obelisks, this is the place for you!
Beautiful place. Visited it in early December. The Christmas market was just set up, but was not as I expected. Still I recommend Piazza Navona as it's a beautiful place!
Beautiful. Just stunning to see. There are so many wonderful fountains, buildings and churches, but this is just beautiful.

RIP OFF CENTRAL!!. Really felt ripped off in the restaurants in this beautiful piazza. The food is poor, the service is poor and the prices are extravagant with HUGE table service charge. It is a MUST to visit, but DO NOT eat or drink there unless you like to be overcharged.

perfect place to relax and watch the world go by. Beautiful fountains designed by Bernini in the middle of the piazza surounded by restaurants and cafes. Local artists display their work. Sit, have a drink or ice cream and soak up the atmosphere.. Become Roman for the day enjoying everything at a leisurely pace. A must on every visitors list
Nice place . We went here when we were in Rome. It is a big place, wonderful sculpture and many fontens. A big place to be and relax on a warm day

Fountain of the four rivers !!. It is one of the best Piazzas in Rome. There are fountains, sculptures, cafes, street performers and artists here. You can click the photographs, grab a coffee at one of the cafes. Due to the rush the waiters at the cafe are very Pushy !! The ambiance is very nice and lively. There were plenty of art displays, plenty of places to eat and drink, there were market vendors selling some beautiful paintings...not to mention the tourists taking lots of selfiesTip: You can also get your potrait done on the spot withing 10-15 minutes and the artist charge you around 15€.

Truly a Highlight of Our Rome Tour. Beautiful fountains. Very nice place to park yourself for a while and enjoy the sights, have a coffee and pretend to be a Roman (which I could easily do). I also loved St. Agnes church. Every alcove was worth a long look. Very seldom was reluctant to leave a church, until I spent time in St. Agnes. I even contributed five euros to it's upkeep on the way out.
Piazza Navona. went here yesterday. the fountains are lovely, but i think they need to update the middle one, as there is 5 continents!

A vibrant place to relax and be entertained. The Piazza Navona has everything you could ask for in an outdoor space in Rome. First there are the historical sites, with beautiful fountains in the square surrounded by period buildings. If you like shopping there were numerous vendors offering everything from original paintings and artwork to souvenirs and trinkets you can get anywhere in the city. There are many restaurants in the piazza, so no need to go hungry if you're looking for a meal or a snack. And there were many "entertainers" including jugglers and a man dressed in a tutu performing strange ballet moves for money. But the best option of all is to take a seat by one of the fountains, relax and take it all in, sharing the beauty, the revelry and the history of this special place with crowds of people from all over the world.

Historical with lovely surroundings!. This was one of my favorite places visit in the evenings given the place, the shopping ( several artists with there art demonstrations), sitting options and of course the dining and gelato options.

Overrated Piazza Navona. We were walking on a hot day in Rome and I directed my wife and my two daughters to the Piazza Navona because it was listed as one of the places to see in Rome. All we saw were restaurants around the Piazza and really nothing else except for a couple of fountains one of which had quite a dirty water. There was no shade or tree to sit under and the square was full of street merchants selling hand bags and selfie sticks. We did not waste time there and walked to the Pantheon which was nearby. But if you go to Piazza Navona on a hot day, exit on its northeast corner and walk on Via delle Coppelle and then turn left on Via Della Maddalena and stop at Della Palma ice cream shop which has 150 different choices of ice cream.

Spent all day and evening here. I took a sketch pad and spent the half the day failing to sketch the Bernini fountains, have an ice cream from Tre Scalini, especially the tartufo (sit outside with it on the piazza or pay a fortune). Lots of street entertainment (especially the spray paint people). In one of the corners is the Gladiators Museum and it is in the remains of Domitian's stadium under the piazza, really worth a visit. Oh and the fountains are everything they say they are (and undrawable)
Great . What a great place to sit and have something to eat , weather was really hot but the water mist under the umbrellas was great , lovely atmosphere and so clean and tidy well worth visiting

Beautiful piazza. . Worth including in sightseeing tour and the Pantheon is almost around the corner. The Trevino fountain is not far. So you could do all three in the same day. So beautiful and for Rome fairly quiet. Excellent restaurants in the square. The history is worth reading up on.
must do in rome. Very nice place to stay and admire the fountains, a little crowded, but you can find restaurants and pubs were you can enjoy your evening

Yes, another fountain!. Do you like roman fountains + Expensive shops and a place to seat, eat and drink? Found it! Take the subway and go down the stairways and you're there! Mingle around for some time, you'll find wonderful places nearby

Great place to base your stay in Rome.. The Piaza Navona has made a sensational base for our time in Rome. The atmosphere around the Piaza is woderfull with numerous restaurants at your disposal, there is a tax rank at the top of the square and you are very central to the whole of Rome. I don't think we have paid more than €10 for any of our cab trips. But it's at night that the Piaza realy comes alive, the artists and buskers comenout and the whole place gets a buz about it, even in the mid 30's heat of this week it has been a great place to stay. The only draw back is the ever present peddlers that don't seem to understand the word NO no matter what language you say it in.

Sit down, relax and watch the world go by. The Piazza Navona was a great place to just sit, have a meal and watch the world go by with its artists and street performers. The meals seemed a little pricer there, but the area had a great atmosphere. There are many talented people displaying their wares and entertaining the crowds.
Beautiful!!!. Fantastic square, beautiful fountains and even an Egyptian obelisk surrounded by amazing buildings. It is crowded but totally worth visiting.

Dont stop at any cafe. The piazza Navona has some of the most beautiful period architecture in rome but beware sitting outside in a coffee shop to enjoy is one big long hassle of people walking past and pressure form the wait staff for you to clear the table or order more

A Lively and Popular Square!. Me and my husband visited Piazza Navona whilst on a recent trip to Rome. The square is very lively......When we got there; it made me feel like I was really in Italy! There were plenty of art displays, plenty of places to eat and drink, there were market vendors selling some beautiful paintings...not to mention the tourists taking lots of selfies!!! It's a wonderful square to walk around and around! When we visited, it was so sunny - there were tourists enjoying the sun but there were also tourists enjoying the shade! I enjoyed the fountains - definitely worth seeing.....all in all; a must see for Rome!

Awesome!. This is an enormous fountain with two other separate fountains at each side. Many people gather here, there are vendors, painters, musicians to entertain you. The restaurant we had lunch in when we visited is right across from the main fountain outdoors. You can sit there and watch people go by as you have your meal. The place was great, food and wine where also good, price was fair.

Interesting Place. A lot to see there, rather amusing. Artists, performers, clowns.
Some paintings of Rome by local artists are pretty amazing.

Lovely and Entertaining Piazza. This is a beautiful and amazing open piazza. The 3 Bernini fountains in the piazza are masterfully and amazingly sculptured. Great opportunity for memorable picture taking. Many high priced restaurants surround the piazza. Artists displayed their amazing work which is for sale. Prices range from $20 euros up to $100 euros.A variety of entertainment comes through this piazza like singers and musicians.This is a great place to sit, rest and people watch for several hours.There is a drinking fountain in this piazza.
Lively and most popular square in Rome..!!!. Its is one square one should visit in Rome. Its a little crowded and filled with tourists but the worth going.

A must see for Rome!. If you want to feel like you are in Italy, this is the place to go! Beautiful fountains, art displays, places to eat and drink, some street performers, beautiful flowers on balconies. Lots of photo opportunities here.

One of the best. If you have to pick one piazza for coffee and people watching, this could be it! Beautiful flowerpots and authentic awnings add to the renaissance feel. Enjoy the fountains, take a good long look at each, and then sit back to enjoy the view from a nearby table. Irresistible.

Walking in Rome : artists , street's life and dreaming in the night. Navona square is a traditional large corner of Rome . On sunday morning you can find lots of buskers and peanters who easly can design your face . In the night you can live a romantic atmosphere with a game of lights in front of wonderful Bernini's fountains just restored . You can't miss it

Visual feast. Busy little Piazza, nice architecture and three fountains, many restaurants.No matter when we visited (and always for pre dinner drinks) there was live music,visual artists working, tourists taking selfies, traders seling selfie sticks and dozens of tourists enjoying the sun or looking for shade. We chose the sunny side and had our drinks at Tucci. Visual feast

Fantastic central location to stay whilst in Rome. We were staying just behind Brazilian Embassy on the Piazza Navona for 7 days so frequently wandered through the Piazza at all times of the day and night.A meeting area offering a wide selection of restaurants market vendors selling painting and street entertainers. It's a great central location to stay whilst vising Rome and hub to explore the wonderful sights of Rome.I personally loved grabbing an early morning coffee and relaxing at one of the restaurants when it's less crowded . Loved it!

Great Roman piazza. Piazza Navona is a "happening" place. There are fountains, lots of people watching opportunities and places to eat and drink. Overall is was as good as Rome gets for me.I've seen the Forum, St Peter's, the Spanish Steps but they are not what Rome is all about for me. The only thing I enjoy these days is the lively but not too crazy piazzas.Piazza Navona is all that. Now if they could just get rid of those pesky guys pushing flowers and selfie sticks.
Wow. This was amazing and so many people that created a great summer holiday atmosphere. So much to see and so many artists it was most exciting. It encouraged us to go further with our site seeing.

Fantastic fountains. The fountains and statues in this square are fantastic especially the 1 depicting the four main Rivers of the world and there are plenty of benches so you can sit and admire them with a picnic

Nice buzz. We passed through this Piazza a few times during the summer time. It is conveniently located close to the Pantheon and Campo de Fiori. The sculptures and fountains are a perfect backdrop for memorable photos, and the many restaurants along the edge of the Piazza offer the ideal place to have an ice cold beer and do some people watching. We chose to eat at the restaurants just off towards Via del Governo Vecchio though. :-)

Beautiful at night. We came here for dinner and enjoyed seeing the beautiful fountains lit up at night. We also enjoyed the "show" - musicians, artists, many talented people came to entertain while you enjoy a good meal in a magical place.

Amazing people watching place. Had afternoon drink, liked it so much went back in the evening for a meal. Was beautiful just watching the artists, sellers going about their business. Fountains would have been more impressive at night if they were lit up

good - but a tourist trap. the piazza is lovely, beautiful and can eb a lovely experience if you dont get sucked into the tourist traps. all of the restaurants lining the piazza are extremely expensive. if you go down one of the side streets, you dont even have to go far, you can sit outside a restaurant still with views of the piazza but the food is 75% cheaper than the restaurants lining the piazza. there are very often human statues in a variety of costumes on the piazza, these vary from extremely realistic to very realistic but they are all good fun, especially when they take an unsuspecting person by surprise and move when they are near :) there is often caricaturists who will do a caricature of you, but make sure you agree upon a price before you sit down and dont be afraid to haggle the price to what you want. make sure you keep your bag on you while doing this or give it to someone accompanying you as there are always pick pockets about in Rome.the fountains are lovely on the piazza and nice to sit next to, especially in the high heat of the summer when the spray splashes on you and cools you down!overall a lovely way to spend an afternoon or evening.
Beautiful. This is a perfect example of a piazza in Rome, anchored by a church, of course, but also by two beautiful fountains.

The spirit of Italy. I'd definitely say this is the most underestimated thing in Rome. It's wonderful and although I couldn't manage to do so, definitely ride a Vespa around it. It's wonderful and I'd be so happy if I could return :)

Amazing Statues and lots to see. Piazza Navona has Amazing Statues and lots to see, especially if you like to people watch, and observe Artists creating paintings and sketches, as well as magicians and people "floating" in mid air! This is one of the most crowded Piazza's in Rome because it contains some of the best fountains around. The Piazza is huge, shaped like a long oval and surrounded with many outside restaurants and places to shop and watch people. Or you can plan yourself on one of the statues and enjoy the sounds of water and the occasional splash of cooling water coming off the fountains. Take side streets off the Piazza to find reasonable places to grab sandwiches which you can eat on the Piazza. Great place to people watch!
Good Restaurants. A nice Piazza to go and grab some food, enjoy some locals displaying their creativity, and grab some gelato. There is also an old fountain from when the aquaduct was built.
Piazza Navona. beautiful square... filled with people enjoying the splendidness. Will visit again soon and will try to dine there too.

Nice After Dinner Walk. Piazza Navona happened to be around the corner from our dinner restaurant, so we walked over after we ate. What fun! Beside some amazing architecture - the Church of Sant'Agnese in Agone, the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of Four Rivers), and the Fountain of Neptune - in the evening, the Piazza is full of vendors, street performers, and people checking out the sights. We wandered around for about an hour, taking photos, enjoying some performances, and just hanging out. We had a great time. There are a lot of restaurants there on the Piazza, which were crowded, but I can't speak to the quality or value as we ate elsewhere. But we did grab some gelato on the way out.
Beautiful Piazza Navona. Very nice fountain is the centerpiece, restaurants and bars all around, street performers and the Pantheon is only a few blocks away.

Art, Art, Art. During the day, the square is filled with young artists who display their goods for all to see and hopefully buy. At night, the square comes alive with wall to wall people enjoying the Roman night life. The only draw back is the influx of Muslims who are rude, obnoxious, hateful and do not belong in this joyous environment.

Great time here!!. Of all the piaza's in Rome this one is definitely a must see. Lots of activity all day long...artists, mimes, actors, etc. Lots of entertainment for the kids. Lots of shopping. This is a huge piaza and definitely one of the best in Roma.
Great for photos.. a place where there are 3 monuments dedicated to 3 different stories told throughout the history of rome.
Piazza Navona. Loved the piazza!! Street vendors/artists, fountains, great restaurants and gelato.....great place to spend an afternoon/evening.....try Luigi's for lunch/dinner!

So many fountains . . .. This one should be on your list because it is beautiful. People watching, gelato, a little bit of shade and you're good! Very crowded midday and would suggest evenings after 9 pm; street musicians and dancers are in abundance and were quite entertaining! A vendor selling roasted chestnuts was nearby. Nice.

Favourite Piazza. This was our favourite Piazza. Nice restaurants, artists and buskers add to the atmosphere. The basilica was also one of my favourite. When we went, there were some local children preparing for their first Eucharist.
Beautiful and fun!. A beautiful piazza lots of restaurants and bars. Love music all around a bit of a tourist stop but still very much worth it. Tartufos all around be sure to try one.
Saturday Evening. This place was absolutely buzzing and well worth a visit. Street mime, artists, live music. People watching and entertainment at its best.

Magicial At Dusk. My wife and I strolled hand-in-hand through Piazza Navona just as the sun was dipping from the sky. The Piazza is alive with live music, people laughing, the smell of food cooking and the steady drumming of 3 beautifully grand fountains. Fountain of the Four Rivers, Fountain of Neptune and, personally preferred, Moor Fountain. I snapped a few great pictures of my wife sitting in front of it (lots of bench space there if you want a cool misting during a warm day or night).

Go to Navona not Trevi. Everybody wants to see the Trevi fountain. While Trevi is impressive, it has also been under rehabilitation since 2011 which will likely take longer. Instead of Trevi ... Go the Piazza Navona. The main fountain is just as impressive; and there is more room for the hoardes of tourists.

Piazza for relaxation. We visited this piazza on our walk from St Peter's to the Quirinale. It was buzzing with people taking in the atmosphere, sitting at the cafes and enjoying the fountains. The Fountain of The Four Rivers with the Egyptian obelisk is very impressive and makes a good photo opportunity. We enjoyed gelato from Tri Scala - listed as one of the 'Must Do in Rome' activities. It was delicious and considerably cheaper than sitting in the café!
Great place to rest!. Wonderful place to rest your tired feet! You can almost feel history on the space. Sit down with an espresso, and enjoy!

Pity it wasn't open. Went on a public holiday and it was closed,but what a monument in the back streets of rome,easily found ,couple of blocks from the piazza novana,will go back some day to see inside!

CROWDED BUT SO NICE. Offcourse it is one of a lot of places to see in Rome, an MUST, but it always return you with feeling of happines after you go thru crowd an still enjoy you stay. You can sit in the cafe's or on banch and breed all Piazza Navona air in you. The fountain is one of the towsent's Roman fountains. I fully enjoy my stay in Rome...

Nice fountains, artists creating beautiful depictions of Rome. I found this a littl edisappointing. It's just a square with three attractive fountains. There were artists selling their paintings of Rome, that made the place more interesting.

worth visiting. Piazza Navona is probably one of the best known pizzas in Rome. Go there but be prepared for crowds. Probably best in the morning for fewer crowds but for atmosphere then the evening is better when there is often music. It is also cooler. Visit the side streets for food which is much better and cheaper.

Beautiful; Visit; People Watch; Be Entertained. As others say --> This square has it all! People; entertainers; food; gelato; music; fountains. It is a grand wide open space. Of course, sitting down to eat outside will cost a bit more, simply the "price of admission" for people-watching.

Worth it. Loooove this plaza! Great spot in the day, and transforms at night to art and singing. Very central and popular so it's a bit crowded, but it's still a great spot. Famous fountain lives up to its name.

A wonderful place to rest and eat. The plaza is beautiful with the water fountain in the middle. Lots of restaurants to choose from and shops to browse. Lots of people milling about and fun to people watch and listen to music from the locals who sing in the hope people will donate some money to them.

Amazing fountains..too many migrants selling wares.. Love the fountains, people watching and a quick glass of vino and a snack. The migrants selling knock offs were amusing, being constantly chased around by two female Polizei.
Great architecture here too. Nice spot in the early evening.

Do it in the mornings !!!!!. The piazza is one of these you'll never forget. If you have the chance to see it when there are not to many tourists, and you have the chance to see the beauty of this wonderfull piazza, with of course the magnificient fountains, and you could read some of the most interesseying facts about them, and the two oppositie churches, i hope you Will have the same trill as i did, and do, whenever visiting Rome, I personally prefer the piazza navona, and her fountains over the Trevi fountains .
When in Rome.... Nice place with a lot of art vendors... nice to have stroll and a look around. The fountains are a real beauty.

Nice tourist spot. A very lively piazza which was very busy both times I visited at the end of June 2015. There are some superb sculptures and water fountains to be found in the middle of the square. Apparently our tour guide mentioned the restaurants on the piazza itself were over priced and not great quality so I didn't venture into any of them. There are however, some decent restaurants just on the road past the Brazilian embassy (insalata and bafettos) to name 2 I visited.

A must see that rewards the visitor. Yes, it may be one of the major attractions and always filled with tourists and salesmen. Still, the Piazza with its church, fountain and surrounding houses is fantastically beautiful and well deserves a visit. A must see that delivers.

A must do.. Piazza Navona is one of those understated things that you keep on thinking about when you walk away. From its three fabulous fountains to the beautiful Church in the middle of it, to the street performers that never fail to impress, this is a must see.Tip: Look into the windows of the Church and look at the frescoes in the ceiling. Amazing!!!

Great Fountains, a place to see and be seen!!!. Visited many times over the years, and never get tired of this wonderful location. The fountains are magnificent indeed surrounded by numerous restaurants on either side of the piazza. They are a bit pricey, but well worth the extra cost just to sit and watch the world go by.and to see the street vendors, artists and actors do their thing day and night. Night time is spectacular, all a glow!! Due to the crowds day and night if you want photos go over very early in the AM before 9 and there are very few folks around, earlier the better.

A Hidden Treasure in the heart of Rome. Follow the narrow winding streets lined with restaurants and you will arrive at the Piazza Navona. The wide rectangular Piazza opens up before you, with a wonderful atmosphere. From the art exhibitions , the street sellars, the statue art to the three brilliant and flambuoyant fountains.Here,it is easy to forget the queues and crowds around the Vatican. Just embrace this wonderful hospitable corner and enjoy. The cafes are on hand for a long cool drink, a snack or a meal make this a most memorable visit.This Piazza comes alive in the evenings too, and really should be a must day or night on anyones itinery

Great place to visit. We used this place as a meeting place to start our walking tours and as a marker to our location. So much to see and do. The fountains were amazing to see. Vendors in the plaza,and restaurants surround the Piazza Navona.
Amazing sight. Definitely a must see in Rome... You dont need to spend a lot of time here, but what you will see, it will be truly amazing what a human hand can create.

Beautiful square. This square has it all...beautiful buildings, fountains, terraces where you can have a drink or something to eat. Also a place where you can see artists making paintings, drawings,..some are really good. Have to go there, relax and watch people passing by. I went during daytime but im sure nighttime will make it even more special.

A Great Place for Street Entertainment. The Piazza Navona is a great place to visit especially at night. The Piazza comes to life with illuminated fountains and street entertainers. It is surrounded by magnificent buildings with some very good restaurants to eat at. Although very busy it does not give the impression of being excessively overcrowded. A great place to entertain children.
A must see place. A must see place in the middle of the old city of Rome. So many restaurants and cafes to eat or waste time. A living place for all day time.

Ticking the box. A must see but a bit too tourisy...try it late at night but my wondering around there at 6am was very good. Great photos and no one around! That's the up side of the Romans who don't get going too early.

My absolute favourite place in Rome. Went to the Piazza Navona with no expectations and absolutely fell in love with it. It is the most beautiful Piazza my partner & I visited in Rome. The Fountain of Four Rivers is truly beautiful and the detail in the fountain is stunning. The restaraunts around the Piazza are of course expensive, however the quality of food is amazing. I had the most expensive meal of our stay here, but my favourite meal of the stay as well, I had the best Carbona and dark chocolate gelato I have ever had and probably will every have.There are lots of craft stalls selling art and various souvenirs, we bought a couple of paintings to bring back to the UK with us. There also lots of live music playing and the place is so stunning at night as well. Piazza Navona will always hold a special place in my heart, especially as it's where my partner got down on one knee and asked me to be his wife! :-)

Beautiful spot to take in Roma. We didn't have too much time here but was a stop on our Segway tour. Very interesting history associated with the sculpture by Bernini. Worth having someone explain it to you or look it up before you visit.
Piazza Navona. Spectacular piazza, especially at night! Live entertainment, great vibe, restaurants with outside tables, not to mention great works of art....

What a fab place!. We stumbled across this at night after eating at Cibo. What a fantastic vibrant square! My fave night in italy tbh! The atmosphere was amazing. Beautiful fountains & buildings & loads of great restaurants down the side streets. Loved it & would go bk in a heartbeat :)

Especially fun at night. The piazza is beautifully lit up at night, with diners sitting on the terraces all around the piazza, and street artists displaying their wares. Our kids loved looking at the artists making portraits, or the ones using spray paint to create renditions of Rome icons such as the colosseum. Lively piazza day and night and not to be missed.

People watching at its finest!. This square is so busy and just alive! The fountain is the main attraction and really is stunning! Art on sale along with lots to see. We stumbled into the square after seeing the Pantheon. Definitely worth a visit very lively lots to do around here. Cafès bars benches. Wow.

Beautiful city square.. Great square to relax with bands and various other people selling some great oil paintings. Best view of this square i got was from the Roman Museum. The big fountain in the middle is pretty cool. Best bit was the church of st agnes in the middle. Lovely little church. One of my favourites in Rome.

Great place to hang out at the end of the day. We visited this place twice. Besides the beautiful fountain and surrounding areas, our kids enjoyed seeing the acts and painting shows. There are a lot of nice places to eat around here.
Our walking tour guide told us to be careful of pick pockets.

Beautiful fountains great ambience. Loads of photo opportunities around this busy piazza ( more an oblong than a square) though we walked past the many restaurants to piazza di Pasquino where we had been recommended to eat at a restaurant called Cul de Sac

Interesting piazza but be careful of pickpockets. There are street artist, magicians etc on this piazza but that also attracts pick pocketers. I had one trying to dig in my bag and thankfully another tourist looked at this guy straight in the eye and he left. He was "professionally" dressed for his "job" in a pinstrip suit and you would never had suspected it. If you have a handbag make sure it has a zip, mine didn't. Otherwise its a lovely place to enjoy. I went back after my episode but more careful with a cross bag. This applies to most attractions in Rome, you read about these pick pockets but never expect to be a victim

Beautiful sculptures!. The fountains are beautiful. We enjoyed walking the loops at night, watching the entertainers, and soaking in the night life. The unlicensed street hawkers got a little annoying, but we had a great time.

How to fall in love with Rome. Just come and see this amazing place. Sit and enjoy a cafe americano, listen to the street performers, shoo the public vendors trying to sell you a bottle of water, check out the cute souvenir shops and try some pasta & gelato under the amazing art of Roman fountains.

THREE FOUNTAINS LOVELY PIAZZA. Another must for art/ cappuccino lovers. One of the most beautiful piazzas in Rome built on a former stadium, this is why it has an oval shape. next to the Pantheon. You would love the three fountains mainly Bernini's fpur rivers and Domitian's obelisk.

Leisurely Stroll Through Piazza Novona. Located near the Pantheon, the Piazza Navona is a great place to grab a bight to eat, look at some fantastic architecture and fountains and peoplwe watch. If you go early in the morning or late at night, it is less crowded and better for crowd free photographs.
Fun vibe. The fountains are the highlight, but its also fun just soaking up the carnival like atmosphere. we ate elsewhere but it is fun in the evening.

The fountains were beautiful and the history between the artist fun.. Read up a little before you go and then look for the hints the artists hid. Our tour guide uncovered a few and let us know some that are undocumented and questionable... visit, sit and head to the Vatican!

Piazza Novona - Rome. This is a good place to visit and spend a day. The restaurants around the fountain are good. You get vegetarian food also (book in adv) .Many souvenir stores around this place. Equally nice to spend the time here in the evenings till late night.Many street vendors peddling paintings (really good ones ) , flying light sticks, belts, caps and knic knacs will keep you entertained.
Sit down and enjoy the city. Just go for walk around the fountains, sit in a cafe, absorb the atmosphere and feel the happiest person
Beautiful Place. Great Place to take a stroll! Lovely fountains , street artists, cafes , churches restaurants...feels like you an other era !

So much to see. The 3 fountains are truly stunning! Surrounding by restaurants, Bars, Shops, Artists, Performers & Street Artists (Which we bought a piece from because he was Amazing, he's name was Vento & he was doing stunning Spay Paintings)

Great Cityscape. The city square features wonderful buildings on all four sides and some magnificent fountains. You need to sit and soak up the atmosphere to try and see all that is on offer. Very busy but the size of it makes it feel less hectic than some parts of Rome.

Charming placeto chill out. Beautiflu large square with fountains, not so crowded but still filled with tourist and different artists and entertainers.I visted this place for another time in my life and I am always really charmed by its atmosphere.Good opportunity to relax in one of neighboring restaurants.Top place on a 'come back list'.

Great place in rome. We have always love piazza Navona. Beautiful fountains. Street artists & vendors. Good food nearby. Watch the service charges. Some places will try to charge you 16% just to use the table. Not tip just a hidden charge

Nice place to eat and walk around after dinner. This piazza has several nice restaurants to eat it and is nice to walk around. We came to his area every night in Rome. There are artists, performers so you can walk around while digesting your meal. My daughters got their caricatures diene, the caricature artists are amazing what can do in under 5 minutes. We saw a fire juggler, a tap dancer, few musicians, spray paint artists are also very cool.

Worth a short visit. Over the years we have traveled to Rome several times and have enjoyed the Piazza. It was a lively combination of music, art, street performers and people just out for a stroll. This visit simply struck as as different. Our major take away was the vast number of invasive street vendors selling primarily selfie sticks. There were other vendors selling pocketbooks and African products. The festive feel of the Piazza was missing for us.

A lively place. Saw it in the morning. A lovely atmosphere with artists and cafes. The fountain is lovely and historic, symbolising the four major rivers of the then known four continents. A must see. One can spend less than an hour to just visit the Piazza or a couple of hours just sitting and soaking in the atmosphere over a glass of beer and lunch.

Beautiful Piazza and Fountain!. This is a large piazza with a beautiful fountain, near to the Pantheon. There are an interesting mix of people-type attractions in the piazza looking to make money getting their picture taken with you. I reminded me of Hollywood Blvd! But the fountain was beautiful!

Dolce Vita. Strolling, dining, and people watching on the Piazza Navona...so lovely. The Fountain of the Four Rivers is a magnificent centerpiece. The restaurants in the Piazza are of course pricier and you could defintely eat tastier meals, but it is the ambiance, no? If you prefer, have dinner nearby the take a leisurely walk to the Piazza, then grab a gelato and peruse the wares of the street vendors, check out the artists and performers, and take it all in...
Best in Rome. By far the best area to stay in Rome, walking distance to everything and a lovely traditional square in the centre which is great to eat nearby in the evening!

Exactly what you pictured. A visit to Rome just isn't complete without a visit to Piazza Navona. I was pleasantly surprised while visiting it wasn't as expensive or as crowded as everyone had lead on. I stopped at a little restaurant just off the piazza and had the best gnocci! Definitely make a stop here, sip of a cold drink and people watch, gaze as the architecture, The scenery is just lovely!
A beautiful square. Beautiful square. It is especially unique to come here when painters and merchants come a offer their goods, you can wander around seeing magical paintings.

Standout in a big city. Our Tauck tour group visited this lovely piazza after our morning tour of St. Peter's. It was a beautiful place to rest and recharge and have a good meal before walking to the nearby Pantheon.

Watch the world the go buy. During our visit to Rome in May we frequently found ourselves back here. It is a really good place to relax after a hard days sightseeing. Firstly, there is a taxi rank just off the piazza which is handy if your hotel is a little way out as ours was. The fountains are lovely especially the middle one, get up close to really enjoy the detail, then sit back with a glass of wine at one of the numerous bars and restaurants to just enjoy the view. Its clear from reading the other reviews, that you either get this place or you don't. Well we did.
