The buskers are great, and the waiters do not allow the street vendors to harass you, so if you don't like that sort of thing you will be ok. There are lots of beautiful churches just a short walk from the piazza which contain statues and paintings which are well worth seeing and offer free seats and shelter from the heat on hot days! We ate in the piazza 3 times in 5 days as we felt really comfortable here and it is a good place to start or finish your day. The sound of the slashing water is calming and relaxing and we thought the area was lovely. As the Trevi fountain is being restored at the moment it cannot really be appreciated so this is a great substitute. You can only speak as you find and I know that our next visit to Rome will begin and end in Piazza Novona just as this one did!

Beautiful Fountains, including one featured
in the Dan Brown movie, Angels & Demons. It's just a short walk from the Pantheon and it's close to the only ATM I could get my bank card to work (that I trusted) in in Rome. In the evenings there are PLENTY of vendors, just remember, HAGGLE). A few years ago my wife wanted a purse priced at 100€. I sent her to pick one up at another vendor and talk to him while I worked on the one she wanted. Within 5 minutes I had him offering to sell it for 15€. If you go at it like a game and are prepared to walk away, you can get a good deal. I got a painting the same way, although not as cheap.It's worth the walk.
Piazza Navona - beautiful. The most beautiful piazza in Roma. Love it. So much to explore; artisans, shopping, restaurants, churches, fountains.

such a pretty place to hang out. i got lost and ended up here somehow. But it's such a pretty place. There are 4 fountains surrounded by restaurants.
So pretty yes...
But the restaurants sucked!!! and they charge 6 euro for a coffee.....

Great. We came to this piazza which is regarded as the most important in all of Rome. It's beautiful and late in size and was used for athletic games in ancient times.It was part of our City Wonders Tour and so it was great to get background info on the piazza!There are restaurants and bars too that one can indulge in too!

Colourful and beautiful. Love this place. Lots happening and a very social place to be. Musicians and artists fill the square, amidst the water fountains and cafe's. Lots to see and enjoy as well as to sit and enjoy a coffee or a cold drink. A must on your to do list whilst in Rome. Cafe's over priced but worth paying just for the experience to be able to sit and relax and take in the local culture.
Nice Piazza with many things to see. Nice place but somewhat expensive - many street vendors with everything from selfie sticks to paintings for sale. Nice fountain with a nice story.

If have enough time in ROME!. If you only have a few days in ROME I suggest options such as Palatine Hill or Roman Forum instead.However, since Trevi Fountain is mainly Closed for Renovations it was a reasonable alternative if you prefer fountains.

Not essential. Big square with a fountain and lots of eateries, not sure why this is an "essential" part of a trip to Rome. If you have plenty of time then fine, if you are a bit stretched then it is not a massive loss.

The best piazza!!. I loved eating in this piazza. The restaurants around are a little more expensive than surrounding ones without the piazza view, but its worth it for the atmosphere. Overall not much to do here except eat and walk around and look at the beautiful fountain. There's also tons of vendors and usually someone singing at night for tips.

Buzzing!. I only wish we had the time to go back and soak up more of the Piazza, I would definitely visit again should I be lucky to go back. The atmosphere is electric and it would be one of the best places in Rome to people-watch. The fountain is extraordinary and for Rome, that's saying something!

Must see and do - beautiful. Piazza Navona and its three famous fountains are a must see and do for your Rome Itinerary. Something for everyone here, young and old. A great spot to rest, recharge, eat, drink, people watch and learn about its three beautiful fountains.

Beautiful Piazza. We visited here several times in December as our hotel was just around the corner. Loved the history and architecture. Especially appreciated the beautiful fountains. The restaurants around the piazza were very good.

Great for people watching. I have yet to really find out why this is on so many "must-see" lists...while I think any part of Rome is beautiful and meant to be explored, I wouldn't go out of your way to see this piazza. The restaurants that surround the square are average but definitely nothing special and a lot of the immediate surrounding area isn't anything particularly special. But, if you're walking by it definitely doesn't hurt to stop and take a peek, the people watching is always good if you enjoy spending time sipping wine and watching others.

Beautiful fountain in a touristy area. As part of our guided tour in Rome we walked through this piazza, which is crowded with artists (and other vendors). The church was closing for the noon hour so we couldn't go in, but we did stop and admire the historic fountain, which was featured in the movie Angels and Demons - if you saw the movie you might remember it. It's a fun place to people watch, and the apartments surrounding the piazza are often rented to tourists. There are cafes for people watching and lovely buildings to admire. Our guide said it stays relatively noisy but some would term that 'lively.'

fantastic. have visited rome three times and always end up eating here. There are lots of great restaurants and street entertainers. It is a great place and you must read up on the history of it with its Bernini fountains before you go. Absolutely love it
One of the best places in Rome. It is a fantastic place in the evening - no crowds, good food at adjoining streets. Try ice-cream Grom over the corner.

Active and interesting Piazza. It is sort of pretentious to "review" the Piazza Navona. The architecture is beautiful. One of Rome's many, many, great places to visit. But a few of the other activities happening in the square - if you buy a selfie stick test it first. They seem to sell bad ones to those who don't know any better (like us ;-) We had our likeness drawn by one of the guys there - not a caricature. But a portrait. Negotiate. But don't expect too much. The process was fun but at the end of the day it didn't look that much like my girlfriend although my likeness was pretty much on. Watch your valuables. Have a good time!

Fun and Historic . Love Piazza Navona. Something for all the senses: Historic architecture, Large landmark fountain, Artists everywhere, Beautiful churches, Fabulous outdoor restaurants (one of my favorites is Ciro y Ciro)

Piazza Navona. Love the fountain. The statues within breathtaking. Within walking distance of our hotel so it was visited often. Many pictures were taken so many memories of our visit to take home with us.

Love this people-friendly space. The best features in the Italian cities that we have visited are undoubtedly the piazzas. They are the heart and soul of the city, with a feel-good atmosphere about them. Piazza Navona is one of the biggest and best examples and we enjoyed our two visits during our recent four days in Rome. The fountains are beautiful and seem to invite people to sit around them; the sound of the water even helps you feel good.If you want to dine, there are maybe 7 or 8 restaurants in the square itself to choose from, and several others just off the square; you will be spoiled for choice. If you are one of those people whose first thought is price comparison; then find a less up-beat place to dine, in a less popular place. The prices will be cheaper there, but the experience, well, not be as good!Wandering vendors populate the piazza, the smart ones will try to engage you in conversation; you can just ignore them. They know that tourists like to say where they are from – why I don’t know - so they may ask you that question. Just ignore it and you will be left alone. I notice many American (and other) reviewers mention these pests, but at least they are offering something for your money. In the two cities in America that I know best, (San Francisco and Las Vegas) you will find the streets of the tourist areas and busy stop lights, populated by the homeless and down and outs, and all they offer is a cardboard sign begging for money.I have never seen that anywhere on this entire trip through Switzerland and Italy, or for that matter, on our trip to Argentina last year, not “Only in America,” but pretty common none the less.

Beautiful Sculptures. The sculptures and the area gives a great visual on the competitive games that were played there. Today it is a touristy spot with street vendors and interesting performers around. We visited the place in August 2006. Would recommend visiting thsi place.

One lovely place. I love this place, so much color, so much art and relax atmosphere is a must when you visit Rome. The food is kind of pricey but it worth it just for the pleasure to be enjoying the view and the music.
Beautiful. It was quite interesting, story behind the sculptor is interesting. It was not too crowded the day we were there in May, 2014.

Perfect piazza. The Bernini fountain is impressive, with sculptures representing the 4 rivers (Nile, Ganges, Danube, Plata) of the known world, but don't miss going inside to see Borromini's church and dome. Fantastic geometry! The piazza is full of musicians and artists and lined with restaurants.

Very pretty Piazza with some beautiful fountains. Amazing collection Fountains/Sculptures, well worth a visit.....lot of people taking pictures of Berninis `Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi` after it was featured in a key scene in the 'Angels & Demons' movie from a few years back. Some shops & places to eat dotted around the Piazza, as well as some vendors offering various wares in the Piazza itself, a very nice place in the centre of Rome to relax for a while.
Fabulous piazza.. Wonderful piazza with a beautiful fountain and artists, mime artists, and musicians performing. Very peaceful place.

Fun and beautiful. This large Piazza has a fun, clean vibe and is beautiful to boot!. Pretty fountains and buildings, street performers, art "market" vendors, musicians, places to sit outside and have a drink or eat. There is a taxi area. Several recommended restaurants right off the Piazza on side streets.

Great History but.... This sight is beautiful. When you think of the history that took place here it is a fun place to visit. Unfortunately, I found this sight to just be a place where non-locals try to sell their junk! I would defiantly recommend a visit here to see the buildings and fountain, and to see where chariots raced but the sellers are pushy and the restaurants that are inside the piazza are also pushy to get your business. We stayed very close by and used it as a reference point to find our way back.

Less than expected. Nice statues, fountains, crowds. Missed the church. Square tucked away. Hawkers tend to spoil it with their approach, and the line "Are you African?" to clearly European looking people. There are restaurants in the square.

Beautiful piazza!. Piazza Navona is a beautiful piazza in the historic centre of Rome (near Pantheon), probably one of my favourite squares in Rome.It has a few nice fountains; Fountain of Neptune, Moor Fountain and the most popular, Fountain of the Four Rivers.Lots of nice terraces around!

One of the most beautiful places. A really beautiful place! And if it's open, go inside the church, it's totally worth it! There's also a beautiful museum a bit further and the chiostro del Bramante is not far from there.

Great place to be entertained for afternoon or evening. This place is a 10-ring circus---so many tourists, vendors, street performers! Grab a seat on a bench or at a restaurant table, but be warned: you will be accosted non-stop by vendors selling roses, selfie sticks, African carvings, scarves, and more.

Stumbled upon on accident, so glad we did. This piazza is definitely worth checking out! We were walking back to the metro from the Vatican City and got lost. We stumbled upon this and so glad we did. Amazing food options, different street performers, lots of art. Fun vibes all around. Some of the best food we had was in this area and the walk wasn't bad either

My favorite Piazza in Rome. Piazza Navona is large enough to handle the many tourists that come for good reasons. This is a most splendid place with the famous Four Rivers fountain by Bernini. At a summer's night the place has the feel of a pleasant garden party.

Charming Square. We visited this square on our last day in Rome. The weather was not pleasant, but it is such a beautiful spot to take a walk through, and not too large - there are restaurants along the sides, small stalls in the middle of the square, many selling some very good artwork, a nice fountain at one end, and a mime artist to keep you entranced too!Im glad we found this piazza!
Incredible space. This Piazza is an incredible space. Wonderful buildings, superb fountains and lots of good quality artists working outdoors.

Navona. I guess it is best to visit the Navona after your visit to Vatican. After Vatican, cross the bridge with Angel sculptures, and straight you go to piazza Navona. I think that afternoon is the best place to visit it. It is lively, full of people, setting sun gives nice color to the fountain... I really like this place and recommand it to everyone.

Is there a more beautiful setting to have dinner?. No!!Restaurants here are slightly more expensive than others in central Rome but the beautifully designed piazza provides a memorable setting for your meal.

Beautiful spot . This is a beautiful location. The fountains are fabulous and the area has a great buzz about it. Loads of people but very interesting spot to just sit and soak life up either in one of the restaurants or on a bench in the Piazza.

Piazza Navona, Italy. No better place to come about a half hour before sunset, sit in one of the cafe's right in front of "The Four Rivers" fountain by Bernini! They cleaned this fountain just a few years back and its more beautiful than ever. As the sun sets you begin to hear the violin somewhere in the distance playing, and you just feel at peace. During the day when you are done watching the painters paint, just go down one of the side streets that lead you to St. Peters ....its just a little ways away and you get to cross Ponte de St. Angelo!

I love this place. How much more beauty can be put into one massive piazza?I have visited several times and am always blown away with the splendour.The cafes & restaurants make it a thoroughly lively place to pass away a ,owning or afternoon.A must visit on every trip.

Nice place for a walk. The Piazza Navona is a square near the center of Rome. The statues are very beautiful and they are lit up at night very nicely. There are many restaurants and shops for souvenirs nearby
Fun, best to see.. This is a cool place. Beautiful fountains, lots of street performers, art (live and otherwise), several shops. We liked walking through.

Lots of People and Lots of Room. This location is a very large and very old plaza and is just a short walk from the Pantheon and an easy walk from Campo De' Fiori. Lots of artist have goods for sale and it is a good place for people watching. The Fountain of Neptune is a good photo opportunity and the church St Agnese in Agone is another beautiful church you can visit. We visited in both the daytime and at night and would suggest doing both. I agree with others, find other and better locations to eat away from the plaza - the restaurants that are located on the plaza are expensive.

Touristy but I love it. Piazza Navona feels like the hub of Roma. It's always busy, with people selling stuff, busking and putting on shows. There are 3 gorgeous fountains, the middle one by Bernini and just so much atmosphere. Full of tourists, but I love it. Just don't eat there, go down one of the gorgeous alleys off the piazza and you'll save lots of money and likely get a tastier meal!
Must visit. It's a crowded square with fountains and churches and a lot of artists selling their art. The main fountain is very beautiful. Best to visit in early am before tourists arrive.

Nice. The piazza very crowded , first time was without the huge school crowds and it was beautiful and fun, the artists there were fun to see.. we had a portrait done and it was charming and inexpensive.When the crowds come, it is not as enjoyable. Restaurants are charming but food average, it is the experience that counts here.

Great place to people watch. The Piazza Navona is huge and hosts beautiful buildings, two fountains and a plethora of artists. Lots of restaurants on the piazza to dine in or have a glass of wine and enjoy the views. We went three times both during the day and at night and the. I e is great no matter when you go. Eateries and drinks are a bit pricier than other parts of Rome but the views are pretty darned good.

Very busy. The fountains are lovely and as it was hot and we had been walking around all day I would have loved to dip my feet in the cool waters of the fountains but I think that this would have been frowned upon.But you can stroll round the stalls selling "works of art" depending on your taste in art.Personally I do not like the works on sale.
stunningly piazza. Beautiful full of character piazza. Has a central fountain which is worth seeing by itself and other fountain at one end. Definitely include this on your Rome walking tour!

Expensive. Large busy square with street artists and lots of beautiful paintings for sale.Stopped for a drink and as I was a little peckish I ordered a fruit salad for €8.I received a tiny bowl with pieces of Apple, 2 peices of melon and half a strawberry.Walk away from the square and the restaurants that run parallel and you will get much more for your money and far better food all round.
Beautiful square. A lovely square bustling with tourists and restaurants and bars, part of a trail of areas to visit near the Vatican and Spanish steps.

Go in the evening!. This Piazza is a really nice meeting place to sit and people-watch. The beautiful fountain by Bernini, the artists, the street venders all make this a wonderful place to chill out after a long day of walking and sight-seeing.

Our favorite spot in Rome. For a place to just sit and watch the world go by, this is the spot. Take off your shoes and rest your weary feet in the water of the fountain. Watch people walk by. Eat at one of the outdoor restaurants. The spaghetti was so good. Was it because I was eating it in Rome? Maybe, but it was so good. You feel like you could be in a world 300 years ago.

Only if you have time...... It was very hot when we went here and all I really wanted to do was jump in the fountain not stare at it, there were markets everywhere around it so I don't think you appreciated it as much and no real sign or information about what is what etc. pretty fountain which nice sculpture and all but not the most amazing thing you will see in Rome.
Navona. In my view, this was the most beautiful Piazza in Rome. Expensive to sit and people watch with a beer but worth it.
Beautiful fountain, lovely square. This is one of the prettiest piazzas in Rome, with a beautiful fountain by Bernini, lots of restaurants with outdoor seating, and street vendors.
Great place to eat & people watch.. A great place to go and get some lunch or an evening meal. Amazing to see at night, especially with the fountains all lit up and the street performers.

A wonderful wonder. The charm you find it here is incomparable. Even with the crowd there is always the romance and the history combined. You will always like it. Don't miss the chance to visit ot any time od the day.

Felt like history. You can't miss this piazza when visiting Rome. It takes you back in history, I felt as if in the 19th century, pretty old houses, painters, lovers. I loved it all except for the sellers who bother you from time to time trying to sell everything from mobile chargers, selfie sticks, clothes, etc.. All 3 fountains are worth a photo :)

Wow - this is one beautiful piazza!!. Make sure you go here - it's an impressive piazza - it had energy, street vendors, artists, entertainers and loads of cafes to sit and have a glass of wine and enjoy the view. There wasn't a crush of people there either - which was a relief and you could actually feel yourself relaxing. The fountains are a great place to take beautiful pictures of your family without 100 other people in the shots - Perfecto!!

Lots to see, but expect to be bothered!. Very cool spot but also very touristy. Got harassed about a dozen times to buy a selfie stick! Probably why I didn't give a full 5 stars. So many cool sites and photo opportunities. The culture, history, and architecture are definitely worth an hour of your time on your trip to Rome!

Beautiful. Gorgeous and beautiful fountain but watch out for pick pockets and avoid the expensive cafes, grab something for a little local backstreet cafe instead for something more authentic and lighter on the wallet!

Amazing place, lively & happening. We had an amazing time here. There were so many artists and that made the whole place really fun and enjoyable. You can spend atleast 3 hours here. The atmosphere is relaxed and fun.
Super. Best place in Rome to people watch, see beautiful fountains, look at street artist's work, and have a meal or a gelato.

One of the nicest squares in Rom. This square has a fanastic atmosphere, with the sorrounding houses, the Sant'Agnese in Agone and the statues of Bernini. It is woth to visit any time of the day, especially during the evening.
Oh, the Fountains!!. A beautiful, peaceful plaza in the middle of the city. Our tour guide brought us here and we loved it! The fountains are so detailed and ornate! This is a must-see!

Great spot to eat and relax!. We were in Piazza Navona during the weekend, so it was full of tourists, but was a really nice place either way. The Piazza had several artists of all kinds selling their works while some street artists performed on the square. We ate at a really good restaurant called Vacanze Romane, a really nice place with good food and reasonable price.This is a good place to go for a nice time, relax a little and watch the world around you. Must be beautifull after the sunset, but we were there on summer when the sunset is only after 21, so we were there just for the day.

Brilliant atmosohere. We are here and enjoyed the ambiance people watching . The fountain is lovely it's very busy but great atmosphere also the street entertainers are great too our horse and carriage tour brought us here and we came back for lunch don't miss out on seeing this

Great for relaxing and people watching after a busy day of sights.. Lovely big Piazza - lovely experience viewing the fountain and people watching while having a drink at one of the open air bars located on the Piazza. Yes it is very crowded and touristy, like the rest of Rome, but still a great place to spend a little time.

Beautiful! . A great place for a nice stroll. There are plenty of vendors to see, restaurants to eat at and artists to watch. Close to a variety of landmarks. Be sure to visit the churches in and around the Piazza.
Crowded, but beautiful.... This was a nice square with a wonderful atmosphere. I only wish that we would have spent more time here.

favorite place in Rome. Piazza Navona is my favorite place in Rome, worth visiting every day. It has such a beautiful fountain and architecture, basilica; sit and relax or have a snack or meal sitting outside at one of the many restaurants. It is near the Pantheon, Trevi, and other popular places.

Crowded but beautiful. Beautiful square. Awesome center fountain. Always busy but not too crowded with people. Wish they'd clear out the pushy vendors, but that's everywhere at every attraction in Rome. We went twice to hangout and chill!

Interesting, but no shade from the sun. Definitely a people watching area. No motorized vehicles allowed in the piazza, taxi dropped us off at one end, taxi stand is located at the other. Lined with restaurants, but better food values located a short block away. Fountains are beautiful, but sometimes hard to get good photos because of the crowds. It was Sunday, artists and street vendors did not arrive until 1pm or later. "Street" easily negotiable with a manual wheelchair, sidewalks and middle of piazza were not.
Beautiful square. Beautiful square with a variety of restaurants. Been here twice now and I just love the atmosphere of the place, especially late at night.

This place is hopping!. With the gorgeous fountain as its centerpiece, the Piazza Navona is constantly abuzz with people - both tourists and locals - passing through. There are dozens of entertainers as well as vendors peddling their wares. As it is fairly central in location, it is a great place to meet up with friends after a day milling about Roma.

People watching at its finest. Unquestionably the central fountain by Bernini in the piazza represents a brilliant achievement however most visitors only spend a few minutes appreciating this monument before beginning the real sport, people watching. The piazza is is a wonderful circus center stage with jugglers, tap dancers, street merchants and performers of all kinds seeking to extract a few Euros. Whether you're part of the market buying small toys or merely watching the activity from one of the cafes that ring the piazza this is a part of the Roman tourist experience that should be enjoyed.
Brilliant. Such a grand square, or piazza. The architecture is truly intricate and lovely. It is nice to just sit, admire its greatness and absorb the cultural-rich area. Truly a gem!

Lively Piazza. We stayed close to the Piazza Navona. There were always alot of tourist roaming the piazza being entertained by entertainers, musicians and viewing and buying artwork with many artists set up there. On either side of the piazza are restaurants that you can sit outside and watch the action. So lively!

"Expectation greater than the impression of the visit". Piazza Navona is one of those places in Rome that a lot of people place on their 'must-do' list of places to see. It was on mine.I am not sure what I expected but basically on arrival it did not live up to my expectations.In reality a very large piazza, absolutely cram packed with people, sellers of all manner of art work, people sketching portraits, lots of noise and congestion with a perimeter dotted with cafes and restaurants.Thinking that if we ate somewhere away from the actual Piazza we would have less chance of being gouged price wise we were wrong. Eating in a quaint café on the street behind the Piazza we had a lovely meal but did not realise that we would be charged for a carafe of water (not mineral), service and an overinflated charge for a couple of slices of bread. It was the most expensive lunch we had on our whole trip.Despite my disappointment I am still glad we took the time to visit. Its size is impressive, there are some great photo ops of the buildings and fountain and its nice to tick it off our 'must see' list.

Beautiful Plaza and Bernini Statues not far from the Pantheon~! Should see it!. The Piazza Navona is a very attractive plaza just minutes from the Pantheon.Bernini statues with fountains are the focal points. I have some photos that say more than I can rambling on. Do enjoy these if you are in Rome!

Rome in the Round. The oval shaped Piazza Navona is a wonderful place to step out into the sunshine and breathe. Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers is massive. I found this Piazza to be a surprisingly relaxing part if the eternal city, perhaps partly due to the sound of the flowing water.

Super. Great picture place
Lots and lots of restaurant choices!
Great night live both at the plaza and surrounding streets
Nice
Loveliest piazza in Rome.. On a bright day there is nothing more pleasant then to sit down in the piazza, enjoy the sights, the fountains, the people and maybe a good restaurant. Just a pure joy.

RUINED BY THE RESPECTLESS MOB. Ok 95% of us are tourists , but this 'to do' place is no longer fun starting during the day until late at night . The space is crowded with people selling their ' unique gems ' and loud , very loud music . Name a song and it is r*ped on the spot . Having a drink on the terrasses used to be a plus but that is finished also . Pushy waiters eagerly just want to pull your money out of your pockets. So visit this beautiful place in early morning and then save yourselves.

must go. Very lively piazza (square) with alot of groups, selling paintings, singing, etc which makes it a colorful and lively place. There are plenty of restaurants, cafes and couple of souvenir shops. There is also 2 fountains which are amazing

The fountains are lots of fun. Maybe it is because I am from drought ridden California, but the fountains in the Piazza Navona were refreshing and great to look at. It is fun to figure out which side of the Four Rivers fountain represents which river. Don't forget to look for St Theresa looking down on them in her compromised state.

History + Vendors = Fun. Not on my list to visit we came upon it accidentally and I am so glad. It's spectacular, historical and yet has the contemporary vibe with street sellers and performers. The St. Agnes Basilica is a wonderful example of Bernini's influence (even though it infuriated him).

Visit at night. Best time to visit as the crowds disappear and the magic of the lights being the fountains to life. During the day it is too crowded and too hot in the summer. Far more pleasant to enjoy the fountains by yourself in the evening.
Relax and unwind. A great spot to grab a coffee and watch the world go by. Many talented artists selling their wares and some good musicians adding to the ambiance.

Wonderful Piazza. Hard to believe this Piazza once sat 30,000 and had replica naval battles as part of the spectacles in Ancient Rome. Today the fountains are amazing and many fine restaurants circle the Piazza. Beware of the street vendors selling faux designer bags - we understand buying one runs the risk of being fined if caught by the police.

Absolutely vibrant place. we visited the place twice on our visit and both times we saw something new happening. its a kaleidoscope of activity. its an absolute must see. both times we felt we could have stayed for a longer time. aim to spend at lest a few hours.

Fabulous fountain. Lots going on in the piazza - in its original state it was a race track for chariots hence is elongated shape. Fabulous fountain. Lots of people. Great stores here - bought a lovely leather belt and my granddaughter purchased a lovely mid brown leather handbag that I'm sure she'll treasure for a long time
Very picturesque. Nice open plaza. The fountain is beautiful. Enough walk around space that it does not feel too crowded.

A great place to watch the people go by while enjoying the exquisite sculptured fountain. Another of the numerous piazzas but like all they are not a case of 'if you've one you'veseen them all' - each has it's own magic and beauty. Like all the crowded piazzas watch your pockets and bags.

Artistic Paradise. The fountains here are just amazing to view and the Piazza has numerous artists displaying their works. Beautiful cafes but I found them a little expensive. I purchased a small cappuccino & a small glass of juice for my daughter and it cost €11
Lots of fun and history. Great atmosphere, great architecture, great food. Be careful of Gypsies and pickpockets. Ladies have your bag in the front. Wander and explore this area and you will love it.

Nice place to hangout. Nice ambience , lots of street performers, some of them playing good music ...... Though over the days you realise they know only those 5 songs which they keep repeating !
All in all nice place to hangout for a meal or coffee , the beautiful fountains make it well worth it , and great gelato's on the corner !

Worth a visit with some great eating around as well. Site of the original Stadium of Domitian, built around 86 AD that was used for athletic races. The shape of the stadium remains, making this one of the longest plazas in Rome. Beautiful fountain by Bernini called Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers) made in 1651. Lots of artists in the plaza, plus the usual hawkers.While there are many restaurants and wine bars on the plaza, take time to explore the side streets for quieter and often better ofers

A step back in time. Straight out of 'Angels and Demons' you will recognise The Piazza Navona immediately. It is a large open area most frequented, when we were there, by artists setting up their easels and selling their pictures. The sculptures and the fountains are utterly amazing, and it is lovely just to wander round taking your time to enjoy them. The cafes are expensive but try not to grudge the owners a living. The capuccino tastes somehow richer when you sit sipping it while gazing round this amazing area.

Wonderful and spacious Piazza in Rome!. My family and I spent 3 of our 5 nights in Piazza Navona. You can immerse in the livelihood of all the people and wonderful restaurants the piazza has to offer. With all the walking in Rome during the day it's nice to get off your feet at night and enjoy all the great people. There are some truly gifted street performers and a great place to enjoy your evening!
Great for people watching!. This was one of the most amazing places for people watching lots going on. I watched a fantastic mime artist here who really entertained the crowds! Lots to see here!

An Historic Spot to Watch People. While here grab an overpriced coffee at the sidewalk restaurants and sit down to watch the passing parade. Note that the front row of coffee shop seats, if on the shade, will soon be crowded out by tour groups getting long-winded descriptions of the Piazza's chariot racing past. Take a look at the Fountain of the Four Winds, then once rested, move on.

Our Return to our favorite last night in Rome spot!. We visited this spot on our last night in Rome in 2009 and have always recalled it as our favorite night in your city. Our return this past week was so disappointing. The energy seems to have been sucked out of it and was replaced by dozens of artists and stacks of pictures to purchase. Also there were dozens of sun glasses hawkers and purse hawkers saying Hello, what price, Hello, what price. The police was about trying to stop this but they just grabbed up their purses for display or cardboard with sunglasses and went a few steps and started again. We left the area as it had lost all its charm. What a shame!

Lively, and spirited.. Thus happens to be one of the most happening Piazzas in Rome. A huge square dotted with many restaurants, fountains, statues and historic buildings. And yes, the fountain of the four rivers happens to be situated here.Apart from that, there are so many performing artists that it is a delight just to watch them. Modern painters, sketch artists, singers and bands..all of them come together to create a visual and audio cornucopia that mesmerises you.I would suggest that you spend your evenings here. They will be memorable. My advise would be to avoid the restaurants for major meals as the prices here are far more than the places some 500 mts away. And the quality is the same.Don't miss this place.

Again, a place you must visit when in Rome.. This is a place full of life and history. There are stalls selling things, all kinds or performers, a lot of restaurants all all kinds, and stores all round and on the narrow streets sourrounding the Piazza.It was a vitality that I suspect has been there for centuries. Don't miss it.

Great for Lunch & People Watching. Went here for lunch after an extremely long morning of walking around Rome and sight seeing. This is a beautiful little area with an amazing fountain in the middle of it.. There are also cafes dotted all around it making it a perfect place to sit out after your pasta and sip on coffee while watching the world go by!!As of June 15, Trevi fountain is still being renovated and is covered in scaffolding - I would recommend here instead.

One of the prettiest plazas in Rome! Great place for some wine and watching people.. There are 2 large fountains in the plaza which are worth seeing! Great photo opportunity and a wonderful place to "people watch". The street artists have something for everyone. Even if you do not buy anything, they are worth seeing. You should drop into the Church of Saint Agnes. It is not a magnificent cathedral, but a really nice church with some great stained glass and it dominates the plaza.

Beautiful during the day and night!. 2 great fountains, a church, and a lovely big square to walk and admire! We went during the day and then back at night when the fountains are lit and it looked spectacular! There are a ton of restaurants lining the square, but you'll definitely be paying a premium to eat there.

Great at night and day. My husband and I took a stroll to Navona one afternoon and sat on the benches surrounding the square. There are many artists set up with their works of art. Some are painting and drawing while others are there selling their items. It's a beautiful square with places to eat or drink surrounding it. We went back in the evening and it was even better. Less crowds and cooler. The artists are still set up and it's a nice atmosphere.

Amazing Piazza. This is the most amazing and lively piazza (square) I've seen and the fountains are beautiful. I sat in an outdoor cafe admiring this piazza and seen how buzzing it was. but it is worth seeing the square at night in my opinion

lively piazza. if you go in the afternoon you will find performers playing music,
and it has pigeons and lots of people just having fun,
the fountain is amazing especially the statue of the river Nile!
it has lots of symbolism which a famous sign of artists and architects in Rome.
Spent hours here so much to see. Would reccommend to all visitors to Rome walk and talk to fellow travellers you will be surprised what you see and hear fantastic.

Amazing Piazza!. This Piazza is very picturesque and hidden away. It is different in the morning, mid day, and at night. The fountains are worth the trip alone. We rented an apartment one block away. Was definitely nice to see at the different times of day.

Just love it. Amazing square in the heart of Rome with the beautiful Bernini fountain (la fontana dei quattro fiumi) in the middle that prefer to the four main rivers of the world: Donau, Ganges, Nile and the Rio de Plata
Great place for people watching. Our favourite piazza theres lots of cafes around the piazza to grab cake and a coffee and watch the world go by! The 4 rivers fountain is absolutely beautiful
Beautiful. A beautiful and large square (rectangle !!) with stunning architecture, fountains and cafes. A greta place to sit and people watch.

Best Piazza in Rome for People Watching. Find a seat and enjoy the parade of people. You'll pay a little more for your bottle of wine, but its worth the price of admission. Best time is early evening when its a little cooler, have a spritz and enjoy before you go out for dinner.

Beautiful but Cheesy. A beautiful piazza but atmosphere is spoiled by beggars and circus acts looking for change. The church of St Agnes is definitely worth a visit. Stay away from the restaurants surrounding the piazza and gravitate to the quaint cafes a couple of blocks off the square.

Beautiful and breath taking. The fountains are works of art, especially the 4 rivers by Bernini and the Il Jesu also is incredible. If you're hungry/thirsty walk a block or so away if you are on a budget, but if not, the cafe scene is remarkable.
Don't miss it.. Lots of restaurants, but you can do just as well for lunch/dinner and spend less if you go just a block away.

Nirvana at Navona. Our apartment was only one block from the piazza so we spent several afternoons just sitting and watching all the people. There are the ubiquitous vendors, hawking their selfie sticks and fake Prada handbags. Street musicians fill the air with all types of music. Artists abound selling their artwork or sketching a quick cartoon of you. In the center of it all is Bernini's fountain of the four great rivers. Piazza Navona is a social hub of Rome and a wonderful place to relax and watch the buzz of all the people. A day or at night, it's like a little piece of Nirvana.

Come for the fountain, stay for the people. The beautify of the Bernini sculpture in the Fountain is worth the trip alone. A beautiful piazza. Take a wander and see the churches and the fountains. Then find a table and stay for the people watching. Spend an hour or two! It's one of the best places in Rome for street life. Everyone comes to Piazza Navona.

Nice walk through !. Was at the piazza Novona and loved the fountains, (even better when you read up on your history ahead of tthem) Taxi. station right at the north entrance . Artists were amazing. Did not stop for food or drink. Would recommend going to see piazza Novona . Could see it getting very hot in the summer time with large crowds.

Fun to walk around at night . Fun area to walk around at night after dinner - great art work to buy with a little haggling. Most are reproductions (very well done wells), so just keep that in mind and don't feel so guilty about negotiating for a good rate. It's fun to watch the spray paint artists as well. I wouldn't eat at the restaurants on the piazza itself as its lovely in thought but much pricier and may cater more to mass food for tourists.
Worth a visit. All of the buildings making up this area was so beautiful. It makes wonderful photos but that's about the only thing you can do here.
People Watching. Brilliant place to sit, drink coffee, eat italian ice-cream and watch the world go by.... my little piece of heaven!!!

Piazza Navona. We had walked from the Pantheon to this very impressive Piazza Navona which was stunning in every direction. I am led to believe we were lucky enough to be there when it wasn't so crowded. There are 3 fountains in the square and they are impressive. A great place to stroll around and have a look at all the various sellers plying their wares. Or alternatively park up for a meal or cool drink in one of the many restaurants bordering the square... the drinking fountains allows you to top up that water bottle with some nice cool and refreshing drinking water also
Great place. One of the amazing squares in rome if you visited rome you need to visit this place full of life at day time and night great resturants street shops great place to take pictures as well

Barbarinis fantastic square. Strolling around Rome is a wonderful passion of life. Seeing all architectural and cultural places. If you want to rest a little then go to this square and sit down in one of the outdoor bars. Enjoy an Aperol spritz and just dream away. Look at the buildings and fontaines and the neverending stream of people passing by. And all the streetartists that is trying to attract everyones attention. I love this square
Busy area. We saw this when we sought out the Pantheon. A very busy square with a pretty fountain and shops nearby.

Water Classic. Being one of the must see destinations in Rome it gets a little crowded. Again the best times are early in the morning or late in the afternoon to beat the bus crowds.If you chose afternoon there are many cafes along the western perimeter, which are in the shade, to have a beverage and take in this piece of Rome. There are also some benches to sit and relax but they tend to get snapped up as soon as they are vacated.It's amazing to think that this piazza would not be possible if it wasn't for the Romans and their construction of the aqua ducts that brought water to Rome. All three fountains wouldn't be here if it wasn't for the Romans and they all have a water theme. In the centre stands the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi by Bernini. It's a absolutely fantastic sculpture. From all sides it is wonderful to look at and offers great opportunity for photos and the selfie. At the Northern end is the Fountain of Neptune and again a wonderful sculpture surrounded by water. The cafes at this end also sell gelato, which seems to be popular in the hot afternoons. Still magnificent though.Whilst we visited this time in the afternoon, I know from previous visits that night time it's equally as majestic under light and worth dining at one of the restaurants.

Bernini's Sculpture - Fountain of the Four Rivers. It is not to be missed on a visit to Rome. This piazzi is busy....great for people watching and various entertainment. The three fountains are beautiful. It is a must for a stroll and, maybe, a gelato or beverage.

"This large square is definitely worth the visit". We walked into the square in the late afternoon and what first struck us other than the large fountains were the artists who were attempting to sell their goods. The outer edges of the square are all lined with stores and restaurants.The three fountains are worth the viewing and a picture must be taken to take home and keep for later viewing. Do take your time looking at the sights in this square and perhaps set in a café and have a glass of red wine and soak up the views.When in Rome this is also another must see.

Beautiful Place. This is one of the most beautiful piazzas in Rome. It is a huge public space with three amazing fountains. We enjoyed a busking jazz trio and a browse through an art market. The piazza is of course lined with restaurants.

Walking tour.. Booked a walking tour through hotel and this was one of the place we visited along with the pantheon, Trevi Fountain, government establishments and a few other interesting places. The scenery is awesome.

Best square in Rome. I visited it on my last day in Rome and it became my favorite piazza. It was so lively, filleed with artists drawing, beautiful cafes and restaurants, a beautiful fountain. It's close to the Pantheon so it's good to visit them together. I loved it.

The Best Piazza in Rome. To not visit Piazza Navona would be like not seeing Rome. The Piazza enjoins the Embassies of Brazil among other things. The Church of St Agatha is a must. Across the way on Via degli Soldati is the Restaurant of Da Memmo. If your looking for a typical Italian eatery, go here. Most of the servers don't speak English, but you'll get by the Food is one of the best & not pricey. Good wine list great service. If your a Pittsburgh er, You'll want to visit the Steelers Bar. Right off Piazza Navona, called LaBotticella on via Tor Millina, 32. Giovanni Poggi is the owner, he speaks perfect English having been born in Toronto Canada but none the less a Roman. Great place to people watch. Highly recommended.

Great people watching place!. We stopped at a café on the piazza and had coffee and gelato and watched all of the touristas and performers. Very busy, but very energizing! Great place to stop and rest for an hour or two (and no one at the cafe's rushed you to move on!)

Great to watch the world go by. The piazza is very busy with tourists and there are artists selling their paintings, portrait painters, and plenty of other colourful characters selling their wares.It's surrounded with pavement cafes where you can sit in the sun or shade depending on your preference and enjoy a drink, snack or full meal watching the world go by. It's a little expensive but it's a prime location with premium prices (circa €7 a drink)

Stunning. Three interesting fountains are a feature of this piazza, particularly nice when we had just discovered that the Trevi Fountain is being refurbished. The square itself is surrounded by a multitude of cafes, many touting for business even more aggressively than the street vendors. Rather than eating on the square itself, wander around and watch, maybe visit the great pen, ink and paper shop (don't, however, expect any service, friendly or otherwise) and then head into the back streets near the Musea Di Roma where there are several really good restaurants, already reviewed by TAs. Anyone interested in visiting this square already knows about its significance, or can look it up. Personally, as a piazza, I found this one to be far more interesting than, say, the Pantheon's.

We ventured here not really knowing what we were looking for.,,. The front desk told us this in one place we should visit. We got to it, and almost walked thru it, until we realized this was it. . It has several performers who ask for money to have a photo taken of them or with them. There is a lovely fountain on the end but the rest..ehhh? Touristy stuff. The next piazza over San Campo is a piazza with some vendors and an open flower shop BUT...We actually passed thru another piazza looking for this one, that had great Swiss horn blowers that was worth the walk and getting lost trying to find Piazza Novena. Don't know what it was or where but they were awesome! We stopped and watched they perform...sometimes getting a little lost is worth it. We simply lucked out and stopped and smelled the roses this time (or should I say, stopped an listened to this fantastic group perform).

Beautiful place to stroll. Definitely take the time to visit....take a leisurely stroll and soak in this site of ancient races. The fountain is spectacular and the atmosphere is so...Roman! If you plan to have lunch around the time of your visit here...I'd suggest getting off the beaten path and find one of those little places around the corner/down an ally. The food is better and the experience will be more of a local vibe.

Unforgettable ❤️piazza Navona !. Piazza Navona is always a magic place I have memories since childhood ...Especially if you are with your loved one ! Full of artists , magicians and stands ...people from allOver the world swarming in and out Magnificent buildings and fountains

Nice Piazza. Full of interesting people and places to eat or take a coffee. This one of the largest Piazzas of Rome. There is always a lot of interesting people all around. Artists, tourists, Italians etc. The fountain in the center of the Piazza is beautiful and there is also a nice church in front of it. You can spend a nice afternoon dinning in one of the various restaurants and looking at the different things sold by artists and exotic salesmen. Be cautious if you like something because if the salesmen notice your interest, you won't be able to leave without buying something. A discount of at least 30% is a must.
Great place for lunch. Great place to visit, see all the stall holders and different acts people are performing. We had lunch there which was great and extended our time.

Lovely piazza with such beautiful fountains. The fountains at this square are beautiful (as are many others throughout Rome). Teaming with tourists, locals, and merchants, there is a very lively vibe here and we lingered longer at this square than most others during our stay in Rome.

Another must see. Fantastic sight. Walk round and soak it up. Glorious square, well oblong. Expensive cafes souround the edges but for the price of a coffee you can sit in the shade on a hot day for ages.

One of my Favorite Places in Rome. I love walking around the Piazza Navona, enjoying all the wonderful sites.We have lunch in one of the many restaurants. The fountains are breathtaking, and I've always gotten a painting from one of the local artists. I think its a must do while in Rome!

Navona. This Piazza is very beautiful. There are three fountains, the fountain of the four rivers is spectacular. It was designed by Bernini and time should be takes to examine and enjoy all four facets of this statue. There is also a church across from the statue worth visiting.

Piazza Navona…..Great people watching surrounded by Ancient Fountains.. We were so tired and hungry by the time we headed over to Piazza Navona, we decided to just sit down at any restaurant and have a pasta and a beer. Most of the restaurants in this area are tourist traps, but we didn't care, we just wanted a front row table to watch the people show with a gorgeous backdrop. Go at sunset to really admire the water fountains.
Wonderful piazza. Wonderful piazza in the center of Rome with a aristocratic grandeur. A lot of café's and a nice atmosphere.
Beautiful (oval😉) square. The Bernini fountain of the 4 rovers is nit to be missed but there is also a phenomenal church that is a must. The name of the church escapes me now.
Lovely piazza and great tartuffo!. A very pretty, spacious piazza with wonderful Bernini sculptures. Don't forget to have a tartuffo at Tre Scalini (although quite pricey).

typical Roman square. the typical Roman square, a meeting place for Romans and tourists, with the many outdoor cafes
& the Fountain of the Four Rivers nice time to spend .
Beautiful!. I live in Rome and love this Piazza....has a special warm feel... beautiful bernini fountains... after watching them.... sit in a cafe' and get the feel! beautiful.....

Lovely place. This is a most go visit in Rome...just walk around, enjoy the plaza, admire the beauty of the plaza and just watch people around, you don't need to be sitting in one of those expensive rest....buy and ice cream and just enjoy it...or have good coffee. It's a great place in Rome!!

So Cool!. The sculptures here are awesome. You can walk around them and see something new from every angle. My guide told me that this piazza was a race track in ancient Roman times. I don't know if that was true, but it sounded good! Anyway, the piazza is a fascinating little corner of Rome!
Piazza Navona. This is a beautiful square. I love to come and eat gelatto here. The fountains are quite large and stunning. There is a great game shop too.

my favorite place to people watch. my favorite "hang out" place in Rome...just walk around, sit down, watch people... the fountain is so interesting - every time i looked at it i discovered something new. if you can get a guide to tell you about the square, you'll be happy you did! perfection

The square of the ancient Rome. Piazza Navona is an amazing place in the Ancient Rome. The past and art take place close each other peacefully. There is 3 beautiful fountains on the squares which speak for themselves with their beauty. The atmosphere in the embrance of cafféteries and restaurants capture your mind and soul. You loose the sense of time in the company of the musicians and painters who try to sell their great and interesting works.

Delightful piazza. This is a delightful piazza, built on the site of an old hippodrome. It is spacious so even when it is busy, it is not crowded. The fountains are stunning with beautiful sculptures. A good place to stop for a sandwich.

A place to sit and watch. This is a very busy piazza but after wandering round taking photos, we sat on the edge of the square in the shade just watching the world go by. Some artists sell their work and apart from the fountains, there was also one of the free water fountains at one end of the piazza. A couple of good gelato shops just off the piazza too.

favourite Piazza in Rome. This is a lovely Piazza with so many restaurants to sit and watch the world go by. There are 3 fountains but the main fountain is just amazing. make time to visit this Piazza when in Rome and sit and have a drink or Coffee and just enjoy the atmosphere.

Beautiful, lovely atmosphere! . So beautiful here and so much going on - it feels so romantic with the street buskers and entertainment. Be sure to have a glass of wine and some food at Tucci while you're there - and hopefully you'll be served by Nino (the world's friendliest waiter!) like we were :)
interesting... . interesting and artsy place. enjoyed seeing various artists and their works. the fountain was amazing in its detail. nice place for an easy stroll. not to be missed!

Always stunning. This piazza is so vast that it always manages to absorb the huge crowds of tourists and locals. Boasting some of the finest fountains, it is the Montmartre of Rome with artists aplenty and a profusion of small shops and expensive restaurants. The only traffic I saw this time was for deliveries and so it feels peaceful in spite of the crowds. If you want to eat, find a small family run taverna in a nearby side street. Currently, there is a good exhibition of the life of ancient Gladiators - great for the children.

Absolutely stunning. This place was stunning, if you want to go somewhere with just a perfect amount of hustle and bustle this is the place to go. Me and my boyfriend sat at a little cafe , and had a few drinks in the sun , with a gorgeous view of the fountains, the square and the street sellers , was a lovely afternoon.Would definately go back!!

Lively. Lots to look at here: beautiful old fountains,street performers, shops, restaurants, people! So great to see someplace famous in person and not be disappointed in the least. Definitely stop at one of the restaurant cafes and have a glass of wine and cheese. You can sit for a while and relax.
A beautiful piazza. This is well worth a visit. It is a little hidden but beautiful. It is open plan, has some wonderful buildings, a great fountain and some lovely cafe's.

Touristy but still worth a stroll. The history of this Piazza is fascinating. Yes, there are lots of tourists and kitchy art and entertainers but it all makes for great people watching and it is just plain fun!Many say the food served in the surrounding restaurants isn't 'authentic' and maybe it isn't but many of them are very good and there is nothing better than sitting late in the afternoon, sipping wine and watching all that is going on.

Lovely piazza in Rome well worth spending time. The origins of Piazza Navona reach back to at least the 1st century AD when it formed part of the open space of the Stadium of Domitian where Romans would have come to watch sports and races. The area seems to have served as a city market from the 15th century onward. You can find many lovely Baroque style buildings around the square, these stem from the 17th century when the piazza was also adorned with its fountains, including the famous Fountain for Four Rivers by Bernini in 1651. Now, the modern Piazza Navona is lined with cafes, artists, performers, a lovely church and three fountains. It is great place of to spend time during visits to Rome and is camera friendly during both the day and night. We always try to visit at least a couple times when in Rome. Note: There are many attractions at and around Piazza Navona so you can plan to spend at least a 1/2 a day or more in this area of Rome.
Magnificent Plaza. All of Rome seems to gather at this regal plaza. Just The scale of it will leave you in awe. Take a look at renderings of the plaza during the Roman Empire to appreciate it best.

Great place to hang out. This was a good place to hang out and people watch, preferred it over other more famous sites. We visited in the morning and at night. Nice place to have dinner, watch the bats fly around and take I'm the atmosphere. Food is more expensive surrounding the piazza due to location, but to be expected and not the best food to be had in Rome either. Lovely fountain in the middle, which is good as the Trevi Fountain is currently out of action.

Beautiful Piazza. This piazza, near the historical centre of the city, is somewhere I just stumbled upon on my first visit to Rome. However, it's somewhere I actively went back to upon returning to the city.In the summer, it is lively and has lots of people to watch. The fountains are also stunning. A must visit when in Rome.

Lovely. Piazza Navona is special to me because this is the first place I visited when I first came to Rome almost 40 years ago. It is still a beautiful spot, although the throngs of people do detract from the ambiance. But the fountains are majestic. Suggest that if you eat here you avoid Tre Scalini - it is overpriced.

Lively and fun. This is very much like London's Covent Garden only warmer! A real hive of activity with street sellers, restaurants, entertainers, architecture and hundreds if not thousands of tourists. Worth a visit to soak up the friendly atmosphere but if you want value for money then most things are cheaper in the many side streets surrounding the Piazza. Look out for the Punch and Judy style entertainer in the pram, unique and funny.

The Fountains are a must see.... Fans of Angel and Demons will know the square from the film. This is a classic Roman Square with great cafes and tons of history. Gorgeous Bernini fountain at the center of the square. Many independent vendors selling "selfie sticks", but they were also in other major tourist areas. Cafes are a bit over priced.
Lively interesting piazza. Wonderful place to wander around looking at the various art and buying a piece if you have room in your case. The fountains and sculptures are beautiful.

Charming. You will just love the place. Very pretty fountains in the middle of the piazza decorated with amazing status and ornaments. Artists selling their work and small restaurants all over the place. However don't eat in the restaurants overlooking the piazza if you are on a budget. Go for restaurants in the narrow streets surrounding the place. The place is also loaded with souvenir shops,gelaterias , and bars. The piazza is also very romantic and beautiful at night. So don't miss it.

You MUST visit, when in Roma!!!!. We are still in Rome tonight, just back from Piazza Navona.The place was buzzing with great entertainment, from jazz bands to comic obversation.We are still talking about all the different acts.Plenty of restaurants, ice cream shops etc.Thousands of different nationalities, all having a great time.This is our second trip to Rome, still the place to see.........By a mile!!!!Get here and enjoy yourselves, you will not be disappointed!!

Colorful. This was our favorite piazza because of its vibrance. Artists, musicians, shops, gelato and restaurants galore. Bernini's Four Rivers Fountain is the central gem. Tre Scallini is a great choice for dinner and their famous tartufo.

Excellent place to eat. We went to Dolci vitta my favourite. Waiter was from romania and made our dining fabulous. All dishes were excellent with personal more romantic touches.We also went Tucci. Waiter was also great. Food was amazing. Lobster was excellent.Back roads have some great restaurants too. U do get charged more sitting outside €5 per person.PLACE TO AVOID: on back street is La Torre. Rude obnoxious manager named christian. Food was terrible and wrong orders. When mentioned he took the wrong unprofessional approach and gets quite vocal and in ur face woman or not. Threw us out without eating. Made us pay as threatened to call police. All nice to get u seated but poor service ever ! Other local restaurants said it happens all the time there ! Ruined our last night and impression.But everywhere else was excellent reason why we tried numerous restaurants. There is always one bad apple. Enjoy ur trip
Beautiful & fun. We visited here when doing the Heart of Rome walk in Rick Steves book. It was beautiful. Lots of people, a few street performers, just a really good time. It did not disappoint us.

Lovely square built on site of Roman circus. Good congregating point with plenty of people milling about. Close to a number of historic sites and the Vatican. Lovely old fountains and buildings but be warned eating in the Piazza Navona is very expensive but pleasant sitting out and watching the world go by.Enjoyed a very nice meal with friends and family in Dolce Vita.

Piazza Navona. Always stay at an hotel near to the Piazza Navona. Love to visit it first thing in the morning before it's really busy. It is beautiful. Totally different in the evening full of people so lively. Artists everywhere. Usually musicians also. A gorgeous experience!

Great place to watch and listen to musicians. many very talented musicians play here regularly. Lots of amateur artists selling paintings too. downside is that there are several sometimes persistent young men selling knock off bags and sunglasses.

Large, pretty plaza with street vendors, cafe's and activity. The plaza is pretty and its large drawing a large number of tourists and activity. It's a nice place to relax, get a coffee or drink and bask in the sun while people watching. There are a number of hawkers and street vendors, street painters, novelty acts etc, happens at all the large plazas at all the large cities in the world I think!Many cafes, some decent shopping nearby and easily located.

A beautiful piazza, fountain and vendors. Piazza Navona has a beautiful atmosphere with many restaurants around, though they can be a bit more on the pricier side. We visited firstly was part of a tour with City Wonders which was very informative and interesting. The beautiful fountain of the four rivers is central to the square (as featured in Da Vinci Code) and during the day there are artisits and vendors a plenty.
Feels Good. This is a beautiful piazza. Artists and musicians gave us a great feeling of being in Rome. Lunch was very good and reasonably priced.
People watching. Great piazza with amazing fountain. Good for sitting around and watching life pass by! Lots of coffee shops and places to eat too. Worth a visit

A very lively and entertaining Piazza. We spent an evening here. Lined with lovely cafes and sculptures and fountains in the middle of the square, we found this piazza very lively with entertainers, musicians and artists performing live all the time. Definitely not to be missed while in Rome.

Fountain of Four Rivers. Piazza Navona was built on a site called the Stadium of Domitian which is where ancient Romans came to watch games, in the middle of the piazza is the Fountain of Four Rivers, each river is depicted with an ornate statue to be represented. There are 2 more fountains, Fontana del Moro and the Fountain of Neptune. The place alive with tourist activity and there are some really nice cafes and restaurants here, worth seeing.

Gorgeous!!. A gorgeous piazza with two fountains!We visited on a hot sunny day and enjoyed sitting and watching the world go by. Very pretty with lots of artists selling their work. Waiters were quite pushy at trying to get you into their restaurant though.

Enjoyable. Piazza Navona is a very enjoyable place to spend an afternoon. The fountains are beautiful. Take a walk through the cathedral. Listen to the musicians but watch out for the vendors, they can be very annoying.
Great area.. Big open space, lined with restaurants. Lovely architecture and plenty of artists and sellers in centre of piazza, not far from Pantheon.A place to relax and take photos.

People watching Italian style. Great restaurants to stop & rest, have an Aperol, & enjoy watching what's happening in the square. Busy, fascinating to just see the variety of people selling items such as pictures, sitting in the air or tap dancing, you could spend ages there. To also complement is the lovely fountain & fantastic obelisk. Found the square by accident but decided a second visit is definitely worthwhile to take everything in.

Just loved it!. Beautiful place! It was lovely to walk around, have dinner with wine looking at the fountain, watching people wandering around and many artists who could paint your portrait. Definitely must see!

Favorite spot in Rome. When I was in Rome this was my favorite sopt. There are may restaurants at the Piazza with outdoor seating. You can see artists, magicians, etc in the Piuazza. A wonderful flavor of Italy abounds. I hopeto go back again.

Definite Go Back. The Piazza Navona is one of the largest squares in Rome (if not the largest) and has the most amazing fountain in the middle. The outsides of the squares are full of cafes with outdoor seating areas that are perfect for people watching or just whiling away the day. It's beautiful and I wanted to spend more time wandering the Piazza and exploring it's attractions.

Beautiful piazza. Piazza Navona is one of the largest and most animated piazzas in Rome. There are three lovely fountains and lots of activity with artists, musicians etc. The cafes on the Piazza Navona are quite expensive but offer a lovely perspective of the square. There are also some lovely narrow streets and boutique shops nearby. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful piazza. Piazza Navona is one of the largest and most animated piazzas in Rome. There are three lovely fountains and lots of activity with artists, musicians etc.
The cafes on the Piazza Navona are quite expensive but offer a lovely perspective of the square. There are also some lovely narrow streets and boutique shops nearby.
Well worth a visit.

Street performers, beautiful scenery, have a drink. Walked through the piazza on my way to dinner and decided to stay and sit down for a drink and watch the different street performers. Very good and unexpectedly exciting place to be on a walk through Rome. Highly recommend grabbing a drink at a resturant in the piazza. Walk around and watch street performers and take pictures/video. People-watch the tourists and see everyone from all around the world.
Square with a Difference. Lovely location to have a leisurely lunch or dinner. Fun street entertainment (mostly during the day)
It's a city centre..... This is a open area with beautiful fountains, street entertainers, street merchants and lots of restaurants..

picturesque square and fountains with a carnival atmosphere. went there twice during our 4 days stay in rome. 1st time we took pictures of the large fountains and people watch and had lunch nearby. the 2nd time we look at some of the artist and their paintwork for sale and had dinner in one of the side lanes off the square. it s one of the nicer piazza to visit in rome.

Very nicely done . This is a fine set of statues in the middle of a fountain. It was operational when we were there and quite beautiful. Worth seeing but if you are on a tour the bus cannot go very near the area so it's a hike to get in there on old cobblestones. If you're unsteady or not a good walker don't do this one. Also be advised the Gypsy beggars are a nuisance and get right in your face with a plastic cup. They may pick your pocket as well, so watch out for groups of them especially with children or babies they drop (dolls) so when you try to help in horror you're picked by a kid with them or coming from behind. The police need to crack down on these thieves. Good restaurants a block off the piazza,

Bustling Roman Piazza with Great Fountains and Churches. This piazza is a highlight for any visitor to Rome. The houses are colorful, the famous Bernini Four Rivers Fountain, the churches, and the many attractive dining options make this a top place to visit. There is always something going on to entertain the crowds who come. Get lunch or dinner, sit outside, and have a wonderful time people watching. My daughter loved this foundation and its obelisk. Spend some time here.

Great Place to drink something. I recommend this place around 7 or 8, just when the day starts to end, because the light in that moment is perfect, looks like Cesar Palace in Las Vegas, seems like somebody is tuning the light in order to see the ceiling and the buildings that round the piazza and fountains.Restaurants are for Tourists, are several, best if You have info of good one in this area, place is for take a while seeing surroundings and drink a Proseco or take a gelato.

Yet another must see. Although when we visited the Piazza Navona it was dull & overcast , it didn't detract from the beauty of the three fountains in the midle of the square.Have a drink at one of the many Bar/Restaurants that border & watch the world go by

What is there not to love!. The moment you enter the piazza you are transported into the glamour of Rome. This was probable one of my favorite stops in Rome. It has great food, shopping, and a great place to just sit and watch the people. I highly recommend just spending the day weaving through all the small streets that surround Piazza Novena. My partner and I found this amazing café not too far from the main Piazza that had the best coconut cappuccino that I have ever had (I wish I could remember the name).

Not much to see or do. Much tourist, many performers. Not much to see really. Nice restaurants to sit in the sun and take a coffee, but for triple the price if you visit any other of the lovely plazas nearby

Wonderful. This square is one of the places where i strongly recommend and put it in my "the best" list. When you enter the square, it is not extremely impressive or stunning. it has it's own spirit. With all the street art performers.. drawings.. fountains.. Just wonderful..

Lovely square. Fabulous to sit and have a drink and enjoy people watching. Gorgeous fountains to photograph, stalls to pick up a print and just relax and enjoy the atmosphere. There are a lot of guys selling Selfie sticks which become very annoying after a while because a lot of them won't take no for an answer.
Beautiful Piazza, busy with street vendors. A lovely piazza and the fountain is beautiful. Surrounded by restaurants. Shame the street sellers pester you constantly

Lovely place to take in the sun. We stopped by here and simply sat by one if the stunning fountains in the sunshine, watching the world go by. The restaurants and cafes around the edges are expensive but there's no charge to simply sit and people watch in the square itself. One of the loveliest sites in Rome.

Lovely piazza. This is a really exciting, buzzing square. The fountain was lovely as were all the buildings surrounding it.
We ate pizza here, which was quite expensive, but that was to be expected of somewhere so central. Service and food was really good!
Just watch out for the people always trying to sell you things.

Happening Piazza. Nice Piazza, crowded with people. There are restaurants and bars around. We went in summers, so it was filled with people and children playing. There are two foundations at opposite end of the piazza. Some people were playing instruments, it was sunny and everyone was sitting around them and listening. It was quite pleasant. Though we spent there less then an hour as we were in hurry.

Great entertainment. Stooped for coffe and chill right on the Piazza. Not cheap, but great for people watching and doing what the locals do. Enjoy free entertainment from the local street artist. Despite what the touts say, there will be a service charge (it states mandatory service charge for groups of over 14 persons only, what a load of rubbish) that said tis a nice feet up for half an hour. Ciao

Bright Sunny Spectacular Afternoon. The square, designed by Michaelangelo, is one of the largest in Rome. It hosts a beautiful, enormous fountain in the center. The plaza is surrounded by gigantic 16th and 17th century buildings. On the afternoon we visited the plaza was full of venders selling paintings and crafts. Musicians entertained the hundreds of visitors and guests dining at nearby cafes. A real "must see" in Rome.

A Must Stroll in Rome. The Piazza Navona is a perfect spot for a morning or afternoon visit with family, even children. Plenty of entertainment in the square-performers, painters, musicians-a lots of places around the perimeter to grab a snack, drink, or meal. The place also comes alive at night as well, but day time is my preference.

Pedestrian Friendly. This is one of my favourite piazzas. It is large with several nice fountains. It is pedestrian friendly. You can walk around and enjoy the atmosphere without traffic noise or fear of being run over. In the evenings, it is not too crowded.

Great spot to enjoy a cappuccino and people watch. A few too many "unauthorized" vendors who scatter when the polizia come around but the restaurants are good and the fountain and architecture is incredible.
one of the nicest piazzas. nice walk as long you avoid the tourist traps, the fountains are impressive with a great level of artistry

One of the nicest Piazzas.. We wandered through Piazza Navona after our visit to the Pantheon. A beautiful setting, with lots going on, and lots of restaurants and bars. Some of the statues are spectacular, and we spent a pleasant hour wandering around, taking in the atmosphere. There were a lot of tourists in the piazza, but this seemed to add to the atmosphere, especially with the street buskers making music everywhere.
Beautiful tourist trap. Amazing architecture spoiled by sellers of rubbish as mentioned on other reviews. Nice enough for a short stroll

Beautiful piazza. We were there in the evening when it was quiet and less busy. It is a lovely square. The only distraction were the people trying to sell the junk trinkets. They wouldn't take no for an answer, but it's definitely worth the visit.

get there early. this is the happening place apparently. we were staying in an apartment not far, so, got to experience this piazza several times. it is best in the early morning before the tourist hoards have descended upon it. the benini fountains are exquisit and the church of st. agnes facing the square is also an art piece, both inside and out.
Love it here!!. Love sitting in a restaurant relaxing watching the world go by!! Tre Scalini is an unrushed experience and the St Agnese church is beautiful!

Marvellous outdoor space - worth a detour to walk through it. Yes, there are people selling cheap tat everywhere, but just ignore them! The atmosphere in this square is a lovely change from some of the smaller streets of the Centro Storico. It's a beautiful space surrounding by a lovely mix of buildings, and the central fountain is stunning. Look for the fabulous, lively looking stone snakes on the fountain in particular.

Lovely square. Great place to chillax. It's not too crowded and you can find Bernini's wonderful fountain of the four rivers. We ate in one of the restaurants in the corner of the square and it wasn't too pricey, considering it's still Rome, and the atmosphere is great. You can breath art in there.

Lovely square, central and a good pace to buy a selfie stick 😉. This lovely square is centrally located and a good meeting point, easy walk to the Pantheon etc. Lots of bars if you've got plenty money or head for a side street for a delicious gelato at more reasonable prices.

The best piazza in Rome. Navonna is huge, beautiful, with three amazing water fountains and their sculptures figuring gods and biblical myths in marble and bronze. The square is surrounded by a few restaurants and caffees and is not overcrowded and Piazza di Spagna or the Vaticani. Go anytime and return by the sunset to take amazing photos. Then go back again at night for a romantic walk.

Busy, very touristy.... We were staying relatively close to here so passed through it several times a day. Frankly I'm not too sure what the attraction is. If you have to tick it off, then go but best to pass through it on the way to somewhere else.
A BEAUTIFUL PIAZZA. It may not be the most exciting sculpture, but still a beautiful piece to see.The piazza is easy to reach and worth walking there.

Beautiful Piazza. Another beautiful piazza in this fascinating city of Rome.
