A wide open space dominated by the magnificent Bernini fountain, which is a mesmerising work of art.The piazza was very crowded when we visited, and you could take the opportunity to have your portrait painted by the numerous artists waiting there.It is advisable to eat out of the main piazza, as like most areas of interest, it costs more for the view! However if you want to take it all in, sit and enjoy!

This beautiful square filled with fountains and bars and lots of sellers of rubbish. This is a beautiful square which has amazing architecture in the form of both fountains and buildings. The square is edged by bars and restaurants where you will be charged a lot more than the normal price for the privilege of sitting in such a lovely location. We (my wife and I) made do with standing at a bar where, by law, they must display a price list for all beverages sold. It doesn't insulate you from paying too much but greatly reduces the possibility. As with many of the other Rome attractions you are plagued by sellers of rubbish (selfy sticks) who, if you let them, can spoil your enjoyment. My advice would be go early in the morning and have a coffee standing at one of the many bars.

nice square. nice place with good atmosphere.ideal for relaxation if you moving from vatican to the old town centre.near to pantheon.in caffe barocco friendly staff and very good prosecco and rose wine

Was better years ago, but still go. The four River fountainted is a must see. The piazza is beautiful. At night it is fun yet touristy. Must have gelato at tres scalini. Dinner at tres scalini was excellent.

A magical place to hang out in the evening.. We have visited Rome twice now and this place seems to be the hub of the nightlife. What I like about Rome is that you feel safe at night. There are no intimidating drunks, and people of all ages seem to know how to have a good time side by side.On our second visit, we rented an apartment; just 10 minutes walk from “Piazza Navona”. We seemed to end up here most nights, mainly because it just buzzes with so much to do and see.I must mention that I would not eat here, as the prices to sit around the Piazza and look trendy, will cost you 3 times what it costs to sit out and look trendy in one of the paths that lead off of “Piazza Navona”.So let me tell what to expect, if you visit when it gets dark. First, if you can, don’t eat out until at least 9pm, as this when sitting and eating “al fresco”, is at its best. And eating out is the best way to enjoy Rome.A lot of the coach tours have left, and then the locals come out. Music, wine, good food and laughter, just ooze out of all the entrances to this Piazza.When you enter it, it will be full of stalls selling art, applying henna tattoos, portrait artists,trinkets & gifts for sale and all sorts.There are quite often musicians playing. One night there was an old guy playing Rock n Roll on his fender electric guitar. A couple who had cycled down, parked up their bikes, and started to perform an impromptu mixture of Lambada and Jive dancing. A crowd gathered and the smiles on the crowds face made you realise that this place offers more than the travel guides will tell you.And how can I mention Italy and not mention the amazing ice cream. There are numerous Gelatos’ around the edge of the Piazza. It is a place where you can bring your kids of all ages, or turn up on your own and people watch.We ended up having a few glasses of wine each night, and then had the challenge of finding our way back to our apartment, through the maze of side streets.I love Rome, could spend a week or two each year in it. And this Piazza would be the place I end up each night, as it is just simply special.

Piazza Navona!. We happened to hear of Piazza Navona during our tour of the Pantheon otherwise we probably wouldn't have sought it out on our own. It is a great place to check out local artists and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from. The fountain of four rivers is also here which is quite a sight as well. There is also an ATM here if you don't want to lose so much money converting your money at a local exchanger. Not a great deal to see here history wise but still worth the walk over if you are near the Pantheon.
It was ok. I enjoyed it however I wouldn't give something like this a 5 star rating. However the architecture is fantastic and it is one of the kind. More of a pass through onto other sites.

Between rival artists are challenged his works next to each other. Bernini and della Porta like the Capuleto and Montesco rival families of Verona, left a heritage of their art diferences in the fountains of this Piazza. The central fountain called the four rivers, has an egypcian obelisc, it was completly made by Bernini. The other two, one called Fountain of Neptuno and the other one Fontana del Moro, were made by della Porta before the Bernini one. Bernini considered this fountains an asymmetrical composition, so he decided to add an sculpture in each of them. You have to visit this especial area where, like the rest of Rome holds the spirit and experiences the universal people tht lived there... Enyoy
Well worth a look. A great place to buy souvenir prints or have your portrait drawn. You can sit in the piazza or in one of the restaurants and watch the world go buy.
Lovely Fountains. The fountains in this square are great. There were quite a few people walking around, but you could still get good pictures of the fountains.
Nice piazza. Nice atmosphere. But did not match other places in Rome.Street artists. Painters. Choir singers. Fire performers. Many impressions on one single Piazza. Very special fontenna.

Lovely Piazza Navona. Not to busy, lovely fountains lots of space nice architecture, just a nice place to be and relax. We stopped here and had lunch at one of the many nice restaurants.Recommend to visit.

Better than the guidebooks say. It was one of those must see place on our short stay in Rome. We were so impressed that we we able to navigate our way there on our own. A must see on every visit to Rome.

Dull and dark! . We visited piazza navona at night as we heard this was the time to go when it would be lively with artists etc. it was very disappointing overall, it was very poorly lit so you couldn't make out the fountain and monuments, there was no atmosphere. The bars overcharge and the men trying to sell you rubbish tat are annoying and there are millions of them. We also walked though the piazza in the day and it was no more impressive. Overall one to miss!
Great place to see life go by........ This is a very busy square with stalls selling paintings. Lots of cafes to sit in and watch the world go by.

Very beautiful. The Piazza Navona is a really stunning place in the heart of Rome and a must see.The fountains are very beautiful. There's always a lot of people, so to get a nice view, make sure you're early. There are also a lot of restaurants with terrasses and it can be nice to have lunch or dinner there. I don't know the prices though.
Sit and enjoy. Sit and enjoy this plaza. There seems to be lots going on. Grab a yummy gelato and enjoy. These fountains are beautiful

Not sure what the fuss is all about. Yes it's pretty, but so over crowded and full of tourists and people trying to separate them from their money ,that it becomes too much. It was exhausting just looking at all that. We ended up being almost pulled into one of the restaurants and completely regretted it. What a tourist trap this place is. Take your picture and run! There are better places deserving of your time and money.

Lovely area to sit and people watch. Really lovely square, visit the church there if you can. Loved the fountain and statues. Many small cafes and restaurants around the square, a few shops as well. Good to sit and people watch while having a drink or meal. Always lots of people around and seems very popular area. Enjoyed wandering round watching street vendors work and the street entertainment.
Just ok. Busy place with lots of artists selling paintings. We were here at about 4 pm and didn't stay long. Several placing to grab a bite to eat or a drink if you want.

Another World. The church, the fountain, and the plaza is a picturesque place to visit. The fountain is functioning, the statues immense, and the waves of people exciting to experience. Art vendors everywhere from prints to originals.

Worth a visit . Picturesque square, great fountains with history. Main purpose for us was a stop off whilst walking our legs off round the city - stopped off for coffee and I suppose expectedly got ripped €5 for a tea and €3 for a coffee! - ah well enjoyed it all the same and great buzz in the square

ok. nice enough place after visiting pantheon, but prices for a bottle of wine (seriously get a grip 20+ E) , I expected expensive in Rome, but visited here after several relatively inexpensively days, decided to go back to hotel fiume for happy hour drinks 4E a drink and bottle of wine for 3E from local shop! Who said Rome was expensive?
Could be more beautiful. The Piazza Navona is very beautiful square but, at the time, full of boring people selling thing. I don't like and I hope that one day improve.

Lively place. This is one of the nicest places in Rome, very loudy and lively, full of performancers, painters, musicians and other people just sitting around, enjoying the atmosphere. You can have a coffee or ice-cream in some of the restaurants nearby and spend some nice time there :)

What a shame. You cannot enjoy the beauty of Rome anymore without being approached every minute by a street vendor from Bangladesh trying to sell you a selfie stick or charger. We thought let's just buy one so they will see it and not approach us anymore. Nope your holding one and they still try and sell you one!! One guy said to me " be nice " when I told him politely "no thank you"...?!? I said I am being nice by saying no thank you but if you want to see what nasty is keep bothering me while I'm trying to enjoy. "My vacation"

Where Art meets History. Once you get to this beautiful piazza... You will be shocked and amazed by the number of street artists and wonderful fountains... Filled with amazing details and wonderful history
Lovely Piazza Navona. You can sit and have a drink and something to eat in one of its many bars and restaurants surrounding the fountain ,music playing all kinds of entertainment buy paintings etc...

Piazza Navona. A bustling piazza full of life and sound. There is always something to see and listen to as buskers entertain the passing crowds. There are shops to explore and cafes to sit outside and watch the world go by.
Lovely fountains with good history. We listened to an audioguide when we visited to get some background on the fountains and the square in general. That really enhanced the visit. Lovely fountains!
The baetefuilst sqaure in rome. A verry baetefuil sqaure in rome with baetefuil fointains &terasses(bhat expensivebhat best time to visit in the morning ,afternoon verry busy

Great for architecture, street performers and people watching!. Make sure you set aside a few hours to visit Piazza Navona: you won't regret it.Brilliant atmosphere - a laid-back and family-friendly vibe with stunning buildings, three very ornate fountains, loads of street performers (magicians, musicians, comedians etc), artists and a host of good restaurants, too.We visited on an early evening in May and spent several very enjoyable hours watching the action and the people going by.....(Do take your camera: you won't be short of picture opportunities).

Great Plaza. Don'tmiss the square and the fountains , the street scene and the cafes. What a great experience. Read up on Bernnini and read "Angels and Demons" fiction by Dan Brown. Have coffee in one of the cafes.
Piazza Navona. This is a must see piazza with three fountains and a beautifull church on it.It is very large and very cozy.

Very Interesting, Rich History and Culture. The Piazza is very interesting and beautiful. It's ancient buildings and especially the church of St. Agnes are all impressive. We loved hearing the story of and history of the statue central to the Piazza named "the 4 corners of the earth". There are several restaurants along the Piazza none of which we tried but they seemed to attract quite the crowds.
Cute little square!. The buildings, fountains and history for both are amazing. Cute little piazza, with lots of art, people and gelato! We had no problem sitting there for a few hours.
Lovely place. It's very busy in the piazza with artists selling their pictures but very pretty too, lively on a night with the many restaurants but expensive to eat
Fantastic place to spend some time. The Piazza Navona is a really lovely place to drink a coffee and sonding time in the hot summer in Rome.
a great place . a must see turist attraction in Rome , but what a pitty it full of illegal foreign vendors and mediocre artist disturbing the beauty of this piazza.
Very nice. Definitely worth a visit. Enjoy. Children enjoyed the atmosphere and the crowd. Should be in your list for Rome.

Relax on piazza Savonarola. A very nice and open square. Not too crowded, yet oozing with atmosphere. Very nice fountains. Idillic and ideal for a romantic stroll. Have your picture taken by one of the fountains and buy one of the many paintings. They're inexpensive and make great gifts or memorabilia.I skipped Piazza Navona on previous trips to Rome, but now that I discovered it, I definitely want to go back.

way overcrowded and too many people selling too much stuff. I really wanted to see the beautiful fountains, but there were sooo many people blocking the view. There area also way too many people selling stuff between the fountains. Very disappointing. There is a beautiful church right in the square that must really hate all these people selling their stuff. The same paintings are everywhere you look. I would much rather have more space to enjoy the beauty of the piazza. Beware of the "tourist" restaurants. They overcharge and the food is not very good. Go further afield and look there.

Beautiful piazza filled with art and artists.. After a visit to the nearby street market and a leisurely stroll through quaintly winding cobbled streets we arrived at the piazza. Lively and bustling. Couples and families wandering through the artworks on display in the centre. Beautiful fountains, bars and restaurants, even some live music and street entertainers. Well worth a visit, come in the afternoon and stay for a drink or meal (a bit more expensive than places in the side streets, but worth it for the atmosphere!)
expected more. Not much to do with teenagers. Kids were more interested in the musicians and artists than in the booths/stalls.
Lovely Piazza. Hustle and bustle of Rome - lovely to sit and enjoy a meal or a drink and watch the world go by. Beautiful statues.

Lovely square with 3 fountains. Very nice place to sit and watch the world go by in one of the many many places to eat and drink. We visited this square twice and the on the Saturday the middle was full of artist with paintings and pictures.

Wonderful fountains and atmosphere. Very popular Piazza with great atmosphere and street entertainment. Beware of huge discrepancies in restaurant prices though and ignore the persistent waiters who try to draw you in! better to seek out the little streets beyond where the food is just as good and much cheaper.Architecture is astounding and beautiful to ponder even if you don't want all the history that goes with it. Look at the detailed feet and hands on the fountain sculptures.
WIth the Trevi temporarily out of order don't miss the Navone. Great scupture, people watching and restaurants that will over charge for decent but not outstanding food. Worth a taxi ride

Piazza Navona. My husband and I saw the Piazza Navona during our Segway Fun Rome tour. As with all the Roman Statues, this is another beautiful fountain. It is quite busy but with much to see and many places to eat and drink. We took lots of photographs and I am sure we will return one day.

Very touristy. Full of tourists but still wonderful - the piazzas in Rome are so wonderful, communal and family - although I know I should skip the bars, I still sit there with a pizza and beer and pay exorbitant prices but love it.
Great atmosphere . Great atmosphere here in this piazza , an art lovers paradise !! Beautiful fountains & architecture. Avoid on a Sunday evening if you don't like huge crowds !

Piazza Navona family time. Great piazza for the kids to run around and take in the views of local artists and street performers. The fountains are incredible and a nice way to cool off when the wind is blowing just right. Good family friendly restaurants and great shopping all around.

Delightful Square. This ended up being the final stop of our time in Rome and our two weeks in Italy, and it was the perfect ending to a perfect trip. We selected one of the many sidewalk cafes that line the oblong piazza for one last gelato and a front row seat to people watch. The piazza is full of artists and street performers, so for the price of a coffee or gelato you can sit and soak up the entertainment as long as you'd like. I didn't want to leave.

Nice piazza, skip the bars due to tourist prices. The Piazza itself is lovely, magnificnt fountains and atmosphere, just skip the bars and restaurants as the prices are horrendous. Wander a couple of blocks away and you will not pay half as much for just the same quality if not better.

If you love Italy, you'll adore this Piazza!. A very lovely, typically Italian piazza, it's got churches, fountains, (one by Bernini), street artists, restaurants, cafes, annoying men selling squeaky splat things, and those selfie sticks, and the odd musician. Wonderful. We visited on a Sunday afternoon, and it was great, I bet it is stunning at night, as the buildings around the piazza are gorgeous.

It is a place for art lovers and fun lovers too. All Italians and a few Non-Italians as well, know this place is made for wishes at Holiday time and Beyond. On January 6,when the Befana- a Santa in Skirts-come to shop for the best " kids" of all ages. That is when Piazza Navona, all lit up and elegant, becomes the most fashionable open air market for toys and what toys!Then ,everyday of the year this Piazza has to amuse all palates with GELATO at the Tre Scalini , one of the best gelato selection in all of Rome. i suggest you to choose the flavors you prefer, take hold of the yummy thing, and then go admire the 2 gorgeous fountains right there, standing on the square or is it coming alive on the square? Nothing better than feeding soul,,mind and body at the same time,right'

This Piazza is absolutely beautiful with it's enormous fountains, sculptures a real real treat to see.. There is always a special atmosphere at this Piazza, music, dancing, paintings, and lots of wonderful cafes, bistros and places to eat or just to watch the world go by. Not to be missed on a trip to Rome.

Excellent Atmosphere. This is one of the best places to be, There is a wonderful atmosphere achieved not only by the great architecture and the glorious central fountain but the milling of people, the music and the street artists. Although its crowded there is still space to enjoy. If you want to eat or drink there are many places just off the Piazza that are cheaper and less crowded and just as good. The two other downsides are the ugly advertising hoarding on one of the buildings being restored and the rudeness of the tourist guides and groups following the flags.

Breathtaking. Piazza Navona is just around the corner from our hotel and we visited it every time we arrived back or left the hotel. After dinner every night we HAD to have a stroll through the Piaza looking at all the artists and entertainment and the MUST HAVE Gelato... You cannot visit Rome with out visiting Piazza Navona...

Lovely square to relax . I had seen this square in Angels & Demons movie and it was a must see on my list. Though my original intention was to capture Bernini's fountain monument it turned out to be a great square to relax and experience the crowds. It's not a good place for those who hate crowds Beware of some cases of theft and forceful money contribution at this place. Avoid talking with strangers and enjoy the atmosphere
Best Piazza in Rome. Wonderful site filled with activity. Visit early in the morning before the crowds and again at night when it teams with activity.

Must see for any trip to rome. This is clearly one of the most important historical sites in Rome, with 3 elaborate fountains sculpted by Boromini, Bernini, and Giacomo della Porta, all very impressive and tied to the Innocent X papacy and Pamphili family of Roman nobility (notice the dove with olive branch in mouth at the top of the egyptian obelisk). During Christmas the square hosts an annual festival with typical rides and games, etc. In the spring, summer, and fall tourists have countless restaurants to choose from with outdoor seating and, if necessary, outdoor heating. It's just really an enjoyable place to be!

A special piazza. Oh, yet another piazza with a fountain -- but no -- this is the one all the others wish to be. It's a very large piazza with three fountains, interesting surrounding architecture, and a ton of people watching opportunities. Grab a gelato, take a seat, and relax here for as long as you want.

Why bother?. The Plaza Navona is terrible, Besides the dozens of street vendors who get in your face selling junk, there are a bunch so-so restaurants with pushy hosts trying to get you to take a table. The whole scene is low class and disgusting.

Rome easy breezy & so much history…... It's been a while since visiting in Rome, but non the less me & my husband loved this al fresco area. Had espresso, people watch & artists in this very european area. Great place just to kick back & relax. The only issue we had as we were walking the area some some gypsies had approached us to scam/rob us but we got rid of them real quick….aaahhh Rome what can I say, we loved every minute of vacation.

Bernini, Borromini, and Buzz. Piazza Navona is a centerpiece of Old Rome and not-to-be-missed by modern travelers. The massive, fabulous Fountain of Four Rivers, created by the sculptor Bernini in 1652, is ensconced in the center of the spacious public place. It steals the thunder of the grand baroque church designed by his arch-rival Borromini that towers over the fountain. Throngs of people, locals and tourists, goggle at the sights and produce a constant buzz of oohs and ahs while they wander around the sights, enjoy the musicians, dodge the hawkers, and munch on Roman pizza in local outdoor cafés. A feast for all the senses.
Lovely sqaure. Loved this fountain very good place for gelato and a sit rest from all the sites. We couldn't get to see the trevi as it was closed so we made do with piazza navona

Magic place. I work near by o really recomend toball turists and not to have a walk over there is a Magic place.
Is romantic and also cinematografic if you remeber tom Hanks....a lor of good bars and restaurants near by will fall you in love. Dont exitate go to navona square.

THE Main Piazza in Roma - You Have to Visit it!. When Innocent X Pamphili became Pope in 1644 he had pulled down a couple of houses to build Palazzo Pamphili - that just happens to face onto the Square (actually it is a rectangle.)That genius Gian Bernini built his Fountain of the Four Rivers, and a North (The Moor) and the South Fountain (Neptune) were gradually added over time.Dan Brown included Bernini's Fountain in his book 'Angels and Devils.'Today you can visit another Palazzo Pamphili down near the 'Birthday Cake', but the Palace Innocent built for his wealthy family is now the Brazilian Embassy.If you did not visit the Piazza during a Xmas time, then look online and see what happens to it when it becomes a European Xmas Market.Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.

Beautiful place. My fiancé booked us a hotel a stones throw from the Piazza so we went through it every day. It is s beautiful place with restaurants and the various tourist stalls although they don't bother you at all, and you can pick up some really nice prints or paintings and there is usually a policeman or two around to keep bag sellers etc away.
Nice square with lots of restaurants and stores. This square is one of the nicest in Rome. Quiet or busy depending on the day, you will always find food and souvenirs here.

A pretty square filled with people selling junk. The square is attractive but it was jammed with tourists and dozen of people selling selfie sticks and other junk. They surrounded the fountains making it difficult to get photos. A pity.

Lovely Piazza. Piazza Navona is one of many beautiful squares in Rome. The main attraction is the Bernini fountain but there is also a beautiful church and wonderful architecture surrounding the square. There are also street musicians and when we were there a great jazz quartet was playing. While it isn't a "site" so to speak, it is a nice place to wander through and the fountain is really one of those things worth seeing.

Nice place to stroll. This is a nice place to see local artists and grab a cheap print, see local street artists such as fire dancers, and to just take a rest while walking in the city. There are cafe's as well offering refreshments.
Impressive square. Very cool. Huge square, with really nice fountains. Lots of street performers too. Don't forget to visit the church on the West side of the square!

Gorgeous Piazza, reminds me of Plaza Mayor in Madrid. Reviews are pretty accurate, including the negative ones. A great place to stroll, the fountain is beautiful, and since the Trevi Fountain is closed for at least another year, I'm glad we went. The bad is, the cafe's around the plaza are not that good. And all the artist pretty much sell the same stuff, but the most annoying part is all the street vendors/ guys coming up to you every 30 seconds to try and sell you a selfie sticks / hats/ water or little flashlights. I am not exaggerating. It seems to be a serious problem right now in all of Rome according to the Hotel staff, and restaurant owners. They are at every major attraction, and at every double decker bus locations and yes, even while you eat outside in a cafe they are come up too you, even after you say no.

Our favorite Roman piazza. Each of the famous Roman squares has its very special appeal and unique personality; Piazza del Popolo, Piazza Venezia, Piazza de' Fiori, Piazza della Rotonda - they all offer their own unforgettable character but we loved Piazza Navona and couldn't get enough of it. Its three (!) fountains, Fontana del Moro (partially by Bernini) at the south end, Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi by Bernini at the square's center featuring one of Rome's several Egyptian obelisks, and Fontana del Nettuno at the piazza's north end, all combine and add up to create an absolutely magnificent, unreal, and captivating fantasy of an atmosphere. Because of the square's original use as a horse track, the Stadium of Domitian (in the Ist century AD), Piazza Navona features a very unusual rectangular shape, that makes it very different from the rest of Roman piazzas, and it really stands apart.At night, the square lives and breathes its fascinating life: the terraces filled with people, the lights, the crowds, the music... The selfie-sticks and bootlegged Gucci and Prada bags sellers may get too annoying at times, but hey, it is a tourist capital of the world and it is to be expected.

Do NOT miss it!!. I mistakenly like at some photos that suggested there was not much there but the fountains. Because of the stories I thought I would swing by anyhow. What a surprise!! There WERE restaurants everywhere! And the really wonderful thing was all of the artisans in the middle!! Really well done pieces. Great atmosphere. And just a short walk to the various bridges that crossed the Tiber and what views of St Peter's from there!!!

Another great Piazza. We probably walked through here a few times during our stay (both day and night) and always felt it was a good spot to be. there is a church on one side that you should visit if its open - nothing terribly special but worthy of 30 minutes.The fountain and the statue in front of the church tell a story of distaste of each of the others work - you will see hands over eyes and other unsuitable gestures.The square is beautiful, if not marred by the selfie stick (and other) vendors

Nothing special. Obviously if you are roaming the streets of Rome you should (and chances are you will anyway) see the piazza. But dont expect anything special.It is a moderate size square crowded with tourists and struggling artists to sell their "art".You can sit down by the fountain if you are lucky.Anyway dur to its location it is worth checking out while walking through the city and it does have a cool atmposhpere.

Best Fountains in Rome. Piazza Navona has beautiful Bernini fountains and church to explore. There is vibrant street life, although it is wonderful to wander through early in the morning with few people around imagining what it must have been like centuries ago.

MOST BEAUTIFUL PIAZZA IN ROME. What a great place to stroll, listen to the live music, watch the artiest at work making beautiful art right in front of your eyes , the smells coming from all the restaurants, the sound of the fountains ,all a work of art, Don't miss this beautiful and historic place while in Rome !!!!!!!

Visually stunning, gastronomically bereft. This lovely baroque square is an iconic attraction of Roma. The cafés here are cheap and nasty, so avoid eating in the Piazza. There are a couple nearby, but avoid those with an El cheapo set menu.It's at the centre of the action and from what I saw, the stereotype that Romans never sleep is largely true. So if you want to stay there, choose a quiet laneway.
Active. It's one of many fountains in Rome but this one is surrounded by an active and busy lifeline of the city. Nearby shopping and dining helps to make this an area to visit.

Great place for a meal. Beautiful fountains, buildings, and lots of street entertainment as a backdrop for lunch or dinner. It was fun to sit outside and enjoy all of this, but if you get one of the tables right on the plaza (farther from the restaurant), be prepared for vendors stopping by to try and sell you things (roses, scarves, selfie sticks, etc.). Move in just a bit (still outside) and you don't get that.

a bunch of fountains. nice and amazing to think about the romans bringing in water to the city from the aqueducts. the detail of the fountains is unbelievable.this is one of the few places around rome where you will find benches to sit on.don't let the security bother you, the Brazilian embassy is there and it's standard to have army guards.

After forty years........ Forty years ago I went to Rome on a schooltrip for a week. We travelled by train and stayed in a simple hotel, Navona, near Piazza Navona. Every morning at seven we rose to be one of the first on the square and drink a cup of coffee -standing of course- in a place opposite the church. After that we went through the city by foot to make slides on a filmroll camera. The slides are gone, somewhere lost in moving from one place to another. But I went back with my wife and my two daughters and the square is still there of course: busier, even more tourist than in 1977 but still a fantastic square to be.

Great meeting place. Art, architecture, dance, entertainment, music, food: all these abound in this delightful square dominated by a magnificent fountain and the church of Santa Agnes de Agone. Any one of the numerous restaurants would be a great place to eat and people-watch. Plenty to see and a wonderful atmosphere. Definitely a piazza to stroll in night and day.

Inspired by Dan Brown. Walk into the basilica of St.Agnes, sit at a cafe, buy a few souvenirs, click photos around the fountain, listen to musicians playing along the piazza ... These are a few things that you can do here

best piazza in Roma. Year-round there is always something going on in Piazza Navona. Besides people living life, you can find a church, the Museum of Rome, and nearby Chiostro del Bramante, which hosts art exhibitions (now is Chagall).

Beautiful and full of life. Beautiful place full of street artists and interesting happenings. Have an icecream and enjoy of´ne of Rome´s piazzas. Stroll on the small narrow streets towards the river, really nice.
One of the best Roman squares. This place has got the best atmosphere of the city. It has got plenty of restaurants and cafés to sit and relax.

Nice piazza to sit down, have drinks/snacks/food. Too crowded. But, you can enjoy strolling there, watching street performers like living statue, amazing painters, sculptors, Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi, Sant'Agnese in Agone, sit down at a bar/restaurant outside while having snacks/dessert like tartufo/drinks and relax while watching the world go by. We visited it as our last place to visit in Rome and it came to be a suitable ending to our Rome tour as it had everything what Rome is popular for - a lot of people, talented painters, sculptors, dining etc.
VISIT - AND STAY FOR A LONG WHILE. A beautiful piazza, simply beautiful, you will want to sit and gaze and absorb what is around you. Book a table for the evening.

Food, entertainment, and drinks every evening at Piazza Navone. We stayed a couple of blocks from Piazza Navone. It surprised us, what with the scuptural competition between great sculptors, the restaurants all around it, and the performing musicians and artists throughout the plaza. It was being next to continual free performances of surprisingly good quality.

If people watching is your thing, then this where to go. We have been here before, and it hasn't changed. The cafés are all around this piazza. They are not too expensive, we had a couple of pizzas a and a bottle of wine and watched the world go by. Worth a visit if you are in the area.

Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers). I won't quibble with some of the negative comments put forth here. However, the Piazza is home to Bernini's Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. For that reason alone, it is worth the effort to visit. Yes, there is a circus atmosphere in the Piazza, but the fountain is magnificent. Simply magnificent. Besides you're going to be five minutes away at the Pantheon, aren't you? Take the short walk to gawk at the fountain. This is not to be missed.

A Beautiful piazza with lot of artists , people , frolic n fun.... No wonder it is one of the most popular tourist locations n most loved square(piazza) in Rome.People really enjoy this location due to the various awesome performing artists, Painters n people doing all sorts of entertaining things.Its good fun to chill here n tk a break from all the walking n sight seeing.

Night visit to the sights of Rome. As Four seniors, two with limited walking ability, we were sceptical if we could do this, but I have never seen Rome at night and wanted to do it. We were staying near St. Peters, so we started there, walked to Castle S. Angelo and the river bridges, all spectacularly lit, then to Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Piazza Venezia and then took the bus back (64) to our room near the Vatican. It was great and the pictures came out beautifully. We were very tired, but it was worth it.
Too touristy!. Had a buzz, nice fountain but overun by people trying to sell cheap artwork, scaves, handbags and selfie "extensions." Probably good fun at night for the younger group.

Piazza Navona! Meeting point for every one. The most beautiful square of Rome! Every day is a celebration!Crowded, mimes, painters, vendors and tourists. It is one of the largest squares in Rome where located many restaurants and cafes. In the middle of the square there are two magnificent fountains, especially that of the four rivers!

Just perfect!!. we loved it. Music, great restaurants, great art-great atmosphere. very romantic place. Its best to buy food at Campo de Fiori-food is cheaper there but this place is definitely where you want to spend your evenings!

Lovely place to sit and people watch and catch your breath.... Gorgeous fountains and plenty of cafe/restaurants in this busy piazza. Waiters can be a bit pushy trying to entice you in. We ate at a little cafe just off the piazza for half the price then spent a happy hour just sitting watching the world go by..enchanting!
Beautiful piazza. Oddly enough the piazza was not shoulder to shoulder people. One could actually walk and enjoy the area. The fountain is magnificent. Pay $7.00 for a beer.

Coolest place to hang out. Plaza Navona is a great place to spend time, either people watching or having a coffee or meal in one of the outside cafes. There is so much to see and do in this plaza. There is also a very hip street nearby Via del Governo Vecchio. There you will find vintage clothing stores along with chic boutiques and also many dining possibilities.

Beautiful Square. Getting to the Piazza after leaving the Parthenon is fairly simple and totally rewarding. The piazza is open and the central fountain is awesome in it's size and grandure. Beautiful buildings surround the piazza with a few restaurants. Very inviting and pleasant.

Busy Busy Busy. My wife and I were in Rome for 3 days and visited this place every day. We stumbled upon it by accident but loved it's atmosphere. Plenty to see (fountain,vendors and artistes) and lots of places to eat and drink. There's nothing like sitting at cafe watching the world go by.

Breathtaking!. Bernini's masterpiece is simply stunning. The Fountain of Four Rivers is the centerpiece of this piazza. You will always be mobbed by street vendors trying to sell you sunglasses or purses, but aside from that, it is a nice place to hang out and eat a gelato.

Generous, lively Piazza with flamboyant fountains and comfortable cafes. One of the candidates for the heart of Rome, and a great stop on your wanderings about the old town. Fun in the mornings before the bus loads arrive. Built in the 1st century as an arena for pagan games The central fountain by Bernini is a baroque marvel. Rumour has it that one of the river gods is throwing his hand up in horror at the ugly church by his rival Borromini. Amusing, except that the fountain preceded the church. For wheelchair users, there is a small curb surrounding the centre of the Piazza which is best accessed if unassisted from the south end or the centre of the East side.

Lovely area!. Got lost walking around the beautiful cobbled streets in Rome and stumbled across this beautiful square! Lovely evening spent here, lots of entertainment, shops, restaurants. And a beautiful cathedral which i unfortunately cannot remember the name of.

Bustling square. One of many piazza in Rome. Surrounded by ornate buildings and restaurants, has 3 fountains and entertains you with artists and music. Well worth passing through then head into the maze of old streets on your way to Castel San Angelo / Vatican city area . Good value restaurants can be found along these old streets and plenty to look at.

Open square. We followed the signs from the Pantheon to this square. It is a huge open square with fountains, one of Neptune and I can't remember the other. After walking around through narrow winding streets you come across this and it is huge. There are cafes all around and when I was there, artists showing their painting.

Could hardly see the fountain for the street vendors.... Trying to actually see the fountain was really difficult, there were just too many people trying to sell handbags, cheap sunglasses, selfie sticks and various other street market rubbish merchandise. The majesty had to be viewed in small glimpses. Photographing the complete fountain without a screen of market traders was also impossible. Frustrating. The Piazza itself seemed a vast marketplace. Could be put to better public use perhaps? Maybe I just got it on a bad day. The surrounding buildings were very nice though, it was possible to get a clearer view of them.
Great place to hang out in the evening. Loved this piazza great restaurants great vibe and a great people watching place, lovely sculptural fountain too .

Lively area. We visited this area a few times on our visit to Rome, it's a lively area with always something going on, like magicians and artists! The restaurants around this area are great places to eat, the fountains are lovely too! A must visit place when you go to Rome

One of the most beautiful fountains. Our hotel was close to this Piazza, so when we took our first walk, we stumbled upon this. It was just beautiful and so close to home :) We took a lot of photos, had some food and drinks and we sat there enjoying Bernini. Love it!
Taking it all in. Had some nice food and drink here. Just sitting by the side on the piazza taking in the atmosphere. Fountains are worth having a look at too.

Great Architecture and history. Wonderful square in Rome, with lovely fountain in the middle, depicting the four continents. Lots of artists around peddling their works, some very lovely. Not cheap. And lots of people selling fake desinger bags. One of our favorite places to sit, grab a delicous ice cream and people watch. Love it!

Amazing Bernini Fountain. Lovely piazza with amazing sculptures that you can stare at for hours. The shops and restaurants are very touristy, but you can't go wrong ordering pastas in Rome. And there's a great gelato place.
Down side is that there are hawkers everywhere.

Lovely place to spend an fwe hours.. Amazing place as you walk in to it. There was a lot of street entertainment and characture artists whom you could easily spend a couple of hours watching. The cafe's are expensive but well worth it just to sit and watch the world going by. Some nice shops here to tickle most peoples fancy. Will be going back here.

Beautiful fountains and artistic atmoshere. The Navona Piazza consists of three fountains and a great church.The church was closed when I arrived so I couldn't visit it, just saw it on the outside. The fountain in the middle is called the Fountain of the four rivers and has four places where water comes out and some big statues on it.There are other two fountains, in the right and in the left of it, very nice too.In the space between, there are artists showing the works and selling them to amateurs of their art. Some of them do paintings right there in front of you. I saw an artist doing a painting using sprays of paint. The painting took shape right in front of me and I was amazed to see things that seemed not to have any sense at the beginning, forming shapes and meaning to the end. To be honest, I am now sorry I didn't buy it as it was only 10 euros. I imagine it's difficult for the artists as well to do their work. This one was sitting on the floor and had a lot of paint sprays near him and I wondered how he would carry them every day to that piazza and back home.I recommend paying a visit to this place as it has its charm and artistic touch.

Cool fountains.. A very cool square with some nice cafes. Visited after a friends' recommendations and also because the Trevi fountain is out of action. Worth some time to explore and soak in the atmosphere.
Great and full of joy. The sculptures of the fountins are a beauty. Losts of artists, reastaurants - a very enjoyable place. One of the most beatifull piazzas of Rome. Don't miss it !

Beautiful lunch and shopping spot. On our recent trip to Rome, my daughter and i visited Piazza Navona. We had a nice lunch (artichoke appetizers and pizza entrees) at a cafe right on the piazza. Afterward we shopped for art from the local artists displaying their work. We purchased very, very affordable art for ourselves and for gifts.

Wow! How you would expect Rome to be. Beautiful, stunning. Accordion players. Paintings for sale. Dream up all your romantic expectations & here you are. All set out for you. Stunning fountains, buildings. All cafes & gelato expensive. But sit & soak it all in. Recommend an evening visit as less tourists. I am getting all misty eyed now thinking of it
Very busy square. Forever hassled by sellers of "selfie" sticks. Plenty going on but very busy with tourists. Keen photographers should visit in early morning before the crowds arrive
Amazing place!. Beautiful fountains, plenty of character buildings, restaurants, people... One of my favourites places in Roma. It's a must!

a beautiful piazza in the center of the historic center. A baroque style jewel of a long piazza with a beautiful fountain in the center. The palazzo and San Agnese church are not open to the public.
There are several cafes around the piazza, and a lot of tourists walking around.

Even when raining.............. Especially as the Trevi Fountain is under repair this is a lovely plaza with three fountains worth seeing when you are in the area of the Panetheon. I would have overlooked taking the time, except for a local on the plane on the way over mentioned it.
Fun day. If you love people watching and history this is the place to go! We spent the entire day there walking around the shops, outdoor market and restaurants.
Charming!. Beautiful piazza, home to the Fountain of Four Rivers which is one of Bernini's most beautiful works! Manty artists selling beautiful drawings andpaintings of Rome! lovely spot :)
Nice. Pleasant stroll round here but be aware it gets very busy and possibility of pick pockets as it is so crowded. Lovely fountain and vibe.

Classy place with lots to do. This place has a lot of different things going on well worth a visit, has a touch of class about it good shops and plenty going on on the Piazza, from the usual artist to entertainment, and plenty of good restaurants around it too. best time to visit is around lunch time as you could sit at one of the restaurants and have lunch.
beautiful. We visited the Piazza Narvona at night an it was still hopping and the fountains beautiful. The atmosphere is alive and there are artist all around selling their paintings. fun evening

Loved it... Artists' painting, classic statues and fountains, beautiful churches, music playing, and delightful cafés and restaurants, what more can you ask for.We spent a lovely afternoon sitting outside a restaurant people watching, you will pay a little more for drinks here, but well worth spending the additional money and the time to visit this Piazza.
Navona. Plenty of oustide cafe's and numerous vendors within the square, there are many side streets that have cafe's as well nearby

Not the Trevi but Extraordinary. The Trevi is closed for repairs. We decided to go to Campo dei Fior and walked over to Piazza Navona. There are two beautiful Bernini fountains there. Also all kinds of activity, music etc. The Piazza is surrounded by restaurants and tourist traps. However, there is a beautiful church Saint Agnes in the Piazza. Don't miss it.

Best place to people watch. We decided to start our last day in Rome at the Piazza Navona - the largest of Piazza's in Rome. There are three fountains, the largest (and most beautiful) called the Four Rivers. Get there early. We stopped to get some coffee and sat people watching for about an hour. The piazza soon starts filling up with vendors, tourists and locals. No traffic. Great spot to just relax, sit back and watch Rome come to life. Be sure to visit the tiny church just off the Piazza. The paintings on the ceiling will take your breath away.
Best place. This place has lots going on very lively and cheerful people. once you are there you are amazed with the architecture

Lovely Evening. Its a big public square and in the middle there is huge fountain.Beautiful and huge rock art in the centre and thousands of people from the world.Street hawkers can be seen , local entertainers and street performers like singers and dancers.Well this experience was too good.

great place to hang out. This square has a great vibe and a lot going on. Great eating places around and beautiful architecture to look at. If you like to just people watch then again here is the place to do it.

Certainly my favourite. Regardless of season or weather artists painting singing playing musicNever too crowdedYes you will pay extra two three euros per drink or dish but worth the view One of the most magnificent fountains

Wonderful. This was on my husband's to do list and I was so pleased we came here. Yes, it is busy but the fountain, buildings, churches etc are well worth the visit. Then you have the artists, street theatre which is good to watch as long as you are sensible and keep your valuables well protected. Amazing to see a couple walking in front of us and the man had his wallet sticking out of his back pocket!! We sat outside one of the many cafes and had a great coffee and just watched the world go by.

Beautiful sunset supper. Perfect place for an afternoon/evening glass of wine or supper. All the restaurants have plenty to offer, and views of the square are possible from wherever you are seated. The sunset reflects beautifully on the tall Roman buildings. Some entertainers can be found here, such as comedians, magicians, street performers and bands.

FUN ! Great food & Service !. While the "Four Rivers Fountain" is a masterpiece in the middle of this "energetic" square, don't be fooled by other perceptions that you look at the fountains and immediately leave. This was one of our (8 of us) favorite spots while visiting Rome this past week. The people watching is fun, the restaurants servers were fun, entertaining and attentive. The food was wonderful and they were served with nice wines, and we found the prices to be affordable. There were live musicians in the square on all 3 of our visits, and we enjoyed this very much ! We will be back here for sure !

A hectic space. Another large busy piazza, but with wonderful fountains, building and church (another one built from the gratitude in the old papal system) with completely over the top trimmingsFind a quite space, watch the people, try and find the detail and appreciate what was required to make this happen

Just one important advice. Just one advice which is true for many places in Rome, especially those that are usually crowded all day like Piazza Navona, Trevi fountain and the spanish steps : try to get there between 5:00 and 7:00 AM in summer (slightly later in winter or it'll be dark). It's a real hassle to get up so early especially on a holiday, but the reward you get for doing so will make the whole trip worth it, and you will remember the wonderful atmosphere that most people, romans included, never experience. You will remember it for the rest of your life !

SO MANY "PUBLICITY" FOR THAT?.... It´s a quite nice square, but nothing more than that., (the fountains are beautiful, but not much more than that)...There are much more beautiful squares in Europe.Once again, I think the movies and the tourism of Rome have done a great job...

Once Grand, Now Overrun. What a beautiful Piazza! Unfortunately, it is completely overrun with tourists and those who cater to tourists. For a memorable experience, arrive very early in the morning , take some pictures and then go have breakfast.

Wonderful piazza!. This piazza is wonderful for people watching and you can sit there for ages.There are lots of artists and people selling all sorts of things, but don't let that put you off. There are also lots of restaurants around the piazza, check the prices before you sit down. If you do sit down for a drink or a meal, you will not be rushed by the waiters.It's really good to stroll around in the evenings as well.

See Bernini Sculpture, then move on. The Four Rivers sculpture by Bernini is obviously the highlight of Piazza Navona and not to be missed. By dusk Piazza Navona is also an interesting place to observe strret culture and participate in the classic italian custom of La Passeggiata. But bypass the restaurants and cafés. They look charming, the hosts are often engaging and effusive but the food quality, service and prices are disappointing. Rather take a five minute walk east and choose any of the small cafés in the winding streets around the Pantheon. You will not have a view of Bernini but you will enjoy much better food at a much more reasonable price.

My favourite in Rome!!. What a place! The restaurants / cafes around are a bit pricey.......its best to carry your own beer!!Perfect place to spend evenings with family, friends or even all by yourself.The fountains are nice and its a busy place with a whole lot of street events.
Nice but busy. This is a scenic piazza like many in Rome and is very busy so beware of pick pockets and tourist trap restaurants! There is a very nice doll shop at the northern end of the piazza.

My favorite Piazza in Rome. I have been to this Piazza many times. Lovely restaurants are everywhere, and you can people watch for hours. The fountains are beautiful. Perfect place to spend several evenings during the Christmas Market held there every year.

fountain is lovely after disappointment of the Trevi. after the disappointment of the scaffolding around the Trevi Fountain, this had to be one of my favourite fountain/centre pieces in Rome. lots of bars, restaurants to relax and people watch in one of the only rectangular piazzas in Rome. up close the sculptures in the fountain are amazing.

Atmospheric and beautiful. Fellow guests at our hotel recommended us to visit this Square, and they weren't wrong. Beautiful buildings and fountains, and lots of space, despite the crowds of tourists and selfie-stick sellers.

Charming but very busy. Great place to visit, one of the milestones of Rome city centre. Definitely worth to go there. It is a pity it is really crowded, full of people selling souvenirs and other stuff, very touristic, and you can not really see and appreciate the beauty of Piazza Navona, which you can better realize in a book

Great place to relax and people watch!. This piazza is simply wonderful. The area is surrounded by bars and cafes where you can sit back and watch the world go by with a coffee, beer or wine. The weather when we visited was amazing and the square was filled with street artists and entertainers. Yes you pay a little more to sit and eat and drink around the piazza but it is worth it to soak up the atmosphere. Go and enjoy this lovely part of Rome.

Piazza Navona - great people wathing and the four rivers fountain. the piazza navona is a supurb place to people watch and to take one's bearings from ,with a fountain that is simply beautiful. Find the river nile in the fountain it has a great story. Don't overlook the smaller piazza pasquino or the shops and places to eat AND RELAX on the via del governo vecchio( coco and mimis spring to mind) the area is quite central also to other sites that await You in Rome.

A must see. A wonder in anyone's language but do try to see it early in the day before the crowds obscure all the fountain views. The average price for Espresso around here is 4 - 5 euros a rip off in any language , steer clear. The buildings defy belief , so imposing but so approachable.
The wayerfall. The structure was amazing. Seeing so many people was so cool - history behind the decision to build cool - a must see

Piazza with beautiful sculptures and fountain. This piazza (plaza) is beautiful and in a nice neighborhood. The place is full of visitors having a good time. Good place for people watching. This was an enjoyable experience.
Beautiful Piazza. Seen many Piazzas but this was my favourite. So nice to sit near one of the fountains and people watch and listen to street musicians. Stunning baroque architecture. A must visit.

Great atmosphere. Relaxed atmosphere in the long 'hidden' square with 3 impressive fountains. Lots of artists painting / displaying / selling their work. Plenty of street performers and musicians. Plenty of restaurants / bars for sitting in the sun (or shade) relaxing - although the food at some is questionable.

Great construction - beautiful. As we can see all over Italy...this is a beautiful spot. Its a tourist point and can find people all over the area. We walked around for some time and there a good painters ,,lively musicians.. we sat and made one artist drew our pic. It was worth and not much xpensive. A piece of great art.
Vibrant environment. A beautiful piazza that lends itself to ambling around and just generally taking in the sights and sounds and general atmosphere. Busy but weirdly relaxing.

Beautiful square. This place was not in our list but somehow managed to visit as it was near the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. After seeing the place we were in awe with so beautiful fountain and amazing square and it didn't feel touristy as well.

Always beautiful, always busy but not crowded. One of the most beautiful piazzas in Rome. Certainly busy with tourists but not ruined by the crowds as the Trevi fountain has been. Sit down and enjoy the atmosphere, but find somewhere else to eat.
Lovely square. Three fountains, a beautiful church and good places to eat and drink. Artists everywhere and a lovely atmosphere for a stroll. Not far from the main road and well worth a visit.

Lovely piazza, so full of atmosphere and wonderful talent!. We stumbled on this area by chance and then spent a good couple of hours in a cafe overlooking the square. We were treated to the music of two fantastic guitarists whilst enjoying prosecco and wonderful sunshine. The square was filled with amazing artists selling their work, as well as numerous talented singers & musicians. A wonderful place to relax and soak up the atmosphere.
Good sculptures. The fountains were beautiful, but when we went at night (early night!) almost everything was closed. We did sit at a nice cafe and have gelato, hot chocolate, and cappucino.

Cool little square of Rome for good restaurants and mingling with the Locals. This a good stop for a break in front of the fountains. Very cool sculpture work and good food. Lots of people around and they seemed willing to chat with tourists :)

How can it be anything but 5 stars.. There is a magic to the whole area.The sculptures are fabulous. The restaurants are good and should probably be experienced at least once. Save some of the bread to sit and feed the pigeons.Sit somewhere in the square and watch all the tourists reacting to the restaurant people trying to entice customers. Also check out the performers looking for money.Headless man, Roman Warriors and accordionists.It makes for a fun few hours.
Graet place to sit for a drink, but.... ... do not eat at the restaurants!! There is so much going on and the architecture is amazing. Could have stayed all day people-watching!!
Super. The first piazza we've been to, impressed us a lot with its cosiness, beauty and a wonderful fountain. For sure, it's a must in Rome.

Wow! Don't miss the fountains.. The church at this piazza is beautiful, but the fountains are the real stars. Even the little restaurants surrounding the piazza are lovely. So take some time and enjoy the views and people watching.

Piazza Navona outshines the under construction Fountain Trevi. Piazza Navona is an awesome square that's beautiful and best viewed at sunset or in the evening when there is less of a crowd and you can linger awhile in the square viewing the beautiful statues and listening to the flowing water. During the day it's beautiful but with more people, longer waits to view or take photos, to eat, to order food and to move around. Of course being a top of the line tourist spot you must be careful and be aware of your surroundings. After visiting the under construction Fountain Trevi, Piazza Navona is a find. We made it a point to stop here whenever in the surrounding area.

The most exciting square in Rome!. Love this square, the atmosphere is tremendous. It's full of very talented artists selling their work. Street performers, street vendors and tons of tourists and locals alike. Ai tre tartufi is an amazing restaurant. The pesto and carbonara is the best in Rome. If you're not so hungry then you must try the ice cream. I would also recommend the limoncello from sanremo, not cheap at €17 for 2, however it's worth every penny and you get a very large measure too. It's worth wandering through this square by day and by night as it's very different at various times of the day. Highly recommend going here.

love this place. We spent most of our time here sitting and relaxing lovely restaurant's and very friendly you do get asked an awful lot if you want a selfie stick but they just go away when you say no thank you, the fountain is beautiful every time I looked at I always found something else different on it.
A wonderful place to go. What a surprise! Unlike many of the other Piazzas. This is more of an artist area. Great food, views , and friendly people. One of my favorite spots in all of Rome.

Beautiful. Lots has already been written about this square. I just wanted to say that we got a bus from Termini (no 64). I had asked for bus directions from Tourist Info adviser at Termini - she omitted to say that we should get off at Fermata (stop) Chiesa Nuova as you can't actually drive into the square (in other words quite a different atmosphere to Piazza Venezia). Of course we missed the stop and ended up crossing the Tiber and walking back. It isn't the easiest to find despite its fame so try to plan out your route carefully beforehand to save on sore feet!

The light in the Piazza. Really lovely spot in beautiful Roma. We stayed here as the sun went down, watching people come and go and artists selling their wares. The fountains are truly gorgeous and if you look into the large windows of the surrounding windows you will catch a glimpse of some truly gorgeous ceilings. The square is quite bustling and there are tourists all around, but that shouldn't deter you...well it didn't deter us, after all, we are tourists. The fountains are lovely to see at night when they are lit up. Don't miss this while in Rome.

Dolce Vita :). I did not visit this renowned square during the day. I did it by night. I was out for drinks with my friends, who were so nice to take me here to enjoy the place without crowds of visitors. It is a pity I had no time to see the wonderful fountain during the day, but I would recommend a walk here to any couple at sunset or after. The square is well illuminated by public lightning so any pic you may want to take will be just nice.

Nice place to rest. It is a nice piazza to have a look around, there are a lot of artists with their paintings, lots of man trying to sell bags and selfie sticks, but there are also fountains and it has a nice atmosphere.

Nice place for coming at evening. Nice place for coming at evening; you will find there a nice atmosphere and somehow expensive restaurants around. But, by turning at the corner, at the distance of 50 m from this square, you may find

Dissapointed!. My second return to this beautiful square, I was keen to show my young family how wonderful this area of Rome is. Despite the beautiful surroundings with the charming buildings, the whole area now is full of artists selling the same 'original' paintings, overpriced portrait artists and even worse - lookylooky sellers selling crap! If you wan to but 150 'selfie' sticks and crap-jelly toys then this I the place! It's such a shame that this gorgeous place is allowed to be degraded by these people. Won't return.

Nice place to walk and look around!. This piazza is nice and beautiful. You can spend many hour to go thru the shops and take many photo.
Especially near the fountain there many artist selling their art pieces.
There are jazz and other street entertainer at the street.

Great place to take a break. I loved the piazza and fountains. It's a beautiful sight both in daylight and night. A good place to take a break in your Roma tour. Bernini's fountain of four rivers is a fantastic sight. Visited the place at least 4 times and would go again.
Excellent place to slow down and look round. One of the most famous Piazza of Rome, beautiful place. Please do not rush through, spend some time and look around.

My favourite place in Rome. This Piazza is stunningly beautiful. After wandering narrow cobbled streets from the river, we turned a corner and found ourselves in this beautiful Piazza. The fountains were all amazing, the square was filled with people but didn't feel crowded. There was a jazz trio at one end of the piazza, other street entertainers and artists. I would describe this place as a mixture of London's Trafalgar Square, Leicester Square and Covent Garden - I loved it!We ate ice cream at Gelateria Tre Fontane - delicious, and also at Vacanza Romana - also delicious.
Navona ...a buzz name, but that is it. Overcrowded, without too much charm. Went twice just to make sure we were not missing something but unfortunately we did not...
Beautiful but full of 'hawkers'. Really enjoyed the Piazza as it's very open with beautiful fountains, but was partially ruined by the 'hawkers' who tried to constantly sell you selfie sticks.
Hungary. Super place! At evening romantic! Lot of people! Good location, near to the main sightseeings. Hotel Navona recommended!
Beautiful piazza. Beautiful plaza and fountain lots of fine restaurants with outdoor seating many street performers and artists selling their wares it really feels like the Italian experience
Very pretty. pretty and peaceful, I recommend a trip here. We stayed for only ten minutes or so as it was very busy and the restaurant waiters were quite pestering

Dramatical Statues. An unbelievable piece of sculpture. Dominates the square completely and the stone sculptures are different on each side of the monument. Well preserved and clean. The water around the monument is crystal clear too.
Great area for food and sites. I liked this area. Great place to grab some food and hangout and people watch after you shopped shopped shopped

Gorgeous, especially without the crowds. I think this is my favourite square in Rome and has got to be one of the most beautiful in the world. Of course it's not really a "square" at all, being far longer than wide but the renaissance and baroque architecture, the fountains, the gorgeous colours, make it unmissable. However, it makes a big difference when you visit because it is normally full of tourists, cartoon artists and trinket-sellers, which do take the shine off the experience. I would recommend visiting at a quiet time of the day (not easy) and my favourite by far is about seven o-clock in the morning. Crossing Piazza Navona all on your own on a summer morning is an unforgettable experience.

Prettiest square in Rome. 2 stunning fountains a really beautiful church and a wonderful atmosphere makes this a great place to stop for a coffee, people watch or just admire the beauty of this elegant square. The only drawback was finding it via a tiny passage. Definitely got the Rome wow factor

Beautiful fountain. There are a whole lot of crowd accumulating over here at any point of time. Its crowded and at the same time lively and one of the best places to hangout while in Rome. Not only the surrounding areas provide beautiful and breathtaking views but the whole vibe around is good as well and then the place also have ample options for shopping and dining
Lovely place to relax and have dinner. Had a lovely meal here at Tre Scilini fooled by cocktails at a bar opposite the fountain. Quite buzzy here.

Montmartre of Rome. There is plenty of artist around almost every corner in Rome, but this is like Rome´s Montmartre with hundreds of them. Just if there were less beggars and immigrants trying to sell you selfie stick or "definitely original" Burberry scarves and LV handbags ... (but these immigrants are really everywhere in Rome ... so disappointing)

Must-See in Rome. We have been to Piazza Navona many times and it is absolutely a must see when in Rome. The beautiful Bernini fountains never lose their charm. The Piazza is filled with "artists" selling their pictures, people taking photos in front of the fountains and all sorts of street performers. What is ruining the Piazza are the dozens and dozens of illegal vendors shoving "selfie-sticks", "Gucci" purses, "Ray-Ban" sunglasses and all other forms of conterfeit products in your face. They are relentless and only disappear when the police are present. I hope the powers that be can do something about this problem.
Absolutely beautiful. Architecture great. Multiple choices for restaurants. Beautiful fountains. Good place to go with a family, couple or singles.

mmmm Piazza). The Piazza Navone is one of the most famous and arguably the most beautiful of Rome's many squares. The large and lively square features no less than three magnificent fountains. Another eyecatcher is the baroque church of Sant'Agnese in Agone. The square is built on the former Domitian's stadium, built by emperor Domitian in 86 AD. Hence the long, oval shape of the square. The stadium, which had a larger arena than the Colosseum was mainly used for festivals sporting events. Domitian's Stadium - The stadium was known as 'Circus Agonalis' (competition arena). It is believed that over time the name changed to 'in agone' to 'navone' and eventually to 'navona'.

The fountains fantastic sculptures are the "only" attractions. but they are really worth while coming here. Amazing to experience this kind of fantastic art in sculptures . . . Of course, the colorfully life of hundreds of visitors from all over the world is a small part of it,-but stay away from the cafés unless you deliberately like to visit tourist traps . . . . .

The fountains fantastic sculptures are the "only" attractions. but they are really worth while coming here. Amazing to experience this kind of fantastic art in sculptures . . .
Of course, the colorfully life of hundreds of visitors from all over the world is a small part of it,-
but stay away from the cafés unless you deliberately like to visit tourist traps . . . . .

Amazing. Piazza Navona has to be one of my favourite piazzas in Rome.It's spacious and busy and has so much to see and experience. Whether you're just people watching at one of the numerous cafes or admiring the beautiful sculptured fountains, the work of Bernini, it's a visual treat. The square itself dates back to 80 AD when it was built as a racetrack. There is also an amazing church that is absolutely breathtaking when you wander inside. Along the piazza are artists and vendors selling their wares. I found the Piazza Navona a worthwhile visit and plan to return on my next trip to Rome.

Great even in the rain. My wife and I have been to Piazza Navona many times over the last 12 years – it’s one of those places we always want to visit when we’re in Rome. We’ve seen the Piazza when it’s been overflowing – body to body – for political demonstrations, but most of the time it’s a fabulous place just to walk around in. The three fountains in the Piazza are awe-inspiring; the Piazza is huge, beautiful, and ringed by unique shops, cafés, and restaurants (which tend to be pricey). Most of the time, there are street vendors who’ve set up their wares, mostly artwork, all over the Piazza. The last time we were there, however, it was raining, and raining heavily; the street vendors were selling umbrellas and ponchos. In many ways, the rain contributed to our enjoyment of the Piazza; it was almost empty and the shops and cafés surrounding it weren’t crowded at all.

Beautiful square with interesting fountain. We were here because we were on the way to other place. But it is fortunate that we passed by here. This is a very interesting square with some very unique fountain in the middle. It is definitely worth visiting this Piazza. Plus, it was very much less crowded than other more popular attractions.

Piazza Navona. I was in Piazza Navona this Christmas, like every year, and what I saw was really disappointing. The total absence of stalls, which have always distinguished (at least since I was born), make it look like an anonymous and sterile square whatsoever. Thanks Mayor Marino for having disfigured one of the most beautiful places in Rome

Sandwich Stop. Navona was our favourite place to stop for a coffee and sandwich whilst sight seeing.Catches the sun perfectly and a great place for people watching.In the afternoon and early evening there are great places to eat.Put it on the 'pit stop' list.

Busy but beautiful. We were fortunate to visit on marathon day, when no cars were around :) Ate well , good value , great view of the fountain and piazza.Went back another day, more good food , another great view, but couldn't get near the fountain really, too busy. Go , sit, eat drink enjoy the views

Remember your wallet!. Absolutely stunning place to wonder about and soak up the culture. It was a nice day so we decided to have a coffee and cake at a cafe facing the restaurant. €7 each for a coffee and €11 for one slice of cake!! Very pricey, I about fainted when we got the bill haha. But as they say, when in Rome...

My favourite place to hang out in Rome. This place is big enough that the masses actually spread out and you can walk freely. Good choice of restaurants that allow you to drink or dine in comfort and watch the buskers, street performers and artists at work. It's also beautiful with some quite majestic fountains

The Romantic Piazza Navona. We had a great time here. Lots of performers. Lovely atmosphere. Lots of paintings for sale. Three lovely fountains. The middle one the most beautiful. It is the work of Bernini. It has four statues in the corners squirting water. They represent the Danube, The Ganges, The Nile and The Rio re la Plata. Each fountain is made of marble and are fantastic works. The square is also called AGONAL CIRCUS. It occupies the land and boundaries of the old ancient Circus of Domitian. The Church Santa' Agnese in Agone is located in the middle on the Square. It has beautiful mable statues in all corners of the church. It has a painted ceilings which are also very beautiful. The dome is decorated beautifully in mainly gold. The floors are made of amazing ornate marble. Amazing for what is a local church. Worth a look. If you are at the top of the hill at The Spanish Steps. This dome and the dome from the Vatican are what you see on the skyline. This square is the place to be for food. Loads of restaurants to choose from. Every establishment unique with the prettiest shop fronts. Lots of paintings of the shop fronts can be brought on the Square. Worth leaving at least two hours for this square alone. Highly recommended.

Huge beautiful square. went here very briefly, very crowded, stunning buildings around though and beautiful fountain. Too many vendors and quite persistent.Would defintely have liked to spend more time here, maybe get some gelato or cappuccino and relax for a bit. it was great stop on our walk to the Trastevere food district, Pity about the Vendors.

A nice place to have a break, otherwise overated. The Square is filled with little sellers and in the center lies a nice fountain. I think it is overrated. Its a nice place to have a break if yo u have been walking around but otherwise I would go all the way. Food is pricey if you want a bite. Be ready to pay at least 30 Eur per person excluding alcohol.

Fun and entertaining!!!!. I could have spent all day here!!! The Piazza Navona is a hub of excitement...entertainers, painters, leather sales, fountains, sculptures, surrounded by restaurants makes this a must see while in Rome!!!
Well worth a visit. This beautiful Piazza was filled with lovely fountains, amazing architecture and beaufiful art stalls. There are also a number of lovely places to eat in the Piazza

Angels and Demons. This is where they filmed a scene from the film Angels and Demons with Tom Hanks where they dumped a Cardinal in the fountain. Nice place to walk round larger that I thought. Lots of people in the Piazza and places to eat and drink but at a premium.

A must in your visit to Rome. This is one of the most emblematic piazzas in Rome (of course, Fontana di Trevi is the most famous). After being in Castel Sant Angelo, heading toward this piazza you can find colorful small streets with local stores. I really enjoy this stroll. Once you get there, feels like an open space in the middle of a buzzing city, a lost square where you can seat with a cup of coffee and admire the sculptures there. The main attraction is the obelisk by Bernini. In one of its sculptures in this obelisk, you can see one man that is facing the church with horror with his left hand trying to cover his eyes. Many people say that has this gesture because the church was built by Borromini, and it depicts the ugly architecture of the church, but in fact, the obelisk was built first than the church. This church is the Saint' Agnese in Agone with a baroque style. Francesco Borromini, was one of the architects that were involve in its construction, Bernini's adversary. You can find local artists in this piazza selling their paintings and drawings. Being in this piazza, is being in the center of everything, that's why if you want to get a hotels close to this area, they are gonna be expensive. In September you have a wonderful weather that you can enjoy plenty the square. Restaurants around are, of course, very expensive, so plan ahead your visit with a gelatto or a coffee before get there.

Great point to stop and relax. We walked through many narrow back streets that led to the Piazza. Wonderfull fountains and cafes, artists, shops and street traders. We went back again later that week and had a tasty snack from a cafe up the narrow street leading off the Piazza. Close by other sites so you can map out your route to see much more.

Rain or shine a must do...but shine is better!. The beautiful fountains and wonderful artists are best viewed here with a walk around and then , if time permits, by having a cappuccino at one of the many beautiful cafes that surround the perimeter. In the am the focus seems to be on the left side to get the sun. We headed right so we could get a table that was quiet. A great spot and well worth the visit.

Enjoyable busy square to spend time. Lovely square, bustling with people and street performers and artists. Lovely fountains for pictures. Lots of restaurants and bars to people watch from. Fun place to spend an hour or so.
pay attention to the details. My favourite square in Rome. Look at the details of the 4 Rivers fountain. Read the story and meaning of each one of them and you will see it with other eyes.

Must go on.a sunny day. 2 blocks from pantheon, piazza navona is the best piazza in Rome. It is beautiful and buzzing on a sunny day. The church in front of it is amazing as well. But the restaurants are very expensive, as expected. If you wanna eat, go a bit further inside the lanes and you will find details cheaper places to eat and drink. Overall piazza navona is amazing. Weak to campo de fieri from here.

Relax and enjoy with a cappaciano. In a corner of Rome you come to this amazing "Piazza" with the beautiful fountain and so much lively activity. Relax and enjoy watching the artists at work, perhaps some mime performers or just people watching. Perfect way to spend and afternoon.
Nice. It was great walking around here. We came at night and there was music being played here. There were a lot of people here. The fountain was beautiful
