Busy and bustling!. I wouldn't necessarily eat there as it seems like a bit of a tourist trap, but the square is really nice, and contains some Bernini sculptures which are of course divine. Enjoy a Gelato in the sun, or a drink at one of the tourist traps and people watch!!

Lovely atmosphere. We went here on the afternoon, and there was a great atmosphere. Lots of street performers, artists, and of course the wonderful fountains and architecture. Lots of 'selfie selfie' sellers however which are expected everywhere. The restaurants around are quite pricey and the one we went had a toilet attendant who wouldn't let you out until you paid her.

A charming place with architectural masterpieces. A large piazza with three fountains to feast the eyes. The centre of attraction was Bernini's Fountana dei Quattro Fiumi or Fountain of the Four Rivers. This Fountain is featured by Dan Brown in his 'Angels & Demons'. The square was crowded with tourists who were sought after by artists, street performers, café & restaurant promoters and small time peddlers.

Fun and funky. Yes, there is a famous fountain here, but the real attraction is that it is just a fun place to hang out. It has some fun street performers - a guy dancing with flaming lengths of rope and several street artists doing surprisingly good pictures with spray paint, stencils, and newspaper. They are certainly not high brow pieces of artwork, but you can say you actually saw it created and talk about it. Much better than the professional looking art work sold on the streets that was just mass produced somewhere.

A wonderful piazza to spend half a day. During the day artists set up there work for sale, as do others selling a variety of crafts. At one end is Bernini's statue, and delightful restaurants, and ice cream shops. Try the Tortufo. At night it's romantic, and exotic, memories of its history all around.
Fantastic atmosphere. This was one of our favourite places in Rome. Beautiful fountains, entertainment and a great atmosphere. A must see
Super crowded piaza. The piza would be quite nice, yet all the tourists are absolutely worsening the overall experience. If you like crowds - this is a place for you.

Beautiful and peaceful!. Beautiful Piazza with Fuimi Fountain (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi).
Find a place to sit and people watch, enjoy the weather, grab a Gelato and enjoy everything around.

My favourite Piazza. Walked there after the visit to the pantheon, and the moment I saw the piazza I was enchanted. The place is lively and charming. The fountains, sculpture, shops, cafes and people in the piazza come together as a great mix. I stayed in one of the cafes in the sun and was not able to leave until after long hours. The place is also kid friendly as my toddler safely enjoyed running and watching pigeons and passing dogs while being looked after by me from distance. This is a must visit!

Great venue. Great place to sit, have a beer or two and enjoy the sights. Yes, it can get busy and the food/drinks are not the cheapest but great to watch the culture.Definately worth a visit for a few hours or all day.

Touristy but worth a visit. One of the many areas of interest within Rome and well worth a walk through. Lots of people here attracting the usual local and not so local sellers. We were plagued with guys selling these 'selfie' extension arms all through our Rome trip. Fascinating place though with an interesting history and fountains.Build in a visit while doing a walking piazza tour.

Another Piazza on the list. Huge piazza with lots of cafes round the square, a couple of fountains and a few hundred street traders trying to sell you selfie sticks, you will get asked every 20 seconds wherever you go in rome, but here and the spanish steps there seems to be loads, couldn't sit and enjoy the Piazza, but its another place on the must see list anyway

Wonderful place. Walking from the pantheon towards the temse... I stopped at piazza navona wonderful view and wonderful coffee shop andwondrful church... Three fountains one incedibe one with4 statues in the middle and largest fountain. Wonderful stop

Best outside busy times. Good to wander through and look at the various artists and performers or to sit and enjoy a drink whilst people watching. Probably best to avoid lunchtimes and mid evening as most of the restaurants want to just pack in the eaters and get them out again for the next lot rather than let people in for a relaxing drink.

Charming. My best early in the evening I like to go there. Appear to be the artists, painters, musicians, clowns, acrobats and sometimes. Bustling and charming. Beüllni like a cafe and watch people, tourists. And this space is used for this. The fountain of St. Agnes. Church and other buildings, magnificent scenery provide a pleasant evening for dinner ... More types is easily accessible by bus or Piazza Venezeia, or from the terminal, but also the Castel Sant'Angelo is just a few minutes walk.

Great place to eat and People Watch!. Beautiful side walk cafes offering a wide variety of tasty local treats. Enjoyed wonderful seafood, great wine, desserts and after dinner drink. Wonderful service and the ambiance is just sort of a once in a life time kind of vibe to it.

A great place to spend some time.... A great place to spend some time admiring the statues, the fountains and the buildings all around. The christmas bazaar happering there, is not something worth seeing.We were told not to sit on the cafes and restaurants all around the neighbourhood, as they are all very touristic and expensive.

A great evening place. A great place to chill out in the evening, people watch, drink, eat and see the amazing fountains, not just the famous one! If you don't want to pay a little extra to eat, there are plenty of places within walking distance away from all the tourists

People Watching. A wonderful place to soak in the culture, while eating lunch on a park bench. You can stroll along the piazza, watch artists at work and drink in the atmosphere. The Four Rivers Fountain rests in this square.

Nice square, but dishonest bartenders and waiters. I keep having the feeling the waiters and the bartenders in Rome are not that welcoming with tourists and are often dishonest. The square is nice, but left me with bad memories.

One of the most fascinating piazzas in Rome. You can spend a long time in this piazza, marvel at the statues by Bernini, take in the wonderful atmosphere, you may even want to walk in one of the churches and have a well deserved rest. (even if you are not religious) when you have finished you may like to have lunch in one of the numerous restaurants. On my last visit in Rome, I was told that the Mayer of Rome ordered for the outside dining tables to be removed, that is a shame.
Beautifull. a must see along your trip close to all other features lovely square restaurants and shops.........................................................................................

Lively & Energetic Piazza. Amazing place for a stroll and a real taste of Roma! Make sure you explore the side roads for wonderful (and cheap) restaurants cafes, and gelato instead of the expensive ones in the Piazza itself. The only downside is the street sellers who follow you around and also the beggars.

Outstanding!! . I felt overwhelmed by the beauty of the fountain, I think is the most characteristic detail of the Plaza. Very close to St. Peter Square and Fontana di Trevi. Don't let it out of your itinerary.

Beautiful Square, Interesting History. We loved this busy square. The fountains were impressive and the unique shape of the square has this as one of the standout locations of our trip to Rome. Sit and enjoy the site by having lunch along the square and be sure to visit it at night. The history of the square is also quite interesting, made all the more so by visiting the little archaeological site on the north side of the square.

Amazing sites and wonderful area to walk around. Come over to see the fountains and then watch all the people! Stop by a cafe and enjoy watching all the people walk by. It's a fun and perfect place to enjoy the energy of Rome.

Impressive square. There are so many squares in Rome. This must be one of the grandest. Even in daytime in March it is full of life and surprises. Street entertainers, artists, fountains, grand architecture and history. I wish the bad weather had not deterred me from going back in the evening when I am sure it is at its liveliest.
Godd for people watching.... We did not linger too long here...a quick look at the fountains,returned a left camera and then on to face more selfie stick sellers.

Angels and Demons!. We loved Piazza Navona and visited both night and daytime. Beautiful buildings surround, lots of street artist etc, vibrant cafe bar scene with choice of good restaurants. A must visit when in Rome

Lovely peaceful place for lunch. Beautiful fountains, which looked as if they had been cleaned recently. There is no traffic, so despite the crowds, it was very quiet. We chose one of the many restaurants to have lunch and had very nice food at surprisingly reasonable prices, given the location.
Beautiful place to hang out, rest, people-watch.. This is one of my favorite places to just relax and watch all the people coming and going. The Piazza is just beautiful. It's a relaxing place.
Amazing!. I loved this place! If you had someone to explain you the meaning of the statue, your visit will be amazing! Pay attention in every detail. A tip: you can visit this point at evening.

Beautiful and very alive piazza. Piazza Navona is a great place to go go hang out. Spend some time looking at the statues and fountains. Have a bite or a drink and spend some time just enjoying the atmosphere. Spend a lot of time people watching!

BEAUTIFUL PIAZZA - NOT TO BE MISSED. A wonderful experience just to sit and soak up the atmosphere of this spectacular Piazza. Many street traders who will badger you to buy handbags or selfie sticks but they are not overbearing and will go away once you have said no. Lots of artists selling their wares too and some terrific paintings to be picked up.Just off the Piazza take a stroll up the Via del Governo Vecchio and you will find the best ice cream shop in the WORLD. Trust me. You can't really miss it because there is always a queue out the door but it goes down quickly. At only 1 euro a scoop it is a steal and we never had less than three scoops at every visit !!

Beautiful place. Lovely little place to sit and take in the surroundings. Once your through the barrage of sellers offered selfie sticks its a lovely place to sit in the sun and have some lunch or drinks. Beautiful fountains and some street entertainment going on, lots of art sellers in the middle just a lovely place to sit and watch the world go by.
Very crowded but very beautiful. You have to see it if you're in Rome. Beautiful coloured buildings with wooden storeys around the 4Fumi fountain

Very Italian, but ruined by street sellers. We sat and ate gelato in the square and watch the passers by which was great. The piazza is ruined though by the number of street sellers. You can't get a decent photo of the fountain as its surrounded by guys selling scarves, handbags and selfie sticks. Maybe go early in the morning to appreciate it.

Beautiful Fountains & Atmosphere. The Piazza Navona is situated in the historic centre of Rome, west of the Pantheon. It is one of Rome's liveliest squares, with many outdoor cafes, restaurants and bars in the neighbourhood. This area usually has a number of street artist and entertainment from locals looking to earn a euro or two.The main attraction of Piazza Navona is the trio of fountains that adorn the square. The central and largest fountain is the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers). The two other fountains on the piazza are the Fontana del Nettuno (Neptune fountain) at the northern end and the Fontana del Moro (Moor fountain) at the southern end of the square. Another highlight at Navona square is the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone.

Another must in Rome. The piazza Navona, with its stadium like layout is another of the spots you need to visit, when in Rome.. The fountains, the atmosphere and all the people make this such a nice and bustling place... Sit down and enjoy the show!!

Pretty Piazza. This is avery pretty piaza in Rome. Beautiful fountain and sculptures. We visited Rome during the week before Easter and the Piazza was very crowded but it was still a fun place to walk around as it has a special atmosphere to it.

Piazza Navona. Without a doubt-if you are looking for a combination of fountains, sculpture, and amazing Italian food--this is a must stop. Not only does this stop provide sometimes a much needed rest between sites, but the culture and feel of Rome really came to life before my eyes. If your experience is anything like mine-you will find yourself lost in the moment, smiling, and giggling just people watching-especially the hosts and waiters trying to get people in their restaurants-and it worked for me-fantastic food and service!!
Pretty Fountain. This is a lovely square with a pretty fountain and statutes of which there are many in Rome. It is close to the Pantheon and Campo de Fiori so it was a nice walk to all three sites.

Beautiful fountains, fun atmosphere. The church and Bernini's fountain are definitely sites worth visiting. The piazza has great energy, with artists and singers. It just gets inundated with vendors and expensive cafes.

One of the most famous squares in Rome. The square is built on the former Stadium of Domitian.Hence the long, oval shape of the square. The stadium, which had a larger arena than the Colosseum was mainly used for festivals and sporting events.The main attraction of Piazza Navona is the trio of fountains that adorn the square. The central and largest fountain is the Fountain of the Four Rivers(Nile, Ganges, Danube and Rio del Platas) make distinct gestures to the church in front of them.

Day, or night, a MUST see when visiting Rome. Filled with famous fountains, artists, street performers, and just "regular," interesting people. Great place to just stroll and take it all in. Can be crowded at times, but again, this is Rome! I have been here so many times I have lost count. In addition, I have picked up some very beautiful, and reasonably priced art from local artists. In case you are thirsty, there are real drinking water fountains at either end (for example, near the fountain of Neptune). These fountains are a really welcomed on a hot Roman summer day. The water is clean, crystal clear, cool, and quenches your thirst. The oval shape of the piazza reveals the original use (a circus during Roman times). The palaces (now hotels, etc.) sprung up around this shape. The fountains are wonderful, especially the one of the Four Rivers. They came after the buildings. Evenings here are very special with street artists and performers. I would avoid any of the restaurants around the Piazza for obvious reasons (expense). However, if you are going to splurge, have a tartufo gelato at Tre Scalini (featured in the NY Times). It really is good. If you go around the corner (the corner opposite the Neptune fountain-sorry I cannot remember the name of the street), you can see where the "original" Rome was - about 40 feet below the level of the current street. This area is now open for visitation, but there is a charge. Children are free. Piazza Navona is, and will remain one of my favorite places in Rome. It is also very close to other site, such as the Basilica of San Andrea di Valle, and near a great place for a great salad, I'Insalata Ricca.
Beautiful square with lovely fountains. We did a walking tour recommended in a popular guide book and this led us through the square. Nice place to sit and grab a coffee and watch the world go by.

Interiors remind of Basilica de Sacre Couer in Paris. This attraction has a church and a fountain in the foreground. This is very close to the Italian parliament (2 streets away) and an easy walk from Pantheon across the parliament. There are frequent buses to Termini from here. This is an attraction not to miss.

Fun in the Evenings. I enjoyed spending my evenings here after the sunset, watching the people walk by, listening the live music being played, and enjoying a snack with some wine at one of the many restaurants (that are very over priced and full of touristy style food, with very poor service). All the same, it is avery lively square in the evenings. If you're staying near the area, breakfast may be nice here. But if you're planning lunch or dinner, I would look elsewhere at an area geared less for tourists. Beautiful fountains throughout the square, and artists selling paintings to bring home. Buy paintings not prints.

Huge beautiful piazza. This was a very nice spot, the fountains are beautiful and there are plenty of places to sit and relax. Trevi was closed during our visit so we really appreciated Navona. It is also extremely close to Campo de Fiori & the Pantheon, so you can plan a good part of a day visiting those 3 sites together, as we did.

Beautiful and fascinating!. Rare big open space in Rome, plus lovely fountains, interesting shape (former arena underneath it), and interesting buildings around it. Center fountain is a masterpiece. Our guide (Maria from Rome with Kids) had a scavenger hunt to find all the animals.
Bernini at his best !. just an amazing piazza with Masterpices sculptures of Bernini just not to be missedRome at it's best

Lovely place. We ended up here after walking around the city. We tried to see the Trevi fountain but it was being reconstructed. This Plazza has beautiful fountains that are working,many places to eat outdoors and lots of activity. We ate at a good restaurant and relaxed. Musicians were playing and crowds were strolling or sitting on the benches. There are windows covered in flowers the prettiest I have ever seen. This Plazza is a great place for photos, relaxing and dinner.

My #1 Best Fountain & Square. I toured Rome with friends in March 2015. Trevi Fountain was under construction but still the area was crowded even in March off-season. We enjoyed more our relaxed time in the area of the Piazza Navona with its interesting history and fountain - not under construction. GREAT cafes nearby with washrooms that require a small fee for the privilege/service which off sets their costs. Quite fair.

Great atmosphere day and night. A lovely plaza with 3 fountains, cafe's around the edge and people dotted around with stalls or selling little things. Often musicians or people doing artwork, skilled things, street performers. Loved the atmosphere and felt safe.

Worth a visit. Tucked behind tall buildings is this huge piazza with its 3 beautiful fountains. Restaurants around the edge, beware expensive but we did find a lovely sandwich/ice cream shop at the one end. In the Central part are artists selling and painting their pictures, plus the usual hawkers which the police chase on their motorbikes! Well worth a visit.

In Restauro!. Like most of Rome's significant monuments at the moment, The Trintá dei Monti at the top if the steps is clad in nets and scaffolding! The hordes of kids on school trips could care less. Their lack if interest is infectious. Next !
Love Rome. the beauty and perfection you can find it in Rome , always the best way is to seat , have a cafe, one dolce and enjoy what you see , what you feel, what can dream...Rome is fantastic
Great find. I think this was our favorite Piazza in Rome . Super place just to relax and people watch. Great architecture including two great fountains.
OK...once again. Miss this beautiful classic and ask yourself why you bothered coming to Rome. It is really that simple and nothing more need be said.

Somehow you´ll always seems to end up here... :). Very beautiful piazza with painters and selfie-sellers. :)Built on top of the old Domiziano Stadio ( ancient arena for athleets. )if you are interested of roman history, don´t miss the Glatiatormuseum at the end of the Piazza that shows gladiatorweapons and clothing, but above all it shows the ruins of the arena below the piazza!Costs 8£ ( free for kids ) to go inside, but it was interesting to see and one realize why the piazza is shaped just like the arena.To eat, just take a short stroll into one of the sidestreets to find cosy small tavernas and hosterias.Enjoy!
Beautiful area. This is a great place to grab a bite to eat or a coffee, beautiful fountains and great atmosphere. Would recommend a visit!
Magnificent. Like no other! Have a stroll around the 3 fountains then relax with a drink or grab something to eat. Grandeur and magnificence of this Baroque piazza is unsurpassed.

Very touristy , crazy prices , but beautiful.. If you could see this piazza without all the crowds and hawkers , you could appreciate its beauty . Usually however it is so busy that you can get distracted by so much going on ... (Keep an eye on your wallet). If you can appreciate the beauty of this piazza sitting in an expensive restaurant and looking out at crowds of tourists then go for it . But i think while it is important to see it , there are more authentic places to sit and watch the world go by . Go very early in the morning to avoid crowds .

The magnificent square. Yes, it is really Rome! Magnificent square on the place of the ancient stadium with three fontains, one of them is amazing fontain of four rivers from Bernini. The beatiful atmosphere, a lot of restaurants, baroque in its full glory. What more could you ask for!
Rome 2015. Excellent location to relax enjoy food and drink at a location steeped in the history of ancient Rome, superb.

beautiful by day or night!. by day has it has alot of street artists and tourists and in the evening lots of restaurants and everything is bright and romantic.our hotel was a minute away (Locanda Navona Hotel that was perfect btw..) so we passed by its every day and it was more beautiful each time.

ANOTHER SET OF BEAUTIFUL FOUNTAINS - WATCH OUT FOR PICKPOCKETS!!!!!!. This set of 3 beautiful fountains are spread all over the square impressive, but not as big as the Trevi Fountain. A great place to rest your legs after a long walk at one the bars and order a large beer (1.5 lotre). Great atmosphere, very pretty at night. Strong police prescence as this square is a magnet for pickpockets.

Great! Especially by night. Go here in the late afternoon or by night. The fountains have lights in the water and this gives a better view. Buy some ice cream and sit down or go the one of the many terrasses.

Great place to relax and rest. There was more to see and do here than the Trevi Fountain. We had some of the best Gelato here. If you want a self portrait done there were 3 very good artists that did great work. The fountains of course were amazing to see.

Good going. Not the best historical place, but nice atmosphere in evening time.
Lots of very good street artists and also something to see(church,waterspring...) a good place to just hang out
Beautiful romantic surrounding. The piazza is really charming, with the fountains, painters, small coffee shops and romantic atmosphere

WOW! Lots of fun and great neighborhood.. This Piaza is really jumpin'. Lots of artists and people. Beware that just like everywhere in Rome street vendors are very aggressive. Everyone wants to sell you aSelfi stick, scarves or leather goods. The church is supposed to be great but it was closed when we got there. Get into the small streets aroundPiazza Pace. You're in the real Rome. Walk as much as you can. Take Ibuprofin. Your legs will thank you.

3 nice fountains, 1 incredible artist!. Piazza Navona is definitely worth visiting if you are in the area. It is very busy, and has a lot of vendors and people trying to sell you things, but not as many as in some places in Rome. Each of the three fountains is worth a good look.One of the artists in the piazza was mesmerising to watch, using his range of spray cans, crude tools and a flamethrower to make truly impressive paintings in around 15 minutes - at €10 each, one would definitely have been bought if it had been feasible to transport it home!

Grwat for People Watching. Lovely fountains - the Brazilian Embassy which they own - the only one in Rome that's privately owned - was pretty cool - the restaurants are awesome. Loved the street vendors. I did enjoy messing the street sellers around trying to sell me a Selfie Stick and pretending it was a golf club - made them cross lol. Food isn't great around the restaurants if im honest and if you wait too long before you pay - and your not ordering food - you will be thrown out!
A nice square. This is a well proportioned square with some nice fountains and statues. A great place to stop for a coffee and watch the world go buy. A bit of peace and quiet in the centre of town.

No overly impressed. This was basically like a big art fair which was no interest to me since I had no room for large paintings. There were also knock off purse vendors and the ever present "selfie stick" vendors!!!! You will become so annoyed and eventually numb to them there are so many. The fountain was beautify but it was next to impossible to get a good photo with all the vendors set up

Best Place in Rome!. Awesome piazza.. We came here so many times... Family, couple as well as solitary adventurers atmosphere.. Always sunny.. Always living, very talented artists drawing, making caricatures, world-class spray-painters being there at any time

The place for selfies. do not worry. If you forgot your apparatus you will find plenty of availables support. You will be asked for 10 euros but you can discuss. And do not forget to look around the piazza the beautiful buildings and the marvelous fountains

Beautiful Italian Piazza. Although the Piazza is obviously very commercialised, I felt it was a true taste of Italy. I found it very atmospheric and to me it encapsulated the romance of Rome. It was lovely just to sit and watch the world go by, then stroll round and look at the beautiful fountains. Plenty of artists and performers, as at most tourist attractions in the city. A visit to the Church of St. Agnes in Agone is also a must. The narrow streets surrounding the Piazza are very interesting, especially the shops selling beautiful church vestments.
The first demonstration I saw in Italy... And it was amazingly peaceful, bucket loads of carabenieri and oodles of police-vans and it was all very calm, and no trouble at all
sightseeing. Nice area to relax. Better to have a coffee, drink a glass of wine or a bite to eat in one of the side streets for better value

Great Evening Atmosphere. This was the place to in the evening. Lots going on, street entertainers, some fantastic restaurants and even some of the large churches in the square were open on a night to view. The choice of food was amazing and at the top of the Piazza was one of the many ice cream shop which gave you a nice sweet as you left for another location.

Stunning square. This is a place which doesn't have to be missed while walking in Rome. In this square is the famous "Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi" of Lorenzo Bernini. The square is surrounded by restaurants, but I don't recommend them as the prices are way too high for the quality they offer.

My favorite place in Rome!. Be it your first time at the "Piazza" or your hundredth, you'll feel the urge to just sit and relax a little bit while contemplating the scenery! The energy at Piazza Navona is unique, life flowing everywhere! The best place in town!

Amazing place. Amazing place! Has many small restaurants, artists performing, selling art or playing musical instruments. Its crowded but the feel it leaves when you are there is amazing. Fountains and buildings around together with the atmosphere tell stories. You can sit for a coffee or dinner ( we had twice dinner there in a different restaurants around the piazza and food was fantastic) and you can enjoy the view. Very romantic will recommend to couples!

Disappointing. We4 went there with great expectation because of last year. A lot of people and many restaurants. Planning to have some lunch like last year. But wich restaurant to choose.Difficult because they look so nice all of them. BUT. When you looked to some restaurant even from the far, someone with the Menu-lists run in to you and tried to get you in. Polite "no thank you" and we moved on. The same in next restaurant. We do not want to go in any restaurant like that. hat did we do ? Walked out on Piazza Navona and choosed aan other restaurant just around the corner.
Perfect to People Watch ??. Terrific Piazza , great architecture, with some good resturants to sit and enjoy a good lunch or supper and enjoy the atmosphere

beautiful and fantastic atmosphere. this place is beautiful and they have a fantastic atmospher highly recommend this place for a posh meal too lovely we saw the quee of belguim there when we was there
Lovely. Lovely Piazza. Nice food in Cafe Dolce Vitae. Cold beer, nice wine. Good service. No traffic. Pick a cafe in the sun.

some good fountains. An interesting square, a nice place to spend some time, looking at some good fountains with history. The square is busy and full of hawkers and performers, so not a quiet place, like many tourist destinations in Rome.

Beautiful. One of the greatest and most beautiful places in the city. Surrounded by stunning architecture, restaurants, bars...with impressive fountains, sculptures. Busy place, full of artists, musicians. Stop here for a coffee and watch life passing by...
Very beautiful square.... One of the most beautiful squares of Europe... Full of cafes, restaurants and historic monuments. Must see...

Quaint and Inviting. We found this to be a fun gathering point for talented artists and entertainers in the afternoon and evenings. Very light hearted enjoyment for people of all ages. Lots of places to eat or to just sit and watch people enjoy the architecture, churches and fountains.

One of the best Piazzas in Rome. This is a beautiful Piazza, especially as there is no traffic. A lovely place to sit and relax in beautiful surroundings. We arrived early and not too crowded, but it does get quit busy later on. Lots of artists selling their pictures

Nice place to spend time. The statues interesting but the piazza is even more entertaining. Lots of people to watch, street entertainers etc. A great place to stop at one of the surrounding restaurants and have an afternoon coffee. Became a family tradition.
Nice place to rest after sightseeing. On a sunny day nice place to sid and have a coffee or lunch, although turistic places food ok, service friendly, good atmosphere.

Best at Night. This is a beautiful place after dark. Check out the three fountains and surrounding buildings with dramatic lighting. We visited in March on a clear night. A few bars and restaurants are also here and nearby.

Beautiful. What a beautiful square so busy with tourists and artists. The Church in the square is wonderful, a real gem. You could easily spend a couple of hours here with a coffee or lunch, wonderful atmosphere.

Great sight. Nice to sit and people watch here.
Great photos during the day and also looks lovely at night photos look fantastic.
Grab a gelato and enjoy!!
Great place. Loved this piazza. A great place to visit when walking around Rome - lots of atmosphere, great fountains, lots to do and see, best gelatos around.

Nice attraction with a great atmosphere. We visited the fountains which look really great especially in the sun, but what made the visit was the atmosphere in the square with all the restaurants and artists. Look out for the guy who paints with car spray paints onto canvas, could have watched him for hours!!

Joyful to be there. This is a must see! Gorgeous square where is located the enormous church of Saint Agnes, virgin and martyr. But there is a lot to see in the square. Also having fun with local painters and entertainers.

Grab a cappu and enjoy the day. One of Roma's famous Piazza's, you can sit for hours and enjoy! Been many times, often on my runs or just to stroll through during a saturday walk. Bring your camera, take a seat and enjoy the scenery. Surrounded with amazing restaurants and little cafes to enjoy the time.

Fun and lively. A fun place to end up when walking around Rome. You may think that this area would be expensive but we found one of the best value (still not cheap) tourist shops and best galato we had in Rome around this piazza.
Stunning. i love the size of this fountain, the big feet, the power in the muscles, it's also in a place you can just sit and watch people

Great place to chill. Great place to have a long lunch and a few beers and people watch. Stroll among the artists some great pictures. After strolling around sit on the edge of a fountain and watch the hawkers run from the police quite funny.

My favourite square in the centre of Rome. Piazza Navona is one of the biggest inhabited squares in the heart of Rome and at the same time, in my opinion, one of the prettiest. Its a tourist attraction, so locals try to avoid it, but still, its great to look at and to eat or drink at, as the square and the surrounding area is full of restaurants and caffee's.It is surrounded by old beautifull buildings, which is the norm in Rome, and has also statues and fountains.I pass by it every time I am in Rome, without exception.

Tourist trap. Whilst a beautiful setting the square is effectively ring-fenced by restaurants and people pestering you to eat or drink.
Enjoy the views but walk on a few street to the fruit market area with places where you can sit and eat/drink in peace whilst watching the locals at work
A nice square.... ..with some nice fountains. Very busy with hawkers/street artists etc. The fountains are worth the visit but possibly on a quiet day (if possible).

Probably very nice... A while back in time. Cometely overrated. Three interesting fountains with lots of history and.... That's all. The square has been taken over by aggressive junk peddlers and cheesy art worthy of a velvet Elvis. Did I mention the layer of trash all around, in and around the fountains? Pretty disappointing considering the hype.
nice. Piazza impressive , large , gorgeous , a little familiar harassment of people selling little things . Amazing sculptures . We had good weather so the pleasure was great.

A nice Piazza. We enjoyed walking around this area at night. Even during the day it is a nice location, large square with lots of vendors and eating establishments. I think the fountain of four rivers is the area within the Piazza that is worth the stop - it is beautiful day or night.

Beautiful space to spend an afternoon. This is one of the most beautiful squares in Rome. Piazza Navona is an open area where scores of musicians and artists perform through the day. One can sit in one of the cafes and just enjoy the view of the beautiful fountains, buildings, people. The true, beautiful Rome.

Probably come during day. It was a bit dark at night, maybe the fountains do not lit up in March. There were couple of street artists and painters, or musicians and many overpriced restaurants around. I expected more romantic place, so it was just fine to sit for a little, but for night photograpy absolutely not interesting.

a great piazza!. 3 fountains wich have been done from antiquity to XVII seculo
some gelaterias around
some palazzios and and a church
nice to rest afternoon

Perfect place to have a little rest after a long walk. Defined as a public space in the last years of 15th century, when the city market was transferred to it from the Campidoglio, the Piazza Navona was transformed into a highly significant example of Baroque Roman architecture. Piazza Navona has two additional fountains: at the southern end is the Fontana del Moro with a basin and four Tritons, and at the northern end is the Fountain of Neptune. There are also a lot of caffes. Perfect place to have a little rest after a long walk.

Beautiful. One of the most beautiful squares in Rome. Choose a sunny day, go to the Piazza Navona, sit in one of the cafes and just enjoy the view of the beautiful fountains, imposing buildings, flowers. Feel the spirit of Rome.

Busy but worth a visit.. The Piazza has 3 fountains covered in wonderful detail and are even more amazing at night when the lights shine upon them. The atmosphere is wonderful with music from street vendors, caricature artists, picture sellers and varying groups of people in general. The sounds and the smells all come together to make this a place where you can go study each of the fountains and buildings in depth or just sit back and watch life go by. Eating there is very expensive so take to the side street ( Via de Pasquino) and get just as good food and service at much better prices.

Awe inspiring and entertaining. Three separate fountains with 3 unique themes, you could spend a long time here looking at the detail, watching the people and seeing all the cartoonists, not to be missed.

Wonderful feeling of life!. There is so much going on at the Piazza Navona that you can spend several hours there, just going around looking at the paintings at sale, listening to the bands playing (at least when we were there) or sit down on one of the somewhat overprized restaurant and have a drink. There are people from all over the world, combined with locals in a friendly, larger than world culture. We were more than overwhelmed, but then again: The sun was shining, the music was playing and it was the first day of our mini-vacation. We walked slowly through, stopped to look at some of the art, admired the obelisk and visited the church. Nice stop on our walk through the streets of Rome. Don't miss it!

Time to relax. Good seating in the piazza where you can relax and contemplate the architecture and fountains as well as people watch. There are a number of good cafes where you can enjoy a coffee and snack and there is a very good one in the museum at the end of the piazza.
you must see this when in Rome. ... so do go! It is pleasant and vivacious, full of restaurants and street artists, so well worth a visit. Very "Roman"!

Perfect late night stroll. Worth including on your walking tour of the city - just so beautiful. It was late at night when we visited so the impressive part for us was the fountain and architecture rather than the atmosphere.

Experience Italian Spirit at Piazza Navona. An evening at Piazza Navona is a must. Enjoy an authentic Italian dinner at one of many cafes. Dip your feet in one of the three fountains while having an ice cream cone. This is how you live.

Beautiful but expensive to eat. Agree with reviews that say this is worth a visit as beautiful fountains and lots going on with art. We fancied grabbing a table a one of the restaurants, opening a bottle of wine and soaking up the atmosphere and to reflect on our Colosseum tour but decided against it when viewing the menus and prices.... In the region of €25 + for a bottle of wine and €10.50 for a banana split !!! I appreciate that's 3 scoops of homemade ice-cream but when compared to paying €3 for 3 scoops in Trastevere where we were staying it seemed a bit pricey.

One of Rome's most famous piazzas.. A trip to rome wouldn't be complete without a visit to this piazza. Originally this was a chariot race track and the buildings have kept the shape surrounding it. Most famous now for it's beautiful fountains and street art.. It's full of painters and performers. There are many restaurants surrounding the piazza.. But I wouldn't recommend eating there as it's a complete tourist trap.. I'd cut through some of the side streets and explore behind the piazza. You'll find many great places to eat. During christmas time the piazza is also home to traditional christmas markets.

the most beautiful piazza in Rome. Always crowded and vivacious! Beautiful fountains and atmosphere all the time! Surrounded by restaurants and great artists - cartoonists! Shame is not one to make and take home as a souvenir!
great piazza. fantastic for people watching, street artists and performers, and the fountains are spectacular. Really busy at nights and on weekends- even in the rain

3 beautiful fountains!. This is definitely a place to go and see! There are 3 fountains across the square and each are beautiful, especially the one in the middle. The square is very lively and lots of restaurants to have bite to eat!

Lots to see. An unexpected pleasure. Our group tour had a short time here before a dinner nearby. It was such a lovely area with lots of people, restaurants, fountains, statues and just a great place to be.

Nice place walk through. Pretty fountain, plenty of restaurant options (tourist traps?) Spent a few minuets walking through. Not sure if it is something to go out of your way for, maybe at night it is more attractive.
Entertaining. Piazza Navona is a busy fun place with lots going on. Entertainers, Market stalls and plenty of cafes where you can sit and enjoy people watching.

A landmark not to be missed.. Very beautiful and full of character, outstanding sculptures. Street vendors and animation (musicians, men-statues, etc.). [Selfie sticks vendors seem to multiply, plague-like.]
A landmark not to be missed.

Did not give it enough time.. We walked round part of the Piazza, but as we were looking for the road through to the Pantheon, we did not spend enough time here. What we did see was impressive and as with some other places we definitely have a good reason to come back to Rome and do it properly.
Beautiful. We stumbled on this whilst walking to the Pantheon, came out of a small side street and there it was. Worth seeing.

A must see. Great place to eat with the many resteraunts around the piazza. The center is active with artists and performers. You can enjoy the action and pick up a coffee and pasterie or sit to watch it.

Not quite as I remember it. Last time I was in Rome, this place felt magical. Unfortunately, it seemed to have lost that. It felt as if the restaurants were thinner on the ground and there were hoards of "street sellers" peddling there rubbish. Still an impressive square.

Run! Run! Roma!. I had only a full day in Rome and I managed to go through the essentials on foot in Rome: http://wp.me/p5Lw9a-2 ...If you have a few more days in the city, I would definitely recommend you to purchase a Roma Pass. It gives you free access to many local museums and it saves you time looking for queues and lining in it. Leaving the Saint Peter’s Basilica, I saw the Castel Sant’ Angelo – again, the final stage of the book Angels and Demons. I just took a few pictures of the exterior and walked through the Ponte Sant’ Angelo across the Tevere River. Piazza Navona is only 15 minutes away. In the centre of the Piazza was the Fountain of the four Rivers with Egyptian obelisk (yet another key location of the story Angels and Demons), and I enjoyed some snacks and a cup of coffee in the nearby cafes and walked around the shops......

Domitian's Stadium. I was supposed to make my way to Castel Sant’ Angelo (Hadrian’s Tomb) and I did eventually. I took a wrong turn somewhere in Rome’s little alley like streets and ended up in Piazza Navona. Despite the warnings about the crowds in this Piazza, I got lucky, because the day I stumbled on it, it was almost empty. What an absolute gift for someone who enjoys photography. Piazza Navona is built on the site of the first century Stadium of Domitian, hence the oblong shape. This was an athletics and games venue rather than another blood soaked arena. During the medieval period the square was a market, the market was moved by Pope Innocent X when he decided to beautify the square he upset many traders in the process.The Palazzo Pamphili, which lines half of one side of the piazza was Pope Innocent X’s family residence, now it is the Brazilian Embassy and has been so since the 1920s. Around the edges are many cafes. On the opposite side of the piazza to Palazzo Pamphili is the Innocent X sponsored Chiesa Sant ‘Agnese in Agone, which is an imposing Baroque Church. Unfortunately the day I visited it was closed, more than likely for the lunch break.Along the north/south meridian are 3 fountains, one at either end and one in the middle. The oldest fountain in the piazza, Fontana del Nettuno, is situated at the northern (Vatican end). Originally, only the basin existed of this fountain as it was the neighbourhood supply of water for drinking and washing, as house plumbing became available, public fountains for this purpose were no longer required. The Italian way to beautify something that is practical but has outlived its purpose like this fountain, is to add an amazing statue or 2 or 3, more often of mythical gods or creatures and create a work of art. Fontana del Nettuno was created over a 300 year period from the 1570s, so therefore the statues were carved by different artists. The fountain takes its name from Neptune in the centre wrestling an octopus; he’s surrounded by sea horses, merpeople and cherubs.At the southern end is Fontana del Moro – the basin and the statue of the Moor at the centre of the fountain were designed by Bernini, the four tritons added a couple of hundred years later to create visual balance with Fontana del Nettuno.The last fountain to be added to the piazza was Fontana del Quattro Fiume which is a very large fountain in the middle of the Piazza. Designed by Bernini and sponsored by Pope Innocent X, it was unveiled in 1651; apparently it was very unlike other fountains already in existence in Rome. This fountain has many allegory and metaphors contained within its four larger than life river gods, who represented the major rivers on the four known continents. • The Danube representing Europe. The largest European river nearest to Rome, hence why the Pope’s personal coat of arms touch the river god.• The Nile represented Africa; this river god has his head covered indicating that the scholars hadn’t yet found the source of the Nile.• The Ganges represents the Asian continent, has an oar, indicating that it was possible to navigate the river.• The Rio de la Plata river god sits on a pile of coins indicating the riches that came to Europe from the Americas.The statues semi recline on chunks of marble, which are built up in the centre to create a platform for an obelisk to rest on. Rising from the centre of the fountain, the obelisk is topped with the Pamphili dove of peace. The underside of the obelisk platform creates a grotto. The sculptures on this incredible fountain were all completed by different artists but create an integrated scene. Take your time to walk around the fountain and really observe what’s in front of you; the fountain is so much more than just the river gods. Stop and listen to the melody of the flowing water and let its sound sooth you.The day I visited the piazza a terrific jazz band were playing, there were a couple of other street entertainers including a very interesting “faceless man” who was quite comical, an Indian “meditating man” who was very much interested in encouraging people’s donations, artists; some who could do a fabulous portrait in about 15 minutes, others specialised in various themes.If Piazza Navona looks familiar maybe it's because it featured in the movie Angels and Demons.What I found interesting is yes, it has 3 fountains, all with different themes, sculpted by different artists, yes, they’re amazing but for all the hype I enjoyed other Piazzas in Rome more.

Luv, luv this place!!. Well, me and friends decided to walk to Piazza Navona from I dunno where the bus drops us in Rome...our luck brought us to Pantheon. Then it's a short walk to Piazza Navona. This place is just beautiful..the water fountain is just amazing, like any other water fountain in Rome..since it's end of summer, the sky is clear blue and pictures here are among the best I have in my collection

Most Beautiful Square in Rome. When in Rome, you cannot afford to miss it. A carefully planned visit should always have this as stop in Rome. Small, with many tourists, just a walk away from other important spots.
People watch. Nice Piazza to have a coffee and watch or have a gelato.Lots of artists who will draw you if you want. Fountain was impressive.

Crowds. . If you have/are an attraction. You want to attract crowds! That stands to reason!The Navona is beautiful. No question. But you share its beauty with a gazillion tourists so be prepared. The restaurants may be fab. But they could also be mere tourist traps. I didn't take the chance!In Rome its best to eat at a distance from popular tourist spots

A real movie setting. A popular attraction, made even more popular by Dan Brown's novel "Angels and Demons" and made into a movie. Unlike the movie where it is a night scene where the Piazza is deserted in the day time it is very crowded with many tourists as well as men selling various items from souvenirs to hand bags and paintings. The main landmarks here are the famous fountain of four rivers in the center, the two lesser fountains at either ends, and the Church of St. Agnes. Unfortunately we could not enter the church as it was closed. (Many churches in Rome closes from 12Noon to 3pm). The piazza is surrounded by many restaurants which are full of people enjoying food and drink sitting outside. For me personally it is a bit too crowded, though the setting was charming.

Good stop after long walk. Nice square with lots of bar and restaurants. Good for a stop after a long walk around the area with the beautiful architecture! I particularly like the food market just behind it for some local spieces.
Pretty little square. Nice little shops, pretty area, not tons to do, but a great little walk and view. We spent about 45 minutes strolling in the area.

Piazza Navona. Piazza Navona is Rome’s most famous square with lots of cafes and restaurants. The central fountain at the Piazza is Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi is a masterpiece by Bernini. Each figure in the fountain represents four great rivers – Nile, Ganges, Danube and Plate.

Great atmosphere, great place to people watch. Took a leisurely stroll here on a Sunday. Really lovely atmosphere of people just walking to listing to the live bands in the square, taking photos by the fountains or sitting in one of the many cafes for coffee or a bite to eat. The square is close to The Pantheon and there are lovely side streets to walk around and lap up the atmosphere of Rome. I visited in February and the weather was mild but the atmosphere was still great. I imagine this is a very popular place in the Summer.
Fun Place. The fountains here are beautiful. The piazza is a gathering place with various street performers, vendors, artists and dining.A "bucket list" location that can be done for free.

Beautiful Piazza. We spent a week in Rome and visited here 3 times, it's great for a coffe or ice cream. This is one place also where genuine artists sell their work, we bought a lovely acrylic on canvas.

The Covent Garden of Rome. A lovely square with restaurants around the outside. Music playing, art etc being sold on the square itself and street performers a plenty. Lovely little spot with a good atmosphere.

Great Spot. This is a really underrated spot of the city. Because the Trevi Fountain is under construction, the fountain in Piazza Navona makes up for it. The architecture and the open space of the piazza really make the location picturesque and pleasing. Also, there are plenty of restaurants and gelato places. Highly recommend.

Very nice place to relax and enoy Rome. The piazza is a very nice and beautiful place to relax in and enjoy Rome. The fountain is very pretty and so are the surrounding buildings. There are also numerous restaurants and ice cream parlours off the Piazza. Water fountains can also be found at the ends of the square which makes for an easy refreshing drink. The church is also very nice inside. If you are in Rome I would fully recommend taking a trip to the Piazza Navona.

spectacular Square!. The squares are a special attraction in Rome. Despite the signs of the streets not help find it, it is worth insisting as it is a spectacle. With three beautiful fountains and full of tourists and artists, is a very beautiful place to fiicar, taking a coffee or an ice cream ... spectacular Square!

My favourite piazza in Rome. Visited Rome and Piazza Navona this February with my family. It's a great place to sit and watch the world go by. This baroque square has beautiful buildings and surroundings. Sit and enjoy a gelato whilst you people watch!

Fantastic sculptures. These fountains are something special to see, I went out for a walk on a cold evening and came across this square and I'm glad I did, I took the chance to go into a cafe and have a nice hot drink, I was surprised to see just how many people were out on a night like this and even some street traders, it was a great experience and look forward to coming again on an evening with better weather. This is a fantastic place to visit

Iconic Roman square. We visited here in October 2013. This popular square is laid out on the ruins of an arena built in AD86 which seated 33,000 people to watch the athletic contests that took place here. It then operated as the city's main market for 300 years after the 15th century. It is filled with baroque palazzi, extravagant fountains, pavement cafes, and crowds of people. The famous Bernini Fountain of the Four Rivers dominates the centre of the square, depicting the Nile, Ganges, Danube and Plate - the only known continents at that time. The Nile's veiled head indicates the unknown source of this river at the time. The fountain is decorated with a palm tree, lion, horse and on obelisk on the top. The other 2 fountains date from the 16th century but have been altered several times since then. At the northern end of the piazza is the Neptune Fountain built in 1576 but the statues of Neptune and the Nereids date from the 19th century. At the southern end is the Moro Fountain to which Bernini added the statue of a Moor fighting a dolphin. The various seasons bring in the street entertainers and the stalls selling toys and sweets. The piazza, up until the 19th century, used to be filled with water in August by stopping the fountain outlets and the rich would ride around in carriages with street urchins splashing after them.

Great spot to people watch. We walked to this area after an afternoon visiting the Vatican. It was a great spot to sit with a glass of wine or a coffee and people watch. There are beautiful fountains, street entertainers and restaurants all along this city square.

Great Theatre. Apart from the wonderful square and the three fountains this seems to attract a lot of street entertainers, whilst we could not guarantee that you will be entertained as well as we were its certainly worth a shot and not to far from great places to eat in the small streets around and minutes from the Pantheion
Jeff Wilkins

Lovely Square. Didnt eat or drink in the area so cannot comment on the prices. Wandered around the fountains and seen a wonderful display of local artists and on the spot caricatures if you like that kind of thing. Can be frustrating with people selling scarfs as they can be very overbearing and pushy affecting the relaxing environment.

A great place to relax and enjoy the sunshine. This was kind of the high points of our stay as we enjoyed wandering the area without fighting queues of people at the great monuments of Rome. A great place for a coffee or a bite to eat.

Famous, but expensive and poor food. This is a gorgeous piazza, but aside from the architecture and fountains? It's too crowded, extortion level overpriced, and has even poorer restaurant service. Hello...35$ USD for a 3 ounce coffee? 11$ for gelato? Who is dumb enough to pay that?? Go a few blocks in any direction, and you will find 200 reasonably priced, family restaurants with wonderful food and fantastic service.

La Fontana Dei Quattro Fiumi. A beautiful fountain with statues of the four river gods who represent for the four major rivers of the four continents. Make sure you walk all the way around slowly to see all the details, such as the horses head at one end and its rear at the other. Same for a lion. The obelisk on top came from site called Circus of Maxentius which is on the Appia Way.

Great Piazza. Liked this piazza and probably enjoyed the fountain more because the Trevi fountain was closed for renovation. We had a meal at one of the many restaurants there which was overpriced for what you get. But it was great to people watch from, saw a fellow walking his pig on a lead which was unusual. Not sure if there are usually little market shops there because there had been a huge downpour of rain before we arrived.
Super place. Lovely place and very delicious food! Bravo! Want to come back again! It is very cozy place for couples as well!

Excellent historic construction. Definitely worth a visit to see this excellent statue, you will need to search a little to find it as it is surrounded by historic buildings. Don't forget your camera!!
Nice place for child to run free. There was really nice breeze during a hot day's walkabout around places... I just dont understand that Egyptian obelisk in catholic country.. some dark secrets?
Piazza Navona. Lots happening at all times. I ran through the piazza in the morning when nobody was around which was an amazing sight. Nice restaurants and artists are nearby.

This is what I pictured when thinking of Rome. Very cute square. We almost passed it up when exploring, but found it and fell in love! Worth the visit. Great place to people watch and enjoy a scoop or two ;) of gelato. Tip... Try to eat outside of the square. The restaurants are touristy and high priced. Anther tip... There are water fountains everywhere from an under water system they have in Rome. Don't throw away our water bottle! Fill up when you see one, they had a few here in the square.

Magical. I recommend the agenda I did on my first night in Rome. I knew I would be very tired, flying from the States, but excited. I got to my hotel about 2:00 pm and had a " disco nap". I got up around 7:00 pm and crossed the street from the Atlantico Hotel near Termini station, to pick up the evening bus tour of the fountains. The luxury tour bus left us off at Piazza Novona. I wandered to a restaurant right across from this great fountain. I ordered a wonderful dinner and just watched all the endless street entertainment. I absolutely loved it. It was everything I imagined and more.
Beautiful. A beautiful pizza with buskers, bustle a n d loads of cafe's. Amazing fountains and architecture and all so old,but breathtakingly beautiful!!

What's not to love?. Such a pretty little spot . Great place to people watch shop and eat. It's a bit of a tourist trap, restaurants are definitely overpriced. Although if you are Looking for atmosphere this is a great place to be and to take in the essence of Rome. Great place for pictures, not to mention the beautiful fountains ..gorgeous!

Piazza Navona. I live in Rome. It happens that I cross this place about 3 times per week. I think that it's one of the most beautiful places/sqares in the world!! Read about the fountain, you will discover amazing stories !!

Usual stop in Rome. I have enjoyed piazza navona for years. Love to sit at a cafe and enjoy coffee or wine as long as the weather is good. The people are wonderful and everyone is having a great time. Should not be missed.

Plenty to do. Piazza navonna if a wonderful place to go to just hangout or if you want a nice dinner. The piazza is centrally locate near pantheon and trevi fountain we spent a lot of nites here would go back there when we return plenty of restaurants and cafes greT people eat hing spot
FOUNTAINS AND FOOD. Go see this piazza both during the day and night. The fountain at night is beautiful. Lots of cafes to eat.

A great place to see. A nice place to see attractive fountain and nice little shops and restaurants we sat and had food and some coffee for a few hours and enjoyed the music being played on the square was a bit cold but we still had our portrait drawn by a street artist

Pricey. Soak up the atmosphere and enjoy the street performers. Treat yourself to an overpriced drink at sunset before moving on somewhere more reasonable for dinner! Worth the visit despite the prices!

beautiful faountains !. If you visit here, you have to know a bit of history about these fountain.
It will make you more interesting to visit gere !
Lovely place in Rome.

Underwhelming and expensive. Full of over-priced restaurants/bars. Fountain was surrounded by people trying to sell you selfie sticks and fake handbags. Give it a miss and head to the Pantheon instead. Much nicer piazza there.

Nice but O.K.. The first time we saw Piazza Navona, we were very happy to see a beautiful European square. The fountain is beautiful but there just isn't a lot to see and we didn't spend much time there. It's a great place to go to people watch but if you're there to see the sights, don't spend much time.

Could have easily missed this..... in fact we walked straight past it and I said "oh, that could have been the temple of hercules!" & it was. So often do you walk past ruins/something of interest in Rome - that's what is so amazing!

A great place to sit and take it all in. A busy little square where we sat and had a cappuccino while taking in all the atmosphere. We travelled in December and it was chilly but didn't stop us from having a portrait drawn by a street artist while we were there.Beautiful fountains and just a wonderful place to spend an hour or so browsing through the little shops and some nice little cafes for a light lunch.

Beautiful Plazza and Great Location for Area Restaurants. This is a beautiful plazza with big fountains and a pleasant place to sit, rest and watch people after a day of walking around the tourist sites. I can't recommend eating at the restaurants directly around the plazza but if you wonder beyond, a couple of blocks down the small winding streets, you will find numerous small local restaurants that are great eating for reasonable prices. My wife and I used this location as our point of reference for locating great eats in the neighborhood. I'd recommend Osteria dell Anima and Antica Taverna for lunch or dinner.

very pretty but spoiled by the sellers..... This square was lovely, but was spoiled by the number of sellers of the phone tripod extenders. Really needed the police there to sort it out. Every two or three seconds you were pounced upon.
Must be summer to enjoy. Huge squre which is best enjoyed in warm weather and all the students, artists and painters. Paid visit in cold weather, and didn't really enjoy this.

Beautiful!. What a wonderful Piazza, built on a roman stadium part of which you can still see in a couple of museums either end of the square, watch out for pricey restaurants in the square, although it is nice to sit and watch the world go by....

Lovely square full of life. Plenty of shops, restaurants, great for people watching.
The square also has stalls of beautiful paintings (some prints some originals) and people busking and playing music to give it a great atmosphere.

Fantastic restaurants and people watching. My husband and I loved Piazza Navona, we had a front row seat at the restaurant, where we sat drinking wine and watching the world go by. It is truly a beautiful place to sit and relax. There is quite a lot going on in the piazza so there is always something to entertain you, from the mimes, to the carabinieri chasing away the handbag sellers.

A Happy Square !. I spent 5 days in Rome, in La mongolfiera rooms near Piazza Navona, so I know very well this beautiful place! I liked the peaceful atmosphere of the square in the morning, with a lot of birds arround, disturbed only by the first artists coming and preparing their instruments for drawing / painting or singing. Slowly the market was filled with tourists eager to capture in photography the beauty of church architecture, the statue monuments, the Fantines. But Piazza belongs primarily to the children, who enjoy the peace and beauty of this wonderful place! Children make this place so Happy!!!

Worth a visit. We took a bus to Piazza Navona to see the beautiful sculptures in the fountains. There were also Christmas street markets, with performers and the ubiquitous selfie stick sellers hanging about, too. Definitely worth a visit!

Largest living room in Rome. Piazza Navona is THE open air place in Rome in the opinion of me and my family. On a bright and sunny winter day (where the temperatures crept up to around 14 C (close to 60 F)) this is still the place to be.Granted, that many of the restaurants and café's has less outside serving place than closer to spring, but the absolutely wonderful thing about Rome (and Italy in general) is that as soon as the sun is out, everybody flocks to the outside serving areas to bask in the sun and enjoy a drink or lunch outside.Piazza Navona is no exception - and the place - a converted horse track from roman time is a beautiful place, with one of the best-known fountains in Rome - the Fountain of the Four Rivers by Gian Lorenzo Bernini. Which of the four statues is which river, I'll leave to you to decide.The two lesser known fountains is at the southern end; Fontana del Moro with a basin and four Tritons sculpted by Giacomo della Porta and at the northern end is the Fountain of Neptune also created by Giacomo della Porta.The usual crowd of street salesmen, buskers, more or less talented street performers is always present - so you can stay entertained for hours. In the small streets leading away from Piazza Navona is a wonderful collection of touristy shops and the Roman everyday stores.Even when you walk the streets in the most touristy areas, normal people lives here - which makes Rome such a wonderful place to visit.Highly recommendable!!

A must see. Near to the Pantheon another super open space. Lots of places to sit benches or round the fountains to just let the world go by. The fountains are superb and the four rivers fountain very impressive. Nice break from the traffic.
Fun fun!. Piazza is fun and busy! We love to walk around in here and people watch! Also, one of our favorite restaurants while in Rome is located here, Tri Scalani!

Magical at Night. This was a fantastic place to sit and eat gelato at night. The fountain is breath-taking! We strolled through here after dinner on our way back to the hotel. Great souvenir shops around and nice cafes, although we didn't eat at them. This is part of the "Heart of Rome" walk listed in Rick Steve's pocket guide of Rome and honestly, my favorite night in Rome. We ate just round the corner in a quiet cove. Explore the piazza, take in the sites, and relax!

Wondered Into a Lovely Square. Took so many pictures here, enjoyed the lively atmosphere, the fountain and architecture. Even got a lovely picture of a winter flower box on a terrace above the square that is one of my favorite pictures from our trip. This square was part of our own walk (wonder) about to discover the city, before guided tours. This was well worth the hours of walking finding wonderful little cafes with snacks and outstanding coffee shops along the way.

Lovely piazza with fun shopping. We stayed near this piazza so spent quite a bit of time walking through it. Sometimes it was filled with tourists taking selfies, caricaturists, fake bags and painters and other times it was a quiet and serene. Either way, it's a fun experience. Lots of campos to stop and have a drink or bite and souvenir shops. Very central to all sites so a good place to relax and take in the view of the beautiful fountain!
Beauty. Simply my favourite place in Rome. It is so beautiful and has got really unique atmosphere with the church, the fountains and the little restaurants and cafés around them. Loved it!
Fun. The piazza is surrounded by nice restaurants and shops. Go to the Sant Agnese (church in the plaza) and buy some souvenirs, much cheaper than the Vatican area.
Dinner or .... Nice place for a dinner, lunch or drink and as always in Roma you´re never alone. Some nice smaller piazzas around the corner so don´t miss the walk in the neighbourhood

A great place. One of the most beautiful places in Rome.the fountain with the statues which symbolize the four major rivers of the whole world.if you visit piazza Navona at night ,it is really romantic!
Great. The architecture here is brilliant and the Piazza is a real talking point for all who experience this place.

very romantic. It is like an italian sister of Plaza Mayor from Madrid. Same type of monumens, of fontains, of athmosphere. Impressive, elegant, romantic, you can stay there entire day and can't be full of it.
Lovely place but too crowded!. Very nice to pass through, atmospheric, but very touristy and too many people! Restaurants were very pricey for poor quality!

Dolce vita at Piazza Navona. While I was imagining Andrey Hepburn and Gregory Peck on a scooter/vespa fast ride through Rome from movie "Holiday in Rome", I found myself at Piazza Navona. Its four fountains, surrounded by beautiful churches and palaces, are considered great works of art. Beauty and richness of baroque opened in front of my eyes. This lovely square is very Roman place - the life swells here. La Fontana dei Quattro Fiume, made by a famous artist Bernini, is situated in the center of the Piazza.This fountain is made of four fabulous sculptures symbolizing four rivers - the Danube, the Nile, the Ganges and the Rio de la Plata and of a grand Egyptian obelisk. The powerful sculptures in motion, full of dynamics and emotions, make some kind of drama for spectators. You have feeling as if you are watching a theatrical performance. Obviously, Bernini has given something of his passion to his sculptures. The liveliness of the sculptures that belong to all fountains at the square, bring into action space around them, and at the same time, create harmony with the water. The water animates and decorates the sculptures. Some of fountains have allegorical meanings, some of them have mythological devotion. I have admired all these adorable fountains with undisguised pleasure. While I was sitting at cafe at Piazza Navona and was watching tourists passing by and taking photos around fountains, I could see anyone wasn't like Andrey Hepburn or Gregory Peck, or close enough them. Maybe, someone of today's celebrities will appear at the Piazza Navona during your stay.So, take a seat at nearby cafe, order a capuccino, pretend as if you are laid-back Italians, and give way to your feelings of dolce vita!
Just beautiful. One of the most beautiful urban spaces you'll ever come across. Not just the fountain, but the whole piazza is a work of art.

Favorite Piazza in all of Rome. This is where you ahould all just sit and watch "the world go by". This is an amazing spot just to hang out and enjoy the Bernini fountains. If you happen to be there during Christmas make sure you head here at night for the amazing light show!

This is one of our favorite Rome attractions. There is SO much beauty to be found here. Our last visit even included a most beautiful blonde mime! She remained motionless until small children ventured close- then broke character to smile & hug them. Take time to enjoy all of the fountains!

Nice place to walk through!. We walked through here on our way to the Pantheon and it was nice to take in the piazza and the lovely water fountains.We didn't spend much time as we got a couple of pictures commented on the architecture and moved on.I can imagine people sit and take in the atmosphere at the near by coffee shop for some time.
Lovely. Very romantic , the heart of Rome ,I think as an architect that Rome is one of the most beautiful cities in the whole world,must see
Away from Madding crowds. We loved the area around the Piazza Navona. Less crowds, beautiful narrow streets, unique boutiques and trattorias. Eclectic and interesting clothing and jewellery as well.
The nicest place in Rome. The square with soul, wondertful fountains and old buildings, restaurants. Full of smiling lovely people. Could stay many hours and enjoy the live. Must visit it

Great Piazza!. We stayed just around the corner from the Piazza Novana. It was a great Piazza, very busy (even in the 'slow' season). Lots of attractions especially with the locals and their pop up shops. Great cafe's and restaurants surrounding the main fountain. Definitely recommend going to visit.

Perfect Piazza!!. The Piazza Navona is the perfect place to chill and people watch, with a coffee,beer or glass of vino in hand and watch the world go by. Beautiful fountains and Renaissance style buildings surround the Piazza with plenty of restaurants to choose from. However, be prepared, it is very expensive to eat or drink here. This part of Rome is well worth a visit.
Really worth seeing. Rome has many places like this and each one is worth seeing.I have seen most of Rome so I know what you should see.AS MUCH AS YOU CAN.Go and see its well worth a visit

lovely place for an evening stroll. Found ourselves here while walking around looking for Trevi Fountain. Just sat on the bench and kept soaking the ambience. Street artists, performers, fountains, stunning architecture, beautiful cafes, lovely people-

Over rated. Not sure why this piazza is so famous. Yes it has a nice fountain in the middle but there is lots of open space with nothing happening around it. There are a handful of expensive tourist cafes around the piazza but not much else.

A must place to visit. One of the great places in Rome ! The fountain and statues are amazing - each time you go you will see something you did not spot before ! We have been in June and January and loved it both times. The restaurants here can be expensive but stroll in to a side street to find a gem a little cheaper.

Our most favorite Piazza in Rome: Piazza Navona. From the Piazza di Spagna (Spagna Metro), we took to the charming shop-fronted streets, and walked all the way to Piazza Navona. If you’ve done your share of walking already, there’s the bus option, with stop just outside the piazza.During our 3-week stay in Rome, this was our most favorite piazza. Charming for its spaciousness, iconic fountains (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi by Bernini, Fontana del Moro, and the Fountain of Neptune), and its many shops and restaurants, this was a perfect spot to spend a full afternoon. The 17th-century Baroque church, Sant’ Agnes in Agone, faces onto Piazza Navona. The pantheon is just a short walk away. My attached video shows some of the charms of this piazza.http://youtu.be/8OMqdp4yjCc

Well worth the visit. We asked our tour guide to take us anywhere she felt was worthwhile seeing and this was one of the places she selected. Rome is filled with beautiful buildings and fountains and this is amongst one of the prettiest we saw.

Can't say enough good stuff. I am a foodie and wine person. As such, the options hat the Piazza Navona are great. The only possible downside is the number of people. Rome is a very social place.....if you do not like lots of people I might not pick this place to vacation. But, if you like social places go!!! This is my fav place to visit. I have been to Rome 6 times, and this trip was by far the best.
Place to be in good weather. In the warm weather this place is buzzing, lots of restaurants to choose from but all with a premium because of the location, lots of little side streets to explore.

Lovely!. An iconic site of Rome and for good reason. It's a lovely Piazza - one of the nicest squares I've visited in Europe - surrounded by some great buildings. The two fountains are quite splendid and, of course, the square is lined with restaurants and cafes. (These are obviously expensive and not top quality, but that's to be expected and still a good place to spend a while watching people pass by, the street entertainers and enjoy seeing them deal with the ubiquitous blokes selling selfie-sticks and the like.) The streets around the Piazza have some reasonable cafes, gelateria (Grom is particularly good) and the like and it's a great place from which to explore the surrounding attractions.
Beautiful fountain. This was one of the prettiest fountains in Rome. Great place to meet people and people watching and it's even better at night

Exceeds Expectations!!!. Our trip to Italy exceeded all our expectations and Piazza Navona was no exception. The history of the place was exciting enough, but add to that the beauty of the churches, buildings and fountain....and you have it all. Very quaint coffee shops and pizzerias with outside seating so you don't miss all that's happening. There are artists in the square, performers, animal acts. You will see the elderly feeding flocks of pigeons with pieces of bread. Make sure to go into the churches. The architecture, statues and stained glass are awe-inspiring. This is one for my "bucket list". I would go back in a heartbeats!
Charming square. One of the greatest places in Rome, with the iconic Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi in the middle. Superb place to meet, there are plenty of restaurants around.
Must See. This is a must see place i Rome.Bernini´s beautyful fontaine is a visit worth. Very beautyful in night too.
a good square. a nice square to take a walk with its fountain that makes it so beautiful.you can enjoy a coffee it the shops around and enjoy the view!!
Amazing sights. Amazing sights to see within the square so much room to say it's in the middle of a busy city, always had something going on to interest you and keep you occupied!
Heart of Rome. Great place to sit and soak in Rome! Fountains, people, street art, performers, gelato and food. Nice at night and the day.

Never boring!. Piazza Navona is the hub of Rome full of attractions...not only is there a wonderful church full of Borromini art but also other churches nearby, Also, the fountains, especially Berninis statues are fabulous! It captures your heart since it represents the known world at that time with four major rivers from each continent! Every angle speaks to your imagination encouraging it to never stop dreaming! There are always venders nearby so life is buzzing besides having super cafes and a very interesting museum at the end of the piazza...life is vibrant here and not for those who don't want to be excited and dream of ancient days! Please enjoy and when I go to Rome I always go there to warm my heart and remember how life should be!

Nice place to take a walk. Nice piazza in Roma. There are plenty of shops and restaurants and Fridays nights are busy with people selling hand painted(bad quality!!) singing etc. Nice to just sit down and have some drinks or have some light lunch/dinner. Good area to spend few hours. Interesting shops around here so it is worth a visit.

Wonderful piazza, with three beautiful fountain with sculptures. Wonderful piazza, with three beautiful fountain with sculptures. Piazza Navona is really a unique place, to visit and experience. Very close to the rest of the "meraviglie" of the center of Rome. You can easily walk all these historical beauties. I love to do it a night time. It is magic.

My Favorite Piazza. One of my favorite places in Rome. During the summertime it is much busier and the best gelato in Rome can be found there.
