In the Winter you can enjoy the piazza without the crowds. If you visit the palace you can sneak a peek out of one of the windows looking over Piazza Navona, for a spectacular view. This is where the postcard picks are taken from.
Must visit while in Rome.. This piazza and the fountains are just beautiful. Grab some gelato and a bench and enjoy the view. Its a beautiful area to stroll through.

Not Just Any Public Square. The Piazza Navona is an historic Roman square which fascinating. The main attraction of Piazza Navona is the trio of fountains that adorn the square. But another highlight here is the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone. All are a must to see.

Favorite spot in Rome. The Piazza is amazing, boasting three fountains of incredible sculptures, all in one place. But what makes the Navonna so special is that there are side streets bleeding off of every corner of the Piazza, each taking you in the direction of different neighborhoods. The family nightlife of the Navonna is welcoming and second only to the after hours scenes at the multitude of restaurants and bars on the side streets just to the west of the Navonna. No better place to mingle with post college graduate Romans after hours.
GREAT PLACE FOR DRINKS. The Piazza is beautiful just go there for enjoying a drink or a coffee but do not go for a meal or you will be served micro haven wormed up foods......

Beautiful piazza. I went to piazza Navona with friends and we all got some kind of special feeling.. we felt like we're in a movie. It is beautiful. There are lots of restaurants and a lot of people. Everything in Rome is amazing but this piazza is really beautiful! We had a lunch there and of course the prices are a little bit bigger then in some other areas but I would still recommend it, because the feeling of just sitting there and watching people is amazing!

the hidden treasure. piazza navona springs a wonderful surprise. as soon as one enters the square one is awestruck by the magnificent and regal stucture. the rippling aquamarine pool and ooh and aahs of the tourists complement each other. it has the "fountain of four rivers" by bernini. i was thrilled to know that the indian river Ganga is one of them.the new painters flock to this place to capture its beauty on canvas. we also saw an 80 year old young man attracting the tourists and the police by dancing and miming.the cafes around it add to the charm and feed yummy risotto and pizzas.

Got to see. Not one but two splendid fountains and lots of beautiful architecture. This one is not so crowded as some other places and there's lots of nice cafes and restaurants around to breathe the atmosphere in.

Great Piazza!!!. My wife and I spent a good amount of time at Piazza Navona each day, just soaking up as much of the Italian lifestyle as we could. From people singing just to sing, to seeing marriage proposals in the Piazza, it was a great place to just sit and relax, people watch, and enjoy the city of life that is Rome. There's a nice little shop a stones throw away that sells pasta, sauces, cheeses, and limoncello. Stop in there to pick up a few things and just sit and enjoy the piazza. The one thing I will not recommend, however, is having a meal there. The restaurants have very tourist-centric menus with very tourist-centric prices. You can walk 10 minutes away and get a lot more for a lot less.

Love it! Dont miss Caravaggio in the church nearby. The piazza is worth every minute you spend there! Don’t miss the nearby Church of San Luigi dei Francesi (Piazza San Luigi de' Francesi): It features amazing art by Caravaggio.
A place to feel totally European!. Enjoy a coffee in this beauutiful place and you will feel as though you are an extra in a Hollywood film. Completely beautifuland truely Roman!
It's allright.... We strolled through the Piazza, seen the fountains and didn't notice things we hadn't seen elsewhere. Don't get the fuzz of this place to be honest...

Easily my favourite Piazza. This is (in my eyes) truly the best Piazza in Rome. It's not too busy, there is some lovely architecture around the edges of the piazza, and the fountains in the middle are magnificent. Obviously it is cobbled, giving the authentic Roman atmosphere.But the best feature is Domiziano, a lovely little cafe from which you can sit and observe all the square while sipping an espresso, which by the way are divine. I wouldn't recommend eating here because it's a little pricey, but for a little stop to replenish your energy after walking, I can't think of anywhere better!

Lovely for a stroll but don't eat here.. Built on the ruins of an old Roman sports track and crowned with the seldom-opened Basilica of Sant Agnese, Piazza Navona is the quintessential place for a Roman stroll. True Scalini, famous for it's ice crean novel, the Tartuffo is here, so enjoy a dessert but avoid all the restaurants here like the plague. You will never find a Roman in these touristy haunts where the drinks are overpriced and the food, including the pizza, (yes, the pizza) is often frozen. A good Roman lunchtime or dinner is too precious to waste on one of these touristic caffes.
JUST TAKE A STROLL. Just take a stroll and watch the people and the street theatre it is absolutely amazing there is so much to see and its all free
Good for food. Great little place to stay for food if a little grubby after the local markets. Lots of nice little restaurants dotted around though.

Beautiful. This is a beautiful piazza and a must see. The cafes at the side of the piazza are expensive, but that is to be expected. However, when my friends and I went (in july) they had fans that sprayed water vapour over us. It was lovely and refreshing.

Great Piazza with things to do in the area. This is a great piazza with fountains and several great places to eat in the area. If you're there during the holidays there is a great holiday market with carnival games and food. There's also a merry-go-round during the holidays.

Nothing to do. I went there. The place is huge and nice.
However, I managed to sit and chill for only 15 minutes. There was really nothing to do unless you want to eat.

A gathering place with a rest.. The piazza was once a racetrack. A look on Google Earth makes it clear. An afternoon in Rome for me starts at the Trevi Fountain, continues with as pause at the Pantheon, and ends with a stop and dinner at Piazza Navona. This is almost a straight path across the city and the reward is the vista of the crowds, displays and restaurants of the piazza. The fountains are the center piece with the artists, buskers, and vendors providing a garnishing accent. No matter how crowded, there is always an air of joy and celebration. A restful end to the day's activities is dinner at one of the open air restaurants in or around the piazza.

Lovely square with cafes. This square is usually crowded and has three fountains with lovely caffes and many artists doing caricatures. It is lesser known compared to Trevi Fountain, colloseum etc but is actually larger and more relaxed, without people shoving and pushing and getting in the way when taking photographs. Good for an afternoon of relaxation

Wonderful Square. This large and beautiful square in the heart of the old city contains three wonderful fountains surrounded by stately buildings, Not nearly as active as other, better known Piassas, that is part of the beauty of this more remote place so close to the centers of tourism. Take a break and wander over from the Pantheon. It is on,y a five minute walk, but you will be surprised at the difference.

has really gone downhill. This Piazza has turned into a tourist-only enclave of overprice eateries and carnival booths. Some interesting architecture and the main fountain earn it 2 stars. Not worth a visit.

beautiful architecture. Piazza Navona is a beautiful square with many small stalls and shops around. It has the four river fountains which is beautifully architecture. The square is surrounded by big beautiful buildings with beautiful structures and architectures. This is a hang out place for many tourists. It is extremely popular and very crowded in December. The Pantheon is just a few minutes walk away. There are a few fountains in this piazza. Happy place to be in, atmosphere is great. There is also a carousel for kids to have some fun.
Stunning Piazza in the heart of Rome. Not to be missed, the famous Piazza Navona, 3 magnificent fountains, many superb restaurants and a very large open space for people just to meet and relax.

First stop in Rome so amazing even if somewhat kitsch/touristy. First stop in Rome so it was amazing to be here.Plaza itself is touristy and the most imposing building is an Embassy (?) fronting the Piazza. Wouldn't bother to eat or drink here, much better places nearby.So, not anywhere near a highlight for us but you come for the fountains, which are over the top, hilarious, and makes you realise you are in Rome as only in Rome.The Four Rivers fountain - make sure you know the rivers so it makes sense - makes it more enjoyable.It is an open space and reasonably large but otherwise that's about it for us. It was a space we passed through a couple of times but that was about it.But, it did set us up for the amazing sights we were to see over the next few days.

This is it. My favorite place to hang our and people watch in Rome. The statues, fountains, Domitian's obelisk (almost shipped off to London) the mix of old Roman, renaissance and baroque creates an atmosphere, an intensity that you cannot forget. It is magical during the day but perhaps even more so at night with all the lights on. I've never been bothered by the tourists or vespas. The waiters can be snooty and the chianti overpriced but it is well worth it. And the coffee is good - as expected in this country that worships food.

Beautiful Plaza!. The Trevi Fountain was closed for repairs during our visit on January 7, 2014 so we decided to walk to this Plaza. The fountains are so beautiful and the church is worth a stop as well. We dined at a nearby restaurant, Taverna Antonini, and had a wonderful lunch with excellent service and delicious pasta.
Beautiful. stunning place lots of stalls and cafes and street art! Beautiful by night as well, the four river fountain is wow and either end of plaza there is two more fountains stunning area in Rome

love it. we chanced upon the Piazza last time we went but it has forever stuck in my mind. So when deciding whether to go back to Rome or try somewhere new my mind was swayed when I heard someone on the radio saying they "loved to sit on an Roman piazza sipping an espresso watching the world go by". It took me straight to Navona. Some people may prefer smaller quieter piazza's but it's just what tugs at the heart strings and Navona does that for me

Piazza Navona. Loved this place. Our hotel was right next to it. It has wonderful food, beautiful fountains and architecture and great shopping. There is also a place within piazza navona that does great gelato (my personal favorite was the mint chocolate chip). Short walk from this to the Pantheon, so I definitely recommend it.

Loved it. The fountain is great to look at and gives an interesting look at the perception of the world at the time it was sculpted. Bernini was the architect Rome and his genius is more apparent in this piazza than anywhere else.

Great place to eat and shop. A must see. Great for shopping . I bought a beautiful leather handbag for around $100.00. One I would not find in USA. Great food,too. What can I say. Everything is good in Italy. I have been there for four times.
A wonderful place. A fantastic piazza of classical proportions. Just the fabulous fountains are worth the visit. Take it easy and stroll, like the natives do.

O what a night. Stayed in piazza navona with family to bring in the new year.we went out earlier for a glass of fizz, then went back to the families luxurious palace apartment overlooking the fountain of the 4 rivers on the piazza. We stood on the terrace just before midnight listening to a band which attracted over 200 people who were dancing to the drums from the band. At 12midnight we brought the new year in drinking champagne dancing and watching the firework display which went on until 3.30/4.00am. Had one of the nicest New Year's Eve without spending silly money. Defiantly worth doing. Even standing in the piazza would have been the same experience

Christmas Markets at Piazza Navona 2014. well, all I can say is I was so disappointed when I got to piazza navona this year to celebrate Christmas. when planning our trip we read how beautiful the Christmas markets were at Piazza Navona. WHAT CHRISTMAS MARKETS ???? two huts with carnavil games. not what I was hoping for. I have been to Piazza Navona twice before in the summer and enjoyed it so much I couldn't wait to see it at Christmas. NOTHING TO SEE. Luckily we went to Paris also and was totally thrilled with the Christmas Markets there. So Festive. it was just awesome.

Exciting Piazza. We were just there right after New Year's and the place was hopping! There were street performers everywhere on the piazza as well as live ethnic bands and groups of singing school children. Of course, food vendors were selling all kinds of food. The place was buzzing!! The piazza itself, if you strip all the entertainers away, has some cool architecture and restaurants. We were there between meals and did not eat at any of the restaurants. The Pantheon is close by. You should definitely visit this piazza. There is something for everyone.

My favorite Piazza. Amongst the many Piazzas we visited in Italy, this one was by far my favorite. The place is very beautiful and romantic at night. We dined at one of the cafes in the piazza and the view of the fountains was just spectacular.

Amazing piazza with flavor of Ancient Rome and today's rome!. Always love to visit this beautiful piazza and people watch.... Berninis fountains and outdoor cafes make you feel as though you are in a very special place...

At last, piazza Navona back to Romans and Tourists!. Eventually, after years of endless debates and fruitless discussions, piazza Navona is back to what it was intended for: a beautifully designed place, thousands years old where now you can stroll in quiet and admire the monuments and the scenic view of the place!All activities which nothing have to do with the piazza have been peacefully removed (no more strange people trying to sell cheap chinese toys or a messy market of silly stuff and presepi, where you could only be sure to be pick pocketed).You can now recognize the shape of the ancient Stadium of Domitian and see the wonderful fountains dei Fiumi, del Moro e di Nettuno.Probably someone will now return to make use of the statue of Pasquino, where traditionally Romans hanged anonymous satires to comment on politics and everyday life!
One of the Prettiest Piazzas in Rome. Large, Oval shaped with beautiful fountains, buildings, and obelisks. Use to be a stadium where chariot races were run. Just cool.

The Grinch stole the spirit of Christmas at Piazza Navona. I try to stop by Piazza Navona every year. This year I was horrified to find it was gutted and a shaddow of the place I loved. Gone were the sellers of Christmas cresch figurines, Gone are the candy and the food vendors, Gone are all vestages of happy and pretty Christmas displays. In their place is a tacky musical stage, a volleyball net for demonstrations of possibly Christmas volleyball, a few carney stands allowing ring toss and shooting games to rule the Piazza. As I left an enforcer was ruining off an independent harpist from the perimeter of the area explaining they could not allow unregistered musicians from playing music. I will not return and I imagine crowds of locals will also not attend.

Beautiful square. Theres live music and a lot of activities for adults and kids alike, get the hot chocolate from the cafe in the nearby Museum Roma..its the best!Beautiful at daylight and night...plan in seeing in both lights

My happy place. couple of years ago I centered my stay around piazza navona, i rented an apartment for two weeks close to it ,it is walking distance to main attractions, it has great stores and restaurants all around it, watch artist painting , people putting on shows , singing ,entertaining with different acts, my favorite thing i did was get a glass or bottle of wine , and sit at the table and people watch. strike up conversations, with others, watch , look admire, or as the italians say DOLCE FAR NIENTE, sweetness of doing nothing,

Beautiful sight at night. A beautiful picture of colour and atmosphere during the night time extravaganza of a busy square. Amazing lighting surrounding the fountain and monument with stunning warm looking resturants in a place of class and culture.

Boems' squere. Place of four rivers, church and lot of Italin's restaurants. Place of art, kids joy. It's a place where everything is so vivid and happy, you have music, noice, and ofcourse beautiful fountain with four rivers of each continent - Danube, Ganges, Nile, and Rio de la Plata. Ideal place for boems, also.
Just Fun!1. This place is just fun, great place to just sit and people watch!:) Great fountain and some good artwork to check out by the local artist. Just a fun place to catch a gelato and relax.

Nice square, beautiful at night. Our hotel was right around the corner and we would walk through frequently. There was always live entertainment by music or even the street carnival like side games to win prizes. The fountain in the middle is beautiful and one of Berninis pieces which I learnt was made beforw the Trevi fountain and was the kinda of layout for that fountain. It is a nice place with restaurants all around that arent so touristy (meaning better price and food).
Best fountain in Rome. Since Trevi fountain is under restoration, this has been our favorite fountain of the trip. Majestic and intricate. The Four Rivers fountain in Piazza Navona is a must see!

A lot of activity in one spot. There is a lot of activity on the piazza when we were there. An Italian children's choir was singing, Santa and Mrs. Claus were still available for children to sit on their laps - a little late for Christmas (since in was Jan 3rd), many other performers, artists, games, etc. to be an entertaining people watching spot.

Quintessential Rome(with tips). With so many sites to visit in Rome I am thankful we made it to this piazza. There is a beautiful cathedral that rings it's bell and it is as if time stands still. It is very popular with tourists so get used to crowds but this does not deter from the uniqueness of this piazza. If money is not an object eat on the square. We found a wonderful restaurant one block off the square and there are many to choose. One tip I should mention is all the vendors that aggressively peddle their items ( some cheep and annoying, some interesting) as a part of the experience. I recommend you take in the beauty instead . Enjoy your visit!

What a fun place. Of all of the places that I visited in Rome Piazza Navona was the most fun. It is a large, busy piazza full of delight. The fountain is beautiful and the sound of the water in the background of everything adds to the ambiance. There is a huge beautiful building on one side of the piazza and on the opposite there are balconies filled with flowers. There are food stands everywhere and street vendors lined up selling just about everything. The merry-go-round played italian music and there was a musical group that I stood and listened to for at least 45 minutes, they played mostly war songs but in a very unique, italian, jazzy kind of style. All in all, a really FUN place.

No Christmas markets. Bernini's Fountain of Four Rivers is definitely a sight to behold. However, I expected to see Christmas markets here and sadly, there were none. Still a must visit for the monuments/fountains.

A great place for people watching, and experiencing Rome!. A huge piazza with two beautiful fountains, on the site of the old Domicitian Stadium in Rome. We visited at Christmas time, and the stalls for Christmas items, and the concerts were great! Not so much a destination in and of itself, but a great area to walk through on your way to or from the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Campo di Fiori, etc.

Well worth a gelato. What a lovely square, well actually a rectangle. Packed with people but still easy to get around. The architecture is lovely but it is the people watching that is lively.
We grabbed a gelato from Gelateria Tre Fontane sat down and watched the tourists in their matching t-shirts put on a show.

A beautiful square and perfect place to people watch. We came across this beautiful square mid afternoon and enjoyed just taking a few photos and people watching. The sounds of the fountains, lovely music and hum of people, made this a great place to people watch.
Visit to see Christmas Markets. We'd visited on this occasion to see the Christmas market, but very poor display, almost non existent. Some of the restaurants are not great.

Worth to visit it!. Yes there are onslaught hawkers in Piazza Navona, as there are in almost any touristic attraction around the world, but it is an enchanting place that it is worth a visit! 3 Beautiful fountains, the Fountain of the Four Rivers in the center and 2 others, several impresive buildings, lively ambience and from there, at walking distance you can visit other atractions as: Capo de Fiori, Piazza Spagna, Fontana di Trevi, etc

If you're in the neighborhood. I found that the best thing about this Piazza is that it is contained in a neighborhood and not on a busy street. The detail of the main fountain is beautiful and there are several benches around the edge of the piazza to enjoy the view. The vendors are quite annoying here, especially in the evening, if you ignore them, they move on to another target. Worth a quick stop if you're in the area. Not really any shopping here to speak of, just restaurants.
The most beautiful square in Rome. Very nice square with three fountains and many artists. Beautiful also in the dark with listening of musicians playing there.

Great tourist attraction!. We came here on our last day in Rome! A great place for family and friends! Be careful of the people dressed as soldiers, they will make you take a photo with them and force you to pay! Robbery in daylight!

Fun despite the selfie-stick hawkers . This is a great place to get some nice photos. December was a great time to visit since i was told by others that the fountain is hard to get near during peak tourism times.

Active spot!. I'm not 100% sure of the significance of Piazza Navona (as I got mixed answers when walking around the public space) but it did pop up on my "things to do list" when traveling Rome so I decided to check it out. I think at one point in time the Ancient Romans used to come here to watch some type of games that used to take place. If for nothing else, you can stop here to check out the architecture and nice fountain.

Beautiful piazza, anemic Christmas fair. Piazza Navova is one of the most beautiful public spaces in Rome with its beautiful sculptures and fountains. I was really looking forward to the Christmas fair so I could add to the accouterments of my Nativity collections and see all of the Bafana friendly witches. This year the local Italian authorities decided those shops were not "elegant" enough for Piazza Navona. Meanwhile, they allowed carnival games to set up shop - talk about cheesy and not "elegant." I don't know who was responsible for that decision, but I sure hope they change their mind for next year.

Nice but there are better not far from there...... Nice Piazza but just a few restaurants with high prices just to sit and watch people around. Nothing attractive but the monument and the fountains. "No benches in piazzas in Italy" only in parks or gardens.

A grand plaza. Within walking distance from the Pantheon, this rectangular shaped plaza was said to be built over a racetrack back in the first century. It is right in front of a nice looking but not grand palace called Palazzo Pamphili and in the centre of the plaza stands the famous Bernini's Fountain of Four Rivers and then at the Northern and Southern ends, two lesser ones the Fontana del Moro and the Fountain of Neptune. The place is literally packed with tourists when we visited and if you could find a place in one of the roadside cafes, it would be a good idea to have a cup of coffee or an ice cream and just enjoy the hustle and bustle right in front of your eyes.
Lively square. Cool place with beautiful statues, lively atmosphere and nicely-designed buildings. From there you can walk to the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain as well.

Selfie sticks, laser pointers, fake scarves and handbags. Unfortunately this is the memory I have of this otherwise fine plaza. My wife and I passed through several times during our stay in Rome and the onslaught of migrant hawkers was incessant from dawn til dusk. If you can get past this annoyance, the plaza is a huge wide open space that's perfect for resting a while and watching people. At the northern and southern ends of the plaza are fountains sculpted by della Porta. Of course you cannot miss Bernini's fountain smack dab in the center.

Nice very wide square, small XMas market. Square is very wide, it can hodl a very big xmas market however there was no xmas market there . It was just the lightings. In general Italy seems to be not interested in the xmas markets. We ate at Tescalini Pizza there and it was nice one.
Love this fountain. Great piazza in Rome. I love the main fountain with the four figures representing the four main rivers known at the time. The church at the piazza is worth a visit, too.

The heart of Rome. We visited in early May on a bright sunny day. Just to wonder about and look at the fountains, statues and events going on would be enough but whilst there you must sit and have an ice-cream and feel truly Roman for a while.

Christmas Fair decimated!. The annual Christmas Fair in Piazza Navona, Rome, has been decimated. According to the locals I've spoken to, the politicians decided the Fair was not elegant enough for the location. Of course it wasn't. That was why it was so much fun. The Fair has lost 50-75% of its booths; it has probably lost 50-75% of its visitors as well. Rome is still a wonderful place to come for Christmas, but not quite as wonderful.

Such a gorgeous piazza. This was one of my favorite piazza's while strolling around Rome. The small shops and restaurants within the piazza makes the area so quaint compared to the others in the area. Even though it doesn't look like it, this Piazza has such a rich history its a must while you are walking around the town! This Piazza is home to one of Bernini's beautiful fountains and right afterwards you can walk right over to the Pantheon not too far away.

Have 3 fountains for you to enjoy. After we visited the Pantheon, we walked over to this plaza for our break. This is a very large oval shaped plaza containing 3 magnificent fountains with sculptures. The middle one is the most impressive called “Fountain of the four Rivers” with an Egyptian obelisk standing tall in the middle and facing the church of saint Agnese in Agone.On the day that we visited it was not packed, so we can have a bench to sit on and do some people watching. There were many restaurants and cafes around. Lots of artists drawing and selling their paintings and a few guys walked around selling hand bags. I wonder if anyone will buy their stuff?This is a good place to see fountains and take break!Happy Travelling!

Best of the piazzas. This for me is the most visually appealing of Rome's piazzas and certainly one of the largest.It is home to Bernini's beautiful fountains and in December a carousel and fair stalls! They are colourful at night anyway.During the day you can people watch and/or have coffee in the many bars and restaurants that surround the piazza.Afterwards spend some time wandering around the narrow streets nearby which ooze with atmosphere

Beautiful fountains. I cannot compare this place to Fontanna di Trevi as it was undergoing some refurbishin in the time we stayed in Rome, nonetheless Piazza Navona and it's fountains are a beautiful landmark, especially after dark.

The place I got engaged!. Piazza Navona will always be special to me now, as this is where my boyfrind proposed to me, right by the Fountain of the Four Rivers! It is a lovely square surrounded by cafes and bars. The fountain and architecture are simply stunning. We went on a Friday during the day and it was quite emplty, and still in the evening there were not too many people about but on Sunday, it was packed! Lots of fun things to see and do. Rome is so beautiful and this piazza is one of the best!

Rome's #1 Piazza . Piazza Navona was my favourite square whilst visiting Rome. Although eating these is quite expensive (like eating in all Piazzas), the fountains and architectures are beautiful and it is lovely to walk through. Highly recommend it!

The best Piazza in Rome. I was lucky enough to see the Piazza Navona on a weekday in December before the crowds arrived in the city! On the weekend it was hard to get near the amazing fountains, get nice photographs or grab a seat at one the cafés if we wanted too! In the week however, we saw the Piazza in all it's glory. The fountains are beautiful and some of the best we saw in Rome. The renaissance style buildings surrounding the square are quite amazing and are home to some cafés and shops. You will find cheaper prices in the streets nearby however.If you visit the square when there a just a few people wandering around then you will feel the ambience and experience that is expected when in Rome.

great place to hang out and people watch. Incredible fountains, incredible energy of the populace, incredible food/drink options right there and within blocks in any direction, incredible colors of the buildings surrounding piazza. This is Rome in all of its beauty and chaos and intrigue and history and I smile really big every time I see a picture of it.

Lovely end to a walk. We arrived at Rome in the evening and walked from Spanish steps to Trevi Fountain, further to Pantheon and finished at Piazza Navona. It was dark by that time, but the lights were on at the fountain and the area incredibly atmospheric. We did not try the cafes here since we had read about the places around Piazza Navona being relatively expensive and touristy. But it was a beautiful place to simply sit after dinner (near the Pantheon) and watch the crowds go by.

beautiful fountains. Rome is full of fountains everywhere, but this is just a beautiful setting all around. The cafe's are too expensive, but it's a nice place to walk around and take pictures. It's adjacent to a nice neighborhood, just north for walking and shopping. Leave the Piazza, turn left on the first street and just keep exploring.

Piazza Navona, a beautiful square. After the disappointment of the Trevi fountain which is under construction, we kept on walking until we came to the Piazza Navona which made up for our disappointment. This is a beautiful piazza with lots of restaurants around it. The actual fountain is beautiful. What is nice about all of these attractions is that they are all within walking distance from one another, so get your walking shoes on and discover!

Wonderful piazza!. This wonderful Barroque square is a must-go in Rome! In the center, it features the amazing "Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi" (Fountain of the Four Rivers) by Bernini, topped by an egyptian obelisk. At the northern and southerd ends of the square there are two other fountains: "Fontana del Moro" and the "Fountain of Neptune", both by Giacomo della Porta. Don't miss the beautiful "Palazzo Pamphili" (the Brazilian Embassy) and the amazing "Church of Sant'Agnese in Agone" by Borromini. Other than that, spend some time in the gracious restaurants and cafes around the square or take a look at the good paintings negotiated by local artists.

Stunning fountain, lovely space, massive tourist trap. Worth seeing but the restaurants seem geared exclusively for generic tourist menus and priced accordingly.
Walk into the back streets for more authentic roman food and better prices.
architect. the most attractive shopping places and cafes in rome , very expensive stores but the views are very nice

Rome at its best for tourists. The large, lovely Piazza Navona is one of my favorite spots in Rome, especially for relaxed dinner with friends when the weather is mild. Take in the wonderful fountains then eat outside at one of the several restaurants to watch the lively street scene. The restaurants are not be best, but the relaxing evening taking in all the street activity as the sun is setting makes it all worth while. It can get a bit crowded, but I have never had a problem getting a table.

Piazza Navona...beautiful!. While touring the Roman Forum our guide suggested the Piazza Navona to rest and eat afterwards. We took the suggestion and were delighted. We ate at the Tre Scalini and was delighted with our food. The Piazza had a large group of people in and out of the area. The fountain was beautiful, and all the shops and restaurants gave the Piazza Navona a wonderful atmosphere. There were plenty of photo spots / opportunities within the Piazza. My wife and I walked to a bunch of other attractions from here. If you need to shop, eat, relax, or just take in the atmosphere of Rome...here you are all in one location! This a nice stop in the touring of Rome. I will come back here!!

Great Place to People Watch, Eat, Drink, Be Merry. Following the outline of the ancient Roman Stadium of Emperor Domitian, the Piazza Navona should be on every Rome visitor's itinerary. With its three fountains, including Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers, and nasoni (drinking fountains--Italian style), cafes, gelato, wine, food, locals, artists and tourists, this is a fun place to simply "be." The 18th century Palazzo Braschi at the southern end of the Piazza houses the Museo di Roma and a cafe.
The best place in Rome!. Absolutely the best place in Rome! One of the most beautiful Piazza's and walking distance to all the other attractions and major nightlife.

Stunning, perhaps the best in Roma...... Piazza Navona is a superb piece of ancient Roma and is well worth a visit. Take an hour for a gentle stroll around to admire the wonderful churches and fountains and sit in a cafe to take in the beauty and the history. Be careful with cameras and wallets as the pick pockets are always on the prowl and are skilled, usually using a map to push against you while they search your pockets or bags. But the piazza is stunning and well worth the time to explore.

Walk, look and breathe. Take the Baroque walk starting at the Vatican and step into Piazza Navona. Walk, look, breathe and take it all in. Enjoy. Have lunch in the piazza and enjoy the people watching, the amazing Bernni fountain and the architecture of the buildings around you. This is why you are in Rome.

Piazza Navona -- Spend your time with Bernini. The Piazza which is within a walking distance of Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon is a spacious square where one can see the famous sculpture by Bernini titled 'The Fountain of the Four Rivers' representing the four rivers Danube, Amazon, Ganges and the Nile. There is an Egyptian obelisk on the top. The nicest thing about this place is that one can spend hours sitting here in the square watching the people from around the world. The area around Trevi Fountain does not have the space to sit and observe as this piazza. One can either sit near any of the two fountains or at the restaurants around the piazza. The buildings surrounding the area are brightly coloured making the place so lively. One can feel Rome here. One can also visit the famous church or go around the stalls of the local artists. I feel if one is visiting Rome and is going on a sightseeing trip, one must spend some time in Piazza Navona.

One of Rome's most beautiful square. Built on an ancient stadium. Excellent people watching square, filled with cafe's, restaurants ( beware most are all poor quality food---tourist traps, especially if they're are outside solicting you to come into their restaurant)....street performers, artists, and chiesa ...The maint central fountain "four rivers",a Bernini design.

The best piazza in Rome. Built on the site of Domitianus Stadium, used in ancient times for games and races and ship battles.
Now hosts the most beautiful fountain in Rome, "Fontana dei 4 fiumi" carved by Gian Lorenzo Bernini.
In the festivities there is a market with stands of games, rides, sweet shops and nativity scenes.

Piazza Navona - A Must See in Rome. Piazza Navona is an oval square in Rome. It is arguably the most lively and beautiful square of Rome. It is a great masterpiece of Baroque architecture. It is famous because of its three fountains and cafes, night clubs and restaurants around it. Its elegance is further enhanced by some of the monumental buildings especially Church of Sant' Agnese in Agone. I am sure that the sweet memories of the lovely sights of lively square will last long in your mind. To get the real feeling of its liveliness, sit in an open air café and order something of your taste. Enjoy the music played by the musicians, look at the beautiful flowing water in the fountains, witness the sketches drawn by the painters, listen the stories narrated by the fortune tellers. Move slowly from one fountain to another by looking at the grandeur of the buildings around it. Take photos in front of fountains. The street performers will attract you to stay there as long as possible. I reckon this place as "Never Miss in Rome".

Piazza Navona Christmas Market 2014G (Nov 26, 2014–Jan 6, 2015). We arrived in Rome on the 27 th November and were all geared up for the Christmas market in piazza Navona. We went to visit the Christmas market on the 29 th november. To our disappointment there was no market.This was a big big disappointment when the market was advertised that is was starting on the 26th November.

Good place to people watch. Went to this place early evening and had coffee & cake in a cafe right in front of the piazza square. There were street entertainers (singing Amore in the background, how romantic can that be) and the fountain looked so beautiful in the evening. A place not to miss if you are in Rome.

The quintessential Roman square. Go for the architecture of the buildings which surround the square. Go for the three great fountains which fill it. Go for the caricaturists who will produce a wonderful souvenir (for only 10 euros). Go to "people watch" as you enjoy a light lunch at one the multitude of outdoor restaurants. Just go!
Evening hang out. Very busy during the day, it is a great place to hang out in the evening. Beautiful fountains. Busy night life. Great places to eat and drink in the area. Pantheon super close.

Amazing Fountains. An elongated oval-shaped public square with three fountains - the most famous being Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi - the fountain of the four rivers which was completed in 1651 and designed by Bernini. The rivers represented are The Nile, Ganges, Danube and Rio de la Plata. The Neptune Fountain was designed by Giacomo della Porta and built in 1576 with further statues of Neptune and sea nymphs added in the 19th Century. The Fontana del Moro was also created by della Porta with the central statue designed by Bernini in the 17th Century. The Tritons (male mermaids) were added in 19th century. These fountains are so beautiful at night or at sunrise for photo opportunities when there are less people in the square.
Beautiful place. Loved this square and it's 3 fountains. The fountains were beautiful and very detailed. The area was very clean. Took a lot of photos and visited the church.
Fountain of the four rivers. It's one of the famous squares in Rome...Has lots of hidden symbols as well as a nice Egyptian obelisk in the middle of the square

Time out in Rome. A must for Rome is to chill out in Piazza Navona, bit pricey but worth it to drink wine and watch the world go by. Had a memorable lunch with my wife, beautiful daughters and crazy son I law. Must do it again.

Paradise. This Place was like a paradise for me. I went to it after a very long day at Vatican city and Michael Angelo castle. more that 7 hours walking. I was so tired I needed to go home home but I found myself so close Piazza Navona So my husband and I decided to see it before going home. but when I entered it was AMAZING atmosphere. People were happy everywhere. I felt all my positive energy back to me. I took many pictures next to the 4 rivers fountain, I danced on the street with my husband. there were many life shows. people are dancing, singing, playing music and talented drawers and painters. coffeehouses and restaurants everywhere. I liked the piazza so much even I visited after that twice

Rione Parione. The sixth ward appointed by chirograph of Benedict XIV contains two of the most famous squares in the world, Piazza Navona and Campo dei Fiori . Two squares rich in history , where the markets have come and gone , previously allocated to the Capitol. In fact, in 1478 the markets were moved to Piazza Navona and in 1869 to Campo de ' Fiori. Parione : a term derived from the Latin paries , wall , belonging to the outer fences of the Stadium of Domitian , or the ruins of Templum Olovitreum (quoted in Mirabiliae Urbis Romae 1500, still preserved in the Library of Archaeology and History of Art in Rome ) , a very high building rich in mosaics , gold and crystals, the residence of the Prefect of the City. In the Middle Ages the ruins were used as a basis for the towers and is remembered here the Parione Tower. Via dei Cappellari , Chiavari, Canestrari , Baullari , Leutari , Balestrari : they are all ways that bear the names linked to the job or the destination ( because of Granari ) . Campo de ' Fiori is just famous for the variety of flowers that were exposed . Area of the Orsini , with the market trading develops quickly and one of the inns here was run by Vannozza Cattanei , mother of Caesar, Lucrezia, Juan and Jose Borgias, in via del Gallo n.11 .But this area was also gruesome. Here, in Campo dei fiori happened the burning of Giordano Bruno in 1600. The statue by Ettore Ferrari ( 1889) reminds us . In the same spot where now stands the statue there 'was a fountain with a cover that looked like a bowl and was called " the terrine ." This fountain is today in front of the New Church since 1924. On its cover there is an inscription: "Love God and do not fail , makes good and not fail." Under the building Orsini - Righetti in 1864 , was found a statue of Hercules, now on display in the Vatican Museums . The presence in the area of Ancient Theatre of Pompey (the first in masonry, 61 BC, with a diameter of 150m auditorium with capacity for 20,000 spectators ) , on which they built palaces , it makes the whole thing fascinating . Right here in the temporary Senate Curia, in March 15, 44a.C. Julius Caesar was assassinated . Walking through via della Cancelleria we encounter a Renaissance palace block in travertine (taken from the Colosseum and the Theatre of Pompey ) built by Cardinal Raffaele Riario ( nephew of Pope Sixtus IV Della Rovere) in 1483 . This palace was the seat of the Apostolic Chancery , here was signed the surrender to Charles V , here was the seat of the Tribunal of the Roman Republic of 1798 and we are always here was the seat of the Imperial Court of Napoleon in 1810. Then , in 1848 it was the seat of the Chamber of Deputies of the Papal States . Currently it is the seat of the Roman Rota and the Apostolic Signatura .

Lovely. This is how you should experience Roma! Go eat at any of the pizzerias around the ancient city but get to the Piazza Navona at sunset and hang around for the evening romance. Best piazza in all of Roma. Took my breath away when we turned the corner and entered this lovely spot.

Neat, busy plaza with an interesting history. It was neat to find out that this busy little plaza was built on top of an old chariot racing arena! If you stand back, you can actually make out the unique design of the arena, with the buildings having been built directly on top of the stands of spectators. Very cool to see in person!

One goal... Tartuffo Ice Cream.. Ok, so, just like any other Piazza... there are fountains.I guess three... can't remember.The only thing I do remember is, after walking almost 15 kilometers straight through Rome, we got there. And the only thing we went there, was to have a bite of, and I kid you not, the most, the uttermost delicious dark chocolate sprinkled chocolate ice cream covered cherry ball with whipped cream topping and a wafer cigar...Mmmmmmm.And Oh! You haven't been to Rome and had Gelato if you don't dirty yourself at least once - it's sort of a signature, proof that you've been there.
Wonderful. Quite an atmospheric place. The beautiful fountains and surrounding architecture were well worth the visit and should not be missed.

Beautiful!!!. Oh yes yes!!! Here is just magical... from the Pantheon I dont know which way I took (blessed be GPS) here you'll find the Fontana De Quattro Fiumi which for me its the epitome of sculptures quality (A i know nothing about sculptures)... You'll get to enjoy each creature standing facing a cardinal point, and the sound of water... uffff!! Lullaby! near the fontana, another one (i don't know the name). Petit sculptures with horn with flowing water... nice visit.

This is a great Piazza. Piazza Navona is a great place to visit 2 great fountains and a large number of restaurants plus part of da Vinci code was filmed here!I found this one of the nicest open places in the parts of Rome we visited.Worth the effort.

Only the fountain and monuments . I don't know, I can see why it's famous because of the fountain and the castle, but as a piazza, there is nothing much in it, and there is no comparison between it and piazza de spagna ( spanish steps ) , I didn't see what most people saw here.

Beautiful. Something there everyone.So many restaurants to choose from, all very friendly , the Italians are so welcoming in this square. Other restaurants can be found in Little alley ways off the square and are a Lilttle less expensive .

Beautiful to look at, not much to do. Lovely Piazza, the obelisk is especially interesting, however there weren't many vendors out when we went. The restaurants surrounding the piazza were horrifically expensive. Its worth the walk to see it, but after about 20 minutes, we were ready to move on.

beautiful and romantic. Beautiful piazza with fountains and statues and fire light around that makes it soo romantic. Great gift shop there and a wonderful place to sit and admire everything around you whie feeling calm.
Eat at parallel road in small road at notte restaurant where you pay 10euros for a full menu optin of appetiser-meal and desert.

Simply the best Piazza. This was stunning and is not to be missed. The fountains are photo beehives though. The restaurants are expensive but a glass of prosecco at 6euros in this piazza is a must if you are in Rome

LOVELY OLD ATHLETIC SITE. Walking around Rome we came across Piazza Navona a beautifull oval area with lots of restaurants and other impressive buildings around it's outskirts. At either end there are two lovely fountains and a magnificent one in the centre. A very busy place when we were there, it seems a popular place to relax, have something to eat , drink and enjoy the surroundings. The oval area was set out by Emperor Domitian around 79AD for athletic games that were held here for centuries, a lovely old athletic site. We also visited a lovely church there as well Saint Agnese In AgonePiazza Navona well worth the visit
Nice area. Beautiful area with a lovely atmosphere. Some nice restaurants and an ice cream shop where you can just sit and relax.

Piazza Navona in Rome-. Piazza Navona is a turistic place to visit in Rome, specially because is surrounded by many italian restaurants and this place has three historical fountains. You cannot lose to visit it if you come to Rome

Busy social center of Rome. This large gathering space contains stores, churches, street merchants, and an imposing fountain--The Fountain of Four Rivers-- from the 1600's. A good place to visit, sit and relax, enjoy people-watching, view beautiful architecture, eat, and shop.

Watch the world walk by while enjoying a drink!. After a busy day see the sights to find this Piazza was heaven!Not so crowded and cracking architecture, plenty of places to eat and drink, while people watching.You'll deserve a break, so enjoy it here.

I wish my city has some fountain like that. Totally cool, there is a lot of history, beens, things in this fountain that when I was there just sitting and thinking about how beautiful it is and I do not even know what everything in it is.

Sometimes I just sits!!. A perfect spot for simply sitting and taking it in. Beautiful fountains. Excellent earring places. In November we were able to eat outside and people watch. Enough entertainment to be good and fun, without being overdone, and lovely architecture all round.

Great night spot. This is one of the best piazzas in Rome. Although rather crowded, the piazza offers several attractions by day and by night, but the restaurants around it make a great spot for a lovely dinner after a long day of walking around Rome´s attractions.

Awesome. This is by far one of the loveliest piazzas in Rome. Grand Architecture all around plus a huge Bernini fountain in the centre. Lovely also at night. During the xmas period full of stalls with toys...used to be precious wooden/artisanal toys but alas now loads of electronic made-in-china ones :-( The bars are expensive if you sit down...just go round the corner and there are many others!

My favorite night spot!. You MUST visit this stunning piazza! Yes go during the day and take pics of the many sights including fountains and architecture. But please go at night! So much activity it so fun to be a part of it all or just spectate. People everywhere. Families. Lovers. Young and old! Not to be missed.

Real Rome. For my wife and I, Piazza Navona is a must-visit, memorable and romantic place. Yes, for much of the day, it is crowded with visitors and full of bored vendors and street artists trying to pocket a few euros from tourists. But try being there at about six in the morning and you can have the perfect romantic experience and privilege of being the only visitors in Rome's most beautiful piazza. Then you can see - without gawping tourists, bored vendors, beggars and inadequate portrait artists - the astonishing beauty of the Bernini Fountain of the Four Rivers and the other impressive sights. If you wish to sit outside a bar to watch the world go by, be aware. By law, bars must display a list of prices but these apply only to those drinking (and standing) at the bar. If you drink outside, the price is what the waiter (and/or owner) wants it to be. Our advice is to do what the Romans do - go to one of the many small and much cheaper bars in the narrow streets around the piazza. Doing this also means that you get way from the hordes of tourists who too often seem to do little more than take photographs or videos of their friends and families.

Busy area. lovely just chilling a few drinks and lunch looking on .at the many stall's a great atmosphere. A fantastic fountain 2nd time but not my last . A wee tip the bag seller are always moving when the police arrive a good time to hammer down the price .there quick of the mark .!!

Lovely space.. The pedestrian plaza has three gorgeous fountains, the best known being the one in the middle by Bernini. The large oval area is circled by colorful building facades with shops and restaurants on the ground story,. Depending on the time of year and time of day it can be so crowded as to make moving difficult (January 6th celebrations of the Befana are wall to wall children and parents) or beautifully free of fellow visitors (last week in October I took my husband's sister there and it was nearly empty). There are usually street performers, unmoving human statues, artists, musicians and all kinds of people strolling along the large oval space or passing through. During Christmas season booths selling holiday related items are set up along the edges.

really awesome.... one of the most beautiful places in Rome with three fantastic fountains inside and a lot of shops all around,probably the seggestive place in the world,,,,really really nice,i hope you can reach this place near campo de fiori.

Fabulously romantic. . A day of walking had us finishing up at Piazza Navona, a large square--actually oblong--in the old city. Couples kissing, children chasing smaller children, musicians, beautiful buildings surrounding a gorgeous fountain of river Gods and the perfect place to stop for a Negroni cocktail before heading back to the hotel for a picnic supper.

Beautiful. We visited Rome 20 years ago and Piazza Navona was fabulous especially in the evenings wandering and watching the artists, eating the best ice cream in the World! The fountains are lovely and so many places to eat. An absolute must if you visit The Eternal City. We will return.

Our favorite spot in Rome. Great scenery, beautiful fountains, good restaurants nearby, gelato, artists and musicians all in one spot. We like stopping at restaurants ordering the piazza for wine/beer and appetisers and people watch. For less touristy restaurants, look down some of the Piazza side streets for a good selection. Terra di Sienna is a place that we enjoyed. Home made pasta and some tasty tuscan inspired dishes.

A must see. With Bernini's four rivers at the heart of the square, Piazzo Navona is a great place to sit, have coffee and admire. Busy, expensive, full of street sellers but I would always go to it when in Rome.
Nice atmosphere. Lovely atmosphere around the place with some great street entertainers. The fountains are lovely and shops.
Excellent Place for a meal. Superb location for a meal (Recommend the Bernini). Wonderful place to just "hang". Pity about all the hawkers but at least the police moved them on.

Splendid Square full of restaurants, artists and street entertainers. Beautiful colours, amazing fountains, plenty of space, our favourite street entertainers. Rome has many piazzas and most are lovely but this one was probably our favourite.

Lovely piazza and fountain. Piazza Navona has to be one of the nicest Piazzas in Rome. The fountain is spectacular, there is seating in the square so you can sit and relax or visit the Church. Plenty of restaurants around the square and local artists sell their paintings. I imagine at night time it is amazing.

Beautiful. This is one of the most beautiful squares in Rome. It’s a terrific place to have a drink or a bite to eat and people watch. It is a great atmosphere. During past visits there were lots of local artists selling paintings and drawing but this time there were just a few. We were here during the week so maybe that is more of a weekend thing.

Roman square with working fountain. After a long walk through the streets of Rome enjoying the hustle and bustle of shoppers on Via del Corso, we were delighted to find Piazza Navona and enjoy the atmosphere without the masses. The square was busy, but not over-crowded since it was mid-afternoon and most of the tour buses were gone. There are plentiful places to sit and enjoy the view over a glass of wine.

Romantic place. If you want to fell alive, you must visit this place. Hundreds of people from different nationalities are everery time comming and leaving the square, and you can make pictures around the fountain, but maybe the main attraction ata Navona are the pizzerías surrounding the square with delicious dishes and of course a big variety of pizzas.

Beautiful Piazza with so much to. Piazza Navona is a beautiful Piazza with so much to see and do. With the fountains, church, street performers, artists, restaurants and the shops there is so much to enjoy for hours. People watching here is amazing. This is my third time to Rome and Piazza Navona is a must every time. Enjoy a meal or a snack and an enjoyable walk around.

Fountain-abulus. This was our second trip to Rome and we could not miss returning to this beautiful location. The piazza is dominated by a fantastic fountain complete with Roman gods, sea nymphs, and sea monsters. You could spend an hour gazing at the sculptures which adorn the fountain. But save time to enjoy lunch or dinner at one of the many cafes that surround the piazza. Stroll around the entire square and just soak up "Italy." This is a Roman experience not to miss.

Italian magic!. At Piazza Navona you'll be able to not only witness the marvelous work of Miguel Angel in a tremendous fountain and church, but you'll be able to enjoy a wonderful meal listening to some of the most traditional italian songs played live, its a bit expensive to eat at one of the many restaurants in front of it, but if you have some extra bucks it's definitely a great experience! Plus you can visit de Museo di Roma which is right in front and holds amazing art, overall, Piazza Navona holds the whole package for tasteful travelers.

Favorite Piazza in Rome. While enjoying the sites of Piazza Navona (the fountains, the street perfomers, and the churches) we approached one of the few remaining artists in the piazza. His name was Sergio and his work was amazing. There are very few artists left in the piazza, and Sergio's story was so colorful and, dare I say it, Italian? Lost loves, celebrity encounters, and far-away children. He was such a sweet man! Gave my friend a great price on one of his oil paintings (which, again, was spectactular), and we even got pictures with him. Best way to experience the culture of Rome (that's slowly disappearing thanks to globalization) is to talk with the locals! You'll never forget it!

Wonderful in the evening. Its a huge square which seemed ideal to me for spending an entire evening over food and marvelous sculpture. There are 3 fountains placed distance apart from each other throughout the stretch of thesquare. Unfortunately the Fountain of Four Rivers at the center which had Ganges as one of the representative rivers was under repair so could not get a full view of it. I personally loved the wonderful sculpture of the fountain of Neptune ( the other one wad fountain of moor on the other end of the square) which dated back to the 16th century and was looking great with lights coming out of the water below it. The entire square is lit in yellowish halogens which created an amazing effect with the tourist crowd all around. The entire place is lined with open air dining restaurants and bars along one side and add to that the wonderful display of arts throughout the square where locals are singing, putting up their picture arts for display and sale and also drawing live portraits, every bit of which contributes to the wonderful ambiance created in the atmosphere here.

Quite Simply Stunning.... To be honest the Piazza Navona wasn't one of my top to see attractions whilst in Rome. But when my girlfriend and I got there at around 6:30 in the evening it really showed off just how charming a Piazza it is.3 beautiful fountains that had been delicately created hundreds of years ago, the street performers and the general atmosphere you enter when you get there quickly turned it into one of my favourite places in the city.There was one street performer in particular that had us hooked, a clown in a mustard coloured suit who insisted with spraying a square around him where people could stand had us entertained for the best part of 45 minutes.Great fun and a great place to visit. You really don't have to be a historian or an architect to truly appreciate this.Lots of people advise to be wary of pickpockets here, we personally didn't see any instances but it's not worth running the risk. Keep your items close and you will be fine.

When in Rome do as the Romans do. absolutely the perfect place to chill and be a Roman when you are here. you see all kinds of people all over and the peaceful atmosphere especially in the evenings. enjoy the Roman Cuisines and do people watching. love this place.

Watch the world go by..... During our stay in Rone we ate at a couple of different restaurants on the Piazza. I absolutely love this place. The beautiful buildings and the cobbled streets. The wonderful artists with their work during the day. And of course the fountains! Piazza Navona is a sanctuary in which to sit with a glass of wine or a plate of delicious pasta and watch the effortless glamour of Rome mingle with every other degree of humanity. Wonderful.

We liked it.. We wanted a place to see some night life. We walked there from the Termini neighborhood. I bit of a hoof, but not bad ... maybe half an hour. We felt it was worth it. Street performers, the fountains, the church and lots of people to watch. We also wandered adjacent streets where there were lots of restaurants that looked appealing. My wife had picked four from the Rick Steves book, so we ate at one of them. Quite good. Then we walked back to our hotel along the Forum and Colosseum which is subtly lit at night. It made a very pleasant evening.
Fun walk through. Street performers and pretty fountains. We really enjoy it, but some may not as it's a bit of carnival atmosphere.
Great place to hangout. this is a large piazza loaded with excellent places for a glass of wine or great food. The church is beautiful as well as the large fountain

Incredible Square with 3 fountains stunning masterpieces. One of the must-see of every journey to Rome, you can’t miss the stunning huge square (2000 yrs. ago a horses races stadium!) with its nice palaces that give it a magical atmosphere, its peculiar, cute concave façade church and, above all, the 3 incredible fountains, some of the most famous masterpieces of The Eternal Town. Above all the central one, with the architect Bernini's 1650 a.c. figurative depiction of the main rivers then known, is something huge and astonishing, to watch very carefully and enjoy with calm, preferably with a good guide to read about it with you.Obviously, as every main touristic attraction is really crowdy, messy and full of every kind of peddlers, so be careful about your wallet and above all be prepared to be offered every kind of portrait, ring neck, fluo bracelet, etc.. But you can really support it, the show repays you abundantly.

Beautiful architecture!!. The fountains were beautiful! Very happening area to stroll, dine,shop or just people watch! The buildings are old but in great condition and it's just a beautiful piazza to visit! Because it's a tourist attraction it is very congested but a must see! It's huge!

Great piazza!. This used to be my favourite piazza in Rome, but this time it was so overcrowded with tour groups, which is sadly to be expected. If you go early in the morning before the busses and crowds arrive or at a time when the crowds are having dinner, you may get an opportunity to see, admire and enjoy all the magnificent fountains and sculptures, all done by Bernini, particularly the Fountain of the Four Rivers ,which surrounds the central Egyptian obelisk, without being jostled. The Palazzo Pamphilj has been magnificently cleaned during the past year.

An Evening Delight. Piazza Navona is a great place to visit in the evening. It has beautiful fountains, live entertainment, lovely outdoor restaurants for a drink or dinner, and is surrounded by colorful buildings. Just to sit an absorb the sounds, sights, and people is a treat.

Fountains. We were lucky enough to be staying at the piazza, very nice fountains with artisans selling paintings etc and cafés all around. Be warned though they can be expensive as we paid €20 for 2 Peroni !

3 Fountains - 5 Stars. Known as the “Square of the 3 Fountains” this is a large and impressive piazza, frequently used as a film location. As it’s nickname suggests it has 3 fountains in it – a large central one and 2 smaller ones at either end. The central one is the famous “Fountain of the Four Rivers” by Bernini, topped by an ancient Egyptian obelisk, the other 2 are smaller but also of interest. Tourists throng the area so be patient if you want to get a photo clear of other people. It is only a short walk from the Pantheon so it is easily visited if you are going there.The piazza has a number of bars and restaurants situated on it – be aware these are more expensive than if you walk a couple of blocks away. This is a great place to sit and relax while people watching.Also situated on the piazza are the Museum of Rome and a church which is really worth visiting – Sant’Agnese in Agone (see separate review). The Brazilian embassy is on the piazza, situated in the 360 year old Palazzo Pamphili. Recommendation – visit, admire, photograph, chill!
Fantastic Fountain. The fountain by Bernini in the middle of the Piazza Navona is not to be missed. The church across from the fountain is also spectacular.

A Special Place. This was a wonderful place to visit on a Saturday morning while in Roma. We sat and had a wonderful café latté and croissant at one of the many cafés along the side and then took wonderful pictures of the beautiful fountains with a statue of Neptune and many fair maidens and their fish. One of my favourite things was a headless street performer that I had my picture taken with. Great fun! A wonderful place!
Fantastic Piazza. This is centrally located in Roma and very easily walked to from many locations in Rome. We felt very safe as there were lots of tourists here.

Relax and take it in. A great place to enjoy the fountains, architecture, and artists. We grabbed front row seats in a restaurant on the piazza and listened to live guitarists. A great place to chill and just take it all in. From there we walked to the Pantheon. An easy walk,

Piazza Navona. We had a wonderful time in the Piazza during our recent trip to Rome. There are so many delicious dining options and to sit outdoors in the Pizza and listen to the street performers was just magical. We found the best gelato in Italy there, yum!

Beautiful Long Square, Quintessential Rome.. If there's one place in Rome which has everything that youimagine the city to be then this is it. Multiple fountains, classic sculpture, baroque churches, an obelisk, colourful period buildings, then this is it. On a fine day it's picture postcard perfection. Of course there'll be lots of tourists eating lots of delicious icecream but that's all part of the atmosphere.

Beautiful Piazza - very crowded. This is a beautiful piazza with it's fountains. You must visit - try to go early in the morning, at about 8 there is not a lot of people. After that it gets crowded.Very nice to walk through.

Love it!. I love the hustle and bustle of this beautiful piazza. The surrounding buildings are wonderful and there are many restaurants. I mostly enjoyed people watching and looking closely at the fountains. My favourite being the central fountain of the four rivers. We enjoyed an ice cream from a place at the opposite side of the square to the museum.

A welcome respite. After a long day of walking and touring it was a relief to sit near the Four Rivers Fountain and Egyptian Obelisk that anchors this spacious piazza to people watch for awhile. A lovely setting with some picturesque views. This piazza has often been used as a film location for many movies including a scene with Tom Hanks in Angels and Demons. Only regret - didn't find the torso of Pasquino (the first talking statue) to post a personal pasquinade!

If you do not visit, you have not been to Rome.. The Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini dominates this very popular piazza but there is an obelisk and other fountains. However, Navona is all about people - watching them, mingling with them and talking to them. Check out the colours on the buildings as the sun goes down. You have to visit at least once.

Piazza Navona. One of my favourite Piazzas in Rome. The beautiful Bernini fountain makes this piazza very special. It is a lively place to visit - always busy with lots of cafes and restaurants. You must make this one of your stops in Rome. I love this piazza at night, full of people and entertainment.

A Happening Spot in the Evening!. First, there's the Fountain of the Four Rivers ... both of us consider it the best fountain in all of Rome!Lots happening in the square ... cafes and eating spots, buskers, lots and lots of people.Beautiful and not to be missed!

Your average square. Another thing in Rome that is such a tourist magnet- but I do not understand why. Great for people watching, but not much else. Some great fountains, but you have nicer around Rome...

The biggest & one of the most beautiful. Piazza Navona is incredibly made square, where u can find 2 perfectly suited fountains & a huge cathedral that make your staying in the middle of this beauty just like being in the other century

Busy location but worth a visit. Beautiful place to visit during the day, sit in one of the restaurants or on a bench and people watch. The restaurants were a little expensive inside the piazza but just outside there are many more reasonably priced places to eat.

Very pleasant. Bernini's fountain of the four rivers (Fontana del Quattro Fiumi) is very pretty.
The restaurants around are tourist traps, but you may want to splurge for a coffee and people watch during the day or come for desert in the evening and listen to the the various street performers.

Our favorite Piazza in Rome. This former Roman stadium graced today by the fountain of the Four Rivers of Bernini is the ultimate Piazza in Rome. Lively, yet not insanely crowded like the Trevi fountain this is the perfect spot for an afternoon gelato and people watching. We returned the next day to enjoy it one more time!
Busy place, good for people watching. Events change as the day progresses. Artists, jugglers, musicians, and over priced restaurants. Location of the 4 Rivers Fountain.

Spectacular.. Piazza Navona is great to visit during the day, but it comes alive at night with street performers and the cafes make a great spot to sit and just watch the people go by. The fountain is pretty spectacular and here is also a great icecream shop (Grom) at one end which makes great icecream with organic/ethically-sourced products. A must do if in Rome.

One of the best. From the Fountain of Four Rivers to the Sant'Agnese in Agone church, I believe this piazza to be one of the best places to visit in Rome. You can stand and stare in complete awe at these fountains & the architecture. With a large choice of cafes, gelateteria's and restaurants this is an ideal place for grabbing a coffee or a cone filled with delicious Stracciatella whilst watching the Romans and quirky tourists go about their day. Whether it be at the break of dawn or the stroke of midnight this Piazza has such a great ambience.
Best plazza for me. !!!! My favorite one!!!No cars, many People, three fontaines.Good atmosphère.Restaurants too expensive. No trees.

Beautiful!!!. The Piazza is truly beautiful with the Fountain of Four Rivers situated in the middle as well as a quaint church that you can light candles within makes this one of the key places to visit in Rome. There are many places to grab a bit to eat either lunch, dinner or evening drinks the Piazza is the perfect place to people watch and have a taste of Italy. The prices are a tad expensive in comparison to other places in Rome but definitely worth a wonder around and to watch the world go by.

One piazza you must visit. If not the most, one of the largest 'piazza' in Rome. A fulfilling experience from people watching to eating or just walking by and strolling along the many beautiful little shops around. By day or night there is always something happening at Piazza Navona.

Always a Hot Spot. Seems like there are always people strolling the Piazza, eating in the restaurants, selling goods, admiring the fountains or just taking it all in. Numerous restaurants line this Piazza offering many choices. There are also numerous artists and entertainers to stop and take in.
Beautiful Piazza. A beautiful area to stroll through or sit and watch the world go by. Beautiful fountains ..... well worth a visit.

The best Piazza in Rome. When you walk into the Piazza Navona, you can only say WOW!!!
The three fountains in the square are very impressive and as the piazza is surrounded by restaurants, this is the place for your Lunch or dinner. Pick one, you can't go wrong

Lovely. Really sweet piazza, lots of buzz and people selling art,cafes are exspensive but thats expected because its in a main attraction of Rome. But never the less a really lovely piazza, and anice church there too which is free to pop in and see.
You must go!. If you visit Rome the Piazza Navona is a must! Huge piazza, beautiful fountains and sculptures. Lots of eating places and street people. Cannot recommend more highly!

Bernini, Bernini.... Beautiful, large piazza centered on which is the incredible fountain with four huge Bernini sculptures on each corner and an Egyptian Obelisk in the middle. Really very impressive.....

Nice area. We ended up there about 11.30pm. Many people about but everything was closing. Still managed to sit and drink a nice red wine. Shops etc nearby looked quite amazing. Need to visit during the day next time.
Gorgeous. Absolutely beautiful square with a gorgeous fountain. Check it out, there's plenty to do around it as well!
Beautiful square. This is probably the most beautiful and vivid square in Rome. A must visit. Its usually very crowded. To embrace tlits beauty i suggest a late visit around midnight.

Miracle in the heart of Rome. Piazza Navona was once the Stadium of Domition built in 86 AD. That is why the square is long and oval shaped. It covers exactly the area occupied by the track of Rome's first stadium, also known as Circus Agonalis (competition arena), pronounced as "n'Agona" and later "Navona".Piazza Navona is one of my favorite squares in Rome. It is a pedestrian square where no cars are allowed, but above all a square where you can enjoy and admire the beautiful Fountain of the Four Rivers of Bernini and the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone by Borromini. The atmosphere at this historical square is great. I walk around the square to see the two other beautiful fountains, the Moor fountain at the south and the Neptune fountain at the north end of the square. Then I take a seat on one of the terraces for a coffee and watch this Italian treasure. There are painters, street performers and musicians and many tourists that keep this square as lively as it is and as it always has been. The square is a miracle in the heart of Rome!
Wonderful place. With so many tourists there all day long, the ambiance is simply amazing. Great place to hang out in Rome.

Just soak it in!. This is the Rome I love. Art, cafes, people, music, what is not to love. Grab a seat at any of the cafes surrounding the piazza, or sit at the edge of one of the great fountains. Relax, watch the people stroll by. Listen to the music from any of the many talented people. Have a espresso or a beer, a glass of wine? Ahhhh Roma.
just for relaxing. one of my favorites in Rome. you can find really interesting types of people. just sit down and enjoy your life :)
Beautiful piazza. Beautiful fountains, some shops and many restaurants around. Very nice photo opportunities. Many artisans around selling paintings and the like.
Great People Watching. This was one of our favorite spots to hang out and watch people and enjoy the views. Also love all the local artists with amazing paintings. We stopped in every day!

Stunningly beautiful!. Had lunch while watching the tourists take pictures by the fountains and it's a nice place to stop and admire the streets of Roma. Had my yummy deli sandwich along with my fresh olives, prosciutto, and cheese. Best place to relax and soak in that you are in one of the most beautiful cities in the world!

Picturesque fountain. My wife and I were disappointed that the Trevi Fountain was closed for renovations, but the beautiful one in this Piazza almost made up for it. Such a wonderful sight. A great place to relax and spend time people watching. It also helped to have a street performer play some classic Eric Clapton. Second time in Roma that I get to hear some live classic 70s rock. Very cool!

Lots to see, not just fountains. On arrival into the square we were hit by the beauty of the fountain of the 4 rivers. Around us street performes danced, Italian men of at least 70 years sang, artists painted and shared their works and tourists took pictures whilst others ate at the many restaurants around the square.The square is absolutely beautiful and must be experienced whilst in Rome.We spent around 1 hour here and then moved on to find a restaurant away from this location due to the fact you will pay extra for the views you will be getting as much as the excellent food the restaurants provide.A must see

Beautiful Piazza Navona. Lovely Piazza Navona -close by to the Trevi Fountain - with many restaurants facing the Piazza and the fountain. Lovely day out! Nice to sit in the front of a cafe with a coffee and/or glass of wine.

Could sit here all day and watch the fountain and people. This was our favorite Palazza in Rome. The fountains were beautiful. Take time and study the fountain and figure out what each figure/person represents. There are many restaurants around the square, but take time and find better/local trattorias within blocks of the palazzo in each direction.Daytime has a festive/chaotic atmosphere, while night is a little more relaxed and romantic. Be careful of the pick-picketers and the nighttime scam artists.....you have been warned. But don't let this scare you off. This palazzo is a must especially at night; take a stroll by the cathedral and look up into the lit grand ballroom to see the absolutely beautiful tromp l'oeil ceiling glimmering.

Beautiful Baroque Piazza. A beautiful fountain both day and night with a lot of cafes surrounding the area. The Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi is magnificent in both architecture and history. Probably one of the nicest piazzas in Rome.

Charming Square. Lovely square. Worth a relaxing (although quite pricy) seat for coffee, ice cream or a meal. Don't worry too much about which place one you choose as they appear to be closely connected and if you order a pizza you may find that it appear from a different restauarant! Quite amusing really.
First Night in Rome. We walked around and had dinner here our first night in Rome. So beautiful! What a great evening and a great start to our stay in Rome!
Excellent. Excellent buildings, statuery, fountains worth visiting for half hour or so whilst walk ok by to other things

Surprisingly relaxing. We'd been here numerous times before, enjoying the architecture and the buzz and the space, not to mention a vino or two in one of the restaurants (they're not all out to rob you!). But we'd never been here at night before, and it was a delight: a relaxed place to sit and have a gelato, with lots of tourists and locals mingling. Frankly, for atmosphere and history it knocks any similar place in Paris into a cocked hat.
