One extra tip: if you buy tickets for one of the classical music concerts in the Chiesa di Sant'Agnese church (the one that dominates half of the piazza) you'll get to see the church with just a handful of people.

Beautiful with fascinating history. If you are not with a guide, be sure to google the history which is fascinating. This is a beautiful place to walk in the evening (or in the day). Ignore the street vendors. Appreciate the beauty and history. Many restaurants here as well.
Lovely place for a walk. or you can sit there, watch beautiful fountain and rest after sightseeing :) Great place for enjoying the atmosphere of Rome!

Nice Piazza. A nice Piazza , mainly due to it's fountain. Apart from that ,it is a good place to just sit and watch people. The restaurant that we went to was very nice,didn't rip you off and no cover charge and we were outside. Some street vendors around which does spoil the area - one selling balloons which would have interrupted everyone's photos and cheapens the place - unfortunately this seems to be something the authorities don't want to curb. Anyway, go and see since it is not far from other attractions and it is free. It is also nice during the evening - assuming it isn't raining either.

The best large plaza , piazza , square , etc in the world. This wonderful place is the true heart of Rome where the city shows off it's elegance, liveliness and architectural culture. Built on the site of Diocletian's circus, this elliptical space s surrounded by elegant buildings, including one wonderful church, and many cafes, bars, restaurants and gelateria. The space is dominated by three lovely fountains, the central one of which is Bernini's masterful Fountain of the Four Rivers.... Danube, Nile, Ganges and Plate... One for each of the then known continents so sorry Aussies, no Murray!The piazza is a Mecca for people watching, relaxing with friends and drinks and of course gelati.It is my favourite place to sit and watch Rome go by.

People watching and gelato paradise. The huge elliptical-shaped piazza between Campo de Fiori and the Pantheon is ringed by cafes, gelaterias, and artisan shops. You can also appreciate the amazing architecture of the buildings that make up the periphery. Additionally, there are three huge fountains in the square, all of which provide ample seating space to relax.Locals and tourists mix to watch entertainers and artists who set up to show their wares. We were lucky to be there on a warm, sunny afternoon with a cool breeze, and we spent about an hour just taking in the scenery, people watching, browsing the art, and enjoying gelato.There is a bus that goes straight there; the stop is Vittorio Emmanuele/Piazza Navona. I would recommend taking the bus there and meandering back towards the Fontana del Tritone (at the Barberini metro stop, A line), during which time you'll pass the Pantheon, Tempio Adriano, Fontana di Trevi, as well as the Via del Corso (similar to Champs-Elyssees in Paris with tons of high end shopping and eateries).Piazza Navona was a great place to relax and enjoy the Roman atmosphere.
Beautiful Area. This is a beautiful open space with some stunning fountains. A number of street performers add to the atmosphere of the area. Definitely worth a visit.

A lively, enjoyable spot to embrace Roman life. Piazza Navonna one of Rome's largest squares, is on the site of an ancient stadium (built by Domitian inAD86) and retains the elliptical shape. Surrounded by cafés and decorated by three Baroque fountains, the site is busy with locals as well as tourists. Day and night there are entertainers and crowds to watch. The center fountain Fontana dei Fiumi, designed by Bernini, was completed in 1651 and represents the the four rivers-the Danube, Ganges, Nile and Rio de la Plata- of the four continents identified at that time. At the northern end of the piazza is a wonderful gelaterie Grom.
the beautiful square. This is one of my favourite square but I don't like it at moment because it is full of abusive vendors and junk... the police doesnt't care, criminality is allowed in Italy.
better than the Trevi fountain. Since the Trevi fountain was closed for renovation, this was the next best fountain. Great energy surrounding the piazza

Do Not miss it. A place that must be visited in Rome. We stayed at Rome for 2 days and we visited this piazza twice as it became our favorite place. You will enjoy the huge space and area of the piazza, surrounded by lots of cafe, and many running activities by different people. We were family with small kids and children and all of us loved this place, music, shows, paintings and drawings done by normal people in this piazza.The piazza was very hot during the day, so preferred time to visit is afternoon and night.

Good place to people watch. We enjoyed the beautiful fountains and statues, as well as the buskers in the square. We did not enjoy the cafe, where the bruschetta had been pre toasted, then vaguely warmed, and the waiter tried selling us a CD of him playing the accordion, and then hovered right over us when we received our change...hoping for a tip for very poor service.Go to Cul De Sac which is around the corner...great wine choice, much better prices and some delicious food

Perfect for my 10 year old. Because I was traveling with my 10 year old son I wanted places that were historical and yet fun and age appropriate. Piazza Navona was a great place to enjoy the beautiful fountain (especially since the Trevi Fountain was closed for repair. What a great square to people watch and enjoy a gelato. Artist are there during the day painting and drawing pictures and at night people are sitting at the many outdoor cafes eating dinner or having drinks. There are also street entertainers at night which my son enjoyed watching. We took the opportunity to walk outside the square and discovered lots of little places to eat and shop. Loved it.

Wonderful way to spend an evening. More than a few times my wife and I spent the evening sitting at a restaurant in the Piazza Navona sipping "Vina rossa della casa" and watching the world go by. I can't think of a better way to end a day.

Lovely little square. Lovely square, with a large central fountain and one at each end of the square. Great place to sit and people watch,whilst enjoying an ice cream from one of the little ice cream shops or sitting having a drink or snack in one of the many eateries within the square. There are street artists to watch. Lovely atmosphere both day and night, quite busy. Don 't forget to have a meander up some of the quaint little side streets leading off the piazza.

Breath taking Piazza Navona square. One of the most beautiful and majestic city square in Rome, Italy. It is believed that the site was that of a stadium in 1st century A.D. A reminder of Baroque Roman architecture where stands the famous 'Fountain of Four Rivers' dwarfed by the Obelisk of Domitian. The square has additional two fountains, the 'Fontana del Moro' and the 'Fountain of Neptune'. The artwork and the sculptures are so very real specially when you see the work on the fountain at South End where one sees a Moor wrestling with a Dolphin and the basin with the four Tritons.One can also not miss the ancient speaking statue of 'Pasquino' at the southern end of the PiazzaThe evenings are so beautiful to spend in the Piazza and one can see painters doing water/oil colurs and artisans doing performing art. There are very good restaurants on the side where one can sip red wine and eat a nice Italian meal and look on to the happenings in the Plaza. It is said that in the past history, theatrical events were held here as also the Bazzars and during christmas the sight would be enthreal.We had quite a few enchanting and memorable evenings at the Piazza Navona.

Lovely little area. Trevi fountain was closed at the time of our visit and we stubbled upon this Piazza. It has one large centrally located fountain which is quite spectacular and a smaller one at each end. There are plenty of places to eat, sit and absorb the culture.

Not to be missed. One of Rome locations not to be missed. Great atmosphere during the day or night. The place is crowded all the time. Regular visits by tour guides and tourists take place there. There are three water fountains with statues. The one in the middle of the square known as the Four Rivers Fountain is not only beautiful but enormous. It has also an obelisk. There are artists and vendors of paintings there. Several restaurants with ridicules prices (tourists prices). Enjoyable place.

Watch Angels and Demons before and after visiting. So we stayed about a block away and walked over here just about every day and night just to watch all of the performers, people watch and to enjoy the gorgeous fountains. IT was fun to watch Angels and Demons before and of course afterwards to say "We were there!". Just a great Piazza with Bernini's fountains and the beautiful exterior of Sant'Agnese church. Definitely worth a visit, don't miss it.

Some of the Best Restaurants in Rome!. Not only is the piazza stunningly beautiful but all the cafe's and restaurants surrounding it are amazing, we had one of the best meals of our life there! It's also only about a 3 minute walk from the Pantheon and all the side streets around that area are full of lively restaurants and shops. This quickly became our favourite place in Rome!

Enjoy the Atmosphere. Like a number of reviewers we originally found this Piazza by accident. But once found we return every time we are in Rome. Yes it is always busy but it is also the best place in Rome to observe our fellow travelers and take in the magnificent architecture. All while you are enjoying a glass of vino and a bowl of pasta in one of the many pavement restaurants, did I say 'glass', it's definitely a place to pause a little longer and enjoy a bottle!
Love this piazza!. We love the Piazza Navona! It has a great feel to it, and there is lots to look at. The fountains in particular are gorgeous!

Happening Piazza. Piazza Navona is a very busy place. The most interesting part of this place is the Artists displaying their work. If you love paintings I would recommend you to buy some paintings from this place. You will be buying the art directly from the artist. Have some coffee and rest here for a while.

A lovely find. We walked into here completely by accident and it's gorgeous. Armed with an ice cream from blue ice, which was lovely, we loved the atmosphere and the beautiful surroundings. Definitely worth visiting.

Our favourite Piazza!. Navona is well worth a visit, a quirky busy square with stunning surroundings and great street performers. A great place to sit back and watch the world go by - well worth a visit :-)
One of the best place in Rome. Very romantic, with the "smell" of Rome, traditional buldings and people. a tourist area, very nice food and normal prices
Great attraction in Rome. Busy...so beware of pick pockets...but a wonderful part of rome...beautiful fountains, cafes, street performers...a great taste of the city.

One of the most beautiful square in Rome. The square is one of the most beautiful square in Rome. What I have found interesting is to stay there in the evening, when you have less tourists. Bring some beers and find somewhere to sit, in front of the Four Rivers fountain maybe!

Best piazza in Rome. In my modest opinion this is the most stunning piazza in all of Rome. Bernini's fountain of the 4 rivers dominates in the centre and there are other 2 flanking each side. In the background there is the lovely church of Sant' Agnese in Agonia. At night it's magical and it livens up with street performers. Pay attention to pickpockets and don't you dare eat there cause besides being overpriced, the food is generally rubbish!

Beautiful!. A taste of Italy. Beautiful Piazza that is full of character. Beautiful old buildings, flowers in window boxes, stalls selling pictures etc, restaurants and bars, fountains, everything! Worth a walk around and take in the atmosphere and scenery! Beautiful!

Must See Site. Piazza Novona, in the heart of Rome, should be on the itinerary of everyone visiting Rome. In addition to being the loveliest square in the city, it is very busy every afternoon and evening with artists, mimes and musicians. The center of the square is held down by the Four Rivers Fountain, one of the most spectacular fountains in the city. The square is quite large and never gets too crowded. Near by is the Pantheon, some notable churches and the Jewish Ghetto. There are many hotels and restaurants in the area and consideration should be given to bedding down in this neighborhood.

Bernini's Masterpiece. This is one of the most beautiful squares in Rome. You admire the architectural jewels of Bernini. You can sit quietly and enjoy the delicacy of Italian art. All around the square are shops, restaurants and specially the best ice cream.

Afternoon stroll-worthy. Walked around here to check out sidewalk artists/vendors (even an occasional street performer), sit and admire the water fountains, people-watch and eat gelato. Wandered into a chapel
For shoperholics. Shops, Shops and Shops. Lovely selection of shops and places to eat. Not too expensive as well. Loved it.
nice but expensive. A nice place to have a walk around and have a look at. Lots of cafes and bars to sit and relax in. Worth a visit.
Beautiful. Wow what a amazing place it looks like something out of the movies so beautiful just sitting there an watching the world go by.
Nice place to roam around. A pretty big area with a nice fountain at the middle. Few towers around. Nice place to take a break after a long walk.

Worth a visit!!. This is a gorgeous piazza that is filled with hustle and bustle of tourists but at the same time chilled out with people sitting back in the cafés just watching the world go by! You can have food or just a drink in one of the many restaurants and cafe bars or even just sit on one of the seats and take it all in. It has fountains and either end which are lovely with lots in between. Well worth a visit!!

Piazza Novona. This was one of our favorite squares. Beautiful view and full of little restaurants to choose from. We had an amazing dessert at one of the restaurants, regretting I can't remember the name.

Feel like a Renaissance contessa in Rome. While Rome abounds with many remarkable sites, ambling inside this piazza transports you to the 16th century. The shape of buildings, the obelisks and fountains, this is a time travelers dream of a place. While I only shopped at a toy store in the square, it seems like aperfect place, too, for a more modern experience of buying presents to take back to friends and family.

Magical activity center. We visited this ancient place dating from the Middle Ages in late afternoon when there were so many things going on: artists using chalk and spray paint, portrait and caricature artists, jewelry artists and vendors, music performers, soccer ball antic performers, mimes, etc. Lots of people, some eating, some people-watching, some watching performers, some dining in front of restaurants but all engaged in some way. A very interesting gathering place with three wonderful sculpture fountains built over the Emperor Domitian's stadium: Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers in the center, Bernini's Fountain of the Moor at the south end and a 19th century Fountain of Neptune at the other end. Be sure to visit this activity packed beautiful baroque site.

Just one word - Beautiful. This square is so beautiful and relaxing, it makes you feel that you really in Rome. It's an amazing place to amble or stop for a drink at one of the restaurants or by any of the fountains. Highly recommended as you'll not regret this!

I see "romantic" comes from the word "Rome" after going to this place. Amazingly beautiful and romantic...the picturesque moment you imagine when you envision going to Europe. Come at night. There are people playing music, selling art, eating a late dinner, and drinking wine. There's a fountain and benches, and the setting felt absolutely magical. You can sit and people watch or get to know other tourists. This was my FAVORITE place in Rome. I went here 2 or 3 times during my 5 day stay in Rome.

The prettiest Piazza in Rome!. Even if you are in Rome only for a few days do take out the time to visit the Piazza Navona.Its a large and rectangular Piazza with three fountains and beautiful statuary. In the centre is the Fountain of the Four rivers with an Egyptian obelisk.We visited the Piazza in the evening and everything shone burnished gold. The atmosphere sparkled too. There were impromptu musicians, a wonderfully theatrical magician, delicate paintings in stalls and artists at work. You could get your portrait or even a caricature made on the spot, share a bench with strangers or just drift from one end of the square to the other admiring the splendid buildings around.Piazza Navona is definitely among my Top 5 outdoor attractions in a city where its very difficult to pick favourites!

Truly Magical. A bustling square full of painters, resaurants, gelateries and fountains.If you like to people watch this place is for you.Just take a moment to sit and listen to all the chatter in different languages and watch the tourists excitedly looking at the market stalls whilst eating their gelato's.A real roman experience

my favorite fountain in Rome. Yes, Trevi and other fountains are more famous, but the Fountains of the Four Rivers was my favorite in all of Rome. Each side is different & tells a story if you do the research/learn the history in its carving. The piazza is oblong & surrounded by buildings, so it feels more tight/small compared to other piazzas. There are other, less ornate details + fountains in the piazza but it felt safe and was relatively clean. Plus, it was centrally located in Rome.

We Love Piazza Navona!. Piazza Navona is one of the most beautiful Piazzas in Italy. Even though it was crowded in July, we were able to stroll around and take it all in. There were some fun street performers (including wonderful musicians) and also some vendors that were selling some nice paintings and purses!

People watching. Find a shady chair and kick back and relax. Take in the fabulous fountains and architecture, listen to the bells and watch the polizei try to keep people from sitting on the edges of the fountain. A perfect place to spend an afternoon making up intriguing stories about the people around you.

Get a feel of being in Rome today. . After seeing all the landmarks and cultural places etc etc. It is a must to visit piazza navona. The restaurants all around , the fountains. The street performers and artists. Everything is just what u expect of today's Rome !! Make sure you don't miss it. Plan half a lazy day here. Have wine. Local food and enjoy the atmosphere.
Beautiful!. This has to be one of the most beautiful piazza areas in Rome. It is spacious and surrounded by fantastic cafes and restaurants. Well worth a visit indeed.
Great!!!. It is hidden piazza :) because it is behind the big buildings, and narrow streets without sign but it was very beautiful...

Magnificent spot of rome .. not to miss it ... What better than spend the afternoon at Piazza Navona until watching sunset reflecting on its orange buildings facade ...I deeply enjoyed walking along the piazza , and admire its 3 fountains , especially the biggest one called " fountain of four rivers" , I liked also the small fountain with its statues ..There is a fabulous cafe in the middle of the piazza serving the Napoleoni (sweet italian dessert) and a good espresso where you can admire all the piazza and listen to ambulant opera singers arround the piazza there are a lot of tiny restaurants located in tiny streets , they serve best italian food on EarthIt is really an amazing place everyone should not miss it ..

"Impressive". What Place des Vosges is for Paris, is Piazza Navona for Rome: the most beautiful square of the city.And when you are there you must treat yourself on the great Tartufo-icecream: it's delicious (every mouthful of it) and when one is sitting there on the Piazza Navona, enjoying the view and the tourists, one forgets straight away that it costs € 10,-. Adding a glass of Port is even more enjoyable.For young lovers it is okay to share one Tartufo on the terrace: the lady often gets the cherry!!!

Nice use of an old chariot race circuit. Interesting by day or night and in the centro area and it's attractions. The fountains there are impressive and the palaces stunning. A nice place for evening dinger ( though more expensive than other areas) but worth watching the parade of peOple, entertainers, artists markets and fountains by night.

Better than a parade and what a study of tribal anthropology. We have stayed within two blocks of Piazza Navona on each of our four visits to Rome. This place is simply fabulous.Some people are turned off by all the honky tonk, but we love it. The tourists, the performers, the artists, the purse sellers, the cops, and the waiters all add to the charm of the place. Plus there are the three Bernini fountains and the buildings.This trip we enjoyed spending time at one of the cafes (avoid Tre Scalini -- Rome's answer to Antoine's in New Orleans, an over-rated restaurant living on past reviews) and just watching the going's on. We particularly enjoyed the purse sellers, who scatter (well, grab their bags and walk about 10 feet away) whenever a police car enters the piazza, and the interactions between the various performers.Whether you're interested in the architecture or the nonstop showtime, it's a fascinating place.

Beautiful in the evening. We visit the piazza in the evening. The entire place comes alive with music and live performances. A very good place to just sit down for a while to soak up the atmosphere and people watch. My 2 year old had a lovely time chasing the pigeons. The fountains are also beautiful.

Enjoyable!. One of my favorite spots in Rome. The three fountains in the piazza are just beautiful and there were people playing music and others singing. I just loved the place and atmosphere. Don't miss it on your Rome trip.

A breathtaking piazza. During my 6 day visit of Rome I went or passed through this piazza about 4 times. The best time of the day is in the evening when it becomes alive with all forms of animators and restaurants open and all smelling of good Roman food. All the fountains contain splendid baroque figurines, especially the four river fountain. The church is also very beautiful to visit though it is not so large.A place worth visit any time of the year.

Absolutely beautiful!. We were very lucky that the sun was beaming the day we went. It is so beautiful and so interesting. The whole area is so full of life! There are so many little restaurants on the Piazza. They are a little pricier than maybe a few streets away but you're paying for the privilege of the view. It's just absolutely lovely!

What a gorgeous place for a small beer!. We stumbled upon this Piazza by accident (not realising it was around the next corner) - and what a place! Just stunning. Be sure to find time to sit and soak up the atmosphere in one of the cafes around the Piazza and people and fountain watch!

Lovely and atmospheric. We kept coming back to Piazza Navona, visiting 3 times during our week in Rome. Evening is the best time to visit in August as the piazza fills with visitors and various artists and performers. Of particular note is a trio who play double bass, accordion and some sort of harpsichord style instrument, they are very entertaining. We watched them two nights running (and left them money both times!)Nice atmosphere and feels reasonably safe (though always take care in Rome)

Visit in the evening.. We found the Piazza Navona in the evening and were not disappointed with the experience. It was busy, full of artists and street entertainers. The central fountain was lit up and well worth a photo or two.

Entertaining street artists and musicians. A lovely place to go to in the evening and great to see the fountains.I bought the CD 'Notte Manouche' for 10 euros from the highly talented group of musicians who were playing there when we went and can thoroughly recommend it.The street performer was most entertaining and well worth the contribution we gave. The only down-side of watching something like this is the embarrassment of seeing so many people who have watched and laughed and enjoyed it and then walk away without offering anything.

Bellisimo. What a piazza!!! The fountains , the atmosphere . All good . Spent the best part of three hours here .  Ended it off by lunching at the restaurant dead opposite the fountain , I did not note the name , but my table put me face on to the fountain . There was a woman playing the accordion to the left ,So the whole thing made my lunch of rigatoni amatricaina very special even tho it was just pasta . The starter of fior di zucchini and bacala fritti was good , the spino Peroni was great and the coffee was spot on. The price tag of € 83 without a tip was expected , but this is a case of paying for the location , which I'm ok with as this is certainly a stunning place to be and to eat at . The only down side to the restaurant was the loos which were in the basement, unisex and attended by an elderly lady with a sign that said. "Your tips are my wages" ... Why? They charge enough upstairs to pay for someone to check there is paper and soap , which is all she did ..
Busy but spectacular. If you are into people watching, food galore and simply a place to have a good time; a visit to Piazza Navona is a must.

Fantastic atmosphere and fine dining. A large square with historic fountains, musicians, art dealers and superb ristorante. Our second visit to this place. TIP: Desserts are expensive. Pop accross to Tre Scali for the best Ice Cream in the world
Beautiful! . A beautiful piazza with fountains, restaurants and many artist with paintings of Roma, Italy and lots more. And some can even draw a picture of you and your loved ones!

Beautiful plaza and statuary. Driver guide service took us here as part of a two day tour of Rome. You will need to walk a few blocks to get to the plaza, but worth the effort. Beautiful fountains, lots of great little cafe's to sit and people watch.
A perfect place to chill!. I never visit Rome without enjoying a meal sitting in the square people watching and enjoying the fountains and artisans and of course good food and wine!
stumbled upon this square!. Very beautiful and I learned it used to be the location of a chariot race track. You can see the ruins of it just behind the plaza.

Just exactly as you expect Italy and Rome to look like!. My family and I have ended up here several times during our holiday, just because there are so many other things near it. There are many cafes / restaurants etc around the piazza, be careful which one you choose if you are in any type of careful budget. We went to Tre Scalini restaurant (famous for their chocolate icecream balls apparently) and it cost €18 just for two cans of coke and a can of Fanta! Having walked around a bit afterwards, there was a cafe opposite selling the same for half the price... The fountains are amazing, the obelisk is grand and the atmosphere is worth soaking up!

stumble upon. got lost looking for the coffee place 'sant eustachio' and boy we were we glad we did! this place was so beautiful and had so much going on. Its one of the bigger Piazzas which has a beautiful fountain in the middle and gorgeous buildings all around. busy but not too busy, highly recommend checking it out and taking a panorama!

Big enough and tourist enough!!. I've been there 3 years ago on christmas time and it was more romantic!! Its a very beautiful piazza but if you want to eat try piazza campo di fiori !! More italians and better food!!

Wonderful place to round off your day.. My son and I ended up here on all but one of our nights in Rome. It is a wonderful place to relax and watch the street entertainers and artists, and it has a very relaxed and safe feel to it. Funnily enough, despite being such a focal point, it doesn't feel too crowded and we had no trouble getting a table at one of the many restaurants.

“"Really Fantastic "”. Alanic is one of the rising clothing wholesalers based in Australia. This company is into offering a vast range of fashion and sports clothing to buyers all over the world. The company, at this very moment is thoroughly involved in spreading their roots all over the globe in all the booming destinations and more with massive acceptance from the buyers in the respective areas. Tony Beig, who is the brain behind Alanic is in the process of introducing more to their shelves and improving their contribution to the world of fashion by every passing day.
Very nice, lots to see!. A very large piazza, filled with restaurants and different vendors. The Fountain of the Four Rivers is the main attraction, definitely worth a visit.

Heaven on Earth. Very possibly my favourite place in this world. All life is here! Perfect place to just mill around, chill out by a fountain, admire the stunning surroundings, watch a street artist, have a meal, or just simply watch Rome go by! I could have happily gone there every night during my trip.

One of our favorite Piazza's. This is area is beautiful, there is a lot going on and you can just sit and enjoy some vino while taking it all in. This was our last stop of a very long day of sight seeing before heading back to our hotel.

Wonderful place to enjoy music, dance, and art.. One of my fondest memories of Rome is just strolling around the Piazza Navona one evening and enjoying the street performers. Everything from a dancer with her dog, to a levitating man, opera singer, acoustic ensemble, and electric guitars and trap sets! Toy shops, souvenir shops, and restaurants surround the piazza. A wonderful way to spend a relaxing evening.

forty years ago this square was filled with druggies and no-hopers... but now..... Yes, it has changed for the better; when we first visited here it was a hangout for undesirables , but now it has fulfilled it's destiny and blossomed into a beautiful Piazza for all to enjoy.It is close to the Pantheon; the Umberto Bridge; Trevi Fountain and not far from the Forum and Colosseo, so there is no reason to miss it, as it can all be embraced into one visit if you are pressed for time. But please try to give it the time that it deserves.

My favorite in Rome. Out of all the fountains in Rome, this is definitely my favorite.Filled with musicians and artists all around it makes for a great place to drink some coffee or cold drinks and walk around.Simply incredible.

Bernini's Masterpiece. This was more beautiful than the pictures make it out to be! The atmosphere around the fountain added to the charm. There was a fantastic souvenir shop right on the corner where you can find almost anything with reasonable prices! The police were helpful and many spoke English.

Ok, so it's 3 fountains in a square but so good!. We spent ages walking and sitting around the fountains enjoying the sunshine. Lunch at a restaurant in the piazza watching the world go by, great day...

"Really beautiful ". Piazza Navona is one of the most famous and beautiful of Rome's many squares. The large and lively square features no less than three magnificent fountains. Another eyecatcher is the Baroque church of Sant'Agnese in Agone.

Gorgeous piazza, amazing fountains.. We were in Rome for only one day as we were on a cruise.we went to the Trei Fountain adn were so disappointed since the whole thing was covered with a scaffolding for renovation so we couldn't see a thing.So we decide to visit the Piazza Navona to see the Bernini's fountains.We are amazed...As soon as you get into the Piazza, you are surprised by the openess of the Piazza.The Brazilian embassy is located in a beautiful historic building.The 3 fountains are located in the middel of the Piazza. There are restaurants and coffeeshops all around the piazza. This would be a wonderful place to sit down and have a memorable diner while gazing and listening to the Fountains.If we ever come back to Rome for a longer stay, we will definitely come back and have diner at the Piazza.

Lots going on here plus a Bernini. This is a very large piazza, with lots of charming restaurants, and interesting art vendors. The main attraction is the Bernini fountain, Four Rivers, which has amazing detail and realism. It seems like this place is busy 24 hours a day.
Romantic Rome at its best. This place oozes style & romance. Best to see as it gets dark. Plenty of good eating or just people watching. Everyone has a smile on their face here. Amazing fountain!

beautiful spot. piazza navona is a great spot for people watching , lots of fantastic restaurants , gelato shops , markets , and local artists & musicians. there is always something happening day or night.

Very pretty, plenty to see.... We visited the Piazza Navona as part of walking tour. Our guide gave us a detailed history, but due it being a tour sadly we didn't really get a chance to "enjoy" our visit. Built originally as the Stadium of Domitian, this has "become" what you now see as the piazza. There are three fountains, the Fountain of Neptune, the Moor Fountain, which is a replica, due to a vandal (who would have thought, a vandal in Rome!) the original is now housed in the Gallery Borghese, and the Fountain of the Four Rivers (complete with the obelisk of Domitian). The piazza also contains the Sant'Agnese in Agone (again, sadly we didn't get a chance to view inside).Apart from these obvious sights, there are plenty of cafes, an art market, shops and the general hustle and bustle of a lovely place. I think it would merit more than one visit, sadly due to time constraints we didn't get the chance to go back, but on our next trip to Rome we definitely will..!!

Piazza paradise.. The Piazza Navona, is absolutely spectacular. By day it is a tourist attraction of grand standards. It is a circle of life, from the tourists to the natives trying to sell trinkets. Food, attractions, everything. There is nothing like Rome. It is like taking a step back into the History books, you can almost hear the roar in the coliseum as the gladiators entertain. I had an apartment rented for 1 week off of the Piazza Navona and my family and I believed it was the best place. It felt like the epicenter of everything happening. Night time it transforms into just more attractions, and there is never a dull moment. Easy access to the rest of the city, cabs are readily available, and the people are very nice. My favorite memory was the guy who served me delicious fresh gelato with berries and sang to me. I think I need to go back and find him...

Beautiful Square and Wonderful Sant'Agnese in Agone. The Navona is beautiful and joyful. We also like wonderful Sant'Agnese in Agone church on the square. There are many nice sculptures in the square.

Fountains, cafes and art market.. Visited 5 times so far, and we will be going back. This well kept square is surrounded by cafes and small shops. Piazza Navona hosts an art market, where you can buy beautiful pieces from local artists or have a caricature made. A must see for all visitors.Beware of the surrounding cafes as they are very expensive. Buy an ice cream from a shop on the way to Piazza Navona and sit by the fountains.

People watching !. This is one of my favourite piazzas in Rome grab a sandwich sit down and take in the views of the fountains watch the artists paint, maybe sit outside at one of cafés and take it all in

The best piazza in rome. The best piazza in rome... Three fountains , fabulous, lot of energy , people who draw, small fan fairs, lot of restaurants and gars near... I believe it i s mor than a mast to visit... Try walking in the small roads near this piazza and the true rome will be revealed !

Yummmm. On the last night of our Honeymoon stay in Rome, what better way to end than dinner in the Piazza. Amazing atmosphere, people everywhere, and a magnificent authentic 3 course meal - my beautiful wife and I could not have asked for any more!

Chill Out, Eat, Drink, Watch and Enjoy. What a lovely place to be day or night.Yes the food is more expensive from the restaurants on the square but I think it has to be done once if you are staying in Rome for a few days. You can sit and enjoy the sight of the lovely fountains while the world goes by.

The Heart of Rome. This piazza is a wonderful place to end your day exploring Rome. We visited two evenings of our three days in Rome, and just sat, relaxed and enjoyed watching Rome go by. The piazza is large so you won't feel crowded out. There are gelato shops, restaurants, street artists, street performers, and all the people watching you can handle. Go explore Rome, and come to Piazza Navona in the evening. Get yourself a gelato and sit down and enjoy the heart of Rome.
piazza navona. a fantastic place especially in the evening,where you can take a seat and just people watch,plenty of great street artists,music,and eateries,and of course the wonderful fountains

My favorite Piazza!. I just love Piazza Navona! Yes, it is crowded with tourists, but that's because it's a beautiful place to be! The fountains are gorgeous, there's lots of room to walk around and enjoy with no cars, and it's location can make a great meeting place. I would NOT recommend eating at any of the restaurants within the piazza (which is true for most piazzas in Rome). It's better to go off the beaten path a bit to avoid the tourist traps, but there are some great restaurants down the ally-ways around it!

Lovely place to eat with a typical Italian atmosphere. Just walking ito the Piazza Navona, it changes from the hustle and bustle of the busy streets to a typical italian Square, lined with top class restaurant, surrounding three amazing fountians. Various street entertainers from clowns to musicians perform for the crowds.It's a great place to eat, drink, or even just people watch
too hot to explore. It was too hot a day to explore at any great length but would love to go back to sit outside and people watch. Impressive fountains.

Gelati highlight. The Piazza is impressive. Right opposite the fountains is a café called Tartufi 1896....gelati at 1.95 each, and we visited it daily...chooses pesca and mirtillo falvours like we did. The owner of the café says his place is the best in the universe, let alobe galaxy.

Do Check Piazza Navona Out. The PIazza itself is a beautiful place to visit. It's so big and open even if it's busy you don't feel overwhelmed by people. The 3 fountains are lovely photo opportunities and the buskers all seemed very talented, playing some beautiful music. It made me wish I could dance, it would have been lovely to just spontaneously dance with my hubby in the sunshine on the cobbles. Its a great laid back place to have a rest and watch the world go by. The cafes around the edge seemed expensive and we guessed catered mainly for tourists.

My Favorite Piazza. Maybe it was just a matter of timing, but this was my favorite piazza! It's huge and open and feels so relaxing. There are numerous restaurants, some very fun street performers, gorgeous buildings, breathing taking works of art, everything you want and expect in an Italian piazza, and more. we went there several times during our 4 days in Rome and each time totally enjoyed ourselves. When we were hot, exhausted, hungry, and our feet hurt from sight seeing, this is where we went to relax and rejuvenate.Now that I'm home, I miss it.
Charming. Very beautiful in any time of day, with decorated fountains, artists, music, restaurants, and nice quiet atmosphere.

One of my favourite places in Rome!. I loved this piazza! We came upon it several times while we were out touring and once was first thing in the morning. It was so quiet for being in the middle of Rome. We watched all the vendors set up their booths and enjoyed the morning watching the locals get off to work. It was nice. It gets fairly busy throughout the day but it's worth stopping by. Great place to people watch from the benches around the piazza!

Stunning piazza. AVOID the cafes and restaurants.. Piazza Navona is simply stunning. The Fountains are out of this world. This is Rome ! However, the cafes and he restaurants on the Piazza are the WORST in Italy (and the world). The worst tourist traps in the world: Bad food and drinks, Lousy service. Grossly over-rpiced with 14% additional service fee (and tip not included). Avoid the cafes and restaurants, but Enjoy the Piazza by walking or sitting close to the fountains.

A free attraction thats amazing to sit and watch the world go by. My wife and I went twice that's how much we enjoyed it. The fountain itself is an amazing structure and worth the visit. It is very close to the pantheon and we did both in one visit. There is smaller less stand out fountain that's also really nice to see, as well as a church that has open doors, where you can visit. We didn't try the restaurants, although like the rest in Rome the jump on you as you go past wanting you go in. But if you "no" they do tend to back off.

Another great Roman Piazza. We had a lovely time here in the late afternoon just watching the locals and having coffee. Great photo opportunities, great for just taking a picnic and sitting on the sidelines. We never had any problems even with pickpockets but that may have been because we were aware and followed the usual safety precautions such as wear a money belt and never take anything out that we could not afforded to lose, as well as avoiding anyone wanting to get too close and groups of people showing interest in others. But we did this in every other city and country and would do the same in home cities. Take precautions but be aware that this is a chance of a life time to enjoy the residue and the foundations of a new great city.
Wonderful fountains. Piazza Navona has some beautiful fountains and great little eateries a nice place to stop after a day of exploring Rome.

Former Chariot Raceway. Though this was once a chariot raceway for lesser drivers there is nothing remaining. Instead its been changed into a piazza with beautiful fountains and restaurants. It's a great place to sit and people watch, have a wine and some food in the afternoon.

amazing!!. loved this area. Kind of a mixture of Bourbon Street and times square with its energy. No glitz but old world charm. Cafes everywhere, huge fountains, people of all races, colors and creeds just hanging out. Artists selling their paintings, horse carriages, etc. Go at night and it's even more fun!!

Enjoyed this piazza. Nice place to spend some time at night. Lots of sights, restaurants, activity. There was a painting expo when we were there. Bustling with activity. Just watch out for the pick pockets and thieves. We saw a few get arrested.

You have got to go here. This is a must, you've got performers, fountains,artists shopping and restaurants.A brilliant and reasonably cheap Morano glass shop, toy shop not so cheap but lots of interesting things you don't see anywhere else.You pay a little in the restaurants but you expect that because of where you are. When your done here(and you will be some time) looking at the main fountain with the Morano glass shop behind you turn right and walk through the entrance at the end turn left when you get through and stay on this side for now when you get to the end of the path look left to find more excavations of buildings recently found. After you seen this turn 180 degrees and cross the road walk straight forward pass the underground loos. In front of you there's a restaurant, if your hungry or thirsty use this place we've been here loads of times one of the cheapest places for food and drink that we have ever found portion sizes are ample as well.Staff also very friendly.When your done here walk back the way you came but now follow this sidewalk pass a couple of souvenir shops and around the corner you'll find a shop that sells different things to most of the others.Now walk back through into navona and head for the other end a few more basic shops in the far left corner but on the right under a arch a museum, take a look.

This is a really special public gathering place. If you look at a map of Rome central city, there is a piazza just about every 3 miles. The plazas were built for many different reasons in Roman days, but mostly to serve as public gathering places. Some are just nice open spaces with a church as an anchor of the plaza. Piazza Navona however is just a great place filled with beautiful fountains, shops and many good restaurants. I have been here 2 times and just love the atmosphere, both day and night. In ancient times it actually served as an oval outdoor arena for racing and athletic events. You get a sense of that by looking at the layout. I would definitely include a lunch or dinner here while in Rome. Don't forget the gelato for dessert!

Nice piazza. Nice piazza, but so crowded when we visited. Lots of nice trattorias and restaurants arround...but beware of the prices! Just a few blocks away and you get the same meal for about 50% less. Beware of gypsy thiefs and pickpocketers!

Pleasant Piazza. In the Piazza Navona apart from the many cafes there were also street performers,Human statues and dancers for example,There were many tourists there on the day we visited.We also visited the Museum of Rome which is in the south part of the Piazza. which gave us an insight to the development of Rome over the Centuries through numerous paintings ,photoes and sketches.

Historic and lively Rome. The piazza Navona is where history and entertainment come together seamlessly, the wonderful architecture of the buildings, combined with the beautiful fountains, its a busy, bustling area, and the general buzz of the piazza make it a place to visit.Restaurants surround the piazza, we've eaten in many over the years, and I can honestly say we've never a bad meal.The street entertainers are highly charismatic, and enthusiastic is an understatement, the best thing is that its a constant revolution of acts, from gymnasts, to fire eaters, and brilliant music acts.Take your time over your meal, the restaurants won't rush you, and just enjoy your meal, and absorb the atmosphere.Some of the shops in the area are the best in Roma, look for the leather goods, as good if not better, than anywhere in the world.. As expertly informed by my wife....?If your lucky enough to be in Roma from November to Xmas, the pizza is a wonderful craft market and children's rides, Italians do Xmas very well.Whilst in the area, you must visit the Campo di fiori, or flower market by day, with lovely restaurants, and by night another source of great entertainment.For you assassins creed players, see the statue in the campo... Then you'll know where the idea came from for the game.

One of the best places in the city. Loved this place, excellent street entertainers, fabulous fountains, awesome architecture, first went to this square during the day and thought it was great, went back after dark and the place had come alive. Take time to really study the fountains, they are not only a tremendous piece of art but think of the history behind the one depicting the four rivers. Magnificent

Looks like a Film Set!. Very busy but a really atmopheric place. The last time we visited Rome the fabulous fountains were shrouded in scaffolding so it was amazing to see them in all their splendour. It looks and feels as if you have wandered into a film set. There are lots of places to sit and eat and it is worth the extra expense to just sit in the shade and people watch.The ochre and rust colours of the buildings change as the sun moves round and in the evening it sparkles with lights.

worth a sit and watch. we stopped and had a soft drink on a very hot day. everyone tells you not to stop on the squares but we found a cafe restaurant with cold water spray which was very welcome.drinks were not too expensive compared to all other places we used.do look at all the fountains. lovely

Charming Sunday. We went to Piazza Navona because we were there 30 years ago on our first trip abroad together. A few street entertainers, families out walking and a very relaxed atmosphere. We spent a lovely hour there people watching and enjoying the ambience. The bonus being the gorgeous buildings around the piazza and the beautiful fountains.

Great evening entertainment. Easily able to spend an evening (or more) people watching here. There's a variety of market stalls every night (painters, entertainers, sales of gimmicky items etc) and the piazza is loaded with people. Many restaurants to choose from and yes, more expensive than eating a couple blocks away but some nights, the extra money was worth the entertainment.

Huge piazza. Relatively huge tranquil piazza in Rome. Entertainers and people taking photos everywhere as usual. Surrounded by many restaurants with terraces. Wish I had tried one of them but as solo traveler on tight budget, they seemed a little expensive. Apparently there is a place called Pizza Bafetto near this piazzza that's real good but did not have time to look for it... cant wait to go back to Rome!

Great Place To Get Pulse Of Rome. I loved this Piazza! We stayed very near it, so we got to experience it during the day and in the evening. During the day there were artists, performers and people enjoying the fountains. At night the Piazza was perfectly lit to accentuate the fountains and surrounding architecture. Nice for people watching or a little romance. Great place to people watch and get a feel for the neighborhood

Still interest from the book. As you walk among the pretty fountains, either with a walking tour guide or your guide book to tell you what the fountains represent and who made them, you will still see people referring to Dan Brown Books and movies. When they first came out there were a lot of tours just on them, but now it's gone back to mostly who, what and where of the art. Lots of fun shops and kiosks in Dec. for the Christmas market, a definite stop if you are in Italy during that month. Enjoy coffee in the morning in the Piazza, gelato or wine in the late afternoon. Decided to try a tourist restaurant for dinner one night, was pleasantly surprised at the food. Is this for tourists, yes of course, and that's what we are when we come here to visit or take friends around...just relax and enjoy people watching if nothing else. Do as the Romans do, relax from noon to 3

For a romantic meal. This is a good place to have a romantic meal, early evening would be the best time,we were there in july so it was warm.You don't have to pay a fortune for a meal either.It's a great place to people watch,there are many talented buskers and street entertainers to amuse you while you eat.

What a Marvel!. My husband and I were in Rome visiting relatives as my husband had not been back since a small child. We stayed at Albergo Cesari just across the road from Trevi Fountain. What a marvel! It was just as I had imagined all the the various Greek (Roman co-opted) Gods and nymphs with all the sounds of the gushing water from the multitude of fountains. Of course I felt compelled to throw a coin in the Trevi Fountain to guarantee our return to Rome. We were not on a tour however I would recommend a tour including other tourist attractions for full understanding. But it is fine to just marvel at the beauty of the Trevi Fountain. Nearby there are places to have some food or have a drink. However be aware there can be pickpockets so be careful of your belongings. Russlyn Garotti

Lovely place to spend an afternoon. What a nice location to just sit and chill and marvel at the fountain. The atmosphere was relaxed and lots of people were just enjoying the great weather and sights. Lots of restaurants in the Piazza where you can have a meal or just a refreshing drink.

beautiful atmosphere and cafe area. this square is hot to wander around these is no shade but it is beautiful. There is a lovely and very reasonably priced tourist shop on the corner as you enter from the Pantheon side. the cafes are higher priced here but no one hurries you along even if you order a drink only. make use of the cafe toilets as there are no public toilets here. There were cheaper bars towards the museum side of the square, as they dont actually over look the square itself. The square was full of artists, a group of adhoc musicians were playing adding to the loveliness of the place.

Arty Rome. We got to Piazza Navone at the end of a long day spent walking all round Rome - at least that's how our feet felt. It was a lovely bright energetic atmosphere with musicians playing and artists displaying their work. The hardest decision was working out whether to sit in the sunshine to eat or go across the square to sit on the shady side. The menus are all much of a muchness so we ended up just picking the most pitiable looking waiter, an older white haired guy. The food was OK but he turned out to be not so pitiful after all after he pushed his accordion cd into our hands as a thank you for choosing his table, and then charged us for it on the bill! Oh well. Made a decent souvenir from our holiday to one of the family back home!

Piazza-tastic. Definitely a must to see during a visit to Rome, this Piazza with 3 water fountains is very impressive and picturesque. We visited during the afternoon and it was busy but not too busy to stop us walking around or to stop us taking photos. It's a nice place to walk around to take in the detail on the fountains and admire the buildings and church. There are also plenty of restaurants in this Piazza, although we didn't eat here as had more sightseeing to do!

Bernini beautiful fountain. One of the nicest plaza in Rome ,with the great sculptures of Bernini.Part of it was under restauration but still we could enjoy to walk around.A great place to spend time there.

Fascinating. You have to spend an hour or so here, just wandering around watching the artists and maybe have your portrait painted, the street muscians, the traders, some lovely shops, bit pricey but window shopping is free, great experience.

lovely and overly populated with tourist-beware pickpockets. Used to live nearby. Strictly for tourists as prices are skyhigh....beer 5-10Euros/each.A known pick pocket haven. Food is typical Roman and tons of restaurants to choose from.there are often artists there that have decent souvinirs-be sure to bargain!

My favorite place. This is my favorite attraction in Rome! The church, the restaurants, the vendors, the fountains, the people, all bring the flair that depicts Rome. The Fountain of the Four Rivers, with the obelisk, and the Fountain of the Moor , with the God of the Sea, at the center of the square, are both sculpted by Bernini and are magnificent! Be sure not to miss the Sant' Agnese church which is very beautiful. Take time outTo sit and people watch while enjoying a gelato, you will not be disappointed. Tour NOT necessary!

Beautiful and lively square but..... The square is beautiful, full of life. the fountains are also lovely.The only thing is it has become so touristy in a not so pleasant way - I mean a bit "gimicky", and has lost some of its authenticity, Roman - Italian authenticity.People wandering around solliciting you to buy silly gadgets that are being sold in squares in cities around the world, those stupid balls that light up, the whistle you put in your mouth to sound like a duck. As you walk around the restaurants look enticing but you cannot even look at a menu in peace without some waiter arriving in 5 seconds trying to coherse you to come in.We actually did eat in one restaurant and the food was just ok, but very expensive for what it´s worth.If I were you, I would look at the square but not hang around or eat there! A tourist trap, I fell into unfortunately. So If you read this you may be lucky enough to not have it happen to you - or at least choose - one may like that sort of thing...

Wet Day at Piazza Navona. Bit harsh really - its a beautiful place but was tipping down with the wet stuff the day we passed through. If the weather is good its a must see but no shelter when its raining.

Great Piazza. The largest of the Piazzas and probably the most crowded, an early morning stroll through will ensure that you miss the 'worst' of the tourists. Plenty of places to grab a drink and people watch. It's a beautiful place and a real must see in Rome.

Beautiful square with lots to see and do!. A beautiful square with lots to see and do. Lots of street artists and performers, picturesque buildings and stunning fountains. Restaurants are a little overpriced though!
Very nice fountain. You can get right next to the fountain for a nice picture. Enjoy the piazza, very nice shops all around.
Christmas Market. We visited during Christmas. There was a Christmas market and it was great. Very busy, colorful, and lively.
Cafe and Art Heaven!. A beautiful and large piazza, filled with cafés and artists selling their works! A beautiful place to relax and enjoy the sculptures, coffee, gelato and fabulous atmosphere!

What an experience. Hundreds of artists showing their art; thousands of tourists milling about, looking in awe, at the beauty, soaking in the atmosphere and buying art to remind them of the experience.

Shopping mall of Rome!. Not really a mall but lots of shops and restaurants. Go for lunch or dinner at one of the street cafes and enjoy the sights. The Bernini fountain is something to behold and the Sant'Agnese in Agone church is a wonderful example of Baroque design. Buy some souvenirs at one of the many shops and then get some gelato and study the details of that wonderful statue more closely. What craftsmanship. This is a great place to end a day and relax.
Piazza navona. Fun plaza of visit. Lots of little shops, restaurants, characters. Nice place to sit down and do some people watching.

Relax and enjoy the experience. Pinch yourself. You are in one of the most beautiful, lively, interesting places on earth. Just relax, absorb the architecture, watch the people go by and be happy. There are plenty of opportunities to have a gelato, a coffee or drink to help you savour the experience.

ROMA'S BEST PIAZZA?. Certainly it's our favorite in the Eternal City. It's large and lively and though always full of people the space means it never feels claustrophobic. Gaze on the spectacle of Bernini's Fontana deir Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers), grab a gelato and wander around amidst the sidewalk artists at work, marvel at the Baroque pallazi that line it, pause for an espresso. When you've had enough of the passing parade and feel the need for food, detour up one of the small alleys that run off the piazza and you'll find an endless array of places to eat that are charming and (as is the case throughout Italy) cheaper than on the piazza itself. You are also within walking distance of other attractions such as the Pantheon and Largo di Torre Argentina (take your time and stop for more espresso and gelato along the way).
Pretty cool little town square. There are some really cool fountains in the square. It gets a little crowded with the venders and tourist but it's free and it's worth visiting.

My favourite piazza in all of Rome .... This is a fascinating place! It contains 2 lovely fountains & is, literally, ringed by what seems like hundreds of eateries. The square is the daytime & evening place where artists gather to display their wares. You can pick up a few nice canvases there. There are also a couple of attractions to visit which some people miss. There are also various buskers to keep you entertained. I cant get enough of the place. No trip to Rome is complete for me without 2-3 visits to Piazza Navona to spend 2-3 hours over lunch & watch the world pass by. Fascinating place ...

A wonderful Piazza. A leisurely stroll around this classic Piazza and you will find 3 fountains. All three are wonderful, with the center one being the classic " Fountain of four rivers" by Bernini. It is huge, with many spigots from which water runs. Stop in the piazza's church while there. There are many restaurants in the piazza and several wonderful Gelatto stores on side streets. Only a block back from the square are some good, local restraunts, with very nice staff and great foo.
Sightseeing.. Piazza Navona is a stunning place to spend an hour or two having lunch or dinner and seeing the sights.

If you love people watching!. If you love to just sit and watch people, sip a cool drink or eat gelato, this is the place to be. Great crowd and fun little shops and restaurants. Love the fountain and the explanation of it is great. The mimes and all the side shows are fun.We were there daytime in May and evening two years ago. Either time is great. THe architecture is amazing.

This is a must-see!!. Piazza Navona is a busy place, but well worth seeing. The fountains alone are worth thevisit. There are lots of great restaurants in the Piazza. Lots of opportunities to shop, too.It's just a wonderful place to visit. If you have the opportunity, don't miss it!

Great Photo Op. This was part of a walking tour that we purchased online from Viatours. It is a great photo opportunity particularly after dark. There are lots of shops in the area and good places to eat.

Much more than meets the eye!. Piazza Navona is less crowded (still crowded, though) than the Trevi Fountain, and there is just as much of the sculpture to take in - I strongly recommend that if you choose not to have a guide, that you at least do a little bit of reading about the sculpture before you go so that you can see all of the wonderful details that the artist has represented in the work. It is really quite something! It is a nice area with cafes nearby, whether just for lunch, a coffee, or a drink - again, I don't recommend passing on the Trevi Fountain, but you can take your time here (at Piazza Navona) without feeling so rushed to get out of the way for all the other tourists.

So charming!. We were there during the time when they have a Christmas market at piazza navona...so charming!!! I can't wait to go back someday. There's fountains, tons of food, kids games, live music and obviously tons of vendors selling all sorts of cool things. I bought a bunch of Christmas ornaments and stuff like that. I loved every bit of our time spent in piazza navona!

A beautiful place, marred by a barrage of vendors. This lovely piazza looses its charm due to the non-stop in-your-face salespeople attempting to sell you flying, light-up junk. But, if you have a beautiful morning walk, while the vendors are still asleep, you can enjoy this piazza and see the fountain and picturesque square. So my advice is take an early stroll and grab a cappuchino and a yummy baked treat.
My favorite Piazza. A beautiful piazza with restaurants and cafés on both sides, centrally located to other artifacts and a great meeting place if you are traveling with a group.

Ain't What it used to be. My first visit was in the early 1960's and I harbored a memory for decades of the beauty of this Piazza and the chocolate ice cream in the Tre Scalini. Certainly the fountain is still as magnificent as always and the chocolate ice cream probably is also, but the experience in the Piazza with crowds of people, those who weren't jamming the Trevi Fountain, and stalls filled with tourist items for sale left me with sadness that the world has changed. If the visit is your first time, be sure to go and perhaps take the advice of the other reviewers and do it at night when it's not so crowded. If you are returning, as I was, be prepared for what has become an ordinary tourist site with an exquisite fountain in the middle. And that alone warrants a visit.
Piazza Navona. Lovely piazza, lovely architecture, monuments, view... Love the spirit of this square. We've really enjoyed it!

So Much To See. Piazza Navona has so much happening that you just need to stop, step back (have a coffee at one of the many cafe's available to you) and take it all in. Very busy with loads of people, but it was June so had to expect that. As with many Piazza's in Rome, the history and architecture is awesome to see.Will visit again when next in Rome.

Great to visit at night. We enjoyed wandering around at night time, there was much to see and it was great just to people watch and see the street performers amongst the mazing architecture of the surrounding buildings.

Rich with history and little details. A vast area covered with landmarks, beautiful fountain with Bernini using the posture of his sculptures to dig at other architects and sculptors of the era. Good food, enjoy it at night if you get a chance.
Fantastico!. Enjoy the ice cream, enjoy the spectacle, enjoy the artists, enjoy acrobatics and clowns, street artists, food, and being one of the crowd! Go there - stay there and ju be...

Tranquil. Great Piazza with lots of fountains, sculpture and architecture around. Many local artist set up and display there work here so it is a nice added touch. The restaurants in the Piazza are a little pricey but a great place to dine in Rome and enjoy the setting.

Better then Piazza di Trevi. This Piazza is without a doubt a better place to rest and admire fountains then Piazza di Trevi. With a lot more space, you can admire fountains and architecture without any problem. Must see when you are in Rome!

Great Local Artists. Location: A very quick walk (unless you get lost) from the Centro.The place: Well first of all, it's a huge square littered with beautiful fountains, restaurants and lots of local artists trying to make a living. Opposite of the main fountain is Sant' Agnese in Agone church, which boasts a stunning facade by Borromini. Again, another great architectural design, which are so common in Rome. The Fountain of the Four Rivers, which is one of the main attractions here, is stunning - but I mean, what fountain in Rome isn't? Luckily for me, I visited Piazza Navona with a friend who is a local guide, and she explained the history of this beautiful work of art by Bernini. The Fountain depicts the Gods of four rivers in the four continents recognized (back then) by Renaissance geographers: the Nile in Africa, the Ganges in Asia, the Danube in Europe and the Río de la Plata in America. For each country, Bernini included animals and plants pertaining to each. For example, for the Ganges, you will see an oar (representing how the river was easy to navigate), the Nile is shown with a piece of cloth covering its head (because no one knew where it was located), the Danube shows the Papal coat of arms and the Rio is shown on a pile of coins, which was a symbol of how rich America was (and this depicted the hope that American might offer Europe some of those riches).It really is a masterpiece.

Great Buzz. Liked the vibe, both during the day and the evening. Got a little frustrated at all those people selling hats, sunglasses and water during the day and daft things that light up in the evening!! Loads of bars and places to eat off the Piazza...nice to wonder around and get a little lost

Lovely. This is certainly a lovely place to visit. Lots of restaurants around the fountains however they are s little pricey. We stopped and took some lovely pictures but then walked another few minutes to the pantheon where there is another fountain and we found a lovely cafe called Negresco where we had dinner and cocktails with a lovely view.

One of Rome's Nicest Piazze. If you are a fan of Bernini’s sculpture and Borromini’s architecture you can’t miss seeing the Piazza Navona. The piazza is long and oval, containing three marvelous fountains by Gian Lorenzo Bernini, the middle one being the famous Four Rivers Fountain. The piazza is not as crowded as most of the other piazze with fountains, so you can take your time and get right up the fountains. They are magnificent. The piazza is lined with outdoor cafés for people watching. There is usually someone playing music for the tourists, and people selling their crafts or paintings along the curbs. Next to the Four Rivers Fountain is the Church of Saint Agnes in Agony built by Borromini. It is not a large church, but it is beautiful and worth more than the 75 cent donation.

Great little bar Fan SRL Via Tor Millina 33. The Piazza is interesting but we passed through looking for something to eat. Among the touristy restaurants we found this gem which serves good beer and paninis for a reasonable light lunch with friendly service.

Dynamic and diversified. Just wandering around there, one gets treated to a vibrant atmosphere that is dazzling on a sunny day. From street performers to vendors to the variety of restaurants and the sensational sculptures, a tourist never runs out of options to feast upon. We happened on a concert at the church that was first-rate. At night, the Piazza is also special, particularly at an outdoor restaurant where you can people watch to your heart's and eyes' and stomach's content.
Must See. A must see when visiting the city of Rome, beautiful location to hand around, best in the evening when the sunsets. So many painters and entertainers and beautiful restaurants.

My favourite piazza in Rome. Ok so its very touristy and not a quaint, quiet little place that I found down some side street, but Piazza Navona is beautiful and on the sunny days that we visited it had a great atmosphere. You do find a lot of salesmen here but that doesn't detract from its beauty - the main fountain is incredible and the surroundings are lovely. A great place to rest and take in the scenery.

Better place to admire fountain sculptures.... ... than the square where Fontanna di Trevi is located. First of all there is much more space to accommodate all tourists and the Fountain itself is just a little bit less fascinating than di Trevi.

Just lovely. Lovely place to spend an afternoon people watching as there are plenty of cafes on the piazza, offering good coffee. Not too sure about the food though - however there are some really great restaurants a few streets away.

Three beautiful fountains in a wonderful Piazza. The three fountains in the square are gorgeous, site of the Stadium of Domitian, built in 1st century AD. Refreshing spot to city and enjoy the sounds of the water, take in the beauty of the fountains and the surrounding buildings, or grab some refreshments at the many little restaiurants that sound the square.

History and beauty. The Piazza Navona is built on the site of Domitian's Stadium and has three fountains, each of which are hundreds of years old and beautiful. This is a very active square with artists displaying their paintings for sale.

Beautiful square, perfect for people watching. Piazza Navona was gorgeous, we stopped for a coffee at one of the many restaurants surrounding the square and soaked up the atmosphere. A great spot for a break during a hot day.

Good to See. Piazza Navona its a symbol of Rome. Its been the inspiration of many artists and displayed in many movie pictures. It has a couple of beautiful fountains that for me were part of my growth as a child. Every time I go to Rome I will spent sometime there just to remember that and enjoy the architecture and the ambience of the area (specially at night).As a tourist, besides the history of the place, there is not much to see. Yes, its Rome so everything its interesting but, besides the fountains, you would not see something special. A lot of people gets disappointed here, mostly, because they don't know what to expect. Its just a square, good environment, a couple of things to see and a place to move on. Nothing more, nothing less. Take the pictures and enjoy the moment.

Another beautiful piazza. Yes, it's certainly worth stopping for lunch, having a drink or just strolling thorough this relaxing piazza. But always be aware of the gypsy pick pocketers. They can be disguised as tourists, mothers with babies or even priests. Sadly there seems to be an epidemic. But don't let this put you off, just be extra careful and if you sense someone hovering uncomfortably close or trying to distract you be extra careful. Often they are young women working in pairs.

A must visit -- if you have more than two days in Rome. Other reviews pretty much describe the unique atmosphere. Worth a visit to just see the fountains.It is long and narrow because the buildings are built over the grandstands of a circus (race track) built by Emporer Domitian. Part of the original structure is visible in the northwest corner. Some street performers and musicans are very good and others pretty hokey,Hint: At least one or two of the restaurants are famous for their gelato. If you sit at a table, expect 6 to 10€. You can also walk inside and order at the counter for 2-4 € and eat it sitting by a fountain. Although reasonably safe, watch your stuff. There was some type of a scuffle near me with someone apparently trying to run off with a vendors money or merchandise. The police seem to be always around, even daytime. Personally, I liked the smaller Campo de Fiori, which is closeby.

Perfect place to soak up Rome. We stayed in a hotel just a few minutes walk from here, brilliant place to people watch & soak up the atmosphere. There is plenty to see here & although it is busy, it is not as crowded as other Roman attractions.Street entertainers, artists, dancers, street vendors, cafes, restaurants all surrounding Bernini's 4 rivers fountain - a very pleasant & free attraction.We thoroughly enjoyed watching the street vendors pack up at lightning speed & walk briskly off when the police strolled in!

Free shows. Restaurants plentiful but way too expensive great free entertainment on the piazza great ice cream shop interesting toy shop lovely relaxed atmosphere great place to sit and people watch super restaurants in side streets near by well worth a visit

Beautiful Roman Piazza Experience!. My husband and I visited the beautiful Piazza Navona countless times when we were in Rome this last visit! Such beauty of the fountains, so much life taking place around it with happy tourists (and sadly too many garbage-souvenir pushers . . . who aren't even Italian . . . and the stuff they are selling is just junk) bustling around. Do (quietly, as in do not talk) visit the Church of Sant Agnese in the center of the Piazza, it is utterly gorgeous. Mass may be taking place, so it is more important to be quiet during Mass. We ate at Tre Scalini and it was amazing! Can't wait to return and just sit and sip a glass of wine while watching people and the day go by in Rome!
Bellissimo. One of the dozens of enchanting squares Rome has to offer.There is a very beautiful fountain in the center and itt is all surrounded by palaces and restaurant fronts..

Must See when in Rome. The Piazza showcases the 4 Rivers Fountain or what they call the "Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi" designed by Bernini, the Obelisk and the Sant Agnese church. But these are not the only attractions in the area. One will find that the square is streaming with artists selling their craft, or maybe, one would rather have himself/herself sketched. You can also see lots of cafe and, another must if I may say so, the tasty home made gelatos (ice cream). When at the Piazza, just relax and enjoy the scenery while eating gelato. Definitely a must see when in Rome.p.s. One also passes the Piazza on the way to the Parthenon, another must see attraction in Rome.

Our Favorite Spot in All of Rome!. This is our absolute favorite place in Rome. The fountains, the local artists, the impromptu side shows, and all of the people's of the world gather here in the evenings. It's a wonderful stroll around the piazza, or you can spend hours sitting at one of the restaurants on the sides of the piazza and enjoy what's happening.
Cafes and Splendor. This is a clean and peaceful area with street vendors and quaint cafes, gelato and the beautiful picture moment fountain.

On your way to the Pantheon..... A big, long and rectangular shaped piazza, with a huge fountain (a beautiful church in front of the fountain- also one not to miss if you have the time to run and run out- photos not allowed). Many restaurants- pricey and touristic, though I've not eaten in one personally, nothing really caught my eye. There are gelato places- Grom being one of them, the other is "Tre Scalini" where you can eat the famous Tartufo dessert, people swear it's the best. Plenty of street vendors selling their paintings, it's a place not to miss. I've been several times and although it is very busy with tourists stopping to see the main fountain- "Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi" there are also many locals that sit on the benches and people watch on the weekends. So grab a gelato, people watch and take in the beauty of the fountain that dates back to the late 1500's! I've visited Rome several different times in the past 5 years and each time I can say I'm equally surprised to see this amazing fountain....

A Place to Spread Out and Relax. Rome was unbelievably crowded when we were there. We experienced an incredibly large number of tour groups that tended to block the narrow streets in the historic center and hallways in the museums. Piazza Navona is very large and can accommodate a large crowd without feeling crowded. You can hang out and escape the crowded city. Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers is just one reason to visit. The piazza is surrounded by nice cafes. The real secret is that just off the south end of the piazza, between the piazza and Vittorio Emmanuel II, are a number of narrow streets with lots of bars, cafes, bistros and osterias.

Fun vibrant ,must visit. Thanks to other trip advisor reviews, we were at Piazza Navona on Christmas evening and were not disappointed. The piazza was filled with various food, arts and craft, toys and handmade italian candy stalls. A merry go around for the kids, beautiful fountains and a place bustling with people many locals. A great place pick up knick knacks and momentos, grab some snacks. gelato, people watch and immerse yourself in the atmosphere of a lively piazza. There were some band players and the fountains were lit up and we had a great time. Would recommend, a great place to take kids as well.

Great. open, active SAFE and fun. Many outdoor performers, music, singers, and vendors. Just the amount of Indian immigrants that were there peddling things disturbed me for a roman landmark. The entire town has been "invaded" by Indians and Hesians it seems with very few natural Italians working as vendors selling pocketbooks, scarves, paintings (beware, most are fake and silk screened then just painted a little bit..be careful). Just was sad to see...like it is in NYC at times. And the police to nothing!! but Walk around and nod their heads.One thing we did notice....in all our travels in Italy and especially Rome we did not see one female police officer that was not very good looking, great bodies and, well, just very attractive or better...EVERY ONE! Huh, Italy!!??Good time, music was great. Food restuarants...stay away from La dolce vita..snobby waitersWatch menu and cover charge. AS you go past and get pulled into a restaurant, NEGOTIATE to eliminate the cover charge or service fee of up to 20%. You can negotiate a lot in Italy we found out!!!Enjoy and travel safe.
