Beautiful Piazza. I decided to visit this Piazza after reading about it on Trip Advisor. So glad I did. It is huge and beautiful. We had dinner at one of the many outdoor restaurants lining the street. Street performers entertain during dinner. It was even more beautiful at night.

don't miss this charming piazza.. Our guide took us here for a few minutes during the day but recommended we go back at night. We did and loved it. The fountains were lit up and street venders were sending lighted flying toys into the air. The embassy was lit up as well and we could see the painted ceilings in its rooms. Lots of great restaurants near the piazza to have a quaint dinner. Not a huge tourist attraction but a very special piazza.
stunning. We stumble across this by accident and fell in love with it. The many bars and restaurants were great to sit in and watch the world go by. and again not to expensive.
Must visit in Rome. Despite the crowds, this is a lovely spot. If you are lucky, you might visit when fewer people are about...

Great for people watching. Piazza Navona is a bustling square in the heart of Rome and central to many of its monuments. The fountains in the centre of the square are amazing! It is a great spot for taking photos and people watching.There are many places to eat around the square and of course there is always the choice to get some gelato and hang out by the fountain.

Fantastic !. A great place to relax and watch the world go by and enjoy the atmosphere. There is so much going on making this a must see when in Rome. Restaurants, ice cream parlours, souvenir shops, street artists, musicians and magnificent buildings make this place a popular tourist attraction.However a little spoilt by the constant persistence of the street vendors who seem unable to understand no thank you in any language.Wander down the side streets and experience a Italian meal alfresco at a fraction of the cost in the square.

Vibrant. This is the place to go to enjoy Rome. The are many shops, restaurants & fabulous building to see. Also street entertainers & artists ply their trade here. A great place just to sit & watch the world go by. Only downside are the pesky illegal vendors.

Nice place to watch the world go by. Its a big square, one of the biggest in Rome I think. There are a lot of people there, sitting down by the cafes, just loitering around and enjoying the atmosphere, and some musicians that make the place even more appealing with their soft music. Lovely place that you should not miss, especially in the evenings. Its a walking distance to Campo De Fiore market.

I Loved It, Get Here If You Can!. A very large Piazza with fountains,  including Fountain of the Four Rivers. There are restaurants, shops and  magnificent buildings to see. It attracts many tourists to this location. It could do with more seating so that you can enjoy the moment. It is an exciting place to visit, there is so much going. A great place to enjoy a drink, meal or gelato (Ice cream.)I loved it, get here if you can!

Fun!. What a delightful Piazza in Rome! There are three beautiful fountains there, and it is always crowded with tourists and street performers. Fun to sit and watch. There is a link with a live webcam that we actually used to "wave hello" to family back home:http://www.skylinewebcams.com/en/webcam/italia/lazio/roma/piazza-navona.htmlThey got a really big kick out of seeing us at the Piazza half-way round the world! There are several cafe's and restaurants there as well, if you want to relax and enjoy the scenery!

Fountains, mime artists and crowds. This place is yet another great site to visit in Rome, you get beautifully sculpted fountains, mime artists and people who leave you spellbound by their art.There are a lot of souvenir shops around and if you are too tired to walk around, loads of restaurants ready to serve you good Italian food.

Great architecture, sculpture and open space. Historical place which was a stadium from first century AD and now an amazing open space surrounded by restaurants. The fountain, Fontana dei Quattro fiumi by Bernini is an awesome sight. The place is busy day or night. There are souvenir shops.

vibey and beautiful. This is one of the must do piazza's in Rome.Absolutely beautiful, surrounded with restaurants and other shops, it is a gem.The fountain at the centre is great for photos.Have some gelato and child out in the sun.
Romantic. When you walk on that plaza you will have flash backs from Sophia Loren movies and many other old good movies.Relaxing beautiful place in Rome.

A lovely location. Great place to relax for lunch after a hard morning touring in Rome. The square is very beautiful and was not too busy when we visited (a Wednesday in May). Classic style fountains. Great ice cream to be had here, but have your lunch down one of the side streets or you'll pay twice the price for the views.

A beautiful place to watch the world go by. Rome has many beautiful piazza's but Piazza Navona must rate among the best. We had already decided to add it to our itinerary when it was recommended by a friend who is Italian. We were not disappointed - it really is lovely - a huge square with little cafe's and shops dotted around it. Just the place to sit and contemplate with a bite to eat or just a drink. We saw a lovely little church which we were able to visit and the fountains which were absolutely lovely.

Favorite Hangout Spot. My time in Piazza Novona happend originally on accident. You stuble upon this hidden gem while trying to navigate your way down cobblestone streets and through large crowds of students. This large square is filled with sops, vendors, musicians, painters and on occasion large choirs. It happened all too often that my friends and I would pick a cafe order a bottle of wine or a cup of coffee and spend a majority of our time here. Take in all of the sights and get lost in the piazzas magic.

Tourist attraction!. No body leaves Rome without an evening in Piazza Navona. The monument to the 4 mayor rivers of the world is a tribute to humanity. Apart from that the wine parlors, pizzeria, trattoria and choice ice-creams is worth it!

Nice enough, but overrated. I was expecting this to be the most amazing piazza, with shops all around. Not the case. A nice fountain in the middle, some interesting statues, a church and a few restaurants. All of the restaurants were extremely overpriced -- do not sit down to eat there, but instead go down any of the side streets around to another more reasonably priced one.
Nice!. Another great place to visit in Rome. If you go at night time and weekend, you will enjoy part of the night life too!

The best relaxation. One of the most relaxing places in the world. A great place to end each day's walking tour. A large oval open space with three fountains and lots of cafes and restaurants. Arrive betwen 4 and 5 pm when it is quiet, select your cafe seat depending on weather and sun, get a bottle of water and glass of wine and a snack, then wait. the Romans come out after siesta and look wonderful, while they walk around and meet friends and family. Relax and eat dinner, enjoy the air, buy some souvenirs. Really this is the high life. All the food is fabulous.Do not buy the knock-off fake merchandise, it is illegal and you can get in big trouble.

Nice surprise. You stumble on this sort of attraction as you wander the small cobblestone streets of the old part of Rome.its a large square surrounded by interesting shops and lost of cafés and restaurants. Then there in the middle are the dramatic fountains with lesser statues at each end. Well worth stopping by to enjoy a early afternoon Spritz or evening meal

Fountain of the Four Rivers. Located at Piazza Novana, Fiumi Fountain is less popular than the one in Trevi but it is still attractive and beautiful. In English it is called “Fountain of the Four Rivers”. Surrounding the piazza are restaurants and coffee shops. This is the place in one of the scenes taken in “Angels and Demons”.

Best piazza in roma!. Beautiful place! Difference between day and night is dramatic. A must see for all ages and interests. Many movies have been film ed here and its beautiful to see how its become such an attraction

A Feast of Fountains. I Introduced the Piazza to my sister. It did not disappoint. A beautiful day and the statues and fountains were a feast for our eyes. Lots of cafes, restaurants and bistros to select from. There are many vendors and tour groups... be warned. We ended up walking the piazza twice people watching and enjoying the fountains. A great meeting place and/or to relax.

Fantastic Fountains. My husband remembered this sight from a previous night visit, so we returned during the day 14 years later. Absolutely fantastic, three fabulous fountains surrounded by statues. Restaurants along one side of the piazza means you can sit and have a meal or coffee and watch the world go by. Fabulous photo opportunities and great memories to take back home. Local musicians and artists enhance your experience.

Great Anytime but Wonderful @ Night. Lot's of activity in this beautiful, somewhat gritty, piazza. It's fun to visit anytime to have a coffee in the morning or dinner or a glass of wine in the evening. The piazza is beautiful at night, the fountain and churches glow and the activity is entertaining. Think of this piazza used in ancient times for chariot races or flooded for boat competitions!
Shame about the sellers. The piazza is lovely, with loads of bars and restaurants, just a shame that there are so many people selling tourist rubbish all around the fountain, spoiling photos.

The place to in the evening. A great place to feel the vibe of Italian life and enjoy the surroundings. Restaurants in the square offer excellent food choices whilst the small back streets bustle with Italian life and shops open late.
Great atmosphere. Great atmosphere especially at night. Lots of great restaurants and gelateria's to choose from. Overall a great place to hang out in Rome.

Nice!. It's a nice fountain area, there's a lot of cafe around piazza navona, so instead you got burned under the sun, better to choose one of the cafe shops and enjoy a gelato over a nice view of piazza navona!

Summer crowds in early May!. If you want to be shoulder to shoulder among the hoards, this is the place to be. The fountain is still beautiful to see even though it is juxtaposed with pop up vendors selling cheap sunglasses, cell phone covers and fake Prada...something impossible to get away from in Roma.
People watching :). When in Rome, you must sit on one of the caffe's or restaurants on Piazza Navona - drink coffee, watch people and just enjoy!

I Love This Place. I think this is a must-visit place in Rome. With the Statue of the Four Rivers in the center, and the Fountain of Neptune and the Fountain del Moro on either end and the gorgeous Church of St. Agnes in Agony entered from the center as well. Come here to relax, people watch, and just take it all in.... A masterful example of Baroque architecture, you should definitely make a point of visiting this wonderful piazza.

Sunset entertainment. Rome's equivalent of Covent garden London. A beautiful piazza full of restaurants fountains a fantastic church .Mime artist and opera singers .Art sales and cartoonists ,take a seat on the East side ,to enjoy a Campari and watch the sunset whilst enjoying the buskers.thoroughly entertaining

Bernini's Fountains. This is the loveliest and most welcoming public space in Rome. To view the 3 spectacular fountains, stroll in the pathways, then dine at one of the many outdoor cafés, is to experience Rome at her best.

Navona. This Piazza dominated at its centre by the large fountain of the four rivers by Bernini is a gathering place of Italians, visitors and street sellers alike, all enjoying the area which was once Rome's
main market, now a tourist venue.

Huge, entertaining, beautiful, nice lunch spot.. This is a wonderful, huge, piazza lined all around the edges with lovely little outdoor cafes. We found all of them to be priced about the same for lunch. We ate lunch casually and relaxed while listening to the accordion player about 50 yards away. One of the best memories from our 2 week trip.
Better than the Trevi. A wonderful oval "square" based on an original race track. The fountain of the Four rivers is lovely, and the atmosphere of the place is to be felt to be believed

Piazza Navona and the fontana dei quattro fiumi, Beautiful!. This is quite a difficult Piazza to find, (we found anyway!). But is really worth finding, as it is a lovely typically Italian Piazza, with the stunning fountains and lovely churches. We saw it in the morning, and the on another day in the afternoon. I would recommend going in the moring, as it is much quieter, and the pesky crap sellers are not about in the mornings!There are cafes around the square, street artists and musicians. Lovely atmosphere. (if you want to see an amazing street artist, outside the mcDonalds between Trevi fountain and I think the Pantheon there is a girl who does great paintings with spray cans. Amazing!)

Awesome Fountain. We walked to the Piazza Navona on our first night in Rome. We were staying neat the Vatican so it was a simple walk and quite enjoyable scenery along the way. The piazza itself is very worth seeing with lots of activity to keep you interested. However, the real fun is the fountain itself. My wife read the kids a story of the fountain out of a travel book which really brought the fountain to life. We spent a lot of time with the kids looking for various features and asking them what they thought of them. It was a nice way to start the trip in Rome. I'd definitely recommend finding some time to stop by when you visit the city. If you can spend some time looking into the history as it makes a much richer experience.

Our best spot - Square Navona. We were positively impressed with Piazza Navona. After visiting the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain which are very crowded, the Navona square was a pleasant surprise. Large Square and feel much less crowded, even though many people around too. Definitely interesting for guests in Rome to stay here for a while and relax and enjoy a meal, street artists, italian ice cream or just the atmosphere. Would stop by again when in Rome.

Overrated, full of touts... possibly nice to see early in the morning. The place is very nice indeed, but spoiled by touts and intrusive sellers of counterfeit upmarket bags, tacky souvenirs and alike. Get there in the morning, when all these are fast asleep and enjoy the silence and beauty in the morning sun.

Nice piazza but overrated. This Piazza has some great features, fountains, palaces etc. but it is surrounded by tacky restaurants and cafes that will charge some Euro 12 for a small beer, and service will be absolutely awful This area is symptomatic of Rome's approach to tourism. We are here, they will come. You would be better served and satisfied from Paris or London to Prague. There is a theme here, Rome and the Piazza is what it is, take out a few monuments and Roman heritage and it lacks anything pleasant. One more plastic glowing thing in my face for sale I will go mad

Magical, visit by night first. Even more than Fontanna di Trevi, Piazza di Navona brings the magical ambient of the old Rome. Visit first in the evening and listen to the sounds of Piazza Navona- a blend of water, music, murmur of voices and vehicles in the far back... Magical!!!!
Highly overrated.. LOTS of tourists. Expensive cafes where you are especially informed that tips is not included. Have a stroll around, then go someplace else.

Increadible!. This became a must visit (it was not in our original plans, as we didn't know how far it was - but nothing is far afterall).Enjoyed the Piazza and the pretty fountains in it.We saw the Piazza in a drawing at our hotel and thought it was beautiful but the reality is even more beautiful.Very romantic I should add.Plan to visit it.

Lots of happening around - great piazza. Lots of people gatherings, street artists, restaurants and other eateries, street vendors just like a fun and fair. It is fun to move around the piazza and watching people of different kind. Very crowded especially in the evening but very specious.

Great for people watching. Lots of entertainment here & loads of restaurants. I thought that the restaurants here were too expensive compared to those just outside the Piazza. Try to see the street artists who paint for you on the spot. Ended up buying 2 paintings. Also watch for a solo guitar artist - best music.

Fabulous Piazza. This is one of my favorite piazza's in Rome. Fabulous Baroque era statues, beautiful fountains, several quaint cafés and eateries ... Often crowded but very spacious and well laid out.
Must see!. One of the best piazza in ROme! The four river fountain makes the difference allong with the urban legends that follows its story...
Fantastic. Do not miss this. Very nice place with a big square. Nice restaurants close by with typical roman kitchen. Inside the church is also beutiful.

Sun and people watching. Lovely Piazza and on our first visit we were advised to go into side streets to avoid the high prices which we did and had a perfectly nice snack lunch but felt we had missed out on the Piazza. So we returned and had a wonderful 2 hours in the sun with a pricey beer but well worth it.

square, fountains, church and much more. the very long rectangular shaped square has a special atmosphere, especially from spring to fall. Bernini's marbles are extraordinary, and also the small church opposite the main fountain has extraordinary decorations. At Christmas time it turns in a very crowded open market, romans love it, but the tourists loose the image of the square. Very nice art stalls, you can buy a small or a large canvas, but don't miss an italian ice cream sitting at the "3 scalini" (3 steps) bar.

Incredible sculptures . My partner was dying to see this piazza. I didn't understand why until we arrived. It's breathtaking, the sculptures protruding from the fountains tell a different story in every step. The detail and extravagance in all three fountains is amazing. It's definitely worth the walk to find it. The oval shaped cobbled road that runs around the fountains was used for chariot races, what an awesome image.

A must to see. Loved this Piazza, there are art stalls in the afternoon, maybe all day - not sure. It just has an atmosphere in it that makes you want to wonder around and then sit down somewhere and watch people.

Great Bernini fountains. I've always enjoyed Piazza Navona. There is usually always some stalls there selling various items. Aground Christmas it turns into a Christmas outdoor market. The Bernini fountain is beautiful and well worth seeing. There is so much to see in Rome that it is hard to prioritize everything. But Piazza Navona, and the surrounding places to eat, is a very pleasant space to spend some time.

The Outdoor Living Room. Piazza Navona occupies the site of a Roman chariot-racing track, thus the oval shape. Especially during warmer weather, it's packed with tour groups, trinket sellers, artists hawking their canvasses, jugglers and sightseers resting their weary legs. So if you have a thing about crowds, maybe walk by once or twice and move on. The fountains, of course, are famous and worth a closer look.

Navona. The best Italian square in Rome...too touristy of course, try early morning or evening for calm! Just Italian, Rome, nothing spectacular, fabulous for atmosphera..... Then go to Trastevere, forget all the famous places, you have done Roma!

Best place I visited. When you head there you know its going to be popular. I preferred this to the Trevi and the spanish steps. I absolutely loved the fountain and could have sat their and ate ice cream all day. Well worth a visit. It is popular so beware especially in summer.

Just too popular for its own goodtractions.. This piazza is stunning with three very different features of interest, but there are always too many people around. Nevertheless it is worth seeing and, because it is so central, you will pass close by when you are visiting other at
Lovely. The coazy atmosphere, the artists, the cafes, the cheap chestnut and of course the fauntain. It is one of the must visit place in Rome.

Romantic at Night. As part of our trip, we went to piazza Navona around sunset, it was very nice. The fountain of the four rivers is right there in the middle. Nice shops for souvenirs. Lots of restaurants, where we picked one & had a great romantic dinner. I recommend this place very much.

Navona , a real taste of Italian artists. Just a 10 minutes walk away from pantheon , you can reach another magnificent monument in Rome . It is Navona Sqaure. Filled with lots of artists and decorated with greatly designed fountains , you may forget that this spectacular place has once been a carriage race with the knights in them . The artists are presenting their works in different sizes . They are really nice and attractive . Just aligned with del Corso and navona there is a street where you can find a supermarket . It has everything for your daily use . The prices are very reasonable

So Lovely. Ah, Piazza Navona! It's so beautiful and really exudes all the charm of Rome. Bustling with tourists and locals, street musicians, artists and more. Check it out at least once if you are in the city. The fountains are breathtaking (but hang on to your valuables as pickpockets are all over the place). This is my most favorite piazza in all of Rome. When you picture Rome in your head, this is the place you are thinking of. You won't be disappointed.

Touristy but great for people watching. Lots going on both day and night. Artists selling there wares in the centre and restaurants all around the edge. We ate in plenty just off the square down the alleys and these varied in quality so worth checking out the reviews.
So much going on. This piazza is massive and full of artists, street performers, restaurants and then buildings of magnificence. it is a bustling place but there is so much to take in.

Beautiful & lively square. Very close to Pantheon, this is a very beautiful & lively square. The place is always crowded and there are so many artists showcasing their handmade paintings, which is a scene in itself. The fountain in the middle (called Fiumi Fountain or Fountain of the Four Rivers) is also worth looking at with its beautiful and grand design.
Nice area. This was a great area to visit. There are annoying peddlers and then there are some street peddlers with neat paintings to view. Lots of restaurants in this area. Beware of pick pockets.

Absolutely Brilliant. The Most Charming part of this Piazza is the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers). It was designed by Gian Lorenzo Bernini for Pope Innocent X whose family palace, the Palazzo Pamphili, faced onto the piazza as did the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone.The base of the fountain is a basin from the centre of which travertine rocks rise to support four river gods and above them, an ancient Egyptian obelisk surmounted with the Pamphili family emblem of a dove with an olive twig. Collectively, they represent four major rivers of the four continents through which papal authority had spread: the Nile representing Africa, the Danube representing Europe, the Ganges representing Asia, and the Río de la Plata representing the Americas.The Piazza was bustling with Life with painters and Tourist. Dining by the restaurants in the evening was a romantic pleasure as the Piazza quietens after Sunset and the Fountain lights lit the Piazza to a different atmosphere. The service here was notably good as do the food! Absolutely an experience to just chill by the piazza with a Glass of wine and admire the artistic beauty of the Fountains.

artists' fair!!. This is probably one of the larger piazzas that are just breathtaking.The whole place is dominated by 1) three fountains and 2) artists and artists and artists.It seems like there are more artists here than tourists. Here is where you will get really awesome artwork by no names, that will make those artsy critters tingle inside you.Lots of restaurants around the piazza (overpiced) and lots of beautiful people to look at.Not really the most exciting place, but still, worth a walk through - on the way to the.... pantheon!

What a charming city square!. Just across the San't Angelo Castle, near the one of the many curves that makes river Tiber,is located the beatiful square Piazza Navona. It is built on the site of Stadium of Domitian that draws its beginnings from 1st century AD. Sometime the ancient Romans, the citizens of the capital of Roman Empire, came here to watch the agones ( "games"). If You look more attentively at the forme of this square, You will see that it has the shape of the open space of the stadium, little bit elliptical. Around the square, there are the very nice buildings with the restaurants and shops at their ground level. In the centre there are the wonderful fountains with some gods sitting on the rock, between the streams of waters, emerging off the holes in the stone body. By the passing of the times, the name agones evolved in avones and then in navone.Surface under the feet is of the cobblestones. The buildings that line along the perimeter of the square, are the significant example of Baroque Roman architecture and art. The fountain, that I just mentioned, is called the Fountain of the Four Rivers (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi).And these rivers are: the Danube, the Ganges, the Nile and the Rio de la Plata. Above the fountain,raises the Egyptian obelisk. At the other side of the square is Fontana del Moro, representing four Tritons and subsequently added the statue of a Moor or African,wrestling with a dolphin. One more fountain located on the northern side is the Fontana di Neptune. Also the very interesting is the ancient 'speaking' statue of Pasquino, erected in 1501. Here Romans could leave lampoons or derogatory social commentary attached to the statue.Here are held the theatrical events and performances of the artists, that with the open market is what gives the square some kind of vivacity,very cheerfully received by the locals and tourists.

Artist square. When I visited Italy in 2007, the fountain here was being refurbished and was completely covered. This time I actually got to see it and it was beautiful. I thought it was a great area to wander around and look at all the street artists working.
Place worthy to see. The square is one of the nicest in Rome. With two nice fountains. It's near to other Rome attractions such as Fontana di Trevi or Pantheon.

Timeless Beauty & Sophistication. Upon first entering into this square where our hotel was booked I instantly knew this was a place I would never forget. It is lined along the two long sides with restaurants and shops that all gaze upon the beautiful fountains in the center. The facades of the buildings shelter the interior of the piazza and make it feel more like your inside a grand room with no roof. The sound of the voices all elevated with excitement combined with the water from the fountain and the faint sounds of the city around you all combine to form a beautiful symphony of joy. The history and knowing how many people have felt the same way standing in the exact spot as you just add to the excitement. Not to mention that there is plenty of room for all here unlike some of the more populated areas such as the trevi fountain, Spanish steps or pantheon.

A lovely spot for a stroll. I decided to swing by this plaza when I was searching for the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain. It's a bustling and beautiful place to explore aimlessly. The architecture and the fountain right in the middle are stunning and the people-watching is entertaining. There were artists all over the plaza, so you could flip through their work- everything from watercolors to photography to oil on canvas. Though there were some vendors trying to sell junk along the periphery, I didn't think there were as many as there were near the Colosseum/Roman Forum/St. Peter's square/etc. A lovely place to relax and enjoy the city!

Just as you imagine..... Lovely square with lots going on and fantastic architecture. Seems like a dream sitting in a cafe on side of square in sunshine watching world go by. But beware premium prices charged to do this.

Beautiful. This is my favourite place in Rome by far. Last year whilst here we never stopped for a drink so this time It was on my list of things to doWe picked a bar and sat outside in the lovely sunshine and watched all the goings onIt's not cheap but all the tourist attractions are like that, it's worth it though

Fountains!. A beautiful Piazza with lovely fountains. Can get very busy but plenty of bars, cafés and restaurants to sit in and watch the world go by. Artists adorn the centre of the Piazza selling some stunning paintings.
Fantastic place for people watching. A must see in Rome - very crowded and touristy though. I would suggest eating away from the piazza, although the gelati was the best here.

Stunning fountain. The Piazza Navona is a short 5 minute walk from the Pantheon. During the winter, there are Christmas markets crammed into the piazza and during the rest of the months, there are artists displaying their work or probably more accurate replicas. The Four Rivers Fountain commands center stage by Bernini. Four burly river gods represent the four continents that were known in 1650. The water gushes everywhere. The Nile has his head covered since they didn't know the source. The Ganges hold an oar. The Danube admires the obelisk. Uruguay's Rio de la Plata leans back. There is even a palm tree created into the fountain. Go to the St. Agnese church behind the fountain.

Best Piazza in Rome.. Loved this massive square and all the street traders, best place in Rome to watch people and drink reasonably priced Prosecco. Also convenient for the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. A must see!

Overestimated tourist rip-off. ok: the overall layout of the piazza is charming - like many other places in Rome;it is full of artist and sales folks, doesn't appear very original;worst: avoid the restaurants, stark food, therefore overpriced, there are far better place to have lunch or dinner;our suggestion: walk around between Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Piazza de Spagna, here you will find lots of nice, small Piazzas with a real charm
Beautiful. Visiting Piazza Navona is a must as it is stopping for a Capuccino in any of the caffes.Around sunset is a perfect moment to stop by. Also visit the Church.

Great Place and Full of Life. What a fantastic place to sit,eat & drink and watch the whole world go by. There is always something going on there. The Piazza is surrounded by some fine bars and restaurants.

Possibly my favourite of all the squares / Piazzas. As Piazza Navona was almost directly between our hotel and The Vatican we saw it a few times. There is a large fountain in the centre with a smaller one at each end of the rectangular square as well as the normal bevy of eateries etc.Visiting on Sunday afternoon was the most enjoyable due to the 'market environment' bustling with artists and those peddling images of local scenes as well as those offering caracitures.I would certainly have made a purchase or two of the local scenes if only i had any possible way to transport them home.
Bohemian atmosphere. Wonderful place to visit; full of art and beautiful music, relaxing and peaceful. By far one of the best places in Rome.

A hive of activity. A beautiful Piazza with artists, market stalls, and resturants. All set around the wonderful fountain that featured in Angels and Demons. Located close to Piazza Madama, we found this piazza to be a hive of activity, plenty of music and a great atmosphere.

Mood Maker. When I read about this place, I thought it will be one of the many fountains and piazzas this magical city has, but, I was wrong when I just got dropped in middle of it from a side street and evening was just about to wake up.Yes, this place has best mood in evening and it is different in day time. If you want to make a promise to love one's sitting while sitting on bench with tiny showers on you from fountain and if you want to enjoy the statue with aqua colours underneath and open sky within your eyes reach and if you want to amuse yourself with variety of art scattered every where on canvas and slight tunes played by any street player to collect few coins, then this is the place.In north and west you cross the streets and enter in to narrow cobbled streets with cafes and in south and east you enter back to Pantheon and Senate buildings or in High Street with hustle bustle, but, while you are in this Piazza, you can make your own mood to enjoy smoothness away from town noise.Must go and feel place to make mood ;)
Piazza navona. A very beautiful square with another picturesque fountain were you can take wonderful pictures.be careful not to go to restaurants on the piazza because they are very expensive.

ROMA!. To be honest, I am sure it would of been a lot more beautiful if it wasn't raining!But it was still gorgeous, I wouldn't recommend trying to eat here if on a budget like we were, as 6 euros for a coke is a bit much!the staff in all of the restaurant's were lovely, and there are heating in all of the outside heating areas for smokers. Great place for a coffee/gelato when you need to rest your feet!

Rome's Culture. On our 11th night in Italy on a 12 day Trafalgar tour, we were guided to our restaurant on the Piazza Navona. Passing it's beautiful Four Rivers Fountain and sitting near the Fontana Del Moro, we enjoyed a wonderful meal with street musicians and artists' displays spread throughout the Piazza I should have been a little homesick, but it was far too enchanting to want to be anywhere else!
must stop in Rome. Both the Piazza history and fountain are very interesting. Worthwhile to read the meaning of the different statues who decorate the fountain, we loved to see it at night.

Street entertainers, patios, & a Christmas Market in December!. I have been here a few times. The square has street entertainers, coffee shops and patios. In early December, a Christmas market was set up, packed with Christmas decorations, trinkets, sweets, mulled wine, and street entertainers, including music and dancing!

Nice bright square, street entertainments.. This is a nice piazza, (with a wonderful church adjacent- SantcAgnese- worth a visit when open. Saturday there was music in there. Remove your hat on entering.) and was nice to sit by the fountains and soak up the atomosphere.

Lovely place to take a break. The Piazza was absolutely beautiful. There were plenty of artists dotted around the square and plenty of places to have dinner or just grab some gelato. There were some lovely little shops dotted around as well. It was a very nice place to stop and take in the surroundings and watch the artists producing their new works if you have been doing a lot of walking around.

Beautiful piazza. Not to be missed, but avoid the restaurants here.. Make sure you at least walk through this beautiful piazza on your walk around Rome.Avoid the restaurants though as they are twice the price and the food is not up to scratch.

Lovely Piazza. The Piazza is full of local artists and surrounded by cafes and restaurants, we moved from one to the other sampling the delicious Pinot Grigio on offer.I wanted to see the square as it houses the Fountain of the Four Rivers - I was on a mission to see the four places the priests die in the book Angels and Demons and this is the water element the fourth priest dies at.Be prepared to pay the higher tourist prices if you choose to dine here.

Great location to take a break. A great pedestrianised square surrounded by cafes and restaurants to sit in and watch the world go by. There's also a good collection of artists and caricaturists if you fancy a fix of art.

Bernini!. The Fountain of the Four Rivers in the centre by Bernini is magnificent! There is a smaller fountain at each end of the piazza. The piazza is very busy, lots of sellers around the fountain. As with all the busiest public places in Rome beware of pick-pockets.

Beautiful square. A beautiful square but really expensive and touristic cafes and restaurants. Instead of sitting there, you can walk to piazza farnese (a few meters away) and enjoy your coffee in Farnese cafe.
Busy!. We had such a good time here! A range of shops and restaurants coming off the little roads. A better range of sales men here.

Stop and take a breather. With so many things to do and see in Rome, this place is certainly a good pit stop. There were benches, usually empty since everybody is walking by and around the piazza, so it's easy to find a place to sit and just take in what's in front of you -- Rome.
Lovely piazza. Piazza Navona is a lovely square with a wonderful fountain. There are several bars and restaurants, but I enjoyed sitting on a bench in the piazza 'people watching'.

Best Piazza. Spectacular place!
Out of all the piazza in Rome this is the most special one.
There are vendors, restaurants and the place is lively at all hours of the day!
Night time meal. Beautiful fountains with sea monsters, lively nighttime vendors, outside seats with a heater for a late meal and large glasses of local wine...perfect!

Top Place to Visit so Don't Miss it. Piazza Navona Simply a huge Square with a couple of amazing fountains, so many restaurants and bars and shops are around the area, The Piazza has an open market during summer, so many Watercolours painting are available there and also so many portrait painters :) basically its a place for all those people in love with arts (Paining in general),During Christmas, markets change completely to Christmas markets, and its so loverly to be there during that time, it would so crowed that much so you won't get any MobilePhone signal.I consider this place as one of the Top places in Rome for every Tourist. so don't miss it

Nothing special.. I've been a bit disappointed. There is nothing special: few fountains, restaurants and shops around and that is all. If you are on short trip to Rome do not go there but instead to the Galleria Borghese or the Galleria Collonna.

Perfect for a stroll through with a gelato stop. A beautiful and vibrant square. The multiple fountains are intriguing and tell a tale while there are plenty of cafes and restaurants to admire the square from while sipping a traditional italian coffee. There is a great atmosphere with locals opting to meet here and socialise alongside many artists selling their work and drawing on the spot. The square is surrounded by beautiful buildings and I would recommend a stroll through here and grabbing a tub of gelato to enjoy while sitting in the sun and watching the world go by

A square. We walked for miles to get here and when we did there was nowhere to get a drink nowhere really to sit apart from the stone seats around the edge, but no coffee bars or anything to look at. yes call if near but you are missing nothing.

Don't leave Rome without visiting here. This is one of the most beautiful places I have visited. The fountains are all stunning. The buildings surrounding the square are equally beautiful and charming. There is a fantastic atmosphere here. Love the art work that is being sold here. I just loved it!

Great atmosphere. Beautiful square, went with my school and we'd go to Piazza Navona every couple of nights to have some free time. Shout out to the bar staff in the square that did shots with us when our teachers were away, they thought we were "crazy".

Great spot for a rest break.. It's a great spot for taking a rest break to people-watch, listen to the different street performers and take photos. We stopped by around 6 pm, where it was certainly active, but not too crowded at all. If we didn't have other dinner plans, it would have been nice to eat there as well to relax for even longer. Near the Pantheon and other attractions as well.

Beautiful piazza. lovely square. Only problem was the fact that the resturants there was very expensive! There were lovely shops. People were selling drawings souvenirs on the streets. A good place to take losts of photographs.
Great place. Lovely square to sit down, share a bottle of wine and watch the world go by. Some great restaurants to choose from.
Really nice. A beautiful piazza. After seeing so many movies it was on my must see list. The fountain was beautiful.

one of the great places. it is one of the most beautiful places with it's columen and the beautiful giant statues and special fountain srrounding by some coffe shops to test the famouse italian coffee and also some special restaurant to try the deliciouse italian food
worth it and less crowded. less crowded than trevi fountain and still has A LOT of charm. we stumbled on it and glad we did. has places to eat, relax and see some street performers

Beautiful piazza. The fountains and piazza are beautiful.
Definitely worth a visit!
It's near the pantheon and we stopped by it, on our way to the colloseum!

Fantastic square in the heart of Rome. Piazza Navona is a large "square" in the heart of Rome and on the perfect walking track from the Tiber river through Campo Di Fiori to Piazza Navona onward to the Pantheon and finally the Fontana Trevi. Important to see is the sculpting in the middle of the square by Bernini and the Church Sant Agnese designed by Boromini. Legend goes that these two did not like these other and hence once the church was made Bernini sculpted his man on the fountain giving an impression that he does not like the church at all (see pic). Piazza Navona is filled with small little gelaterias, pizzerias and cafes. We had a very fine gelato. But beware of the prices at the pizzerias along with the "service charge". Could also contemplate making a nice sketch of yourself by an artist for about Euro 10.
Nice place to visit. Nice place to visit. We have stay around here for several days and walking arround and passing the enjoyful place.

Beautiful Roman Square. This is an ornate piazza with fabulous fountains and many art vendors. It is fun to sit and people watch and just soak in the surroundings. Give history from my book. The piazza was filled with artists and vendors selling their wares. The fountains here are the Fountain of the Four Rivers, Fountain of the Moore, and Fountain of Neptune.
Best seen during the day I think. We first saw this at night and it was a bit disappointing however the next visit during the day was completely different. Very busy with artists and people.

Touristy, but a must see. The restaurants inside the piazza are very pricey and the waitstaff of the various restaurants would call to us while we were admiring the fountain or the local artists that are set up in the center. Felt a little like Little Italy, NYC. Their solicitation worked and we were lured to one of the patios and enjoyed a delicious bottle of over-priced house wine. When in Rome...

Touristy, but fun. Very touristy, but lots of fun and excitement. Recommend going to see the fountain of the four rivers, but if you want something to eat walk outside the square and prices drop. Outside of the Piazza on the northeast side, there is a bakery, Pasticceria Cinque Lune. Really yummy sweets at a great price!

cosy, typical Rome (but touristic!!). Cosy Piazza. I wouldn't recommend eating on the square itself, the little streets around the square are just as cosy, cheaper and better food. There is also a very nice little 'souvenir' shop at the right side (facing the river) of the square, in a little street.
Nice as everything in Rome. Nice place to take a photo. As we have been in jannuary the place was not overcrowded. The temperature, 17 centigrade

A lovely Piazza.... It's a lovely Piazza. Notice it's shape. It's eliptical. Do you know why? Because it was an ancient Roman racing circuit. The shape remained, and along centuries, they builded around. Lovely fountains, fancy restaurants around, the Pantheon near by.

Night view is comfortable. If you are done seeing museums and other places during the day, show up here in the late evening or after dark, especially after 10 PM when the crowds are thinner. You can get good photo-ops. Souvenirs, trinkets, food and drinks are all over-priced here. Ignore and save your euros for spending elsewhere.

A Must Visit Place. This is a very beautiful, picturesque piazza--one not to miss at all. The fountains are gorgeous and a must see and the churches around the square were beautiful. It is a good place to spend an afternoon taking in all the beauty and enjoying the souvenirs that the vendors were hawking and also enjoying the street performances. This is a step back in time.

A magical blend of history and culture. Stunning place with colourful buildings taking your breath away! So much too see and experience. There are lots of little cafes, an especially tempting one is the coffee with a little extra in the Lindt shop situated in a street off Piazza Navona on the way towards the Pantheon.

The Piazza of Roma. This is the grand daddy of Piazza's. Large square, over priced restaurants and great place to people watch. The statues in the fountain are amazing-thanks to Bernini, make sure to set aside at least an hour to take in the sights.

Very enjoyable atmosphere. We strolled through the Piazza several times on our trip in October (2013), mostly because it happened to be within walking distance of our hotel. But, it's a great Piazza to walk through at any time of day/evening. There are a lot of people (a little less so in the evening), so it's a pretty safe place for a stroll or for some people-watching.We loved the atmosphere/buzz, the architecture, and the fountains. The central area of the piazza is usually filled with people painting or selling merchandise, while the outer edge is comprised of mostly cafés, a large church, 1-2 stands for purchasing roasted walnuts and a few small shops. On the neighbouring streets, you'll find more retail and cafés/gelaterias (check out Grom!).* One word of caution, however, is that there are some restaurants in and around the piazza that I would suggest not going to. Read the reviews online if you can! We had one experience where, since we were so tired of walking around trying to find a place to eat, we settled on a place on one of the side-streets of the Piazza. We were charged a lot of Euros for a rather sub-par meal. So, just be aware of the prices and look at the food as you walk by people's tables. You'll constantly be approached by the guys waiting at the entrance to seat you - don't let them persuade you into a bad meal!

Calme . . .. Sitting outdoors at a sidewalk café, while taking in the spectacle at the stunning Piazza Navona & still in NY mode, my husband raised his hand to signal the waiter for some water & menus. Not ungraciously the waiter responded, "Signor, calme, calme. . ." Which says it all. From the spectacular Baroque fountains, enticing trattoria, people watching - especially at Christmas, when holiday booths offer unique treasures - it is hard to find another locale that conveys the charms of Rome.After lunch be sure to step inside the stunning church Sant' Agnese in Agone, a jewel of Baroque architecture, dedicated to the martyred young woman who - regardless of the terrible consequences - had the audacity & integrity to resist her father, secular authorities & the Inquisition. Brava Agnese!

A beautiful plazza turned into a Carnaval.... I was so excited to show y family this plaza. For me is one of the most incredible spots in Rome. The fountains, the coffee shops, restaurants and all the artisits that sorounds it. The possibility to just stay there and watch people come and go. In winter this plaza turns into a Carnaval, circus, fair... was exciting for the kids but you can not see the plaza at all or, even think of eating there.So if you want to enjoy it I suggest you go after winter. To watch the Fontana del Moro sculpted by Giacomo della Porta (1575) with some additions in1673 by Bernini and the Fountain of Neptune created in 1574 by Giacomo della Porta.
Loved it. Great! there was a market there when we visited (unsure if it's always there) but it was fab, great food and drink as well as tourist type stalls. well worth a visit!

Christmas Markets in Rome!. It was my first visit to Italy in December and the markets were filled with hand made colourful treasures and delicious foods. Have you heard of Lemoncello Chocolate? Me neither until now and its fabulous! I'd go back in December now.

Don't miss Bernini's Four Rivers Fountain. We visited in December and the piazza was the site of the main Christmas market in Rome. Flanked by two smaller fountains on either end and Bernini's Four Rivers in the center, the location was ideal for Christmas shopping as well as sightseeing.

Get started. I tell you how i did it. I ordered a book on all the work of Bernini. And to sit at a resturant in piazza navona and learn more about his work in Rome - gives a special taste of the wine. Try it out. Perfect. Sincerely Kristian Ree, Norway

Wonderful piazza with Bernini's Fountain of Four Rivers. This piazza is a great meeting place with a lot of artists, street performers and the gorgeous sculpture of Bernini's Fountain of Four Rivers. You are surrounded by beautiful architecture. This was my favorite piazza that we visited during our day tour of Rome. We arrived in late morning just after the rain had stopped and the piazza was not very crowded which allowed us to enjoy it that much more.

Quick pass through only. Passing through quickly it again highlights the Baroque architecture, the different styles, the exotic fountain. We even saw a gladiator-dressed up kiddo with his plastic sword, so cute.
Beautiful. Definitely one of my favourite places in Rome! Beautiful views, architecture, food and people. I could quite happily go every day for the rest of my life!

My favorite Piazza in Rome. After visiting many famous piazzas in Rome I must say Navona was my favorite, I loved the Baroque style and at last we found some proper coffee shops there and not the usuall bar-restaurant-coffee-pizza-gelato you find in other piazzas
Stunning. with the fountain & obelisk in the middle & restaurants around the place, it gives the feeling of a big closed arena, so familier

Lots to do here!. Went here in the evening before it got dark. Lots of nice things to do here . Many places to eat, take pictures, and shop. Spent a nice few hours here with my wife. Definitely a place you should put on your check list and check out!

Full of fun. Rome..What a great city. Full of fun, entertainment, architecture and fabulous food. I do remember this square quite well. Bernini's Fountain of Four Rivers is goergeous.I had my name written with nature-related letters on a paper by a Chinese artist and framed it once I went home. Still keep it on my office wall. The letters were made of butterflies, birds, trees, etc. Great artists, great cafes and a lovely elegant square to wander around.

Interesting market with attractions. We can find many interesting souvenirs here. Lot's of nice stand, food, attraction and even a trick! Someone sitting on the chair but seem flying. This is not a magic, only a trick!

Best Piazza in Rome. This huge oval piazza is the most elegant gathering place in Rome. In ancient times this was a large racetrack. Today it is lined with cafes, restaurants, and shops. Street performers and artists add to the entertainment. Bernini's Four Rivers fountain is the highlight.

Refreshing & magical. Beautiful space with a refreshing fountain and one of the best sculptures worldwide.Lively with people and artists.Few eating and drinking places.I suggest a walking trail covering the fountains of Rome and ending here.
This place makes me feel Happy. Small place with 2 fountains and games for the kids infront of huge church.... I don't know why but this place makes me feel happy.

Beautiful spot, especially at Christmastime. We visited the Piazza Navona in December, and there was a lovely Christmas market! Lots of stalls selling things from roasted almonds to balloons to sculptures. The fountains are ornate and stunning, and make for a great picture. The streets surrounding Piazza Navona are scenic, also. A great place to visit!

We enjoyed the Christmas Market. It was a great place to enjoy the Christmas Market to (1) people watch, (2) sample some delicious desserts and holiday food treats, and (3) buy some water-colored and oil paintings for one's house (I purchased several from an ex-patriate immigrant Iranian art student in Rome located at the end of the piazza near the museum who has a very expressive style in color and black and white).

One of the best squares to visit in Rome!. Loved the three fountains that make up the center of the square and the hive of activity both during the day and night!There are painters selling their original oil paintings, sometime street performers doing a few acts, and most of the time there are nice restaurants open where you can grab a good sandwich, a cappuccino, hang out a little or just take a load off one's feet if you are busy doing a extensive walking tour of the city, as I was!Also found some unique shops here and purchased some beautiful souvenirs and gifts.Also enjoy the architecture and buildings that surround the square, there is no mistaking which city you are in and most certainly which country you are in.I would put this on my must visit list and, if I only had the opportunity to visit one square, this would be it!
Shopping. A lot of stands with funny stuff, great restaurants near by, Great food, and such a lovely place! What can I say, I LOVE ROME!!!

Where the action is at night.. Artisians come out in the evenings to sell their paintings. Play their music or to entertain the crowd. We visited this location each night and purchased and oil painting as our Rome souvenir. Need to stop for dinner? Right off the Piazza, go to Navona Notte for a great meal.

Lovely Xmas market. Lovely atmosphere here as the Xmas market was on when we stayed in Rome. Lovely live acts including a spray paint artist and a traditional Italian band.
Beware, it felt as though it was pickpocket central here!

Great Christmas Market. We visited in December and the Christmas market was in full swing, Some lovely things, and we bought a bauble for the Christmas tree to remind us of our visit. The street performers were very good, and well spaced out down the square. Very pretty, and the surrounding buildings were lovely. There are also fountains in the square which are very pretty and well worth a look at.

Nice place to hang out and people watch. Lots of cafes, street musicians, painters, flea market sellers and some of the best restaurants in Rome are only a few minutes' walk away. Unless you're agoraphobic, what's not to like?

Sightseeing, street performers.... Gotta see as many fountains in Rome as possible as it is also known as the city of fountains. Beautiful, peaceful, relaxing and potable! Really they are, I drank out of more than one Roman fountain after watching a local do the same!
an artists' place. Great square for taking a walk and enjoy the sight of hundreds of paintings that a lot of local artists are exposing and selling.

A favorite. This was one of my favorite squares with the wonderful Baroque Roman architecture, the beautiful Bernini Fountain of the Four Rivers, plus two others, and the outdoor cafés. It has a great vibe. Go to the end where there is a little antique shop and a toy store. You'll find a Gelateria. Order a chocolate tartufo ice cream. Ohhhhhhhhhhhh!

Fountain of Four Rivers. Came here when there was a festival and very crowded with vendors. The 3 fountains are nice to see, but it is just a big open square where people meet and hang out. A lot of higher end restaurants close by. Nice place for a short visit.

3 fountains at one place. Roma is known with its fountains all over the city. But in the piazza navona, there are 3 fountains :) all of them are big and different.Around this place there is a lot of artists, musiciens, singers, photographers... a lot of restaurant and coffeshop.if you are Lucky you can Watch a couple brides taking photos near the fountain :) wish is so romantic.

stunning.. great for lunch and people watching. this was one of the spots they filmed for the Dan Brown book.. (though it seems they filmed everywhere!)the Piazza is great! its a wonderful spot to have a beer and or lunch and people watch. The artists ply their wares and its like a mini art market. Get some photos near the fountain .Spend some time at a cafe and enjoy some vino. The waiters are friendly and will jokingly try and coerce you to their restaurant.Just FYI.. the bird at the top of the obelisk is a dove.. not a pigeon as some may tell you!

Very nice but . . .. The piazza is beautiful, it has a magnificent fountain and a very nice and interesting church, the surrounding streets are really nice to explore and find great little shops and places to eat as well as some very interesting corners, but I found the piazza disappointing with all of the sellers of cheap art and street performers and several touristy restaurants.

A greate public square. Piazza Novona is built on the ruins of Domitian’s stadium, which was built in 1st century AD. It was opened as a public square and a market place in 15th Century. In the center, there is the famous fountain Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi or Fountain of the Four Rivers (1651) by Bernini. It also has an Egyptian Obelisk brought here most probably by Caligula. The four rivers reprsented in the fountain are – Nile, Ganges, Danube and Rio de la Plata.One side of the square is dominated by the family palace Palazzo Pamphili of the Pope Innocent (1644-55). Piazza Navona has two additional fountains and they create the perfect harmony for the space. The place is full of tourists. There are shops all around and there is a kind of buzz in the atmosphere. A major attraction of Rome despite being overcrowded most of the times. If you take the Pantheon nearby, the entire area once constituted the historical Campus Martius. All in all, a beautiful square and worth multiple visits.

Have to go if in Rome. Its not really a tourist attraction as much a spot you have to go for an evening in Rome - really lively with lots of things happening around the piazza - from painters, to singers and even magicians. Tons of restaurants - all serving more or less the same food so pick any table that is next to the square and you're set for a great evening. Sipping prosecco by sunset and enjoying the atmosphere of the square is one of Rome's greatest attractions for a tourist.And of course the Fountain of Four Rivers by Bernini is a stunning fountain.
What a sensation. We were there in the first week of January, when the Christmas Markets are still in full operation. If you get the opportunity, it's a must do at that time of year.
A Must See. You must visit Piazza Navona on your next trip to Rome. You will fall in love with this piazza and each other all over again.

Incredible!. We just finished a trip to Malta and Sicily. We spent our last day and night in Rome. After dinner we walked by the Pantheon and on to Piazza Navona. It was a beautiful night and there were a lot of people milling around enjoying the evening. My wife and friends stopped for a gellato but I needed a sambucca! What a wonderful place.

Amazing and worth the visit. THe only reason it does not get 5 stars is because of the men beggin you to buy or try there ploys. They beg and then won't let you go. I found it very frustrating even though I am accustom to that in New York and travel a lot. They just would not let up and we only had one evening in Rome.Otherwise it was amazing and madee for a romantic stroll through Rome.

huge extraordinary piazza. huge extra ordinary piazza, like on tv,so romantic,full of restaurants,gelato,vendors,artist,who do self portraits,close by there is cafe st eustachio good coffee, magical definatly worth visitig

Pretty piazza with fountains. Like all popular attractions in Rome this is crowded with tourists. But Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers in front of the church of Sant' Agnese in Agone is incredibly magnificent, and it is relaxing to sit around the fountains and take a break here. The two smaller lovely fountains are at both ends of the piazza. There are many cafes and restaurants, and the piazza is an artists marketplace, many paintings are sold with similar landscapes, and there are various entertainment performances, which I wasn't eager about. We had steep-priced coffees here on a morning, but with the view of the grand fountain, it was worth it to do it once! But being very touristy, I wouldn't dine here. If you like it quiet, best to come here in the early morning, there are less sales people too. At night it is very nice with the lights and ambiance, but busier and more street vendors.

My favorite piazza in Rome!!. Just a beautiful place to sit down and have coffee or gelato. I made the mistake of sitting in one of the restaurants here to eat and the food, as I would have expected for such a touristy place, was not good!! Service was horrible as well...but...back to the piazza...it's a wonderful place where you can see and listen to different types of artists while soaking up the beauty of it all!
By Roma's standards average, although.... I recommend a visit because the small streets around are full of small cozy restaurants and bars. And a special gelato place (Frigidarium) is also nearby :)

It's all right here!. The Piazza Navona has it all. Fountains, shops, restaurants, musicians, artists, magicians, and more! The fountain sculptures are magnificent and each tells there own story. Go early or late, have a meal and a glass of wine. Don't forget the Gelato (2 a day minimum is the rule!) There is always something happening in this grand piazza!

Spend an evening as the sun goes down. Its a large recangular square with lots of restaurants and local artists displaying their art, street performers entertaining and fountains playing in the moonlight. Another wonderful square to spend an evening as the sun goes down on this fascinating city.

Rome at it's best - a must see!. If you want to feel the spirit of Rome, the beautiful view and people - this is the perfect place. Once you get there, the smile is inevitable - the plaza is perfect! A must see!

Our favorite piazza in Rome. Piazza Navona is our absolutely favorite square in Rome. While in Rome we lived near Castle St. Angelo, but every day we end up on Piazza Navona, multiple times. Wonderful fountains, beautiful surrounding buildings, a lot of local artists with their art & street performers…. Crowded – yes, but still beautiful.The fountains: In the center stands the famous Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini, topped by the Obelisk. Piazza Navona also has two additional fountains: at the southern end is the Moor Fountain with a basin and four Tritons to which, Bernini added a statue of a Moor (or African) wrestling with a dolphin, and at the northern end is the Fountain of Neptune. The statue of Neptune in the northern fountain was added later to make that fountain more symmetrical with the Moor Fountain in the south.Piazza Navona is beautiful at any time of the day or night. Don’t miss it.

Amazing Piazza. Truly beautiful Piazza. In my opinion the best Piazza in Rome. Wonderful fountains, beautiful surrounding buildings, nice restaurants and cafes around and lively throughout the year. It has something magical

Beautiful square but very expensive coffee. This is a very beautiful sqaure with a wonderful fountain and church. Lots of resturaunts but be warned it cost 40 EUR for 4 coffees! You can use their restrooms afterwards which is what we really wanted.

Visit here, but eat at the Piazza Capricana.. Absolutely beautiful plaza, with a gallery at one end and street art at the other. The Fountain of the Four Rivers is also a great place to get photos. Restaurants line the border, but make the extra 5 minute trek over to Piazza Capricana (get a map) for a quieter and equally as tasty lunch away from the hustle and bustle of this popular plaza.
lovely little piazza. Lovely little piazza with some nice restaurants and lovely buildings around the perimeter, worth a visit on a nice evening...

Quite charming. Built upon an ancient circus, this is a perfect piazza were you can sit near the fountains and just admire them. even though the one that's holding the obelisk is a bit exaggerated. The piazza is full of painters that let you enjoy the magic of their work being made. And when the sun drops people gather to listen musical artists, once I caught four women playing violin! it was beautiful, the sound of the violins echoing through the air. You will never forget!

Vibrant Location!. This square is my favorite in Rome. Perfect place to take a rest while looking at the mesmerizing masterpiece of Bernini: Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi - Fountain of the Four Rivers. Be cautious about the pickpocketers since this is one of the top tourist attractions in Rome.

A must see...but VERY touristy. The first time my wife and I visited Pizza Navona in the 70's, the Piazza was in it's glory days. Crowded, but mostly with Roman's who visited what used to be enjoying the fantastic eateries along the Piazza, it was a place to dine "al fresco", people watch, bask in the sunlight reflecting over the magnificent sculptures and fountains, and feel very much like you were in a "Fellini" movie. I was in the entertainment business in those days, and Tres Scalari (I think I have it correct) was the spot for not only the best tortufu in the world, but for fabulous food and delicious roman wine. That was then, but alas not now. The last time we visited, about a year ago, the food in the cafe's along the Piazza were poor quality at best. The tortufo was mediocre, and the prices outlandish. It is a must see for the art, but a real tourist trap, where the only "Romans" I saw were beggars, pick-pockets and street performers. There are still a few decent shops along the street here, but you need to haggle. If you want great Italian food, go out to where the people live, not where the tourists congregate. There is still wonderful food to be found in Rome, but not on Piazza Navona. If you travel away, just a bit from the city, almost every restaurant is magical, reasonable and memorable.

Lively City Square!. Piazza Navona is a lively city square with beautiful fountains lined with cafes. A wonderful gathering place to watch talented artists and performers hone their craft. A bit crowded but if you go early in the morning or late at night, you will appreciate the beauty of this square!

Something for Everyone. From beautiful buildings to impressive fountains, this public square is one of hte highlights in Rome. A variety of restuarants and cafes, the options are plenty. It is also a great place for people watching and viewing a variety of street entertainers. It is worth visiting during the day and night to appreciate its true majesty.

A nice place to people watch!. Piazza Navona is a city square in Rome that is built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian in 1st century AD as open space of the stadium. Now primarily bringing local artists and entertainers. Many artists do caricature here but be cautious as some are truly good but others are not so great so examine their work and ask if they did them. Its a great place to sit and people watch and right around the corner from the Pantheon. The square is very crowded but its a great place to take a break and the mountains are worth a look. Its an alright place for lunch but probably only if you want to people watch as its loud and over priced with lots of people trying to sell you things (so sit a row or two in).

Truely Majestic. It is great to visit the fountains fo Rome at various times of the day. I particularly like night time to see then in some sense of solitude (away from the crowds) and in the darkness they take on a more poignant air.

Piazza Navona - lively and entertaining. We were lucky enough to stay close by Piazza Navona, which was a lively and exciting place to be, with its fountains, artists, singers (on an evening) and street sellers. It can become crowded so if you're not keen on a high volume of people, then its not for you. In this clean piazza there were many good restaurants and a few lovely shops, stunning architecture and great ambience. If you go behind the piazza, there are winding roads which are dotted with more shops and restaurants, which were less expensive than those in the main piazza. Italian life was abounding there, with people playing chess al fresco and the buzz of excitement all around.

Nice but a bit crowded. We sat in this square for a spot of lunch on our way to look for the Pantheon. The square itself was nice although very crowded, the multiple fountains here were worth a look but the best part of our visit here was perusing the art collections on sale all around the square. Nice place for lunch but would have been better when quieter.
Like an Italian Momarte. Wonderful place to visit at night. The sculptures and water look magnificent. Lots of artists and restaurants. You don't have to buy just people watch and enjoy the ambiance!

Nice place to be, with accomodation nearby.. Walked around numerous times, also ate there.A Baroque Piazza.Was used for chariot races and other sports originally I believe.Lovely fountains, churches were good too, also an Obelisk.The interesting and varied people make the piazza what it is, other than the old buildings etc.Many restaurants trying to get you to go theirs, in a fun way usually, people selling goods, another riding a cycle with room for passengers riding around, such a social place.Only bad experience was one restaurant we went to, only had a small amount to tip, was abusive, so naturally we did not go back there, plenty of others. It was not the person who had attended us. Off putting.

Very Popular Square!. Piazza Navona is a very popular (hence crowded) tourist attraction in Rome. It had 3 baroque style fountains, the middle one with a obelisk. There are restaurants and cafes all around the piazza. There are also a lot of vendors selling paintings, crafts and touristy items. The cafes and restaurant around the piazza are pricey and cater for tourists! If you walk a bit further away from the piazza and into the many side lanes, you will find a better option for your food choice. Even though it is always over-crowded, especially during lunch time onwards, it is an icon of Rome and certainly worth a visit.

my favorite place in Rome. Even if it is a tourist place, I love this piazza with all the artists, street vendors, and activity. Have a glass of wine and plate of cheese and just watch the world go by. Great place to relax for a few minutes.

Beautiful place to hang out and to people watch. Piazza Navona is one of Roma's most spectacular piazzas, local artists selling their pieces of art, lots of sidewalk cafes and great people watching. I wouldn't buy any of the art, all of it is pretty tacky and I only sit to have a coffee at the sidewalk cafes because they are very much over priced. Still you must go to see this place, the fountains are beautiful, if you can go during the day and than again at night to see the piazzas two different looks.

Amazing fountains. The four rivers fountain was amazing, so dramatic and vivid, the busy life of this square was so nice, there are different things to see and places to sit, the area is great for dinning and going out for dates, love it, we stayed very near the piazza

Lots to see. Read some history or google the fountain. We were on a tour so the guide explained it all to us but the symbolism is interesting. Yes, lots of art & artists. It's a busy place in the evening but that's what makes it an attractive area as well.

a great sqaure. This piazza was amazing to see. The best times to go are early in the morning and when the sun is setting. In the morning there aren't a lot of people and that gives you the opportunity to experience the piazza. At night it's nice to sit on a bench and watch some of the street performers. Beware of street vendors.

Beautiful piazza. Nice piazza to spend some time. I visited on Sunday morning and there were many artists selling their paintings. Fountain is so incredible and massive and piazza itself invites you to spend some time to sit, relax and look around.

Center of My Roman Holiday. We stayed at two hotels within walking distance of Piazza Navona, and I'll definitely do the same on any future trips to Rome. It will be like going home. PN is like a living room for tourists and locals alike, with everything one needs to enjoy life. Take a coffee, have a beer on a hot day, enjoy an evening aperitivo, and then dine at one of the restaurants lining the expansive (but not too expansive) pedestrian center. Or we just headed off on one of the side streets for a slightly less costly dining experience. It's the place to be, to be seen, and to see.

A delightful piazza with an interesting history. The Piazza Navona was the meeting place for our walking tour. Our knowledgeable guide shared the history of the piazza as a stadium for athletic games and competitions, and it is now a lovely area with unique shopping, restaurants, artists, and street performers. The architecture of the buildings, the beautiful church, the obelisk, and the fountains, (including the "fountain of the four rivers"), makes this a lovely area to relax and enjoy Rome.

Great Central Piazza, Lots to Do & See. I wish we had stayed closer to this area of Rome; it was my favorite place, and so close to things. Definitely make it over to Piazza Navona around sunset, it's breathtaking. There's tons of street vendors, performers, and so many great restaurants all around.

Nice piazza, cool buildings and statues and some unique art. This was the first place we stopped on day 1 of our trip to Rome. There were some great statues and buildings surrounding the piazza - as well as some good restaurants and great artists. Not all of it was entirely original stuff, but some of it was absolutely original and unique. Definitely worth checking out, especially as its so close to so many other attractions!

CliffRome. An excellent place to visit. Local talent and architecture make well worth the visit. We strolled through here early one morning when things were just getting started and before any crowds. The fountains were amazing and the building surrounding the piazza were a beautiful site to see. We found it an excellent way to start the day by just taking a leisurely stroll around.

My favorite Piazza in Rome. Great place to people watch, see art and enjoy vino and/or lunch/dinner. Tre Scalinni is my favorite place to eat on the Piazza. Ask for the "crazy butterflies"---farfalle pasta with a great vodka sauce.

Piazza Navona. This used to be a beautiful area to visit, but the annoying street vendors with the fake Prada bags and the ones with the green lasers do detract a lot from the enjoyment. In the case of the counterfeit bags, it is amazing to me that the Italian authorities allow it. These guys, all immigrants, were in every single attraction and the police tolerates it.

An open air museum. If you want to relax and enjoy the beautiful surroundings Piazza Navona is the best. Large enough to avoid the crowds, the group of fountains is fantastic! There are several vendors with beautiful paintings of the piazza as well as of Rome for sale. You will be very happy. The best cappuccino is at Neptune Café across the piazza. Enjoy it!

Lovely place to unwind.. Piazza Navona is definately not to be missed. The fountains are lovely, and it is a bustling area in the evening. It's great to stroll around the piazza to unwind - to admire the fountains, watch the street artists composing their artwork, or to just people watch. The surrounding narrow streets are full of busy restaurants. Nice place to just lose yourself for a couple of hours.

A Wonderful Stop In Afternoon or Evening. Piazza Navona is a pleasant way to spend some time while in Rome and a sight not to be missed The Piazza is quite large and is surrounded by lovely buildings painted in pastel colors and also also many with beautiful floral displays on doorways and balconies. In the afternoon, the Piazza is filled with artists displaying their works. A real pleasure to stroll up and back viewing the art and much of it is pretty good stuff. . Resaurants line the outer perimeter giving many choices for lunch and wine breaks. In the evening, the Piazza is also lovely. The crowds are lessened and many people are strolling and taking pictures. Of course, the restaurants are all bustling. Probably one of the most handsome Piazzas in Rome.
Superb. This plazza is a must to be seen, nice restaurants, art stuff on the side walk, very nice place to spend a couple of hours.

Do Not Miss This Piazza!!. If you love listening to talented street musicians, seeing beautiful local art, admiring fantastic architecture, eating beautiful and delicious food-- this is where you want to be!We visited last month and it was as spectacular as it was 16 years ago on our first trip to Rome.Definitely worth a visit!

Great place for inexpensive art.. Not only are the fountains lovely, you can pick up lovely water color paintings at great prices. This is the perfect place to stroll and enjoy people from all walks of life.

Family favorite!!. This is one of my family's favorite places in the whole world!! Every time we go to Rome, we have to spend time & have a meal in Plazza Navona. One of the best people watching spots anywhere!

Full moon over Navona - AWESOME!. My wife and I were walking back from placing our 25th Anniversary "Love Lock" on a bridge over the Tiber and decided to stop at the Piazza Navona for one last Italian dinner before returning home. The serendipitous circumstance of this choice could not have been planned any more perfect! As we entered the piazza the full moon had risen above the buildings and its glow filled the area with an almost tangible romance, reminiscent of a 1950's Hollywood 'chic flick'. We thoroughly enjoyed the dinner, by candle and moonlight al fresco, while watching the people coming and going and the artists busily converting blank canvas to a memory that a passing tourist would hopefully take home. The central fountain and obelisk was a tremendous work of art in its own right and easily rivals any of the many fountains we enjoyed during our stay including Trevi!When it was time to return to our apartment and pack for the trip home we happened upon an artist who had done a piece with a man and woman standing and kissing with the full moon behind them. You guessed it! It came home with us a memory of our time by the full moon in Piazza Navona.

An old favorite, somewhat dimmed by the hoards of crowds. We love this piazza with its exuberant fountains with exquisite statues, not to mention the fabulous gelato at Tres Scalini where we go every time we visit.

Piazza Navona. Amazing place! Once we discovered it we were there every evening for Wine, Music and Food.The Piazza comes alive at night with artist, performers and the many restaurants .
