Then of course there are two fountains, one on each end of the Piazza. It is a beautiful place to visit and It is quite large,(walking shoes) with many locals and families strolling by. It is lovely during the day too!

A fun place to people watch. All the tourist seem to pass by going to Trevi or the Pantheon . A great place to take a seat and sip a beverage perhaps . There is alway someone entertaining you . It always amazed me how many people seem to be selling the very same artwork here . Fact is its everywhere you go in Rome . Not that you won't find a real artist here because you can and will if you only look around a bit . So go on and see if you can find a few real artists of Rome in the square .

fabulous evening people watching!. This is a great spot to unwind after a busy day of touring. The fountain in the center of the rectangular piazza, representing rivers of the world. It's captivating....can be seen in the movie Angels and Demons, and is filled with cool vendors, musicians, and superb people watching. Though I've been to Rome many times before, I haven't spent as much time as we did this time. As we sat with our cappuccinos, a guy sat down with his guitar and sang songs like Hotel California, Fire and Rain, and Sweet Baby Jane! An amazing evening for everybody!

so much to see. There are so many things to see and do in Rome plan your trips accordingly. This was why an escorted tour was so good. You got priority entrance to most places and the tour director knew which places to go and what was the best time. The Piazza was great with such wonderful buildings and sights
Amazing place. Great place to take a break, and sit in any of the restaurants that you have around the Piazza. You'll be always surrounded by musicians, artist and a very colorful view.
Piazza Novona. |i have been twice and never miss visiting Piazza Novona. Many happy memories.Our last hotel was close by and lucky us spent 5 days in Rome before cruise.

Bar Navona. As an annual visitor to Rome,my days always end just before sunset at Bar Navona we enjoy a bottle of wine and chat to the staff who along with us enjoy the sights and sounds it is a wonderful way to relax people watching is one of my favourite pastimes and sitting outside Bar Navona you certainly get your fill of characters as you enjoy the wine and reflect on what you had done that day,just looking at the buildings as day goes into night gives you another perspective of the architecture, so do yourself a big favour and just try it.

Stunning beauty. The first time I saw the Piazza it was in early morning. We (my group) walked around all three fountains as the sun was hitting the Piazza. There was a group of nuns from South Africa there and we chatted with them for a bit as well. Coming back later on and all the street vendors were there, the cafe's were open for business, as well as the musicians. What a wonderful place to go and sit and watch people go by.
Nice Place to Stroll. Enjoy the fountains and the artists. Grab a gellato or stop for a pizza and a glass of wine. Relax and enjoy.
More fountains. Its unbelievable this piazza has 3 fountains , the one in the middle :amazing. Liked the restaurants around the piazza, nothing to dislike.

Lovely piazza with great vibe but be wary of rip off cafés.. This is a great piazza to stroll around if you want to make a detour from the Pantheon to the Campo de Fiori. A popular tourist spot, I enjoyed the street entertainers and collection of art by the numerous local artists there. I'd recommend a quick visit to the Sant Agnes church next to the four rivers fountain. Very beautiful, but not as stunning as the Sant Ignatius de Loyola. Also be wary of the cafe opposite the church and fountain. I knew there'd be a mark up in prices at tourist hotspots but a little can of Sprite for 7 Euros is daylight robbery. The food was awful too.

the piazza in Rome. we really loved Piazza Navona, we visited it on beautiful sunny Sunday and there lots of people , three fountains and water running , cafes all around, shoppind to do , especially if you are a tourist and you could eat and drink italian.It is a piazza surrounded by buildings but you do no feel that at all.You are Roman among Romans..

My favourite place in Rome.... ...together with Santa Maria de Concezione, which is a totally different experience. I took off one star, though, for the fact that Piazza Navona seem to be quite crowded nowadays, making in more of an attraction than a piazza. Still, go there, ignore the hubbub and relax.

A perpetual festival of people, art, food and fun. Once upon a time, Piazza Navona was filled with water so mock sea battles could be performed for the amusement of ancient Roman elites and nobility. Today, it's a daytime-and-night time scene for performance arts, singers, painters, clothing retailers, food vendors, mimes, tourists and locals, all surrounded by a score of cafes and restaurants. Not a bad seat in the piazza. It's located at the crossroads to and from every worthy ancient site in Rome, and hosts three monumental fountains and Sant' Agnese basilica. Rubes will insist that from the correct angle, one can imagine a statue in Bernini's Fountain of Four Rivers trying to hold back the imminent collapse of the facade of rival Boromini's church. Don't fall for it. Bernini designed his fountain representing the four great rivers of the Medieval world before Boromini completed his church (1651 vs. 1657). Nevertheless, the fountain, church and the high-energy life of Piazza Navona makes this site exciting, fun and stimulating. Not to be missed.

Must visit.. Memorably and beautiful spot. Typifies the Italian Piazza and no visitor to Rome should miss it. I recommend that you plan to walk from Vatican City across the river and through charming streets to the entrance to this large oval piazza with 3 beautiful fountains. Enjoy.

My Favorite Piazza. The Piazza Navona was my favorite. The home of the Fountain of Four Rivers, it holds 3 beautiful fountains an old palace and a spectacular church. It was previously a location for chariot races in historic Rome (hence the shape) and currently is a center for lical artists. Very beautiful and lively. I wouldnt eat at any of the restaurants there (over priced and not very good) but if you cross the main street to Piazza Cancelleria there are some yummy restaurants and hidden gems for pasta and pizza.

Lovely fountain & square. Lovely fountain within 10 mins walk from trevi. Nice square shops & eateries very good prices. Artists & craft stalls to wander round. If you don't like the thought of the crowds at the trevi fountAin then make this your alternative.

Lovely square!!..Rectangle!. We first visited piazza navona, and it was disapponting because just after christmas and the area was filled with Christmas pop up! market, so wehen you sat in the piazza all you saw was the rear of these sheds/kiosks.However had the chance to come again in July, and thoroughly enjoyed the experience, lovely to sit and drink in the shade of the sun, and watch the world go by...As with all sights, the restaurants were a little overpriced, but that is only to be expected.Wonderful fountain and great for spending an hour relaxing and resting you feet, watching everyone go by.

Fountains, Art, Music. Piazza Navona is a great place to wander about and soak up the atmosphere. Although it's packed with tourists, there's always music in the air and lots of art to see...but beware, some of it may be mass produced elsewhere! Agree with others re avoid eating on this (and most other) Piazza as the prices are high and the food not that good - go back a couple of blocks for better value and taste.

A must see. When you weave through the streets and arrive in this very large piazza take a good look around, maybe buy a coffee or ice cream and find somewhere to sit and appreciate this most beautiful fountain and the reason for its being. Just take your time to soak up the atmosphere.

Nice but not lucky lucky. We strolled onto the piazza by accident, but were very pleased to have done so. Its such an eclectic mix of shops, ice cream parlours cafes and restaurants around the sides, and spaces to sit and watch the people everywhere in the middle. The fountains are lovely, and the evening is full of market stalls of paintings, other artwork, and some goods. We liked the laid back easy ambiance, except for the lucky lucky men. They hound you with their wares, this time it was a small helicopter device that they fire up in the air using an elastic band, it lights up and spins to the ground. Each one of these sellers moves in your path, and pesters until you firmly state No, at which point they leave to find their next victim. Unfortunately, they are replaced by another, and another. Your desire to quietly sit and watch the world will be broken every few minutes as they try to sell you their goods.Yes we enjoyed the piazza, and returned their again the night after, but the delightful memories of this place have been tainted a little.

Quintessentially Roman in every way. Loved Piazza Navona.. Wonderful open square with a feeling of spaciousness despite being July and busy. Open air cafés add to the atmosphere. Lively square with painters and street performers. In the past, it was a meeting place for the inhabitants of Rome. The Navona square houses the beautiful Church of Sant'Agnese and two fountains namely the Neptune fountain and the Four Rivers Fountain. This piazza, which displays magnificent sculptures of Bernini and Borromini, are amongst the finest examples of Baroque masterpieces in Rome.

Atmospheric piazza navona. You cannot visit rome without visiting piazza navona its has 3 incredible fountains and great places to sit and take a cool drink or coffee and escape the heat of Rome or rest your feet for a while. I love restaurant tre scalini its the ideal spot to sit and people watch and relax. It's a little more costly to sit and eat in piazza navona but its worth it.

Navona square. The shape of the square, its space and the location are very nice. The prices in the caffeterias and restaurants nearby are very expensive. However, taking picture in front of the beautiful fountain is a nice souvenir to take back from Rome.
Perfect sense of la dolce vita........... Sit, sip, gaze, enjoy...........for hours and hours and hours and especially at sunset...........one cannot visit Rome without Piazza Navona............

This is lovely to walk around and watch the street performers. Don't be ripped off by the restaurants here, the prices are triple for all except pizza. Go down the back alleys to the family run shops to receive greater value . It is a lovely atmosphere to relax in .

People watching and beautiful fountains too.. A great place to watch and wander. Bernini's sculptures are stunning and provide a great backdrop to all the artists and vendors that crowd the piazza. Have your portrait sketched if you are so inclined. Stop for a drink or a meal if you have deep pockets. If not take a stroll in the adjoining streets and find a quiet café.

Beautiful Piazza, better cafes on the side streets. Rome is packed with beautiful Piazzas, churches and places to eat. they don't always come together so yes, visit the square and Church. have a coffee or chocolate in a cafe and definitely go there for the Christmas market but seek out side streets for better value, better tasting Italian food. Visit the amazing market in Campo Di Fioro and in the side streets between the two there are lots of places to choose.

Must do. I like Plaza Navona a lot. The artistic wave, the restaurants around, and The fountains are the best attractions, its nice to walk around and enjoy it. Near to this plaza , there is a great restaurant Cantina E Cucina,

A good venue to rest and to have snack. Looking the fountains and crowds, it is a nice place to sit down and watch the street artists after walking from other attractions near-by. Around the square are the street cafes for you to relax.

Full or artists, street performers and many wonderful restaurants. Just the spot to explore many fine eateries. Admire the architecture, magnificent fountains and enjoy a lovely meal at one of many lovely Italian restaurants. You may just find that one special gift to take home with you.
return visit. We went back in July 2013 just to walk around, enjoy the vibe and see the fantastic fountains. As well we had another taste of chocolate gelato from our favourite place.

Peaceful Piazza. We visit this oval shaped plazza every time we visit Rome. It has lovely fountains and charming restaurants and gelaterias. A specialty gelato found only around the Piazza is Tartfufo. It is a dark chocolate treat named for truffles and a must have.
Nice place to visit.... A nice square to hang out, specially with all the painters in the afternoon! Buy something to eat around and have lunch around!

Plenty of people and plenty of places to sit and eat or drink. Unlike some other aspects of Rome, this is not a "historic" spot (or it would not be "navonna"), but it is a great place to see crowds and to sit and have a drink or a meal. It is almost unavoidable on a good walking tour -- and Rome is a great place to spend a day walking.
Love this Piazza. Especially loved sitting at one of the many outdoor cafes, enjoying a glass of wine, listening to the street musicians.

A Lively and Lovely Place to Visit. We had dinner twice at this lively and lovely square during our visit to Rome. You meet many people and tourists from around the world wandering along to enjoy music, artistic works, watching painters or having their portraits, in real or caricature, done. My husband and I had ordinary portraits for 40 euros each. It was a great experience and we enjoyed it. However, be careful from pickpocketing while watching painters. Restaurants serve delicious Italian and international food, but those located at the main square charge higher prices than those on the streets around the piazza. Another advice, try to get a bus map from your hotel. Bus routes cover many of Rome attractions and they are cheaper than taxies.
Spend an Evening here. Long oval piazza with 3 beautiful; fountains, sidewalk cafes and lots of entertainment. Charming to say the least.

Must see!. Wonderful place to spend time looking at the beautiful sculptures and fountains. Many restuarants to sit outside and enjoy a meal, coffee, or gelato and relax. There are artists and street entertainers for adults and kids to enjoy.

A must see ... and it is FREE. This very large rectangular piazza is a wonderful place to visit.It has no entrance fee and contains a lively mix of interesting elements: fountains, sparkling in the light and lit up at night; street artists (including a magician, a statue, and spray paint artists who create work for you as you stand there, for €10); a market; many restaurants and cafes; and even a jazz band playing in the corner on the afternoon we visited.In one corner you will also find the entrance to the Museo de Roma; and taking a side road you will also find your way to the Pantheon.ALL available by taking the electric bus 116, which makes its way through old Rome from the Vatican to Villa Borghese. Get off at the stop for the Museo de Roma.No facilities though; if you need a loo you will have to go into a cafe or the museum (for which there is a substantial entrance fee).

stunning scupture. This fountain is so incredibly beautiful it took awhile to walk all the way around and admire it from every angle and note al the fine details that tell a story.The plaza is fun too with all the artists and interesting people.It was particularly beautiful at night with special lighting.

Love art? Then must visit. This called Rome's show case square.You will find artists, circus of street perfomers, fortune tellers and many more. This was the cetral market of Rome a long time ago according to the books. Fountain Quattro Fiumi adds more beauty to this piazza. It's an ideal place to do people watching. The artists sell their paintings here. You can bargain sometimes. You can watch the way they paint.

Don't miss. Three unbelievable fountains. Great restaurants, a stunning church. Quaint alleys with shops, vendors in the Piazza to just browse. We went there every night just to appreciate ( and of course get some gelato) .

the best hangout in rome. The restaurants are all similar and nobody rushes you even if its just a cup of coffee. or a gelato (tre scalini still the best). The fountains are are wonderful. Just sit back and enjoy. Still the best piazza in Roma

Lovely atmosphere. I recently visited piazza navona with my husband and father we went for dinner in Dolce Vita it was a beautiful restaurant we had a fantastic meal a tad on the expensive side but its not every night your in rome, the whole place had a great buzz about it street performers were singing artists drawing I loved it and im so glad we spent our last night on holiday there I will be back.

Lovely, Lively, Fantastic. We were there only at night time (around 9pm), so i can't attest to day time activities. We went there on our last night in Rome for a nice dinner. The place is bustling with life: street vendors, artists, musicians, people and restaurants. It was great. You can just stroll along, look at art work or people watching, or you can pick a restaurant and enjoy it all while eating!

Gorgeous. The was my wife's favorite Piazza in Rome. The fountains are absolutely lovely. We hit the area right before lunch time and the activity was all hustle and bustle. Grab a coffee, glass of wine or some food and just take in all in while sitting at one of the numerous places to eat. A short walk from the Vatican and worth it just to relax a bit.
Not very impressive. Crowded with painting sellers, surrounded by overpriced cafes and restaurants, wasn't impressed at all.

My favorite square in Rome. There is much to love about this square: The way it opens up to you as you approach from one of the narrow lanes; the beautiful Bernini fountain; the cafes and restaurants that encircle the square; the bustle of people filling this square day and night to enjoy its Roman ambiance.

Very very beautiful!. This is a vey beautiful square with the beautiful fontains. I think it's better to come here in a day time...here you can se the real Italian life. You can find here souveniars, you can order here your own portrait, drink a cup of coffe, eat an icecream and make a good pictures)
Piazza Navona. I have been to Piazza Navona and was thrilled with it's ambience.Lovely place not to be missed when visiting Rome

Peace in the city. An impressive Piazza, but to be honest Rome is impressive. I fell in love with it. They say not to sit outside as you pay more but I think you have to. There is no point going there and not experiencing the whole thing. Great place to sit and watch the world go by.
Beautiful. Very nice Piazza with many little restaurants, an art market on the square and beautiful buildings. Definitely worth visiting if you are near the Pantheon or Trevi Fountain

Great Dinner, Great Atmosphere, Great Artists!. This was a truly lovely square to spend a Roman evening in. There are lots of tourists, but that is the case for nearly every square in Rome. The fountain is beautiful and the restaurants seemed reasonably priced. The one we ate at was delicious and offered a great view of the fountain.We also paid to have our portrait done by one of the many artists. It was a bit expensive but this beautiful souvenir was worth it! Check out the beginning of the picture in the attached photo. Some artists were doing serious portraits, some caricatures. Wander around a bit and watch them at work to see which artist's work you like best. This was one of the highlights of our trip!

A pleasant surprise. We walked to the Piazza del Popolo the day we arrived in Rome, since it was a convenient walk from our hotel. Maybe it was jet-lag, but everything felt too big and touristy (same for Spanish Steps). That night, while searching for a restaurant we'd seen on Trip Advisor, we took a bus to the Piazza Novona - what a different experience! The plaza was beautiful at night, with the central fountain lit. The narrow streets to the east of the plaza were fun to wander in, and though we never found the restaurant we came for, we landed at the Antica Taverna for dinner and had a wonderful time! The day we left, we had an hour or two to kill, and took the Metro to the Barberini stop and visited the Trevi fountain and Pantheon on our way back to the Piazza Navona, where we caught a bus back to our hotel. The Piazza Navona was a wonderful beginning and ending to our time in Rome!
Tourists, Tourists, and more Tourists!. Nice, but overrun by tourists and surrounded by tourist restaurants. Try going early in the morning to enjoy it in peace and quiet.
A place that shoundn?t miss. Besides trevi fountain, i think this is the best fountain in rome. The atmosphere was good. It?s a good place for relaxation.

Great for people watching. This is a fabulous place to go with lots of atmosphere. The piazza is a long rectangle with lots of artists selling their work and a few musicians. Be aware though that the cost of drinks at the restaurants is extortionate! It cost us 20 euros for 2 beers. There are, however, quite a few restaurants a few streets away that are not as expensive, you just sacrifice the atmosphere!

The fountain is the piazza de resistance.. The four rivers fountain is the piece de resistance of this immensely elongated piazza, among Rome's most beautiful. Never mind one of the gods missing finger- yet another victim of a vandal's tormented mind, the fountain is among the world's most beautiful.
Amazing. Visited there in July 2013 an absolutely spectacular public space. The fountains are beautiful and the square itself is just great. As with most things in Rome, a joy to behold.

Evening is the best. This Piazza is worth two visits...one during the day for great photography and once during the evening, to take in the ambiance of the place. Lots of vendors, and great people watching. But the center of attraction is the Bernini statue in the square [featured in Tom Hank's movie Angels and Demons] which is amazing...

NICE TO SPEND SOME TIME THERE. Pizza Navona where There are three fountains, beautiful, the most famous is the Fountain Central, this fountain of the most important works of art, and is considered one of the finest fountains that are spread in the Italian capital of Rome. this fountain known as the Fountain of rivers, and by four statues of great, each representing a statue of the River of the most important rivers in the world: Today is the Piazza Navona of the most important squares, which will be held where festivals and celebrations, a meeting place for artists The Italian and foreign painters, and you can make a cartoon for you Many restaurants and cafes are located there that meet our target

Check your wallet before ordering. The prices are high there but worth it. I told to my cruise companion, a lately retired bargain cruiser with wife still working at homeland that you pay for the drinks here and I shall be the host at Montenegro. We would be still drunk had I kept my promise. The poor man presented a twenty Euro bill thinking himself a generous man of the world until shown the last line of the bill tendered with an understanding smile from the glorious waitress who had seen first timers before.Actually the prices are not much higher than in Norway. I accept a premium for places like this.

Worth It. Your a tourist looking for scenery, history, and entertainment. This is the place you can sit and people watch and enjoy the atmosphere for hours. Walking distance to more attractions. Suggest going at dusk so you can see the fountains with then without daylight, and experience the transfer to being lit up. Many movies filmed there don't bring enough credit to the beauty. Cafe's are awesome and not that expensive for tourists. The street merchants were even nice. Great Place.

Nice place to people watch. I came across this piazza while out for a walk. It is quite large taking up a couple of city blocks. There were plenty of places to sit and take in the atmosphere. There are several restaurants that surround the square. The fountains are spectacular and the area was well kept. There were lots of vendors, but they were not aggressive. However they do take away from the beauty of the piazza.
fantastuc square. even the crowdsand ten identical tourist-trap restaurants couldn't spoli one of the world's most charming squares with fantastic sculptures by Bernini

Has lost its charm. Have watched the Piazza evolve over the years , unfortunately for the worse.What used to be a beautiful place just to stroll around is now crowded with hawkers , street painters and the like which makes the place seem like a souk. The top shops like the cameo and coral boutique Giovanni Apa have simply packed up and left.Now only worth a quick first visit .Really sad.

The most amazing place to spend an evening. This was my second visit to this Piazza and it felt as wonderful as it did the first time, even with the swarms of people that I didn't have when visiting in Winter. We arrived at dusk and it was still filled with people. With the warm evening air, we grabbed a table in one of the countless restaurants ringing the piazza, ordered a meal and sat back to people watch. It is filled with a vibrancy and a sense of relaxation that simply can't be described, but is definitely somewhere you should take some extra time to just sit back and enjoy rather than simply ticking it off your list of things to see.
One of the best Piazza's. Stay till it gets dark, walk in to one of the restaurants located about the piazza, to grab a glass of wine and a meal. Lovely, cozy atmosphere.

Beautiful Piazza Navona. Yet another Piazza worth seeing, walked here from Castel Sant'Angelo and what a beautiful piazza to stumble across, the whole square is packed with stalls, mainly art stuff, it has a wonderful water fountain in the middle and yet another church, it is very busy and crowded, there are restaurants and street entertainment to take in, we'll worth a visit!!

Great Piazza!. Not a long walk from where we were staying in Rome. Lots, and lots of people doing the same thing we were taking pictures! A site not to be missed while you are in Rome. A lot of young artists selling their paintings!!! The sad thing is all the beggars, and guys trying to sell their paintings!!! Beware, all is a scam. They sit there pretending that they are painting these small paintings. All the pictures are the same. They dabble a brush in paint and pretend to be painting!!!!

A special place - so atmospheric and full of the spirit of Rome. Built on top of a Roman arena, the piazza has a very grand church (well worth going in as the ceiling paintings and altar are spectacular), some fantastic pavement cafes, as well as Bernini's fountain and the incredible statues under a vast Egyptian pyramid. Quite breathtaking.

A must but very crowded. It is so pretty near the Trevi fountain, but very crowded. However, we went early Sunday Morning . The best time to go for sure. We got right up to the front of fountain and were able to toss the coins. We found the restaurants touristy and expensive. also stay away from the restaurants that charge you just to sit down, ask before eating there. Some will state on sign , no entry fee. Find little side streets to eat on , away from all the hustle and bustle. Campo Di Fiori has nice little spots.
Delightful. Another amazing piazza to visit. Piazza Navona is such a beautiful piazza & buzzing with energy. Lovely place to chill & sit on a hot day in Rome.

beautiful and romantic. Beautiful square full of artists paintings - watercolor, oil.....Love the Neptune fountain my favorite. I could sit there for hours and listen to music and watch the artistist at work. A must see and I know if I ever go back will be here for sure.

My favorite square. Before my days in Rome, everybody suggest me so many place to visit.I have seen (or better i think) all the attraction of this wonderful city. The most impressive for me doubtless is Piazza Navona.

60th Celebration. First stop Rome! As you round the corner, approaching this piazza, you hear the sound of the three beautiful fountains right in the center of the Piazza. Then you enter and there they are. While there dine at Cafe Barroco where the pizza was amazing, not to mention a robust glass of chianti. Toss three coins in the Trevi Fountain to make sure that you return to Rome!
A must see. Read the history before you go, it helps you appreciate what you are seeing. We went during the day but it would be cool at night also. Lovely.

Beautiful Baroque Square, not too crowded. Wonderful square bounded by colour washed buildings, covered in balconies & flowers. Bernini's fountain is the centrepiece, but all along the sides are artists and picture sellers touting their wares. Plenty of room to sit and wonder at the sights & all the side exits lead to twisting streets with cafes, bars & little shops.

Romantic. Beautiful place, need to go and see, lot of street performance. Need to be very careful where to eat, some are very touristic an very expensive. The restaurant we ate was not worth it , food sucked and was veryyy expensive. I would suggest to eat at nearby restaurants instead of on the piazza.

Wonderful. A pedestrian area with 3 fountains and the central one (Fountain of Four Rivers) designed by Bernini. It is a lively place with plenty of stylish restaurants, gelato, bars, and everyday musical or artistic performance. Every night u might experience something new

A wonderful afternoon. We were two full days in Rome before a cruise. We really just wanted to have a lazy day of exploring and walked to the Piazza Navona from our Hotel. We walked through the Spanish Steps, the shopping area (?Via Condotti?) and then to the Piazza Navona. Prosecco was had at one of the many restaurants at the Piazza, we watched the people go by and we stumbled across a little Museum at the end of the Piazza that was just wonderful. It was small enough to see in an hour and a half, the architecture was beautiful and inside we saw a painting of the Piazza that was done around. 1600 or so. Interesting in that only 2 of the three existing fountains is in the painting as the centre one had not been built yet. Really gives a sense of the history.....A lovely dinner was had at another restaurant. Definitely a place to relax and get a feel for Rome.
It's amazing. Everynight here is amazing experience, a lot of street performances and fun for kids. I think is one of the best plazza in Europe.

A beautiful place to hang out. Located in the center of the square is Bernini's famous Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. The other two fountains are equally beautiful. Around the square there are many outdoor cafes and restaurants where you can sit and enjoy good food, the street performers and the flock of tourists.

Lots of character. Great place to visit if you want to works of art by street side painters. Plenty of restaurants around to grab a drink or eat a meal. The fountains are impressive and its a pretty busy place all through the day.
Fantastic place. It's much nicer than the Trevi fountain as it is not so crowded :) There is a lovely fountain, church, and some restaurants there!

COME TO ROME TO VISIT THIS PIAZZA!. No one piazza in Rome is splendid like Piazza Navona. Cafes are luxurious and Navona is social center of the city. This is most beautiful baroque piazza. The fountain is Bernini's most magnificent fountain.

WOW simply WOW. Going to Rome? Don't miss Piazza Navona. Good food, fun buskers, great art - the fountains? There are many good restaurants here at somewhat reasonable prices and a very nice gelato place at one end accross from the toy store, that makes the best cappuccino I have ever had, I think it is called Moretti's. Definitely worth looking out for.

If Rome can get rid of street vendors. A beautiful piazza with many bars, restaurants, thronged with weary tourists. Vibrant with life. The fountain in the middle, Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi is breath-taking, sculpted by Bernini, who else? the famous Lo Zozzone restuarant for the best pizza bianca is just around the corner in Via del Teatro Pace, 32. You can eat better just off the square but then you miss the people watching. You choose.

Great little artist community. The fountain of the four rivers is the centerpiece of this old world feeling Piazza. Have lunch in an outside café and watch the people paint and talk and enjoy the several Fountains there.

Go there in the evening - Piazza Navona is magical.. This square is amazing at any time, but it gets very romantic after the sunset.Go there and check on the paintings, street performers and take some artistic night photos of the 4-rivers fountain and the church at square.

Nice place for a quick visit. There are 2 famous fountains here and "sidewalk art" to admire/buy. It is not too crowded and is enjoyable to walk around. Make sure to go to Tre Scalini for take-out tartuffo!

Best fountain in Rome. This piazza is a thriving area for tourists and artists alike and is the location of Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers. This sculpture to me was the outstanding fountain in Rome as it had style as opposed to the clutter of the Trevi.You can easily spend an hour looking around the piazza with the range of art. Look in the surrounding side streets for some great eateries including the Ponte and Parione.

Crowded but pleasant. Piazza Navona was crowded, and a bit overpriced. Steeped in history but then so was everywhere in rome. Too full of stalls selling souvenirs and doing hair/henna tattoos for my taste, took away from the experience. Good food though but no better than the cheaper restaurants elsewhere. 5 minute walk either way are better areas to sit, relax and enjoy the ambience of this beautiful city.

This is the hot spot at night!. We strolled the Piazza often. You can stop and have an espresso, a meal, a vino or just a rest. Many artists are there as well selling their paintings. Check out the work by Evangelista Martino, my personal favorite. The fountain was my favorite by far. It's a must with friends, family and the kids. Something for everyone.

This was our favorite piazza. When it's hot, best way to beat it is to find some open space. I think this is the largest piazza in DT Rome. At night it is beautiful and good family space. Fountains are beautiful, fun street entertainment and artists to watch. Yes it's touristy, especially in August when most Romans are on holiday but that's what we're there for:). Lots of tasty restaurants to choose from. We enjoyed our meal and the atmosphere here very much!

Beautiful, bustling piazza dominated by tourists. As we were staying in Campo de Fiori, we had the chance to walk through nearby Piazza Navona several times. It is indeed a beautiful piazza, large enough for three lovely fountains and surrounded by stately buildings. However, unlike most reviewers, we were actually disappointed in its over-commercialization and intense focus on tourists.We were hoping the piazza would be bustling with people and things uniquely Roman. There were multiple musicians, street performers, and artists who could have been in San Francisco, London, or New York just as easily as in Rome. But I guess we weren't surprised with it being the height of the tourist season. We, too, were tourists after all.Still, Piazza Navona is worth a visit, even if just for the fountains. Just make sure you have your expectations set right.

A great place to relax and take in the atmosphere!. You can spend anywhere between 15 minutes and a whole afternoon here- from fountains to restaurants, art work and stalls, to street performances, this is a great place to spend a lazy afternoon and for all ages. Great atmosphere and very enjoyable!

When in Rome.... This is cool to see. I loved hearing the story about the fountain. There are many cafe's around here, along with a store that sells the coolest stamps. There was a market with tons of paintings too.

Beautiful place. This was a beautiful area, There is a gorgeous fountain in the center of everything.This area had lots of restaurants, street entertainers, and artists selling their paintings in the street.

Nice plaza for a stroll. As typical with most piazza in Europe, you'll find your restaurants, street vendors (legal and otherwise), and entertainment. I particularly love Bernini's fountain here called the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers). Try and visit at dawn or night to see the fountain lit up with lights -- just beautiful. Unlike the Trevi fountain where you have to fight through hordes of people, this Fontana can be admired calmly and in close-up detail. There are a couple of other fountains in this piazza too. Nice place to take a stroll after dinner.

It's so lovely. I loved this Piazza. It was milling with people but it has such a nice atmosphere about it. The fountains are gorgeous, the bells chiming adds to the whole aura of the place. You can sit , drink a coffee and just soak it up.

A must, when in Rome. We walked from the Vatican to the Piazza Navona during the hottest part of the day. It was exhausting but so worth it. Walking through the narrow lanes we discovered a fountain which was a lifesaver. Finally arrived and was thrilled to be part of the hustle and bustle. Accordions playing Italian music, artists painting and selling their work. The smells of gorgeous food. Sat in one of the restaurants just taking it all in. Staff were delightful and made me the most gorgeous iced coffee with ice cream in a pint glass. It was out of this world. On the way out, we visited the toy shop on the edge of the square. An Alladins cave!! The Piazza Navona, one of the highlights of my trip to Rome.

street art. I suggest to go and see it in the evening. Is not that hot and the place is nicely lighted by the fading sun. The street artist are giving shows every evening... feels like a fairy tale. :)
Fresh. Its defenetly a place u have to go, specially in summer becouse u can refersh with the clean water in the foutains.

Lots of Artists. This large rectangular piazza contains several large and beautiful statues and fountains; however, for me, the highlight was the large number of artists set up in the piazza, as well as, the artists located up and down all of the little streets surrounding it. Also, Piazza Novana is conveniently located between Campo di Fiori and the Pantheon, so it is easy to take in all three sites within a relatively short period of time. Additionally, several museums and churches are in the vicinity.

Lovely square and fountain. Worth Visit and a look but won't take long! The fountain is great (there are also two smaller fountains). The square itself is very pretty and lined with eateries (looked a bit pricey but you pay for the shade and view!).

Great Family fun at the end of the day. We ended up visiting this Piazza on several evenings. Our children (4 and 6) could not get enough. The Piazza is full of artists - the ones doing the spray paint art were favorites of our kids, and the street performers kept their attention like no museum in Rome could. We ate at a couple different restaurants and never had a bad meal. There are a few shops around the Piazza, notable for us was a high end toy store at the north entry, and a leather and stationary store on the west side by the Fountain of Neptune both are worth a visit. Of course the Bernini statue in the middle of the Piazza is the main draw and it is amazing.St Agnes in Agony is a relatively small church on the west side where according to legend Agnes was stripped naked by the Romans to embarrass her into recanting her Christian beliefs. Miraculously her hair grew to cover her body. The church is very pretty and worth visiting.After dinner and taking in the sites go out the north entry and head east for a few blocks to Giolitti's for their iconic gelato.

One of the stops you have to see in Roma. Maybe it's not so famous like Colosseum, Vatican and St. Peter's Basillica, but it's famous from several movies (and Dan Brown's Angels and Daemons novel). It's nice to go there to see two fountains and take some coffee in one of many restaurants there.

Popular sight. We found a shady corner and enjoyed the sights of a bustling square. Beware of the usual tourist traps - poor quality gelato in particular. Explore the little streets that lead off the square

a mix of history and myth. Get to Piazza Navona itself it's worth the journey. Six little alleys that take you in the magnificence of the Piazza, just breathtaking. A triumph of renaissance and history mixed with myth, a must see spot to visit once in Rome

Pleasant place for a coffee or lunch. This fairly large piazza follows the plan of an ancient Roman circus, the 1st century Stadium of Domitian. Has artists or sellers of art and other vendors, lots of cafes but the cafes are very expensive - better place is the Museo di Roma at the Neptune fountain end of the piazza where the prices are reasonable, service, food and coffee very good for a lunch and you can either sit inside or outside in foyer (limited seating outside) to the Museo. The Museo di Roma is also worth a look if you have to time.

Very pretty with great scenery and restaurants. This was a beautiful sight to see.The fountain was very nice to as nice as Trevi butreally special. Their are restaurants and gelato stores.The area is surrounded by scenery and outdoor seating.Their is a restaurant that specializes in tartufo and its great.

A great place to people watch. When we walked into the Piazza Navona tears came to my eyes. It is simply beautiful. The three fountains, it took my breath away. We went early in the afternoon and stopped to have a glass of wine and appetizers at one of the many restaurants at their outside tables. An added bonus was that we got free Wi-Fi. A lot of the restaurants in the piazza have free Wi-Fi if you sit at their tables and order something. We started our day there and finished it there after wandering Rome and had dinner at another restaurant. There are plenty of artists and street entertainers and it is fun to people watch while enjoying the amazing atmosphere.

An abosultely lovely Piazza. It was easily one of the most buzz filled points in the whole of Rome, with so much going on at the same time. There are artistes, performers, horse carriages and so many other activities going on at the same time plus of course all those cafes and restaurants around the piazza where you can just sit back and enjoy your pasta and wine. To add to it, it has lovely fountains, just in case you are in mood to click a few pictures. One can also indulge in some cheap shopping, around the area. I would definitely recommend everyone going there to spend a couple of hours there to just soak in everything, and fall in love with the place.

Beautiful Piazza. Within the oval square!!! are 3 lovely fountains, the main one being the beautiful Fountain of the Four Rivers.The piazza is a lively place with cafes, artists, entertainers & vendors selling souvenirs.Pop into the Chiesa di Sant'Agnese in Agone Church, opposite the Fountain of the Four Rivers, its well worth itRecommended

Great Place. Visit at day and Night. Art, Artists, Cafes, Fountain.... The place is beautiful. Watch the artists, street performers, smell Rome here. Beautiful Piazza surrounded by history, and NO CARS! Wander the cobblestones and sit and have a coffee!

An absolute favourite. This is one of the greatest places to visit in 'modern' Rome. Whereas the forum and the colliseum typify the ancient side of the city, I believe Piazza Navona typifies the modern architecture and attractiveness of the city in more recent years.This is one of the great places in the city to watch people go by, spend a long time at a cafe, looking around the market stalls that are here or just walking around aimlessly. If you've got time to spare, there's nowhere better to spare it.

A piazza worth a visit. read a bit before visiting and it becomes much more interesting . Afterwards roam the back streets it is so comforting in the shade away from the blistering heat of the July sun in Rome. In the kiosque a bit away from the piazza i found the perfect gift for my princess Yvonne A placard saying princess's room do not disturb . She really liked it. This piazza is wonderful and one should not come to Rome without visiting it and admiring its statues and two large fountains.

Riverrunaround. A late-in-the-day lunch on the piazza (book a table in full view of the River God sculpture) may give you time and an untrammelled view to savor the fountains gracing this essential Roman space. It can't be a peaceful place to live - the crowds at midnight , the mountebanks, the near pandemonium make this a sleepless place on summer nights. The point is not to be hurried. Planning is everything.
A classic. A classic place to visit in Rome. Lots of activity around the fountain and places to sit and sip coffee and people watch. Don't forget the great ice cream shop on the square
Super fountains, buildings and vibe. Great creative vibe with artists and musicians all around this massive meeting place. The fountains and architecture around it are very impressive. Go see it.

A welcoming place in Rome. My first visits to Rome were marked by a bewildering sense of confusion trying to sort through the levels of history and the buzz of modern life. Finding the Piazza Navona not only showed me a more welcoming face to this amazing city, but offered everything anyone could want for a morning or afternoon's break from heavy touring. Three fabulous fountains, the shape of an ancient stadium, a stunning and important baroque church, elegant shops and restaurants, street artists and musicians and reputedly the best ice cream in Rome draw visitors from early morning until night. I never got tired of sitting and watching the changing parade, of admiring the fountains, of talking with the artists. There are numerous hotels nearby, and I was glad we stayed in one. Walking through the Piazza to start the day and again, stoping for ice cream at the end of it made our stay in Rome a deep pleasure as well as an unforgettable travel experience. Without a doubt, the Piazza Navona is my all time favorite place not only in Rome but in almost al of Europe's cities.

Great atmosphere and must-do Drinks stop. Piazza Navona is the best start point for at least one evening drink and nibbles - across 3 nights in rome we went there to start the evening - beautiful open light piazza with fountains and bars/restaurants - great people watching of course - only minor issues are the musicians that play in front of diners for tips - most are ok - but some think they are pavoratti and aren't
Heaven. Sitting in the Piazza Navona with a cold beer on a warm day (although the beer is overpriced) is heaven and something I will remember forever

Great place to people watch!. If you want to see the fountain, it is best to go in the morning when the Piazza is not filled with vendors. Fountain is very beautiful. The Piazza is a place where you can shop for souvenirs, listen to a street musician, have a nice meal al fresco. This Piazza has LOTs of activity. On the far end of the Piazza is a gelato shop that is very good. Be sure to save room. Get the Strawberry (Fragello) gelato.
Amazing spot to relax after a long walk. the atmosphere in this piazza is so relaxing you don't seem to notice the crowds. its a must see and enjoy

Le fontane meravigliose. We visited twice during our stay to simply sit on the benches by the fountains and enjoy seeing the people go by in such a lovely environment. Night time there is beautiful and nearby is a traditional baker where one can get great biscuits and cakes and meringues from. The Church opposite Bernini's main fountain is also worth a visit.

Take a walk to Piazza Navona for lunch!. Great place to take a lunch and rest from sightseeing or shopping. I enjoyed a good lunch and took some photos of the famous fountains. There's also a great place to get a gelato there and there's a mini bank there also. Rest on one of the benches and wright postcards home!

How to while away an hour or two!. Fantastic place to sit, eat, wander, eat, shop, eat, watch the world go by and finish with an ice cream! Loved this Piazza above all others because its got such a fantastic atmosphere - really laid back eating out and people watching. Have a beer and enjoy!

Bustling square. Worth a visit here, nice photo's of the surrounding buildings, cafe's and fountains in the afternoon sun. You can take a hotse and carriage ride from here if you wish. Go down one of the alley ways though if you want to pay aalmost half price for the same style and quality of food, or pay the extra to enjoy the ambiance and some of the musicians. There ate dozens of painters here, so have a meander around the square after your meal. Pick pockets are virtually non existent now due to the police presence, but you still should be careful anyway.
beautiful nice to stop. Lovely piazza with 3 different fountains and street entertainment and artists great place to sit and rest a while and amazing ice cream parlour Angelo's just off main square

Perfect place to spend the afternoon. Visit this piazza when sun is going down, then it's not as hot to see all the interesting things happening here. They are Piazza Navona itself, the beautiful fountains, the street artists who create pictures right in front of you, alive statues who start to move when you throw coins to them, the street clowns entertaining the crowd, the plenty of different souvenirs, the nice cafes to have dinner. Enjoy your time in Rome :)
MUST SEE. This is such a beautiful place to spend the afternoon! You can eat, drink or just hang out near one of the three fountains in this piazza.
The most beautiful Piazza in Rome. Beautiful and full of life during the day and at night. Great atmosphere. Amazing artists drawing pictures and caricatures of you in a few minutes.

Beautiful Area!. This was one of my favorites! My husband and I came back here 4 times in a week, just to walk around and look at the paintings. For those who are interested, the large oil canvases can be purchased for around 75 euro, bot the 100-150 euro they will ask for. The water fountains and restaurants in the area are also fabulous.

Great piazza! Worth a visit. Much quieter than places like trevi fountain and piazza de Spagna as tourists tend to come and go and thd space is quite large and of course beautiful. You can eat at one of the restaurants in the piazza or try one of the many restaurants off the side streets more initimate and beautiful ambience

A great place to get your bearings in Roma. I don't know why, but this is my favorite geographical location in Rome. It does help that it is beautiful and on a grand scale. Yet I think it is because from this easy to find place you can walk to any destination in the City of Rome and find it without a map and/or GPS (this may take you awhile, but you will eventually see exactly what I mean). Yes, it helps if it is in the day time because of the shadows (east, west, north south, etc.), but it is such a large north/south spot, it helps with your bearings through the winding streets east of the Tiber. It sure is nice it is open (unlike Trevi Fountains), filled with people (almost all the time), restaurants, shops, a beautiful big church (obviously) and cool fountains even people that have not been to Rome will recognize in your pictures. The obelisk is an added bonus. It is a "must see" in Rome, whatever others may tell you. Ciao!
My favourite piazza!. Piazza Navona is my favourite piazza in Italy. I love the painters, the street performers and the food. Definitely a MUST SEE on your trip to Rome!

Possibly the liveliest Piazza in Rome. Piazza Navona is a great place to hang out, lively with street musicians and an array of cafes. The most impressive attraction is the famous Fontana Dei Quattro Fiumi (meaning Fountain of Four Rivers) scuplted by none other than Bernini. A roman palace also faces the piazza. So head here for a relaxing evening by sipping some great Italian coffee, soaking in some great instrumental music and taking in the great view.

Somewhat over-rated. The fountains had very little water trickling through which spoiled the possibly beautiful effect. The 'artists' are mostly pedlars of mass produced art, none actually painting in the piazza, other than a couple of artists who used spray cans and various tools to produce gaudy pictures of nothing to do with Rome as far as I could see. There were 3 or 4 people, sprayed in either gold or silver who stood or sat very still until you approached and then they beckoned, hoping for payment. There were also a couple of girls with their heads buried inside their jackets, a pair of sunglasses and a hat up on a wire stalk that made them look like headless people. And of course, the eateries that encircle the piazza are grossly over-priced. Sorry, but it's not all it's cracked up to be.

Great Surprise after Dinner in Rome. My family & I were in Rome for several days & were given a restaurant that was close to the Piazza Navona. After dinner, we wondered over the piazza & were very pleasantly surprised by the piazza, the fountain & the people. I had hoped to see the fountain of the four rivers, but did not realize it was in this piazza. What beautiful fountain! It was a nice cool night in Rome & the piazza was humming with folks just enjoying themselves at little restaurants, gelato stands & hanging out. A great, relaxing experience.
Fun hangout. Lots of restaurants (which will be overpriced due to location), lots of people watching and street performances. Fun place to go hang out if you have the time

Piazza Navona Has It All!. Everything you love about Rome can be found at the Piazza Navona--beautiful Bernini fountains, ancient church and many outdoor cafes on the large square. You can look at this giant oblong area and imagine when it was a racetrack during ancient times.

Navona square just piece of artmagic )). Yeah, it really magic - there are many people and a lot of art purposes, funny animator and beautiful fountains, especially fountain of Neptune. Have a look also here: http://lookrome.com/en/place/fountains-in-rome/fontana-del-nettuno.html

Beautiful. The main fountain in the center of Piazza Navona is beautiful. My favorite part of the piazza was admiring the detail on the fountain carvings.During the day, the center of the piazza is absolutely filled with vendors selling artwork. The buildings around the outside of the piazza contains many restaurants where you can stop for a coffee or grab some food.

Music, street art, fountains and architecture - what more could you want?. Piazza Navona was by far my favourite square in Rome - especially at night!Go and see the Pantheon at dusk just as the sun sets then go around the corner to the Piazza Navona. The fountain is large and exquisite and unlike the Trevi fountain you can usually sit right next to it! There are loads of painting stalls and towards the church doors there are the spray paint artists that will create something custom for you in under 5 minutes its truly amazing to watch them. When I was there, there was a wee guitar band soflty playing acoustic Pink Floyd hits - it was just amazing. A really laid back atmosphere I could have stayed there hours.TIP: there is an *amazing* gelato store round the corner from this Gelaterie de Teatre; white peach and lavender mmmmmmmm! Go there first then skip round the corner to this amazing square.

A beautiful square. I love Piazza Navona and ALWAYS stroll through it when visiting Rome. I love meandering through the side streets and then all of a sudden coming upon this magnificent square. Every time is see the fountains a notice a new detail. Definitely come see them by day and by night. If you feel like spending some serious cash, go to Tres Scalini and sample the tartufo and do some great people watching. This is a must see on your stroll through Rome.

Thumbs up - Piazza Navona. Had espresso just in front of this magnificent fountain! Mist was falling from under the restaurant umbrellas. Lovely. Artists displaying their work. Wonderful place to visit, a must see in Rome.

My favorite square in Rome. With three magnificent fountains, and always full of art (music, visual art, etc.), the Piazza Navona is my number one piazza in Rome. Go there when the sun is setting (late-afternoon to evening), and you'll be amazed by the lighting of the fountains and the colors and light on the surrounding buildings.

My favourite square in Rome. This is by far my favourite square in Rome. Eating gelato and people watch while the water from the fountain gushes behind me. Artists, tourists and pigeons all gathered here to make this square one of the loveliest that I had been so far.

Beautiful!. A must see! It has beautiful fountains and all around it are cafes where you can sit down and have some lunch or have some homemade gelato to get some relief from the heat (they even have misters) really fun place to see!
Very popular nightlife spot. Go to the Piazza Navona in the evening. There are several nice outdoor restaurants. Great atmosphere and many local artists displaying their work.

It's okay. If you are expecting artists, you'll be disappointed. There aren't that many artists but middlemen. There are a few artists though and the prices range from fair to madness so bargain and bargain hard! We had offers for water paintings from 10 to 35 Euros and for oil paintings from 35 to 150. It really depends on the seller and the business he or she has had all day. My advice would be to only buy if you see something that you must have. If not move on and try elsewhere. I liked the atmosphere and the interaction with the Italian middlemen. There's a good ice cream shop at the entrance to the square to cool off.

Art and Restaurants. This beautiful piazza is skirted by restaurants and filled with artists painting, displaying, and bargining their creations. If you want an authentic painting of Rome, this is the place to get it. Many restaurants in Rome offer free Wifi.

Chic, Romantic, and Delicious!. We rented apartments just across via Emmanuelle in Campo di Fiori and enjoyed walking to Piazza Navona to soak in the nightlife and street cafes. We particularly enjoyed our wine and cheese crawl. We enjoyed the variety of Italian wines which I can't say if any were better than the other. The cheeses were perfectly paired. These waiters do know what they are doing! Just lived it!
Spectacular. A must see and much to see! Many over-the-top sculptured fountains that are extraordinary. Very crowded with visitors and artists painting in the square. Quite beautiful.

A square of fountains. The piazza was filled with tourists and artists. The St. Agnus church was closed but the fountains were there in full glory. My favorite is the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Four Rivers),
Always a good place to visit

Elegant Glamourous FUN. This lil square is a must see i nROme people watching and just hanging out with gelati is nice here. the restuarants ont he squares are always a bot more but well worth the experience. Enjoy theoutsife fire and sounds of the fountains.. watch you dont get hit in the head by a blue light tourist junk ! The peddlers shoot them all over the place

The Most Beautiful Piazza in Rome. Historic and beautiful. A must see in Rome. Go in the early morning to avoid crowds or go in the evening to enjoy crowds. Avoid the restaurants, they are historic tourist traps!

Check out the Local Area!. This place is AWESOME! Gorgeous square with tons of fun eateries. Local artists display their wares and they even had those funky spray paint artists. Food is expensive if you eat right in the Piazza, but walk a bit and the food becomes more reasonable. 60Euro for a family of 5 with wine and a moderate appetite. This is what night life is like in Roma!

Best Piazza in Rome. This was probably my favourite piazza in the city and that is no easy feat as the others were all also very enjoyable! There were plenty of decent restaurants and cafes around the edge as well as shops which had some very friendly owners. We got chatting to one owner who recommended restaurants in other piazzas and was very helpful. There are plenty of street artists in the centre of the square and I didn't see any of the scammers with flowers there which was very nice!

Beautiful square. We really loved this square. Sadly, like most of Rome it is over run with street venders but the fountain was better than Trevi in our opinion and it is great place to people watch. St. Agnes is a beautiful church. This is just a couple blocks from Campo Di Fiori so you can do both of these easily and then walk in 5 minutes to The Pantheon and 5 more to Trevi. The restaurants were a bit overpriced as you will find in the touristy areas in Rome.

Beautiful spot to enjoy a Gelatto. This beautiful Piazza has two fountains and all kind of artists on the side. Surrounded by pricey restaurants the Piazza Navonna is a great spot to catch a breath and enjoy a Gelatto by the well known fountains. There's guys posing as roman soldiers, caricaturists, painters and all kinds of artist and looooots of pigeons

Great Way to Spend an Afternoon. Piazza Navona is full of life and worth a stop. Lots and lots of people, artists sharing their talents of all levels, restaurants and gelato galore to tempt the palate. It's a wonderful place to spend an hour or more, especially just to watch the Italian world go by and recharge before you head out to see more of the city. There are several Bernini fountains with the Four Rivers Fountain being the highlight (the story and history are worth reading a more knowledgable review). As a side note, my husband is quite enamored with fountains, so we sought out Piazza Navona for this purpose, knowing the three fountains were there. However, we had seen Trevi Fountain the day before, and this can't even begin to be compared, in our opinion, to Trevi. If I were to do it again or to advise others fountain lovers (hence the review), I would suggest seeing Piazza Navona first, so as not to compare. The Bernini fountains are quite amazing and because it's much less crowded than Trevi, you really have the time and space to appreciate them.

Pretty but Pricey. Everybody who visits Rome has Piazza Navona on their wishlist. And one look at the square will tell you why. The large Fountain of Four Rivers in the middle along with two small fountains either side make for a spectacular centerpiece of this square. With artists, musicians, painters everywhere the square just comes alive with a lot of vibrancy. The periphery of the square is dotted with a lot of restaurants. One can sit outdoors and just watch people go by for hours.But this luxury comes at a price. The restaurants were the priciest in all of Rome with no significant upsurge in quality. If anything we had tasted better food for far less at some places in Rome. Having said that, we understand that this is a prime chunk of real estate in Rome, hence the hefty prices. Overall, a must see in Rome.

Fountains fabuloso!. I visited the Piazza Navona with my husband and another couple. We were especially enamored with the Four Rivers Fountain. We were rather tired from our sightseeing so we enjoyed some fabulous Tartufo ice cream. My favorite was the White Almond Truffle...delicious but very pricey. Lots of artists showing their wares gave the Piazza hustle and bustle. There was a small shop selling handmade Florentine paper and delightful leather goods. Be sure to include this on your itinerary!

Lovely Piazza Navona!. Located very close to one of the main streets of Rome - Via del corso, the Piazza is a revelation! Bustling with street artists and restaurants, the Piazza is pure joy! Right in the center stands the Fountain of four rivers created by Bernini which is a sight to behold! To the southern end is Fontana del moro and to the northern end is fountain of neptune - both created by Giacomo della porta! Right in front of the main fountain is a long bench (which if you are fortunate enough to get space) you can sit and watch the magnificent structure as long as you want.....the Piazza also has so many portrait artists who can sketch you in a matter of minutes....located behind the Fountain of four rivers is church of Sant'Agnese. Very lively and must see!

An ADD paradise. So much to see and do at this square. Many artists on site with interesting paintings, crafts, fountains that amaze and cooled us down, and numerous restaurants to choose from. People watching opportunities are endless!

A beautiful Piazza. This is the most beautiful baroque Piazza in all Rome. It started life as as a circus under Domitian, where chariot races were held. The circus layout is readily apparent as the Piazza is is a long rectangle. The Piazza has 3 fountains, with Bernini sculptures. The center fountain, sculpted by Bernini, represent rivers of the 4 corners of the world, the Nile, Ganges, Danube, and Plata. This fountain was sculpted by Bernini for Pope Innocent X, in 1651. The Piazza is a great place to have a meal and just relax and watch all the people stroll by.
Touristy and alot of fun. I enjoyed my time at Piazza Navona watching the people fountains,,all the outside cafes and artists selling their wares. It's free and not to be missed.
Lovely. Huge area to eat, stroll, shop, and enjoy! There are 4 large fountains that are beautiful. Grab a gelato and sit to enjoy the view! Very close to Pantheon and Jewish Ghetto. What a treasure.

Nice and GREAT bakery nearby. Very nice piazza, especially at night!! we liked all the beautiful fountains. When here, make sure you stop by the nearby corso di rinacimento and walk toward victor emanuel. on the left you will find a delicious organic bakery (Boulangerie MP) that we visited 5 times during our six day stay. Definitely a must! Sadly, it is not on trip advisor yet since it is brand new.Here is their instagram link http://statigr.am/tag/boulangeriemp

Good atmosphere, great architecture.. If it wasn't for our excellent guide we never would have known about this place. An amazing huge fountain with lots of architectural details. A huge square (piazza) with lots of little stalls selling all sorts of paintings, art, sculptures etc. Lots of cafes. For me though - just the beautiful fountain was the main attraction.

Pizzaz in Piazza Navona. Ahhh, our local Piazza during our stay. At any time of the day or night walk via the Piazza Navona; quietish in the early morning; busier over lunch and in the evening packed. We liked Caffe Nettuno for a hit of caffiene (located towards what I call the narrow end of the Piazza); standing at the counter for espresso and croissant is heaps cheaper than sitting down; unless your legs are tired after walking the cobblestones of Roma! If you have an espresso say 'hi' to Fabio and Ratzzi, we got to know them over our stay.

A piece of architectural art. Not to be missed if u like architecture.We got lost in the "vicoli", narrow cute streets from the main street of V.Emmanuele and it was one of the best naif accidents. It's huge and u pleasently want to get lost into the sculptures and little selling tents. Suggestion: eating in one of the trattorias there, is really gorgeous but also pricey, like 40% more than in regular trattorias ( 12-15 euros for a pizza) and be aware of the hidden costs.

Nice square!!. Lovely square thats great to watch people passing through. Great atmosphere with local musicians playing and the sound of the water flowing in the fountain. Also quite near to the pantheon.

Fun and atmospheric !. Great piazza and anotherone to see at night when it seems to take on a nostalgic feel. If only the italians could rid the street sellers selling things that fly and light up or silk shawls then it would be an even nicer place to come and unwind at the end of a sight seing day

A square not to be missed for the colours. A very attractive square with 3 large fountains. A good place to sit by a fountain and have an ice cream whilst watching everyone else going past. It is full of artist selling there paintings. Beware if you sit down at a restaurant here, it will cost you!

Artist's galore. This vibrant square was a wonderful place just to hang out. There is no shortage of artists' works to admire and purchase, shops to peruse and restaurants to enjoy. I highly recommend spending an evening here. I is conveniently located near Trevi Fountain, another must see.

Amazing. What a fantastic atmosphere at Piazza Navona. buzzing with energy and the Fountain of the four rivers is the highlight. Be warned about the cafes in the square as they are twice the price of other cafes nearby.

Fabulous. We loved Piazza Navona, and were drawn back here a few times in our 4 day stay. It is buzzing with tourists, artists, street sellers and street performers which is great fun. The fountains are beautiful. We enjoyed sitting outside with a coffee or a glass of wine at one of the cafes, just taking it all in.

it became our 'home base'. What a wonderful location!
Great restaurants, fabulous fountains, art..people watching..even gelato...
If you are in Rome, this should be a 'must see' destination. No matter the time of day (till 11pm) there is something to see, do or eat. During our stay in Rome, we dined here very frequently and were never disappointed (every meal was great)

Go at night. Went here at night and the square looked really lovely. Plenty of restaurants here and the fountains are really attractive. Had to go through it again during the day and it was not the same. Just did not seem as nice as when seen at night.

Fantastic area to stay. We stayed in the area which is fantastic for getting around. Lovely art markets are night - even if you don't want to buy anything the merchants are all really friendly. Also a great place to meeting other people as art makes everyone start talking!

Nice Piazza but eat somewhere else. The nice atmosphere of the Piazza Navona can be spoiled when you sit down at one of the many street front restaurants around the piazza. I suspect they are all the same but I will refer to one that I ate at and am personally familiar with. This one is Caffee Barocco. We had 1 beer and one coffee and 4 slices of very thin traditional pizza for $27 Euro or about $36 dollars ( generally an afternoon snack for 1 person ) The prices are high but not ridiculous when you move a block or two away from the more popular attractions. I dined at various street front restaurants in Rome but was gouged at this particular one.

A must visit in Rome. Built on the open space of a stadium , Navona square has a slightly narrow oval shape with three beautiful fountains; the Neptune in the north , the Four Rivers topped by the Obelisk of Domitian in the middle and the Del Moro in the south, The Church is located near the Four Rivers fountain. The statues are huge and amazingly beautiful. The square is surrounded by buildings which house many designer shops and restaurants and gelaterias or ice cream parlors. The space around the fountains are occupied by artists showcasing their paintings, peddlers and tourists. There is a humming sound around the place during peak hours. The place is vibrant, colorful and dynamic. Navona square is a must visit in Rome.

One of my favorite places!. Piazza Navona is one of my favorite places I visited in Rome recently. The fountain of the four rivers is absolutely beautiful. You can't find a better place for people watching. There were all kinds of artists drawing and painting and vendors selling everything from tacky souvenirs to true treasures and beautiful jewelry. Lots of restaurants in the area for pretty much all price ranges. Some of the best gelato we had in Rome we got while in the Piazza. I'd say this is a "don't miss" if you're visiting Rome....especially for the first time.

Most scenic Piazza in Rome. As a photography enthusiast, I had a grand time shooting different parts of the piazza. Lots of street performers, vendors, and photogenic cafes. To top it all, of course, is Bernini's fountain and the church at the center. A good place to do people watching as well!
Spetacular!. Very beautiful place with lots if restaurants there and on its way.You can also eat gellatos and Tartufos around the area and take some nice pictures.Definetly recommend it!
Another must-see. The Fountain of Four Rivers is awesome!Especially at night. Dinner costs more there, but the view is great. If dinner is too expensive, then just get a gelato.

My favourite. After a day long strolling through Rome, visiting churches, typical small shopping streets and everything else Rome has to offer, Piazza Navona is the place to sit down, have a glass of wine and enjoy people walking by. Do not forget to visit the beautiful church and to walk around Bernini's Four River fountain.

Lovely Piazza spoilt by the traders and over-priced restaurants. Spectacular central fountain with a couple of smaller fountains at each end of the piazza. I'd give it at least 4 out of 5 if it wasn't spoilt by the traders.The whole square was full of artists selling paintings and prints taking up far too much room and not much use if you don't want to buy any. They all looked much the same. Restaurants were seriously overpriced even for Rome. 10 Euro for a beer. The mozarella and tomato pizza I ordered came as a hot pizza base with tomatoes and cheese straight out of a very cold fridge on top. Not my idea of good food as the condensation soon made the base soggy. If only I could remember the name I'd give it an appropriate review.

Go for an early morning walk and see its real beauty. I won't go on about the various characteristics of Piazza Navona's cafes and unpleasant hawkers. These themes have been well documented here. Just a couple of tips for the traveller....if jetlag is keeping you awake, or if you are able to get yourself out on the streets of Rome for an early morning walk, get to Piazza Navona by 7.30am and you'll see the true masterpiece square of the Baroque period in all its glory and get a full appreciation of the real beauty of the Piazza, which is completely blighted during the day when it is overcrowded with people, hawkers and expensive cafes. Another tip, just off the street near Piazza Navona is an excellent tavola calda, as recommended by UK Guardian newspaper in their top 10 delis of Rome. This shop, opposite the Senate, near Piazza Navona, is good value for a quick lunch. Perch yourself on one of their bar stools for a great lunch with the locals (not the tourists being overcharged in the Piazza around the corner). It is apparently owned by the same family who have the upscale fish restaurant, La Rosetta. They have vegetarian dishes as well. I had half a roast chicken with vegetables for 8 euro. Bargain. Address is • Corso del Rinascimento 83/85. It is not very well sign posted but is called Rosticceri. They are on the net at Rosticceri.com. If I was rating Piazza Navona during "normal tourist hours" I would rate it one star for a terrible experience but if you go when no one is around and appreciate the beauty of the Bernini fountains and lovely buildings, it is wonderful. It is worth the effort to make it out of bed early just for one day at least.
Multiple Artists. An abundance of watercolor artists, some of which are very talented. A pleasurable visit. The Piazza is lined with a large number of outdoor restaurants with passable Italian food.
Christmas Market. We loved that so many of the vendors sold nativity sets! Adorable stuff, altho a bit expensive. The best part... sweets with Nutella and the fountains. :)

Loved this place!. If you want to sit and watch the world go by then this is the place to do it! Full of atmosphere with lots of cafes, restaurants, street entertainers, local artists etc. Highly recommended but a bit pricey!

must do. lovely piazza covered with artists (portraits, selling paintings etc) which is fun to wander around. never felt harrassed to buy anything. surrounded by cafés, trattorias etc, lovely fountains and buildings. worth adding to the list of things to see - maybe stop and have a drink or meal

One of our favorite spots to visit in Rome. Piazza Navona is absolutely gorgeous. The three fountains are just amazing. People watching is great here. If you are into art, this is also a great place, with lots of vendors. Lots of restaurants and bars, but very pricey if on the Piazza. It's also worth a second visit at night, with musicians and all the fountains lit up. There is also a beautiful church to visit there.

Another gem in Rome!!!. Beautiful setting in the middle of Rome. Fantastic to just sit and people watch over a drink. Restaurants and bars are slightly overpriced in the area due to the location. Wander up the side streets for cheaper food and drinks. Fantastic artists and street performers throughout the day. If you get a caricature done be ready to get slightly offended in a playful manner. Bernini fountain is the centrepiece, another landmark which are littered throughout Roma!!

Piazza Navona and the Four Rivers Fountain. This is a really nice square, near the Pantheon, to wander about, full of cafes and places to get some of Italy's famous gelato. There's a little place down a little side street from here that does 'medium' size ice creams which are huge and tasty for 2.50 euros but I can't remember what it was called - but it's good to explore to try and find it ;) Great to sit down and just watch everyone go by near the Four Rivers Fountain - a stunning piece of work by Bernini. There is also Fontana del Moro and the Fountain Of Neptune, also both stunning works. Still a few tat sellers, invisible men and Tutankhamen statue people but they don't really bother you here.

Four Rivers. Not far from the Pantheon and worth the walk, for this piazza houses the four rivers fountains. The square is lined with cafes and shops and you have an array of local artists selling everything from thatch art and charactercher drawings to professional artist plying thier wares...Worth the short walk...
Loved it!. Must see. For a drink, meal or just for a wander through. One of our favourite things about Rome. There is lots going on and a great atmosphere to soak up.
happening square. Its in the centre of city. There are 2 fountains in the square. Various activities like puppet shows, paintings, road shows etc go on ...

Absolutely gorgeous!!!. The Piazza is beautiful with two fountains Fontana Del Moro and fountain of Neptune. The Piazza is abuzz in the morning with street performers, artists and tourists. You could just sit here for hours looking at people and admiring the work of artists on display. You could also buy artwork from the artists at very reasonable rates. The piazza has cafes all along that add to the whole atmosphere. I personally loved the piazza and this was amongst the best I visited in Rome.

Quaint piazza near Pantheon. I loved the fountain, cafe and performers but i hated the dirt. People just left their trash everywhere. There were also vendors selling knock off purses. I think that it's great for romantic dates.
