The beauty of the square hasn't changed, but an influx of rubbish artists and souvenir touts has spoiled the atmosphere and the views. Even the surrounding restaurants seemed tackier. Still worth a visit to see the fountains but don,t linger!

Great Eateries. Pouring with rain on the day we visited so the covered restaurant areas were very welcome. Lots of restaurants round the square so take your pick. The street artists were a little thin on the ground and only the brave ventured out. Worth a visit as good food near to the Pantheon etc

Delightful!. When I visited, there were not only the regular shops with their various wares, but, artists painting and selling their work, musicians performing as well as scholas, magicians, and other various theatical acts all free and positively wonderful!
Great place to eat outside. Lots of places to et and drink and even better at night. This is a must see place because of all the activity.

Good to stop and eat.. Like every where in Rome its a little expensive but worth it. You can browse throught stalls and pick up a picture or two the fountains are cool and like other plazas come with their own stories take your time and try the Gelato

Loved the fountains!. This is a large piazza built on the plan of the original chariot races so you get a sense of the size. The fountain in the middle, representing the then-known four continents, does not disappoint. The monument is also in great shape. Most of the buildings were in good shape, considering the age of them.
Tranquility - amazing place. This was just an awesome place. I recommend this to all. What a feeling of peace and connectivity. Highly recommend

Lively and beautiful Piazza. We stayed in a hotel off of the Piaza Navona, so it was a place we frequently crossed and often stopped to watch people, take in the beautiful Bernini fountains or have a gelato. Don't miss it.

Beautiful square. The Navona Square is very best known for the Four Rivers Fountain, sculpted by Bernini. Each man represents a river for the four continents knew then (Danube, Nile, Rio de la Plata and Ganges); The square is filled with people and it's a perfect place to relax and enjoy that you're in Rome.

Love this Piazza!. I am not wild about Rome, but do love this place. 2nd time there, and it still continues to amaze me. The scuptures are truly inspiring. The energy on the piazza is contagious, and I really did like all the artists who have set up there stalls. This is one of the key places to visit in Rome, so do not miss!! But, skip the restaurants on the piazza (too expensive) and explore some of the back streets.

Don't miss this. Beautiful, picturesque fountain and church, in a square that is filled with artists--many are creating art as you watch and others were performing. Several restaurants surround the square as well. Great place to experience Rome!

Tourists, vendors, and restaurants galour. A "nice to see" place when visiting Rome, but you do not need much time there. Full of tourists and tourist trap vendors. The restaurants on the plaza seem less then appealing as it is all "tourist" food an nothing special. Maybe do a walk through of it on your way to something else, but again, not a must see, just a nice to see.

Buzzing. Beautiful Piazza with it's two great fountains the Fontana del Moro and the other end has the Fountain of Neptune.This Piazza has always hosted theatrical events during its history and today is no exception with, on the day we visited, a small theatre group performing and many street artists adding to the experience.
people watching. love the fountains and the architecture around, a big space to while away time and do nothing but people watching...
Pretty. Pretty little Piazza, nice to wander around watching artists. stop for a coffee and do some people watching-very nice chilled atmosphere.

Amazing. Take a little time to soak it all in. To see how they could take a piece of marble and sculpt it is amazing. And of course, try the tartufo at Tre Scalini while sitting outside to soak it all in.

A nice hang out square. Nice street artists and a good overall atmosphere. We liked people watching and enjoyed the painters. there is also a nice fountain in the middle. and the square is surrounded by buildings which makes it cozy

Artsy hangout, chill after the vatican visit.. After quite an intensive Vatican tour, we grabbed some drinks, and rested our weary feet. Since I love to paint, I visited all the artists in the square and watched some at work. Talked to a few about their impasto technique and bought some works, supporting the local artists as is my wont. A very pleasant way to while away the afternoon. The square itself is a photographer's delight, very aesthetically colored and sized, and of course the sun plays off the fountain and flowers beautifully as it does all over Italy!There are a lot of historic spots very close to Piazza Navona that one must visit, so this is the ideal meeting place.

Pick your musicians!. It was beautiful there and we picked a restaurant by an acoustic guitar player who played such beautiful songs for us while we ate our dinner looking over the piazza. Word of caution, not all musicians are of the same calibre -- you may want to check out the musicians before you pick a restaurant. Food was good, but not the best I had in Rome (as food in Rome is fantastic!) but definitely the romantic music and the table set ups really helped! Everything about the piazza is beautiful. Lots of artists selling their arts, and the Bernini statues!!! Fantastic!

Great to see but watch your back ... and your wallet!. This was an amazing sight to behold like most of Rome. Definitely worth a visit but I would recommend not to eat at the restaurants here as they are super expensive for what you get. Also, this was the only area in Rome where we felt unsafe as we had to guys follows us for a couple of blocks until I finally managed to let them know we were on to them and they left ... lucky for us, but be careful.
So beautiful. Full of life, rubbishy art work on the street, mostly! Fabulous fountains, awe inspiring altogether and very close to the Pantheon
Love the square. Lots of people and i love Bernini's work of the Fountain of the Four Rivers. Don't want to miss that. The tartufo at the square is a must try as well.

Piazza Navona - Buon Natale. Piazza Navona is the best location in Roma for finding Buon Natale and Befana items. The vendors begin to appear in late November/early December and they turn the Piazza into a holiday shopping experience.
Make time to visit this lovely square.. I wanted to move our hotel closer to this beautiful square: many lovely bars and restaurants, shops, architecture, etc.

The place they burned St.Agnes. This is what Rome used to be : small and narrow streets that open up into a medieval piazza. Used to be a sporting areana during the Empire, now filled with artists, tourists and restaurants. Nice fountain.

Too crowded. I wasn't as impressed with Piazza Navona as I had hoped from all I had heard about it. All the artists and touts were distracting from the fountains and diminished the perception of the size of the piazza. The restaurants were much more expensive than comparable restaurants just a couple blocks away, so one really pays for having pasta in the piazza. Glad I saw it, but I wouldn't rush back.

Rome’s "must see". Piazza Navona is beautiful at any time of day and year.It's pleasant to sit in some café on the square drinking something refreshing on a hot summer day.It's interesting to watch the evening performances and street painters making paintings and drawings. Cafés' fragrances arouse appetite. Restaurants are expensive, but always crowded, especially in the evening.In general Piazza Navona is very touristic, but nice and atmospheric. You must see it!
Beautiful Bernini Fountain. Don't miss it. My sister and I tried to visit the sights from the Angels and Demons book. Beautiful!
a great place. We had lunch an an early evening meal at this location. The food was excellent and watching all the events made it very memorable

Lively atmosphere. Our Hotel was close to this Piazza, so we strolled across for a drink and watched the street performers and artists here. To eat and drink in one of the many surrounding Bars and/or Restaurants was expensive. So we tended to have a drink there, eat in a Restaurant in one of the side streets and then come back and stroll around in the Piazza later in the evening after our meal.
Cool. Exciting vibe, always something going on. Vendors, entertainers, etc.... One of our favorites during our trip.

Beautiful square. Beautiful architecture surrounding the square, the three fountains tell incredible stories, and the artists flooding the square create an fantastic environment. You could spend all day in one of the superb restaurants watching people go by.
what a great selection of fountains !. The fountains are great and when you couple them with the history of the competing designers, it makes for a very entertaining visit.
Big with nice restaurants. Was nice to see but see it at the start of your trip otherwise you won't be impressed after the rest of Rome which is all so lovely

Not to be missed. This is a nice Piazza with three fountains. Loads of artists come here as well. The buildings surrounding the fountain were very nice. I didn't like the pushy restaurant staff asking everyone to come to their place.(we saw that in every city we visited but not on the Amalfi Coast)
busy, buskers galore!. very busy, cold and blustery day. expensive coffee and treats in this area. mostly for watching the crowds and busker entertainment.

Night time stroll. This was one of the last sites I laid eyes on in Rome, quite literally. On our last day we decided to finish off all the little bits we hadn't yet done, and this just happened to be very last, before we found somewhere nice to eat. The fountains we're lovely to see at night, it just looked picturesque against the dark nights sky. Also there were these orange foam cubes, which people could just walk up and play with, children were making puzzles it had a great atmosphere! There were also a lovely string of restaurants surrounding the Piazza, a wonderful view. Really recommend a stop here.
Barock, barock, barock. Ba-rock everywhere!! go back in time and see artists, painters and dancers having while having an ice-cream or a cup of cappuccino to the cafes around the fountains!!!!

Beautifully. Piazza Navona - the last stop on our odyssey Roman :). Unfortunately the main fountain was closed for restoration, but still managed to peep and see how deep, and under the influence of the movie "Angels and Demons" - though this film brought me to Rome. Very nice place, a lot of people, artists, various artists, and ... our wonder which one of pop street gray van in the movie - hahaha, great place. Here - a girl performs his program - a balance tank head - photos were unique. You can sit for hours and enjoy the sun, the smells, hustle. Just a feeling that the next day we leave bitter taste left ... Rome is fascinating with its plazas, fountains, places, food, people ... Our dessert was Piazza Navona - still feel the whole atmosphere that reigns there. Elevation man in Rome - must enjoy the Piazza Navona!

A large nice square, but very crowded. There are plenty of restaurants lining the Piazza and there are some beautiful fountains in the middle. There is also a beautiful Cathedral that is free to visit.There are tons of street vendors, street performers, and lots of crowds there to see them.I was somewhat disappointed with Piazza Navona since I had read so many nice things about it.

Love this place. We went there in the evening and we absolutely love the atmosphere - lively, not too crowded. Bought two paintings from here. Check out the statues at the fountains - they are amazing
Fun place to visit.. We experienced a wonderful afternoon with a clown entertaining the whole piazza for over 20 min. He was terrific!

Great place to hang out for an hour or two. The central area of Rome is basically a pedestrian area and a walk to the Piazza Navona is an essential stopping off place for the foot traveller. There are many cafes and restaurants dotted around the Piazza and they are lovely places to watch the world go bye for a half hour or two.If you are an art lover, why not check out the many stalls of water colours and sketches. You can pick up a lovely water colour painting of a scene in Rome for about 15-20 euros.

Artists galore. If you're looking to by some art, then this is one of the places to go. There are some highly talented artists that sell their works here. Look for the watercolour artists painting their next creation. They may be a little more expensive but you will truly be buying a quality piece.

Piazza Navona dissapointing. Not really sure what to expect, but if you like artist's painting charactures of kids and couples, overpriced drinks, you'll love it here, the fountains are very nice and its a good place to sit and watch the world go by on a sunny day, make up your own mind!!
wonderful concert. enjoyed a wonderful evening concert on Piazza Navona till near midnight, which was a terrific experinece

People watching in the rain. We wandered over to Piazza Navona after a trip to the Pantheon on a rainy afternoon in October - we found a cafe that served us wine to warm up and a good view of the main fountain. The fountain is impressive, and the Piazza is really beautiful.

too many peddlers. This plaza is large and has the most beautiful fountains (3). the peddlers from Senagal were everywhere and very aggressive. They need to be removed so tourists can linger peacefully in this lovely area
Very Busy but worth seeing. This was apparently the busiest Rome has been in Oct in a long time. So everywhere you went was extremely busy with tour groups until very late into the night we found.
tourist trap. the food is more expensive at the restaurants around here and the plaza is simply a crowded market full of vendors selling, for the most part, bad art.

Beautiful, lively. We spent a good bit of time in and around Piazza Navona, passing through each day of our visit to Rome on our way to and from our hotel to historic sites. We ate in several of the cafes, had drinks in two of the bars, and stopped for gelato in addition to just relaxing by the fountains. There were lots of people there and its was truly festive.
Huge & Fabulous!. I love this piazza, there is so much to see. Loved the human statues and the fountains. It was very busy , would like to see it again when it's quieter but definately worth a visit!
Beautiful at the sunset. I liked the atmosphere, the music, the fountains. Good, good piazza to go. Enjoy and relax! I'll go there in my trip.

People watching. Best Piazza in Rome for people watching surrounded by beautiful architecture, sculptures and very good restaurantsBusy, cosmopolitan and vibrant. Quite commercial but well worth a visit

Good place to walk, avoid the expensive cafes and restaurants. The Piazza Navona is one of the largest piazzas in the inner city, with different attractions including the Fountain of the Four Rivers and the Obelisk of Domitian in the center of the Piazza. The attractions are surrounded by many restaurants and cafes, all charging a premium for a crowded view. Not worth it in my opinion. Best to wander through the Piazza, take your photos and move on to the streets parallel for a wider (and cheaper) selection of food and drinks.

a very happening place. A microcosm of Rome. People buying, selling, eating, painting, performing, reading by the fountains, attending church, and just enjoying life. at one end (under cover) there are ruins of an ancient chariot track.
Always go there. Love Piazza Navona, always go there when in Rome, very colourful and filled with artists and entertainers.
Beautiful. Such a lovely and relaxing place to stroll through in the evening. This is part of the Dolce Vita Stroll and you'll see many locals as well as the tourists.

Beautiful at sunset. Best time to go by is at sunset. The colors of the sky and the atmosphere of the piazza is amazing. The piazza is lined with artists and musicians. Great to go before or after dinner.
food. great to catch an early tea with the fountains or music and dancing here at night we just stopped for a coffee which was lovely as well

Only for passage. I didn't like.Thousands of tourists.Lots of people trying to sell everything.Very expensive restaurants (walk 5 minutes and you'll get very good restaurants for half a price)By night.very very poor ilumination.Go only to pass and don't spend too much time

Stunning. Wasn't in Rome for long but this is definitely one to head for. I went at night and whilst I can imagine it is as beautiful during the day, the scale and beauty of the fountains and buildings at night were quite stunning. Must bring the family back here. Highly recommended.

A little disappointed..... Don't know what I expected, but it was so busy (saturday) could only 'shuffle' round the place. The cafe's were hugely expensive, the 'artists' pictures were all the same - reproductions......Great little ice-cream shop, double scoop cone for 3euro Perhaps would have been different on a quieter day.

Surprise. Loved Piazza Navona! We went for the atmosphere as were told it was a bit of a social hub. We didn't eat due to the prices, but found a lovely restaurant much cheaper down a side street. My favourite part was the Church Sant'Agnese in Agone, which was barely mentioned in guide books - but deffinately worth going inside - amazing!

Very Touristy. We remembered it more fondly from a trip ten years ago as the place we went at night to see the fountains lit up and enjoy the many people. Doesn't appear to have worn well over time. Worth a quick walk through. Avoid the subpar restaurants here.

another square. Average. It is another square onto the 100 other squares we saw in Rome. Yes it is big and you will probably stumble across it during your visit but I would not go out of my way to find it

Busy artistic italian atmosphere. We came back to this piazza every night when we stayed in Rome. A very beautiful collection of all kinds of artists. Painters, musicians, singers, clowns. We had very nice time and fun. The cafes surrounding this piazza at night is really beautiful. At 10 pm some opera shows starts for amateurs you can see the shows on the streets. It's very near to the pantheon and the Trevi fountain.A remarkable place and a must visit if you passed by Rome.

Soak It In. There's an awful lot going on at Piazza Navona -- restaurants, magicians, musicians, you name it. Plan to spend a lot of time there, just soaking it in. Probably not a good idea to have a meal there -- restaurants have the look of tourist traps. But stray a little bit from the Piazza and you'll find fantastic restaurants.

Beautiful, very large Square with a lot of history!. There was nothing to dislike, although we did not eat anything or shop in any of the stores or restaurants. We were on a tour and the guide spent a lot of time explaining the history of the square and its fountains.
A hidden gem.. Gorgeous buildings and spectacular fountains. Artists are usually there including live street actors.

Very pretty but you pay for it at the restaurants!. Worth seeing best at night when it lights up. Don't get ripped off by the expensive restaurants around the square. Loads in side streets just as good, but much cheaper, just without the views!

Just another great historical sight to see in Rome.. This piazza is what you picture when you think of Italy. I enjoyed walking around looking at all the street painters work and then enjoying some food from one of the local restaurants that lured us in (I'm not complaining. The food was amazing and they had free wifi!). This is too cool not to miss!

stunning square buzzing with italian atmosphere!. My boyfriend and I stumbled across this square as you do most of Rome when walking around one eveningI couldn't believe how amazingingly beautiful the design of the building within the square was and the fountain. This is a perfect square to sit and have a glass of wine in awe of the surroundings and watch the italian world go by. All of the restaurants around the square were busy with tourists, there were people water colour painting in the street. I would have to say that this was one of the more classier squares in Rome, where you were not as hassled by the 'looky looky men' as other squares and the Spanish steps.

romantic plus good restaurant.. great food restaurant. great coffee shop and just sit down by the fountain to enjoy your cappuccino. lots of paintings to buy. enjoy the history of the church navona. fountains are just beautiful and not too busy. it's anniversary trip and that even made more memorable.
Great for taking photos. Beautiful piazza with an interesting history.It was filled with water during some parts of the year long ago.A few nice ice cream places nearby
Restaurants. Great atmosphere, beware wine is pricey and service charges. Plenty of choice for foodies. Fountains are superb. Artists working in the piaza ate talented. For value eat off the square

A Wonderful Roman experience. You cannot say you have been to Rome until you stroll Piaza Navona. It is a bit touristy, but it is very italian and charning. Be sure to check out Bernini's fountain in the center.
One of my favorites!. I loved this place.... it had numerous paintings for sale .... a lot to see.... great resturants .... the ambience is so like piazza's I see in the movies and in paintings too

Slightly more expensive but great atmosphere. We stumbled onto this little gem one day wandering from the Pantheon back to the tram stop. Some of the art work is amazing and is great to take home as a souvenir. The first time we went we just got an ice cream and had a wander enjoying the atmosphere and the street performers (a nice change after so many churches and history). Unlike some of the other square we weren't over run by street seller trying to make us buy their wears and we enjoyed it so much we went back on our last night for a meal. The restaurant was over priced and the staff were rude but to be completely honest we didn't care as the atmosphere made up for it. First we had someone serenade us by voice singing some English classics then a violinist set up and played some beautiful tunes - we even bought his album. If your looking for a culinary master piece maybe look elsewhere but for a nice atmospheric meal, or even just a coffee, I would highly recommend it!

Great atmosphere. the general atmosphere of the place is great. I liked the restaurants surrounding the piazza as well as the vendors of paintings in the middle of the square. I didn't like the constant badgering by individuals trying to sell us toys, shawls etc.

Wonderful fountains and festive atmosphere. I loved the 3 fountains here. Each was distinctive in its own way. I came here 1st as part of a walking tour and it was very interesting to hear the tour guide talk about the features of the fountains and what they stood for. There were plenty of street performers and people sitting in the numerous cafes, all of which just added to the festive atmosphere. Nice to sit down here and just people-watch.

Beautiful square with good restaurants. Beautiful fountains. Outlined with lots of little stores and restaurants. We stopped at two of the restaurants, one for pizza and wine, and the other for tiramisu and free wifi. Prices were reasonable. Restaurants were air conditioned, which was another reason we stopped in. A very busy square.

Enjoyable. After enjoying our walk around Rome we came to the Piazza Navona right on 7:00pm. There was a lot going on with different artists showing their work and performers, some acting as statues. There was so much atmosphere. The square is lined with restaurants which we walked up and down before deciding on where to have our first meal in Rome. It was great being able to dine outdoors and enjoy the real Italian food.

Early morning cafe. We arrived here early one morning before the tourist arrive. We had a wonderful cappuccino while watching the Piazza come to life. The fountain is incredible and the people watching is superb.
Great place to. Awesome square tucked away with beautiful fountains and lively atmosphere. A must see for any traveller
Worth a detour.... .. if only to see the <Fountain of the Four Rivers> by Bernini. We ate a nice Italian lunch on one of the many terraces.

My favorite place. This was my favorite place in Rome. We strolled through the Piazza two nights in a row. This is the most romantic place in Rome we visited. Since we were celebrating our 10th anniversary, I couldn't think of anywhere I would rather have been.
Great plaza. Beautiful plaza, great church around. Great place to buy food and souvenirs, lots of artists around painting.

Love the Bernini fountains. This is a must if you are in Rome, great gelato places around the Piazza, do not eat anything around the fountains its the law
The Piazza is full of life and lots of turists but always great to hang around for a bit
good place to chill. all nice. just relax, there is a small market here. lots of painting for sale, easy place to find, its not crowded. nice place to take pictures,

the best piazza in rome. No vehicles driving round it as so many others sadly in Rome spoilt by traffic. Beautiful fountains and lots of artists, lovely atmosphere and only 5 mins walk from the Pantheon.

Better in the evening. We went to this during the day and at night.
Definitely more of a buzz about the place at night - all the musicians, artists etc are still there.
If you find the prices rather high, then just take one of the streets off Piazza Navona - plenty of bars/restaurants with lower prices.

Bernini Fountain defining landmark. A lovely piazza, with the defining landmark being the Bernini fountain. Spending a while on one of the benches and watching th world go by, gives one a microcosm of the demographics around as well as a reading on latest fashion and its "victims"!
plain square. It's just a square with 2 nice fountains. Nothing fancy really , but if you want to go there, I wouldn't stop you because the fountains are indeed pretty.

nostalgia. I liked the fountains in the centre of the piazza , the restaurants
and the way people stroll around without a care in the world the kids playing and the appartments overlooking the piazza it looks like something out of a 1940's movie ,nothing has changed it comes to life late afternoon and it is magical to see

Magic. Beautiful square , full of life , people milling around , artists , fountains , restaurants galore . After a day of walking around it was a pleasure to sit in this square and enjoy a superb meal .
Special place. Loved the fountains there, lots of artists selling their work, little coffee shops, overal nice place to spend time and see.
When in Rome. I was told that Piazza Navona was a must see attraction by friends. I found the Piazza interesting but not not a wow experience. Glad I went, but no major wow factor.

Visit at Night for a Special Experience. We happened to visit the Piazza Navona one night when we took a walk after dinner and it was spectacular. The square is surrounded by incredible buildings, the fountain is lite up, the cafes on the edges of the square are filled with charming people and the atmosphere was magical.
Perfect fountain. Bernini sculpture is alive in Rome. This magnificant fountain represents the corners of the world as well as animals. Extreme positions of figures makes the fountain come alive

Breathtaking. You come across the Piazza all of a sudden. Its truly unique. The fountains are spectaular. The sculptuers are mind blowing and totally absorbing. The piazza is pleasant just to sit - have an ice cream and just take it all in. Well worth the visit. amazing photo chances as well

beautiful fountains. This square is very beautiful especially with the fountains & churches. there are alot of cafes (over priced) and street vendors. It is fun to sit and watch the people go by and watch the street performers. The four fivers fountain is very beautiful and go in side the church it is very nice
lovely place to sit with a glass of wine!. Lovely relaxing Piazza, we sat with a glass of wine or two! The only thing that spoit it was being pestered by people selling all sorts of tacky gifts!
Nice - but a tourist trap. A lovely square - but full of 'tourist art' and the usual sellers of tourist trash goods. Lovely buildings and fountains.

Not the place to go for street art!. The square itself is lovely but the atmosphere is somewhat ruined by the street sellers with their 'art' which on closer inspection is mass produced pictures which are all identical - most disappointing.

One of my favorite piazzas. We had been to Rome a few times before and had never stopped there. So glad we did this time. It is charming. Beautiful fountain and the artisans were there with their wares. Lot's of places to eat or just people watch.

Go at dusk. This is the most beautiful of the Roman piazzas. Have a tartuffo at Tre Scalini or wait and have a glass of wine at one of the cafe's at sunset...or both. Huge flocks of birds make amazing patterns in the sky at dusk. I also enjoyed the church of St Agnese and fun shops to browse.

Bella Bella Bella. The most beautiful of squares, the fountains, the buildings, the skies at dusk, and don't forget the ice creams, although they are EXPENSIVE. Never go to Rome without visiting Piazza Navona.
Beautiful public space crowded by beggars and tourists. Look -- you're going to enjoy this place, so go and don't worry about the 60,000 fellow humans cramming the square with you. Just relax.
Very impresive. Very impressive and very much alive, I have seen in at day light and night when it was not as crowded and have enjoyed more in the view.

Many Piazzas. we spent 4 days in Rome so it was natural to make an effort to visit as many sights as we could possibly see in 4 days.the first thing you will notice as you move around from sight to sight is that there are several Piazzas every few blocks and they all start to look the same after a while. one thing that we liked is that there are many beautiful fountains that identify most Piazzas, pIazza Navona is nice to see but like I said earlier once you have seen one Piazza you have seen them all.be prepared to do a lot of walking everywhere you go. Ladies, do not, I said DO NOT bring high heel shoes to go sight seeing or you may break a leg on the cobble stone streets.
Rome Icon. Again another must see and stroll around if you have the time when in Rome. The sun was out it was a beautiful day to be there.

Loved this place. One of our favorite places. Yes, lots of people, stores, restaurants, but the atmosphere in this plaza was so much what you'd expect to see in Italy. We lingered over a plate of pesto pasta and just took in the sights and sounds.
Touristy but fun. Lots of artists selling their wares and the occasional musicians. It is nice to see all the restoration work complete so that all of the fountains are visible and functioning.
Beautiful Square. Visited at lunchtime, on a whistle stop tour would of been a perfect place to sit , eat pasta and people watch. When I next return I will definitely be spending more time here.

Beautiful, very large piazza. This is a very large square and has several extremely beautiful fountains. It is also filled with artisans of various sorts; painters, mimes, people selling trinkets. It has many restaurants throughout and they looked like they had nice menus but we walked a few streets off and found a good restaurant for much better prices. We had a fabulous gelato a block west of the Pantheon also. A nice place to rest, have a snack and enjoy th day.

Very Italian. Walking down the main roads in Rome it is sometimes easy to forget you're in Italy. You need to get into the back roads to find the little streets leading to places like this. This is a great square - I love the big fountain in the centre. Lots of eateries and artists.

Best Place in Italy to People Watch. The PIazza Novona features the fabulous fountains by Bernini, but is still the best place to people watch in Rome. Lined on all sides by cafes, grab an outdoor table, order lunch or just a coffee and enjoy.

Great place to watch world go by!. We went there on a sunday and was looking for the continental experience of chilling out with coffees and doing a good bit of people watching! Perfect! Beautiful fountains.. More bernini.. Flanked by another stunning basicalla. Lots of street sellers. Everything to eat and drink is that bit more money.. But location is priceless im afraid!
Navona Entertainment. Very busy with tourists but worth while visiting. Street entertainers were quite comical, fountain just magnificent and local artists very talented.

Beautiful Piazza. I found Piazza Navona to be beautiful and everything I thought an Italian would look like. It is busy, but the surrounding architecture is lovely. Great people watching! Hearing the Church bells ring is breathtaking!! Some cute shops around the Piazza as well.
Beautiful!. Picturesque scenery! I could sit there for hours and watch all of the different acts and the beautiful fountains.

Would give this attraction excellent if.... there weren't so many darn peddlers constantly pushing umbrellas, rain jackets. dollar store toys, knock-off purses, etc. Otherwise, this is a must - see. Just be ready to say "no", or get your best "get lost" look on! Piazza Navona is in a great location, centrally situated, with shops, restaurants, and street artists abounding (note: most of the street artists are not selling original works of art - most are reprints - but we did find two who were selling original paintings - the price is the usually the clue!). The gem in this square is the statue created by Bernini and it's interesting history.
Unexpected delight. The fountains etc are amazing. It's a great (but little pricey) place to just have a drink and people watch. Loved it.
Family of four. Fantastic square with the Four Rivers Fountain, Sta Magdalena´s Church and the Moro´s fountain. The conservation is impresive

Not too impressed. I loved the piazza, church and fountains but hated all the artists and picture sellers. Would have loved to see the piazza without all the touristy stuff. There is a nice restaurant just beyond the piazza called Cul de Sac and we had a lovely meal here, more reasonable than on the piazza.

Just ok. This could be a beautiful place but there are too many people trying to get you to buy things and too many vendors set up that spoils the scenery. Restaurants were nice but they approach you to get you to come to their place and this is annoying.

brilliant atmosphere. This Piazza was a real find. The buzz here was excellent. Lots of artists selling their wares and drawing scenes and people, Many surrounding bars and restaurants. A lovely place to sit and watch the world go by - great atmosphere.
too busy!. a lovely square, but very very busy which spoils it - which means you can actually see the square! There are nice ice cream shops round the edge!

Bad Food quailty. expensive microwave food. You could smell the pavement sewer while eating. Take pictures here, and then dine at Trastevere area. better food, better prices and there you see Italians dining

My favorite place in Rome.. A must to visit! One of the nicest and most romantic zones of Rome, and probably of the world. Would just not eat on the piazza, there are much better and cheaper restaurants a couple of streats behind.

Great for Sunday People Watching. We missed the excitement of the Piazza Navona on a busy weekend night so we decided to visit on a lazy Sunday morning. Really liked seeing more locals on their way to and from church. Some of the best people watching we had in Rome!

Elegant piazza built on bread and circuses!. If you are hoping to pay a quiet visit to this gorgeously elegant piazza you should arrive with the sun! There is a permanent carnival going on here at all times of the day and well into the night! There is a constant throng of vendors, portrait artists and picture snapping tourists who tend to crowd around the main attraction! The piazza itself is home to Bernini's fountain of Four Rivers which was commissioned by Pope Innocent X in 1645 and payed for with a much despised tax on ...bread! Innocent also hired Boromini, Bernini's great rival, to redo S.Agnese in Agone, a beautiful church well worth a visit, right next to the fountain! Interestingly, although the much martyred Agnes suffered agonies aplenty, the name does not refer to her martyrdom but rather to the athletes' games (agone) of the ancient Circus Agonalis built by Domitian, which the piazza is built on. The obelisk that rises out of Bernini's fountain infact once stood beside Domitian's temple of Isis! You can still see remnants of the ancient circus around the outside the North end of the Piazza. Great place for an evening passeggiata!
Sit and Soak up the Culture. This is where your perfect moment can happen!Order a bottle of wine and just sit and watch the world whirl around you.

My favorite Piazza. Loved this Piazza,it was beautiful it is like what I imagined Rome looking like. We bought art to bring home from Navona and it was very reasonably priced. We dined outside and enjoyed people watching.

My favourite plaza in Europe!. Something about this plaza is just so captivating and memorable.Maybe it's the long rectangular shape, closed in by taller buildings which gives it great depth. Maybe it's the 3 monuments, including one unique obelisk in the centre, placed in front of a large cathedral. Maybe it's the numerous artists selling their work, or entertainers playing statue.Whatever it is, you should simply go and see for yourself.

Passeggiata. A wonderful place for an evening stroll (passeggiata) like a true Italian. The fountains, the lights,the sculptures, the open air cafes, the artists offer an exhilarating experience. Who needs television when you can see life, history, art for real here?
People watch. A great place to experience the splendor of Europe and all the different types of people walking by!

You cannot pass through Rome without a stroll here.. It is a little-alright very- touristy area. Still, the fountains and buildings are sublime. Dont pretend your not a tourist. Sit down, have a Bellini at one of the cafes and enjoy watching the Piazza filled with artists and performers. In the wintertime, there is a Christmas Fair in the center. The history of Piazza Navona is fascinating.

Great for a sunny afternoon. A great Piazza to chill in and watch the world go by. But beware the prices are not cheap and you pay for the setting not the food quality. Still, it is a place to sit with a glass of wine and relax

One of the must-to-see sites. This Piazza is full of life, most of them not Italians ...
Nice place for a 15-30 minutes visit, some rest after walking in the streets. Bring your camera with you ...

Meh. Went after dark, expecting the experience to be similiar to St Marks Square. Not the case. Many many " pretend starving artists" selling cheap reproductions and many third world vendors aggressively selling cheap trinkets.StatuRy and fountains were poorly light. Disappointing. Perhaps it would have been nicer in the daytime.
A must. A square to be visited for the history behind it. The fountain is unbelievable beauty and the atmosphere either

Beautiful. Another amazing treasure to behold in glorious Rome.
Word cannot describe ancient Rome. It is powerful, proud and respectful.

Not What I Remembered. I had visited Piazza Navona about ten years ago and loved it. This time, however, was a bit different. The young men walking around, trying to sell us flowers or some wierd flying lights or other things were relentless. They approached us every few feet and were very aggressive. We saw them all over Rome, so by the time we visited the Piazza Navona, I was just sick and tired of them. Other than that, the Piazza is a should see when you go to Rome.

My favourite Piazza. Many good cafes/restaurants but can be expensive. Usually many artists diplaying their paintings. Location of Berninis' famous fountain of the foue rivers. Great home made ice cream on sale in one parlor
Location to people watch. Also has some nice fountains. There are restaurants all around the piazza. Grab a pizza and chill for sometime amidst a more relaxed piazza in a chaotic city

Liveliest & Happiest Roman Piazza. The piazza is beautiful, cheerful and hustling and bustling with tourists, artists and street performers. We loved it so much that we returned here everyday on our 4 day Rome visit. There was a happy buzz and artistic fizz about this place. The fountains are very beautiful and elaborate. The square is great place to take an evening stroll, do people watching or buy Italian paintings.Location is pretty much central and close Trevi Fountain & Campo Di Fiori.Do try the Gelatria GROM which is at the end of the piazza and IMO is the best one in Rome (perhaps Italy).

Stunning Piazza!. Piazza Navona is not to be missed! Studded with grand fountains and lined with several palazzos and a church, there is much to admire. The Four Rivers Fountain is absolutely breathtaking! Street artists proudly display their watercolors and sketches in front of the upscale cafes and restaurants. A great venue for people watching!

Great place to watch people. Well worth a visit with lots to see and do. Good selection of restaurants and lots of history. Good picture taking opportunity and somehing you should see when visiting Rome. Avoid Sundays when the Piazza is packed
Sit and watch. Have a coffee and watch the world go by. Great fountains. from here it is an easy walk to the Pantheon.
Favourite Piazza. We loved Piazza Navona and kept going back here for ice cream, cappuccino and to people watch! Bernini's fountain is just beautiful and the Piazza has a lovely ambiance to it.

Must see. . This and Piazza del Popolo are the two finest places in the city to quietly sit and people watch. It's a pity the cafes here are so dear but I guess that's why! Still it's on my must see list for any visit.

Not just another Piazza. A buzzing, exciting, colourful place. I had the good frtune of visiting when the sun was shining and everyone was out enjoying it. The whole place was full of artists selling their ware. Wha a colourful and exciting place.

A nice spot to linger. Walking around this piazza is a calming experience even though you are surrounded by hundreds of Romans and tourists. The central fountain is beautiful and very impressive. Street artists are everywhere and the mood is light and gentle.

Seriously overpriced. In the last few years this place has become ridiculously expensive, to the point that there is no longer any joy in sitting there watching the world go by. Another example of the greed we found everywhere this visit.
A must place to visit. Very impressive piazza with many decent restaurants. Nice place to walk around and maybe stop for lunch.

The best of Rome. Piazza Navona is one of the larger squares in Rome. It is located fairly centrally in the city and creates a great postcard image of Rome. I enjoy having a cappuccino while watching the artists work their crafts and the children play - wonderful! The restaurants here are fair/average. You must go elsewhere to find great Italian dining. I like these restaurants for lunch or a brief respite in the middle of your busy touring schedule.

Tourist trap. Pretty but heaving. I have to say I was not totally sure what all the fuss was about. The kids liked the idea that the Piazza used to be a Roman circuit, but now it's mostly over priced restaurants

Lovely Piazza. Definitely take a look at the piazza but you might choose not to eat there. We had a meal in one of the many restaurants. it was very expensive and not great food, although the atmosphere was good.

A beautiful, and popular, piazza. One of the most well-known and popular public squares, Piazza Navona is a long oval shape, because it formerly was the site of Domitian's stadium, where races were held. This is a must-see for the visitor to Rome. In the center is the magnificent Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini, with its Egyptian obelisk. On the ends are the smaller Fountain of the Moor and Fountain of Neptune. Important buildings here include the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone by Borromini and the Pamphili palace, designed by Girolamo Rainaldi; many other important sights are within a few blocks. This is a beautiful Baroque piazza, and it seems like everyone -- Roman or visitor -- ends up here in the evening. Artists and street performers ply their trade; during December the piazza is a Christmas market. While there are many restaurants here (with, admittedly, great views), my suggestion is go a few blocks off the piazza for more affordable dining.

Fun, fun, fun, did I say pricey?. Great piazza for people watching, sitting at a table and sipping wine, smoking a cigar and eating pasta. As is well known the food/drink on the piazzas is very expensive but worth it imho--once you have paid to come all the way to Rome you should enjoy it at it's best!
Excellent shopping for souveniers.. Some of the greatest souveniers I purchased in Italy were paintings from local artists in the Piazza Navona. Beautiful and historic piazza.

Beautiful and light. It is a beautiful light square. Visit the square twice: once early in the morning before all the other tourist arrive and once in the afternoon when they sell paintings, some are really nice.
Nice location for a Gelato. It's a nice location with fountains and couple restaurants, for sure the best location to have a break from the city walk visit and having ice cream.

still beautiful but tourist mecca. Bernini, Borromini, Sant' Agnese - yes, it's all here and nothing can detract from the beautiful proportions - except for the tourist crowds, the cheap "art" market and the hustling restaurants and cafes surrounding the piazza. Best seen at night when everyone else has gone to bed, or very early in the morning after Ama (Rome's cleaning service) have made it all pristine again.

The people and the place work well together. There is so much to see in this always crowded Piazza and it only take a few seconds to understand why the people are there. The Piazza is beautiful and instantly reflects the glory that was Rome. The fountains are the first thing that draws your attention and you can spend a long time disecting the magnificent sculpture that makes it seem too good to be true. It is also a wonderful place to watch people. Some artists display their work while other actually paint while you watch. There are street vendors and performers everywhere you look and an atmosphere of party time. Dozens of restaurants surround the Piazza and the side streets. Although touristy and a little expensive the food is always satisfying. Sit and have drink and take it all in. It's worth every minute.

Look for the legend. Magnificent place with 3 fountains, full of mistery. in the centre stands Bernini's Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi. Legends say, that he didin't like the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone, which was built by concurrent Borromini. 4 sculptures represent the 4 big rivers ( Nile, Danube, Ganges, Rio Plata. Head of Nile is covered by a sheet not to see Sant'Agnese representing the depriciation of Bernini, while Plata holds his hands up, as he scared that the church will collapse. Of course, itis not true, as Sant Agnese was built after the fountain. :)
Amazing Fountain in the middle!!. We love Piazza Navona. The three fouintains contain so much beauty!! They hold your gaze for a long time. had a Tatufo @ Tre Scattini which was amazing!!
Beautiful square. Great people watching opportunity. Some great architecture and the fountain is well worth going to see.

Beautiful Piazza. This is the location of the Fountain of the Four Rivers and one of the obelisks made recognizable by the movie, Angels and Demons. The square was the site of the Stadium of Domitian, and housed chariot races in ancient Rome. Don't eat in the square, too touristy and expensive, but goes see it!

Nice statues and building architecture. When you wonder here make sure you have had a good meal and bring your own water. Unless you want to people watch the restaurants has very creative and inventive ways of squeezing money out of visitors. Howeveer if you have prepared well then you can spend your time enjoying the beautiful building structures around the fountains with great sculptures and themes created by famous artists like Bernini.

great for people watching!. We sat at a small cafe (the waitor was a bit gruff but ended up being rather sweet and chatted with us for a few moments) for about an hour after our segway tour and just sipped vino and enjoyed the bustle of people and cars. Fantastic spot for people watching!

Great!. Wonderful history and amazing fountains. Make sure you go see the ruins of the former piazza. Also, there are great restaurants/ cafes in the area if you'd like to have lunch with a view of the fountains.

Still the best. This is THE Place to feel the vibe of Rome. There is really no better place for people watching. There is always something going on -- vendors, art merchants, etc. The restaurants that ring the Piazza are more expensive than other parts of Rome but have a simple lunch there, i. e. pizza, pasta with a drink and watch Rome!

A Must See!. One of the more popular piazzas with a wonderfully charming atmosphere. This was our 1st time in Rome. Yes, it was busy, mostly tourists but the fountains and sculptures were exquisite and it was nice just to watch the street entertainers and check out the artwork. Restaurants seemed pricey so we chose to eat elsewhere. One of the best stores to purchase Limoncello is located close to this piazza.

Beautiful place, but disappointing market. This is a beautiful place and it's always enjoyable to spend a little time by the fountain, but when we visited all the stalls, it was people selling prints of Rome, there was no music played and no other types of sellers. Had hoped for a bustling, diverse market.

Beautiful Roman Square. The Piazza Navona is beautiful and the fountains are amazing - particularly the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (the Fountain of the Four Rivers). There are some very nice restaurants, especially Tre Scalini. Don't miss their Tartufo, a wonderful chocolate dessert!

Pretty Square. Pretty fountains especially the Bernini and lovely buildings on the square. We walked through on a Saturday when it was filled with "artists" and vendors selling their artwork. Nothing but cheesy copies and prints, don't waste your time walking through the stands. Look for the street artists.

the foe of the 4 rivers is amazsing. the fontaine is amazing, the coffe shops and restaurants around are tourist traps, you can find better in the little streets around. but the place has a special atmosphere, do not miss the church!! it is a wonderful piece of art!! bewear of pickpokets it is crowded on the sq.

amusing fountains. It's a place full of life and art. Everytime you pass by or sit for a drink you may enjoy beautiful buildings and the water fountains which create the casual and delightful atmosphere of the place. You can complain it's really busy here, but I think that's the charm of the place brings everybody here.

Don't miss this unique piazza.. We loved the spacious piazza with its fountains surrounded by some of the finest Roman baroque buildings. The artists working in the piazza give the place a lovely atmosphere.
A pleasant area. Nice Piazza to walk around looking at the art/artists and a coffee and ice cream. No traffic either.

Lovely piazza - the real feeling of la dolce vita!. A wonderful piazza to enjoy a drink, a meal or just a lovely stroll. If you find the restaurants on the piazza too "touristy", we really enjoyed the Grotte del Teatro di Pompeo just off nearby Campo di Fiori (via del Biscione, 73, I think) - it felt more authentic.

The Best Piazza in Rome. This piazza offers something for everyone. It has wonderful fountains. My favorite is The Four Rivers. Try to name them. There are outdoor cafes on all sides. You can sit outside in the nice weather. There are also street vendors selling their goods, artists selling their pictures and street musicians playing for your enjoyment and hoping you'll throw them a few euros. Around Christmas there are holiday stalls. Around the outside of the piazza is a church and a lovely hotel.
Don´t go to a restaurant here. Nice to see, just don´t eat or drink there, the prices are twice higher than anywhere else. And the church in the middle is really beautifully decorated.
Busy with Tourists but a fun place. Great place for people watching. The fountains are gorgeous. Plenty of shops and restaurants to make for an enjoyable couple of hours

Beautiful but overpriced. another exquisite Piazza like many that appear apparantly from nowhere when coming up the back alleyways of Rome. The Piazza with its beautiful fountains and architecture is well worth a visit but the stalls are invariably full of touristy junk and the restaurants and bars terriblly over priced. Drop back through the side streets to find much better value and ambience

Wonderful place for a stroll in the evening. Piazza Navona at night time is the perfect place for a wander. While adoring the fountains and sculptures, the buzz of people milling about watching the street artists, caricaturists, and those just sitting in a bar or at a restaurant, you can't help but be sucked into this classical gem.Don't miss it.

sunny italy. the piazza is magical. You can sit at the any of the many cafes and enjoy a meal and watch the tourists go by. The biggest drawback of visiting Italy is that there are more tourists than natives.Do not visit Italy in July/August it is hot, blistering hot, and crowded with tourist mostly Chinese and Japanese and they chatter so much you cannot hear yourself think

A stunning Piazza if a little touristy. One of our favourite Piazza's and always busy. The Piazza is a great place to go for a drink in the evenings but I'd avoid the overpriced restaurants and head for a back lane close byThe Piazza is full of artists and buskers and always entertaining.Well worth a visit

Beautiful piazza. This piazza with all the water fountains is very pretty and definately worth the visit. Tip - read a guide before hand about the buildings and the fountains - it is much more interesting when you know the meaning and the story...

Busy! Busy! Busy!. Most tourists to Rome get to visit Piazza Navona. It is la lot of fun and bursts with energy. You can admire the buildings, art on sale, numerous pavement "statues" etc.The Piazza has many restaurants in, and in the streets surrounding it.The area is a nice place to visit and relax and "people watch". We found that if you like to eat early, many restaurants had "dinner offers" which were excellent. Just walk the restaurant strip and check them out. But be quick, because after 7pm or so the "specials" often disappeared to be replaced by the "normal menu" with higher prices reflecting the popularity of the area and that locals are late eaters. The Piazza is great to visit, but put it lower in your priority order if in Rome for a day or two.
A charming place. A charming and lively place to spend an hour at lunch in one of the several eateries surrounding the Piazza.
Amazing. The electric atmoshpere of the Piazza will leave you dazzled! The fountains, cafes and shops are so spectecular, they will take your breath away!

Meeting at the Plazza Navona. While in Rome we had booked a walking tour at night on the first evening there. The small tour gathered in the Piazza Navona. We arrived there early and sat in front of the Fountain of the Four Rivers. Each statue represented a river. Designed by Bernini who worked with nine Popes, they were so life-like and detailed. Our guide pointed out that The Piazza Navona was designed for charriot races. In 2012 it is a meeting point and a great place to people watch.
Tourist trap. A must see! Even though there are tons of tourists and shops, it's a sight you must see. Everyone has to go there once.

Fun place at night. Great place to order a pizza, some cheese, bread and vino and watch people! Lots of people at all times of the night and day. Great central area to find an apartment for your stay in Rome.
A nice site for dinning!. I had a nice dinner in Piazza Navona but i was a little scare of the thief's that were lurking around...
Touristic but nice. It is fun to people watch here, aside from admiring the fountain. There are numerous restaurants, pizza parlors and ice cream shops around.
Lovely Piazza. This is a great place to go in Rome. Spacious, with lovely fountains. Artists abound. Nice little shops. Not crowded, as you will find Trevi Fountain.

Glowing in late afternoon autumn sunshine. The weather could not have been more perfect: an azure blue sky, just fading light and the buildings almost glowing in the sunshine. At one end of the piazza a couple in evening dress were giving an elegant performance of ballroom dancing - so romantic - while at the other was an elderly gent miming to classic Italian ballads being played through his amplifier. He had a touching innocence, seemingly oblivious to the scattering of the fake bag sellers who took to their heels when a police car pulled into the square. And between the two is a fascinating array of artists selling work of surprising quality and very cheaply. It couldn't get much better but then you can add to the mix the sublime Bernini 4 rivers fountain where you can seek out the 'armadillo', an animal the stonemasons had only heard about and had certainly never seen a picture of one. It shows! There was also an amusing group of human staues slumped against a shop wall but when a coin was put into their collecting tin they burst into animated, coordinated life. Most amusing. We stopped for afternoon tea at Tre Scalini. Maybe we were swayed by the glory of the fternoon, but I don't think I've had a better cup of tea in all of Italy.

A must visit in Rome. Of course the Four Rivers fountain is the big attraction and puts this on the "must" list, Expect huge crowds, folks hawking knock-off purses, "pashmina" shawls, street entertainers and vendors of all sorts.
Elegant square with art stalls and restaurants. once a Roman race track, now this square has great restaurants, beautiful fountains and plenty of artists stalls to wander round of an evening.

Just hang out. A great place to spend a few hours after strolling to just sit, eat, have a cappuccino, people watch and meet fellow travelers from literally around the world. Totally European. Godere di tutti!

No end of places to eat.. We ate here 3 times and each time at a different restaurant. The weather was lovely and warm the last week of September and we were able to eat outside each time. Every restaurant has large outdoor patios. Artists abound, a very large fountain is located in the centre of the piazza and musicians are usually playing - a lovely ambiance!

A great area to soak it all in !. After walking to Pantheon and Trevi Fountain nearby we sat in the square and just watched the people in the area. It was evening and many street vendors were there but enjoyed watching everyone. Many restaurants and gelato shops. Yum! We had dinner and of course tartufo was our dessert. A beautiful, cool evening, just perfect for people watching.

fabulous. a trio of stunning fountains are the centerpiece of this ancient site, the middle one being the most ornate also holds the column, there are virtually no remains of the old stadium which is a shame but it doesnt take away its magnificense, truly stunning

Piazza Navona. Highly recommend heading to this lovely square in the heart of Rome, I'll admit we did have to wander around a few backstreets to find it but definitely worth the extra effort. Local artists filled the square, amazing central fountains were great to look at & there seemed to be an abundance of places to eat but we did not try anywhere out ourselves so no info there. It was pretty busy, so not sure how young families would find the experience but we managed fine. Overall, just beautiful architecture to admire. Just beautiful.

Viva Roma!. I made several visits to the pedestrian-only Plaza Navona during my week in Rome. Located in the historic center of the city, this place is like a cross between Washington Square Park (NYC) and the Main Market Square in Krakow. Artists, street performers, innumerable restaurants, and hundreds of tourists jockey for position here with Bernini’s Four Rivers Fountain, a (fake) Roman-era obelisk, and Pamphilj Palace functioning as backdrops. Families, solo-travelers, couples, tour groups will find things of interest… if you want a “slice of life” of the touristy side of Rome and enjoy people watching then make sure to swing by here, there is something for everyone.
Nice. A beautiful place to sit and absorb Roman tourist culture; the buildings surrounding it and the fountains are really nice.

Beautiful statues and small crowds. I'm not sure if the piazza is always like this or we timed it right but the crowds were very small and we were able to get many photos of the fountains and statues without a lot of heads in the shot.

It big and busy.. Wonderful fountains and history. Take the time to read the story boards found around the plaza. Pick up a guide book and learn what it was first used for and how it has been transformed. The fountains are works of art but served a practical use. If you have the time sit at a cafe, have a glass of wine and people watch. Busy with tours and croweded with people. We were told it is a good place to buy art if you are interested in buying because the vendors are liscensed and are really artists. Beware of pick pockets but enjoy the plaza.
fountains light and air. three large fountains grace this wonderful piazza - a wonderful place to have lunch watching the water and the crowds
Beautiful but Inauthentic. A sight worth seeing but not breathtaking, and I prefer the sites that are not strictly for tourists. This probably was such a site long, long ago.
brilliant. Much better than the Trevi. 3x fountains, amazing buildings and quiet. a really nice piazza and a must see.

Great place but too many people. We enjoyed looking at the wonderful craftsmanship of Romans through Piazza Navona. Our visit is short at Piazza Navona. We took time to relax & do what the local do that is people watching & enjoy the day. Not much to see but can hang out to relax after long walk.
One of My Favorite Things in Rome. I loved Piazza Navona. It's a beautiful piazza with outstanding people watching. It was one of the highlights of Rome for me.

one of my favourite Piazzas. we visited here as a one off but the piazza left such an impression on me I had to come back. Three beautiful fountains, lovely restaurants, little stalls and people trying to sell their wares.
Wide open spaces and great for people watching. There are lots of people to watch here and the fountain is very photographic as are the street chaaracters.
Nice piazza. No traffic and some great architecture around the piazza, the fountains cannot be missed. Plenty of art and artists around to add to the colour.

great place. great place to rest and watch the world go by,
geared up for the tourist but enjoyable.
lots of bars/cafes, and things going on in the square.

Gorgeous Sculptures!. While I agree with many others who have noted the amount of people trying to sell you junk can be distracting and annoying, the Bernini sculpture makes this a must see! We went on a Monday in October so the crowds were not an issue but I just can imagine what this place would look like in high season.ps - the junk salespeople are also an issue in Venice, Athens and many other places we visited on our trip!

Expect anything. On two separate occasions had groups singing in piazza who were just there as tourists. It was magical. The artist really make the piazza and some of them are quite good. Just a great people watching spot.

Large open Piazza. Nice open piazza that's large enough to be away from traffic. There's three large fountains, the central one having one of the obelisks. There are street performers and vendors selling all sorts of stuff.

piazza Navona. one to see. This piazza Navona is a constant hive of activity. It is one of the main places for street artists to congregate and showcase their wares. The centre of the square is full of artists showing pen and ink sketches, oil on canvas, caricature etc. A wide range of appeal too so if you hope to take some artwork home at the end of your stay in Rome there is a good chance you will find something to your taste here.There are the inevitable tat sellers in the evenings but ignore them and in the main they will ignore you.The square also houses some fine resturants where you can sit, eat, drink and watch the constant activity. Two excellent sculpted fountains also adorn the piazza.Fine architecture, a buzz of life and living long into the night, make piazza Navona one of the places on your must see list.

Magic. I only had 3 days in rome so i didn't get to spend much time in piazza navona.
i sat there for 3 hours and it was magnificent ! It felt like i could spend a whole week just sitting and admiring the italian spirit and magic everywhere around me!
Deserves to be #1 attraction in rome !

Super ice-cream !!!. I'ts one of the the most joyful places in Rome. The atmosfere is alive, you can hear a sound of water everywhere. Don't miss the opportunity to eat a BIG BIG ice-cream portion in Piazza Navona sitting on the steps near fountains.
Lots of artists. some art is very good some very average. Neat fountains lots of restaurants around the sides of the plaza
Go in the morning. A truly magnificent piazza, best savored very early in the morning before it fills with tourists and the annoying people who prey on the tourists.
nice. I love piazza Navona..not only because of the majestic fountain in the middle but the great buildings surrounding the place

wanted to go back!. Gorgeous. Novona was built on top of the Circus Agonalis, the arena where St. Agnes was martyred, so we were diappointed that St. Agnes of Agonalis had closed by the time we arrived. Fontona del Quatro Fiumi and Neptume Fountain are amazing. Chose a nice cafe -- but be prepared for VERY aggressive maitre di pushing their restaurants. Confeninet to the Pantheon and Santa Maria Dopra Minerva.

Lively!. Charming fountains, street performers playing music, dressed in costumes, local artists selling their wares, restaurants... Piazza Navona is just full of life. Have a snack of gelato or roasted chestnuts, a glass of wine at one of the many cafes, people watch or enjoy a street performance. This place is hopping, especially in the evening.
Beautifull Piazza for a Dinner. Charming plaza, 3 fountains, paintings, surrounded by restaurants all arround.Beautifull place for a late evening dinner.

Visit st. Agnes next to big fountain. This plaza is large with fountains, cafes and local artists showing their work. You will also see a large church with little signage associated to it. Seek the entrance!Of all the churches visited, I don't think many could top the beauty of this one. Only an offering is suggested for entry, but you will see that it is worth much more than asked. The dome interior is amazing, and the detail throughout like none you've seen.Photos are not permitted but not enforced, however at such a place I think it is best to adhere by the rules out of respect.It was amazing to me that this church was not mentioned as a key spot to visit in piazza navona, it was the most amazing.Note: do not let the street statues take your photo, they will demand money for the service. Any acknowledgment, including taking a photo of them will result in a plea for money.
What a surprise. You're just walking along thinking you know the neighborhood when this beauty comes at you. At night it's full of people, a vibrant experience to treasure.

Beautiful piazza. This gotta be the most beautiful piazza in Rome, although haven't seen too may just yet. It's very touristy with the three fountains in the middle and street restaurants on the side. However, a must-see for most visitors and Angels & Demons movie fans.
Amazing place. There are 3 fountain at this place. You have to return to this place at night too. The coffee at this place not so good as written.

Fountains and Markets. A wonderful area with restaurants and out door market stalls selling every thing from paintings to collectables. The fountains in the Piazza are very special and a great back drop for any one with a camera! The Piazza gets very busy later in the day, so if you want quality pictures go early, you will not regret it.
Wonderful Piazza!. Just like in the movies, fountains and artists in the center, surrounded by wonderful cafes and restaurants!!!

September 11th 2012. Having a week in Rome, never been and no idea where to start! BUT we got lucky as our hotel is Novona palace, right behind NAVONA Piazza!, step off the piazza and into Via del a pace,, it's like a little village on its own!, no wonder they filmed EAT PRAY LOVE HERE! IT MAGNIFICO!!!!, sit have a Prosseco or a wine AND WATCH!! It's sheer entertainment. And all the actors are locals or the people passing by!........if I were a poet I'd write about this, a painter I'd paint it, a songwriter I'd write The greatest song ever, and Michael Buble would sing it!!!...., BUt I'm not! I'm just a wife, mother, sister , friend and a Nannie !, BUT I know what I like and I love this area in rome,,,,,, go see it before you die!!!!!!!!! There s something there for EVERYONE! ! MUST SAY THANK YOU to TRIPADVISOR!!!! I used this site for EVERYTHING we wanted to see etc and ALL the tips were SO HELPFULL!!! dont leave home without TRIPADVISOR, it saved us money, time and made our trip so much better!, go see Rome and check TRIPADVISOR before and during your Trip!

Not to be missed!. This is my favourite spot in Rome. Yes, the restaurants and cafes know how to charge but buy one drink and you can sit and people watch for hours. The fountains are beautiful, the surrounding buildings very attractive and the street life very entertaining. The central space is full of picture sellers - be prepared to barter if you are interested in buying!Don't miss going into the chuch of Sant'Agnese in Agone - the ceiling certainly has the WOW factor.

Nice fountains, expensive restaurants. We walked quite a long way to get to this square and were quite underwhelmed when we got there. There were some attractive fountains and some pretty restaurants.

Awesome Piazza - Beautiful Fountains. Piazza Navona is a great place for dessert, cappuccino, people watching - and experiencing the beautiful artistic fountains - especially the Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini. A great vibe!
AAA. I was very happy with this tour co, specially with our tour guide Luca, if I come again I will contact this co, and I hope I will be able to get same tour guide.

My favorite place in Rome!. I love the atmosphere of Piazza Navona.We ate at Tre Scalini and people watched.The food was good and it was great to watch the artists painting their scenes of Rome.It is just a fun place to experience.
Must see. You dont want to miss it when u in Rome, nice place to relax and also there is many artist painting on the street.

beautiful statues. this is a pretty cool place to see, mostly because of the fountains. the fountains are beautiful and just amazing to look at the detail of them. this is a large open area with very little shade. and lots of vendors. if your in the area or just want to see an amazing fountain its worth walking through

Nice for an evening stroll. Well-lit and teeming with activity, Piazza Navona is great for a late-night stroll to work off the gelato! It is filled with artists displaying beautiful tableaux of well-known Roman landmarks, as well as the occasional caricaturist or two. The Fontana di Quattro Fiumi(4 rivers) is gorgeously lit, and makes an excellent backdrop for people-watching. Just keep an eye out for souvenir vendors with glowing helicopter-thingys, or bouquets of roses. Steer clear of these guys and you'll enjoy a relaxing stroll.

Crazy fun!. This piazza was crazy fun. We visited it several times while in Rome for a week. The first night we visited, it was PACKED with people. The other 2 times, not as much, but still plenty, We ate, drank, had gelato, visited artists, met people, and just enjoyed the ambience of the piazza. A defintite "must visit" in Rome.
Nice place to visit. Piazza Navonna is nice during the day, lots of artists, vendors and restaurants with outdoor seating. We found it nicer at night all lit up. Its still in a great part of town.

Nice piazza to stop & spend some time. It's a beautiful piazza to stop & relax. There are some vendors & street performers in the piazza. We were there during the day & enjoyed our time there. We did not eat or shop in the area.

best piazza to visit. best piazza to visit as its much more authentic, cheaper food but much better quality and far less tourists, venture off into the cobbled streets toward the Tiberi River and you will find lovely little shops and restaurants, there was a little cobbler who sells handmade sandals.. Romes fab but you have got to walk the streets and discover the alleys and pathways

3 Lovely sculptures/fountains. The centerpiece of this square is the middle sculpture/fountain by Bernini. It's worth a visit just to see it despite it being a bit crowded and touristy.The other 2 sculptures/fountains are nice too, but not as well maintained as the center one.You can spend 20 minutes here and be done.

glorious at sun set. loved arriving late late afternoon, really surprised at just how beautiful it was, sat for a while, took lots of photos, evening (low) sun washed all the monuments and buildings in a beautiful light.

Christmas markets are wonderful. The markets are a true experience during December. The weather is cool but very comfortable and the sights in the market are gret. The culture of Christmas in Rome is truly alive and well here. The sight of the "Buffino"the Whitchurch who comes at Christmas to good children is interesting and the miniature statues which are bought to enhance the Nativity scene are really something different to Australian culture
Best "square" in Rome. Night or day this "rectangle" is a great attraction. Maybe even more at night with the lighted fountain, creative artists and wonderful surrounding restaurants.
Delicious spaghetti Bodensee. Great place for people watching and enjoying a nice meal. Siting on the piazza was a wonderful Roma experience.

Such a nice place to visit. We stayed 10 days in Rome and crossed Piazza Navona about 5 or 6 times. In the evening it 's the best moment to take a look at the artists, in the afternoon it 's nice to spend time at the fontains .... Don't try the restaurants at Piazza Navona They are more expensive than at Strastevere.
pretty area, sit & have a gelato. restaurants are overpriced within the piazza so explore the outer area for lunch/dinner, watch for the cover/service charges

Soak it all In. large Piazza with two fountains of art, with great restaurants and always some art work being displayed, lots of people and simply a great atmosphere to enjoy an espresso or a gelato or a fine meal in a fabulous setting

A little bit of Heaven in Rome. Piazza Navona is beautiful. It was mine and my son's favorite place in Rome. Grab a gelato or sit at one of the excellent restaurants that surround the piazza and drink in every moment you can spend there.
A must see / be. Just love sitting in Piazza Navona watching both other tourists and life as it progresses, fantastic fountain and many great restaurants
Great place. Great place to visit- good restuarants and an outstanding toy store. The fountains are beautiful and it is close to the Da Vinci display and other museums.
beautiful square. A beautiful square to wander around and one of the most beautiful squares in the world. A must see in Rome. More peaceful in the evenings.

Fun, Fun, Fun. We nevr miss a visit to this Piazza whenever we arrive in Rome. The fountains, the sculptures, cafes (food everywhere) .... not to mention the artists and venders. This just a beautiful fun expierence for every family member. Sit at any cafe (they all serve good food) and enjoy the "people watching' ... the noon chimes ring melodiously in the church, the artists paint the beautiful surrounding archetecture, or the musicians play for you. A must!!!!

Nice place to see fountains. With the three fountains here it is much less hectic than the Trevi. Nice places to eat or to just have a gelato. All the artists around are colorful but unoriginal but it gives it a flair. It is a very nice piazza just for a drink and to people watch.

Overrated. Very Expensive and the Views were not that great. Went back at Night hoping to see all lit up,But disappointed. No lights no atmosphere. Sat down at what seemed a reasonable priced Eatery. Looked at the Menu and Beer and Wine was Very overpriced. Get you in with the keen food prices and sting you on the Booze. Left and went to Pantheon were prices were much more reasonable. Alos atmosphere was much better.

Place to go for fab pizza and to watch the world go by. Loads of places for great pizza at 10 - 15 euros each. Artists in the middle. Great to watch the world go by over a glass or two of Italian wine.

Sunday artists and crowd watching. Fountains nice, but not spectacular, the better is on the South end. I can't really see why this is a landmark in itself, but it is pleasant enough to pass through. We came on a SUnday and the entire square was full of artists selling their (much repeated) wares .... but a very pleasant stroll or just have lunch, relax and watch the people!
Dennis Tang. So so, except for the fountain, too many dodgy xxdian waiting to pick your pocket.But a few good cafes around,
Pleasant Surprise. WE stumbled upon this Piazza while on the way to what we hope was the Colosseum. Nice open area surrounded by numerous outdoor eateries. Great atmosphere.
Touristic but still nice and friendly. Sit down, buy a gelato or a beer and enjoy the view and atmosphere. Dinner is likely better and cheaper a few blocks away.

Loved it!. Piazza Navona was full of life! Artists showing their art everywhere. Restaurants, pizzerias, gelaterias all around the piazza. Also the Brasilian embassy was located there which I found very impressive.

street artists and performers. The Piazza is architectually beautiful, and there are lots of painters selling their works and street performers to entertain you. But worth the crowds and touristy stuff? Personally I prefer the quieter side streets nearby, where there are tons of tiny art galleries and little family-run restaurants.

Beautiful Fountains in a big Piazza. This is a beautiful Baroque piazza. There are three foutains all of which have been altered over the years most famously by Bernini. It has a lovely feel to it, street vendors sell paintings, wooden toys and tourist gifts. The fountains are all impressive and are flanked by beautiful buildings.
