Street cafes line the piazza as well as a selection of shops. Not the impact of the Trevi Fountain but far nicer location and environment.

Any Rome Visit Must include Piazza Navona. Wonderful people watching, there are artists in the square - all sorts - and it is fun to walk by and watch them work. There are fantastic restaurants there, and at night, music to entertain you while you eat spaghetti or pizza. The church in Piazza Navona is also worth checking out.

great sightseeing. Wonderfull yet expensive place to sit and enjoy a glass of wine and people watch.The 3 fountains are a must see and the tartufo is a treat.Full of artists and performers,and alive with people at night.Christmas time brings all kinds of booths and food stations ,a great place to check out and handy to pantheone.

fantastic. Piazza Navona was our favourite place to sit and watch the world go by, always something going on, there lovely fountains and lovely little places to sit and drink coffe, also a nice place to have breakfast, I would say some of the best resturants are around this area, not in the square but to the left and above, wander around and you will find lovely paces to eat and drink.

Not too far from where we stayed.. A short walk from the hotel brought us here great place, wonderfull ice cream shop on the corner. A few Angles & Deamons myths put to rest, the fountain is only knee deep, but so lovely, the whole area is beautiful. See it at night
Beautiful fountain. It's beautiful, but really crowded in the evenings. It was hard to get a photo without much people being in your photos though... Just go there to enjoy the atmosphere around.

Plaza Navona. Don't miss visiting Plaza Navona. The fountains are extraordinary and be sure to pick up some of the art work that is sold in the plaza. Nice souveniers. There is also a museum with a gift shop and a cafe.

Picturesque. It's worth reading about the history of the fountains and the sculptures they contain before you visit this place, which is close to other attractions. It's a picturesque and large piazza that's nice to just hang out in. Please note that Rome has apparently just passed a stupid law making it illegal to eat ice cream and snacks in some areas of the centre of Rome, and hopefully this rule will disappear soon!
Beautiful!. Just round the corner from our hotel. It's huge and beautiful and impressive. A must see! Get a gelato from just off the main piazza and Enjoy the view!
atmospheric. Good place to see artists cafes and ice cream in among the fountains and atmosphere of the piazza. Plenty of choice for food/snacks. Early morning visit can be less crowded
Piazza Navona. as you stand in the piazza, looking around at fountains and huge stone statues, you imagine the years and man hours it took to erect all of this

Beautiful Square - Must go!. One of Rome's nicest squares - a must see! However, eat in the side streets as the restaurants are completely overpriced here. Eat at Mimi de Coco and have ice cream at La Gelateria Frigidarium. Coolest bar: Fluid.
Lovely light. We visited late afternoon and early evening and the natural light was great for pictures! The fountains are lovely fringed with restaurants and littered with artists and paintings.
Big. Nice area to visit and get a feel of the grandeur of Rome. Beautiful monuments and lovely architecture. Worth the visit.
Amazing. Enjoyed the fountain, roman column and just the vibrancy of the Piazza. Enjoyed seeing all the artists and their work

full of life. one of the most magnificent squares in rome shows you all the Italian liveliness. always crowded with people, dogs, kids running around the magnificent fountains, shows you all elements of life.

Beautiful Piazza. Visited only at night and it was spectacular. People milling about, having dinner or drinks on the square. Fountains are beautiful including the Fountain of the Four Rivers - note the one representing the Nile is blindfolded as at the time Bernini created it the source of the Nile was unknown.

Tourist trap. We came here just because we had finished everything else on our list and just wanted to check it out since it was in the guide book. The square was cute and nice fountains, but the entire surrounding area was incredibly expensive for food and snacks. Nice to check out if there's nothing else to do, but not a priority in my opinion.

A gathering point in Rome. Very busy area, nice fountains around, including the The Fountain of the Books, quite remarkable. Lots of activity, groups come and go with their Local Tour guides with their "umbrellas".Vendors offer souvenirs of all kinds. I liked the area.
A must.. Again, a large Piazza to visit and see the three fountains. this is the site of many films including Angels and Demons.

A must see!. If you've never been to Rome, the exquisite Piazza Navona is a must on your itinerary. It is a lovely spot to find a quiet spot to enjoy a glass of prosecco on a hot afternoon and watch the world - sidewalk artists, musicians - delightful!

nice fountains. i was initially coming to see the fountain of the four rivers, to my surprise i found 3 fountains in the square!! all of them beautiful!! a good place to have a short break and grab a bite or an ice cream!
My favorite plaza in Rome. There is so much activity in Plaza Navona, during the day, full of artists and performers. At night, surrounded by good restaurants and interesting things to see and do.

Piazza Navona. I was pleasantly surprised about this place. It is like an elongated courtyard surrounded by buildings - the dominant one being the Brazilian Embassy. There are three fountains - the central one being spectacular with 4 'men' representing the 4 main rivers - Nile, Danube, Ganges and the Amazon. There were loads of artist stalls when we visited - I assume they are there every day, and plenty of cafe bars.

A great place to sit down and enjoy your stay. Even though it was a bit (too..) crowded – the walk around the Piazza on a warm evening in July was one of the best time I had during the trip.The painters, sound of kids laughing and great atmosphere.During summertime : in the daytime it was extremely hot and I recommend waiting for post 17:30 to travel the city and enjoying it.
shopping!. great shopping for old prints and vintage clothes. i would love to return soon. i just wish i had bought more cheese and food products.

Charming and active Piazza. While walking around the city followed signs to Piazza Navona. It was a lovely stop on our walking tour and enjoyed a tasty lunch at one of the little cafes along the fountain. Enjoyed a woman playing the accordian which brought back fond memories of when my dad used to play.

A unique and beautiful piazza with amazing chapel also. Despite the pouring rain this was our first tourist stop in Rome and we also visited the chapel opposite the monument- worth a trip, including into the sacristy this chapel was very elaborately decorated as we were to soon find in many chapels in Rome. Beautiful fountains here at piazza Navona and the shape of this piazza is apparently due to it onece being a race track.

Cool square to wander around in. Cool square to wander around in. Although we didn't eat here, it looked like a lovely place to eat. We did stop for a rest and all the artists were amazing, I wish I had bought some artwork.

like covent garden. Piazza Navona is the place to be in the evening, lots of little restaurants, "bancharelle" to shop, performers and lots of people around. Reminded us of convent garden, had the same buzzing feel

A beautiful open space!. My visit to the Eternal City would not have been complete without going to Piazza Navona! This is a square where tourists and locals come to enjoy its beautiful vast open space, either by just strolling around, dining, drinking or buying souvenirs or a local art work or just watching people. I went here twice, first during the day and second, in the evening, for dinner with a couple of my friends. The beautiful Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini, in the middle of the piazza was like a oasis in the hot August’s sun. Yes, summer in Italy is extremely hot, thank goodness Rome has so many fountains so if you asked me, Rome should also be called a “fountaineous” City. Surrounding the Piazza are restaurants and other watering holes, we dined alfresco at one of them (I forgot the name of the resto), we ate our favorite pasta, sipped the local wine and enjoyed the great encompassing view of the Piazza. I can understand the romantic aura of this place, but even without my significant other, I had a wonderful and lovely time! After dinner, I had such a delight going from stall to stall looking for good bargains, I bought a couple of water color paintings depicting the City of Rome, which I took home with me to New York as souvenirs.

Upscale with a beautiful setting. Want a better experience? Visit this pleasant setting near the beautiful and must see Pantheon. Artist community and magnificent fountains. Great cafe's and shops. You see more interesting things in the shops too. Really enjoyed this square the most.

Piazza Navona. Large open square with an amazing fountain representing four rivers. Loaded with bars restaurants and artists. We passed a very happy afternoon in the restaurant of Rome's best ice cream maker!

Romantic Nighttime Stroll. I love the theatrical element of this piazza. It's quite large and has several fountains which you can appreciate close up or from a distance. It is always full of people, tourists gawking and snapping photos and locals meeting for lunch. At night the fountains really come to life and the piazza is full of activity with puppeteers, musicians and other entertainers. There is romance and excitement in the air...

Nice to wander around in the evening. Rome is a city off so many sights and this is one area which is nice to visit at the end of the day. Unusually spacious for Rome so sit outside one of the bars early in the evening (Happy hour at some1) and people watch.

Must see this!. upon entering you are overwhelmed with everything going on there, all of the artists who love to show you there work with out being pushy and all of the small cafes, you could spend half a day there and never know it

Tourist Trap. Beautiful square and a must walk through, but if you can do it early morning or late afternoon on a weekday I'd suggest it. Don't be fooled by the restaurants in the Piazza, they are very over priced and not good.

Wow. This was wonderful, the Bernini fountains are to die for [in my opinion] the square bustled with lots of people, nice shops and plenty of bars etc.Downside, number of people, but we are in Rome !
As always.. You can understand and see that it was used for horse races. Nice statues, try the gelateria at the end close to the Pantheon.

battle ships practiced here. we liked this plaza so much we went back twice There are some great places to eat on the side streets so don't feel obligated to eat at one right on the plaza. There are many artists on the plaza selling their art I bought 3 water colors for 25 euros If you need a child's gift to take back home there is a toy store with a great selection of stuffed animals. Don't miss this stop

Fountains as good as the Famous Trevi Fountain. We liked the artist setting up their pitch & the ice cream or gelato's very reasonable at around 2 euros. The fountains could rival the Trevi fountain & there were lots of benches around to sit & take in the views

Wish I arrived earlier. We arrived at the Piazza Navona on an early Saturday evening. It was full of artists displaying their work. I would have liked to see the art better in daylight, but the atmosphere in the Piazza was wonderful-the fountain and lights and the tall buildings looming over us.

Beautiful. We were attracted to the Piazza by the music we heard flowing down the streets, it turned out to be a full orchestra playing much to out delight. There are also a good number of street performers vying for your attentions while the paitings and artists lining the streets pull your hands to your wallet. The restaurants are really pricey but if you walk a little you can find a better deal.

Wow factor. I visited here to experience the wow factor, unfortunately it wasn't there for me on this occasion.I was paritularly interested in the fountains, however it was irritating being harassed constantly by peddlars, beggars and tour guides distracting you all the time.

Enjoyable....watch out for fake artists..... We first wandered into this large and impressive Piazza after visiting the Pantheonand watching the doors close. It is a really nice place for an evening stroll. Onour visit, it was alive with people, but not overly crowded. We appreciated thescale of the place. While the Trevi Fountain (Fontana di Trevi) made us feel almostclaustrophobic, this very open long square gave us the opposite feeling and it wasactually quite relaxing to wander along the periphery and people watch. Therestaurants and cafes were open and busy; the odd retail shop was open as well. Thethree fountains are impressive sculptural works of art, and the centre of the squarewas filled with artists, mainly painters (or, more accurately, sellers ofpaintings). If you want to get your 20 Euro painting of a Roman touristattraction, this is the place, but beware of the alleged "fakes". From our eyes,it appeared that there were at least a few artists selling their own original works. These people pointed out their certification and website for their art. There arealso the guys selling cheap plastic toys and fake purses ubiquitous throughout Rome. Overall, worth a visit or two.

Nothing impressive. I heard from everybody that I should not eat in the restaurants located in the square, so unless you want to buy gifts in the standing bazaar, you are better of going somewhere else.

Lots of good places to eat here. Piazza Navona is like a really typically Italian Square which has lots of restaurants surrounding it. There are also a lot of artists selling their paintings during the day. Nice place!

Piazza Navona. The restaurant we ate at, Tre Scalini was nice for the view of the Piazza and people watching, food was expensive and not necessarily amazing giving other restaurants on some of the smaller streets.

Lots of history, but avoid the restaurants. This is the remnants of a hippodrome, and with half closed eyes one can just about imagine it. There is an impressive 18th Century fountain and the church behind it has some wonderful paintings. The food places around make the most of their location and offer rather overpriced and underwhelming standard food- much of which comes out of the deep freeze ( in Rome, it s compulsory to indicate this on the menu ) There are remains of the stadium building at the top narrow end which can be seen below street level through railings.

No trip to Rome is complete without a visit. Piazza Navona is not so much an attraction as a "scene". The piazza itself is attractive, but it's the people who congregate there who make it special, from the artists and hawkers, to families, to bewildered tourists, to everyday Romans out for a stroll. Good place to sit and watch people. Best on a sunny day.

One of our favourite places in Rome. This is one of our favourite places in Rome; we have been here twice before on day trips while on cruises, this time we decided to fly to Rome for a few days. I was a bit apprehensive that it would not be as I remembered but as soon as we walked into the piazza I felt at home. It’s a wonderful place to sit and watch the world go by while having a cappuccino or gelato and the sound of water from the 3 fountains in the background; it’s just as lovely at in the evening. We also bought some beautiful paintings from a couple of the artists that were in the piazza. If you are in Rome for a day or a week this is a ‘must visit’ place.
My favorite place for people watching. Always spend some time here when in Rome. It's fun, the fountains are beautiful and have the best gelato anywhere!
A delightful Piazza. Great Italian Piazza with lots of room to roam. Vendors, musicians, artists and restaurants make this a delightful spot to visit.
It has a real buzz. Nothing better than strolling around in the sun watching people, perhaps a bit if shopping, something to eat and soaking up the atmosphere, very entertaining

Busy busy. Busy with locals and tourists alike. Statues, fountains, people selling prints, paintings, tourist knick knacks, restaurants, gelato outlets, it's what a visit to Rome is part of. Immersing one's self into the atmosphere.
Stunning. Visited during our walking fountain tour in June 2011. The day was gorgeous and we stopped to have gelato and walk the Piazza.

A highlight of Rome. People may go to see other places, but the Piazza Navona is not only a place of beauty with wonderful fountains, it is a place were everyday people have come to meet, talk, eat and walk. The artists working and selling add to the experience.
Pretty!. Nice to see what Napoleon called "God's waiting room"--beautiful fountain, plaza and artists selling their wares.
Not special enough for me. Yes, a good square and impressive size but, unless I'm missing something, saw nothing that would make me want to return.
Great place to people watch, shop local artists, etc.. We ate a couple of the Piazza restaurants. We enjoyed watching the vendors perform music, magic, etc.
Italian atmosphere at its best!. Brilliant place to visit! Very picturesque...with lots of restaurants, cafes, bars, shops & artists at work. Beautiful fountain as the centrepiece of this Piazza

Lovely. Yet another beautiful Roman Piazza,full of fountains,churches,gorgeous buildings and street cafes.The local artists peddle their wares in the piazza and tourists flock to sit in the sun and breathe.A must for any trip to Rome.

Fun place to explore. A nice wide open square in the middle of Rome. Explore the side streets for extra sites, but be careful not to get ripped off on food. Some are OK, some are traps! Great fountain.
very very beautiful!. So impressive the main fountain and the street near navona square.. i just want to be back there loved rome and italy in general
beautiful. This was the first fountain we saw in Rome. It is so wonderful to see fountains actually working. Really nice.

A great place to laze away a little time. Beautiful traffic free square with wonderful fountains, buildings and exquisite little back streets with great little bars and restaurants - a must for local art lovers.
Our favorite Roman hangout. This is the best place in all of Rome to relax, have a drink or a snack, and watch to people passing by.

Oh! to be Italian and enjoy this piazza on a daily basis.. More fountains, more people but who cares when you can sit and ponder Rome in bygone days the marvel at the beauty and artistic skill that created this bautiful Piazza.

Huge piazza with tremendous energy. The Navona is one of the largest piazzas in Rome. There are several lovely fountains in the piazza. The building encircling it are full of shops and open air restaurants. It is a great visit .
Love this square!!!. So many interesting artists, shops and people. One of our favorite places to walk! Close to Campo de Fiori, which is a great outdoor market that opens in the morning.

One of the nice place of Rome. Yes, I loved this place, fully with drawers with their pictures, designs, really wonderful, and after that the fontanes with wonderful sculptures.There we have a really good lunch
Beautiful!. We visited the Piazza Navona during our first night in Roma. It's just beautiful with a gorgeous fountain, lots of local restaurants face the piazza. A must see!

The best and the worst. See this remarkable public area in the middle of the day and you will wonder what all the fuss is about. Catch it early in the morning before the hordes arrive and you will understand why it is so highly regarded.

Favorite Square in Rome. This piazza is touristy, but one of my favorites in Rome. An old Roman racetrack, it is a long oval now filled with sidewalk cafes in warmer months. The center contains beautiful fountains by Bernini. Great place to have a snack/drink and people watch.

Beautiful Square. Lovely fountains and statues away from the bustle of the Spainish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. Some lovely artworks for sale and a great place to have lunch well watching all that goes on in Rome.

Rome's most beautiful Piazza. Just as I remembered from 30 years ago. Great fountains, art vendors, people watching, cafes and Ice cream! Best part, no cars. At night it is just as beautiful with the fountains lighted. A must see.
Atmospheric. Good open and light piazza, not over crowded. Sculptures fantastic, not pestered by hawkers! Nice scale to the place.
Beautiful!. This little area is absolutly wonderful! Packed with artists selling the most beautiful artwork! Plenty of resturants to chose from! A must see for anyone visiting Rome!

Best piazza in Rome! Don't miss it!!!. Although I have visited Rome previously, this was my first time in Piazza Navona. I really regret not having time for it during my first trip. It was fantastic! We were there at dusk, so we were able to see it both in the light and after the lights came on. Both were gorgeous. We enjoyed walking around and checking out the art of many artists who were there selling their work. Many of the paintings were quite reasonable. We bought a couple simple pieces for around 20 Euro, but they had more refined pieces if you wanted to spend more.My parents had a cariacature done for only 20 Euro too. I thought that was very reasonable, and they enjoyed having it done.This piazza is very close to the Pantheon, so it's easy to walk from there. I will make a point to return to this piazza whenever I visit Rome.

My favourite place in Rome. I have always loved Piazza Navona. it's peculiar and cozy. Great in summer but wonderful in winter. Gotta go there when, around christmas time, it's full of stands selling Christmas decorations and other gifts ideas. In the center of the square you'll find an old merry go round. a bit pricey but cool. Watch the Italian movie "Ieri, oggi e domani" and you'll wish you had a house overlooking Piazza Navona. I love this place so much that my husband asked me to marry him there.

Great People watching. Ok for the last few years there has been this girl playing the accordian in the plaza....search her out and listen to her as she is very talented. You never know what you will see here. The drink prices are a rippoff.
Great if you like art. This piazza had a lot of artists selling art- so its great for that. There were some nice fountains and buildings, but overall I'd say it is overrated.
Go inside the church!. Go inside the church, it's free and be amazed by the beautiful things inside. Very very beautiful inside!!!!

Beautiful Day or Night. We first visited this piazza at night. There were many artists and a few "junk sellers". The artists had car batteries to provide power for lighting, providing a nice glow across the piazza. The "junk sellers" had light novelties to sell and that was neat to see also. When we visited in the daytime, everything was there, but the piazza wasn't as charming as it was at night. We had returned during the day because we learned of a special chocolate gelato sold there. The gelato was well worth the return trip. It is sold for 5 Euros at Tre Scalini Tartufo which is just north of the cathedral. The cathedral is beautiful inside.

beautiful in the evening!. the place is filled with a romantic ambience for those who walk there in the evening. the square is filled with paintings, buskers, restaurants with a view of the square. Be sure to be there!
An Italian art lovers fantasy come true. Breathtakingly beautiful architecture and fountains, complemented by the ability to purchase original works of art by local artists at great prices.

Beautiful place at night. Piazza Navona is just beautiful at night, especially the magical lighting of the fountains and buildings. The artists and their work are wonderful. Great if you like watching the vibrant passing world. Cafes and restaurants etc too expensive, but your really paying for the views. Street peddlers very annoying and harassing us and kids to buy rubbish light up gadgets, but not as bad as some other places we visited.

Postcards and artists. Busy busy busy. But not crowded. Seems to be a load of postcard sellers and artists selling their wares. A fantastic atmosphere. A great big building in the centre of one side dominates the long oval of the piazza. Excuse my ignorance of it's name and function but another of Rome's impressive pieces of architecture. A statue adorned fountain in the centre and another at one end are quite nice too. There is possibly a third but we didn't get to that end and the stalls and people obscured the view.Not a must see but is well worth a detour if in the area.

VERY GOOD SQUARE. Very nice square with a lot of restaurants surrounding the square. Very special also for the many painters selling their art directly in square with excellent paintings. Take the opportunity to buy some paintings because you will not regret it.

Watch the world go by. Loved this square for its architecture, fountains and art marketLots of bars at which to soak in the sun and people watch (why do people strike such funny poses when having their photos taken these days?)Cautionary note, we thought the restaurants were very touristy and we found better on the quieter back streets
Just lovely. We sat in a cafe enjoying a Prosecco or 2 here - watching the world go by - read the history - it's a beautiful spot to people watch

The history of this piazza is worth investigating. This piazza is a lovely surprise to stumble upon, It is a large, long rectangle, with a large 4 rivers fountain in the middle. The story behind the piazza is very interesting, and it comes across as light and airy. Being so big the large tour groups don't irritate as much as usual, as they cannot clog it up.

Piazza Navona. Always a great attraction. Disappointed that the fountains were not lit but the scene on a Saturday night should be a must for any visit to Rome. Be prepared for typical " Italian Minutes"in the restaurants and bring molto Euro.
Afun place to visit,especially at night.. Lots of artists and music.mixed with good restaurants and bars,we visited at night to take the atmosphere.
Worth a visit, just don't eat here!. Lovelly little area for wandering around, just don't get suckered in to eating at one of the restaurants as they are ridiculously expensive!
Big Piazza. Very big piazza with fountain, arts and a lot of restaurants. A nice place to sit and watch people passing by.

My favorite location in the world. Seriously, If you don't like it here, you won't like it anywhere. Peaceful because there is no traffic, no cars allowed. Stroll around and people watch at one of the many cafe's and restaurants. Go at 4pm to catch the sun starting to set, hitting the buildings and turning them gold....a must see there. Watch the kids making out on the benches. ("lovers square"). Enjoy the Bernini fountains. It's magical. I've been to Rome 3 times and this is the first and last stop with many in-between. Try to find Ave Caesars, a street off the P. Navona that sells Pope robes and Nun underwear. You won't find this anywhere else that I know of:-)
very busy. interesting, venue for local artists , lots of good restaurants. Good to sit and enjoy a pizza and a bottle of wine and people watch

Touristy but beautiful. It is extremely crowded and mainly just tourists. However, it really is a beautiful piazza with beautiful fountains. Still a good place to sit and people watch and have an extremely overpriced drink or gelato.
Very good but overpriced... We have eaten here and just stopped for a drink as well. It is overpriced and abuses its fantastic location. Go to campo de' fiori nearby instead.

Fantastic sight. sight of splendour and creativity. Got mesmerized with the artistic creativity of ancient Rome. A never too miss place to visit in Rome. Always crowded but the admiration of the beauty of the place is so fantastic.

wonderful street life for Rome. Artists displaying their work, stalls to buy from, cafe's to sit at to watch the world pass by, meander through the streets and allys to the Pantheon, beautiful fountains, lovely way to spend an evening and view life in a small part of Rome ....
Great Entertainment. Piazza Navona is my favorite piazza. While the restaurants are quite pricey, the local entertainment and talented vendors around in the evenings are not to be missed.

best surrounding to dine. i love Piazza Navona, the atmosphere, music being played while you're eating surrounded by art and history. the food is good but beleive me you dont even notice what you're eating you're too busy enjoying the piazza and it's magic
beautiful buildings. terrific size and great architecture but like a great many Italian cities you take your life in your hands crossing roads.

Wonderful little square... This is a wonderful square to visit. It contains beautiful fountains and is surrounded by lovely restaurants and museums. The air of life and vibrancy just bounces around the piazza and is popular with both tourists and italians. On a sunny day its easy to pass away few hours relaxing and enjoying the lovely atmosphere of the piazza

Definitely visit but don't eat here!. This is a must see. Beautiful with artists in the piazza, fountains, the church, street entertainment, etc. Just don't eat at one of the retaurants in the piazza...extremely expensive and not exceptional!
Good atmosphere. We had lunch during midday and the piazza was very hot, but still it was worth it. Food was good and service was good. Plenty of restaurants to choose from.

Great place to visit, pricey to eat there though. We had dinner in one of the restaurants here, and it was quite expensive. We had our dessert in another restaurant here, it came quite highly recommended in a guide book, but we were a bit disappointed with it. As a location, great to visit, but you could find somewhere else a bit cheaper to eat.

Beauty in Stone. The sculptures are truly inspiring as is the square as a whole. Very pretty. Lots of places for a snack or drink. Have a good look at the carving from close up. The work is exquisite.

Amazing plaza. This plaza is really beautiful. We stopped at Piazza Navona on our way back from the Vatican City for a drink. There are a lot of paintings, ceramic and art souvenir to buy plus a lot of restaurants. The shape of the buildings, the fountains and the shape of the plaza are fascinating

Beautiful!. Beautiful fountain and piazza. I felt like I was thrown back in time to the Renaissance, almost. Make sure to allow time to sit at an outdoor cafe. This piazza is the place to soak up Roman ambiance.
Art, food and entertainment. The square has it all and lovely fountains and buildings as a perfect backdrop. The restaurants all have outdoor seating areas and there is a real buzz about the area.

Great part of Rome to hang out. Loved the Piazza Navona. Beautiful Baroque style fountains and famous for its Angels and Demons scene with Tom Hanks rescuing the Cardinal. Beautiful lighting on the fountain at night and managed to grab a seat at the Ai Tre Tartufi restaurant right next to Bernini's masterpiece. Angelo was our host for the night and fantastic owner of the restaurant. He immediately set up two glasses of Champagne on the hour and his quart of wine which we ordered with the meal was so reasonably priced. But you have got to try his Tartufi which is a sort of truffle with ice creams of three different choices and a banana split which all in all makes it a massive dessert even for the most hungry mouth. He was a really nice guy and his waiters were very attentive and polite throughout the evening and an old guy sat playing classical tenor songs on the piazza which made it a magic atmosphere..we just happened to arrive the evening Silvio Berlusconi was meeting with all the Italian Government cabinet and he it was weird to discover the next morning that he was to resign. Lots of Military and police around the parliament building which was interesting and historical moment to be there. So good a restaurant we went there again the following evening to eats, so take my advice, don't miss out on visiting the Piazza Navona and Angelo's place when next in Rome. He loves the movie 'Barry Linden' so if you meet him ask him about it and he will engage you in conversation for ages!!

indifference. I dont know, maybe my time here was what it was like in ancient times. Maybe it was some kind of special event going on. Maybe I was just expecting more, but all the vendors in and around the Piazza made for a disappointing experience.

Overcrowded and inauthentic. Having visited here about 15 years ago we arranged to meet family for a meal. We were very disappointed in that it seems to have turned into a venue for stag and hen parties and lost its charm entirely. It may be better in winter.

Great place to visit, but don't eat here. Fun place to walk around and see the various artists performing their crafts, but beware of the "hawkers" trying to get you into their restaurants.....I actually had to send back spaghetti and meatballs for lack of meatballs, and mushy pasta. The Piazza itself is a MUST SEE!

Massive Piazza with Massive Fountain. The Fountain of the Four Rivers is featured in the center of the Piazza and everyone flocks there for photos. However, it's surrounded by vendors, artisans, outdoors cafe's and restaurants and other impressive architecture.

My favorite piazza in Rome. This piazza is very nice and I recommend visiting it. It is surrounded by cafes (although they are overpriced) and shops, and people selling artwork in the middle. It is close to other attractions like the Pantheon.

great feeling at night, at day see the little church. we spent several evenings last summer and were glad to return this year. We even succombed(sp?) to a touristy restaurant on the Piazza last summer;expensiv ebut good and fun to be on the PiazzaIf you are there during the day, take a few minutes to visit the little church on the Piazza, in front of Bernini fountain.(forgot the name).
Divine. Always something to see - performers or artists, always something going on! A great place to stop and rest your tired feet and people watch!

Very enjoyable.. This is a great Piazza which is fill of artists and their work (although some seem mass produces and are probably bought in). However it is very enjoyable. Be carefull if you want to stop at one of the restaurants as we had been warned that a lot of them serve frozen food and not fresh food. Well worth a visit though.
People wathcer's Paradise. We spent a good hour just sitting in the shade, soaking up Rome's atmosphere here. Lots of fountains to drink from and cool off.
beautiful though overrated.. atmoshpere nice, with many tourists milling around, and local sellers and street artists all around. beware of pickpockets!

Great hanging out place, but with dodgy folks hanging around. Great atmosphere for just hanging around and spending some relaxing time taking in the local Roman life. Lots of street vendors and artist selling their works or trying to draw your portrait. Several good places to have local food or just hang back and enjoy the wine and background music(ians).
Admirable fountain of the four biggest rivers !. Great ice cream parlors around it :Do not miss to have a tartufo! Not as crowded as other Piazzas, nice to stroll and people watch.
a picture-postcard scene. When you picture a typical European piazza surrounded by restaurants and beautiful statues and artists displaying their work, come here. It's got it all!

An amazing space. We tripped over this incredible piazza walking aimlessly and were quite impressed with its size and beauty. Lovely cafes and restaurants line one side, looking over at the statues and architecture.

To see and be seen. The old Roman chariot race track - always full of life from wealthy dining to students wineing, sitting on the Bernini fountain of the Four Rivers - watch for the figure with his arm up to protect himself - he is facing a building designed by Bernini's competitor Borromini as if in fear of the edifice collapsing on top of him! You can find bric a brac markets here occasionaly too.
Fantastic atmosphere. The whole square is pedestrianised and large accommodating a wide selection of restaurants. Great vibe and ideal for people watching.

Great, but expensive, place to stop for refreshments. Enjoyed sitting having an ice cream in the square and people watching, but the prices were pretty astronomical (our ice creams were 11 euros each!).

Dinner at Piazza Navona. Definitely a place to visit - especially at night. We walked around and found a side street that led us to a lovely outdoor cafe. Can't recall the name but, definitely a better deal (with lots of charm) than eating at one of the cafe's in the square.

Nice in September. We sat in the square for several hours having drinks, people watching and being entertained.Ive been here before out of season but it was much better sitting outside in the sunshine.Drinks same price as anywhere and you could sit there as long as you were having a drink unlike some restaurants who don't le you taking an outside table jut for drinks,

I love this place. There is something different about Pizza Navona that makes you fall in love with the place although it may not have the same historical heritage other location have.great atmosphere and delicious food

Fun for an outdoor meal and people watching. This is a very large piazza where things are always happening. Tons of artists selling their goods. Surrounded by over priced food options. Still, you can sit and have a drink and soak up the sights.
Must see. spectacular and all free. A must see - follow the trail, the earlier the better - Piazza Navona - Pantheon - Trevi Fountain

Vibrant and bustling piazza.. A very popular, busy and historically significant square in Rome. A bit of a maize to get to, but worth the effort. The baroque fountain of the four rivers attracts tourists and the colourful artists do clever sketches for so little. A good people watching spot too! Put this on your list of" to see!"

The coziest square in Rome. This famous piazza is the one you will want to visit for your dinner, be it alone or with friends and family. Alive with artists, painters, singers and whatnot the atmosphere here is nothing short of magical. For a small amount of money you may enjoy an excellent dinner here under the stars.
Bellini at his best. A fantastic space both light and airy with excellent cafes and ristorrantes.Beautiful buildings and delightful little streets off to theside

one of the greatest squares. Breathtaking, yet livable. You walk between works of art and you have families with kids around you. You can sit for an Italian Gelato or go to one of the restaurants for good food. Or you can chat with the many artists who sell their stuff or work on it. There are few places like Piazza Navona.

People watching. If you want a chilled out place to have a beer and soak up the atmosphere than this is it.Ocassionally buskers that are brilliant and just adds to the ambience.A bit pricey but well worth it
One of the Must See Roman sites. Forget the Trevii FOuntain. Forget the Spanish steps. If you want a beautiful plazza and no crowds, make a stop here. You can thank me later

The glories of the past cheapened and vulgarised. Perhaps the Italian Renaissance was never known for its good taste: I mean, that gaudy painting on the roof of the Sistine Chapel, with all that human flesh: impressive, of course, but tasteful? But then, who needs taste? A beige ceiling would have been much more tasteful, but would it have drawn those millions who come here to crick their necks and trample each other? Not likely.So the Piazza Navona may have been even in its day a bit over the top. But like most Italian piazze, what a glorious outdoor space for people watching and socialising. Except that nowadays the space is taken up by purveyors of ticky tack and kitsch, the latter generally of a quality to make Michelangelo weep. And the cafes surrounding the space are, of course, pretty much mass feeding and drinking places -- or so they seem. Perhaps you'll discover an authentic little Roman trattoria amidst the brashness and the crush of humanity; but I would head for the Trastevere if I wanted a good value meal.
Favourite spot. Great food and lots to see as there is so much happening all around you. Found ourselves returning on 3 occasions and went to the same place - restaurant with the pink table cloths.
Beautiful Piazza. Enjoyed all the Piazza had to offer - including shade from the August sun. Loved the fountains, shops & restaurants. Enjoyed viewing the local artist's paintings.

Beautiful and expensive. Lovely place to be in the evening, and to eat out - if you can afford it.... Stroll away a little bit, and prices become more affordable, particularly in the small ice-cream parlours around.

Art town. When you find this great plaza it opens up with beautiful fountains and a center piece of a very small but beautiful church. When we went the plaza was filled with painters selling their work. Much to look at and buy.

Beautiful piazza to have lunch/dinner in. Nice piazza full of restaurants, antique shops and artists selling their work in the middle. There's also a few street performers in the area too. Worth stopping by for lunch or dinner.
Lively in evenings.. Lots of artists selling paintings, lots of restraunts, safe at night time, close to Trevi fountain and Pantheon not far to walk.

Beautiful Piazza. My daughter and I toured this Piazza on a Monday, there were not as many people and you can really get close to the 2 fountains to admire the beautiful sculptures. It’s a must see if you are in Rome.

a night time visit. The night here is wonderful, artists musicans and entertainers, has changed over the years the artists now seem really only to be sellers of mass produced works.very expensive to eat or drink on piazza butsome nice bars in the side streets
the painter's gallery.. a beautiful piazza, with the coloum and the statues!, it had a painter's selling area, lots of stalls and tourist items.
Bernini fountains. We stopped by in the early evening and enjoyed viewing the fountains and all the people that were enjoying the Piazza. It's very lively.

piaza navona. Nice place where you can both day and night. There are a lot of painters, selling their pictures and also a lot of restaurants.
You should try it :)
An open air delight. So mch going on. Great fun and enjoyment here.Fountains and statues grace this open area where vendors offer their goods.

Go there!. Whats not to love about the Piazza Navona?! The fountains are wonderful the atmoshere is buzzing and there is fab places to eat for all budgets. Did some great people watching here and really got a sense of local life.

Go Sunday afternoon. There may be a concert on the go.. We just happened into the Piazza Navona on late Sunday afternoon...to hear the sounds of classical music being performed by a huge military band. I have no idea why the concert was going on at that particular time,but can tell you they were great. They did several recognizable opera tunes and finished up with a spirited version of 'Volare'. All that was missing was Dean Martin singing it!
Piazza Novona. We stayed just of the Piazza Novona and Walking around looking at the art never got old. It's a great place to get a meal and have a wander day or night.
Busy and beautiful. On our itinerary of places to see when in Rome. It was worth seeking it out, loved all the floral displays in the window boxes that adorned the surrounding buildings.

one of the most beautiful areas in Rome. Lovely square in a very nice area. There's so much to see and discover around here, lovely fountains, restaurants, stores, small cobble stone streets... La dolce vita!

True ambiance of an Italian love. Piazza Navona houses many artisans selling their paintings and artwork. Surrounded by Bernini's 3 Rivers Fountain, restaurants and open air cafes create a perfect spot for people watching. In the summer, operas and music fill the air, along with the aromas from the different spots. This piazza is filled with love, laughter, and happiness that creates many lasting memories.
Great Piazza. This is a wonderful piazza in Rome surrounded by restaurants, cafes and ice-cream stores. We had a great meal in Tre Scalini. At morning or at night is a great piazza to visit.
Where were the guns?. A very pretty square and fountain made memorable for me by an American tourist who renamed it Navaronne Square. I looked but couldn't see any large anti ship guns.

Expensive. The piazza is well worth a visit as the architecture is quite breathtaking. We didn't stay to dine as it was quite expensive here and there are many other hidden gems away from the tourist traps.

Best Piazza in Rome. This place has probably the nicest atmosphere of anywhere that we visited. The cafes around the outside seem good - try the Granita de Limone.
Well worth a visit when you're in the vicinity of the Pantheon.

So Much culture. Lovely to walk around and take in the sights and sounds of a beautiful area of this beautiful city. Dont be taken in by the restaurant staff, some of them will sweet talk you to get you into their restaurant, but we couldnt complain about the beauty of the Piazza though
My favorite spot in Rome. Simply the best spot in Rome. Always go straight here for an evening. Fun location with artists, restaurants, street vendors, performers. lively eveing scene.
Stroll on through. Amazing building but too touristy for my tastes. Stroll on through if you are in the area but don't make a special trip.

Without comparison. This is the best atraction in rome! Whether you like looking a the incredible works of art you can find in the fountains or just hanging around or eating a gelatto or having dinner, both experiences you can´t ever miss.One of the most beautifull places in the world.

Great views. The Piazza Navona is very pretty with much to see. Great people watching and a great place to take a small break. They usually have street vendors displaying all sorts of trinkets and keepsakes. It is a large open area in the middle of the city. There are many cute restaurants there, but beware. You will pay a small fortune to dine there and the food was average.
Tourist Mayhem - not real Rome. Worth a visit but would recommend getting lost in the small winding streets of Rome and getting to see real Rome. Don't pay more than 5 euro for a beer or you're mad.

Definitely worth a visit. Piazza Navona is a fantastic place to while away some hours..yes there are hawkers and all things touristy but it is crammed full of traditional italian cafes and whilst the prices may be a little on the high side if you hunt about you'll find the perfect little cafe to soak up the atmosphere of this amazing place. The architecture of the surrounding buildings is breathtaking and local artists try to recreate same everywhere you look. Its constantly buzzing with people and generally just a nice place to spend some time whilst in Rome.

Great for a stroll in the evening. We had a nice time strolling around the piazza in the evening, fully soaking the atmosphere. There are many sellers and artists in the piazza as well as restaurants and eateries. We sat down at one of the restaurant, but it was very ordinary food priced rather expensively. It was a great spot to people watch though.
pasta for lunch. Stopped off and ordered lasagne for lunch with some lovely chianti wine shared with two great fun couples I was with.
Great Place. Buzzing and lovely to see at night lots of restaurantReally nice tourist place hard to find nut when you dowell worth it
A room with a view.... From out appartement (Casa Navona) we have a splendid view on the Piazza. Locals and tourists passing by 24/7, great laid back place.

Fun place to see and shop. This piazza was close to our lodging and we had the opportunity to visit it at three different times of the day. Of course you should enjoy the wonderful art of the fountain. We also enjoyed the street entertainers and the local shops on the Piazza.
These piazzas are everywhere!. great centralized location for meeting tours and tour guides. exciting nightlife scene with restaurants and wine bars. Brazilian embassy on the square.
Large square full of tourists. Came here by accident, its worth a look but mostly full of people trying to sell you things (mostly cheap rubbish)!
Beautiful. Had a brilliant lunch at Quattro Fiumi overlooking the square. Water from the fountains sprayed gently cooling the day. Nothing to dislike here!
Fountains and statuary. This vast area is easy to find and spend some time viewing the buildings, fountains and statues in the piazza. People watching is good as well.
stunning. A gorgeous piazza among gorgeous piazzas. Lots of nice restaurants nearby. Try the streets parallel to the Piazza for better deals. Worth a visit to see the three stunning fountains.
Beautiful Fountains. Great place to take pictures and relax. I recommend travelers read about the significance of the Four Rivers Fountain to appreciate the meaning of the sculptures.

Beutiful location for a stroll at night.... The fountains, buildings, artist, musicians, and the atmosphere make it a wonderful place for to take a night time stroll through Rome. There are dozen of restaurants in the piazza, they are probably all over priced but you are paying for the views. Pick pockets might be a problem, but we say plenty of police patrolling the piazza. Street vendors are everywhere trying to push their wares on you. At night they sell lasers and glow in the dark toys that shoot into the air, providing for a night time light show in the piazza.

Lunch in Piazza Navona. Lots of places to eat in the Piazza, its advisable to walk past the different eateries and compare the prices, they can vary enormously. I think you must bear in mind this is a tourist hotspot

A great place to People Watch. Love just walking around, get a gelato near by and sit and watch Roman life pass by...the beautiful people fountians and buildings..A great place to be for the holiday when the Christmas Market is open

One of the best. We loved Piazza Navona. We ate here a few times and enjoyed every minute. There are lots of places to sit and eat and people watch. For some reason we also felt the most welcomed here. Of all the places we visited while in Rome, I think this would be the area we relaxed in the most and just enjoyed the surroundings

Beautiful. Rome has many beautiful fountains but the Piazza Navona is simply AMAZING. The details make it completely life like. There are many restaurants inthe area making the Piazza Navona the perfect backdrop.
Nice fountains. Worth a quick visit to see the fountains and the baroque houses - built on site of old roman stadium, hence oval shape. Buses go nearby.
Great eating place. It was mine and my husbands 5 year wedding anniversary and we went here to eat. Couldn't have picked a better place. So romantic

Angels & Demons!. A truly beatiful piazza where a main part of Angels and Demons with Tom Hanks was filmed, where he rescued the soon to by pope from the fountain of the Four Rivers. Great art stalls are set up during the sunshine if you want to take home some local art and the whole piazza is surrounded by restuarants and bars where you can sit and watch people go by or the street performers. However use TripAdviser on your SMART phone to roam a little further to find much better food and much better prices!

This square has everything!. The Piazza Navona has an amazing Bernini fountain, a couple churches and countless cafe's and restaurants! In a nearby square/piazza, the French Embassy is also a must see!

Fun stop for street artists, etc.. This Piazza was lively and full of vendors selling art, prints and one fellow who made necklaces out of wire while you watched. Fun to stroll through, and three fountains/sculptures. Just Beautiful.
This piazza is alive. a great place to people watch, browse various street vendors and artists and view Bernini fountains.

Very lively evening stroll. We strolled through the Piazza Navona on a Thursday evening. The piazza was alive with diners at the many outdoor tables, street musicians, painters showing their works, many admiring the fountain, and others just people watching like us.

Lively place.. Great place full of life throughout the day. If you want a caricature, portrait or want to pick up a nice painting then there are many great artists here. There are also many good street performers to entertain the day away.
Artists mecca. At night it comes alive with artists of all stripes plying their trade and selling their works. There are restaurants surrounding the Piazza that add to the ambience.

So close to the hotel. We ate here most nights as it was close to our hotel and we really enjoyed the atomsphere every night. There was so many choices in resturants. There was so many people in the area which was really nice to see. I would definatly recommend having dinner here at least once on your stay in Rome.

Gorgeous area to sit and watch the world go by. A fantastic place to take in a nice ice cream or beer and just watch the world go by. Full of little stalls with artist paintings and many various acts performing. A little disappointing during the night as the lights do not do the fountains any justice but still a great place

Loved the artwork on display!. Big Piazza - one of the best. Lots of things to see including artists with their paintings, sketches and watercolours, performers doing all sorts of things and musicians. The lighting of the many fountains made the evenings particularly enchanting. Ristorantes surrounded the outside of the piazza, with their waiters urging you to join them. We wandered inside the church on the piazza, and the inside was incredible, with a beautiful dome. Most of the buildings had abundant flower boxes or vines & creepers enveloping the walls. Very pretty site. Dont miss it.

Amazing square with a beautiful church. We walked from the pantheon to this piazza it just took around 10 mins over there was a huge number of artist sellingThere paintings and might i tell you there is some amazing paintings to buy after talking a look at the paitings you should really visit the st agnese right in the middle of the square the church is simply breathtaking. And p.s the square has 3 amazing fountains
This arena lifes every time.... The square is always crowded. Street artists, nice cafes and restaurants, Sant'Agnese in Agone, Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi very nice.
Expensive. Very nice and lively place, but expensive restaurants! Ice-creams for ten euro, crepes for 9 euro... Too much really!

Picturesque. Again, a must see Roman attraction with three beautiful fountains that we no doubt set as great backdrops to some picture posing. There are many street vendors in this area, as well as many many artists ready and willing (a little too willing) to let you sit for a portrait.
Lovely walk at night. Statues and fountains are beautiful and losts going on in the square. Great restaurants surround it. Not too expensive.
Worth a look. since this is such an easy walk from the Pantheon, you can't go wrong. look at the fountains by bernini and avoid the other touristy stuff in this area.

Exquisite place. A beautiful day in a great place. It is a magical place to be and enjoy what is then in front of you. So much to take in in such a small place. U can spend hours here any sights many restaurants well worth spending a few hours here
Love this Piazza!. Restaurants and Stores surround a beautiful plaza with remarkable statues and fountains created by Bernini. What more could you ask for?
Gorgeous. Loved the whole Italian feel. Fantastic tour guide round Rome on foot. Walked round all the cafes and shops. Loved the street vendors and street entertainers!

montmartre with water and ice-cream!. The 'Four Rivers Fountain' by Bernini (which was featured in Dan Brown's 'Angels and Demons') which forms the centrepiece of this elliptical square (the area originally formed the Stadium of Domitian) which is now the equivalent of Montmartre in Paris. It is crowded with artists of varying ability and rubber-necking tourists, and bordered by the usual ice-cream shops, restaurants and hotels. 'Tre Scallini' is famous as the creator of the famous 'tartuffo', an expensive and very indulgent ice-cream (all the geleterias sell 'tartuffo' but buy the original). Two further fountains grace this very busy square which appears lively and more 'Italian' at night although the fountains are regrettably not illuminated.
Comes alive at night . In the night/evening, this place really shines. Lots of people, artists, and restaurants. Beautiful fountains.

Schedule for the Piazza Navona. Open Sept. 22-23?. I take the plaza for what it is and the artists as well. Everyone should be careful with what you buy, but if you like it, buy it!
Does anyone know the schedule of dates the artists are in the plaza?

charming place. First we went around looked at the fountains, at the artists and paintings, at the architecture of the buildings. then we bought ourselves a big!! gelato (ice cream) found a sit and... absorbed the place ...and enjoyed!!!

Looks good at night, too many street dealers. The fountain in the middle of the square is magnificent. However, there is a huge lack of police presence to keep the illegal street vendors from harassing you. They will try to sell you a bunch of junk that you will never use and they need to be told no VERY sternly before they will leave you alone. Still, a beautiful site to see.

Beautiful square for chilling out.. What a lovely square, beautiful fountains, lots of artists and a very chilled out atmosphere. We visited here both during the day and also at night time.The fountains are lovely, it's a shame they did not light up at nigh time as it would be great for photo opportinities.It is such a busy place, lots of people watching and cafes from which to do so.Well woth a visit.

Amazing place. We'd spent a busy morning touring Rome and went to visit the Piazza. The buildings and the fountains are amazing. We enjoyed just strolling around looking at everything. Plenty of things to buy and then we sat down and enjoyed a bottle of wine at one of the many cafes and watched the world go by. There was lots of street entertainment taking place which was very good.

Lovely Piazza filled with Artists. We enjoyed our stroll through the Piazza Navona - which was filled with artists selling their renditions of various Roman attractions. Crowded in August with tourists (and a long line for Gelato at Grom), we didn't linger too long. The art was pedestrian, & the crowds detracted from the beauty of the Piazza.

Great Piazza. Probably the most famous Piazza in Italy and one of the most romantic ones.Be sure to pay this Piazza a visit in the before the dark so you can see all the local artists and their arts - lots of restaurants around here

Over the top touristy.... Hey....you are in Rome...it is to be expected. Funny history to the fountains and buildings. Also, best gelato so far was at Il Grom. Enjoyed alleys and side street restaurants.
Three fountains and a nice atmosphere. We went there twice. The fountains and the beautiful architecture of the houses around make this a very pleasant place to be.
Our favorite place in Rome. Beautiful and romantic, we came back here many times during our 10 days in Rome. We enjoyed the people watching and the artists in the piazza.
A night time wonderland. A wonder around here at night is really something. The fountains lit up. try to work out the four Rivers of the world and the snake hanging down looks real enough to pounce.

Beautiful. Beautiful sculptures, and great atmosphere. The many resturarnts at the square are touristy, but just a few block away you can find some really great food. Also lots of toy stores for the kids to look at in the square, though very expensive.

Fun, vibrant atmosphere. We dined at a few different cafes in the Piazza Navona. It was very fun for people watching and great little bands would stop in and play throughout the evening. There were some fun shops too.

Very touristy, but interesting. Nice place to head to at night, find a place to eat and walk around with a gelato after. Local artists and smalls markets can also be found around the piazza, but my favourite part are the musicians playing for tips and filling the night air with romantic music from all over the world!

Pretty but expensive. Check the price of the coffee before you sit down - the most expensive 30mins rest of our stay. However, it was worth the visit and great as part of a longer meandering walk down the nearby back streets.

Something for everyone. The Piazza Navona has something for everyone. Sculptures, dining, artists, palm readers, and trinkets. However, if you go down a side street you will find better food at a cheaper price.

Great fountain and great people-watching. Visited this Piazza twice in the 3 days we were in Rome, first with a Twilight Stroll tour with Walks of Italy where our guide Anna explained the history of the Piazza and the significance of the Four Rivers Fountain and then the following evening to just sit at one of the cafes (Ristorante Panzirone) and enjoy a drink while strolling musicians played and people walked past.

Don't Leave Rome Without Coming Here. I love the atomosphere of artist vendors and fountains within the piazza of quaint buildings. You're bound to find the right restaurant for you, and have the choice of eating outside. This was a return visit for us, and the first for our children. The thing I didn't like was that the prosciutto at the restaurant of our choice was NOT prosciutto as I knew it as a child and at other restaurants -- it was what I know as "American ham", which I detest. I asked for something else and told them that I would save it and my husband would eat it later, but it was not wrapped well and we discarded it later.
Piazza people watcher. What a great place to sit and enjoy the people, the artists, and the fountains. Don't be coaxed by the cafes they are overpriced, and only offer fair food.

Love in Rome.. To know Rome is to Love her. One of the most Romantic places in that most romantic of all Cities is Piazza Navona. I have been there in all Seasons - however, the most magical of allis Christmas time. One should go about 7p.m. at night. There you enter and think you are in another world of wonder. There are all kind of people selling all there hand made trimmings,creches, paintings, hand made leather, little books all hand painted. There are clowns all dressed up. The music plays from all sorts of places. Perhaps the Church there is a concert.Then above a restaurant one looks up and there is a young man playing the violin. All the people are happy and friendly. One never ever feels lonely as the Romans embrace you and make you feel part of this glorious season. Christmas in Rome is a very spiritual experience - as they do NOT decorate their trees or windows until the 15th of December. Christmas is the birthday of Jesus Christ, and true old Italians do not give bought presents for that day. They give home made cookies, jam, pies,tree decorations. However, they do give bought gifts for Old Years last day December 31.That is what I call civilized.Whenever I am blessed to be in Rome I am in Love with Rome.Barbara Ann MacMahon-Firestone.
Fountains are breathtaking. Love the fountains, love the buildings, ambiance, art on the middle of the plaza. Great place to stroll around and enjoy an afternoon.

My personal favorite piazza in Rome. The piazza is full of life with the locals & their talents. The Bernini Four Rivers fountain is also my favorite. I could sit in that piazza all day & enjoy Rome life!

Wonderful statues and fountains, too many vendors!. If, and this is a big if, there were not so many vendors trying to sell gimmicky (silly) little toys, this would have been a better place to see. That said, first timers to Rome absolutely must take a stroll here because the architecture is stunning. Just be prepared for someone to ask you to buy something every minute or so! We went in the summer, in the evening and while there were some authentic artists displaying their work, it felt rather like a tourist trap. But that can be said for many of the piazzas in Rome, so my advice is to get in, get out unless it isn't super crowded.
Every piazza is beautiful!!. Beautiful! Just visit as many piazza's as you can, the all are very special in their individual ways.
Beautiful. A place that romance is made sweeter.. Piazza Navona has wonderful little roads and good aperitifs and shops

Very touristy. What a lovely place early in the morning when the streets are still quiet and the fountains are being cleaned. Later in the day it is over run by vendors selling cliched oil paintings and reproductions of watercolours - which is reproductions of post cards! But for the sculptures and the church by Bernini it is worth a visit.
One of Rome nicest piazzas. This is a really beautiful piazza. Bernini's fountain in the middle with its allegory of the four rivers representing four continents is magnificent.

Bought beautiful oil paintings. Beautiful square with artists selling their paintings - bit of advise though, do not pay full price - haggle with them - I got €300 knocked off 2 really good oil paintings. restaurants in quare are expensive though. Fountains are beautiful.
navona. a lot of street vendors. be careful. Nice place to walk around if you like to do souvenir shopping. We also had a nice coffee break during our walk (expresso, capuccino) along this area.
Lovely square. Good place to people watch whilst having a coffee. Lots of restaurants here, but I would suggest eating away from the main Piazzas.
Quick visit. We liked this place but it's kind of a visit-for-once place. 3 nice fountains specially the middle one (fontana dei quattro fiumi).

Piazza Navona; Beautiful. Come to rome and not just pass by Piazza Navona is a pitti. A beautiful place sourrended by excellents restaurantes , The church of Santa Anita in fron of it, another amazing church to make a short visit at least

killaloe group. this piazza is one of the nicest in rome a lot of countries have their embassies in this area if you want to eat in this area go down one of the side streets are cheaper than eating in the piazza
Never alone in the Navona.. Atmospheric day and night but does not quite live up to its reputation, perhaps need to appreciate Bernini more.
One of my favorite places in Rome!. I loved this Piazza. Lots of artists and restaurants. The Fountain of the four rivers by Bernini is really amazing to see. It is definitely a place to see!

a bit of nostalgia. We went to Piazza Navona because on our first trip to Rome in 1968, we enjoyed a restaurant there so much. We just wanted to revisit the area, but it is considered sort of too "touristy" now--although really, what is wrong with being a "tourist"??? There was a street fair atmosphere with artists and souvenirs--nothing special, but a fun lively area. I hear that at night they have music and that must be fun.

Beautiful. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful - and all you'd love Rome to be. Be sure to go during the day and also go back in the evening. Great pictures to be taken during the daylight hours, but the place really comes alive after dark. Restaurants everywhere, artists and other vendors displaying their wares and the cool evening breeze - even in August. You will be a little overwhelmed by all the restaurants. Be sure to take your time to look around at the menus before deciding. I'm not sure we picked the best place. The food was good, but similar to what you'd get in an American Italian restaurant. We didn't have any alcohol, so we were pretty much overlooked by the staff almost to the point that they were rude. The tables where the wine was flowing got all the attention. I bought a small print of the Trevi Fountain (probably 4 x 6 size) for 8 euros. You'll love it. Prettiest piazza we visited.

one problem. one of the most beautiful squares in the world is almost impossible to see. Too many tables of restaurants on the sidewalks. Too many buskers and players, too many sellers...too much stuff around! please free this magnificanet place so that visitors can enjoy!
Romans enjoying their city. I have been here several time. It is a timeless place. But it should be seen in winter when it is filled with Roman families and is devoted to children.

Nice tourist location, beautiful fountains, great gelatto. Old center of Rome, lots of people out to enjoy the air, local artists and shops, excellent gelatto shop. Worth a stop to see how Romans live.

Nice place to buy art. It's one of the most interesting piazzas in Rome, especially at night where many artists sell their paintings and street performance entertain the crowds. It stays active until very late in the evening. The only downside is that you do get the usual restaurant greeters trying to entice you to dine in their establishments.

The fountains are a must.. We were there at least twice. We had dinner Da Francesca, which is off the Piazza. It was highly recommended but my carbonara was not hot enough and the pata too al dente for my taste. The other dishes were good however. The Piazza is huge. It was a racetrack so it is oval. There are many artists and places to eat surround. I love the guy who paints fans. Useful and pretty.
Glad I saw it.. During our several-day walking tour of Rome this is one of the many sites we saw. Like the Trevi Fountain, it's one stop you should make an effort to see.
Beautiful. There are several beautiful fountains along the vicinity. The crowd here is also not too bad. This place was also included in the film, Angels and Demons.

Touristy. This area looked a little seedy when I was there, and one of the major fountains had discolored water. After a quick walk through go to Santa Maria Sopra Minerva instead, head back toward the Pantheon and find a nice little restaurant there.

Bernini and more. I really enjoied the walk going from the Fontana di Trevi to Piazza Navona in the “Centro Storico” of Rome. Leaving the Fontana di Trevi you will find first the Temple of Hadrian, and then the Pantheon of Agrippa, another great building of the Imperial Rome. Finally you will see Piazza Navona, with a fantastic Bernini's work in the center: The Fountain of the Four Rivers. You will find then, the Egyptian Obelisk, the Church of Sant’Agnese in Agone or the Palazzo Panphili, the current Brazilian Embassy building. Many painters located in one of the sides of the square, add some bohemian flavor to the area.
Lovely fountains. I really loved the 3 fountains there. And the atmosphere is great too.The restaurants are very expensive so if you intend to save money you ll have to choose other venue.
A must see!. Three fountains by Bernini, need I say more? Crowded with tourists and artists...but worth it. Do not miss.

Bernini masterpiece - one of the nicest piazzas. We visited this as part of Dark Rome's Angels and Demons tour, and liked it so much we returned twice more. A beautiful square, of piazza in Italian, featuring three gorgeous fountains, one of which is a masterpiece by the prolific Bernini. The insight we gained from our tour guide - a student of Bernini's work, really added to our apprecation of the piazza. It contains may fine restaurants, none of which we visited this time, and is a welcome diversion and break whilst on a very hot break in Rome.
Very nice!. Piazza Navona is really nice! A great place to relax after a long day visiting.... It's not a good idea to go there eating because it's really expensive...

Great for dinner. Lovely restaurants with tasty food all around the backstreets. Street entertainers and art stalls in the evenings, with stunning architecture and fountains in the middle. Recommended for an evening visit definitely!

Must see attraction. The Piazza Navona is another one of the many sites in Rome you shouldn't miss. The Baroque architecture is jaw droppingly beautiful and it features some of Bernini's best work. Difficult to beat for the combination of artists, entertainers (some of the buskers are excellent) and restaurants.The food at the restaurants varies and some of them do trade on being in a tourist trap. You can undoubtedly do better for value-for-money and quality elsewhere, but it comes down to a choice between venue and what you want out of your meal/pocket. It's maybe worth eating there once just for the experience, but you can undoubtedly do better for price and quality elsewhere in the heart of the city.

Chill to hangout. After almost every tour or class during our workshop back in May, we would stop by the Piazza. The restaurants around were almost always full but one could always grab a gelato from one of the many Gelaterias and just walk around the Piazza. There are more than a dozen entertaining artists doing their thing—spray painters, sketchers, dancers, moulders, etc. Just don't allow yourself to be ripped off when you decide to buy something.

Restaurant Heaven. Piazza Navona is shaped like an oval racetrack. All around are inviting outdoor restaurants - very hard to chose. The center has a beautiful fountain that tells a story - you make it up once you see it! Great people watching and fun photo opportunities. Busy with vendors, actors, artists - a lot to do and a fantastic afternoon to be had.

A tourist trap. A great place to visit, but be careful not to fall into tourist traps like my daughter who had her hand taken while a piece of string was wound around her finger to form a bracelet. She was unable to let go and we were forced to pay 3 euros for it. The prices of the restaurants around the square are also more expensive compared to other areas of ancient Rome, for example those close to the Pantheon. You are obviously paying for the priviledge of being here.

Our favorite Piazza in Rome. Pretty much every attraction you go to in Rome is in or near one Piazza or another and in fact many of the Piazzas are named for the main attraction there. Out of the many Piazzas we explored, this one was our favorite. We walked through and/or ate at and around the Piazza several times. I think we took probably 50 photos of the Fountain of Four Rivers and the other two fountains in the Piazza. While Trevi Fountain is larger and much more famous, it is also ridiculously crowded to the point where it becomes difficult to get a good picture. Not so here at Piazza Navona - while crowded it is possible to get plenty of good photos of the Fountain of Four Rivers, which was built in the 1600s (I believe). There is also a fantastic and beautifully decorated church, 2 other smaller fountains, scads of restaurants, and interesting street entertainers at night.

So much Italian charm. I know this place is known for being a tourist trap, but I love it. I have been to Rome four times now and have to make sure I stop here every time. Something so charming and fun about this place...plus I like being around the "action" at night and there is ALWAYS something going on. Don't miss! Have a glass of wine and enjoy.

The market and the fountaines. You may want to go at the end of the afternoon (in summer) to enjoy for a while the whole picture: artists, people, great fountains, bars, a good drink.... yes! It was very good

interesting. Entertainers, artists ands restaurants. We walked off the Piazza and ate very well at one of the restaurants there. It was cheaper and offered a tourist menu for a set price including a drink.

Beautiful square and lovely view for lunch. Piazza Navona is the largest square in Rome and is well worth a look around. It has three fountains (the middle one being the largest and most beautiful) and has lots of art stalls in the centre of the square and restaurants around the edges. All restaurants seem to have outdoor fans or air conditioning so the square makes a lovely back drop to a cool lunch whilst watching the world go by.
Best piazza in Rome. This was our favorite place in Rome...The painters, the musicians, the fountains are so romantic. But the resturants are very expensive, and not the best in Rome.

Get your portrait painted!. The piazza Navona is a beautiful square with a number of fountains. It is very lively and a lot of artists are doing their thing all day. You can have your portait painted or a caricature. Funny!
Also there are numerous restaurants to choose from, from very expensive to reasonable. Of course you can eat Italian Icecream. Lovely place!

Perfect during a cool breeze in summer. We heard it was bucketing down with rain the week before and that there would be a heatwave in the following week. The day we sat outside a gelati cafe on the Piazza Navona was had a perfect cool breeze. We stayed for about an hour and it was beautiful to see the growing shadows beneath the statues before the setting of the sun.

One of my favorite places!!. Great place to sit outside to either eat or just have a coffee and gelato. you have the Bernini fountain of the 4 rivers, the mimes, artists, vendors and just the people to see. Try Tre Scalini (3 steps) for their wonderful gelato as well as the food, or Tucci's across the piazza or pic a place of your own. Great spot day or night.

The place is fantastico, but.. Would it just be for the buildungs or houses bordering the Piazza, with their beautiful colors and the way they retrace the former dimension of the ancient stadium - that's why the shape of the Piazza is actually oval - THEN it would be worth even more than five points. But there are thousands of people, mainly tourists like oneself but also plenty of Romans, walking around and watching the even so numerous semi-pro painters offering their services to do your portrait. I really wasn't prepared for all that busy bubble. Oh yes, the fountain with the obelisk is quite amazing and there are some nice little hangouts to take a bite and a refreshing drink - a pricy one I may wish to add!

Make it interesting by brushing up on your history. this square is very nice, its surrounded with pizza shops, has a lovely fountain in the middle, some other buildings and museums but the real treat is the great rivalry exhibited between two great architects like Bernini and Borromini in the fountain which stands in front of Sant'Agnese in Agone.
A cool piazza.... ...which changes from market to restaurants during the late afternoon. Excellent statue in the middle

Absolute must-see in Rome. One of the most fabulous piazza we've seen in Italy. It seems like nothing has changed here for centuries. We spent hours here in the evening just watching people or one of the many artists performing here. A note of caution however regarding the restaurants, some of them tend to lure you in but food is actually not very good. Apart from that, highly recommended.

Not as impressive as they say. Yes, the fountains here are beautiful. Yes the atmosphere is lovely. But there are many more impressive locations in the city. Since everything is so close together, it still doesn't hurt to walk through!
