Awesome vibe, beautiful place. A must-see in Rome! We went as the sun was starting to go down and it was absolutely picturesque. Plenty of paintings for sale, as well as artists drawing caricatures and the inevitable tables of 'ray-bans' for sale. Cafes and restaurants aplenty, and only a short walk to the Pantheon and onto the Trevi Fountain. Allow around half an hour to relax and wander around, but you could definitely spend a lot longer there just people-watching and enjoying the beautiful surroundings.
magical. This is a wide, spacious, cafe-lined piazza. Just sit on the steps of the building if the cafes are too expensive for you and watch. You'll be delighted.
Beautiful Piazza with a great atmosphere. This was definitely my favourite piazza. It has a wonderful atmosphere. Lots of wonderful artistes selling their paintings and a beautiful fountain.

Buzzing Brilliant Rome. Fabulous Piazza, fantastic artists painting, trattoria and Pizzeria all around this square, but try some of the smaller restaurants up and off the side streets. Buzzing happy atmosphere.

Fabulous show, especially in the evening. The piazza itself is one of Rome's most attractive. Built on the foundations of Domitian's Stadium, it's long and narrow. Highlights include the Bernini fountains and the Church of Saint Agnese in Agone. The Piazza Altemps branch of the National Museum, the churches of Saint Augustine, Santa Maria sopra Minerva, and the French church as well as the Pantheon are only a block or two away.But the "show" is what really attracts. It's a magnet for tourists and for street vendors and performers. Frankly, most of the stuff sold on the piazza is probably junk, but it's still a fun show. During the season, it's crowded until at least 10 pm at night. The entire piazza is ringed with bars and restaurants -- Tre Scalini gets the highest profile in tourist books and we liked it. The area just west of the piazza (toward the Tiber) is a maze of small medieval streets that is packed with restaurants.

What atmosphere. We visited this Piazza on a Sunday when it was chock-a-block full of artists and buskers plying their art. The atmosphere was electric and magical. My 7 yera old daughter was intent on having her portrait drawn free-hand by one of the artists , that we had to return on a Tuesday. It was much quieter, we managed to get a table and a roadside restaurant and had a good lunch at leisure while she was being sketched. It was a great, relaxing, day out with fab food and wine. Bellissimmo!!
Hangout. It,s very nice to have lunch there after visiting the colosseum or just go for a gelato and chill by the fountain. If you go there by night and sit by the fountain is so nice also

Historic!. I felt like going for a run around Piazza Navona. Great buildings, close to the Museo di Roma, impressive fountain an obelisk. Try to avoid the bars and restaurants around the Piazza as just like other establishments close to monuments, the prices were sky-high... even more expensive than hotel prices.

Very beautiful! Must see for Angels & Demons fans. My brother is a fan of Dan Brown's books. So we went to see all the places mentioned in his Angels and Demons novel. Piazza Navona was the one of these spots on our route. Very beautiful place to stay for a short break. You can sit near the fountane and eat an ice creame or have a stroll and watch lovely paintings set for sale all around. The Pantheon is only few minutes from this place. So you can kill two birds with one stone.

Amazing Fountains. Piazza Navona is home to some of the best fountains in Rome and it's free. It can be crowded, but the 3 gorgeous fountains of the Moor, the Four Rivers, and Triton are worth the visit. There are also tons of artists selling paintings and even if you don't want to buy anything it's worth a look around.
Great fountains. The fountains here are fantastic! There are also a lot of art dealers here if you are looking for a pen and ink or watercolor picture. I'd go back here on another trip if possible.

Great place to people watch and soak up the atmosphere of Rome. We were there during the evening when the sun was setting and shops beginning to close but there were still artists and stalls in the middle of the piazza. A great time for a (pricey) aperitif at a pavement restaurant, but save the food for the maze of restaurants just to the west of Navona where you will find lots of locals eating cheaper and better meals alongside the cannier tourists who have avoided the two-tier pricing system common in Rome where it is more expensive to sit outside!.
PIAZZA NAVONA. Beautifull square with lovely fountains and good restaurants. Here the food is a little bit more expensive off course.

Great experience. We walked around the Piazza Navona at night and stumbled upon an artist, who used paint, a roller, and etched the most beautiful pictures. We told her the colors and subject that we wanted, and she created a "masterpiece" in our eyes. We are now trying to find her. She is an architect by day, and she and her husband share their time in the Piazza at night. We had her paint a picture of ballerina's (she did have others available, although they were too big to carry). We would recommend everyone to stop by and see her, and if anyone does find her, please post it on trip advisor.
Another beauty in Rome. Not far from trevi fountain. There are also many people and many groups of tourist so like the other crowded places care about your bags and pockets.

Ahhhh:-). What a beautiful square!!!:-)beautiful buildings,a beautiful fountain,a nice monument,steps and a church from which you get a panoramnic view.A meetingpoint and a great place to take photos,and for all shopaholicks:the main shopping street starts there!

bustling piazza. If you are looking for art, this is the place to go, many artists with their reasonable priced treasures, they paint throughout the year and sell during the summer months, I took a couple of paintings home myself to help me live vicariously through art.

pretty piazza but pricey. nice walk from the Spanish Steps to the Trevi Fountain to the Pantheon to Piazza Novona. The Bernini Fountain is beautiful and lit up at night it is a very romantic area. Complete with an Egyptian obelisk.The restaurans are very pricey in this are better prices elsewhere. After leaving here walk to the Campo de Fiori market and get something to eat here if during the daytime.
Two Great Fountains here. Fountain of the 4 rivers and neptunes fountain can be found here.Lots of artists and artwork? for sale here. good picture opportunities crowded

Piazza & Fountains. Piazza Novone is not that far away from Trevi Fountain and is a wonderful rectangular area with fountains in the middle and cafes/restaurants around the perimeter. There is frequently artists with their paintings on display (a lot of prints). Note the restaurants are quite pricey but you go there for the atmosphere. There are many side streets of the piazza that run into smaller cafes, gelati shops, shops etc.

Fabulous history and architecture. The fountains alone are worth the trip! Many cafes, ristorantes, coffee places, stores all along the piazza. Take a side trip down a few of the smaller streets at both sides and both ends of the piazza- so many wonderful nooks and stores and eating/drinking places to explore. Take a peek into the hotels on the side streets, thinking about future visits. Keep a sharp eye out, because some hotels are almost invisible until you spot their small signs. Look for the Raphael Hotel, on an ivy-covered backstreet, and find your way up to the rooftop terrace restaurant for views of Rome's famous domes in nearly every direction. Piazza Navona and environs architecture is incredibly good - do take a guide book or leaflet explaining what some of the major structures are, and history of the fountains and their meanings. This piazza is fabulous, always something of interest going on there.

Start at the Trevi Fountain, and walk through to here. The Piazza Navona should be the end of your walk through the pedestrian areas that start at the Trevi Fountain. In itself it’s a bit of a disappointment after all the stunning buildings you will pass, and it’s designed just for tourists with everything from factory art to really tacky souvenirs. The square is surrounded by pavement restaurants, none of which I feel tempted to try, not least as I would expect a combination of high prices and relatively low quality. That may be very unfair, and certainly any of them will give you wonderful people watching situations. Having said that, it’s still worth seeing, but look up to see some of the original beauty of this square.

Very atmospheric- a must for an evening stroll!. Such a wonderful atmosphere particularly at night with all the restaurants and stalls and the beautiful fountains, head off the main piazza to the maze of streets around for a wonderful meal as I'd pricey on the piazza(12 euros for a cocktail...but worth it for one to soak it all up!)

A Place to eat, view and shop. Enjoyed strolling along there, with fountain of the four rivers as the background, restaurants along the side, and many paintings for sale. Have bought 3 paintings there and found them nice and not costly.

Do Not Miss. Bernini's beautiful Fountain of the Four Rivers is the centerpiece for what I think is one of Rome's most picturesque piazzas. The piazza is very large and oblong in shape. The area was once an ancient stadium. There are restaurants around the piazza and lots of tourists day and night to see the street performers and musicians. Beware of some of the artists selling what they claim to be watercolor paintings. You will see these same paintings everywhere. At night, walk from Piazza Navona to the Pantheon past the Tempio di Adriano to the Fountain of Trevi. All are lovely lit up.

large public place to enjoy. Piazza Navona is a large square in Rome.There are many attractions on this squire like Fountain of the Four Rivers in the center of the square , the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone.  the Fontana di Nettuno , the Fontana del Moro . This place is a very good pass time. It is a very popular place for tourists to see the sculptures and architecture and enjoy street performers, restaurants and cafes, exhibitions and several small stalls selling paintings and novelty goods. Large no of fine painters doing instant painting are there. The place is a public place, near corso vittorio, open 24 hours, and can be reached by bus nos. 62, 64, 40.
be careful. lovely area, great atmosphere , but very expensive food in the restaurants , better quality and value elsewhere if you look for it
Best Piazza. For me, Piazza Navona was the best outdoor seating/dining area in Rome. I went there day and night times and it was beautiful every time. Filled with restaurants.

Wonderful spot. Recommended to us by a friend but well worth a visit. In the height of summer, there was no shade from the relentless sun but lovely places to have a drink and ice creams around the square.

Lots of people, wide open and HOT in the summer. If you're visiting in the heat of the summer, the Piazza Navona is better seen at night when it's not a WHITE HOT scalding piece of marble. It's beautiful, filled with fabulous restaurants and artists working and who will paint your portrait. Good anytime of the year, but in the summer, who can appreciate any of its magnificence with the sunlight off the white marble is blinding you? Take it in during the evening hours instead.

The most beautiful piazza. Admire the work that two rivals and great masters left at the lovely Piazza Navona. Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers (the Nile, the Ganges, the Danube, and the Rio de la Plata) and Borronini's facade of Saint Agnes in Agony. The atmosphere is pleasant and relaxing maybe with the idea of the four great rivers flowing at the same accord.
The colour of the marble is a sight to behold!. Immense in size and proportion! Amazing to view, but not much to "do" and very pricey dining... Better, cheaper food found outside of here...

Gentle neighborhood Piazza. Have spent time here, enjoyed seeing the art, mimes and fountains Took pictues of the stolen Egyptian obelisk (all of them are stolen from Egypt) and the stone figures. Nice way to spend an afternoon. Plenty of restaurants, easily reached.

Famous plaza in Rome, great for a stroll or lunch/dinner. Piazza Navona is a longish rectangular plaza with several fountains and ringed by restaurants and other shops. It's another must-see attraction in Rome. We passed by and stopped many times during our stay in Rome and had lunch in the Tre Scalini restaurant in Piazza Navona.
It is amazing place.. At night it is a best time to drink a beer. There are some restaurants around the piazza. This place was a stadium in the past, and now is the best point in Rome for travelers.

Charming atmosphere. Picturesque, clean and charming. The atmosphere was pleasant and calm-an oasis of tranquilty away from the hustle and bustle of Roman traffic. Lovely restaurants and shops. Well worth a visit.
Very nice Piazza. Nice Piazza for an evening visit plenty of restaurants surrounding it but be ready to pay extra just for the location.
Relaxing. Lovely piazza to sit and relax in restaurant whilst people watching. Surrounded by beautiful buildings and fountains

Must Visit. We spent some time there every night since it was only 2 short blocks from our B&B. It has a couple good resturants and Gelato shops. Several artist displayed their offerings. The fountains were wonderful.

Great place for art and people watching. Great place to explore local artist work and have lunch in the near by restaurants. It is also a great place for people watch at night and have a glass of wine.

Another beautiful part of Rome. Tucked away off of the main roads of Rome is the Piazza Novano. The fountains in the Piazza are again impressive much like the others in Rome, but this area seems to be much quieter than the rest. We were able to admire the many artists who sold their wares here, and also to enjoy a coffee in a restaurant overlooking the central fountain which was very romantic.I'd recommend a visit here before setting out on your days sightseeing.
We enjoyed our visit.. Too many crowds but it was July on a fine day around 11.30 am! But it is a beautiful place and we enjoyed the fountains and buildings around.

Interesting place with lots of things to see beyong the buildings and fountain. Like - Lots of artists selling their artworks and live pianting
Dislike - Expensive restaurant around
A day in Navona. Lots of nice restaurants around the square. Interesting items available in the edible category. Beware the pricing of souvenirs, in particular authorized T-shirts!

Lively and fun. It's central location meant that we passed through here almost every day. It's fun place, lots of artists set up their work for display. Loads of tourists too. We didn't try any of the several restaurants, since we make it a rule NOT to eat near such touristy spots. However, do try the GROM gelato located on the North side of the Piazza. We loved it. Discovered it in Venice at the start of our trip, the kids were thrilled to find Grom in Rome as well!

A nice place to watch the world go by. As the heading says a great place to sit and watch .... however we also ate and drank which made it very expensive and a bit average as all of the restaurants seemed the same with cartel pricing in operation ..... the artwork for sale did not inspire us.

Art square. If you like the buzz of people enjoying themselves you certainly should give this square a try. Restaurants are expensive at the square but you can sit and watch everything from stone benches or just walk through all the artists selling their paintings. Ýou can get water at a tab at the north side of the square. I liked sitting there and just letting everything go by because there was always something interesting to see.

Worth the visit. The piazza is filled with animation - street performers, musicians and portrait artist. The Bernini fountains are very beautiful (there are three of them spread out on the piazza) and the piazza is lined with restaurant terraces. We spent a wonderful evening at Tucci's Restaurant - their Tartufo is excellent.

Great fountains!. I give Piazza Navona a rave review for the two amazing fountains. I especially liked the Four Rivers fountain. There are many great restaurants lining this former circus--you can definitely still see the circus shape. In the center, vendors sell various souvenirs and there is often some type of musical entertainment going on. While some of this was enjoyable, some was far too touristy for me. But definitely worth a stroll and great for people-watching.
Masssive. its so impressive that makes you feel too tiny. one might say that the statues are not carved by humans. so perfect. the only drawback is that its always very busy

Great after midnight. A night marketplace was fun to experience for our first night in Rome. The gelato here (just down the alleyway off the square) is amazing. Nearly all of our party got their portrait done, that was fun. We went home early hours in the morning. Next time we'll come a little earlier. I enjoyed the guitarists playing and singing at the fountain, they weren't busking they were just enjoying themselves on a late Summers night. Something you'll do most definitely if you visit Piazza Navona.
Impressive Fountains. Lots of kitschy stalls offering touristy trinkets and a significant police presence when I walked through. There are some lovely fountains in the square
Nice in the evening!. Good variety of nice, although expensive, restaurants around a beautiful piazza. Some street artists and a good selection of paintings. A nice place to spend a couple of hours.
A beautiful place and a bit of a surprise. One of the prettiest piazzas in Rome. The street artists and musicians make it a gem and the surrounding bars and restaurants are superb.

Vibrant plaza to sit and chill. This is great plaza throughout the day and evening to sit and enjoy all the stuff going on around.Artists and musicians surround the plaza with lots of stuff going on. You can sit next to one of the fountains or can have a drink (or eat) at one of the many al fresco restaurants (although they're a bit of a tourist trap).Definitely a must see. There's no other plaza in Rome like this!
Architectue. Beautiful, amazing piazza to walk through, grab something to eat and get your picture drawn (not just caricatures) from an Italian artist sitting in the piazza. GORGEOUS!!!!

Lovely Experience. We spent our last evening at the Piazza Navona. It was dusk and the fountains were gorgeous. There are many food venues and we just picked one and lucked out as it had great food. There are "knock off" peddlers all over the place who were constantly being run off by the police, but it didn't spoil our experience of being there.

A Wonderful Evening. It's the perfect place for couples, families, and friends. The restaurants are yummy, the art and entertainment is enjoyable, and the atmosphere of the buildings and statues is simply charming.
Bellisima!. When in Rome, visit the Piazza Navona...it's absolutely beautiful...within walking distance of Via Nazionale

really well worth a visit. loved the fountain, and also a great market for paintings, lots of sellers - however avoid the cafes in the surrounding area, if you go one street over you pay half the price.
great place. we went here every day, it was so fun to hang with the local people, have great food or a glass of wine, always lovely music being played, loved this piazza!
Beautiful Piazza. This is a great place to spend an evening, dinig or just sitting by the fountain "people watching" It seems to always be alive with something happening

Nice Square. Fantastic square where there are a number of stalls and local people selling their artwork, etc. Nice coffee and food stalls.
Worth a visit.
beautiful. Go late in the day when the crowds are not as heavy and the local merchants have set up their wares. You get a much better feel for the Piazza and Rome this way.

Beautiful Fountains. Like the title says- beautiful fountains, thats about it really. you can access the museum of Rome here too. Best not to eat or drink here as it is pricey in comparison to the smaller bars etc
Awesome!. The most beautiful plaza I've ever been in. We actually went twice. Great places to eat or just walk around and 3 beautiful fountains.

Not much to see. The piazza is packed and with the heat, it does not make a great experience. The best time to go would be in the evening for dinner or just a drink. There are lots of tourists, cameras and street artists in the piazza, so even viewing it becomes mission impossible! It's okay if you're looking to tick it off your list, otherwise I wouldn't bother with it!

My favorite place in Rome!. I went twice this year so far, one in March and once in June. Love the lay-out of the square and how people hang around it.. it's beautiful and romantic... putting people together. When I was there the end of June it was VERY hot.
Breath taking. You turn a corner of another cobbled Roman street and are greeted by a fantastic piazza of such magnitude

Real Italian Feel. This Piazza is so pretty all lit up at night, part of the Rick Steve's Night Walk Across Rome self guided walking tour. I like doing these because it's at my own pace and I can enjoy the sights for however long I like.Wonderfully lit up monuments, street performers, beautiful fountains, restaurants right on the piazza, art for sale - and unfortunately very irritating men trying to sell goods. It really is unfortunate, because they really detract from the ambiance. The police were there to try and scare them off, but all that happened was they would scatter like roaches and then come right back out. What got me was that they police were more concerned with making the talented musicians stop playing after 10pm for noise control, but didn't seem to put to much energy into getting these guys out of there. Seems to me the priorities were wrong, but overall a very nice Piazza to enjoy in the evening hours.
Very lively!. A very lively square with nice places to eat and artists drawing portraits and caricatures. Great place to spend your evening!

Nice square. I really like Piazza Navona. It's not very big, but you can feel that a lot of history is out there. You can come to Piazza during the day and enjoy its magnificent water fountains. Or, you can come in the evening and (besides enjoying the fountains) you could purchase some paintings from the artists as a lot of them are out there in the evenings. Either way, you could easily spend up to 2 hours at the Piazza.

Loved this Square. This Piazza was my favourite as it was large with three beuatiful fountains with fantastic statues. A artist area with lots of paintings and prints to buy and surrounded by lots of restaurants and bars. There was also musicans around the square which gave a lovely atmosphere to the place.

Beautiful place to have lunch. I went to the Piazza Navona for a nice lunch and to admire the fountains. As a kid who grew up near Hollywood, California this area of Rome reminded me of a backlot set. It was just too perfect! I almost expected a film crew and director to yell "Cut" anytime during my meal. It is simply a beautiful and peaceful place to eat a midday meal and go for a stoll after to admire the work of the artists who set up shop in the center of the plazza or to study the statuary of the fountains. It was a lovely way to spend an afternoon of Dolce Far Niente!

Lovely. What an amazing place to just grab a seat and take in all of the sites and sounds of Rome. This was a little touch of paradise. Street performers providing mood music, beautiful architecture and some fine food options.

Get there at 7am and she's all yours. Usually very crowded during the day and evening but if you get there by 7am (our hotel is 10 meteres from the piazza) and you can have the piazza for yourself.Piazza is less than 10 minutes from Pantheon and 20 minutes from the Trevi fountain. Nearby (at the back streets) lots of local restaurants and cafe.

Great at night. Piazza Navona comes alive at night with an artists market. We had our characterture done for a bit of fun and a great souvenir of our time in Rome. I would not suggest eating here as the prices are high for the tourists and quality not as good as other areas in Rome. Great to visit after dinner.
beautiful square. we can see there a historic site , beautiful fontanas and statues .the piazza is very cloudy , many people go there .lots of restaurants around and near .
This is Rome. Lovely square, all said before. Artists selling their wares abound, very high prices though.eat at restauarnts off the square, prices cheaper, great atmosphere especially in the evening

magical at night. Beautiful large square with amazing architecture which is flood lit at night. definitely the place to eat a gelati- lots of great ice cream shops there as well as fantastic restaurants
Great atmosphere. This seemed to be the square to be in on the evenings. The street entertainers, musicians and artists all helped to promote a nice atmosphere. The fountains are beautiful.

Read about this place before you go. Gobsmacked! Fantastic atmosphere and history, and so large.
Its a historical arena that people live in, so much history old and modern.
NICE EXAMPLE OF ITALIAN PLAZAS. Pretty fountains, nice restaurants surround this inviting plaza. Nicely situated with Italian architecture.
A Must in Rome. This Piazza is wonderful any time of day... the fountains are beautiful... and there are always people & artists hanging around, demonstrations taking place...

Painters Galore. Situated mins from the Pantheon, is a haven for art lovers. So many artist sell their art. I bought one for $100 Euro, Remember to haggle the prices, Should get at least half the orginial if your lucky! A nice fountain in the middle.
Nice Piazza. Beautiful looking Piazza and some great restaurants and food. Only annoying thing was the large amount of people selling novelty toys and getting in your face wanting you to buy them.

Bernini!. Rome has made me fall in love with Bernini. One of his masterpieces in the most beautiful fountain that graces this very busy piazza. The buildings are are also breath taking. Other than that....this piazza is very touristy. You need to be aware of your belongings and who is near you.

Great Scene. It's always a wonderful scene at Piazza Navona and a must see for visitors to Rome, particularly at night. Scores of people, artists selling their work, great Bernini fountains, restaurants, performers––wonderful!

Great piazza, beautiful fountains. The Piazza Navona has Bernini's four rivers fountain in the middle, and tons of art street vendors in the piazza, surrounded by overpriced cafes and restaurants. The crowd is touristy, but lively. The piazza is worth a visit, but I would avoid the shops and restaurants and look elsewhere for better quality and value.

maybe our favourite piazza in Rome. We kept coming back to Navona for the activity, the street performers, the spray can painters, the gelato--yes, grom is there, but it is not the best gelato in Rome. Try Gelateria Frigidaire via del Governo Vecchio, 112. The nocciola is to die for.
beautiful!!!!. Rome's monuments are enchanting: Piazza Navona is one of the most beautiful squares I've ever seen...

Rome's "Living Room". This was part of the tour and what a lovely area it is. It is really like a town square with shops and street mimes and beautiful fountains. We were told it rests on top of one of the arenas they raced horses in ancient Rome and thus you can see it almost oval shape. We were also told it is sometimes referred to as Rome's "Living Room" as many people come here just to unwind and relax. There is so much to see and somewhere (I couldn't find it) you can actually look into a hole in the ground to see the old arena. It is really a place to spend a leisurely afternoon. Everything is unhurried and relaxed. Would have liked to have spent more time here, but the tour moved on. If you get a chance, don't miss it.

Loved this Piazza!. We found this Piazza just wandering throught the streets not far from our hotel and fell in love with it! There were artists set up all along the Piazza and there are places to sit and eat or have a drink and just watch the world go by.....I highly recommend it!

Put this on your "To Do" list in Rome.. This seems to be Rome's version of PLace Du Tetre. Great atmosphere, wonderful fountain and fantastic architecture, I would certainly recommend you include it in your "to do" list. Also, easy walk to Pantheon and Trevi Fountain.

Beautiful street with 3 Fountains. Here you will find a beautiful traces shaped stadium , with three magnificent fountains that decorate the piazza. Do take time to walk through the whole stretch as you will see a lot of roadside act, musicians and a lot of restaurants which are a little expensive, but my recommendation would be to sit and sip on a cold glass of beer while your there the atmosphere is amazing!
Great people watching. What a great piazza to do people watching in Rome. Excellent street entertainers, craft shopping and cafes. A must evening adventure while in Rome.

Great place to spend the entire night. Ok, if you need to hang out all night and just chill in a nice, bustling, hip and historic--Piazza Navona is actually the remnant of a Roman chariot race track!!!! It has kept the general outline, although the stands have almost totally been built over by gorgeous medieval and Renaissance buildings. I spent many night at the Navona until 2-3am. It is alive with perfect aire, music (no, not the blasting barbarian type), coffee, wine, food, sweets... and GREAT people to mingle with.

A great piazza. I loved the atmosphere in this piazza but if you want food if drink stroll a little way from here as 2 cokes were 12 euros! The street art is fab though and the fountains are a must-see!

Breathtaking and full of atmosphere. Loads of street cafes to sit and enjoy your stay, lots of crafts people especially artistes and loads of street entertainers...all good. A must for any visitor to Rome
wonderful. a wonderful piazza and especially those pantomime people all painted and dressed up as different historical characters to take photos with

Favourite place in Rome. This was my absolute favourite place in Rome! I loved the fountains, the atmosphere both in the day and evening. The buskers were fun to listen to and we had the BEST gelato here too! Just north of the piazza on the corner next to grom. It has a yellow awning and when we went they had special blue Smurf gelato lol. MUST see!!

Grab some gelato and enjoy this charming square!. I really enjoyed my short time at this square. It's charming and there are many artists selling their work. Additionally, many of them paint or sketch portraits. There are some nice fountains and a few shops too. Definitely worth a stroll in this square while you are in Rome...

Beautiful!. This is a very beautiful square (piazza). Architecture, decoration and environment is so nice and relaxing. the fountain can really give you a relaxation time from all the walking around the city (which I would recommend instead of hiding underground in the subway and missing out the city!).

prettiest piazza in Rome. The fountains are gorgeous, there's always a lot going on, with outdoor cafes ringing the piazza. For a more personal visit, go early in the morning, before the crowds arrive.

The Best Piazza. Well worth a visit to see the artists at work and to relax a little while whilst watching the world go by. I suggest you make it part of a Rome walking tour when you can take in the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Piazza de Popolo in one visit

The most touristic, but still a must do. To quote Catullus, "I love and I hate." Piazza Navona is so expensive and the restaurants may tack on outrageous charges, but it is so vibrant that you shouldn't miss just wandering around with a cone of gelatto.
Piazza Party. Beautiful place, outdoor cafes and street scenes. The fountain was incredible and the architecture beautiful.
Beautiful Piazza. Very open and nice piazza, with several "living statues" which were funny, lots of places to sit and eat and lovely fountains.
beautiful little piazza. Loved this lively little area. Fun to walk around and take pictures. Many outdoor restaurants to eat at. Beautiful fountains in the center and flowers all around.

Nice Experience. This is a big piazza with fountains in the middle and restaurants and shops around it. It was really nice. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the restaurants were a bit expensive there.

Alive At Night. We went to Piazza Navona as part of a night walk from Fiori del Campo to the Spanish Steps. Once you ignore all the trashy tourist hawkers in the Piazza and simply look around you will find it is an amazing place with the restuarants, the buildings and the people. We did not go during the day when we understand it also serves as a daily market in the morning. Well worth the visit and also to see the sights at night.
A Must in Rome. This Piazza is filled with life! Fountains, restaurants, artists and shops abound. You must not miss this special part of Rome!
beautiful. the amazing sites and sounds of plaza navona with the many shops and restaurants and water fountains
used to be a racetrack. Pretty . Spend a short time. Never eat or drink in the famous piazzas like this one. Food is mediocre and prices are outrageous.

Magic atmosphere. Whether you are there in winter, strolling around the Christmas styalls or in summer, trying to find a little cool from the fountains, Piazza Navona will work its charm for you. The shape of the piazza, the street entertainers, the painters, the bars.... sit outside and watch the world go by.

Beautiful view, fun area. View is beautiful, and several artists display their paintings there. Lots of restaurants to choose from (somewhat touristy, but nice to sit outside and people watch). Usually someone there playing an instrument also.

great family hang out. This is the perfect plaza for an evening with the kids. We enjoyed watching the artists create their spray paint masterpieces as the sun set. Everyone is out, so great for people watching and getting a bite to eat.

Best piazza in Rome. Very attractive square with 3 fountains including Bernini's famous Fountain of the Rivers. if you want a painting this is the place to come with many artists exhibiting their work but careful not to display prices in case they frighten people away.

Bernini knows how to do a fountain. Day or night i love Piazza Navonna. Go to Tre Scalini buy a tartufo con panna and either sit admiring the fountains or walk around eating this wonderfull gelato whilst looking at the stalls , artists by night. Heeps of good restaurants surrounding and more behind this very large square. Another must when in Rome.

The Rome you see in the movies. Loved it. This is what we pictured Rome to be from the artists and hawkers filling the piazza to the many top quality restaurants and cafes lining the sides. The opposing fountains are a delight and were a treat for our children, Just beware of some of the artists. One gave our 4yo daughter several paintings then claimed she took them and wanted payment. Fortunately, the waiter from our restaurant sorted it out for us. Now that's service! That aside the piazza is a must do. Pick a restaurant, buy a bottle wine and sit and watch the locals and tourists soak up the ambience.
Like a circus. We liked the piazza, but it has changed to be a supermarket of all kinds of useless souvenires and agressive pizza salesmen.

A relaxing way to take in the history. There's something very special about this Piazza; lots of artists help create a buzz and plenty of cafes to enjoy pasta and vino! Ask the waiters about the history of the square, it's intriguing.

Beautiful. I loved this piazza. Its open and breezy, the artwork is impressive and the fountain! The Four Rivers Fountain is beautiful. We stopped and got a gelato and a beer and enjoyed the people watching.

Beautiful and scenic area. This is one of the busiest places filled with tourists and people selling their artwork. The artwork was absolutely stunning and I only wished I had a mini-fortune to buy all the artwork that Iiked.

wonderful in early evening. the statues and fountains are amazing - you can hear them before you see them! The light in the evening as the sun is setting is amazing. We spent our time deciding which apartment we'd like to live in! Cafes and restaurants are very expensive - what you'd expect in a tourist area. Be warned, there are quite a few buttocks on display!!

Check the price before you drink. Lovely Piazza but ripped by the waiters for two small drinks in a cafe on the square, its a shame as it spoiled a lovely time my advice is walk the square do not sit in the cafes use another cafe away from the square.

Beautiful and right around the corner of the Pantheon. Strolled through the Piazza on a Friday morning after visiting the Pantheon. Neither were crazy crowded as you would think for a July weekend. We were there around 10 am.
Don't forget to walk here!. We almost missed this gorgeous Piazza - even the vendors and street people could not mess this up! Several beautiful fountains. fun place and Gelatto is to die for!

Lovely fountains and buildings!. Great people watching and a grand fountain to walk around respresenting the 4 continents. Incredible to imagine that the this was the place where young men would race naked thousands of years ago.

Large and Lovely. My family strolled along the easy walk from our hotel in the beautiful and bustling Campo di Fiore to the larger and better known Piazza Navonna for dinner one evening. We arrived as artists were setting up their wares for the evening, giving us an outdoor art gallery to enjoy along with the beautiful fountain and architecture. Be sure to read about the fountain before visiting. There were not as many restaurants as I thought there would be, but we ate at the long-standing Ristorante Tre Scalini, which has been there since 1815 and it was excellent, although their signature dessert was disappointing, it turned out just to be chocolate gelato.
Touristy. Just restaurants and stalls selling tourist stuff - the fountains were nice - the little cobbled streets off of this are far more interesting and Rome as I imagined it to be.

Another site in Rome worth a visit. This piazza is really pretty and lively. It had the most beautiful fountains; Fontana del Moro sculpted by Giacomo della Porta (1575) with some additions in1673 by Bernini and the Fountain of Neptune created in 1574 by Giacomo della Porta. You can get some gelato and sit and listen to minstrels play by the fountain. The piazza is a great example of Baroque Roman architecture. A great place for lunch or just a rest.

Beautiful. With Bernini statues, can't get enough of it. There are plenty of artists in the terrasse worth seeing. Just sit on the steps and bask in the atmosphere, and admire the amazing sculptures adorning the central fountain.

check your bill in the cafes!. atmospheric and elegant. the Fountains are lovely and we had a really good coffee in one of the cafes along the side of the square. Watch out though- they overcharged us when we left!

Great place to sit and relax for an afternoon. This piazza has enough cafes and gelaterias surrounding the central fountain for any visitor to spend an hour or so relaxing after seeing other sights in the surrounding neighbourhoods. Lots of interesting artists and artisans sell their wares in the central portion around the fountain, and the mix of locals and tourists is a nice balance

Evening of relaxation. During our stay in Rome, we visited the Piazza Navona, where we had dinner at Trozzi resturant. After dinner we walked around the Piazza and visited all the sites and entertainment.

The place for a romantic evening walk.. Between the live music, singers, artists, and romantic atmosphere you'll be glad you ventured out for an evening stroll.Just be careful of pickpockets and the people selling the glowing flyers, laser pointers, etc. They like to point the laser pointers up girls skirts as they walk by.
Good place to chill out. Large piazza with the wonderful fountain and lots of eateries and gelato shops. Good place to sit down, have a gelato or coffee and see the people and world go by.

Idyllic. We've come back to this piazza time and time again just to enjoy the sun, the people and the fountains. The restaurants at this piazza are pricey due to the view, so if you're on a budget like we were - visit the supermarket at Via Vitorrio Emmanuele ll (nr 42 I think, near Torre Argentina) and enjoy your sandwiches at Piazza Navona.Many artists (or fakes, I wouldn't know) display their drawings of Rome's main historical treasures so you can bargain for a decoration.
Mozzarella in Carozza. Very welcoming .Friendly waiter , not expensive considering the location,nice Lunch try Mozzarella in Carozza !!

'A short walk away' 40 minutes later.... Our apartment was a the far side of the Vatican City but we were told that Piazza Navona was 'a short walk away' so 40 minutes later we arrived. The walk there wasn't too bad actually as we walked through St Peter's and down the side of the river, it was very nice, not for my boyfriend who hates walking mind. We went at night in search of a lovely restaurant and ended up walking there for two nights running as it was, although more pricey than other places, it was so lovely. There were many restaurants around the Piazza and many stalls and points of interest in the centre of it. Although we could have been anywhere at this point.The fountains themselves were beautiful, I was fascinated by them and the building surrounding them. There was so much to look at on the fountains. Understandably it attracts many people, but it becomes 'touristy' in a way with the stalls and pricey food. Its a shame though as its definitely worth a visit.
the nicest square in the World. A great place to go in the evening - full of people having a good time - lots of fun, great places to eat just off the main square. My family loved it.

Good to see on the way.... Of the sites we saw in Rome & Italy (Colosseum, Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Catacombs, Sorrento, Pompeii), Piazza Navona was in some ways the least memorable. There are fountains, and there is a market in the Piazza but nothing particularly memorable compared to the other sites. It's a gorgeous area like the rest of Rome, I mention this only to help those who might be pressed for time and need to prune sites. For me I might trade Piazza Navona for other things...

Beautiful to pass thorough.. The Piazza and its fountains are stunning but don't expect to find much to do there. A lot of street artists about, however very few of them are selling original stuff so be wary. If you're in the area, make a detour to see it but don't expect to be there for long, especially as the bars, shops and restaurants are pretty pricey.
wish it were empty. so full of "artists" selling junk, and the cafes/restaurants around the place are so touristy. the architecture is great but i wish we could see it empty.

Great place to just sit and watch the crowd.. Great place to just sit and watch the crowd. we visited this place just last week. It was almost evening and it was crazy with people milling about and vendors selling paintings, baskers singing and dancing and some people just sitting near the fountain and enjoying the environment. Great place to eat as well and there are quite a few restaurants about.

Fountains are great..very touristy. Don't expect ANY good Italian food around here.. Also, don't expect good house wine for cheap.. this is "tourist' rome to the hilt. We usually have them give us a table out front and order one glass of good wine to sit and people watch.. Stay away from the food.

nice plazza, bad picture. My boyfriend loved it. I was a bit dissapointed. Not because the plazza itself, but because the picture. We got my portrait painted, but it's not me. Even my mum couldn't recognize me :).

Piazza Worth Visiting - Nothing More. Come early in the day and enjoy walking around this large Piazza. Avoid the crowds and skip the tourist trap restaurants that populate the square. A coffee (standing at one of the coffee bars -- don't sit down or it will cost extra) or a gellato are okay, but anything else will disapoint and make you feel like you have overpaid.
So much fun!. Great atmosphere, fountains, art and street performers!
One of the most lively and fun piazzas in Rome.. Loved walking around, eating gelato, looking at the fountains and people.
Nice. Nice and pleasant but expensive restuarants, be sure to go down the little alley ways to cheaper restaurants.
beautiful plazza. drinks in the bars in the plazza are very expensive ( £20 for 3 drinks )
Nice stop. This was nice to see. Not much to do here but you can get some great pictures and learn a little bit of the history.

Gorgegous. It is definitely my favourite square in Rome! The sculptures and the fountains are beautiful, honestly, in my opinion much more beautiful than Trevi Fountain. In the hot summer evening it is cool quiet. It is surrounded by many nice restaurants and cafes that you can sip your cold drink and watch the fountain. Time flies in Piazza Navona.

LOVED IT!. Can't put into words, Piazza Navona is one of our favourites in Rome. From the buildings to the fountains (yes of course these are Bernini's)...painters, patio restaurants, atmosphere....well in you are visiting Rome, you have to go there!
beautiful. Beautiful, lots of artits and a good little museum just round the corner
Great people watching. Watch out for restaurant's that charge a cover charge or a bread charge in the funky out door cafes. Don't miss this place.

Busy but worth it. Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers is always worth a visit. There is always something new to appreciate. Navona is surrounded by shops and restaurants that cater to many tastes. A lovely spot to stroll and window shop or enjoy a drink.
nice. a must do when visiting rome, something that will always remind u of older times, very nice square with alot of history.

My childhood.. I lived around or in Piazza Navona for 5 years, and it is one of the best square in the whole world. Spacious, calm, with wonderful masterpieces (such as the Bernini's fountain or Borromini's church) it's a must go for whoever visits Rome.

Should be called "Piazza di empty tourists pockets". It's a nice looking square, but the place is entirely overrun by overpriced restaurants serving mediocre food, and touts selling those sticky wall-climbing slime balls that stopped being cool in the 80s (why they feel the visiting population of Rome would be in the market for possibly THE most unItalian product known to man, I do not know).Anyway, it's nice to look at, but I got tired of people trying to pull me into their restaurant. There should be some kind of badge system in Rome. Maybe blue for "I've eaten, leave me alone"... or red for "If you're that desperate for custom, what does that say about your food?". Either way, I got bored of feeling like a walking ATM and telling people 'no'. Once you've done it, there's little reason to go back.

Stunning. This square is full of character and on market day you will really enjoy seeing all the art work. Don't eat or drink on this square but go a few streets back and the prices are less than half. There is an amazing little back street restaurant called Navona Notte which is buzzing, full of Italians and cheap honest Italian food!
Lovely.. Who wouldn't love all those lovely cafes and bars and fountains.

Great atmosphere. A lot going on.. Although great atmosphere there were lots of hawkers. It was good to see the artists showing there talents. The restaurants are very expensive for what you get. Eat elsewhere.

Beautiful Square. We stumbled across the Piazza Navona, and so glad we did the square was full of various artists all more than happy to show you their paintings, and pass the time of day. They were not at all pushy to sell you anything.

Take a picture at the Trevi Fountain, but don't miss this!!. Loved to escape the crowds and really enjoy this beautiful piazza. If you don't have a tour guide, read all the incredible history ahead of time.

Tourists beware!. Between the piazza restaurant hawkers, the salespeople selling questionable merchandise constantly being routed by the police, the beauty of the fountain in the plaza seems a distraction.
The Best place for an evening stroll in Rome. And don't miss the Tartuffo at Tre Scalini!! You can practically see the chariots charging around the circus!

Amazing site at night. On the suggestion of Rick Steves we attempted the night walk, which included Piazza Navona. The Piazza at night was beautiful and the fountains were spectacular. Never went during the day but I recommend a night visit.

Beautiful, despite the pushy people. Large piazza with the famous fountain that starred in Angel's and Demons. There are many painters that gather here to sell their works and many of them are very talented. We bought one on a piece of canvas for 30eu. Best spray paint artist we have ever seen! There are also people pushing Ray Bans, laser lights and other useless objects. They tend to get pushy and overstep their boundaries.

Great atmosphere and a taste of Italian nightlife. This is a great Piazza to visit if you are looking for a dinner or even drinks. It's buzzing with people and lots of variety to choose from. This was recommended as a great night life venue by Italians so you cant go wrong.
You must have a drink there. Great place to have a drink and watch life go by. The piazza is full of artists that sell their works or some other artists works.

Absolutely Picturesque!. After leaving the Pantheon we stumbled across Piazza Navona... Wow! Beautiful fountains and grand buildings all around. The Piazza was filled with artists selling their paintings and surrounded by cafes with outdoor seating. The main fountain appeared to be the same one in the movie "Angels and Demons" where Tom Hanks rescues the drowning Cardinal. Also, there is a really nice Gelato cafe near the entrance of the Piazza, I wish I could remember the name, but it was very clean and a nice place to use the WC ;)

much better at night visit. We came to Piazza Navona at night, we end up staying longer by eating in one of the restaurant in the area.The restaurant has been around since 1949 & served the best gelato.We came back the next day during our tour. It was definitely more beautiful to see it at night time

Love the atmosphere and excitement. If in Rome, you cannot miss Piazza Navona. Its three fountains are beautiful, especially the Fountain of the Four Rivers, but also the Fountain of Neptune and the Moor Fountain. Full of restaurants and life explode in this exciting Piazza of Rome all day everyday. It is an elegant square in ancient Rome that while frequented by many tourists is able to maintain its attractive nature and entertaining atmosphere. With the Palazzo de Madame only one block away, it is also very safe and 'guarded.'
Nice plaza. Enjoyed walking in this plaza and seeing the fountains.

Fun to people watch. There are several fountains in this piazza including the Four Rivers Fountain. It is a great place to people watch. There are several mimes competing for your attention. Several outdoor cafe's line the piazza and local musicians hawking their CDs often set up impromptu performances.

Ok in every respect. The structures and history are great but the normal entertainment is just ok as are the restaurants surrounding the Piazza I find the Piazza at the Pantheon better in every respect
Good place to eat in good restaurants. There are good sights in this place, but the gastronomie is the best issue there. Including an wonderful italian ice cream.
romantic. a place of romantist, an ideal place for a coffee with a loved one.

Relax and enjoy!. We stopped here for coffee as we were struck by the scale of the piazza with its three fountains. Enjoy browsing the art on display for sale - some really quite good some really quite awful, but all part of the experience as you listen to street music and soak up the overall ambience.
Busy, Busy. Great place for people watching, but a bit expensive if you're doing from a restaurant, lots going on from painters to street performers when we were there
Very nice area. Wonderful courtyard with beautiful fountains and soothing atmosphere. Local artists selling their paintings and drawings. Drinking fountain with fresh cool underground water. Love it.

Great for people watching. We went twice. Once in the daytime and once in the evening. We also walked through here two other times! It's a great place to see such a variety of people. Don't get taken by the artists. Some of the art isn't original! Make sure to spend some time taking in The Fountain of the Four Rivers. It is amazing!

Good start to the day. Staying in Campo De Fiori, this was a short walk away and offered a beautiful setting while we drank our cappuccino's and ate our fruit bowl. The buildings and statues are gorgeous though it does get busy so I suggest stopping here first thing in the morning.

High point of our trip to Rome. This was one of the high points of our first trip to Rome so we went a second time when visiting again. I have a beautiful painting in my dining room that we purchased from an artist in the Square on our first trip to remind of this wonderful place every day. Cafes, shops, architecture -- who could ask for more.
My favorite square in Rome. Fantastic square , with the lovely fountains , painters and restaurants all around. The best square in Rome

Can be very expensive.. The Piazza is certainly beautiful, and the people selling their paintings etcetera do add to the place. But be aware that some of the bars and restaurants can be very expensive. I paid 20 Euros for 2 small beers.
Nice Piazza to hang around. It is a nice piazza to hang around. Just to sit down, enjoy the view around, listening to the voice of the fountain's water, it is really nice.
beautiful, artsy, crowded. during the day it is packed with people, try to visit during the evening or night for awesome experience. the place is beautiful.
Peaceful and beautiful. The fountain in the Piazza is simply amazing! And wandering among the artists, viewing their work.... inspiring!

Piassa Navona. If you're looking for inexpensive watercolor paintings of classic or cliche Roman or Tuscan scenes to take back home, here is the place. A fun area of Rome to visit. Lots of little cafes nearby.
Fun place to hang out in the evening!. Great artists and lovely fountains. A great place to hang out in the evening.
St Agnese. My favorite church of all time! Emerald marble abounds in this dedication to Christ, as opposed to St.Peter's which seems more focused on popes than Christ.
Lively square. Many artists with their artwork. Such a large square with street performers, artists and so much to do.

Good restaurants nearby. Piazza Navona is a relaxing place to browse art and get a bite to eat. We enjoyed gelato at a small place on the northwest side of the piazza. The real gem was the deli RosticceRì located outside the north east corner of the piazza on Corso del Rinascimento 83/85. Their take-away food is delicious.

Must be seen.. Unfortunately, the Piazza is crowded every day with vendors selling mass-produced-in-China paintings of Italian scenery. Apart from that, for those interested in Roman history, the fountains and the church of St. Agnese in Agone are must-sees. There are also some very good mimes to be seen there. For the simple reason that the place is iconic for Rome, one should see it.
great for people watching. fountains are lovely and sitting there watching world pass by
My favorite place in Rome. This place is amazing, you could sit and watch all day. there are performers & painters all around, its a beautiful romantic area

Piazza Navona well worth the visit. We nearly missed this site but a good Italian friend encouraged us to go on our last day. What a beautiful piazza. Unlike others, there is no traffic in the piazza, lots of gellato shops and pavement cafes. Definitely to be included in your visit to Rome.

Truly a beautiful piazza. We read that this was the most beautiful square in Rome and although we did not have extensive comparisons - this was a beautiful site. The combination of beautiful buildings surrounding it and gorgeous fountains, make it a must see in Rome
Lovely Piazza. This is the most beautiful of all Rome's piazza's. Enough said really, there are several others than would also get a five from me.

Family Fun. My husband, parents and toddler spent one evening here. Sure it is touristy, but, some of the live music was very charming. We really enjoyed our time walking around...there was a very happy energy here.
lovely square. was a very nice piazza , full of artists , the fountains were a excellent place to have a photo taken ;

Great fountain - don't stay for the food. The fountain is beautiful. Go there, appreciate its beauty then leave to eat.
We made the mistake of eating there our 2nd night it Rome and had the worst meal of our 2 week stay. Lesson learned - don't eat in piazzas with a lot of tourists!

Arts and beauty. This piazza is very charming. There are many street vendors selling their artwork. The only draw back is the number of tourist that flock to the fountain. I just wanted to see it, but tourists cluttered the area that it was difficult to see. It's a beautiful and peaceful place to walked around in the later evening/night.
Go at night to see the full splendor. Brilliant place to spend the evening. also in the side streets away from the Piazza are some great restaurants

Charming. Tucked away near the Pantheon lies this charming little square full of beautiful fountains, quaint cafes and restaurants, and local artistic prodigies displaying and selling their work. We ate dinner here one night and enjoyed looking at The Fountain of the Four Rivers while enjoying a plate of pasta.

Wonderful place but don't eat here. Great place to visit with the fountains, tha artists, and the varying styles of housing design, there are touts but they're not too bad for Rome.
One thing - careful of eating here as the restaurants are aimed at unawares tourists and so are very expensive for what you get.
Vibey Spot. There's a great vibe with plenty of people, places to eat, and stuff to buy. As always, in busy spots, keep valuables safe from pickpockets.

Beautiful but..... Piazza Navona is not to be missed. With it's three beautiful fountains, beautiful architecture and history. Sadly, aggressive knock-off designer bag peddlers have overrun the piazza, especially in the evening. It definitely detracts from the experience.
Circus. So many sounds and things to see. It's a street carnival of life and sounds.
Not very special.. A large piazza with a number of restaurants and bars charging over the odds. Just why it has a popular reputation eludes me even after visiting it for the 4th time.
Navona. Fun place for the whole family with lots of life at all hours.
Huge piazza. Piazza Navona is a great place to spend a little time. It is a very large piazza with two huge fountains (think Angels and Demons). Many places to eat and buy souviners.

Breathtaking!. Piaca Navona is definatelly one of the most popular places in Rome. Fountains are amasing. Restaurants are really cute. Shame there are no trees at all. It would be more romantic. But anyway one of the most beautiful piacas or squares in the world.

The highlight of our trip to Rome!!!. Great meeting point of talented artists, nice restaurants with outdoor sitting place, to enjoy the whole happenings! Great musicians that amuse with their songs. In general the best place in Rome!!!!
Navone. This is probably the most beautiful piazza in Rome, The fountains, art sellers and restaurants which line the square give it a character of its own
Wonderful sight. great spot to sit and relax, recommend eating elsewhere though
LOVE the Piazza Navona. The atmosphere is fantastic, and the fountains are so beautiful. The restaurants are pretty touristy, but the food is still really authentic and yummy.

Just like a movie set!. This square is the quintessentilal Italian scene - the church, the fountain, restaurants, musicians, street performers, artists - it has it all. It is a delightful way to spend an evening. Of course with all this charm, the restaurants are not inexpensive but you can walk around the corner and save some money. A great place to soak up Rome.

Twilight is Best Time For a Visit. This is a very lively, exciting place to be. Late afternoon and early evening is when the peak is met and the vendors, street entertainers, and cafes become alluring. Linger until night and the fountains light up beautifully. I’d advise a twilight visit here—early enough to shop but late enough to see the fountains at their best. The cafes may be a little pricey. An alternative may be to visit one of the square's gelato shops and stroll around the fountains.
people watching. artists showing paintings young people playing music great place to people watch BUT beware the ristorante they over charge so much the bill came as a shock.
Loved It!. The area is great, filled with Artists and great restaurants. Especially, Cafe Barocco
Beauty and Relaxation and Culture.. Very nice place to hang out. Particularly at night. Have a bite. Have a drink.
A familiar feeling. This place is a piece of modern Rome. It is a place where lots of children could spend time with their parents, grandparents and family.

Rome in an instant. This really felt like Rome; we walked there after lunching on fruit in the Campo di Fiore, we were enjoying our gelati, we found the fountains impressive, and there were people all around but not so many we couldn't enjoy the experience.
Best piazza I. Rome. We visited here at night. There were musicians playing and singing and many artists set up in the square. Beautiful fountains. Great place!

Magical...Truly Magical. This is a breath-taking gem in a city made of wonderful spots. The Piazza is filled with resturants, cafes, and dozens of artists selling some of the most beautiful paintings. Although one must always be mindful of the pickpockets, the ubiquitous police seem to have a good grip on the petty criminals.Enjoy all of the splendor of this fabulous piazza, but be mindful of your surroundings.
Interesting gathering spot!. It was a great place to gather and see local artists sharing their work.
Classic Italy. You will feel like your in Italy visiting this square. Make sure to visit the church in front go the larger fountain in the center of the square.
This is he place to relax and put the sun glasses on. Get ready to have a cappuccino and watch the world go by, watch the artists in the square and enjoy

The More You Look, The More You See. The square can be crowded, but you don't want to just walk-by, instead you should take your time and enjoy. We went to Pizza Navona twice during our visit to Rome and had a meal there at the square. There is no comparison to what you see in the picture or movie. Although we are not convienced that the "water" element in the movie "Angels and Demons" actually took place here - the water in here does not seem to be as deep as in the movie.
Tourist trap. Worth seeing if you can see beyond the tourist trappings.

dine on the site of ancient chariot races. There are three fountains in the piazza and no less than six resturants offering outdoor dining at night. A fun place to see and be seen. Street artists put on a variety of shows including jugling, singing, mime, music.
Enjoyed an evening of shopping and dining. Highly recommend spending an evening strolling through this Piazza!! Many vendors, street perfomers, and nice cafe's and restaurants to relax at.

Pleasant surprise. I really hadn't expected much, but Piazza Navona is really interesting. Not only is the artwork and architecture outstanding, but there is plenty of dining, shopping, street vendors, and people-watching. I wish I had allotted more time to spend here.
Excellent Site to Visit. Lots of crowds and very hot in June/JulyBreathtaking

People watch. This is still the best place to sit and watch all the artists and musicians as they work away, it can be quite expensive to eat or drink here compared to the little streets all around it, but worth it at least once!
“Piazza Navona”. Very nice plaza with beautiful fountains that will take your breath away. Maybe the best plaza in all of Italy. A must see!

Alluring Destination. It's a must to not skip this destination as there is 3 alluring fountain especially in the night where the place look magnificent and romantic for couples as well. There are portrait sketching for the young and old as well as many line up of beautiful drawing available for sales

The most beautiful pedestrian square in Rome. Decorated square with fountains and elegant caffes. Here is Bernini's Fountain of the Four rivers that symbolize the four rivers on four continents: Ganges, Danube, Rio de la Plata and the Nile.
Fun night!. Great restaurants, Great atmoshere, a fun spot to take in the vibe of Rome, and get a good gelato too
An often overlooked gem. A bit off the main street but worthwhile. One of the few places where there are enough benches for a quick rest while enjoying the sites.
Excellent for people watching. Well worthy of a visit for a drink and to soak up the atmosphere on a warm Italian evening. Street artists and performers.

Artists and something different. Lots of artists and easels for sale or to have your portrait drawn. Came across a big brass band performing in the square as if a flash mob. One of the artists broke into song worthy of a stage.

Fountains and painters... Piazza Navona, Fountain of four rivers, Pantheon and Trevi Fountain all on same direction. Keep walking with the crowd and you will be visiting all these. Plazza Navona consist of 3 beautiful fountains.
Lovely area. We had lunch at the Scalini Restaurant, the food was beautiful
Piazza Navona. Rome really does Piazzas well. This one is bustling with great art, outdoor restaurants and music and art. Great meeting place and for people watching especially on a summer evening.

Magical at dusk. Go here to enjoy the atmosphere and people - try eating at Ristorante Tre Scalini - a bit touristy but good - and fun. We enjoyed. There are vendors, and artists, and fountains, cafes, people watching - beautiful architecture -made me really feel like I was in Rome...

Piazza Navona. What a great place to travel to. This is a great courtyard to still, relax, and eat great food! I wish I could remember what restaurant we ate at, but I don't! Regardless, you're in Rome. Which means great food! But this piazza has a great fountain, great restaruants, and great entertainment! If you are in Rome, do not miss out on this Piazza.I would reccomend having dinner here one night.
Finesse. The shape, the monuments, the churchs, the painters and the tourists give a special air to this very Roman piazza.

One my all-time favorite places to hang out in Rome. For the truly quintessential Roman experience, go to Piazza Navona - it looks like the Rome you've always seen in movies, magazines, and travel shows...incredibly stunning fountains with amazing statues, a beautiful church in the piazza, tons of restaurants (yes, they are touristy but so what? You are a tourist, so just go with it for once!) Strolling musicians, interesting people-watching, outdoor cafes, great gelaterias (for great gelato!) It's just really fun, day or night....
An artist's haven!. Some truly talented artists sell their art here and they're really talented! The fountains and churches on the square are also great sites to behold.

Chariots of Fire. Learn about the Piazza before you visit - and you can soak up what was an amazing period in Rome's history. Kick back in the sun and enjoy a bowl of Pasta and a glass of excellent Vino de Casa.

Beautiful fountains and nice art. Very nice plaza with beautiful fountains that will tke ur breath away. The day I was there, there were any vendors there selling art. Very reasonable priced too, a cheap lightweight souvenir that you will get to see all the time.

Perhaps the best Piazza in Italy???. Three great, ornate fountains! Exceptional Piazza with many eateries, shops and vendors. Beutiful. Enjoyed this Piazza even more than Venice's Piazza san Marco and Siena's Piazza del Campo!
GO!!!. One of Bernini's wonderful pieces. You must go see this its amazing. Its great to walk among the painters and look at their work. there is a museum near by, worth a visit.

Fun and entertaining for our family of 3 boys. We really enjoyed this piazza! Neat place (although certainly touristy) to hang out and just soak in the street culture of Rome. Great restaurants and shopping around. We enjoyed it so much during the day, we went back for an evening and had just as much fun.
Wonderful atmosphere.. The Christmas booths set up in the piazza made it a beautiful and interesting place to visit in December.

If we lived in Rome..... It would be in this area of town. Awesome vibe- many peddlers, artisans, shops and cafes. Unfortunately, also many con artists as well, but they are easily ID'ed and ignored. some of the best eats in all of Rome are in this area.
It's great to be here at sunset, where the piazza take on a new life.

Night or Day beautiful piazza. Very different ambience from day to night. During day artists show their paintings and its crowded .We found in the evening although the bars are full with people sitting out eating and drinking the area around the Bernini fountain is less crowded so we have some great photos taken in the evening with the lighting on the fountain.

A busy, noisy tourist trap. The Piazza Navona is somthing that you have to see because it is one of the famous landmarks of Rome. How satisfied you will be with the visit is something else. We stopped our walking tour around Rome in one of the pavement bars for a drink and an ice cream and remarked how the number of tourists and expensive bars had taken away a lot of the mystique of the place. Worth seeing, but not necessarily worth going to see.

Fantastic by night or day..... As the day darkens, the area flourishes with endless talented artists coming out of every nook and cranny in this delightful piazza in the heart of Rome. The piazza is full of hustle and bustle and centered around the 4 river fountain which is amazing. it's surrounded by lovely restaurants and bars. Spent hours just people watching, can't miss this of your must see list!!!
Nicest place in Rome. This is another stunning area with beautiful fountains. The square is packed with cafes and restaurants.

A must see!. Piazza Navona is one of the spots that must not be missed. I would not choose to eat at most of the restaurants directly on the square, but spending some time just wandering the square is a must whether it is your first or fortieth trip to Rome. There are always artists doing portraits or otherwise selling their wares for very reasonable prices and most of the time there is some kind of musical street performer who is very talented sharing their art. It is a wonderful place to pick up that unique souvenir which you will actually display or just spend time wandering and looking at some of the most beautiful fountains in Rome.

Amazing, I can't believe they fit boats in there.. Knowing before hand that the Romans use to have re act water battles in here, I was surprised it was so "small". The three fountains that can be found here though are beautiful and well worth the walk during an amazingly hot day in Rome.

lovely place. The Piazza Navona is a short walk from the Vatican,across the River Tiber.Cross the Tiber using the Ponte Umberto and walk straight down to the square.As you enter it ,you feel the history of the place.There are fountains in the center and eating places and bars all around the square.Be warned though,the prices in the square are a fair bit higher than just off it.

Must visit for an outdoor dining experience. This beautiful plaza is thriving with activity - among the beautiful fountains and sculptures are artists and vendors of various types in a big, rectangular open area. THe Piazza is lined by restaurants with outdoor seating and on a summer or fall evening all the restaurants are full and there is a giant, party atmosphere. You cant go wrong, I have never had a bad meal at any of the restaurants here, but "Tres Scalini" is one of our favorites. This is worth finding for a uniquely Roman dining experience.

Lively. We stayed within two blocks of here, and went every night: an ever-changing mix of artists, street performers and vendors, different every time. Two beautiful fountains and lots going on. Note: the restaurants that surround the piazza are tourist traps. Much better food (at much better prices) is available nearby. (The gelato shop just off the piazza is excellent, though.) The only drawback: very few places to sit.
Excellent!. This was our favorite place in Rome. Our family was there for 5 days, and we went twice! It was a wonderful restaurant to end our delightful trip.
Wonderful. Good if you just want to wander around. The place is an open area so you can just walk around or sit in any restaurants close by and just enjoy the ambience.

Very nice.. Visited in the day and returned at night to eat. Lovely setting and there are loads of artists selling there paintings for reasonable prices in the main part of the piazza. Very friendly and you can haggle a little with most of them, if you buy mulitple from one seller you can get a deal too. Good food, reasonable price for location.

Great atmosphere and my favourite place in Rome to eat.. Do visit the Piazza Navona especially in the evning when the place is alive with artists and musicians. It is a great place to eat even though it can be expensive. However, if you are going to treat yourself once then this is the place for me. Enjoy the atmosphere and the food assuming the weather permits.

Check out the watercolors.. One of Bernini's most famous works, the Fountain of the Four Rivers, figures prominently in Dan Brown's Angels and Demons. It is beautifully displayed in this piazza which is known for its watercolor vendors and great restaurants. A must see.

Fantastic. Brilliant atmosphere. The Neptune fountain is fantastic, better than the Trevi in my view. Restuarants quite expensive in the piazza. We went down a side street and found a the restaurants were cheaper and really good food

A great Piazza in the old city. We stayed on the River in the old city (rented a villa) and walked to almost everything, this is one of the great Piazza's to experience. Understand that all the food around the Piazza is expensive but it is a fun place to go chill day or night

The Best piazza in Rome. This piazza was formerly the chariot racing arena in Roman times, they won't be chariot racing there anymore as the Pavement cafes will get in the way of the horses, and tourists would complain if they got horse manure in their cappuccini. :)
Picturesque. After the Pantheon, we continued to Piazza Navona which was picturesque. Lunch was delicious but very expensive.

Fantastic. Cute square! The church here is beautiful and it's very romantic and makes you feel like you belong in Rome if you sit at any of the restaurants and just enjoy yourself ;) lots of beautiful art to buy also

Visit the artists. Not sure how often this occurs but both times we were there we found many artists exhibiting in the piazza. Some were wonderful, especially a man who does brilliant watercolors of the neighborhoods. The fountains are lovely, same story as Trevi - try to find a time when there are less people. Even though we had wonderful weather I imagine it would be a great spot to vitas on a rainy day.
Great atmosphere. Lots of people watching and artworks to be seen. Prices at restaurants are high but with such lovely sights, music and the general atmosphere it is worth it.
beautiful piazza. nice to people watch at night, music playing and artists selling paintings, watch for serivce charges in resturants some are expensive

The center of Rome!. After a good ride around Rome, go have an ice cream in Piazza Navona and see the night welcoming you! It´s a perfect place to believe that you are in Rome. Honestly, I don´t recommend having dinner in that restaurants, because they are so turistic, but just sit next to the fountain, take your ice cream, but first walk around and find a hidden restaurant. I am sure you will have a better experience!

Among my favorite places on earth. In the hottest Italian heat I would sit with my Gelato and marvel at Bernini's works. It is a shame there are so many peddlers and trinket pushers, but that is actually quite normal for tourist attractions in all of Europe.

Piazza????. I am left wondering what the true sense of the word piazza might be - since it seems to be more of an art(?) market than anything else. What happened to the atmosphere along the way? There was no sense of Italy here for me - maybe because of the crowds, but I think it's more than that. Maybe all the real Italians are nowhere to be seen when the city is full of tourists?

Morning visit!. Go on a morning ( before 9-30am) if possible, you miss the touts, the beggers and the crowds of tourists! You can get up close to the fountains, watch the artists setting up and enjoy a quiet coffee in many of the bars.

Statue heaven. Just the statuary is enough to make the hike from anywhere! I have always loved foutnains and small pools and the Italians do it up right. There is something so peaceful to be near water and have something stunning to ponder while you relax by it. Its a classic!

Fountain and church are magnificent.. This is another "must-see" site in Rome. The fountain "of the 4 rivers" is easier to study than most works of art in Rome as you are allowed to get closer to it than say the Trevi Fountain. The church is stunning both outside and inside. The vendors are selling a wide variety of wares from the usual tourist stuff to more intriguing art work. We found that the quality of the food in the restaurants was sub par, however. It seems that the closer to the fountain you are the worse the food gets. A crime in Italy!
Piazza Navona. On our first day to Rome, we walked through the city. We arrived at Piazza Navona and had lunch right in front of the 4 Rivers Fountain. Beautiful!

Prettiest Piazza in Rome. The energy in and around this piazza was unbelievable. The fountains were so amazing and the church (don't know the name without going back through my notes) in Piazza Navona was worth walking through.
neat area. Artwork & history! Always bustling with people, beautiful in the daytime and at night.

One of our favorite piazzas in Rome. This Piazza is large, open and has some incredible fountains. There are plenty of artists and vendors present as well but they don't bother you. The restaurants surrounding are pricey, maybe just sit for a drink and enjoy the atmosphere. We returned here a few times just to people watch and enjoy the fountains.
