If Roma, always the Navona. nice sqaure with 3 fountains and sorrunded with restaurants. At the sqare the ice cream is on good price. But the restaurtants are quite expensive
A new show every night. On our 1st night serenaded by a military band & 2 nights later the Rome Firemens band provided the entertainmnet. A classic people watching site
Second-best fountain in Roma. The main fountain is fab and it's very lively. But there's not a whole lot else to see. Nice place for lunch, if a bit of a tourist trap.

Place for art. We like to purchase original art when travelling and Piazza Navona had about 40 or 50 artists with original oils and watercolors among other things set up in little booths all over. And that was on a Monday! There are two very nice fountains as well with gelato shops and restaurants all over as well as the typical trinket shops. Definitely worth a visit and much more to look at than Trevi, especially if you want to purchase something.
Wonderful square on the way to Campo del Fiori. Great statues, space, qonderful buildings, restaurants, buzzes at night.

Loved the area. We visited this piazza late one night. the piazza is lovely and the fountains are just gorgeous. The atmosphere in the piazza was very festive. There were still many artists and vendors with booths set up. Sant'Angese in Agone was such a beautiful church; there was a service going on, so we didn't get to walk around admiring the interior. A must to see when visiting Rome!
Not to be missed. Great atmosphere, more room to move, nice bars and restaurants with friendly staff. Rome truly is beautiful and Piazza Navona sums it up.
Interesting but pricey. The square itself is interesting and the entertainment is fun. However the restaurants are all over priced with decent food. Plenty of better places to eat in Rome.

must see place in rome. If you have read Dan Brown then this piazza will interest you. Even otherwise it is a divine place especially in the evening. Great architecture and fountains. A lot of restaurants here, on the expensive side although you can find good ones in the side streets which are full of character.
Wonderful. Great restaurants and market stalls. Great photo opportunities and a lovely place to sit and watch the world go by while having a nice meal or just a cold drink.
Not crowded in the morning. We enjoyed walking through the Piazza in the morning when the artists and cafes were opening up.

Beautiful by day and night. A great place to sit and watch the world go by. There are artists offering portraits or caricatures and also water colours of places of interest. By night musicians play and the outside restaurants take on a new look.

Fun. If you go to Piazza Navona in Dec Jan they sell the best Nougat there. But in the spring that is may you get to see the flowers. It is best to sit there on the steps in the evening and watch the world go by
Beautiful in the evening. but hot, hot, hot in the summer. Lots of artists and folks just hanging out.
beautiful, best at night. Had lunch there, and also went back in the evening. So much to see, including great people watching!
Pretty. This was a nice part of town. A great piazza with great fountain.

fountains are underwhelming, but the piazza is lovely. personally, i'm an avid fountain lover, and there is something about the fountains at piazza navona (there are two separate fountains) that is just ... underwhelming. with that said, the square itself has a lot to offer. the first time i visited, in december 2011, there was a special christmas market in the square selling trinkets and various seasonal items. we had heard that it's one of the best places to go to get the christmas feel in rome, and that was true. when i went back recently, in june 2012, there were painters lining the piazza selling their original work. piazza navona is certainly a beautiful place, and one of the must-sees in Roma.
Stunning. Beautiful say and had lunch here first day in Rome little expensive but you're paying for the beautiful setting

Piazza Navona and Le Tartufo. Piazza Navona is beautiful in and of itself. A very large Piazza with three beautiful fountains, lots of local artists and a great energy. But if you go to Piazza Navona, be sure to have the Tartufo at Tre Scalini - it's a must. Sit outside, enjoy the views, and delight in chocolate! And if you plan to purchase art from local artists, this is one of the best places to do it. Lots of great choices.
Art area. Art area and restaurant area for the now who love music, art and people

Beautiful !. A beautiful suqare with three of the largest fountains in Rome. Very popular with the tourists and Italians and lots going on. A great place to people watch from one of the cafe bars around the square or to enjoy an ice-cream. Cafe bars around the square are a little expensive though.

Just Italy!. Try and get there early in the morning to avoid the crowds for some beautiful photos. If you can't, don't worry, it is still a beautiful piazza which is teeming with life. The restaurants are not bad but if you walk a short way out of the piazza you will be rewarded with some great places to eat.

Very Charming. Very charming place, especially in the evening when it's cooler. The performers and artists tend to set up shop then. Lots of restaurants around, nice place to eat and watch the performers or tourists. The 3 fountains are also nice for photos.

Best Piazza. This piazza has a history which included Domitian Circus and chariot races, and the palazzo of Pope Innocent's family, and the duel towered St Agnes which dominates the piazza. the three fountains are worth the trip, and the four rivers in the middle is a Bernini gem.
Spend an hour there!. Beautiful long rectangular square, statues, fountains, lots of life painters resturants etc. Must be seen when visiting Rome.
Fantastic Square. Everything, the square was a hub of activity, there was plenty of stalls to buy things and cafe's all around, you just get lost in all of this and more.
Beware of drinks prices. We had 2small pots of tea in a restaurant in Piazza Navona. We paid 16 euros for it. They charge extra for hot water, so beware!!
Great for food and atmosphere. The restaurants around Piazza Navona provide an excellent place to eat / drink an enjoy the culture and atmosphere of this special place

Great place to chill out. You can spend a couple of hours here easy! One of the murder scenes in Dan Brown's novel Angels and Demons. Artists, street entertainers and the restaurants are not as expensive as the experts will have you believe. Time you visit to eat here or just have a beer. The Pantheon just a couple of minutes way.
The fountains make this a must see.. The three fountains are beautiful and make great photos. St Agnes is worth going in also.

Navona at night. We visited the Piazza Navona on the night Segway Tour and it was magical! A must on any visit to Rome! We had a warm evening and music was playing from a party at the Brazillian Embasy. Artists were painting. Kids playing and laughing. So much fun!
Fun place at night. Great people watching and a fun place to hang out after dinner. Very lively.
Laid back. Be sure to visit the church there; quiet, cool and laidback...
Piazza Navona. A Must see! Beautiful. Bernini Fountain of the 4 Rivers is outstanding

Cool place.. Many vendors and music, painters, and also the trash. Wear comfortable shoes, drink water, beware of over priced restaurants and cafe's; beware of the service charge, look at the menus and and check to see if they take charge cards; some only cash.

Must do!. The Piazza Navano is excellent. We were there on a Sunday (i think) and there were many artists (some selling originals, many not) set up. There was a great atomsphere with street performers and many people about. The restaurants all seemed slightly overpriced but you can really put a price on being able to sit back and soak up the atmosphere. I recommend going for a walk in the many side streets off the Piazza. We spent the day just getting lost around this area and it really made out trip.

Historical Arena - Now a Beautiful Square. A great way to spend a romantic evening walking the square, admiring the sculptured fountains and eating in one of the wonderful sidewalk cafes. Lots always going on in the square.
My sister loves it; I endure it. Great sculptures but way too filled with touristy things. I only go there to humor my sis.
Great place to eat and people watch. great square to eat, drink, people watch and be entertained by street entertainers.

LOVED IT!. Amazing piazza! With three fountains and lots of flowers. People selling great pictures there.
Restaurant located there are good but very expensive.
Would reccomend it for just walking around and taking pictures but not for eating

Lovely spot to include in a stroll or for a mooch.. Obviously expensive to eat/drink there, but we weren't hurried so quite nice to sit with a drink and watch for a while. Nice to go both night and day.
so Rome!. Fantastic place to spend a nice evening with some gelato or a glass of wine. The piazza is full of restaurants but very expensive!
Beatiful. The fountain and statue are beatiful. And the piazza is a lot bigger than we thought! You must visit it before leaving Rome

A special place.... Piazza Navona to me is like no other... The fountains, the church, the restaurants, the artists, I could go on and on. Great for people watching.... go with time and take it all in.
beautiful. don't miss the rooftop terrace with panoramic views for a drink/snack at the Hotel Raphael in this area.

Interesting. This is a interesting Piazza. The restaurants surrounding it are extremely overpriced so skip them and walk 1/2 block away to eat.
But the vendors and artists in the Piazza are worth seeing.

Beautiful Piazza Navona. We visited Piazza Navona on a Sunday. The fountains are exceptionnally beautiful. I could not stop taking pictures because everywhere I was looking it was beautiful. We visited the church of St-Agnes and it's not to be missed. Then we visited the painting stands. They were as nice from one to the other. We had an excellent brunch in one of the restaurants,(Vacanze Romano). There was also a person playing accordeon, she was excellent. The ambiance was Grand.

Fun Time Eating and Family Sketches. Navona Square is a nice place to include in your sight seeing for dinner and having your children's sketch done. We had a couple of good thin crust pizzas at Tucci and while very touristy, the setting was perfect.

A brief look @ Piazza Navona. I loved Rome and all it's Piazza's. Due to time contraints and only a day to visit we unfortunately did not get to spend much time here, but walked past very fleetingly. Would love to visit again and spend more time. Lovely fountain here.
Great. Great place to eat and walk around lots of places to eat

Preferred Jewel. Another outdoor masterpiece, but not scary crowds like Trevi. Find the statue who, urban legend has it, is cowering in fear that the adjacent building will topple on him. The sculptor and the architect were enemies according to the story.

Good place to visit. nice place to visit, with many restaurants in the area, spend a good bit of time just relaxing, taking in the views, having a pizza and taking a few photos.
very close to the pantheon and 15 - 20 mins walk from the Vatican.
Crowded, but a must-see.. Full of people, artists, musicians and merchants, this is a essential stop on a tour of Rome. The Bernini fountain is beautiful.

Touristy, but Worth a Visit. This is one of the second tier tourist sites for those in Rome for a few days. Sure, there are vendors hawking the latest toy, but focus on the "Four Rivers" fountain, performance artists, and people-watching. (Just be aware of who is around you.) At night the piazza comes alive with musicians and art vendors. Some of the art is good, but a lot is of a middling quality for tourists. Don't be afraid to negotiate. You'll pay a premium for food and drink, especially if you sit outside, but it might be worth it for you. Just be aware that Piazza Navona is prime real estate.

Watch the world go by.... Great place to observe people and police. Busy, bustling area that made you really appreciate where you were have a gelatin, even n winter and just be a part of this amazing experience.

A nice place to people watch. Lots of tourists restaurants and gypsies selling things (watch your pocket), but a nice place to just hang out and relax. Have your picture taken at the fountain that was in the Da Vinci code.

Very crowded. This had changed a lot since our last visit. Very crowded and too many stalls selling the same products. Restaurants compete for you patronage. This can be annoying. But it is still worth seeing.
Lovely spot for coffee or an icecream. It was 40 degrees when I was here in June... Totally sweltering but a lovely spot to sit and people watch, drinking ice-cold coke and icecreams!

Stop and have lunch. Lovely place to sit and people watch. We had a nice lunch - it was a little pricey for what it was but very enjoyable just to take the weight off your feet, have a lovely cold beer and we were not hurried to move on. The fountain is interesting too but find out about it before you go so you can enjoy just looking.
Fun place to shop. Lots of shops and street artists, musicians, cafes. Great place to people-watch!
nice place. the worst thing in rome is a lot of free sellers from asia urge you to buy thier products
Very nice. This is a great place to have a rest, sit by a fountain, and maybe have a meal or gelato. Very nice...
See the sights avoid the restaurants. Very touristy but worth seeing the historical sights. AVOID any restaurants which are all a price rip off and not good quality.
Overrated. Full of tourists and touristy restaurants. Walk through and move on. Watch your bag!

OUR FAVORITE. What a wonderful place to wander around and eat at. We ate meals at three different restaurants there and loved all of them. The prices were very reasonable and the ambiance is just so relaxing. Waiters all spoke and understood English which was so helpful.There are lots of musicians there and the sounds are wonderful. Had GREAT gellato there (on the corner as you enter the Piazza, It was an area we went to every day.

Fabulous. It may be a piazza but it's not square! The large rectangular shaped area has the most amazing fountain in the centre with two smaller ones either side. The statues in the fountain are so detailed and are absolutely huge. Plenty of places to eat and drink whilst you're admiring the view!

As you leave go towards the left!. We had to hop on two different buses to get here and when we did my husband says "is this it?" unfortunately it's not all that. A lot of surrounding restaurants. We walked up to the fountain, had a squizz, took a photo and that's pretty much it. You can hang around and people watch a little, it's nowhere near as busy as Trevi Fountain. I can absolutely swear by the street as you leave and it's on the left. We found the best restaurant, the best souvenir shop, the best gelato & the BEST chocolate store!
Interesting find. Fun little find with music and artists. True taste of Roman culture and makes me feel giddy just thinking about it.

A place to people watch!. After Trevie Fountain you will love the numberous fountains and the shopping in this area was great. I especially like L'Artigianato. A great variety of souvenirs and we had a great meal at Tucci!

Beautiful Evenings. We thoroughly enjoyed the piazza during the evenings when we could relax over a great dinner, view the wares of the artists, enjoy the people watching as well as the ever changing entertainers that came and went; would definitely stay in this same area of Rome again just to be near the Piazza and all it offers. Don't overlook the church on the piazza - beautiful

Probably One of (If Not) the Best Piazza(s) in Italy. It's my opinion of course but I could probably spend the day in this Piazza. We went early, went to mass at St,Agnes in Agone and then had lunch in one of the many restaurants. I think the restaurant was called Il Tartufo. We spent several hours just relaxing, people watching, eating, etc. You have to visit Piazza Navona. Of course, you have to end it with a Gelato which there are plenty to choose from.
Beautiful at night..... But very crowded, i.e., touristy! The restaurants that line the piazza are very expensive, so be forewarned! It is entertaining so don't miss.
Evenings a must.. A very exciting place to visit in the evening so busy with so much going on and a fabulous fountain.

Stunning Piazza -- so much to see!. The Piazza Navona is filled with everything that makes Rome amazing -- beautiful architecture, a gorgeous fountain, colorful shops, numerous restaurants and a huge caravan of local artists painting and selling their works in the middle of the square. Not to be rushed through -- give yourselves time to wander!
Crowded. Too crowded and with overpriced restaurants. Only the central fountain was working.

What's the big deal?. I suppose if you've never been away from home, this place might seem lovely & exotic, but seasoned travelers will find it run of the mill and touristy as we did. We couldn't see what all the raves were about.
Lively at Night. A beautiful square during the day, but at night it comes alive! There are a lot of street performers and artists displaying their wares.

Amazing. Amazing square, full of history and art!
The Fontain of Bernini is the best and the bar, near the square, had something special!
Beautiful. Sort of a little art enclave. Artists set up their work for you to purchase, people sitting around the fountains, The vendors haven't overly commercialized it. Still very nice.

Stop for a while. A lovely place to stop and take in the atmosphere. Plenty going on, street artists, stalls, paintings etc Avoid the restuarants here as you pay a premium for where you are, just venture a few streets away for better prices. Visit before or after the heat of the day as its impossible to avoid the sun here.

Stunning - especially at night. What more can you say about a Piazza which has 3 great fountains - 2 by Bernini. The fountains are even more spectacular at night when the whole Piazza if filled with people.
Lovely. Beautiful fountains in beautiful piazza right in the heart of things, must see when in Rome.

My favorite!. Of the long list of attractions in Rome, Piazza Navona was my favorite. I could stay here forever. The fountains are beautiful, the artists are charming, the restaurants are yummy and friendly (ok, completely touristy - but then I was a tourist!). I just loved the feel and the vibe of the Piazza.
Very vivid and colourful. Love this place too, have a coffee and chill out looking at the fountain. Read about their history and enjoy the dolce vita way of life.

Active piazza with lots to see. Besides the beautiful fountains this piazza is also bursting with life and close to a great gelateria ( gelateria del teatro).
Nice place to stroll, go for a drink and do some proper peoplewatching.
Great. Very inteerating place to visit with many local artist showing there wears. Beautiful Place
People watching. Quite a good little spot to simply sit around and people watch. This is also a great meeting point. Plenty of interesting buskers set up in this area too.
Great Cultural Site. Tre Scalini and a Tartufo, sitting and watching people and street scene, fabulous
Gorgeous Plaza. This place just draws you in. The restaurants on the plaza are touristy so choose one one side streets for best food and value.

A Must see while in Rome. You haven't experienced the true essence of Rome until you have enjoyed the artwork featured during open air market in mid-afternoon, or an enchanting dinner after sunset at the Piazza Navona. A short walk(with Gelato in hand ofcourse) from the Pantheon.
Pretty as a picture. Great eateries in the back-streets, much cheaper than the restaurants on the piazza itself and worth a little explore to go find something to your taste.
Lovely and Romantic. The most beautiful piazza of Rome. Lovely and romantic.

Lovely atmosphere. It is well worth going for a meal here a little more expensive than other restaurants in Rome (approx. 60 EUR for two people, one course, with house wine) but it is well worth it for the atmosphere and surroundings. You can sit right by the fountain in the centre. On the evening that we were there, there was a fantastic guitarist playing music while we ate. It was just one of those memorable nights, just what you dream Rome will be like.
excellent. third time here and always our focal point. great entertainment and great food.
Crowded marketplace. Interesting to walk through. Nice little restaurants in the neighborhood - but get outside of the piazza.

Great for people watching.. The piazza itself is surrounded by gorgeous buildings and the central area where the fountains are is filled with a very touristy market - lots of hawkers too. We sat to one side and just enjoyed the spectacle for half an hour...
Disappointed. As with all the tourist spots in Rome it is just too packed with tourist (I realize I'm one of them). But there's art, music, mimes, artist and very expensive restaurants.

Went there twice. That's how much we loved it. Bernini's Quatro Fiumi fountain is gorgeous, but I am partial as I LOVE Bernini's work. There are 2 other, small, fountains in the piazza, but they pale in comparison. A definite MUST for Rome, an preferably at night.

Nice, Beautiful, Relaxing Area. We enjoyed the Piazza Navona very much. Its probably the nicest fountain in Rome after the Trevi. Again, beautiful Bernini sculptures. Not sure anything quite compares to his work. Beautiful church adjacent the fountain. Pretty sure this was the backdrop for the movie, "When In Rome". We sat at an outdoor table and had lunch at a restaurant right next to the fountain. Was a nice relaxing way to have lunch and enjoy the fountain and sights. Not to mention maybe the best lasagna and fettucini alfredo we've ever had. If you hit it at the right time, there might even be a touch of romance in the air. Enjoy.
great place to visit. especially on Sundays - wonderful market and at night for dinner
beautiful and very lively. Great time, area is full of local resturants and local artist. Very tourist, but had good time at the trevi fountain area.
Beautiful. So many lovcely picturesque Piazzas in Rome & this is just one of them. Very special.

Have plenty of time. Beautiful fountains and interesting area just hard to get to was a very long walk but saw a lot of neighborhood areas and the way real people live not that many tourist. Cafe's all over square but diffenently pricey-just sat and enjoyed coffee. Took taxie back to far to walk again.

Beautiful. We stumbled upon this Piazza whilst looking for The Pantheon and were breathtaken. It is fantastic, and as there are very few things to do in Rome that are free - you could easily spend an hour wandering around here and find a spot to relax and people watch for a while.The fountains are amazing and so detailed - trying to spot different people in the carvings was really interesting.

Good food and lot of artists. We had our accomondation (Palazzo Olivia) right next to Piazza Navona. Piazza Navona offered daytime caffeterias, restaurants for lunch, ice-cream, and artists with paintings and self performance. Square also has two fountains, one of them beeing very impressive. In the evening square turns into meeting place around fountains and from hungry tourists looking menus of tens of restaurants reaching to the square. Food at the Piazza navona is average priced, caffeterias quite expencive (e.g. small Cappuccino 6€/$8). In the evening restaurants are filled with rich mini-adults (teens), dressed for the red carpet. ;)
Charming. Very pretty, busy with people but still a delight, lovely fountain

Lovely PIAZZA. Amazing artwork and fountains, lovely to walk around and admire - near to the PantheonOnly issue the christmas market stalls where there when we visited so we couldnt get a full view of the piazza/square without stalls thereBut worth a visit- we went Nov/Dec 2011 and after 1030hrs in the morning went very hot/humid - very sunnyLovely to eat gelato's in the square in November!
A great meeting point full of artistes and cares. Lively both by day and by night, surrounded by eateries within and also in small streets surrounding the area.

Beautiful buildings, fountains, artists at work, food. A must. Piazza Navona brings all of Rome's elements together in a wonderful setting. It's a great place to end your day -- just hang out watching the performers and artists and the people. Truly a favorite.

Amazing Fountain and Plaza. Piazza Navona is a city square in Rome built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian, built in the first century AD. The ancient Romans came there to watch competitions. In the center is Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi or Fountain of the Four Rivers (1651) by Gian Lorenzo Bernini. On top of the fountain is the Obelisk of Domitian, brought in pieces from the Circus of Maxentius. This is a good place to go with family and friends to eat at a restaurant and enjoy views of the fountain and the artists and people who are nearby.
Slice of Italy. One of the most authentic, and less crowded of the piazzas. Nice place to take a break.
A beautiful square. This is a beautiful square, in it you find painters busy with their art and lovely fountains and buildings. It's really well worth a visit.

great nightlife scene. Fun to watch the spray artists and musicians. We enjoyed a drink here every evening in one of the outdoor cafes. Try a caipirinha! Expensive, but good. The entertainment--crowds walking by and buskers--is free. The gelato isn't bad, either.

Just plain lovely, great art and fountains, pricey drinks. Piazza Navona was once used as a type of colosseum, filled with water, and used for naval battle spectacles. The original sits literally under the current piazza and can be visited by special arrangement. In the evenings on the piazza, local artists ply their works, largely oil paintings some of which are sincerely impressive. The fountains are amazing. Several excellent restaurants are walkable. Dining and drinks are less expensive off of the main piazza on any of the interesting side streets. Favorite place in Rome.
perfect place. Just perfect with lots of people, music, artists. Great place to stay at night!

A feast for the senses. Piazza Navona is a treat for the senses no matter what time of the day you visit. During the day, the place is filled with people from all over the world. It is a great place to sip a beverage in one of the many cafe's and people watch while listening to many types of music. Or, stroll amid the artists and street performers. At night, Piazza Navona is a place for lovers of all ages. The light and atmosphere encourage hand holding while strolling around the magnificent fountains, artists, and restaurants. One of my favorite places in the world.
Lovely and lively. Go there on a warm evening, you won't regret it. Painters, artists of all kind and a lot of other tourists milling around - worth for the atmosphere

Interesting Piazza... wander a few streets within to eat. While navigating through the tourists was a bit cumbersome, we enjoyed the piazza very much. We made the mistake of eating at one of the restaurants (don't remember the name) and regretted it very much... It's much better to wander into the area a bit and find some other place for a meal.
Must see. Fantastic place to spend an afternoon, have lunch, or a great dinner, just be ready to be robbed even for bread at the restaurants. But when in Rome ........

Fun in the sun.... Had a great time in this Piazza. Like most Piazza's people watching is fun while sipping on a Campari and soda or glass of wine. We were entertained one day for one of the comedians performing in the Piazza.......he was hysterical and kept the crowds chuckling for an hour......
Large square with beautiful fountains.. This was like walking into a picture. The fountains and buildings were beautiful and the people watching was fun. Be aware of your surroundings though. :D
Picturesque. A lovely square...full of atists wth their paintings at the time of our visit. Extremely pricey to eat & drink there though.
Must see in Italy. This was such a great place to take in the Italian culture, see beautiful buildings and sculptures as well having a great meal.

Tourist trap. Don't waste you money at the cafes, even if your travel agent has given you a 'free excursion'. Lots of excellent sculpture and architecture all round. Some is obscure and I'm not telling you about that...

Go back and back again. We liked this square best at night. Musicians and street theatre, though much of the artwork on display was the same from stall to stall ... and all over Rome, to be honest! We found an original artist and bought a small painting from him for a good price.

Not what I expected. One of the many piazzas in Rome which others had told me to visit. I did not find it very impressive. It is just a large square with restaurants on one side and the regular dose of sculptures. The only interesting aspect were the many painters who were showcasing their talents.

Huge square with an abundance of fountains and tourists. This is a popular square...actually it's a large rectangle as it's built on top of an ancient sports stadium, with the Fountain of the Four Rivers smack in the centre of it. There are also two other fountains at either end.This place is happening at all times of day, but especially at night with restaurants surrounding it on all sides. A Rome must-see.
Atmosphere. Just as good in the day or night for drinking in this large space full of amazing buildings and fountains.

Best Piazza at night. Better than the Trevi fountain where people just sit and stare, this piazza has dining, a Cathedral to look at and the Pantheon.
Plus it used to be a chariot racetrack. Best at night. Much better at night;

Best Piazza in Rome. Piazza Navona was our favorite piazza in Rome. There were lots of cages for lunch, cappacinos, glass of chianti and people watching. Great place to buy oil paintings of Italy from original artists. Beautiful fountains.
Must see. The art work is expensive but your in Rome! If you bargain you can get a buy, don't jump.
Very Cute!. It a very colorful piazza and extremely cute! I loved it!
fun!. It was nice sitting at a cafe, enjoying a Tartufo and a pizza - very touristy, yet very nice and somewhat very Roman!

dissapointing food. food and wine was mediocre, although the outside dining set-up was lovely. look for "tourist" meal deals (eg, an appetizer of brushetta, plus a big margarita pizza, plus a glass of wine for 15 euro). Not much to see around here at all.

Typical Italian square, only rectangular. The interesting fountain in the centre is about the only thing that distinguishes Piazza Navona from any other square we saw in Italy. Other than that it has completely succumbed to tourist cafes and art sellers. Take a walk through as you stroll through Rome but there are nicer places to linger. The famous Tartufo was fine but a gelato from one of the famous gelateria in the neighbourhood is better and cheaper.
A hive of activity. Lovely area of the city to visit and great to spend some time watching the world go by and the street sellers are great and bring atmosphere to the place.
Nice walk. This is a great place to find good sidewalk restaurants. On a cool summer evening you might find a lot of artists working. The Panteon is a short walk just a few blocks away.
Beautiful. Fountains are amazing but as they've been cleaned so much they're best seen at night.

A Center of Activity. We went there on Sunday May 27 about 4:00pm. There were two lovely fountains and about 100 artists all selling their art work. I wasn't sure if they were really originals and I had the idea they weren't actually the artists in some cases, but it was all fun to see. There were also some street characters posing and some musicians. I can see why people would hang out there and just people watch. We almost ate there, as there were any number of Pizza type restaurants or just regular ones, but we really weren't hungry so walked on.

Part of the Roma experience.... Try to see what vendors and events will be happening in the Piazza, if you like the vendors this could be a few hours, otherwise it is a walkthrough onto another destination.

Go!. I embarked on the Heart of Rome walk (self-guided and recommended in Rick Steve's Rome book) and when i came upon Piazza Navona, i lingered longer than planned. The piazza is big. Plenty of room for all the ppl strolling through. You can look at/buy art in the piazza center or have your picture drawn. Plenty of places to eat/drink along the way.
Expensive. Lovely piazza. Typically Italian were you could spend hours watching the world go by but very expensive to eat and drink.

Lots of art for sale. Has a very pretty fountain in the middle of a large piazza. There are tons of artists selling paintings, etc. all throughout the piazza. Also has a lot of good restaurants around the outside of the piazza. Worth a stop on your walk to the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. Signs on the corners of the buildings will point you in the right direction.

Alaways Tingle as I walk into the Piazza. If I was a multi-millionaire I would have a flat overlooking this Piazza - it is wonderful. The Bernini sculptures and the fountains are masterpieces and of course the artists and surrounding restaurants, ice cream parlours, and bars only add colour and character. It a must do when in Rome.

By our hotel - great location. Great place to watch people, the fountains are wonderful, and have such history. We walked through this area 3-4 times as our apartment was nearby. The history is really cool and we visited the Museum Rome at the south end. Lots of old pictures and paintings of how the piazza use to be. Recommend both the piazza and the museum. Only negative was the high pressure junk sellers, not the art but the junk toys.

My Favorite Cafe Piazza. Go the Piazza for dinner at one of the many cafes that offer could quality food (didn't say cheap, nothing is cheap in Rome). There are artists on the Piazza selling paintings, sketches, etc and is relaxing just to stroll through checking it all out. And if you are a people watcher, this is your place. Get a table in the front and let the show begin!

Fun place. Unlike the piazza del popolo & campo fiore, there's wide spaces to saunter about. The 4 rivers piece is magnificent, the Del Moro fountains on the side are good. The sidewalk cafes & vendors selling art as well as the performance artists made it our favorite place to wind down for a drink or gelato snack at the end of the day. It is right in the center of Rome.
Great place to people watch & have a drink or dinner.. Nice, safe piazza to have dinner, drinks or just hang out. Lots of good options. Good for all ages.
Fantastic area to watch the world go by. Sit and have a coffee or glass of wine in a marvelous Italian Piazza. Even in the rain it shines.

Great Place for Art!. We loved this place so much that we went here twice on our 3 day visit. The art sold here is amazing and very well priced. The fountain in the middle of the piazza is beautiful. Do not miss this beautiful piazza, especially if you want to buy any art!

Can't miss site in Rome. Fantastic people-watching, cheesy caricature artists, fountains to take photos in front of. It's a must-see hangout spot in Rome. Grab a gelati and wander around or visit some of the great restaurants located just behind the Piazza.

Beautiful!. A typical Italian square with a wonderful buzz. There are street artists, restaurants, gelataria.
We loved it!
cool square. plenty of space and places to relax and people watch
It's not a square, it's not a circle - it's a rectangle!. Great sculptures by Bernini, but difficult to get shade!
great people watching. enjoy a coffee or glass of wine at one of outdoor restaurants and watch the art vendors and tourists. Expensive for a drink

Great after dark atmosphere. This is a great place to visit late afternoon, have a coffee and watch the world go by. Or after dinner, there are lots of people just wandering around, buskers, aerosol artists to watch, caricaturists, and stalls selling art. A terrific gelato shop is just on the corner. The restaurants are a bit pricey, better to eat at one of the little places in the narrow streets running off the Piazza, and then return for a walk after dinner.

Fun piazza. We enjoyed looking at the fountain, eating dinner, and watching everyone. A nice place to hang out and watch. We met friendly people at the restaurant and enjoyed our meal. See review of ai tarfutti.

Helpful tip. We visited the Piazza Navona (one of our favorite places in Rome) in early June. Avoid the restaurants there. The food is mediocre. We also took the bicycle ride from there to the Trevi
Fountain. What a treat; the gentleman provided historical
information and was entertaining. Try it; you'll like it.

Don't miss. Easy cab drop off and pick up at the head of the piazza. Great restaurants, fountains and sights. At Christmas time a must visit, roasted walnuts and Crech scene vendors. A short walk to the Pantheon and Trevi fountain. A truly unique experience.
Average. Had read that there was great shopping here, with market vendors but it was all the same just people selling paintings. Nice little Piazza though

Breathtaking BEAUTIFUL Piazza that is so vibrant!. This is one of my all time favorite Piazza's in Europe. Always vibrant and so incredibly beautiful. It's always full of people. Gorgeous water fountains and incredible architecture. There are many restaurants surrounding the Piazza but typically the food isn't the greatest in these touristy places but it's GREAT to get a drink or have coffee and watch the incredible scenery.There is always so much going on and there are some amazing sketch artists that are sketching people. It's always fun to watch them and their amazing skills. Definitely a MUST visit when in Rome.

Enjoyable place for dinner and people watching. We went to the Piazza to meet out tour guide from Context tours. It was a wonderfully buzzing square (or long horseshoe) we ate at the first cafe on the left (facing the rounded end and enjoyed the food.
Evening haunt. Great place to spend an evening having a coffee or a meal, watching the musicians, tourists and locals

lovely square. large square on site of ancient theatre. lovely fountains. very touristy. full of very pushy sellers which gets very annoying. best have a quick look then move on to nearby Campo Dei'Fiori which is less tourisy and cheaper for eating & drinking.

Big open Plaza. The plaza is home to three fountains, the largest is the Fountain of Four Rivers. Very impressive statues on the fountain, of the four major rivers known at the time, Nile, Danube, Ganges and Plata d Ora. The artists here are selling paintings and prints from the banal to some very good pieces of art. Here and the top of the Spanish Steps had some of the best tourist art I found.

Best area to stay !!. My family rented an apt a block from the Piazza. Best decision I made for our stay. My sons loved it! It was fun and busy and quaint. Felt great to get away from the crowds and the busy areas like Trevi and Spanish steps. If you want a more village feel, Piazza Navona is for you. Also close to Trastevere, bonus!

Another "must see" in Rome. Ok, it's touristy, but OMG, this is my favorite piazza in Rome. A few years ago when I was in Rome with my daughter, we set out early in the morning and arrived at the Piazza when there were just a few people out and a few strudents rushing to school. It was a blissfully peaceful way to see the scope of the piazza and enjoy the beautiful fountains and architecture. My most recent visit was with friends and we went after dinner and of course it was crawling with people and open cafes stuffed to the gills. Of course we had to have a glass of champagne and a tartuffo at Il Tre Scalini. So pick you favorite way to see it, but do see it!
Great people watching. Day or night, this is a wonderful spot for people watching. If the weather is nice, love having an outdoor aperitivo!

Bellissimo Piazza Navona!. Beautiful or bella, no matter how you say it, make sure you visit Piazza Navona on in Italy. Most people would be crazy not to, but it is close to all of the major sites (Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps). I wouldn't do a meal there, just a nice cocktail and enjoy the people watching.
Love going here. We always love going here. Many artists are set up in the middle and their work is very nice and usually a good price.
Enchanting. Great place for dinner and people watching. I love when the musicians come out and all the artists are in their prime.

Take a stroll!. Just take a leisurely stroll all around the Piazza Navona if for no other reason but to see the wonderous fountains! Everyone is out taking a walk and looking for a great restaurant. If you have never gone to Tartufo, it is a must stop for desert and coffee. The local street performers always come up with something new and the shops on the outskirts of the Piazza are charming.
Very pretty. Go see it, it's beautiful. There's nothing to dislike, just go check it out.

Pure tourist. Loved Rome - don't like being intimidated by restaurant owners standing in the street pressuring you to eat in there establishments when looking at the menu or simply walking past the restaurant

The best 'hang' spot in town. This place just 'feels' like Rome. Everyone needs to go there, hang ut over a glass of beer or wine and people watch. Also- Bernini's fountain is amongst the best pieces of art in Rome.
Great fountain of Bernini. Bernini really was a genious - this fountain proves that. It is very detailed and stood up against the test of time

Great place to visit. This place was packed when we visited - the fountains are fantastic, but on top of that its crammed full with artists, some just displaying their work for sale, whilst others are painting. We bought a colosseum work from a man who worked in spray paints and created it in front of a watching crowd. Could have stayed for ages.
A Blast!. This is a touristy area but was a lot of fun for dinner and gelato.
Piazza Navona. The fountains are lovely, interesting street entertainers too
Great Fun. The fountains were wonderful and the square a buzz with artists, human statuesw bars and restaurants, don't miss it
Bustling.. Very good American bar around the corner and a couple of decent restaurants, they're the ones without someone trying to entice you in.

Beautiful, classic Roman piazza. Great spot for people-watching, art, lunch. Lots of foreigners hawking toys. Counterfit bills received as change at Libreria Spagnola (cute book store). Come here to absorb the large, traditional square with church, fountains, pretty lighting at night, but spend your money elsewhere for a better value.
must see. Google it. Look at the maps, its a must see...its in a great location to branch out and see all the things around it. just go.
Lots of art. Big square, restaurants, market in the middle with lots of local art. Lots of street sellers too but they were not too pushy. Street performers, gelato, something for everyone.

Great spot. Atmospheric piazza in great location in historic area of the city. Many restaurants with outdoor dining to be able to soak up and enjoy the atmosphere and enjoy excellent food and company. Artists display their works here and musicians entertain you whilst you enjoy a glass of prosecco or peroni, the local beer.The ice cream is also very good and sitting by the fountain on a sunny afternoon is really quite idyllic!
One of the best Piazza in Rome. There is a reason why it's touristy. It's because it's one of the most beautiful Piazza in Room.
Artistic. Full of artists during the summer months. So good some not so good lol... Avoid having coffee here as its expensive.
Loved it!. This beautiful piazza is a great escape from the noise and chaos of Roman traffic. I love the restaurants situated around it and the fountains are gorgeous.

Most beautiful piazza in Rome. Spacious plaza with three beautiful fountains, surrounded by restaurants. Even with Saturday crowds, never felt claustrophobic like other popular sites. Brazilian embassy is in the piazza.
Splendid!. Eat, drink and people watch! A great palce to try the local cuisine, wine and watch the world go by.
Classic square in Rome. Great place for a coffe or ice cram and watch the world go by.
great eveing stroll with lots to see. great square - loads of artists and entertainment - restaurants not that much more expensive than the surrounding streets
Great Entertainment. Wow apart from the actual statues, the piazza was full of entertainers who really created an atmosphere in the square.

Great atmosphere. We loved this square. Love the fountain in the centre of it. It is surrounded by many restaurants, with waiters encouraging you to enter. We ate twice at the restaurants there, and although a bit pricey, the food and service in both of them was excellent. Recommend a visit, even if it is just to sit and watch the world go by.

A Must See Early in the Morning. Our tour guide got us there early in the morning - about 9 AM. The light was beautiful, there were very few tourists, but all of the vendors were setting up. I bought a couple of paintings and really love them.
Bernini brilliance. Worth a visit but beware the hawkers, some good restaurants nearby.
Pretty but pricey. Pretty square but the restaurants are clearly aimed at tourists as they're expensive.

A wonderful place to people watch. When in Rome..... it is a must to sit and while away some time watching people go by. This is a lovely place, but as with all very popular places you have to accept that the food and drinks are higher in price. Best to eat outside the piazza and then sit with a coffee/beer/wine and relax.
Great. We loved this square. It is strategically located and has a lot of action in it. We loved looking through all the art. We even bought an original oil here!

This is Rome. As you walk through, relax and watch: the artists, the street vendors with the sillier stuff they try to sell you every year, the maitre'ds trying to entice you to enter their restaurant, the hundreds of other tourists who are stunned by the attack on your senses, and the locals who breeze by as a part of their daily lives. I recommend having a meal here and simply watching this place live. As someone who is not too fond of Rome, I find this a great place to kick up and let time pass me by. Eat, enjoy, relax - you're in Rome!

Tourist trap.. Came here in the evening and couldn't see the ornaments and structures clearly though the figurines were very beautiful. It was an open space with many ristorantes lined up at the side to attract tourists. Food was overpriced and there were many touts trying to sell gimmicky toys to the tourists.

Great place to hang. One of the most vibrant and interesting piazzas anywhere in Italy. It is surrounded by historic buildings and Bernini's Fountain of Rivers sports spectacular marble statues that are worthy of a visit in their own right. Many artists can be seen behind their easels, and many more spruikers selling paintings. There are several restaurants around the square mainly catering to tourists with too much money to spend. If you wonder through the back streets around the piazza you will find many less expensive and more authentic choices. An excellent choice we found is Restaurant Piccola on Via Cuccagna, just about 50 meters off the square on the fountain end. They have a wonderful anti pasta buffet for EU10, in case you are getting sick of eating pizza and pasta.

Lacking in atmosphere. Everyone tells you this is full of life and really interesting but on the evening we were there, there were some artists displaying their work, but only two or three actually doing anything and one mime artist. The square has lovely architecture, but the restaurant we tried was a bit expensive although the food was good. Probably wasn;t worth walking to specially.

Arty and fun. A great atmosphere with local artists and entertainers - the restaurants within the square were a bit pricey but you are paying for the views, so no real objections. Fountains and obelisks were stunning, one of our favorite places to spend time in Rome.

Beautiful piazza, amazing statues + toy shop!. Really enjoyed looking at the statues in this piazza and as an added bonus found an excellent toy shop on the corner that had an amazing range of items for the kids to drool over!
Delightful. We had an evening soaking up the atmosphere, music, art stalls, lovely restaurants edging the square, traffic free and quinticentially Roman. Street sellers are a pain but never impolite.
Be better without all the tacky street sellers. Lovely place. Stop for a beer, wine or coffee. I wouldn't eat here as it's expensive and there is much better nearby.
Stunning Piazza. Great atmosphere, nice restaurants, good place for just watching the world go by or having a chat over a beer.
Love this piazza. Could spend days sitting watching the world go by here it is a great spot to just chill for a while and enjoy the atmosphere of Rome.

Sweet. It's a great place to pass through and check out all the merchants. QuickTip: If you are going to buy from an artist walk around and find a real painter. Many of the merchants are just "reps" who sell the art from art students who sit in a room all day painting from stenciled tracing. Notice they will all look the same so choose wisely and you'll walk away happy.

Beautiful!. this is the place to visit if you like depictions of Rome in paint or pencil. It is an arty place and has a special sort of atmosphere. There are street artists and performance artists- not to everybody's taste but good to see.
People watching. Great place to kick back and watch the world go by. Fun street entertainers and great gelato.
Festive Piazza. This is a colorfukl full lof life square not to be missed. Filled with restaurants,. shops and musicians.

A large busy Square with stools and restaurants. A large long square with entertainers and artists and stools throughout the middle area. The outside consists of restaurants and other shops. Its a nice place to walk about and watch some of the entertainers. A good place to chill and take your foot off the 'tourist gas'.
beautiful Piazza!. Definitely a must see while in Rome, one of the larger piazza's in the city!
Stop for a coffee. Great place to sit and watch the world go by sipping a cappuccino.

Brilliant for quirky souvenirs. A fantastic find towards the end of our trip, there's often people selling paintings in the middle of the square, and many ice creams available around the edges. Also a post box and stamps in one little shop. Best find was a little stationary shop which I can't remember the name, but i bought a wax seal kit for me and my sister and it's brilliant, you can write lettters and sign it pretending to be living in tudor times. They have all sorts of letters that can be made up into a personal stamp.Really worth a visit.
2011 Cruise. Threw in a few euros for luck and then partook of a large glass of red wine

Nice Square. Really Nice square with lovely cafes and a fountain in the middle of it... street musicians/entertainments and it has a market every Sunday which you can pick up some great food to take back after your holiday....

Tacky, superficial and a dissapointment. You would think you were in an artists marketplace if you happened upon this piazza. Its all hype and not worth the time to go. You cannot get a good photo, it's full of "artists" waiting to suck money out of naive tourists. If you must go there now to see what I am talking about, go only for the proof, but please don't go to see anything wonderful, as you will be dissapointed. I am yet to see the value in this piazza.

Tourist trap!. Other much more palatable piazzas in Rome! Tons of people, 'artists', hawkers and the like. Wandering aimlessly around the city took us to much prettier and quieter piazzas. Fine to wander through but I wouldn't rush back!
Beautiful. Great plaza...if you love art and music thsi is theplace to go! Lots of staurants all around
busy. such an incredible area. great shops and restaurants. tourists from everywhere congregate to take photos. its great

great place to hang out, watch people and have an icecream!. We did alot of walking in Rome and found this piazza, we didn't plan it but by just walking alot you will discover Rome more than by bus. The fountains were beautiful and there was a lot going on. Artist were selling paintings and it was just nice sitting there and watch all the people and feel the italian atmosphere. What I didn't like were the guys that tried to sell roses and hats etc in an agressive way, but that is also the case at all the touristics spots in the city, they just don' t know the word NO.

Don't Miss Piazza Navona. This piazza was within walking distance of our hotel near the Pantheon, so it was a covnenient place for us to stop and eat. You can see that if was a "circus" - an overal racetrack in roman times. The beautiful 4 Rivers Fountain by Bernini as well as the two other fountains on either end are beautiful. Worth a stop to see the fountains and the Church of St. Agnes in Agony which is right behind the fountain (no admission - may or may not be open. No photos inside.) Tres Scalini restaurant is good.
Very turistic. Again a place that everyone has to see when they are in Rome. But it is very turistic, and you don't have to spend very much time here.

Average !!. Whilst this is a very nice square with cafes around, the thing which really ruins it are all the tacky stalls in the middle selling rubbish !! it would be so much nicer if they didn't allow these stalls.
Enchanting. Great sculptures and a charming marketplace too - many artists sell their paintings here.

Historic, great atmosphere. If you are holidaying in Rome, then make you way to this very large piazza. It has a great history, fantastic fountains; and the adjacent church, San Agnes di Agone, is beautifully decorated and a cool place to rest on a hot day. And, if you are into buying souvenirs, or tacky produce, you are in the right place in this piazza!

Our Favorite Piazza in Rome. This is a great place to go, especially at night. The piazza is filled with artist and musicians. It is surrounded by restaurants. A guide told us that at one time this piazza was actually filled with water and the romans would reenact ship battles.

A great piazza with stunning fountains and their sculptures. Another place to breath and rest for a while. Much entertainment also seen here. Portrait painting and mimicking/impersonating were the usual scenario. Take time to know the story behind the famous fountains around piazza Navona.

Beautiful place, don't buy a cup of coffee here though!. As you will get ripped off - we knew that it would be an expensive place to take the weight off our feet and have a coffee, but it was raining quite hard so we didn't have much choice (my appalling choice of footwear didn't help!). 11.50 Euros for two coffees! Need I say more. Go off the beaten track, don't get lumbered with the prices in the square.The fountains are stunning - well worth a visit. The square had a nice atmosphere to it. It's hard to give an apt review of it, as it was raining, so I don't think we experienced it like we would on a nice day.
So expensive!. Prices are crazy! Do not eat/drink in the square, just search for less touristic places nearby
Golden Afternoon in Navona. Wonderful amalgam of painters, musicians, happy people; relaxing sunny afternoon in a beautiful historic piazza
Gorgeous Views. There was so much activity at the Piazza Navona, Great Energy.

Hive of activity and a great place to take a break, enjoy a drink or a snack and do a bit of Roman people watching. On a sunny day, this is one of the places to be. Great buzz about the place, a lovely place for couples/singles to sit back during those hot sunny days, take in one of the many fine offerings for quenching your thirst, and watch life pass by. For families, it is a beautiful place also, lots of mime artists and street performers operate here, and normally a few artists set up stalls here, so a bit of colour day and night. Lovely. Dining just off the Piazza is best, as food prices in the square can be quite high. Walk 1-2 minutes down any of the little streets off the Piazza and you will find a wealth of littel spots serving classic Italian dishes at good prices. Must say, one of the best Pasta Carbonara was had by me near the Piazza.
Most charming Piazza in Rome. Just stroll around this magnificent Piazza, look at the fountain, eat some ice cream and enjoy life!
beautiful Piazza. but never ever sit down in one of the many restaurants, pizzeria's etc, faaaar to expensive
Nice area for a walk. This area was a pretty walk with the spanish steps near by, filled with bright flowers! Be ready for very thick crowds and traffic congestion!
Wonderful Atmosphere. Truly magical piazza - and a wonderful place to enjoy a delicious ice-cream whilst watching street theatre and the numerous artisans selling their wares.

Atmospheric Ambling. Full of atmosphere and interest with beautiful buildings not to mention the water features. There are rather too many hawkers selling trashy souvenirs pestering for a sale. Lots of artwork in process and very tempting to buy. Some areas are very poorly lit and food is expensive in relation to service and quality.
Restaurants galore. Best restaurants off of it. Was taken by friends to some pretty amazing restaurants, and best Italian discount shops.
Piazza Navona was very interesting. We walked past it many times and really didn't appreciate it til we had a tour of it. The explaination of the fountain and the buildings really made it coma alive.

Wonderful Piazza!. Tourists and locals gather at the Piazza throughout the day, adding to the magic of this wonderful place. We were most impressed with the three Fountains and spent most of our time taking in the details of the main statue depicting the Four Rivers. The large crowds can be somewhat annoying but it is really nice to see everyone so happy and having fun around the main Fountain!

Nice but a bit overrated. When you're there remember to look up at the buildings and at the fountains, they are nice but this place is generally just a tourist trap full of eateries and street performers. Could be viewed as a place to take a break from other sightseeing.
Restaurant area. I came late afternoon after the market had finished so it was a bit of a mess. However, this is supposed to be a good place to visit in the evenings for a meal out.

Overrun with Street Sellers. A beautiful and famous Piazza, but it was hard to enjoy it as much as I had hoped due to the hoardes of street sellers and 'artists' pedalling their wares. Spoilt it a bit, I thought. Sadly. Still beautiful though.
Beautiful Square. This is a very pretty square with flats, restaurants and artists. Take your time walking through it.

Lovely center. We loved our walk around the Piazza Navona esp. the Piazza Navona square where we even watch a street performer group dance so well. My toddler of 2.4 yrs enjoyed this square a lot too as it had her 2 favourite things water at the fountains and the music from the performers.

Beautiful. Another terrific area of Rome to walk around and visit. Enjoy beautiful views while dining out at one of the many outdoor restaurants that line the streets of Rome. Take in the sights and sounds and aromas of the area! Fantastic!!
Best square in the Europe. All Rome visitors must see this place. I recommend do it twice - at sun and moon light.
pitoresque place with lot of artists. nice restaurants, best to leave piazza Navona and go arround to find cheaper retairants

Is said to be the prettiest place in Rome - indeed. This is another must see at night time. So many scenic views, an artist market with a lot to see, surrounded by nice restaurants to be poised by the Italian way of living. Just be there.
Unbelievable. The people, the colors, the artwork - it is something everyone should see. Just sat around and people watched trying to imagine what it was like back in the day.

Magical. The Piazza is like no other Piazza in Rome.
It was purely magical, with art and shows, thousands of people enjoying the sunshine.
There is a lovely Cafe in the area as well named after the Piazza.
This area is pedestrian and just in the heart of the whole Italian experience.

WOW ! Absolutely beautiful.. We visited this square after visiting the Pantheon during our family trip to Rome. When we turned the corner and saw it for the first time the overwhelming thought was WOW !. It was here we knew for sure and had 100% confirmation of what a beautiful city Rome is. The fountains looked magnificent in the late morning sun. Definitely worth visiting. The café’s nearby looked on the expensive side.

Great piazza, but crowded. As with most of the piazzas it tends to be crowded but it's definitely worth at least walking through and seeing the sights. As others have said the restaurants right on the square are pricey and not necessarily the best food! Find a restaurant on one of the little side streets nearby instead!

Beating Heart of the City!. A meeting place, an eating place, a living space!
Simple in design but beautiful at the same time. I love being in a city so able to live within its two skins - ancient tableau/modern lifestyle.

Come for the fountains, then head elsewhere for wine or gelato... The fountains were terrific! Worth seeing, but the early evening action in the piazza was more vendor than artist, and there seemed to be more energy (and street musicians) around the wine bars at Campo de' Fiori or the gelato shops near the Parthenon in the early evening hours.

Fountain ...you´re in Rome !. The fountain are part of Rome history but they are more than a beatiful artistic piece.....is a way to live.
Please, go to see the fountain in the night !!!
Don´t have dinner nearby ....is expensive and not always good.
But the little streets in the way have good Pizzaria !

Art Work for your Home. This Piazza is crammed with artists all looking to sell you a painting. My friends purchased several, I sat and ate Gelatto; all of us were satisfied. None of the vendors were pushy, just enthusiastic and were willing to negotiate their prices. It's a great place to watch and listen and be grateful that you are there.

I loved this place. The fountains amazing, restaurents not all were good do some research before you go. I advise to go late afternoon before sunset
Have a drink then dinner

A free show on summer evenings. Piazza Navona is great. The fountains are wonderful, and the atmosphere is wonderful on a summer evening. A great place to see and be seen. Buy an ice cream and walk aroud. Plenty of places to sit.
Art. Great to pick up art work and have a bite to eat al fresco. Watch out so you are not scammed on the art work.

Lots of great restaurants. One of my favorite Piazzas and there are lots of good restaurants all around the Piazza, definitely gotta visit and lear about the stadium that is underneath the actual Piazza

Crowded, but required on Rome trip. We went during the day hoping to get a better view of the three famous fountains. With the crowds of people and the hawkers, this was just about impossible. Perhaps a night visit would be better. This is the most notable piazza in Rome. Now it is off my bucket list.

Piazza Navona . . . home to Rome's artists.. Piazza Navona is a treat for many reasons. First, the piazza has three beautiful fountains. Second, the center of the piazza is filled with artists displaying their creative skills in oil, watercolor, or chalk. If you are looking for a painting to take home, Piazza Navona is certainly worth a visit.You can also, have lunch, dinner, or just a snack at one of the many outdoor cafes that surround Navona. You can enjoy watching the artists work while enjoying an Italian treat. And, after you've eaten, you can look for the gelato shop at one end of the piazza. Then while enjoying your gelato, you can visit any of the many shops that also surround Piazza Navona . . . one of our favorite places in Rome.
Great People Watching. Best taken with a Gelato at one of the many restaurants which flank the Piazza
Beautiful. Gives you a nice feeling and bohemian atmosphere: musicians, cafes, fountains. Definitely a place to visit.

Amazing at daybreak. Get up early and see the piazza alone with you and a cup of coffee. Most beautiful and peaceful place for pictures. THen watch the town come to life as local scurring thru on there way to work. THen the tourist mob will arrive around 11am until midnight.
must visit.. It's worth a visit. If you can stay close to Piazza Navona.
nice restaruants and ambience. many artists sell wares in the square ,nice retaraunts.

Great Hangout. Painters galore. Just a wonderful area to just enjoy the scenery of people loving life. Great place to appreciate life and get a bite to eat and gelato. Beautiful Fountain...great photo op.
It's The Place to Be. Artists, musicians, dancers, and entertainment for everyone. Numerous cafes and shops. It's the place to be for an evening out.
One of my favorite spots in Rome. Beautiful buildings, fountains, street artists, street performers all make this piazza special. Always visit when I'm in Rome

Beautiful fountains!. Several beautiful fountains in Piazza Navona. Street performers, live music, and lots of people! Every restaurant in the Piazza will try to lure you in with their "special menu." Enjoy the Piazza and walk a street or two out of the Piazza and find much cheaper dining options!
Navona Nirvana. A must on any tour of Italy. Embrace the history and culture of the area.
Fun Place. I enjoyed my visit in P. Navona. The area is small but there's just too much happening~ interesting arts & people. Lots of interesting stores in the street alleys too.
my favorite piazza in Rome. I loved piazza Navona. I could just sit by the fountains and soak in the surroundings all day. There are musicians and artists everywhere. It is a must see.

Too touristy.. Piazza Navona is a unavoidable when walking through La Citta Eterna, Rome. The piazza itself with the magnificent fountain is spectacular - go there at 7am. Once the day begins, so does the scene - the so so restaurants get busy and the street performers and junky crap seller arrive. It amazed me to see tourists stay and watch a tacky magician perform - someone who can be found in any tourist spot anywhere - for longer than they look at the Sistine Chapel! And when you see 2 "Invisible Men" pose in the same square, you know you have to get out of there...

Nice place to spend a few hours.. This is what urban open space is all about. Nice open space with art in the piazza along with the 3 classic fountains. The space is surrounded by a number of outdoor restaurants where you can people watch while having an orange spritz or eating a simple meal. Reviewers will say not to eat here but then you miss out on just hanging out in the wonderful space. Try Caffe Barocco near the middle as a great place to sit in the sun and listen to music.

The heart of Rome. We were there when the artists had all their work out. Be careful not all are genuine. The restaurants are expensive here but it is lovely to stroll around taking in the atmosphere.

Have to experience it.. If you have the time to kill, pull up a front seat at one of the cafes, enjoy some wine of espresso and watch the human sea of wonder before you. There was a very funny mime/clown performing when we visited.
Lovely square. A place to chill, sit down have a cup of coffee and watch the world go by. Short walking distance to Campo de fiori.
4 Fiumi: Ecceptionale. We enjoyed our lunch at 4 Fiumi. Exceptional food and great service !

Very Good. This location was within walking distance of our boutique hotel, Deko Rome also highly recommend. Nice walk. We strolled through in the evening when the Piazza was jumping with locals, tourists and vendors.

Very close to our hotel stay in Rome! Great photo ops and they were playing Eagles music on the square!. Loved the art opportunities, disliked the request for dining... But if you like to people watch - this is better than the Spanish Steps!

Fantastic atmosphere. Walk around this fantastic piazza and soak in the atmosphere. The restaurants in the square are very expensive, but a nice place to have a glass of wine and soak in the atmosphere. I would recommend walking towards Piazza delle Coppelle, very close by - try Casa Coppelle. Also Caffe della Pace is a very romantic bar
A beautiful piazza. One of the nicest squares in Rome, boasting three beautiful fountains. Also quite a few cafes and restaurants in the area.

Piazza Navona is the best!. Bernini's fountains are exquisite. The Piazza is THE best in Italy, especially for people watching. The energy, the music, artwork or living photographs... incredible. My favourite spot in the entire world!
Beautiful piazza. This reminded me a bit of Place du Tertre in Paris because of the street artists.

Art and more art. Great place to find nice aquarels about Rome. Also don't miss the opportunity to see Bernini's four rivers fountain and notice how all the scullptures are looking away from Borromini's Church
Spectacular!. A living piece of Roman history. It really is a must see, buy some artwork from the artists there. Much cheaper then elsewhere.

LOVE TO EAT HERE. This is one of the most fabulous piazzas in Rome, filled with beautiful architecture and some of the most famous and gorgeous statues in all of Rome. Just eat here at a sidewalk cafe (we love Tucci's) and take in all this beauty and ambience.
A Gem. Although I had been to Rome several times previously I had managed to miss this square before. What a gem! Great to sit and people watch, grab a drink or ice cream and the artists.

Overly Crowded. Once again, overly crowded and difficult to take pictures. People were rude and pushy. The Piazza itself needs a facelift as it looks a little tired. They also need to rid themselves of the gypsies and beggars that lurk about as they are a real nuisance.
BEST PLACE TO EAT IN ROME. it is filled with amazing restaurants! The night life is fantastic. Get a table out side, enjoy the food and the atmosphere! a must do when in rome!

Baroque Nirvana. Don't miss the Fountain of the Four Rivers, the art on display/for sale, and the fun of sitting and watching the world go by at an outdoor restaurant serving a good, basic Roman dinner. For us, it was the gnocchi al pomodoro at Panzirone.

BEST AREA OF ROME. Wonderful piazza full of great restaurants, shops, artists, street vendors and performers. Beautiful fountain and cathedral, felt perfectly safe and best of all was central to all the major sightseeing musts. Wouldn't stay anywhere else when in Rome.

THis is THE happening place in Rome!. What fun to walk around Piazza Navona day or night. Wander through or sit and people watch. There is always something to see! Shops and restaurants on the Piazza tend to be pricey, but just a block away, things are more reasonable. The neighborhood is full of fascinating sites. Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers is magnificent!

Great place for lunch. Piazza Navona is the perfect spot to enjoy an afternoon of food and wine. The Piazza is lined by many small restaurants and bars (most are very touristy, but still nice). There are several artists displaying their work in the middle of the Piazza. Taking a stroll among the art with some local gelato is nice as well.

Lively and touristy. It is definitely a must-see, and impressive for sure. It is also very crowded and filled with mostly tourists, but with a little imagination you can see it how it once was! Eat at some of the restaurants in the surrounding area rather than on the piazza for better food and prices.

Great plaza for art, food, & night life. Our hotel was near here, so we came here often during our 4 days in Rome. In the day/evening, there are tons of art stands in the Piazza. You need to have cash if you want to buy something, though. There are also several artists working in front of you. Especially at night, there are some artists that work to music and gather quite a crowd. We never went there when we thought it was just too busy and crowded (like the Trevi fountain often is), probably because it is such a big piazza. There are also tons of places to eat. Even in the evening, it seems to be a great . attractions, and it looks like a hot spot for young people. The fountain looks beautiful at night. As always, watch your wallet! We didn't have anything taken, but it gets crowded with spectators sometimes, and this is a prime time to lose something.

Loved the fountains. One of the most beautiful squares in Rome with three wonderful fountains. The piazza is also a great place to shop for art souvenirs, as there are many local artisans selling there wares here. The piazza is alos ringed by many cafes where you can enjoy lunch, a cappuccino, or a glass of wine.

Somewhat over rated. Made it a point to go here; nice statues of Rivers there, nice plaza, many vendors, over priced and mediocre restaurants. Not my favorite place but worth a stroll. We took taxi to the place for cheap, then walked to pantheon, trevi, spanish steps.
People watching Mecca. This is a large PIazza with restaurants and "street entertainment." We enjoyed just walking around and sampling the Gelato.

Favorite Piazza in Rome!. This was our favorite piazza in Rome. It's oval shaped with lots of cafes and restaurants all along the edges. There is a beautiful church on the west side of the piazza that's worth a peek inside. In the center of the piazza you will find 3 beautiful fountains surrounded by artists where you can by reasonably priced art to take home.

Beautiful setting with a great restaurant. Fountain was spectacular, not quite on a par with the Trevi but a good little competitor!
Go to the Tartufo House owned by Angelo, great host, great value for money & you'll be keeping his ex-wife in the style to which she's obviously accustomed by eating there according to Angelo!!!

away from the crowds. This is not strictly true as there are a lot of people in this piazza, but it is relatively quiet for Rome and there is a great deal of entertainment from musicians to artists and restaurants. It was part of a peaceful walk we took one day in Rome away from the crowds at most tourist spots.

PERFECTION IF IT WASN'T FOR THE HUSTLE OF THE TOUTS. Magnificent architectural entity, quite one of the most imposing piazza's/squares any where in the world and only just behind St Mark's in Venice.However your pleasure in what is before you can readily be much reduced by the incessant badgering by restaurant hustlers, flower sellers, and numerous other fly-by-night nuisances pestering you buy anything from cheap looking garish handbags, scarves and a multiplicity of inferior looking toys and gizmo's. They come at you in their droves showing a dogged persistence refusing to take "No thank you" as a reason to cease chasing after you.The flower sellers are the worst pursing you for some distance, even trying to force a single rose into your lady partners hand and then insisting the man owes him money! No - means absolutely nothing to them which makes visiting Piazza Navona, a harrowing and wholly unpleasant experience. Other tourist hot spots in Rome suffer from this malaise but not to the same extent as here.It is unfathomable why the City Authorities allow this quite dreadful pestering of tourists which must in the long run impinge upon the full tourism potential of Rome and adversely affect the enjoyment of a visit to this city.

One piazza, THREE fountains. A beautiful, large space with three fountains and an obelisk. I only read the interesting facts about the symbols represented by figures in the three fountains afterwards, but still found them enchanting. The large piazza had been used for races and sporting events in the days of yore. RTake your camera to photograph the many figures and details in each fountain.
See it early. Try to be there first thing in the morning. It gets so crowded during the day and evening. You can hardly see the fountain.
Pretty. Pretty Piazza, but very expensive and you get pestered a lot by street sellers and people offering photo's for money.

Stunning and Majestic. This is an awesome Piazza to stumble upon on your stroll to the Vatican city from the Pantheon. Taking the winding tourist trail through the streets, you stumble across this huge majestic Piazza. Easy to get to and worth the photo.

Great place in the evening. Lots to see (painters, street performers etc.) and lots of restaurants. You pay a bit more to actually sit in the piazza but there are also lovely restaurants are bars up the side streets.
Super. Loved this place a great place to sit at a Restaraunt and watch the world go by.Loved the amazing fountains.

A lovely square.. Piazza Navona with its lovely fountains is somehow overrated to me.Don't get me wrong - it IS lovely, but the length of the square makes it more difficult to appreciate its beauty.Wroths a daytime and a nighttime visit to enjoy the different looks of the square.

A vibrant place to visit day and night. The piazza is lovely decorated with Bernini´s famous fountain «Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi» and the Egyptian obelisk as the centre. The piazza is crowded both day and night. There are always painters and people selling different things on the square. The restaurants fronting the square are of course expensive, but it´s really nice to sit there watching this vibrant piazza.
This is why I love Rome. Great or people watching - just go and soak it all in its about so much more than jut another piazza.
Beautiful. Beautiful square with lots of cafes for a spot of people watching but very expensive. A gelato to take away was around 2-3 euros, to have at a restaurant about 8 euros!
just like in the film. this is a wonderful spot and i enjoyed seeing it for real
Busy, busy, busy. Very busy, pestered by vendors, food more expensive then streets further back.
Delightful Piazza. What a wonderful place to stroll, people watch, have a glass of wine or lunch. Love the artist displays.
A place to mingle and spend time. A fun, action filled area that allows you to mingle and feel a part of Rome.
too crowded. Too crowded place, but the piazza in the morning is very beautiful, you can see all 3 magical fountains

Fantastic place, don't miss it. Are you young? Middle age or even old person? Don't miss such fantastic place, Bernini fountain and the Borromini church will make you crazy, don't eat at the restaurants as they are expensive and for tourists, go nearby in more typical small restaurants and osteria. Have just a drink, coffee or cappuccino and enjoy the view. Highly reccommended square!
Peace in the Piazza. Fabulous piazza, lovely street vendors & the church is amazing

Charming piazza, go if you can. This was my favorite piazza in Rome. The Bernini fountain in the middle was absolutely gorgeous and the piazza itself was charming and lovely. The church in the center is worth a peek inside too.
