Definitely a stop to make. Great place to people-watch, have an espresso or a gelato. Stop at any one of the cafes along the piazza and enjoy!
Beautiful Old Piazza. Great for people watching and strolling. Fountain is beautiful. Buildings and architecture surrounding are really wonderful. Best at night.

Once a center of life - always a center of life . . .. Piazza Navona is a must on your first trip to Rome. The long piazza still attracts the crowds seeking to watch the many artists and entertainers at work - whether while sipping a cappuccino or enjoying a meal at one of the many restaurants surrounding the piazza. The three fountains in the center of the piazza add to its magic - especially the Fountain of the Four Rivers by Bernini that tells a story of Rome's early connection to remote parts of the world. And, if the lights are on, you might catch a glimpse of the beautifully frescoed ceiling on the south side of this center fountain. So, whether its entertainment, dining, artistic treasure, or simply people-watching. Piazza Navona's history still yields something for everyone. I hope that you find something on your visit that will continue to enchant you.

one of the prettiest piazzas in Rome. This piazza is quite busy. There are cafes, vendors, entertainers, and tourists everywhere. But it's well worth a visit because the architecture was simply beautiful. And it's in this place where I've tasted the best gelato in Roma!Not sure of the name though, but if you're facing the fountain keep walk to your right past the restos. There's a souvenir stand at the end and it's beside it! i had a good time sitting at the piazza, people watching whilst eating my gelato al pistacchio :)

Somehow overrated. Yes, it's a very nice piazza, but I am not sure I would put it my top 5 attractions in Rome.Anywhere else in the world, I would see it as a top spot. But Rome is so great that in comparison, it felt "only" very good. Rome makes you become very picky, I guess.Nevertheless, it's a must-see for all tourists. Not only the square itself but the adjacent small streets as well. Tons of restaurants there and great atmosphere there.
April in Rome. Glorious day when we visited - sat & people watched - so many people! & gorgeous ice cream.

My favorite piazza for many reasons. Not only are there 3 fountains, charming cafes, and street artists, but the cathedral of St. Agnes frames one side of the piazza. Here we spent an incredible evening listening to baroque music and hearing a narrative history of the church. Tickets are easy to come by and you don't have to dress in evening wear to listen to classical music. Opera company sponsors these musical events around the city with small ensembles. So good I cried.

Another Piazza. Piazza Navona is a large, pretty square (actually rectangle) in Rome. It has it's grand church as the centerpiece. There are fountains and restaurants as well. It was kind of dreary when we were there so we didn't stay long. There are lots of artists around offering their works for sale. Again as at many Rome venues, watch out for pickpockets.

Breathtaking, So EUROPE. When I first saw Piazza Navona, I was so impressed. This is why I love Europe. Its sceneries, sounds, colors, down to the most unique and unnoticeable vendor - this is what makes Europe Europe. I actually walked around and started out with Piazza Navona - onto the Pantheon until I landed at the Spanish Steps. It was just a wonderful afternoon in Rome.

A nice enough piazza.. A nice piazza with buildings and statues/fountains worth appreciating. Some vendors selling worthless junk (watch out or they might soap-up your camera lens with a bubble-blowing plastic gun, which one almost did to me). Not many places to sit in the shade and enjoy, few benches at all in fact. We walked through and left within minutes.

A place to enjoy. I like going there at night because there's a lot of activity. I went several nights and enjoyed several sets of musicians with different music. One was rock and they were excellant and so was a lone guitar ballad player.
Lovely atmosphere. Great spot to enjoy ice-cream and people watching...

Not so impressive. A whole lot ofvendors selling everything you don't need.And the cappuccinos were expenssiv as well as the ice cream, if you just walk 50 m north of the piazza you will find better and cheaper coffee and ice cream!I think the piazza could have been beautiful if it had been less vendors so you could see the whole piazza!

Fun atmosphere!. If you want to eat at one of the ristorantes on the piazza, you will pay more. It's fun to do once for the people-watching perspective, but the little places right off the the Piazza Navona are less expensive and have better food.
A great nightime spot. A treat just to walk around and look at all the art, listen to the music, look at the beautiful fountain.

Loved it.... Its the life and soul of Rome, packed with tourists and locals alike. Ate in 6 of the restaurants and they were all great, hated to leave :( This place comes alive at night...plenty of street artists, music, people enjoying themselves...its lovely to wander thru it and experience it.

A must see, then move on. You must visit Piazza Novona for the sheer majesty of the Piazza. The Bernini statue is magnificent and the assortment of characters and artists and performers provide some entertainment. We had a quick snack and a couple of prossechi and were not surprised at the price which was a bit high. We moved on after this and sought out more of Rome's treasures.

Elegant and fun. With beautiful fountains and architecture, hawkers and buskers, it is fun to relax in and enjoy a magnificent space amidst the warren of old Roman alleyways. We loved the Tre Scalini, friendly and thoughtful service, excellent food.

City Center. At any time of the day, the Piazza Navona is visited by people. Probably one of the most photographed locations in Rome besides the Coliseum, Roman Forum and the Basilica of St. Peter, it is daily filled with people doing things - painting, juggling, just sitting, and eating at the over-priced spots along the sides of the Piazza. Everyone is drawn to Bernini's statue of the Four Rivers (Quadri Fiume) which uncannily supports a very heavy Egyptian obelisk, with much open space within the base which seems too delicate for the task. If it is open, the Church of St. Agnes in Agony is worth a visit for its overly Rococo decoration. I often am asked about how to get there, and unless you are staying close by, I recommend a taxi to the Largo Argentina, and walking to the Pantheon in the Piazza di Rotondo, then turning left at the far corner of the Piazza, to the Church of Santa Luigi dei Francesci (stopping in to see the Caravaggios there), then proceeding in the same direction opposite the Palazzo Madama into the Piazza Navona. If you remember where entered the Piazza Navonma, after browing around, go to the far right of your entrance point, past the toy store out of the Piazza, and then right into a small square in front of the Church of San Agostino. Go into the church, and on your left view the great Our Lady of Loreto by Caravaggio.
Exciting place. Full of life with lots going on. Also some really wonderful churches to visit everyone different.

A buzz. The atmoshere of Piazza Novona is relaxed and fun. The fountain of the Four Rivers with its Egyption obelisk is a stunning focal point, good restaurants in neighbouring walkways and a carnival feel.

Lovely place to stop for a drink. This is a really nice large open area with some beautiful fountains and surrounded by beautiful buildings. There are lots of restaurants with outdoor seating and it is a real sun trap so a great place to stop for a drink. There are also lots of street entertainers from statue people to breakdancers and lots of people selling paintings and other various artwork.

A little bit of everything here!. My wife and I spent several different visits to the Piazza over our 3 days in Rome. Its fun to walk through all the art vendors in the middle of the square, watch the break dancers or statue impersonators and most off all, grab some wine and listen to the local musicians entertaining the crowds. We bought a bottle of champagne at the local market and drank it while sitting next to the Bernini fountain in the middle of the square. I would also recommend checking out cafe Bernini in the corner. Free appetizers with drink purchase and great staff. Free wifi too!

Too Many Gimmicks. I was looking forward to traipsing through the Piazza Navona. But while the weather was beautiful and the fountains interesting, there were FAR too many vendors hawking their cheap wares and harassing our kids for us to enjoy ourselves here. Skip this sight (unless you really need to see it) and head to the other, less touristy piazzas for a more relaxing Roman experience. Minerva is quaint and quiet in the mornings.
Enjoyment. For me the best "piazza" in Rome. It is huge square, that is why isn`t so much crowded. There are interesting animators, musicions, painters.... Come here in the evening, before sunset...

Favorite Piazza. We stayed a 2 minute walk away from the Piazza so it is especially close to our hearts. We walked through there at least 3 times a day. Some times we passed though, some times we eat and sometimes we sat and people/ artist watched. Some great things about this Piazza over others is that it is big so there is lots of space to walk around. There are also benches to sit and rest on. This isn't too common in Italy. Many Piazzas have no where to sit. We also enjoyed the people watching. We saw an Italian couple have a real fight. She was yelling and yelling at her husband or boyfriend. He would yell back a little and she would yell more. Then they got up and walked away like nothing happened. I would have loved to know what they were saying.There are tons of artist and musicians work so it seems like there is always music playing and if you don't think the Piazza is beautiful enough on it's own, the art should satisfy you. The restaurants are pretty good. This isn't where you will get your best meal, but you will be able to find something decent to eat. The waiters are entertaining and friendly. There is almost always a service charge so check your bill for one. I still left a couple of euros for the waiter though as they were so great.

Wow, and ... wow!. Few people know this is built on top of historic ruins, walk to the north side of the Piazza and around the corner and look for the excavation site.. Oh and the fountains and buildings are lovely at night!
Great Area. The fountain is great, the square is open, full of people and colorful. I mostly just passed through it on the way to Campo de Fiori and Trastevere, but it would be a nice spot to linger.
Great place to wander. Likes: Big piazza, interesting fountains, lots of artists and musicians around.Dislikes: none
Lively spot to people-watch. Lots of art vendors and musicians at night ... great spot!

Can't wait to go back. I had heard about the Piazza Navona but visiting it is like stepping into a dream. We followed a map down some narrow streets and then stepped into the sunshine, literally. It was gorgeous, breath-taking. The atmosphere was casual, lots of artists, street performers, and the fountains were amazing.

Amazing place to chill out. Piazza Navona was not on the plan but visited there just by chance and spend rest of the day over there. Amazing place - just spend time near the fountain various activities going around, watching people and ofcourse having good food.

Worth spending some time. Worth standing in this circle for while to observe people of today and the market place of yesterday. It is just like how they show on tv from Roman time. Visitors enter the gate and saw this gathering place as their first view. let it be your first view. Worth a walk by atleast

Must see at night; it is amazing. I was exhausted when we got to Rome from Florence and my feet were still hurting from all the walking I had done in Athens and Florence. Unfortunately, we had such a short time in Rome that every minute counted. So we walked from our apartment( about 25 mins) to Piazza Navona. It wasn't very crowded as there seemed to be a lull in the crowds, we were sort of in-between the dinner crowds and early evening gatherers. Piazza Navona with Bernini's masterpieces has always been on my list of places to-see. It is not exceptional like the Sistine Chapel but it is a symbol of Rome and the Roman atmosphere is unparalleled to any other, oh well, perhaps with the exception of Madrid. I didn't really sit and have a coffee but walked among the artists and other tourists, inhaling the night air and sweet flavors of Grom's gelateria just within the Piazza. This is really a place to experience, you read about it in literary accounts, travel guides and just about every author writing about travel in Rome refers to Piazza Navona in some way, so I sat by a fountain, took some photos and wandered some more. It was the best 'wandering' I ever did.
Bernini Fans this is for you!!!!. This fountain is so special and during Christmas time it takes on a very magical place!!!!!!

Breath Taking. This is the most beautiful piazza in Rome. Great place to breath Rome into your soul. Just sit by a fountain and watch the people come and go. Great concerts in the evenings a must see in Rome.
Tre fontane. Have a coffee and see the statues! be aware of pick-poketers

Do not miss this spot!. One must visit Piazza Navona when in Rome. It is filled with charm, wonderful restaurants for good food and "people watching"! And it is surrounded with magnificent artistic beauty!

Nice to visit along the way. Since this Piazza is noted on all the tourist maps, it is a great landmark to visit and use as a navigation waypoint. We used it to find the local Caravaggio paintings and keep our bearings on our walk to the Vatican.
Wonderful experience. Sit in the cafe opposite the middle fountain, they make lovely coffee, expensive but worth it for the atmosphere and ambience of it all
Magnificent at night, extremly nice by day. Great place to hang out, to make photos, and enjoy roman atmospfere
What an atmosphere. There are so many restaurants to choose from here. You can just sit and watch all the entertainers and soak up the great atmosphere

Cool place with artist and the church. Piazza Navona is a larg square which is dminated by the central fontain and two smaller once on the sides with a church in the middle. The church is very nice from inside and it is with free admission so I recomment to see it. The nicest thing aldo for me where the artist on the square which is full of painters - musicians - one man show artists. Just dont go there for a cofee as the prices are much higher then in streets around.
Pretty Roma piazza. A pretty spot to wonder through and take in the architecture, various entertainers, art and passers by.
Loved it.. Beautiful fountains. Loads of space. Very entertaining street performers. A must visit site !!
Poetry. How can you miss this beautiful site? A bit too crowded with street artists, the square is one of a kind and MUST SEE!

I loved this piazza. There is a little something for everyone! There are many restaurants, and fountains and lots of interesting people to watch! We saw one older man lipsyncing to old Italian songs. My father-in-law really enjoyed Sant'Agnese in Agone, the church there in the piazza. It is a beautiful church with beautiful art and is a quiet place to reflect on your day. I would absolutely visit this place again!
We kept going back to see the fountain. At my 1st visit I thought it was too touristy but going back in the early morning or last, in the evenings is highly recommended
Piazza and surrounding area. The back streets around this beautiful piazza with three fountains are charming and full of great bars and restaurants.
well worth a visit. hundreds of paintings of tourist attractions.lovely restaurants and street artistes.
Loved it!. Great place to eat, lots of wonderful fountains. Beautiful.
A lot of fun. Beautiful piazza with a lot of fun things going on. The church is beautiful and, worth seeing. One of our favorite night spots.
beautiful plaza. lots of artists, venders,etc. beautiful fountain, and some very friendly people. good place to people watch.

This is a party piazza, from one end to the other.. Restaurants, bars, shops, and a Plaza to boot. This is a must see area when in Rome. If you can't find it here, you probably don't need it. Some very upscale shops, as well as moderate priced ones. The same with the restaurants.
Great site.. Fantastic fountain and lots of local artists. Sidewalk cafes in abundance and not far from the Pantheon. It is also a short bus ride from Vatican City and some ancient Roman ruins.
Touristy and not much to see. I wish I could walk five feet without someone asking us to eat at their restaurant- we ate there, it was okay, I'd skip it if I could

At night. This is a beautiful piazza that I have visited on trips prior to this one. On this trip, we visited in the early evening. I was disappointed that the fountains were not very brightly lit, it was crowded, there were lots of gypsies trying to pedal to everyone. Don't waste your time. See it in the daylight!
Beautiful. .... and expensive - we ate at one of the restaurants which was great but pricey and the staff have a tendency to hover which is a bit off-putting.
This is a Happening Place.... Loved people watching in this charming piazza...and even indulged in a double scoop of gelato mmm...
Like so much in Rome--spectacular. The Piazza Navona and its splendid fountains are spectacular. Again, another not to miss sight when visiting Rome.

Pushy pashmina sales guys. The piazza novona is beautiful. The fountains are beautiful and the live music is nice. What makes it a turnoff, like at most touristy areas are the pashmina sales people. They are annoying and pushy and can be aggressive. Though I can handle them, one poor woman bought one, then the whole slew of them came and tried to give her the hard sell. She was being polite, but they can't take a message. Then you have the flower guys, and the others. Also, many "art works" being sold, many are duplicates and mass produced. Hard to say that they are the real deal; takes away from the ones that are doing the artwork honestly.

You cannot leave Rome without seeing Piazza Navona!!. The heart of Rome: colour, warmth, fun and beauty!! Stoll around the square, enjoy the street artist and chiil out. Tips: do not eat on the main square, the food is poor and dear as gold! take the little lane on the right side of St Agnese church and enjoy nice food at affordable prices (I would recomend "Da Francesco" in Piazza del Fico: yummy!)

Lovely piazza.. Lovely place to walk around when it's not too busy. It does get busy however...and there are quite a lot of people selling tat. Also, try to avoid eating at a restaurant within 50 metres...there's a high chance you'll be fleeced.

Great fun, with beautiful buildings and fountains. Lovely big piazza, plenty of room for all the travellers, without feeling crammed in. Three great fountains, each differnt and histically interesting. The square is surrounded by beautiful buildings, and has plenty of restaurants where you can sit and enjoy looking at the architecture, or be entertained by the street artists.

Carpe Diem!. Go here to relax for lunch or dinner after a long day of touring around Rome. Choose any of the fine restaurants on the piazza, listen to the street musicians, stroll among the artists, and avoid the hustlers selling tacky gizmos.
dont miss this!. somewhere to spend a lovely afternoon watching street artists -amazing atmosphere

Dissapointing. From the description I had expected a grand piazza with genuine atmosphere - what I found was a marketplace for painters surrounded by anonymous buildings + a bombastic monument. Go to Sienna to see the marketsquare, if you want to get excited!
Worth seeing if you're in the area. but don't make a special trip across the city to see the trio of fountains. There are a lot of nice shops for upscale shopping nearby.
Excellent place to watch the world go by!. We ate here 2 nights and sat and drank several bottles of wine and watched the world go by. Great atmosphere!
Great Area. Nice large square with beautiful fountains and buildings. Artists on the square. Wished I was able to bring back some art, but didn't work out.

Annimated Piazza !. A Piazza where one one can enjoy it for its Three Fountains, Many Restaurants and Cafè, musicians, and most of all its culture. On a sunny day, one can spend the whole day and relax !

Great Place to Hang out. This is a great place to shop, eat (although a little more expensive due to high tourist traffic) and just sit and people watch. There are always people out doing street performances and painting and playing music. A good place to walk through, especially during the evening hours.
Great place to people watch. Lots of restaurants, street entertainers and artist/vendors. Wonderful buzz about the piazza as you wander or stop for a bite to eat

Best Piazza in Rome. Is a great place to either sit and watch the world go by, eat or have a mouch around in the shops.
Opps, also forgot to mention the three fountains in the square, there pretty stunning too.
Great for children. lovely square to wander round with children; there's a great toy shop in addition to the fountains & ice creams!
Lovely Atmosphere. Enjoyed eating here and seeing all the street artists at work.
Well worthwhile. Piazza Navona is a must for a Rome trip. Best early morning before the crowds arrive.
Our favorite place in Rome!. Such a wonderful place. The restraunts are great, the fountains are great, the people are great! There is nothing else like it!

Ok but not amazing. We were staying a few minutes away from the Piazza, and passed through it several times, but were left unimpressed. There is a fair/market on the Piazza during the day, which was really nice, but it made the area especially busy, and the buildings are pretty but not amazing. There are lots of lovely restaurants on the Piazza but all were pretty pricey; if you move into the streets behind it so much quieter and cheaper, but if you love the hubbub then this is a great place. The fountain at the centre is lovely. The area is busy well into the night.. we were still drinking here at 11.

Great for people watching. Bernini's fountain aside, the Piazza Navona is a nice spot for people watching. The fountain is impressive, there are several interesting buildings and there are a market stalls selling a variety of souvenirs and other goods.
Beautiful Area. The Piazza Navona is an Artists quarter, set amidst beautiful architecture and friendly cafe's . The fountains here are exquisite and a visit here is a must!
favorite square.... Soo much life in this piazza! This one was one of my favorites...
Quaint. We visited here in the evening & it was so pretty & atmospheric

Piazza Navona. Beautiful part of Rome, lots of little cobbled streets a fabulous architecture but the Piazza itself I found a little disappointing. It was crammed with sellers of paintings, so the 'space' of the piazza was lost. Didn't eat or drink there so can't comment on that aspect of the Piazza
Great place to people watch... The Piazza was 5 minutes walk from our hotel. Great restaurants all around on the side streets. Avoid the restaurants ON the Piazza they seem to be more expensive..

a place to see and be seen. full of amazing architecture, duomos hidden down side streets, market stalls full of artists and restaurants of the finest quality. Of course the famous fountains are beautiful.

Fun spot. This Piazza has street entertainers, vendors and alot of people watching. We enjoyed sitting at one of the cafe's with a glass of wine watching the people Relaxing end to a very busy day. The fountains in the Piazza are so lovely and interesting.

Spanish section within Rome. Piazza Navona is a big square, more like a rectangular square that houses an impressive Spanish-influenced architecture and surrounded by colourful Spanish-inspired concepts with lots of people walking around taking in the beauty and charm of this place and enjoying the music that is often played a group of enthusiastic old-time musicians!
Beautiful Piazza!. This is a wonderful place for people watching, see many excellent artists with their art and enjoying numerous restaurants.

You can't go to Rome without spending time here!. Here is where you can really feel Rome. Here is where you can get amazing oil paintings of the sites of Rome. Here is where you can get great Gelato. (at the end of the piazza). Here is where you can get the famous Prada (Frauda) purses, along with anything else.
Pick your water colors here. I loved the artists who were selling there paintings , struggling painters packed the square the day we were there . you can get a good bargain ..
beautiful piazza. nice piazza with lots of artists selling their paintings and other artist doing performances

One of the top tourist attractions. One of the must in Rome, without any doubt. Try to get there early in the morning, when it's missing thousand of people if you want to enjoy the architecture and fountains. And go there any other time if you want to watch people
Super. Great place, loads of Cafe's and a church and fountains. Very busy bustling area.

Our favorite piazza. We have been here in July when this square teems at night with the populous doing the passegiata and eating gelato and browsing through the artist displays. In March, even though we experienced a relatively pleasant sunny afternoon, we needed to seek out a bit of shelter and took a coffee and dessert in one of the local cafes so that we could listen to the musicians and people watch. Still lots of fun. The fountains are magnificent.

A very fun and hip place to visit. Go and enjoy the afternoon here. Super fun with a fresh fruit and vegetable stand in the morning to early afternoon, and then other exhibits throughout the day. Just a great place to go hang out and enjoy Rome!
Artsy, touristy. I loved listening to the street musicians, drinking a glass of wine and looking at all the artists selling their creations. It was a nice place to relax from a day of sightseeing.

A place to intermingle with tourists. The relaxing atmosphere of this little piazza allows for talking and sharing your views. Do not, however, try restaurants right nearby as they are usually overpriced and not worth it.
loved the atmosphere. 3 great fountains are displayed here with many, many local artists showing there artwork in the piazza. The piazza is also adorned with outdoor restaurants and cafes.
Gorgeous in the evening. Went here in the evening with our children for a gelato. Was really beautiful but got very tired of the street vendors selling all sorts of rubbish- they are everywhere!
My Wife's Favorite Place in Rome. This is just a nice piazza to visit and to stop for a rest and coffee or gilato.

21st!. At Christmas a beautiful craft market ...hot delicious baguette with hot dogs or famous "porchetta"(special roasted pig!)...shopping within 3 wonderful fountains and Michelangelo's presence around you!
Energy Squared. The nighttime scene was pulsating. A wonderful walkthrough.
The Bernini Fountains are Awe-Inspiring!!!. But the hawkers of cheap novelties can be distracting. Go at night, when it is peaceful and lit up.

Very Cool. We walked through this piazza during the day and liked it so much we came back at night for dinner. It is a closed off section with no cars that has three very nice fountains. Grab a bite to eat or an espresso and enjoy.

excellent atmosphere. I loved the atmosphere of Piazza Navona, with the street artists, restaurants, fountain and music. It was lovely at night to sit and have a good quality meal watching the world go by with live music in the streets
My favorite place in the world. This is the best place in the world to people watch. Sitting at a cafe' taking in the sights is what this place is all about. Enjoy!

Superb place. The overall layout of this Plazza impresses one at the start , but the 3 fountains are just outstanding. Artists & musicians add to the atmosphere. Easily reached from the Pantheon , this should not be missed

Lively and lovely. Navona is a lively and colorful piazza, sorrounded by art, either by the artists that expose their work selling them for a very reasonable price (if you negotiate a bit) or of course by its main attractions: the center piece "Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi" sculpted by Bernini and the side ones "Fontana di Nettuno" and "Fontana del Moro", both sculpted by Giacomo della Porta. Not forgetting the church of "Sant'Agnese in Agone" by Borromini and the "Palazzo Pamphilj" that houses the Brazilian Embassy and was designed by Gainaldi with frescoes from Pietro de Cortona. Of course, a visit to the Piazza Navona is not complete without trying the delicious Tartufo, a wonderful frozen chocolate dessert that was invented by the "Tre Scalini" restaurant in 1946. Enjoy!!

Love this place. We stumbled across this piazza by chance one night well after 23h00. The piazza was filled with artists and musicians and is lined with restaurants all along the outside of the piazza. We went back there on the following evening for my birthday dinner. The dinner was expensive, but worth every cent!! Beautiful view, great food, excellent atmosphere, I would definitely recommend it for a special occasion

a beautful Piazza. amazing atmosphere in the evenings. We saw street dancers, artists and musicians. The cafes around the Piazza are very expensive however if you take as few steps into the back streets there are some beautiful street cafes with excellent value for money food, beautiful wine bars and excellent shopping
Beautiful and bustling with activity!. Many restaurants and shops. Musicians playing and artists selling there wares. Gorgeous sculptures and buildings.

A really nice place. The biggest Piazza of Rome so far, with a lot of people and interesting things to see. You also have fountains. Lots of artists come here to draw or paint. Some people come to relax and enjoy the weather. Others come to meet other people or for the shops surrounding the piazza.

Wow. A fantastic Piazza with amazing fountains and architecture. The place was buzzing when we visited and we stopeed to watch spray-paint artists at work - so skillful and only 10euro for a completed masterpiece. It was great to imagine the chariots racing around - a piece of history come to life

Tourist trap!!!!!! but beautiful all the same.. Firstly Piazza Navona is beautiful. It has wonderful cobbled streets and two stunning fountains by Bernini which are illuminated by night. It is surrounded by plenty of open air cafes and restaurants so you need never go hungry. There is also a beautiful church by Borromini standing tall in the piazza. Aside from all of these beautiful images the place is over run with people selling ridiculous things. I must have been offered a cashmere rug maybe 30 times. The sellers were rude and would even touch you to get your attention. I was with my mother and was even propositioned for sex at one stage. I was quite well dressed aswell and i couldn't understand. People were staring. It was the most uncomfortable experience of my life. We ate in a little restaurant called Tre Scallini. It was overpriced for a very basic menu and service. We did not return here again. There are some wonderful artists, caricaturists and musicians here also....would describe it as the montmarte of Rome!

Piazza Navona. Bernini's Fountain of Rivers at its centre this must be one of the busiest Piazzas in Rome It comes alive at night with artists and crafters selling their wares. Restaurants circle the square and continue downthe small alleys leadingto it . A nice place to spend the evening and people watch.
lovely atmosphere. lovely place to have a drink and watch the world go by

The market place in the day time. Interesting market place, with fruit and vegetables and various stuff. The tourist stuff like scarves and jewellery is a bit pricey. To purchase the same stuff you need to visit the Sunday market in Porto Potuesse (Hope I got the spelling right). It is only open on Sundays and it is gigantic. You can get anything and everything.
nice to see. artists painting things for you to buy...worth seeing just for the square

Best place to thake a drink on one of its terasses. Lovely place with artist and painters.
Take a while and sit down for a drink (these are not cheap) and enjoy !

Very nice place. A perfect place to visit especially at night!!
Try the tartuffo icecreams sold in the shops of the piazza or have a cappucino..
For eating it is a bit expensive...

A beautiful place. Good stores. Good restaurants. A beautiful place. Good stores. Good restaurants.
A nice place to pass a whole day. Take water and a hat.

Great, but crazy touristy.. My favorite spots are rarely the tourist spots and Piazza Navona is no different. Beautiful, especially at night, but so packed with tourists, it was hard for me to get too excited.

Beautiful Art. This Piazza has a beautiful fountain. It is full of artists and their work. My friend bought a beautiful oil painting of the Almalfi Coast. She paid 100 euro for a large painting that was marked at 160 euro. There is also an outdoor cafe that is nice. There are shops all along the street. Just a nice stop along the way.
Not to be missed. One of my favorite places in Rome. You can spend ages admiring the architecture and the Bernini fountains and people-watching.
Don't miss it. if you miss this, you might as well have stayed home. Great neighborhoods surround as well.

Piazza Navona.. Three wonderful fountains by Bernini and lots of cafes and restaurants where you can sit and watch the world go by,There is also a stunning church on one side of the square.There are lots of artists and entertainers.It is a very popular place for italians and tourists to relax and while away the time and only a short walkto the Pantheon from here.

Gorgeous buildings and statues. Another busy area of Rome but this square is so big that it doesn't seem as manic as some of the other sights. A lot to look at and a nice spot to eat a takeaway pastry ans soak up the atmosphere. If we could just get rid of the silly tourist 'attractions' like the Statue of Liberty costume wearer and the breakdancer then I'd probably stay a little longer!

One of favorite places in Rome. We were taken to this piazza in August 2011 but had no time to stay as we had to catch a cruise.We have just returned from Rome and this place has to be one of my favorite ways to spend time in Rome. A charming spot with fabulous restraunts and artists galore.We asked for this place because we wanted to buy some oil paintings. Staying down by the Vatican, it was a simple relaxed 10 minute stroll to the Piazza NavonaOnce there we ended up buying 5 paintings for less than one would have cost us in Venice. There must have been 30 artist stands and 30 restraunts with three beautiful fountains. I have seen the coleseum twice now and may or may not go back but this Piazza will be the first place I go the next time in RomeDont Miss it !!
Buzzing. We found it at it's best in the daytime - very buzzy. Spivvy streetsellers a pain though.
Great Piazza. This is a beautiful Piazza and a short walk from many other land marks. Worth your time.
Rome. Great spot to people watch and enjoy ice cream. Lots happening all the time

PEople watching. There is so much to see just watching the world go by. Sit and have a glass of Prosecco and just watch everyone meandering and the street entertainment - some of the best was watching the illegal street sellars making a run for it when the police came past. Very very expensive so pick your resturant carfeully for your drink! There are nicer places to eat and a lot cheaper!
Charming Piazza. More impressive by night. Great place for a coffee or gelato.
Piazza Navona. Great atmosphere. Excellent art work to purchase here.
Very Nice Area in Rome!. What's not to like? Shopping, atmosphere, gelato, cappuccino, people, history and architecture all in one. Worth a walk or cab ride to find while in rome. We enjoyed it.

Good for people watching. Large area where local artists feature their art for sale. Musicians and human "statues" also set up here. Many restaurants in the Piazza, however we found them to charge a higher cost than those on side streets. Guessing this is because of their nice location.
GREAT AREA. Our apartment was a block away from the Piazza. It's such a gorgeous place, full of life and energy.
coffee rip off. We had a quick walk around the city whilst waiting for a plane to London. Coffee in the Piazza was 6 euros - but I suppose there was a rose on the table.
Awesome. It loks different at night than during the day....go for both...great artists musicians....etc
Historical place. You need to reach Piazza Navona after sunset and long day. Seat there, relax and enjoy.

Avoid the restaurants in the area. It's a huge piazza, it doesn't feel crowded. I would try and even wait in line for a local/smaller restaurant away from the piazza. We had bad pizza and bad service.
The hit of the sightseeing. This square is not only a real beauty but it is also a nice place to have a rest, to see some performances there and not only

Lovely atmosphere. It's a pretty square, with 3 fountains and statues, quite big. The atmosphere is lovely as you can find artists painting and entertaining outside. Its also quite quiet, probably the only place in Rome where cars don't go!
Beautiful statues, shops and stalls. A lot of fun but don't try to eat here: better and cheaper elsewhere.

A bustling place. This was a fun piazza to visit. We were there on a sunny day and there were throngs of people milling about. There were many retaurants, trattorias, gelaterias with outdoor seating. There were many artists - some selling their work but others who were also creating their works right there. It was fun place to spend some time and to see some more of those Roman fountains!

My favorite Piazza in all of europe. Found this lovely Piazza on my Third trip to Rome! What I was missing! The rectangular, large shaped piazza is full of artists and musicians, outdoor cafes and a lovely fountain! A perfect stop to enjoy a caffe or glass of wine and drink in the beauty of Rome

Scenic. Stopped here on the way to the pantheon. With the help of our guide book and spying on some tours we were able to discern what fountains we were looking at. Some artists selling paintings but not hassling you. Worth a stop to take photos.

Buzzing with youth!. We had been recommended to eat in this piazza, but it lacked budget eating places, and though we loved the atmosphere and the definite buzz, we preferred to eat nearer to the Pantheon ( see review of Napoletanos ) A definite place for yoounger crowd, but the shops are expensive. Beautiful place in the evening with the lights on.
Excellent..well worth a visit. Great for street artists and having a cold drink and people watching. Superb statues.

Story of Rome. When we arrived in this square I undestand why ancient roman create ancient navy battle inside this place.ùI suppose a question? It happens really?How many water they need to fill that zone and for how many days!Rome was my best trip in the last 3 year and thanks to TA I had the opportunityu in my fwe days to Went in the right place in the right time!
when in rome.... Not one for those looking for somewhere where the locals eat I expect, but still a joy.
Beautiful. The architecture of this square is amazing. Not only that, there is the most amazing gelatoria located there (can't remember the name) that is a fun to go to as well.
Great place!. Awesome food and shops. The Bernini Statue was great. Walk up some of the side streets for better deals in restaurants verses the ones in the square. Blue Ice gelatto is amazing!

Great Local Artist. Had to go here after the Vatican. Bought a water color painting and took a lot of pictures of the "Statue People". The fountain is beautiful. The food alone will make you hungy! Nice leather store there for handbags.

Splendid. A lovely square with 3 fountains - lovely restaurants although a bit pricey - but ice cream parlour at the end so you can sit by the fountains and enjoy. Lots of artists and street performers too!

My favorite square. This long square, once upon a time, a Roman charriot race arena, is a very pleasant place to admire the three fountains, the art being sold and stop for a snack and a drink in one of the sidewalk cafes.
Lively. Music, food and people! This is the place to hang out after a day of exploring in Rome! Should not be missed!
Enjoyed a leisurely lunch. Enjoyed a leisurely lunch surrounded by great history and mighty pleasant spring warmth. Nipped ot the sports arena ruins just at the north end of the piazza.

Excellent location and square. Another beautiful, huge fountain in a large square that hosts an art market and many cafes to sit and enjoy the view. It is also a great location as it is near to the campo dei Fiori where a market was held when we visited that included many different stalls selling pasta, olive oil with truffles, fruit and veg.Would recomend seeing as even walking there you see a different part of Rome away from the main attractions.
A place to sit and watch. Full of performers and artistes it is nice to come here in the afternoon and sit have a wine or coffee and absorb all that is going on.

One of my Fav's. It's surrounded by a maze of small streets with dozens of bars and restaurants. the piazza itself has 3 wonderful fountains and is full of artists and street performers... a really nice place

The famous square of Rome. It is situated in the historic center of Rome and west of the Pantheon. It is one of Rome's liveliest squares, with many outdoor cafes, restaurants and night clubs in the neighbourhood. It features 3 magnificent fountains (fountain of the four rivers by Bernini, Neptune fountain and Moor fountain both by Giacomo della Porta) and a baroque church by Borromini (Church of Sant'Agnese in Agone).
Great spot to hang out. We stayed near here so passed through very often, and enjoyued very much dinning here twice, well worth it

A dream after sunset. We lucked out with a wonderful restaurant that I don't know the name of! The mime working the main area was fantastic. Browsing the artwork in the piazza was like being at a wonderful, small artfair. We also enjoyed the musicians. It is a beautiful setting for a lovely, relaxing outdoor evening for the preteens as well as the adults.
A great spot to while away some time. Pedestrian traffic only, so it is not noisy. A beautiful spot to have a coffee or light meal.
Great Artwork Super place for a sunset drink. Have a drink, sit in the sun. Watch the world go by. View the art, just enjoy life.

Piazza Navona. A delightful Piazza, with 2 Bernini fountains to , dare I say it, favourably rival the far more famous Trevi fountain - but without the huge throng of people surrounding the fountain.I visited the Piazza on several occasions, if you like to relax in pleasant historic and attractive surroundings, people watch, visit fab little restaurants - then make sure you visit Piazza Navona when you go to Rome!

Great atmosphere. So much fun just taking in all of the performers and art works. The polizei keep most of the hawkers on their toes so the pressure to buy is not too bad. Stay for dinner as the musicians go till about 9.30pm. A great vibe
Best Pizza. There was a Pizzeria that was the best pizza I have ever eaten.
Don't come hungry. A great tourist site...but don't arrive hungry. The restaurants are good but pricey. Some advertise free wifi, but there always seemed to be some kind of problem with it.
Liked the atmosphere. Nice place for having a break, we really enjoyed it there. Piazza Navona had lots of artists who sold their paintings and we saw some musicians who made great music.

Something for everyone!. Of all the piazzas we happened upon - this one was by far the most animated and entertaining of them all. Something for people of all ages to oogle and be entertained by. Bought a couple of beautiful watercolors there for a very reasonable price. Gorgeous fountains too!
fountain of 4 winds. Famous from the movie Angels and Demons. Beautiful place . It's worth to go there at night as the fountain looked stunning .
market area. nice fountain of course, lots to buy and places to eat
Piazza Navona. Great place to enjoy a gelato and listen to some local music in the square.

Classic Italian Paizza with the Four Rivers Fountain. Wonderful spot with two beautiful fountains. Many artists and performers in the Piazza. Great restaurants around it with outside tables for people-watching. Put it on your must visit list.
Lovely for a glass of wine.. Plenty of places to sit and enjoy a relaxing glass of wine and watch the world go by, and many people playing music in the background.
nice atmosphere. I liked little restaurants with fantastic food everywhere
Couldn't see the fountains for the tourists. Too many people, too many hawkers of tat. Go early in the morning before it gets thronged.

Culture Anyone?. This used to be an arena for chariot races. Hard to Imagine it today. There is a huge obelisk in the center of the square with the work of Bernini underneath (4 rivers). On either side there are two more fountains by Bernini. Other than the structures, this is a wonderful place to buy things. A painting, trinket, or meal. There are also a lot of street performers too. People posing as statues and such. Great way to spend a mid afternoon.

Poor value. The square itself is pleasant with the fountains and artists creating a good atmosphere but this was the most expensive area to eat or drink. 8 Euros for a glass of Pinot or Frascati wine is crazy

Nice square close to Vatican City. Large square full of restaurants, small pubs - prices are a bit higher as it is a tourist attraction. If you go a little bit further the restaurants have better prices.Many fountains in the square ask to get out your camera and take many pictures. It's beautiful when sun is shining.

not to be missed, an experience you won't forget!. Vast & beautiful, crass & classy, serene and hectic, commercial and artful all at the same time. Artist drawing, food/restaurant vendors hawking, sculptures and architecture abound, plan a few hours early morning or mid afternoon and come back late evening for a completely different feel.Our daytime visit we were guided here by Roberto of Gioia Tours (via Golf Cart) but previously walked here at night - just BEAUTIFUL.
Amazing gelato!. Piazza Navona was full of people and artists by day, and full of lights and enjoyable restaurants outside by night. The gelato on the west side was absolutely incredible!

My favourite!. Loved this piazza so much I revisited three times, chilled out listening to music, had icecream, pondered over local art (bought some) and watched some amazing acrobatic dancers. There is something for everyone and a beautiful church isn't far away to rest your feet and appreciate the decor.
Square with lots of choice in places to eat and drink. Very busy,good atmosphere and lots of artists displaying their pictures in the centre

I Love Piazzas!. A bit of an art fair with sellers plying their trade throught the piazza and some nice street music as well. No intrusive selling, just lots to look at and listen to. Of course the buildings and fountain are beautiful!! sat for an hour or more at a street cafe and had a drink or two on the piazza soaking in the atmosphere with my girlfriend. a guitarist and later an accordian player entertained just in front of where we sat and both were excellent. My girlfriend julia, loved the romantic setting. Me too.
The best Piazza!. In the best part of the city center, can be a good place to start your evening, and walk around the streets to find a ncie bar, restaurant or ice cream.

Another gem. Such a beautiful city and so much to see, it is hard to choose a favourite. Suggestion, if you have an iPhone, download descriptions of the sights beforehand so that you can have your own guided tour. Be warned prices are obviously higher here and the street sellers a little annoying but other than that it's amazing and you must put it on your list.

Good to people watch, but don't eat or drink there!. The prices at the cafes in the square were ridiculous! found a cafe on a side street which, for the price of one coffee on, the square, we got a beer (pint) coffee and savoury snacks, then got an ice cream and sat in the square watching the world go by in the sunshine

Beautiful piazza, tons of artists. Prices for the art I inquired about were very reasonable. Not sure about the actual quality as many of the pieces looked very similar. A lot of street artists, beggars, and men hawking the same souvenirs.

Great vibe!. This is the place to see the rivalry of Bernini ( The Four Rivers Fountain) and Borromini (Sant Agnese in Agone) built in marble and interracting today like three hundred years ago. Music, fantastic italian food, artists, vive - I am already missing all it.
Wonderful square. The square has some fantastic fountains all around and a very nice atmosphere, the stand and merchants slightly ruin the experience
Very nice piazza. The fountain in the middle si very nice. It's a marvelour place in the heart of Rome
Must See. Vibrant piazza with street artists and musicians. Take a stroll through it and soak of the atmosphere and artichecture. Nearby restaurants are expensive.

Fountain of the 4 Rivers. Don't miss this Bernini fountain! Piazza a main tourist attraction. But a must see. stop at one of the many cafe's and enjoy a glass of wine. Explore the many alleyways and find great restaurants and enoteca's
Favorite place to eat in Rome. You almost can't go wrong with any of these restaurants but go to Tres Scalini in the center of the Piazza. Excellent Cacio y Pepe and Tortellini.

Great place to feel the atmosphere of Rome. You can find something for everyone here. The artists are great. The gelato is amazing. The musicians are fun. Afternoons are fun because of the bustle and enthusiasm of the people.

One of Rome's (and the world's) best squares!. This is one of the most beautiful individual squares in Rome (if not the world) and should be included as very top attraction requirement for anyone making a list of to-do attractions and areas to visit in Rome.  What we love about Piazza Navona are first the fountains. The Moor Statue and Neptune Statue, backed by beautifully painted buildings, are very camera friendly, helping visitors make memorable pictures of their time here and in Rome. Further, the Fountain of Four Rivers, one of Bernini’s most intriguing works, anchors Piazza Navona as its centerpiece, and is a marvel of a structure. It comes with a history and story almost as good as the fountain itself. Collectively, these fountains make Piazza Navona simply great.  In addition to the fountains, there are some decent church visits you can make directly on or very close to Piazza Navona. These include Sant’Agnese in Agone, just in front of the Fountain of Four Rivers. Santa Maria della Pace (limited opening hours) is just off the square and the Church of San Luigi dei Fancesi is only a couple place East.The atmosphere in Piazza Navona is very nice, many artists are set-up with paintings, drawings and other interesting things to see (or buy). There are plenty of place to sit for a coffee, snack, meal or gelato near Piazza Navona. We enjoy the GROM gelataria, which serves very good (authentic) gelato, just past the north exit of Piazza Navona. Overall, Piazza Navona is something that visitors do need to see while in Rome, even on the shortest of trips. You can target this area when you are in the Historic Centre of Rome. Also, the Pantheon is 6-7 minutes walk east and make a logical next place to visit before/after you have seen Piazza Navona.

Get here early for best photo opportunities. I arrived at about 9am and just about had the whole Piazza to myself. How wonderful to wander freely between those gorgeous fountains and to be able to sit quietly and appreciate my surroundings, without being harassed by the street hawkers. (believe me, this is one of their favourite spots). Take the time to visit St Agnes in Agone, the Basillica right on the Piazza for a quiet break from the cacophony that is Rome. There are plenty of eateries around the square, but why not slip down one of the little vales away from Navona, and find a little gem that is not tourist driven, there are lots to choose from.
Navona. Great experience! Don't leave here without trying the famous Tartufo Gelato. Is a chocolate ball! This was delicious!
Must seen piazza. Again u should go and see it during the day and in eve!is full of life!! There are lots of small restaurants arounds so u can sit and have as a view the piazza

Beautiful plazza. Though it was raining when we visited it, Piazza Navona still showed lot of charm. It's surrounded by painters and their works (not necesarilly things you'd decorate your walls with :-)) and beautiful buildings.

Don't miss Chocolate Tartufo at Tre Scalini. Go early to avoid crowds and heat. Be sure to set aside time to sit down at the cafe Tre Scalini and indulge in one of life's great pleasures ... sharing a massive chocolate tartufo ... and people-watching.

The best of the piazzas we visited. Busy and beautiful, Visit the museum nearby to see more art than you could ever imagine! Great restaurants round the piazza at which to have a beer and watch the world go by.

Scalini's Tartufo. Make sure to get your tartufo at Scalini's. Getting table service and watching all of the activity in the piazza as you eat your tartufo is wonderful. Make sure to go to this one and not the competitor on the next-door corner. This competitor is not run by Italians and has a sign hanging up above the door that is a blatant lie about being the "original".

Favorite Square: Medieval Feeling: Bernini Work. During the day you will visit the magnificent Vatican City. Visit the fascinating Vatican Museums that were founded in year 1503 when the newly elected Pope, Julius II placed a full-size statue of Apollo in Chains. Since then, many different works of art were added to the church, discover the Gallery of Tapestries, a collection of tapestries of different fabrics from the 16th and 17th centuries and the Gallery of the Candelabra, created in 18th century which contains classical Roman sculpture which dates from the 3rd century B.C. to the 3rd century A.D.Located alongside these museums is the Sistine Chapel built in the second half of 15th century and famous because of its beautiful frescoes, especially the ceiling and the Last Judgement painted between 1508 and 1512 by Michelangelo. Exit the museums and enter the remarkable Vatican Square of St. Peter, with its ellipse of encircling columns in front the impressive St. Peter’s Basilica, traditionally believed to have been erected over the spot where St. Peter was buried after his martyrdom in Rome around 64 CE. Guests that do not have a walking guide for the vatican musuem tour will not be allowed to access St Peter's Basilica directly from the Vatican , so they will have to get back to the car , drive to St Peter's and wait security line (It could take about 1 hour).We do suggest to have a walking guide in order to visit also St Peters Basilica without waiting in line . You will also be seeing the Victor Emanuel monument (the first king of united Italy), also called the “Wedding Cake”, built from 1885-1911 and located in the very heart of Rome, Piazza Venezia. Today, the monument contains Italy's tomb of the unknown warrior from the First World War and is also the home to an historical institute and museum. Climb to the top of the famous Capitolin Hill, over steps that designed by Michelangelo, to observe the superb panorama of the Roman Forum and the Rostrum that stands upon it, a platform from where Rome's leaders addressed the city's people. Visit the most impressive and artistic Trevi Fountain in Rome that covers an entire side of Piazza Poli. Then on to Piazza Spagna, If time permits take a stroll through Piazza Navona, a marvel of light and sculpture with its three Baroque fountains by Bernini, a short walking distance from the Pantheon, a classic Roman temple built by Agrippa in 27BC. Tour the vast Colosseum and imagine it in its grandour, explore this well renowned structure; a symbol of Rome, today standing with original wall sections at their full height and exposed sub-arena pens. Conclude with one of the most important commemorative monuments of antiquity, the highest and best-preserved arch of triumph in Rome, the Arch of Costantine, located in the valley of the Colosseum that represents victory over Maxentius in the battle at the Milvian Bridge in 312 CE. www.romelimousinebyjohn.com

Ate lunch there most days. We loved this piazza. We first went in the morning and it was practically empty but even when it's packed its worth going to as there are a lot of street artists and musicians so it's fun. We ate at the Dolce Vita (lovely service but limited food choice) and Café Bernini (slow service but better food).
Beautiful. It was nice but unfortunately we went on a rainy day. But the good thing is the crowds were minimal because of the weather.

This is one of the many classic plazas that visitors should not miss. The fountains, the art, the architecture, the coffee places that ring the piazza all contribute to the feel. Stop there for an hour or more, you'll love it. Lots of other Rome attractions nearby, so no reason not to at least stop on the way.

Piazza Navona. Another must visit spot to photograph the fountains etc and stop for a spot of lunch or snack or even indulge in some gellato.There are plenty places to eat just off the Piazza that are highly reccomended, just to get away from the hussle and bustle and do some people watching such as Cafe della Pace for drinks (dont have the bloody Mary's) and dal Paino(via di Parione) for great Pizza and pasta..
Artistic centre. Great atmosphere, Full of artists and performers. Great little street cafes around the square.
Great place for a walk at night. Check out this Piazza in the evening and enjoy the fountains. Lot's of places to eat but seemed to be a little touristic.
Lively place!. There is always something going on here and it is great for people watching and the fountains are wonderful. Don't forget to watch your wallet and purse!

Gorgeous. This was the first "sight" that we encountered on our Roman holiday. It's beautiful, which crowds of people and street artist and street performers and fountains. A beautiful piazza to take a stroll and count your lucky stars that you are in Rome.
One of my favorites.. A MUST see. You cannot go to Rome and not visit Piazza Navona. You have to visit it during the day and during the night.
Somewhere to sit down!. Good for people watching but get your coffee somewhere else as prices are high round here. Read the guide book to make the most of the interesting architecture and fountain
picturesque large piazza. With an obelisk, 3 fountains and colorful buildings this was my favorite piazza in Rome.

Flea Market and Restaurants. It's a nice open area with a lot of people selling mostly art when we were there. Several good restaurants located all around the square. Makes a good stopping point if your walking to/from the Vatican from the center of the city.
bernini again. beautifull place with so much going on its difficult to explain, from electric guitar to superb bernini fountain.loved it

My favorite !. I just love all the artist and the coffee shops around . And all the buildings which so round the piazza... My whole family loved the place.We could stay there just sipping coffee and observing for hours !
Nice Piazza. Large Piazza with 3 fountains lots of bars to stop and let our feet recover and people watch.

Quite and Peacfull. A nice place to relax and have a cup of coffe or cappuccino and watch painters painting , it is a small place full of coffe shop and restaurants, also you can take some nice photo if you are into photography.
Theme Park. Fountains and history difficult to appreciate because of street sellers just about everywhere like ants :-(

Amazing atmosphere for the tourist in you.. It's only natural to enjoy the touristy places when you're on holiday....despite how tacky that maybe. The impressive fountains by Bellini & the street artists & the hustle & bustle around the oval chariot course is invigorating.

FOR A GOOD TIME!. I love Piazza Navona!!! I know the sidewalk cafes are overpriced, but it's worth it. You get to sit and watch the activity of the piazza while drinking good wine and receiving excellent customer service. If you're visiting Rome, be sure to visit Piazza Navona!
Most beautiful Piazza. This Piazza has a lot of fountains and is just beautiful! It also has a lot of vendors, but I think that adds to the italian charm

Very Nice Piazza. Converted from a stadium, this piazza is quite large. It is filled with fountains and some churches worth seeing. Quite a few buskers were there. It is worth checking out while you visit rome.
Just amazing. Another beautiful place to see in Rome. Sit and enjoy the world go by and walk around the Art stalls

A place you won't regret visiting. This is a beautiful place to visit, mainly at night. It has some charming restaurants and coffes. The Fountain is so so so breathtaking and impressive. There's a huge number os street artists exposing their (sometimes impressive) work there. The only catch is that it could be a little bit more illuminated at night, but it is, without a doubt, still very beautiful.

My favourite place in Rome to go to!. I stumbled upon this place in my first night in Rome. I was travelling alone for the first time and was terrified. I got lost and ended up here and suddenly started to enjoy myself. There are wonderful sights to see in Rome and this is by no means a top attraction but it is a lovely place with a lovely atmosphere. If we were in London this would be Covent Garden or Bara Gothic in Barcelona- a lovely place to wonder and sit day or night. Go and drink Prosecco in one of the bars or sit on the fountain with an icecream. Go go go!

A Perfect Piazza!. Beautiful harmonious houses with a wonderful baroque church (St Agnese in Agone) in the middle! Fascinating fountains! Especially in the evenings there happens so much and it is great place for the kids. Cafés and restaurants are quite expensive but on the other hands, the surroundings is so wonderful it's worth it.

Rome isn't Rome without a Piazza!. Hi gang - a visit to all the major Piazzas is a must, and Piazza Navona is at the top of the list. Yes, it's nearly always packed, but the atmosphere, hustle and bustle of activity and the amazing fresh food around the Piazza makes it well worth the visit.

My favorite Piazza. Find your way to Piazza Navona to experience the artist vendors of Rome. Breathtaking is an understatement. The best part of the people was an elderly man lip syncing an Elvis song and not very good at it but the entertainment value was priceless.
Great. A good place to eat, drink and watch the world go by

The artists hang out. fabulous architecture, especially the fountains Watch the various artists at work, buying one of their canvasses can be a little pricey but we haggled and got a good deal The numerous cafes are also rather expensive, but hey, when in Rome !! Angela C Bridgend South Wales
Great hangout spot. Very artisan, very comfortable, lots of people and not many annoying sellers.

Another of the stroll-worthy sites in Rome. This piazza in Rome is larger than most. Only the Piazza del Popolo was larger among the ones we visited. The highlight is Bernini's Fountain of 4 Rivers, which lies right in the center. North of this fountain, the piazza contains an open air art market. South of the fountain was more open. Close to the Piazza della Rotonda with the Pantheon as well as Campo de Fiori

Wonderful evening in the Piazza.. There are so many cafes to pick from - just pick one and you will not be disappointed. The fountain is beautiful and all the artists are so talented there. There are even musicians to listen to as you relax and have a glass of the house wine. ENJOY!

A must visit by day and night. Three spectacular fountains, an obelisk and dozens of street artists surveyed by the diners in the posh restaurants adjacent. By night the emphasis is on surveying the cleverly illuminated fountains, socialising and eating in the cheaper venues off the main Piazza.

Very fun. This Piazza was one of our favorite Piazzas in Italy. It was buzzing with people and things to do and see. Lots of restuarants to choose from. Gorgeous fountain especially at night all lit up.
Life is a caberet. Always a trip to walk through and watch people watching people doing a thousand and one things.

Just another piazza. Nothing special here (unless I missed it), just a bunch of art vendors and some restaurants. My husband and I walked through it because it was on our way to the Panthon. We stopped at a restaurant for espresso and that was more thn enough time here.
Fun place. Obviously a tourist location - lots of (expensive) cafes and restaurants. Stalls and street artists and plenty of fun people watching and viewing the art on display.

Nice but too popular?. Without doubt one of the most attractive piazza´s in Rome. Unfortunately it is becoming too popular. Huge crowds and all kind of "artists" are polluting the piazza, taking away its spacious character. Best visiting is probably January-March when you can occasionally have the piazza for yourself. Avoid the drinking and eating: far too expensive and of mediocre quality.
Great. We really enjoyed having an evening meal here than strolling through the Christmas markets had so much atmosphere.

Excellent!. Piazza Navone is one of the most famous and arguably the most beautiful of Rome's many squares. The large and lively square features no less than three magnificent fountains. Another eyecatcher is the baroque church of Sant'Agnese in Agone
Piazza with expensive pizza places. Lovely big square with lots of street artists which were fun to watch. There are so many places to eat but all quite expensive.

Great at night. I loved this piazza at night, after dinner, everyone is out on the piazza and there is entertainment, music, lots of great restaurants in the surrounding areas and arts/crafts marked where you can watch people do their art.

Breathtaking!. I spent two evening in piazza navona. The three fountains are wonderful. This piazza is full of life. Aside from the pakistanis who tried to sell us pashminas (beautiful ones btw, had to buy! But do haggle with them if you decide to buy), this place is ideal to sit down and watch life go by in the evening. Besides, it is ideal if you want to buy art- watercolours, oils on canvas). The artists price their art very decently compared to spain or paris. One word of cautiion: if you decide to wear high heels, be prepared to walk on cobbled pavements which couldbe a serious death trap! better wear comfortable shoes!

quite a pleasant moment. be an italian. sit there and chill out especially during good weatherwalk around and hit to the back street for the specialty fashion stores. there is also a webcam there so you can ask your friend to capture a screen of you sitting in the piazza
So Italian.... Artists of all kinds, 4 Seasons Fountain and a sense like you travelled in the past

Impressive square and great for people watching. Bustling and architecturally impressive piazza. Good quality (but expensive) cages and restaurants abound. Well worth seeing and having a coffee but if you value your bank balance, eat elsewhere :) ...........I didn't and am looking forward to a year of bread and water!
Lovely Piazza. Great restaurants and fountains lining the piazza. Great place to relax.

Beautiful square... Ridiculously expensive restaurants. Piazza Navons is a bustling, stunning piazza that is perfect for people watching... If you are not on a budget.Don't get me wrong... We don't mind splashing out whilst away but paying out £16 for two beers we decided was a bit ridiculous.Definitely worth a visit.

Very entertaining. Various street atists and painters are dotted around the fountains in the Piazzo, making this a different experience to most Piazzas. Great to see but too busy for a relaxing drink.

A cultural gem. Like all the main tourist spots in Rome you can happily stroll down here late at night without a care in the world. And when you arrive you'll be treated to street artists galore. And the atmosphere is simply wonderful.
Beautiful fountain, terrible crowds. Crowds and souvenir stands completely spoil the experience. Perhaps a bit better after dark.

possibly the best square in the world. An armonic combination of styles by the greatest architects and sculptors of the italian Rinascimento immersed in a constant crowd of different and colored people....
Beautiful. It was absolutely beautiful people were all sitting about eating ice creams and enjoying the fountains .The only thing thats annoying is the men selling flowers.

Magic!!!!!!. Love this place. One of the first places I saw in Rome and it does not disappoint! Expensive I suppose but worth it. Two of the best meals I have ever had were had here. Shame I can't remember the name of the restaurant. A must when in Rome.
Expensive cafes.. A nice place for a drink or ice cream, and watch the world go by, but beware - study the menu before ordering as the cafes can be expensive!
go!!. In the top10 of things to see in rome P. Navona is up there for sure!! Go to 'ai tre sacalini' and try the cake with tartufo!!
Grab a bite and watch the world go by. Stop at one of the plethora of restaurants around here and grab a pizza and a glass of wine. Watch the people go to and from and enjoy yourself.

Beautiful square with fabulous fountains. One of the most beautiful squares in the center of Rome, with fountains that are famous all around the world, souvenir shops and restaurants . A must see in Rome...
Piazza Navona A Must. Also listed in most peoples top 10 sights in Rome. You will enjoy this experience.
expensive. i had heart attack most expensive 2 coffees i have paid for but still nice cost me 18 euros!!!!!!
Quaint plaza with lots of restaurants. A beautiful fountain attracts you to the square. Artists surround the fountain. There are many restaurants and cute shops in the large square.
An interesting little pocket of life!. When we visited the Piazza there was a political rally going on which made for an entertaining and lively experience!

Prettiest square in Rome. This has 3 incredible fountains, including the incredible Fountain of Four Rivers by Bernini. Very vibrant area with lots of atmosphere and not nearly as packed out as other fountains like the Trevi fountain. A MUST SEE

Would be better without the stalls. Full off little stalls selling tat and all the restaurants trying to get you to go in. We stopped for a coffee.(and to use the bathroom) 11 euros! for 2 coffees. Beautiful architecture but ruined by stalls selling tourist tat.

Romantic and artsy. I love this place, specially at night time. It's wonderful for a stroll and a good meal. Don't get lured in by the guys selling crap on the street, they're illegal immigrants taking advantage of tourists. Other than that, this place is beautiful.

Lively.. When people visit Rome they flock to Trevi to throw the coin and see the stunning fountain. Though we loved Trevi, we loved Piazza Navona and the Fountain of Four Rivers even more.Bernini's fountain is beautiful but Piazza Navona... was so lively that we stayed there for hours.Our kids loved playing a game where they went on a search around the fountain to identify all the animals in the fountain.It was so much fun for our family!! :)

The four rivers and all the world. Sunset, dinner and more tourists, but all in all superb! See with attention, the sculptures, before and after sunset. Truly good food right across the street right in front of the fountain.
Nice rest spot. All of the piazzas are really beautiful. Have a gelato and people watch, you won't be disappointed

Lots of street vendors. There are lots of bars/restaurants/ice cream shops around the piazza navona. The ice cream was a little more expensive here though. In the square (we went at night) there were lots of people trying to sell you things, such as pictures or these laser things.

Crowded, but lit magically, at dusk.. Piazza Navona is beautiful, but crowded, at dusk. Artists are selling their wares (as well as hawkers with less desireable goods.) Bernini's Four Rivers fountain is a wonder, and it's lit dramatically at night. The light here, as the sun sets, takes on an almost otherworldly quality. Blues seem bluer, and pinks seem more pronounced. (Or was it just the wine?)
Beautiful in new years. The square is awesome always but by the time of xmas and new years its even nicer, lots of people, arts, and little snacks
Favorite spot in Rome. I found this piazza to be the most beautiful and lively in Rome. The fountains are amazing and many local artists and musicians come to display their talent.
Pick a sunny day and enjoy. Most of the art is touristy tacky but you can find artwork that may move you. Lots of restaurants but I would go around the corner to Cul de Sac.
Great buskers. We enjoyed the buskers around the piazza. It was a pleasant place to spend some time in the evenings away from the heavy traffic throughout the rest of Rome.

Wander at your leisure. Marvellous statues and fountains. Artists sit about painting,street cafes abound,(but cheaper down the side streets),another area to people watch and enjoy the bustle of tourists trailing behind their leaders going glassy eyed. It's a lot to take in!

Beautiful, a must see!. You simply can't miss this piazza if you come to Rome. A great mix of scenery, beautiful sculptures and fountains and lively mix of people. A great place to stroll with a gelato after a Roman meal!

A unique place - OCT. 2007. It is a unique place where you can see the talented people painting, making shows .... etc in addition to the historic statues there. A nice wide place to have fun & see these types of arts.
My Favourite spot in Rome!. Such a beautiful vibrant area in the city and I could have spent hours browsing through the artists work, eating gelato etc. My favourite part of Rome :-)

Nice place for people watching and lunch. Awesome views of the fountains by Bernini.
Lots of street performers and touristy thngs to buy.
Very nice to realx here with a glass of wine after sightseeing all day.

Take your time. At first it may seem like there isn't much there. It is an old Roman circus converted into a public square. There was an art show going on which added to the atmosphere. It has a very nice fountain as well and is a quick walk to the Pantheon and other sites.

Don't like the market. Piazza Navona is one of my favorite places in Rome, because of its history, its buildings and the Bernini Fountain in the river. Last time I visited it was raining, so the piazza was majestically almost empty. This time it was fully invaded by a pseudo-artistic market that devalues the artistic and historic beauty of the space.
Good atmosphere. There was a lovely atmosphere here, with lots of musicians and entertainers and lots of good-humoured, happy people. Expensive restaurants though!

have a break and watch the world go by. three fountains and a church too many peddlers now
but still a lovely place on a sunny day

Enchanting piazza. History that relates is all over this piazza. I love the artists at work. The piazza is a significant display of Baroque art from the 1600's with work by Baromini, Bernini and others.
The most beautiful in Rome. Two beautiful fountains, buildings the color of sunset, and a gorgeous church to visit. This was a lovely piazza for photos, and a great stop for gelato.

Buzzy and bright - but don't eat here.. This is one of Rome's most famous Piazzas, loved by tourists and good to walk around for the experience. But beware of eating here, or buying anything from the artists or street vendors - it's a well-known tourist trap and both quality and prices reflect that. You'll pay a lot of money for food which is at best average, you'll be expected to tip well for service which isn't great you've sat down, and you'll be hounded by buskers wanting a few euros for 'entertaining' you with often not great music.But it's an experience. It's a very 'buzzy' square; it has one of the best toy shops in Rome at the top ( 'Al Sogno' - don't let your kids touch anything though, it's not cheap!) and Bernini's famous and stunning 'Four Rivers' fountain in the middle.Piazza Navona is by far best visited in the winter when most of the street sellers have gone and the restaurants are far more desperate for your business, and therefore more likely to offer better food and service. The best time of all is in December when the Christmas market is held there. At that time of year it is, quite simply, magical.

Lovely place to while away an hour or two. Piazza Navona is a lovely place to while away an hour or two without the noise of traffic and to watch artists and surprisingly gifted musicians at work or just people watch from one of the many cafe/restaurants surrounding the Piazza,

Expensive coffee!. Piazza Navona is a wonderful spot to while away an hour and people watch. Home to buildings of the Baroque era, nowadays it accommodates many artists who draw caricatures of the tourists that visit. Coffee is expensive here in the many cafes - at least 5 euros a cup compared to 2.50 euros elsewhere. Worth it for the experience.

A nice place for a coffee break or brunch. Another tourist trap that is nevertheless a pleasant location to visit. Stop in one of the many restaurants for brunch or simply a coffee and watch as the many tourists from around the world walk on by!
one of the best piazzas in Rome. the fountains, the artists, the cafes all around and the vibrant crowd create a majestic atmosphere and put a smile on your face

Go early. Great place if you get there before all the "artists" show up to peddle caricatures and schlock art. Visit the San't Agnes church on the square, it's stunning. And spend time admiring the 3 Bernini fountains.
Eternal City at its best.. This is my favorite spot for people watching and relaxing. You can also access Campo die Fiori easily from here. I really consider this to be the heart of Rome.
People watching. Had a lovely 2 hour lunch people watching here. The Piazza has a large fountain in the middle and there are a lot of artists selling their wares and also others selling prints.

Artists Delight.. This is a must go place for the tourist. Artisans of all sorts are here, particularly painters selling their creations. A place of sights, sounds and smells. Two wonderful fountains and surrounding sculptures. Restaraunts are good, if somewhat expensive. It is an experience.

A pod of calm. Piazza Navona is a wonderful place to soak up Rome culture without the hustle & bustle of the tourist sites. There are many restaurants, cafes & gelateria's here to simply watch the world go by accompanied by live music and watch the artistics at work.
