Favourite square. Best place to sit, eat or drink and people watch !

Fun, grab a bite and wander around the vendors' stalls. There is a delicious bread bakery (wish I could remember the name) tucked in the corner. We grabbed warm focaccia fresh from the oven and wandered around to look at the vendors' wares and people watch. Nice way to spend an hour or two

Lovely Piazza - spoiled by street traders. Beautiful piazza, stunning architecture, lovely shops and restaurants, but - far too many street traders selling the same stuff that you can find anywhere else in Rome. It all just cheapens the place.

A must see that is really nice.. The Piazza is much larger than I expected. We went in the early evening, walked around and had dinner. The fountain is beautiful, worthy of many pictures. The Rick Steve’s pod cast about the piazza and fountain are great. On the piazza you will find many artists, so you can have a portrait drawn, see a mime, hear some live music, or purchase pictures and drawings. The restaurants around the piazza are varied; they range from white table cloth service to take out pizza and gelato. It is a nice way to spend an evening

Bernini at his finest!. The fountain in this piazza is a true work of art. Take time to study it as there are many hidden pieces. Having lunch at Piazza Narvona under one of the tented restaurants is really fun, watching all the tourists take their pictures.

Beautiful at nighttime!. We walked across Piazza Navona during nighttime and it was absolutely amazing! The lighting of the fountains and buildings are beautiful and the atmosphere is different from other big open areas in cities as it doesn't feel very cramped in space.

The Popes got this wrong. This was a rare stadium in the Roman Empire. The Romans preferred blood sports and chariot racing to athletics but this was really a home of athletics and should have been reconstructed by the Popes in that manner. Its worth a look with a guide book.
Busy Piazza. Very nice and busy piazza. Big attraction for tourist. T night you will find talented local artists displaying and selling their art work. A must see attraction while in Rome.

Very Busy. If you like local art mixed in with beautiful fountains and quaint cafes you don't want to miss this Piazza. The local artists not only have their paintings with them, you can also watch them paint. It is a very busy square so if you don't like crowds it is not the place to be. Mind you if you don't like crowds Rome is probably not the place for you in the first place. The only annoying thing is the constant badgering of street vendors who approach you contantly to try to sell you junk toys. That was the most annoying thing in all of our travels to Rome.

Nice in Eveing and daytime. The Piazza and the fouhntains are well worth the visit although my preference is in the eveining. As you would expect the establishments around the square are expensive, but search down the lanes and you will find places of great value.

One of the ost beautiful piazzas in Rome--if we could only see it!. It was a gorgeous sunny day when we visited Piazza Navona on 26 March. Unfortunately it was hard to see all the fountains because of the many artists and their paintings as well as tourists. Was able to take some pictures of the family while trying to get a glimpse of the art work in the fountains. Some annoying vendors kept trying to sell their trinkets but a "no, grazie" did the trick. Some human statues (i.e. Egyptian mummy in pic below) were also trying to get you to photograph them for a few euros. No food and drinks here, though; why pay triple the price when you can just walk round the corner or to a smaller street for a delicious cappuccino or beer? Despite all of this, I still enjoyed re-visiting this fantastic piazza.
Piazza Navona. Plan on some time here. This is a very large piazza with many things to look at. Some of the best street artists were in the center.

Everything in one place. The Piazza Navona has been a central part of Roman life since the first century AD, when the emperor Domitian built a stadium there for everything from races to Christian executions. You can easily see the outline of the racecourse in the layout of the piazza, and even find the last intact original gateway to the stadium just north of the piazza (look down or you might miss it!). In Renaissance times, it was the embodiment of the ongoing battle between two extraordinary architect/sculptures, those being Borromini and Bernini. And in modern times, it's the place to catch some great street food and hover to people-watch. Piazza Navona is alive with activity around the clock, with great restaurants and bistros located in it and (if you want to lose some atmosphere but save a good bit on the bill) just west of it. It's a place you're likely to frequent daily, maybe to come and stay for a while, maybe just to pass through, but definitely to use as a locus point when you're wandering the maze of twisted little streets that is Central Rome.

When in Rome. My absolute favorite spot (and fountain) is the Piazza Navona. It is spacious and actually has 3 fountains but the main fountain alone is incredible. You must find a place to sit and watch the musicians, artists, and other tourists. We ate at a cafe on the piazza. Even if the prices are higher there, you must experience this. It is lovely.
Go at Night. I liked the Piazza, but thought it was better at night, because the fountains are lit up, and the street entertainers really make it a fun place.

If you're an Angels & Demons fan this is a must. Amazing fountains - and the Romans so love their fountains! Street entertainers, artists, bars restaurants. Visit day or night its equally breath taking.

Historic statues and local artists at work.. This is also a must see in Rome. Lots of local artists painting and selling their paintings. If you're going to eat or drink, recommend choosing restaurants down one of the small streets off the piazza. Better food and prices there.
A dream fulfilled. I always dreamed about visiting this place and I finally did. I little less glamorous in reality but definitively a very romantic place, specially if you are with your loved one.
Good atmosphere. Enjoyed the numerous street performers and general experience.
The most lovely spot. This may have been my favorite resting spot in Rome. It is a great place to listen to music and watch the crowd.

Great Evening People Watching. Here you can eat, see street performers and study the great sculptures of the great Bernini. https://www.google.com/search?q=bernini+piazza+navona&hl=en&prmd=imvns&tbm=isch&tbo=u&source=univ&sa=X&ei=eOJ0T7rABKXu0gHQvdDaDQ&ved=0CD4QsAQ&biw=1020&bih=637

Beautiful Piazza. I wasn't expecting to like the Piazza Navona - thought it would just be one big tourist trap. However, it really is a lovely piazza - beautiful fountains to sit by and chill out. The restaurants are quite expensive, but they are happy to let you sit right out on the piazza even if you are just having a drink. Would recommend visiting here.

great fun for the kiddos. a hub of activity and artist. beautiful! we found a great sandwich shop close by, got some beer and juice for the kids had a picnic and watched people from all over the world marvel at the fountains. there are places to eat everywhere you look. you will not go hungry.

Tourist Trap. The Piazza more and more resembles Montmartre (Place du Tertre). Waiters of the many restaurants/cafetarias are very intrusive in trying to catch you. Be aware of pricing and poor quality of food and drinks (e.g. overdose of ice cubes). Best moment to visit is very early in the morning without the crowd, the portraitists and the waiters.

Go at various times of the day. Fountain of four Rivers by Bernini is so interesting as is the Piazza, especially at night and early morning. Many cafes and gelato stands for all price ranges circle the Piazza. Artists and entertainers are sprinkled all around the fountains; there is much to sit and absorb. The outdoor seating all over is great and the staff do not rush you to leave but seem to encourage you to sit and enjoy.
Great little ristorantes in this area. So many ristorantes to choose from, quaint, while people watching and sipping wine, Many local artists displaying their work. Very good artists.
Lovely area. Don't like being hounded by street sellers, apart from that the area has lots to offer.
Go in the morning before the street venders. The street venders later in the day crowd this beautiful Piazza that supports 3 stunning fountains.
Beautiful. Crowded with sellers if you can look past them and enjoy the beauty of what it is, then you've got a gem.

An unexpected find. I was unaware of this place before I came to Rome, but when walking around I saw loads of signs for it and it was on every tourist map, so I went to see what the fuss was about!! Beautifull fountains and ice cream parlours and restaurants. The buildings were very grand and there was lots of street performers and artists! A great place to sit with a book and ice cream!!

Relaxing Stop during Tour. The Bernini Fountain was impressive and unique representing the four continents (at the time, they had identified 4). The Square was very crowded with tourists and shoppers but was easily traveled. We had some gelato at one of the shops in the square and were very pleased. Just a very relaxing end enjoyable stop on out our.
Beutiful Bernini fountain. Very beautiful fountain by Bernini, otherwise nothing special.

Lovely meeting place. I love this piazza, it has so much going on. The fountains are spectacular and it makes you feel that you have definitely arrived in Rome. Loved all of the artists etc even if you are proabably paying over the odds.
amazing place. it was very crowded but the atmosphere was fab make sure you sit down at soke it all up
favorite piazza in Rome. very cozy and beautiful piazza. a lot of art work, cozy cafes and very beautiful old buildings surrounding it.
The jewel of Rome. I always come to this place for the Bernini Fountains. but down the side streets is the best Gelateria. For some reason it always tastes better here.
It doesn't get any better than this!. This is what we thought Rome would be like...the music, people, sights and food. Have a leisurely dinner and soak it all in. Simply divine.

Good for Buying Paintings & People Watching. Great Piazza to people watch and pick up a cool Rome painting or two. Cafes are a bit pricey. Good place to rest the feet when making the trek from the Vatican to Trevi Fountain.
Relaxation. A very special place with full of cafes, fountains, a lot of artists (painters) and a nice church
A delight!. After seeing how crowded much of Rome was during the day, I'm very glad we went here our first night. At night, it was lovely and a breathtaking introduction to the city.
Wonderful. One of the best place in Rome, you won't find anything symilar all over the world

make sure you walk from one end to the other!. silly me, i came to piazza navona through the middle and stopped there. took a seat in front of the middle passing area and never went to the opposite sides for the fountains! HOW SILLY!!! so i actually didnt get to see the neptune fountain nor the fontana del moro! sigh! yes, the movie when in rome was filmed near the neptune fountain! so don't miss out like i did! we were also entertained by a handful of free acts! there was a particular comedian that put on a good show and gave us all a good laugh for about 10 minutes! great way to people watch and enjoy the weather out here!

Very popular Piazza filled with local artists. This is one of the most beautiful Piazza's in the world. It is filled with local artists as well as visitors from around the world taking in the beauty of the statues. Very romantic place to stroll and take in the beauty of the surrounding buildings and shop the many stores.

Tartufo to go. Get a tartufo to go for half the eat in price and wander around this lovely square around sunset before settling down for a drink before dinner in one of the many cafés lining the square. You'll pay through your nose but the atmosphere and people watching are worth it.
great place to eat. great for people watching - lots of nice restaurants
Great people watching!. Fun restaurants, fun fountains, lots of trinkets to buy - and great people watching. Get some pasta and wine and just sit back and enjoy.
Same story as Trevi Fontain. Yes, nice square, but Rome has so much more to offer.
one of the most beautiful places in a sunny day. Try to avoid the restaurants and cafes since they will rip you off for a very poor drinks and foods.
Great Square : Romelimousinebyjohn.com 2012. In this square you can admire the famous fountain by Bernini completed by him around 1650.
Lovely piazza. Fabulous fountains and great for people watching – lots of cafés and chilliing out.

A must-see when in Rome. My fiance and I stayed in a hotel just off the Piazza Navona and so visited the square a few times during our stay. It was the first place we went to on arrival for a licquor coffee and pizza at lunchtime and we ate out twice here in the evening. It is hard to remember the names of the restaurants - there is one called Scalini which was very pleasant. We tended to find the restaurants on the left of the square (if you are stood by the tourist information) were better quality and a nicer atmosphere for dinner. The first meal we had was made extra special by a street singer who sang for our entire meal - he was excellent and made it really magical. On the other side of the piazza you do tend to get pulled into the restaurants by the charm of the waiters but I would say to be careful - the meal we had on our last night was over-priced and disappointing, It can be hit-and-miss. All in all, a must-see in Rome. There are many piazzas like this but smaller.

Not one of the most known places, but still a charming one.. When you think about Rome, you will probably not think about Piazza Navona, but you must know it is a very nice place to visit. It hides the shape of the old circus for 30.000 peolpe it was once, which you can still guess. It has one of the works of the great sculptor Bernini (the fountain of the 4 rivers). And it has lots of people painting, selling, and giving Piazza Navona life and charm.It is not the Colisseum or Saint Peter, but don't leave Rome without walking through this place.

It's how you would imagine a Roman square !. It's so typical - dozens of artists painting and selling their work, street artists, scores of people chilling out and just enjoying themselves, lots of restaurants and cafes and narrow winding alleys with shops and more cafes & restaurants. Roman life is enticing!

**A MUST when Visiting ROOM. This is just a presentation of a tremendous story including one of the Cardinals who would be pope and a wealthy family there. The restaurants with offered wood fire pizza are great. There is such artistic talent on display that you would wish to have many more days to visit.

little oassis. a little square with artists painting little ice cream shops and cafes nice to sit and catch your breath little allyways lead off to pretty back streets not main roads and one off the best toy shops china dolls fairys and cuddly annimals life size by the way
My favourite place. This is true cafe culture, so much to see and do, and the atmosphere is fantastic with street performers and paintings wow what a place.

Buzzing. This square in good weather buzzes with activity, painters, market traders and of course the illegal ones that get moved on touristy priced restaurants, so find a quieter one on one of the side streets. the fountains are very ornate and the detail is amazing

Bit touristy but go anyway.. Anything by Bernini is beautiful and his three fountains here are no exception. When we were there a young woman was playing Puccini on her violin. We felt like we were in a romantic movie.

Lovely place for lunch. Lots of artists painting and stalls in the middle of the square. A great fountain too.
We ate at one of the restaurants (can't remember name) on a Sunday lunchtime. The sun was shining and the square had a great atmosphere. A great place to meet friends and enjoy al fresco dining.

A truly magical spot. We loved coming here in the evening. Aside from wonderful restaurants and entertainment, the art was amazing. There were dozens and dozens of local artists displaying and selling their works. Then of course the 3 amazing fountains! Absolutely beautiful.
the greatest place in Rome. the amount of people make it very lively, and the three fountains make it very Roman

Great spot!. We went to Piazza Novonna several times while on vacation. It is really nice with the statues and the outdoor cafes for a bottle of wine while people watching and relaxing. The Pantheon is a 5 minute walk from here as well which is great!
Nice but too crowded. Very nice piazza with beautiful fountains. Super crowded with tourists and the respective sellers...
Fun. In the evening there are street performers and it just comes alive with music and dancing!
Fun Piazza. Lots of activity and fun right in the center of Rome. Amazing fountains as well

My favorite place. I went here several times each day. I love this Piazza. A block to the west along the via de tor Millina you will find caffes with cappucino for slightly more than a euro and restrooms. On the north side is a "toy shop" called "Al Sogno". I bought a beautiful statue from them. There are Real artists in the Piazza and there are people sselling photocopies of art. Find and support the actual artists. On the east at the corner of Corsia Agonale and Corso del Rinascimento is a shop with some very nice oil and vinager carafes. To eat, walk one to two blocks in any direction and then start looking. Good food at good prices.
The beauty of the Bernini Fountains if overwhelming.. The impresive and massive fountains of the talented Bernini should not be missed on any trip to Rome.
nice. A nice little square around the corner from the pantheon

Best place to enjoy a gelato!. So beautiful, not one but 3 exquisite fountains, lots of folks selling their art work, and an amazing Church to visit. Sit enjoy your favorite gelato, all the people, and the view!
Atmospheric - great fountains. You can really tell this was once a Roman arena - large square, tourist cafes a bit pricey

You should give this some of your time. Great atmosphere here, with little stalls etc in the square. We sat on the steps and had some gelato here, as the restaurants are all so overpriced in this area.
Great people watching and gelatto!. Large open piazza with lots of vendors and great fountains.
Wonderful shopping and food. You can find products actually made in Italy. We ate at several restaurants in the Piazza and all were wonderful!
Lots of people. Interesting area where the Romans raced their chariots,lots of interesting shops and goods for sale.Always many amusements to sit and watch.
little piece of heaven.. Dont know why, but I love this Piazza. Its a great place to stroll with beautiful fountains. Grab a gelato and people watch
Touristy but fun. Go there but be on notice that it is a tourist location. The activity level is over the top - but it is Italy afterall.
One of the places people go to see but a tourist trap. Nice atmosphere but a real tourist trap. EAt elsewhere

Best Piazza in Rome. I've been to Rome 3 times and it was this time that I saw all three fountains in Piazza Navona uncovered and restored. They are beautiful, take lots of pictures! Walk from one side to the other and enjoy the little market stands where they sell everything.
Great place to relax. I loved Piazza Navona. Great place grab a sidewalk table at a cafe to people watch. Very relaxing place to be and enjoy.
Good place to hang out. Yes there are statues and buildings and so on, but actually the center of rome is just great because you hang out there with romans! ahaha, we had so much fun

pleasant afternoon activity. The fountains and the church are lovely. The street vendors are not overly pushy, and many have good things to purchase. Not on my must see, but a pleasant stop between other sites.

Delightful Roman Piazza. We stopped at Piazza Novona twice on our last visit to Rome. Good place to grab and coffee or gelato, though prices are a little higher due to it being a major tourist spot.
Excellent location to view artist paintings or prints that you can purchase relatively cheaply that make fantastic souvenirs.

wow. Went here on our first day in rome just before sunset the fountains are magnifacent and the four rivers is just awesome look for the figure of bernnini shielding his eyes from his great rivels work

Best place to visit and enjoy a gelato. During your tour in Rome after visit the Fontana de Trevi on the way to it is recommended to stop on this piazza and enjoy a nice gelato.The restaurants have many tables on the outside where you can sit and enjoy your ice cream at the same time that you see the people walking around.By the way this is the place where the Brazilian embassy is located in a building with more than 500 years old.

spectacular fountains with spectacular priced coffee. This is a gorgeous place to walk around, enjoying the most amazing fountains, street artists and watch the passersby, but be careful you don't go and sit in a restaurant for a coffee. They charged us about 6 euros a coffee, which are usually 1 euro standing in a normal bar. Enjoy but be aware.
Fun. Beautiful fountains, lively people-watching. Watch out for pick-pockets!
Lovely. This is the place to go if you want to a relaxing lunch or coffee and to sit back and enjoy the sunshine and watch the world going by

An interesting piazza. To have such a large piazza in the centre of a city is unusual and very rewarding for visitors. It has three beautiful fountains including the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi which has the personification of four main rivers. The place is agog with artists - singing, painting & performing during day. Sit there with a gelato. There are decent restaurants and pizzeria in the vicinity.
Great Piazza to be entertained. Enjoyed looking at at the artists work and being entertained by the street acts and musicians.
Amazing piazza. In my opinion, the most beautiful piazza in Rome! It's definitely a piazza where you can sit and relax with a Gellato
Great for People Watching. Wander around take in the atmosphere and treat yourself to drinks at an outdoor cafe (surprisingly not too expensive) to enjoy watching the world go by.

A beautiful square filled with people and fountains. The Piazza Navona is a wonderful place to start and end each day in Rome. A former racing track in ancient Rome, it is now a square filled with dramatic fountains. There are cafes, street performers, artists, and wonderful architecture. We sat quietly one evening near a fountain and an artist came over and gave my daughter a picture of the colosseum.

Former race track. My husband thought every piazza was similar until he heard that Navona was the sight of former chariot races. Then the place became alive for him. The enormity of it,it's shape, made sense. 3great fountains and a lot of interesting artists who park themselves there. We were told the restaurants in the piazza were expensive, and seriously too much people traffic, so we did not eat there. Impressive, we walked through there twice.
Must See!. Three wonderful fountains and large open park area. Away from the crowds and a great place to grab a sandwich and watch people.

Piazza Navona beautiful and very busy. In Oct 2011, my daughter my sister and I were thoroughly enjoying our trip to Rome. We had heard that the Piazza Navona has the best pizza in Rome at Forno de Campo de’ Fiori. We had just visited the Trevi fountain and decided to walk to the piazza Navona and walk we did, past statues and monuments and the magnificent Pantheon. We eventually arrived at the Piazza Navona and much to my chagrin it was not at all what I expected. It has the beautiful fountains of the Four Rivers and Neptune’s fountain, and the fountain of the moor and all sorts of “living” statues trying to make a quick buck, such as a cowboy all in black, a pharaoh and whatever else you can think of. I had expected a park, but there you are it was a Piazza. There were a lot of café’s around the park, and the churches and buildings surrounding the square were quite beautiful. Quite a sensory overload.

A must for visitors to Rome. The fountains are spectacular and have recently been the subject of restoration, the Piazza itself is a vey pleasant space. Worth a visit Xmas time when there is a special market dealing in all things Xmasy. Its easy to do Campo di Fiori, Piazza Navona, The Pantheon and the Trevi fountain on one leisurely stroll
great picture taking. as with all of the art/ruins etc in Rome, a must for pictures. lots of little vendors all around..atm close...i think i also spotted a little cafe or two very close as well
FUn place to people watch. There was always a lot going on here and we enjoyed the people watching.

Best place in Rome. This was one of the best sites in Rome. Its a huge piazza , many fountains all around & marvellous cafe's, which i ate in one of them the best lassagnette ever...it was 14 euros, but it deserved it.!

Great at dawn.... One of the most visited sites in Rome and very...crowded during the day, evening and night. If you want to enjoy this beatiful "piazza" you should have the courage to wake-up just before dawn and stand or sit in the middle of the piazza to watch sunrise in this huge square without a soul. During the day or after dinner walk, go to the Tre Scalini caffé and enjoy the famed "Tartufo"...

A tour of Rome is not complete without this Piazza. The fountains are amazing, especially because they are amazing from every point-of-view. Visit this Piazza again at night for an entirely different perspective. Cute cafe's, interesting vendors complete the package.
Fabulous. we spent beautiful afternoon on piazza Navona. Just sitting and watching the life going on around us.

Beautiful art, lots of street art, hustlers, music, and food. The Piazza Navona is a beautiful place. Three gorgeous fountains, the central one by Bernini "Fountain of the Four Rivers" and the huge Sant' Agnese by Borromini, define the piazza. It is ringed by restaurants and shops. The center is, at any given time, filled with tourists, school groups, vendors hawking wares ranging from sunglasses to art prints, local artists who will do a sketch for E15, and musicians playing for a donation. Yes, it is a lot of fun. There is not much serious about it. My favorite place is at the southern end, where you can often hear a lively quartet of older men playing classic Italian music. It sets the stage for some mighty good people-watching. It is not so much a destination as a way station for people passing through to get to the Vatican or market at Campo de' Fiori. Hang on to your wallet just in case, but mostly the crowd is just looking to get some sun, gelato, hear music, wattch the world go by, and a have place to hang out. Also popular at night with young people.

A beautiful fountain. Piazza Navona is a must see when you go to Rome. Besides being beautiful, it has a very fascinating history.Plus one can get chocolate truffle gelato. Yummmmm. The explanation of the design of the fountain is great and the piazza used to have horse races. Lots of vendors, which i avoided. way too expsensive, but a great place to people watch.

Magnificently Italian but bring a flask. This Piazza gives a real feel of Italy. It is quiet, relaxed and Architecturally outstanding. It is so pleasant to stroll around that one would be tempted to sit in one of the outside cafes. Six Euro is far too much to pay for a coffee there and this in a country where a good coffee costs less than two Euro.

One of my favorite spot. I’m not sure why it was my favorite spot to hangout and relax in Rome. It has two magnificent water fountains and is closed to really good restaurants like La Focaccia. It has many bus stops nearby. It is a good, strategic, and kind of quiet place to take a break and relax during the day or night.

The Best Piazza. Great Place for Refreshing, big place...i can drink coffee at the cafe and see many peoples, many art (paint/drawing), many show ; music, pantonim, dance and many more in this place..

Favorite Spot in Rome. This was easily my favorite Piazza. Yes it's a tourist stop so will be somewhat crowded but nowhere near as crowded as things like the Trevi Fountain or Spanish Steps. There's a beautiful fountain in the middle which represents the 4 largest rivers at the time Bernini sculpted it. There is also a church in the Piazza which allegedly holds the skull of a martyred saint.Piazza Navona is a perfect spot to get some gelato and people watch. There are also a number of street vendors selling art. Be aware, most of booths containing reproduction prints. For a truely unique treasure, walk around a little bit and find an artist actually there painting and pick up one of those works. Chances are you'll get a great story from the artist as well!
Fun, lively, toursity. My wife and I had a great time here. The piazza is beautiful with million things going on. Be aware of pickpockets though because it's very crowded.

Fantastic Paintings. This is the Piazza where all the artists gather to sell their paintings, they are brilliant and well worth buying if you can get them home. The restaurants and cafes are expensive sp only go if you can afford to treat yourself.
Beautiful but crowded. This is one of the largest piazzas in Rome, and also one of the most crowded.. There are many other piazzas in the city that are less crowded,
Don't miss it.. Its beautiful, it's amazing, it's romantic...just sit and enjoy the view, and if you're lucky, also enjoy some good jazz musician playing around.

Not my favorite place in Rome, but worth seeing. It is a great place to people watch, but I didn't love the crowds. And there were so many people selling stuff, it was a little annoying. They even let them set up their shop on or in front of the fountain, so it makes it hard to take a picture. I would much rather hang out around the Pantheon.

must see. It is a famous place in Rome. You should not miss it. It is really close to the Pantheon. In the center there is one of the great fountains in Rome - the 4 Rivers by Bernini. It is an area full of life, day and night
Beautiful. A great place to stop & watch the world go by!!Magnificant history & fabulous places to eat & drink

Beautiful Fountains. The Piazza Navona was one of our favourite places in Rome. The three large fountains allow for excellent sitting areas to sit in the sun and listen to the water. A gem in the city.

A beautiful piazza!. We really enjoyed our hour or so that we spent at Piazza Navona. My 3 daughters (5, 7, and 9) enjoyed looking at all the paintings, and watching the artists at work. There were some benches to sit on and enjoy the square, and feel the warmth of the sun in February. We had just eaten, so didn't have an opportunity to enjoy any of the many sidewalk cafe's around the square - but they sure did look tempting!

Nice place. Great atmosphere!Very nic architecture. But there is too many persons that offering the tourist stuff (sun glasses and other souvenires). It quite annouing and it spoil the atmosphere a little.

Special. Another special fountain that I would have hate to miss ... My only issue was: a lot of people trying to sell you something, a little piece of souvenirs ... Ruining a little bit the beauty of the place.
great Piazza.. worth a visit. another of those places to walk around and enjoy a gelato
Great resturants !. Superb choioce of places to eat here in a beautiful location , we loved it here !

A must see when in Rome. OK its a bit touristy but its a beautiful square and a must see when in Rome. Always loads going on. Can be a bit difficult to find your way in though as m any of the toursit maps are not great!
Lovely place!. When you step into Piazza Navona it's like you are in a different dimension. Love the place!
well worth a visit. lots going on could sit there all day people watchingnever seems to get quiet
Great restaurants. Big plaza with lots of restaurants. Great for relaxing and watching the world go by.
lovely. Not what I expected at all. It was very lovely and so much to see around it.
Sit and watch the world go by. We were lucky there was a carnival in progress so saw lots of local people taking part
Love this Piazza. The is the only piazza in Roma where traffic is not allowed. This is where they used to have the chariot races. Very nice fountains and places to sit outside and people watch.

Avoid the restaurants. Historically it is a great place to visit as you can still see down to a lower level of Ancient Rome from certain places on the Piazza. However the Christmas Market was rubbish and the restaurants are ridiculously over priced for not very good quality.
Tacky. Lots of vendors, restaurants expensive and ordinary
free tour. This piazza was also included in the free tour, It starts in the Spanish Stairs by the monument of Mria. The guide was very good.

Nice plaza. Very nice plaza, part of where they filmed the movie angels and demons.
Nice fountains

Beauty, energy and history...don't miss it!. Piazza Navona is a delightful spot to spend the evening - the beauty of Bernini's "Four Rivers" fountain graces this beautiful Piazza. With the historical race track around the Piazza, we could visualize the history. The energy is high with both locals and tourists window shopping and eating. We did not eat there because of the poor reviews earlier, but some places looked just great... I went to Piazza Navona December 2010 with our two daugthers - if you're there over the Thanksgiving/pre-Christmas season, this is a MUST!!! Vendors of all kinds set up booths and the shopping is wonderful! Ciao!
Three fountains in one square!. One of the many squares in Rome - a lovely spot to sit and enjoy an ice-cream.
Peaceful and quiet in the morning. We visited at least twice. In the morning it was lovely but at lunch time, the street vendors were a pain pestering those appeared very vulnerable.
Your dream comes true. Beautiufull surrounding for one of the best icecreams
walking between the artists. very good place,with many painters around.Dont drink coffee ,its very expensive(6€)....
So festive. We travelled to Rome in Jan and Feb and both times went to Piazza Navona on a Saturday....it was so vibrant with buskers, entertainment, cafes don't miss it
at last the scaffolding is gone. all the scaffolding is gone in this Piazza. this won't be like this for long.
Great for cafes and restaurants and shops.. The fountain is huge, the crowds are large, the cafes and shops full of beautiful things
Classic Roman Spot for People Watching. My favorite "reprieve" from the hot city. Great gelato, wonderful art, and full of life. As it has been for 2 thousand years.
Bellissima. It is a pleasure take a drink or eat something in this Piazza. It has a own life and we fee happiness in the faces of all people. children and adults there is place for all.

mixed emotions.... the Piazza itself if glorious. The fountains, the architecture wonderful. But ALL of the restaurants in the Piazza serve the worst food in town. Uber tourist traps, bad food, really bad food. So unfair to the place itself. Christmas time, make sure to buy the "bad kid" candy, that looks like coal. That is fun. But, please do yourself a favor, do not eat there - walk a few streets over, you will find a place that you can enjoy your food.

must see piazza, extremely overpriced terrasses. very beautifull piazza, but the little streets just behind it are just as wonderfull to discover. Do not eat or drink anything in de restaurants on the piazza. 15 euros for a spaghetti bolognese, 6 euros for a beer... you can find much better restaurants for half..

Nice. We spend one evening at the Piazza Navona. Lots of restaurants and street acts around this area. Very entertaining. We ended up having a walk around look at the stalls, street magicians and then having a few cocktails in a bar on the square. Not too expensive either!

Piazza Navona - a must see. Piazza Navona is big, leisure oriented and again one of the top attractions, While you will not have much to do (except for corner museum on history of mechanical inventions) it is good to stroll around, possibly have coffee in the most famous coffee shop in Rome (on the left side if you look towards Porta Navona) ...tip: do not sit down they will charge you three times more than if you enjoy your coffee at the bar as most italians do:)

lovely piazza, but please do not eat here. many artist and streetsellers at the piazza which has a relaxed atmosphere. I recommend not to eat at one of the restaurants here, as they are extremely overpriced and not that good.
the place to meet. you can eat there in one of the many fine resturants, enjoy a two hour lunch then step outside to see three fountains of brilliance. You could stay all day there.

Go at night, its a surprise. This was one of my favourite Squares in Rome, at night when its a little emptier it was really nice, have some wine in one of the restaurants and watch the people float by, and the flashes from all the cameras. it is an impressively long square and feeds into a nice walk to the Trevi fountain and pantheon.
Loved it. Don't just wander through it - sit and take in a (light) meal, coffee or beer. It's worth the time to sit and just watch the action from a cafe.

Beautiful, excellent atmosphere!. It doesn't matter what age you are, it is brilliant here! It is a beautiful square with an amazing fountain. Me and my boyfriend got some wonderful photographs of us here, it was great. There are a number of cafe's around and a daily market of people selling their paintings- some are wonderful and unique. The atmosphere is lovely- there's a gentle buzz to the piazza. Went here three times in two days just to watch the world go by, it was lovely. It is roughly a five minute walk to the pantheon from here, so it's near some main sites. Definitely going to go back here if i go to Rome again!
Live in Rome. Amazing ambience music people, fountains, the bars very expensive

Walk to the Pantheon are if you are hungry. Piazza Novana is a wonderful area of Rome. After a long day of walking, we sat down at a cafe near the center of the piazza for a drink. After waiting several minutes for the waiter to take our order, we decided to pass on the 9Euro beer and took the short walk to the Pantheon where there are several outdoor cafes with much better pricing!
My favorite place in Rome. Must visit if your in Rome...I loved the artist and just sitting around people watching..

One of my favorite days included Piazza Navona... Visit Campo di Fiori open market in the morning, shop and then grab fresh items for lunch and of course a bottle of wine! Walk over to Piazza Navona and grab a bench and enjoy your lunch. Nothing better then a great piazza, good food, wine and friends in Italy!
Lots to see. Restaurants and bars are a rip off. Instead, dash in, use the loo, but an icecream and eat it on one of the many benches...and just watch the entertainers at work

Angels & Demons. Enjoyed the close atmosphere of shops, restuarants, residences and the church which surround the fountain in the center of this piazza. Many of you will recall this to be one of the film sites in the movie Angels & Demons.
Covered in Scaffolding. We could not see much of the Piazza as there was some construction going on
Different days... Empty and depressing on the rainy day, buzzing, chilled and fun on the sunny day!
Nice square but do dine elsewhere. Lovely architecture but surrounded by overpriced overrated restaurants Better eaterie in any of the sidestreets.
Watching Rome Go By. Loved stitting in this square watching the world go by. Lovely local artists have their wares on sale.
So cute and fun to walk around. Great gelato, gorgeous fountains, loved the street performers. Hated the Moroccan peddlers
Wonderful during the holidays.. Twice now I've been to Rome over the winter holidays and the Piazza Navona is really fun to visit. It's like a carnival set amongst history.

Piazza di Navona, mangiare e godere. When you want to eat with a view to historic buildings and a lot of life going on, this is the piazza to be. Don't mind the food, it is OK, Here it's all about the location, the view and the vibrant lifestyle, I like it

A Great Place to sit and watch. This place is right at the heart of it, There is so much going on in and around the Piazza that I would definately suggest that you sit and watch it all going on, The are a great range of places to eat and drink. Think Covent Garden x5
Evening outing. Our B&B was a 30 second walk from this square (Casa di Sara). This place was great in the evening, tons of life and activities.

Favourite place in Rome. As my title suggest, this is my go-to place in Rome. It has 3 stunning fountains and endless street performers to keep you entertained. There are many restaurants, but as some are overpriced, we happened upon a little place on the main road which looked like a cross between a fastfood place and a tavern which had the best Penne Arrabiata I've ever tasted. There is an amazing street who's name escapes me right now, where you can buy beautiful vintage items, mainly leather, in which I'm sure I shall sink a large fortune next time around. A brilliant place to just people-watch and take in Rome in all it's glory.
Nice piazza.. The surrounding buildings make a very nice setting. Downside is that you can't avoid the crowd here. Just accept this.
Lots of history. great fountain to explore and realize early roman history of this area, can be seen in movies
lovely. lovely artwork being sold and jazz playing very nice atmosphere, The fountains are amazing too

A jewel surrounded by excellent antique shops. Piazza Navona is an elliptical-shaped, large square, fully enclosed by palaces (one is occupied by the Brazilian Embassy, another by the Museum of Rome) and an open air market for painters and portrait artists. A short walk from Piazza Navona will take you to the Pantheon, another "must see".

M'eh OK, maybe the time of day/year. Big impressive building along the Piazza but the Piazza itself was bland and unimpressive. Nice waterfall in the centre but after seeing the Trevi, it wasn't all that impressive. Maybe it's because we were there in February and in the morning too. It's problier prettier and a bit busier in the warmer months.

Full of life. This old market square is filled with life, street-artists, street-performers, nice cafes and surrounded by fine architecture. It has something for everyone.Tip! There is a great toy shop in this area.
An experience!. Great entertainment for all ages atomosphere electric great choice of restaurants just to sit and watch the world go by
:). A very nice square. There are lovely side streets going out of the square too, so don't forget to explore them!

Colorful square. Piazza Navona has always been one of my favorites. An old stadium now surrounded with historical buildings. Although nothing remained from the stadium, Navona is now really a nice square...With many cafes and restaurans all around, mini carnivals, street artists, it is a colorful vibrant square for the most of the day.Fountain of the Four Rivers is the symbol of this square. Once you are there, you can't miss it. (the four rivers are the Danube, the Ganges, the Nile, and the Rio de la Plata)
Ice Cream a Must. Had a lovely chilled out meal and ice cream here, just sit and watch the world go by
Excellent area for the outside arts. We walked Piazza Navona and enjoyed the outside artists, the musicians and the sculptures. Beware of pickpockets. No dislikes.
Busy and Beautiful. This Piazza is definitely worth a visit. The fountains, the architecture, the restaurants, and the PEOPLE! You will not forget this Piazza.
Painters,Fountians, Bars and Gelato. You will spend two (or more) beautiful hours of your life relaxing, enjoying one of the best piazza in Rome

Lively!. We were in the Piazza when they were having a festival for the Christmas holiday(which is through Epiphany). It is a beautiful Piazza filled with an amazing fountain. A must visit while in Rome!
Great art work!. During the day you can find amazing art work here, fountains were great. Take a picnic and enjoy the great people watching.
A great place. Really cool fountail. the best piazza in rome. bought some great art here.
Great place at day or night!. I love the little trattoria here. It is a great place at all times. Good market options too!
Worth a look. Nothing special but still worth a visit! Eat or drink outside of the Piaza

All that Jazz. We were there on Valentines Day, & to add to the merriment a jazz band were playing. What with that, the artists & the rememberance of reading the Da Vinci Code, it all came alive for me.

Happy hour - every hour. This place is great. People are going there to have fun with all the streets artist, music, shows etc.
Don't eat there... the restaurants in the area are not good. loof for the side and paralel streets
Piazza Navona. The place to go to see the street artists. There were also artists selling and painting.
Oh lovely Piazza!. I know it's a tourist spot but the atmosphere there is wonderful, colourful. Many bars and cafes, artists selling their paintings and mime artists - lots of fun!.

One of Rome's most impressive and popular square.. During the Christmas season Piazza Navona is packed with stalls selling toys, sweets and decorations for the nativity scene or Christmas tree, making it a favorite spot for children. There are also musicians and performers at the center of the square. What I most enjoyed was marveling at the different fountain/ sculptures in the area. Another great spot to enjoy a cup of espresso or a glass of wine and donut lovers or not, one has to try a "ciambella calda" (hot donut) with chocolate filling.
lovely view whilst dining. lovely view whilst dining, restaurants are quite pricey around here though
Dont miss Piazza Navona. Vast array of restaurants and we never leave Rome without visiting Piazza Navona
Piazza Navona. What a breatiful place this is. Very calming and relaxing. Lovely to watch the artists painting.

Great Spot - Average, Overpriced Food. This is a central happening spot in Rome! It is not to be missed, especially if you enjoy shopping for art prepared by local artists. The only drawback is that the restaurants are so busy that they are overpriced. If you need a break, they are great for resting and watching all the action in the piazza. You must order something to eat though. Order a plate of cheese and fruit and a half bottle of wine to share. Savor the food and relax as the Romans do.

Magical place to relax in rome. One of the most romantic places in rome. The whole square and the ambience is just electric. There are musicians and steet performers, tourists and locals and it really is a taste of roman culture..old and new. The fountain of the 4 rivers is also another masterpiece of bernini....i never knew a INDIAN river was one of the 4 great rivers depicted in the fountain.My honest advice to tourists is to avoid the restaurants by the piazza...they arent the best for food but good to sit around and have a capuccino or exspresso or a glass of wine...for serious dinner...walk a few meter in either directions and you will find a host of restuarants.
Beautiful fountains. The foauntians and square are beautiful, it's a great place to sit relax and people watch in fantastic surroundings.
Beautiful 'square' with a great buzz. A great spot to relax and watch the world go by - preferably while eating tartuffo ice-cream.
Fun!. All kinds of stuff always going on here. Best is the old man opera singer -- absolutely adorable man!!! Also, the neighborhood behind it, Via della Pace is right out of a movie set.
Daily Carnival.... Besides the beautiful fountains and St. Agnes church to view, there are regular street performers to enjoy.
TURN AROUND. An exciting and head turning experience, didn't know where to look first.
Stands out!. Beautiful!It really stands out as you pass by, like so many monuments in Rome.
Charming. A great area to share an expresso and people watch.

Nice to see, but don't stop to drink. Pretty fountain - but you will pay at least 3 times the price to sit and have a drink of average quality, when literally 4mins round the corner are a wealth of delightful tavernas and bars sitting in little squares....

ruined by cheap fair. What a lovely Piazza it is and after seeing all the photos I really looked forward to seeing it in real life. When we arrived I thought we were in the wrong place! It was covered in fair rides and candy floss machines and donut sellers. Not the artists and relaxed atmosphere I was expecting. A real shame as the fair blocked the view of all the surroundings and it was all just tacky. It was the only real major disappointment of our whole trip to Rome. I would just like to add I don't give out 1 star reviews lightly but the fact we couldn't see the attraction through all the tat means I have to score it so low

Disappointing after all the hype. Granted the weather wasn't great to show PN off at its best, but it looked quite run-down with several bits fenced off for building work and even the street sellers looking really sorry for themselves.
beautiful. bustling with stalls and artists, a beautiful piazza for a stroll in any season

My favourite piazza!. Whenever I visit Rome I enjoy having an espresso at Piazza Navona during the summer. Very picturesque, lots of tourists, people drawing, singing...a very nice atmosphere!
I would advise you not to eat in the nearby restaurants. They are rather expensive with an average quality!
A great place for coffe. dont be fooled by the coffee shops in the piazza, Its better to look for a more authentic place in the alleys around

oh! such fantastic place. When in Rome, this was one of the places I could't get enough of it, we were trying to be around it every day. It had such a peaceful, special, magical atmosphere...and I was thinking of the movie " The roman spring of Mrs. Stone", fantastic movie which had a lot to do with Piazza Navona.A tip: avoid the terraces and restaurants in the neighborhood, they are only expensive, not good. Find the ones hidden in the little streets, then you have the best!

Piazza Navona. It was really cool seeing the piazza's shape and knwoing that they raced chariots there. The fountains are beautiful and the gelato is great, but it's expensive if you buy right there in the piazza.
stairway to love. sit down, breath the summer and Pizza, think of your imaginary italian lover and become one

Piazza Navona. Fair enough it has a couple of really famous fountains which are well worth a visit but the restaurants on the piazza are just plain rip off establishments. Go one or two streets away for better food at half the price.
Relaxing. loved the area, surrounded by restaurants, nice to sit and watch the world go by. Easy to find
When in Rome .... Our hotel was in the neighborhood and it was worth the walk.
great fountains and atmospheric buildings. super place to sit and look around or drink a coffee and watch the world go by

This covers a bigger area than just the square. Go in the day time and see the artists. Whilst there research the back streets for a restaurant. We did it in reverse and ended up very confused. There are so many side streets that we did not visit in the eveining we were there that housed some great looking restaurants.
Tyremarxx. Just relax and let it take you. have a coffee and watch the world go by. Nobody can do this like the Italians. Go in December to the Christmas fair.
Full of charm.. Lots of charming shops and monuments but beware of the food and coffee prices just because you are in the piazza.
Beautiful Rome. This is what you think an Italian Piazza should look like and be with lots of people, artists and fountains.

Piazza of the Gods. Come over to Piazza Navona every night if you can, and sit outside at any of he restaurants you can grab a table at. Have some wine, engage the waiters, have a terrific meal and watch Rome go by. If I lived in Rome I'd be there all the time!
Colorful Piazza. Lovely fountains. Many movies have been filmed here so a pleasant locale to visit and photograph.

This Piazza is highly recommended for a Rome Trip!!!. It is one of the most popular squares in Rome and if you are going to Rome to enjoy the atmosphere then your visit will be incomplete if you didn't visit Piazza Navona. You will find local art, paintings, street artist and places to eat and there are some good shops for souvenirs as well. Pantheon is also close by and we had one of the best Pizza's on our way to Pantheon in Via Giustiniani street. ATMs are also close by if you need extra cash to buy any painting as we did. This Piazza was also part of Dan Brown's movie Angels and Demons.It has some colourful buildings which will make a good HDR photo if you are into it. :)

Love it!. Fantastic!!!!!! In December there are a lot of markets selling several things, including my favorite, Torrone!! There was a man selling HOME MADE chocolate of all flavors! Melts in your mouth!!! The fountains are breathtaking!!!

Magical piazza. Fantastic place to people eathc, eat a gelato, listen to the rishing waters of the fountains....All the little side streets around Navona have lovely gems of restaurants, designer and second hand clothing shops and pubs. Do spend some time wandering down these streets, eating a pizza slice or a gelato from the myriad of sellers.
a living piazza. a must in rome. Too much joy ,people.. İt s a living part of rome in day and night
This is a MUST-SEE!!!. Go here! Bernini's Fountain is a masterpiece.Notice thr layout of the square....it was a former racetrack in Roman Times.

Piazza where it all happens. This is the hub of Rome i think. The piazza is littered with shops and restraunts and in the middle of the piazza were people performing different things and paintings.
In the hotter evenings this place will be amazing!

Biggest & Best. Nice to get that wide open space in historic Rome.... it's beautiful and it's got SEVERAL fountains and the restaurant we ate in had excellent food with only slightly-hyped up tourist prices. Worth it for the view. Linger over coffee!

The square of beauty and enjoyment. This square is full of art, each fountain and statue is a master piece, the area is crowded with people appreciating beauty and enjoyment. There are musicians, performers and painters. You will enjoy an hour at least in this place. If you decide to have a dinner or lunch, you wll find many nice restorants, you will enjoy the food and drink, but you will not enjoy their over prices. Its a place that you can't miss if you go to Rome.
Another nice square. As the title says, a nice square with coffee bars & shops etc.
great atmosphere, often events. great atmosphere, often events, a lot of artistic painters and restaurants around an old piazza with fountains

Great Restaurants Here!. You will find some nice dining in this piazza, slightly elevated prices, but still affordable. We did run into a protest that congregated in the plaza that day, so we didn't stay much longer.

Very, very cool. This piazza is amazing. We had our Sunday lunch here, overlooking the 4-river fountain. We had a few dishes, a couple of bottles of wine, outside, under a heater as it was January, chatting, watching the crowds, looking at the fountain, listening to the singing - it was magical.This is a beautiful beautiful square, well well worth the visit, either by day but also by night for a drink or a coffee.
It feel great to walk around. It's a great place to walk around and enjoy the atmosphere, the cafes and yummy gelato.

Shops around are my favorite. The thing is we discovered Piazza Navona when we were heading for shops. There was a huge celebration going so the square was full of people. It was the furtest we went up on the small Rome map and we walk all the way back to the Colosseum afterwards.It is a nice route to take on foot if you like walking so much.
piazza navona. you can spend hours and hours wandering around this wonderful square without never getting bored. i simply love rome

Always worth a visit. Piazza Navona is special to visit... day or night... in season or off season.... Bernini's Fountain of the Four rivers is perhaps his most viewed work.... Try to visit during morning or late afternoon so as to visit Borromini's church, St. Agnes... a fine Baroque church which offers a Thursday evening service and also hosts many musical events ( see entrance doors of church).....In the evening, look up to the building... second floor , left of church entrance... you will see a beautiful ceiling fresco. Now part of the Brazil embassy, this was once the residence of Pope Innocent X and he gave his blessings to the crowd from this window..... His papal marks can clearly be seen on the Fountain of the Four Rivers..... The other two fountains , at either end of Piazza Navona are also worth a look..

What a nice spot. We were staying minutes away from here and we were there quite a few times. This is were we bought some paintings to bring back home. Lots of talented artists are selling their work. It was not as nice as the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain, but still worth a visit. And if you are looking for art to buy, make the visit!!
Would be amazing in the warmer weather. Worth a trip but beware as prices all around the Piazza and streets are very high

More stunning fountains1. Originally a sports arena, the space is now half filled with artists , buskers and statue people, and lots of people doing the passegiata. A lovely city space with beautiful fountains
Pretty. Even in the snow it was a pretty Piazza with nice restaurants and bars

Hard to believe this Piazza sits directly on top of Roman ruins. The Piazza is serene and a peaceful break from the hustle and bustle on the main streets of Rome. The fountains are beautiful and we found a souvenir shop where my husband bought a gladius which he was happy with for the make and the price. There is a little bar/trattoria where we had some wine and espresso...I do not recommend stopping here as a single espresso was 4 euro.
Early morning to get the best pics!. We went there about 9am and it was great to get pics of the fountains.
Local Art. There was a lot of local artist displaying their art. Beautiful statues and really good art. Well worth the time.

Wonderful location for people watching over wine or cappuccino. Between the seemingly omnipresent sound of someone singing opera, the lovers strolling hand in hand, and the beautiful architecture, fountain and statues, this is the place to stop for a snack or a bit and just drink in Rome. It is quite near the Spanish Steps (also a great place to watch the people) and each street leading to it has many wonderful stores.
You must stop there. You must stop there to eat an ice cream, sit and watch people.

MUST. This was pretty much the first place I saw in Rome and it was unintentional! We were wondering around the streets of Rome, wanted to sit somewhere and grab a capuccino and there it was - Piazza Navona. Four fountains and one of them (one in the middle) perfect! You got to see this!

Beautiful & Fun. This is a good place to stroll along, people watch, take pictures, and enjoy some gelato. You can browse the street vendors selling art, visit the church, or maybe just sit and relax for awhile.
Beautiful!. Lots of artists, shops, gelato, eateries... just a beautiful place to take a walk.
3 fountains and a church !. Wow, sounds like the nicest piazza, but still Rome has many, nice church and a cool piazza - visit !!!
Ok. Felt quite touristy.....consistently similar and fairly poor food around it

LOOK FOR THE TRICYCLE TAXI GUY... SEE MAIN POINTS OF ROME IN UNDER AN HOUR!. Have a lovely lunch here... but be sure to keep an eye out for the Tricycle Taxi guy! There are not many of them. Oh what a time you will have!!! They are cheaper than the horse and carriage, and he will show the highlights of Rome (Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc) in under an hour, winding his way through the small streets that most cars cannot go through, and quicker than you could walk through. Crowds parted at every attraction and we had door to door service. He took our picture, too! A 5 Star fun-filled experience!!! We had 3 adults and a toddler...exceeded capacity so we tipped him extra.... boy was he tired! Great with kids and elderly... LOOK FOR HIM!!!!!! Best experience in Rome!

I just loved it!. A very nice place, with beautiful houses, tavernas, people and, of course, fountains. Once you get there, you start feeling sort of being Roman. Even is full of tourists, there are a lot of locals too and the combination it's like a welcome for the foreigners. Beautiful architecture, beautiful place and people. Go visit it and get the Roman scent.
Cool to see. It was very neat to see Piazza Navona. I enjoy the history immesely.
Breathtaking scuptures. Loved this Piazza, a must see for the Fountain of the Four Rivers and the street performers . I guess the locals stay well away but it is well worth visiting
Wonderful. My favorite piazza in Rome. Go there every time I'm in town just to watch the tourist rush by and grumble about the prices at the restaurants

see Italy here. There is always something going on in Piazza Navona. Read up on your history before visiting because it has a fascinating story. Read "Mistress of the Vatican" for more information on this place. Be sure to see the beautiful church in the Piazza
Beautiful. Wish we would have spent more time in the Piazza! We went there at night and wish we would have seen it during the day as well.
Favorite piazza. I adore this piazza. Lovely! However be careful from buying paintings, most of them are not real.

So Cute. We loved Piazza Navona. We walked there from the Colosseum because the crowd was just too thick on the ground to forage for food over there. We found an adorable place to eat outside, and then walked through and bought cheese and wine and fruit and other nifties before the sellers packed up for the day. We loved it, even if they bizarrely left horrible messes after they left?

Piazza Navona January 2012. Large and pretty, lots of artists displaying their work. Watch out for the bag sellers as they are aggresive and not meant to be there - saw them all get chased away by the police!
Amazing. Good place to have a romantic lunch in the sun and enjoy the view

Very pretty and fun vibe. This place was lovely, so pretty (as is everything in Rome) with lots of mime artist dressed up!! Really nice atmosphere! We were there during the day!! We had been advised by a local family friend living in Rome to be wary while at Piazza Navona at night time!!
Nice to see. Great location and fountains and good for a stroll and lunch and a coffee. Wonderful around the holidays especially to see Befana (the good witch)

uncrowded. There are so few tourists in Rome now that even on a Friday night one can stroll peacefully in the piazza. There are still some street performers and artists selling their work. Still too many street vendors selling junk gimmicks, but just ignore them. The piazza is calm and beautiful.Enjoy!
Buzzing with life. Great for a walk or for a coffee. Watch the hustle and bustle pass you bye as you marvel at the arcitecture and fine surroundings

Beautiful square, great gelato and good for a relaxing hour or two in Rome!. Lovely square to walk around, have coffee or gelato in and view interesting art works. Whilst busy the square is very laid back and a much less hectic atmosphere then other places in Rome.
Piazza Navona. Upon the advice of others we went to this site. WOW, very good with lots of artists selling their paintings, a good jazz band, and great restaurants surrounding the piazza.
entertainment square. another must see, great vistas, plenty of street performers and market stalls not far from other central sites
4-river fountain is the best part.. Lots of artists tried to just decorate a fountain. Benini made a sculpture which is part marble &part flowing water

Pretty piazza, fake artists. The piazza, the fountains, the architecture around are all beautiful. But most of the "artists" are selling posters and cheap prints. We saw someone filling in a pre-printed (kind of paint by number) painting and we realized that it was not original art because we saw the same thing next to the Spanish steps. I thought I might find some young artist's work, but there was nothing of the sort, even though the guide books and websites tell about this being a place where artists paint. There were a couple of portrait artists, but that isn't what I had in mind. Also, just because I'm in Rome doesn't mean I want to bring home a painting of the Colosseum! I might want a non-location specific painting. This aspect was a disappointment.

Beautiful Fountains. This Piazza is only 5 minutes walking distance from the Pantheon. There are two of the most beautiful fountains in this Piazza, and all around the square there are little cafes. The day I was there, on a Sunday, there were artists showing there wares. It seemed more relaxed that other piazzas that I was in. It is worth visiting , maybe having lunch , a glass of wine and watch the people.
Beautiful, even with the people. People watching is great here - you might even see the Statue of Liberty.

People watch. Sit down and watch the show in the evenings, but I love the very early morning 6 or 7 am not many folk about and a real feeling of magic to the place. Get up earl go to an early mass and then sit and watch Rome come alive.....

Jan 2012 trip. A local showed us around and stopped at a small shop to grab a sandwich for lunch. Sat near the fountains and enjoyed people watching. Were told the story of the 2 competing sculptors that built the biulding first, then the other one built the fountain with all the staues shielding their eyes from the building. Brought alittle humor to the scenry around us. Enjoyable place!
Take it as it is. Dont be put off by the masses of tourists, join in, observe Bernini's fountains and visit the two wonderful toy shops at each end of the piazza. Avoid eating anywhere on the square!
Terrific. Statues/Road side artists/some music in a really idillic setting. What more can be said.
Beautiful place. The plaza is gorgeus. The three fountains builded in it are wonderful, and the church right in front of it is a bit of heaven...
fabulous.... ...a truely beautiful square particularly in the evening...could spend many an hour just sat there watching the world go by & drinking wine!!

Best piazza in Rome. Definitely a must when you go to Rome. The fountain that was designed by Gian Lorenzo Bernini is amazing.
Also the piazza is very colorful with painters and vendors that sell all kinds of stuff.
free & buzzing. day or night this place is so atmospheric, we went when all the christmas markets were on and the sounds and smells and friendliness are of christmasses past

Piazza Navona - Not to be missed when in Rome. Piazza NaVonna has three very famous world class fountains to see when you're in Rome. The first is the Fountain of the Four Rivers, by Bernini, the other fountains are the Moor Fountian and the Fountain of Neptune. A great meeting place and usually full of people, a true treasure of Rome.At Christmas time the piazza is usually packed with people, vendors selling Christmas goodies, and other vendors selling food. Check it out, always a great meeting place.
People watching and Tartuffo. Sit at Tre Scalini and order a Tartuffo and just watch the hordes of people in the piazza. It's my favorite place in Rome.
Chocolate Lovers. Have to stop on the square for their famous chocolate dessert.....delisicio....just have dessert too pricey for a meal.
Elegant & Quiet. A beautiful piazza - worth the stop. Epic espresso just a few blocks away at Sant'Eustachio.

Get here well before lunchtime.. This was a delight. We managed to get seated at a cafe on the piazza, called Caffe Barocco. The food, when it came, was fabulous, the service however, was dreadfully slow. It was great to people watch, lots going on with various artists and entertainers around. 60 euros for lunch inc a bottle of wine for two people.
Beautiful Piazza to spend a sunny afternoon. Relatively quiet and beautiful, this is the perfect place to spend a sunny afternoon, people watching with live music wafting through the air.

Culd de Sac restaurant. Culd de Sac restaurant, off the piazza serves excellent sardengan food. the owner of our B & B reccomended we go here. full of local office workers, no tourists. great place and the best pasta we had!
Great Piazza!. Loved this Piazza for eating out! We had nice weather so we sat outside in some of the various restaurants one may find in this Piazza. Visited this piazza several times!
Great spot to eat & people watch. We went 3 times for lunch & dinner. Restaurants are all delicious. It is a great big open area of painters & restaurants. We love it there & would not miss it.

Large and impressive. This piazza, if I'm not mistaken, is the largest in Rome. However, the bigger the piazzas get, the more charm they tend to lose. The best thing to do in this piazza is simply people-watch and browse the local artists and see their art on display. If you want to grab a bite to eat but don't want to be in the piazza, then head to nearby wine bar Cul de Sac (Piazza Pasquino).

semi-intresting piazza, slightly remote location. piazza navona is one of the famous piazzas in Rome, mostly for the statue - Fountain of the Four Rivers which is reviewed seperatley.the piazza is slightly reomte when compared with other attractions and sights of intrest in Rome, and by it's own right not the most intresting the area.A market with many stalls is located in the piazza but wasn't open at 10:30 am so can't tell you much about it.finding the way and walking around the piazza was intresting - but definitley not a must.
great atmosphere!. Good place to buy art, and spend the evening! although very crowded.
Spectacular at night. Go at night, see the fountains. Then go somewhere else for dinner.

Christmas Market. We visited during late December and the whole piazza is occupied with a Christmas market. It was great fun to walk around and watch the locals, and the buildings around the piazza are beautiful.
The Domiziano stadium transformed. This is the most excentric and beautiful square of Rome. Fountains, churches, imperial games, and today the delight of us tourist approching art. Overwhelming.
Lovely. I loved this Piazza...we walked through here on our walk througout Roma in the evening.
Among the better piazzas. There was a lot going on in this piazza on the day of my visit. It added to the authenticity of the square. The fountains were lovely to watch despite the crowds.

Just one of many. Piazza Navona is a great place to people watch and view a piece of history - but such is the case with almost any other Roman piazza. At the time of our visit, the Piazza was host to a carnival, which I understand lasts through Epiphany, and during this time is a great place for children. The restaurants along the Piazza are touristy and some of them are pretty persistent in trying to lure prospective diners inside. The bottom line - it's great to visit, but you would not be missing much if you didn't.

Beautiful piazza with lovely fountains. A huge piazza with amazing Fontana dei Fiumi. Like the large amount of different kinds of paint artists selling their paintings-one painting is now on the way to my living room wall.

beautiful piazza lively atmosphere. The piazza is simply beautiful at any time of day or at any time of the year. Its always lively and you will often find entertainment of some sort. The fountains are fabulous - particularly the four rivers by Bernini. The cafes in the piazza are expensive - try the smaller places off the piazza and down the small side roads - where you will find some decent bars and tavernas
Always a carnival!. Theres a carnival set up in the Piazza with plenty of sweets and games. Cotton candy, Nutella, huge doughnuts.
enchanting. an architectural wonder -see, impossible not to be enchanted by the square during Christmas is full of surprises

Rome's quintessential Piazza - just stay away from the hawkers. I regularly visit this city on account of having relatives living there, yet this is one place in Rome that I never give a miss to visit - unlike other star attractions such as Trevi fountain and St. Peter's.The square can be described as Rome's quintessential Piazza - a masterpiece of late Baroque made possible mainly due to the competitive enmity between Borromini and Bernini, and other contributions by della Porta. The square has three foundtains - della Porta's Fountains del Moro (Fountain of the Moor) to the South and del Nettuno (Fountain of Neptune) to the North, and Bernini's star fountain (and my personal favourite in Rome - yes, even more that the Trevi one!) Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers), which represents the Ganges, Nile, Danube and Rio de la Plata. This latter statue can be seen looking in horror at the Chiesa di Sant' Agnese that was built by Bernini's rival, Borromini. This church has wonderful ceiling frescoes and should be visited as well.The only minus point of this star attraction is not the Piazza's fault itself, but the hawkers - be very careful as most of them are under the 'protection' of a racket - you are guaranteed to be overcharged. Most of all, stay away from the Chestnut vendors, which can charge up to 5 Euro for 10 chestnuts! Despite being a seasoned Rome veteran, of of these hawkers managed to dupe me (a favourite trick is to quote the price of a single chestnut!) - to add insult to injury one of these chestnuts was foul and poisoned me, ruining my entire day.
Feel the spirit of the city. A little time in Piazza Navona is a must! It is such fun to watch the people.

A MUST SEE!. The Piazza Navona is a must see on your trip to Rome. There are numerous restaurants along the perimeter of the piazza and it's a wonderful place to have a leisurely dinner, or even a cappuccino and "dolci" in the afternoon ... or even a glass of wine and brischetti! One of the most romantic places in Rome!
A must every time in Rome. At Epiphany too much junk and beggars and pickpockets

Worth the Walk. We went on a walking tour that ended in this square. Although, we loved the site of the fountain, there was a Christmas Bazaar going on and it was disappointing that there was a lot of flea market like finds at that time. They were selling witch ornaments which evidently have a story about a lady whose child died at Christmas and she gave all of the toys to area children. Vendors had roasted chestnuts for sale, which we do not have in my region, so that was interesting. Other than that, it was pretty much junk. The fountain of the four rivers was beautiful, much like many of the other fountains that you can see in Rome. Make sure, if you are not on a tour, that you bring your guide book for the story of the fountain. We also had dinner in a restaurant off this square that was very good. Many of the better restaurants in our guide books were closed. I am not sure if this is because we were there during Christmas, the wrong time of day, or what. I recommend getting away from the main square to find something to eat as the menus showed meals 3 times pricier than what we paid for the best gnocchi ever.

A visit to a Unique and fascinating Square. We visited on the 6th of January - Epiphany day but also called 'La Befana' in Italian. Don't miss the Christmas market in the Square - the 6th is the last day. The crowds in the square can be quite daunting though.
Good for taking a stroll. Compared to what Rome offes it was average. Lots of shopping stalls came up in the evening. Looked like a fair. Took a stroll.
Beautiful. Beautiful Pizza, full of life. A must for anyone who travels to Rome.
Nice. Very nice place close to Pantheon. They sell excellent ice-cream there.
I would have liked to see it. The square was full of small Kiosks selling Christmas things and it was impossible to see the whole square
Astounding. The statues and frescos surrounding the area were vivid and as interesting as other areas.
A Main Event. You just can't miss the piazza at night. It's the center of activity and there are of course three important Bernini fountains here.

Christmas market. We were a bit disappointed because we thought it was a traditional christmas market. Well it wasn't and the was a lot of decoratios made from plastic and so on. The athmosphere was still nice and statues and fountains beautiful.

HORROR. We were there on 01.01 and 01.02.2012. No way that one can actually see Piazza Navona. It was more like some Bazaar in Istanbul then one of the best sites in the world. All around place only merchants selling very strange goods. Disaster!

Lively!. A visit to Piazza Navona was recommended to me by an Italian friend who grew up in Rome. I was not disappointed. Talented street artists, amazing architecture, fountains and great gelato! Well worth the visit!!

Nightlife. I've been to Rome a number of times and know better than to fall for the tourist-trap restaurants fringing Navona... but I don't always. It's worth (to be honest, decent) one overpriced meal to sit outside (no matter the weather) and watch Navona spin. Most recently the Christmas markets were in season and so the chaos was bright and merry and wonderful.
so busy. We went there on Jan 6 which is Le Bafana great for the kids but so many people.
sunny and happy. finally we got sunchine on this piazza, and there are very good ice-creams to taste

Nice Photo area. Visited on a Sunday. There were stalls galore with lots of little nick nacks for gifts etc. Not sure if stalls only there on sunday? However a lovely area leading to some quaint little shops and restaurants. Definately worth a visit

Huge piazza with beautiful buildings. Bernini's architectural influence can be found back at this square, which is, not surprisingly, a very popular one. To get a good impression of the square, best going there is not on a market day.

Spectacular.. We went back to the Piazza several times while there. One of the nicest spots in Rome to just sit and watch people and sample your own little taste of la Dolce Vita. You need to ignore the hawkers with their tourist crap, but even with their annoyance, it's a special place. Go back at night. It's a different, and even more interesting place. And go back again in the early morning. The hawkers are still in bed. The tourists haven't arrived yet. It's a special place.

Worth to go there the 6th of January. According to tradition, in Roman's times, this squared was closed and boat races were held. Today, it's hard to imagine it was true, but is always nice to think about it. The square is simply lovely. Full of bars and trattorie all around it. At the end of it (heading on the direction of the river) there is a toy store which brings you back in time. Each time I visit, can't avoid to get it and have a tour.
