love it. There's something very romantic about plaza navona. We walked around, ate lunch, had gelato, watch the street performance and art work, and of course admire that beautiful fountain - it's a work of art of its own!

A break from the crowds. This Piazza seemed to be much less crowded than some of the other attractions in Rome which was nice. The fountains are wonderful and there were plenty of cafes, and market stalls selling pictures, etc.

What you see in movies!. For my husband and I, one of the most romantic spots we saw while in Roma! This is how you picture Italy will look like before you've been there. This is where the Four Rivers fountain is (yes, the one you've seen in the Angels and Demons movies). Quite a few places to eat, and the best people watching! There are street performers trying to earn a buck everywhere, but it's not as irritating as you'd think - they really are quite entertaining. Beautiful flowers hanging from the balconies, and beautiful music from violinists, guitarists, and an accordion player. Tons of art for sale on the street, some of it made right in that same spot. I heard after I returned from our trip that there was a Pittsburg Steelers bar nearby Piazza Navona - yes, Steeler Nation in ROMA. I cannot believe I walked right by it and didn't notice this! I will be hanging out in Piazza Navona next time I am in Rome, with my Terrible Towel and a glass of wine, people watching and listening to the wonderful music.
nice piazza. It is a must when travelling to Rome....................................

visit the christmas market there if you are in Rome in December!. we visited it during christmas season. I bought couple of hats here for cheap. lots of christmas decoration, food, and knick knacks. worth a visit!
Best Piazza in the City. This is a place that is so wonderful just to take in. The fountains are gorgeous and the cafes are plentiful.We enjoy this Piazza both during the day AND at night.

Unfortunately ... it was only a festival !. Unfortunatelly , when my wife and I visited Piazza Navona, the square was full of little shops , street food etc. I must admit it was very lively , but I would rather had the chance to see the real beauty of its remarkable fountains in a less noisy atmosphere . Luckily , I found a nice Befana doll for my daughters.

Another great Roman monument. It used to be a circus that was practically a race tract. Now it is a magnificent long piazza with curving ends and straight sides. It is very very long. There are three main sculptures and fountains that are placed down the middle and the whole is surrounded by beautiful buildings which house cafes and restaurants. It is a great gathering place that not that long ago was filled with cars. Now it is for people, the black grime has been cleaned off the buildings and people play in the fountains. Definitely one of the top places to visit when in Rome.
enjoy with pizza and coffee. Trip to Italy is not complete without sampling their pizza, pasta and coffee. Choose the really thin pizza...yummy!

Loved it. During Christmas time it is packed with activity - from selling jewellery, frames, christmas decorations, leather handbags to candy :) I would love to go back in the summer and see the other side of Piazza Navona :) It's beautiful. It's a must if you are visit Rome! :)
Beatifull at christimas time. Very beautiful Piazza! Worth visiting specially in christimas time. They make a very nice xmas market. Amazing place, very happy!

Sadly, becoming ruined by visitors. In our opinion, the P Navona is going downhill!! The restaurants and bars are more and more of a ripoff; the number of tourists is almost unmanagable and the market contains more and more tat with junk food stalls (Italain sytle) Perhaps the square and the fountains are best appreciated at night as is undoubtably lovely.

Christmas Market. The Piazza Navona is on its own very nice, with its fountains. At Christmas and over New Year there is the traditional Christmas market which is for both adults and children- we enjoyed browsing the stalls.

Especially wonderful at Christmas. Piazza Navona is a beautiful oval shaped piazza any time of the year, but it is really special from December until Epiphany, which is January 6. During that time, there is a Christmas market with toys, food, candy, a merry go round, Mr. and Mrs. Claus, manger scene pieces and of couse Befana dolls and likenesses of all sorts. Befana is a good witch who delivers toys to good girls and boys on the night of January 5. It is a really fun, lively, crowded Christmas fair.
Lovely at Christmas. The square is full of Christmas shops and food vendors during the holiday. It was lively and great fun.
nice place for a rest!. Nice place for a rest, bit hectic in summer though. Another incredible contribution from Bernini!

Holiday festival on the square. We were here for the holidays and the square was filled with street performers, merchants, and food vendors. Very lively. The central water fountain and church typical of the area but a real good opportunity to get a taste of Italian culture. We at a small Italian restaurant just to the right of the church. The white chocolate gelato was filled with bits of the candy that melted in your mouth. The restaurant food was very good and the service was excellent. Street vendors sold large donuts which were very good. (skip the Nutella unless you're a fan).

always seems to be under repair. I was in Rome at Xmas time when the Piazza Navona was covered by stalls selling tacky Xmas gifts and caricature artists. Also, it seems that every time I go there the fountain is covered in scaffolding, both in 2007 and 2011.
lively. lively piazza away from usual tourist traps. close to very good restaurants, cafes, gelato and museums.
Fantastic during the holidays. They had all these booths selling these crazy looking witches, nutella with crepes, and music playing. It was so fun. We entered the church and it was spectalar
Very touristy area but a must see. I would not recommend eating in Piazza Navona because it is so touristy, but it is an area you should see for the two beautiful fountains.

Bernini's best. This is the most boutiful place I've seen in Rome, architectonial peaces of first quality al arround. The place to be, restaurants bars, etc.
When you go back to Vit Emanuele ave there is an Argentine steak house, delicous !!!
Pretty but crowded. As everywhere in Rome, it's generally crowded, but a pretty place to visit.
Must do. Try a bottle of Prosecco if in a group, at one of the cafes,(much cheaper than individual drink orders) and sit and watch the dusk....especially if the swallows above are flocking...

Artistic Piazza - Great "fontanas". You can spend your evening there, eating Gelato and follow the shows (music - magicians' shows etc).
Tip: Visit the Cathedral

Great fun for kids during Christmas. Around noon it was empty. Great fun: candy, ballons, ferris wheel, musicians. I like that no one asked for money, you could give something to the artists. Nice fountains also. Someone mentioned that it was like this only for the Christmas holiday though.
Lovely little square. The Piazza Navona is a lovely little square which has plenty of nice cafes.

Great atmosphere with lots going on.. When we visited in December there were Christmas markets including a carousel and entertainment. Lots of local families were out enjoying the evening and there were many stalls to browse through. Fountains are great - probably better than Trevi fountain in my opinion.

Christmas just as we imagined. Although a bit hokey, the bazaar at Piazza Navona during Christmas offered a true glimpse into Roman life today. Fun to watch Italian families enjoying the holiday fare and activities. Kind of like an Atlantic beach town's summer boardwalk moved onto a beautiful Roman plaza!
Everything you thought about Roma. This Piazza was set up for the Christmas fair and was ablaze in light and locals. We had a great time just people watching. A must see for any Rome tour.
fun place. we have been there in 01 Jan. when the piazza was full of fun and activities... wish it would have been this way more often...
great. the atmosphere is great, lots of artist, it gives you a special feeling
Christmas Fun!. We visited the Piazza for the Christmas market and found it quite a bit of fun despite the rain. The Piazza also is near other tourist sites and very easy to access by bus or metro.
Gorgeous!. We were very lucky as the Christmas market was on when we were there and the whole Piazza was stunning.

Meravigliosa anche se piena di ambulanti.. Da visitare al mattino molto, molto presto o in piena notte. Solo in questi due momenti della giornata si può godere a pieno della sua magnificenza. Le tre fontane del Bernini, il palazzo Pamphilj oggi ambasciata del Brasile, il Museo di Roma e la chiesa di Sant'Agnese in Agone. Sicuramente uno delle piazze più suggestive di Roma deturpata di giorno da mille ambulanti che vendono paccottiglia di ogni genere ad uso e consumo dei turisti. Niente monetine nelle fontane please!!!

A wonderful place to have a rest or a meal in Rome. This piazza is the largest in Rome. It is ringed with very good restaurants. Artists display their art in the square. There's a beautiful fountain - Bernini, I think. What's not to like? This is a great place to stop for a glass of wine on a long walk around Rome or to have a delightful lunch. Do not miss this piazza.
Good for kids. Bug Christmas market with lots of. Booth. Kids like it!

The finest square in Rome. Spacious and studded with myriad masterpieces, Piazza Navona affords visitors the matchless leisure moment be it day or night. Similar to an open-air museum nestling amongst a maze of nostalgic alleys, the Baroque-style square boasts renowned Fountain of the four Rivers with Egyptian obelisk in the center, Palazzo Pamphilj palace opposite the obelisk and 2 other fountains, Fountain of Moor and Fountain of Neptune, on 2 flanks of Piazza Novona. Also, there are plentiful cafés and gelato vendors in the vicinity, all brimming with visitors. To get the piazza more alive, quite a number of street musicians are on the pitch for hours. Given Piazza Navona is not highly recommended as a must-see in several guides or reviews, I find it worth visiting in a jiff, albeit to simply relax with a gelato and melody of streets.
Really a Great Roman Vibe. a must to walk through...eat at restaurant Tre Scalini an Italian delight for food Lovers, you can order anything on menu and not be disappointed !!!!!
navona blue. such a romantic place and try the tartufo exquisite...
What a great place to spend an evening. The Piazza was filled with artists, musicians & dancers of such a wide range of fields.
Nice fountain with beautiful design. Piazza Navona has a nice fountain that has a beautiful architectural design.
great piazza. This plaza has a little market where they sell loads of goods , so it kinda of disstrackes you from its main beauty.

historic versus modern. It's a mix of old statues and arhitecture and modern art! there are a lot of talented artists who perform there, young people, tourists, restaurants!The atmosphere is incredible!
A cool place. The three fountains were neat and the whole area was appealing. There was also a great Christmas market when we were there.
lovely. a lovely little piazza with fountains at either end, nice to get a gelato and enjoy the weather.

Nice place to spend few hours !. This is a nice square, always full of people and great at night. Be carefull, that to get back home at night could be a huge problem, as the Metro is closing too early, and the taxis become very few. Watch out for touristic traps, by the restaurants and Cafes of the area and negotiate hard the prices of the souvenirs !!! All in All is a nice square with great life at everytime of the day and night !My tip, would be to find out in advance in which restaurant, you would like to have your meal, so you are sure, you get a nice price quality ratio.
breathtaking. For me this is the most beautifull Piazza's in Rome. The main fountain is just breathtaking. I was lucky to bee there when there was a little fair so it looked even nicer.

Beautiful fountian. If you have seen/read Angels and Demons you will want to go here. The fountain is beautiful. The tour guide we had told us that one of the figures on the fountain is supposed to be shielding their eyes, this is because Bernini had a rivalry with Borromini and Borromini was due to build the church in front of it. The church then has a figure on its own turning away from the fountain. There are stalls there selling art work in the evening lots of place to eat or have a drink. Very beautiful day and night.
Cool atmosphere. Was here on Christmas day, when most places are quite. Very nice flea market as well as street performers. the Church there was magnificent as well. The fountains are amazing.
Very cool outdoor space. Very cool outdoor space - many restaurant options and great for people watching!

wonderfully entertaining during the Christmas period. The stores selling interesting trinkets and items combined with the shows by street artists made the experience unforgettable over the Christmas period. There are several restaurant options too so we also had options to relax after a walk around the piazza.
nice!. nice piazza with three beautiful fountains/status by Bernini and many bars and restaurants around! there was also a christmas market.

Dissapointing. I would love to have seen this without the traveling tacky Blackpool style stalls that completely filled the Piazza Navona. One of the largest piazza's filled with tat was extremely disappointing, that added to the fact it cost 36 Euro's for 4 beers made this truly a disappointing experience. I hope that it would be far better away from the Christmas season, as at the moment it was a real waste of a beautiful piazza.

Nice place to stroll. The Piazza is great for a stroll in the evening time. Sit and just people watch or enjoy dinner or lunch at one of the restaurants. There was a merry go round when we were there so it was fun to watch the little kids run around or hop on and off the ride.
Enjoy the ambience!. Plaza itself has two fountains and a obelisk... not too much to see, but has an energy with all the people that makes it a must see on Rome
Christmas Markets. Good Christmas Markets located here during December.

Love it!. An amazing place! Really lively, we went to an excellent cafe for lunch and a suberb restaurant for dinner here, although the names of both escape me. Others looked equally good! Loads going on, superb location and excellent atmosphere.
There was some kind of festival on the entire Piazza.... we were in Rome over the New Year's holiday and there was a huge festival so it hampered the ability to enjoy the beauty of the piazza.

3 fountains in the Pjazza. We went to Piazza Navona and saw the 3 beautiful fountains, the fountain of Quatro Fiumi, the Nettuno Fountain and the Moro Fountain. There is also the church of St. Agnese. There was also a Christmas market.
Wonderful square!. We visited early in the Christmas season and the bazaar atmosphere was lots of fun. Very nice at night when it's lit up and folks are strolling.....good place to visit!
Great at night. WOnderful place to grab a drink at night. Great people watching

A People-Watching Nirvana and Circus. Lots of street performers, artists, tourists furiously scanning maps and taking photos, restaurant directors trying to entice passers-by in to their touristy venue for a meal, locals passing through--shaking their heads at the beautiful circus that is Piazza Navona. Angels & Demons fans will stop at the path of illumination/Water location. Try the gelato at Tre Scalini: you won't be disappointed if you are a chocolate lover! Three beautiful fountains, churches, and a wide-open magnificent piazza that is somewhat marred between November-February by an abundance of temporary kiosks/stands that sell every kind of trinket, Christmas bauble and street food. These stands hurt the overall visibility in the piazza, and the restaurant owners hate them since they block the views; however, these temporary vendors have been apart of the piazza for over 100 years so seniority rules here. It's a great place to stroll, rest and people watch, and is the starting point for a popular evening stroll up to Piazza del Popolo.
Eat lunch at one of the cafes. You will remember it for life.. This is how you imagine Italy. Beutiful laid back. a little crowded. But fun to eat and peo[ple watch for a while.
Beautiful Piazza. We loved this piazza with the beautiful fountains, gelato shops, street vendors. A must see at night.
All That Glitters. Many restaurants (overpriced) but a must see - the fountains and artists, painters, and their work.

in December it is ruined by cheap market stalls. Such a beautiful Piazza should not be filled with such cheap market stalls. The Christmas markets of Germany and other countries add interest. These stalls, selling cheap junk, ruined this beautiful piazza.
Heart of art. If you like to see the real art; you need to visit Piazza Navona

Lovely fountains- a fun place for lunch!. I wouldn't say this was 'top 5', but we had a lovely afternoon here. It's good with small children because there is often entertainment and the kids can wander a bit while you have a nice glass of wine and watch them!
Great place to see and eat. Beautiful foundtain and there are nice little restaurants in this area and we found the best pizza - Mount Blanc has cream, mozzarella, ham, mushrooms and olive oil.
Little children would like it here. Buy a balloon and a giant, Nutella covered donut and wander around. Ignore the beggars and street vendors if you can then head off to the Pantheon!
Lovely Piazza. At Christmas time there are fairground stalls, which is very festive. A great place to people watch.
Nothing special. Nothing special, it was xmas time and they had tis big market but selling only very maed in china items, too much colors, too little italian.
Must See. The most convenient place in Rome. Plenty of gorgeous cafes for you to sit at and people-watch :)

Christmas time on Piazza Navona. The piazza was covered in stalls and decorated for Christmas! You could buy traditional foods, toys,presents, pictures, colored
lights or eat in the resaurants round the square or eat Roman
snacks while strolling with the kids.Roman Families in Action!
Landmark. It's really nice to sit around this Piazza and see the people passing by, eating in restaurants and enjoying a nice gelatto. A must go!
Nice square and impressive statues. The statues and street artists were very interesting...a nice way to spend some time in Rome.

Best outdoor market in the city. Yes, it's best outdoor market in the city, with thee fountains. Like it a bit more then Fountain di Trevi which is also awesome monument, but this square has more cause of market place there, with so many people circulating around. It's not static as di Trevi.
Nice pretty and active attraction. The plaza has very nice fountains, perfect for pictures. There are lots of great restaurants and artists selling there wares. Don't miss it.
Disappointing. The fountains are beautiful and well worth seeing. But when we visted the piazza was full of stalls selling cheap tack. Not what I woulld have expected.
Beautiful. Chill and relax is this place amids all the chaotic

Charming. My wife and I really enjoyed this square and wandering the narrow streets around this area. One of our favourite walks through Rome. With so much to see and do I didn't think a square would impress me all that much but I would consider this a must see.
Stayed here. This piazza is very vibrant and fun to go to anytime of the day or night to see the people, eat gelato and just hang out.
Beautiful. Another beautiful piazza in Italy. Filled with great restaurants to eat at and people watch!
So beautiful. But please limit the number of stall-holders - I found it less beautiful than on previous occasions

Overrated?. We only visited Piazza Navona on Friday night, which is supposed to be a night that students and young people go out to have fun. We had heard that piazza Navona is one of the nightlife spots of the city. Well, the rustik-festival booths/ counters/ light bulbs, not classy at all.
Great markets. We stayed just near this Piazza and found it very handy for picking up our daily snacks. Lots a great restaurants nearby.

Tourists welcome. This place attracts many tourists, with many restaurants, street entertainers and artists. It's very lively in the evening, and a good place to get something to eat, listen to the music and watch the popoli go by.

Exciting and fun! Great energy!. I would recommend this on your first night in Rome. It's so fun and energetic here. Even if you are tired it will re-energize you to come here and let Rome envelope you. I was here at Christmas time and the Christmas market with roasting chestnuts, balloons, St. Nicholas, and La Befanas is a sight to put you in the right spirit.

Currently in pre-Christmas mode. If you go to Piazza Navona at this time of the year, it's dominated by temporary shops that have been set up on it. While you lose the charm of the square's layout and surrounding archiecture a bit, it's still possible to have dinner near Pza Navona, especially on the quiet S. Maria della Anima street (Ponte e Parione is a grea restaurant there), or a gelato ot tartufo by the piazza itself.

Very nice place , close to Pantheon and Trevi Fountaine. It was very crowded and there was a cirque or something like that i should better keep eye on my vallet. Lost of restaurants and cafes around and also Pantheon is very close the Navona.
Beautiful at night!. Shopped here on a warm December night....Christmas lights, many vendors, carnival atmosphere.

Nice Place - Not for December. This is a picturesque corner of the city. Supposed to inspire romance and italian passion. All you get as a memory, are the outdoor salesmen who have conquered the Piazza. Could be organized better.
Piazza Navona. We walked to the piazza from our hotel. There were many vendors there selling many amazing items. There were men playing instruments, trumpet and saxaphone.
My fave. My fave in all rome :D and in xmas with all d malls - wow

Lovely fountains. The square was being setup for an event when we passed thru, this obstructed our view a little. This combined with the fact that there are so many amazing sites in Rome is why I found it only average.
The fountains are gorgeous, certainly worth a walk around.
meh. cool tourist trap, but compared to the rest of Rome, nothing too impressive. Cool art and knicknaks for sale. Walk out of the Piazza for dinner, the best restaurants are just outside.
A great late night spot!. This is the spot to be at night! Filled with entertainers, gawkers and energy! Great street performers at all hours of the day! A MUST!
very nice. very nice piazza, there are also a nice activity there was the Christmas market with mostly hand made items, and it was nice seeing that movement and all lighted up

Disappointed at the Christmas market. My wife and I hadn't been to Rome in a few years, so we wandered down to Piazza Navona and were met by a amazing display of acres of cheap market stalls covering the entire square. Maybe one in twenty of the stalls had something unique to sell, but the large majority just ruined the effect.
What a way to watch Rome go by. A square that changes as the day changes.Don't lose sight of is tremedous impact on Rome because of all of the sideshows
Coffee & Cake at Piazza Navona. After a looking around the Piazzo and being told the history sat in cafe for coffee and cake while taking it all in. Bought two paintings

Incredible architecture and statues. The buildings were just awesome, and I took many photos. The fountains were quite wonderful, and yet there was so much else to see close by, we went from one awesome site to the next.
A real taste of Rome. Piazza Navona is a great place to see the 3 beautiful Bernini fountains, some great artwork for sales and a lot of nice outdoor restaurants.
Gellato at Navona. We sat outside and had wonderful ice cream and watched all the People in the Piazza. A wonderful experience.

A large piazza. Piazza Navona is a large piazza with restaurants and shopping around the square. We sat and had a cappucino facing the square, great people watching . You will see artists selling their wares, street performers and fountains. Warning: the cappucinos were the most expensive in Roma that we had, I guess that was the price for looking out on the Piazza,
very cute christmas market. very cute christmas market, good prices and choice of display things

beautiful photo spot. Wouldnt eat here but you should pass through and take some snaps. be warned ice cream can be 6 euros on the piazza so get it on the side streets. there was a fair on when we went. must take your camera.

Exquisite, but a tourist trap. Bernini's fountains are beautiful, but the restaurants surrounding it - perhaps predictably - are expensive and low quality even by European standards. Enjoy the magnificence of the space, but eat elsewhere.

nice piazza. Lovely place, there was sort of a "xmas market" going on when I was there selling random xmas decorations and also a "fun fair". Not as overwhelming as some of the other sights in Rome but still nice nonetheless.

A Disappointment. We were looking forward to visiting Piazza Navona and sitting in an outdoor cafe, sipping cappuccino and people-watching. The piazza was filled with vendors' booths selling all kinds or touristy items and taking up most of the piazza. It was impossible to see the beautiful architecture or, in fact, see anything except the vendors' booths. We stayed less than 10 minutes and left. I would advise skipping Piazza Navona.

Disappointed. I was so looking forward to seeing this square. When we arrived, there had been some sort of carnival so it was quite dirty and a little disgusting. The monuments were beautiful, but I couldn't appreciate them for all of the other chaos going on.
Contains Bernini's best fountain?. A lovely Piazza, I love the four rivers fountain in the middle. Only slightly marred by the tacky Christmas market
great location. so much to see and do...watch performers, buy artworks
great at Christmas time. small stands and interesting stuff...not too crowded...we could actually enjoy the fountains
Nice to see. During our stay, the Christmas market was running, so it was difficult to see the Piazza in its full glory. The main fountain though was excellent
Must see. Beautiful place. The bars/restaurants/cafes around the piazza... Extremely expensive... Same product a block away...1/3 of the price
Splendor!. A nice Christmas market, nice people, nice roundabout, a fairy atmosphere! Thats Rome!

Great place to relax. We grabbed a table in the piazza and relaxed with a glass of wine--it was divine. I really wish I had bought a small painting while I was there, but I assumed I'd have more chances later in our trip but that wasn't the case.
The biggest piazza in Rome!. Look at the central fontana...drink a coffee there and explore the mini caffe and restaurants at the area

A little bonus when we visited - Christmas market. We visited Rome in early December, and strolled through the little inner city streets from Trevi fountain to the Pantheon to the Piazza Navona with it's famous fountain of the four winds. Wnen we entered the piazza we were surprised to find a Christmas market in full swing - lots of yummy treats to eat and some lovely Christmas decorations to buy. Lots of little places to have a snack and a drink and while away a couple of hours.

overwhelmed by christmas market sellingall things non-Italian!!!. hardly got to appreciate the piazza as a massive xmas market established selling sadly all chinese toys and items from every other country other than Itayu, let alone Rome!
Still the sxale is impressive and interesting streets around the piazza

Great Location, amazing architecture. Loved this place althought the tacky fairground style vendors in the centre detracted from the overall appeal. We also went into the magnificent Church on the westernside. A visitor must see.
Check out the Live Art!. Beautiful piazza with amazing sculptures, architecture, merchants and, yes, living art!

Feel Rome. There are art kiosks and restaurants of all varieties. A large cement park where you can wander the day away. There are fountains to look at and people watch to your hearts content. Buy some gellato and sit on a bench. Street musicians, great time enjoy it, don't rush and say " Oh, I've been there".

Very touristy.... The three fountains on there are lovely - you may recognise them from Angels and Demons - but the piazza itself is edged with stalls selling tacky artifacts. Wander off down the side streets and you'll find lovely restaurants with good prices.
Fountain. I didn't find this place terrific: loads of gadget sellers, not good food. However the fountain and its history is amazing

Loverly Piazza, but expensive to eat.. Another 'must see' in Rome. Walk around the artists and take in the atmosphere. Countless restaurants, but not cheap, so either choose carefully or go to the back streets where it is much cheaper.

People watching galore. Another gorgeous spot to sit near a fountain (there are 3!), soak in the atmosphere, watch people, listen to buskers (there was a beautiful woman playing the accordion to an impressive crowd, on one of the days we went there), and stroll through market stalls. Just be aware that a number of stalls sell prints as "original paintings"
Christmas market. Market was beautiful and had a lovely meal in the square.

Variety of Art. Place on which you can enjoy in baroque roman architecture, Berninis famous Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi topped by the Obelisk of Domitian, the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone by Francesco Borromini, two additional fountains - at the southern end is the Fontana del Moro with a basin and four Tritons sculpted by Giacomo della Porta to which Bernini added a statue of a Moor wrestling with a dolphin, and at the northern end is the Fountain of Neptune created by Giacomo della Porta. At the southwest end of the piazza is the ancient 'speaking' statue of Pasquino.All around Piazza you can enjoy in many artists in work, restaurants, caffes...
Tacky. Full of stalls of stupid games or selling plastic stuff from China or

more than just your ordinary plaza. so like many of the plazas around italy, the piazza navona offers tourists more than just old buildings or beautiful fountains. it is a sprawl of markets and cafes that are a must for every tourist. the markets offer different treats, such as giant donuts or crepes filled with nutella. the cafes however, as quite pricey, but the food was superb and we did not mind paying the hefty price.
Favoutite Piazza. Full of character. Places to eat, fountains and local artists. Soak up the atmosphere here

Must see! Stunning at night.. Crowded with tourists and locals alike but well worth the hassle.Bernini's "Fountain of the Four Rivers" is lovely.Many cafes (expensive) are located in the Piazza Navona where one can have a beverage or bite and admire the beautiful venue from the comfort of their table.

Have to see but don't eat here. It is a must see on your trip but the restaurants are overpriced and overcrowded with tourists. Short walks in all directions from the square take you to smaller piazza's with better restaurants and decent prices with a more authentic feel.

Really buzzing. The Piazza is full of stalls - not really a Christmas market, but more like lots of sweet stalls, and fairground side shows, but there is always something to watch whilst enjoying a cup of coffee at one of the many cafes around the Piazza. The area heading towards the Vatican is really great to stroll around and had some great cafes
Very nice square but very expensive. It worths to visit Navona evening hours. Don't sit for a coffee, you will pay it 3-4 times more than in any other place in Rome.
Too bad it is being spoiled. They have allowed hawkers to erect huts around the piazza and have turned it into a carnival. Also have ruined some great photo views.

My absolute favorite location!. If there is only 1 place I'm allowed to visit when I visit Rome next time, I'll pick Piazza Navona. I absolutely enjoyed the museums and monuments and I would love to re-visit those, but this Piazza was a sum total of the Roman experience...I love watching people, experiencing culture, artists at work, being in cheerful atmosphere, enjoying a truly Italian meal...this place had all of that and more. This happened to be our last stop before we left Rome and left us with a wonderful after-taste!
Piazza for everyone. Sourrounded by lovely builfings this Piazza is always full of people seemingly enjoying themselves in one way or another

Beautiful square, but do not go for the Christmas market. It really is a beautiful square and nice to walk around. Was excited for the Christmas Market, but this is not a market a la western or eastern Europe. Mostly crap, sadly. But still a fun walk around.

Great Roman Piazza. This plaza as we call them in the US, was incredible, with 3 different fountains, and lots of great shops around the perimeter. When we were there, they were having a carnival, which was a fun bonus.

Premium prices around this place. Sat down at a cafe that fronts this Piazza, 12 Euros for a cappucino and 10 Euros for Gelato. We got up fast, things way overpriced around this Piazza. Do see the Bernini statue her though, but eat and drink elsewhere.
Very good and less crowded. Loads of restaurants around the square and many stalls selling paintings and so on.
Lost in Piazza Navona. Painters, artists, kids, couples, elder couples... A street orchestra was playing the "Fly me to the moon"... That's the place that you can start your moon-voyage:)
Fun market when I was there. We kept visiting here each day, they had a festival all day! Ended up eating chocolate and hot wine at 11pm !
Why. Not a lot happening in the rain when we visited this place. The market stalls were all closed for lunch - we just walked through.
an ancient Roman race track. Now a beautiful piazza. This area has the best deserts in town.

My Favourite!. This was my favorite piazza. Lots of restaurants to chose from. Little stalls with paintings and lots of other nic nacs to look at or buy. 2 Beautiful fountains. I could sit there all day, which we nearly did. A must see.

Nice and relaxing. Great place, stopped and enjoyed the crowd. Sat at one of the chafes and had appetizers and beer. You sit back and enjoy the fountains, church,artist and the people. We bought some oil painting here, shop around they are priced differently.

Lovely atmosphere. We went in the time leading up to christmas, so there were stalls and buskers. It was fantastic. Recommend that you take a tour so that you can understand the history behind the fountains and buildings

Great piazza destroyed by street vendors. You simply cant see the whole beauty of it due to the fact that piazza is covered entierely by street vendors shops. Its a circus, not a relic, althoug its history is absolutely a top (it was a scene of special sea battles! in ancient times)

Great Area. This is my favorite large piazza. It's able to absorb the crowds with seeming crowded. The setting is beautiful and the areas near it are great for walking, eating and observing the local environment.
Sunny and Lively. Beautiful fountains, nice shops, good cafes and the Christmas market was fun!

The place to be!. Famous "living rooms" of cities like Trafalgar Square in London, and Piazza San Marco in Venice finish behind this place. Great fountains by Bernini, a masterpiece of a church (Santa Agnese) by Borromini, and people-watching nonpareil. Hang out, sit in any of the sidewalk cafes surrounding Piazza Navona, and enjoy!

Great atmosphere in evening. Great place to sit and soak up the atmosphere in the evenings, listening to buskers. You can buy wine and beer at local shops and sit in any Piazza/Spanish steps etc - it is a cheap night out.

Nice Fountains. We stayed right near Piazza Navona, so we walked through it every day for 6 days. The fountains are beautiful, and the painters are fun to watch. It was much more lively in the evening while we were there than during the day. I thought the cafes were way too expensive, though, so we didn't eat there.
Fun place to go.. Bustling place to visit with great restaurants. Avoid the restaurants right at the entrance because they tend to be grossly over priced.
Beautiful. There isn't a bad piazza in Rome, is there? Always the hub of activity, they are a don't-miss.
Great square. easy to see sights and catch open top bus if necesssary

One of the most beautiful piazzas in the world. Piazza Navona is, to put it simply, one of the most beautiful piazzas in the world. Just go and enjoy it. Unfortunately when it's crowded it looses some of its charm. I favor visiting it early in the morning, when the light is still not too harsh. Its beauty at dusk it's unequalled. Stay away from it in early January, when it turns into a horrid souk selling all sort of stuff.

Return Trip. My husband and I have fond memories of Piazza Navona and decided to go back once more, even though we were short on time. This is a typical Italian square which offers some good artists who sell their work, a beautiful fountain, and plenty of better than decent restaurants along the streets that spoke out from the square. My main draw is the artists. I've picked up several wonderful paintings for very reasonable prices. Don't forget to negotiate ~ most of the artists expect it.
nice. nice area for restaurants and shops. go in the afternoon as it dies down quite early for shops, restaurants are open late, great choices for food.
Christmas markets time. Great to see the markets but it meant that it was not possible to see the splendour of the Piazza. Look in the huge church (St Agnes) too as it's beautiful.
too touristy. The monument and fountains were incredible but the place was overrun with tourist-trap booths and people selling things. Snapped some photos then got out of there.

Another beautiful piazza!. We discovered Piazza Navona on the first evening of our trip to Rome. The atmospere was vibrant. There were some street musicians and some nice but touristic restaurants around the piazza. In addition to that a preparation for the Christmas Market was taking place making it even more lively. However, do not expect to see something like the Kristkindlesmarkt in Bavarian towns or Vienna. But after all, this Piazza is beautiful with or without the Christmas Market.

My favourite part of Italy (not just Rome).. Piazza Navona was our destination at the end of literally every day that we spent in Rome. We travelled across 6 destinations in 15 days in Rome, but this was my one favourite place.Calm, serene, alive. The Frigidarium, a Gelato place off the Piazza served fantastic stuff.The cafes lining the Pizza are great if you want ambience, but I recommend the places off the Piazza more. The cafes in the Piazza are unnecessarily costly, and definitely not worth the money.Just walk around the Piazza Navona. And when you get tired, sit and watch the painters and their wares. And then walk some more. You will love it.

Go At Night. Piazza Navona is roomy compared to other tourist hot-spots, but still best seen late at night, we think, when the crowds dissipate and the lights come on. Even the fountain is prettier. Also the vendors seem too tired to hassle you!
Spanish Steps. Recommend walking down not up. Fountain in square awesome.
christmas fayre. extremely pretty piazza with an un expected christmas fayre.
Great. Worth a visit - particularly in December as it has a fun Christmas market. Good place for a drink to watch the world go by but expensive to eat.
Political rally. Didn't get to really appreciate it because there was a huge political rally going on~~ but what we saw was lots of artists also displaying their work. Very nice square!

Piazza Navona, also it's backstreets. The beauty of Piazza Navona is also because of the gorgeous cobbled backstreets, twisting alleys, beautiful houses with glimpses into courtyards. Like everything else in Rome, nothing stands in a vacuum but is intrinsically blended and dependent upon other parts and aspects and all magically brought further to life by plays of light, of sounds, smells and textures. What makes Piazza Navona further special is that it is still so alive today and important to the Roman people. The music is there for people, not necessarily for tourists and so are many other parts, e.g. the street theater performances. This Piazza has been at the centre of roman life for millennia and in this sense it is as modern today as it was ages ago and its heart still beats to the present day enveloping its inhabitants in a magic spel that emerges from the harmonies of space. There is an enormous sense of harmony and balance that seems to affect the psyche, thereby re-balancing all those who come here. It is a Piazza that also lends itself to contemplate the deeper meaning of life.
Crowded but nice. Lots of vendors and people running around - very nice place to walk by and take in the sights. Great spot for people watching.

full effect couldn't be seen. the piazza was covered with market stalls as a christmas style market was in full swing, we enjoyed walking around the stalls but the stall broke up the effect of the three fountains - still quite impressive on their own though

Beautiful Place. Our first visit here was magical. The piazza is huge and magical. Our kids asked to go here multiple times due to the performers that could be seen and to buy some of the wares that could be purchased from street vendors. Watch out for gypsies that approach your children under the guise of making them a string bracelet. They are crooks after your money. Other than a nasty experience with one crafty man there, the rest of our visits to this beautiful spot were amzing.

You have to go there at least once!. This was our second time to see Piazza Navona, and the fountains are worth the stop. On a previous trip, we were able to go inside the large church there (can't remember the name right now). I would skip it on future trips just because it does have A LOT of people (tourists, chestnuts-roasting-on-an-open-fire sellers, etc.), but I'm glad I've had the opportunity to drop by there twice. It's near bus stops for several lines, so that's a good thing to know if you're using public transportation.
Beautiful square. Really pretty square with lots of restaurants in the surrounding sidestreets, some of which are really good value for money.

Rained out. It was raining the afternoon we went and i was disappointed, It's like a big market with loads of restaurants around it. Didn't buy anything from there as they were shutting up quite early. The restaurant staff all try and force you in for a coffee (That you'll have to pay for!!)

Great Hang-out. This is a really great place to gather ones strength while criss-crossing the historic centre of Rome. THe fountains are beautiful and interesting while the restaurants and gelatarias around are a succour to hungry stomachs and the painters with their wares add a welcome dash of local colour.
Beautiful Piazza. Beautiful to stroll around or just sit down and have a drink. be aware of the high prices of the restaurants.
Cool place to hang out!. Felt we were really in Italy here. Cool to hang out and people watch, eat or relax. We found ourselves here a few times and I have nice memories of it. A must do!
Beautiful place; restaurants not best value. The restaurants in the Piazza and surrounding streets are plentiful, but it would be worth checking reviews online as quality and atmosphere are variable
Piazza Navona, worth a visit.. Loved the ambience, the colours, the music from the resident Mariachi band and the 3 magnificent fountains!

Beautiful place. A beautiful square with three lovely fountains. Read up about the history before you go, especially the Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the four Rivers) which is the central fountain. Built by Baroque sculptor and architect Bernini.A pretty place to stop for lunch either in one of the restaurants..or pick a bench for your picnic. Plenty of artist here displaying there art work.
Must see it!. A piazza with atmosphere and activity. Good for people watching and relaxing with a cafe latte or glass of wine.

Not a MUST see, but a nice place to relax and people watch.. Depending on how many days you have in Rome, you may or may not wish to visit here. Plenty of other places to visit that have more substance in Rome. Good cultural "open air" plaza in the middle of the city, but not much of a true "destination".
Ok but..... ... nice restaurants a pleasant walk around, a lot of very mediocre art and ugly fountain statues.
Lovely place. It's a lovely place, even though it's a bit too crowded. I wish I could enjoy it without all the artists and people
Lovely. Could have done with more seats just to sit and enjoy the surroundings

Must see - Wonderful !!. This Piazza is a must visit and a true attraction in Rome. This is a massive Piazza with 3 fountains and a truly majestic one in the centre. The market atmosphere of art vendors (majority are the artists themselves) and buskers is wonderful. A fantastic church to vist too.
Spolit by the Market. Tacky market stalls ruin the feel and look of the piazza, shame

Picturesque - even with the crowds. The recently refurbished Fountain of Four Rivers (Bernini) is the centerpiece of this Piazza, but don't miss the other two founains at either end -they are just as interesting and make for great photos. Very often the Piazza is filled with artists selling their paintings and other crafts people. The shops and restaurants that line the Piazza are also worth a peek. You can't go to Rome without seeing this famous Piazza. Enjoy!
must see. Piazza Navona is a must see, particularly in the evening. Stop for a limoncello and gelato and enjoy the vibrant nightlife.
november in Rome. lovely and worth visiting - nice, relaxed atmosphere here.

Very commericialized but nice fountain and music artists.. Beautiful fountain and surroundings. The musical artists were very good but the blue tents everywhere screamed "Circus coming to town". I wouldn't recommend spending more than 10-15 minutes here if you really want to put it on your list. If you don't have a lot of time in Rome this should be the thing you decide NOT to do. Put the Vatican, Trevi fountain, and Colosseum ahead of it.

A wonderful place for architecure, art, and music. We were blown away here! A beautiful place to soak up the best of Rome. Fountains, beautiful buildings, artists, and musicians. There are pleny of benches to just sit and enjoy these beautiful surrounding. Go there!
Beautiful architecture. Nice place. It looks like there is a non-stop music and entertainment.
Meeting point. Painters show and sell their works in the place.It has three beautiful fountains and restaurants all arround the square.
A PIECE OF HEAVEN. The Piazza has it all!!! Culture, food, people!!! It has to be my favorite place in Rome! There were street vendors and musicians around you while enjoying some tapas and wine!
Sit and Watch. Great place to sit and have a drink although quite pricey. A very lively place with artists painting and buskers performing.

Square of two halves.. However you approach this piazza you arrive from narrow streets or alleys, so the open space is welcome and it catches the sunlight .I suppose that's why the artists paint there. Half is a poor mans" Mon Matre" but not a bad imitation . The other half seems empty and better for it the collection of fountains are very interesting. The tourist restaurants are reasonable if "touristy menus" but there's a couple of good "Gelataria" with numerous flavours to choose from.

Can't miss this location!. Half of the piazza is taken up by artists (ok some are artists and some are selling cheap prints) and caricature artists. The other hald is less crowded, and has a number of mimes. Around the city saw several dressed as cowboys - the others were boring and no personality. This one highly interactive - we put money in his pot 5 or 6 times during the week, and photos of him lassooing and pretending to shoot members of our party are some of the highlight photos of the trip. Also a headless mime - very creative and unique. Skip the Status of Liberty, Roman Emperers, etc. Three wonderful fountains in the square that are nice to just sit and watch. Superb people watching everywhere. And just at the north end of the square is a great gelato place - try the chocolate.
An expensive place worth a visit. A superb pizza with three fabulous fountains well worth a leisurely stroll. Don't eat or buy here unless you pocket is very deep!

My favorite of the fountains. Everyone talks about the Trevi fountain being the thing to see. This piazza was my favorite with not just one but three fountains and a good amount of room to enjoy it. I wou7ld make this a must see for Rome as we dropped by it a number of times on our 6 days there.
Great place for people watching. Pack a light lunch, e.g. a panini or something from a back street store nearby, and just sit there people watching.
Interesting fountains. The Bernini fountain was quite impressive. Sit at one of the outdoor cafes and people watch.

The essence of Italy. We thoroughly enjoyed our relaxed time here at the piazza Navona. It has a stunning water fountain in the centre and is surrounded by lots of restaurants, shops and icecream parlours. Be warned the prices in these places are expensive ie €6 for a coffee but it is absolutly lovely to sit and take in the atmosphere, people watch and to see the various street artists and buskers. In my view this is the nicest piazza in the whole of Rome and is well worth a visit!
excellent for a drink & chill out before dinner. One of the nicest piazza's in Rome! Life musicians, loads of restaurants to choose from, life artists.
Not what I expected. Very unassuming, except for the Fountain of 4 rivers. The church on the Piazza is incredibly beautiful.
Piazza Navona. Love the fresh fruits, and flowers in the morning! Artists and restaurants at night! great place to hang out and people watch!

A wonderful square full of charm. I loved this square, it's beautiful and although it's very bustling with stalls and restaurants, there was something so peaceful about it. The architecture is amazing and you'll be serenaded by buskers.

Great space pity about the 'art'. This is a magnificent, enormous piazza with a lovely Bernini fountain. There were also far too many stalls selling dreadful, garish, 'art' works, they quite spoiled the view!

Great place to chill, eat and take in the culture. Just west of the Pantheon is a wonderful piazza where you can lose yourself for while in the culture of Rome ancient and modern.Rome has many such open areas all served, it seems, with eateries, coffee houses and the inevitable architectural excellence. Navona is one of the better known such 'square' and it is one of the larger ones. Oriented North South there is an elaborate fountain at each end and a central obilisk. Around the edges are numerous restaurants - I ate at one toward the south end - The Tucci I believe - where the Parma Ham and Melon followed by a Canneloni Rose turned out to be one of my more enjoyable meals while in the Eternal City. The other feature of the square - apart from it being a vibrant meeting place for all ages - are the collection of artists selling views from the square, Rome and Italy in general which are always nice souveniers. It can be rather pricey but you choose to buy or not. But by far the best plan is to sit and watch the world go by - and this isnt a bad place to do it.
Most Romantic Spot in Rome. It doesn't get more romantic than Piazza Navone. My wife and I would travel to Rome all over again just to visit here.

The most beautiful piazza.... If I could choose a home in any place in the world, I would choose one in Piazza Navona. Open your window and see this... The amazing fontana of Bernini in the middle and the other to in the two sides of the square. Having coffee and tartufo in Tre Scalini, watching people painting in the square, selling flowers... The most romantic place in the world.I've been in Rome three times, and every time I spend most of my time in that Piazza...

A beautiful Piazza with fountains surrounded by villas and churches. It is always a pleasure to visit the Piazza Navona during the day and especially in the evenings when artist present their paintings for sale and the street actors perfrom, The fountains come alive with the lighting and are spectacular. The structures can go back into the 1400s or before.. and the actual shape of the piazza is such since it was a arena for Roman chariot and horse races in the early AD centuries. A beautiful place to just stroll and or set by a fountain and watch the action.
Just like the brochure!. Loved the history - buildings - Italians sitting/standing around drinking coffee and enjoying life!

Cozy place.. A place where you want to take pictures and get the memories back home. Some prices on the terraces are low, some are higher...As the Italian say : "Occhio al prezzo!" - Keep your eyes on the price!
the most charming square (!). a must see, nice even to linger next to the fountains or maybe taste a dessert at a bar (although expect to pay a high price for it)
Worth a visit for the fountain sculptures. There are many piazzas all over Rome, but Piazza Navona is one of the largest, and it sports 3 fountains with gorgeous sculptured figures well worth seeing.
Gelato everywhere. Great people watching, several places to pause on your wanderings and enjoy the best gelato. Several of the best to chose from here. Tartufo is one of the best of the best.

One of my favorite places!. Just a beautiful place to wonder, sit & eat, read, walk around ... Whatever. Perfect place to see beautiful fountains & appreciate Rome.
Don't forget to walk over to Sant Eustacio for Rome's BEST cappucinno
One of the prettiest Piazzas in the world. Great people watching, lovely fountains by Bernini. Just a beautiful space.

Living la dolce vita. If you've ever dreamed of eating out on a sultry evening in a stunningly beautiful piazza in Rome, then you've probably been imagining the Piazza Navona. The square has the most beautiful fountains and buildings and the restaurants are exactly what you want in a Roman holiday. It's also buzzing with life. Great gelati from the shop in the corner of the piazza too.
A MUST SEE!. The hustle and bustle of this Italian-ly charming area makes you so excited and want to be a permanent resident.
One of my favourite Roman piazzas. Lovely place to sit down and have a coffee, read the paper or people watch. Rome at its best!

Lively!. We stumbled on Piazza Navona which was a pleasant surprise. It is apparently a good place to go and eat dinner. There were lots of restaurants around. We stopped and admired the fountain. There were many local artists displaying their work in the square.

Beautiful piazza. Tons of nice open air restaurants to choose from here. Great place to sit outside and people watch while you dine. When we were there we saw several bands, magicians, mimes an the like strolling around .
Beautiful. As the title says beautiful, Bernini's four rivers fountain is incredible but beware the expensive restaurants.

Bumpy for a Wheel Chair. The Piazza Navona is beautiful and the fountains are fantastic!
It is a bit difficult for a person in a wheel chair because of all of the cobblestones (San Pietrini), but it is worth it! The artists are very interesting and were fun to talk to in my limited Italian. The gelato is great!
Angels and Demons. nice place with fountains, cafes, artists and people having a good time.

Must visit Piazza - although very crowed during the day. A very impressive Piazza (out of the 300+ ones in Rome. Very big. a lot of picture sellers and portrait painters. Recommend to visit early in the morning.

Quintessential Rome.. A beautiful plaza surrounded by lots of wonderful restaurants and shops. It was filled with people when we were there. Lots of people relaxing by the fountain in the middle of the square. A short walk to the Pantheon. Lovely old buildings with beautiful architecture.

painters paradise. 3 beautiful fountains surrounded by painters selling their wares. Even my teenage children loved this area and wanted to return. Peaceful. You can wander around the fountains whilst eating gorgeous ice-cream.
Walk Across Rome. Perfect place to stop, have Cappucino or wine, watch the other visitors, see a fabulous fountain and enjoy the night time Rome.

Absolutely love this piazza. I just love the atmosphere in Piazza Navona and at times, you can catch some musicians entertaining tourists. Take time to browse the Piazza and on a sunny day, grab a sandwich or ice cream and seat yourself down on a bench to enjoy this beautiful Piazza.

go to tre scalini. In noviembre, go there instead of anywhere else to get pizza and their specialty. It's not so costly as it looks. In autumn, the sun is not there but the food and service is well worth the price (Roma-wise).If you are not against alcohol, the tartuffo dessert is the best tartuffo in the world.Go there and nowhere else on Piazza Navona if you can afford the price !
Easy to find. Enjoyed seeing the many artists at work. Too many sellers present with junk/toys/touristy items
A Piazza to Remember. A must for all visitors to Rome. Disappointing at night when there are very minimal illuminations.

A must see-focus on the architecture not the circus like atmosphere. This Piazza is a perfection of Berninni. It is now filled with people selling their pictures,cartoons or other things one would never need. Concentrate on the architecture. Tre Scalini the famous ice cream bistro offers its specialties (tartufo con panna) which are very expensive and not as good as previously but on a hot day they refresh any tired tourist.. Off the Piazza (away from the direction of the Spanish Steps) are good restaurants in the tiny streets. Seek them out for lunch or dinner.

You know you're there for bernini but..... Dony forget to go to the northern end and find the two storey deep remains of the original roman marble structure; visit villa altemps if you wish to see some fabulous roman sculpture in a renaissance palace
Don't miss this place. The best gelato! Fun to wander around and enjoy the architecture, people watching and even shopping.
Favourite Piazza. This piazza is beautiful - get an ice cream and sit and watch the street entertainers
Loved it here. Very large piazza area lots of artists and market traders wonderful fountains - musicans - brilliant
Great People watching. Just sit, relax and order a drink on side walk cafe and watch people. Or get a gelato and sit on benchs near cafes and do the same.

Not only a square, but also a live entertainment center. Piazza Navona is Rome's open air market and fairground. During the day, it is busy with street vendors, entertainers, and magicians performing all kind of shows. Nevertheless, thieves are also very active and plenty, pretending to watch the shows, but actually checking around tourists and bystanders. Watch your bags and belongings!

Marred by tourism. Piazza Navona was always somewhat crowded, but years ago the crowd was made up of mostly Romans relaxing or enjoying the cafes and restaurants. Now it is jammed with tourists and ruined by street sellers who have their fake designer handbags and other junk spread out all over the ground. If one can overlook this, however, Piazza Navona's fountains and the surrounding buildings are spectacular.
Romantic. Music playing, artists displaying there art, gelato stands, surrounded by restaurants and fabulous buildings and fountains! A must, especially at night.

Ah Navonna!!!. Ever since I first went to Rome as a kid in 1977, I've been in love with Piazza Navona. Love the fountains, sitting on a terrace having a drink watching the people walking around, listening to the café owners telling their tales... I had a great time once again.

Pretty square but too many 'statues'. Navona is lovely but the beautiful statues are a bit spoilt by the terrible street artists - both the painting kind and the 'living statues' Had great zappa inglese ice cream though!

Great night time walks.. We followed the recommended night walk trail. Definitely worth it. However, must be me or does everyone else have way too hard of a time figuring the maps. We were lost 80% of the time with or without maps. That's the only part that made me exhausted.

Busy Piazza. If you visit this busy square, you would not miss the "Four-rivers Fountain" and the adjacent obelisk that was brought by Caesar (Augustus, if I'm not mistaken) marking Rome's victory over Egypt.The restaurants immediately overlooking the square are quite pricey. If you want to save a bit and still dine decently, walk to one of the quieter parallel streets from the Piazza.
Beautiful Piazza. Beautiful fountains by Bernini, but watch out for purse sellers! They sell illegal purses and we watched some of them get chased down by the police through the plaza.
A must see.. Crowded but larger piazza than Trevi. Plenty of artists selling souvenir paintings.
attractive. good place to take a walk, to take photos, to see the ancient buildings around. there are some caffes and restaurantes around. it seemed too hot during summer, no trees.
Beautiful Roma!!!. Another can't miss on a visit to Rome, a really beautiful stop.
Stay a while. Walk in the square, but dont stay in the reataurants in the piazza - it's too turistc. If you go in the litlle streets around the square you will find best food and value.

Beauticl Navonna. The fountains - the people - artists - incredible. It happened to be a beautiful day also - and we we're later in the day for lunch - so were were behind the Roman lunch crowd. Do walk the circle first - you can see a menu and what they offer - whether they have a table charge - found a nice place. Take your time - adjust your time for events to align with Roman schedules - it will be alot more fun.
Great Piazza. Not one or two fountains but three fountains,artist selling their work and fantastic restaurants. Lots to see in this huge piazza.

wow!. i loved this place the most! all the music and artists! so fun! the atmosphere is great! do not miss al sogno! it's the most beautiful toy store with toy animals that looks so real! they are fuzzy and a great gift! the whole store is just magical you can't miss it even if you don't have kids you'd have fun! the only down side is that the restaurants are expensive!
Romantic Piazza. I love it with all the painters! Lots of Picassos I tell you!Don't miss out on the ice cream shops :)

Traditional Piassaz Navona. I guess I just like Italien squares as I was very taken with the sights and sounds of Piazza Novona. Again, the fountain was outstanding in its beauty. The buildings are back from the square and this gives one an opportunity to take in the scene. We were there in the morning and we came back at night. What an exciting place in the evening! There were buskers and musicians. We strolled around the square eating gelatto. The alley ways from it lead to interesting restaurants and other squares. It's an extremely interesting part of Rome.
lovely fountains. expensive to eat and drink round there but good atmosphere
wonderful. superb buildings and fountains by day and night - another must see!
Beautiful square with lots going on.. Be sure to go to Piazza Navona and watch the street acts or have a lovely meal.
Piazza Navona. Visited multiple times on our way to and from other sites. A good place to stop and have something to eat or drink and pretend to be Roman!

My Favorite Piazza in Rome. This is a wonderful piazza at night with two magnificent fountains and restaurants lining the edges. Lots of artists hang out here hocking their paintings, which is unfortunate, as is a distraction from the beauty inherent in the site.
FUN. Tons of places to eat, shop, street artist, very pretty and fun!!

A wonderful place for a late afternoon caffe'!. This piazza is huge with lots going on all around from street dancers and singers to business/government employees hanging out windows to watch. Lovely restaurants all around for lunch, gelato, or un caffe'! A great place to people watch.
Much improved. All cafes now have signs saying they don't charge for service and seating!!!

Piazza Navona - Best Piazza in Rome!. We'd had a long day, been to the Catacombs, walked miles and then happened across the Piazza Navona! We arrived just before dusk and what a beautiful site. 3 amazing statues/fountains surrounded by magnificent Italian architecture. I'm a sucker for statues, throw in fountain too and life does not get any better.As dusk arrived and lights from the cafes & restaurants came on, the whole square looked magical. There were local artists & street sellers in the central area. Some of the artists are clearly very talented, I would have bought a painting but for the logistics of getting it home.We were supposed to be 'passing through' on our way back to our apartment before heading out to dinner, but lost track of time at a lovely restaurant (sat outside under a heater) people watching. We left a couple of hours later.TOP TIPUse public transport! €4 for a daily ticket (to use on buses and metro) or €11 for 3 day pass. Get a Bus/metro map (well worth the money) so you can navigate your way around Rome for a fraction of the costs of a taxi.
Good place for lunch. A good stopping place for lunch while in your walks.

Peole watching at its best. Beautiful Fountains grace the piazza, singers, artists, buskers of all types. Restaurants surround the piazza hawking for you to come sit and eat and watch all the goings on.

Nice view but not worth a 6 euro coffee. I would recommend the Bernini sculpture and the general ambience, but we thought that the 6 euro coffee was excessive that we had at one of the numerous cafes. It's not as impressive as St. Marks Square in Venice or the piazza in Siena.

Awesome at Night. The piazza takes on a different life at night, with artists, musicians, lovers, tourists and lively cafes. For a detailed report with photos and vids, please follow this link. Hope it gives you some good ideas for your trip planning!http://tulum.info/showthread.php?6094-Chichen-Itza-for-Wine-and-Pizza-an-Italian-Adventure!&p=77259&viewfull=1#post77259
See the fountains and markets. Walk the fountains, visit the markets, stay for a cocktail or lunch at the surrounding cafes. Listen to live music.

So lovely. Perfect spot to have a 5 hour dinner!. I found this place so captivating, I sat down and had a 4-5 lunch/dinner at one of the cafes that surround the piazza. I highly recommend grabbing a front row seat and throwing down wine and food while the sunlight fades into night. The character of the fountains changes as the light fades away. Musicians come and go. The wine and delicious food flows like the water before you. Simply put, my favorite experience in Rome!
Happening Spot!. Fun & lively, good cafes & cool art work on display. Great fountain & a happening place to hang out & enjoy the people watching.

The Life of Rome - and some good Food , too!. On our trip to Rome, we somehow always wandered in the direction of the Piazza Navona at dinner time. We found several good restaurants there where you could sit outside and people watch while enjoying some good food and wine.

Great place day or night. This is where the artists display their work, day or night. The famous Bernini "Fontana dei Quattri Fiumi" (Fountain of the Four Rivers) is right in the middle of the piazza.
Day or night the restaurants are always full of people. I'd have to recommend the "Ristorante Panzeroni". Great food and service.

Magestic. We enjoyed, again, seeing all three fountains. Many other tourists were there, as have been each time we've visited. Very popular. An easy addition to our half-day walking tour which included Trevi Fountain, The Parthenon, and The Spanish Steps.

Would have been tranquil. THis was a lovely area to sit and relax in the sun if it weren't for the people trying to sell you crap that you didn't need, extremely pushy here. The place itself was lovely and there were a lot of artists work on sale here, if we had more suitcase room i would have brought a few trasures to bring home.
Old world charm. Beautiful pedestrianised piazza with three fountains and "old Italian" charm. Lots of artist's displaying pictures and street performers. The Church is worth a visit too.
Loved it. Truly a masterful moment of city planning. Very lovely and had Lunch there.
Very commercialized. I revisited this piazza in October after being away for 7-8 years. The piazza has become very commercialized. Still beautiful in some ways.

A Must-do for People Watching. Get the history of the Piazza and try to visit when it is not busy as well as when it is. Take some time and buy a drink in one of the many sidewalk cafes. Soak up the local color and make the most of some of the best people-watching in all of Rome.

When the moon hits your eye.... Pick a beautiful moonlit night and renew romance at an outdoor table. Actually, it is more fun to watch the sidewalk salespeople spread out their wares then snatch them up and walk off as the police make their rounds. It happens over and over...
Only ok. Ok to see, not much to do. Rip off restaurants here. Wouldn't recommend to eat in any of them. Nice place to go to if you're sick of all the italian traffic
loved it. loved this area, full bustle but with more space to mill around.

Beautiful Fountain. There is a beautiful fountain and some interesting architecture to see as well as beautiful church. Wish the street "painters" and other weird vendors would vanish or at least be limited as they seem to dominate what could be a lovely city square. Navona is not alone in this problem. But it is worth a trip to see.
Wonderful Collection of Artists. This was a new stop for us on this trip to Italy. We enjoyed exploring the local artists and listen to the live music.

Artwork and fountains. I don't know what this place is like normally, but the day we were there, a bunch of artists had their art displayed on easels everywhere - would like to have had more time there

Great Nightlife Scene. Piazza Navona is THE place to be in the evenings - atmosphere with the Fountain of the Four Rivers, restaurants, street performers and hawkers, artists. Take time to really admire the fountain - it is an amazing work of art and every side and corner is different and the quad arches in the center supporting the obelisk make it unique. Go ahead and splurge a little on lunch or supper at one of the restaurants - the view is worth it and the food is lovely.

Great nightlife scene. My husband and I unexpectedly discovered a great nightlife atmosphere at the Piazza Navona during a random stroll! Great musicians, fabulous restaurants, a bustling crowd and an overall wonderful atmosphere. And the fountains can provide a romantic setting as well.
Beautiful Piazza. This is worth investigating, Amazing fountains and lots of local artists selling there paintings in the center. Food is pricey but a great atmosphere.
Stunning sculptures and fountain in a pretty Piazza. Easy walk and amazing sculpures. It is best light for photos later in the day and is quite a different piazza from the Pantheon

An interesting place to spend a few hours. The Piazza Navona was an interesting place to visit. Only a few blocks from the Pantheon, it is surrounded by shops and cafes. In the middle of the piazza were two fountains and a large monument.Street performers, artists, and musicians were all vying for your attention.While there were plenty of restaurants and cafes inside the piazza, their prices were fairly steep for what would be a simple meal. We headed north and just as we left the piazza, we spotted a café on the corner opposite the street we just exited. The Sale Miele offered a nice selection of Italian pasta dishes as well as pizza. My wife had lasagna and I had a seafood pasta dish. We were very pleased with the meal and service. The waitress was very helpful and spoke very good English and the menu was in English as well. Our two first course dishes and one salad cost 24€.

Adorable square!!. We did nothing here - just sat down and enjoyed the beauty of this place post sunset!!The area is full of life - artists painting beautiful scenary using spray paint.. some others displaying fine art work.. and loads of people enjoying the beauty of the fountain and clicking pictures all the time!!Your fatigue will vanish if you simply spend the evening here sitting and watching these artists.
Wonderful fountains. Fountains are even more beautiful at night with lights on!

Run the gauntlet!. This piazza is full of atmosphere, romance and very good food and entertainment, you could eat here more than once on your trip. The waiters are very enthusiastic trying to get your custom. be firm and choose one for yourself. We enjoyed live music and walking around the artists stalls. Brilliant.
Pretty. A very nice place to chill out and have some lunch. Lots of stalls to visit surrounded by some very attractive buildings

wonderful. what a lovely square to spend an afternoon in, spoilt however by too many visitors. Lots of artists and comedians performing, nice cafes if a bit expensive, lovely fountains, great place to do some people watching
One of the best. Loads of things to look at in the sqaure you must try the gelato shop at the top of the square, amazing! Watch out for the pickpockets and beggers!

My favorite square in Rome. It is everything you expect Rome to be. The 3 beautiful fountains are amazing, the large square filled with artists painting and selling their artwork and even the the street performers collecting their coins. Surrounded of course by restaurants trying to lure you in (but do find some alleyway to explore and find something off the beaten path). Make sure to get a gelato and enjoy the ambience...it's great!

Wander around ( but eat in the side streets). A lovely wander at night and some nice but pricey places to eat. Best bet with a family is to eat in one of the side streets - great value for money and really good food

The best piazza. Impressive and large with fountains, music , art and restaurants, Piazza Navona is alive with activity. Centrally located in the historic center, and nearby Campo di Fiori. Take a stroll through !

Loved the street performers but expensive coffee. Lots to see - fantastic fountains and loved watching the performers and artists. It's easy to find yourself spending more than you expected on food and drink in the cafes.

beautiful and serene. We had just come from the pantheon and were heading back towards the trevi fountain to grab a taxi back to our hotel. It was getting on in the evening and the sun was almost down. There weren't a lot of other tourists and it was great to get to look around and enjoy it's beauty and wonder.
The heart of the Rome. This pedestrian-only zone is filled with umbrella-covered tables, gelaterie, hawkers, tourists and lovers.

A lovely day. We started our sightseeing this day at Piazza Navona. The Fountain of the Four Rivers is absolutely riveting and all the artists and musicians make Piazza Navona so fun. We went into St. Agnes' church and when they closed, we made our way to a restaurant where we sat in the shade, listened to the guitarist, watch the artist sketch a woman, sipped wine and ate melon & proscuitto. It is one of our favorite memories amongst all the amazing memories of Italy.
Nice to relax. Piazza Navona is a huge square with lots going on. We found it nice just to walk around and soak up the atmosphere. There are loads of great little restaurants and bars in the area.

Artistic favours. Nice cultural and artistic-flavoured place to walk through. Buy some pictuires as souvenirs. There is one souvenir shop at piazza's far end and one toy shop in the beggining - get something fr your kids and home. Do not eat there please - food is defrozen and uneatable.

Amazing Space. Piazza Navona is a wonderful space, with the wonderful fountains in the centre and some majestic buildings around the edge. One could sit for hours in one of the many restaurants and just watch the crowds. Also, it is still a piazza of the Roman people as was evidenced by the big political demonstration that was happening when we were there one day.

Don't go on a Sunday. This is a great area to visit. I stayed very close to the Piazza so visited it on many occasions. Sundays are particularly crowded so avoid that if you can. There are many restaurants to people watch from. Keep in mind that you will pay more to sit outside (some say they don't charge this but check the prices as it may be built in) but sometimes it is worth the expense...you are on holidays after all.

Dine while viewing Bernini's Four Rivers. Bernini's stunning Fountain of the Four Rivers, backdropped by the beautiful Saint Agnes Church is reason enough to visit. The piazza is ringed by restaurants all vying for your patronage. The views of the fountain, the sidewalk artists and the strolling visitors will exceed the good-but-not great quality of the food but the overall ambience makes for an enjoyable evening.

people watching and site seeing galore!. great place to visit and spend a few hours, however, word of warning, the restaurants within the Piazza are expensive and the food is generally poor for the money charged. Try the little bars and restaurants in the surrounding narrow cobbled streets and you'll get a great meal at a very competitive price!

Excellent Entertainment with world class cuisine. It was a very nice evening to wander up to the Piazza Navona and sample the artists, the street entertainment, and the to top it off an excellent bottle of wine and dinner at any of the cafes surrounding the piazza.

Too many people!. When we finally found this Piazza, there were so many people there. It was mid-afternoon, and the throngs of people were everywhere. We grabbed some gelato, and looked for some shade to enjoy the fountains. I would recommend trying to time your visit either early in the morning or later in the evening. But do enjoy!

Enchanting Place. Go back in time when you visit this place, not to far from the Pantheon. the statue of the 4 rivers and all the other fountains are wonderful works of art. the artists and cafes surrounding the Piazza is so wonderful you dont want to leave. Went there as part of the Globus Tour in Oct 2010, wish we had more time to spend. Next time, I will go on my own and just sit there for several hours absorbing the sights, sounds, and food.
Great place to sit and people watch. Huge historic piazza - interesting fountains and buildings - dozens of cafes - a great place to sit and watch the world go by.
Beautiful place. Third visit to Rome and cannot believe I missed this before. With its fountaints, churches, and restaurants, it is a memorable location. Visit at night for less of the crowds
